Reviews.Title: “Stayed in the Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: MeLilMomma
Reviews.Content: We had stayed last year in the Carson Tower and was nice too, just a little farther walk from the rooms to the Casino Floor. In October (late post) The pool made this trip the kids loved it. When it was adult time, the Fremont strip is very entertaining. The Golden Nugget staff was great and their games were awesome as well. Overall clean room, great bathroom with separate toilet area from the Tub, which is always nice. Upscale on Fremont, Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A downtown alternative in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ratcher
Reviews.Content: We have an annual golf outing that occurs over a weekend in early March. Given the courses that we play, it is easier for us to stay downtown than on the strip. We have stayed in a few of the properties in downtown and now have settled on the Golden Nugget. It is the nicest of the hotels that I have stayed in downtown. We stay in the Rush Tower which is the lowest price option. There are three other towers with increasing amenities at higher prices. But our needs are for a bed and a shower, little else, so we are content where we have stayed. Rooms are spacious and reasonably well maintained. My only serious gripe is that there is no desk/chair combination that is ergonomically appropriate for using a laptop computer. Lots of options for food within the hotel. We have eaten at the Italian, Chinese, and seafood restaurants for dinner and had nice meals at each. Breakfast in the Carson St. Cafe was fine, particularly for golfers who weren't going to eat again for several hours. Being right on Fremont St. was also nice because we had access to the other hotels where our party were scattered as well as some variety in dining and drinking options. In summary, a nice option for visitors to Vegas who don't need to be located on the Strip. Now if only they extend the Tram downtown, it would make access to the Strip a snap.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: 12FTW
Reviews.Content: Being on Fremont Street, you wouldn't expect the luxury of the casino hotels on the strip, but I have to say The Golden Nugget was a really nice hotel. The room was big and the amenities were nice as well. I really liked the Shark Tank pool area the most. I was in the Carson tower, and the room there had thin walls so I can hear a lot of the other rooms surrounding me. But other than that it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: suz406
Reviews.Content: What a great place. If you are on Freemont Street than this is a great place to be at. Clean and Liked the appeal of the casino

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Cal H
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. It is cheap but rooms are very nice, although you have to pay for internet and coffees you are still saving some money.

Reviews.Title: “Small Beds”
Reviews.Author: Grapevineswine
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Golden Nugget before and really like the hotel, but on this trip we booked a double room and instead of having two queen beds we had two double beds. I didn't even know hotels had double beds anymore! We'll be sure to clear that up before we stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Weekend in the Scarlet Suite”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeGoddess
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my 40th birthday I invited four friends down to Las Vegas and I booked a two bedroom Parlor Suite for the weekend. We checked in on Friday morning at the VIP check-in (comes with the suite) and went fairly quickly. The front desk person was very helpful as we tried to find a suite with the second room with two beds that was non-smoking. Unfortunately they did not have one so we got the Scarlet Suite. Sadly I have no pictures to post since I lost my camera, but there are pictures from another person's stay on Trip Advisor. While I couldn't smell the smoke in the room very strongly, two of my friends could. However, it wasn't so bad that they had to leave or got headaches from it. The view out the windows was of the roof top mechanical equipment since it was on the second floor. The room was also pretty dark even with all the lights on. It was pretty cool with it's red wallpaper in the main room and the black and white in the bedrooms. Both bedrooms had deep jetted soaking tubs with an integral shower. While I used the tub, I did not shower in the bath since the main room had a half-bath with a shower only. I have seen some reviews that the doors don't have privacy hangers but we had them on all three doors. The maids waited until I had pulled them off to check and see if we wanted our rooms cleaned. The mini-fridge had the regular bottled water and we had plenty of room to chill our beverages and left-overs. There were several extra wine glasses in the cabinet next to the fridge that you could pull out. Having read about the $10 coffee pods, we came prepared with our own pods. We didn't get a chance until Sunday morning to try out the pool so I asked to be allowed to check out at noon. They had no issues with that so we had a great time on the water slide and in the Tank watching the fish. One last thing, The Downtown Third has a weekly farmers market on Fridays from 9am to 2pm and if you're there during this time, I suggest you take the short walk there. It's right at the old bus depot on Casino Center Blvd. (which is right on the east side of the Golden Nugget) and Stewart Ave. They have some wonderful fresh fruits, vegetables and sweets along with several food trucks.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by comp upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Keikidoc
Reviews.Content: Booked via Vegas.com just for one night, a Saturday, on our way through town. When we checked in, receptionist said she had a comp up grade for us, even before I asked. We were upgraded to Spa Tower suite. Never staying at the Golden Nugget before, we were thankful and went up to the room...boy were we surprised as we walked into the "suite" . The first floor was living area with large screen HD TV with connected HD channels, several sofas, breakfast table, full wet bar and floor to second floor ceiling window that looked out to the strip and down to the pool. The second floor (which was actually the 10th floor) was up the spiral staircase to a large sleep area and bathroom which contained a steam shower and tub with jets. Tub area also also looked out the picture windows. Loved the upgrade. Didn't get to experience the noisy Fremont street side and It was pretty quiet except for the party going on next door but hey, this was Vegas. It was better after getting back from the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BACJS
Reviews.Content: Just not what we had experienced in the past year. Some maintenance issues with our room and the room change took forever which us a half day of holiday, packing up, moving and unpacking. Ths was our fifth stay and I am unsure if we wil stay at this property again

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: loulou1976
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Nugget the last 3 years during the WNFR in December. Everything has always been great. We have always been able to check in Early and had exceptional service. The pool is awesome even when it is a little chilly out it is a great place to relax and watch the sharks in the tank. They have outdoor heaters and a bar! I love the Rush Tower rooms. They are large and very clean. The Chart House is a great restaurant even if you do not stay here go eat here. The chocolate lava cake is to die for! Great place will continue staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Sliding through sharks, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kickboxchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my first time because I heard about the shark tank, and if was more than worth it! We stayed in the new tower and the room was amazing! The pool is beautiful and a great experience. I love Fremont street and this is the only hotel I'll ever stay in there :)

Reviews.Title: “First timer not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bergma
Reviews.Content: We called week before to confirm reservation and I again asked if we had a non smoking room I was told we can't guarantee that. I had saw in reviews about VIP checking so I asked about that and he said you pay 25 dollars and you get a guaranteed room of non smoking. So of course I did it. So the day before we came my husband said there was a 271. 00 charge on our debit card which is what I used for our VIP. So my husband called and they said that's a hold for room. Excuse me they never said anything about that on the phone. And the never said the VIP check in closes at 1100 at night which we found out when we checked in at midnight. Thank goodness there was no line. So we asked about the charge again and the staff at front desk had no idea and couldn't find it. So I called the next morning and the finally saw charge and said they would call the bank for us to get that released. She didn't know why it was charged either because we went through Expedia no hotel. So you would think they would be so apologetic since this was our first time. But they didn't offer anything I had too ask. So they gave us buffet tickets. It's a bummer because we gambled a lot there and now we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent stay at a GREAT Hotel..Forget "The Strip" the "Nugget" is where it is all at!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: A friend invited me to go with him to Las Vegas (from June 14-17, 2011) as he had never been before and wanted someone to go with that had been here...I could be his tour guide so to speak. Well I did not have to be asked twice as I love Las Vegas and had just been here 5 years ago and wanted to see all the changes that have taken place since the recession etc. After having stayed at the Luxor on The Strip I was not sure how staying in a downtown hotel was going to be. I read a few reviews about the "Old Las Vegas" and the older properties and resorts on Fremont Street and some were not very flattering, but my friend decided to go downtown as he was taking his father with him on a early birthday father son trip and his father loved to gamble and had been to the Golden Nugget some time ago. Forget all the negative things one reads about the downtown Las Vegas Area. Yes it is a downtown area so there are all the traffic jams, there are homeless people and all the bad and good things that a downtown major metro area has...BUT the REAL Downtown Las Vegas...not all the places south of the Stratosphere Resort that people think of as Las Vegas...and officially not in the city limits but in a Census Designated Place (CDP) called "Paradise" is where all the best things happen. The Golden Nugget is as they say the "King or Queen" of resorts on Fremont Street. It is one of the oldest having been around since 1907 and also the largest resort casino downtown with over 2300 hotel rooms. It has consistently for over the last 32 years earned the AAA 4 diamond distinction award and one look inside here and it is no wonder. We stayed in the newly remodeled Rush Tower hotel rooms. Everything is modern and up to date. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. House keeping did a wonderful job everyday making sure we realized we were staying in a 4 diamond resort. The Breakfast Buffet in the restaurant is amazing and ranks up there in size with that of a Golden Corral restaurant buffet, with alot better food and atmosphere. The pool is often said to be one of the best features of this hotel, but I was not able to take advantage of it as I was too busy seeing the sites in the Las Vegas area to stay in the hotel for more than sleeping,eating and gambling in the late night. The only downside to the pool is that (and I may be wrong but I did not see any other option) there is a charge for reserving chairs to sit on. I am sure people who want the resort experience are use to paying this fee perhaps but coming from Florida where there is no charge for parking at the beach or anything else I found this a little pricey, but it is Las Vegas and Water is at a prime level of want and need with the drought southern Nevada has been in for the last 10 years. Over all I loved the location of the hotel. The Fremont Street experience with it nightly video presentation on the worlds largest movie screen is amazing as is the people watching along Fremont street with all the acrobats and jugglers and others who are trying to make a living or make a break into the world of show business and think that doing well or being seen on Fremont street may be the big break they need. For those interested in the program on the history channel called "Pawn Stars"...the Gold and Silver Pawn shop at 713 South Las Vegas Boulevard is just a short 20 minute walk about 8 blocks away from here. Another great thing about the location of this on Fremont street is that within what would be the confines of one of the HUGE casinos on the strip you have over 8 casinos all along Fremont street and each one has its own little unique niche as to what games they offer, the chances of winning and what type of clientele they attract. It was awesome here because at the Corner of Fremont street and Las Vegas Blvd where the Golden Nugget is there are also 3 other resorts...the 4 Queens, Binions, and The Fremont Casino. No where else in Las Vegas can one go to 4 casinos in so close proximity to one another. This trip really sealed the deal for me in future trips here. I will go to Las Vegas hopefully many many more times but I think I will always decide to stay at the Golden Nugget and just go on side trips to see the new resorts for fun. Downtown is the place for me and the Golden Nugget helped to seal this deal for future trips to come.

Reviews.Title: “Classy without the Fluff”
Reviews.Author: biochemist
Reviews.Content: The Nugget was always the class of the downtown, but with the changes made by the new owners, it is even better. The pool surrounding the shark tank is nice, and the fact that you can water-slide through the tank is a neat touch. Gold fixtures, handrails, doorknobs, the theme is everywhere. Plenty of tables and machines, and you can find everything from 1 cent to $500 varieties. Seven restaurants and plenty of bars means everyone does not look long to satisfy a craving. The rooms are well-appointed; the bathrooms are not as roomy as the room in the older towers, but everything is more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: redrider53
Reviews.Content: Located on Fremont Street in the heart of old Vegas; right on the Fremont Street experience with free nightly live shows and light shows. It's our 5th time at the Nugget and the rooms and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best”
Reviews.Author: Bigczeck
Reviews.Content: I've had the opportunity to stay at the Golden Nugget multiple times over the past years. Of the 27 time I've been to Las Vegas, I've never stayed on the strip, only downtown. Service has always been first rate. Checkin on my most recent visit took about twenty minutes, but it was a Sunday at about 11:00am, when there were a great number of people checking out. Still very friendly and efficient. Room was in the Gold Tower. Unless you like a long walk, stay in the Gold or Rush Towers, Carson Tower is just too long a walk. the addition of new restaurants adds to the property and they're all very good. Buffet is good, but not like when Steve Wynn owned the place. Room was always made up before noon. Nice tv, bed ws great and I slept well. Minimal noise in hall, een late at tnight when the drunks are all out. Service in restaurants was fine, een bufet. Bartenders are another story, they can walk by you without even acknowledging you. But I've seen this in many casino bars. Gambling is getting tough. Tables are opened only when its decided its absolutely necessary. they want filled tables. So finding a table with only one or two other players is very difficult, even late at night into the early morning. (1:00am to 6:00am) but this is the way it is in all casinos now. Very nice poker room, but forget the late night poker tournamnets, its full of drunks and smokers who prolong the action by not coming back to the tables when the breaks are over. It take forever to get these people back to the table. The pool is something else, but if you got to Vegas in winter, don't bring kids if the pool is closed there is nothing for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Aquarium at pool”
Reviews.Author: Az86401
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay at if you want to hang out on Freemont Street, which everyone should do at least once. The refurbished rooms are nice and the pool area is very cool there is a slide going through a shark tank.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: h&jManitoba
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed 5 nights downtown at the Golden Nugget. This classic hotel is fabulous! Everything you need is right there within walking distance, the rooms are clean and spacious, (wasnt sure what we were in for staying in the Carson Tower, surprising enough, no need to upgrade!) hotel staff friendly and helpful, restaurants were pretty good and reasonably priced, room service was fantastic, casino area was clean and staff friendly and bar service was pretty good as well. We didn't use the the pool, but did try the whirl pool/hot tub, which the chlorine was a bit too much for me. We had a great time staying here and would stay again in a heartbeat for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun at the Nugget!!”
Reviews.Author: mitsylavigne
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a girls weekend, and we had a blast!! It was NCAA, and spring break, so it was super busy at the hotel, and there were people everywhere, but it was great. The service was fantastic at Rush Sushi (possibly Red Sushi), and the sushi was so yummy. Spend the $20 for a lounger at H2O lounge, it is fantastic, lots of sun, the drinks are great, and the bartenders are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great time downtown”
Reviews.Author: Ready.Teddy
Reviews.Content: I had a low rate on the regular (Carson) tower so I didn't expect much. Turned out to be just fine, clean, and comfortable. Not many cable channels though but fantastic heated pool was great. Nice to see the Fremont street light show again. Free parking by showing your room key. No resort fees. Fair pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Downtown Hotel with Awesome Updates!”
Reviews.Author: lorielu3093
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget has been around forever and they've done a great job with the updates. We stayed in the Rush Tower. The room was large, the bathroom was beautiful with a rain shower head. The bed was super comfortable! The Tank water pool was great! Loved the waterside through the shark tank, how cool is that?! The water temperature was nice. The Buffet "champagne breakfast" is not worth $30! While it was nice to have the mimosas and ponsettias, it would have been nice if they offered a $20 no champagne option. The food was fine, but had more salads than breakfast options.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy E
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay downtown vegas insted of the strip and the Golden Nugget was not a disappointment. The room was huge, king bed, clean and very nice! Newly remodeled and very nice, we enjoyed it, but the service in the Grotto bar was less than impressive, but we enjoyed our stay anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Had A great time”
Reviews.Author: Sally G
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and found the staff very nice and helpful. Had breakfast in the buffet that overlooked the pool. WOW! So clean and neat, we enjoyed watching as people came and went in the pool area so we decided to spend some time in the hot tub, it was so nice and cozy, placed in the back area of the pool with a bar close by, as the day warmed up we ended up sun bathing and swimming most of the day, that was not our plan, but we so enjoyed all the areas of the pool, the shark tank, the hot tub, the adult sun bathing area, the kids playing by the pool. That afternoon we met up with my adult daughter and her friends, we went and did the zip line and the kids noticed that all the drinks were cheap compared to the strip, so we hung out for a while and they enjoyed all the Fremont street has to offer, three girls of thier group won on the slots and we all had a great time. We enjoyed our stay and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: rioram
Reviews.Content: Best place in Downtown Las Vegas for evey fun. Bars, Nightclub, Cassinos

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was golden!”
Reviews.Author: Kcindy2000
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived at the hotel, we had already been through quite an ordeal with the airlines. So imagine our surprise when we arrived at 1:00 am and still had a room in the Rush Tower! The room was clean, modern, and beautifully decorated. We were on the 18th floor in a corner room that overlooked Fremont. We loved it, but if you're not a night owl, the noise could be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sherrie L
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed here a couple of years ago and was very happy with the overall experience so I booked again. This time the area around the beds looked like it was under remodel. Boards screwed to the wall with no headboards and the wall needed paint and curtains. Room was not made up by 3 p.m., no clean glasses for a couple of days. Air conditioner clanked all night long. I paid extra for VIP check-in which I never got. No coupons or anything given to get me for quick service to check-in or to the restaraunts or coffee shop. A waste of money. I was quoted a different price per night when I booked than I actually was expected to pay. When I called the front desk to question it the woman had an attitude and said I had signed the iPad listing the charges so I'm pretty much stuck (not her exact words but you get the idea). I called the 800 number I used when I booked and luckily the woman was very nice and changed the bill to reflect the amount I was quoted. That saved me over $150. When you check in be very careful of what you're signing and question amount right away. I won't stay here again and don't recommend it. Plenty of other hotels on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “RUSH TOWER IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: 3SanFranLovers
Reviews.Content: Husband and I took a quick flight to Vegas (do not think we will ever drive again), had a limo waiting for us at McCarran and were whisked off to the Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget, Downtown Vegas. This was a birthday surprise for my husband that I had planned a few months in advance and he was so surprised. Valet at Rush Tower greeted us, the bell desk grabbed our bags and we did not see them again until we were in our suite. VIP check-in was quick and easy in front of the elegant floor to ceiling aquarium. I had booked a Jr. Corner Suite and the extra bucks were well worth it...very elegant suite with all the goodies and perks, not one but two big screen televisions, nice living room area, gorgeous large bathroom with a deep soaking tub and the bed....oh, the bed. A king size cloud to sleep on...heaven, simply HEAVEN with cool, high thread count linens (yes folks, it matters), six or seven fluffy pillows with various degrees of softness and the entire Rush Tower has this "spa like" aroma....not the icky stench of cigarette smoke. Part of my husband's VIP treatment was a line pass I'd purchased for $28 and well worth it....the line was long at the Cafe but we walked right in and were promptly seated. Same at the famous Golden Nugget buffet upstairs. The food was a bit pricey (as is most of Vegas restaurants) but delicious and a nice selection. We discovered Dupar's restaurant in the Golden Gate. Golden Gate Casino is at the end of Freemont on the corner right before you cross the street to Union Plaza....excellent food and very reasonable. Dupars is famous for shrimp cocktails and the best I've ever had...I had two actually. Husband and I enjoyed prime rib dinner with all the fixins' including dessert for $9.99 each and this restaurant is open 24 hours...do not pass on a piece of pie and cup of coffee for a late after gambling treat. We love downtown for a change of pace from the Strip. Gambling in Binion’s El Cortez, Fitzgerald’s, Four Queens….and even in all the old “dive” casinos is fun. Mermaids machines still give out coins! Freemont Street Experience in the evenings is a must-see and don’t forget to try a deep-fried Oreo or Twinkie in this little grill at the rear of Mermaids….even the Nathan’s hot dogs and French fries taste better there…again, very reasonably priced for late night snacking. Bayou has great HUGH margaritas too…try the watermelon one! We checked out the new Mobster Museum too…way cool. Whether you are just walking up and down Freemont Street, ducking in and out of the various casinos, checking out the shops, snacking at the food trucks or sitting people watching sipping a Starbucks….Downtown Vegas makes for a great weekend place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Best Property Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Udakine
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Golden Nugget and waited till the last month to book the room as we got the coupon book which was a big savings. The rooms were big and clean. The hotel is good with excellent restaurants. What I did not like in particular was there was no security near the elevator until my last night, when I suspected that there was some other kind of activity in the casino by the increased security presence and a person being handcuffed out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: megg210
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at the Golden Nugget and don't really have a negative thing to say about it! Both times, I was in the Carson Tower and the rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. Check-in can be lengthy, but once you're done with that, there isn't much that should stress you out. The pool is great! Its shark tank with the water slide is fun, but I also like that there are several levels of lounge chairs with plenty of room to lay out. There are several restaurants on-site, but my favorite is Red Sushi. The food is extremely fresh, and the staff is very attentive and helpful! The hotel is also right on the Fremont Street Experience, which is a trip (and I never heard any noise from it in our room), and if you want to explore other restaurants, I definitely recommend Hash House a Go Go in the Plaza just down the way - food was great and the portions are enormous! I would not hesitate to stay at the GN again or recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuperRn11
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay downtown one night, allowed us to checkin at 10am, gorgeous pool area(and it was open!), standard Carson tower room, was actually nicer than we expected! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The jewel of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: finallyavacation29
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a Nascar weekend. I always stay on the strip. Have been to vegas like 9 times, but this was the 1st time we stayed downtown. We did this because we needed a suite to accommodate 3 people and this was a good location for the race. Room was decent and big. Bed was nice and 2 bathrooms are always a plus. We like to have a separate seating area in the room if we stay more than 1 night. Hotel is the nicest down along the Fremont St Experience and you will pay a little more. BUT when you go out to a casino on a Sat nite and find a $5 roulette or Craps table it's a definite plus. The table games at the Nugget seemed high for me. Also get a Coors Lt on the strip and you'll pay $6 each, downtown they are like $3. The pool was nice as well but get there early to get a seat in the sun. Waterslide was epic, even for a 41yo. Room service was decent, even at 2am. Also ate at Chicago Brewery, it was ok. Got a pizza to-go from Uncle Joes, that was amazing. It's at the end of the experience, across the street. The downtown area is fun for families but staying down there for 3 nights got a little boring. Once you see the light show and all the impersonators, maybe do the zip line, your pretty much set as far as downtown stuff. But again if you can deal with some old school vegas, with lights, cigaretttes, cheap gambling, drinks and food, downtown isn't so bad. A couple of more points: The cab ride to the strip (Venician) was $25. The cab to the airport from Golden Nugget was $35 before tip. You can take the shuttle bus but keep in mind those buses stop at every casino dropping/ picking people up. If you like me and want to get to your hotel as soon as you get off the plane, then take the cab. The shuttle is like $10 anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless in all respects.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa049
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Golden Nugget on the evening of Feb. 28, 2012 for a stay of 7 days. The next morning we were about to leave our room when there was a knock on our door. On opening it, we were totally surprised to have this uniformed person, accompanied by a dog, introduce themself. This person was there to inspect our room re: pests. I will not say what kind as I am sure everyone is aware of this problem. We were told that the Golden Nugget is proactive with this potential problem and wants to stop it before it happens. The hotel has contracted teams that come in regularly to inspect every room in the hotel. What a good feeling after this inspection and conversation! We all know that this is a problem in many hotels almost all over the world but this inspection alleviated any doubts that we might have had although we were told that there was no problem at the Golden Nugget before we booked. I would definitely and have recommended this hotel to other travellers to Las Vegas. Overall, we totally enjoyed our stay at this hotel and surrounding area. We had been to Las Vegas twice before but some time ago and we stayed on the Strip. I would definitely return to the Freemont Street area again and once again stay at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDon1
Reviews.Content: Big issue we had was leaving the room at 1:30pm and because I had the do not disturb sign until that time the room never got cleaned. I thought at least they would have called since we paid $249.00 for a suite. It was a very nice roomy suite with two tv's and a sectional couch. I do have a problem with hardly any outlets . It's nice for the room to look good but sometimes we need to plug in something. Forget plugging in your alarm clock. You would have to move a granite slab end table to try and find a outlet. The fish tank at the Nugget is amazing. Even if you don't stay there go see it.

Reviews.Title: “Usually Stay on Strip but this was Worth it”
Reviews.Author: OnH0liday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to LV several times and I have been there for conferences as well. We stayed at the new Rush Tower and were very pleased. The room was just like the pictures, the bathroom was spacious and very nice. Everything new and in working order. Walls were not thin, didn't hear doors slamming or people talking---just occasional obnoxious folks in the hallway on their way to/from wherever but that is Vegas. Room darkening shades were the best I've experienced, hands down. It was so dark you couldn't see under the door or even your hand in front of you. We actually kept the bathroom dimmer on low with the doors partially closed to see to get there in the middle of the night. Beds were great, not hard and just right. The air conditioning worked great and we didn't even hear it kick on. Loved the huge leather sectional in the room and big new flatscreen t.v. We were on the 9th floor in the back and never heard Fremont Street. Some people on the elevator said they were on the 7th though and heard morning traffic to service the hotel (trucks beeping as they backed in, garbage truck, etc.) but we didn't hear that. The hotel/casino itself was nice as well, food ok pricing for Vegas. They have two Starbucks in the hotel itself. We went to the impersonator country show which was just "ok." I'm not really into that. Willie Nelson was perfect and hilarious, the rest were a bit weird to watch. We heard they are different every night and they don't pre-announce who it is. The buffet was typical, if you like seafood that might be your speed but we don't so everything else tasted the same. Desert was the best part. Others at the show told us the Rio buffet and even down the street at The Main Street Station was better. There was a McDonalds and Subway in the hotel next door to us which I think was The Plaza that just reopened. We just loved that the Golden Nuggest is so quick/easy to get to the street (Fremont Street, of course) where the activity was. Friday was busy but Saturday was packed and we still loved it. So much to do and see. The street shows were great but not for kids (pole dancing). The staff was all great, we never had any rude people and the valet will help you with directions even if you aren't wanting transportation and you are just walking to get somewhere. There are some homeless folks out at night but they do not bother you and not nearly as many as you see on the strip. Also, no one flicking stripper cards at you on Fremont Street. Any feedback I might offer on the somewhat negative side is that the pool chairs are side-by-side and packed into a very small space. Also, despite Rush Tower being nonsmoking, everything else in the hotel is smoking so it hits you when you get off the elevator. The ceilings are low throughout so that doesn't help. So, if you don't swim or you do smoke, this hotel would be a '5' for you. We would stay there again. We went to the NASCAR race and they had transports directly outside the hotel that left timely with no hassle whatsoever. The Deuce (city bus) picks up a block away at Binions. We found that we were traveling opposite of most since we were going to the strip at night and back to Fremont even later wheras most the Deuce traffic was coming from the strip to Fremont St. Also, don't try walking to the Pawn Stars (gold & silver pawn shop) as its a hike from the hotel. Take the Deuce to Bonneville and walk two blocks, go early or you'll wait for hours to get in. If the buses are packed to get to the strip for whatever reason, check the map and take the WAX route. Tthe loudspeaker recording says its for airport and locals will tell you it doesn't go to the strip but it stops at the Tropicana (again, look at the map), right across the street from MGM. And don't pay for a cab to get to the airport, take the WAX bus route. Cab to the Golden Nugget was $40 without tip taking the shortest route then the valet told us about this for the way back. Also, the North Premium Outlets were much nicer and newer than the South---the North are just two stops up from this hotel on the Deuce or the SDX routes but not walking distance due to the railroad tracks out there. Also, SDX stops at fewer hotels than the Deuce if you are going to the strip and want to get there quicker.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Downtown Las vegas Hotel bar none.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey C
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Luxor when I stayed on the STRIP several years ago - This was a pleasant Change for a more Quaint, non- mega strip hotel. Centrally located in the City of Las Vegas - it ranks as one of the best Hotels and Casinos I have been too. The location is GREAT. Food at Restaurants inside the Golden Nugget is high quality at low prices (This is what Vegas IS known for beside Casinos) and the Casino is a highlight as well - and downtown Vegas Casinos are better know for higher payouts and easier chances to win as well). The Freemont Street Experience is EXCELLENT - Just Walk Out the Golden Nugget and you get to experience the show anytime you want from Evening until late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is so pretty and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: vexsgirl
Reviews.Content: We were sent 3 free nights to enjoy at the GN. We called and got the Rush Tower or Gold Tower room. I said I preferred the Rush Tower since it was non smoking.My husband has a wheelchair and they said that the R.T. would be better due to the larger rooms. When we got there I had asked if we could get a room with a walk in shower since my DH could not step into the very tall tub in the regular RT rooms. The check in clerk found us a Suite with a HUGE bedroom/living area, a bathroom that was as big as the regular rooms in some hotels it had a nice big soaking tub and a very large shower with a seat in it. This room also had a very large walk-on closet. Maid service was spot on and remembered that we like to have extra glasses every day. The Hotel was very nice and all the staff was nice. Now, the casino on the other hand... I wish the cocktail servers came around a bit more. I sat on morning for over 30 minutes and did not see one. The only thing I can say that was negative was the hotel rooms window was so dirty I couldnt see outside very well. When we got home I had 2 different offers from them to come back. We will... oh yes we will!

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Customer Service!!”
Reviews.Author: G0Places
Reviews.Content: Our Plane arrived early....8:30 in Las Vegas....we figured we'd have to leave our bags at the desk until check in time....BUT.....Surprise Surprise....they let us check in right away!! Our room was in the Rush tower....very nice room...but no fridge/microwave and only coffee/water that you have to pay for. AND worst of all, NO FREE INTERNET! So a few disappointing things...but we were so happy to be able to check in early, we got over it! Be sure to get your coupon book at check in, because there are a few great deals. for instance...2 buffets in the hotel for the price of 1!! we used this coupon for breakfast and lunch and found that the Breakfast was a great Experience, not so much for lunch. Our room was over Fremont Street, and was very Loud...so if you are a light sleeper, don't expect to sleep until after midnight. We asked for a room change and they easily and instantly moved us w/o any problems! A few more things to note....not a great selection of tv channels.....also the beds in the Rush tower are set on platforms that are a bit larger than the actual mattress...so you'll find that you crack your shins on them alot!! The Pool is fabulous....great for getting sun!! All the staff were just super nice and helpful! The casino and hotel are Easily the best downtown! The whole place is brightly decorated and clean with many restaurant choices! We had a Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Shaky start at first”
Reviews.Author: kmbkat
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation for a room in the Rush tower for my Feb visit to Vegas and was looking forward to checking out the new tower. When I arrived to the registration desk at 7:45 pm on a Saturday I was told that my room was sold, they were overbooked and I had been downgraded to the Carson tower and was that "okay" with me? Hell no it wasn't okay with me but what was I supposed to do, act out, have a tantrum, sleep in the lobby or worse yet---jail? So I spend that night in the Carson tower and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, the bed was super comfortable and they had a Keurig coffee pot in the room. They also gave me a fridge so that made my stay a little better. I was able to move into the Rush tower the next afternoon and they put me in a corner suite. It was nice and way bigger than I needed but I appreciated the gesture. My sister and I will be going to Vegas next month and I've book our room at the Nugget. I wish they had some rooms in the Rush tower with two beds but all of those rooms have kings so we will stay in the Carson tower for our upcoming visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club Room review”
Reviews.Author: auroraclubjazz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night in February 2012. Had a hard time figuring out where the VIP check in was (It is next to the elevators by the front desk area). Once found I was checked in quickly and efficiently and was able to get into my room at 10 AM. The VIP lounge is a joke - just a small interior room with a small check in desk and then a sitting areas for about 6 people, with odd victorian decor. I think ther ewas a mini-fridge with free beverages for VIP guests. The room itself is very nice, though it isn't really that large - almost too much furniture packed into it. They could lose the bench at the end of the bed. The leather couch was nice though. The sitting chair was a recliner but wasn't particularly comfortable. the TV is huge, and there is a DVD player too. The wood TV wall is neato, but it does make for a dark part of the room sinc ethey don't have adequate lighting built into it. The decor is very nice, modern masculine feel to it. I wish the rooms in this hotel hard larger windows. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom has significant design problems. It is long and narrow, and the only closet in the room is in the bathroom and is hard to get into. The bathtub is plastic cheesy and nothing special at all. They call it a deep soaking tub, but it is not that much bigger than a regular tub. The glass door for the tub opens only on one side as the other panel is immediately adjacent to the toilet and is glued (!) shut. There is a small TV in the mirror, but it is sort of hard to see the screen unless you are right in front of it. The fancy sinks are fancy. I was traveling by myself and I felt crowded in the long but excessively narrow bathroom. The Gold Club rooms cost about $20 more that a Rush Room. For that $20 I got a smaller room with similar decor and a smaller bathroom. What makes it worth the $20? Well I did get two free $8 bottles of water. I got free snacks and free coffee in an area next to the elevator. I got a free VIP pass to the work out center, which I had good intentions but never did actually use. I got VIP passes to the buffet and to the show line, neither of which I used. I also got charged for $10 in coffee that was never in my room to start with (I just got my bill in the mail and found that one out and will need to call them up). Next time I think I will try a Rush Room. The Carson rooms I have stayed in before were just fine too. Overall the Gold Club room just wasn't that special. The hotel itself is great. I ate at the Carson Cafe and the food was good The hot tub was hot, and there is a very nice sitting area next to the hot tubs with gas firepits. The people working there all seemed very nice. And it has great location on Fremont Street, which I always try to stay overnight on my trips so I can stay up and watch the bands play.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for a low price”
Reviews.Author: Ckickert
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have it all. Great rooms, several swimming pools, restaurants bars etc. First off I have to admit that I was upgraded to a room in the Gold Tower, we got a suite with a separate living room and kitchen. Totally unexpected but of course more than welcome! Your mileage may vary. The hotel itself has a great location on lively Fremont Street. Different than the Strip but to be honest I liked it more. There are so many things to do within walking distance that I never felt bored. The Strip may have classier establishments but to be honest to me it's all the same kitsch. That was what I was going for anyway. Because I did so many things during the day I never had time to relax in the pool but it certainly looks exciting. Don't expect olympic size swimming lanes, but it's nice anyway. The restaurants looked ok, but I have to say that their buffet was horrible. I went on their 'luxury day' with seafood, it sure didn't matter. One last thing: if you are a hotel guest, parking is free!

Reviews.Title: “Very entertaining, but smokey and they nickle and dimed you”
Reviews.Author: ebreimer
Reviews.Content: The Good Stuff: My room ranged from $49 (weekday) to $89 (weekend). The room size and quality was similar to ones that I've paid $160-$200 per night in metro areas, like Nashville TN, Springfield MA, or Poughkeepsie NY. This was simply the most luxurious $49 room I have ever slept in. While undersized, it has a great pool area with a fire pit, outdoor bar, different levels, and a water slide that goes through a shark tank. The Golden Nugget is located in the center of Fremont Street, which is the best free freak show on earth. I felt safe but I'm 6'4", 265 lbs, and ugly. If you like psychedelic music from the 70's or 80's hair-band rock then Fremont St. is for you. The "Experience," the street, and the people were very entertaining. I had a great time even though the scene is not really my cup of tea. The Bad Stuff: Everything cost extra: High speed Internet $13/day, lounge chair at the pool $20/day, fitness Room $20/day, three minute long distance phone call $26, bottle of water in the room $7, 4-pack of coffee in the room $10. Their business model is simple: Inexpensive rooms to lure people and then expensive amenities throughout the hotel. Just be aware that the hotel is not a good value if you are looking for more than a room to sleep in. Consider that it'll cost $80 for a family of 4 to reserve lounge chairs by the pool. Unlike the hotels on the Strip, the Golden Nuggets casino ceilings are low, the ventilation system is poor, and this hotel attracts smokers more than the typical casino. I was prepared for a very smoky casino area and it was far worse than I imagined. While I've never smoked, I wanted to start just so I could get the benefits of nicotine since walking through the casino was no different than having two lit cigarettes in your mouth. Other stuff: The breakfast buffet becomes a brunch on Sunday and they charge dinner prices. The hotel has three Starbucks including one with an outdoor seating area where you can enjoy the Experience and "people watching" without rubbing elbows in the crowd. The restaurants were good. The buffet was good, but it does attract buffet lovers, so be prepared to battle with very large people who cut you in line as if they are starving. Believe me. I know the type. I am one of them. The buffets at the Bellagio and Paris had much more normal people. In the morning there are plenty of $5 blackjack tables. I went in February and the place was hoping with activity. Its certainly not a dead hotel or on the verge of going out of business as some describe. Conclusion: Surprisingly, I would stay here again. Comfy bed, clean bathroom, big room, plenty to do and see. Just be warned that you are in smokers’ heaven and the inexpensive room rate is not indicative of the high price for basic hotel amenities. Everything costs extra, but that's a reflection of the entire town, not just the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “New Rush Tower is Fabulous! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MonBon7
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 2 other couples and were pleasantly surprised with the rooms in the new Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget. The decor is sleek with clean lines. Our room was spotless! There was a nice flat screen TV, double vanities in the bathroom, plenty of seating and counter space. Our view was not the greatest, but who stays in their rooms the whole time at Vegas? The casino was VERY smokey and the only reason I didn't give 5 stars. It would seem there could be a better venting system with all the other beautiful renovations. There are nice stores for shopping and great restaurants. The Golden Nugget is located in the older part of town. It's the nicest of all the other hotels/casinos, which are in walking distance. The slots are seemingly a lot looser in the downtown district. If you're wanting the HUGE, FLAMBOYANT, SHOW STOPPING experience, this is not the place. HOWEVER, you can take a cab ($25 one-way) to the mega strip and make a day of it. We've been traveling to Las Vegas since 1996 and have stayed on and off the strip plus downtown, and we like downtown the best.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, beware of location!!”
Reviews.Author: Ifeelgood0
Reviews.Content: Thi was my first visit to Las Vegas. On arrival, we took a shared shuttle bus to be dropped at our hotels. We started by going to lots of hotels on the strip and then finally last stop was downtown and to the Golden Nugget. The Golden Nugget is one of the nicer hotels downtown but my advise would be to stay on the strip. Thankfully we were able to move to the Luxor which was 100 times better and for only 99 dollars more over the four nights we stayed there. My advise would be if you want downtown, the Golden Nugget is fine. But seriously, stay on the strip! It's 1000 times better!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationingChris
Reviews.Content: We had a great two day stay at Thanksgiving. We have been to the Golden Nugget many times and have stayed in the Carson tower (south tower) and the Gold tower (north tower) On this trip, we stayed in a Gold Club room in the Gold tower. In spite of some negatives, we thought the Gold Club room was fabulous. Positives: The room was bigger than the regular rooms, beautifully decorated, and clean. We thought the bed and the sofa were both comfortable. The pretty bathroom was a nice size. We liked the coffee maker. We brought our own Keurig coffe. We would bring coffee cups next time. The goodies in the hallway were replinished several times a day. We had a nice city view. Room service was quick, and the food was delicious. The pool is lovely. VIP receptionists are friendly and efficient. There are several good restaurants and a Starbucks. Negatives: The brown room decor and deep colored wood furniture made the room seem quite dark. The closet is inconveniently located in the bathroom. You have to get used to shutting the bathroom door to get something from the closet. The many shower heads are tricky, but managable. The Keurig coffee costs an additional $10.00. The regular front desk reception person was business-like and unfriendly. Downtown area may not be suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “The Pride of Freemont Street !”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget probably has one of the best pools in Las Vegas. It has a waterfall, a waterslide, as well as a shark tank.The Casino is perfect for real gamblers. Great sportsbook too. The place give you the feel of "The Old Las Vegas" (prior to the monstrous new hotels). The rooms are very nice, larger than most and very clean. The food is exceptional. They have several restaurants, including Vic and Anthony's (One of the best steakhouses in Vegas), The Grotto, (Italian cusine), The Carson Street Cafe, (a diner), and Lily's Noodle House, (Chinese cusine), as well as The Chart House (seafood). It's conveniently located on Freemont Street, which is a great time at night !!! I love the GN, and go a few times a year !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nocole1
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel. If I were going to stay downtown in Las Vegas again this is the only hotel I would stay at. The others seem kind of shady. I stayed in one of the Carson Rooms. The room was nice and large with a king size bed. Most people will say to stay in the rush tower but I thought this was pretty nice. I did not see a rush tower room, but we were happy with this room. As others say, there is not a refrigerator. You can get one if you want to pay for one. There is a coffee maker for $10. HINT..bring your own K-cups. Then you will not have to pay for coffee. The only complaint I would have is that they said our floor and tower was non-smoking. I could smell smoke in the halls and it was pretty strong. The room did not smell of it. I think it just radiates through the whole hotel from the casino. The casino is pretty smoky. Food in the buffet was average. Bus stop is easy to walking distance to go strip.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown's 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Petroparts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nugget 2 to 3 times per year since 1996. Never disappointed, there have been minor slip ups here and there but nothing to rate it anything other than 5 stars. Stayed in the Rush tower (non smoking) and everything was great, very clean, no issues whatsoever. I have also stayed in the North Tower, South Tower and Spa Tower but i Love the Rush tower by far for the simple reason that i need to get out of the cig smoke for a while. Make reservations for dinner if you are not flexible. Tip Tip Tip, its vegas after all, a little tipping goes a long way, a lot of tipping, well, try it and see!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel/Casino Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Suncove98843
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days and really enjoyed are room as well as the very intentive staff. My only two complaints were the shark slide closed at 5pm and the food was quite expensive, other than that it was excellent. This is not like the other casinos downtown, don't expect free drinks unless you are betting at least $10 (top shelf) on each bet or min. 25 cent slots (well drinks), as long as you tip, the service was right on. The bed was awesome and we were in the cheap room, I wish I upgraded cause they were worth the money, I peaked in during housecleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Ash076
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went on vacation to the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. We had a great stay there. Our room was in the Rush tower. Everything was pretty much brand new and very clean. The bed was super comfortable. Only complaint about the room was that housekeeping came every morning at 8:15am and woke us up as we didn't have a do not disturb sign in our room. Staff was very helpful and the food was delicious! The shark tank aquarium pool was great and we spent an afternoon hanging out by the pool. The waitresses took their time bringing change back (I'm not sure if this was on purpose because they hoped we had forgotten) but were very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a hotel on Fremont Street I would absolutely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Need2EscapeAZ
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas before, but this was our first visit downtown. We arrived about 4pm on Friday and we were immediately assisted by the valet at the entrance on Casino Center. We didn't want bell service, so we unloaded our bags and headed inside. One big surprise immediately inside the door is there was no ramp around the small set of steps into the lobby. While a nuisance for wheeled luggage, I don't know what they do to accommodate wheelchairs or scooters. We waited with the luggage while the guys went to check in. There was no wait, but check-in seemed to take longer than usual for a hotel. The guys didn't complain about the staff or service at check-in, so I presume it was nothing awful. We did get the room type that we reserved -- non-smoking king in Carson tower. We headed up to our room on the 16th floor. The elevators were quick and available(which was the case for our entire stay). We were in the far end of the Carson tower, so it took a few stops to read the signs to figure out how to find our room. I had already seen pictures of the rooms in Carson tower, so there was no surprise. The room was clean and reasonably spacious, but it would feel pretty crowded with 2 queens in the same room. We had an awesome view of the valet parking garage as well as other parts of downtown. ;) We both slept as well as usual on the bed. There was nothing noticeably uncomfortable about it. They provided the usual assortment of toiletries and added a second set when housekeeping came through on Saturday. Only surprise was a Keurig coffee maker. I had specifically looked at the hotel's web site on room amenities and there was no mention of a coffee maker in the rooms, so I didn't bring any coffee. Of course, there was a charge for the coffee -- $10 for a 4-pack of k-cups. So, if you drink coffee, bring your own k-cups!!! Hubby got in the pool and tested out the slide. He said the slide was great and the pool water was a good temperature. The pool is a bit small and has a lot of shade, so it would probably be unsatisfying for a day of laying out by the pool. But it's probably perfect for sitting on a chair and watching your kids play around in the water. And watching the shark tank! We never got over to the adults only pool. We didn't eat there at all, so I can't comment on food at all. We ate at Binion's steak house which was awesome and at Hash House at the Plaza which was very good. We also ate at the Chicago Brewing Company at the Four Queens and it was nearly awful. We really didn't interact with any of the staff at Golden Nugget at all, but the few we did talk to were very nice and gracious. We did most of our gambling at other casinos downtown, especially Fremont, since the table minimums were lower. For us, the Golden Nugget was mostly a home base for the other things we were doing. I think it all comes down to expectations. We didn't expect it to be like a luxury suite on the strip. We've stayed in regular rooms at the Luxor and Monte Carlo and our room at the Nugget was just as nice as those and in some ways nicer. Noise from the hall and other rooms kept us awake all night at Monte Carlo. The Golden Nugget was very quiet up on our floor. We never heard people in the hallways or from the rooms around or above us. The room doors were very quiet when they opened and closed instead of the slamming you hear in other hotels. As far as we could tell, the whole floor might have been empty! Maybe we don't expect much, but as long as things are clean and the bed, shower, sink, and toilet are usable, we are generally satisfied. In general, I enjoyed staying downtown more than on the Strip. I liked the smaller feel of the area. I liked that I could walk 50 feet down Fremont street and go buy a bottle of water at the ABC store for less than a dollar. I liked that it was less crowded for walking around than many places on the Strip. The free entertainment at the stages on Fremont street was generally decent, some better than others. The drinks were definitely priced much better than anywhere on the strip (we paid $20 for a beer and a rum/coke at Caesers!!!). Fremont felt more like wandering around at an outdoor mall while the strip often feels like being herded like cattle. There are definitely sights worth seeing on the Strip and I absolutely recommend a trip down there for anyone new to Vegas. But I think Fremont street and downtown is a better choice for casual hanging out and drinking and gambling. Everything is so close together and it's not a major expedition to go to someplace outside your hotel. I think our main complaint about the Nugget is the lighting. They may be going for ambiance, but the halls and rooms were a bit too dark for our taste. I kept trying to find a light in the room good enough to read maps and papers. The "Elevator" sign was also hard to see -- a small spotlight on the sign would do wonders. We would definitely stay there again, although we might like to try the Rush tower for comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Jules0529
Reviews.Content: Liked staying there. Wonderful hotel. Rooms spacious and clean. Great pool. However- we ordered a fridge when we checked in. They said they would deliver it shortly. We called 3 hours later and they said it would be right up. But- no fridge. Called again the next day and they said no problem - it will be right up. Never received the fridge our entire stay( 4 days) . Also- sent us to the wrong tower at check in which wasted 20 minutes and was a pain bc we had to haul our luggage around after flying 5 hours. Would I stay there again?? Maybe. Would like to check out another downtown hotel and compare

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: ScubagirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because my husband was there for a work conference. The first three days of our visit, we stayed at a much nicer hotel on the strip. The stay was a disaster from the start. We could not get into the parking garage so pulled up to the valet and then had to wait in our car because I couldn't get out since the area was so crowded with other cars. We entered the hotel and stood in line for well over an hour. Once we got up to the front desk, we were told that there were no nonsmoking king rooms available but to check back in a half hour. We had a reservation for a non-smoking king. I told the front desk person that was not acceptable. There was a smoking room available, so I told her we would try that. We walked into that room, and the smell was overwhelmingly awful! I called the front desk and after being on hold for what seemed like forever, finally spoke to someone who said our room was being cleaned and we should check back in a half an hour. I asked if I could have the room number, and she said that they couldn't provide that. So, we took our luggage and went and sat by the pool. I went back up to the front desk after 30 minutes, and I was told that they were still cleaning our room. The funny thing is - we never saw a room being cleaned in all of our walking around the hotel that day. I asked her how long it would take, and she said another 30 minutes. I told her this was totally unacceptable and that I wanted to speak to a manager. She said the managers were all busy helping other guests. I told her I could wait. My husband and I stood our ground, and magically a room was available. Of course, it was a double room but it was nonsmoking. As we were talking to other people in line, they were all having the same issue. One woman said that she had the wrong room, and her daughter ended up sleeping on the floor. The hotel didn't have any extra roll-aways and no extra blankets. The room was definitely nothing to brag about either. The beds were old and uncomfortable, the furniture was old and dirty. The bathroom/shower had a "squishy" bottom, and the bathroom was gross. I will never stay at the Golden Nugget again! The hotel was extremely crowded with a lot of teenagers running all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: Trojah M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Its not on the strip though. Its actually downtown. It has a old charm to it sort of reminds me of old Hollywood. The pool THE TANK is amazing. This hotel is filled with elderly people though. I'm only 25 but the older people didn't bother me at all. As a matter of fact I'd rather be around them at the end of the night then a bunch of young and loud kids. This hotel is truly like home away from home. When your all worn out from the excitement from the strip hop in a cab, pay about $20 to get back to your hotel oasis! This was my first time in Vegas. The buffet was GREAT as well!

Reviews.Title: “what you make it”
Reviews.Author: more4yourbuck
Reviews.Content: We love Fremont street the old and casual feel its" what you make it ".The Golden Nugget was great. Good food,clean rooms,GREAT comfy beds,shark tank and pool awesome and the fire pit by the hot tub was relaxing.And the duece bus was great to take to the strip if you aren't in a hurry.Been to Vegas 4 times and noticed more homeless and people begging for money on Fremont Street and the Strip more then other years.Just a mental note to people you don't know who is under those costumes wondering around for there pictures to be takin for a buck or to cop a feel.BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great stay at The Golden Nugget LV!”
Reviews.Author: HWJOEA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GN from 2/22/12 thru 2/27/12 and I was pleasantly surprised. Overall this property was quite nice and definitely a departure from staying on the Strip! It def is the nicest casino in the Fremonst Street area! THE GOOD: The hotel is very clean. The staff very friendly. Its location is convenient being smack in the middle of Fremont Street. Food choices are very good. I ate at the buffet, very price-worthy with and witrhout the coupons provided at check-in, the 24 hour cafe, tasty and good value, and Lillies Asian House for Japanese Hibachi which was as tasty as it was entertaining! The rooms in the CARSON tower have been freshly renovated and it shows. New Mattresses, clean and modern decor, and quite spacious! The pool area/aquarium are pretty cool and the pool was quite refreshing and thepool staff friendly. THE MEH: The casion while large is a bit confusing and spread slightly haphazardly. You will eventually get used to it but being an old school casino, they try to modernize anyway they can and it can get a bit crowded and cramped. Signage is a bit confusing with poor contrast but again after a few days you should get used to it. Most of the craps and poker dealers I saw were friendly but a slight few were quite cold and unfriendly. [Maybe they werent having a good day]. The slots werent loose but were occasionly paying out pretty well. Drinkj service is hit and miss but mostly when its really crowded; otherwise it was pretty good. THE BAD: Check in was pretty hectic and confusing. No one at the frontt desk staff seemed to know that my convention group was supposed to placed in a particular block of rooms. Also when I went back up to the front desk get a coupon book that wasnt given to us at check in; the front end staff were actually quite surly to me about my request; like I was asking for a free room or a gold plated mattress. I was passed off a few times until I found the right person and even then it was like they were doing me a favor rather than providing me with something I should have gotten in the first place. Overall I would def recommend staying at the GN is you will be staying in the Fremont Street area!

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy service and Freemont street feels unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Reddevils73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my partner's 40th birthday. We booked online and asked for a non smoking room and upon arrival were offered a smoking room in a cheaper tower than the one we had booked. We were not happy but they said this was all they had. Then we complained and they offered us a different tower. We went to the new room to find a man also trying to get into the same room and a couple were already in the room. We went down again and after complaining were offered a penthouse suite which was lovely. However, it was the sheer fact that we had to complain and keep trotting down in the lift that was annoying. I didn't feel they were very apologetic and no one seemed to know what was going on. The buffet was disgusting and overall I preferred being on the strip. There are a lot of homeless people around here and they come in to the hotels asking for money. We later moved to Ceasar's Palace which was awesome. Give Freemont strip a miss, and the north mall. Go the South Mall it is better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler1801
Reviews.Content: We were just looking for a place to crash after a night out, and i was very skeptical considering that many people believe fremont street and downtown to be very trashy. The stay exeeded our expectations. The pool was amazing, although we never actually went in, just lounged by the firepit. The slots were tight, but its a short walk to other casinos. Our carson tower room was very nice, although slightly outdated. Bed was soooo comfortable. Our friends got a room in the new tower, so we will definitely stay there next time. Great value and the Fremont experience was awesome. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Laraine D
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Nugget. We go once a year to Vegas and always stay on the strip. The last few years at the Wynn, which we love. This year we wanted to try something different. We read all the reviews and decided to stay at the Nugget. We had a great time. The pool is unbelievable, the restaurants were all good. We ate breakfast at the buffet which had everything imaginable and all good. Custom made omelets were great. As many reviewers have mentioned, the Grotto had good Italian food and service. We had lunch at the Grill one day. Hamburgers, hot dogs, pastrami sandwiches, etc. We asked at check in for a quiet room and was put in the back not overlooking Fremont St. It was quiet and clean. Very comfortable beds. Felt like Mardi Gras every night outdoors. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We HATE This Place”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the best hotels on the Strip. Husband had to come for business...this is why we had to stay here:( We HATE the Fremont area and all the stuff that is here. We consider it a dangerious/low class part of town and we do not go there. BUT, since BUSINESS is paying for it...had NO choice. Hotel is rather low class...stayed in the Rush Tower...and all the "glam" they had. Which is none. Room was VERY dark....VERY Dark. Okay bed...the entire room made us feel creepy. Look out the window and there was some parking garage...yeah...PERFECT Vegas. We would NEVER pick this hotel on our own. If I had to, I would rather not come to Vegas. Each person has their opinion. And, our's is...NO.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: HellerbCalgary
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Nugget. Rooms are nice and large and clean. Staff is great. Really nice restaurants, especially The Grotto It's great staying on Fremont as opposed to the Strip because there's no 10 mile hike from one hotel to the other. Fremont is very busy at night so there's always somthing to do and people watching is at it's best on Fremont. We stayed in a regular room and it was fine. Beds are super comfortable. I can't think of anything negative to say. Had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: Myrac805
Reviews.Content: To start off with we had to line up for 3 and 1/2 hrs. to check in as their computors were down. We had stayed there in july the past year and the same thing happened. Attendents put other people in front of us in the line and when we all complained they just shrugged it off. We were not compensated for our long wait and stress. Were given coffee in our room for the 1st day and after that we had to pay if we wanted it. All other hotels give it free. We were given tickets to a country show that was an accident waiting to happen. When we got up the escelator we found that there was no room to get off escelator, so we literally fell into people. They would not open the doors to the theater which would have eliminated this problem. We went to the buffet for breakfast and they had run out of waffles. I asked them to make some more and they said they were out. Who runs out of stuff at a buffet. The whole area was so disorganized. People lined up for the egg station that didn't want it but had to stay in the line. Our coffee was cold by the time we got back to our table.When we checked out after 4 nights they tried to charge us for a breakfast we never had in the cafe. All they had to do was match the signatures and see that it wasn't ours. We were very dissappointed as we enjoy staying on freemont st.

Reviews.Title: “VIP = Very Insignificant Person - I guess.”
Reviews.Author: Christopher W
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2/20 - 2/23 (Only because they had charged ALL night up front- by mistake?) Checked In with the rudest Front Desk cleark I have ever dealt with. Stayed in the new Rush Tower $160 for a Corner Suite on a weekday - supposed to be VIP, the room was nice but $10 for in room coffee from a Keurig and styrofoam cups with "handi-pac" sugar? $8 for a bottled water? Extra charge for Internet? The hotel did its best about every 5 hours or so to make our stay a living nightmare (Maids knocking on your door @ 8AM to see if they can clean your room - Construction @ 6AM that sounds like a truck is running into the building over and over again - Hotel computer systems crashing every 3 hours so no one knows whats going on with room charges (At this time I have been charged for 5 nights and only stayed there 3 - no one seems to be able to fix it) - When I asked to speak to a manager I was told he was very busy and would not come to the Rush Tower - When I demanded to speak to a manager I was told I would have to go to the other side of the property to the Main registration area as thats where their offices are - I went over there and the manager still refused to come out - I could see why EVERYONE in that lobby was angry - NEVER - EVER - EVER again !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still good but a few "kinks" to work out”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: When we go to Vegas we always prefer to stay downtown. Love the Fremont experience - light show, rock bands, easy to walk in and out of casinos AND we win more downtown than we do on the strip. Stayed in the Rush Tower. Very nice rooms - like the double sinks, and fairly spacious. While many strip hotels charge a "resort fee" the Nugget goes not BUT we had to pay $10.00 if we want coffee in our room using the little one cup canisters. Would rather have good coffee from Starbucks. Fitness Center was $20.00 a day. We chose to walk Fremont and get exercise for free. There were hardly any plugs for appliances in the rooms. With two cell phones, IPODS, Kindle, etc they need to update this so that items can be easily plugged in. I just bring an extension cord where ever I go since some hotels still don't have enough plugs. The biggest issue we had with the hotel was the noise factor. The rooms must be made of paper. We were awakened at 3:00 AM by our neighbors playing loud music and singing at the top of their lungs. Now....yes this is Vegas and we were out and got home late too but did not choose to sing and play music for all to hear...so why don't the hotels have better soundproofing in the rooms since they know this will be happening on a daily basis. We decided to put up with this for about 45 minutes hoping that the neighbors would fall asleep or pass out but no luck. Finally at 3:45 am I decided to call the front desk only to be told all operators were busy and I was number 3 on hold. I held for 15 minutes and finally just left a message. Their message says they will call back. At 4 AM I pounded on the wall loudly twice and it worked.....silence after that. No call back ever from the front desk and no one ever to answer the phone...what if it was an emergency????? At check out I was charged an extra $90.00 by mistake on my bill. If I hadn't looked it over carefully and kept my original reservation booking, I would have had to pay this. As it turned out, I was told they switched over to a new computer system and the price had incorrectly transferred over. I was given a $90.00 credit back to my credit card but haven't seen it yet so hopefully I won't have to fight this one out with them as it was their mistake. However, even with these issues, I still feel this is the best hotel to stay at downtown. Service is generally good. Nice bars and entertainment. Free parking. Nice budget rent a car in the hotel making it very easy to rent a car for heading out to see the sights. Just keep an eye on your final bill and bring earplugs if you are not a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is my place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Angilynny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Rush Tower at Golden Nugget twice. Once in April of 10 and then October 11. I have no customer service complaints at all. The first time we stayed they let us check into our room at 10am nothing better than that. The second time we stayed it was a Friday evening and it took us 10 minutes to check in. The pool area is great I especially love the poolside blackjack. There were wonderful blackjack dealers outside and our whole group had a great time. We had one bad experience inside with a dealer he laughed at us when we lost our money. That is really the only complaint I have at all about the Nugget. We go to Vegas to gamble drink and have a fun time with friends. We have eaten at the buffet (its ok) Grotto which is really yummy and the asian restaurant which is really good also. The first 4 times we went to Vegas we stayed on the strip and I don't think we will stay anywhere but Golden Nugget in the next few visits.

Reviews.Title: “Literally a breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: calanne
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it's the smoke free rooms, the fish tanks at the pool and Chart House restaurant, or the amazing food at a fair price, but whatever the case the Golden Nugget was a breath of fresh air after spending 3 hectic days on the strip. We really loved our room in the Rush Tower and had a view of the strip and pool. Nice. Ordered room service and low and behold, we did not get robbed for a soup and a sandwich! Everyone was so nice and approachable. The spa is gorgeous - wish I was able to take advantage of it but it's on my to-do list when we go back. The Fremont Street experience was just fun and flirty and prices were much more reasonable than the strip. I'm glad we ended our 5 day Vegas trip here since we were able to relax and enjoy ourselves before coming home. We also took in the newly opened Mob Museum which is a short walk away. I truly recommend checking it out if you have time - a very cool exhibit which took us a little over 2 hours to complete. the Golden Nugget was clean and classy and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “"Good for a traveling group"”
Reviews.Author: Keliixmom
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our soccer team (17 year old boys) to the Las Vegas Mayor's Cup 2-17-12 and stayed at the Golden Nugget. At the same time, there were girls volleyball teams also staying at the Nugget for a tournament, and lots of families supporting them. Because of these two tournaments, President's Day is a good weekend to go if you are looking for a more wholesome crowd. Although the Nugget was loud and brassy compared to our hometown, it seemed serene after visiting the Strip one night. The pool was terrific and had a great hot tub. The staff was polite and friendly and the beds were really comfortable. Downside was that everywhere smells of smoke, but that seems to be Vegas in general.

Reviews.Title: “Wynn's legacy is gone....”
Reviews.Author: Hamill67
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor let me down. This place is nowhere near as good a hotel as similarly rated hotels like the Mirage. It took one full hour to check in and the clerk was completely unapologetic about it. The black jack dealers weren't very friendly and the pit bosses were cocky. Don't stay here. The hotel wynn built long ago on strong service is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: calnevatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Rush Tower, a tower which they put up 2 years ago. It was a package deal which included air, limo & VIP check-in which was short since there was no line. First time in the Rush Tower, back in Oct we had stayed in the original property so the contrast in rooms was markedly different. Two years ago, GN made additions which included the Rush Tower, new casino area, new 2nd-story pool & slide down to the first level through a shark tank. If we hadn't been strongly encouraged to take a look back in October by GN's Director of Player Development, we probably would never have known about the changes which have had a positive effect on us. We only ate our breakfast or lunch at GN but felt that it was on the pricey side even though our meals would be covered by comps. If you're on a budget, there are plenty of dining options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Days”
Reviews.Author: WANAKO54
