Reviews.Content: This is a property located in the Old Las Vegas downtown. Freemont St. is just outside the building where a colorful LG electronic canopy display awaits for your amusement covering at least 5 long blocks of free entertainment as you stroll down the street.Tribute bands,local artists,and many other casinos are along those 5 blocks. After going to the strip for far too long, this place is a much quieter place and less congested.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas for the price.”
Reviews.Author: TC-SD
Reviews.Content: We have visited Vegas many times and always stayed on the strip. For this trip we decided to do 2 days on the strip (Flamingo) and 1 night at the Golden Nugget. What a difference, the strip is all glitz and no substance or character whilst Fremont Street (and not just the lights) is a real experience and full of a party atmosphere. Fremont street is no our preferred Vegas destination and the Golden Nugget is the best place to stay whilst there. The rooms are very nice but nothing special and most hotels on the strip are just as good if not better. But that’s where the comparison ends, The GN (and Fremont Street) is full of people enjoying themselves with a happy and friendly attitude. The pools at the GN are great, warm and open till late for the enjoyment of the guests (unlike the Flamingo). The 16yr+ infinity pool on the roof was extremely relaxing even though both pools maintained an almost party atmosphere without being in our face or disturbing those we wanted to relax. Would we stay at the GN again, absolutely the next time we’re in Vegas. Can’t finish the review without trying to convey just how enjoyable the Fremont Street area is. There is an electric atmosphere with loads of street entertainment going on. Stay in the main area and you can help but feel intoxicated with the atmosphere and certainly never threatened. It will appeal to all generations, including children. We loved walking up and down the street soaking up the atmosphere and felt very devilish with our cans of beer in brown paper bags which had been courteously supplied at the gift shop were we bought them. Take my advice stay at Fremont Street, enjoy the atmosphere and good humour and just make trips to the Strip when you feel the need to see the glitz as you shuffle along it from one Mega casino to another.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Fun Location”
Reviews.Author: Kerry A
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget is a beautiful hotel in downtown Las Vegas with amazing prices and very good service. I can't get over how beautiful the room was. It was in the Rush Tower (I think that is what its called). Awesome, but generally over-crowded pool, fantastic restaurants, and downtown is a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Take it or leave it”
Reviews.Author: travelisfun2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was adequate. Total lack of customer service. Rooms were very clean and large close to Fremont street which is a lot trashier than I remembered. I think for the price we paid we could have stayed on the strip somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay when you're downtown”
Reviews.Author: milkergirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Golden Nugget in a Rush Tower room. Great room. It was comparable to many of the rooms we've stay at around the country under the Hyatt or Hilton name. It was nice having it's own entrance to check in so we didn't have to walk through the casino with our bags. We arrived around 10am, and were able to check in, which was great. The Rush tower is non-smoking which is a nice break from the smokey casino. We've stayed at other casinos where it's just select rooms that are non-smoking, but they still tend to smell like smoke. The bed was very comfortable. The only small issue that we had was we had put a tip out one evening for housekeeping for the next morning, but when we returned, an evening housekeeping employee had come into the room that we didn't expect and took the tip without doing anything in the room. We had not requested turndown service, nor was it done, so we're not sure why an evening housekeeping employee had come into the room. We did try many of the restaurants, including the Buffet, Carson Street Cafe, Lillian's, The Grotto (twice), and Vic & Anthony's. They were all amazing. We're already planning our next trip to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “I like staying at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: JCfromOKC
Reviews.Content: Checked in around noon on Saturday 2/11/12. The line was long but went quickly. The girl working the front desk was very friendly. They didn't have any kings ready but did have a two queen room so we took it. We stayed in the Gold tower which was a mistake, it is terribly outdated. The air conditioner was extremely noisy and barely kept the room cool even though it was February. Hate to think what it would have been like in August. Going again next summer and will definitely book in the new rush tower. Don't get me wrong, I love the Golden Nugget. The casino and the service is the best you can find downtown but I recommend either going cheaper and staying in the Carson tower or spending more and staying in the Rush tower.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Coco2707
Reviews.Content: My parents love over here we stay here everytime we go to Vegas even before I was 21.every person from the cocktail waitresses to the dealers is so nice can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “RUSH tower is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: SKinAZ
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas twice a yr for Furniture Market, which is almost walking distance to the GN. It is BY FAR the nicest hotel in "Downtown" Vegas! We don't leave it except for Market. The Rush Tower Rooms are new and FAR nicer than the older sections of this hotel - even the non-smoking rooms there reek of cigarettes. The Rush Tower also has a private check-in desk which is really nice and convenient. Rush Tower rooms have modern furnishings, flat-screen TVs, built in desks/cabinets/drawers, and faux leather sectional sofas. The baths have high-end fixtures and finishes - tile that looks like wood on the floor, vessel sinks (2), separate water closet FURTHEST from the bed - hooray! Deep tub-shower combo. As for restaurants, we've been to all except the high-end steakhouse - can't recall the name. The teppanyaki restaurant is excellent, but only has 2 teppan tables. Cafe is great for good (for casino) priced sandwiches and such. Buffet is OK, nothing special (breakfast/lunch - have not gone for dinner). RED Sushi is one of our favorites! Not much on atmosphere (open to the casino) but fantastic rolls and fresh sushi. Chart House is good as expected, with a giant saltwater fish tank as a centerpiece, and lots of fresh flower arrangements. We went to the Italian restaurant once and did not care for it at all - margarita pizza and chicken parm - Italian basics but they were Chef Boyardee-caliber, at $15-20 each. There's a cafe by the sports book that makes AWESOME garlic parm fries, if you need a snack! The pool area can complete with resorts at the Strip so far as people-watching - an episode of "CSI" was filmed there on one visit. It's smaller but VERY nice and well-maintained. It's a pain that they require you to carry your room-charge-card, photo ID and a room card to charge to your room - especially at the pool! Too much stuff to keep track of. The clientele at GN is slightly higher than the rest of downtown Vegas, although that doesn't say much. I've always felt safe, but not necessarily germ-free. An occasional hooker strolls through, but security is on the ball and quickly and quietly escort them out.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Charm, Hometown Value”
Reviews.Author: Sumfabgear
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in Downtown La Vegas before, and had no expectations for anything but a clean place to crawl into after a night of fun. My friend and I were disappointed to find our room was a smoking room, but all others were sold out. Actually, that, and the lack of a "courtesy" coffee maker were my only complaints. Spacious room, clean, with plenty of towels. I can see myself returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, everything is ala carte”
Reviews.Author: Wendy K
Reviews.Content: The property is extremely clean, spacious and sparkling. Hotel employees are gracious, patient and helpful, especially Jeff the Doorman. Internet service is $13 a day, coffee in your room costs $10 for 4 cups, a one liter bottle of FIGI water is left in your room with a $7 price tag on it. If you want coffee to be left in your room on a daily basis, you have to request it after the first night. The buffet is excellent in food and service. Get around the internet fee by bringing your laptop down to the lobby Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Strip, pay less for the best!”
Reviews.Author: TeddyC52
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for the week to attend a convention on the strip for the first 3 days. After our 3 days at the MGM Grand we headed downtown to finish our vacation at The Golden Nugget downtown. The Nugget has always been the crown jewel of downtown and the recent renovations and new Rush Tower are the icing on the cake. I sent my wife ahead on Thursday in a cab while I finished my convention chores. The staff was helpful in getting her and our considerable baggage into the hotel and room. The fridge we ordered was delivered before the bags made it to the room. The check in staff was friendly and efficient. We chose the new Rush Tower and were overwhelmed. Lots of earth tones and an asian flare. The room was plenty large, well appointed and very clean. The Nugget has not gone with the resort fees so we had to pay for the wifi, which was actually a savings over the resort fees at other hotels in Vegas. The room has a Keurig coffee maker, but the cups are 4 for $12. Save some money and go across the street to the Dunkin Donuts, if you have to drink in the room, buy the k-cups at the DD. Typical high priced mini bar items, but there was a well stocked gift shop right off the elevator with everything you could imagine including bottled booze. We like downtown, it has a different vibe than the strip and everything is so close. There was a Walgreens right around the corner for those things we forgot and three other casinos on the same intersection we were on. Plenty of other casinos line Fremont Street, plus there are bands every night playing for free as part of the Fremont Street Experience. For low budget gamblers like us, your money goes a lot further downtown. The slots pay better and you can always find a $5 blackjack table and often a $3 table.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to fault..”
Reviews.Author: Dee1828
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms and clean. Enjoyed being down town away from the hussel and bussel. Pool area looked fabulous! No point buying bottles of water/food from the hotel when they have a convince store next door. Had a fun night with the hubby at Golden Nuggets club "Gold digger". Had a great stay, nothing to complain about. Great Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest by far downtown - but prefer the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Page1977
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was nice. Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. This trip was a spur of the moment trip on Super Bowl Weekend - so we decided to stay downtown - a first. It was ok - but I much prefer the Strip. Smoke was bad. More panhandlers. Very crowded. We still had fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover171
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend 2/11/12 -2/13/12. Stayed in Carson Tower 18th floor. Rooms were clean, but daily maid service was slow or non-existent. Room offered bottle of Fuji water for $7, Keurig coffee maker with 4 pods for $10. Friends did check in so cant comment on speed. Parking was free, but Saturday night circled 1/2 hour to find spot as garage is open to all. Ice machine on floor was good, TV worked fine. Single sink bathroom w/tub/shower. Overall room was dark - lighting wasn't too bright. Check out was leaving keycard in room. Overall nothing fantastic but nothing bad.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tayshan1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I booked a room at the Golden Nugget because of the price and the location. We prefer to stay away from the traffic. We had not stayed here since 2004 and after the experience we had, it will never happen again. We arrived at 1pm to check in only to be told to let them store our luggage because their computers systems were down. They were switching over to a new system. One of the front desk clerks said check in would start at 3pm. When we come back at 3pm there was a line of about 100 people. Then we were told to come back at 4pm. We came back at 4pm and now it's 200 people in line and the computers were still down. By 4:30 I went up to the front desk and asked for a refund so that I can go to another hotel. They did not pay for us to go to the other hotel and still have not given me my refund. All they were offering was free water, beer and buffet vouchers. Most of the people in line were elderly people and they had to stand in line for hours to check in. I can't tell you what the room looked like because I never had a chance to see it. There isn't a wheelchair ramp and the cocktail waitress spilled a drink all over my mothers cream colored coat and her coach purse. She blotted the coat with club soda...WOW. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelfoodie1018
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at the Golden Nugget during our recent trip to Vegas. We couldn't get in anywhere on the strip for our first night, so we thought to give downtown a try for the first time ever. Boy am I glad we did! We LOVED the Golden Nugget! First off, the valet service was nice, especially since it was free. Check in was easy and we were able to get a room on a high floor not near elevators/ice machines, which was a plus. The only negative was that we weren't in the newer (Rush) tower and came to find out it wasn't much more to stay over there... I wish someone had offered it to us. Nonetheless, our room was really nice and clean, the bed was comfortable, and it was a good size. We LOVED the pool area. Though it was a bit chilly to swim, it was nice to sit outside, listen to music, have a drink, and be near the fire pit. I do wish they had more more pits though, because it was usually packed and didn't allow for more people to partake in it's glory. Even though we only stayed one night, we really enjoyed the atmosphere of the Golden Nugget. There are two starbucks (a huge plus for me) and lots of restaurants to choose from at this hotel and at nearby hotels. It also is nice that this is the place for cheap gambling (fremont st.). We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown at the GN is the way to go”
Reviews.Author: Tmurrayis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget on our last 3 visits to Vegas and find the hotel and location checks off most of the boxes. The Gold Club rooms are nice but I think we will opt for the Rush tower which was opened a couple of years ago so much newer. We like the location as the strip is just too sprawling and it is a major hike just to get from one casino to the next. Also, the table minimums on the strip have become unaffordable unless you want to gamble at 7:30 AM. Downtown is not a glitzy as the strip but you can go from one casino to the next within a minute so very convenient. The table minimums are also much lower so your stake lasts a little bit longer. I suggest renting a car at the airport and taking advantage of GN's free and expedient valet service. You can then get to the strip easily and use the free parking that is provided at all the main casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: twototravel
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Vegas once (sometimes twice) a year for the past 16 years and have stayed exclusively at the Nugget for the past 15. We like staying in the downtown area; and since we always spend at least a week, we rent a car and enjoy driving to different casinos on the strip 4 to 5 times a week and even drive to the M casino, Silverton and Red Rock. Thus we get to experience all of Vegas during our stay. We are retired seniors and travel 3/4 times a year to other parts of the country and Europe and consider Vegas our "budget" trip. We stay at the Nugget off season when the rates are low (we averaged 60 dollars a night for the week this past trip); we take advantage of some of the downtown deals - 2 for 1 buffets, etc. We have always stayed in the Carson tower because it is close to the self-parking garage; this tower is far (a long walk) from the casino, but the walk isn't as bad as some make it out to be! This tower (I can't speak for the rest of the hotel) advertises "king" size beds, but they are really queen (and their queen beds are really double). I don't understand why they do this...but the beds are very comfortable. Our room this stay was very clean when we arrived and the daily maid service was wonderful. The two chairs in the room weren't very comfortable and one had quite a few stains on the arms and seat. The flat screen TV was a nice size; the lap top did not work. We like the addition of the Keurig coffeemaker; we took our own K cups. We were on the lowest floor (third) and weren't bothered much by any street noise. Occasionally we'd hear a rowdy vacationer in the hall but overall, the tower was quiet. We usually eat at the Grotto once or twice during a visit; but didn't this trip. We did enjoy happy hour at The Chart House.....a great deal on fantastic appetizers (that made for an inexpensive evening meal). We had lunch at the buffet; it was adequate/ good (not great). Our only disappointment was the gambling at the Nugget; we played the slots for three hours on our second day and (1) did not see or hear a CW and (2) had absolutely no luck at the machines - it was like they sucked our money as fast as we put it in. Thus for the rest of the week we only gambled at the other downtown casinos (4 Queens, Binions, Fitzgeralds and Freemont); we decent luck and good drink service. We are already thinking ahead to next year's trip!

Reviews.Title: “Really Impressed”
Reviews.Author: L82travel
Reviews.Content: After several visits to Vegas, we wanted to stay on Fremont Street. We booked the Nugget as it was described as being the most deluxe hotel downtown. We stayed in the Carson Tower even though the Rush Tower and Gold Tower had larger rooms and more ammenities. Our room was spacious enough and well appointed. NIce bathroom, granite countertops and flat screen TV. The view from the window was of the mountains, and we did miss a large window with "Vegas" lights. The walk to the casino was quite far, and there were Ticket Hawkers outside of the elevators which were annoying. The pool space was lovely with a beautiful large fish tank, bar, card tables, and "firepit" conversation areas. All the bars were intimate. The casino was OK, but I prefered the others on Fremont as they were more fun, not so stuffy, and had better slot machines. The experience was great! We might choose another hotel next time around, but we will definately stay on Fremont Street again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: nathanjb
Reviews.Content: **Please read the whole review before labeling me as a downtown hater** Each year I travel to Las Vegas for the Consumer Electronic Show and this year we decided to stay at The Golden Nugget. Having stayed here several years ago, I was curious to see if it's still as nice as I remembered. The hotel did not disappoint. Check in went smooth with very nice customer service at the front desk, the walk to the room is relatively short, and the elevators were quick, with little wait (maybe it's just me but long elevator waits and rides are infuriating). We stayed in the south tower(furthest from the Fremont Experience) and between the front desk and our room was a busy bar(I believe it is called The Ice Bar), the pool(more on that in a minute), the hotel cafe(again, more on that in a minute ) , clothing store, japanese restaurant ,convenience store, and a starbucks. The room was nice and is comparible to any standard room on the strip, unlike most of the other rooms downtown, which can be quite small and dingy. Most importantly the room was clean, quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom is...well, a bathroom. It is clean with soaps, lotions, shampoo and conditioner. The only issues I had were the air conditioning unit which rattled a little but a piece of paper wedged in the vent fixed that easily, and while the coffee maker was a Kuerig, which was nice, they charge for the coffee (I guess the days of free coffee are over at the Golden Nugget...booo!). The tv is a nice flat screen but I don't watch much tv so, not a priority for me. Being that this was winter, we didn't spend any time at the pool but it is very impressive looking for such a small area. There is a bar outside near the Jacuzzi and fire pit, as well as gaming tables. There seems to be plenty of seating and lounge chairs, though in the summer it might be kinda tight, as well as a pretty awesome looking water slide that goes right through a huge shark tank! If we ever stay here again (more on that below) I will definitely try it. The hotel cafe is great. The service is friendly and quick, (except for the keno girl, she seems to be on sloth time) and the food is great, though the prices are a little expensive. The snack bar next to the sports book is great too. I highly recommend the hot wings, they are pretty awesome. The casino is nicely decorated, not too crowded, and a lot less smokey than most places downtown. Though, my two main interest, the sports book and poker room, are unfortunately only average. They are both small, crowded and smokey (yup, even though the poker room is smoke free, it is right next to a very busy bar and people like to hang out near the rail and smoke, ugh). Overall The Golden Nugget was again a great experience. Unfortunately I probably won't be staying there again ,and I blame the downtown experience. I have always loved downtown and almost exclusively stayed there (I have stayed in every downtown hotel many times) when I visited. It was busy, loud, kinda rough, walkable, had a real party kinda feel, and was just a lot of fun, but it has spiraled into just a weird freak show. 1st, the zip line is kinda cool but the structure is giant and kills any view looking east on fremont street. 2nd, there seems to be a lot more unsavory types, homeless people, and worst of all, character peddlers. It used to be a handful of characters, most of them pretty funny, an odd looking Mickey here, a grubby Buzz Lightyear there, but now it has degenerated into dozens of them and most of them are just nasty and are becoming quite aggressive for tips. The final straw came when I saw a family with small children (Vegas with kids!? No thanks) wedged between a dominatrix leading a man in a bikini with a leash and an old man dressed as cupid wearing nothing but wings and short shorts with the butt cut out. And while they are down on the strip, they can easily be avoided unlike in the small area of downtown. Lastly, downtown was a great deal. That doesn't really exist anymore. You can still find cheap stuff but the quality of what you get has tanked. No more cheap gambling, food can be had for cheap but don't expect much, and room rates keep going up, yet the hotels aren't improving. As nice as The Golden Nuggets is, I will be taking my dollars back to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Not so great food!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsE514
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December and I liked it a lot. I loved how beautiful but affordable it is. I loved how it's free to swim in the pool (if you're staying there), hot tub, slide, etc. The valet and front desk people were super nice. I didn't care for the food much at all, it was way too expensive for what it was. The people working at the pool weren't very nice any of the times we were out there. If we are ever on Fremont st again, we'll definitely stay here again! It's right in the heart of Fremont st and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great value.”
Reviews.Author: GWV1
Reviews.Content: Yeah, we loved it. We stayed 3 nights at Harrah's before moving to GN for a change of pace and to check out Fremont Street at night, as we've always stayed on the Strip. So glad we did. After reading the reviews, we decided to try it for a couple of days - made reservations with our Landry's membership and got a free upgrade to Gold Tower room. At VIP check in we were offered choice of Carson or Gold Tower so looked at Carson first. Carson rooms are great but beware; If you like to drink and gamble, you need hiking shoes and some provisions to make the trek as it is a LONG walk. A very long walk. Conversely, the Gold Tower rooms are right off of the casino floor and near the pool and the valet entrance. Our room overlooked the pool, was quiet and so .... choice. No king beds were available so we had doubles (NOT queen, but full size beds) but the room was perfect. Although the bathroom was relatively small, the room was clearly larger than the "mini suite" we stayed in at Harrah's and the furnishings were much better. Leather club chairs, granite topped dresser, end tables and vanity, 40+ inch flat panel TV etc... I loved this room. Overall, the service was very good, and Damien at the VIP check in is a consummate professional, incredibly patient and cordial. All of the staff were great but it was a little tough to get a drink on Friday evening if you were at a machine. The restaurants are all a little pricey, but you've got to expect that. But it doesn't matter since you can run over to Binion's, Fremont casino, Las Vegas club or the like and find specials all day long on the cheap. For non-strip gambling, the location is great. Binion's, 4 Queens, Fitz, etc... all had plenty of lower end games ($3 craps tables, for instance) and the machine payouts seemed to be radically better than the Strip. Even though it was 70 degrees, people were at and in the swimming pool. Wish we had been prepared as the pools are amazing but too crowded to enjoy in the summer. Next trip we're probably going to spend all 5 or 6 nights there. We've stayed at 8 of the casino resorts in Vegas, and so far Golden Nugget is acutally the nicest and the best value. If you have never been to Vegas before, you may prefer the Strip - otherwise, you owe it to yourself to give it a shot. I can almost guarantee you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is very Uptown”
Reviews.Author: Jayel57
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was stunning (small but very beautiful.) Because the Golden Nugget is in "Old Town" I was expecting a fairly dated room and hotel. What a surprise when I walked in! The bed was so comfortable I really struggled to get out of it to leave. I travel a lot so this was a rare pleasure. I loved the shrimp bar downstairs. The staff were friendly and helpful. This is my new favorite hotel in downtown Vegas. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: anna320
Reviews.Content: We revisited the Golden Nugget,after twelve years. Overall, it was an "okay" experience; however, the grandeur was lost to us this time. First of all, Kudos to Larry, Manager (General or Front Desk, I'm not sure) for sorting out "a problem of ours" with class. The hotel was crowded and it was disappointing that on our final night our favourite area - pool, firepit, hot tub - was closed at 3 pm for a private party. There were wonderful linens and a very comfortable bed, but minimum amenities - only two glasses in the room; substandard toilet tissue and hair products; coffee in room priced at $10 for a 4-packet; water at over $4. None would be deal-breakers, but do add up. The service by staff was polite but not personal, efficient but tired. However, at the buffet we had eggs fried by a very nice gentleman, and a young man at the newstand gave excellent service. So, we have mixed feelings in rating the hotel. We felt safe and comfortable, and it is a great location for the Fremont Light Show. Next time we would probably stay on the Strip and visit the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Tournement Getaway”
Reviews.Author: rmorris9
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomadations, up- scale restaurants are good but the slots on the floor are very tight! We like staying downtown to get away from the rat race of the strip. The Golden Nugget also has great Slot Tournements which occur about 8 times a year. The prize money is tops and the tournements often include free rooms breakfasts,drinks, extra buy-ins etc. and usually the losers in the tournements get some money back as a concillation.

Reviews.Title: “Love the nugget!!!”
Reviews.Author: MNpackerfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush tower and the room was incredible!!! We usually stay on the strip but decided to try the Golden Nugget after several of our friends recommended it. The hotel was great, we ate at every restaurant and all were excellent food, and loved the location. It is very quick and easy to ride the bus if you want to spend time on the strip. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: gk681
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new Rush tower in a Junior Suite. Room was nicely decorated, although very dark even with every light on. King size bed is a top of line Serta Perfect Sleeper pillowtop. Very comfortable, linens were also top of the line cotton, excellent feel. Not much to do downtown besides gamble and the other downtown properties are not even close to the quality of the Golden Nugget. Enjoyed this property and will likly stay again

Reviews.Title: “They understand the true meaning of welcome”
Reviews.Author: ktwist
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Golden Nugget for a buying trip at the World Market Center. This was so close and convenient to the center saving us valuable travel time everyday of the market. We were planning on going to the strip quite a distance away in the evenings. We were tired at days end so we didn't take the opportunity and chose to stay and eat and play in our hotel. Our meals at the Carson Street Cafe, Lillie's Asian Cuisine and the Grotto were very good but the most impressive part of those restaurants were the customer service, welcoming attitude and sense of professionalism of the staff. Granted, there aren't many options to eat near by other than in our hotel but the management makes one feel happy and content while there. Next time we will visit the strip to experience the other restaurants if time allows. If you are in town for business at the Market Center I can't recommend the hospitality and comfort of the Golden Nugget more highly. Plus the pool and shark tank is quite spectacular to see. Spend the extra $25 to get a VIP card allowing you to jump to the front of the line at the Carson Street Cafe for breakfast if time is important to you, it's the breakfast place and the lines can be long.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget Is a Gamble”
Reviews.Author: andrawatkins
Reviews.Content: I'm not a gambler, and I still had a generally enjoyable stay at the Golden Nugget's Rush Tower. The highlights first. The room was large, with a separate sitting area. The Serta mattress slept like a dream, even with The Fremont Street Experience right outside our window. A deep soaking tub and plenty of water pressure made me wonder whether I wanted to leave the room. Eventually, I did. The Golden Nugget is in the downtown section of Las Vegas. It is an older property, but they obviously take pristine care of it. The staff were friendly and helpful upon check-in, though they only had one person on the desk. A line several people deep formed, and they never sent anyone to help speed up the process. We ate at both the Chart House and the Grotto on the property. The food was good but not sensational. The drinks were priced right. :) I went to the spa for a hair treatment. Given the prices charged, I would've imagined the spa to be decorated in much nicer finishes. Everything was clean, and the staff were generally affable, but the place overall looked dated. I was pleased with the service I received, though there was a mixup with my bill. They tried to invoice me for it again at check-out. It took almost ten minutes to get the charge removed from my bill, and the staffer at the desk initially tried to tell us that my husband had a service, too. A taxi to the strip from this hotel is almost $30 one way with tip, and the walk to the monorail is almost two miles. If you plan to spend a lot of time on the strip, then stay there instead. I enjoyed this part of old Las Vegas, and there's plenty to do, but keep those extra costs in mind when you're booking. I would probably try a different hotel the next time I'm in Vegas. The room was exceptionally nice, but the rest of the experience was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: headred
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying in the first 5 minutes and $5 of playing by favorite Wheel of Fortune slot machine, I won $160!! Maybe this helped me enjoy my experience at the nugget :-) My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget mid January of this year. We usually stay on the strip, but my dad and his wife suggested the Nugget since it's their favorite place to stay. He's been going to Vegas for 50+ years, got married there, loves poker, says it still has the feel of the original Vegas. Thought we'd give it a try. We stayed in the Gold tower at his suggestion because the elevators are right by the front desk, near the front door and drop you right out by the casino. Apparently the Carson Tower might be a further walk from what I understand. We were on the 9th floor, overlooking the pool. Not in use in January, so that location was completely quiet. Good insulation, can't hear rooms next door. Summer might be different with noise level from pool. Rooms are very nicely remodeled, clean, flat screen TV. My best advice if you are coffee drinker, take your OWN Kuerig coffee packets. They have a one cup Kuerig maker, but if you break the seal on the 4 pack they have in the room, it'll cost you $10!! We took along our 12 pack, $7 coffee and brought along our own half and half packets and wa-la, had the best morning cup of coffee for almost nothing. They do have sugar/creamer packets if you don't want that hassle. Also, water in the room is like $7 a bottle, get one free on the floor before you go to your room! Bedding was awesome, slept like a baby. Downside, small bathroom, but who spends time there!!?? I booked the room thru Golden Nugget, was $70 a night. Think they might be one of the few hotels who don't charge a resort fee. With that we also received a coupon book which was totally worthwhile, so make sure to get that as the front clerk did not offer it until I asked for it. Inside are buy one get one free breakfast buffet. Reg. the buffet is $10.99, not bad for the vast amount of food you get, but 2 buffets for that price is awesome! The food was great, made to order eggs, also some lunch foods, salad, pasta, desserts. Drinks are included so all the oj, milk, coffee you like. A great deal!!! Get there by 9:00 to avoid the lines. We walked right in each morning at 8 and then watched the lines form. You can also find a McDonalds down the street at the Union Plaza hotel and a few other fast foods inside some of the other hotels. Other coupon in the book was for the Grotto, Italian restaurant right inside the casino. $5 off a $20 purchase. Fills up fast, but we sat at the bar, got excellent and quick service. Hubby and I shared Lasagna, had all the bread and dipping sauce we wanted, I had a glass of wine, he had water, and our bill was $17, not bad! Also, between 2 and 6 weekdays, the Grotto has happy hour pizzas, $7!! They have wood oven awesome pizzas and worth every penny, easily feeds 2. Have a $7 pizza with water and then go sit at the slot machine for free drinks. Can you tell I'm frugal yet??? We really enjoyed our stay at this location. Downtown has such a different vibe, more laid back, little more middle class, not so ritzy, not so big. I like being able to pop into all the other casinos so quickly with not much walking. We also enjoyed the Main Street Station casino just around the corner. Binnions is nice. They are all smoky and get worse as the day goes by. We found ourselves gambling more in the morning and nighttime not so much, just because of the smoke. We had dinner one night at Hugo's Cellar across the street I think in the Fremont and had a wonderful dinner. Feels very old Vegas. Expensive, but a nice treat when everything else is so reasonably priced. You can easily split, but even with the plate charge will save you money. Also, there are coupons you can find for 25% off meal, can't remember what or where they are, but they do exist. Another tip, right next door to nugget is a store called ABC I think. They have anything you need, liquor, toiletries, snacks, trinkets, and all priced regular prices. This was probably what I noticed most, downtown prices were much less than those on the strip. Not a lot of options for shopping, but thats not what I go to Las Vegas for. Last but not least, the shark tank is really cool. This place has got to be a whole nuther world in the summer!! Would be great for kids, but I could also see it being overly crowded. Just know if you are downtown, your experience will be different than the strip. Buskers in the street, people just hanging out, lots of people watching opportunities. I felt very comfortable and at ease downtown. Fun in a different sorta way. First Vegas vacation that was really relaxing. I highly recommend! BTW, we are 50 years young couple, grown kids.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' The Nugget”
Reviews.Author: islandjeffrey
Reviews.Content: We take an annual January guys trip to Vegas and have stayed at The Golden Nugget for each of the last three years. We love being downtown and the accommodations are great since the renovation. Absolutely love Vic and Anthony's is phenomenal - one of the best steakhouses you'll ever go to. And, if you prefer seafood, the Chart House is located there as well. Always a fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “This place manages to stay classy...”
Reviews.Author: mikebern
Reviews.Content: Even as downtown continues to deteriorate...In fact, it might be a little bit better than last time I was here. The confusing thing is they have so many towers & room choices/rates. Often, however, they will upgrade you if you just ask: I guess they want to make you happy... Happy customer, you'll gamble more. The (relatively) new pool area is beautiful. They seem to have scaled back their sports book a bit, which is a shame. But otherwise the dealers here remain among the most professional and competent group in Vegas and most of the patrons know how to play what they're playing. They also are pretty liberal about comping meals, etc....so that's another plus. Even if I'm not staying here, I always make a trip here to play. Their 24-hour cafe is excellent...the buffet, not so much

Reviews.Title: “What happened to service here?”
Reviews.Author: kailuafam
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying we have been staying at the Nugget for at least 10 years, sometimes several times a year for at least 5-10 nights each visit and never had any problems. Until December! We checked in late as we were driving in from Disneyland and were told only smoking rooms were available (we reserved a non smoking room, always have), it was me, my husband and 4 year old daughter. I asked if they could check again and nothing was available. We went up to the room and was shocked at its condition. The wall paper was peeling from the walls near the window big time, the carpet was stained all over the place, the toilet seat had peeling paint all over and had exposed wood (there was no way I was using that thing), the tub had rusty everything, I could go on and on, but the main thing was it was extremely smokey, really bad. I did not want my daughter sleeping in there. I went back to the desk to ask again, I was very nice, they didn't care. Back to the room, daughter had fallen asleep, I was crying that my baby had to sleep in that stinky filthy dirty room, it was a nightmare and not a 5 diamond star room (did they lose their rating?). I couldn't breathe, was breaking out in a rash all over my chest, DH had the window open, door open, everything, nothing made it better. It was about an hour later, went back down and asked nicely again if anything was available, told him I was getting sick, couldn't breathe and showed him my rash, didn't care or even blink an eye. Went back up, crying some more, back down and hour later to see if something opened up, nothing. Finally I couldn't handle the thought of my daughter in that room for another second, I put her in her stroller and took her to the looby to sleep. I check again, nothing available, it was about 4am so I parked ourselves on the couch near guest check in, hoping if something became available they'd come get me, about 4 or 5 hours later I checked again (it was now about 9:30 I think) and a room was ready. Now you think they would have said excuse me, I was right there and they knew why I was there. They didn't care at all, I really wish we would have went to another hotel but my daughter loves their pool and was so looking forward to it and other family members were checking in to join us the next day. I took pics of the filthy room and plan to send it in the the diamond review. We would have paid whatever amount was necessary to get to a non smoking room, money was not an issue. Now as to the rest of our stay, The Buffet, check the plates before you put your food on them, the majority were dirty, very dirty and we ate at the buffet for several meals, there were always lots of dirty plates in the clean stacks. As for getting a drink while gambling, don't expect much, they never hardly came around. I had to go to the gift shop to buy a bottle of water I was so thirsty. The staff also was so rude all the time, no mater if it was in a restaurant, in the casino, whatever it sucked! I am really disappointed in what as become of the Nugget. It really was our favorite, go to, place in Las Vegas. We told everyone to stay there, and I mean everyone. Being from hawaii, everyone goes to Vegas for vacation. I don't know if we'll ever stay there again, it's really sad, we thought of it as our vegas "home".. So sad, we've stayed all over the stip and preferred the Nugget over everywhere. Not sure yet whether to blow this off as a bad experience and try again or find a new vegas "home" :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but big caveat: dark rooms!”
Reviews.Author: traveldan21
Reviews.Content: I realize most people go to Vegas for pleasure, not business. But for those few who do need to do work in their room, a warning; the rooms are unusually dark. I stayed at the Rush Tower the last two business trips (hearing at the federal courthouse). The rooms are on the larger side, well furnished with large, modern bathrooms. But there are no bright lights anywhere and I even found it difficult to find light switches. There was a desk in both of the rooms I stayed in; one of the rooms was a mini-suite that I was upgraded to. But the lights come from the top of the integrated unit that also housed the TV, etc. There was no desk lamp to be found. I called the front desk to inquire but they said there is no desk lamp in the entire resort. That's unfortunate and not indicative of four star service. The first time, I was able to drag a huge floor lamp over to shine onto the desk area but this last time, there was no floor lamp to use. It really cramped my ability to read small print docs, etc. Otherwise, the hotel was fine; very good values available downtown as compared to the strip. I wasn't gambling so I can't comment on the casino. The Charthouse restaurant at the foot of the Rush Tower is very nice and had lots of good fish options, as well as a beautiful, huge circular aquarium. I also liked being able to be dropped off at an entrance very close to the dedicated Rush Tower check in desk. I've never stayed in any of the other rooms, but I imagine at a hotel this large, there might be long waits to check in, etc. For this reason alone, the Rush Tower would seem to be recommended. Now, if they can only aquire a few desk lamps...

Reviews.Title: “beware of special rates”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDusty
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the golden nugget many times when down town. The pool area is spectacular and the dealers are professional. However, this time we got a special room rate through email. When we arrived, and explained that with the good room rate, we also got 2 free drinks plus a coupon book, we were not believed. You would expect that all the specifics would be listed with our reservation. Instead, we were dismissed, even though I explained that I had the documentation in our bags (which the bellman was holding). Everyone who has checked into a casino knows that the line is long enough one time, let along two. So we had to retrieve our bags from the bellman, get back in line and talk to another person, since the lady who denied us saw us in line and walked away just as we were next in her line. We did get what we had been promised, but the room we were put into (because we refused the pressured upgrade) was musty as though it had mold in the carpet. All in all, it was a sub par experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachTripper
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the best hotel in Downtown Las Vegas. It is more like one of the "Strip" hotels in that it is more upscale than some of the surrounding hotels on Fremont Street. Depending on the experience you desire, this may not be a good thing. I say this because one of the reasons to stay downtown is to get away from the glitz of the "Strip". Downtown is more old-school Vegas, with smaller, more manageable casinos. However, while I enjoy the grittier side of downtown, I like to seek refuge in a nice, clean room. Hence I stayed at the Golden Nugget. When I checked in I was offered an upgrade to the Gold Tower or the Rush Tower, but I didn't think it was worth the extra fee. I hear the new Rush Tower is beautiful, but they only offer King-size beds, and I was traveling with a friend and I wanted a room with two separate beds. I stayed in the old Carson Tower, which has been renovated. I was on the 17th floor, and I had a so-so view of the mountains and a great view of another wing of the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable. No frills, but serviceable. The Carson Tower rooms are far from the main casino, so be prepared to walk. I didn't mind because the walk includes a pass by the lovely pool area with the shark tank, which is always pleasant to stop and watch. The bathroom had the old-fashioned tub/shower combo and the awkward shower curtain, but it was clean. The water pressure in the shower was really something to write home about! I love taking a hot shower to wash the casino smoke off of me, and this shower was amazing. Again, there was no special shower head, it was simply powerful water pressure. Since I tend to sleep late in Vegas, I was concerned that I might miss the maid service, but I needn't have worried. I saw the maid in the hall and informed her I was leaving, and the room was cleaned when I returned a short time later. The Golden Nugget doesn't charge those annoying "resort fees", but it does charge extra for in-room coffee or internet access. The restaurants in the hotel are a bit pricey for what they are, but there are plenty of more reasonable options a few steps out onto Fremont Street. To recap, the Golden Nugget is a nice "Strip" alternative when staying downtown. If you want the whole "downtown" experience, though, you may want to consider the Four Queens or Fitzgeralds.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rooms and Unbelievable Pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: PatCross
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas numerous times but haven’t ventured off the strip in years. I stayed at the Golden Nugget when I was younger and it was beautiful then, but it totally surpassed my expectations now! The rooms were remarkable and completely renovated with super comfortable beds, a nice desk and a table area too, plus great linens and drapes, etc. We loved the wide-ranging choices at their great buffet, and also took a sandwich to the pool from indoors at their super reasonable ‘sports grill’ ...Awesome food! We loved the pool area…upstairs pool is infinity type with bar and several king-size “beds” to lounge on. And the lower pool lounging area is expansive with tons of chaises and a fairly large hot tub. And the swimming pool itself is breathtaking…it encircles an unbelievable three story 250 gallon fish tank with hundreds of huge fish, plus it’s shark infested! You can slide through the fish aquarium in a transparent water-slide that lets you witness the nine or ten large (!) sharks up super close as you glide “through” them! Must do!

Reviews.Title: “Why bother with the strip?”
Reviews.Author: Elise M
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Rush Tower (I guess named after the gold RUSH?) was newly-remodeled and had all the amenities of the popular hotels on the strip. The room was spacious, nicely decorated in dark colors, and comfortable (excellent beds). The coffee set-up was a Keurig--nice. Downstairs in the same tower were a notions store, the Chart House restaurant and bar, a sushi bar. We ate at both the sushi bar and the Chart House, and they were both very good. In the adjacent building was a pool (not much used in the January weather) and other restaurants with varied themes and prices. I myself was not interested in gambling, but of course the casino was a big draw. Being on Fremont St. instead of the strip was a pleasant change. But the strip was not in walking distance, so we spent time and money on taxis (it turned out we were there while the HUGE electronics convention was going on, so the town was in gridlock--very hard to get around.) Had we not attended the Cirque du Soleil at the Mirage, we probably would not have bothered with the strip; the Golden Nugget and the Fremont experience together added up to a memorable 3-night vacation. The staff were friendly and helpful. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: Horrorflickchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Fremont Street right at the centre of the Fremont Street experience. It has a buzzing atmosphere at night when the show is every hour on the hour. The hotel itself is ver clean & rooms are a very good size. The only bad thing I would say about the rooms is that there is no coffee making facilities apart from the pack of 4 charged at 10 dollars per pack used. We chose to use the Starbucks that was situated just downstairs. The bus stop is very close to the back of the hotel & an all day pass to go up & down the strip costs 7 dollars only & this goes as far as the outlet malls on both ends & Town Square shopping area. Some of the reception staff are very friendly & willing to help you any way they can, however, some have the "I can't be bothered attitude".The all you can eat buffet breakfast is very good value for money with a good choice but we found the dinner menu very disappointing with practically nothing we would eat. We asked if we could have a look at the dinner selections before deciding & we were allowed to so at least we did not waste any money. All in all this hotel is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “always a good time”
Reviews.Author: k-rizzzle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the golden nugget early Jan and had a great time, we love staying on freemont it is so much more laid back than on the strip if your looking for a chill vacation with cheap drinks and loose slots. The nugget is the best place to stay on freemont, great pool and hot tub, clean and updated rooms and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Every Aspect Rates a 10/10!!!”
Reviews.Author: gypsycher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Carson Tower in a deluxe room...it was Fantastic!!..Beautiful and absolutely spotless!!..The H20 pool was beyond words,huge tank with sharks and a 3 story see through slide goes through the middle of the tank!!.. We ate at their buffet twice, once for breakfast and once for lunch...Awesome food!!!..Located right on Freemont Street very convient for touring...The Casino was very well laid out and all staff were incredible.... I have been in several Casinos-hotels and to me the Golden Nugget is far superior ... Plus there is a bus stop ( RTC ) which you can ride right to the strip....$ 7.00 for a 24 hour pass!! The shuttle to the airport costs $ 8.50.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay better then strip”
Reviews.Author: Brazilianbeto
Reviews.Content: Been in vegas 9 times and always stayed on the strip.I wanted to change it up so stayed downtown.This is the only place worth staying in downtown area.Rush tower was awesome and newly renovated hotel had strip look but with laid back crowd. The light show and shows at the fairmont experience was really great.i will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “User Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Seastrand
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and well appointed. Employees were most friendly from check-in through housekeeping. The list of services that were offered was extensive; even the restaurants offered a lot of variety and price ranges. The location in the heart of downtown Las Vegas was perfect, but I would caution about wandering much further than the area covered by the illuminated ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jdhanneson
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights down town at the rush tower apt the golden nugget. We have been to Las Vegas 4 times and what a blast. Enjoyed downtown so much. Not as much walking and tearing up and down the concrete on the strip. The prices for entertanment was very reasonable. Thank you. To the Golden Nugget again. We will come again fore sure .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: valueisall
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in busy downtown Las Vegas, couldn't fault it. The rooms very spacious, clean and up to date. The selection of restaurants varied and the pool area clean and well looked after. The only downsize is that it gets quite smokey in the casino area as compared to other hotels on the strip that uses ventilation systems to keep the air limpid to breathe. Its a very classic american hotel with many of its guests in the older cathegory. Personally I wouldnt stay here again only because of its location, the Freemont experience is lovely to see for an evening or 2 tops, but if youre staying for longer, Iwould reccomend to stay on the strip, wit the Venetian as one of the best. All in all a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovations .....better than the strip hotels ...definitely going back !”
Reviews.Author: llychornblower
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this property ! From the staff to the bargain rate to it's beautiful renovations ...this is the best kept secret in Vegas ! From now on ...it's the Golden Nugget for me and my peeps ! The HEATED pool is fabulous with a cool waterslide through a shark tank ! Brand new chaise lounge chairs are padded and surround the pool area ...I could live there ! Great service compliments the pool area via the pool bar and I just can't say say enough about the huge bonfire pits waiting to mezmerize and warm you on chilly nights ..... no wind , welcoming , cozy and ...OPEN FOR BUSINESS ! The strip ...been there done that ....Everyone knows your name at the Nugget !

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel in downtown vegas”
Reviews.Author: lotiss
Reviews.Content: stayed in the newly redone rush tower-it was just as nice as the wynn rooms. great pool, spa was very nice, and good choice of reatuarnts. The steak house is amazing-expensive but worth it! Hotel is close to outlet mall-great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club Room!”
Reviews.Author: buddha0404
Reviews.Content: We got an awesoem gold club room. huge room, great tv. you get inculded snacks, and water all day as well. we also rented a cabana at the pool for adults and had a blast. we love freemont street and the nugget is our hang out.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget Nevada USA”
Reviews.Author: Debs2020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and friendly, very good value for money. It is not an expensive hotel and i was expecting for it to be a bit tatty round the edges, but to my amazement, it was beautiful. It is down town, but there are regular buses to the strip so it was just perfect. We went there last April as we had planned our wedding in the Little Chapel of Flowers and we could not been happier for our choise

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: nacho321
Reviews.Content: First time staying downtown. I have stayed at several other places in vegas. First off, the Nugget is very smoky inside. Generally, this kinda thing does not bother me nor do I like to be picky but it was. The food at the breakfest buffett was very fresh and good. Room service was also very good. Had a reservation in the Rush Towers but the keys were not working so they upgraded us to a suite and no additional charge. The suite was nice, bed was very comfy and clean however the room was beat up alittle and could have been cleaner in some areas. I was traveling on business and with the time change (3 hours diff.) i got tired early. If you choose to stay here, keep in mind of the Fremont Street light and music show that happens every night. The music in our suite was VERY loud!!! I know it's Vegas and this is a signature fun event for the downtown and I did enjoy it. Just not when trying to sleep for my classes the next morning. These are just my opinions and personal experience here. Generally, i am not a picky person as i mentioned. Hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: “For a Change of Scenery from the Strip, this is the Place!”
Reviews.Author: mrjustice
Reviews.Content: Though a frequent visitior to LV, hadn't visited let alone stayed "Downtown" in at leat 10-15 years. Wow, have things changed. Love the way they made a covered pedestrian mall out of the main street. Not only feels and is far safer to walk around, it makes it fun and interesting, especially at night when the covered 'ceiling' turns into a giant projector screen and lots of good music. As for our stay at the Golden Nugget, we were equally impressed. While no doubt it cannot be compared with the top hotels on the Strip, it is nevertheless reasonably classy and quite comfortable. Best of all it is a very good value, and they treat you far better than the Strip (i.e. far fairer and more generous in 'rating' you for comps). Definately a good alternative when you want a change of scenery from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Missing the glitz”
Reviews.Author: MammaTori
Reviews.Content: First I arrived some where around 2 in the morning. I was put on the 26th floor of the tower farthest away from the hotel desk that took a GPS to find! The maze of hall ways was just too much. When I arrived at my room the keys did not work and I had to find my way back to the only front desk at the other end of the hotel. I was never offered help with my luggage. In the morning I made coffee and as I picked up the cup to get my coffee I read what the cups were covering....that it cost $10.00 for the 4 single serving coffees. Too late all ready opened the coffee so I figure what the heck I would pay that downstairs. The next morning I go to make my coffee and no cups. House keeping took the used cups and never gave me any more! EVERY single day of my 5 days/4 nights I had to ask for coffee cups REALLY! Customer service stunk! I too love down town but I think I will go back to one of the cheaper hotels that give better service and free coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off! AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: jumbz55
Reviews.Content: Okay so this place is "cheaper" due to it being in Old Vegas but think again. Yes it's a super nice hotel, yes its got some amazing amenities - everything you'd want in a Vegas hotel. However they rip you off as soon as you check in. Basically you are charged DOUBLE the price up front to your credit card as a (security charge). I asked about this upon checkout and was told that the enormous security charge would be credited back to my account. It never was. Tried contacting them. Got no response. So yes much better to stay somewhere on the strip where all the action is happening. Considering rooms in Vegas aren't too bad anyway. I'd happily pay more instead of getting ripped off - will be much more careful next time and I advise the same to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price! Really like the new look”
Reviews.Author: Chris Z
Reviews.Content: It has been awhile since we stayed in old town Vegas. This hotel has raised the bar in old town. The hotel is elegant and the restaurants do not disappoint. Make sure the check out the aquarium slide and the Chart House.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovations, no customer service”
Reviews.Author: sannycat
Reviews.Content: I'm currently deployed and was previously stationed in Las Vegas; I still visit friends and family a few times a year. Normally, I go to the Nugget to gamble and socialize with friends...although I had never stayed there, I really enjoyed what I could see of the renovations. On-line the rooms looked great. I'm having a small wedding (for about 30) during my mid-tour break and need to book about 10 rooms and find a location for a reception. I thought the Nugget would be perfect as it has rooms available that fit a broad budget range and some high-end rooms...very large suites suitable to host my reception. I was all ready to book with them until I discovered that parties are 'forbidden' in their suites. So I attempted to coordinate with them and see if we could come to a compromise. They said I could have the reception in my room only if I order ALL food and drink...including my wedding cake through their catering department. If I could afford that, I would not be having the reception in my room. They would not budge at all...not even when I offered to order the food from them and bring in the cake and drinks. I'm very disappointed and they just lost over $4K in revenue!

Reviews.Title: “Rush to Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: SeeingTheWorld701
Reviews.Content: When we travel we look for clean, safe, moderate priced rooms. Our room in Rush Tower was all that and more. Room Details: Positive: rainhead shower, two robes, two sinks, blow dryer (in bag on shelf in closet), large tub, full length mirrors, iron/board, flat screen TV, couch, safe, all Rush Tower rooms are smoke free, and nice decor and layout. Also, we felt the price was very reasonable: $79 (Dec 26 - Dec 30). Negatives: charge for coffee from coffee maker ($2/cup), Fiji bottled water was $7, and no free internet. The first room we were given overlooked Freemont Street and we knew from reading the reviews that it had the potential to be noisy so we asked to change. Our next room looked toward the Strip and besides a lovely view, there were no noise issues. We usually cut corners on breakfast and lunch, then eat dinner out. We took a small water boiling appliance and instant coffee, instant oatmeal, and some instant soups. Then we went to the Walgreens (east to Freemont and Fourth) and bought fruit and bottled water. Also, there is a Subway in the Four Queens Hotel and a Jason's Deli (west on Ogden to City Parkway). For our trip to the Strip, we took the SDX (Strip and Downtown Express) bus (NW corner of Freemont Street and Casino Center Blvd). I believe it was $7 for a 24-hour pass and you could buy other time-frames as well. Also went to the Gold and Silver Pawn Shop (from the TV show Pawn Stars). We walked. It was probably about a mile away from the Golden Nugget. East on Freemont to Las Vegas Blvd. South (right) on Las Vegas Blvd to between Garces Ave and Gass Ave. I'd advise getting there at 9am when it opens. You won't have to wait in a line like you do later in the day. Details about the Golden Nugget: There are two pools and one large hot tub outside. The Tank pool is large and open to everyone. It is somewhat heated, has a waterfall, and a shark tank with an enclosed slide that goes through it. The other pool, The Hideout, is smaller and located above the larger pool. That pool is open until 2am to ages16 years and up. I am not sure if that pool is heated, but I believe that it was. We were there at the end of December and people (kids mostly) were swimming in The Tank. In the pool area there are several bars, lounge chairs, cabanas, a firepit, and freestanding heaters. The casino was easily the nicest in the downtown area. We took Craps lessons at 10am on Tues, Wed, and Thurs. The lessons were free and then, after the lesson, they would open up the table to $5 minimum bets. That was nice because the guys who work the table would give you advice and it was a good way to reinforce what you had just learned. Transportation: we flew to Vegas and took a shuttle from the airport to the hotel and from the hotel to the airport when we left. We used Bell Trans. When we arrived in Vegas we purchased a two-way ticket. The day before we returned home, I called to verify that they would be picking us up from our hotel for our trip back to the airport. They were there at the correct time, the driver was pleasant, and we made it to the airport safe and sound.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Kenny F
Reviews.Content: Beware The Golden Nugget. I always stay downtown and come to vegas a couple times a year. The Golden Nugget is always higher so I have never stayed here before. This time their rate was same as four queens so I decided to Try it. The hotel is much nicer, BUT!!!! My room has not been done properly since I got here. Left empty cans in room and used drink glasses w contents in room and failed to provide clean ones. 1 night an accident. Every night a company practice. 1st night ice machine near room was out. Front desk said additional one on same floor but at other end (note this is a very large and meandering hotel). Ok I walked a mile to it. Now 3rd night it is out too and closer one still not fixed. NO ice on my floor. I call front desk, very nice just want my room clean and why cant at least one ice machine work. Said they would send clean glasses and have Ice delivered to my room. 1 Hour later got glasses no ICE. Called and they said it was coming. Then room service called and said if you want us to bring you ice you have to PAY for it. I call front desk and get different manager who was very condescending. I WILL NOT be staying here again and if you appreciate just basic service when you pay for a hotel DON'T STAY HERE!!!!! Just an extra note. I didn't mind this at first but after all this I am going to also point out, NO Free in room coffee maker. You have to pay $10 for 4 (yes only 4 single servings) of coffee if you want to make it in your room. DONT STAY AT GOLDEN NUGGET!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Lisabug1021
Reviews.Content: 70s luxury but would definitely stay again. Off the strip but the downtown experience was great. Great food, less crowds, cheaper eats, and definitely cheaper prices. The pool area was wonderful with a special adults area that was especially nice. We paid about half of what we paid on the strip and enjoyed it more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: mndmndl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great values!! If you want a clean modern room for a good price this is the place to say. Also drinks on fairmont street are way cheaper and the gambling is also better!

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheCBs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11th January to 14th January 2012. What a great hotel , with every amenity you could want. The staff were excellent and could not be more helpful. We will definitely be going back

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: MichaelB94
Reviews.Content: What a great experience! The Rush Tower is on the back side of the Golden Nugget property. It has it's own valet parking, lobby area and check-in staff. No long waits to check-in, even during peak check-in times. Self park is right across from the entrance and easy to access. I have stayed here both for pleasure and on business trips. The fact that this tower is set where it is, you never have to enter the casino area, unless you want to and then it is just a very few steps away. The rooms are GREAT! Very spacious and extremely well appointed. The kingsize bed is very comfortable, the bathroom is large and has double sinks, a deep shower/tub combo for soaking and separate water closet. The standard room has a 42 inch flat panel with DVD player, the Jr Suite has two of them. The suite also has a conversation pit with seating for 8. They call it a "Jr. Suite", but this room is HUGE, nothing "Jr." about it! Internet is not free and they need to make electrical outlets more accessable for laptops and cell phone chargers. Plenty of desk space with task lighting if you need it and a nice size table with chairs should you decide to order Room Service. View choices overlook the shark tank pool, Mt. Charleston or "Freemont Street Experience". If you get the Freemont Street view, be aware that live entertainment goes on until midnight and gets loud. That's OK if you are in town to "party", not so great when there on business and have an early morning appointment.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel / fair price”
Reviews.Author: scott g
Reviews.Content: stayed at golden nugget on way home from a cross country trip. stayed two nights in the rush tower in a standard double queen room for around 115.00 wich included vip checkin. hotel rooms where very nice, and super clean. furnishings where very nice. only bad thing was service checking out. the hotel was packed and they didn't have enough help. the pool is great, just get out early and put your towel on a chair as it fills up quickly. freemont street is worth the price alone, everthing starts around 8:00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “2 Br Scarlet Suite/Gold Tower”
Reviews.Author: dewhit6959
Reviews.Content: We made our annual holiday trip To Las Vegas for the dates of December 27th thru the 31st. I made reservations for our party aged mid fifties to mid seventies for a two bedroom suite in the gold tower months before our arrival. We originally wanted to stay there the entire time , but indecision by the Nugget on releasing suites and prices made us alter our plans before arrival. We used Presidential Limo as always to arrive and checked in at the VIP check in close to the main entrance. All went well with check in. The suite elevators are seconds away from check in and the casino and main floor area. This suite is a one bedroom suite connected with a one bedroom on the eighth floor. The colors were not what we would decorate with, but no problem for a gambling suite. Two full bathrooms with seperate makeup dressing area, large closets and another full (shower only) bathroom in the central family room beside bar area. Glasses only, no plates, etc. Room service will bring. Also great group of older attendants on this floor. Good tip will get anything in amounts you need. Refrigerator with ice maker, wet area and bar and prep area. Keurig coffee maker. (brought our own coffee) Table for four comfortably, pit group, big screen. Each bedroom had entry door and central area had entrance. Rather dark room with subdued lighting. These rooms are on Fremont side and only view is canopy supports and noise did not bother us, but could be a problem for those that need total quiet. Window unit ac and heat block most noise. Ate at cafe twice and Vic and Anthony's one night. Great V&A meal with great service. Dress code needs to be enforced better. Not cheap, but worth every nickel to me. The rate for the night of 30th was almost triple the other three nights and we were attending Bob Seger and KA shows at west end of strip for 30th,so did not stay , but moved to MGM for last night. We enjoyed these rooms and would use again. Good layout and location for travels with wheelchair/walker and being near center of all. women used spa services, nothing great they noted. Pictures attached of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay”
Reviews.Author: webfeetmama
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip on Priceline from 12/1 to 12/6 staying at the Golden Nugget staying in Carson Towers. This was our second time staying at the Nugget and I felt like the room was just as nice as the last visit it was very large and clean and bed was really comfortable. I was really impressed with the hotel because it was one of the busiest week-ends in town. We were in Vegas to watch our daughter and her friends run the Rock n Roll Marathon the full 26 miles and the National Rodeo Finals was also being held, yes running shoes meet cowboy boots wear ever you went. We rented our car through Hot Wire and it was from Advantage so we used valet parking all times of the day and our service was great for how busy they were. We enjoy staying at the Nugget because is newly remodeled and we like being on Fremont St. and would rather drive to the Strip than stay there. The marathon experience was not so good, not very well organized and they ran out of a numbers of items for the runners along the run and then after reaching the finish line the Mandalay Convention center looked like a disaster area the runners had to walk miles back to their parking areas to get to their cars. When we had to leave to get back to Mandalay Shopping Mall valet parking we were nearly trampled to death going through to the Casino. We had fun eating, drinking and gambling and staying up to late and sleeping in too long but thats what Vegas is all about.

Reviews.Title: “A Place With Class, but...”
Reviews.Author: MnineM
Reviews.Content: Sunday - Thrusday, Early Jan. 2012. Dislikes: Although there is a K cup coffee brewer in the room, if you open the K cup 4 pack, there is a $10 charge. The bottle of Fiji water in the room costs $7. $12.99 per day per computer for Internet. Go to the Krispy Kreme coffee shop at the Fitz for free Internet. There are other coffe shops with free Internet in the area. Near the elevators for the Carson Tower is a self-service Internet counter. Per minute fee for the computer and a per page fee for the printer. Now I know why the lines are so long at the airport check-in counters. Room safe is tiny. It is in the closet about 18 inches off the floor.Tablet will fit, but a larger screen netbook may not lay flat. No smoking poker room is good, but the smokers block the entrance ways to the poker room. You can find the poker room entrance by looking for the dense gray cloud. If you can hold your breath for 4 minutes and you are aggressive enough to push people aside maybe you can get into the poker room on the first try. Likes: It was CES week and there was a Moose poker tournment (more than 800 players plus their companions) at the Golden Nugget. Although the check-in area is tiny by Strip standards, the front desk people did an outstanding job. They were fast, but gave full and proper attention for questions; spoke clearly and anticipated the question if a customer looked confused. They kept things moving without upseting anyone. Two beds in the room with 4 drawer dresser, vanity table with lighted mirror and low chair, small round table, 2 upholstered chairs, 2 folding luggage stands. All of it fits and nothing gets in the way. The coupon book had useful 2 for 1 offers and a few free items: buffet, resturants, drinks, and match play and poker room chips. Food portions are large. Often we heard couples order one meal and an extra plate. Grotto resturant - Italian meat panini with cup of soup, $13.99. Bowl of lobster bisque, $9.99. Bread with oil included at the table. The site floor plan is well designed. Things are spread out but after a little walk around, land marks and lines of sight become familiar and navigation becomes easier even if you do take the long way. Other than the casino, ceilings are high and there are few floor to ceiling walls; making for a sense of open space. Resturants, shops and walk ways wrap around the pool on 3 sides but are separated from the pool by glass walls. Although taxi and small shuttle bus drop off and pick up are ongoing at the main lobby entrance, there is a spacious, multi-line area on the so called back side across from one of the parking decks. There is non traffic blocking space back there for more than one bus and several taxis. Will we go back? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Completely enjoyed our 1week stay at the Carson Tower!”
Reviews.Author: lfj00
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a poker tournament, stayed in the Carson Tower (Room 1256) and had a great time! As my spouse is a smoker, we had a smoking room. The bonus here was that the windows actually opened! The room was quiet, spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Another reviewer recommended the VIP check in for $25 which we used. It was it worth every penny.It guaranteed our room choice and allowed speedy check in and check out. It provided access to free bottled water, juices and snacks and we took full advantage especially because the bottled water in the room was $7!!! We found the staff at the GN friendly and talkative.The Fremont Experience was fun. There are so many Casinos, trinket shops and the light show was loud and fun! Realistically there is a negative side to everything and in the case of the GN it is all the extra charges ie the crazy price of the bottled water, additional charges for the gym, only room to room phone unless you leave an open credit card at the desk, no fridge in the room (we bought a styrofoam cooler at Walgreens down the street). None of that would stop us from going back though. All in all good value, in a great location with lots of casino and hotel buffets to choose from within a 3 block radius.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beyondbess
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget and loved being downtown instead of on the Strip. We travelled to the Strip one day to sight see and have dinner but were able to walk out the door of our hotel and go anywhere in the downtown Fremont St. area. It was great having several live bands every night of the week, playing along the street and the light show was amazing. Even though we didn't swim, we enjoyed lounging near the beautiful pool and shark tank. I also recommend eating breakfast next door at DuPar's.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Up To Standards”
Reviews.Author: msj57
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Golden Nugget for years and I had always been pleased until last year and I gave it a bad review. We spent a week there in December of 2011 and Janurary of this year and I feel it only right that I update my review. No problems at all this year; our room was very clean, we had a great view of the city and mountains, as I wanted, and the staff was very helpful. The Golden Nugget is the jewel of the downtown hotels and I do highly recommend it for your Vegas trips. The hotel has several new restaurants and the pool is rated as one of the top ten by one of the vacation magazines.
