Staying downtown is such a neat experience as there is so much to see and do and you can casino hop without a lot of walking. If you stay at the Nugget, you can get valet parking or park free in their parking garage. The downtown area is very clean and they have good security; as does the Golden Nugget Hotel. If you like to stay in a nice hotel, forget my review of last year, and give the Nugget a try, I believe that you will love your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Not for non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: BigRinVirginia
Reviews.Content: The price of doing business in Vegas. I was hopeful from the ratings on the Golden Nugget especially since I had two weeks planned there, but the rating went from 4 to 3 because of added costs, the smoke-filled environment, and and went from 3 to 2 because of some of the misleading scripts from reservations. If you are a smoker, you will not mind this place, and it is on the Freemont walking mall (heart of downtown Vegas), but the additional fees may start to get irritating. But I had been promised a smoke-free room, and they placed me in the tower over the casino. Even though it was recently remodeled, it is impossible to have a smoke free room in that center tower. They have a separate non-smoking tower, but refused to move me there without additional fees. Some of the staff were really nice, but it was obvious management had given them scripts over certain issues, such as smoking, such as the $12.95/day wifi access, the gym in the spa at $20/day, etc etc. So reservations would say "oh, just talk to the front desk if you are going to stay long and they will cut you a deal on wifi", but when you get to the front desk to check in, they say "no way" and then launch into a prepared script on how they are not a "spa destination" and wifi costs extra. I think they are missing the mark on how they handle these issues, and with wifi access on phones, there additional fees will quickly dry up as a revenue stream within a year or two. I am not sure you will get better in downtown Vegas, so if you are a non-smoker, you have to find deals at more expensive strip hotels (Bellagio got high marks from others for clean air), or go to a non-casino hotel at least to get a breather with free wifi and gym at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking rooms, average service, overpriced food/casino”
Reviews.Author: Ottawawomanlaura
Reviews.Content: Who: Me and my spouse When: 1 week, December 28 2011-January 4, 2012 Check in: We were booked for a king bed (Carson tower) and were told on arrival that we had to settle for 2 double beds. Not a great start for a couple starting our first child free vacation. We were switched to king room the next morning. Cleanliness: In our first room, we found a pair of dirty underwear hanging from the shower bar. The underwear fell on me when I pulled the shower curtain. The rest of the room seemed clean but we had our doubts for the obvious reason. They comped us a dinner buffet for this incident- slightly cheap. Room setup and amenities: Fairly average with a flat screen TV (didn’t go to Vegas to watch TV). Water was provided in the room for 8 dollars. There was a coffee maker in the room as well but they charged 15 dollars to use it. No mini bar. Room service was excessively expensive for downtown so we did not order it. The robes and toiletries provided were above average. Other facilities: The shark tank is awesome. It was a little cold for the pool though the pool and water slide looked great. Service: Average. We were on hold quite a while when calling front desk (20 minutes). They resolved our room transfer quickly. Upon checkout, they held our luggage. We had trouble getting service (waited long) to retrieve our luggage as we could see multiple staff standing in the luggage room having a chat and ignoring us. Casino: It was the most expensive casino along the Fremount Street stretch. The tables had the highest minimums and the drinks were more expensive here then any of the other casinos in the area (Fitzgerald’s, Four Queens, Binions etc). Tip- If you enjoy low limit tables (quarter roulette, 3 dollar blackjack), El Cortez just down the street is good. The place is not the classiest joint around but it is fun. Overall, I would stay again if the price was right. It was good (3.5 stars but they did not give that option), just not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected (But I Had Low Expectations...)”
Reviews.Author: PriusGirlVA
Reviews.Content: First impression of my rooom in Rush Tower - WOW - this is lovely! Very "urban" feel, dark wood, great sliding doors to the bathroom... Second impression - boy is it dark in here. And, umm, it smells like vomit.... Yes - vomit. The smell was disgusting. The room appeared clean but smelled otherwise. I called maintenance, who sent up a poor housekeeping woman who agreed it smelled like vomit (we narrowed it down to one of the two sinks...). She called maintenance (again) and they sent up a friendly guy who set to work snaking the overflow drains of both sinks. I asked if he had enountered this before and remarkably this was his SECOND CASE THAT NIGHT. Ewwww. He said it might be "white mold" which grows in the sinks and smells like vomit. OOOKKKK, perhaps that is something they should treat for BEFORE IT GROWS then. Yucko. He also snaked the tub (his idea) and said it was a good thing he did, because he thought it might have been coming from there.... Later I also found hair on the lamp (odd...). On the plus side - comfortable bed, well placed tv. On the negative side - that pesky vomit smell, too dark, crazy expensive in room water and coffee, and poorly placed electrical outlets. Also could hear loud music coming from outside late at night both nights of my stay even though I was on the 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for the price.....”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: We always stay downtown for one night while in Vegas and once again selected the Golden Nugget. Excellent property and even better when you get an excellent price. Received a solicitation for 40 bucks per night (including tax) with two free breakfast buffets and two free Gordie Brown tickets. Now I'm not sure how you can go wrong with that price or even be dissatified with the Carson Tower rooms. We didn't use the Gordie Brown tickets but they are good for 6 months and I'm sure we'll be back by then so, no biggie. The room was in Carson Tower - good enough. Absolutely nothing to complain about. Clean, appointed well, good shampoo, conditioner and lotion in the bathroom, fluffy towels. For us we really don't do much more than sleep and shower then are out for the entire day so cheap rooms in the Carson Tower are just fine for us. Yes, as others have said....the in room coffee will cost you $10. Totally ridiculous and the in room water is $8.00 so be prepared and plan for it. There is a Starbucks right at the bottom of the elevators, so no need for 10 buck in room coffee. The breakfast buffet was fine. Wouldn't choose to voluntarily eat there again, but fine with a free pass. Much better, less expensive breakfasts just about anywhere in town. We did eat the night before at the Paradise Seafood Buffet, across the street at Freemont I believe. It was on a whim (and very late)...$17 bucks and pretty good. Good selection, crab legs, shrimp many way, good variety of fish, deep fried oysters, etc. You know...not bad. Would do it again. Pretty equivalent to a Red Lobster type food, and the service was great. Overall great time. Would / will stay again and recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Tower Suite at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: gillscarol5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I splurged on our last trip to Vegas and stayed in a spa tower suite. Our daughter and gradson visited for a few days and this was a great place for a kid to run around. Lots of room and a great view. We enjoyed having the separate living area and the bar. This way when you spend some downtime you have space to move around. This particular suite had been updated; but still had a gawdy Vegas feel about it. The bathroom had a separate area with a jacuzzi tub and then another area with a steam shower. So if you want some pampering this was not outrageously expensive. I would do it again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “more of the same”
Reviews.Author: craiger702
Reviews.Content: I brought the cold weather from CT. It was in the 70's every day until I got there then topped out in the high 50's. The day after I left back to 70. I spent the weekend of Dec 5 at the GN. This was the beginning of the NFR. Cowboy hats, country music and busy. I had a great time AGAIN. No problems with room, or service. Check in was easy and the staff was great. I will be back in January for another shot. This trip the tables were great to me and I hope for more of the same this month. I did go to Aria and the Palms for a few hours. Aria is a beautiful place (in the limited amount of casino I saw. Palms casino is a little dated but I have a host there who I like. Might be a younger crowd there than I like but whatever. My preference will always be the GN Great hotel with great people. REMEMBER: Stuff happens it is how you handle it that will get you the best results. Don't let little things bother you. Some of the reviews I read are so nitpicky. It is ridiculous. Have fun here

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Extremely Clean. Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jayro1969
Reviews.Content: Rush Tower corner jr suite. Stayed 1-4/1-7. Exceptional room. Great 2 angle views being a corner room. We generally stay on the strip but wanted something different. Cant go wrong with the Nugget! Pool is outstanding, Vic and Anthonys was probably the best steak I have ever ate. If this hotel was on the strip the room I had would easily be triple what we just paid. Nice boutique hotel with great food choices. Also, I highly recommend Gordie Brown. For $25 this guy is an incredible talent. Definitely bring your own K-cups for the machine in the rooms. Or you have to dish out $12 for there in room k-cups.. Cant go wrong with a stay at GN. Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad-but watch it!”
Reviews.Author: harrylime49
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm giving this property an average rating, is that the room 'appeared' clean, and was nicely decorated. Our room was in the Carson Tower, about as far from the elevator as it was possible to be. When we checked in, the toilet wouldn't stop running. The maintenance man came quickly and unplugged it. Unfortunately, he placed the 'snake' (fresh from the toilet bowl) first in the bathtub, and then across the sink.Our 'free' breakfast buffet came with an $8.65 Christmas Eve surcharge. Our 'free' Gordie Brown Show was cancelled. $7.00 for a bottle of Fiji Water seemed excessive (we didn't partake), as did $10.00 for 4 Keurig pods of coffee. Just to finish, there was hair in the bathtub, and the ceiling fan was noisy and ineffective. Unless some of these problems are corrected, we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in the Rush tower!”
Reviews.Author: Pookaloki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN in the Rush tower on Christmas for 4 nights. Upon check in we were offered an upgrade to a corner suite for $25/ nt, that's not much of a deal, we declined, but it was nice they offered. The Rush room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The king bed was awesome, the best I have slept on in a hotel. The only concern I had was one of the two sinks had a foul odor sewer odor coming up when the water was on, so we just used the other one. We were in room 8-222 which had a partial strip view and you could kinda see the pool area off to the side. We did use the pool since it was sunny and warm that week. Even though it was winter the pool is heated and the hot tub was toasty warm. We ate at the buffet, the food was ok and we had a coupon for it upon check in, but the service was terrible, I expect better from a 4* resort. The selections were small, but I enjoyed the food especially the desserts! We also ate at the Chart house during their happy hour my husband loved the Ahi nachos, he said it is the best thing he has ever eaten in Las Vegas, my fav was the prime rib sliders. I really enjoyed my time at the Golden Nugget and plan on returning again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Strip”
Reviews.Author: deanoooo_82
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Vegas after staying on the strip previously. Much prefer Fremont, better atmosphere and feels more like 'real' Vegas to me. The video screen is cool and the people there seem much less pretentious :) The room itself was great. As we are used to travelling around Europe, we are always surprised by how big US rooms are and this was no exception. Great bed, lovely views towards the Mojave and a decent sized bathroom too. The reception staff were helpful and friendly and the casino staff were a pleasure. Met some lovely people and we would probably stay here again should we choose to visit Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Years weekend!”
Reviews.Author: travel-addict2000
Reviews.Content: We never stayed here before and I wasn't very familiar with Vegas hotels, but I found an good deal through hotels.com for $149 on New Years Eve weekend. We arrived 8pm Friday night and got one of the last parking spaces in the self-park ramp. Valet was already full. Upon check-in, we had reserved a King non-smoking room, but all they had left were doubles in non-smoking... and they would not give us a rate adjustment, saying the King was just a "request" and not guaranteed. It was disappointing but only a minor inconvenience for us. Our room in the Carson Tower was very nice- clean, modern, very comfortable bed, but only had a view of the roof. The hotel/casino is located right along the Fremont Street Experience, which is a 5-block long pedestrian mall with an awesome overhead canopy of lights and sound system. They had several tribute bands set up on different stages so we just strolled, listened to music and people watched the first night. It turned out to be a great central location. We decided to have dinner at the hotel Friday night at the Grotto (Italian restaurant). Our hostess was lovely and the food/wine list did not disappoint. On New Years Eve we splurged on dinner at Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse, also in the hotel. Very pricey but one of the best meals I've ever had in my life. The pool looks amazing, although we didn't swim. They have a shark aquarium in the center that you can swim right up to, and there is a clear tube water slide that goes right through it.

Reviews.Title: “new year's stay - brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_m101010
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Golden Nugget over the new year holidays and only have praise for the place. Stayed in Carson Tower, which although a fair walk from the casino, was a good sized room, albeit a bit dated in decor, but at $50 a night, cant really complain! Fremont St is a great experience, brilliant over new year, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stay downtown: great location, great hotel, lots to see and do!”
Reviews.Author: LyndenWilliam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget twice, last year in Carson tower this year in Rush Tower. Carson rooms have been redecorated, but the Rush is relatively new, has it's own covered entrance, valet parking, luggage storage and standing line of taxis. We have not stayed in Gold tower rooms. We found both times the rooms were large enough and the beds comfortable but the check in/out experience is much faster and smoother at Rush Tower as it is dedicated to fewer rooms. If you arrive from the airport by shuttle it will drop you at south entrance (across from Rush, but a long walk with your luggage to Carson check in desk). The walk from Carson rooms to the Casino and restaurants is very long compared to Rush and by staying in Rush you will avoid the people trying to sell show tickets and tours in the hall near Carson. The slight extra cost is worth paying for the convenience it brings. At Rush you should be careful getting into/out bathtub shower as there are no 'grab bars' and some of the areas have sharp edges. There are several good restaurants in the Nugget (see reviews), but if you plan on charging to your room be sure to inform them at check in. There is no 'resort fee' but you will have to pay for WiFi internet. There are two fish tanks. One is at the Chart House restaurant. With luck you will get to see someone inside the tank cleaning it. The other is a SHARK tank at the swimming pool with a water slide that runs through it. It was featured on an episode of CSI Las Vegas. Sit down, relax and enjoy the fish as they swim about in this large tank. It will take your mind off the slots for a few moments. CAUTION if you use the coffee maker or drink the water from bottles on desk in your room you will be surprised to find out it will cost ($10 for coffee about $5 for water). If you use both it will likely be the most expensive coffee you purchase, ever!! Prices are marked, but may not be immediately visible. We suggest you bring bottled water from casino (free) and grab a coffee at Starbucks (2 locations at Nugget) We found all the staff interactions on our recent trip were much more friendly than our first experience. The great feature about staying at the Golden Nugget is that you can walk to about 8 or 10 casinos in 5 minutes (not possible on the Strip) and you can enjoy the Fremont Experience--a fantastic light and sound show each hour starting when the sun sets. The outside casino lights dim and one of several shows appears on the 'ceiling' about 90 feet above Fremont Street. Each night crowds of people arrive from the Strip to take in the shows. Fremont Street is an 'experience': music, light show, street vendors, buskers and if you seek excitment you can enjoy the 'zip line' (about $20) running above Fremont, or have your picture taken ($ tip please) with one of many 'celebrities' (from Elvis to Superman). All this just outside your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Felt ripped off”
Reviews.Author: southislander16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Golden Nugget, Las Vegas over 6 times in the last few years and always enjoyed our stay. This time not so much. We stayed in the Carson Tower, which is the furthest tower from the casino, but not a bad walk. Rooms were large, clean and well furnished. Our problems came with all the extras that we had to pay for. In our room we had a coffee maker, but if we made a cup of coffee the cost was $10.00, so why even put a coffee maker in the room. The pool was beautiful, but if you would like to sit in a chair after your swim expect to pay $10.00, more for a chaise. The buffet 19.00 which is average in Vegas, but the food was terrible. Salads were wilted and rusted, salad bar was dirty, other foods were only lukewarm and cooked beyond recognition. The sushi was so old you could not chew it. If we had only paid 5.99 for this buffet I would still have felt I paid too much. On the plus side the staff at the hotel check in and resturants were very good. We do love downtown but will be looking at staying on the strip and travelling downtown for an evening. No more Golden Nugget Las Vegas for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end the year!”
Reviews.Author: lxd0yo4
Reviews.Content: Property exceeded my expectations. Management has done a great job at keeping up this property modern. Loved the restaurants with exception of the sushi restaurant by the casino, waited for my food so long that all the people in my party finished theirs and mine had not arrived. Other than that was a perfect stay. Overal great experience. Room was very nice and clean. Would definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People, Great Fun !”
Reviews.Author: jhaleyusa
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice in the Rush Tower. Very clean, and spacious. Bathrooms were large with a rainfall shower in the tub. King size bed and sectional couch for 6 all face the large LCD tv mounted on the wall. Desk / chest of drawers is ample for his and her clothes. Closet is normal size and will easily hold clothes for a week. Rooms come with safe, and ironing board, and coffee maker. Heat and cooling system is fantastic. I could get the room down to 65 easily to cool. Liquor store and convience store is just two doors down from the hotel so a bar in the room is easy! This hotel is very easy to get around in, and the people were very friendly! Food and room service was quick and reasonable priced. We had more fun here than any of the other hotels on the strip. We will come back !

Reviews.Title: “Love Golden Nugget and Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Dragonflymomma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas at least once a year, and 95% of the time we stay on Fremont Street - I love that area and feel very safe there. I love the constant "street party" atmosphere. The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay. The rooms have all been refurbished and the hotel atmosphere itself is very clean. The pool area is wonderful. I agree with other reviewers that having to pay for coffee and water in a room is a bit ridiculous, but I don't drink coffee, and I always bring my own bottled water, so it's not a big issue with me. On our last trip in November, we stayed in the Gold Tower and had a great view of the pool area as well as Mt. Charleston. It was nice to have a sitting area to relax in, and our bathroom was wonderful - with the rainforest showerhead and the tv built in to the mirror. The little "extra perks" that went with the room were nice. We were in Vegas in December and stayed at TI, which was nice, but I have to say I missed being "home" on Fremont Street. We will definitely stay at the Golden Nugget when we return again in November.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, loads of dining options....buffet was tasty...better for lunch than dinner! Hotel room was spacious, comfy bed! Only downside...had to pay for water/coffee etc. in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Rediscover Downtown”
Reviews.Author: JRC_9
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget, (and several other properties), have done a great job upping the ante on the decision to stay on the strip or downtown. The Hotel is extremely well appointed with excellent dining choices and a super swimming pool complete with Sharks (yes, I said sharks...).

Reviews.Title: “Vegas glitz at its best”
Reviews.Author: DickDee
Reviews.Content: We were in the South Tower, which has it's own check-in, but were dropped off at the main entrance in error. There are stiff doors and several steps down, so that makes carrying your own bags awkward, all to persuade you to use the baggage service I suppose. Hotel is bigger than I imagined, and the decor is relatively restrained; it's glitzy but not gaudy. We had a junior corner suite, well appointed and large; in truth, we would have been as happy in a standard room, we only sleep there after all, the rest is just under-used space. Beware the coffee machine. At the bottom of the instructions you're told it's $10 for the 4 sachet box - and the water's $7 a bottle. Think that's a bit stingy when you're paying $160 for the room. There's a decent pool area with plenty of sunbeds, but we didn't use it much in November! The casino is good fun, even as a spectator sport. Had a blackjack lesson the second morning, went to play that night but minimum stake had risen to $10. That's a bit steep for learning the game, but we weren't there for the gambling so I had fun watching others. A large selection of restaurants and bars within the hotel itself, including a balcony bar overlooking the Freemont Street Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms (in the Rush Tower)”
Reviews.Author: aash23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just okay. We opted to stay in the Rush Tower and the rooms were nice and modern. I rang reception to enquire about the cost a call home from the room and was advised that they use AT&T but add a "small premium" - a two minute call to the UK was charged at $30 dollars. DO NOT TRY THE BUFFET at the hotel - you will be extremely dissapointed, the food was awful and the quality exceptionally poor. I would not like to see what my review would be like if we had stayed in any other accomodation within the Golden Nugget as we were pleased with the Rush Tower rooms. We were not very impressed with Downtown overall and much prefer the strip - there is very little to do Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Class Act Downtown”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for New Years Eve weekend. It's been about a decade since I've visited Vegas and since then, many things have changed in the world, including ownership of the hotel, so I was a bit concerned. I needn't have worried. Things are still golden at the nugget. I especially recommend staying downtown for New Years eve. The Fremont Street Experience is a much more comfortable and interesting way to spend the countdown listening to the 3 stages of entertainment than simply standing in the middle of the street on the Strip I'm told that you can't get into the strip casino hotels without wristbands, but they're all available on Fremont Street. (Although there IS a $30 charge for the party in the Fremont Street Experience) My only complaint is simply that our room in the Carson tower was looking a bit dated (although apparently the hallways have recently been refreshed with new carpets and wallcoverings) and the large room was a bit awkwardly laid out - perhaps due to the fact that it had a connecting door. That said, the room was comfortable, clean and well-maintained. I recommend staying downtown for a very different experience than the Strip - and I can't think of a hotel I'd recommend more readily than the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: DrMitch
Reviews.Content: I have been to LV many times and stayed at most of the hotels on the Strip as well as the Golden Nugget downtown. I can say hands down that the Golden Nugget is an excellent choice and incredible value. Located off the Fremont Street Experience (actually a very over hyped, display of video and music on street long overhead street roof) in what is called downtown. Actually this is probably not more than a couple of miles from the center of the Strip. One could have a very long walk to the strip (not a good choice in summer when temperatures can melt your shoes) over a 5 minute (or less) drive. Most of the hotels on the Strip have free parking so staying off the strip is not that bad. The Golden Nugget has been remodeled. We stayed in the Carson tower which is the least expensive at about $60/nt. For that you would not expect much. Actually it is very clean (spotless), modern, well furnished, spacious, curtious staff and fast check in/out. We had a room with two double beds which were more queen sized. LCD TV with usual channels. Bathroom was done in marble and spotless. We stayed on 22nd foor which overlooked desert with the other side overlooking the strip. Most of the guests were either familes or older people. As a result the hotel was reasonably quite especially compared with the large hotels on the strip. Unfortunately the Golden Nuggett had about as much cigarette smoke in the air as all other hotels. Restaurants were very good and without a line.

Reviews.Title: “Old Las Vegas, Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Heidorama
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Golden Nugget on Christmas Day, leaving just before the mayhem of New Years. Staying at Rush Tower - the new addition to the grand dame of Freemont St. - was fantastic. Carson Tower is the older hotel area, but still quite lovely. The room was top notch, very clean and spacious. The prices were very reasonable and the service was stellar. Being in the downtown part of LV, I sensed the crowds were a little more thinned out than down on the new part of the strip. This meant we didn't have to battle line-ups at the Golden Nugget, even at the buffet (which oddly reminded me of an all-inclusive buffet in the Caribbean, but I digress). My only concerns were the tired party atmosphere of Freemont St. and the fact that it cost about $20 in cabs each way to get to the newer area of the strip (Wynn, Belagio, etc.). So you must factor in that cost to the savings you reap by staying iin the area of the Nugget. But with free parking and a heated outdoor pool, the Nugget is certainly worth considering!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jackie00
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas for us and what a good choice we made. We stayed in carson tower, rooms big and comfy beds, coffee maker 10 dollars, bottle water 7 dollars so make sure you take a travel kettle, that was the only down side to the hotel. Pool was fantastic, pool bar prices around 13 dollars for glass of wine and vodka coke, good measures as well!. We paid 20 dollars for a 3 day bus pass which was great for getting to strip and all the shopping malls. Deuce or the Express bus go up and down the strip all day long, Deuce is the double decker which stops at every hotel from Freemont street to South Shopping Mall and returns to North Shopping Mall and the Express bus is a single decker which by passes some hotels but ends up at Shopping mall north and South, both buses have dialogue which tells you where you are and the next stop etc. Freemont St is much more compact and friendly, free shows on the various stages each night and more affordable food and drinks. Downtown food places great: Main Street Station great breakfast and lunch buffets for around 10 dollars excellent choice of food and free top ups for cold drinks, Golden Spike steak and eggs for 5.99 dollars, Fitzgeralds whole rack of ribs or 10oz steak plus soup and salad bar for 10.99 dollars. excellent service and free top up cold drinks. Golden Nugget excellent buffet, you will be given a discount voucher for one free breakfast or lunch, breakfast queues started at around 08.45 and about 40 minute wait, lunch starts at 10.30 am so we used to hang out for lunch which had an even better choice, all non alcholic drinks free as well. Henneyses Irish bar was rubbish, overpriced, dark and dingy,bad slow service. Not many shops for food or snacks for the room, Walgreens and ABC stores sold basic snacks but very expensive. Premium outlet North usual designer stores is near downtown, you can get the bus or around 8 dollars in a cab, Miracle Mile shops and Fashion show Mall shops all easy access on bus, in the strip area amd Town Sqaure shopping mall by the airport is very quaint and pretty and about 45 minutes on bus. Ross shop is like TKMAXX thers is one just accross the road from circus Circus this is very affordable clothes shopping and just like TKMAXX. We are not gamblers so found the whole gambling scene just jaw dropping, totally different world and it never stops!! We liked the sight seeing and shopping, weather was 65/70 in Dec so it was T shirt weather during the day but freezing at night. Dont book any shows until you get there go to the tickets for less booths which are dotted around everywhere ask the hotel where they are and you will save a whack of money. Hotel transfers book on line in UK, but be careful as to where you have to pick up tickets, we arrived into terminal 2 and were supposed to collect transfer tickets from terminal 1 on arrival, that is a real pain because it is a trail to get to another terminal. However I had no idea that we were in terminal 2 and fortunately by chance a guy from Ritz transport was waiting at terminal 2 and took us to Golden Nugget, he was very helpful and gave us tips about downtown and best way to get around, his name was Jim. The return trip back to airport was a bit of a nightmare, ritz travel turned up and the guy was a complete jobsworth he demanded tickets and all we had was our on line confirmation and payment receipt, he proceeded to lecture us that we did not read the instructions and that we should have gone to Term 1 to collect tickets when we arrived and that we were a nuisance because he would now have to ring the office and confirm that we were Bona fide customers!!!! He had our name on a booking sheet what more did he want!! so that wasn't a good end to the holiday, then he drove like a maniac all the way to the airport. I am going to email them and tell them about this guy because he was a prat, unlike Jim who had picked us up on arrival and took a look at our confirmation emails and was OK with this. All in all Vegas is magic, Downtown is a better base because you can walk around easily it seems more relaxed and family friendly and if you want catch the bus to the strip to do the sight seeing. All the best

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Scott8459
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Golden Nugget was great. We stayed in the Rush Towers and loved the room. The room is large and the bathroom amenities were modern and plush. The shower was huge and the towels were nice and soft. The king size bed was great. Some of the best nights of sleep I have ever had on the road. I know that everyone says that you never spend any time in your room in Vegas but if you have to come back to something after your hours at the tables this is the place. Our room faced the rising sun and also the spotlights at night; however, the curtains block out all the light... seriously, we almost over slept our checkout because we had no idea it was morning. Travel tip... there is a coffee Keurig coffee machine in the room but four kcups cost you $10. Bring your own and you will be set. So now for the NYE downtown experience. This was great. It only cost $32 a person to be on the street. There were three live bands so you had a variety of music. At midnight the countdown started with highlighting the events of 2011 on the canopy, which was done to music. Then the countdown and the fireworks on the canopy (computer generated); as well as, fireworks under the canopy (real) and timed with the computer generated fireworks. This was a great experience and was told several times this is were the locals go to celebrate. Would recommend it and do it again. If not doing the NYE experience still stay at the Nugget. The downtown is fun, less expensive and the strip is just a 20 minute bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Nugget”
Reviews.Author: ledj2
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Requested connecting rooms, 1 king bed for Wife & I & 2 beds for the kids, non smoking on a high floor. Rooms were already saved at check in. Really nice rooms. Pool area was fantastic & the kids really enjoyed it. We will definitely stay here again & recommend to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Always a favorite”
Reviews.Author: sauceontheside
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Xmas Eve and Xmas day. Last few times we stayed in the Gold Club Rooms. They seemed to be getting a little old so we stayed in the Rush Tower. The room rate was great and we always love staying downtown. I was surprised to see that they still used (I think) the same designer that they used for the Gold Club Rooms. The bathrooms are so poorly designed for cleaning and just overal general use. They still used the same dark tones as the Gold Club rooms, but would stay there again as we like it downtown. Vic and Anthonys AGAIN was the most delicious steak I have ever eaten twice my lifetime now. We stay here just to eat there. They raised the price on the French Onion Soup in the Cafe, but it's still good. The minestrone at the Magnolia Cafe at the Four Queens is now my new favorite soup. Did I tell you I like soup? Not a whole lot to add except it's downtown, don't expect a whole lot because we stayed four nights at the Cosmopolitan, awesome room, hip and modern, 3.9 billion dollars to build, but we would prefer to stay downtown and have all of the amenities and food options and gambling options. To each their own. You have to ask yourself what's more important during your trip to Las Vegas. There's pros and cons to everywhere. Oh, we loved the fun little tournament at the Main Street Station daily. Sign up for their players card and it's ten bucks and it's worth the entertainment, plus the finals are at 4 so they don't hold you hostage until nighttime. You can still go back to your room and go back and win some money if you're in the finals. I think downtown will be the only place we stay from here on in. Just love the convenience of everything. Don't feel like I'm holed up like on the strip, way too far to get anywhere, plus the crowds are annoying and so are the locals with their signs, poor little doggies and whatnot.

Reviews.Title: “Really gone down over the past stays.”
Reviews.Author: beneve97
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the nugget for the past 3 visits to to vegas and I have to say on the latest visit the service became somewhat cheap. House keeping now only gives two towels unlike my last visits when they gave 3-4. They don't give out hand towels like they used to. When you ask for bathroom amenities such as shampoo, they only give you one. Before they gave you 2-3. Overall the rooms were great but I noticed that the service has gone down and became somewhat slow.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly excellent”
Reviews.Author: Joe I
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10:30 AM on Dec 26th. No line at check-in and room was ready depsite the early arrival. My request for a quite room was honored and was able to sleep well. I didn't really spend a lot of time at the hotel other than sleeping, as I was working at a 2 day conference on Dec. 27-28. Walgreen's is a 2 minute walk from hotel. I've heard people complain about the $7 water bottle in hotel room, but if you're too lazy to walk to Walgreen's then you deserve it. Right outside the hotel is an express bus stop and you can get to the Strip, the airport, UNLV, and even the premium outlet malls. $7 buys 24 hour access pass. I used the service to get to the airport and it was reliable and efficient and better than Bell Shuttle. I've also heard complaints that the hotel staff wasn't forthcoming about giving information about the public bus service, but if you couldn't discover it on your own then you weren't trying. I stumbled upon it within 30 seconds of walking out of the hotel onto Fremont St. Downtown (Fremont street) isn't very glamorous, but nowadays neither is the Strip. The Golden Nugget is definitely the best hotel downtown and it would hold its own compared to the high-end hotels on the Strip. I paid $49/nt for my hotel room and was very pleased with what I got. I would definitely stay there again. I found the staff friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed & pillows but could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Liz730053
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here. We like the location away from the strip but still close to some of the action. Last visit we joined the 24 Karat Club and they sent us a special promotion for a Carson Tower room for $45 a night. Upon arriving we walked to the check in counter and it was closed so we had to lug our luggage to the Carson Tower. For $20 extra a night we decided to upgrade to the Gold Tower. It was not worth it!!!! Yes the room is a little bigger and you are closer to the casino floor but that's it. The bathtub needed to be resealed & rust around the overfloor which was disgusting to look at. There was a coffee machine but you had to pay $10 for the coffee, internet was $13 a day (there is nowhere in the hotel with free access) the tank pool was closed and the morning we left the carson street cafe was closed. I think we will try another hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A haven on a Tuesday night!”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on the spur of the moment and got a great rate in a new Gold Club room. We were sent to the VIP checkin room and were given champagne while we waited, which was only a couple minutes. The room was excellent, very well designed with comfortable furnishings - especially the recliner chair in the corner by the window. The bathroom was well layed-out with tons of room at the counter. The bed was remarkably comfortable and the view of the pool area was very nice. The Carson Street Cafe had excellent Eggs Benedict, and the Style & Trend clothing store had AMAZING discounts on Tommy Bahama shirts. Easy access to Fremont Street was fun, and the casino was terriffic. We would love to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “If only...”
Reviews.Author: kainoeye
Reviews.Content: I recently had a major surgery and spent the whole summer recovering so my boyfriend and I decided to plan a trip to Vegas. I'm an avid traveler but neither of us has been to Las Vegas so we're really excited! We didn't even know there were such things as Old and New Vegas so we fully relied on other people's reviews and decided to stay at Golden Nugget. On our first night, we realized that there was a drainage issue with the bath tub as well as the sink. We called up the front desk and they offered to upgrade our room BUT they did not apologize for any inconvenience. At that time, we were just happy to be upgraded although it was a bit of a hassle to pack and unpack again. We were moved from the Carson Tower to the Rush Tower and we loved the elegant look of our room and bathroom. However, on the same night, we were ready to go to bed and something got caught between my toes. At first, I thought it was a bed sheet but as I pulled it from under the bed sheet I realized that it was used underwear. Until this day, I don’t understand how the cleaner has missed the underwear under the sheet because they are supposed to take everything off the bed to make a new one. I called the front desk again feeling really frustrated but the first thing they said was “Do you want another room?” I ended up speaking to several people until they offered me a complementary food coupon at the Café and NONE OF THEM said sorry. I had to let it go because I didn’t want to ruin our Vegas experience but they have definitely lost valuable customers who could potentially bring in a lot more customers for them. Although the dirty underwear is unacceptable, I would have come back to Golden Nugget if one of them had sincerely apologized. All in all, the Old Vegas was not too far from the Las Vegas strip and we loved the Old Vegas with all the stories and history. We are a younger couple in our 20s and was ready to recommend to our friends to experience the Old Vegas and stay at Golden Nugget IF ONLY staffs were nicer.

Reviews.Title: “I do not stay anyplace else when I BOOK! 4 years going on 5”
Reviews.Author: GOSEEITALL24_7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I take a girl trip every year it is the only time we get away from our spouses! Bring on VEGAS BABY! For the last four years we have stayed at the Golden nugget. The first year we chose it because of cost. The next 3 was because we love it! Myself and my friend can not stand the "Vegas strip" it is busy and I feel like I need to be in Louie Vuitton all day and night! I can never get more then one drink while gambling. I sit at a machine or slot long enough and tip well enough I should not have to search a server out! At any hotel on Fremont Street that is not an issue. Before you question yes I have stayed at MGM, Mirage and Excalibur. When I have went with Vegas newbies they just hav eto stay on the strip but regret they did not listen to me after they spend a night on Fremont street! 2.00 blackjack! NOT on the strip! The rooms at the golden nugget are very luxurious. I love feeling like a big baller without putting the big baller money out! LOL The rooms in the rush tower are fab! We did stay last time in the Carson tower jsut do to the price difference w/my comps. I would have rather stayed in rush but I am not in the room that much! Spa we use the spa every time get a massage and use the Whirlpool and sauna afterwards. Well worth the money and it is not very much! Checking in can be a pin if you are in the Carson area the line gets pretty long. If you are booked in the rush or above you have another area you can check in at. I suggest Golden nugget to stay and play! If you want to dress up you can and if you want to sneak down at 3am in your pj you can do that also! I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Golden indeed!”
Reviews.Author: CUMom65
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Golden Nugget for both work and pleasure. It was just my husband and me this time. We paid a little extra for the "Golden Level". I highly recommend upgrading to this. The free internet and perks (like free spa access) more than make up for the difference! Every morning they put out fresh coffee and in the afternoon the put out little free snacks like M&Ms and mixed nuts. It was a nice treat. The room was very nice and well appointed. Our view was just of a back lot, but it wasn't bad. The shark tank was interesting, but I couldn't help but notice that they had rubbed sore spots on their skin that was obviously from bumping up against the tank. I thought it would be cool to watch them, but it was really just kinda sad. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout the hotel. The bartender at H2o made me a great Hot Chocolate with Baileys and a dash of Amaretto and we cozied up with the fire pit. Even though it was a chilly night, we were very comfortable indeed. The only two legit complaints I have and they are minor at very best are that the Breakfast Buffet left much to be desired and somehow the air kept bothering my eyes. I've heard that bigger casinos pump extra oxygen into their casinos to keep gamblers awake and happy and playing longer, and my more paranoid friends have claimed they pump even stranger things into the air. Honestly, I think it was just their deodorizers they use to try to flush cigarette smoke smell out. But whatever it was, whenever we went downstairs, my eyes watered terribly, which made my sinuses and nose icky. We went to another casino down the street and it smelled smokey, but my eyes were fine, which was the lesser of two evils. Odd. Over all, we loved the hotel and plan on staying there next year when the convention is held again. My biggest suggestion is upgrade to the Gold Level rooms. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “This Trip, Bed, Bugs and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie808
Reviews.Content: This review is for the most recent trip to Golden Nugget. And does not necessarily apply to my other visits to this property. I have been to Golden Nugget too many times to count. That is why I was so horrified to discover on my last visit that we had BED BUGS in our bed! After catching the bugs and bringing them down to the front desk, they offered to move us and send our clothes to their in house laundry. But what is feels like is equivalent to going to a 5-star restaurant and finding a band aid in your soup. Can you really enjoy the rest of your meal? We changed rooms and had a small bag of clothes that we wore to bed laundered. When security came up to take a "report" he said that bed bugs are a problem all over the USA and therefore, we shouldn't be so alarmed by finding them at this property. REALLY? Is that an answer? I don't know, I guess for a hotel you want to keep your patrons happy and that was not a good way of doing so. Bottom line is we booked a 5-star hotel and just got bed bugs. AND they couldn't comp the bottled water and coffee in the room.....good grief! And on a side note, we noticed that GN does not have as much visible security walking around the casino as other hotels. Twice, we have had incidents of people trying to rip us off or con us. Management should take action to make the casino and hotel feel safer.

Reviews.Title: “Senior Citizen and handicapped..stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ2012
Reviews.Content: Mom and I stayed at the Golden Nugget from December 22nd -26th, 2011. Recently, mom has had difficulties ambulating and uses a cane due to previous knee(s) replacement and hip replacement surgeries. We were initially booked rooms in the South Tower. I requested rooms in the North Tower, due to her circumstances, because dining accomodations and the casino were in closer proximity. We were granted the request for an additional charge! Mom and I have been patrons of Golden Nugget, at least twice a year, since 2002. I did not think there would be a charge for making special accomodations for handicapped senior citizens! Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodJudie
Reviews.Content: Having read the many reveiws I was thrilled we were upgraded to the Rush Tower upon check-in. Paying for VIP check-in is strongly recommended to guarantee the room type (king bed, non-smoking), otherwise you may not get the room type you expected, especially if arriving late evening as we did. VIP lounges provide juice and water too, so no need to drink the tap water. We had a distant view of the strip as well as the mountains. The room and bathrooms were spacious. It was very easy to rent a car at the Budget counter mid-way during our stay and we simply returned it to the airport when leaving. It was easy and inexpensive to get to the strip via the buses that run 24 hours, departing and retuning close to the Golden Nugget and making stops at the major hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in original Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Joan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the new non smoking Rush Tower. Because we have the Landrys Select Card we were upgraded to a suite. This was wonderful. Very comfortable bed. Nice amenities. VIP check-in and always welcme in the VIP lounges, where able to get water, juices and candies. We enjoyed spending time on Fremont street.

Reviews.Title: “Love those Gold Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: December 15 and 16, 2011 I stayed in the Gold Club Room 1620. This was my second experience with a Gold Club Room and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I have stayed in several room types at the Golden Nugget, but believe the Gold Club Rooms give me the best value. The Gold Club rooms are set up very similarly to the new Rush Tower rooms, but have a smaller galley-like bathroom. I travel by myself so this is not an issue. With two people, you may decide that it should be one person at a time usage of the bathroom, unlike the Rush Rooms. Other than the bathroom, there is not much difference in the two room types. I’ve included pictures for the bathroom for your enlightenment. I didn’t include pictures of the room because they are plentiful, but the bathroom is not. Like the Rush Rooms, the Gold Club Rooms are all non-smoking. Unlike the Rush Rooms, The Gold Club floors (16 and 17 in the Gold Tower) are accessible only by inserting your room key into a slot the elevator. More importantly, you get a great deal of extra benefits and value for about $20 more than a Rush room. While there is great value, be forewarned that there is no "club" per say as the 16 and 17th floors are not "club level floors, but rather they are the floors the Gold Club rooms are on. Don't let yourself be misled by the term "club". The benefits include check-in at the VIP area. This is very helpful when there are long lines since VIP is limited and never has a long line. You can also use the VIP lounge during your stay, although I never do. There is also a line pass that you receive which is good for the buffet, the Café, and the Showroom. Free wired internet is included as is use of the Spa facilities. The most valuable benefit in my opinion is the coffee and newspaper they put out by the elevators in the morning. Most guest get coffee and a paper in their robes and then head back to their rooms to wake up. The coffee is replaced at noon with snacks like M&Ms trail mix, mixed nuts, jellybeans and water. Although they say there is a turndown service, I really have not noticed it. I have eaten in many of the restaurants, including Red Sushi, the Chart House, and the Grill. All the meals I’ve had there have been very good, especially at the Chart House. The gaming area is better and cleaner than most downtown casinos (in my opinion). However, since it is hard to prevent entry of anyone, it is not unusual to be approached in any of the casinos for money or a cigarette by the homeless who have a large presence in the downtown area. The trade off for putting up with that is that I have not seen any “porn slappers” downtown, but they are very numerous on the strip. I had a great time during my stay and highly recommend the Golden Nugget to anyone looking for a great place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “This place suuucks!!”
Reviews.Author: Jordan Y
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend booked for the Golden Nugget based on other customer's reviews.....never again. I don't know what is so great about this place. The room we had felt like I was in some small cheap motel or someone's small apartment. It was very tiny but somehow there were two small little beds. The beds were horribly uncomfortable. I could not go to sleep, and was tossing and turning all night! The room was noisy due to the window not closing all the way, and the big ugly a/c was a bit noisy. The bathroom was really small, the toilet was horrible and flushing was weak. We won't be staying here again that's for damn sure!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ocwes
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thursday thru Sunday in a Parlour Suite (Gold tower). Very nice rooms, quiet and clean. VIP check-in is a nice perk with this room, no long lines. Hotel staff was all very friendly and helpful, even got some nice pointers from 'Kam', the bartender by Starbucks, that paid-off very nicely for both of us! Great bloody mary's and mimosa's! Ate at the cafe, the Grotto, and Vic & Anthony's. Service was excellent and food was great. Only bummer was the pool and jacuzzi were closed for refurbishing, and of course this info isn't offered when you make reservations two weeks prior. Note to self; ask if there will be any closures or construction that could possibly affect your stay next time when making reservations Overall it is a very nice place with a wide range of room types, a cool pool area (when it's open), great variety of food on property, and LOADS more all within walking distance off Fremont Street. Taxi to the Strip runs about $20 with tip, just tell driver to go surface streets or he'll go the freeway (long way)

Reviews.Title: “the great golden nugget”
Reviews.Author: michaelcrossan
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed there for 12 nights last november.The bedroom was very clean good size and bed very comfortable.Buffet a little pricy for what was on offer but food was tasty.Ienjoyed poker room had afew winning days good punters there.The casino is well run but a little hard on the cash.We haved stayed on the strip many times but for value the nugget beats them all. No more strip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower -----Fun without the expense!”
Reviews.Author: NWRiver
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Golden Nugget Rush Tower. It is non smoking, modern furnishings and colors, large bathroom, and a comfortable king bed & nice pillows for $69/night. My only disappointment was the $12.95/day internet charge and the beautiful shark tank pool was closed for maintenence. Freemont Street is not as busy in the winter as it was last summer but still had at least one live band as well as all the normal shows. The Holiday shows were fun and different. Parking is free and access to the freeway is easy and fast if you have a rental car. The Buffet is great for breakfast or lunch at about $11. there is all kinds of other inexpensive good food in the area and $2 Corona beer at most casinos on Freemont. We had alot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Night on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: RR1451
Reviews.Content: We spent thanksgiving night here. We were in the new Rush tower and the room was very nice 21st floor with a view looking north over the city. You could hear Fremont Street below but didn't bother us. The beds were very comfortable and all the furnishings were great. The bathroom was massive. Would be good to have a refridgerator and $2.50 for a cup of coffee in the room is outraegeous even for Vegas. We will be back. Great for the Fremont Street experience right out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Loves GN and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: mcaa1
Reviews.Content: Gold Tower was a bit smokey and would book Rush Tower in future but room and bed were absolutely fine Loved the casino and the atmostphere of the GN and the immediate access to Fremont. My room was at the back - no view - but then no noise either which i prefer The Shark pool was fab even though only braved once on account of the weather Great free entertainment in Freemont Street Would recommend downtown and the GN to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Havre2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed recently in downtown Las Vegas for the first time. We usually stay at one of the nicer strip casinos so we were a little apprehensive about staying downtown. The Golden Nugget was a pleasant surprise. The casino and grounds is no Bellagio, but the rooms are just as nice. We used a special weekday rate to upgrade to the newer Rush tower, which is completely non smoking. There is not a lot to explore downtown but the Fremont street show at night is interesting. It is very easy to get to any of the strip casinos from downtown by utilizing the nice public buses. However, you wouldn't know that there was cheap easy transportation to the strip by asking the staff. I think they want you to stay a captive of the Golden Nugget. During our entire stay, I didn't see or hear about the public bus service to the strip, which is used primarily by visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Couple get away”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMikefamily
Reviews.Content: We had booked a corner suite in the new tower but when we checked in we were offered a spa suite for a little more money, since we tend to spend more time in our room then most people who visit Vegas we took them up on the offer and were so happy we did we went back to the clerk and thanked him. If you can afford a spa suite you won't be dissapointed, it was nicer than the pictures show.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: laurie28
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rush Tower room and loved it. Very quiet and is a Non-smoking tower. Took our own k-cups as others had suggested and was great. But they don't leave the cups or sugar packs if you use your own. No big deal just used the glasses instead and got sugar from the restaurants. Very busy as the Rodeo was on but still had great service. The Grotto and Red Sushi were awesome. Never made it to Vic & Anthony's Steak House. When we left and were driving to Yuma, our daughter realized she and her boyfriend had left their passports and some cash in the safe in their room. I phoned the Hotel and talked to Daniel in Lost and Found who said no one had checked in that room yet and they would open the safe and check. He phoned me back and everything was there including the cash. and I paid to have it Fed exed over night to Yuma. It arrived the next day at 11. Thank-you Daniel!!

Reviews.Title: “They Really Blew Our Gold Club Room Experience”
Reviews.Author: bluejay19golf
Reviews.Content: We booked a Gold Club Room, which are on a special floor and accessed by the room key in the elevator. The rooms are pretty spiffy and we enjoyed our previous stay. HOWEVER, this was not a good trip. Some of the perqs of the Gold Club Rooms are the complimentary coffee and snacks. We arrived about 4 and discovered that all the snacks had been cleaned out (like somebody had dumped them into plastic bags to take home) and they were never replaced. They also provide bottles of water -- which also were missing and not replaced. We were unable to go to sleep very early since our room overlooked the Fremont Street Experience and after midnight it was blasting out "Born to Be Wild" as part of the show. At 8:30, I went to get the complimentary morning coffee -- and nothing! Empty coffee, no water bottles, no juice. I visited the VIP office and they said, well, they were set up at 6. Apparently you have to get very little sleep in order to get some coffee! They eventually did bring more coffee (especially after another person complained) and water -- but they weren't really doing their job if they want to get repeat customers. This is the last time we'll pay extra for the Gold Club (or stay at the Golden Nugget for that matter)

Reviews.Title: “The Unfriendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjgettys
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a several hotels in Las Vegas but the Golden Nugget has the most rude and unfriendly staff that I have ever encountered. It could have been a very nice stay because the rooms were nice for an older hotel but they did not make you feel very welcome in the hotel of the casino. The only person that even smiled was our waitress on the last day. The dealers were so rude that we ended up going across the street to Binions to play cards. Also be aware that they charged extra for everything, internet, pool chair and even the coffee packets that were in the room with the coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Got My Exercise!”
Reviews.Author: sheilaannestuart
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days in November, 2011 and had a pleasant stay. The hotel room was a long haul away from the casino however. Room was nice; no view whatsoever; housekeeping did a fine job. I enjoyed watching the pool area where you could swim next to an amazing aquarium. I would urge the marketing department to re-evaluate their signage as it appeared that it cost $20 to go in to the pool area even if you were a hotel guest you still had to pay for a chair to sit on. After a day or two I wandered in and found out that wasn't the case. There was no charge to enter or to have a lounge chair to sit on. These special chairs were on a second level. I think they area leaving tons of money on the table and losing potential guests. Did alot of financial donating to the casino which is my norm. Very nice downtown. Clean, tons of things to do and see. One FYI-no hair dryers in the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: aggiemom20002000
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay downtown. It is located in a great place to walk all of Freemont Street, and staight down the street is the bus stop to catch the bus to the Strip. The Showroom is a small venue, so what ever you see there means there is not a bad seat in the House. We say Clay Walker. The Grille has a great Ruben for a quick grab meal. There are also choices from the Steakhouse to the Buffet. The pool is heated for winter with cabanas for rent. The Nugget is a great break from the large Strip hotels. I love an oppotunity to be downtown for a break.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of good things to say about the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: bkayak
Reviews.Content: We like staying downtown better than on the strip, although we do go to the strip for a day or to see a show. We took the bus from downtown to the strip during the day, and took a cab back later that evening. Downtown to us just feels like it evokes the colorful history of the city, I love seeing the old photos in many of the casinos. We stayed in the Rush Tower on a high floor and the daytime view out towards Red Rock is very nice. The room was great, very big, great shower and tub, good king bed. What particularly attracted us to the Golden Nugget was the pool. The shark and other large fish in the shark tank in the middle of the pool were beautiful to watch, with their grace and interesting features. We are not particularly young but are active, and had a blast each day taking many trips down the water slide thru the shark tank. Adults and children alike were enjoying it. Since we were there in late November the temperature was in the 60's. I was glad I had read on a tripadvisor review that the tall buildings around the pool block the sun for part of the day. That is probably welcome in the hot summer but we had to work around it to keep warm enough as we were in the pool a lot. We had to make sure we went to the pool at the times the sun reached it, and we had to move from one section of chairs to other sections as the sun moved. The top pool on the third level catches much more sun, so we were up there quite a bit. Children are not allowed there. There is a big hot tub which helps when you get out of the pool. We ate one lunch and one dinner at the Grotto Italian Restaurant in the hotel and the food was wonderful with what we thought were reasonable prices. Breakfast at the Carson Street Cafe was nice. We did go to Vic & Anthony's which is a quiet, lovely place. It was excellent although I think the rave reviews we have read had our expectations a little too high. It's great to walk out of the hotel onto Fremont with so much to see in such close proximity. We love the old signs that are scattered about as part of the Neon Museum. And the Fremont Experience light and sound shows are still fascinating. The one problem with our room which I would try to avoid next time we go is the noise in the room, as we were looking out at the top of the Fremont Street experience framework. We realized it was the noise from the performances on the stages on Fremont that carried right into the room. The noise made it through my earplugs and noise cancelling headphones. We would attempt to find a way to get a room on the other side of the Rush Tower next time we go. I guess there are several ways to do that, one possibility being getting there early once check-in is available. That said, it was only a problem the night I wanted to stay in early and rest. The other nights we were out past 1 a.m., so it was fine by the time we got in. I like the layout of the hotel and casinos within, and the pretty bars, including the large aquarium at the Chart House and the large selection of vodkas at the pretty little bar just outside of the pool area. All in all, if you like downtown, I would say the Golden Nugget is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: jjones4180
Reviews.Content: I was booked in the Carson Tower (stayed before) and upgraded to the Rush Tower. The room design was completely different and very nice. The rooms in the Rush Tower are much larger and nicer appearance and the tower is non-smoking. If you are a tall person, you will actually fit underneath the Rain shower head. The tub is deep so an unusual step up needed to get in. The room furnishings ar every nice. The Rush Tower has its own checkin desk that is not as busy as the Carson and Gold Tower checkin desk. Parking is free for hotel guest. The room has a Keurig coffe maker but I would stay away from it as they charge is a box of K cups (4 to a box) is way over price. You can buy your own in a store with 14 - 16 cups with what they charge for 4. The same for the 2 bottled waters. Also be aware that is seems to be a practice of downtown properties to charge you a minimum charge to use the kiosk to check in to your airline online. They then charge you extra to use the paper to print your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “So far away from elevators 10 minute walk”
Reviews.Author: ajm1120
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel since 1971, always been treated excellent till this stay , I requested a room in the Rush Tower , close to casino, in the past I was always given the option to upgrade if space available , the agent on desk said would cost $100.00 per night.The usual fee as advertised in the Touch of Class Folder is $35.00, interesting jump in price. Also my offer included 2 free drink tickets which were not in my welcome pack .After checking in an going to room , was mildly surprised when after a 10 minute walk from the elevators in Carson Tower located our room .The safe didn't work, had to have the security personal open and reset the safe for our usage. The maid did not leave any wash cloths in changing the towel service guess too far to get correct linens lol The room haas a new coffee maker with a package of 4 coffee packets available ,however there is a charge if used. The charge for 4 single serve packs of coffee at $!0.00 seemed a little excessive. Certainly not a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is Tacky Brass”
Reviews.Author: LoveLaughEatLive
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Vegas for the weekend at The Golden Nugget, and while admittedly Vegas isn't my scene, I would gave appreciated a nice hotel. Coming from Australia, where smoking is strictly prohibited anywhere indoors, walking unto the smoky Casino lobby was the first strike. Having said that, that wasn't specific to this hotel. Thus us why I rated cleanliness terrible. The room wad spacious & clean, and actually quite nice. I rated location poor, as it was downtown, about a 20 min cab ride from the real Vegas where all the nice hotels are (which are a sight to see even if you don't stay there) & where all the shows are held. It was walking distance from the Freemont Experience strip, which was full of nothing but white trash (apologies for my lack of political correctness, but there's no other way to describe it). Worst of all, internet was for a charge if $13 for 24 hrs. Not impressed. Find a Starbucks or McDonald's for free WiFi if you go to Vegas. No sense in paying. Honestly, Vegas, take it or leave it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitlam H
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Stayed here in April 2011 and will def be going back in 2012. The staff are really friendly and quick to assist (no queues) and the rooms are very clean and tidy. Did have one hiccup when we first checked in. We asked for a non-smoking double room and they had none left (even though we had a paid reservation). We were taken up to the room they had spare but we decided to change. It took them about an hour to organise another room for us. The decor does need a bit of updating but that honestly shouldn't be considered a negative - if a room is clean and bedding/towels etc are regularly changed then surely thats all that matters. Bed was very comfy and the room itself was spacious. The bathroom was small but to be honest, small is the norm in Vegas unless you are spending more money on a bigger strip hotel. Again, very clean and shower really nice. Aircon was fab and you didn't hear anything from the other rooms, was very quiet most of the time. We had a room quite high up overlooking the pool - didn't hear any noise from that at all (nor Fremont Street). The casino is well laid out and has some nice bar areas. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: A perfect choice as I was travelling with a teenage daughter. The location of the Golden Nugget is probably the best and the nicest. We were given a room on the top floor which was nice and quiet to retreat back to when we had enough of the hustle and bustle of the Fremont Experience. Large casino area..and if you get bored and want to wander...you just have to walk out the door and into the door of another neighbouring casino. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying on strip better than downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Utahrealtor
Reviews.Content: We always stay on the strip usually at the MGM but wanted to see what has happened to the downtown area in the past 30 years. Stayed at the Nugget. Check in was in a very small lobby full of guests in line. It felt claustrophobic. You see the pool area from the hallways coming and going. Weird. We stayed at Paris last visit and will continue staying on the strip from now on. Walking at night is better there except for the hassle of people handing small cards with provocative photos. Nothing really wrong with room or service at Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: aebhawaii
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed in a Rush Tower room on 11/24/11, it was very nice! The room temperature was set to 63 when we first entered but it didn't take long to get it warmed up. We were staying just the one night prior to checking into our time-share condo but I easily could have spent the entire 8 nights right there! While checking in (which was a bit slow due to the business), my husband mentioned that we were in town to celebrate my birthday and the clerk moved us up to the 21st floor. We had a beautiful view of the "Fremont District" and the downbtown area. The room's bottle water price, $10, was steep, so I don't advise drinking it! Later in the week, we brought friends back to enjoy a great dinner in the steak house there and again enjoyed the beautiful view!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas / Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: HAMMRR2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget 11/19 to 11/22 for our 25th wedding anniversary. We always stay at GN. So close to so many other casinos within walking distance. Stayed in room 2276(end room) south tower. Nice clear view. Never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: H2OSprtlvr
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Golden Nugget. The room was very clean and airconditioned. The first day I didn't have a coffee maker or bottled water, but they magically showed up the next day. You have to pay extra for the coffee they offer to you and bottled water, so be careful if you don't want to pay the price. There was a Starbucks not too far from the elevator on the first floor. There was a Walgreens and other stores within walking distance to purchase bottled water, which I did, far less expensive than the hotel's water. I loved the big shark/tuna tank in the middle of the heated swimming pool and the slide that starts on the third floor and runs through this tank is very fun! This was my favorite thing about this casino. There was also a swimming pool on the third floor that was only for adults that stayed open until 2 AM. They do have a spa/workout place, but you either have to be in the other tower (I was in the Carson tower) or you pay $20 per day to use it. There were many restaurants of different types of foods to choose from and a couple of Starbucks. There was no Concierge to assist you with questions regarding Las Vegas and transportation. The staff would only recommend taxis to me, but I found the bus system very convenient and cost effective for getting me down to the strip. I enjoyed the Fremont Experience each time I was out there on the hour to listen and observe it. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Golden Nugget and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back here”
Reviews.Author: Susan43501
Reviews.Content: got a wonderful chlorine burn from the hot tub. Feels like a sunburn that also itches. Its been over a week and it still has not gone. Went down to the hotel manager 24 hours later and showed him the burns and he didnt care less. Told me that the pool guy would be in tomorrow and did nothing to ensure the same wouldnt happen to anybody else. I showed him again and was like, well this is pretty bad, and he just said "Yeah I see it" with total attitude. No apogylogy. No attempt to prevent this happening again. He just told me I would have to file a complaint with security and went back to his office shutting the door in my face. Still have not been reached by the hotel, as the security guy said I would, let alone an apology for the incident.

Reviews.Title: “overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: kvapt2550
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Thanksgiving holiday and enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget. There were some things in the room (Carson Tower #1410) that needs to be repaired or looked at. One was the room a/c. It was rattling whenever it kicked on. I place a chair against it to stop the rattling. Also, the tub did not drain very well. We showered in 2 inches of water the first night. Called for maintenance and they responded within an hour and cleared the tub drain. The water pressure for the shower seemed low. Other than those discrepancies we were quite satisfied with our room and all employees we came into contact with. Having stayed here before we again enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BabsSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN from 12/3 to 12/5 for a 50th Birthday party. This hotel is beautiful. We were in the Gold Tower, Club Floor. Had view of the pools. Bathroom w/TV in mirror, loved that! Very comfy bed. It was a pretty busy weekend in Vegas w/the Rodeo Finals and Rock and Roll Marathon so it seemed like the casino was really busy for a Sunday. Went to the club Gold Diggers for dancing after the birthday dinner. Great venue overlooking Fremont St. To rent a balcony table it was $200 (liquor guarantee). We just hung on the otherside of the ropes as the music from the club is filtered outside and there were heaters, so it was great for dancing! Did go inside later for dancing as well. No cover charge, but not sure if that is because we were with a group? At at Red Sushi for dinner. Great restaurant and great food. We will stay here again as we fell in love with Fremont St. area.

Reviews.Title: “not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: basil2812
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for business and this is NOT a hotel for business travelers. The business center has limited hours and it is annoying to have to pay for the extras - making coffee in your room, use the gym, have a small refrigerator in your room for a long stay. The hotel is smoky. the Rush tower rooms are new but personally I don't like the decor. the food is seriously overpriced in all restaurants. The Chart House was the only excellent restaurant. Uniformly at the hotel and restaurants, the service was sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Trish M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister in May, 2011. Beautiful hotel, right in the center of downtown. Rooms are very nice, the hotel is the nicest in the downtown area. Since we've both been to Vegas many times, we don't bother with the strip unless we're seeing a show. However, it's very easy to take the local transit to the strip if you want to, just make sure you catch the express! Local transit is only steps from the hotel and you can catch an express bus to the Sunset Mall in Henderson, great shopping mall, and there's a bus to the outlet mall as well. We will definately stay at the Golden Nugget the next time we're in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but rely on yourself”
Reviews.Author: FunAnd40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rush Tower and the room was fantastic. The Ruah tower was much better than the other tower we stayed in Agee years ago. The renovation the Nugget completed was well worth it. My only complaint was the $20 per person per day charge to use the fitness center ( and definitely not worth the money). I've never been to a hotel that charged guests to use the fitness center. It was also disappointing that I knew more about the city than the front desk staff and that the women at the ticket desk lied to me about available tours and shuttle to the Hoover Dam. It's a great place to stay but rely on yourself for information.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardJenny
Reviews.Content: If you are going to stay downtown, THIS is the place.
