The pool area is excellent, the staff are very friendly, the hotel is clean, the food is great, the bedding comfortable and all of this at a great price. This was my first experience with an off-strip stay and I was VERY pleased. The Plaza hotel across Main St. just went through a major renovation as well...don't miss the Hash House A-Go-Go. Come hungry! Prices are great, portions are HUGE. Seriously, split one meal.

Reviews.Title: “If your going to stay Downtown consider this place.”
Reviews.Author: jujubiee
Reviews.Content: So we went on a recent 8 day stay in Las Vegas . Broke our visit between 3 hotels and this one was one. I have not been to Golden Nugget in years. Great location. Check in was very fast. The review is for the Gold Tower. My understanding is that these were the newest rooms. Room was very modern looking, nice size , flat screen tv. Nice neutral colors. Now for the "other" things. 12.95 for wifi for 24 hours. There is a nice desk in the room but get this..there is no where to plug in your electronic device. I guess its just for writing. Also they have the Keurig machines in the room which i thought was great ...until I noticed the $10.00 charge. That is for 4 kcups. Now i have a keurig at home and you can buy those kcups online for around 50 cents each. That is soooo cheap. Im sure the casino makes enough money to spring for some free coffee. Also there is a bottle of water in the room with a price tag of $7.00. Also for some reason the beds only had sheets on them. They were made up of 3 sheets. No blanket no comforter. None in the closet either. As for gambling some friends and relatives we were with hated it. However my husband did great here and I did ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for staying in old downtown for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bluidechik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great spot of downtown Fremont street. If you plan on partying at Fremont street, this is the place to stay. you can party then just walk right to your room. the casino and hotel are smokier than the hotels on the strip. the rooms are nice for the price. Parking is free if you are a hotel guest. If you are visiting Las Vegas on a budget, stay at the Golden Nugget. You won't be disappointed. the stip is only a few miles away. Visit the strip but party on Fremont street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, large rooms, nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: AllisonA0523
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over memorial day weekend in the Rush Tower. We had a king size room with a sectional sofa. The bathroom was very large and had a separate shower and toilet area. The pool is amazing and great for kids. The restaurants were good. The poker room was fun. Great place downtown close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is Aces!”
Reviews.Author: MustEatOut
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Carson Tower November 19 thru November 22, 2011. The whole complex was clean and neat as a pin. I was a bit leery of the Carson Tower based upon reviews, but it was a very nice, clean room with a fantastic view from the 21st floor. I can't say anything bad about it except the timeshare hucksters right by the elevator, but even they left us alone after a while. We will stay here again when we pass thru Vegas again in two years. Definitely the class of Freemont Street!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in downtown”
Reviews.Author: GoNIUHuskies
Reviews.Content: Went the week of Thanksgiving and spent Saturday to Tuesday at the GN. i have stayed at the Rush Tower previously so we tried the Gold Club room. Loved the snacks right outside our room and the room was great. Wife did the spay and I did the poker room. She is converted from a strip girl to a downtown girl. She used a groupon and Red Sushi and loved it. Too cold to swim but showed her the pool and overall she really like the GN. Downtown was a blast and actually took a walk through Freemont East, had breakfeast at a cool local coffee shop and just enjoyed being downtown. She really enjoyed gambling in Binions and is not a member at Fitz, could have never imagined it. Stay at the GN, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Malena
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant as this was our first "Downtown Hotel" stay. Wow! What a beautiful Hotel! We stayed in the Rush Tower which was non-smoking and very quiet! The rooms have very comfortable beds, a large screen TV and a love seat/chaise lounge to relax on. The pools and hot tub were clean and having the upper "really" heated pool and hot tub open until 2:00 a.m. was a Big plus! Our swim at 10:00 p.m.was such a treat,only the bar maid and us to enjoy the stars. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants,a little too pricey especially since there is quite a selection of restaurants on Freemont Street. Dining Tip: We ate breakfast at Hash House A Go Go, located at the Plaza Hotel, it was reasonably priced,my waffles and sausages and hubby's pancakes were both delicious .

Reviews.Title: “VERY,VERY,VERY NICE.”
Reviews.Author: stomper_10
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed downtown.The Golden Nugget is by far the best place to stay.This hotel casino is so nice, it should be on the strip.Our room was beautiful,the pool is outstanding,dining is excellent,the casino is beautiful,makes the other hotels look bad.We walked around downtown a little,not impressed,we stayed at the hotel most of the time,we really loved there.Wish this hotel/casino was on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service, clean rooms and friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: bcf1108
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days and two nights at the Golden Nugget, and I will make a return visit very soon. My stay was perfect, the food was great, the bars and bartenders were perfect. The rooms were very clean and parking was close by the hotel so that was also convenient. If you want a break from the usual face pace and crowds, give the Nugget at try on a Sunday-Thursday and you won't regret your stay. Thank you to the employees of the GN and hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay in the Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: gmtom1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rush Tower for a 3-day weekend, which was recently completed. Reception lobby and check in were nice, although there was only one agent on duty when we arrived late at night and check in process was slower than I would have liked. Overall the rooms are very nice and new, however the interior color and artwork choices are definitely not my taste. Would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: drw00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street for 4 nights in November. The room was spacious and well maintained. It was also very quiet. There was a fire alarm our last evening an we were instructed to evacuate. The all clear was sounded before we made it to the stairwell which was very much appreciated. The location was great for visiting the "Fremont Experience". It would have been nice if they offered free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In All of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hpark4
Reviews.Content: I'm a Vegas veteran, having stayed in over 20 hotels on the Strip and downtown. The Golden Nugget is my favorite of any place at any price. The pool area is outstanding and I appreciate that the huge hot tub is always open. The buffet, while smaller than some of the Strip giants, is outstanding. The Spa is absolutely first rate. On top of everything the GN is such a bargain. Downtown Vegas is also the best place to gamble which is, after all, the reason Las Vegas exists.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Brysum
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the new Rush Tower during my trip and i wasnt disappointed.... The Golden Nugget is the only place to stay downtown as far as I'm concerned... the room was excellent and the whole property beats the heck out of the places downtown... the pool at the Nugget is not to be missed so make sure you bring your swimming attire!!!! check out my video walkthrough of the new Rush Tower room at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMPz21ls4yU

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay - for Downtown Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: outpulsed
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it "going on" downtown. I was able to stay in the Rush Tower which is the newest tower. If you see photos of brown-walled rooms and modern bathroom vanities -- that's the Rush Tower room. They are nice and new. They are also very dark. I turned on all the lights I could find in the room and still felt like I was in a theater because it was so dark with the brown wallpaper and dark curtains. If you don't mind dark rooms and like modern decor, you will love the rooms in the Rush Tower. In recent years the Golden Nugget has expanded in a good way. They have expanded the public areas and freshened the decor of the rooms and casino. They have brought a warm elegance to downtown. These new Rush Tower rooms have comfortable beds, large screen TV even a DVD player in the room. (nice touch) Overall the rest of the hotel....They have an amazing pool area with a shark tank and slide. A new lobby for the Rush Tower. They have a buffet, two-three lounges, at least three restaurants plus two Starbucks. The casino is owned by Landry's. The hotel restaurants seem very overpriced; however, there are cheap eats up and down Fremont Street. It seems every casino other than the Golden Nugget is running some sort of food special. Anyone who stays downtown makes a walk through of the Golden Nugget so be prepared to wade through a mass of sightseers on the weekends especially.

Reviews.Title: “Best value is the Carson Tower (formerly South Tower)”
Reviews.Author: Eagle42
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in all three towers. Most recently the new Rush Tower. This is truly an excellent hotel for the price, but we don't see any added value in the Rush Tower. The rooms are just newer and a little larger, but they are not well lit, which is a problem even in the daytime. We've stayed at the Nugget twice a year for more than 20 years. Small pool area, but very nice. Breakfast buffet is a good value. Couples can avoid the annoying time share people by walking apart and not looking connected. They are only interested in accosting couples.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed for the first time”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: We always stay here , several times a year. Never have any complaints other then the daily annoying time share people bugging every time you pass them which is on the way to Carson Tower- going up to the room and then back down they dont even rememeber they just asked you 10 minutes ago are you going to be here a coupe days-L.O.L ah but back to the subject- this time in room 1667 we heard a horrible noise off and on the majority of our 5 day stay - cant even say just what it was- it was a rumbling type sound - like something huge vibrating. Were going to ask for a different room and just decided to contend with it as i didnt want to pack up everyhting and move- took sleeping aids every night to try and sleep thru it. Also i think is is amusing they have now placed coffee in the room at ONLY 10 dollars a pot and also offer a bottle of water for 7 .OMG i always bring my own coffee maker and while there is nothing wrong with them offering this - i just think it is funny they started it now when all these yrs before we had not had that option which will nevetr use anyway at a highway robbery price The cleaning of the rooms were later then prefered and one day i was going in and was asked oh do you want service today? uh? yeah i do- why wouldnt we? we left in the morning - no sign on the door to not disturb why ask that and have not cleaned it already as it was sol ate in the day. We still will stay again as this was just the first time we had a complaint and it is no ones fault but ours that we didnt ask to be moved - they may have acomodated . and we are used to the vulture time share people although they are certainly no asset to an otherwise very nice hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Sindi63
Reviews.Content: For me, the best place to stay while in Las Vegas is Down townFreemont Street. The Golden Nugget being the premium choice. It is a clean reasonably priced home base for your trip. The goldline bus is right out side to take you to the strip any time and you can still get back itn time for the Freemont show.The Golden Nugget has one of the best pools with a shark tank and upstairs adult pool. Best of all,the jacuzzi and bar are open unitll 2:00AM. What a way to end the night!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JimOCotodeCaza_Ca
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place to stay in downtown. The rooms and service are excellent. Nice casino and great food in all of the restaurants. Compact, but nice pool area. Free parking for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: TumbleWeed4
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend one night of our four night trip, downtown. The Golden Nugget was a good choice. The rooms & beds were clean and comfy, the drink service on the casino floor was awesome and there are some great restaurants here. After staying at the big strip hotels the bathroom seemed extra small though. Fremont on a Saturday night was fun. A handful of live bands to listen to and a bed within easy staggering distance. Starbucks was quick to get to for coffee in the morning. Definitely have dinner at the Chart House.

Reviews.Title: “Service has slipped from a year ago”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler077
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Friday - Saturday night in November. Checked in after midnight. Wait at front desk was 15 minutes, then they gave me the wrong room number and had to send me to a different floor and send someone up with new keys. Agreed to make an adjustment on that night's room price due to the inconvenience, but the adjustment had not been made when I went to check out. The clerk did make the adjustment when then when I told him the story, but did not apologize for the initial inconvenience or the fact the adjustment had not been made earlier. This hotel is an icon that I have stayed at for years. Location is great and I love the atmosphere and friendly people that stay there. I hope management will remind their younger staff of what customer service is all about. I stayed in the Carson Tower rooms, which are comfortable and adequate. Sink and tub drains were slow.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - The Best on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Soundtech36277
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas for 4 nights as a mom and dad getaway. We've been to Vegas a few times and decided to give staying downtown a try. We loved it. Can't speak for the other rooms, but ours in the new Rush Tower was awesome. Clean and up to date. Huge double sink bathroom, very comfortable king size bed, good a/c, new flat panel TV, no complaints at all. We love Fremont Street and all the bars and casinos being so close together. Much less walking than on the strip. I took an hour or so one morning and went in most of the other hotels and casinos on Fremont and the Golden Nugget is much nicer than any of the others downtown, no comparison. We had a great time. My wife loved all the shops and kiosks being so close together and easy to walk to. Fremont is a great place to hang out every night, and you always see something different. For a first time Vegas visitor, I'd probably recommend staying on the strip and visiting Fremont one night, but if you stay downtown, the Golden Nugget is the only place to stay. Now that we've already seen the glitz and glamour of the strip a few times, we probably will stay downtown at the Nugget a few more times before we go back to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, but needs better customer service”
Reviews.Author: todski85
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms in the new rush tower, maid services could be a whole lot better. she didn't show up until late in the afternoon and by that time we were trying to get ready for dinner. kind of sad that I have been to the Golden Nugget before and I get a so, so room, and the other party in our group got a suite and he has never been to Vegas before.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you want downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms in Rush Tower. Overall, the property is very average and lacks the glitz and excitement of being on the Strip. Additionally, taxi ride to strip is about $25 each way,so anything saved on the room rate is lost on transportation unless you ride the bus. No plans to return any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but I would recommend a stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: susancoolgraney
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a fitness competition. I treated myself to a room in the Rush tower. These are all new hotel bedrooms and are very comfortable and well equipped. However, I requested a quiet room and although my room was on the other side of Fremont Street (rooms facing Fremont street are very noisy), I could still hear the noise from Fremont Street. I had to blast the fan in the evenings so I could sleep at night. I did not feel safe on Fremont Street and I felt that it was quite run down and a bit grotty. I got the shuttle bus to the strip and this was a scary experience. On each trip, I had "down and outs" sitting right beside me and they were somewhat aggressive, as a lone female traveller, I was very scared. I would not recommend the shuttle bus to the strip for a female traveller. After the fitness conference, I moved onto the strip and I felt a lot safer and was never bothered by strangers.

Reviews.Title: “asdasdasd”
Reviews.Author: Dhiman P
Reviews.Content: hese are as-good-as-it-gets in room amenities...Very quiet, good linens, excellent "rain" showers....AND the best value in Downtown options...there are less expensive rooms; but not this quality. The self-parking lot is more convient for the Rush Tower.. Certainly the best pool in downtown... Try the Chart House... more

Reviews.Title: “Rather stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: noordwyk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget for a week commencing Halloween, we had booked a room in Gold Tower. We arrived early evening after travelling for 17 hours, checked in and went to our room - right next to the elevator on the 11th floor - not good! On entering the room I went straight to the window to see the view and could see nothing, I managed to see a glimpse of light far to the right - yes we had a view of a brick wall! Straight back to reception to say we would not accept the room. We were told there were no other rooms available with king beds and so we agreed to move to a room with two doubles and a promise of a room change the next afternoon to a room with a king bed and a view. We then freshened up and went downstairs for a drink in the bar - my drink arrived in a plastic cup! My husband took it straight back to the bar to ask for it to be put into a glass, after waiting patiently while the bartender ignored him (there were not many other people in the bar it was early evening) my husband leaned over the bar and helped himself to a glass. We were not impressed after travelling halfway round the world that our first drink in Las VEgas was in a plastic cup - why? We noticed nobody else being served with plastic cups. Not a good start. The hotel is OK, nice furnishings and clean. Fremont Street on Halloween was a lot of fun. However, we would not stay there again as we spent the entire week travelling up town. We also had to spend the first full day of our holiday hanging round the hotel waiting till lunch time to find out if we could change rooms. Fremont Street is OK to visit once or twice at night, there is no reason to go there during the day. Next time we will stay on the Strip. You would also think that on checking in when they know they are giving you a room that is a) next to the elevator; and b) with full view of a brick wall - that they would tell you this and offer you whatever else was available, instead of letting you go up there and being very disappointed. Would therefore not recommend this hotel as they clearly wait for you to complain before they do anything, not good guest relations. Las Vegas on the other hand was fab!

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is great”
Reviews.Author: lou1944
Reviews.Content: These are as-good-as-it-gets in room amenities...Very quiet, good linens, excellent "rain" showers....AND the best value in Downtown options...there are less expensive rooms; but not this quality. The self-parking lot is more convient for the Rush Tower.. Certainly the best pool in downtown... Try the Chart House , right behind the reception with the giant fish tank, great service and Happy hour specials.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jem.”
Reviews.Author: kkroe77
Reviews.Content: No one stays off the strip anymore. Why would you? Everything is there, you want to be there and will stay there when you do get there! Howver, if you do find you are not wanting the strip, Golden Nugget is a most wonderful diamond in the rust. The rooms were very clean and a decent enough size. It is fairly easily to navigate and you come out on Freemont! Now I love Freemont, as should every one, so it was no sacrifice to stay for 2 nights! The pool is on the small size, but they have a huge shark tank in the middle of the pool compex, which has a water slide going directly through it! It was pretty cool. This hotel was so reasonablt priced. It was perfect for me!

Reviews.Title: “Better then staying on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Linda113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and we loved it. Very very clean and the staff are most helpful. We've stayed on the strip before and won't ever again since our stay at the Nugget. The room was in Carson tower and it was beautiful. This hotel is on Freemont Street which is most interesting in the evening with the lighting canopy. You can easily walk to other gambling places, restaurants and shopping. That's perhaps one of the biggest advantages by staying downtown rather then the strip. The music in the evenings on Freempont street is mostly 60's, 70's and 80's and we both enjoy it very much. We would definitely stay at the Golden Nugget our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms in Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: wausauinMT
Reviews.Content: Stayed in $79 weekday King-bed suite room in Rush Tower and couldn't have been happier. Free parking for hotel guests. Check-in and out were very fast. We booked directly with the hotel and got the $72 AARP rate, but no discount coupons or other bennies. None of the 'resort fees' we had been warned about by other TripAdvisor recommendations. Golden Nugget is great place to stay downtown and right in middle of "Fremont Street Experience." If you turn in early, get a room looking at the Strip, not overlooking Fremont Street. The noise can be overwhelming and we thought would "color" your late evening. Only annoying thing was being stopped every time we walked out the front corner doors on Fremont Street by nice folks trying to peddle time shares in a resort community. Every one had a different 'line' and they became a nusiance. We'd gladly stay at the Golden Nugget next time. The rooms were spotless, fresh-smelling, and very comfortable. Beds were excellent. No smoking or pets allowed and a $200 fee imposed for breaking this rule. Way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with a Toddler”
Reviews.Author: TheReviewR
Reviews.Content: Check in took quite a long time and they didn't even have us registered as having a certain package which I had booked directly through the hotel's website. I had to call the reservations line to get our freebies. Be sure to take any confirmations with you that show your deal. We stayed in the Gold Tower Room. We asked for a room away from Fremont Street and they gave us a room with a window facing a cement wall with a small bit of space to the outside. Plus our room had one wall behind the elevators. They are loud and you can hear them going up and down all night. We had to run the AC to drown out the noise. The carpet had a stain on it. A little gross when you have a little one all over the floor. There is an ice machine on each floor and a little ice bucket in the room. The swimming pool is nice and clean compared to the large hotels on the strip. No one was walking around the pool with a drink in hand, so no worries about stepping on straws or people peeing in the pool. The slide through the tank is awesome! The best view into the tank is from the back side of the pool. Be sure to walk outside and take a look even if you don't go in. There was no problem finding a chair at 11:30 am. The sun moves across the pool area so the chairs to the right when you walk out will be in the shade, but eventually the sun will hit them. The buffet is pretty good! I was going to avoid it after reading poor reviews, but it really was good we ended up eating there 3 times. If you go before the meals end you can catch both parts of breakfast and lunch. Yum! Our 1 year old got to eat for free, great deal considering he eats alot. Also they charge 20% gratuity on parties of 8 or more. They don't count the little ones that don't pay though.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel- try the gold club rooms”
Reviews.Author: DEW5245
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a few times and always go downtown for a night but never stayed downtown until this trip. Spent my last night downtown in the newly remolded Gold Club rooms. Loved that this tower is right off the casino and not a far walk from anything. You have to use your key card to access the top two floors which house the Gold Club rooms. As soon as you get off of the elevator you are greeted with coffee in the morning and snacks and bottled water in the afternoon. Loved having the bottle waters to grab before heading out and especially when coming in for the night. The room is very nicely done but a tad dark. Wonderful view overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: GBrooks800
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay, have been there four times in the last two years, why stay any place else. Excellent value, staff great from check in to check out, Waiters, Front desk, House Keeping, Casino, Security, all very professional, and a great value, after the Nugget' s 35 million dollar up-grade, food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: partyjockeys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget in August of 2011, was far and away the nicest place downtown to stay, and is reasonable! The pool is awesome, the rooms are nice, clean, well stocked. Buffet was very good, took in the Gordie Brown show which was also very good. My only complaint is that the casino kept a pretty good chunk of my money.... :)

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas - No Wonder Why Everybody Loves It!!”
Reviews.Author: secmac0112
Reviews.Content: Visited in October 2011, traveled with my sister. We drove from Calgary Alberta Canada. I would suggest this location as I found Freemont Street much more interesting then 'The Strip'. We spent two nights on the strip and three nights on Freemont Street. The hotel is clean, comfortable and very well maintained. The weather was poolside warm - we had a great time! Needless to say, I would definitely return to the Golden Nugget!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the "Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Charlie628
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a number of years ago and returned recently for business meeting. Stayed in the Rush Tower which has upscale rooms at reasonable rate of $79 (weeknights), but be prepared to pay $13/day for WiFi and $2.50/cup for in-room coffee. Fremont Street right outside was hopping every night with live bands, street performers, etc. In the Nugget ate at Grotto, which was fantastic and at the Carson Street Cafe which was pretty bad (how can you mess up bacon and eggs?). No shuttle from here to the strip, so either take the city bus (NOT recommended by hotel staff) or pay $25 for cab - each way. But there's plenty to see and do downtown and much easier to get around than the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lvirtudes
Reviews.Content: Jus came back from Vegas and had a great time at Golden Nugget. The restaurants were great and the food excellent. The employees were friendly and helped us when we didn't know how to play certain card games. Will always go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pjsplace5
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the nugget. We stayed here for 4 nights in the Rush tower and had a wonderful view and great room.Our room was clean and very roomy. Loved being right downtown where we could walk around. Great food at hotel. Grottos served great food and wonderful pizza. Very pretty hotel. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Aznorran
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We usually stay on the strip but decided to try Fremont Street. The room was very large and very clean. Yes, a little dated but added to the charm. The bed was very comfortable, large tv. Carson Tower was close to pool, lobby, casino and Starbucks. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in Nov and found the room to be clean and spacious for 3 adults. Room service appreciated and went the extra mile every day with a small tip. Will certainly stay there again when we go back. Only con was no rooms with 2 queen beds, which would be nice for friends sharing a bed. Otherwise, rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: janetteBradford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 week in November 2011. We stayed in a basic twin room. It was just ok. The cleaners kept up to the rooms but we both got skin rashes and we found a couple of bugs in the room. I woke up with 2 bites on my face. We have stayed in the Nugget 5 times now and never had problems before. It seems like all the effort is maybe in the new rush tower? Anyway the buffet has improved and the casino is great. Will stay again but in a newer room. The air con was too noisy in our room this time. Sorry Golden Nugget but we were disappointed for the first time in 10 years!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: heartz13
Reviews.Content: We went here for a wedding. It is off the strip which kinda sucked, but it is still a really nice hotel. We started off in the Gold (?) tower with the rest of the family, but they gave us the wrong room which was not very cool. The room itself was okay. They fixed the problem first thing the next morning and upgraded us to the Rush Tower. It was quite an improvement. It is the newest tower and was absolutely beautiful. The decor and quality of the room was awesome. The bathroom was stunning. The beds were a little on the soft side, but still comfy. Gold diggers night club was great for music but not busy at all. The pool area was nice but it was freezing cold as it was outdoors. The water was supposed to be heated but didn't feel like it. The wind was so strong and cold that it overpowered what sun there was. They should consider investing in an indoor pool as well for crappy weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Awesome Pool Deck!”
Reviews.Author: VickiSecrets
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carson Tower , which is the non renovated section.. it was perfect . Rooms were clean, all required amenities, beds could use a pillow top but all in all ... pretty good! Access to Fremont Experience, full casino , starbucks, cafe with great fast service, food was ... las vegas style... get it and enjoy it cuz the next one might not be as good! The pool was amazing though, the watre slide through the shark/fish tank was awesome..when i go back for a relaxing vacay with my hubby I will stay here and relax on the pool deck while he plays black jack at the pool side tables!

Reviews.Title: “wasnt the best hotel but worth the pay”
Reviews.Author: Lanisha J
Reviews.Content: So i stay in the gold tower and besides the bathroom being too small and the sink water smelling like sewage it was an okay stay. The "tank" is the only reason i would come back. Didnt get to use the pool but it looked great. Was kind of upset that there was no free coffee had to pay $10 for a box of 4 and when i got to my room the box was already open and missing 3 of the coffee's. Only good thing with that was i was not charge for the coffee. I would recommend the hotel again only for visual reasons. Will advise unless staying in the Rush tower i say just get a regular room because the gold tower didnt seem much of an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Last night in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: notquite50
Reviews.Content: We decided to finish our trip with our last night at the Golden Nugget with the evening spent on Fremont Street. We booked online a basic room in the Carlton Tower, check-in staff very helpful. Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable. The pool area is a great lay-out, and the 3rd floor sun-deck and pool area is great set-up. Looks to be a place to be during more suitable weather. I would definitely consider taying there again, possibly in the Rush Tower just to see how much better those rooms are than Carlton. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who looks to spend some time / evening on Fremont or comfortable with transit to the strip or North-End outlet mall for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Treatment of a Loyal Customer”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday in Oct she wanted to see George Wallace's show at the Flamingo in Las Vegas. We had to split our stay between Harrah's and Golden Nugget because Harrah's did not have any rooms available the third night we would be there. Just as well, Harrah's did not treat us very well while we were there. On the flipside, Golden Nugget was excellent beginning with our arrival. The doorman treated us with a hearty hello and friendly smile. He got a tip just for his attitude alone. They allowed us to check in early, gave us free drink coupons, and our bags arrived without us having to call for them. The room was much bigger and nicer than Harrah's. The morning we left, I went to the rewards card counter to see how much I had on my rewards card as we wanted to use the points to pay for breakfast. The friendly lady at the rewards desk not only told me how much I had, but threw in enough comps to pay for 90% of our breakfast! Needless to say, we will be staying at Golden Nugget on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaConcierge
Reviews.Content: You deserve 5 stars but the rude "VIP" employee started the stay off a bit sour. I just returned from a stay at the Golden Nugget. On a previous trip to Vegas we were mesmerized by the amazing Shark Tank, cabanas and pool area. This was enough to want a stay at the property when we returned. I booked a parlor suite and got an amazing rate! I booked through the hotel website so when the rate dropped a week before our stay they were able to confirm me with the lower rate. We had 4 different rooms in our party. Two standard rooms which were well appointed and quite spacious as well as a Rush tower Jr. Suite and our Parlor Suite. We checked in around 1pm, for the suites, I waited online at normal check in and a very nice receptionist told me I would need to check in at the VIP lounge. The VIP lounge is right off the main lobby and is a nice little well appointed lounge. My main complaint of my stay: the receptionist in the VIP area was rude, curt and generally unfriendly especially compared to the "normal" front desk staff. The guests experience at check in can often make or break an experience and I would hope VIP management takes that into account. We were put in room 538 in the Gold Tower. This is a low floor for the building but we were put at the end of the front hallway overlooking the buildings main entrance. The view was not stellar but pretty and not having anyone next to us allowed for a later night of laughs in the huge suite. The two rooms suites have 2 bathrooms and a wet bar in addition to the bedroom and living room. The bedroom had a gorgeous king bed with white sheets and a beautiful box valance above the bed which made it seem very regal. There is a seating area in the bedroom as well as a large flat screen TV and the mandatory items like clock radio/ipod player. Off the bedroom is a full closet, a dressing station and one of the bathrooms. This area was all marble, the bathroom was a bit small but had a soaking jetted tub which was terrific. The living area was enormous and the wet bar made it easy to keep the champagne and snacks coming. There was a mini fridge sink and counter but little else. It was outfitted with glasses but no dishes or cutlery, etc. Living room consisted of a large couch 2 arm chairs and a dining table for 4. Off the living room is the second bathroom. This bathroom was much larger then the first and did not have a tub but included a heavenly steam shower. At the Elevator bank to the Gold tower is where you will find the enormous gold nugget spinning in its large mirrored exhibit. We did not eat while at the Golden Nugget but the restaurants all looked clean and inviting (we had a full agenda of foodie stops, side note: Bouchon for breakfast is an orgasmic experience) The pool was definitely a highlight. The 3 story water slide that spirals thru the shark tank was a terrific experience. We spent a few good hours riding the slide before the main pool closed and we retired to the Hideout for more drinks and the adult pool. This 3rd floor pool lounge was empty, making for a peaceful stay. Other then not feeling like a VIP- I would definitely return to their beautiful rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Happy 60th Birthday spent in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TheRubys
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Vegas celebrating my 60th birthday! The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay, clean rooms and nice comfortable beds!! We stayed on the 21st floor and was quiet with a great view. We spent extra to have the VIP package and it was so worth it, no standing in lines and special attention they gave us was wonderful. Check in was smooth with no wait. Be sure and eat at The Steakhouse Vic & Anthony's, 5 star restaurant!! The Golden Nugget will be the only place we will stay in our future visits to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lance F
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in a Gold Tower room. Clean, large, good bed--- great stay for the price. Tower is right off casino floor. Grotto restaurant serves really good food ate lunch there twice. But hands down for this entire property the best food and service goes to Vic and Anthonys. We had eaten there on previous trips and knew it was good. First night went into bar for a cocktail and ended up eating there all 3 nights. The 2 person bar staff, Megan and Mark, took care of us every night. I was in the high end restaurant business at one time, so saw that these two people do not miss a beat. What a asset for the Nugget! Thanks again to Megan and Mark and the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown's Best Place”
Reviews.Author: ACMan53
Reviews.Content: Never stayed at this property before. Was pleasantly surprised at the accomodations, the size of the room...even had flat screen TV's. Many good places to chose for Dining: the Steak House, the Grotto for good pizza and even the Coffee Shop for Breakfast. However was very disappointed with the Charthouse Restaurant in the hotel...not very good and somewhat over priced, but overall the Hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Are Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CWimer62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget on business. The hotel is nice. You can see they've done some renovations and it has paid off. The rooms are huge -- so they are perfect for couples or business travelers. The Chart House restaurant is exceptional. My only complaints is the check in process because it seems to take forever. Great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: hayden23911
Reviews.Content: I've been to vegas a number of times. The wife and I decided to stay in old vegas this time instead of the usual strip hotel. We picked the golden nugget and stayed in their newly renovated rush tower. Rooms were very spacious and upadated like a 5 star hotel. Location is perfect, walk out of the hotel and you're on the fremont experience. Old vegas has better payouts at the casinos and food/drinks are much cheaper down there as well. The pool had a huge aquarium with sharks in it. A slide also went thru the tank if you want to do that. Only problem was the pool is in the center of a few tall buildings so the sun does not always hit the pool area well. I would defn' stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: pnmbn
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying downtown. Loved the property.! Room was spacious and clean. Private cabana at the pool area was worth every penny :-) Charter House was yuumy! Breakfast buffet.....not so much :-(

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lm55417
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Golden Nugget and we were just as pleased with this trip as we were the last time we stayed. They've been updated their rooms - unfortunately, we didn't get one of those rooms but it was still nice and clean, which is always my first priority. The staff was very pleasant at the front desk and check-in was rather quick - in spite of the number of people in line. I will avoid their cafe/restaurant the next time we go. The service is almost non-existent and our food came out a little less than room temperature. I LOVE their spa - it's one of the best I've been to - and I've tried quite a few in Vegas. I had an 80-minute massage that was pure heaven. The whirlpool in the spa is wonderful and I'm always surprised at how under utilized it is. My only complaint with the spa would be the lack of seating in the women's waiting room. The hotel pool was wonderful and refreshing on a hot day - get out there early for you best choice of seating. We will go back - we like being downtown and like that the GN is in the center of the Freemont Street experience.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting much more--and better”
Reviews.Author: Bigbill69
Reviews.Content: The first four trips to Vegas we stayed on the Strip at four different hotels--some great, some not so much so. After we started going with friends, we started staying downtown and liked it so much better. At the downtown hotels you don't have to walk for 30 minutes just to get next door. Anywhere on Fremont Street (or within a block or two) you can get around quickly and not spend all of your time trying to get to somewhere else. If you do want to venture over to the Strip its only about two blocks to where you can catch the Duce (the double-decker buses). This, in itself, is a treat for me. The first couple of trips in which we stayed downtown, we stayed at the Four Queens which in my estimation was not bad. It wasn't the Bellagio, but then I wasn't expecting it to be. The next year (Oct. 2010) we got a good deal and stayed at the Golden Nugget. I had always heard that the Nugget was the best and nicest of the downtown hotels and was really excited about staying there. With all of the hype I had heard and read, I was expecting much more-- and better. Overall, I rate it very good, even though I was somewhat let-down, especially with our room. It was clean, but average at best, not any better than what we had at the Four Queen the previous two years. We were on the back side of the hotel and our view was of the top of other buildings and parking lots. But, afterall, we don't go to Vegas to spend our time looking out of the window, so really this was a no issue. The one thing I really didn't like, was the fact that there was not a coffee pot in the room. There are several Starbucks in the casino area if you want to buy overpriced coffee (which I refuse to do), but I don't want to track downstairs just to get my morning coffee. Even the Motel 6 offers free morning coffee!! The hotel and casino common areas are really nice and there is a lot to see, like the shark tank and pool, but still was not up to my expectations. I didn't particularly like their casino, but then, I judge a casino on the machines I like to play and how comfortable I am while I'm playing. If you're going to stay at the Nugget, you'd be better off in getting a room in the new tower (which was under construction when we stayed there). Overall, it's worth a stay--you might like it a lot better than I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: curly002
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and the Nugget was an excellent fit for us! Previous to booking our hotel, we did a lot of research and got a lot of advice/suggestions for where to stay - downtown or the strip. We definitely made the right decision with downtown and the Golden Nugget. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. We had a gorgeous, clean room with a wonderful view in the Rush Tower. It was very quiet, which was nice in the mornings for sleeping in. The pool was awesome - even with kids around, it was relaxing. The wait-staff was timely and the bartenders prompt. We ate at the Carson Cafe and had the Champagne Brunch Sunday morning. Both served delicious food with great service. For the price, I would have to say the brunch wasn't worth it for me, but my husband was pleased with it. The location was wonderful - there were taxis readily available as well as public transportation within a block or two. You could walk out of the hotel at night and watch the light show, listen/dance to live music (we heard three different rock bands and a saxophone player/signer) dance to dj's, see magicians, contortionist and a variety of other "acts". There were many different shops, casinos, restaurants, kiosks, and clubs along Fremont to enjoy. We did not gamble much (at any casino), didn't win a penny - but had fun playing. "Free" drinks were readily available if you are gambling, which was nice. There were people smoking in the casino's, but the ventilation must be awesome because it never smelled smokey, especially at the Golden Nugget. The only thing at the Nugget I was disappointed in was the availability of the workout room and the extra charges. There was a $20 fee per day to use the exercise facility as it was considered part of the spa. There was also a $13 fee for 24 hours of internet access. Even with these "negatives", we would stay at the Nugget again and recommend it to anyone who asks our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: cazzalfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Golden Nuggetn for 2 nights in September before moving on to the strip. The hotel was great. Just walk outside the hotel and you have all the entertainment Freemont Street offers right outside your door. Some great bands where you can grab a drink either from the hotels or street bars, or even the shop and watch the bands, then of course there is the light show every hour. I enjoyed Freemont Street better than the strip as the strip was so busy you could hardly move. Would definately recommend a couple of nights here. Pool area was also good, especially with the shark tank. Rooms were clean, big and comfortable. only downside was wifi was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel-Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: stynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget the last 2 years and I think it's a wonderful Hotel. Reasonable Price, Great Bartenders very lovely waitresses and Gold Diggers is a ton of fun. Rooms are very clean and they do a great job of meeting your requests. Food is good and the pool is breath taking. Close to other Hotels and fun to walk the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury downtown”
Reviews.Author: aloha68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new tower and it was very nicely appointed with dark wood furnishings. Rain shower was a bit weak for our taste and there was no mini fridge. Other than that we enjoyed our room and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel for what you get”
Reviews.Author: msmcelligott
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gold Tower. The rooms had been renovated, however many remnants from the 70's still remained, including the doors / locking mechanism, the loud wall air conditioner / heater and the shower. We chose this hotel because it looked like it had an incredibly cool pool. I will say that the pool itself was not a disappointment. Very nice. The pool is set around an aquarium, giving you the feeling of swimming with the fish. There is an awesome water slide that goes through the aquarium, however the speed of the slide makes the inside of the aquarium a big blur. Great concept, poor implementation. The smoke! Like most casino hotels you have to go through the casino to get to your room. Since this is an older casino, the ventilation is not as good as some of the newer ones. It was very smokey and very hard to breathe. My room was a smoke free room, but it was very obvious that it had been smoked in. Yuck! The room was ok, but parts were dated as mentioned above. Our pool view could be seen in tilting your head and looking at a 1/32 quadrant of the window. The rest was pavement and non-pool. The bathroom was small and you could not keep down the bath mat if you wanted to open the bathroom door. The room was appointed with 2 full sized beds. The beds were comfy and the bedding was nice, however if you have 3 people in your group, you know that sharing a full size bed is NOT comfy. The buffet. The lines are long during the week. If you show up for breakfast on the weekend, expect to pay a lot more as it becomes a "champagne brunch". Hard to spend $20.99 for a 13 year old to enjoy a champagne brunch, but they offered no alternative pricing for those that do not drink. Room coffee. We recently stayed at nice place in central California. They had a Keurig coffee maker in the room. They included 4 free pods as your "room coffee.". The Golden Nugget had a 4-Pack of coffee and wanted to charge $10.00!!! No free room coffee here! The location was fun. The downtown area has a great light show and friendlier casinos. It's very easy access either via local bus or driving to get to the strip. So, it wasn't horrible, but I doubt I'll stay at the nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ol' Dependable Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bruce L
Reviews.Content: When I need a quick week's break from work, nothing is simpler than a visit to Las Vegas... Even in late October the weather was in the low 80's and the Golden Nugget in Freemont (downtown) has a fabulous pool area where non-gamblers (like me) can read a good book, enjoy a few drinks and be away from the noise of the casino! I booked our room directly with the casino and was asked if I wanted to purchase the "VIP option" for $25? Why not? They threw in a couple of free breakfast buffets, drink coupons and show tickets and put us on the top floor too. Nice! The VIP option provided us a super-quick check in (just a few feet away from the front desk is the "VIP room" and when I strolled past the mass of folks lined up at registration and opened the door to the VIP room, I was imediately greeted by a cheerful receptionist who handed us our keys and coupons. Done, just like that). A quick unpack and hanging up of some clothes and we went off to one of our favourite watering holes, the Chicago Brewery in the Four Queens (next door) after placing a small sports bet so we could enjoy some beers and pub food while cheering on our team that was broadcast on the big screened televisions (I'm not a BIG gambler but $50/day of short-term investing is about my comfort level). Kimmie at the CB is always cheerful and an attentive server - the big 22 oz growlers of Wezenheimer beer (with a slice of orange floating in them) helps the sliders and burgers go down. Well, my team lost, but I visited the nearby Premium Outlet Mall and purchased my Sweetie a bag full of her favourite soaps and lotions at L'occitane en Provence - now that's a smart investment! Up on the strip (just a short bus ride away on the Ace bus), the Fashion Mall now has the newest Tiffany & Co store and, while small in size, the service was first-class and I left with a tasteful gift for my work colleague. While the weekends are busy in LV, the weekdays are craaaazy quiet and I found myself enjoying the classical music and dancing waters outside the Bellagio Casino with only a handful of people scattered on the sidewalk around me. Inside Bellagios there is a piano bar that has awesome martinis, great music and is the ideal perch for people-watching. The Caesars's Casino next door has (surprise) another great bar, just outside the forum as you enter the casino floor and the bartender, Mike, is a true artist in dispensing amazing alcoholic creations... (he makes a killer "old fashioned" using Knob Creek whiskey). All that walking (and drinking) can create a little appetite mid day and thank goodness there's a Ghirardelli Chocolate shoppe hidden in behind Harrah's (actually more beside it and behind all the kiosks). They feature a menu with colour photos of their belt-busting sundaes and that makes picking your favourite a real challenge (there's always tomorrow for another visit!) While on the subject of eating (there's lots to discuss on that subject in Las Vegas) another good spot in Freemont is the diner at the Golden Gate Casino - well prepared food 24/7 (plus terrific pies if you have room for dessert...) when you don't feel like a buffet (but when you do, Main Street Station offers the best buffet downtown!!!) So, when you're not eating, drinking, shopping or people watching (or hanging out a the pool), there are loads of attractions and shows in LV. The Titanic exhibit, Paul Simon and Rodney Carrington were all enjoyed on this latest trip (I vow to see Garth Brooks next trip). Some evenings when we weren't up on the strip shopping or attending a show, we enjoyed live music outside the casinos in Freemont; listening to Carl Ferris performing on his saxaphone while at the other end of the street a group played rock n' roll classics. For the younger crowd there are pretty female bartenders outside the Golden Gate Casino dancing on top of the bars when not selling drinks (but in my book the "mature" bartenders inside the Golden Nugget create the best martinis in downtoown though...) We always agree that 5 nights is long enough for any LV visit (any longer and I couldn't get all my purchases on the plane - plus I'd be "circus fat"!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tipsytravler
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay in Rush Tower. Fast and early check in. Very clean and comfortable room. Toilet was located in "water closet" which was very nice. Yeah a make up mirror too!! Finally someone thought of the ladies. Also very quiet. Received breakfast buffet and show tickets to Gordie Brown. Both very enjoyable. When we mention to people that we stayed downtown the first reaction is, "Oh did you feel safe?" Well absolutely. I felt safer downtown then on the strip. Plus the atmosphere is better. We rented a car for the week, parked for free in the garage and had the freedom to go and do whatever we wanted. the Golden Nugget is my first choice in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: RandPEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Fremont Street because it's a "friendlier feeling" area than the strip which can at times be a little on the snooty side. It depends on what kind of Vegas experience you want. We like both areas but if we have a car we like the fact that the parking is so much closer than the strip hotels.We usually end up strolling down Fremont at night to enjoy the ambience without having to walk such long distances.The Nugget staff are so frindly and helpful and the rooms in the Rush Tower are awesome. Once we got upgraded to the Spa Suite which is just too opulent to believe,lots of fun.The pool area is great and just as fancy as the ones on the strip but somehow more comfortable.The bars and restaurants are all top notch. If you feel like trying a different sort of Vegas trip next time you might want to give it a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: semi872
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in the Carson Tower on the third floor and were very satisfied with our room. I will stay here again and would recommend it to my friends and family. We didn't spend anytime in the pool area although it looked very nice. It would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room and the check-in process could go a little faster if they had more people behind the counter.

Reviews.Title: “way to go fremont st.”
Reviews.Author: hotelhoppers17
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Oct.24. Check-in we had to wait one hour because we wanted a view of the strip and not Fremont St.& this was at about 11A.M. Great view of strip& very clean room in the Rush Tower on 20th. floor. Elevators were quick & four of them for youre use. Fantastic aquarium for a backdrop behind the lobby desk when you check-in which makes for a relaxing wait should you have to wait a bit to check-in. Food at the buffet at G.N. was O.K. for breakfast & lunch if you use the two coupons per person for these meals at a cost of two for one price which you get in the coupon booklet at check-in. Dinner buffet was a big waste of money, costing $42.00 for two. Much of it was leftovers from lunch & not even any soup for lunch or dinner. In big letters over top of the Fremont casino entrance they advertise as the biggest & best in L.V. for buffets. Dont go for this gimmick. This was most likely the worst buffet we have ever been to in L.V. for $32.00/ couple for supper The best place we found was in the Fitz on the second floor of the casino called the Courtyard. For $9.99/ adult you get a full rack of pork ribs smothered in B.B.Q. sauce with fries or baked potato a full salad bar with veggies & two soups to choose from & as much salad soup as you want. Dont forget to see the worlds biggest "gold boulder" at the G.N. It measures in at just over 61 pounds! Entertainment on Fremont St. was very good, with the St. filling up over the hours from 6 P.M. to 12 midnight. After that the street empties & the casinos fillup or people return to the strip. Sound system is absolutey amazing on Fremont St. for the light show. What used to be Harrahs on Fremont St. is now the Plaza casino, & this is a nice change considering this property has been abandoned for years. Lots of security & police on Fremont St., never felt unsafe until you venture into the " Badlands" which can feel iffy at any hour. Would we stay on Fremont St. again? Yes. Very pedestrian friendly & easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Modern large hotel”
Reviews.Author: north12345john
Reviews.Content: This was a nice modern and comfy hotel we stayed in the new rooms and it was very modern and sleek just stayed here for one night to see downtown lv, only problem with the hotel was they let people who werent staying in the hotel use the pool so i couldnt even get a sunbed for all the outsiders everywhere. Good base and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Franahan
Reviews.Content: We enjoy all the entertainment and casinos on the strip but the Golden Nugget called us back when it was time to relax. We spent a day at the adults only pool and were treated extrmely well. This time we chose to stay in the Gold Tower which is closer to the casino floor. Our room was right off the elevators and we were concerned that the noise might be disruptive however there are noise curtains between the room corridor and the elevator bank that are pulled later in the evening. It worked great for us. One of the reasons we returned to the Nugget is that the staff were great, especially the valet and bell staff. We are already planning our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Strike Gold at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPaul
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here previously and the room was OK, but this time we stayed in the Rush Tower and the rooms were excellent. We are going back to Vegas next spring and will stay here again. If you want to see the strip, this hotel is a little out of the way, but still do-able. If you want to see old Vegas, then this is the hotel to stay at, right on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Another great week at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: oldporcupine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Golden Nugget. As always - great service, food and quiet accommodation...and sitting by the pool and fire enjoying the intimate ambience of the hotel. I must say, though, the rug in my room was in desperate need of a good deep cleaning - showing a bit of fading our rooms were, but a good dose of 'tidying up', some paint and a carpet cleaner would do wonders. Love this hotel -- really first class service and food--went to the spa for the first time - got my hair cut by gal named Sally I think - very happy andwill make more use of the Spa when we go in February/12. Such a nice hotel all around. Walk to Drugstore, ABC store, etc. Please may we have a good reading light?

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bea256
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget on the recommendation of my daughter. Rather than pay Strip hotel prices this enabled me to easily catch the local express bus and get back to everything on the Strip. The bus stop is across the Fremont Experience walkway. The room in Carson tower was clean, modern, comfortable and QUIET. Best buffet for lunch is Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan. Check out various locations to get discounted show tickets through Tix4Tonight which opens 10am. Recommend Vegas the show at Planet Hollywood, Rita Rudnor at Ventian, and expensive but well worth the money is Le Reve at the Wynn. Coming from McClarran airport can catch a shuttle to all hotel locations and beware of some unscrupulous taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: m h
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget Ocotober 25-28th 2011 in the Rush Tower, room was great, clean, quiet, very modern. We ate at the Grotto and Vic and Anthonys, very good and the service was excellent, not so much at the Carson Cafe, employees seem rude and a pain to wait on people. Tried something different, took the City Bus to and from the Airport, the cost is $2.00, we were at our Hotel within 20 minutes, left Downtown at 3:24 p.m. and was at the airport before 4:00 p.m. the Airport bus (WAX) does not run as often as the other buses, so you would want to check the schedule,, we go to Vegas frequently and this was the quickest transportation we have had, and cheap too!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rapjoy
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room, comfotable bed, no coffee, fridge, microwave in the room, guess that is why there are 30 people in line for Starbucks near the elevator this morniing. Zero view, looking at a wall, but I think there are some nice view rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice alternative to staying on the strip”
Reviews.Author: wittless55
Reviews.Content: Very nice pool. This hotel is good if you are in town on a business trip and not here to party on the strip. The rooms are better then most on the strip and the pool is great. right outside is the fremont street experience. This is a nice taste of old las vegas. If you are going to a convention, stay here and save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Need to wear good walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: 49andholding
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carson Tower and the room was nice and clean. The lighting in the room left something to be desired. You have a magnified vanity mirror but not adequate lighting to see your face. The down side was how far you have to walk to get to the elevator from your room and to the casino floor. If you are not in good shape you will probably have to sit down and rest before you get to your room. They no longer have the check in area open at the back of hotel so you have to walk quite a ways to get to the main check-in. Had breakfast there only and food was good. Economy is still bad out there according to several locals I met so do not expect to come home with what you took.

Reviews.Title: “A modern full service hotel in downtown las vegas”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: This is the luxury hotel in downtown. expensive for the downtown area but is a one stop type of resort. Huge property with many room types. Lots of entertainment and amny food outlets as well as the "worlds largest Golden Nugget" on display in lobby. Amazing ' strip quality pool', deck and aquarium. My only thought is that its a real budget area to stay and this is the only high end property located downtown. For the same money you can stay on the strip. So its really a matter of which location you desire.

Reviews.Title: “away from the strip but a nicer feel”
Reviews.Author: Graeme C
Reviews.Content: Four nights in this hotel for a memorable first time in Vegas. The quality of the accomodation in our Rush Tower room was excellent.Noise from Fremont Street until midnight, but what do you expect here? Nice pool,bars and restaurants including an awesome buffet. Some good extras such as a free breakfast and cocktail per person.If you want to concentrate on the strip - stay there.This was very different, much more 'old vegas'.Having visited some of the more big name Strip establishments I felt The Golden Nugget to be far less intimidating - all the staff were friendly and helpful while the refurbishment brought the decor up to an extremely high standard.Depending on your budget taxis to the Strip are the best option ,between 18 - 25 dollars or so each way. The Fremont Street experience is a must,casino seemed Ok ,but not really a gambler.

Reviews.Title: “Great time on Freemont”
Reviews.Author: Princess713
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time downtown in October,2011. We pulled up to the valet parking at the Golden Nugget and were told we could check in at the desk in the Rush Tower even thoughnwe were staying in the Carson Tower. I went to the desk and was greeted right away. We were checeked in and on our way with very detailed directions to our room within ten minutes and this was after 3pm which is unheard of on the strip. Our room was a king room. The room was very clean,no funny smells,bed was very comfortable although the pillows were too soft for me. The gaming area is clean , roomy ( not backing into people as we leave a slot machine). We didn't use the pool but wil on next visit. It was not crowded,there wwre plenty of chairs open and the aquarium is fab! We ate at the buffet and Carson St. Cafe while on our trip. I preferred the cafe over the buffet which is too pricey for the selection. There are quite a few different restaurants in the hotel to choose from. The valet's were very friendly and rememered us. They even offered directions and suggestions when we were going out. In fact, we found all the staff members to be freindly and helpful. We didn't have any issues with the noise from Freemont street at night either. We walked Freemont each night to see the different street performers and to visit the different casinos. I would suggest zip lining while you are down there, very inexpensive and an experience you won't forget. The street was not overly crowded at any time, it was clean and was fun to watch the hourly laser show. We will be staying at the Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “Grand place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: terrythepoolman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 days, Room 22lll Awesome view of the city, and a very clean, quiet, and comfortable room. The Asian Noodle House was wonderful, great food, a very entertaining and showstopping performance as they cook the food right in front of you with great flair and showmanship. Really had alot of fun. Weather was great and Freemont was as very interesting with all the Halloween stuff. What a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “a bad experience at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at the Golden Nugget for a non smoking king. We arrived late due to our plane delay. We went to reservations they informed us that all that was available was a smoking king. Due to allergies this was unacceptable and we actually thought we had made reservations for a particular room. We asked to talk to the manager (Wally) he came out looking very unprofessional and told us he could put us in an upgraded room for $40 additional for the one night than could switch us to the non smoking the next day. This was not acceptable so he basically put us out on the street at 1:30 am. They refunded our money but that wasn't the point. We ended up staying for a night at Fitzgeralds then found a room at Balley's. Stay anywhere else because Golden Nugget does not want your business. They would rather lose over $400 than give you the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: BasilFowler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October, as part of a Saga "Western Wonders" tour. The hotel is located Downtown, but the Strip is easily accessed using the local "Deuce" Bus. This costs $5 for 2 hours or $7 for 24 hours. As it can take a good half hour to get to the Strip and you need a good few hours to properly explore the Strip Casinos and Shops, the $7 fare is the best option. Travel tip - do not wait at stops outside very popular venues, walk a little and find a stop with no queue. The Hotel is showing it's age. We stayed on the 3rd floor. The room was dark and quite small, The bathroom was functional but the shower left a lot to be desired. There was quite a bit of machinery noise from a building just below our window. The double glazing did not cut it out and it went on all night, making it difficult to sleep. There are no coffee making facilities in the room, probably because the hotel wants you to spend as little time in the room as possible so that you spend more time in the Casino. There is a swimming pool and water slide, but charges for the pool chairs is high at $10 or $20. The Casino, as expected, was full of "Slots" and "Tables". There was a good selection of Minimum and Maximum bet tables, to suit most pockets. The slots took only $Bills and gave credits. You could also purchase a card loaded with credits. It was sometimes difficult to understand which buttons to push on the "Slots" and what options were available. There is no NO "No Smoking" in the Casino and the amount of smoke was sometimes very unpleasant. The Breakfast buffet was only average and there was always quite a queue at opening time. My recommendation would be to stay on the Strip and visit Downtown rather than stay in Downtown and visit the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel in the pits!”
Reviews.Author: Brooksies1
Reviews.Content: Really expensive hotel with very few amenities located on freemont street which is absolutely awful! Light show very impressive but rest of it total sleeze with drugged up pervs roaming around ogling some real nasty people of both sexes roaming around half naked nowhere to eat with kids and just felt dangerous even makes strip look family friendly anyhow back to hotel very impressive decor and pool area lovely with impressive shark tank slide sunloungers and bed setteas with fire pits etc verybeautiful also separate infinity pool. Overall nice hotel but overpriced, wrong location, not enough amenities, doesn't come close to main hotels on strip

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on the "strip" many times and wanted to try staying Downtown. The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay! Everything you need wrapped up into a small , fun package! For me the "strip" is way to fancy, I dont want Louis Vuitton shoes I just want a cold beer, some entertainment and a place to celebrate with my friends! Freemont St. is the place for that! I highly recommend the Nugget, beautiful place, old school style!

Reviews.Title: “Best 4-star Vegas bargain around!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineD
Reviews.Content: We booked the Nugget at the recommendation if friends. We couldn't have been more pleasantly surprise. We were told to stay in the Rush Tower, but will sell-out status we stayed in the tip floors of the Gold Tower and were really impressed with the modern look and feel, not to mention the complimentary yummy goodies that awaited for you when you got off the elevator ( jelly bellys, peanut m&m's, mixed nuts,chocolate raisins, fresh apples and bottled water). We had the pleasure of having spa services, which were first class and ate in all of the restaurants and had some of the best meals ever. Even my very Frenh mother-in-law was absolutely amazed. The only down side is the area. The area is nt as glamourous as the strip, but it's only a $10 cab ride away as is the North premimum outlet mall, which has a far better selection than hebold outlet mall. Next time, we'll stay there again. You can't go wrong! Oh and one last thing, the shark tank and pool area is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds anywhere!!”
Reviews.Author: asok76
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Golden Nugget last year and enjoyed it so we decided to give it a try this fall. The room was very clean and the bed was the most comfortable that we'd ever slept on! It is an older hotel so things aren't as brand new as some others may be, but it was a good experience all around. Staff was very friendly, pool area is lovely, shark tank is a nice feature, The Grotto restaurant was EXCELLENT. Fremont Street is just a lively place to be at night and it was nice being so close to it. The shuttle ride to the strip wasn't bad at all, especially on the Express Route.

Reviews.Title: “It's just not the strip… but the pool is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: NYtoPA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually stay on the trip - either City Center (Aria) or the Wynn - so that may affect how much weight you put into this review. We decided to stay at the Golden Nugget for a couple of days at the beginning of our Vegas trip because we'd heard how awesome the pool is! We opted for a standard room in the Rush Tower but were upgraded to the Junior Suite upon arrival because the hotel was fully booked. Score! Or so we thought… Our good experiences: -The room is incredible for a hotel of this star rating. A nice, big junior suite, 2 flat screen televisions, a sectional couch at one end and a large comfortable bed at the other. -The bathroom is nice and spacious. Rain shower head was a nice touch. -The pool experience is a blast! The shark/fish tank in the middle of the pool is so much fun. On the bottom level, chairs are first come, first serve and it didn't appear to be hard to get a spot on a Sunday afternoon. The top pool is the adult-only pool and we opted for the day bed for $50. Money well-spent! It was so fun and relaxing up there. Great drink service, good music, and a terrific pool experience. My husband did the slide through the shark tank a couple of times and we went to the downstairs pool for a change of scenery throughout the day. Fabulous pool day! Our bad experiences: -When we got to our Junior Suite on our first night, we felt as though we were downstairs directly on Fremont. It was SO FREAKIN' LOUD. Normally in Vegas this wouldn't be a problem but, technically, we were still on Eastern time and we just wanted some sleep. The description of this room should be, "Experience the sights and sounds of the Fremont Experience from your very own suite," because it couldn't have been any louder than if we were actually on the street. On weekends, Fremont experience ends at 1a and on weekdays, 12a. So by the time we were able to get any sleep on our first night (Saturday) it already felt like 4a. We asked to switch to any room, even a down grade to a standard room in a different tower, but they couldn't accommodate us because the hotel was full. -To me, the crowds and environment just aren't the same as on the strip. Seems like such a shady place. But some may prefer this locale over the strip. -I wished, in the junior suite, the tub was either a jacuzzi or whirlpool. But how picky can you be with a free upgrade? Overall, a fun experience for a couple of days. The pool was worth a change from our normal Vegas habits. But I don't think I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short visit to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Jacinda A
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It looks like it has been 'done up' recently. Rooms were comfortable and must be sound proof as we could not hear any noise from outside. Free parking when you stay at the hotel was also good. The Fremont Street Experience is right outside and is amazing. Also just a short trip away from The Strip via the new 'Strip and Downtown Express' Bus. I would highly recommend staying here. (although the pool is very small and in full view of anyone walking from the rooms to the casino)

Reviews.Title: “It is not on the strip, but have a lot of other nice advantages.”
Reviews.Author: FredGR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Golden Tower for 4 days during our stay in Las Vegas? The good stuff - Fairly big room and a decent bed - The Freemont district is fantastic if you want to be able to move around a bit and get a really diversified impression of vegas. - The Freemint experience is just outside your door with street artist, small supermarket, ziperlines, outdoor bars from different establishment and properly the world biggest flat screen used as roof of the square. - the tank and the hideout. Fabolous pool area for chillimg out or watching sharks and huge fish up close. Basically and aquarium in thr mittle of the pool with a fantastic waterslide going throug it. Simply awesome. Not to mention that several playboy girls are hanging out in the pool during the summer. - Fitness and Spa is 20 usd extra but is clean and very nice with a steamer, boiler, finish sauna, cardio and muscle training facilities. - no resort fee - free self parking just accross the street. - a very good restaurant in the casino called the grotto for badic italian food and wines :) check out the review on trip advisor. The bad stuff - bathrooms are a bit old and not the standard as coukd be expected, a bit of rust, paint falling off and very small - wifi is 13 dollary extra per unit per 24 hours, which we found simply unacceptable for a hotel in this standard - windows cannot open (are bolted) so if you want fresh air you better learn how the aircondition unit are working (which is a bit old). Owerall we had a great stay, but would only recommend it if you get a deal that is around 80-90 usd per night. Remember they have several options for rooms and we stayed in the golden tower 2 queen beds Best of luck in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Two Timer”
Reviews.Author: AdventureAwaits58
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas only twice in a twelve year period and stayed both times at the Golden Nugget.
