I love the whole layout of the hotel ,and find it a relaxing place...The casino is very large with enough slots for many to enjoy...I did enjoy the cafe restaurant and our service was excellent...I know the check in line can be long sometimes, but I guess we hit it just right because we didn't wait long at all to check in...We stayed in the older section the Carson Tower, and that is where I stayed before...The room was well kept and clean ,and bed and towels were done up everyday...The pool area is spectacular, with the slide going down in between the shark tank, my only regret was that I had a cold, and could not go swimming...They also have a lovely spa which I did go up to visit just to see, next time I would like to go for a massage and facial....We got some yummy chocolate at this little shop inside the hotel ,and also the stores were reasonable to purchase things....Love the addition of the star bucks as that was not there the last time I visited ,and went there several times...they have 2 inside the hotel...The friendly and efficient staff makes for a great visit.......

Reviews.Title: “After staying on the strip, this was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nsvetor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Golden Nugget after staying 3 nights on the strip. The Fremont Street Experience was NOT for me. The crowd was rough. The Golden Nugget room was old, out of date and felt dirty. The bed was very comfortable. The restaurants in the Golden Nugget were very overpriced. Hotel pool on 2nd or 3rd floor for 16 and older was very quiet...except for all the drunk adults doing cannon balls and belly flops!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Madjude
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on the 9th floor of the Rush tower. We got an upgrade and were very happy with our room. It was very large with 2 tv's, a lounge room and dining table. We had a view of the pool area. Bed was very comfy. The shark tank is a great attraction. Plenty of deck chairs on the pool level. They charge $10 for the k coffee cups in the room and no free internet but overall enjoyed the experience. From what I have seen the golden nugget is the only place to stay on Fremont street.

Reviews.Title: “FREMONT STREET DIGS.....FUN”
Reviews.Author: greenchilikid
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly and we were in the older Carson Tower. The room was nice and met our expectations.....and it was conveniently near the elevator and quiet. The far end of the hallway seemed a stretch, even for Quarterback TOM BRADY. Possibly another elevator served there. The GORDIE BROWN show in the Nugget theatre was outstanding and thoroughly enjoyed by our party of five. The evening "Light Show" under the Fremont Street roof was spectacular....a people watcher's paradise for the old and young. The crap table crew was extremely helpful and friendly. Played roulette......won modestly, slightly less than we lost with the dice. The slots took their usual, expected toll, but provided hours of enjoyable play. The casino was not as clean as it might be........ashtrays, bottles and drink glasses. The cafe food was barely adequate as the Philly sandwich was lacking enough steak and cheese for the tasty roll. The buffet food was good but the entrance cashier/hostess area was inadequate and very slow. The room was too small for the numbers and high fructose corn syrup has made the average patron too large for back-to-back seating. This casino, like most, has expanded in stages as business growth dictated. So there was uneven ramps and step areas to accommodate the transitions. While not a corn maze, it takes some effort to find one's way. My wife, late evening, found orientling off a Starbucks was confounding........there is more than one Starbucks! At least that was her explanation. Yes, the pool area was used and enjoyed for a bit of Vitamin D. Overall, we look forward to our next stay........this was our first off Strip experience after many trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Had to stay a second night!!!”
Reviews.Author: cruisefanz4ever
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for one night, on a Sunday. Got a great rate with a promo they were doing. We were supposed to stay at a different hotel the next day, but changed our mind because we didn't want to leave!. Or room was in the Rush Tower, very smooth check-in process. The room was REMARKABLE!! Awesome bathroom. We requested a quiet room and were placed on the 16th floor, opposite from the Freemont Street Experience, which is fun, but goes pretty late at night, and we are in our 40's, like to party, but also NEED our sleep. We didn't hear a peep!!! Very nice, bed was awesome, great pillows. Also the buffet breakfast is good, and was included in our promotional rate. Eat at The Grotto!!! Great pizza and a nice bartender, Jeff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service Worse Public Relations”
Reviews.Author: Ian B
Reviews.Content: Recently friends from Indiana stayed at the Golden Nugget Hotel/Casino on vacation. We all [8 of us] went to the buffet as part of an entertainment package deal. The meals were already paid for as part of the ticket deal but we were told that we would not be allowed to enter the restuarant until an 18% tip was paid which is part of their union contract. They refused to seat us and even asked us to step out of line at one point which we did not do. After a heated discussion we paid the tip and then were seated. None of us minded paying a tip for good service but to have to pay before even being seated and receiving any service at a buffet is wrong. The waiter brought a total of 10 drinks to the table. I wrote a complaint and took it to the hotel where it apparently was discarded, garbage I think. I have written three times more to the Associate director of Food services and have been given the standard "we care" answer the first time then no response at all. All we want is to have it told up front when purchasing combo entertainment/ meal packages of 8 or more at a time that you will have to pay 18% extra up front before being allowed to eat. What I got was that it was the unions fault. All of us are well traveled and are good tippers when we receive good service but feel this situation is just plain wrong. I will keep trying to go up the ladder to see how far I have to go before anyone really cares.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont Street Favourite”
Reviews.Author: jbg01_52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times and have always had great rooms and wonderful service. If you have a problem, the Concierge or Customer Service is very accommodating. There is something for everyone. The new "pool" area is beautifully decorated in red and yellow and makes the area very rich looking. The Carson Street Cafe is a great casual place to eat. This trip we saw "Gordie Brown" comedy for a very reasonable price right in the Golden Nugget and the show was great. The hotel being right on Fremont Street makes for great shopping and great entertainment without having to travel by taxi to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't stay beside the elevators !”
Reviews.Author: rocketman000
Reviews.Content: I love the Nugget. Its a very beautiful hotel/casino. The first nite, we were on the 17th floor in the Gold Tower, but didn't sleep a wink. Elevator motors all nite long ! They moved us , and the remaining 3 nites were great. Nice, big, soft, clean, comfortable king bed. Its great value for the money paid- espcially if you get it on a deal or a comp.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a change from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: tillyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for two nights over the Columbus Day weekend. Our rooms were in the new Rush Tower, which has its own check-in counter. If you are staying in the Rush Tower, be sure to tell your cab driver. We didn't, so we were brought to the regular check-in counter which was much more frantic. Check-in went smoothly, and took about 15 minutes, however, we may have received a better room had we gone to the Rush Tower check in. Our room was on the 5th floor (5206), and had a HUGE 5-foot tall air-conditioning unit right outside the window! We couldn't see anything else! And the thing made a constant humming noise! I would have given the GN five stars, except for this room. Anyway, I offered to go down to the lobby and try to switch, but my wife was okay with it. So we just relaxed and went with the flow. Other than that, the room is new and very nice, decorated in dark colors with dark woods, large flat-screen TV, robes in the large closet, separate toilet room in the bathroom. Tub-shower combo. with a very nice rain-head shower. Great comfortable king-sized bed. We paid about $100 per night average, since it was a holiday weekend. A woman that we had met in the casino was staying in the Carson Tower for $39 a night; not nearly as nice, but she said that it was okay. The Rush Tower has a bank of 6 (I think) elevators, and there was never any waiting. The pool was great, and generally can be described as a "lagoon" centered around the shark tank. It was fun to watch people water-sliding through the shark tank, and scuba divers cleaning the tank every morning. The tank actually is deeper than the pool, and has schools of tuna and some other kinds of large fish, in addition to the sharks. There is a bar in one corner of the pool area, and three black-jack tables at the other end. We were told that we would have to pay $20 for the padded chaise-lounges, but there was no charge while we were there, possibly because it was Sunday and Monday nights? Seating is on a first-come first-served basis. We were generally there by 10:00 am and had no problem getting loungers. The pool is within the center of a cluster of towers, however, so one half is in the shade in the morning while the other half is in the sun, and this switches in the early afternoon. Drink service at the pool was good to spotty, depending on how busy it was. Drink prices were reasonable (unlike the Mandalay Bay!). There is also a lunch and snack menu. The hot tub is in a corner of the area that seems to always be in the shade, but is very large, and shaped like a four-leafed clover with separate hot tub areas. There are also gas fire pits and padded deep-seating areas near the hot tubs. There is a three-story hike up to the water-slide through the shark tank, but it is worth the trip. Many people made the water-slide trip sitting up, which slows you down a bit so you can actually see the sharks as you go through. Otherwise, the trip is too quick to see anything. The adult pool is also on the third floor, but we didn't spend any time there. It appeared to be a lot more kicked-back. All of the cabanas appear to be situated on the second and third floors around the pool area, and are not situated convenient to the pools themselves. Restaurants. We ate in the Carson Cafe late one night, and the food was decent and so were the prices. We also enjoyed one meal in Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse, which was excellent! I asked that we be moved from our original seats at a table behind a pillar, and they were very gracious in moving us. The serving staff was exemplary, and really went out of their way to accommodate. Very good and enjoyable meal, but also very expensive!! We had one dinner at the Red Sushi, which was okay. The small restaurant is open to the casino, but still seemed to offer some level of privacy somehow. There are two Starbucks located at opposite ends of the hotel. The Chart House is centered around a large cylindrical fish tank just behind the Rush Tower check-in desk; we heard good things about it but did not have a chance to eat there. There is also an Italian restaurant near the center of the hotel that offers some seating looking into the pool area, but we did not eat there either. The casino is clean and well-maintained. Some areas feel dated a bit, but when you explore the other casinos on Fremont Street, you realize that this is the nicest one of the bunch. There is a specialty bar with a glass wall facing the pool, which offers a variety of martinis and high-end liquors, but expensive. Also, if you order a drink from this bar, you cannot wander around the casino with it, unless they pour your drink into a plastic cup!?! This isn't true of any of the other bars in the casino, only this one. The casino/hotel is right on Fremont Street, and convenient for exploring the other casinos and sights on the street. The bus stop for the strip express is just around the corner from the hotel, and the buses appear frequently. There is also a WAX express bus that apparently goes to the airport, but it was 45 minutes late one day so I wouldn't count on that one. Fremont Street also has kiosks with artists, fortune-tellers, souveniers, booze, etc. At the far end of Fremont Street is a place that sells Heart-Attack hamburgers, with waitresses dressed up in skimpy nurses outfits. But the place seemed very slow. There is also a zip-line that travels about halfway (800 feet?) down Fremont Street, and costs $20 at night. Signs on Fremont Street proclaim steak and lobster for $11.99 and $3 blackjack. Didn't try the steak and lobster, and there was only ONE $3 blackjack table which always had a huge crowd of people waiting for an opening. Otherwise, you can find $5 single-deck blackjack tables if you look around. The Street really livens up about 10 to midnight. We had stayed the three previous days at the Mandalay Bay before moving to the Golden Nugget, and there is a world of difference between the two. Cab fare was $30 (including tip). For the trip to the airport from the GN, we arranged for a shuttle (Bell Transport?) using the telephone at the front desk). The shuttle cost $8.50 apiece, and arrived promptly on time. The shuttle made two other stops on the way to the airport. Anyway, bottom line is, we really enjoyed our stay at the GN, but if you go, just don't get room 5206!!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the buffet”
Reviews.Author: JoelsKitty
Reviews.Content: I found the food on the dinner buffet to be bland and unappealing. Thank goodness my husband and I had a buy one get one free coupon. The server was unfriendly. Overall, not a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip But Large Rooms, Plenty to See, and Available for Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Have only stayed here once using the Name Your Own Price Option. It is further from the strip that I had hoped but the room and service was excellent. The interior decor all seemed to have been refreshed. It is part of the Fremont Street activities and that is worth an hour or two. The price was very cheap. There were many interesting elements of the interior decor and some seemed to be popular with children. Of course, with the casinos nearby there was plenty of adult entertainment. No complaints with this stay at all if you can tolerate being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn S
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this Hotel and again we loved it. It is on Freemont Street where everything is happening. Our room was great, and we love all the Restaurants at the Golden Nugget, especially The Chart House - great food, and excellent service with one giant fish tank.. My favorite fun thing is the Lazer show outside on Freemont St. The stores, Casinos, restaurants, bands, and all the crazy happenings are right there. You do not have to take a car or taxi unless you are going to the Strip. We will probably go back in the near future. JoAnn & Marty/Bradenton, FL

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget and Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: daytraveler
Reviews.Content: Vegas Traveler’s, Just returned from Our first trip to Las Vegas. The wife and I loved the town and our short 3 nights and 4 days in Vegas. We stayed in the Golden Nuggent, downtown on Fremont Street. What a great choice it was. The hotel in beautiful, the pool is so cool, and the Fremont street experience is great. To get to the strip just pay your $7.00 and ride the double decker Deuce all day. It’s the perfect way to get around without needing a car. We hope to return soon and will most likely stay at the Golden Nugget. Great for old and young. Daytraveler

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Debra P
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget. We stayed in the Rush Tower and the room was great! We had a nice view of Freemont Street experience. Loved the pool area with the water slide through the fish tank. The buffet was excellent and good value too!

Reviews.Title: “Like the rush tower”
Reviews.Author: Mafreer
Reviews.Content: Just finished three night stay. Rush tower is great and non smOking. Need more help on rush check in desk. Charging for $2.50 for in room coffee is not a good deal as well as $5 to print a boarding pass. Have stayed here for 20 years and it gets better every year. Great place

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but not sure t was worth it”
Reviews.Author: Computergeek60
Reviews.Content: We paid $59 or a room at the end of August. My son thought the pool was better than the hotels we had been to, but the room had not been redecorated since the 70's, and though it was marked as non smoking, there was a distinct smokey old smell. The bed linens were clean. The room was located in one of the older towers.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 89AV8R
Reviews.Content: I visited Las Vegas this week for a conference and brought my wife along for some fun time in Vegas before the event. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel very much. They have updated a lot since the last time I stayed here in the downtown area. I definitely think the Golden Nugget is the best hotel if you plan to stay downtown versus the strip. The hotel is beautiful and nicely appointed. They spent a lot in upgrades. We stayed in the Gold tower and our friends stayed in the Carson tower. The Gold tower was only slightly nicer, with coffee maker in the room and a desk; otherwise pretty much the same. PLus, you have to pay for the Keurig cups for the coffeemaker - $10 for four of them. We ate in three of the restaurants during our visit, Lilly's Asian Cuisine, the Chart House, and Carson Street Cafe. All excellent restaurants. Brian, the manager at the Chart House, was especially good and took good care of us. Staying downtown versus the strip is nice because there is a lot to do and see without straying far from your hotel. There is a convenience store and gift shop right there on Freemont Street where we bought several bottles of water and some liquor and wine for the room and it was all very reasonably priced. Another good thing was there was no charge for the valet other than tips. This seemed to be a teme in Vegas, but we only went to two hotels and neither charged. I have stayed in other cities and paid upwards of $20-$25 per night to keep a car in the garage. What else can I say... the rooms were nice and comfortable. The bed especially; both my wife and I agreed that we slept very well at this hotel and the bedding was very nice. She complained about the lighting in the bathroom and at the makeup mirror outside. Funny, I didn't notice a problem :-) Overall, two thumbs up and we would both stay here again if we came back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable downtown luxury”
Reviews.Author: alank1101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the gold tower rooms. Comfortable bed and improved bath amenities. The rooms were quiet, slept very well. Convenient location next to the Fremont street experience and other downtown hotels. Coffee in room if purchased, $10.00 for four Kreb cups. Bottled water for purchase. Wake up calls very efficient. Parking so convenient. Close to premium Outlet Mall.The place to stay in downtown Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great,loved the pool w/slide thru the shark tank”
Reviews.Author: LUVEGAS2011
Reviews.Content: We realy enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget,but have one complaint, we reserved 2 chase lounges by the Hideout lounge/pool area,first day was great,on the second day,we did not get to the pool till late & they told us a private party was going on & we couldn't use our reserved chairs,they should have notified us(we are waiting for our credit of $40.00),so we went down to the main pool & no chairs to be found,we had to sit on the edge of the pool,other than that,loved the main pool area at night,with firepits & candles,nice place to unwind.the slide mage you feel like a kind again! Very clean rooms & personable staff would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool_boy66
Reviews.Content: We stopped in the Gold Tower - on the 17th floor - you get your own check in and have to put in a special card in the lift to access the floor. The decor was dark wood and really tasteful. I found the staff friendly and helpful. Check-in was speedy and efficient. As with any huge hotel it was a little impersonal but we had no complaints. The bed was really comfortable and we slept well - we coudn't hear any noise from the pool although we overlooked it - probably as we were a long way above it. I would recommend the Gold Club rooms that we stopped in very happily. We also ate in Lilly's Chinese/Asian restaurant and this was very nice too. If you want a few days away from the strip as a change from the usual - this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower power”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: Free upgrade to Rush Tower awesome. Minisuite kind of room with great views down to the Strip. Little leather sofa area, flatscreen with sound system, very nice bath setup. GNugget is best downtown, yet prices beat most of the Strip. The nearby downtown Premier Outlets are worth checking out for some good prices on clothing/shoes. Carson Cafe was nice and decent value. Never had good fortune in the poker room, cards seem to be better for me at Binions. Still the nicest poker room downtown by far, very beautiful setup to make you feel Deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on Freemont street”
Reviews.Author: simba070
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel with everything you want, nice pool, good restaurants and casino. We was staying in the Carson tower. Check in was very fast and the second day they let us change our room to a room with a Strip-view. The hotel is on Freemont street that was a nice surprise, lots of music and entertainment on the street and much smaller than the Strip, so you could walk around and not getting so tired as walking the Strip up and down. We had both breakfast and dinner at the buffetrestaurant and it was well worth the money and also very good. The only complaint we had was that the music at the pool was very loud, but we will certainly stay here again if we going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: ddp01
Reviews.Content: We (a group of at least 6) have vistited Las Vegas numerous times. We've stayed on the Strip but prefer staying on Fremont Street. This was our second time staying at the Golden Nugget and I must say, we LOVE the Golden Nugget. Our experience has only been made better with the recent addition of the Rush Tower and The Hideout. Check in was a breeze, our room was amazing (a Rush Tower Suite) and the pools at the Nugget are fantastic. We enjoy sitting around the pools during the day and living it up on Fremont Street at night. My only minor complaint is although we were positioned above the Fremont Street Experience, we did get some noise from the band that was playing below. It was certainly not anything that would ruin the trip.

Reviews.Title: “SLOW CHECK-IN, Great pool”
Reviews.Author: Saslady
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas from Chicago 4x a year 6 nites aver. for 20 years. Stayed in most strip/off strip/several downtown hotels. Golden Nugget only 4 star rated downtown. Rooms average and not 4 star compared to the strip. Do provide robes/safe in rm. Check-in super slow compared to other hotels. Great pool area w/GIANT aquarium that includes sharks. Tube slide is transparent and goes right thru the aquarium. Very cool. Very crowded hotel/casino. Expensive food....walk a block to fast food for coffee and free refills.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget's Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: ClarkGriswald
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Rush Tower in Las Vegas. The location is convenient to Fremont Street and the downtown action and a pleasant variation from staying on the Strip. The Rush Tower has its own dedicated check in staff but unfortunately we didn't learn this until after we waited in a rather lengthy check-in line in the Main Lobby. The room itself was large and well furnished with a very comfortable King size bed. The room's decor was a bit dark for my personal taste with lots of brown,beige and dark wood accents. Housekeeping was impeccable and the room was always spotless. The Golden Nugget is a rather massive facility which offers a great deal but can be a bit intimidating to navigate. Fortunately, there are plenty of signs to assist in directing you to the appropriate Tower, restaurant or amenity. During our stay, we tried several of the restaurants on the premises-The Grotto for some very good Italian food; the Carson Street Cafe for some late night dining after attending shows, and the Buffet, offering a vast array of breakfast foods. All offered good food and service at a reasonable price. While I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Rush Towers, I found it somewhat disconcerting that Internet access was only available at a cost of $12.95 a day. Similarly, the in room coffee maker required the use of Pods supplied by the hotel at a cost of $10 for 4 pods. All in all, the Rush Tower experience was very nice. As to value, mileage will vary depending upon the rate you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: TrishaMarie
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Las Vegas we stayed four nights on the "Strip" and also wanted to stay in the "downtown" (original) area of Vegas. The Golden Nugget was a great choice. There are other hotels/casinos in that area that are cheaper, but I would not actually sleep in them. We had a great time on Fremont Street, but do stay in the area that is contained under the "Fremont Street Experience" light show cover. The area outside of that looks shady. The Golden Nugget is very nice; clean, comfy, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Classic”
Reviews.Author: joliver1000
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the pride of downtown. This was my 1st stay at this property, though I have visited it many times before. My companion couldn't sleep due to constant noise from outside - we never could identify where it was coming from, but it sounded like construction. The room REALLY needed new carpeting, but other than that it was well appointed and the beds are wonderful. Once you stay at this hotel, they often offer you room upgrades free on subsequent visits. Their food is very good, but a bit pricy: for example, breakfast entrees are $10-$17 without beverage. So with beverage, tax & tip, you can easily spend $20-$25 for breakfast. The ambience is exceptional. Their pool is iconic - there is a water slide that shoots you through a large tank of sharks. The hotel rates are very good for parties of 1 or 2. They hit you heavily for a 3rd & 4th person. I will definitely return to this property on my very next stay. I much prefer downtown with easy access to my car and reasonable walking distances to other hotels, unlike the strip properties where if you forget something in your car, it may be a half-mile walk to your car and back to your room. With an upgraded room on my next trip, I absolutely expect to upgrade my rating here from "Very Good" to "Excellent."

Reviews.Title: “Really surprised how nice!”
Reviews.Author: magicmominmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rush Tower for one night on 9/30/11. Always have stayed on strip; first time downtown and what a lovely surprise!! The room was fabulous. Very nicely appointed, with an "L"-shapped sofa next to the windows. Loved the flat screen TV and the fact that there were double sinks in the bathroom. The view wasn't over great (overlooked canopy on Freemont Street), but who cares about the view when the room was so nice. The entire hotel was MUCH bigger than I ever thought it was from previous walks down Freemont street. Although we didn't use the pool, it looked great and wasn't all that crowded (although the bar area around the pool was!) Would DEFINITELY stay here again....maybe for a longer stay next time!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: scotsmember
Reviews.Content: stayed in a junior suite which was fantastic - it was a surprise upgrade from my new husband. hotel was well located for downtown and rooms were fantastic! would defo stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: barbie95
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend & I recently celebrated her 30th birthday in Las Vegas, watched an amazing Garth Brooks performance and were thrilled to rest & relax in the amazing heat! My top choice of Hotel completely disappointed us but overall we had an amaing trip. I have travelled alot, all over Canada, U.S. and even some third world countries and encountered the worse customer service and hospitality at the Golden Nugget. Upon arriving at the hotel after a long but uncomplicated day, the hotel had no record of our reservation! It is 10 pm at night and we are at the desk with no where to sit down, except on a casino stool...after some time of checking spellings, dates, confirmation number and re-checking, we ask to speak to the manager and the clerk said ok but failed to make that call. This clerk is alone at the desk, no one came to help him figure things out, no one offered us a drink, the clerk refused to take our luggage or have someone get them. We had been travelling all day, the last meal we had was on our connecting flight 6 hrs previously and we were starving. We used our cell phone to call the airline we booked through (US Airways-very good and affordable) and was told that they recived confirmation from the Golden Nugget 3 weeks prior confirming the reservation and she would take care of it and call me back, politely letting me off my very expensive roaming charges. The clerk refused to give information (fax number ect) to the airline, in fact told me that I could pay for the reservation or atleast a night and we could sort it out tomorrow! What, pay again..OMG I was furious with this guy, it is now 11 pm and we were still ion the lobby! I used my cell phone once again, called the airline who was on hold with the hotel getting no where, Lisa (the wonderful US air agent) faxed all the information to the hotel after I finally got the fax number. Finally the clerk, found "a" reservation with our name but the dates were mixed up. We were getting no where...and after 3 times asking, still no manager or even another employee to help out! My mother-in-law called from Alberta in the middle of the night for her and talked to someone to try to help us out.....but still no manager or anything. We finally got bored of waiting, put a few dollars in the slots...drank some more (because we couldn't leave the lobby beause all our luggage was still with us)...and waited. I gave the clerk the benefit of the doubt...he did get busy.Finally at midnight, another clerk entered the picture, so I went over and reminded the first guy, we were still waiting and he went off shift...he bairly even acknowledged us! Amazingly, the new guy found our reservation.....was a bit confused because we were in an "upgraded" room. I let him know, we had been waiting more than 2 hrs already, and maybe this was a way of showing some hospitality towards us, he gave us our keys and it would seem we were set....when I went to sign the room charges card, I noticed it was only for 3 days...we had booked for a week. Finally closer to 1 am we finally got into a room....it was exhausting! The "upgraded" room was average, beautiful large bathrrom and tub, large flat screen and modern furniture but nothing special..in fact coffee was $10 for 4 cups, water was $7 per 1 L bottle, although our room attendant failed to put a slip on them so we assumed they were free. I even left a note stating unless they are free...we don't want them. The coffee is clearly marked...although do hotels really charge for coffee now? I have never encountered this elsewhere and the coffee was terrible. The room was never really cleaned. I do expect to come back into my room expecting it to look how it did the first time I entered it, but it was always only tidy...and so dusty!(pictures will be posted). In the end, we spoke to "a" mananger the night before we left (and we stayed a whole week), our room charges ($80) were comped and our check-out was extended until 2:00, and reminded us we did have "an upgraded room" and apologized. I felt ripped off completly and felt like they didn't even care. I really fought to stay in this hotel because I thought it would be amazing but was very disappointed and would not reccommend it....but the pool was amazing, food only average, the buffett for breakfast had barely any fruit in sight...the rest was nice but no where near what I expected. I would not saty at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont St.'s best deal.”
Reviews.Author: NewlywedNormy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget Rush Tower for two nights. Rooms were clean and a good value for the money. Bed was extremely comfortable! Casino and common areas are absolutely beautiful, with rich colors and wonderful chandeliers. The pool area was nice as well. HIGHLY recommend eating at The Grotto... be sure to get a seat with a view of the aquarium. Carson St Cafe was good too. Overall a wonderful experience with the exception of the loud music from the live bands on Fremont St going well into the night. But as it was Bike Fest weekend, I suppose that was to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, as always, it just gets better”
Reviews.Author: lynn r
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights mid September 2011, and had room in Rush Tower. 4th time at GN and have always had a great stay whether Carson Tower or Gold Tower, but the WOW factor of the Rush Tower Room! Totally fabulous, plenty of hanging space in closet, amazing bed, very nice corner sofa, huge TV. House keeping did a very good job. Breakfast each morning at Carson Street Diner, always a great start to the day and very reasonable. Ate at several of the resturants at the GN, melt in the mouth steaks at Vic & Antoneys, tasty pizza and pasta at Grotto and also wonderful "happy hour" cocktails & snacks at Chart House. We celebrated our Anniversary whilst away, and was greated by balloons and chocolate covered strawberrys arranged by our host. Thank you Shannon. Had plenty of slot play and VP with a few good wins. We found all the dealers to be friendly and helpful, and had many enjoyable hours playing Craps and Roulette. Had a few good wins on the Roulette also. Must also mention the Pool, can be busy and had meant to pay for the Hideout pool chairs, but was always able to find chairs around the tank Pool. To sum up, great location (bearing in mind this is not on the strip but $25 taxi/$3 bus ride away) as DT has it's own unique style and lots of fun, wonderful Casino/Hotel with a good range of eating options. Counting down to next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Nuggett”
Reviews.Author: mpo8000
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend away from the strip for our first stay downtown. I believe we made the best choice of the downtown hotels. Easy access to the parking garage from Bridger Avenue coming from L V Boulevard. Carson tower room 1061. Decent size, clean, all the amenities we needed for a weekend. Only small issue was having to ask twice for a fridge which took 5 hrs to arrive. Pool was very busy but thankfully not too many kids, plenty of cocktail service here as well. The tank upstairs is a great idea to remove yourself from the crowds. Nice selection of bars and restaurants.Casino was busy with a good selection of tables and slots. Went for cocktails at Claudes bar where the bartender didn't know how to make a whiskey sour??,. or maybe couldn't be bothered. I asked him to surprise me with something vodka based. He did surprise me with a vodka 7up! Anyway that aside it was worth the cost and we would definitely return. mpo

Reviews.Title: “Anger, rage, frustration...”
Reviews.Author: Rahpahteetah
Reviews.Content: Anger, rage, frustration. These are just some of the emotions you can expect to feel when staying at The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. My wife and I were on the last leg of our journey, having just done a coastal driving trip of the western United States. On our way home to Salt Lake City, we thought we'd treat ourselves and stay somewhere in Vegas that had more quality than just your normal hotel. It's a shame, therefore, that we chose the Golden Nugget. We started off with a huge line at the check-in. Oh, well, that happens. Once we got checked in, we made our way to the elevator, not an easy feat considering that the Golden Nugget has one of the worst casino mazes I've ever been through. We were directed to go to the Starbucks and that the elevator was nearby. The front desk girl neglected to tell us which of the TWO in-house Starbucks she meant. Sigh, oh well. When we finally found the elevator, we were stopped by a man who demanded to see our room cards. Since he pretended to be a hotel worker, we did. But it turned out to be someone trying to sell us crap. I was very annoyed that he posed as a hotel employee by asking us to show him our room cards but, again, that's Vegas. When we reached our room, it was facing the elevator lobby with six elevators AND between the elevators and the ice machine. Not a recipe for a good night's sleep. I called the front desk to arrange another room but there was no answer, even after trying multiple times over fifteen minutes. I went back down to the lobby, waiting through a line that had now become even longer, and requested another room. The girl at the desk was unwilling to change my room. Not unable, unwilling. She told me that my reservation included only certain types of rooms. I guess I reserved in the "crappy" block of rooms or something. I was turned away without so much as an apology or any effort to try and rectify the situation. Not wanting to ruin the entire trip because of this nonsense, my wife and I decided to go for a swim in the famed shark tank swimming area. But when we went to check it out, it was closed. It closed at 6pm. WTF? 6? Really? It's June in Las Vegas, why are they closing the pool at 6? Ok, so I guess we could go get something to eat. Not a good option unless you're interested in spending $70 on ONE roll of Sushi. Seriously. I know Vegas is marked up, but that was pretty ridiculous. No decent dining options in the hotel so we found something on Fremont Street. Still expensive (as expected) but not ridiculous. So it was back to the room to try and salvage something out of the day. The room was small and dusty without any trace of the four star promise. I decided to get some business done while we were there but found that the wi-fi was $12.99 for 24 hours. Ridiculous. You can walk into McDonald's and experience free wi-fi but you can't pay for a four star hotel and expect the same. There was a tube of Lay's chips on the table which I assumed was for the guests. I, of course, wasn't going to open them so I wouldn't be charged. But wait, these ones are already open. Wait, these chips are already half eaten. Wait a minute! There is a stack of papers here with someone else's flight info and personal documents! And their trash is still in all the trash cans!! MY ROOM WASN'T EVEN CLEANED!!! Another call to the front desk was met with an answering machine. I left a message which was never returned. As expected, the constant dinging from the elevators and ka-chunks from the ice machine made for an unpleasant night. People also tend to congregate at those elevator lobbies and chat loudly before heading to their rooms. Add an extra noisy air conditioner into the mix and you now have the full picture of sleeping at the Golden Nugget. In the morning, we tried to check out using the TV checkout system but were met with a "we cannot process your request at this time". I called the front desk again but was naturally met with another answering machine message. Oh, and the hotel parking was PAID parking. In Vegas. PAID parking in Vegas. There wasn't even a hotel guest voucher or anything. You pay to stay in the hotel, then you PAY to park there. I've stayed in Vegas dozens of times and never encountered this phenomenon. All in all, I can't recommend this hotel to anyone. If you want to see the shark tank, just head over from the decent hotel that you decided to stay in, which is certainly NOT The Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a nice visit...BUT”
Reviews.Author: areynax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much larger and nicer than I ever thought about. The rooms are nice and roomy, the beds were nice and comfortable, and we had a nice big screen tv. We were here for Vegas BikeFest, and decided on this hotel because it was the host hotel. Everything was going good until our second morning, when we get a VERY RUDE call from the front desk,accusing us of being to loud and rowdy. I do remember hearing loud and rowdy behavior sometime during the night, but definitely was NOT from our room. We were very tired when we came in, and were asleep within minutes of coming in. I tried to ask the clerk when exactly it was that we were supposedly too loud, and that he was mistaken in accusing us. He yelled into the phone that he didn't have time to argue with me, and to just keep it down! He then slammed the phone down before I could reply. His behavior ruined a nice trip, and my view of the hotel.I believe we will be trying The Plaza next year. They are remodeling the hotel and is looking very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: tntxfour
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Friendly staff. Room was spacious and no issues except our room keys would not work. Went back to Customer Service Desk and we were reissued room keys. Only, one of the new two keys worked. No other issues. Would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Rush Tower if possible”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie A
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Golden Nugget. Everyone super friendly, quick check in, room large. Keuring coffee pot in room. ( We took our own pods and saved the $10.00 for four pod pack, but not a bad price for four fresh brewed cup of coffee and you don't have to wait for room service) Beds extremely comfortable. Flat screen TV. IPOD station. The Rush Tower is perfectly located to access the casino, chart house reataurant or the Tank pool. Walk right out to the Freemont Experience. Plenty of lounge chairs at the pool and never had a problem obtaining one of the the limited number of water loungers. Didn't do the tube, but the people that slid through the shark tank sure seemed to enjoy it. Ate at the Chart House and enjoyed it more that Hugos. Service was great and food fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lin925
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget on September 17, 2011. Our flight got in early and when we arrived, we were able to check in to our rooms immediately. The hotel is beautiful and everyone was friendly. We only stayed there one night as we booked our airline reservations the day before we were due to check into our other hotel by mistake. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept in. Wish we could take it home. We only had the standard room, but it was till very nice. The pool was amazing and the hotel was immaculate. We would definitely stay there again. The only thing that would keep me from rating it excellent was that when we came back that night from the Fremont Experience, we were told by the host at one of the restaurants in the hotel that it was the only one open. We were looking for something more casual than an expensive full course meal, so we had to go back out to Fremont to try to find something to eat. We found out the next day that there were several other restaurants open in the hotel that were serving exactly what we were looking for and I was disappointed that we were misinformed. Other than that, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious room at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: dvmkathymurf
Reviews.Content: Spent my first night at the Golden Nugget in a Gold Club room and it was fabulous. I knew I was in for a treat when I got off the elevator to find water, fruit, jelly beans and chocolate covered raisins waiting! The room was great and the mattress was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The floor was quiet and non-smoking and the room amenities included a Keurig coffee maker. Would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Discrimates Against Paying Customers on Motorcycles”
Reviews.Author: Bazk12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget numerous times and it has always been our first choice when visiting Vegas. This year when we visited for Las Vegas Bikefest we were told by both the Security Assistant Manager and the on-duty Manager that the motorcycles guest are not allowed to park just anywhere in the self-parking but must park in designated parking on the 6th floor of the parking gararge in the sun. They both stated we (bikes) were taking parking away from paying customers. What are we if not paying customers? Are they comping me my room and forgot to tell me? Don't I have a parking permit? It doesn't say I have to park in designated parking spots. Are cars told you have to park in designated spots. Also the on-duty manager stated they were trying to maximize parking spaces, what cars can't park on the top floor of the parking garage? We were told if we wanted to pay $25 per bike in the valet we could have covered parking. The on-duty manager stated the hotel was booked and they wanted to maximize parking, aren't many of their visitors coming by plane and don't have vehicles??? What is the difference of one person in a car and one person on a bike? One parking space right?? Many bikes have two up or are bikes traveling together who usually only take up one spot as they park tandem in the spot. When we spoke with the Managers neither one was friendly and the security manager boarded on rude. Why do they feel parking is a problem they have to manage? Why can't everyone just park where there is open parking?? By stopping bikes entering the parking garage they are about to cause an accident. Making bikes travel up the 6 floors past all the cars who are backing up to get in a parking space of a car leaving they passed by (which we almost hit as he backed up) is just an accident waiting to happen. I thought this was a friendly high class establishment that enjoyed the bikefest participants, apparently not. We are a nusiance to them because we take parking spaces. Seems to me bikers bring a lot of revenue to the Nugget and it's a shame to be discriminated against when you ride a motorcycle. We will be looking for a friendlier hotel in the future! Even if they won't admit it, they are definately discriminating. Former Golden Nugget customer

Reviews.Title: “The Best Time Ever - Love The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Moonray_red
Reviews.Content: We recently had visited The Golden Nugget and stayed for 6 nights (Sept 17 - 23). We would certainly go back again. The hotel is beautiful and clean and of course every member of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. When I made our reservations, I had asked for a room in the Rush Tower that was on a higher floor facing the strip. The excellent staff member upon check in did give us the room we requested. The Rush Tower room was beautiful and clean and I would not hesitate to return. The staff at the restaurants were excellent and all the hotel/casino staff had great customer service. We ate at the Grotto a couple of times and our meals were fabulous. This was our 3rd trip to Vegas and our first time staying at the Nugget. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone that would like to stay downtown. We will be returning to Vegas in May 2012 and of course we will stay at The Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cj2388
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the best hotel for the price in Vegas! Stay in the Rush Tower, go to Vic and Anthony's or any of the other great GN restaurants, get your beer from the convienent store next door and enjoy a great Vegas experience. Best bed and best shower I have ever had in my life. We have stayed at GN the past three times we've been to Vegas and our next trip is planned for November. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: flowernc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget Sept 25-30th. Check in was a breeze, rooms were ready, staff was great. Our rooms (Gold Tower, Gold Club) were beautiful and large. Very clean and fresh. We were on the 16th floor, nice view of pool and shark tanks. Did not have a problem with noise. Rooms 1601 & 1619 We LOVED our beds, they are so comfortable and a real blessing at the end of a fun day. Pool and shark tank were fun. People of all ages were having a blast going down the slide. The whole hotel was very clean. Staff was always busy cleaning. All contact with staff, from front desk to maids was excellent. All were friendly and helpful. We had breakfast every moring in the buffet. We found the food to be very good. Everything you could want to eat was fresh and hot. Since we had a gold club card we did not have to wait. There was a long line after about 10am for others. Some of the people I was with had never been to Las Vegas, so we took cabs to the strip 2 times. Cost us betwwen $23.00 to $26.00 each way. (Guess it depends on traffic and time on the cost) Everyone in my group has decided next time we wont waste the time and money to go on the strip. We won the most and had the best time right there at the Golden Nugget and the Fremont hotels. We really enjoyed going out onto Fremont Street each night. A new party every night right outside our door. Golden Nugget is our new number one favorite vacation location. Can't wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: JamieAkron
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, especially for the price. We stayed in the Carson Tower, though a bit older, still everything as expected. Downtown is a great place to people watch on Fremont St. I stayed at the Rio and would choose the Golden Nugget over it everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Back for a second visit - still fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NCGirlLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at the Nugget in November, so we decided to give it a whirl during the hot summer month of September this year (which means we got to use the awesome pool!). Golden Nugget again did not disappoint. We stayed in the beautiful Rush Tower and again enjoyed the spacious, modern room. We were excited to use the pool since the temps were hitting a warm and sunny 100°. It's fun to see adults waiting in line (albeit a short, fast moving one) to slide down the water slide and splash around next to the fish and sharks. The pool is definitely the highlight of a summer trip to the Golden Nugget. Even though it was a holiday week (Labor Day), there were plenty of beach chairs, the pool was spacious, and the views of the shark tank were beautiful. In addition to the pool, I can't stress enough how great this hotel's location is. You walk out the door and are right there with all the fun and excitement of Fremont Street. There's always something going on and always someone (or something?!) to look at! My only gripe with GN was lack of free WiFi. If you try to log on to your computer or tablet, you are greeted with a message that there is a charge for wireless service. If I remember correctly, it's not exactly cheap, either. Call me crazy but I'd think enough money flows through those tables downstairs that they could give you some complimentary WiFi! :) Other than that, we love GN and plan to stay there again and again. It's a beautiful facility with great customer service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel downtown but with some downsides”
Reviews.Author: jaf07
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in May and we had a pretty good stay! My sister and I shared a 2 double bed room and it was very spacious compared to other hotel rooms I have stayed in. Really enjoyed the vanity area with makeup mirror it was perfect for getting ready for a night on the town. The closet was also spacious and had a safety box. The pool was amazing but we were only able to enjoy it one day due to the weather. Get there early though or there will be no where to lay out or sit. Also must try the slide that goes through the shark tank! We ate at the italian restaurant on site and it was delicious! Cons -When arriving the lady at the check in was very rude to us. We asked if someone could take our luggage to our room she just ignored us as if we were not speaking to her. -She didnt direct us to which way we need to go to get to our tower which left us walking all over the place with our luggage. -Our room smelled of horrible smoke when we arrived. However when I called they immediately came up and sprayed and cleaned up a bit while we left the room.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown excitement”
Reviews.Author: Fishtherapy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Golden Nugget for our fourth time. We think Golden Nugget has one of the best pools in Vegas, which is our main reason for staying there. They have an awesome slide that goes through a shark tank, which you can also swim around if you are not into slides. There are plenty of chairs if you get there relatively early. They have an outdoor bar and you can order food in the pool area as well. I must admit I thought $11 for a long island ice tea was expensive until I went on the strip where they charge $14. The hotel is on Freemont street which is an exciting place to be at night. They have a light show every hour with music. They also have outdoor live music as well, along with people dressed up as characters trying to earn a buck for a picture. This visit, we decided to stay in the new Rush Tower. At check in, they informed us they ran out of the deluxe rooms and had to upgrade us to a suite.......it was very SWEAT!!!!. The only downside was the suite was pool side and the music blared until 2:00a.m. but was not a problem for me because I slept with my ear plugs in. The Golden Nugget has a night club which we did not attend. They have several nice restaurants, both upscale and modern. They have a grill and a cafe for a more economic choice. The first night, I had a huge mushroom burger with chips and my husband had a good size pizza, both for $18 which I thought was a good deal in Vegas. The most economical breakfast was at Fitzgerald's and the food, service was great. Staying downtown allows you to walk to multiple casinos in a small area.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel with lots of great features. Old School Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: heathgirly
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms have smaller beds - like two doubles instead of queens. However, the room was clean and nice. Very retro modern. The beds were comfortable and had good linens. The bathroom was nice also! The pool is super cool with a slide that goes through a shark tank. It is old-school retro pool and I LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: suedebicycle
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is located on Fremont Street in Downtown Las Vegas. Not the perfect location but a $20+ taxi ride from the Strip, and there are also regular buses. On arrival at reception there was some confusion about the rooms. We had booked separate rooms, but were down as sharing one room, although this was soon cleared up. The room itself was large and modern with dark furnishings. It had, unnecessarily for one person, 2 double beds. The hotel has a large casino and it is easy to get lost finding your way around. It has a smallish pool and a shark tank, with a transparent water slide going through it. A great value place to stay if you are flexible about location. Nearby are several other hotels with decent dining and drinking options.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - not right on the strip though (if that's what you want)”
Reviews.Author: Ildi_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night in the GN two days ago - Carson tower. We picked the hotel because of the low price / good reviews / interesting pool (shark tank). Pros: -The POOL might not be huge but the shark tank & slide idea makes it really good :-) The infinity pool is small, but perfect if you just want to relax. -Room/bathroom were very CLEAN and nicely decorated. -STAFF was friendly and helpful. -Buffett FOOD/variety was good / price was very reasonable. -Room was very QUIET even though we had the street view (I guess its due to good insulation?) Cons: -We had a nasty surprise when checking our bank balance after 3 meals in the buffet : turns out they charged an EXTRA 20% TIP without our knowledge. It was not even on the receipt so we would have not known about this without checking our balance on our iPhone -Hidden POOL charge: 10 dollars for chairs, 20 for loungers. We didnt get charged though, because we arrived late, only went to the pool at 7pm and they didnt charge anything because it was late and there were only a few people around. -No BABY diaper changing stations at all! I found it strange that I didnt find this facility in any of the hotels I stayed in Vegas. I understand Vegas did not intend to be a family-place but that doesnt matter because there are still plenty of families with babies and toddlers in Vegas. - Very long QUEUE at the buffet for breakfast and families with babies are not allowed to go ahead (even if baby is fussy - mine was :-( ) LOCATION : if you want to see the main stuff on the strip, you need a car or have to catch a cab. Takes about 20mins to get to the strip by car. Even though FOOD was good at the buffet, I noticed that they served the same food at dinner, then next day breakfats and a few hours later at lunch. They added one or two new dishes at lunch, but all others were the same. I wasn't bothered though, I liked the dishes (desserts were not amazing, they were okay). If you don't fancy the buffett you have choices of restaurants in the hotel. Our room had a door that opened TO THE ROOM NEXT DOOR. I was really not happy about this because I had a nasty experience with this in Albuferia - see my review on the hotel in Albuferia (we heard everything from neighbouring room and they heard everything too). But because receptionist told us there's nobody in the other room, I was okay with it. If there would be guests in the room next door, I would ask for a room without that door though.. Overall it was a good experience, I would go back but only after seeing everything on the strip, staying in a hotel that's on the strip :-)

Reviews.Title: “Vegas with 11 Year Old”
Reviews.Author: Jeffnich79
Reviews.Content: We stayed labor day week, 4 adults one 12 year old. I book 2 rooms in gold tower. When we arrived rooms were sold out. Best to book with hotel than expedia. They kindly upgraded both rooms to Rush Tower. SWEET and gave me two coupon books for free. BOGO buffets where in there. Buffet food was okay - champane brunch nice. The best resturant was by the pool, cheap and very good - nice variety. The pool was awesome, opens 10am but toss a towel down to save a seat. We spent allot of time at pool, GF read and I gambled right there $5 BJ and thats were i won most of my dough. Drinks reasonable at pool. Oh I thank the hotel staff person who comped all my drink bills ($239.00). Sweet. Valet parking perfect and EZ, check in smooth. Rooms OMG plenty good enough. Starbucks (2) ez to find, I love 1-2 poke no limit always find a game anytime of day. We did west rim grand canyon - 2 hours away must see. Couldnt see hoover dam as we drove over it Also down street Four Queens nice prme rib 9.99 lol freemont street allot of freaks, but also allot of entertainment. Zip line at night $20. I got two rooms, gold tower, car for $1000.00 for a the whole week. best money ever spent. 2nd time to vegas downtown much better than vegas. we also did 4 hr limo night tour presidential limo $260 with tip well worth the cash to see vegas at night. includes roses and champane. I love VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “GN / Rush Tower needs security at the elevators to do a key check for non guests going into the tower”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn H
Reviews.Content: WARNING!! IF YOU USE A DEBIT CARD TO CHECK INTO A SUITE, YOU NEED AN EXTRA $500.00 FOR DEPOSIT!! We checked in Monday, Sept. 12th Had reserved an East End Jr Suite ...using a debit card, I had enough money in this account to cover the room plus some extras. At check in I was advised that an additional $500.00 would be held on the card "because it was a suite" Didn't have it, had to down grade to a regular room. That sucks!! All was OK until Friday night when the week crowd arrived.............Four times during he night, kids, people?? were knocking at our door looking for their friends or what ever....... answered the door once to see a bunch of drunk non hotel guests?? since they said sorry, wrong room I have to guess they didn't belong in the tower and they were looking for their????? Call security -HA... by the time they would arrive, the non guests would be gone. + Also, the soaking tub is very, very, very hard to get & out of to enjoy that wonderful shower

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Educator64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas, NV with our adult children. We stayed in the least expensive rooms and ate most of our meals in the hotel. The rooms were clean and neat but not fancy. The meals were just fine. We enjoyed every meal with excellent service and good choices on the menu. Walking outside each night onto Freemont Street was just pure excitement. One never knew what type of entertainment you would find and of course the variety of people you would see. Staying downtown is far more convenient than staying in one of the more upsacale establishments on the strip. We will return to Las Vegas, NV and will stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Old School”
Reviews.Author: brownmonkey
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try the old style Vegas by staying in the Freemont Street zone for a change and we were not disappointed!! The Golden Nugget is the overall nicest hotel on Freemont Street it has the old charm and style that the strip doesn't have. We loved that everything was so close with affordable dining live bands on the street and a party atmosphere. We stayed in the Carson tower which suited us fine. It was off the casino floor and since we were hardly in it it we were happy. The room was clean and comfortable I was considering upgrading to the Rush Tower but felt it wasn"t necessary. We would stay at the Golden Nugget again for the location and all this area has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at an awesome price”
Reviews.Author: erg32
Reviews.Content: we stayed on freemont street the end of august 2011. the nugget was a great place to stay. it was a little busy though and couldn't get pool chairs even though there were lots. freemont street was a really fun place to stay! highly recommend it! we spent seven days in vegas so did the first two on freemont then the rest at the rio. i think freemont street has so much to offer that next time we may not even bother going to the "strip"

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rhino6915
Reviews.Content: Right in old time Vegas on Freemont St. which is a cross between New Orleans and Key West with a touch of Myrtle Beach. The hotel was clean and the rooms very nice for the only $47 a day I spent. Seeing the largest gold nugget ever found was also kind of cool. The must see is the pool with the shark tank. This is off the strip and all the glitz and glammour, but a better value if you don't care about all the trappings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush Tower. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews on the rooms in this tower. But I was very pleasently suprised at how nice the rooms were. Yes the furnature was a little dated. But everything was nice and clean even the carpet. The pool was great, I even tried the water slide. Only ate at the buffet for breakfast. It was a good deal with our 2 for 1 coupons. Saw the Gordie Brown show in the hotel He was pretty funny. All in all I would stay here again. We had always stayed on the strip before so this was a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “The room was worth it...the staff not so much”
Reviews.Author: Chichikoko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas many times but this was our first stay at a downtown hotel. We chose the Golden Nugget rush tower as I had read good reviews. The room was gorgeous and very clean. Completely impressed. Well worth the $72 a night. Beware that wifi will cost you $13.99 per day, you'll pay $10 for in room coffee and $7 for in room bottled water. I was quite disappointed with the front desk staff. Not very friendly and on three separate occasions we asked for directions/information and not once did they have an answer. Ended up getting the right answers from the valets. Very expensive to eat in the hotel, better off heading across Fremont. I would go back again but would be more prepared to fend for myself

Reviews.Title: “Glittering sparkle with a hint of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Lady25
Reviews.Content: Just fab! The hotel is very big so I was glad for the little map you got with your room key. The swimming pool is a must do along with going to the buffet which had something for everyone. My room was big and had a good sized bathroom as well. I had an afternnon at the spa which if you have time is a lovely treat for yourself after a long day on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: carlsonrn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in the Rush Tower at the Nugget. It was a great room and best of all very quiet whenever we decided to sleep. The staff were so helpful as well as pleasant. We ate at many of the restaurants in the Nugget but by far the best was Vic and Anthony's. We had the Porterhouse for 2 with several sides and all came to the table cooked perfectly. Our waitperson was Ben and he was excellent. Take a chance on staying downtown and you will find the Golden Nugget is very deserving of a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: lastshanks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Sept 11th until the 16th.We had a super time,but most of our time was spent visiting the rest of Vegas.Our trip was booked through expedia for the flight and hotel at a great price with no problems at all. The Golden Nugget is a nice older hotel,but I don,t think its as nice as the other 4 star resorts on the strip which is why I rate it a 3 star.I would not rate it higher than the Stratosphere or Riviera. Even though the price to stay at the nugget is good,they nickel and dime you with everything else.For example - the other hotels on Freemont had beer on sale for $2 but at the nugget it was $5.Sure it was free if you gamble but it took forever to actually find a waitress and get it back to you..Next time we'll stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: glennifer
Reviews.Content: Great mini-vacation. The Golden Nugget surpassed our expectations. We decided to stay in the new wing and were not disappointed. A lovely clean and comfortable modern room. Try to book a room on the higher floors to get a view of the city and mountains. (No fridge in room though). Large casino. Great restaurants. Never used the pool area but definitely will on our next stay as I wanted to go down the waterslide through the shark tank. The only problem was at check-in in the main lobby. It took way too long and then found after that we could have used the alternate check-in at the back of the hotel (where our room was) and there was no line up. They could have posted signs to advise customers of this.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for travelers”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Well ... we are on the road ...traveling around a day here two days there that sort of thing. So the old Nugget might be outside this box, a little. After being sucked into, and spite back out of, the black hole of checking in. For the amount of people that were checking in, you'd think there would have been more than one person at the check in desk. Guess not. The 'desk' was no help, to us, figuring out how to get our gear from the parking lot to our room - what a hike that was. True to their word, there is secure parking, set a side, for motorcycles. Score one for that. Good price for the room (during the week). Things were looking up. Until ... The additional $13 for an - unsecured - WiFi hook up. Which, of course, requires a (24) $50 hold on the credit card - Grrr. The other half booked the room, so I was not allowed to set up the WiFi, because there was no 'share' listed on the room. Even though it was booked for 2 people. We ended up in the Carson tower. So hiking back and forth to the main desk is a PITA. It's a bit of a hike. No refrigerator in the room. No coffee. The room safe is cool and all but wasn't big enough to hold anything I wanted to lock up. We decide to try out the tube/slide, through the shark tank. Get ready, hike over and up to the beginning of the slide, just in time to find out, the slide and the main pool had just closed - at 8 o'clock at night. 8 o'clock .. in Vegas? Ok ... fine. We go over the the Hide Out, a bar with a wading pool in it, to see if they can make a martini. The martini was good (not great). But ... $9 for martini - in a plastic cup? I under stand no glass near a pool, but don't charge top dollar for a drink in a beer swilling cup! So, off we go to find something to eat. The restaurant was top notch. The food was excellent and the staff was right there. Only thing was it was so damn noisy I couldn't hear anything they said. I've eaten in cafeterias that were less noisy than that. By now, all we're interested in is sleep. To that end the bed was very comfortable and the 20th floor is very quiet. The hotel staff treated us really great - no complaints with them. Once we got the hang of the place. I became apparent the NG caters more to people that come there as a destination, not just passing through. As a here-today-gone-tomorrow traveler ... the GN just don't get it done. From what we saw of Vegas ... it don't get it done either. We're going to leave it to those that can afford the, constant, gouging.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here almost everytime !”
Reviews.Author: Kittinameow
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the slots are fine, and the buffet is great ! On Weekends and holidays the buffet includes Crab legs, Oyster Rockefeller and other seafood, it is well worth the price. LOVE IT ! The rooms are always clean and perfect. We stay here every time !

Reviews.Title: “You did it again!!”
Reviews.Author: liverpool95
Reviews.Content: What a great trip. This time I was not there for business but brought a family member from overseas. The Nugget is a great place to stay with lots to do and great service, our housekeeper on the 18th floor was Maria and what a treat, she really went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed. I will be back and will recommend this hotel to anyone going to Las Vegas. Rooms are well furbished and very clean, price was great as well. See you in December, I am already planning my next trip there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kencon70
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great; clean, quiet, maintained with adequate towels and toiletries. Really liked staying in old downtown. You can walk everywhere, and the casino had new machines and good service. Would definitely stay here again, over the Las Vegas strip which is a complete mad house! The Fremont Street light show is great fun, and good restaurants all around. The hotel pool is really neat with the shark/fish tank and the water slide that goes through the tank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: txbikerTexas
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here the second week of September 2011. The room was clean and large with a very good bed and bedding. I was in the Carson tower on the 14th floor, and it was very quiet. This place is huge! I had a rental car, and would never consider using the self park here. There are two valet stations, so remember which one you left your auto in. I was amazed at how crowded the casino was. Seeing several groups of people following a leader holding a flag or standard, I suppose this is a "must" stop on many Las Vegas city tours. The pool was amazing. It was packed during the day. The only negative was that there was no coffee maker in the room. I use Starbucks at home, and always keep my card loaded. The Golden Nugget had two Starbucks, but they wouldn't honor Starbucks cards, and their prices seemed about double what you would pay at a "normal" Starbucks location.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Great Pool, and best hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: WVUNeal
Reviews.Content: My stay was for 3 days in mid-September in the Carson Tower. Unlike the experience of others, check-in was reasonable with a line of about 5 ahead of me. My room was in the Carson Tower at the farthest corner of the hotel. For me, no big deal, the extra walk. The room was large and well appointed, with a comfy king-size bed. Thick and large towels, and two robes in the closet. The best part is the pool area, featuring a shark tank and water slide. I didn't use the restaurants, so cannot comment. I preferred eating at other downtown locations. They did seem a bit on the high side, although not for a hotel resort. As I prefer Downtown to the Strip, I would stay at the Golden any time.

Reviews.Title: “Carson Tower”
Reviews.Author: tonymike
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Carson tower the past 2 trips and it was fine. I do plan on upgrading to the Rush tower next time just to see if and what the difference is. Would like to know what the difference in price is and do you actually get nicer rooms and better views? i do like staying on Freemont street because there is always something going on and lots of people around. Very entertaining place at all hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cheryl46
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Golden Nugget each year when we visit Las Vegas and have for years. We enjoy staying on Freemont Street where all the casinos are close. The Nugget overs great value, the rooms are spacious and always clean. We often have breakfast at the Carson Street Cafe and the food is good and service is excellent. They have two starbucks on the property one right on the street where it is great to sit and relax and people watch. Front desk staff are friendly and efficient. The pool area is awesome. If you are looking for a great place to stay and receive good value look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home!”
Reviews.Author: bumblebe
Reviews.Content: We do love staying at the Golden Nugget when we visit Las Vegas for at least part of our trip. Freemont is a fantastic time and not the seedy place that people think it is. Grotto is our favorite place to eat while at the Golden Nugget and Gordie Brown was pretty good! We have only stayed in the Rush tower, twice in a standard room and once in the San Francisco Suite. If you have the money to spend the SF Suite is amazing and so much brighter than the regular Rush Tower Rooms. The girls at the Rush Tower check in do usually have an attitude problem, but the other employees are very nice. They have done a great job remodeling the resort and the shark tank pool is beautiful! Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Baby Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Pookaloki
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in an awesome parlor suite, we picked the "Vegas Baby" theme, using the summer 11 promo we got it half price though the GN, this got us VIP check in and the "fun book", which is full of the coupons for food, shows and shops, it also had ones for drinks at the bars. At check in the lady was very nice and while the suite was a bit of an upgrade, she didn't charge us anything extra. The suite was very cool, it had a massive lava lamp and the theme looked like a more modern Austin Powers / Vegasy theme. It has two bathrooms, a bar(including mini fridge and coffee maker, dining area, living area and the bedroom was large and WOW awesome bed! We enjoyed the pool everyday and ate at the Chart house for happy hour one day. I really liked the GN it was such an excellent value, not only is it extremely clean, the staff was VERY professional, we will be staying there again in December, next time we may try the Gold Club room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sue W
Reviews.Content: Didnt know what to expect in Vegas but the hotel was lovely a bit noisy through the night but it didnt bother us as we have stopped in new york and that was noisy.Our room was a good size and bathroom was fine. we had a few meals in the different restaurants in the hotel and they where good specially the Itlalin. A bus ride from the strip but the duce buses where easy to get. Hotel is in freemont street which comes alive at night it was brill with different little shows going on along the street. Had been told the Hotel was a bit dated before we went but we didnt think so. We would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lucky2826
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nugget in August 2011. It was great. We stayed in the Gold Tower with a deluxe room. Clean, elegant, spacious. We didn't have a noise problem being on the 10th floor. The restaurants in the hotel were great. Food was excellent. The pool area is really nice with the shark tank but it is extremely crowded. It's really hard to find a spot to layout. Renovations were great - not dingy & smoky and the "old worn out" feeling of the other hotels in the downtown area. The Fremont Experience is always a good show, bands playing was great entertainment. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good times Downtown”
Reviews.Author: handlebar7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Golden Nugget three times, each time many years inbetween. We have always enjoyed it. We were two couples my friend was celebrating her 50th birthday, first time in 20 years going to Vegas. Thought she would have wanted to stay on the strip but was surprised she wanted downtown. She thoroughly enjoyed downtown better than the strip. We did rent a car so that did make it easier to go from downtown to strip. Did alot of touring outside of Vegas, Hoover Damm, Red Rock Canyon etc. We stayed in the Carson Towers, yes they are dated but very clean, beds were comfortable the drains were a little slow but no worry. The staff were very courteous. We ate at the buffet twice, had no complaints about the food, not fancy like the strip but still tasted good.
