Also ate at Cafe for breakfast, no complaints there either. We really enjoyed the pool area, even did the water slide, it was busy on the weekend but that is like that everywhere so expected it. Let the kids have fun on the weekend but the week they were gone and us adults became kids. Enjoyed staying downtown probably will do it again when go with hubby, but with the girls will stay on the strip easier for us. Highly recommend staying at Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deb756
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews before our trip, I was a little skeptical about staying here. I can tell you the Nugget is the best hotel I have stayed in Vegas. The staff were professional and courteous, the rooms were beautiful, and the hotel itself was fantastic. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel4fun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget after renovations and found the accomdations to be excellent. We travel with frequency and ususally we seek out the best steakhouse in town. We had found a steakhouse in Seattle, WA that we had rated our #1 choice. However, after staying at the Golden Nugget, we ate at Vic and Anthonys located in the Golden Nugget. The steaks were phenominal and replaced as our #1 Choice. It was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown terrific”
Reviews.Author: skullicous
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the strip but land up hanging around downtown so much more fun bands , fremont experience. I decided to book at the Nugget and slurge for the Rush Tower We had a great view the romm was great. I love soaking in a nice bath when the tub is a good size and the Nugget had that. My husband he hangs at the pool and he had a blast just like a kid with the slide at the shark tank, until he said actually too many kids showed up. The elevators in the self parking lot are very slow. The lobby of the rush tower is beautiful. All in all a very nice stary I would splurge again if I wasn't comped.

Reviews.Title: “No Longer 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: bgjhn
Reviews.Content: We booked the Golden Nugget for a week. They put my wife and I on the 5th floor overlooking Bridger St. It was extremely noisy all night long. Trucks were continually backing up into the delivery area and someone was sorting through bottles for most of the night. Additionally there was a sewer gas smell in the room. After getting no sleep for two nights we complained. The desk clerk (no apology) changed our room to another on the 21st floor. He gave us keys that worked on and off for the next five days. We elected not to go to the pool. They charged extra for all the comfortable chairs. And the pool chairs were extremely close; there was really no room to move around at all. Finally at least two of the elevators never worked during our stay.We booked the Golden Nugget for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terence P
Reviews.Content: Booked the Golden Nugget as the rate was very competitive, also it is in the old town, which is just great asv the hotel is near the local bus for the strip. The room was excellent we had a king size bed, very comfortable anb clean, the buffet breakfast was good value, except on saturday and sunday it is a champagne brunch. Nice pool area with a soot that goes through the shark tank. Would book this hotel vagain.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Rooms, GREAT pool and low dollar card tables”
Reviews.Author: BriMarie01
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it was wonderful. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool with the slide through the shark tank. Chart House restaurant is inside this hotel and 17 of us ate dinner there and everyone loved their food! Not one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Too big a hotel for Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: Deeferdawn
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous hotels in vegas I have now settled on my favourite two unfortunately GN not making the grade as it is simply too big! It takes an age to get to your room and as there are so many other guest some are very noisy spoiling your sleep! Furthermore our room 4109 was above the loading bay resulting in constant noise all night from deliveries. Should you be offered a room near 109 be aware of this. Other than that the hotel was fairly generic.

Reviews.Title: “Best Property to Stay at Downtown LV”
Reviews.Author: kolonialone
Reviews.Content: Although the taxi couldn't get us to the hotel directly because of an event blocking streets downtown that didn't stop us from enjoying the hotel immensely. We had a view of the strip from our window and the room was spacious and clean. Like any big hotel in LV we had a ways to walk to get to the room from the elevator, but that wasn't any big deal. The staff was courteous and the amenities were great. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wants to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “delevired what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Harroldp
Reviews.Content: The golden nugget delivered what i expected. They have the nicest rooms in Downtown and a very nice pool area. I would not recommand it for Gambling (high limits for downtown and bad rules)or hanging out. This is however no problem as evrything is nearby downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower the Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierfan_7
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Las Vegas for a long weekend the past 10 years. After staying in some of the larger, newer hotels on the strip, we decided to try downtown a few years ago and never went back to staying on the strip. Being downtown is probably not for everyone, but we like that we can walk a short distance and be at another casino within a few minutes. The Rush Tower is a wonderful addition to the Golden Nugget and the rooms are very nice. We have always had a room with a leather "L" shaped sofa as well as a wall entertainment unit for the television. The bathroom is large with a big tub and shower. The restaurants at the Nugget are varied and good...prices range from low to high depending on where you choose to eat. I have fallen in love with the cannelonis served at the Italian restaurant, so I have go make a point to order them. The shark tank at the pool is definitely a plus for their pool area, cabanas are available for rent on the upper deck. I have taken advantage of the spa for pedicures and massages...it may not be as large as some hotel spas, but it suffices for a nice spa treatment....who can complain about that? Prices are not cheap, but they are also not as expensive as some of the strip hotel spas. If you wish to go to the strip, there are always taxis outside the door or you may walk about 1.5 blocks and catch one of the city buses that run to the strip. There are a few places to get a nice dinner downtown near the Nugget as well as a hot dog or the world famous $1.99 shrimp cocktail (which used to be 99 cents). The light show is not that impressive after you have seen it one time, but the Nugget is definitely worth a stay at least once...you may find that you like the smaller downtown area better than the crowded strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: IceTeaAustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent an exhilarating holiday at the Golden Nugget. We wanted to stay and study the Fremont area. We like the fact that the hotels are close together. We got a deal with our Landry's card- VIP check in and an upgrade on the room, but you have to call the number provided to get the deal. The surprise is the slide through the shark tank. We didn't do that this time but it is going to be a big reason that we stay there next time. There were robes provided with the room. We rented a car an went out to Red Rock Canyon Preserve. Very nice. We found free parking every place that we went. We really like the Fremont Show and atmosphere. Gordy Brown made me laugh so hard that I hurt. The Lion King was amazing! We rode the monorail just for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for Fremont area.”
Reviews.Author: vexsgirl
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy, no wait, pleasant clerk. Rush tower, 19th floor. Walked into the room and went WOW! The interior was very pretty! Dark woods, a nicely appointed bathroom suite. The bed was heaven! I would totally buy one of these beds if I hadnt just bought one. I slept so well! The only issues we found were the bathtub/shower. The tub was VERY deep and since I am not a tall person (5'5" only) it was hard to get out of the shower without feeling I may fall. Also, after the first morning we werent given any more coffee sups and had to use the glasses. Most of the restaurants were very good. one star for the Grille, 2 stars for The Cafe, 4 stars for Lillies and the Chart House then a big 5 stars for Vic and Anthonys. The casino was fun, Had my ups and downs. Cocktailers were spotty. Good days and bad ones. Check out this Hotel. If you stay in the Rush Tower, you shouldnt be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: BandJ49
Reviews.Content: Great good, wonderful pool, and beautiful room. The south tower is also great, but the new rush tower rooms are awlsome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: vex10
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Golden Nugget, and likely won't be our last. Our room in the Rush tower was first-rate, and all the staff were polite, professional, and accommodating. Most of the restaurants we tried on-property were excellent. I'll review them separately. One item that really stood out about our room in the Rush Tower was the bathroom. It was huge, with his-and-her sinks, and an excellent "rain shower" shower head. No low water pressure here! High pressure shower and toilets were excellent. Housekeeping replaced all our linens in the bathroom daily, hung up or not. Nice to see they didn't want to give the impression of being cheap, by "rationing water" like so many hotels do these days.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like the young kids took over.... security did not care”
Reviews.Author: Tamirose170
Reviews.Content: I was appalled at a 4 star hotel tolerating the behavior of a great majority of the guest; with their pants around their mid thighs and me getting the full frontal views and a few back shots while walking from my room to a restaurant or to the casino, etc. Why would the hotel tolerate such behavior and decorum? Certainly they must have some sort of policy in place to NOT tolerate such "dress style". Also, I had a voucher, very clearly printed with my name and a scan code on it which I was to receive a coupon book worth $250 in coupons once I presented at check-in; however, the front desk clerk refused to honor and also refused to call her supervisor. If there had not been 50 MORE people standing in line to check in (as I waited nearly 45 minutes myself); I would have stayed my ground and insisted... but for the love of the people aging in line, I let it go. We have stayed there yearly,as we live in Vegas and use this place as our get-a-way place a few times a year - but we might want to rethink it. Also, everything we put into a slot machine was a complete donation - I've never seen it SO bad as it was this past trip - WOWEEE. Not even time to play, a bonus game or anything - just straight donations from both of us. The hotel itself is nice, the rooms are lovely; but the staff again needs to be retrained in the Federal Laws regarding Service Animals (NOT therapy dogs) but SERVICE ANIMALS; as they are protected by Federal Law and ARE permitted to go wherever I am; as I am disabled and they are WORKING DOGS - but I had to swat off many of the uneducated staff members, security guards, cocktail waitresses, etc and explain to them to them the Federal Laws and request. yet again their manager to win my battle. It's get unnerving and very frustrating. Just because I am NOT blind and I do NOT have a shepherd or labrador, does not mean that my smaller breed is NOT a SERVICE ANIMAL; as I adorn a 3x5 card with his Registation Numbers and photographs (courtesy, as not mandated); but that still did not cease the "harassment". It will take me awhile before I get the gusto to go again and battle all of those things; the last two days I just stayed in my room and read magazines, watched TV and took naps - a lot less hassle!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: barryg19
Reviews.Content: After 3 years, I finally got to go on a vacation and used Trip Advisor to help. Well here is my review, that I hope, helps. First off I have no idea why people are so negative at times about the Golden Nugget. Everything was perfect..from the check-in to the check out. I was totally unsure about the room. I stuck with the Carson Tower after flipping back and forth with the Rush Tower. I'm glad I did. Quiet, and totally comfortable. The buffet...wasn't too sure with some of the reviews. It was great!! Nothing wrong with the breakfasts at all. The pool...great. Of course it's going to be crowded during the day, this pool is unbelievable. Do yourself a favor and stay at this hotel. you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MNGreen_Pea
Reviews.Content: Check in took a little while and they didn't have our coupon book noted in our reservation and they didn't give us one so that was disappointing! The rooms were on the other side of the pool so there was a little walk to get to the casino floor but the pool is beautiful so it was nice to walk past. Plenty of games, great location and everything is real clean! If you book online pay in advance for your transfer. $12 per person to go both ways is by far the cheapest route! The taxi cost us $30 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hidden Gem at Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonermay
Reviews.Content: If you haven't already tried, book a room in the RUSH Tower of the Golden Nugget. It's the newest addition there and it's the best value for your money. Rates aren't that bad when you get in on a special. We stayed for a weekend (Friday - Sunday). A very large, open bathroom, double sinks with lots of counter space, beautiful showers with those rain-type shower heads, plus the shower tub is huge and set up so you can take a comfy bath (headrest and arm rests and all), no clogging in the shower drains at all - which i seem to experience at most hotels i stay at (granted, that is not that often), and DVD player included for TV. it just feels luxurious when you stay there. also, the rush tower has it's own registration desk and just out the door is a valet for rush and the self-parking garage is just across the street from the RUSH entrance. ALSO, Rush gives you a free parking pass for the self-parking garage for the amount of time you stay there. it definitely beats paying for valet tips when you can just walk across the street. the garage is large as well and we never had a problem finding a parking space. MY ONLY negative is that i wish these rooms had refrigerators! it seems odd to me that such a "luxurious" room, would be missing a simple refrigerator of all things.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: 1deano11
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive staying on Fremont rather than the strip. However, this hotel was in top form, from the time our shuttle pulled in, to the time we left. The room was clean and we were well taken care of. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicosere
Reviews.Content: Good service. Room OK - problems: no fridge. The best: swimming pool with aquarium (sharks!) Good location if you have a car, it's far from the Strip. Freemont street experience is interesting. Good price during week days.

Reviews.Title: “Will return over and over”
Reviews.Author: Condo-Pop
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to the Golden Nugget, I've never been disapointed. The room ( Carson Tower ) was spotless from top to bottom with plenty of elbow room for two. If you want to stay off of the strip but still be in the middle of the action, the Golden Nugget is the place to be. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone heading to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Downtown alternative to the Strip with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MaineEXPTraveler
Reviews.Content: So we stayed in the gold club, and it was great....the people were nice, the rooms were clean and well appointed, always water bottles near the elevator with bowls of treats, and just a great experience for a moderate price. I like downtown because things are closer and the card games have better odds than the strip....and everything is a little more real. Good buffet breakfast and when you do the golf club, you skip the line! Go for it if you always staynon the strip - you might just like it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Splicejunkie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Never needed anything. Only problem they were cleaning our windows outside and it was noisy at 6:00 am. Casino is nice. Always seem to win more downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown Casino/Hotel, too many kids.”
Reviews.Author: slotblog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time of 15 Vegas trips at the GN. It was decent and would be the top rated downtown hotel. The casino could use better video poker paytables, especially at the bars. The pool and aquarium with the water slide was fun but it was over-crowded and that made for uncomfortable time to lay out. There is a more private upsatirs pool but they charge for chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Still the classiest of the downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie45
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget on several occasions. The Golden Nugget is the classiest hotel in the downtown area and has a lot to be proud of. The decor is beautiful, even tho they are building even more by the front desk. The new pool is ok - you have to make reservations prior to 5 pm to get in - after that it is free access. The Tank is gorgeous. The buffet is still very good. Went to the Grotto - good food but pretty pricey. We also ate at the Carson Street Cafe once, would have been twice, but we were advised by the not overly courteous hostess that there were not any tables available at 11 pm at night and that we would have to wait-this was on the night of our arrival, after driving for over 1700 miles,and when the cafe was approximately 1/8 full. The empty tables were "Reserved'. Oh well, that was the cafe's loss - we usually frequent it when we stay. Not this visit - and we stayed for 11 nights! I was able to upgrade from the Gold Tower to the Rush Tower using my Landry's Select card. That was nice. The Rush Tower has nice, contemporary style rooms (be careful getting in and out of the shower tho! The bathtub side is pretty high and it can be awkward getting in and out - there is nothing on the wall to grab on to). We had initially reserved the room for 10 nights, on the 7th night I called to have the stay extended one night. They were able to do it, but I felt that the rate that I was offered could have been better. Oh well, live and learn. We will definitely return to the Golden Nugget in the future, because, as said before, it is the classiest of the downtown hotels. Everything in the downtown area is reachable by walking. The Fremont Street experience is something to see! The entertainment saluting the '80's music was great - especially the VJ Invasion. We watched their show several times! The Golden Nugget is a very good place to stay - you can gamble, swim, go to a show or club, people watch or simply relax - pretty much has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: momoftwins_11
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Its amazing in every way. Everyone should stay here. Cheap!!! 5 star looking, Clean, neat, central on freemount, great restaraunts....awesome spa ladies! Will be returning next year! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: edsgirlAustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night, our 6th anniversary and we were very pleased with our selection. This was our 1st time to stay downtown and The Golden Nugget came highly recommended on the TA Las Vegas forum. We booked a Gold Club Room which came with VIP check-in. Check-in was very easy and friendly. Our room was ready for us even though it was only 10:30 in the morning. The room was very easy to get to and we found it to be very clean, spacious, and well appointed. The view was nothing to write home about but as we were staying only 1 night, this did not matter to us. We enjoyed our time downtown, did the zipline, gambled a little, and had a lovely meal at Vic and Anthony's. If you are staying downtown you can rest assured that The Golden Nugget will be an enjoyable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: Noon1
Reviews.Content: Was our first time to stay at this hotel. We found the rush tower room very nice and loved the bath plus we had an amazing view of the strip from our window (room 18222) really liked the no smoking tower, fast elevator but could hear the other doors opening and closing loudly. We enjoyed the pool and did not even mind paying for chairs at the Hideout Pool since that is how we spend our days in Vegas and don't want to fight for a spot or worry if I leave it. Second day at the pool some group got a little rowdy and would have liked for that to have been calmed down some by the staff. The second day my husband ordered a bloody Mary at the pool and became ill within the hour. He spent the entire day throwing up and we are convinced it was the juice on the drink. We ended up having to check out early We hope to give it another try without the apparent left over day before juice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Not on the strip, but nicer than some on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: redheadfreckleface
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Nugget was not my choice. This was a group trip and the rest of the group chose this hotel. No one in the group had ever stayed at this hotel, in this part of Vegas. The hotel was very nice. To say I was surprised is putting mildly. Check-in was a breeze, especially considering that check-in time was at 3 pm and I arrived at 10:30 am. No problem, though, I checked right in. The desk staff were very nice and accommodating. The room was VERY large. I was surprised by the size of the room! There was a dressing table, stand alone vanity with make-up mirror, and large bathroom. The towels were extra fluffy and the shower water pressure was great. The bed was super comfy. This room was very comfortable. The hotel was easy to navigate and there were good restaurants located on the premisses (Vic and Anthony's Steak House was amazing!). An Elvis impersonator played the lounge one night and we had a blast! His accompanying band also played other genres of music. If you are looking for excitement during the day, you will need to take a bus to the strip. It just isn't going to happen here. BUT, if you are looking for a clean, nice, roomy, affordable room, stay here and take a shuttle or bus to the strip. I normally stay on the strip and probably will continue to do so, but for those of you who like this area of Vegas, The Golden Nugget is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great room rates/great rooms”
Reviews.Author: aks472
Reviews.Content: great rates & great rooms food was good when checking in park in the garage take your bags & go find a front desk as there are 3 or so located around the casino just ask any staff

Reviews.Title: “a little dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: deskdiva
Reviews.Content: we arrived and had to change our room twice one we had room 1666 not a great number then 2dn room air cinditioner did not work 2rd room aircondition was iffy and non of the sinks or bathtub drained called housekeeping twice and after 1 day same senerio plumbing backed up to a discusting black ooze then air cin filter needed changing and had to run 24/7 to keep the room comfortable aslo had to call housekeeping for suitcase caddy the was non in the room carpets wer also stained and locked safe did not work overall we like the golden nuggett and would try to stay again just kindly bring rooms up to day please continnue to senf coupons D&B Moore

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but what's going on with the food”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDon1
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the golden nuggett for years and years. After Steve Wynn owned it , it was sold a couple times. It is now owned by Landry's the food people. I just stayed in the Gold Tower Room and it is very nice. TV mirror in the bathroom and really up to date. The service and check in is also great as you can use the VIP check in room. This hotel has always been the best place downtown to stay and this remains true. They cater to a new croud of younger people but they have all ages and it is a great place. My only problem the past few visits has been the restaurants. They do have a couple upscale restaurants but I have not been there. I have been to the buffet and the casual restaurant. Buffet is around 20 bucks for dinner and not really all that good, both in food quality and selection. Had dinner in the Carson Street Cafe last night. 10 oz prime rib with salad and ice tea was $31.00 . Green beans were cold and just not what I would expect from a restruarnt owned by Landry's So my advice is STAY at the Golden Nuggett you will love it,, eat at the high dollar restaurants or go someplace else...

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kinnies_10
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip this year to the Golden Nugget. Went in April for ACM's and tried downtown for the first time. Was worried we would be disatisified. It was fun but not the Vegas I was used to. We decided to try again in August to see if the time of year would make it better. It did! Freemont street had a ton of entertainment at night that was free and I love that old Vegas feel. We paid the $20pp to go to the Hideout adults only pool on two of the days we were there. When it's 108 degrees it's totally worth it. Drinks were somewhat afforable and my husband liked the bucket of beer prices. Our room was exactly like the one we had in April. We stayed in Carson Tower. Nothing fancy but very comfortable and clean. We paid for the VIP and that was so worth it. No wait to check in and the clerk was able to get us a connecting room with our friends. That was nice! The only negative I can come up with is.....I had to come home!

Reviews.Title: “Best in 'downtown Vegas'”
Reviews.Author: jglaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel with casino is not located on the strip but 15 min by car in what is called 'downtown Vegas', at the very lively Fremont Street, a carfree stretch with day and nighttime entertainment. This was our second stay, and we loved it again for its laid back atmosphere, and also for the low prices (!!) of the rooms. Means 85 USD for a big deluxe room on the 12th floor. The hotel has all the amenities of the powerhouses on the strip but with a bit less poohah. Decent restaurants on site. One downpoint: hotel seems a bit understaffed at check-in. You don't want to queue for 40 minutes after a long drive.

Reviews.Title: “Tank pool was the highlight of our stay.”
Reviews.Author: ohana05
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room in the Carson Tower. When we checked in, they said that there were no more non-smokings left, but after some insistence and a talk with a manager regarding health issues, a non-smoking room "just became available." My son's 1st comment when we opened the door was, "Oh, this is very small." We requested a 2 double bed room, but the beds were more like twin sized. The beds were not very comfortable and were firmer than firm. There was no coffee maker or fridge, but luckily we brought our own hot water heater and a cooler that we kept filling with ice for our drinks. Cable TV was very basic and had about 10 channels available. The best part of the hotel was the tank pool with water slide that runs right through it. The kids had a great time there and would've spent all day there if we let them. The hotel is worth staying just for the pool area. i recommend it for kids. Downtown LV is a bit of a drive to the strip, but there's the Fremont experience which is a cool thing to see. We ate at the Grill once for a quick dinner and the food was average. We tried the buffet dinner another night and the food was a little better, but some of the choices seemed like they had been sitting too long under the heaters. We've had better at hotels on the strip. We probably won't choose this hotel again in the future and will get one on the strip. But we were happy that we stayed there just for the fun of the pool area. Overall, the value was right on and was a good deal considering we stayed over Labor Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Overall”
Reviews.Author: dwhall58
Reviews.Content: We have visited this property in the past, and made the decision to stay here during our next trip to Vegas. Before I begin, let me say that I have done a bit of traveling and stayed at all grades of hotels/resorts. I do not consider myself a high maintenance customer, I do expect to get what I pay for though. Check In (Rush Tower): The process went quick. We arrived on a Thursday 9/1. I instantly noticed that none of the desk staff were smiling or being cordial at all. Overall, not welcoming. We specifically asked for a room that did NOT overlook a roof. Instead, we were given a room that faced a parking garage. The Rush Tower room: The room was just ok. Not as large as the website portrays. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was user friendly. The door to our toilet didnt have a latch,so all we could do is hold it shut for privacy.There is no mini bar or fridge in the room. There was a Keurig coffee brewer in the room, but if you used it it would cost you 10.00 for 4 cups of coffee, so we ordered a pot of coffee from room service that was 5.00 plus 5.00 delivery!!! The next morning we opted to use the Keurig only to find no plug in close to the pot. So we had to brew our 10.00 Keurig coffee on the floor. Beware...dont use the bottled water in the room. It will cost you 7.00 per. Room service didnt even pick the thing up off the floor for us when they came in, nor did they restock the coffee. Room service also thought it was ok to start knocking on doors at 8:30 am. Not cool. The Casino: Sort of small, but thats why we like it. I had to call the hotel to find out where all the cocktail servers were. We had been in the casino for over an hour and not seen or heard a single server. I finally went to a couple of the bars and was served warm beer at both. Gambling here was brutal. We ventured around other casinos (mainly Four Queens) for better luck. We also visited the strip one day and had a GREAT time at a place called Casino Royale. Food: The food here was good. The wait staff were all friendly and attentive. Pools: Very small. I refuse to pay to rent a chair, at the pool, at ANY hotel I am staying at! What are they thinking?? Most memorable here: poor customer service at check-in ( come on people...smile a little!!), fee for in-room coffee, being charged for pool chairs,tight machines, no casino cocktail service, Great chicken fettuccini, and service, at the Grotto.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Gill M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we first were attracted as a family by the pool. Were staying with family in Las Vegas anyway, so tried to book 4 day passes. For our family, (two adults and two kids over 12) that meant $20 each. The receptionist said you may as well book a room for $99, so we did. The pool wasn't as big as it looks on the website, and it was pretty crowded. Getting a sunbed was an art! However, the family room was good, big and clean and we had a great time. We ate in the buffet in the casino, and that was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, but far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: oekonomi
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, they went all on the gold-theme, in classic Las Vegas tacky style. The pool is quite small not suited for swimming. The sun decks gets filled up really early so run down as soon as possible to hold a deck. The casino was quite small, so better go to the strip and the larger casinos. It's actually quite far from the Strip, so take a cab/limo. The buffet breakfast was really good and the lunch as well.

Reviews.Title: “"Overall Satisfied"”
Reviews.Author: Krdrury
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Aug. 22-24, 2011 and were mostly pleased. Used VIP check-in and it saved us time. Room in Carson tower clean and comfortable. On upper floor so noise not a problem. Would like to see stronger security presence in hotel. Some questionable characters wandering around casino. Bartenders not friendly. My husband bit into wad of plastic wrap eating breakfast from buffet. No offer from waiter to comp us for the meal. Enjoyed Fremont street experience.

Reviews.Title: “One place that keeps their pool & spa open reasonable hours even in winter.”
Reviews.Author: newmexicoonline
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfy; there rooms were nicely updated for an older property. What I really love about this place is that even in January, the spa was open until 2 p.m. and the two pools until 6 or 8? I think the adults-only pool upstairs was open later than the one with the water tube going to it, which I went down 3 times--what a trip! Shark tank etc. you can view from every angle around the pool. As usual, renting a cabana is expensive. The H2O Bar was closed most of the time when we were there (upstairs by the HideOut Infinity Pool). The water temp was pretty darn nice considering the outdoor temp and the spa temp was great. I checked around and many hotels either close their pools entirely in the winter or have very shortened hours. We ate several times at The Grille and once at The Grotto, where we sat right by the window with a great view of the shark tank/pool area. Good food. Next time, we'll spring for either the Chart House or Vic & Anthony's. I honestly can't remember which one we stopped into just for drinks and dessert, but the dessert was SO good I went back and got one to go to take to my room the next night. We've always stayed on the strip before, but I am now sold on Fremont Street. There are some fun places to get free drinks and play the machines at the bar out and about, and of course the Fremont Street Experience has a different program every hour, so that's worth checking out a couple of times. The Nugget's room rates range from good deals to kind of expensive depending on day and season, and unfortunately, they do not have a rate calendar where you can see rates for the whole month and pick your dates from that. I've been getting emails and facebook ads saying 'rooms from $42' but no matter what dates I plug in, they are always higher, generally over $100. Guess I'll have to call them. We stayed in the oldest Carson Tower, which is a fair walk from the elevators to anywhere, but that's another reason they cost less. Had a couple of noisy times (sounded like carpet cleaner or something), but out of five nights there, mostly it was pretty quiet. No 'resort fees' but they charge a lot for internet access (as usual for many Vegas hotel/casinos). I can't really say how the gambling payouts are versus other casinos; as usual my spouse played for a couple of days before eventually losing all he had set aside for that portion of the trip. I read and enjoyed the water.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: DC_Money
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay downtown and we like it better than the strip...so much easier to get around!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: jabdab
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget in past years and were very satisfied. We liked the atmosphere and the room. This time, we reserved a room in the Rush Tower. This was very disappointing. We were at the end of the hall--the window was blocked by a building. The room was dark and, honestly, rather dreary. The tub enclosure opened on the opposite end of the shower handles etc. Awkward! A positive was the free water in the room along with snacks and coffee on a table near the elevator. This was a nice perk. When we had difficulty with the code to connect to our computer, the front desk sent us maintenance people who were very nice, but unable to help us. After calling the front desk the first night and then again several times the next morning, and then the bell captain, we finally were connected to "Hospitality" who had a tech person who was knowledgeable and was able to help us. It was apparent the front desk did not have all the information necessary. There was also a high school basketball meet which caused the hotel to full of young basketball players. The positive was the show with Gordie Brown. It was very well done,high energy, and professional. We bought the combo show and buffet. The buffet was okay. The checkout was efficient because we had VIP status. We do like the covered laser show in the evenings. We drove to the strip the next morning to take in a few shops and the sights. Parked free at one of the hotel parking garages.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: tim346
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the California because that is where all of our relatives stay but they were booked for the duration. The Fremont and Main Street were also booked so we opted to stay at the Golden Nugget as it is in close proximity. After the initial hassle of the long haul from the parking lot, we were greeted by a long line to check-in. Over half an hour later, we finally got our room keys. When we got to our room, we were shocked at how beautiful the rooms were. This was our second stay and I opted for the middle grade tower this time to give ourselves a treat. The Carson Tower was very nice but if you are going to spend any time in the room, the Gold Tower is worth the upgrade. My wife did not know I paid a few dollars for the upgrade but she noticed the marked difference. Not quite sure if I would opt for the Rush Tower next time but for an additional $10 more a night, it might be worth it. Will definitely stay here versus the strip or Sam Boyd's hotels anytime. Am sure all the restaurants were great but we were spending most of the time with relatives, especially meals.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again at Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: SammyGunn
Reviews.Content: Wife and I booked three nights. I like to sit at the bar as she roams around playing slot machines. She did not feel safe in this casino, to many seedy characters walking around. After one night we checked out and left for the strip - I realized I left some clothes in the dresser drawer at Golden Nugget - after several calls to housekeeping and security - I was told they could not find my clothes. So either the made kept them or the next guest in decided to keep them. Not a good experience, bartenders were not that friendly and I am a big tipper. We are done with downtown, will now only stay on the strip. Thanks Golden Nugget for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Second Class Treatment - ADA Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Dotty_4_Dalmations
Reviews.Content: Beware Hotwire users, you will be treated differently than other "hotel direct" guests when you arrive at this hotel. I called ahead to request two connecting rooms to accomodate traveling with my deaf sister and 94 year old mother-in-law. While in the slow check-in process, (40 minutes) I watched large parties with tall drinks and blow-up sex dolls get rooms together to continue the party...but our request was not honored. The clerk explained if we had paid the VIP fee of $25 to the hotel and booked direct he could have saved us rooms, but not as a third party booking. The manager told us that he was full and could not make our accomodation. We were relegated to the end of a hall in a far tower, with the wrong bed requests, but were at least on the same floor - which was suspiciously quiet and seemed less that full. Of course problems occurred: the power went out in my mother-in-law's bathroom, and she was left feeling around in the dark at three in the morning (an accident waiting to happen with a frail person). A welcome message popped up on the phone after midnight she could not clear, so it flashed all night keeping her awake, and the alarm clock went off (someone's idea of a joke), which she could not figure out where it was coming from. This all could have been avoided with our connecting room request. There are too many rooms in Vegas to go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than hotels on Strip”
Reviews.Author: plata1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at casino hotel in downtown. I have stayed at almost all hotels on Strip, so I wanted to try something new. Well, I was happy I did so. The room was clean and spacious. Though I was happy my overall stay at this hotel, there are couple of complaints I have to make. I found a dirty wed towel in the bathroom when I first arrived. I left a message about this, and they didn't seem to care. Second, I left a privacy hang tag on the door, and even told the house keeper not to come in the room, the housekeeper still came in the room. Of course, I complained (left a message), but no response from them. Overall, for $50, this was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Billyp27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last few days of our Vegas vacation away from the Strip because we wanted to experience the Freemont hotels. We had previously walked around the Nugget and found it to be the best by far of the Downtown hotels. We reserved a Rush tower room and found it to be at least the equal if not better appointed than our standard room at the Aria. It was great to have a livingroom area to be able to spend time in the room and just chill. We spent time in the Rush lounge which was not busy but very nicely done up. The bartenders were very friendly in the casino! I felt the dealers in the poker room were also much more friendly than in other strip casinos that i have played in. My wife bought a spa package and raved about how friendly the staff were! I was very happy to be able to walk around in shorts and a t shirt and NOT look out of place in the casino and especially out on Freemont street. The people are for sure different, but way more relaxed and having,(it seems) WAY more fun. We for sure will be spending at least part of our next Vegas holiday at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly - Last Time I'll Stay here”
Reviews.Author: LoboTX
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget holds many fond memories for me, and this used to be my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas, but no more. Where to start ? The Nugget expanded a few years ago, adding many more rooms in a new tower. Unfortunately, they didn't expand the other facilities enough to handle the additional guests. This problem showed up everywhere - from check in lines, casino, restaurants, to the pool area. Granted, part of my stay was over a weekend - CROWDED. This allows the Nugget to charge $25 for those of us "smart enough" to pay $28 (w/ tax) for a one-stay VIP membership so you can skip the long check in lines and get a coupon book of dubious value. VIP was quick and friendly, and I got some free M&Ms. I'm told that it took an hour for others to check in the regular way. Also, as noted by others, they charge $12/day for internet. The last night it got blinkey and required numerous log-ins. It said I wouldn't be charged twice, but upon check out I noticed I was. If you play blackjack, look elsewhere. Much of Vegas has the "new rules" which tilt the odds heavily in the house's favor. The tables I saw were 6-deck and only paid 6:5 for blackjacks instead of 3:2. Also, dealer gets to hit soft 17. You can and should do better if you want to win. A small thing, but my biggest gripe was no coffee. I was fully aware that they ding you $10 for 4 Keurig cups, but that's academic if you're staying in the Carson Tower. There are no Keurigs there, so you're only choice is $15 (plus tip) for a pot from room service, or getting dressed and going downstairs for Starbucks. I need my coffee people - before I get dressed ! Lastly, the staff isn't what it used to be. I remember fondly the days when they had suited doormen at the entrances (okay, nostalgia) - no more. Valet parking was courteous, but it took 20 minutes on a Friday morning to get my car - and I was the only customer. On the positive side, the room was very adequate. Nice size, rather dark, good bed, comfy chairs. AC had a hard time keeping up during the heat of the day though. Some may find same noisy, but I like the background noise. Pizza at the Grotto was decent, food at the Asian restaurant was good. Chart House was so-so and pricey - service was good at all, but we were well dressed. Those in cutoffs and tshirts complained more about the service. There's free parking right across the street (get a permit to exit free), and they do have plenty of elevators, so no wait there. Next time I may try the remodeled Plaza, Four Queens, or even the El Cortez (who has the best blackjack tables in town, albeit their dealers never talk or smile).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Adult Pool”
Reviews.Author: lgustafson
Reviews.Content: We loved the Golden Nugget. The Rush Tower rooms are as good as any on the stip. Staff were friendly and helpful. As this was our vacation away from the kids we especially enjoyed the Hideout Pool (16 and older). We rented chase loungers that were will worth it. The service was great!! Downtown is a great place to stay. We will definetly be back at the Golden Nugget!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Golden Experience in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: maxmuscle03843
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Downtown Las Vegas on my last trip for one night. I chose the Golden Nugget as it's the nicest hotel downtown. My room was in the Carson Tower which is the furthest away from everything, it's a good walk to the casino. If you don't like to walk too far I would suggest staying in a different tower with rooms closer to the casino floor. The rooms in the Carson Tower are older, but the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was average size for a hotel of this caliber. All staff that I encountered were really friendly. The pool area is definitely the nicest of all the hotels downtown. The casinos in the downtown area are closer together than the casinos on the Las Vegas strip, so this makes for easy casino hopping. There are more "real people" in downtown Las Vegas, so if your into the celebrities and pretty people, the downtown Las Vegas area may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but be aware of the noise”
Reviews.Author: bsmithy2k
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week of August 15th and we stayed in a Rush Tower Jr Suite facing the Fremont Street Experience. The room was nice and big, updated furnishings, and the bathroom was a good size. Robes and slippers were a nice touch. Unfortunately, after a long day of travelling, we went to bed around 9 o'clock, which was 12:00 for us. The noise from the FSE was quite noticeable and kept us up for the better part of the night. The next morning, I called down to the front desk, and asked for a room change because of the noise. The first response was a suggestion that I contact Housekeeping for a pair of earplugs. I declined and asked to speak with a manager. I told the manager about the noise and my request to switch to a quieter room. She checked the availability and told me that she could switch me to a lower floor facing away from the FSE. I asked if the room the faced the pool which had been pumping out the jams throughout the day and she said not that the room did not face the pool. Technically she was correct, however, when I went to the room, it was not overlooking the pool, it was overlooking a roof that was adjacent to the pool, and the music was noticeable. Again I called the front desk and asked how long the music at the pool lasts and they told me that it will go until at least 10PM and possibly later. I asked again for a manager to request a room that was quieter, and he proceeded to check his room inventory. He found a room in the Gold Tower on the 16th floor and told me that it was not facing either the pool or the FSE. This room turned out to be a much quieter room than the other two. Dealing with the front desk resources proved to be a challenge, especially with their inability to recognize that their hotel has noise issues. Granted their is nothing the hotel can do now to fix the noise problems without a great expense, which is most likely why they deny that there is an issue. I gave the hotel an overall review of 3 because after changing rooms twice, we finally got a room that we had originally asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Fast paced but well organized”
Reviews.Author: kathykirch51
Reviews.Content: I just love staying here and have stayed here many times. It has all the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas, but yet feel so organized. I luv 24 hr lunch/sandwich counter for that unexpected hunger and the prices are right too. They have 2 starbucks in the casino, that helps on those early groggy mornings.. I feel comfortable, at home and safe and stay here when ever I am in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “gambling trip”
Reviews.Author: ednjane
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in downtown Vegas. The Nugget has a very nice casino with good entertainment and it is walking distance to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: amyde1201
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights to get the 'downtown experience'. This has to be the nicest hotel downtown. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were very comfortable. We only ate at one of the restaurants in the hotel. The food was wonderful! The pool is awesome. There is a water slide that goes through their shark tank. My only complaint is that they were doing construction, so it was a little too loud in the lobby, but we couldn't hear anything from our room. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: dprell
Reviews.Content: Exceptional upgraded rooms. Simply beautiful! The shark tank and slide is an experience in itself. Service was wonderful. We took an 8 and 10 yr old. Caution to parents taking their kids to see the light show later at night.............. don't! Was appauled to see huge women exposing their huge breasts with only pasties covering nipples. Was also appauled to see half naked women and innappropriate commercial type flicks on the lighted big screens. We usually stay at The Orleans for the kids quest, bowling, restaurants and movie theaters when we take the kiddos. That is a perfect family option!

Reviews.Title: “Why stay on the strip?”
Reviews.Author: khanebutt
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed on the strip until we stayed at Golden Nugget in downtown Vegas! It is fabulous! It has been totally re done and is as nice as any hotel on the strip. It has great gambling that isn't crowded, fabulous restaurants, an awesome pool with a shark tank waterside and easy access to many other casinos without getting out in the sun. The Freemont Street Experience is covered for at least 4 blocks! And shows outside every night! I don't ever want to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: tripit10
Reviews.Content: Check-in is traditionally slow, but I'm used to that. We stayed in a Gold Tower room on the 15th floor, overlooking the pool. The room was quiet and clean. I could not receive data communication from my Blackberry to thether to my laptop which was frustrating, as I refuse to pay in-room wi-fi charges. I am hopeful that the hotels in Las Vegas realize that they must provide free wi-fi soon. The television is a nice flat screen but with very few channels. Most of the HD channels were local stations. I utilized the health club facilities which were very nice, for an additional charge. More television stations are available at the health club, and I was able to thether my laptop there, too! We plan to return to the Golden Nugget in September. I hope our stay then is as pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved and would go there again!”
Reviews.Author: Grantparkracefans
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the GN in August. We checked in early in the morning and were able to go right to our room. Later in the day I did notice long lines like others have commented on. We stayed in Carson Tower. It was clean and quiet. The only thing is the beds are small. They are double not Queen size. The beds are very comfortable though!! We did call the desk and they said they are all this size. They sent a roll away up at no charge. We didnt go in the pool but after a lond day we would go back to the motel and sit out by the pool. Not many people out there and nice to just relax. Didn't eat in GN. Went to DuPar restaurant in Golden Gate Casino on Freemont Street. Great food and service! Excellant pancakes in morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rush Tower Area, But...”
Reviews.Author: halo16
Reviews.Content: Easy check in from the Rush Tower Lobby, Parking was no problem. The area by the Rush Tower is nice with all the restraunts etc. The Room was clean, and was nice, a more of a relax vibe than a party vibe in the room. The flaws of the room was very loud plumbing from the other rooms, not sure if this was isolated to our room or what, but was loudest I heard, and I have stayed some dingy places ha! The hallway was loud also but there is a lot of kids for the pool, so no biggie. I would stay there again, I liked it but not sure I would pay as much as I did for the Rush Tower again. Downtown Vegas is the best...Fremont East Rocks! Insert Coins, Beauty Bar, etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower rooms are beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: geezersgirl
Reviews.Content: We choose the Golden Nugget based on an amazing email rate. Staying 3 days in one of the Rush Tower rooms. We used VIP check in which is an extra $25 flat fee. I felt it was worth it just for the fact that we did not have to wait in an extremely long line at check in. We went straight to the VIP lounge and had our keys, coupon book, and a complementary drink all in just a few minutes. They also gave us VIP front of the line passes for the buffet and shows. The rooms are exactly as shown on their website with large bathrooms and flat screens. Our room on the 11th floor had a view of the Fremont Street Experience which was nice but also noisy. After midnight it did get quiet and who goes to bed before midnight in Vegas anyway. The pool area in this hotel is amazing. It is not all that large but it does have a very cool shark tank in the middle of the pool that you can swim right up to and all the way around. The adults only pool on the 3rd level is a fantastic place to get away from all the kids and just relax. There is a charge for a chair or lounger in this area but after 4 it is free. This pool is open until 2am and we loved going up there late at night as it was not crowded at all. The only restaurant we tae at in the hotel was the buffet. The breakfast and lunch we had there was really good. All in all I think it was a great value for the money and a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but also not bad!”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Golden Nugget for the first time, but was a bit dissapointed. The room in the Carson Tower was average....very average! There were cosmetic repairs that were needed and the beds were very hard. I found the room to be on par with a higher priced motel! I actually stayed one night at Circus Circus because I came into town very late and just chose the cheapest room available in Vegas downtown or on the strip. The Circus Circus room was much nicer and the beds more comfortable. This shocked me. On the plus side, the hotel is right on Fremont Street and this allows for easy access. This is a huge plus for those with small children or mobility issues. Also, the pool was incredible! I was with my kids and we enjoyed it very much. The shark tank located in the center of the pool makes for an unique experience. My oldest child also liked the tube slide that travels thru the shark tank. The Golden Nugget may be a good choice if you can get a good deal on a room. Also, if you have kids they will love the pool. It's not a great hotel, but it's also not too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Busy place”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler2010_10
Reviews.Content: The Rush Tower is your best choice of the 3 towers if you don't smoke because it is smoke free. Depending on where your room is located, it can be noisy late into the night. There is loud music from the pool and music from Freemont Street. The higher up you are, the quieter it is. If you don't show up exactly on time, even if you have paid up front and reserved your room, they will give it away. We arrived after our expected arrival time and had to wait until midnight to get a room. They charge a daily fee for internet access, so if you want to use your computer it will cost around $10 a day. Local calls from your room are $1 each. I had problems with cell phone reception in my room, but not all rooms were like that. My parents did not have this problem in their room. The shark tank in the pool is really cool, but don't try and swim there. This pool is to play in, so enjoy it for that. Happy children are jumping around and splashing and people are hanging out in the water drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit far out of strip.”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTeddy
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, but bit far out of main strip. Rooms large but corridors can be noisy with guests and room itself may have noisy air con. Pool area looked good with huge tank with Sharks in, there is a clear enclosed slide that goes through the tank, that people can go down. Casino area noisy but thats to be expected.Car Valet service is very good and efficient. We stayed in Vegas twice on our road trip around California , once here and once in the main strip, although this hotel is lovely, I would recommend staying on main part of the strip as so much more is accessible just outside the door. Having said that taxi's from this hotel are around $15 dollars each way (£10ish), so you can weigh up the pro's/con's.

Reviews.Title: “Suggest avoid”
Reviews.Author: PaulWestcar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of four recently. The hotel is downtown ie several miles fro the centre of things in the old part of Las Vegas. On the positive side children with love the small swimming pool because of the water slide that goes through a tank full of fish & sharks. The Freemont Experience is adjacent & is definitely worth seeing, although I would recommend staying more centrally & visiting one evening. The rooms are large & the buffet breakfast is excellent & reasonably priced. On the negative side, there is not much to see locally & the area is a bit seedy. There is a good shopping area about a 20 minute walk away but no good restaurants nearby. I was irritated because the hotel offers a price match deal but clearly has no intention of honouring it. They promise to price match if you can book cheaper indirectly. I managed to do this & filled in all the forms they requested. They resolutely refused to refund the difference & wasted a lot of my time. This hotel is still quite cheap but you can get good deals on the Strip. We stayed centrally at Treasure Island for a little more money later on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME I LOVE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaWorld17
Reviews.Content: Okay first if all the golden nugget is just plain awesomeness! I mean first you have the pool to swim in all day that Has the funnest pool ever! It has a tunnel that you go through with sharks! Then at night you get free Entertainment because you walk Luke right outside the front doors and Ba-Boom FREMONT STREET!! I mean come on plain awesomeness right there!! YOU MUST GO IF YOUR IN VEGAS!

Reviews.Title: “What a Rush!”
Reviews.Author: R77556
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at South Point (reviewed earlier) and two nights at the new Rush Tower in the Golden Nugget. We were upgraded to a sute with a Strip View on the 17th floor. More on that later. You know that you are in an upscale place when you walk into the lobby and there's a massive fish tank. The lobby is bright, cheerful and well decorated. After a quick check in we were given our room keys and directions to the elevators. I have to say that walking down the hall to our room seemed like walking down the middle of a nuclear submarine. The decor was grown & gold lit by red bulbs. I half expected to hear a klaxon and the order to "DIVE" at any minute. The term "suite" is actually a misnomer. It's actually one very large and nicely decorated room with a very large bathroom. Part of the room held the kingsize (and very comfortable) bed and a couch separated the bed area from the sitting area. Two large flat screen TV's hung on the walls. One facing the bed and one facing the sitting area. The bathroom was large and beautiful with thick and thirsty towels and nice shampoos/conditioners. The tub was large and deep with sliding glass doors. Because it was so deep, getting in and out of the shower was a bit of a challenge. Golden Nugget would be wise to install a grab bar before someone falls getting out. The only other odd thing about the bathroom was that the toilet was in a tiny separate room. What used to be called a "water closet." But the room is so small that it was like taking care of business in a phone booth. What you get here is what you would expect from any of the major resorts on the Strip. But because it's located downtown it's significantly less expensive. We normally get to Las Vegas a couple of times a year, but it had been a while since we had gone during the month of August. I was surprised to see so many kids out on Fremont St. And I'm not talking teenagers. I'm saying toddlers to tweens out side at 10 - midnight. and even as late as 1 AM. None of my business really, but you have to start wondering about the style of parenting going on. Okay - end of rant. The Rush tower at the GN is beautiful, new and classy. I would also highly recommend seeing Gordie Brown who now has his own theater in the GN. Great, high energy and spot on impersonations in a very comfortable venue.

Reviews.Title: “Nix the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat09
Reviews.Content: After reading some good reviews on the Golden Nugget on TripAdvisor we booked our vacation thru US Airways Vacations. I called the hotel a few days beforehand to make sure they had record of us and to let them know my "significant other (SO)) has severe asthma and that we would need a non-smoking room. They indicated that it would be no problem. When we arrived late the night of check-in (around 11 pm) we followed signs all over the hotel for our particular "tower". Since there was no sign of a concierge or baggage handler we were dragging our luggage with us. We were exhausted, especially since we were on eastern time (it was 3 am). Needless to say we weren't too happy when we find the check-in counter and it's closed!! We then have to schlep our stuff back all thru the hotel to another counter. When we go to check-in we're told there are NO non-smoking rooms available in our tower at the price we paid. We were then told we could pay an extra $113 for 5 days for an upgrade to another "tower". No 'We're sorry" or "We can do this for you.." It was basically "That sucks for you that you have asthma." Not a good first impression that's for sure! So we paid the extra $ and here's a little list of what we encountered, pros and cons: Cons: *TV did not work *Bathroom sink clogged up *Toilet has metal bar so close to left side you bang your arm on it everytime you sit down!!! Plus lefties beware. You can't wipe your b--- with your dominant hand! How crazy is that? The bathroom was not handicapped accessible so not sure what purpose this bar served. * Detachable showhead was mounted halfway down the shower wall. We had to duck to get our head under it to wash our hair. Neither of us are over 5'9" so height isn't an issue on our end. *Some towels were normal, some were threadbare *In room coffee was a Keurig with 4 pods. If you wanted more than 4 it was another $11!!! Bring your pods! *Iron didn't work *Digital bedside clock was the most annoying, outrageously bright blue display I've ever seen in my life!!! We had to cover it up w/ a towel each night. *The AC in the wall was like a freight train coming thru when you turned it on. It cycled on and off all night. We had earplugs and it still kept us awake. Also the room was extremely dry. Do what we did, don't buy the $7 in room spring water and walk down the street to Walgreens and get a whole case for $5! *Internet was $13 a day! Even the Starbucks in the lobby didn't have free wifi. We heard a lot of people complaining about this. *No fitness center. We heard there was one, we never saw it and the hotel brochure said there was a charge. *Don't believe the hype that the location was better than the Strip. It cost $7 a day to go back and forth on the bus to the Strip, where we went every day. Many times we had to stand on the return bus trip because of overcrowding . Plus it took forever because of all the stops. Cabs were out because we heard they were at least $25 one way. I would say the only plus is if you rent a car, as we did for 2 days, you can get in and out of the area pretty quickly. *The pool was packed and by the afternoon the water was gross!! Cloudy and dirty looking. Unless you're a swimmer you can't get up close to the shark tank, which was very cool. * We ate at the strip and all the great restaurants we had heard of so not much to report on the restaurants. We did have a turkey club sandwich in the Carson Street Cafe. I asked if it were real turkey and they told me absolutely! When it came it was nasty old turkey roll! Pros: *The bathroom looked as if it had been renovated. It had nice terrazzo tile throughout. *The bed, bedding and pillows were all really comfy. The pillows were really small tho. *Calls for maintenance were answered very promptly and the workers that came to our room were very nice. Sorry the pro list is so small but there really isn't much good to tell you good about this hotel. I consider myself very open minded and have traveled a lot, both domestic and internationally, being a trip leader for a local travel group. All that travel has made me very aware of what makes for a nice hotel stay. This one just didn't cut it!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VICAROUNDTHEWORLD
Reviews.Content: I go at lest once a year to Vegas and stayed in a lot of hotel but the Golden Nugget is the best place. Every time i go to Vegas i rent a car so i can stay downtown and go to the strip staying in the strip could b cool but can be expensive too. So if u dont have a problem driving Golden Nugget its the place to be

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise! Wonderful Room, great pool!!”
Reviews.Author: paulala
Reviews.Content: When you go to Vegas you usually have two choices; a lower priced hotel with average accomodations or an expensive one with luxury. Well, now you can have both!! The Golden Nugget is a low priced hotel with an impressive selection of rooms. When we first booked I did so because we wanted to go to Vegas but our budget wouldn't allow a lot, so I wasn't expecting too much. I figured we would just make do. I chose the Rush tower because it was the newer one and also paid the extra one time fee of $25 to get VIP check-in, (well worth it). When we walked into the room my jaw dropped. It was not exactly the minimal room I expected. It is full of rich woods and dark colors,with great lighting and a large flat screen. The bed was beyond comfortable with enough pillows and a down comforter. Our friends upgraded to a suite and it was astounding!! You walk into living room with two big couches, a dining room table, a bathroom, a sit in front of bar, and oh yeah, a winding staircase that goes upstairs to the bedroom!! I have never seen such a beautiful hotel room! I kept remarking how you could probably rent this room for the same price of a regular room at one of the high end hotels there. The casino is also very nice. You can still play $5 blackjack and the employees are all very pleasant. We spent a great deal of time in the pool. Since we all had no children with us we chose the adult pool because the normal pool does have a lot of kids, it was summer break so I'm sure that added to it. The adult pool is above the regular pool and is pretty small but worked just fine. They have cabanas there that they rent but they are not worth the money in the summer because they are too warm. There is a fan inside but there is no cross-ventilation so you won't spend anytime in them. Also there are no umbrellas so you really cannot lay on a lounge chair for very long before you have to get back in the water, which is just what we did. It was a lot of fun. The food at the Nugget is very good. Our favorite restaurant was the Chart House. It is not the most expensive, we avoided that one after looking at the prices on the menu. But the Chart House was fantastic! My husband said they had the best prime rib he has ever eaten and he is a meat and potatoes guy so he knows his beef! This hotel is wonderful and you will not be disappointed! BTW, my exhusband is a Bellagio type, I suggested he go here and he has since exclaimed that he will never go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “STILL GREAT”
Reviews.Author: druhbarnes
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I have stayed at the Golden Nugget and it was great. I booked a sale price room and stayed in the older tower. The room was very clean and up to date. The service was real good too. I know I will stay there again in the future. If you want a 4 star Downtown, this is the only place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBirdsWeAre
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in the Gold Tower of the Golden Nugget. Room was $544 for 4 nights and had 2 Queen beds. Room had a big screen TV and was clean and quiet, with very nice furnishings. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Busy, busy, busy!”
Reviews.Author: Mumnelsk
Reviews.Content: Bit out of the way but a nice hotel, has a great swimming pool with sharks in a tank that you can slide through in a tube! It was a little noisy but service was good. Visit stratosphere, it's really good. Also take gran canyon helicopter ride, it was fantastic, booked through viator.com - excellent service, very reliable. Really good hotel but a little far out of the main strip. Taxis approx. 15dollars. But very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but disappointing in some regards”
Reviews.Author: GoHorsesGo
Reviews.Content: Apparently in the minds of the GN management team there is no need for bellman at the airport shuttle drop-off area! It is a hike from the airport shuttle drop-off area to the check-in area for the Gold Tower. And could you run that by me again why they prefer to have separate check-in areas at each tower? Not only is it a hike from the airport shuttle drop-off area to the Gold Tower check-in area, but hotel personnel seem far too busy (or at least pretend) to answer questions about where the check-in area is located. OVERALL NOT IMPRESSED WITH THAT LITTLE CHECK-IN GAME! I had a VIP room in the Gold Tower and of course finding the VIP check-in was even more fun and I might have enjoyed the hunting game more had I not had to drag my bags with me since bellman are not available. The room key card did not work properly, well at least what I might consider properly and I will admit my standards might be a tad higher than those personnel employed by the Golden Nugget. One would expect a key card to open the door on the first attempt, ok maybe the second, but having to shove the card in and out of the door 5 or 6 times each trip does seem a tad extreme. Yes, I had the key cards changed out the next day but the same issue continued and of course the maids (or whatever the politically correct job title is these days) thought it was funny. Me, NOT SO MUCH. The room was nice but the need of the hotel personel to use the telephone message service as an annouching/advertising system for their gaming tricks was pretty low class, as a matter of fact it does not get much lower. And they actually think we customers are stupid enough to believe that in 2011 they do not have the ability to limit what rooms they choose to abuse the telephone message service! I did not eat at the buffet as I read previous reviews and was not impressed, but I did eat at the Carson City Cafe and The Grotto and bother get high marks. I stayed downtown as I wanted to experience firsthand up and close the Fremont Street Experience and that was well worth staying at the Golden Nugget. But I suspect on future trips to Las Vegas I will choose to stay at a hotel on the Strip. You had your chance Golden Nugget and you blew it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but disappointed in "upgrade"”
Reviews.Author: FlyaBonanza
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at GN last weekend before checking into another resort on the strip. I had prepaid for a rush tower suite through a promo sent directly from GN. We checked in quite late and were told that we would be ugraded to a fabulous gold club room in the gold tower. I had researched the rush tower and was very excited to experience this new wing. We weren't asked if we wanted a different room, we were "told" that we had been upgraded. Having never stayed at GN, I trusted that the upgrade would exceed what I had read and heard about the rush tower rooms. When we got off the elevator on the gold club floor, it looked like a hurricane had torn through the hallway. The bowls of candy and treats were strewn all over and there was trash including empty cups on the floor in hallway. Our room was ok, but quite dark. The view out our little window was of a brick wall! The next morning, we explored the rush tower and one of the housekeepers showed us a king room as well A suite (which I had paid for). Both rooms were new, beautiful with floor to ceiling windows. I was really disappointed that I didn't insist on the rush tower suite that I had pId for. Oh well...live and learn. On the upside, Grotto has excellent pizza. The layout of the resort was decent and the property overall seemed to be well maintained. The shark tank was also neat, but the pool area was quite congested. Overall, I believe the GN is probably the nicest resort downtown, however buyer beware of "upgraded rooms/towers" as the quality of room greatly varies.

Reviews.Title: “Completely surprised!”
Reviews.Author: dmforce
Reviews.Content: We booked our $41 room (two doubles, standard) ONLY to use the Golden's pool for the day. Didn't expect to stay as we had a condo on the other end of the strip. We were completely surprised as to how nice the room was! Very clean, didn't not smell of smoke as expected. The hotel pool is outstanding with shark tank, waterslide and adult-only cabana pool/bar. We would definitely stay at Golden Nugget on a future "cheap" trip. Buffet was good for a buffet too.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: fiscalini
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal Golden Nugget fan forever. Discovered it years and years ago when I decided to take the train from Los Angeles to Las Vegas. Amtrak no longer offers that route, sadly. It was actually walking distance from the downtown depot (in those days, luggage with wheels was NOT the norm so carrying my heavy suitcase seemed laborious! But worth it.) I 've stayed there through thick and thin, even before the amazing renovations. Finally had enough 'points' to get a free room. FINALLY! Disappointed when the front desk gal so urgently recommended that I accept the Carson Tower (older) than the other newer choice. Both choices valid for a free night. There was so much dust behind the head of the bed, it had transformed into thick chalky powder. So I cannot assume they use vacuums there! But worst of all, one could not call out without a room charge for a simple 1-800 # Can you believe that? I had to go down to the oh-so noisy-lobby to use the payphone (with nonstop prattle on the overhead speakers above), people rushing by , noisy, noisy, noisy. Well, that was nothing compared to the 24 hour Carson Cafe. Certainly has gone down in quality. Service slow. Had to flag down wait staff every time. Quite the disappearing act. And a simple teriyaki rice bowl awash in so much thick soy that it no longer had any taste - neither the chicken, nor the rice. I don't know how the watiresses and waiters get by on their tips...with their version of customer service! And the access from I-15. Don't get me started. If that doesn't give an out-of-towner a coronary I don't know what will! Switch lanes to the left - switch lanes to the right , avoid Hwy 215 accidents fi you can. Good luck, we get stuck every time. Try to figure out what lane to merge to, to access 93/95. Quick - right lane! Quick! Exit! Sheesh! And that's just getting there. Arrivng in 105 heat, and the valet staff just stares at you. Like you know where to self park! Continuing north on I-15 I was told to stay in the left lane (south) to turn to the right side (north). Really, there are SO MANY OTHER HOTELS in Las Vegas to choose from. Consider carefully. Save your money, even though the Golden Nugget seems so reasonable, it's the memory that will haunt you, not the amount you paid or did not pay.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Revisited..”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRa
Reviews.Content: I wanted to clarify that DH and I have revisited the Golden Nugget several times since my last review. He had to drag me back the first time but we decided we wanted our room in the new RUSH tower and would gamble elsewhere. We did. It was perfect. The RUSH tower rooms are spacious yet "darker' colors giving it a warm feel. Beautiful, huge bathroom, shower, etc. We have stayed three more times since and even gambled again. I talked to a wonderful NEW pit boss who said the people who were caught being rude had been terminated. GOOD! Hope they never find work in "customer service" again. lol The bartenders were fun again as well as the casino staff for the most part. The pool is amazing as always. DH and I splurged and for 50.00 rented a day bed in the new H2O club (adults only area!) on the top deck of the pool area. I HIGHLY recommend it if it is just adults in your party. In July, the main pool area was full of little kids..of course though when you have that beautiful aquarium and water slide ..it's to be expected. Get up and out there early if you want a chair in the main area. Feel free to ask away ...we have been to Vegas several times a year. This was our second trip this year (also stayed on the Strip at Luxor) and going back to run the 1/2 marathon in December if not sooner. Enjoy and don't sweat the small stuff! IT'S VACATION!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good!”
Reviews.Author: josh_taylor_henderso
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Vegas. We chose the Golden Nugget because we liked the idea of staying downtown. Our room was in the Rush Tower. Opening the door to the room was a wonderful surprise. What expected to be a run-of-the-mill hotel room turned out to be a surprisingly well-appointed and spacious affair.
