Clean, large, and comfortable. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and dinner in the Chart House off the lobby was easy and delicious. The only improvement I might suggest would be a free shuttle to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool area is a unique attraction!”
Reviews.Author: Jon T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week...at super-discounted 'Internet' rates. The 'regular' rooms are quite spacious, so you don't need to upgrade to the premium towers, in my opinion. Ate most breakfasts and dinners at the hotel's buffet -- a late 'breakfast' held me until dinner easily! The waitstaff were really nice and welcoming. The Casino/Hotel is right on Fremont Street, downtown...where the 'Experience' sound and light show, plus other stage entertainment each night was great fun, and free! The best part of the place is the swimming pool...shaped like a huge donut, with a 3-story aquarium in the middle, stocked with tuna and sharks. You feel like you're swimming with the fish...as the glass wall seems to disappear when you look from underwater. A free water slide runs through the aquarium, too! On an upper level is a smaller pool and bar that feels like your own private club...there is plenty of sundeck space on multiple levels around the pools. Next to the pool is a large hot tub...open until 1 AM for a late nite soak! Al in all, a change from the frenetic pace of the Strip...great for families, couples or singles -- young or old!

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable experience... not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: S B
Reviews.Content: Wanted to experience the Rush Tower and Shark Tank, which was being built/renovated during my honeymoon at the Golden Nugget in 2006. I was so impressed with the GN during that visit, I convinced my female friend to stay at the GN for a couple of days during our vacation! My reservation was for 2 double beds in the Rush Tower. Upon check-in, I was informed that only rooms w/ king size beds were available (they only have about 11 rooms w/double beds). We open the room door--GORGEOUS! But, we smell sewer. I assumed the room was just recently cleaned and the cleaning person farted before he/she left. Lol, wishful thinking. Hours later, about 8p, showered--huge puddle! Called front desk who sent maintenence to check our room. Apparently, all the caulking on the bottom of the shower doors was gone. Decision made to move us to a "Suite". We had show tickets so we couldn't move at that time. 3:30 am: We're moving from Rush Tower to Gold Tower. Upon arrival--utter disgust. Felt like we were stuck in an Austin Powers movie. Lava lamp, room decorated in multiple colors, stained carpets and walls, one bathroom smelled like mildew. And... a king size bed. I immediately called front desk to speak to manager about dissapointment and to request another room. At first, she couldn't understand why I was so displeased with the "Suite" we were given. I explained the presentaion of the room AND the mildew smell... major downgrade in comparison to the Rush Tower room. She advised me that no rooms available in Rush Tower til later that day and to call back to speak to manager. Hours later, I explained the whole situation to Orion (manager) who states no room available yet. He was extremely rude, unempathetic and acted like I was inconveniencing him with my situation. He advised me to call back later for an available room. Again, we had tickets for another show... we returned at about 3am and decided to remain in the room since we were checking out in about 8 hours anyway. Upon checkout, updated another manager of situation. (Apparently, they don't communicate at the GN.) This manager acted like I should've been thankful that the first night was "comped" and that I would only be charged for the second night. I argued that my intentions were to stay at the Rush Tower and that my secondary accomodations were unsatisfactory. He agreed to charge me the lowest price they charge at the GN. Also, I booked my reservation online, after receiving an e-mail advertising "One Sweet Deal". It promised 2 breakfast buffets, 4 welcome cocktails, 2 for 1 show tickets and 2 for 1 ice cream. I didn't receive those gifts during check-in and when I mentioned that to the woman at the front desk, she stated that I did not make my reservations using that deal. Why would I lie??? I still have the e-mail. We finally checked out of the GN and in to NY NY. That's when the enjoyable part of my vacation began. P.S. Our last day in Vegas, we had breakfast at the Wynn hotel--Terrace Point Cafe. Most enjoyable experience. Made me wonder... is the Golden Nugget the "orphan child" or the "black sheep" of the Wynn hotels? In 2006, I was extremely impressed with the Wynn hotels. 2011... not anymore! BTW... Shark tank was beautiful, beds in both rooms were VERY comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Glad we picked the Nugget and the Rush Tower!!”
Reviews.Author: SKLMT
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Golden Nugget is extremely accomodating. We stayed in a junior corner suite in the Rush Tower, and it was elegant, spacious, relaxing and quiet. While in Vegas, people generally spend very little time in their rooms, but when I get to the room, I appreciate the peacefulness as opposed to the constant stimulation of the casinos, entertainment, etc. This room is your ticket for that! The beds provide a good night's sleep and the shower was invigorating. We will definitely stay at the Rush Tower again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: trueblue001
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Nugget in a Parlor Suite, located in the Gold Tower. Had a half price deal for a midweek stay, with VIP check in. Wed/Thurs night. This was a two room suite, which was spotless. Two bathrooms, one with a shower, the other with a deep jetted tub. Wet bar with a nice half size refrigerator. 40 inch flat screen in each room. Robes and slippers to boot. Old style ac units which worked fine. Also a great mp3 set up/sound system. Living room quite comfortable, as was the bed. This was a concept suite called the Vegas Baby. They also have another called The Scarlett. Excellent maid service, chocolates left at night. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and outgoing. Pool area was great. Did reserve loungers at the Hide Out pool for 20pp, well worth it, adult pool area, no kids. Dined at Vic and Anthony's. Fantastic steak dinner and service. Loved everything at the Nugget. Had some luck in the casino as well. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Cattle”
Reviews.Author: ncrjamie
Reviews.Content: (Couple in our 40's.) I wrote a prior review last year which was a good one for the GN. gave them the benefit of the doubt when they screwed up my reservation, although upon my recent visit I will give them a bad review. Sorry, but you really gotta get the customer service back on track here, it's definitely going south. Booked a free weekend with their promo few months in advance. Was asked which room I wanted. Ok, I'll take Gold. Gold is midrange between Rush and Carson room. I only chose it because I stayed there last year, and I was comfortable in knowing where to walk navigate, ect. I checked in, and was told "too bad no more rooms left, we put you in a Carson room" Now, not that these rooms were particularly bad, they are ok. The fact is you have the balls to ask me what I want, I tell you, then you pull the rug out from under me when I get there. Do you honestly know how I felt (with a grand of cash in my pocket by the way-hey I just got there) being downsized upon arrival? Well, I will tell you how I felt. I checked in my Carson room, walked downstairs and across the street to another casino. Played there all three days as a matter of fact. Thanks for the free room. Had you kindly informed me it is first come first serve, no problem. But you didn't and I felt like, well you know what. Anyways, the check in line is LONG. Bring some lunch with you by the way while you wait. The pool is not even worth going to anymore. Way overcrowded for my taste. Just out of control. The customer service is extremely lacking as well. But I gotta give a thumbs up to the sports book (Asian?) guy. I did play a few horse races, and he was very helpful in helping me bet (Im still a rookie) Good team in that dept! It's nice to see people like that working. I would go back to play race betting because of the great service I got. All in all, probably would choose another hotel. I also got a promo for El Cortez that week. They actually UPGRADED my room without me even asking! And, of course, I reciprocated by playing in the casino. Win-Win situation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Secret Gem”
Reviews.Author: dansterboy01
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I have always stayed on the strip. I wanted to try something different this time to Las Vegas. My plane arrived at 7:15am from Honolulu. I was sure that I could not get a room that early. I was wrong. I walked up to the front desk and was immediately treated to a fantastic greeting, good morning and even an upgrade from my original reservation. From check in to check out. I had a great time. Thank you Golden Nugget. My new home in Las Vegas!!! VIVA!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to be back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: princessmomof3
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on our flight and hotel and were extremely happy with everything! We loved the pool area and the sharks, we just wish we had more time to enjoy it! We had so much to see in 4 days. Next time we plan to go longer and spend lots more time relaxing at the pool!! The front desk staff were very helpful and very friendly!! We loved it and we love staying on Freemont Street!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay.”
Reviews.Author: beneve97
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1:00-1:30 pm There was a lot of people checking in but the line only took 15 minutes. We asked for a free upgrade but we were told nothing on that day. We got the Carson tower room which was spacious and clean. Nothing spectacular about it, but for only $49 a night for a four star hotel was a great deal. We didn't ask for our room to be cleaned so we only asked for new towels and shampoo with no trouble. Overall the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas has pass my expectation.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in the heart of downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: poetrypartners
Reviews.Content: Downtown Vegas suffered from a seamy reputation in the past, but efforts to improve the area in more recent years seem to be paying off. The Golden Nugget shines as an example of downtown's rehabilitation and provides a fantastic alternative for people who want the Vegas experience without having to deal with the over-the-top scene and crowds of the Strip. When you walk into the Golden Nugget's lobby, you are greeted with very attractive and tasteful decor and a reception area that is on par with nicer business hotels. The hotel rooms have been renovated recently and are large, comfortable, and clean. I'm particular about the comfort of beds, and the king-size bed in our room was one of the better ones I've slept in at a hotel. Even though there were several groups in the hotel, including teams in town for a sports tournament, the hallways and room were quiet, and we didn't have any problems with noise. The bathroom is well stocked with the typical shampoo, soap, and lotion -- nothing fancy, but more than adequate. The Golden Nugget's pool is small by Vegas standards (especially compared to the large pool complexes of Strip hotels), but the facility is one of the nicest in town, more like a lounge than a pool. There are oodles of very comfortable cushioned lounge chairs to sun on, and there are many areas arranged into conversational, living room-like alcoves, which are great if you are at the pool with a group. The pool features a shark tank in the middle, so you can swim alongside marine animals and even slide through the tank down the Golden Nugget's popular water slide. There is a quieter pool for guests aged 16 and older, but we didn't go there on this particular visit. The Golden Nugget offers several attractive dining options. We had dinner at Vic and Anthony's steakhouse, and this was one of the best meals I've had all year -- definitely worth the price! We also had breakfast at the buffet, which didn't feature anything particularly noteworthy but had a good selection and wasn't expensive. Locationwise, the Golden Nugget can't be beat. Its location in the center of Fremont Street gives easy access to the Fremont Street Experience, the zip line, the other casinos, and great peoplewatching. We were very happy with our stay at the Golden Nugget and will definitely be back. While we like the Strip and all the energy and entertainment it has, there are times that we just want to enjoy a more classic Vegas, gamble a bit, and get our drink on -- the Golden Nugget is the perfect place to do just that.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: buzzboles
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is truely a jewel in Downtown Vegas. It may not have the Vegas Strip at its front door but the night entertainment on Fremont Street is really great. The hotel itself is very clean and well updated. Most of all it is a really a good deal on room rates. So bang for the buck is there. Also I broke even on my gaming so with the comped drinks I left feeling like a real Vegas winner.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I will go back.”
Reviews.Author: arizonanative46
Reviews.Content: Got good rate on internet. Plus. Check in lines ridiculous. Minus. Room large and clean, comfortable beds. Plus. Restaurants, expensive; not that good either. Minus. Attitude from staff mostly minus. In casino couldn't find anyone to fix malfunction on machine for at least 15 minutes. Then she acted like she was doing me a favor. Crowds like Disneyland. Huge minus. Overall, too many people to enjoy even walking around. Never got to the pool to go in the slide; the line was ridiculous. My sister had room 937 in the Gold Tower and could not sleep because of the noise from the parties on Freemont St. We were in 902 and it was really quiet, except for late nite people in the halls. Overall, I don't think I will go back unless they send some really fantastic rate; which I doubt will happen.

Reviews.Title: “way done with golden nugget!”
Reviews.Author: ibezo1
Reviews.Content: where do i start. booked rush tower jr. suite room for 3 nights through expedia.com. paid in full for the room stay. got to the rush registration. there were 2 registration clerks but no queue. i will call the clerks right & left for clarity. both were registering people & we became 2nd in line behind left, as there was a 2nd in line behind right. while we waited right completed the 1st & 4 more registrations with people still behind them. finally it was our turn to be registered on left. but, rather than greeting us, she looked at the people next in line on right saying 'are you next'? she never apologized for her error. later, it the casino i was approached by someone who witnessed the event. even she was incensed. the room looked beautiful. the bed was comfortable. coffee available is $10 for 4 cups. lighting was not well done, either too bright or ineffective to the space. the walls were paper thin. it sounded like a bar band was playing in the next room till nearly midnight each night. because of this & more irritations during our stay we wanted to check out a day early. i called expedia.com who called golden nugget to requested a refund. ??Carmen?? told expedia it was not golden nugget's policy to make any refund. golden nugget had the nerve to ask if i wanted to check out (letting them keep my money).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location - lots to do on Freemont”
Reviews.Author: LWeirHalifax_Canada
Reviews.Content: The shark tank in the center of the pool was so cool. Great for pics. The pool is shaped like a donut with the shark tank as a cylnder in the middle. There is room in the back for shade. Make sure you go early in the morning to reserve your chair with a towel. It gets full by 10ish. The pool can be pretty busy from 12 - 3pm Not a lot of room to move. If you like Bingo they have it over at the Las Vegas Club across from the Nugget 11, 1 3 5 7 and 9pm We had breakfast about 5 min from GN at Fitzgeralds for only 2.99 you get a hot breakfast of eggs, hashbrowns, toast and bacon. Free refills on drinks. We also went back for supper $4.99 hot chicken platter -portion size is good and very tasty food. The ZipLine was a lot of fun my mother is 63 and she did it - $15 before 6pm a great experience. Lots of entertainment starting at around 6pm until 12am. Very busy streets. The room was beautiful we stayed in Carson Towers..Just beautiful.very clean. Fast checkin and good service. On checkout we even got new keys to continue using the pool etc until we were ready to leave. Recommend seeing Freemont first before the new strip..1 night/day was enough to see everything. We took the Deuce bus $7/24 hr pass from the GN up to Harrahs hotel Only a 10 min driove. The bus stops on Freemont 2 min walk from Golden Nugget Dont take a taxi to Free mont or you'll pay $40+..instead take the shuttle bus from the airport or Deuce bus for only $7 you wont regret it

Reviews.Title: “Oy, Worst Parking Ever-Especially if you have a nice ride”
Reviews.Author: inoitall
Reviews.Content: Came back to the hotel one evening at midnight, not exactly late by Vegas standards to find there was no valet parking. They were full. Alright, I will do self parking- no problem. Drove up and down garage for 20 minutes , no parking. Go to the gate and the attendant says, here , you can go to our "overflow" parking lot, and hands me a ticket to put on my dashboard. When I question her, I find out this lot is a quarter of a mile away, down a creepy street, across another street in some wilderness. So when I ask why can't a valet drive my car and park it there for me, I am told they can't because "it is not hotel property". ! I have 3 rooms at this hotel for 2 nights....and the only place to park my car is in some open space a quarter of a mile away from where I am staying. After complaining to manager he offered to comp me breakfast...mind you I had already received coupon for this on check in. If you are driving a nice ride, be warned....I have a old car and I was freaked out....

Reviews.Title: “shark tank slide a big hit”
Reviews.Author: warywoman
Reviews.Content: The Golden nugget was a very nice hotel. We stayed there one night because the kids wanted to use the slide that went through the shark tank. It is very clean and modern and was also quiet. There are places to sunbathe around the pool and shark tank. The beds were great with a more modern decor. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mr_St_Kav
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel in a 2 1/2 star location. I love Downtown Vegas as much as the strip so the location was no problem for me. There are great deals in the casinos around the Golden Nugget such as $10 lunch buffets, $2 Coronas, $3 blackjack, $1 Nathan's Hot Dogs, and $1 deep fried twinkies just to name a few. The Golden Nugget itself does not offer any great deals. It is the only 4 start hotel in the area, so you can expect to pay regular prices like $22 for the dinner buffet or $5 for a beer by the pool. Also during prime gambling hours, tables had $10 minimum bets. The hotel itself is in great shape. There are times you forget you are in downtown Vegas until you walk outside. There are marble floors, clean carpets, and a few Starbucks in there. I named my own price on Priceline.com and got a room for Thursday and Friday night for $64 per night (saved $30 from what the GN website wanted). Check-in and check-out were slow so be prepared for that. My room was spacious and clean and well worth the $64 per night. The decor of the room is modern with a 42" flat screen, vanity mirror, and marble tops on the counters. The pool is one of the best features of the Golden Nugget. There is small fish tank and water slide in the pool area. I counted 4 sharks total in the tank. I also went down the slide which was great fun (and I wasn't the only adult doing it!). The pool does get crowded so I would suggest going in the morning or after 4pm. Overall, the pool is a mix of all ages from kids to seniors. There is also a "private" pool on the third floor that costs $20 to get into. However, it's free after 5pm and that's a great time to go to get away from all the commotion at the pool downstairs. This private pool is also open until 2am which is a pretty rare thing in Vegas. If you are on a budget, downtown Vegas and the Golden Nugget is certainly the place for you. I would also suggest it for families with children as the downtown area (Fremont Street) is rather self-contained and offers many activites like zip lining and free concerts.

Reviews.Title: “Big Crickets, in Spa Tower Suite”
Reviews.Author: only1nacho
Reviews.Content: We came for a week for our Wedding anniversary the first week of August. We checked into the Spa tower suite which was 9D and two floors. We heard some really loud noises from downstairs and we thought it was a broken fan. We went down to check it out and found the biggest black cricket I have ever seen. We looked around the room for a min. before calling the front desk and found 4 more in two min. We had to move rooms at 1:30 in the morning and it was more than inconvenient to say the least. They moved us next door and comped us 1 night stay. We went down in the morning and spent an hour of our time arguing with management about how one night comp didn't make up for our trouble... day shift manager was a real treat to deal with and wouldn't even give us comp buffet before we flew out that day. When you're spending up to 400 a night for a week in Vegas, I would expect a lot more from the facility to make your trip most enjoyable and would least expect to get huge bugs in our room. I will not go back and it is very unfortunate because we loved the pool and the Freemont experience.

Reviews.Title: “Feel of the Strip without the headaches”
Reviews.Author: inzombiac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of our 2 week cross country trip in early June. After driving for 4000 miles we wanted to treat ourselves to a nice suite to end our journey and the Golden Nugget did not disappoint. We stayed in the Gold Tower and were blown away by the room, the amenities, and the VIP service we received. We always stay downtown when traveling to Vegas, but never had stayed at the Golden Nugget before. Our room was far enough up in the tower that we weren't bothered by the Freemont Street Experience, the pool was fantastic although we couldn't get access to the adults only section because they were at capacity. We had no problem getting seats and towels at the pool and it was a relaxing experience. Our only complaint was the fact that there didn't seem to be any security there checking to see if the patrons were actually guests of the hotel, locals, or guests of other hotels. Several people I spoke with at the pool were actually Vegas residents. I think they should crack down on this a bit to ensure their guests have access to the services they deserve. The room and bathroom were more than adequate and we felt like we were being treated as VIPs during our stay. The buffet was great, the casino had a great vibe, and the service was fantastic. We would definitely hit up the Golden Nugget again. Like I said, the Golden Nugget has the feel of the Strip, without being overloaded by the tourists and mass of humanity that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: blacksheepfan
Reviews.Content: We just had our first 'couples' trip to Vegas becuase our kids are old enough to stay at home and would rather do that than hang out with mom and dad. We stayed at the Golden Nugget about 4 years ago for a wedding and loved it then so we decided to stay there again after getting an email for a special rate. I booked the Rush Tower, which was a treat for us because we usually just book the cheapest room. WOW. What a room we got! We had a 'strip' view room on the 18th floor. Granted most of the strip is blocked by, well, the strip, but it was facing the direction of the strip and the view with the mountains was grand. Our room was huge. The bathroom had a double sink, a large tub and toilet in room separated with a door. Plenty of room for the two of us to move around without being in each other's way. The room was beautifully decorating and very posh for us. A deliciously comfortable king sized bed, an 'L' shaped sofa by the window, a nice entertainment center with a big flat screen tv. The safe was very easy to use. We hardly heard a peep from anyone. Only heard our neighbors shower one time. No noisy guests or housekeepers. The drapes totally blocked out the sun in the morning. We were in a quiet, relaxing paradise. With 4 elevators in the tower we hardly ever waited for one. Our package came with two coupons for free drinks, which we used while watching a baseball game and two coupons for the breakfast buffet which was delicious. The best coffee I've ever had at a hotel. We did not use the spa coupons, no time. And we did not use the 2 for one show tickets deal as we opted to see George Wallace at the Flamingo...hilarious. All in all a great two night stay and we would definitely pay extra to stay in the Rush Tower in the future. Here is our special tip for meals...the Triple 7 Brewery in the Main St. Station Casino is the BOMB. The BEST food downtown and so reasonable. We at dinner here both nights. They have a large selection of their own beer. Happy Hour M-F is from 4pm to 6pm. ON the first night we were in time for happy hour and my husband's beer was 2 bucks and we got a huge basket of calamari for 5 bucks. My husband had the Ceasar salad and I had the Oriental Chicken Salad for dinner. The portions are gigantic. Most dishes are under $10. The second night we sat at the bar and my husband had the mushroom burger which came with a mountain of fries and I had the two fish tacos. The best fish tacos I've ever had in my life. They are big and very filling. To get to the 777 from the Golden Nugget, exit the GN onto Freemont street, Walk to the casino on the far north west side of the street. Enter that casino and exit it on the far north east side of the casino. You need to exit, cross the street and enter the California Casino, go up the escalator and over the pedistrian bridge to the Main St. STation. This will keep you cool and I think a bit safer than walking the whole way out on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area”
Reviews.Author: LoLaIreland
Reviews.Content: Swimming pool was the best part of the hotel, water slide that goes through a shark tank. As it was December when we stayed it wasn't that warm for swimming but we made the most of it. There are hot tubs too and a pool bar. Hotel itself not located on the strip which I wouldn't reccomend doing. The hotel was nice but you are out of all the action and it wasn't that cheap for taxis up and back.

Reviews.Title: “Ups & Downs but maybe the best on Fremont st”
Reviews.Author: Vneuman921
Reviews.Content: We transitioned over to the Gold Nugget for a couple of nights at the end of our Vegas trip so we could have fun checking out the Fremont St Experience without having to drive back & forth from the center of the Strip. We were coming from The Cosmopolitan (outstanding hotel-read my separate review) which had totally spoiled us with a top of the line Vegas Hotel experience. That was an awesome hotel! Check in was a nightmare at the Golden Nugget but part of it was my fault. I had read that the newest tower The Rush Tower had it's own separate check in lobby..but I mistakenly went into the Gold Tower Entrance (not clearly marked) where there was a check in desk with a closed sign on it. I asked a girl behind the desk what was up and she said it was closed...had always been closed. I said that the website said it was opened and she said they had never opened it and I had to go all the way around to the front of the Hotel (it's clear on the other side two blocks over) and check in there. Now you think the lady could have told me that there was a beautiful lobby check in about 50 feet over right across the parking lot from the Gold Tower entrance at the new Rush Tower...I mean it's the same hotel right ? could she have asked if I was in the Rush tower? Anyway I drove back around to the front of the hotel and when I got to the check in line there were what seemed like 100 people standing in line. This was Sunday afternoon around 3:00 and we waited 50 minutes to get checked in...only to be told our rooms were clear on the other side of the hotel at The Rush Tower. Imagine how I felt when we finally got over to the Rush tower and I saw their Beautiful Marble lobby with Huge Aquarium behind a long check in counter and about 5 people waiting in line. GRRRRRRR! The Rush Tower rooms are fine..about what you would expect for a 3 star property but kind of dark and not a lot of lighting or wall plug outlets to plug stuff into.We had requested a strip view high up and were given a view of the roof of the parking garage roof...you're really to far removed from the strip for any typ;e of view.. The coffee machine was one of the newer POD type Machines and they were charging $10.00 for 4 cups of coffee if you wanted to use it. They did have a refrigerator which is nice to keep your waters and beers cold. I'm not sure the rooms are worth the extra $30.00 from the Carson tower rooms(we had some friends staying there) but the lobby was a lot nicer and certainly had a lot less people on check in and the rooms were a little bigger with a nice couch/sofa area. The Casino is nice and the restaurants in the hotel are all really nice with a lot of variety (you can see on the web site). We really liked being right on Fremont St cause its a Blast hanging out there at night to party and then being able to just walk right into your hotel from there.. One of the Major drawbacks was the pool area which was packed with people when we first checked in but the next morning when we went out to go play in the pool the Attendant yelled at us... telling us to get out... it did not open until 10:00am!!! Now what the heck is up with that? 10:00am? Lame! Most of the employees working at the hotel were fine but we did run into a few that seemed like they hated life and had no business being in the hospitality industry. At one point I lost my room key and went to stand in line with about 3 couples ahead of me. They had one girl working and she averaged 15 minutes per couple so I waited 45 minutes just to get a new key while a 2nd manager looking guy just roamed around behind the desk not bothering to help the girl. All in all Its fine for what it is but the issue with the pool (two many rooms between the 3 towers for the size of pool & not opening until 10:00am) and a couple of run ins with less than stellar service kind of left a bad taste in my mouth. Having said all that...I would return to the property for a night if I wanted to hang at Fremont St ...but it can't really compare to the other newer center strip hotels. I've heard that the Plaza Hotel at the beginning of Fremont St is undergoing a complete renovation, so who know..maybe that one when it opens again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great atmosphere, awesome pool”
Reviews.Author: mtstang
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget twice now and would go back. We travel to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year and always try different hotels, however we really enjoyed the pool and found the atmosphere fun. Black jack around the pool is great the dealers are very fun and entertaining, make it seem like they enjoy there job. Food is good. i would say if your going to stay down town this is your best bet. After reading some of the other reviews i should include, the first time we stayed we had an upgraded room and it was excellent. This time we went on a long weekend and it was very busy and they said they were sold out so no upgrades were available, i think we had the oldest room,not redone yet, and likely the farthest away from the casino, however other than the long walk to room was great. The bed was super comfortable and everything was really clean and looked after. In Summary, I will stay here again, definitly if you want to be on freemont street, if its your first time to vegas, this will be a good start, unless your into clubbing every night, if so then i would say stay on the strip so you dont have to cab home every night.

Reviews.Title: “If it wasn't for the wedding at the hotel we would have stayed on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: vaso815
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not get things right. Between messing up our reservation, to charging us for a refrigerator that was free, I found things to be non-accomodating. When we asked for 3 towels or pillows, we only got 2. The staff wasn't friendly. The only restaurant worth going to was Lilies, but even they had crazy rules about how to eat there. Their 24 hour restaurant sucked. Buffet was not much better. Beyond that, there is just a lower class of people that stayed there. Couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “FAVORITE HOTEL IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: POMMOM2
Reviews.Content: We love the Golden Nugget, and when possible we always stay there. Besides the lovely and affordable rooms, this place has amazing service, truly good (NOT great) food at a good price and the most wonderful two pools in the city. We love the location for all of the access to fun downtown. Parking is easy and FREE! The only time we stay someplace else is when our conference makes us do it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: derektt1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice, pool and slide is even better. The kids loved it and hopefully we will be back. Fremont Street experience is really something, more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff and reasonable prices at Fremont”
Reviews.Author: coloradojentravels
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget is a wonderful hotel. The prices on Fremont cant be beat and if youre going to Vegas you should experience "downtown" for at least a night or two. Plenty of entertainment there and places to eat. Golden Nugget has a beautiful shark-tank pool....you swim and the pool youre in surrounds an aquarium. There is a fun 2 or 3 story slide that shoots right through the shark tank. Get to the pool at the right time and you might catch a feeding. The 1/2 price ticket booth for shows/restaurants around Vegas is right inside the Golden Nugget, be sure to check there for deals.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the trip, did not enjoy the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marshamell0w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for a girls weekend. I didn't book the room, so I didn't have any preconceived ideas on the hotel/casino. First impression is that it is far from the strip and not worth the money we saved. Taxis to the strip and airport are at least $40, so if you plan on going at least once a day, you might as well pay for a better location. Check-in was super slow. We arrived on a Friday, but only one person was checking in guests. I think we stood in line for about 30 minutes with only 3 people ahead of us in line. The room was clean, but still old and not 'updated' as the website brags about. The pool area is small and full of kids. I'm not complaining about the kids, just an fyi. Since it was a small area, we paid to get into the bar/pool area at the top and it was totally not worth it. It was $20pp and we got chairs in the shade AND the people in charge would not change us to any other open chair!! I don't know if they were reserved, but no one sat in them ever. Moral of the story for us is make sure you know what you are paying for. Speaking of which, if you want to use the fitness facility, it also costs $20. Not the best value/money. The cafe near the enterance has ok cafe food, but the service is very slow. We even left one night after waiting 30 minutes for someone to take our order. We couldn't even find someone to flag down. One bright spot was the steak restaurant 'Vic & Anthony's' - super yummy. It is a bit pricey, but you get the best steak. Sides there are family style so everyone can share. Overall, I was expecting new and clean and modern, but got still smokey, dark and depressing. Sorry Golden Nugget, you just aren't for me.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wonit
Reviews.Content: We checked in July 25th. Following signs to check-in we ran 3 trips back and forth because the Carson tower Desk was closed.It then took 35 minutes of standing in line to get our rooms. My mother has had double knee replacements so we asked for 2 rooms next to each other.how is !504 and1516 close.....not! Another family had the same problem. We had to walk the distance of 2 hallways to get ice. The one close to us was out of service the whole time. Not even a coffee pot in the room. Also how can a place that is SUPPOSED to be the best on Freemont Street be out of washcloths all 4 days. The toilet seat in moms room was loose...glad she didn't fall and break a hip ! You might as well stay on the strip if you want to spend a couple hours of your day walking just to get out of the casino!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation”
Reviews.Author: jessfair
Reviews.Content: We are locals, but every once in a while we like to go down to the strip and pretend we are tourists for the night. We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times! The rooms are updated, the restaurants and bars are nice, and the pool is great. Let's not forget: Freemont Street is right outside!!! GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Going down...”
Reviews.Author: antonitta
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for 20 years! The rooms in the Rush tower are nice, as are the Carson...but don't go to the old tower unless you're toting a cooler full of beer and chewin' tobacco! The Nugget used to be classy and clean. where did the fresh floral arrangements go? When was the last time someone dusted the chandeliers? who cut the menu @ Carson street Cafe! Please someone put the class back in the Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip - Nuggest Stay, So-So”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nuggest wasn't such a hit this go round. Had a much better experience when here November 2010. The service in the restaurants was medicore at best. Customer service doesn't rank high here so be prepared for some frustration when dealing with front desk personnel and especially the various restaurants on site. Rooms were clean and would stay here again but will be eating off site next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Great place...awesome pool...”
Reviews.Author: Traci65
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 days at the Nugget and would go back! Nice pool, especially the upper deck adult pool, got a cabana too...very wonderful. Rush Tower (new) has beautiful rooms. There are a lot of kids, incase that is not your thing, but still very enjoyable. Little cofusing at arrive, hard to find registration, but once we did we got our room hours early.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best bargains around Vegas”
Reviews.Author: drdeger
Reviews.Content: Although the strip is why everyone visits Vegas, the old downtown Freemont Street is fun and a bargain. This is the only hotel we have ever stayed downtown, and will continue to go there everytime. It is nice, clean, and a touch of class without the snobery of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Quality Room!”
Reviews.Author: pecogg
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms in the Carson Tower for two nights in late July 2011. Had always heard that GN was the best hotel Downtown LV, but had never stayed there before. Got a great deal booking during a promotion directly through the GN website. The rooms and accommodations exceeded my expectations. They were comfortable, well decorated / furnished, and very clean! The management and staff does a great job of insuring quality and comfort. The beds, especially (made exclusively for GN, according to what I read in the room), made for a good night's sleep. "The Tank" was great, as was the restaurant (don't have the name) on the first floor, closest to the Carson Tower entrance. Quick access to the casino was also a plus. Parking was a breeze. Will definitely look to the GN for lodging on future Vegas trips!!!

Reviews.Title: “"LOVED IT, THE GEM OF FREMONT"”
Reviews.Author: coco7272
Reviews.Content: Actually Stayed 3 Nights In April & 4 Nights In May 2010. The Rush Tower Rocks! Awesome Time And Looking Forward To Our Next Visit. The Pool Is Fantastic, Staff Are Super-Friendly & Everything Is Reasonably Priced. A Refreshing Change From The Strip. The Spa Exceeded Our Expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: 1nyfan2
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at the Golden Nugget so on our most recent trip to Las Vegas we did just that. We stayed three nights in a room in the recently renovated Rush Tower. The rooms are fabulous...especially the spacious bathroom. The toilet is behind a separate door, there are two sinks and the shower is all glass. The bed is comfortable and the price is right! The Grotto restaurant was a favorite...we went twice during our short stay. Personally we love old Vegas and actually prefer it to the strip. Low minimums on the gambling and everything is nice and close together. The show on Fremont Street is very cool. My only complaint is the pool was packed and all of the chairs were filled. The shark tank is very cool. I highly recommend Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget going downhill fast”
Reviews.Author: forever-lost
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is going downhill fast. We have stayed there many times in the past several years but have noticed an accelerating decline in the hotel recently. Spent one night there in July as we were passing through Las Vegas. The air conditioning in the room rattled so much we could not sleep. The drain in the shower barely drained. I tried to check out using the Express Checkout on the room’s TV, choosing the option to have my bill e-mailed to me. The keyboard where you can type in your e-mail address did not work and there was no way to cancel the checkout process. I called the front desk and explained the situation. The woman said she would e-mail me my bill. She never did. When leaving I still had a cash-out ticket from the slot machine I had played the previous night. The kiosk for cashing the ticket that is near the garage entrance was out of order prompting a long walk over to the main casino to get my money. Steve Wynn would never have tolerated these types of issues. Very sad to see the decline in such a grand old hotel as the Golden Nugget .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hellosunshine_hb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights with two other couples. The staff at the front desk, and housekeeping, were very friendly and efficient. Valet, while always very busy, was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions every day when we left. The main pool "The Tank" is quite small, but the atmosphere is awesome and the lounge chairs are comfortable. Shark tank was really neat - there were always a lot of young kids (very well behaved, for the most part!) surrounding the tank, just staring at the sharks. The pool area was packed every day... if you didn't get there by 9am, there were no chairs to be had. But the upstairs "Hideaway" appeared quite nice and for $10 a person I'm sure it is worth the peace and quiet, if that is what you're looking for. We stayed in the Carson Tower and the rooms were quite nice... standard, with a bonus vanity with lit mirror which was nice. Housekeeping did a great job. Fremont Street is so much fun. There is always a ton of street entertainment, we spent hours just walking around, going in and out of casinos. The Fremont Hotel & Casino has $1 margaritas and $2 Coronas & Heinekens which is WAY cheaper than any bar down on the strip. While I definitely recommend checking out Las Vegas Blvd and the Strip, we found Fremont Street to have so much more character, lots of history in the buildings, and just more of a laid back, fun, relaxed atmosphere. We can't wait to go back and will definitely stay at the Golden Nugget again... the price is right and we didn't have a single complaint. We're probably more easy going than most travellers though :) If you are looking to splurge on the BEST steak you'll ever have in your life, go to Vic and Anthony's. Definitely a splurge for us but totally worth it. I would have paid twice as much for that steak. My husband barely looked up at me the whole time he was eating his, that's how good it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: nandog
Reviews.Content: We were so pleasantly surprised by the professionalism of all employees we encountered at the Golden Nugget. We spent time at the pool, the pool bar, the Grotto restaurant for Happy Hour, had dinner at the sushi restaurant and breakfast at the buffet. All servers were quick, reliable, courteous and knowledgeable. We had been traveling from Montana back to San Diego, so after stopping in a few little po-dunk towns without a lot of competition where service was friendly, but unreliable and often slow, Vegas was such a nice change! The room was really clean and the beds in the Carson tower were super comfortable. The only bummer was our crappy view of the roof of one of the other buildings. Other than that, a great stay after a long, stressful drive! Oh, even the bellhops and valets were helpful in terms of answering questions about Vegas, giving directions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room - food . . . not so much.”
Reviews.Author: Parizienne
Reviews.Content: The short version: Liked; Great Rush Tower room. Lovely pool -- especially the Hideout pool. Quality of spa facial was great. Disliked: Loud substandard Gold Tower room. Horrible restaurant experiences. Service in the spa was not well organized, and as a result I was rushed into the treatment room without the usual wait time beforehand ( and I did arrive early). Parking was a problem. They were full all three nights we stayed. Valet parking was free (except for tipping of course), but even the Valet spaces filled up pretty quickly. Details, Details . . . We arrived very late on a Thursday night. We were booked in a Rush tower room, but it was full when we arrived. So the reservation agent said she would upgrade us to a suite in the Gold tower, and we could change to Rush the next day. When we got to the Gold Tower room, not only was it not a suite, but it was located in a corner unit with the ice machine on one wall and the elevator on the other. The A/C was really noisy and cancelled out the elevator noise, though. Since it was for one night, we didn't make an issue of it -- however, I believe the overstatement of this room being called a "suite" wasn't necessary. We were so tired and it was so late, that we had no trouble falling asleep. Once we moved into the Rush Tower the next day, we were much happier. The whole tower is non-smoking. The room was splendid! We had a view of Las Vegas which was divine at night. The room was clean. I forgot my cell phone cord in the previous room and housekeeping promptly retrieved it and brought it over. The bed was comfy. Didn't like that the in-room coffee was $10 for four cups. You can't buy just one. Didn't like the $7 Fiji water either, but that's Vegas, I guess. We rented a daybed by the Hideout pool on Saturday. It was pricey, but I felt well worth it. We relaxed without kids around. The pool was full, but not jammed. We enjoyed having our place to lounge, and we had a dedicated pool server to keep our drinks filled. The person in charge of ensuring that people who hadn't purchsed seating at the Hideout wouldn't be admitted wasn't very good at her job, but we didn't have any trouble with people trying to take our bed or any of the cabanas or chaises that were unoccupied. They were mainly there to visit others or check out this 16+ pool area. Now -- the food. We didn't like the 24 hour dining options. The Carson Street Cafe didn't offer anything light. And the prices were outrageous. We ate at the buffet on Friday morning at 10:30, and breakfast was over. We used a buy-one-get-one-free coupon and had lunch, although the omelet bar was still available. It wasn't a bargain because the food wasn't that great and there weren't a lot of selections for a buffet. The selections were quite limited. Very little fresh fruit. I liked the carving station and the omelet bar, but I had a hard time finding healthy, fresh choices. I don't eat pasta or potatoes, so I depend on vegetables for my sides, and there were slim pickings. We had breakfast Saturday morning at the Carson Street Cafe. I ordered eggs benedict. WORST ever. The Hollandaise sauce was not right. I think it was either a packaged sauce or it was chicken gravy. Hollandaise should be tangy because it's made with lemon, butter and eggs. This was salty and bland. My husband ordered the Loco Moco. It came smothered in onions which did not match the menu's description. We paid about $40 for our combined meal. Outrageous for food that was neither accurately described nor correctly prepared. We filled out comment cards after because we were outraged at the poor quality and high prices. My spa experience was okay. The aesthetician was great and the facial itself was wodnerful. What I didn't like was that, though I arrived early and did have some wait time before being called into the changing room, someone forgot to call me. When I got to the changing room, I was told to pick any empty locker with a robe in it and place my clothes in there. I changed and did as I was told. I found the robe was too small. I asked an attendant whether I could get a large instead of the medium that I had. She got kind of snippy and said, "That's the 'medium' section. The 'large' section is over here. I'm the one who is supposed to bring people back here!" I explained to her what I was told and apologized. She calmed down a little, but then I had to switch lockers and by the time all this transpired, they were calling me into the treatment room. I didn't have time to drink my juice or relax. Once in the treatment room, the experience was great. I was very happy with the facial treatments I requested. Other than the food, the rush to the spa treatment room and the first night's room in the Gold Tower, we enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget. I would stay there again, but we would not eat in the restaurants. We didn't chance the Chart House or the other restaurants for fear the food there would be just as disappointing as the two in-hotel restaurants we did try. Downtown is different from the strip, and I was glad to visit there again after many years. If you're looking for a stylish room with a great pool, go to the Nugget. Eat at the Four Queens or Main Street Station, though.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget & Downtown Vegas My New Spot”
Reviews.Author: tamaoj
Reviews.Content: Downtown Vegas where have you been my whole life? My girlfriend has a long time friend from the East Coast that travels to Vegas every summer as a tradition. They're both teachers so they have the luxury of not having to work during the summer. So my GF and I decided to meet up with her in LV since it's not that far of a drive from SoCal. We only had two days to stay so I knew the trip would be a quick turnaround. Our arrival day was on a Saturday and our departure day was on Monday. I had to be back at work Monday night. So the decision was made that I would save a little bit of money and try staying in Downtown Vegas for the first time. Based on prices and reviews I chose to stay at the Golden Nugget. The Experience; Upon checking in I was upgraded from a regular room to a suite for no extra charge in their brand new tower. The kicker? I didn't ask for the upgrade nor am I known to be a gambler at any hotel. This room was a really surprising treat. We had a huge bathroom with one of those speacial shower heads that rains down from overhead. Beautiful bathroom counter top too with two sinks. The room had two big flat screen TV's with a sectional leather sofa along with an extra large comfortable bed. Two large windows one facing the pool and other looking out into the desert. GF had a special vanity space and chair just to put on her make up. Everything was a very pleasant surprise at this hotel. The Comparison; My GF's friend was traveling with a male friend of hers who knew the owners son of the Planet Hollywood hotel along with some other hotels in LV so they were comped a room. The room they were staying was supposed to be a suite. Well you guessed it, our room was way better than their "suite". When they came and visited our room they wanted to stay because it was so nice and way larger and decorated better than theirs. Moral of the story. I felt pretty dumb after recalling all of the past years I stayed in Vegas and made a point to stay on "The Strip" because everyone else does it. I wasted lots of money, large minimum buy ins and overpriced everything and missed out on the vintage style and service Downtown has to offer. It was cool to look at all the different people visiting, Europeans, senior citizens, families with kids and thirty somethings like myself who no longer want to pay for overpriced and "mainstream" Vegas. I would call my stay in Downtown Vegas like a visit to Venice Beach Ca. Compared to the times I stayed on the Strip like visiting Newport Beach Ca. I will no longer stay on the Strip unless I absolutely have to. During my stay at the Golden Nugget I only noticed one guy wearing a suit with an open collared shirt on the prowl. That alone is enough for me to keep coming back to Downtown LV.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if you're staying off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Deutschreisender
Reviews.Content: We were here for a soccer tournament, and I'm not a huge gambler, so for us it was more about location and the room. The hotel sits right on Fremont Street Experience covered mall, and has enough of the Vegas flavor but easier in and out to outside activities. The rooms are excellent, nicely decorated with great marble bathrooms (we were in the Carson Tower), not too "Vegas-y" (see their website virtual tour). New super comfy beds. Lots of restaurant choices in the hotel; we had an excellent Italian meal at the Grotto, and had breakfast and lunch at the Carson Street Cafe that were also very good, but standard fare. Starbucks right near the elevators. One of the nice things: in and out self parking in their garage behind the casino, free for guests of the hotel, enter off of Bridger Street. And they have a huge pool area with lots of seating, outdoor bars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: right105
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean and friend room. Very comfortable beds. Free upgrade to Gold tower

Reviews.Title: “The pool is the main attraction”
Reviews.Author: sunnynocal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite dated and the location has its benefits and issues (close to Fremont St Experience but not close to the strip). Overall decent value and not the giant hotels that are common on the strip but i wouldn't stay there again without kids. For kids, on the other hand, it is really good as the pool is fun (esp the aquarium and slide through it) and it is easy to get to as the hotel is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “It was AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: lunacherubim
Reviews.Content: This trip was a birthday surprise for me from my husband. The room was AMAZING. It was super clean and really beautiful. We even had a few people ask to come see it (we didn't know them, they found out which floors we were staying on!) I think our biggest complaint is that the sink smelled something AWFUL. My husband is a plumber and said that sometimes there's very little you can do for it, but we had to keep one sink plugged our WHOLE TRIP. Ew. Other than that, it was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It, Stay here often”
Reviews.Author: donnakays
Reviews.Content: Great pool, good food and very nice rooms for the price. Friendly staff and can't wait to go back. Walking distance to several downtown Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: mjc85250
Reviews.Content: This is a four star true vegas-style hotel in the heart of the best place in Vegas - Fremont St. The Casinos down here are much more accommodating with free drinks and loose slots. They have several $2 blackjack tables in the area too. Don't miss the $1 hot dogs at Mermaid's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shanshan725
Reviews.Content: Everytime we stay here we have a great time. The staff is wonderful and make you feel so welcome. Whenever we have a problem it is fixed in a timely matter.. i.e the drains in the bathroom were plugged up. We called front desk and by the time we were done with lunch they were fixed. Very comfortable beds and rooms. The pool is awesome! What a cool slide and tank!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: MsBLC
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The rooms are nice, clean and roomy. This is a very busy hotel and casino, which makes me comfortable being downtown. The nightlife is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened to good customer service?”
Reviews.Author: CrazyinCA
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Downtown. We stay here 4 to 5 times a year. This last trip just lacked good ole fashioned customer service. The pool is terrific but good luck finding a chair that has not been saved by a towel. I finally just had to grab a couple that had no bodies near them for over 20 min. The cocktail service out there was simply horrible. One waitress took my money in advance because if she doesn't she tends to forget to collect. I prayed she would remember to bring my drink and my change... Ended up walking to the bar several different times. Bartenders at the casino bars are just plain rude. Check in and out folks are friendly enough and very accomodating in most cases. The Valet/bellhop guys are the best part about this hotel. Great personalities, helpful and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: woody495
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four day stay at the Nugget in down town Las Vegas. We stayed in the Rush Tower which was very nice. The rooms were great and the beds some of the mosy comfortable we have slept in for a while. It is right in the middle of the Fremont Street action so anything you want to do is at your finger tips. We ate at the buffet and restaurant and both were good. We have stayed here before and will return. The only complaint was security needs to do a better job keeping the bums out of the casino as we were hit up a couple of times while gambling, and they need to kick the time share folks out of the building. Thier business practices reflect poorly on the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Another fun time at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: whiskyandgolf
Reviews.Content: This property is downtown, so if you want The Strip this is not for you. I find the Golden Nugget to be a great value, the rooms are large and have been recently updated. I go primarily for betting on football, so a good Sports Book is a must. The hotel itself has also been renovated and the Shark Tank is really quite striking. This is not a huge party casino but if you want a quality hotel casino at a cheaper price, this might be on your radar.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Happy but Pool Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: bexnate
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget has a great Fremont Street location and the food at Carson Cafe is great. However, expect to spend at least $50 per meal (even breakfast) if you are there with family. My family liked The Grille, as well, but not the buffet. The buffet costs $20 on Sunday because it includes champagne - - but same price for kids, which I think is unfortunate and not worth the money. Room in Carson Tower was nice, but no microwave or fridge. No view. But the room was clean, quiet and nice for a family because there was actually walking-around space, dressing table, dinner table, etc. (too bad for double beds, not queens... but we survived.) I heard from several guests Rush Tower was very nice and the rooms were like mini-suites. Service was great -- especially Perfecto in the Carson Cafe; and maintenance was quick -- our AC broke and they brought in a new unit within 10 minutes!! The only real disappointment was the pool. It is wayyyy too small for the amount of guests. You HAVE to get there before 9 a.m. to save a lounge chair. The pool opens at 10 so be prepared to wait/read a book. The line is very long for the slide in the afternoon/evening but it was fun. The pool is jam packed in the afternoon and you can't really swim, just stand there in the water. The 16 and older pool was VERY DIRTY and I cannot recommend it at all. I did not use the hot tub. The sharks and fish were fun to watch, and on Sunday the scuba divers were in the tank to clean it. Fun! The wait service at the pool was great. Jessica was a great server and the $9 pina coladas were yummy! I booked this hotel because of the location off the strip, the price and the pool, and 2 out of 3 aint bad...! still looking for that perfect place in vegas, however! :) There is also a small arcade for kids and two Starbucks for adults... nice lil features for us. TV was Ok, not a lot of channels, tho. I did not use the spa, internet or fitness center because of the extra costs involved.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Kimmetje
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost 2 weeks in de Golden Nugget, rushtower. My boyfriend was there some weeks longer. The rooms are very nice and I really like the bathrome. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: LUCKYCHARM32458
Reviews.Content: We fell in love witht he Golden Nugget two years ago, and we just went back July 3rd for a couple nights.You cant go wrong with this hotel, its clean, its priced nice, rooms are comfortable and quiet. We enjoy walking along Freemont Street in the air condtioning, especially when its 109 degrees!, You literally are one step away from Freemont Street from the from of the casino! The pool is so pretty, wish I could say it felt great but we honestly ran out of time to get in and enjoy it.Leaving the Golden nugget ,we went to the Flamingo to stay on the strip a couple nights, wish we would have stayed the entire trip at the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “OK - decent enough if you want to stay in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: SteveHDevon
Reviews.Content: Nothing much wrong with the rooms or cleaning, though no coffee-making facilities in the room (I assume this is the norm in Las Vegas ?) . Room was also surprisingly quiet, though being on the 9th floor must have helped ! Could not use the main pool as it was pretty well mobbed, getting a sunbed would have been impossible but it would have been a great experience to use that water slide ! Hotel was nicely decorated and overall seemed pretty secure, so if you want to stop in teh heart of downtown this could be the place !

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Affordable, Fun”
Reviews.Author: highdesertwanderer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times over the years. It has always been the nicest property on Fremont St, but it rivals the strip casinos for value and fun. This visit was extremely memorable and there was nothing to diminish the stay in any way. Keeping it brief, avoid the children at the lower level of the pool and head straight to the hideaway on the third level. We chose to pass on a bungalow but did reserve lounge chairs for the days we were there. It’s an adults only pool and worth whatever they want to charge. Ignore the line of people on the stairs; they are just waiting for the water slide. Go right past them. The bar staff is fast and efficient. We stayed in the “Rush” tower which is very reasonable and had a great room that offered easy in and out if we wanted to catch a cab and go elsewhere or a short walk through the casino to Fremont St. Definitely pay the $25 for VIP check in as it has its own set of rewards like head of line privileges etc. For an incredible experience, ask about upgrading to a room in the “Spa” tower. These suites are incredible. Most are 2 story and some are 2 bedroom. Our friends opted for a room there and it was magnificent without being too expensive since we were there during the week. You will love it and it is an excellent place to host friends or clients. See my review for the Charthouse restaurant as it was incredible. In our party of 8, every person said their meal was the best ever and we had dinner there several times. They even personalized the menu for us. Jacob and Suzanne are superb. They treat you like a king and deliver excellent service. Writing this makes me want to go back now!

Reviews.Title: “Laissez le bon temp rouler (Let the good times roll)”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiSportsman
Reviews.Content: Garish, glitzy, gaudy, gauche or whatever you call Downtown Las Vegas; the Golden Nugget is the queen of the Fremont Street Experience. Underneath all the veneer is arguably the best hotel there. If you are looking for a five star experience this is not the place. Convenience of location is what it is all about. Room accomodations are comfortable and clean. Vic and Anthony's is as good a steak house as you could want and the other restaurants on property are satisfactory. The swimming pool hosts a great aquarium, but, space is limited and you may be disappointed finding a favorable location on the sun deck. The casino is a slot players delight and stocked with the latest machines featuring all the bells and whistles, literally. They are priced for the average gaming budget and available in sufficient numbers. Courtesy drinks for the active player features call brand liquors and beers. The machine pay back line seems a little tighter than some other nearby casinos, but, not by very much. Your decide.

Reviews.Title: “High Class on Fremont Street!”
Reviews.Author: vtmathteacher
Reviews.Content: Yes! Stay here. Previous writer extolled the bus access to the Nugget from the airport and is completely right--if you are not renting a car, take the bus, period. If you are not leaving Fremont Street, take the bus. We needed to drive so I will take it from that standpoint. We stayed in the Carson Tower (which is the older rooms) but they are COMPLETELY FINE; Vegas is outside the room anyways. Echoing others, I do recommend the following: call ahead and order the "VIP check-in" which after tax is $28.25. This guarantees your room choice, gives you a waiting area at check-in (versus a line) and gets you a line pass at the restaurants. Ask for the 'Values Book' and see if they'll give it to you--let of 2-for-1, free drink, etc coupons. Also, I recommend doing valet just for check-in and letting them take your bags during check-in. For a few dollars in tips, you can get the lay of the land easier. I flew in from the east coast and was exhausted; this started my vacation nicely. After that first day, I used self-park. Once in my room for the evening (after I went to dinner with friends and 'donated' money), I called for my bags and got a very detailed explanation of the hotel from bellman--worth the tip money! The Nugget is quite family friendly (except in the casino, of course!), so if you want a no-kids experience go to Palms. There is an 18+ sunbathing area and a very small 16+ pool. Service was excellent. I easily got extra pillows at midnight and when something wasn't right with the shower, they were there and fixed it in ten minutes. Downside, which is STANDARD in Vegas casino hotels, is no free internet or coffee maker. So let's get around it: --Go out of the casino and turn right down Fremont street. Just inside the Fitzgerald is a McDonald's with the $1 coffee. -- Continue down Fremont there is a Krispy Kreme with free wifi, but you MUST buy something or they will run you out--which is fair, they are not a charity. --Continue one more block to the Walgreens, which is 24/7. Nice, safe, ATM, snack foods and the usual pharmacy stuff. --On Fremont Street, the 'tourist trap' shops all sell 2/$1 water, for what its worth. I enjoyed the stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simple declarative statement ...”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: ... This is a great property! And if you enjoy saving money, as I do, let’s start with getting to the Golden Nugget from McCarran Airport. The Regional Transportation System of Southern Nevada (RTC) operates three public buses to and from McCarran, Bus No. 108, No. 109 and the new Westcliff Airport Express, or WAX Bus. You’ll find their downloadable schedules at http://www.rtcsouthernnevada.com/. For the Golden Nugget, or any of the other Downtown hotels, the WAX is your best and quickest option. WAX buses are brand new and spotless; my drivers were very friendly and accommodating, and the fare is $2 each way. You pay as you board, exact change required; bills or coins accepted. My flight landed on Sunday, July 17, at 6:40 PM and I was easily able to catch the 7:02 departure as I had only carry-on luggage. To get to the WAX bus, take the down escalator near Carousel 7 in the main baggage claim area, then walk across the street to the pedestrian crosswalk. Turn right and go to the very end of the bus docks. You’ll see a large sign, “All Buses Stop Here.” There is also seating in this area. My WAX bus pulled up at 6:55 and departed exactly at 7:02, as scheduled. There were maybe 8 people on my bus. These are truly express buses and I was at my stop, 4th Street at Carson Avenue, at 7:35 PM. I had no worries about missing my stop as the driver asked me when I boarded where I was going, and he made sure I knew when my stop was coming up. It is a short three block walk up Carson Ave to the Golden Nugget. Check in was quick, and my room on the eighth floor of the new Rush Tower was perfect. In fact, it was exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. The bed was great, the separate L-sofa was comfortable, lighting at the ample workstation was adequate and the Rainforest showerhead was a real treat. Before checking in, be sure to sign up for the Golden Nugget’s player card. Present it at check in and when you purchase chips in the casino or play the slots. As to the casino, the Nugget’s was one of the friendliest ones I have ever been in. Now, I’m not saying the pit bosses were chatty or overly engaging, but unlike some of the ones at Strip casinos, these pit bosses actually made eye contact, mentioned me by name and once in a while said “congratulations” when a dealer paid me off. Three nights in a row, after long Roulette sessions, I asked if any meal comps were available, and all three nights I was comp’d meals in the Carson Street Café. That sort of generosity is a really nice touch, and it will bring me back. I also gambled (and got a haircut) at El Cortez five blocks down Fremont Street, and ate on the cheap across from the Nugget at the Fremont ($8.99 prime rib). The California, a few blocks up Main Street from the Nugget, has good inexpensive food in their coffee shop. I never felt unsafe walking around the Fremont Street Experience and nearby streets, but do expect to get hit upon for a dollar now and then. I highly recommend the Golden Nugget, especially the Rush Tower if you are a nonsmoker. Some posters have complained about the $10 in-room coffee service, but it is optional and at least one of the Starbucks in the Nugget is open 24 hours a day. A word of caution if you return to McCarran airport by the WAX bus: Southbound, which is back to the airport, the stop where you board is in a different location than the stop from the airport. Going back to the airport, it is in front of Binion’s, on South Casino Center Blvd, which is actually much closer to the Nugget. The way I look at it, the $4 I spent riding the WAX bus from the airport to the Golden Nugget and back again easily saved me $60 in cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Started out bad and got worse”
Reviews.Author: Kristine15
Reviews.Content: We make many trips to Las Vegas, but this was our first time staying on Fremont Street and was excited for the opportunity to experience the new location. We stayed on a recommendation from my parents because of the "cool"pool for the kids. Check in was easy, but it was later in the evening, things quickly went downhill. I used the bathroom after checking into the room and noticed a clump of long, black hair (I have long hair, but blonde, and the rest of my family are males, so I know it wasn't theirs,either) on the floor under the toilet paper holder. After washing my hands, I went to use the complimentary lotion. The housekeeper obviously didn't look at the bottle to see if it was used because, once again, there was a long black hair wrapped around where the lid is. I quickly disposed of the bottle and during the three days staying there did not receive another one. The next morning, I was the first to shower in my family and noticed short, black hair all over the bath tub. When I was using the makeup table (enjoyed that in a motel room), I noticed there was candy under the table, again not ours. Then next to the closet was a cherry pit (YUCK!) The second day, we left our room around 1:30 and returned later in the evening and found that our rooms had not been cleaned. During that day, we also tried to dine at the little diner there and had to leave because nobody would serve us after sitting at the table for over 20 minutes. The icing on the cake was the day that we were checking out, we were checking under the beds (and they are truly only double beds, not queens, who does that anymore?) to make sure we weren't leaving anything and my son found a bag with raisin bread in it (again, not ours). Then, my husband looked under the other bed and found a used condom!!! OOOOOOOOOOooooooohhhh gross!!!! Just glad it wasn't my 9-year-old son who found that. Housekeeping definitely needs to improve at this hotel!! I am not one to write reviews, but felt that it was necessary after this trip. Fremont Street was an experience, but not one I'll be willing to take again!!

Reviews.Title: “SO much fun!”
Reviews.Author: zephyr555
Reviews.Content: Wow! Great deal for incredible rooms. So much going on, walk out the door to all the street performers, bands, & of course the great video in the sky. My husband & I had a wonderful, romantic trip. There was so much to do we ran out of time before trying out the pool with the slide through the shark aquarium. Oh well, we'll just have to come back!

Reviews.Title: “great bargain-”
Reviews.Author: RCB1960
Reviews.Content: for $39 a night this deal was fantastic. The casino isn't as elaborate as most of the casinos on the strip but the pool and rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,,,,,,,,,,but.”
Reviews.Author: Billcmh
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Golden Nugget (GN). After the $40 dollar cab ride, check in was a breeze. Tip: if you want to charge meals ect to your room, you MUST set it up during check-in. Our room was in the Rush tower, I highly reccomend the Rush tower. The entire tower is Non-Smoking. The room itself was great. King size bed & a sitting area, overlooking Freemont street. Housekeeping did an excellent job everyday. The pool was awsome, you can get right up next to the shark tank and watch the fish. When you are here, you MUST do the water slide that goes right thru the shark tank, very cool. There were lots of kids here during our stay, I found it a bit wearing, but they were all having a great time. For peace and quiet, we went to the Adult Only sun deck on the 3rd level. (use the stairs next to the bar or the elevator) Just a short walk over to the slide, and you arrived downstairs, cooled off, and ready for a drink! Spent happy hour at the Chart House. Good service and great drinks. (Say hi to Maggie) The food served at happy hour is delicious. We had dinner at Grotto, this was a let down. Never again, the food was good,but the service and attitude of our waiter (Steven) ruined the meal. To begin with the waiter wanted a drink order, but we had to ask for a wine list. (let the attitude begin) Then he wants a dinner order, before we have had a decent chance to review the menu. It became clear to us at this point he just wanted to turn the table and collect his tip. (but, the restaurant was NOT busy at all) Our meals arrived quickly. I got the wrong order, but, it was good and something I was considering, so I didn't mention it. The waiter eventually catches it, apologizes and offers to buy us dessert. (let the attitude continue) He gives us the "bum's rush" just to get us out the door. I just wonder if he is smart enought to understand the lousy tip he earned. So i suggest, avoid the Grotto, especially Steven. Other than that, we had a great time. Left some money behind, but hey, it's Vegas baby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ptpurr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean. Staff is very courteous and professional. Only exception was when I asked the desk clerk if they could recommend somewhere for dinner on the strip and my answer was "You know the strip is 15 miles away?" Well first of all it's only about 3 miles away and I really didn't care how far away it was, I was looking for an opinion. Nonetheless the rush tower rooms are beautiful and new. Pool is great and food in the buffet was awesome. Less busy than the strip hotels. Spa was also wonderful. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pro47
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the pool facility with the tube water slide going through a shark tank. My girls loved it! The room itself was very clean, exactly as described. All the staff, including those in the parking garage, were very friendly and helpful. The Carson ?? restaurant was excellent, too.

Reviews.Title: “had fun”
Reviews.Author: tttoojftrndmd
