Reviews.Content: i have been to vegas tons of times infact am there about 6 or 7 times a year ,have stayed at most hotels on the strip with my wife and somtimes bring the kids but this trip i went with a buddy for my birthday so as you can imagine there was a lot of drinking and gamberling than normal so we decided to stay on fremont street ,well the hotel is very nice probaly the nicest on fremont ,the pool was great to hang out ,played black jack on the outside tabels by the pool with some rowdy crowds and had a lot of laughs ,binnions across the street was awsome to play the manager there carlo gave us his personal phone number and told us we could stay there for free any time we wanted he was great he gave us a card in there and got some free meals we didnt gamle much changed a 100 bucks on black jack and lasted us all night dealers dress up and are very freindly ,some good restaurants we eat at when we where sober was red sushi in golden nuggett best tempora rolls you will ever eat ,and we walked down to the the railway station casino and went into the micro brewary pub had a prime rib dinner excellent 14 buck and there beer sampler 7 different beers for 7 bucks a great way to start the night off ...so in a nut shell if i was going back which i am in sept and dec with the wife i would stay on the strip as we like to walk and check out other hotes and stuff ,fremont street you can walk up and down in 10 minutes but if you are looking at laying by the pool drinking margaritas during the day ,and haveing some good cheap meals at night and meeting some of the most freindly people in the casinos and just having a good party then fremont is for you ,have fun in vegas its the best place on earth in my mind .........

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: kiinga
Reviews.Content: This actually is one of the nicest hotel rooms we ever stayed in. Our room was in the Carson tower. Although it's close to Fremont St., the room is quiet and you can sleep peacefully. We had a little problem getting in the room- the lock was a little tricky, but the personnel was nice and helpful. Overall I would say that the location is excellent, the room is comfy and the cleanliness of it is great too. The restaurants of the hotel look great, we actually tried only the Carson Street Cafe and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nursecat85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times over the past several years. The accomodations are great and we consider it the only place to stay in downtown Vegas. The rooms are well appointed and the pool is awesome. If you are a member of their rewards club the rates are very reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone considering downtown Vegas. We are always meeting folks who are staying on the strip but come downtown to gamble because the stakes are so much more reasonably priced. They are surprised to find the Nugget so nice. I think downtown still has a little bit of a shady reputation among a lot of folks, but this is so untrue and we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino for the money!”
Reviews.Author: markersh
Reviews.Content: Went with 2 friends and stayed 1 night downtown for a change...the other 2 nights were on the strip. A great change of pace staying at the GN! Gold tower room very nice n clean; however, would reconsider getting a 2nd room next time when traveling with 3 or 4 in one room...the double beds were a lil tight....most other Vegas hotels have 2queen beds! All staff from registration associates to casino dealers were very pleasant with each encounter! Loved the pool. Loved the Grotto! Loved the fact that freemont street and other casinos were just right out the front door! Loved the Buffett for breakfast especially the 2 for 1 coupon.... All in all a great value at the GN for a 1 nite different experience away from the strip! Would recommend doing this to experience old Vegas rather than spending all ones time on the strip! AND... Gambling was more fun downtown....more relaxing and the dealers don't seem to have a snotty attitude like some establishments on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay on Fremont St.”
Reviews.Author: NSummer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the golden nugget for two nights in the gold tower on the 17th floor. Check in took a few minutes due to lack of check in staff but to be fair I checked in early. After checking in I found out that I could have used the VIP check in lounge due to the room I booked so check your booking prior to waiting in line like I did. The VIP lounge is nice, they have free juice and snacks and the staff was very helpful. My room was very nice. It was spacious, clean and comfortable. I was very impressed with the furnishings. My only complain about the room was it was behind the elevator and you could actually hear the elevator. It was not obnoxiously but this may bother some. Check out was easy in the VIP lounge. Overall, I was very impressed with the hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “When did downtown get so sleazy?”
Reviews.Author: lisahb
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is a very nice hotel, particularly the new Rush Tower, but it's in the worst location. We used to love going downtown because the casinos were so close together, but it'sbecome an absolute sleaze-fest. Who really wants to see cracked out "dancing" girls on stripper poles while playing blackjack? It's also rare to encounter pleasant customer service staff. If you do choose to stay in the Rush Tower, be prepared for very loud music (even on the 21st floor) resonating from Fremont Street, and a sewage odor in the room. If you hang out by the pool, be prepared for the rude, Gestapo-like security guards making sure you don't sneak food or beverage in, and make sure to get a chair by the pool before 9:30 or you're not likely to get one. Why sneak them in? You're not gambling, so the drink prices are fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: NoMercerGamer
Reviews.Content: Day one. When I tried to use the pool not enough beds. Really wrong when we had paid for and upgrade to the Rush Tower. However I just wanted to use the pool. I was directed to lockers which wanted $1.00 (no problem) however they take money but don't open. When I asked for help I was greeted with the most bullying person I have ever met (and I went to an all Girls School) to be fair after they reduced me to tears they did comp me lunch and a free sun bed. However to me it was about you don't pay top dollar to be left in tears. Drinks are very expensive $20.00 for a double gin and tonic. I pulled the Manager to tell him that there was little to no gin in my drink (tip ask for your sprit and mixer in seperate glasses) No kettle for tea or coffee and water is $7.00 in your room don't use it. $10.00 for coffee that we did not use but was charged to my credit card when I got home. I can in all honesty say I will never go near this place again. Buyer be warned

Reviews.Title: “A gem downtown”
Reviews.Author: MidMO65340
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at The Golden Nugget in the last 2 years. As usual, the GN is by far and away the best property if you want to stay downtown. You are in all the easy-walking action of late night Vegas, but you are spared the miles and miles of walking on the strip. In response to other reviews complaining about the spa/resort fees or no coffee maker in the room, those practices are THE NORM at nearly all resorts in Vegas. The management does not provide in-room coffee because they want to get you into the casino. They can't take your money if you are sipping coffee in the room! My tactic is to go sit at a slot machine for 5 minutes and order coffee from the waitress! And the resort fee, while annoying, has become common, too. If you join the player's club and gamble tables or slots relatively hard, most properties will waive that, too. The machines here are looser than the strip, and we travel with a friend who loves the poker room. The ability to walk to neighboring (and more seedy) properties nearby is a plus to experience "old time" Vegas. The smaller downtown casinos are known to pay better and have odds/rules that benefit the player more than the mega casinos on the strip. The buffet is marvelous and worth the long line. The bread pudding is the very best I've had outside of New Orleans!! You MUST try it if you like the stuff! My only complaint is that the pool area gets very crowded in the hotter weather, and it is difficult to find an open lounge chair, but the shark tank in the center with a water slide that goes around it is obviously a big attraction. Ate at the Chart House and was a nice meal with a group, albeit a bit pricey. The sushi place looks very hip and inviting but have never had time to go. The rooftop bar was fun to go for a few hours, and got some great pics with nice landmarks in the background...

Reviews.Title: “The Secrets to Vegas and how to avoid tourist traps”
Reviews.Author: NoneReally
Reviews.Content: Downtown is the 'real' Vegas and there is no better place to stay. Usually have stayed at the Plaza but due to being closed for renovations, I chose the Golden Nugget. 1st, there is never a need to pay rack room rate. Go online to their site and check for promos and then compare with discount sites. 2nd, valet. Let them park your car. When checking in, they will also help you with your bags and have them brought to your room. But anything you need within the first hour- tote that in yourself. 3rd, check-in vs VIP check-in. I paid the 25 bucks for VIP to guarantee a non-smoking room. But other than that, when I arrived at 7pm on a Monday, July 4th...there was no line. The VIP is to the right , 2nd door just past the Chocolate store. They had a bowl of M&Ms...but I have this thing about eating from an uncovered bowl that people stick their hands in. 4th, use the resources of the staff. When the bellman brought up my bags, he explained the hotel and amenities. Asked if I had any questions. I told him I was on my way to the airport to pick up my sister- he pulled out his I Phone and tracked her plane, told me when she would land, then gave me directions....even directions to her gate. Wow! That's service. 5th, Landry's Club...gotta have. The 25 dollar fee puts 25 on the card. Plus, it puts another 25 for your birth month. So planning a trip? Get the card and use your travel dates as your birthday. Grotto is fabulous! And then go to the MGM Grand to the Rainforest Cafe. The Buffet doesn't accept the card. And about the buffet- skip it. The food wasn't even worth it with the buy one get one free coupon. 6th, cleaning staff does a great job. Our room in the old Carson tower was perfect. They will bring up more shampoos and stuff if you ask. They also have a denta packet complete with toothbrush and single use toothpaste. They will bring you three if you ask. 7th, The Golden Nugget is perfectly located. Walk out the doors onto Fremont. Go down 1 block to the Krispey Kreme for FREE internet. Just buy something first. They have patio seating outside, if you choose- but alot of nonpaying customers sit there and security will ask you to leave. So don't pay the 13 bucks for internet in your room. Walgreens (or was it CVS) is just a few doors down from Krispey Kreme. Snacks, souviners, etc. 8th, the pool. Too crowded for my taste. It's a headache waiting to happen. I went out one afternoon and could not find an empty chair...tons of chairs with no one in them but people leave their stuff to mark their territory. The Golden Nugget was awesome! While in Vegas, avoid the tourist traps. Sure- go to the strip, take the monorail, see all the sights and shopping. Stripburger is a MUST. Best burger of my life. The Harley Davidson Cafe is delicious! Hash House A Go Go is a must eat as well. 1 plate can feed a family of four. The Mob Tour will give you some history- if you are into that sort of thing. Trent Carlinia Elvis Impersonator at the Las Vegas Hilton is the BEST show in town. The Imperial Palace has their card dealers dress up like famous people- Wynonna, Michael Jackson, Lady Ga Ga, Garth Brooks, and others. They do a floor show. Wow! There is so much free stuff to do...skip the tourist traps. Minus5 was expensive but well worth it. Mandalay Bay- bar made of ice...the furniture, the cups you drink from, the fixtures- everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best pick of the downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: ch9sab
Reviews.Content: The room in the Carson Tower was amazing value for $35 per night. Big, clean, huge TV, large bathroom, and a super comfy bed. We ate at the italian place in the casino one night and the food was very good, and breakfast at the carson cafe which was pretty nice. All the staff I spoke to were friendly and gave me good directions/advice. Having visited the other hotels downtown for some entertainment (gambling :-) ) I'm very glad we chose the Nugget! Only downside was the pool was quite crowded early on, but when you have a slide-through shark tank I guess that's what happens. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Sad and Angry”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMarianne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were introduced to the Nugget, by friends, way back in 1991. It was superb !. Every guest was made to feel like they were welcome and respected. That they were special ! The superb service of that Steve Wynn style brought us back to the Nugget year after year --- through the 90's and until a few years ago. The Nugget was so special that we responded by doing all of our dining and gambling there. We felt we should ! Then the Nugget was sold a few years ago and everything changed. Over the last few years we have noticed a continued drop off in the service. The managers and staff (not the maids or other junior employees) demonstrate contempt for their guests rather than respect. The check in is dreadful unless you pay extra for the VIP checkin which in itself is an insult. Often there's only one person on duty even when there is a line for checking in or out. I understand you now have to pay for a seat around the pool. They added the Rush tower and a very small second pool which is nowhere near large enogh to accomodate the extra guests. My wife and I visit Vegas twice a year which means we've been there probably 40-50 times since we moved to the States in 1989. All but the last few have been at the Nugget. Now when we go just by ourselves we go elsewhere. Our last stay was at the Mandaly Bay --- great pool. We are Brits living in California and have lots of guests from the UK. We take them to Vegas and until this latest trip they loved the Nugget because they too remember what it was like. On this recent visit our party of four was returning from a vacation in Yellowstone and Utah. Wherever we stayed in Montana, Idaho and Utah we were treated with respect and it was made obvious we were welcome guests. Free internet, coffee in the rooms, even breakfasts, were standard. Then we decided to end our vacation with a two night stay at the Nugget. I booked 2 rooms for the four of us. When eventually checked in, remember that comment about lousy check in facilities, only one room had been reserved. OK mistakes happen but the check in clerk inferred it was our fault, not the hotels. Lack of respect for their guests !. Come check out another long line with just one clerk on duty. On checking the bill we found there were four incorrect charges to one of our rooms. OK mistakes happen, again, but the clerk's attitude made it obvious that he suspected we were trying to get away with a free meal. The incorrect charges were from the Carson Street cafe, a joint we would not take coffee in let alone a meal. The clerk, a Mr Juan Pablo, needs lessons in civility. Lack of respect for their guests ! I was so offended by his attitude that I asked to see a manager. I need not have bothered. The manager, a Mr. Gerald Stoafer went through the motions but he made it obvious he didn't care an iota. Lack of respect for thir quests ! His attitude would not have been acceptable to Steve Wynn ! Our friends witnessed this last event and they now need no persuading that there are far better choices in Vegas. They too are no longer fans of the Nugget and the other sets of regular visitors will no longer be given the option to stay at the Nugget.. Unless of course Steve Wynn buys it back and returns it to its former glory. We have to say there were a couple of small signs of the better days. The first is Terry the egg man in the buffet. He has cooked my eggs to perfection since the mid 90's, always with a guiet grace and respect for his customers. I will miss him. The second was one of the valet attendants. I will not mention his name because it might land him in trouble. He asked how our visit was. I replied that the Nugget was not like it used to be. He touched my shoulder and replied "No it's not" . He shouldn't of course have said it but he was being honest. It is intresting to note that the junior staff know how to behave, yet the staff wearing suites do not have a clue. In conclusion I'd say that if you just want a room this Nugget will not disappoint. But if you're looking for service, respect, no nickel and diming, uncrowded pools etc then go somewhere else. Vegas is hurting and for just a little xtra money you can get the service that the Nugget used to give. We, and all of our friends and family from both the UK and the USA will of course go elsewhere even though I'm leaving "Private Arrangement" points on the table. For those who do not know Private arrangement was the old Nuggets loyalty program. It was abandoned a few years ago but old members were grand fathered. Memership in this "loyalty" program not only gave you points towards room costs, but also gave you an automatic line pass and a members check in. Only the points remain. In short loyalty no longer matters to the Nugget. Instead they reward for the amount of money you gamble in the casino as a member of their Karret club. They obviously haven't realised that some of us prefer to keep our gambling habbits private, noyt out of guilt but because we value our privacy. I happen to like a little gamble on our two visits a year ! Think about it Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “It's great for downtown”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: Clean and well taken care of - i hope it never gets run down like all the other's downtown. The valet parking staff is so nice and the bellhops always friendly and seem to enjoy their job- not like some places where they have a bah humbug attitude I dont mind to stay in old hotel /casinos as long as they are well cared for and CLEAN and kept up- but aside from the Golden Gate -all the others i have stayed in have had issues . The Fitz was fine for awhile and we liked it for the price - but now it is getting more worn. So i say if you like to stay downtown which we do the GN is the place--it is pretty and clean as a casino should be . Pool is awesome though like anywhere with cabana rentals etc the fees are CRAZY A nice choice of resturants- and Gordie Brown show is fantastic:) The only down side for me is the gambling- the slots seem to be right up with the tightest of them. But with the other casino just a step outside no problem.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: WILDLARKANNE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget, for 4 nights, I stayed in the Carson Tower and was a bit worried that I would have to upgrade,,,(I had seen some bad reviews). My room was BEAUTIFUL,, it was VERY CLEAN,, The furniture was in very good shape and a big screen T.V. the bed was sooooo comfy and the bedding was inviting. The bathroom was updated and in great shape. I rented a beach lounge at the HIDE OUT POOL (adults only) $20.00 . it is well worth the money.. the family pool is great but ,i was travelling single and wanted to meet other adults and suntan in peace and quiet. (the music up there was very nice). It was like an allday pool party. I felt comfortable and never got hit on,, just very nice friendly people. One of the best decisions of my trip. ***note*** very little shade in the HIDE OUT POOL the staff was very nice,, William at the front desk was ``GREAT`` the bell hops were tip top.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kelexa
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed on the strip but we got a great deal at Golden Nugget for this trip and it was well worth it! The room was great, the service was excellent, they even let us check in super early. Our flight arrived at 830am and they let us check in at 10. The pool is something else! We didn't swim but we spent some time out there just gazing at the goat aqarium. We gambled a little at the Nugget on week nights but table limits went up at night and on the weekend so we just walked across the street to some of the other casinos. Nic and Anthonys had great food although one rude demanding patron ruined my overall experience. Lobster bisque at The Grato was to die for. Staying downtown is a different experience and one I enjoyed very much! We were able to walk down the street to a Walgreens to buy some pop and snacks and a liquor store across the street for cheap alcohol. I felt very safe down town and the light show couldn't be heard from our room. A cab ride to the middle of the strip was about 13.00 but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget, but we missed the gold on this visit.”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers55129
Reviews.Content: So, our gambling ventures were not so profitable this trip - but the GN did not disappoint as a hotel. Our room was clean and extremely comfortable. The beds are very, very comfortable. After a a disastrous night of craps - we woke up recharged and ready for round 2. One little tip...after reading from one reviewer that she was not provided two double beds on her visit (as she was traveling with her adult son), I called the GN to inquire as I too was traveling with my adult son and we need two beds in our room. The response was the request would be noted in our record but the room is assigned upon arrival. However, to guarantee our room request, I could pay a $25 VIP up charge. Given the relative decent value of our room rate to begin with - I gave in to what I thought was another Vegas nickel and dime up charge. (For new visitors to Vegas be prepared for this). However, in addition to our room choice guarantee, we were able to check in at the VIP desk and we also received a GN coupon book. We also received the privilege of using the VIP line at any of the on-site restaurants, including the buffet. The 2 for 1 buffet coupon paid for the VIP up charge and we skipped the huge line general customer line. We probably saved a half hour each morning...which meant a lot given we couldn't wait to give the GN our money at the craps table! There are other coupons in the book as well but not nearly as lucrative as the buffet coupons. Yet, use a couple of those and you're either even or ahead on the VIP up-charge. Generally about the GN: The demographic is pretty mixed with quite a few families with young kids. The pool, shark tank water slide and over all value is probably the draw. A little surprising but we found this was the case all over Vegas. Families have returned to Las Vegas in a big way. Our flight home had a dozen kids under the age of 5. The staff is wonderful and one morning when going to get coffee, I noticed the fact the chairs in the casino at the various table games were being painted. My point, the GN is reinvesting in the property and it shows. It is a luxurious property but at a lower price point than on the strip. This translates into a great value for its guests. Before signing off, one little tick that I hope the management of GN will notice. My son and I headed to Gold Diggers one evening. This night club is not crowded and last year we got a table on the balcony over looking Fremont Street. There was no up charge or reservation needed last summer. This time, however, those table were roped off. Again, another attempt to squeeze guests a little more for a very small revenue generator for the property. Again, just a little thing, but please know, it's noticeable to guests.

Reviews.Title: “If you must be downtown stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RockNJim
Reviews.Content: Was in town only a few days buying a second home/investment property. Stayed downtown at the Nugget, not bad. Rooms were OK, pretty quiet (was on 15th floor), no coffeepots in rooms so you had to wait in long lines at the Starbucks in the lobby. Room service outrageous, but I guess to be expected.. Casino was fine did not wait in line at the sports book. Hotel check in was anybody's guess, no signage that I saw upon arrival directing you. Self parking is free if you show the permit given to you at check-in. Of course, valet if you prefer to pay. Pool is very cool, hotel decor is nice throughout. Did not eat at the restauarants but they were pretty packed. Downtown area isn't the best and outside of a few blocks of bars and the fremont street experience (overrated), I don't recommend wandering too far. Will stay on the strip on future trips but this was a pleasant stay at $40/night. Recommended for value travelers and short stays only.

Reviews.Title: “No Bluffing in this review!”
Reviews.Author: landlockedwanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget last week and what a great value. Modern stylish rooms and clean. When I first checked and got to the room the remote would not work. So i dialed the front desk and in less than five minutes the technichian was at my door. Oh, and it was midnight. Well done Nugget! I'm come back as soon as I can. P.S. Love the 30 million dollor pool too!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, I'd stay again...”
Reviews.Author: LakeLizard
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is in wonderful condition for being such an old hotel. It might not have all of the bells and whistles that the new hotels on the strip have, but you really can't complain about the place. Rooms are large and clean. The bed was comfortable. Noise didn't seem to be an issue while in our room...although we didn't get in until late each night so maybe WE were the noise other people heard! The hotel was definitely crowded when we were there, but so were the other hotels/casinos we visited. I will say that because the rooms are inexpensive, there were some interesting characters in the hotel. More kids than I would've expected too. The only real complaint would be the availability of late night dining. I mean, this is the city that doesn't sleep, but try finding something to eat at 3am. The Golden Nugget had one cafe open, but service was extremely slow. Plus they got my order wrong. So no brownie points scored here. But I did hear that the other restaurants in the hotel that close earlier were all really good. Parking wasn't a problem for us until the last 2 nights we were there. The parking garage was completely full, even for hotel guests. The last night even valet was full. This meant having to park at an offsite lot. It was only a block away, but you had to pay $5 and it was a slight inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: RJ56Mc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gold Tower. Room was really spacious and bed so-o-o comfy! Parking garage is on premises. Pool area is inviting and pool itself is interesting with a water slide that goes through a shark tank! Many restaurants on site - meals we had were good. There is no "resort fee" here, but there is extra fee if you use wifi. Right out the door is the Fremont Street Experience. Bus stop is nearby to take to the strip. This was my first time in LV, and I hope to go back. There is so much to do! I would absolutely stay at the Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: pands178
Reviews.Content: From the 1st phone call to check out his hotel shone. Having stayed in many on strip hotels we decided on a change having herd good things about the nugget. We paid for the VIP check in service garentering the room type we wanted also vip passes for all resaurants. We stayed over the 4 july weekend and although the hotel was busy we always managed to find a spot by the pool and the H2O pool bar is not to expensive, pool atendent efficient and the pool is only open the guests security manage this very well. Champagne breakfast buffet is well worth the money on sat/ sun ($23). Rooms in the Carson tower were well equiped with 42 flat screems and Ipod docks. We didnt get a great view but then that was not the aim of the room we were on 18 floor and at the back of the hotel so very quiet. The whole hotel has benifited from the reinvestment and really stands out in fremont. The only small points are no coffee facility in rooms but there are 2 Starbucks. No free internet $12 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Decent spot”
Reviews.Author: Averagejon
Reviews.Content: Nice pool. Would be a great hotel if not on Fremont street. Took forever to check in. Got 2 complementary drink coupons for the wait. Good pizza spot. Lots of penny slots. Nice big tv. Housekeeping took my fork which was sort of odd.

Reviews.Title: “No Peace and Quiet at the Rush Tower Junior Corner Suite”
Reviews.Author: valoriek
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to have a band practically playing in your room, knowing exactly when your neighbor is showering, and not being able to sleep a wink because of all the noise, by all means, book a Rush Tower Junior Corner Suite. While the suite itself is beautiful, ours faced Fremont Street and no one in booking warned us. There were 2 bands on Fremont Street who might as well have been playing directly in our room, the walls were so thin I could hear our neighbor showering at midnight and finally at 1:00 a.m. demanded a new room. They were out of suites in the Rush Tower so we were moved to the Gold Club Room which was only slightly smaller than the Rush Tower Suite and so so so much quieter with an unlimited supply of free bottled water and snacks as we got off the keyed elevator and free access to the Spa for workouts. A much better value and best of all, no noise!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, but next time I'll stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TravelingKatie11
Reviews.Content: We are locals and booked this hotel so we could have a little "staycation" and swim at their pool, "The Tank." The pool has a water slide through a shark tank, and I'd heard it was really fun. We got a great price on the room, and it was pretty nice and clean, but other than swimming, sleeping, and one meal, we spent all our time on the Strip. There were lots of disappointments, too. The hotel seemed overwhelmed by all the guests. After waiting in line to get checked in, we made the long walk to our room only to find out that our key wouldn't work. So we had to go all the way back to the check-in desk and get keys to a different room. Then when we went to the pool, it was so crowded that at first we couldn't even find two lounge chairs together. Plus, they were all out of towels when we first got there. The shark tank is pretty cool, so that's the one reason I'd recommend this hotel (and the price). But even the second day when we went to the pool, it was so crowded that we couldn't find any lounge chairs at all. I don't know about you, but when I go to the pool I do like to spend time laying out and reading, and we couldn't even do this. We also at breakfast at the hotel (Carson St. Cafe), and the experience was poor. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated, but then once we were seated it took about 30 min for the waitress to even come to our table to take our orders. Then the food was underwhelming; I wouldn't recommend this restaurant at all. And in the morning, the maids knocked on our door at 8:30am! We were checking out that day, so they shouldn't have even knocked on the door at all. Also, the self-parking was not very convenient. Overall, I'd only recommend this hotel if the price is right and you want to go down the water slide, but don't expect to lounge by the pool unless you get there soon after it opens.

Reviews.Title: “A nice break from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Eve G
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Golden Nugget after leaving an upscale strip hotel. We have stayed at the Golden Nugget before and will definitely stay there again. We book two junior corner suites and, as usual, they were clean and spacious. They did not have the worn look as the strip hotel did and, while it was an oversold weekend due to some rave going on, the staff was courteous and went out of the way to help us. One suite was ready on check in and the other, within an hour of the appointed check in time. Beware, however, that, when we asked for a late check out by two hours, we were told we would have to pay $70/hour. Not cool, especially when they weren't on time. That, however, was the only drawback of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “1st Time in the Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: jbm50
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Golden Nugget for years and it was our first time in the Rush Tower. My husband surprised me with a junior suite for our 35th anniversary and birthday which were on the 26th & 27th of June. Check in was done quickly. We were on the 6th floor in room 6202 which was beautiful and spacious. It was spotless our entire stay thanks to Norma. The room did not have a good view out of either window, one side overlooked the roof top and the other the canopy of the Freemont Experience. We didn't care as we weren't there to spend all our time in the room. It did get noisy at 6 in the morning when the garbage trucks(I think that was the noise) were banging around however. I had great luck on the machines while my husband did not but that's gambling anywhere. The breakfast buffet was so-so compared to past years whereas the Carson Cafe was much better than past years. We also tried the Grotto for the first time. The food and service was great. Drink service was offered quite often in the casino. We are already planning our next stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back at the nugget!”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before. We stayed on the strip for two nights and decided to spend our third night at Golden Nugget. If management is reading,I would like to compliment your check-in staff on their quick and efficient check-in! Thank you for getting me through the long line and to my room so quickly! Your rooms continue to be gorgeous. We even upgraded to your Gold Tower this time. I love your furnishings, the curtains, the comfortable bed, and all of the really nice details, like the sink and Keurig coffee maker. I loved the really nice and big TV in the room. Parents, this is a great place to bring your kids. They will love the really special pool area with its shark tank and sliding tube. There is plenty of music in the pool area, and guests enjoy the recliner mats in the pool. Parking is free for guests. Unfortunately there is no free WiFi. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Jessica
Reviews.Content: The service was very good. The people are very friendly and helpfull. We had a room in the Rush Tower. The room are very modern, very clean, comfortable and very spacious. The Shark tank in the swimming pool is really amazing. Should check it out. Location is good as well, you can enjoy a walk on fremont street or take a 5 minute drive to the strip. Not being on the strip, makes that in the evening/night it is quiet in the hotel and you can enjoy a good nights rest. The Buffet is ok, but the choice is limited. The Buffet at the Bellagio was the same price but much more choice and the food was really good there. No free internet though.

Reviews.Title: “family loved it- fabulous out door pool with fish”
Reviews.Author: vizzu
Reviews.Content: If you have been already in every other hotel on the strip , you can appreciate this one when you are in town with a family, the pool itself was worth the trip, to see and swim side by side with all kinds of fish, you can be hours there just observing them there, kids love it and adults too, experience of a lifetime, recommend to get to the pool early in the morning to get the best pool chairs for sun, pool gets crowded fast! its a very nice hotel, room was spacious and modern, remember the room is just a place to sleep, enjoy the city and what it has to offer, also the restaurant inside where the large fish tanks are is a must go , we had excellent food there, a fabulous dinner, you have to try their specials on fish! and service was excellent everywhere, beautiful atmosphere and design, five stars for a hidden gem in vegas ! VIVA LAS VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “A SMOKING EXPERIENCE NOT NOT NOT”
Reviews.Author: QUILTSHOWSISTERS
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience ever. I became sick after being exposed to all of the second hand smoke. Shocked that there isn't one hotel in Vegas with no smoking. I overheard so many of the guests checking in that they wanted a non smoking room and none were available until the second day of their stay when they ould have to change rooms. My husband has cancer so we got a non smoking room. We checked out early but beware of their 48 HOURS CANCELLATION POLICY. If you book 3 days you are stuck there for at least 2 before you can cancel. The rest of our dream once in a lifetime vacation was ruined as I was so sick with a sinus infection and then bronchitis. I couldn't stand another minute in this hotel and ran outa fast as I could. Also note that although the rooms are CHEAP, everything is ala carte-internet 20.00, lawn chairs 10.00, then you have to tip the bellman to bring your bags up to the rooom, then you have to tip the valet everytime you want your car, etc etc. All the other hotels gave promotions but not this hotel. A lot of young people in the crowded pool area. Although we had a nonsmoking room we were forced to walk through the thick smoke before we couldget to the elevator. the restaurant had along line so we didn't make it in time for breakfast as we wasted time in line. they charge more for lunch. Once themagic lunch hour arrived the line all of a sudden started to move. We were told it was too dangerous to walk in this downtown area at night. Also beware of the desk across from Starbucks-they are promoting a timeshare. If you PAY THEM 50.00 you get lunch and a tour of their timeshare facility and in return they will give you 200 in gambling or show vouchers. They can have Vegas-never going back

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: flavormama
Reviews.Content: Arrived on thurs, check in was easy at the rush tower. Parking is free for guest and no resort fee. Its on the fremont street where you can walk at 8-12 and see the show! It has a 70's feel. The hotel has a lot to offer. A casino and good resturants. The cart house was by far the best food there! The pool on the main floor is crowded by 11am there is a pool on the third floor. Skip the buffet- not worth the money and tasteless... beware of the grand view time share tour. We did it for 250 in comps but it took well over the 2-3 hour est of time. It pretty much took a whole 4 to 5 hours. It was worth it for us since we didn't really have plans for that day.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is tarnished”
Reviews.Author: Pelorojo13
Reviews.Content: Not the worst - not the best (not even close to the best) but if you go expecting little - then you might be pleasantly surprised. The pool is so crowded and their are no chairs to be had. With the heat at 114 F - you need shade but good luck with that. While this is not the hotel's fault - the low class cliental never put a wet towel in the bin or pick up their garbage, making this place dreary and dirty. It all blows into the pool. Our safe conked out on us both days and both days we called security to come and let us back in. It took quite a while and a few phone calls to retrieve my passport. Kinda a hassle when you want to get out and go. The FSE is kinda cool but it only takes one day - not the four that we had there. Their Casino sucks at drinks - the waitresses never come back - guess my $10 tip wasn't enough. The positive...hhhmmm....I guess the Hideway pool but there is a fee. AFter 5 p.m. it is free. It is the only place to get away from the screaming kids but it is hotter than anything on the roof. At night it was nice to put in your feet but that is all I would suggest because the drunks never get out to use the bathroom. Were is all that beer going? We were in the Carson Tower - I hear the Rush is much better and upgraded. If so, that would probably be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: dcollinsdj
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget is comfortable and very clean. Could add coffee maker to room to make it a better stay. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Meets it's Star Rating, Just a couple of caveats to know about”
Reviews.Author: OCDaddy1958
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true 4 star hotel from the standpoint of quality and conveniences. Stayed in the Rush Tower (has it's own check in) this week on business. Beds are truly to die for, the rooms are all completely upgraded, nice seating area, excellent bath and shower head (over-sized), just top notch in every way. Value to price, VERY good. Pretty sure that the Rush tower is also non-smoking. They DO charge for almost everything considered extra, but my opinion this is due to the extraordinary room prices you can get. Examples include coffee in room (Keurig system), internet access daily charge, and so on. Food in the Carson Street Cafe, was actually very good, better than my expectation based on the "typical" menu items. That was a very nice surprise. Pool area is the signature for this property, it's a circular ring pool, built around a shark/salt water fish tank with a water slide through it. Since they didn't have the room to "spread out" the pool area, they built up instead - it's kinda built in levels. First level is the ring pool and vertical shark tank. Head up a flight of stairs and a second level is more isolated cabanas (for a charge) and chases. Finally, kinda up and behind, is an adults only pool/bar area. They really did a nice job with differentiating each of these areas and providing a pleasant experience - it is very busy around the pool though! Water slide for the kids through the shark tank is pretty popular too. A nice touch in my opinion: the multi story parking garage is free for Hotel guests, a charge for non guests wanting to park there. When the garage begins filling up, however, (which I believe is a daily occurrence) they monitor this and turn away NON-hotel guests ensuring parking for you if you are staying at the property - kudos to the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Alling
Reviews.Content: Room was clean ,pretty and had everything we needed. The hotel is beautiful and loved staying on Fremont Street. Hotel staff not at all friendly. Luckily we had minimal interaction after check in. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: lakechiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luxor on our way back, and based on weekend rates and discounts we thought the price was about the same - don't be fooled, Luxor and possibly other places on the strip are charging $19 per person "resort fee" per night on top of the quoted price. Golden Nugget had rooms very comprable and was much less expensive - LOVED the waterslide through the shark tank.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: AK_Flyer
Reviews.Content: Booked here for the low price, was surprised by the awesome pool! Staff was really helpful, and rooms were quite upscale. Also really liked the location right next to the Fremont Street Experience. Saw a lot of the evening show there, and came back for some shopping the next morning. Worthy of note: Quite a ways from "downtown" Vegas to "the strip". It was good that we had a car. Also, internet access was about $14 a day extra, so we did not use it. Overall, pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not customer friendly for the average person!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rubyslipper54
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews but after what has happened to our group, I felt I need to. We have a group with apprx 20 people half are children. Some of the group had difficult air travel due to delays caused from weather which made them very late arriving...3 am. All had notified the Hotel and were told it was not a problem and everyone would have rooms ect. This was NOT the case! By the time some arrived the Hotel had sold the rooms these people had reserved months ago to other people. One family in particular traveling with an infant were forced to locate another Hotel... 3 am. This happened to 4 families. Our particular case was .. We arrived at 8 pm... Had called the Hotel at 4 pm to let them know our ETA... Again, no problem.. The rooms would be held for us. Confirmed with a credit card means nothing to The Gold Nugget. We were told we had rooms but the only thing available were smoking rooms. We had requested non smoking. Non smoking are first come...! Our room was so polluted with cigarette smell and the carpet stains looked like a CSI crime scene. The AC was loud and only blew the smell of cigarettes into our lungs all night. The people at the front desk were not very friendly the next morning when we tried to change to non smoking rooms. We were told to return after noon and they would relocate us. A big joke! No rooms were ready till 4 pm. The rooms we ended up in were non smoking... However our room was handicapped equipped.. We aren't handicapped. The handheld shower head came off during my husbands shower... Got ugly! I will say the bed is comfortable but that's it! We will never stay at there again! That's a promise! Oh and the really nice lady at the what we thought was hotel staff who wanted to give us some nice gifts... She worked for a Time share vendor !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Classy Side of "Old Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: per4mance
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a different stay than on the Strip, but that's what we were going for on this trip. We have 5 girls from all over the country meet out here for a long weekend. The hotel had lots of options for eating (thank goodness for the 24 hour cafe) and it's nice to be able to walk out the front door of the hotel to everything on Fremont Street. Going into the weekend we planned to hotel hop during the day to check out of the great pool scenes. We stayed every day at the Golden Nugget pool. It was a fun crowd, not many kids and not too rowdy. They played good music and the drinks weren't too badly priced (for a Vegas pool). It was more than the 2 for $3 PBR 24 oz cans that you can find at any stop on Fremont, but that's just a beer drinkers dream. :) And yes, everyone will go down the slide by the end of the trip! We were actually in the older, Carson tower, but that worked great for us. The room was huge. We had plenty of room for all of our shoes. Plus, the staff put our friends in the room directly across the hall from us as well which was great. The down fall is that a cab ride to the Strip is $30 each way which can add up if you go there multiple times a day, but if you are staying downtown you expect that. If you are in no hurry you can take the Deuce from downtown to the Strip for $7 for 24 hours. We did this a couple times to enjoy the sights and then would cab back to save time. The nightlife is lacking there. We tried Golddiggers...empty. We tried other bars throught the weekend...empty. If you want to Vegas Club action you will have to leave downtown, but for people watching (WOW!) and cheap drinks this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in rush tower”
Reviews.Author: cslater
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas. Stayed at the Golden Nugget's new Rush Tower. Great place to stay. Rooms were large and updated. Look exactly like the pictures on the website. Check in/Check out was a breeze with their own lobby. This is by far the best place to stay on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fremont street has gone downhill, all the way”
Reviews.Author: angelkat713
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is still a great Hotel on Freemont Street. However in general there is a major decline on Freemont Street. There are now Pole Dancers at the Casino door of Fitzgeralds. Alot of the hotels have gone to Tacky costumes on the female dealers and workers. Gordie Brown at the Nugget is so worth the ticket price, awesome show. The country Superstars was the worst show we have ever been to (also at the Nugget). Food prices have gone haywire, and it isn't very good. Best deal nearby at Sunset Station in Henderson. It is a short ride, but the prices are great at the buffet and the cafe, and the food is good. Dinnner at the Sunset $9.99 buffet and breadfast only $4.99. It is also a great place to play good odds on the craps tables (better than anywhere in Vegas, and the slots payoff, wish we had stayed in henderson. You can be in vegas in less than 15 mins. the accomadations and the poll at Sunset are awesom, and they have an inhouse movie theater and bowling alley. For me if I don't go to Vegas for awhile that would be fine, a week long cruise would cost less and be more fun. If you are going the Price is right show at ballys is a blast, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bristolforever
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was my first Downtown hotel stay. Very comfortable and clean. Aircon/heating in room was incredibly noisy; luckily I didn't need to use it much. Coming from the UK where you practically get thrown in jail for smoking in a public place, the smoky atmosphere on the casino floor was a shock though I soon got used to it. Downtown was OK but might go for the Strip again next time in view of the slightly seedy feel of some of the places (not the Nugget which is the pick of the Downtown crop, I reckon). Premium Outlet (or whatever it was called) was a disappointment; seemed a bit too pricey to me. Note; if travelling Virgin Atlantic, they use Terminal 2 at Vegas which is quite small. If you want cabs, hotel shuttles, buses etc take the free shuttle to the main terminal. Several of us hung around outside waiting for hotel transport (anything would have done) but nothing appeared until a friendly guy directed us to the airport shuttle. Tip: Some young British guys maybe need to realise that this town, though mostly accommodating of those who get drunk, ain't a Friday night in Scunthorpe. Don't give anyone with a badge and a gun any grief. At best you could end up on the next plane home. At worse, you might get something you might want to see your doctor about (like a bullet in the head..)

Reviews.Title: “Ok...But”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in the Carson Tower, room was large, bed good, pillows old and flat, amenities in bath were cheap. Room was clean and no problems otherwise. A good walk to the elevators. As for the hotel it is an eclectic mix of old and new styles, furnishings and guests. We found WAY too many children of toddler age and babies for our liking. We did not enjoy the pool at all - full of children and lounge chairs crammed together making itva noisy uncomfortable place. we tried acsecond day and same issues. We were not interested in forking out $200 for the adult pool for 5 nights. Casino is nice, and we played sone slots and BJ. After listening to some other guests we choose not to eat at the GN and instead ate elsewhere. We rented a car and had no problems with parking. We saw little security in the casino compared to Strip Hotels and that may account for the homeless guy who bumped into me knocking a glass of red wine on me while trying to sell cards to the guests and the other homeless guy we spotted walking around for unwatched handbags at the slots. We decided this hotel was ok for this one visit - but back we go to the Strip on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “What's happening with this place?”
Reviews.Author: Jackie155042
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times over the last seven years. We usually visit Vegas two or three times a year. Never pay for a room. meals, and usually get cash back. Yes, we play the dollar slots the whole time we are there! They always send us promotions, usually we visit when we get the the $500 or $250 in free play. Our last visit, we arrived around 10 on the Thursday evening(against our better judgement, we hate Vegas on the weekends). Straight to our favorite wall of slots! Are you kidding me? Out of the 15 or so machines, six of them had hold notices on them. As we play these all of the time, we know they usually hit around $1070.00 jackpot. Sure enough, all of the held machines were around the $1045.00 to $1080.00. After two hours, no one was back to play these machines. I finally got an attendant, and he told me no one was playing them....hmm? I will also add that that me and my husband were the only two playing on that wall. The attendant told me that he wasn't sure why they were shut down and walked away. It didn't take a rocket scientist to figure out that they were saving the jackpots to go on the Friday when new people arrived. It makes the casino look good when it wins pay when other people are around to see them go. Sure enough, Friday morning a couple were opened up and by late that afternoon,they all were opened up. Yah, we ended up getting some wins, but it really urked me! Nextly, the trash that they allowed in there! We have always seen a few street stragglers, but usually they are asked to leave. Sometimes had beggers asking us for money, but after notifyingattendeants, they got kicked out. This time, my husband was approached twice by prostitutes wanting to go back to his room. At the roulette table two woman, literally had their boobs hanging out! I mean all of their boobs! I chuckled at first, but after an hour of listening to them talk about their drug habits, their sexual encounters, and F bombs every second word, I had to get up and leave. Yes, Me, not the trash that was only betting $1.00, when I was betting $25.00? Makes sense, drive away the big betters . I am far from being a prude, come on I visit Vegas three times a year, but enough already. The Golden Nugget has always been the only well maintained place downtown. And try and get a drink! Not like before....tip the girl, she would be back all the time. Never had an empty glass.This time, we waited a good hour before we even seen the waitress. After complaining to a floor worker, she did come back regularly. At the $25.00 black jack table, played three hours, got one drink! When time to leave, met with our host, meals covered(rightfully so after what we spent), but still gave no explanation as to why we couldn't play any of the Blazing Seven slots our first night. Shoed us out of her office and said she looked forward to seeing us on our next visit. Not Likely Lady, our Nugget days are over. This July we will staying with the MLife group. We spent a few hours at The Mirage our last day, got a card, had a nice lunch on them, and now are getting offers for rooms at any of their resorts. Good Luck keeping your old faithfuls Golden Nugget, you are driving us all away!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get the downtown experience, this is the only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MindyinLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Freemont Street, as a local on a staycation with friends, we chose the Golden Nugget. If you get the VIP check in, you can stop and grab free peanut M and M's throughout your stay:) You also get free line passes for the buffet. I think it is a little over the top they charge you $25 to guarantee a certain type of bed...but overall a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “They don't really care you are there...”
Reviews.Author: LMcKee
Reviews.Content: Stayed her many times over the years. Booked a Rush Tower room, to experience the new part of the hotel. Upon checking in, I knew that some rooms had a separate bathtub and I inquired about getting one. I decided to ask as it was my birthday and I wanted to upgrade. We asked the check in person, and he informed me it would be an additional charge...for the Jr Suite...Ok I was game...Oh, but sorry we don't have any available...No offer of the other tower that has suites also. Gave up trying. Got to our room, on the 6th floor, and looked out the window and there was a row of 3 ft by 3 by lights pointing at the room, lighting up the side of the hotel..uh no, this was not going to do. In addition our view was the top of the parking garage...complete cement and cars. Called and asked for a better view, and again possibly an upgrade to the separate soaking tub room. They told us none were clean, but there would be a wait, Ok I will wait, but oh, there IS a room available for an additional 50 bucks a night that matched our request. Went back down stairs and waited in line, 3 guests in front of us, for 30 mins(might I add) to receive our new keys. Went back up to the new room and it was larger indeed...great view toward the strip, and also a window over the pool...but no separate soaking tub...in fact, NO TUB at all...it was a Handicapped ROOM! Bars in the bathroom, and higher counters and a shower you could roll your wheelchair in to... I was not happy, for the extra money, and in addition, felt guilty that I was in a Handicapped room, possibly taking it from someone who may need it! Tired of all the fuss, I gave up, but felt compelled to tell someone. Went back down and spoke to the original check in guy, and he said, oh we will give you 25 dollars back. The room was well appointed, nice amenities, etc, coffee pot was nice, but cost 10 dollars to use and bottled water was 7 dollars a bottle. Went to Starbucks w my Starbucks gift card and they refused to take it saying they don't take them cause its owned by the GN What??? Ate at the Chart House for dinner, it was marginally OK...a total rip off in my opinion. I give it 2 stars. Lousy atmosphere, as it sits behind the check in area. The aquarium is nice, but you tend to feel bad for the fish... Also ate late night at the Cafe...it was horrendous and awful food. The Rush Tower rooms are conveniently located and easy access. The South Tower, where the less expensive rooms are attract a real low class crowd...but hey, you are downtown. Explored the pool area after hours. More fish swimming in a tank, felt sorry for them also. Very tight chairs if you were to lay in the sun, and the pool is extra small. There is an upper area w another small pool, and has a few cabanas with TVs, etc. There also is a bar up there. This is also where the access to the slide is that you take down to the other pool through the fish tank. I guess there is not adequate employment or attention to their property, as while we were up by the slide a very large drunk man was up peeing down into the slide....OK that was gross...so tacky... Casino was crowded and had lots of life, and access to other properties and entertainment on Fremont street (if you are in to that) is readily available. This is a good place to take a tourist that has never been to Vegas... \

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ToriG35
Reviews.Content: I came here not having too high of expectations...I was the only adult with 3 children and was just staying in Vegas one night. From start to finish this hotel was amazing. Very nice people, rooms, and overall feel. We stayed in a different hotel on the strip on the way home and completely regretted it. We had a great time here, and between the excitement of Fremont Street and the luxury of this hotel I will be coming back for sure for my husband's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: StuckinIllinois4429
Reviews.Content: The only negative about Golden Nugget is that the pool area is so small that there is no room to relax in the sun! The pool is very cool but not worth staying there for just that. The Hotel and room was very clean. If you are interested in staying in old Vegas this is a very nice hotel with easy access.

Reviews.Title: “A Golden Deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: gaxansmommy
Reviews.Content: We love, love staying at the Golden Nugget! It's a great value for your money! We just stayed there for our 3rd time. This time we stayed in a Gold Club room, and it came with daily access to the spa, VIP line access at Golden Nugget restaurants, and free snacks, water, and coffee in the lobby area (floors 16 and 17). You get a special key to allow you access to your room floor. The rooms are upgraded with very nice bedding and a nice bathroom. You can't beat the price! It's a great place to stay weekend nights. We have stayed there Friday and Saturday nights and then moved to another hotel/casino on the strip during the week. Also, the pool is neat with a water slide running through their Shark Tank. The spa facilities are great, and the staff is extremely helpful! We totally enjoyed going to the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rosey89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fremont for 4 nights, then moved to the Nugget for the first time. I booked 2 gold tower rooms . Booked through nugget website , then noticed the Landry card offer. We each bought a Landry card hoping for an upgrade at check-in or VIP check in. Got to the nugget and there was a line at the regular check in. Walk around the corner to the VIP check in and told her I had a Landry card and she said she would have to check to see if we could check in there. She said we didn't book the rooms under the Landry website so we couldn't check in at VIP. There was no one else thereand she was just standing around . So we go back to regular check in and line up for 20 minutes. The check in people were very non expressional , not very friendly, didn't even crack a smile even though we tried to lightened things up. Maybe I should of tried the $20.00 trick! We asked about the upgrade and she said they were sold out. Well I was glad I book a gold tower room anyways. The beds were very comfy. But the bathroom always smelled like it was cleaned with a dirty cloth! The water had an odour to it. The room was large but I could tell it was not vacuumed daily. Will return to the Fremont Hotel even though the rooms are small , but much better service. not sure about returning to the nugget , maybe they are just too big to care about the little people! Rosey for a gold tower room just in casewe did not get an upgrade , but thought we could use the VIP checkin and $25.00 for landrys restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “New Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: beepbeep77
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel I inquired about an upgrade to a suite. I was informed that for a minimal charge I could get a spa suite in the new Rush Tower. This was my first time staying at the Golden Nugget and really didn't know what to expect. Well when we got to our room we were very pleasantly surprised! We had a corner room and there was enough seating with the corner group sofa and other seating to sit at least 10 without anyone having to sit on the bed! The room was smartly decorated in hues of dark brown and red. The shower/tub was large and I had to take a bath on the last day because it was calling my name. Will we go back? You bet we will and I have already booked our room for next month. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great for a first-time visit to vegas”
Reviews.Author: leslieinsf
Reviews.Content: I had business in Las Vegas and tagged a couple of days for a girl's weekend with my best friend who flew in to meet me. She thought the Golden Nugget would be a good choice, since it's old-school Vegas, and the rates were good, too. I arrived in the afternoon, exhausted from a long business trip, and was impressed at how great the service was. Parked the rental car with the valet, who took my bags while I checked in. I called when I got up to my room, and another friendly person delivered the bags just minutes later. I ordered room service and it arrived quickly, and was excellent, well worth the price. Even my martini was good. The room was large, clean and perfectly adequate in a 1989 kind of way. No complaints from me. My friend arrived late that night, so I napped, and then we hit the gambling room. Again, great service all around. Not pretentious, and the hotel was filled with tattooed young rockabilly punk types; we never could figure out why they were there (tattoo convention maybe?) but we loved the crowd. Most of the guests were middle class families and couples. The next day, we drove out to Hoover Dam, then in the evening went downstairs to the Fremont Street Experience. Wow, that was awful. What a waste of electronics; the visuals were unimaginative and mostly ads. Very low tech. We decided to head to the Strip to check it out. Expensive cab ride, way too many people, and throngs of chicks in mini dresses and high heels having bachelorette parties. I don't need to do that again. Our last day, we took the bus up and down the strip, which was a good way to figure out where things are. Restaurants in the Golden Nugget were good and not crazy expensive. Checking out, the experience was equally good -- friendly people at the desk, fast bellman service to come collect and hold our luggage, and fast service to pick it up again. We didn't use the pool; too crowded the first day and if you're not there early, you don't get a chair apparently, and the second day, bad weather closed it. Not that I feel a need to return to Las Vegas, but I'd happily recommend the Golden Nugget as a place to get a feel for it without having to stay down on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great swimming pool with huge Fish tank”
Reviews.Author: Ottawakolumbus
Reviews.Content: This hotel has almost all of it. Good rooms, ours had a great view of Vegas(but... no coffee makers and fridges), great suntaning area, another warm pool up above the fish tank, good parking(must go across the street), then supper buffet at very reasonable price($12.99 pp) and also the Golden Nugget itself. it is also located close to Fremont St. experience. That was a lot of fun, we went 2 nights in a row and listened to rock band, saw acrobats, people were sliding over the stretched ropes acroos the lenght of this street, etc. just GREAT..Please equip the rooms with coffe makers and mini-fridges.. computers were only downstairs and you had to pay.... Bummer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool”
Reviews.Author: dalejr1fan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas Mother's Day weekend, more for relaxation than for gaming. We usually go for gaming. We love the atmosphere downtown. This however was are first stay at the Golden Nugget. First, when we arrived we originally reserved a room in the new Rush Tower but since my husband is a smoker we quickly were able to move to the Carson Tower I was skepitcal of what the room would be like since it was so much older but was very suprised at how nice they were. The Bed was very comfortable. The 1st full day there we went to the pool. Much to our dismay there was no place to sit so we walked to the third level to see about a lounge chair in the over 16 pool but they also were booked( hottest day of 2011 so far). But they did have a cabana available we looked at one and decided to take it. We had a wonderful day I was able to lay in the sun and my husband sat and enjoyed watching tv relaxing and snacking. We enjoyed so much we rented one the following day. We have never had a more relaxing stay in Las Vegas. Loved both pools and the slide too. The wait staff was very nice and very attentive. The pool manager made it a point to introduce herself and was very nice and helpful too. Can not wait to go back. The restaurants were great too wonderful food! We ate 3 will try the others the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A safe haven”
Reviews.Author: steviesmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel underwent an extensive renovation last year, and it looks beautiful, the swimming area has a wonderful shark tank, the rooms are great, and the restaurants are superb. I loved it because it still is small enough, and safe when traveling by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: txmeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown at Golden Nugget which was much quieter than the major resorts on the Strip, although fewer "beautiful people." We chose a Rush Tower room, which was beautiful and comfortable. It had its own entrance and valet in the back of the property, which was easy to get in and out of. Even when all the parking was full, hotel guests could still get valet parking. Dinner there at Grotto was very good; nice wines by the glass. Dinner there at Charthouse was excellent; better even than Olives at the Bellagio which had a high rating. However, even though it was well decorated with a floor to ceiling aquarium, it was not as romantic a setting as other places. It was small and intimate and had great service. We reserved well in advance but when they advertised a better rate, were able to cancel and get that rate so it pays to watch the website. We also got center close to front seats to their Gordie Brown show which was very enjoyable. He's a comedian, singer, impersonator. He is able to notice a person's smallest mannerisms and exaggerate them in a very comedic way. He takes songs and sings them like the original vocalist but changes the words to something that kind of satirizes them.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: mpatrick5454
Reviews.Content: The hotel is owned by the Landry's group, owners of Chart House Restaurants and others. From the time I pulled up to valet until I checked out everything was first class. The staff was friendly and helpful. I needed suggestions for meals, and the recommended some restaurants outside their own company. I was truly impressed. I chose to stay here because of the great service I've received at their restaurants in Denver, and I was not disappointed. And the shark tank pool is so much fun. I will definitely make this my place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We will always go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Obx20fan
Reviews.Content: Best hotel ever! We will always go back to the Golden Nugget. From the decadent decor when you walk through the door, to the friendly, competent, helpful staff located throughout, this is truly a "golden nugget" in Las Vegas. The pool, equipped with a shark tank, is great, as well as the "16 and UP" pool located above it. Their website has great pictures of the whole facility, including the beautiful spa. They are located on Fremont, and the Fremont Street Experience is a must see!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choices in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AJWISLER
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Golden Nugget multiple times and will be returning this summer. Located on Freemont Street, this hotel is in a great location for the old part of Vegas such as the nightly Freemont Experience. The hotel offers clean rooms, a fun pool with the shark tank, and top-notch restaurants. I especially like Red, the sushi bar, located inside the hotel. Highly recommended! The Golden Nugget is good value for the money and will always be a favorite for me.

Reviews.Title: “Strip-Level Hotel for Downtown Value Vegas”
Reviews.Author: galle8
Reviews.Content: If you want the "Strip Experience" iwthout the strip prices and long walking distances, then the Golden Nugget is perfect. We stayed here in June of 2010, as well as three other times in previous years. We've stayed at no less than eight other Vegas establishments, and the Golden Nugget is by far the best quality for the price. It has a fairly large gaming area (exceptionally large, by downtown Vegas standards). It also has an excellent pool. Though it can be crowded at times, it is a great place to hang out for a good part of the day, and minimize gambling losses... As to the rooms, they are spacious, clean, and comfortable, which is all that I'm looking for in a room. The service is fairly decent (though, depending on how crowded it is, the wait time to check in / check out can be substantial. Overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights at golden nugget and loved it”
Reviews.Author: phil1935
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the start of june, great hotel and great holiday, rooms are large, clean & comfy. buffet breakfast is very good value as the hotel give you 2 for 1 vouchers, we gambled (moderately ) at a a few casinos on freemont street, and found the best for service and cheapest gambling to be el cortez hotel and casino. then we moved on to the stratosphere, review to follow

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: desertdiva71
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay downtown as we were nervous that the hotels would be dated and dirty. We booked the Rush Tower and it was fabulous from the minute we stepped through the doors. A beautiful lobby with a view of the huge aquarium at Chart House. The room was also amazing. Contemporary, spacious, comfortable and it over looked Freemont St. This made our anniversary trip very special and memorable. We will DEFINITELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: onemanwolfpack61
Reviews.Content: Checked in Monday evening. Had a late dinner at the cafe, not bad but nothing special. Ate at the buffet a few times and it was okay. The upscale restaurants had great menus and looked nice but we had plans for other restaurants for dinner. Room was clean and quiet. Slots were enjoyable and the payoff was decent. Early mornings had coffee at Starbucks and enjoyed having an outdoor space to have a sit and watch the Fremont Street Experience. Felt very comfortable strolling throgh the facilities whether wearing a suit and tie or just shorts and flip flops. The "tank" with the sharks and fish was awesome. Really enjoyed strolling up and down Fremont Street, found good places to eat and drink and the prices were very reasonable. Only disappointment was I tried to arrange delivery of wine and a snack tray before the trip for delivery on our anniversary night, and the contact was "off work" Monday and Tuesday and did not handle our request or have someone backing him up in his absence. Ended up buying a bottle of wine in the hotel shop and having a corkcrew and wine glasses delivered by room service, which they did without complaint. Overall, really liked the laid back atsmosphere and the access to Fremont St. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The best downtown has”
Reviews.Author: DibbsUk
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, check in was fine, stayed in a gold club room for two nights and it was good bed was very nice. Things that could be better: water pressure in the bathroom was poor, really poor something should be if it can be. The good things: breakfast at carson street was great and Vic & Anthonys what can I say it was the best steak ever. One last point Free High Speed Internet, is not high speed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is the best to stay at downtown”
Reviews.Author: Megga-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Golden Nugget many times. I'm not crazy about how crowded it gets in the casino but the rooms are good enough for me. We stayed in the oldest rooms, the Carson Tower. Even though they are old and dated (floors 1-9) the beds are comfortable. The only noise I heard was the showers starting up. Never heard anyone out in the hallway like I have at the MGM Grand at all hours. Mind you, you don't have the best views in this tower (usually the parking lot) but you are suppose to be out and about anyway. My parents were with me and I was a little worried about them because they are very picky about the beds they sleep in especially my dad. They were pleasantly surprised. I have no problems staying here but prefer to stay on the strip because it's where all the action. We stayed here this time because my father cannot do much walking so this is the place to stay if you are handicapped or like my father cannot get around very well without a cane.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mcco_99
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 4 nights in May and LOVED IT !!!!! The room was spacious, clean and bed was comfortable. All the staff that we spoke to were helpful and friendly and check in was a breeze We only ate at one of the Restaurants - Lillies Asian Cuisine and it was FAB - some of the best asian food I have ever had but all the other restaurants looked great, the drinks were dirt cheap and the 2 Starbucks came in handy. Not the biggest gambler so I only played the slots a littled but they seemed pretty good, always walked away with more then I put in :) Would definately recommend to anyone who wanted to stay downtown - We had a ball

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Val_and_Shell
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was lovely and kept very clean and tidy throughout our stay. The beds were comfy and at the end of the day thats all you need the room for in Vegas (although at least 2 nights of the trip we ended up not going to bed, bloody Alice in Wonderland slot!) The hotel itself is in a great location. The pool looked amazing, we didnt use the area as you had to pay and we thought it was very expensive, especially considering the pool area is in the centre of the complex and only seemed to get the sun when it was directly overhead. We also felt a room/bar area with comfortable seating would be a bonus as sometimes we like to read the paper or a book and just chill for a while. A 5 minute walk up Freemont street to the bus stop, and the Deuce is still cheap enough, we got the 3 day ticket a couple of times, but mostly stayed on or around Freemont. On a previous visit we stayed at the Mardi Gras, off strip, and although it was a nice motel it was a pain getting back from the strip as the shuttle stopped at 11pm. Freemont street is fantastic and as we had seen the rest of the strip hotels in great detail on our previous trip we had a great time looking round "old Vegas" this trip. We also found the slots to be a lot looser, a tour guide explained this was because of the lower overheads for the casinos in this part of town. We ate at the hotel on the first night, but there are so many places around which are cheaper and as good, if not better. We ordered the chicken strips, expecting them to be strips of chicken, when they bought the plate the chicken "strips" turned out to be 4 chicken breasts! Would definitely recommend the Hotel California restaurant. The steak dinner deal was fab, and the best salad bar I've ever seen. 3 courses for $8. We also ate at the Fitz, there steak deal was also good, and the Gumbo was delicious. Got the bus to the outlet mall and got some great bargains. Didnt bother with the Grand Canyon trip again, but did go to the Hoover Dam which was brilliant. We also went to the Rat Pack show again, I would definitely recommend this to anyone, it was the 2nd best highlight of our holiday last time (after the helicopter flight and champagne lunch inside the Grand Canyon!) and the highlight of this trip. I would not advise the trip (done with Thomas Cook) to LA. The guide was not very helpful and at times very rude, we were dumped at the end of a road and told that the sidewalk stars were "up there, meet me down there in half an hour".
