Didnt have time to look at the chinese theatre, the group of us just wandered around trying to find it, then we all grouped together at the place the guide had pointed in the general direction of (no one dared be late as he had really humiliated the people who had arrived back 2 minutes late at the rest stop) 10 minutes at a place you could only just see the Hollywood sign from, and he dropped people off at the top of rodeo drive and told them he would pick them up in 10 minutes at the bottom. The best part of the trip was the Warner Bros tour (which he wasnt part of), still not worth the 5 hour journey there and the 8 hour journey back (traffic was insane) We probably won't be going back to Vegas, for a while at least anyway, as we feel we have seen everything there is to see at the moment. If, or when, we do go back we will definitely book at either the Golden Nugget or another Freemont Hotel. Hope this has been of some help

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the Rush tower”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyes22
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Rush tower. It was just as others have described it, new and modern, but a little dark. My husband and I loved the rainfall shower, and the larger room. We also ended up with a nice view of the strip. The bed was so very comfortable! It was great to leave the noise of Fremont street and relax in our room! The pool was great, but got busy, so go early for a chair. The slide was fun, but went fast. The hot tub was nice. My only complaint would be about the smoke smell in the casino... it is an older casino compared to those on the strip, so the air ventilation is not that good. Overall, the Golden Nugget was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when downtown...but”
Reviews.Author: my_red_dress
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel when we are staying downtown. The rooms are always clean and I like the dining options here very much, they seem to be the most upscale for downtown. The thing that I am not impressed with is the pool. It smelled terrible time before last when we stayed here. So I haven't been in it for over a year. You'd think that with such a beautiful pool (after all it is the nicest pool downtown) that they would want to keep it clean. The smell was hard to remove from my bathing suit and had to be washed multiple times to get the smell out. Now that is NASTY! Also tried some candy from the candy shop and it was stale and they wouldn't give me my money back which kinda ticked me off since we stay here every year...whatever!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Return”
Reviews.Author: FlyWriter
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the Golden Nugget and we usually have a wonderful time. We booked two nights in the Rush Tower, excited that there was a whole tower of non-smoking rooms. At check-in we were given a room on the 12th floor. We started to unpack and noticed that there was glitter all over the floor. Closer inspection revealed that the room had not been vacuumed, there were spots on the mirrors and the shower looked as though it had not been throughly cleaned. We repacked, went downstairs, stood in line again and requested a new room. With no apology, we were given another room on the 12th floor. We trooped back up to 12 and immediately inspected the room. It too had not been vacuumed. Back downstairs, another wait in line, again no apology and a room on the 14th floor. Back upstairs, the floor looked better, but this time there was a long hair on the bed. By this time we were so tired and hungry that we just gave up and unpacked. The complete lack of customer service by the staff at check-in set a very poor tone for our stay. This impression was further reinforced when I purchased a drink at the bar by the sports book. The glass was dirty, with some unidentified whitish smear across the lip of the glass. I returned the drink and the bartender looked the the glass and said, "It's just cream, it won't kill you." The one bright spot was our lesson in Texas-hold-em in the poker room. Our instructor was great, very patient and a good teacher. We enjoyed several hours of poker during our stay thanks to his instruction. I highly recommend taking a lesson. As I said, we have stayed several times at the Golden Nugget, but because of this trip, I think we will consider finding a new hotel in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Yet Again!”
Reviews.Author: CheeseheadFred
Reviews.Content: Another great vacation at the Nugget! I think this was my 4th time staying there in as many years. I just realized that I still haven't eaten there. Stayed in the Carson tower again as I couldn't get a free upgrade. Please don't waste your money on the Landrys card as it has never worked for me. Entire week ended up getting comped, so that was a plus. Still haven't had a real complaint about this property. Left the strip years ago without looking back!

Reviews.Title: “cool pool, poor room”
Reviews.Author: wskungfuclub
Reviews.Content: even though we are vegas locals, we had family in town and decided to make a little staycation for everyone. on a very busy weekend we weren't able to book at the mandalay bay (always our first choice for staycations because the kids love the wave pool) so we decided to go with the favorable reviews we had heard from friends in town and check out the golden nugget downtown. also, we had to check out the tank pool because tripadvisor had rated it as one of the top ten hotel pools in the world.... to start, the casino at the nugget encapsulates the downtown gambling vibe. it's a less flashy, more old school feel that some people really enjoy and prefer over the craziness of the strip casinos. it's all a matter of preference, but when you gamble at the nugget, you can feel like you're throwing bones in the movie, casino. the hotel room itself in the carson tower is a little below average. you're downtown so the views aren't that great. our room was outdated with very small double beds and very average linens. the bathroom was nothing special and the toiletries were nothing special. the tv and channel selection is horrible. overall, the hotel room was like a good holiday inn express--no other way of describing it--it does the job and is nothing special. now to "the tank"--the main attraction that sets the golden nugget apart from the other hotels is its pool. what the tank lacks in substance it makes up for in aesthetics as the pool area is very uniquely beautiful. when you can swim right up to a huge tank filled with fish and several sharks, well, that's pretty cool. the swimming and lounging area itself is surprisingly small and so ends up being uncomfortably crowded. you almost wish the whole area was twice as big. all the lounge chairs are in very cozy rows and there's no place you can get in a decent lap swim. also, the hot tub was very uncomfortably crowded. there is however, the 3 story waterslide that becomes transparent and goes through the fish tank. if you slow yourself down enough on the slide you can go through the tank and actually enjoy the view of the sharks from the inside of the waterslide tube. not surprisingly, kids are really good at this and heavy adults are not! you can also view your friends and family as they go through the waterslide while you soak in the pool area surrounding the tank. while the tank is fun and worth seeing once, it's not so amazing that we will probably ever visit the nugget again. the leap of faith slide that goes through the shark tank at atlantis? now that's a water slide worth a return trip--but the tank waterslide at the nugget isn't. was tripadvisor right in putting it in the top ten best hotel pools in the world? i don't think so. other tips: parents the minimum height requirement for the slide is 48". if you can't get enough of looking at fish in a large tank, then eat at the chart house restaurant in the golden nugget--great restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience with shark tank, bad room in Carson tower.”
Reviews.Author: TheEffect
Reviews.Content: well, what can I say? Im sure new tower is BRILLANT but if you have a room in old tower so you can't give 5 Stars for AWESOME swimming pool with sharks and all the other stuff. We had a room in Carson tower, room was worn and looking really old-fashioned from the Seventies, and if your window is to parking garage on the other side so you have all the noises from dustcart almost all the night. The windows are not newest standards (also dirty) so its pretty loud if you are sensitive. :( So please try to get a room in other newer, tower or a room w/o outlook at parking garage with garbage collection on the ground - then it will be the PERFECT stay at Golden Nugget! Otherwise - very friendly staff, great rates, great hotel ! I give "Average" because of the room only, otherwise - 5 Stars! Fremont street is great but a bit boring if you stay there for more than 2 days!

Reviews.Title: “Back to the strip for me”
Reviews.Author: Datadude76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always stay on the strip, but this time decided to try the old section, I can promise you we will be going back to the strip. The room itself was fine, the bed was comfy and the room was clean. The housekeeping staff was great and very helpful. Thanks to Monica and Maria for making our stay good. Now for the negs of the stay….. First and foremost the smoking, the bigger/newer hotels must have much better ventilation systems. The cigarette smoke was beyond bad. When is Vegas going to join the rest of the U.S. and ban smoking in public areas? The food at the hotel was fair, it is much better on the strip. Like some of the other reviewers have posted I also got sick a couple of days. I will not say food poisoning because I am not sure, but it is strange. The extra charges, $20.00 a day to use the exercise facilities, $14.00 a day for spotty internet service, you have to pay to lay by the pool???? LOL gotta love it. I could go on and on but I think you get my drift. Fremont Street is good to go to for one night while in Vegas but otherwise stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: CCridertoo
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay downtown here for a night then out to the strip but decided was so nice at the Golden Nugget that we stayed all three nights. Easy to park and enjoyed the Fremont Experience which was just out the front door. Be sure and ask for the coupon book when checking in, had two coupons for their buffet, 2 for 1. and a $10.00 thing for at the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and We'll Go Back”
Reviews.Author: GopherCal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget this time because we had a wedding to attend and didn't want to spend a lot of money. Based on the website photos, the pool looked inviting so we decided to give it a chance. The last several times we had stayed at Caesar's Palace at 3 - 4 times the cost of the Nugget. At $39 and $89 per night for Thursday and Friday respectively (less another 10% AAA discount), the Nugget certainly filled the bill money wise. The other people attending the wedding stayed at the wedding for the same price per night as we paid for both nights. We went over there and it had a certain ick factor to it. The Nugget pool area was outstanding. The pool was heated (unusual for Vegas) and beautifully appointed. They made the most out of a small area. The slide was fun and the drinks were great. Our room was in the older Carson tower. The room was a little dark (which kind of frustrated my wife as she was putting on makeup). The biggest complaint we had was that the TV didn't work. Despite calling maintenance twice, they couldn't get it to work. The only restaurant we went to was the Carson Street Cafe (coffee shop). I liked it, but my wife thought food was better at other hotels we'd been to. Overall a real good stay. We'll definitely be back. You get all the Vegas fun for a fraction of the price at other pricier places on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget is great for Fremont St”
Reviews.Author: BA_Rock_Star
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to the Nugget, went with some friends to surprise my sister for her birthday. The slots are tighter this year then in the past, but the cards are always fun. We had the whole table..it's better that way. Got comp. 4 meals which was to the buffet upstairs. Food was good, and had a variety to choose from. The room was good. overlooking the 4 Queens hotel next door. BEST pool area downtown! The only negative that we took away is like with the other resorts, the wait staff has been cut significantly! We had to wait several times for drinks as we played. But the dealers made up for it with fun..letting us win. :*) It's always easy to walk out side to Fremont and catch the show. Would go back to nugget...maybe next time stay on the strip. If you do a tour of Hoover..use Deans Outdoor Adventure! The best!

Reviews.Title: “Not great if you are not a gambler”
Reviews.Author: wanni
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas. The last trip was two years ago when we stayed in the Lakeview rooms at Bellagio. We were travelling with the same group who wanted to stay downtown this time. We knew ahead of time not to compare the two or we would be disappointed. The rooms and location at Bellagio were superior and as a package from Toronto with air was only about $100 difference. We did not book for the cost saving but rather for a different experience on a short three night stay. We stayed in the Rush Tower, rooms were nice, clean and modern with a view of the strip a long way in the distance, not much to look at really. Beds were extremely comfortable and the small sitting area was a nice touch. We did not have any noise keeping us awake from other rooms although we could hear when doors opened and closed in the hallways, not a big deal. Once you walked into the casino, the smell of smoke was strong although not as bad as some of the other hotels downtown that were really unbearable. For anyone with mobility issues, the hotel is quite compact compared to most on the strip and very easy to get around. It is definately the nicest downtown, the others I would not consider staying in. We ate at the Grotto for lunch, about half the price as the poolside restaurant at Bellagio and equally as good. Lilly's, the Asian restuarant was good. We ate at Vic and Anthony's also but found the steak not great for the price and reputation, (salmon was excellent), wine list very extensive although a bit overwhelming and pretencious. The pool was very crowded and finding chairs together in the afternoon would have been impossible so we booked the reserved chairs at the Hideway. It was nice to have our space but the newer hotels on the strip have much bigger pool areas and this would not have been necessary. When it beame windy, the empty lounge chairs blew around, some even landing in the pool. An earlier review complained about the pool closing for wind this but after seeing what happened to the chairs, I can understand it being a safety issue. As a non gambler, the attraction of Freemont Stret wore off quickly, same bands and street performers daily. Also, if you ventured off Freemont, there were many homeless people and boarded up buildings. We never felt threatened but not a great vacation spot. We did walk to the Gold and Silver Pawn Shop (Pawn Stars). It was open but no one from the store was there, it is much smaller than we expected. We took the bus to the strip two days to wander through the hotels on the strip and rented a limo one evening for a private tour of the strip to go the "Welcome to Las Vegas" sign and stop at the hotels for the free outside shows. ($140 total cost for 6 for over two hours- worth the price). For us, we would have been better staying on the strip and venturing downtown one day or evening as that was more than enough. If you like to gamble and can bear the smoke, the odds are supposedly better and the food is definately cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: DebStorey
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, the rooms were spacious and clean. We enjoyed having the robes and I found all the service to be friendly and helpful. The restaurants are a little pricey so we found other places to eat and it was really great having the ABC store just down the street to buy water, beer, wine, sandwhiches and fruit. I really liked the Freemont street area (especially because we were there for Punk Rock Bowling and the area was full of punkers) and I actually preferred it to the scene up on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is nice”
Reviews.Author: annapink
Reviews.Content: I've never been in Golden Nugget before and the Rush Tower was a very nice experience. The hotel is new, all appliances are new, the room was big (2 comfortable beds), I loved the shower, it was like a "rain in the summer", the cabin was huge. Nice bathroom with 2 sinks, bed sheets were clean. Everything was nice. The only problem was during check-in: my friend booked rooms months before, but they didn't give us a room with 2 beds as was booked and unfortunately first night he had to sleep on the couch. Pretty sucks for a good customer. The second thing was the room was "kinda" prepared, I found some cheap neklace in the bathroom and used shampoo in the shower. I liked the bar downstairs with a big aquarium, the bartender was very nice. The balcony has a great view on Fremont St. Food was very good, the service was very nice. We have the hotel already booked for this year, so I only hope there won't be problems with rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: NickimomHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at both the Strip and downtown. Loved downtown and the freemont street experience. Freemont Street right outside the door. Great service, great value. The pool looked great but we ran out of time.

Reviews.Title: “Undecided on the nugget”
Reviews.Author: sammygalsam
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the golden nugget over memorial day weekend. the rush tower jr. suite was awesome, they were so prompt on cleaning the room as soon as you would leave and you also get turn down service. the pool was nice, we had the joy of not many people on Wednesday & Thursday but by friday it was so full of kids you couldnt get in the pool with out one of them trying to run you over. we enjoyed the hideout pool very much on Saturday, was for sure a good choice when you would look down and see so many people. I would say unless your very wealthy do NOT gamble at this casino for they truly cater to the rich. we play craps and had a blast over at binions and the golden gate, but the nugget was a bit to be desired. there table people are some of the ruddiest i have ever seen in business and the stuffiest tables i have ever played at. After staying at the Encore for the last 2 years, i really missed the royal treatment that you get there and i have to say that i will take my gambling's back to that casino....apparently the golden nugget dose not need your couple of thousands, they just want your millions...hehe there is a lot of security on the streets, i never felt unsafe at anytime we were out. We did almost watch someone outside of the golden nugget get tazered but eventually he moved on...I'm thinking he was homeless! the homeless are out in the mornings eating out of garbage cans in front of you, this was very disturbing to me. I tried to give one of the men my breakfast the one morning and he was pushed away by security...sad! The food selection is very limited downtown, lots of buffets. we ate one night at vic & Anthony's and the food was just fair. i suppose paying 40.00 @ plate i expected a little more but only got a chain food restaurant. Honestly we had better steak over at paradise buffet at sam boyd's (no joke). downtown was a fun experience however i don't think we'll be returning to the nugget on our next trip or any after this. we'll go back uptown.....Encore in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: carly0287
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to complain about hotels. Usually, if my room is clean and the service is friendly, I'm happy. But this hotel....I warn you, do not stay here! Someone broke into our hotel room late on Saturday night while we were sleeping IN the room, took all of our cash, and the hotel management did NOTHING to help except feed us a lousy breakfast. Plus, there were other break-ins that same night, but we only very briefly were told of these events. The management wanted to keep everything very "hush-hush" and make us feel as though the robbery was our fault! The security system at the hotel is almost worthless. Cameras are only installed in the elevators - none in the hallways or other areas. And this wasn't our only problem! The pool and hot tub was closed because of "inclement weather" (low 70s and windy), the Starbucks within the hotel was always incredibly busy and usually only had one to two baristas working, making the wait to get coffee 20-30 minutes at a time, and the restaurants were all over-priced. There are major problems going on within the Golden Nugget and please be advised....it's not safe or worth your money! There are lots of better options if you're wanting to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in the Rush Tower are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: durnn
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed in the some of the premier hotels on the strip (Wynn, Encore, Palazzo, Aria), I can honestly say the newest rooms at the Golden Nugget are on par with those traditionally considered premier. Extremely modern and clean, I stayed in a suite that offered an abundance of both space and utility, with two large plasma TV's and a gorgeous bathroom area. Check in was quick and the employees were friendly and helpful. The rate was also incredibly reasonable, and the proximity to the downtown area turned out to be a plus. I would recommend to anyone on a budget who wants to experience an upscale room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for adults, ok for kids”
Reviews.Author: travelingmommy14
Reviews.Content: I can't compare this to any other hotel in vegas, we always stay here, (3rd time in 12 months) price is reasonable, tables are fun and rooms are decent and clean. Pool is really fun with waterslide through shark tank but way too small for the amount of people. Need to get there way before it opens and claim a chair or you'll spend the day sitting on the edge. They allow drinking in the pool so by the end of the day its cloudy water. Its also pretty deep, not alot of area for kids. They can have water toys and tubes though. Wont let you catch your kid at the slide so they have to know how to swim. This time they closed the pool for wind. Ya, wind. No rain and it was sunny just windy. Arcade pretty substandard pay to go to the arcades on the strip. Its right on fremont, everyone needs to go once to fremont. There are street vendors and chararacters to take pics with, be sure to take single bills for tips. Between 60 and 200 pounds can now zipline down fremont too. Its about 20 for a taxi to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a RUSH!”
Reviews.Author: Chace_22
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of May I heard so much talk about the new Rush Tower addition at the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas. I have always been skeptical about the area, but this last trip changed my mind entirely. After finding an amazing deal online for one of the Rush Tower suites I was sold! When my friend and I checked in their front desk service was phenomenal. What I really liked is how this new addition to the hotel is separated from the old hotel, so when you walk in from the nice valet area you are automatically greeted by the front desk staff. Their check in sit right in front of a beautiful restaurant with a massive fish tank right behind them. Above them is a gorgeous chandelier that covers just about the entire entrance way. Once I received the keys we were shown to the elevators that were only for the Rush Tower Suites. The room in one word, incredible. From the color schemes to the comfort of the california king size bed everything was perfect. The room had a very modern touch to it with a modern asian theme as well. The restrooms were all marble with a roman bad tub and square shower head. Their were i-pod radio's as well as a huge plasma t.v in the room. For paying the price that we did it was also great having a whole view of the famous Fremont Street. We had dinner at an Italian restaurant in the hotel called Grotto, which is located in the old Golden Nugget, but right next to their world famous "Tank" pool. The food and service were excellent and we felt right at home. I really liked Rush Tower and the time we spent there even if it was just that one night staycation to get away. The service was awesome and the rooms were better than most of the properties that I have stayed at on the actual strip along with the customer service.If there is one thing that I did not really enjoy I would have to say the walk from the Rush Tower to the Grotto restaurant. Once you walk out of the new expansion, you walk straight into a cloud of casino smoke which I always dislike. Other than that, I know I will be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Bother Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: VIRGINAHAMMOND
Reviews.Content: After staying years on the strip I took some friends advice and decided to try downtown. The Golden Nugget is obviously the only nice place to stay downtown. I was really disappointed with the room in the Rush tower. The layout of the bathroom, the shower door not wanting to open or close, feeling like it was going to break. Even the location of the faucet did not make sense. I heard read alot of great reviews but I am guessing those reviews are from people who stay regularly at a Motel 6. Since I have high standards and stay at only the best hotels I was so disappointed with the Golden Nugget. The customer service is clearly forced, employees at really nice Hotel's provide easy smiles and genuine customer service. The Golden Nugget had fake customer service. I even received the same "canned" greeting everytime I called somewhere in the hotel. Not once did I feel like I was receiving genuine customer service. It was like a play with very very bad actors in it. I would say the Golden Nugget is probably fine for someone who cannot afford anything better but if can spare an extra couple hundred dollars stay someplace nice on the strip like Bellagio or City Center. The customer service there is genuine, you can tell the employees are trained to empathize and sincerely care. Customer Service being fake and canned at the Golden Nugget was not the only problem but it is all I have room for.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is a great value in downtown Las Vegas hospitality”
Reviews.Author: debsaccount
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Golden Nugget was very good. I'm not a big fan of Las Vegas, but a business meeting was being held there so I had no choice. The Golden Nugget was a great value, very clean and comfortable, with excellent access to Fremont Street Experience. My only complaint is the high cost of internet access in the rooms. I didn't want to spend $11.99/day, but the room rate was so attractive I probably could have rationalized it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the Room Rates”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrim45900
Reviews.Content: We don't gamble but this turned out to be a great stop on our trip. The pool is fantastic, with a huge aquarium and cascading waterfalls. A slide goes right through a tube in the aquarium making it appear that the sliders are right in there with the fish and the sharks. The room was big and comfortable. The only problem was a misunderstanding on the room rate. We booked the room for 2 nights and thought we had the rate for both nights but it went up on the second night. Apparently the rates fluctuate regularly there. When we asked about the changed rate as we checked out, we were shown the card that I had signed to check in. I found that in my tired state upon arriving, I had initialed the card in various spots as directed by the clerk but didn't notice that I was signing for an increased rate. My initials were there, so there was nothing that could be done about the rate. I learned a lesson -- always take the time to READ before I initial anything.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - FOOD POISONING”
Reviews.Author: Dupont-Logan
Reviews.Content: I became violently ill after eating at the Chart House Restaurant located within the Golden Nugget property. After meticulously following their procedures for reporting my illness, the hotel management refused to acknowledge they were at fault, basically telling me the burden of proof was on me. This laissez-faire stance has cost them my future business. The Golden Nugget does not appear to value their customers' input, nor does the management express any empathy or apology for a trip ruined by circumstances that point to negligence on the hotel's part.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back 2012”
Reviews.Author: Nyx17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget the first time I visited Las Vegas, in april 1988, and after staying at different hotels on the Strip on my trips after that I decided to "go retro" and book The Golden Nugget again. Booked a Golden Tower room and it was unbelivable cheap, just around $750 for 10 days! We got to the hotel around 9 pm and check in was very fast and efficient which was a blessing after 28 hours of travel. GT elevators was close to front desk, pool and casinofloor. The room was very nice, spacious and clean with a big plasmascreen TV. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've slept in -ever! Bathroom had thick towels and bodylotion etc from the Spa. Free robes, ironingboard, safe and hairdryer. Room is NOT soundproof so when the alarmclock goes off in the next room you will hear it (as well as early morning drinkers who scream and shouts in the hallway). BTW, the alarmclock docks with iPod. Pool was very crowded even though it was mid april, lots of little kids running around. Be there early if you want one of the free chairs, on topfloor you can rent a chair (or cabana) for the day. Poolside service was a little bit understaffed but it is quick and easy to just visit the bar at groundfloor poolarea, you can buy snacks at the booth were they hand out the towels. Buffé and Carson Street Café was ok. Lots of things going on at Fremont Street every evening/night, there are three stages that play different kind of livemusic/DJ. One day it was "movietime" outside the hotel when they filmed a sequence of "Lay the favourite" with Bruce Willis, it was fun to watch. It is easy and quick to get to The Strip with the bus just around the corner. You can buy a 24 hour pass for $7. Take the Express Bus if you are going to the Bellagio/Flamingo area, the "normal" bus stops at every corner and takes forever at rush hour. Coffeemachine in the room cost $10 for 4 capsules/cups but the hotel is very close to Krispy Kreme were they serve good coffee and they also have free WiFi. Signed up for 24 karat clubcard (free) and got $5 to play for. To sum up: We had a fantastic stay and I didn't miss The Strip as much as I thought I would. Frontdesk, maids, doormen and dealers were very friendly. Downtown you can get from casino to casino in just a few minutes. So, if you want a more posh stay you may be happier at a Strip-hotel but if you want cheap drinks, lots of different music and a great mix of people - you'll like downtown. We will be back in may 2012 and for us Golden Nugget is our first choice. Bi and Mia from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the strip - stay here and save $$$. Use the buses to save more....”
Reviews.Author: AONE5
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas for business and pleasure about 10 times in the past 15 years and have seen the rise and rise of downtown. It may be a little "blue collar" for some, but it is great value if you want to drink, eat and gamble a little in what is a small village of casinos in easy walking distance of each other. The GN is great value - you'll easily pay double for the same room on the strip. The new Rush tower gives you some glitzier accommodation, if that's what you're looking for. If not, stay in the Carlton tower. Who spends time in their room in Vegas? You should also note that GN does NOT charge the "resort fees" that are springing up all over Vegas - $10 or so added to your bill for "your convenience" for using the pool or high speed internet. The only thing that shocked me was the $10 fee for a Sun Bed by the pool - and they are pretty well packed in with little shade, so load up on the sun screen. At least you have the choice of spening the $10 or not! The buffet is good for breakfast weekdays - with little or no queues. It's better value that the coffee shop for the same meal - and you can get eggs cooked to order in front of you. Coffee is best bought and the two on-site Starbucks outlets. A small stroll will take you to Main Street Station - great brewpub for food and beer and a good buffet. The bus to the strip is easy - it picks up either end of Freemont Street. There's a map at check-in. $7 will get you a 24hr pass, which you need to buy before you board at the ticket machine, cards + cash, but no change. If you can, take the express which (unsurprisingly) is faster. Use that to get to the strip and walk betweent the stops. The other bus, the deuce, is double decked, but busier and makes more stops. If you're flight arrives at a convenient time, and you have little luggage, you can really save $ by splashing out $3 on an express bus from the airport almost directly to the hotel. Google las vegas westcliff airport express. This leaves every hour from level 0 of the airport. If you do get a cab, tell them not to take the tunnel - this will add $5 to the fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fremont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kinnies_10
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying on Fremont and I wasn't sure what to expect. Friends recommended that we give it a try and for the price we were game. Check in was smooth as we paid extra for VIP. They were booked full so there were no upgrades available but they were able to get us rooms close together so that was good. We stayed in the Carson tower and the room was very clean and bed comfortable. We had a view of the strip but of course it was a ways away. Casino was like any other. Not a whole lot happens on Fremont during the week in the spring. We were there for the ACM's so Saturday night had free concerts with big name country artists but nothing the nights after. My friend got sick (probably from airplane) and pretty much was stuck in the room the whole trip so I had to hang with my spouse and friends spouse the entire time. We didn't find a lot to do except gamble and play bingo. Both a lot more fun in Fremont! There were a lot of kids at the pool but it was spring break time. Just don't get why people take their kids to Vegas but I guess that's just me. We did check out all the other hotels in that area and found this one to definately be the best. Not sure if I'd stay downtown again and if I did I would more than likely go in summertime when there is more happening. Food/drinks/gambling much cheaper however and for that I definately liked it.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL place to stay - will be back”
Reviews.Author: Knittingnut
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a king room in the Rush tower. It was BEAUTIFUL. We were surprised to find that our room wasn't just a bedroom with a couple of chairs instead it was like a mini suite. It had a very comfortable bed, a corner couch and a large flat screen television. The bathroom was large with double sinks and a wonderful rain shower and deep tub. The only downside would be that we could hear the band playing on Fremont street - it didn't really bother us but might bother others, if it would, you should ask to be on the other side of the tower. All of the hotel staff that we dealt with were AMAZING. We have always stayed on the stripe but since we always seem to end up downtown we decided to stay downtown this time. We were so glad that we did. We have never had such a nice room or the wonderful staff that we found at the Golden Nugget. We will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location, some pitfalls”
Reviews.Author: blhappypets
Reviews.Content: Excellent service at the Golden Nugget. They really have that going for them! The Rush Tower rooms were nice. Great decor, awesome bed, nice layout, bathroom had a great layout too. Fluffy towels, complimentary robes to use during your stay, iron, hairdryer. One of the sinks during our stay started to smell like raw sewage. At first, just a little, but the morning we checked out it was pretty bad. The whole bathroom started to stink. We stuffed towels in the sink to try to contain the smell. The shower didn't work quite well, wasted tons of water-shower head never fully was off when you just wanted a bath, and vice versa with the main spout. A little attention to functionality with the shower would have been nice. Gambling was good! Can't complain, I swear it is better odds downtown than the strip. Food was not good in general. The Carson Street Cafe was sub par cafe food, Grotto was not good (see separate review), and there just weren't a lot of options. Room service was okay, not exceptional. Service was great everywhere except Grotto, and the service there was just a bit pushy. Full disclosure, I am a complete foodie, and I don't think the average downtown cuisine is my style. The exception was Vic and Anthony's and Chart House (see separate reviews). Pool was fine. Great poolside service, water slide and pool was great. Small pool deck/area compared to other hotels, and the sun can often be blocked during the day--you have to chase the sunlight, but it is generally too crowded to find another seat once yours goes in the shade. The music they played at the pool was awful. It faded in and out, played Christian rock and slow indie music--it was a bad adult contempo channel with an identity crisis. It didn't convey a poolside Vegas attitude--not that I am huge fan of your average club music, but the style of music was really off. There were children staying on our floor for some portion of the stay, and I couldn't really hear them at all. VERY quiet rooms--I loved that! You had to pay for WiFi. Bummer. I had a good time in Vegas, and it was a different experience than the strip. I would probably not return, mostly because food is a deal breaker and there is not that great of food options downtown.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: John_Michael925
Reviews.Content: The rooms were 1970s luxury but the hotel was very nice. There was an adult pool with a jacuzzi that stayed open til 2 a.m. which was really nice. It is downtown but the Fremont experience is a must see and there are lots of excellent discounted meals to be had in that area. Also, the strip is just a 10 minute trip by car, bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star, but still pretty good”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many places downtown, and I usually go for the cheap ones like Fitzgerald's, the Gold Spike, or my favorite, the El Cortez. But I couldn't pass up $39 a night at the Golden Nugget. I was excited at the prospect of staying at a 4-star hotel, but a little apprehensive about staying at a big, fancy place. Would I have to walk for miles to get to my room? Would I be able to find a chair by the pool? Would they hassle me if I brought down a beer from my room like they do at the strip hotels? The pool situation turned out to be fine. It's a great pool, I was always able to find a chair, and they didn't hassle me about bringing down a beer (not a cooler, mind you, just a beer or two). The public areas were stylish and clean.The place is bigger than a lot of downtown hotels, but the distances are manageable. My room, on the other hand, was a bit of a disappointment. It wasn't terrible, but it was in no way a 4-star hotel room. I'd say three stars would be pretty generous. The carpet was faded, the furniture was worn and dirty. The ice machine on my floor was broken. it had a big flat-screen TV, but so what? The bathroom was decent, pretty standard-issue mid-range hotel with a little granite thrown in. Now OK, this was in the Carson Tower, the cheapest rooms, but still. A 4-star hotel is a 4-star hotel. It should be something special. And my room certainly wasn't. With the possible exception of the bathrooms, the tower rooms at the 2-star El Cortez are nicer--cleaner, bigger, better furnished, with coffee makers and a view. The Golden Nugget has far and away the best pool downtown, so if that's a priority, the Golden Nugget might be your best bet. Just keep in mind that you will not be wowed by 4-star luxury unless you upgrade to a Gold or Rush Tower room. If the pool is not a big priority, you can do better with the El Cortez, Main Street Station, or California.

Reviews.Title: “After staying at the Nugget, I will never stay on the strip again.”
Reviews.Author: ChickOHIO
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean and friendly hotel. Everything is a short walk, especially in the morning. Starbucks locations in the Nugget, a Dunkin' Donuts directly across the street, a Krispy Kreme and McDonalds only a minute away. The Spa rivals any faclity on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: Comanderkody
Reviews.Content: We had four rooms in the Carson tower. All rooms were on the same floor and exactly what we ordered. Clean, plenty big with nice bed and bathrooms. Service at the hotel was very good. Had drinks and snacks at the Grotto and Mother's Day dinner at the Carson Cafe. Both were very good. Pool not large, compared to strip properties, and very crowed on the weekend. Gotta get there early (9am) for lounge chairs. Knew that from previous visits. Enjoyed the Fremont Street experience. Entertainment was excellent! All told everything we thought it would be. Very nice place to stay at a reasonable rate. A good time was had by all including my 20 something kids and elderly parents. Definitely something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Livin' it up in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bribs28
Reviews.Content: We were kind of wary by the name, but don't be! This place was massive and amazing. The pool had several lounges to lay out on and had an aquarium with a water slide going through it in the middle. The aquarium was home to several sharks and other fish - very cool looking. There was 24 hour room service which we used to the extreme, however there are plenty of cheap places to eat around the hotel. It is also adjacent to "The Fremont Street Experience" which is a fun thing to see at night. It is a drive to the strip, but you can catch a bus which we were told was $7 per person although we did not use it. A cab ride to the Strip is about $40. We stayed in the Carson Tower of the hotel but the new towers are apparently even more exquisite, perhaps the next time we visit we will stay in the newer ones. Our only complaint is the constant smell of smoke - however this is not just excluded to the hotel, but all of Vegas. Also some of the staff are extremely friendly especially the room service and housekeeping staff, however there are some staff on the floor that are not so friendly and are a bit abrasive. You will enjoy the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “The pool was likely big for vegas but we were like sardines”
Reviews.Author: Meredithstar
Reviews.Content: Overall I think this hotel was good for a more economical stay in Vegas. Away from the Strip. I have to say Vegas is not a place for kids in my opinion. However I cannot believe it is TENTH in the most popular pools in the world???? It is tiny, and (yes we were there in July) we were poured into the pool area like sardines. it was remarkable and not at all relaxing. However I learned one does not go to Vegas for relaxing by the pool :) and I suspect pools are at a premium in Vegas due to the climate but ....... I still can't imagine how it made it onto the list, let alone 10th.

Reviews.Title: “A golden jewel on Fremont Street!”
Reviews.Author: AB_Travellor
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels on Fremont Street are smaller thatn those found on the newer parts of the strip - and they are also a bit older with not as many amenities. The Golden Nugget stands out as the best hotel on Fremont Street. Nice pool area (although small) adn the room are great. Nicely renovated and modern with a great atmosphere. I would go back. Room are great - great TV, spacious, and lots of extras like bath robes and dental kits, etc. No mini bar but there is room service. The negative points were minor. The small pool area fills up quickly and it is hard to get a lounger so you need to have someone go early to get seats. On one day the maid didn't get to our room by late afternoon and we were in need of a nap so our room didn't get cleaned that day. Maybe there were short staff that day - who knows? Faily expensive charge at the door to get into the fitness centre and no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Tourist56_56
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel. Stayed in the Rush Tower, rooms were very nice, better than the ones I stayed in at TI on the strip. Well worth the little bit of extra that we had to pay, to stay in the Rush Tower. Ate at the buffet a couple of times, food was good, tried Grotto's restaruant, food was only so so. Been to Vegas many times but always stayed on the Strip. As we were only going to be there three nights decided to try staying on Fremont St. It was truly an awesome experience, loved that you go out the doors of the Hotel and be at another Casino in seconds. Walked back to our hotel by myself (female) at 3 in the morning and had no problems and felt very secure, even ventured off of Fremont in the day and had no problem. Will definately stayed there again, no matter how long!!

Reviews.Title: “Right in front of Fremont Street! Very Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: burningspidermonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while visiting family. The inside of the hotel is amazing! It looks so luxurious but it was very affordable. The buffet was kind of expensive tho. The rooms we stayed in were average compared to the rest of the hotel, but that's because we stayed in the cheaper rooms. If you have the money there's another tower with way more luxurious rooms. I only saw the pictures but those rooms looked really nice. There's also huge pool area in the middle of the complex with a water slide that goes through huge aquarium with sharks in it. The best part of course is that this hotel is right on Fremont St. This was my first time on Fremont st and was just amazed by LED canopy that covers almost the whole street. They do light shows and concerts on it every so often, and it's really cool to watch. It's definitely a must see if your in Vegas. Anyways getting back to the Golden Nugget, my only complaint is that you need a map to find your rooms. It's really easy to get lost here but they do attempt to help people by putting signs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY ON FREMONT STREET”
Reviews.Author: honestmum
Reviews.Content: Great location for this updated hotel...only nice looking one on Fremont. reception staff, be glad if you get a friendly one, the man who checked us was struggling to raise a smile... rooms were big, clean with duvets, great shower and bath all recently updated hotel has a nice swimming pool, restaurants a handful of them we ate at grottos...a nice italian pizzas,pastas thai/chinese fusion restaurant...food was ok - but depends on what standard and type of taste you are looking for in this thai...not like the thais in uk Casino...v smoky by end of eve no free internet $12.99 pd all in all stay in fremont street and at the Golden nugget...but fremont street is not worth more than a 2-3 day stay as there is not alot here to do during the day, in the eve there are free shows and a light show

Reviews.Title: “Perks should be better in Old Vegas to entice young people”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler405
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget Mother's Day weekend for 4 days and I must say that for the price of the room, I expected the customer service to match suit. Pros: +On Fremont Street Experience (which is like the Old Vegas strip but there is SO much to do and see there +On bus route that goes to Vegas Strip (10 min ride generally and buses run a lot) +Nice Room (the room was well put together) +Early check in +Friendly maid staff and bell hop Cons: -Gambling minimums are high during peak times (drop after 12 or 1 am thru about 9am) -Need high per hand bets to get rated on table play -Forgot to put in my table play -Have to pay just to sit down at the pool ($10 for chair and $20 for Chaise generally) -Expensive food options (no cheap food or late night options in the hotel itself). -Long line to "check in" and rude front desk What you should do? -Golden Nugget is on 1 corner with "Fremont", "4 Queens", and "Binions" on the other 3 corners. For what you lose on not having as nice of a room will more than be made up by the tons of dinner and drink specials, cheap gambling minimums, and the Fremont Street Experience, by staying at one of the other 3. -Show the Golden Nugget that they can't just live on their "brand name" alone. Maybe this is why they have lost money in the past and the past owners got out while the getting was good. So in a nutshell, the Golden Nugget was physically a nice place to stay but the service and deals don't match up to the physical appeal. Try those other 3, pay $30 for a room you'll never be in, drink $1 margaritas, $2 coronas, or go to one the little stores on the "experience" and get 2 for $3 coors and bud lights or the bayou bar across from Mermaids and get a 48oz marg (hooked up) for $17 with $9 refills (it only took one)! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Golden Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dahn11
Reviews.Content: Note: This hotel is on Fremont and Fremont street is not on the main Vegas strip! Therefore, if you would like to stay on the main strip or don't want to take a taxi to the strip, then the Golden Nugget is not the best choice. Clean and Pretty That being said, the Golden Nugget is a great hotel. We stayed in the Rush Tower with a king bedroom. The cost was 100 dollars per night and was very affordable for the high quality of the room. Updated design with leather couches, super comfy big bed, and modern shower. I cant testify to the other room types; however, the lobby and pool were amazing. The casino was okay (seemed a little quiet). Conclusion If you are trying to experience Fremont, which is the older part of las vegas, I would def say go for the Golden Nugget. Fremont is a little bit slower than the main strip, and there are plenty of other hotels and little shops to entertain yourself. It seems to be a better spot for families because the street itself is closed off. If you are a first time visitor to Vegas and want to do it super big and get the full crazy hangover vegas experience--than you might want to stay on the strip or get a taxi/bus ride from the Golden Nugget. Either way the GN is a nice hotel to come back to and is cheaper bc its off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: L0vinMexic0
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to Las Vegas. The last one we stayed on the strip for the whole trip. This vacation we decided on 2 nights on the strip, 2 nights on Freemont Street and had The Golden Nugget recommended to us last time we were there. This hotel is BEAUTIFUL! Staff are very friendly, rooms are HUGE and EXTREMELY comfortable!! Excellent price per night also! Our ONLY complaint... the pool area is WAY TOO SMALL for the size of hotel. The pool doesn't even open until 10 am, but people are out saving chairs at 7 am! We arrived at the pool at 9:00, and got the LAST TWO CHAIRS in the whole place!! Plus, the pool sits between all the towers, so you are constantly trying to avoid or chase the shade as the sun moves around the buildings. This would be great in July/August when it's a million degrees, but in May we had to chase the sun a lot. Nice area, great staff, just not large enough for the hotel size. Freemont Street on the weekends cannot be beat! Check out Marriage Can Be Murder at Fitzgerald's!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: letterdude
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try a couple of nights at an iconic, old Vegas resort. The Golden Nugget was the first place to come to mind! The fact that it receives some glowing reviews, offered a bit of a discount price and is situated on Freemont Street sealed the deal. For those who don't read all of the reviews, there's two, distinctly different, towers. The new "Rush Tower" appears to be getting most of the attention. We, however, were given a room in the original "Carson Tower". It's dated, but clean. The room was a good size with a comfortable bed and a nice, flat panel tv. Due to an unusually warm 1st week of May (at least, we won there!), we used the a/c. It worked very well. but, being an older unit, it was a little noisy. Very little external noise. Our room faced the Northwest and gave us a view of a parkade and the side of the old Plaza Hotel. If that's important to you, don't get that side. Bathroom was ok. Standard fixtures. All dated, but in good working order. Lots of hot water. No fridge or coffee maker. What's up with that...Vegas? You can get those in any "Motel 6", anywhere else in the world! (it needs to be said!) Our wifi was free, but a little slow. I tend to be suspicious about many of the unexpected "fees". The Golden Nugget, for us, was better than a lot of area hotels, in that respect. The pool was crowded but quite nice, regardless. Loved the Shark Tank adjacent to it. The waterslide, taking the rider through the tank, is a nice touch! Enjoyed a buffet lunch. Not a huge selection, but enough good stuff so as to walk away satisfied. Also, had a late dinner at the café. It was really quite good. Freemont Street is a ball! The overhead, 5 city block video show is a must-see on any Vegas trip. Much more intimate experience than "the Strip". Excellent, top-notch entertainment provided - free - as you walk along the street. Lots of fun. Met some very nice, very interesting people. The hotel was nice and we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property - No Problems - I'm Going Back”
Reviews.Author: MT5211
Reviews.Content: After becoming tired of the prices in the hotels on the strip and the rising crime levels in them I decided to try downtown and the Golden Nugget. I wish I had done this years ago. The Golden Nugget is truly a 4-star property, my room was clean and spacious and there are plenty of things to do downtown within walking distance of the hotel. I've already seen the mega resorts on the strip and they are ok to walk through but I can't justify paying for them. Non-weekend rates at the Golden Nugget are a great bargain and as Captain Kirk says: "you get 4-star rooms at 2-star prices." I ate breakfast in the hotel's buffet every morning and it was unremarkable but adequate. One evening I had dinner at the hotel's steakhouse and it was indeed remarkable albeit rather pricy but I didn't travel that far to eat from a paper bag. The casino is good and the odds are better than on the strip (see above: paying for the mega resorts) and the Deuce Bus is a nearby bargain if one still wants to visit the strip for dinner, a show or to see its glitz. I'll likely rent a car next time as taxi fare one way from the airport is a full day's full-size rental. I haven't heard of and didn't experience any of the scams or petty crime I've experienced on the strip and am reading about here more and more each week. Overall the Golden Nugget is a great place and a great bargain if you can choose your dates. I certainly recommend the Golden Nugget and I'll likely stay there henceforth.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at GN!!!”
Reviews.Author: alyshiab
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at GN. from April 24-27 2011. We got to check in early with no problems. We stayed the first four nights at NYNY on the strip and then moved to the GN for three nights. Our room was right off the elevator (which we requested). We stayed in a "GOLD TOWER DELUXE" room (I think it was the second cheapest room). It was a lovely room. The bed was AMAZING; like sleeping on a cloud. Amazing Serta matress. AMAZING. Not having internet included is a bit annoying. But there are NO resort fees at this hotel, so it's a trade off. We paid for the internet for one day (24 hrs) which was fine. We ate at Grotto twice (LOVE IT) for lunch. - Even got to "make my own pasta" b/c I wanted a Carbonara which wasn't on the menu at lunch, and it was awesome. We also ate at the Buffet once b/c we got it free with tickets to the "Country Tribute" show - the buffet wasn't great and we certainly would never pay full price for it with such other great options in the hotel (like Grotto). We ate one (EXPENSIVE!!!) dinner at Vic and Anthony's which was also great. The ceasar salad was fabulous; full of cheese. And the potatoes au gratin were also super yummy. The steak was good too. Mushrooms, not so great. Overall, the meal was a bit pricey for me but it was good. We also ate one meal at Carson Street Cafe and were not impressed with it (the ceasar salad here was NOT good). Ate a few goodies from The Chocolate Box too. Overpriced but certainly yummy. I loved the chocolate macaroons best, try them if you like that kind of thing! Spent lots of time in the poker room; which was fun. Played several tournaments (they have tonnes running everyday) and my boyfriend played the cash games. Enjoyed our time there. Played a few tables games but didn't fair too well. Had fun winning and losing ont the "sex and the city" slot machines. Fun bonus games. And I sure raked up the 'comp points" (or whatever they're called) by betting $2 a pull on those machines! Servers serving drinks come by frequent here (esp if you're playing near the bar areas) and tipping a $1 is always a good idea. Tipping the dealers helps too! What's a dollar here or there (or more if you actually win something?) when you're in Vegas?!?! Tipping goes along way sometimes.... We went to the Country Tribute show which we both enjoyed. I actually HATE country music (my boyfriend likes it) but I enjoyed the show too; live music. "BIg and Rich" were really enjoyable. It was a fun show and nice that it was right in the GN so we didn't have to go anywhere. We took a cab ride one morning to the "Pawn Stars" pawn shop from GN. It only cost about $10 one way to get there. It was cool to see the store that is shown in the tv show. None of the "guys" from the show were in the store when we were there but it was fun to see the place. Being close to Freemont Street is a HUGE bonus at GN. It's a whole different world when you step outside the Golden Nugget. Kinda shady in parts, the people are "different" but certainly it's a different side of Vegas and very enjoyable. Hotel pool is great! We did swim for a little while (it was quite windy the day we swam so cold) and went down the slide once (it was fast and scary for me!). The pool area is really crowded and small. But it's a great pool and very fun watching the sharks and fish swim while you swim. SO neat. There are cabanas you can rent on upper levels of the pool area. If you like the pool scene this might be fun. I think the cabanas even have TVs in them. They looked interesting but that wasn't our scene. Our comps at GN were great. ALL of our rooms were comped (3 nights) and our Country Tribute show ticket/buffet combo thing we got; all comped. VERY impressed with the comps! We had been impressed with our comps at NYNY but were extra impressed by the comps at GN. We didn't think we had played THAT much (since playing in the poker room does not count towards comps) but somehow we did quite well! Overall, we loved our stay and will stay here again most certainly!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place To Stay Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay downtown for a couple of days because I had never done that. I chose Golden Nugget because of its reputation, history and location and was not disappointed. Other than the fact that the smoke in the casino made me feel like I smoked 6 packs myself at night, it was great. The room was extremely big, clean and comfortable (I was in the Carson tower), the pool is really cool (you should see the size of the shark they have floating around in their tank at the pool) and the staff could not have been nicer. The price was fantastic with no hidden fees, unlike at some other hotels. Really liked it there. Step right outside for the Freemont Street Experience. Go get pancakes at Du-Par's at the Golden Gate in the morning. And for those things alone, you'll be glad you stayed downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money--not good for those with alergy to cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: lwebb23
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. We stayedin the Gold tower, which is the "middle" quality, one step above the older Carson tower, and on step below the Rush tower, which opened in 2009. Gold tower offered clean, impressive rooms that were larger than expected. 42" Plasma was awesome, but room does not come with DVD player, and it coss $10 if you drink the coffee offered with the in-room coffee maker. This type of room does NOT come with refridgerator or microwave. This is an older hoell that has been updated with a new tower and an awesome pool. The only reason that we did NOT give the Golden Nugget a five star rating is the smoke. The smell of smoke is overpowering, even on the non-smoking rooms/floors. I guess this is true of any hotel in Las Vegas, but it seem particularly stong at the Golden Nugget, including the room, lobby, check-in area and pool area. Also, the hotel is an excellent value, but it is a bit removed from the strip, and everything around us is old and a little run-down looking. The rooms only offer CNN and Fox news, no MSNBC. This was a little bit of a downer for me, but not a deal breaker. Internet service is $12.99 per day, which is pretty steep. The hotel will give you coupons good for various services around the hotel, including a buy-1-get-1 buffet ticket, which was excellent. Freemont street was excellent, great entertainment in a family friendly envirionment. Request a room on a higher floor so that you do not have to hear the music from Freemont street if you like to go to bed early. Red sushi bar was overpriced and not worth the money. The Grotto was excellent, if you eat here, request a table near the pool; price is moderate, around $25 per plate. Room came with two bath robes, which was really nice, and the housekeeping staff was great. Pool was awesome; shartk tank is very cool and the water slide that goes through the shark tank is very cool. Overall, a very good experience at a great price. Remember, this hotel is NOT on the strip, and that is why the price is so affordable (we stayed in a delux room for $39/night). Save yourself some $$$ by stayingat this hotel off the strip: You can self park for free at the Golden Nugget and drive yourself to the strip and park at any hotel for free and enjoy the same experience as those paying for pricier rooms on the strip. The disapointments (smoke, no MSNBC, loud Freemont street,removed from the strip) are outweighed by the value and exceptional accomodations. Do not stay here if you have an exteme sensitivity to smoke, but if you don't have such an alergy, it's easy to forget to about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ncrjamie
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget was great. Had a problem with my room upgrade though, but no worries Jerry the manager took care of me! This guy's a keeper. Nice pool, good times. glad we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly OK”
Reviews.Author: tjlowe
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful on arrival, took bags up to clean room. Used self parking.After long trip, used toilet, and it overflowed on floor.Sure they cleaned it up and all, but that toilet just wasn't right the whole time we were there. Air conditioner had a bad rattle that would wake you up when it started.Housekeeping was excellent.We played roulette, slots, and spin 6 ( ?)...the girl here remembered us each time we came back, made the game a lot of fun.We stayed 4 nights, and went to the casino several times each day....never got a free drink, despite keeping the machines fed. No free WIFI...costs $13 / day. Food variety was good, but pricy.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: alexgers1873
Reviews.Content: went on 08/10/2010 got married on 10/10/2010 stayed for a week in this hotel could not fault it food was excellent staff were friendly and helpful rooms were very clean and the bed was the comfiest we had ever slept in i would highly recommend this hotel hope to be back again sometime thanks again for a wonderful stay alex patterson

Reviews.Title: “golden nugget is a good experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: We go to vegas 6 times a year and the Nugget is the best value expience in las vegas - their main long term problem is their front desk check in is long and painfull.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Vegas, easily...”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay1969
Reviews.Content: Husband attended a work related conference in April. It was at the Flamingo, and that's where he stayed while attending (found it to be only okay, the hallways there were filthy dirty tho and we saw beer and used condoms lying around, no lie!)...Anyway, I flew down when it was over and we moved to the Golden Nugget. This was our second stay. Loved it even better than the first stay 2 years ago. Golden Nugget is in the older part of town, Fremont Disrict, which to me is much more relaxed and fun than the strip is. Older, yes, but just way easier and less stressful and tiring. The GN is a very clean, good sized hotel/casino with plenty to do and see, plenty of restaurants to eat at. (both the Carson St diner and Grotto were good, and Chart House is VERY good, though a bit pricier) Anyways, staying in the Fremont area is just so much nicer. We love being able to walk to a different casino in a matter of only a minute, as opposed to the strip where it can take you 20 minutes in some cases!...The strip is also so crowded and so many more obnoxious folks and partiers than we like to be around. You also have to deal with all the vehicle traffic and the crowds backing up at the crosswalks. It can be fun, and there is lots to do, but I just find it more stressful and tiring rather than 'fun'. I have stayed at many of the strip hotels...(Mirage (my favorite), MGM, Ballys, Flamingo...) but I don't think I would ever stay anywhere else other than Nugget now. It's just SO much cheaper and just as nice, if not nicer than many of the strip hotels. We had a super cheap rental vehicle (16 bucks a day at Fox rent-a-car) so getting to the strip the few times we wanted to go was no big deal. We stayed in the Gold Tower this time around. For only a few dollars more than the regular Carson Tower rooms, we got a gorgeous comfortable room, with soft clean sheets, excellent mattresses and a nice flat screen TV. Air conditioning was terrific, the room was simply immaculate. Would be nice if there was a tiny bit more water pressure, but that is really all that I could think that would improve the comfort. Great toiletries supplied, light bathrobes, iron/ironing board, safe for your valuables...Carpets were clean...Very very comfortable place to stay. We did order room service one night also. Husband had a cheeseburger and he said it was quite good and the service was lightning FAST! Typical expensive prices as you would expect, but no worse than anyplace else. We aren't big gamblers, so we didn't spend a lot of time in the casino itself, only a few slots here and there, but it is easy enough to find your way around. Check in took awhile, a very long line, and seemed to be a very slow process for many, but once it was your turn they were pleasant and efficient enough. The pool here is rather cool....A slide from the upper floor goes down through a shark tank. The main pool area however is horrible in that it is so CROWDED! and so NOISY!...Ugh...The lounges are packed in like sardines, the place is overrun with children, it's just not that enjoyable if lying out in the sun is your thing. Our last visit however, we did rent a private cabana on the upper floors with some friends, and THAT is the way to go if your budget allows. (believe it was $250 for the day?) SO much quieter, you have plenty of space, nice cooling tent, refridgerator/lounge/tv, beverage service...just great, loved it. Very peaceful and relaxing. This visit I had reserved two pool chairs at the private upstairs pool (16 and over allowed) but never used them. When I had tried to cancel the reservation of the chairs the day before I was told that it was not 'allowed'. What?....Only 20 bucks lost so whatever, not a huge deal to me, just thought that wouldn't have been a problem to cancel in a big hotel/casino. Oh, and parking is very easy and is FREE with your room card, never a problem finding a spot which is nice. In closing, you just cannot beat the comfort/price and cleanliness of the Golden Nugget. It is THE nicest place to stay and play in the Fremont District by far, and it is actually way nicer than several of the strip hotels, honestly. Don't be afraid to give it a try. It's a very cool joint. :)

Reviews.Title: “One stay was enough”
Reviews.Author: Seni0rs
Reviews.Content: We now always stay on Freemont Street anymore as we love it downtown. We stayed at the Nuggett because of the pool, as the hotel we always stayed at is currently closed for renovations. We found the Nugget in general to be a large, sprawling and impersonal place. The check-in for the Carson Tower was a long way from the elevators, when we finally found it. Except for our maid, we found that most of the staff didn't make any effort to be friendly, welcoming, or helpful, but were content to be cool and impersonal. Since we had to check out at 4 am, I wanted to get a copy of the bill the evening before, but when I mentioned this to the desk clerk the night before, I was told that I would have to call back in the morning. When I went back and 4 am. the desk clerk then told me the system was down at that time each morning for auditing, and that they would have to mail my bill. The pool was very pretty and the lounges comfy, but it was always crowded so finding a lounge was at times impossible. The fact that the pool was small didn't bother us. Nothing it seems went with the room! $1 ea. for local phone calls, fee for using the exercise room and on it went. We didn't received a coupon book when we checked in which is very unusual for a gambling town. After talking to a person who was staying ONE night at the Nugget in a more expensive tower and found he got a coupon book with some discounts, I stopped at the desk and asked why he got one for staying one night and we stayed 10 nights and got nothing. The desk clerk gave me the book. We stayed in the Carson tower and our window faced a wall which made it feel very dark & dingy in the room (3rd floor). Lighting in the room was very poor, even after we took the shades off the lamps. Bathroom was ok, good shower. Carpet needed steaming; other than that the room was clean. We really felt that we did not get our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget and Fremont Street are the place to be in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: westcoastgal35
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in the Golden Nugget. Had a basic room which actually was very spacious and roomy. Check in was a bit painful as we parked in the self parking and wandered all around the hotel trying to find where to check in but that was our fault for not asking someone right away. Check in was smooth even though it was busy. I had a Laundry's select card but didn't get an upgrade because they were sold out. The rooms were clean and quiet. The location is fabulous and we had everything at right out the door. In fact, we didn't even hit the strip and spent all our time in the fremont area. Going back to Vegas I would definately stay here again. One tip would be to keep checking on the room prices. I initally booked two nights for $180 but when i checked back a few weeks before the trip the prices had dropped and it was two nights for $130. A quick call to the hotel and I got the new rate but I had to do the work...

Reviews.Title: “Always a good value for the money on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: TexasBConTour
Reviews.Content: I love the Nugget and don't know if I'd ever stay on the strip. The Golden Nugget has a great new tower (Rush) and I was upgraded to a room there because I was there for a special event. The transportation to the strip is SO easy... and the atmosphere is amazing on Fremont. Though the pool at the Nugget is AMAZING - be prepared to struggle in finding somewhere to sit unless you rent a cabana. Definitely consider the Nugget for any trip you're planning on taking!

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: craiger702
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas three time is 2010 with friends as a gambling trip. This year I took my family. My wifes best friend and family live in LV and we thought a good spring break time would be had by all. We stayed in the rush tower. When I made reservations, through my casino host, he did not think the rush tower had any connecting rooms, which is what I expected. I wanted the rush tower so I planned on 1 adult and 2 kids in each room. We arrived at midnight on monday the 18th and got to the rooms and what do you know they were connecting rooms. We turned 2 rooms into our little own 2 bedroom suite. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel rooms except for sleeping and changing. We stayed 5 nights and had a great time. We did everthing from the pool to the freemont street experience and spent 4 days off property. If you are taking a family to Las Vegas I suggest you google "Las Vegas Power Pass" If you find enough things that look entertaining buy it, You will save money. We were going to buy it online but my wife wanted to see what her friend wanted to do so we didn't. We ended up buying a 2 day pass for 2 adults and 4 kids. Total with Taxes and Fees was just over $500. We added up what we would have spent and it totaled over $800. You can do everything on the list once per day. If you buy the power pass online you get a voucher that you must redeem at the planet hollywood restaurant in Caesars Palace for your actual Power Pass Card. We started the power pass for breakfast at PH. $10.00 off per person with the pass. Breakfast netted $18.00 for 6 of us. PH restaurant adds the tip for parties of 6 or more. I was told this by our server the first morning and I told her she would make out better if she did not add the tip to the check. She did not and she was rewarded. The next night on our way back from the Grand Canyon we chose to stop there again for dinner and this time our waiter did not mention about the tip and we got our $60 off and I let him keep his 18%. His loss and my gain. I absolutely love the Golden Nugget. 4 trips now and every employee, bellman, waiters( either cafe, buffet or Vic and Anthonys are great) valets, front desk personel, cocktail servers, especially dealers and casino personel were a pleasure to deal with. If my family needed anything we asked and we got. I had one small issue. We ate at the pool saturday for lunch and my kids asked for more ketchup with their lunches and the server never got it. My kids survived. Pool was jammed as always. You have to be at the pool at 8:30 if you want a lounge chair. Keeping in mind the pool does not open until 10 AM. Downtown has what you need unless you want exercise. Then go walk the strip and be hounded by everyone handing out passes for every strip club in town. That might have worked for me 20 years ago so maybe there is a place for it. I know a lot of people like the mega resorts and that is great. I like the comfort and convienence of the Golden Nugget and the downtown area. Take the bus to the strip. 24 hour pass is $7.00. I would definitely reccommend the GN to all. Thank you GNLV.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: jeanbaraboo
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget is the place to stay in Vegas. It is so nice to walk outside at night and have no traffic problems and enjoy the Freemont experience. There is so much to do in downtown Las Vegas and a short taxi trip to the strip. The show we really enjoyed was "Vegas, The Show" at Planet Hollywood Mall and the Viator trip to Hoover Dam was the best. We had a wonderful gondola ride in Venice - the gondolier was informative and lots of fun - especially the kissing bridges! I would recommend Expedia and Airtran anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a solid choice.”
Reviews.Author: Sindar001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget for a friends birthday. Had a great time. Staff was helpful and friendly. Apparently the highland games were going on during our stay and the free concert on Freemont St. had some great Scottish and Irish bands play. When I'm in Vegas for fun, I love downtown because everything is so close and there is more variety. We ate at the Chart House to celebrate. What an excellent choice. The meal was superb not to be outdone by the service. If you want to celebrate at a wonderful dinner, you can't go wrong at the Chart House. I get a massage about four times a year. Got one of the best ever. The work out room could use a little more variety, but was good none the less. Service and staff were great. My only complaint was the charge for internet use. Most of us can't get that far away from business anymore. $12.99 a day for internet is crazy. The Nugget and the Venetian are my favorite two places to stay in Vegas. I have never been let down by either. If something goes wrong, they fix it immediately. Thanks for the great time.

Reviews.Title: “no drinks, mold in bathroom and cranky dealers!”
Reviews.Author: jaliotti
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Room was okay except for the mold in shower! Told the maid, nothing. Went to front desk and they wanted us to change rooms to a completly different tower! They did take room charges of $67 off our bill. Still not cleaned. Went to a Pai Gow lesson, the dealer told me I would stop people from coming to table because I was smoking, never introduced himself, never smiled and was very, VERY unfriendly. When we asked questions he would say like I said the first 3 times...I am a high school math teacher not some idiot, and wanted to make sure I understood the betting. As my fiance was asking him a question he said, "lesson over" and walked away. I was alll set to plan my wedding there. I will never drop a dime in a slot machine at any of their locations. I did calll the pit boss manager and was told he would get back to me. Never happened. Gambling the first 2 nights I got one drink and never saw a cocktail server again. The pool was filled with little kids that apparently had no parents. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hides away the oldness of downtown”
Reviews.Author: beneve97
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks really luxurious and looks more like Bellagio. The hallways still has that Steve Wynn touch. The rooms are really nice but the bathroom is a bit small. The pool is very kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly Designed Club Room But Good Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: losharoth
