Reviews.Content: I like the Golden Nugget because it is away from the strip and but within easy reach on the bus. It is not as crowded and the casino's in the area have a very "Old Vegas" feel. The only problem I had with the hotel was the room design. I am guessing in an effort to be sleek and modern the designers of the Gold Club Room chose blinds instead curtains for the one very small window. They do not block the sun and at about 6:30am there was a lot of light streaming through the window. We didn't party that much in Vegas but being awoken that early was a huge nuisance. Also the bathroom is oddly designed. The shower hardware is on the opposite side from the door and turning on the water before entering requires quite a lean over the edge. The closet is also behind the bathroom door. The room was clean and it was nice to have free water everyday and a few snacks near the elevator. This is about all you get for your "VIP" experience. Although VIP check-in was nice - no waiting in lines. FYI - the water can go quickly and they don't tend to re-stock that often. Coming in around 11pm or 12am - there were no snacks or water. Overall I highly recommend the Golden Nugget if you want to stay downtown. The casino is good - the food is good - employees were nice - it is the nicest hotel in downtown. Go to Binions across the street and join the player's club - frequent drinks are served and they are always offering free slot play.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget best deal in LV”
Reviews.Author: oldporcupine
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the GN for a week - 3 times - the last in March,2011. We love it - best run, best price, great service, lovely clean rooms and room service - both restaurant and maid. Food in Chart House is marvelous - had crab legs - enjoyed the bar in the new tower; the fish taco and martinis and of course, the fish swimming in the tank. Sit by the pool and firepit, people-watch and just enjoy ambience. We will be back in the fall. Go to Fantastic Swap Meet on FSSun.

Reviews.Title: “Carson Tower was fine but I will go with the Gold Tower next trip”
Reviews.Author: LaLaLaLESTER
Reviews.Content: Being a poker player that has a preference to play downtown instead of the strip that makes the Golden Nugget the place to stay for me. I was allowed an early checkin at about 10:30am which was totally sweet. The Carson Tower is a hike to the far end of the property though. I will upgrade to the Gold Tower next trip for an extra $20 a night and that elevator is right next to the poker room. My Carson Tower room was huge and the view from the 16th floor to the north was very nice. I did enjoy the Gold Diggers Club and the balcony has a nice view over Fremont Street. For anyone curious about the current contents of the $250 value coupon book the contents as of Feb 2011 is as follows: $10 match play on even money bets $60 poker chips for $50 $2 draft beer $3 well drinks 5pm to 7pm at Red Sushi $2 draft beer $3 well drinks Weds – Sunday at Golddiggers Buy one get one free drink at Rush Lounge 6pm to 8pm Two free domestic beer or well drink at Claude’s Bar or the International Beer Bar Two “Buy one get one” free breakfast or lunch buffet (Monday through Friday) $5 off lunch or Dinner at the Grotto (minimum $20 tab) $5 off lunch or Dinner at the Chart House $2 off at Carson Street Café (minimum $10 tab) Free desert with one entrée purchase at Carson Street Café $5 off Gordie Brown show ticket $5 off Country Superstars Tribute show ticket $10 off any spa or salon service 10% off $100 or more purchase at 1946 Style & Trend Boutique 15% off Budget car rental

Reviews.Title: “Class and fun on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: fordpickup78
Reviews.Content: I booked the Nugget from a Priceline bid. At first I was a little nervous about staying on Fremont Street away from all the action on the Strip, but after I the trip, I was glad I did. This was by far my best experience in Vegas. It's not themed or the size of a city, but the hotel rivals anything on the strip in terms of accommodations. We stayed in the Carson Tower (I was hoping for the Rush Tower, but you get what you get). Although the room was not as modern as those in the Rush, it was still very nice, clean and comfortable. We tried a couple of the restaurants in the hotel (Carson's and Lillie's). The decor of the restaurants is pretty nice, but the food and service wasn't all that remarkable (Lillie's food seemed like local Chinese grub in a fancy restaurant...maybe I just ordered the wrong thing). I have to admit, I did most of my gambling at the Fremont. I preferred their lower limit on table games. The casino at the Nugget was tasteful (as tasteful as a Vegas casino can be). It didn't seem too smokey and the tables didn't seem too crowded. Unless you're paying for some sort of spa treatment there is a fee to use the fitness center. I thought this was a bit lame. How am I supposed to work off the $11 champagne brunch at the Fremont? I love the Fremont area, I'd highly recommend staying at the Golden Nugget if you're into a good time downtown without the crazy modern Vegas prices and higher minimums of the Strip. If you do decide to venture down the strip, there is an express bus that runs back and forth as well as the Deuce (which is slower). Taxi rides back and forth don't come cheap, depending on where you're going fares can easily go above $25 to head down to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: onebzemom
Reviews.Content: Back home from a 5-night stay in LV at the Golden Nugget, couldn't have been happier. Chose to stay "downtown" because we had a car if we wanted to leave the area. Easy walking distance along Freemont Street to several other hotel/casino's for food or shows, and the nightly entertainment along FS was amazing - mimes, "statues", artists, musicians, folks dressed like Mickey Moouse, Death, Show girls with all the feathers, etc...! The drive to The Strip was never difficult, free public parking at all the hotels (free at the GN, as a guest). We were in the Rush Tower, a non-smoking tower, which is the only place that we found in the hotel. That was our biggest complaint about Vegas...we couldn't find any place to eat, drink or walk through that wasn't smoky. Beautiful room, huge bathroom, very clean, quiet, super easy access to elevators right inside the outer doors of The Tower, unlike some hotels where you are forced to go into the bowels of the casino to get an elevator to the rooms. Super stay!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: canadianeh09
Reviews.Content: Arrived and both amazed at the decor of the Hotel. Booked a smoking room in the Carson Tower and was impressed although as other reviews mentioned the smoking floors do smell...smokey. Got back to the hotel about 1100pm after the Fremont experience and turned the TV on.....nothing. After 2 calls and 45 mins maintainence arrived and said they couldnt fix it....right away offered us another room in the same tower and gave us a 50$ coupon for THE BUFFET. WARNING the Carson Tower rooms are quite a distance to walk from the casino. My wife who has a bad knee found it a struggle to walk from the Casino/Fremont. Asked for a room upgrade and they offered Gold Room for $20 a night extra..worth it just for the shorter walk alone. DInt sleep most nights though because of the older air conditioner Overall a wonderful stay and they couldnt have treated us better.....THANKS!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Atmospheric, Great Old school Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Leegees
Reviews.Content: 5 Nights here in April 2011. I have been to Vegas on 8 occasions and this time decided to try the Freemont Street end. I have to say that as someone who goes to Vegas to do some Gambling and drinking, this is the best place to stay. Here are the bullet point bonuses. * Nice hotel, smaller and more personal than the strip mosters. * Old style feel to it and the area. * You can leave your casino and enter another one in under 5 minutes! * Its small enough to get to know the dealers etc over your stay. * Good comps ( I got two nights free at the end) * Lower table limits * Lower drink prices if you are drinking at the bar. My advice is to try it once if you never stayed at Freemont. You can get to the strip for about $17 in a taxi, but you save that on drinks in two rounds at the Nugget .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Camtex27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Golden Nugget Sunday and Monday nights. We had originally wanted to stay on the strip but, due to two large conventions, had to stay downtown. In hindsight, I'm glad we did. I researched Tripadvisor.com and noticed that the Golden Nugget had some pretty good reviews (the new Rush tower in particular). I am happy to say that the Rush tower did not disappoint. Room: Elegantly modern rooms, great room rate and a very good night's sleep. If you are willing to spend a few dollars more, per night, upgrade your room to the Rush Tower. It's worth it. The beds are very comfortable. The rooms are very quiet (we stayed on the 16th floor with a strip view). Food: My wife and I dined at Lillie's Asian Cuisine, The Buffet, the Grille and Grotto. Lillie's was pretty good. I had the General Tso chicken and my wife had the Kung Po chicken. Both were flavorable but the General Tso was better...I reccomend it. On Monday, we had lunch at Grotto. This was very good. The Golden Nugget got a 4-star review from me, based on Grotto and the quality of our room. I had the Spinach-Pear salad and my wife had the grilled chicken and marinara sandwhich. Both plates were excellent. The Breakfast Buffet was pretty good. Nice warm plates and delicious omlettes. Out of all the places we dined in Golden Nugget, Grotto was, by far, the best. Overall, we liked the Golden Nugget and we will stay here again. The location is not near the strip. That is the ONLY reason why I did not give this establishment 5-stars. At night, we mainly gambled and hung out in the lounges downstairs. We watched the Freemont Street experience as well as the assorted bands, performers, costumed people and overall freak-parade. Never a dull moment at night on the Freemont!! We wanted to go party at Gold Diggers but didn't get a chance to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for first time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: formerbrit2003
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this hotel by a frequent visitor to Vegas. We were not disappointed. The rooms in the Carson Tower were very comfortable and clean. We booked early so was an excellent price. There is a Starbucks downstairs which is nice as there is no coffemaker in the room. We took a kettle and instant coffe for the first fix of the morning. The casino is busy but not crowded. Fremont Street is right outside the casino (a little bit of a walk from Carson Tower) and the light show, four times nightly is a must see. It is very interesting walking and people watching along Fremont. The casinos along the street still serve free drinks to you if you are gambling. And there are plenty of gift shops as well as a Walgreens. The Deuce bus which runs to the Strip and back has a convenient stop at Fremont. The trip on the bus is a bit lengthy as it picks up and drops off people along the way. Night time is even busier but is still a good buy at $7 per day. We rented a car and had no problem parking at any of the big hotels when we went to some shows. There are 2 streets that run parallel behind the hotels along the Strip. We used Industrial Road to access the parking and it was very easy. Tix4Tonight booths are everywhere for discount show tickets, there is one on Fremont. We definitely enjoyed our stay at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget and Landry's Select Club”
Reviews.Author: cschuten
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at the Golden Nugget, JOIN THE LANDRY'S SELECT CLUB. The membership entitles you to VIP check in, free upgrade (if available) and $25 free to use on your first visit to a "Landry's" resturaunt and another $25 on your birthday. So here's how this worked. We stayed at the GN on a crazy busy weekend (Academy of Country Music Awards - free downtown big star concerts). We reveived the free VIP check in with complentary snacks and soft drinks. There was no upgade available bc the hotel was sold out. We dined at Chart House and used our $50 credit - It's was my hubby's birthday month! Our room was a rush tower room. It's very nice, but dark. Beds are great, but pillows are not great. Gaming - We dont gamble here. We do our gaming at Four Queens and Vegas Club. LOVE the GN, wouldnt stay anywhere else downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of OK, I did it but not again.”
Reviews.Author: socal55wm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the "NEW Rush Tower" and the rooms look nice, but things are starting to get old. For instance the shower diverter valve wouldn't divert the water to the shower head and then the diverter lever came off ion my hand. I called this to attn. of front desk next morning and was offered a repair later in the day instead of the room change I would have expected. Since we were in and out of room I elected to rough it till we left. I assume they fixed it after we checked out. The location right on Fremont with all the old time glitter has its moments, BUT, there are many panhandlers and homeless hanging around the front of the hotel putting the hit on old folks like us. Reminded me of San Francisco. Finally the food in the buffet was mediocre at best. We also ate dinner at the Grotto and lunch at the Grill, food was ok but expensive, but I suppose they figure if you can afford to spend money in the Casino, what's a few extra bucks for a meal. Almost forgot, in this day and age charging $12.99 a day for Wi Fi access is sort of chintzy since even Days Inn and Motel 6 offer free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “$11.99 for 24 hours of internet service”
Reviews.Author: sedg1
Reviews.Content: The (Carlson Tower) room was clean and in good condition, bed was comfortable, nice tv, nice bathroom, no coffee maker. The hotel stores, restaurants and vending machines are all overpriced ($3.00 for a 12 oz pop) . The overall hotel, stores, hallways, etc were in great condition, clean and very nice. They charge $11.99 for 24 hours of intertent service. (A cheap $50 motel in Montana will provide free internet) From the Carlson Tower it's a fairly long walk tp Freemont St. .Watch out for beggars hanging outside the hotel door going to the parking garage. Also watch out for beggars on Fremont St, some get very aggressive. IMHO, for $50 it's a great value, for $100 it's nothing special and better value can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chewySTG
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Golden Nugget - Las Vegas. We were there on Country Music Awards week end. Was cool to see free - yes free - concerts by the famous stars right in front of our hotel. We wanted to upgrade our room but hotel was filled up - not a surprise. Our room was fine although,clean, all the aminities and they sent up a small refirgerator as we needed it for medication. The bed was comfortable but the upgraded rooms really have very comfortable beds. The pool area is really amazing with the shark tank in the middle. Love hanging out by the fire pit at night. Happy Hour at the Chart House is a pleasent little surpise. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a little more laid back atomosphere and a feel of old Las Vegas. The Fremont Street experience is not to be missed - every hour after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. They nickle and dime you for everything.”
Reviews.Author: twinzdad
Reviews.Content: The room had 2 double beds instead of 2 queens. They wanted $20.00 for a roll away. Wi-fi is 13.00 extra. The casino was the smokiest I've been in. The kids liked the pool, but that was the only good thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is where its at!”
Reviews.Author: missyc_11
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the first time in April and stayed 3 different places, Golden Nugget, Wynn and The Trump. The Golden Nugget was our favorite by far. While the strip is nice..downtown is way more convienant. We are in our 30's and i was afraid downtown would be too "old" for us. I was so wrong. Downtown was so fun we continued to go back to the golden nugget every day/night we were there. The hotel was very nice..not tacky. The buffet was ok. We used a bogo coupon so for the $25 it was fine but would not be worth the regular price in my opinion. The drink servers on the floor were excellent. The front desk staff on the rush tower side were friendly but they needed more help. The line was way long and there was only 1 agent. We were upgraded two levels because they were behind in cleaning rooms:) One of the pit bosses JR was awesome! Really nice man! The pool was definately cool. I just loved it here even after comparing it to the Wynn which by everyones opinion is one of the nicest hotels in Vegas. We cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Endless pounding music”
Reviews.Author: rochne
Reviews.Content: The hard thumping base music from Freemont Street and some what the loud music continually at the pool is not pleasant, some quiet time would be nice. Our room vibrated from the music all the way up to the 25 th floor late into the night. Hotel staff are friendly, Chart House, Grotto and Vic's are tremendous. Buffet staff are wonderful. Skip Carson Street Cafe, especially diner, very poor quality. Valet staff excellent. The private adult pool was over flowing with people standing, drinking and smoking in the pool. Not very inviting. Shark tank is interesting, a little small for the number of guests, great hours from 10 am to 2 am. Take a trip to Furnance Creek in Death Valley , 2.5 hours from hotel, stunning rock formations towards Badwater.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A Guy's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rod_Houston
Reviews.Content: For the first weekend of the 2010 NFL season myself and 4 other buddies took a much needed trip to Vegas. We've all been to Vegas a number of times but we've always stayed on the strip and were in the mood to mix things up. Good decision. One of my issues with Vegas over the years are the huge crowds and the difficulty of simply walking to a new casino. Well this isn't a downtown. The table limits were much more reasonable. It didn't take 30 minutes to find an exit to try your luck across the street. The crowds were not as massive. It was simply a much more laid back atmosphere which we all enjoyed. Keep in mind we didn't really care about shows or fancy dining or going to a club. Our trip was all about watching football, having some drinks, gambling and having a good time. And a good time we did have. As for the hotel the rooms were very large and very clean. We had 5 guys in 2 rooms and we were never cramped. The dealers were very friendly and the drink girls quick on the draw. Also, they were well prepared for the football season as they turned their large conference center into game central by adding multiple large screen projection TVs so we could all watch the games. If we can ever talk our wives into letting us go again there is no doubt we will stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower Was Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rogercsr2007
Reviews.Content: WOW what a tower/Hotel!!! Great service from the time we arrived to the time we left! Had the 5th floor at first, then asked if we could go higher and have a late check-out, she said yes and yes. We had the 20th floor and 25 dollars for late check-out which we really liked. I would reccommend this hotel to anyone, the food was awesome (Steak and Italian). The drink service was ok not the greatest but one lady came all the time if you were gambling at 12 am and onwards but the day service was slow but still ok. Slot pay outs was awesome, we gambled so much and bought so much more because the slots were a lot looser then the strip.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice-but can do better.”
Reviews.Author: Schaghticoke
Reviews.Content: We chose the area of "old Vegas" on purpose and this worked out fine for us. The hotel is located on Fremont Street which is where the action/fun is. We loved the location. We chose Golden Nugget because of the price on the room -a special $42.00/night rate. It was a very nice hotel, lot's of amentities and fashioned in old class. We really enjoyed the swimming pool and hot tub, water slide throught he shark tank. However, upon check in, although very friendly we weren't given much information on how to get around, what to do, etc. We arrived very late at night and too tired to think of questions to ask. This proved to be a problem the next day. Whenever we asked questions we were treated very friendly and professionally. the restaurants in the Golden Nugget are extrememly pricey-so we ate at other places except for brunch one morning that we had a BOGO for. the hotel is very busy and noisy but the room was quiet. Another thing that really bugged me is there is no coffee maker in the rooms. Nor is it supplied in the lobby - you have to go to their restaurant to get it and it was $3.25 per cup. the next day we went to McDonalds and got coffee. A fitness room is on the premises but you have to pay extra to use it. Who knew? The bed was comforatable but horrible pillows. Roomy bathroom and table and chairs are in each room which was nice for relaxing in the room. Parking is on site, but a walk. could be an issue for elderly or handicapped persons. For the price-it worked. Would I stay again? Probably not. I'd at least try another place first.

Reviews.Title: “slept in Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: Evan2
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in the Golden Nugget's Rush Tower. My room faced the Fremont Street Experience, so it was noisy until about 11 pm when the Experience died down. The room was excellent. I had one dinner at the Chart House. The soup, tuna steak, and glass of wine were excellent. I had breakfasts and other dinners at Carson Street Cafe, which was mediocre, but less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Tower wonder...great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLabs
Reviews.Content: Great location, happening crowd, safe, clean and a newly modeled room (17th floor VIP). Check in was a breeze, friendly and attentive staff. Great location to stay in Vegas, to gamble, stroll or people watch. Air conditioning fan is a little loud w/constant hum, but we like that! Ate at Vic & Anthony's and it was fabulous, big portions. Didn't use the pool but it looked like fun and with a lot of places to lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great value”
Reviews.Author: Fisherwoman4
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and comfortable. The place is expansive and you have to walk quite a ways to check in from parking and then back to whatever tower you're staying in but no different than any other hotel/casino in Las Vegas or Reno. Valet parking and bell service is also an option making it easier but I prefer having easy access to my vehicle at all times. One thing we like about staying downtown is that there are a number of options for dining and gambling. I prefer staying downtown for the convenience. There a a number of restaurants in the Nugget complex but you can also find others within easy walking distance. At the Four Queens there is a discount ticket place where you can purchase tickets for shows and restaurants and we've utilized that a lot. Driving to the strip is easy and no matter what show or restaurant we've driven to we've never had a problem with parking. Alternative is a cab and I believe there's a shuttle to the strip. Tony Roma's in the Fremont has some terrific value meals served every day. Prime rIb and steak and lobster is the fare plus the best ribs on the planet. The Asian restaurant in the Nugget is top notch as is the steak house. The Golden Nugget is by far my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. We go there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jandt_10
Reviews.Content: Love the location, love the shark tank/pool area, love the craps classes they offer (free), love Fremont St.! Much better than on the strip. And the price is right!!! $42 for a Sunday night!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOMS! But where did that apple sticker come from?”
Reviews.Author: dartanya2
Reviews.Content: Was on the 8th floor of the carson tower. When our shuttle dropped us off we had no idea where to go to register. We walked over to the rush towers and registered there. Turns out we were dropped off by the Carson tower but there was no signage around to help guide us to the registration desk for the carson tower. the rooms were nice and large and clean. I wish they had blue bins for recycling paper bottles etc. im not entirely sure the sheets on my bed were ever changed. they certainly did not feel as nice and crisp as the sheets on my sisters bed. Also those beds were not queen sized beds. towards the end of my 6 night stay i found and apple sticker at the bottom of my sheets. I never had an apple the whole time i was there. and no apples were eaten in the room by me or my sister or my friend in the ajoining room. The remote in the tv needed new batteries. a call for service fixed that asap. we requested non smoking rooms that were ajoined. my friends room did smell of smoke. nice shower heads. nice bathroom sinks. pool was cool. the water slide is super fast and actually scared me a bit! next time i would slurge to spend the 100 bucks on a private cabana for the last day if you have time to waste between check out and your flight home. fremont street is pretty fun hopping from casino to casino...get signed up for your casino cards for those four casinos on the corner as soon as you get there. I like the restaurant at the four queens, (Magnolia's) better that the restaurant at the Golden nugget. ( the carson street cafe)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Nikbuzi
Reviews.Content: Started in march for girls get away! The staff was super friendly and very helpful (except one manager in the sports betting lounge) but I will that slide! Pool was excellent. Rented a day bed at the top adults only pool. Great service from Doreen who remember our names the next day down at the other pool! Slide is a must and fish tank is awesome! Don't eat at Lilys but the all day diner place next to it is great. The other sushi place called Red sushi is better. Gambling was super fun and profitable. Love the poker room especially! I love the GN and will stay again no hestition

Reviews.Title: “We love this place, and we love Downtown LV!”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_traveller_8
Reviews.Content: During our previous stay in Vegas we stayed at the Strip, in very nice hotels. However, when I go back to Vegas, I will without any doubt stay in Downton in the Golden Nugget! Downtown is so much nicer than the strip (walking distances, the beautiful Fremont Experience, friendlier atmosphere, "real" casino's, the neon lights,...). The Golden Nugget fits greatly in this total picture. The hotel is gorgeous. We chose for the Gold Club Luxury room, a great choice. The design and lay out of the room is both comfy and fancy (a bit dark though). The bed was great. The bathroom was beautiful and clean, with wardrobes and a TV in the mirror (an extra that I really like). The room was also very quiet (very important for us). No nice view but we do not care about that. (I'm sure you can also request rooms with a view but I always request a quiet room). When you book a Gold Club room you get really nice extra's: next to the perfect room, you get like water and snacks next to the elevator (and coffee in the morning), VIP check in (at first we did not know where to check in: you need to go to the VIP lounge which is close to the normal check in for the Gold tower), and free wireless internet. EXCELLENT value for money (we paid the "normal" price for the period of the year, that is 123 eur (taxes incl, no resort fee comes on top!). The pool is really nice but of course full of children. We tried the slide and enjoyed the hot tub. Also the casino is really nice. One negative point: we did not like the buffet that much. But it was fun to pass the whole line with our VIP access pass (one of the extra's that comes with the gold club rooms) (the line was long!).

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Crazy4Casinos
Reviews.Content: My friends and I travelled to Las Vegas for the NASCAR race. We decided to stay at the Nugget because a shuttle to the race left from there. We were not disappointed. While the price is a little higher than some of the other downtown properties -we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean (if you don't count the empty dorito bag that was on the floor for 3 of our 5 night stay and not ours), comfortable and quiet. The staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. The location was great! We can't wait to go to back to Las Vegas and stay at the Nugget. We enjoyed the stay much more than we would have if we had spent the night on the strip. Didn't get a chance to use the pool - but it is a beautiful pool with an aquarium, lots of lounge chairs to sit and enjoy the weather and over all a great place! We were so happy to get a room on the top floor of the Carson Tower! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is a gem”
Reviews.Author: cartour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget on Freemont Street for one week (Feb 23 - Mar 2/11). This being our first time to Las Vegas and going in with high expectations we were a little worried of what we would find staying "off strip". I can honestly tell you we were pleasantly suprised. Neither my husband nor myself gamble or drink so we really weren't sure if we would be bored with a week's stay. All though our check-in was a little bit confusing (mostly our own fault) once we got to where we were supposed to go, all went very smoothly and the check-in staff were friendly and quick. Be sure to get your coupon book from the front desk. The room we were assigned was ready and waiting for us. Nothing spectacular but definitely comfortable. We were pleased to get a room with a view of the mountains. The family we traveled with and who paid for the VIP service were given a room with a view of the corner of another hotel and a wall. During our unpacking we noticed that the previous occupants had locked the save and we were unable to access it. A quick call to the front desk and less than 15 minutes later we had someone there to unlock it for us (our only issue with the room). Room service was done early so we could go for breakfast knowing that when we returned all would be done. The hotel itself is very well maintained with mostly friendly staff available to assist. A couple of the women in the small gift shop were rather rude and non-helpful. Almost as if you were imposing on their day. Tho we didn't gamble (other than a couple of spins on the slot machines) or drink...others that were seemed to be enjoying themselves. Food was always good (we ate at the Carson Street Cafe, the buffet (2 for 1 on weekdays) and the Grille. It was a little pricey but you could always go to other hotels for cheaper meals - especially if you took the bus to the Strip - which we found out almost too late. The Freemont Street Experience is well worth the time. There is always something going on even thru the day and the evenings were great for entertainment and people watching. Lots of security and police around so walking up and down the street you felt completely safe and there were always places open to pop into if needed. We were warned by many not to travel off Freemont in the evenings so we didn't. Buses to take you all over Vegas were cheap (seven dollars for a 24 hour pass) and easy to use. We did three trips to the strip to wander the bigger hotels and catch several of the free shows. Very crowded on the weekends. Beware of ALL the people on the sidewalks handing out discount coupons. Without looking at them our one travel mate grabbed every one offered him and when eh (and his wife) returned to the hotel, he discovered he had over fifty cards for escort services, three somes and other various "women" offers. Quite comical. Our ONLY complaint with the hotel was the "pending" credit card charge they put on your card upon arrival. This "pending" charge can sty on your card for up to thirty days and can be as much as four hundred dollars (even if you have paid in full for your stay). My suggestion (and we will do for all future hotels) is to have the extra cash available for this and then you can get it back at the end of your stay without having to wait the thirty days for it to be reversed on your card. If we were to return to Vegas we would definitely stay at the Golden Nugget again but maybe split the vacation up so we could spend a couple nights at one of the larger hotels on the strip. Any questions I may be able to answer please ask. As first timers I can give you unbiased answers... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: Dacamic
Reviews.Content: We were told at check-in that the Golden Nugget did not have a room for us, even though we had confirmed reservations. Without doubt, the NCAA basketball tournament is a busy time in Las Vegas, and room availability will be limited. And, in fairness, the Golden Nugget did arrange for us to stay at the 4 Queens (which is across the street). Nonetheless, it was disappointing to have our plans changed due to their booking practices. We declined the "opportunity" to stay at the 4 Queens, instead chose to get a room at the Luxor (on the Strip). In hindsight, we were lucky to get bumped from the Golden Nugget because we much enjoyed our stay in the Luxor (although it did cost a bit more to do so).

Reviews.Title: “The pool is icky!”
Reviews.Author: circleseeker
Reviews.Content: The hotel gets 2 stars due to the fact that the pool is overun by kids and the water looks grey. I did not want to go in as there were so many people lounging in there with a beer you wonder if it just ended up one big toilet with the kiddies and the alkies. It was super crowded and even the hot tub, which was supposed to be quiet and calm was over run with unsupervised, splashing kids. They do have another pool but you have to pay to go to it, and it is exposed with no umbrellas unless you also pay for a cabana. The hotel is clean, the restaurants were good and the staff was nice, but if you want to relax by the pool at all, this is not the place! Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: 07corvette66
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget Rush Tower. Really liked the room. We have stayed at several strip hotels and were a bit skittish about downtown, but were pleasantly surprised. All the staff were nice and helpful. We saw more "needy" people on the strip than on Fremont Street. The casino is very smoky, didn't like that. But the room made up for all the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “GN - Alright. Older but is well kept and has come cool points to it.”
Reviews.Author: D67
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget. A Vegas Classic. The first thing you think when you hear it and consider staying here is that it's going to be old, run down, dirty, smoky, tacky bla bla bla. Some are true... but not necessarily bad. Old, yup. Smoky? A little bit? Tacky... compared to Aria, yes. Compared to other hotels in old Vegas, nope. I personally thought it had a lot of character. They really keep it up to date and are always cleaning the elevator chrome and carpets (etc). We stayed in the older Carson tower. We were on the 22nd floor (top) and while we didn't have a great view the room was really big sporting two double beds and a nice big 42in tv. No complaints on the room except the counter top in the bathroom is pretty high so if you are short it doesn't work out that well... also despite the granite and housekeeping I still felt kind of dirty in it. I'm picky.... but generally it was clean. The showers are a bit old. I did the bed bug and gross checks behind the bed and in between the pillow top and did not see any signs of bed bugs, eggs, hair (etc). I know it's nasty but I'm not sleeping anywhere that I'm going to get that stuff.... In fact, the mattress was so new it still had the warranty tag on it. The bed was really nice and the quality of sheets and betting was decent. Very soft and smooth. Local calls are $1. No fridge in the room. The casino is ok but nothing spectacular. I lost $$$ with my bad luck on video blackjack. Everytime I hit on 15 I bust or the machine beats me... go figure. The pool area is cool, though. Despite having to pay a ripoff $20 for a beach chair (and $20 to access the gym per day), the pool is cool and the water slide that goes through the shark tank is neat. Be sure to check out the gold vending machine and the world's largest displayed gold nugget. Not 'blow your socks off' but cool to see for free. The area is cool/tacky/fun/stupid/cheap... the crowd down in old vegas are mainly older people in their 40s and 50s who are there to drink and party. Not my thing.... but the souveneir shops there are super cheap and beer/liquor on Freemont is really cheap as well. They also have free live shows and bands playing... personally I think I'd rather spend time on the strip (a short drive down Las Vegas Blvd through the abandoned crackhead area) than Freemont. Make sure you pull into the Gold & Silver Pawn Shop (as seen on Pawn Stars) on your left right before Stratosphere if you are a fan of the show. Say hi to Chumlee for me. Overall, no complaints for people on a budget who want somewhere clean to stay with things to do at night and cheap booze at night. Rent a car... don't take the bus through the questionable area at night to save some bucks. And this way you can spend your time on the strip and just sleep in old vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Strike it rich with the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: northernlight_26
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was the mid price choice when we purchased a package to attend the Kobalt 400 Nascar weekend through a sports travel company. We loved the hotel! The room was spacious, clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly and although the hotel was obviously full with the Nascar crowd we never felt neglected or encountered any surly or short tempered employees. Fremont street and the Fremont Street Experience was just outside the door and we enjoyed strolling along Fremont and going into the other casinos and businesses. We were renting a car for later in the week and had decided to go with the company that was located in the lobby of the Golden Nugget for convenience sake. This worked out well too. We did take the deuce bus up to the strip, attend a show and take in some of the sights. We checked out some of the prices and it seemed as if the restaurants downtown were less expensive than up on the strip. Join the casino's member's clubs and get $$ off at their restaurants, free gifts, (usually a deck of cards or something simple), or a few dollars, $5 or $10, to gamble with. One thing we were not used to was the smoking in the casinos and out on the streets since our state has strict laws about smoking and we are non smokers.

Reviews.Title: “everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: jusry
Reviews.Content: i have been reading the reviews for a month before we left and i was expecting huge waiting lines to check in, but it took no time a all, and that included upgrading to the rush tower, which we got a sweet deal on as well...our room was fantastic with a view of the strip and the mountains....the location was ideal!!!..freemont street is the best..we have stayed on the strip the previous times we have been to vegas, but the golfen nugget was by far the better choice....it takes no time at all to catch the buses that run 24 7 to go to the strip or the outlet malls, but really, who needs to leave freemont street..we stayed 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed our 2$ beers every night on freemont street...gordie brown was fantastic, and i highly recommend seeing him..we ate at the buffet once for breakfast, and had appys at the chart house....the food presentation and taste were absolutely amazing...our room was 4 doors from the elevator, so there wasn't a lot of walking, and no smoke smell..bed was soooo comfortable, and being able to watch the keno board from your tv was cool....will do it again, and again....plus the weather was amazing..las vegas rocks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Clean Room - but no extras included”
Reviews.Author: asim11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for two nights. We stayed in the Rush Tower. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was beyond comfortable and the sheets were so soft. The room also had great curtains that blocked 100% of the light so sleeping in was no problem. I never heard any noise from housekeeping or other guests which was great. The annoying things were : we had to pay extra to get wi-fi $13 for 24 hours, there was no fridge in the room, and no mini bar either. The pool was nice - it was a little too cold to swim in it but we did go into the spa/jacuzzi. The restaurants in the hotel were convenient but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Hoppydog
Reviews.Content: Due to Nascar weekend and our last minute plans the only rooms left at the Golden Nugget were luxury rooms/suites in the Rush Tower. I was upset at paying almost $200.00 for one night on Fremont Street but decided that since the room was in the Rush Tower it might make the cost a little more tolerable. So we get to the Rush Tower check in desk and the clerk assigns us a room in the Carson Tower. I complained but was told that I had booked a room in the Carson Tower. I have stayed at the Nugget before in the Carson Tower and there is no way I would have paid $200 to stay in a Carson Tower room. Of course the confirmation email in my hand only had a reservation number on it so I could not prove what I had booked. The room we got was nice but certainly not worth $200. I was very upset with the bait and switch approach.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower=Great”
Reviews.Author: justherenow
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Golden Nugget for the first time (also first time staying downtown Vegas) and did not have really high expectations. I have to say this was one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. The bathroom is large with a seperate toilet area, instead of a regular door it has French doors going to the bathroom, the room had a large king bed and a nice sitting area, large flat screen TV and DVD player. The room had a real tempreture control that worked as well. It was done up in nutural earth tones, the tower is totally non-smoking. The pool area was perfect but I did not really use the area. I found some of the staff seemed rude but that was a theme downtown, but over all it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Off The Strip but Right On Fremont”
Reviews.Author: 5LolaBeans
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and easy. They were very willing to accomodate our request for a room far from the elevator. The room was spacious, clean and quiet, a great value for the price. We appreciated the many dinning options onsite. The free parking was a nice bonus even for our oversize vehicle & trailer. We came down for a Vintage Scooter Rally and it was nice to have our trailer so close to store the scooters at night. It only took us 5 minutes to get to the main strip from the hotel. The $25 fee for late check out at 5 pm was very reasonable. My only complaint was that after arranging for late check out the housekeeping staff stalked us until we left. Even though we had the do not disturb sign out they kept trying to enter the room. It made it very difficult to sleep in after our super late night or feel comfortable even getting in the shower. Housekeeping and the Main Desk need way better communication about late check out arrangements. Overall though we were still super happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sauceontheside
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of years ago and I gave the Gold Club rooms a great review. But, I must say, that next time I will consider the Rush Tower and paying the fee for the spa. The Gold CLub rooms come with internet, water, snacks on floor, morning coffee and spa admission (gym) locker rooms, etc. Although all the extra amenities are great, the floor was very noisy, the bathroom design is horrible (as previously mentioned), but this time I realized just how horrible it is. I can't believe anyone would approve such a non-functional bathroom. It is so clumsy (and I'm athletic) gettting in and out of that shower, that I opted to shower at the gym, much nicer anyway. It also smelled a bit musty in there. They stuck a TV right smack in the middle of the mirror and so you have to move left or right to see yourself (maybe a good thing! HA) Anyway, we still love the Nugget and we love staying downtown. Their onion soup in the cafe is delicious. The steakhouse was excellent! I would definitely give that a try. Go drive out to Red Rock; it's beautiful and a great escape. They also have the zipline out there, but haven't done that yet. We didn't have to validate our ticket; they gave us a pass. Don't know if it was another perk with the Gold Club room or not. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Amsobor
Reviews.Content: What a rip off! I booked two rooms for three nights and two days before I needed to cancel the third day. I could not get to Hotels.com to make the cancelation as my computer could not open the web site. I finally called hotels.com and the receptionist said her computer connection was very slow but for me to tell the front desk when I arrived and they would cancel the extra night. THEY DID NOT WANT TO KNOW ME. They were quite rude and told me never to book on line. They would help if I had booked through them originally. The prices are high, the gambling stacked. You get a much better deal in places like Laughlin or almost anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed I ever had in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LindaW4812
Reviews.Content: Just got back three days ago from a one week stay at the Golden Nugget....it is an awesome hotel! We stayed in the Carson Tower, the room was HUGE, the bed was beyond supurb and all the staff were friendly and helpful! The only complaint I would have is that the casino part is really "squishy" - very narrow aisles between machines, etc. Other than that, we were more than pleased!!! Oh, and you MUST try the Grotto restaurant if you enjoy Italian meals - their linquine was fantastic!!! :o) The buffet and Carson Cafe were excellent too, and I heard the Grille had fabulous chili (but I didn't get to it)! Being in the downtown area had it's advantages - it is a lot less crowded than the Strip, and the bus service to and from the Strip made life very easy. All in all, a +10 on my radar!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: I won a great Priceline deal on this upscale hotel. My room was very spacious and contained high quality amenities. The bathroom was fairly small but has a large marble counter. I had a very nice sleep on their comfortable bed. My room was pretty quiet although I could hear the mechanical hum of what I am guessing was the elevators. Overall the room was outstanding. The property has a huge pool area with a shark tank, blackjack tables, bars and several levels of lounge chairs and cabanas available for rent. I enjoyed hanging out there for several hours, but was somewhat annoyed that they shut the tables one day due to a shortage of dealers in the casino. I also took advantage of the luxurious onsite spa and workout facilities. The casino has several nice looking restaurants (although it was also aggravating that several weren't open for lunch) and bars and a moderate sized gaming area. There were also several upscale shops in the hotel. The downtown location right on the Freemont Street Experience is very convenient to explore other casinos and attractions in the area. Some visitors are intent to stay on The Strip, but there are better deals on gambling and food downtown and transportation is pretty accessible. I would stay at the Golden Nugget again and would definitely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: stoew000
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Las Vegas, and I stayed at the Golden Nugget. The hotel was recently renovated, and everything was quite nice. The rooms were alright, but when you go to Vegas who actually spends a lot of time in their room. The pool was very nice, and it surrounded a massive salt water fish tank. I would stay at this hotel again, but the only problem is its a $20 ride to the main strip from here, and about a $30 ride to the airport. The Friedmont street experience was also a pretty cool site to see, and it is right out side of this hotel. The atmosphere in the casino was also nice, and the poker room was kind of small, but I never had to wait to get seated at a game. I ate breakfast at the buffet everyday, and there is an asian cuisine restaurant in the casino with good steak and sushi. Overall this is a great place to stay, but I think I may stay on the strip next time I go to Vegas. I was not very impressed with the club inside the Nugget, but it was alright never the less. Out of all of the hotels and casinos downtown I think the Golden Nugget is the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: JakobMaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week loved the freemont experience. Much better than the Strip for the old world of vegas. Food in all the restaurants was fantastic. Service was very personable and had a manager come at every meal to ask if everything was okay. Felt like we were treated very properly the whole time we were there. Would say the Chart House restaurant was the best by far. Table help at the casinos were very friendly and other than taking my money was very enjoyable. Would recommend this to all my friends rather than staying on the Strip where they just want your money. Other than paying for internet I would say excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMorrison
Reviews.Content: For whatever reason, if your travels take you to downtown Las Vegas, the Golden Nugget is the place to stay. We stayed in the Carson Tower, and the room looked similar to a standard room at probably 50% or more of the hotels on the strip - for $65/night including tax. You can't beat the value, that's for sure. The hotel covers 3 or 4 square blocks and has been recently upgraded. The pool area is especially nice. The new Rush tower looked very elegant from the outside! The breakfast buffet was OK, nothing special. On the 3rd day we discovered the buffet at the Fremont Hotel which was better, probably the best one I've had downtown. Beware - downtown Las Vegas is not the most elegant part of town, by a long shot. But it has its own unique charm. But if you get a little claustrophobic, the strip is a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “My Review”
Reviews.Author: bluelace
Reviews.Content: Hello Travelers, I usually travel to Vegas for business reasons and select my hotel depending where the convention is going to be. I travel all the time and I was very unhappy when my reservation was made in the downtown area. Stay there only if you are going to the furniture show which is almost walking distance otherwise don't stay there. Is dead only the casino and the smoke remind you that you're in Vegas. I upgraded to the Rush Tower which is kind of new and decent. Is a cozy hotel I think must be good for seniors because they were everywhere. My room was dusty and the pillows had makeup stains on it. The rest was fine. Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel stay on a Buget”
Reviews.Author: SmoothTravel77
Reviews.Content: We booked the Golden Nugget on a recommendation of a friend . It was Great!!!!! We were there during the Rodeo Finals. Never saw so many cowboy boots and hats in my life!! Back to the hotel.....The rooms were clean and quiet. We had a view of the mountains and city lights. The pool area was inviting, wished it was a little warmer and I would have gone down the slide at the aquarium. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was decorated in grand Vegas style. Would definetely stay at the GN again, very much enjoyed the Freemont ST. experience.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Golden Nugget in the Rush Tower. The room was beautiful with Seta bedding, iPhone dock - clock/radio, flat screen Tv and beautiful leather couch. The bathroom was spacious with double sinks, large soaking bath tub, Rain shower head and separate toilet. The casino is small a bit smoky and the slots were tighter than my high school jeans. Pool area is great with gaming tables and a beautiful fire pit to lounge around in the evenings. also got a great haircut in the spa/salon. Downtown in general is a bit iffy, with lots of strange people. The girls working the hotels, outdoor music stages and other areas all have lots of tattoos and piercings, which I personally think is trashy. We tired of downtown pretty quickly and spent most of our time on the strip at Encore, Paris and MGM. If you need to be downtown, then Golden Nugget is the golden ticket. If you don't need to be downtown I would advise you toi stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYOccasionalTraveler
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade to the new Rush Tower at check-in and was rewarded with a spacious room on the 19th floor with a view towards the strip. Staff at hotel and casino were universally friendly and helpful. It's worth a walk up Fremont Street to Fremont Street East to see the hipster bars, and to the Arts District nearby, especially on First Fridays (google the event). The new express public bus service that stops opposite the hotel entrance will zip you straight to the Arts District and the Strip in pretty much the same time that a taxi would but for only $2 each ride ($7 for 24 hr unlimited) - I highly recommend! It was wholly worth not renting a car - although there is a Budget rental desk in the hotel itself. Casino has all table games (I don't really play slots) and generally good dealers and excellent cocktail waitresses. You get good, personal attention here and for the price an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “No one does their job well”
Reviews.Author: ghoff
Reviews.Content: For the second time in 4 months they did not have the type room reserved available. I had been offered 2 comped nights. The second trip they again said our reserved room was not available, I found trash behind the nightstand which was never removed our entire stay and the desk clerk tried to charge us for the comped nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: sandy_bottoms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 nights at the Golden Nugget in the Rush Tower. We thought it was really nice considering we were not on the Strip amongst the newest and fanciest hotels. We had signed up for the Landry's card prior to our visit which allows for a room upgrade if available. This only applies if you made your reservation directly with the hotel, not with a third party website. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade to a junior suite. The room was spacious and was more than adequate for our needs. We ate at 2 restaurants in the hotel - Chart House and Vic & Anthony's. Tip: Happy hour at the Chart House is Monday thru Friday 4pm-6pm in the bar area. Half off appetizers and drinks - this was a great deal, we sat at the bar and watched the fish in the 75,000 gallon tank. Vic & Anthony's was also very good. We used the credit we had on the Landry's card in there. We spent a lot of time gambling in the GN casino. There always seemed to be a someone offering a cocktail to us, and we found the employees to be friendly. This was not the case in some of the other casinos on Freemont Street. Great pool area, it was a little chilly but we enjoyed it regardless. It is not nearly as large as some of the pools on the Strip, we were wondering if it got crowded when it is warmer. One other tip - don't miss breakfast at Du-Pars in the Golden Gate casino for their awesome pancakes. Overall had a great time and enjoyed staying at the GN!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: dacarr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ Golden Nugget with extended family to celebrate an anniversary.Initially we were all assigned rooms in the Carson tower, they were ok-clean basic rooms simliar to what youwould find at a Super 8 or Motel 6.We all talked and determined that everyone was a little dissapointed with the rooms so we decided to upgrade and were all given rooms in the new Rush tower- what a difference- the rooms are by far the nicest of anydowntown and equal to rooms @ Mandalay Bay or other upscale Vegas resorts. The furnishings are all dark wood with lots of decor, have 2 42" plasma TV, pillowtop mattress with down topper and high quality sheets. There is a seperate sitting area and large bathroom with seperate room for toilet. The Rush tower has its own lobby and entrance with valet parking right outside. The rest of the hotel/casino is pretty nice-several upscale type restaurants, 2 Starbucks, a very cool pool area, and the Freemont Street experience right outside the door. Even with the upgrade ( +$30 night) it was a great value, and way less than rooms on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “ONIONS to Golden Nugget and their management......”
Reviews.Author: AZSun46
Reviews.Content: ONIONS to the Golden Nugget and their management!!!! My husband and I recommended this hotel to my parents (since we liked it so much) - so my parents arrived yesterday for my mom's birthday (booked a corner suite in the new RUSH tower)....Their heater caught on fire this morning in their room and it has been a disaster since then....... My dad went down and reported a terrible smell of smoke in the room - they hotel did not put an urgency on getting up there. By the time my dad got back up to the room, actual black smoke was coming out of the heater (thanks God they were not sleeping). So, now my mom is sick in bed in another room ON HER BIRTHDAY, they have to miss the show they prepaid $200 to see tonight...AND all the management can say is "sorry - we can only comp you tonight". WOW - what customer service!! I even called and spoke with the RIsk Manager their after it happened and he was nothing but nonchalant about it. Myself, all our friends, and my parents (for certain) - will never return to this hotel again..........

Reviews.Title: “Treat yourself”
Reviews.Author: svetlana_jovanovic
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this wonderful hotel are its friendly employees. There's also the amazing bathroom and the view at our room. Not to mention the shark pool! Two thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, because of the cost of the room.”
Reviews.Author: fabulous990
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in Old Vegas, this is the nicest hotel on Freemont. I stayed in the Carson Tower because the Rush Tower was sold out. The room was very spacious, but had to walk what felt like 3 blocks to & from the elevators. Suggest getting a room near the elevators. Room service was ok, no free internet, not enough pillows on the bed and they were very soft. All in all a decent stay and will return for my next trip since my conventions are closer to Old Vegas than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown property”
Reviews.Author: waynelv
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is is downtown but the property is like staying in a hotel on the strip. We were in the Carson tower and our view was of the strip. The staff is always great as I have stayed her several times. I have stayed in the new Rush tower and the rooms there are just amazing! Best property to stay at if you are staying downtown! I am a travel agent and I recommend this property to all of my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Club Room not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: catfishmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GN from 1/18-1/22. Overall enjoyed the GN. Nice & clean hotel, not too big as to get lost, but plenty of room for gaming. We decided to spend a bit more for an upgraded room on the Gold Club Level. These rooms are on the 16 or 17th floor. We were on the 16th. The room itself was nice. Comfortable bed, nice linens, flat screen tv in room, and a tv in the mirror in the bathroom. The view was overlooking the pool which was nice except a big air conditioner was directly in front of the window, so you had to lean over to look outside. Would have been nice to place a chair by the window and enjoy the view. The room wasn't as clean as it should be, and the bath amenities were never replenished. This room was also suppose to have turn down service, and that never happened. I also think the room was dimly lit, at-lease 1 good reading light would have gone a long way. There was a switch on the wall for lifting the window blind, but it didn't work. I asked the bell boy but he didn't even realize the room had a blind switch. Another problem was a lack of plugs, in this day and age more than 1 plug is a must. A nice touch is bottled water & bowls of peanut m&m's, jelly bellies and trail mix are left by the elevators. In the mornings they also have apples. My husband enjoyed his nightly snacks. Overall its a very nice hotel and I enjoyed our stay, I just wouldn't spend the money to upgrade to club level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HHTAP
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Room was spacious. Beds were excellent. Good casino, restaurants, entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy with Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: larredc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget in the Rush Tower on Jan 17th and 18th. We usually stay at the Golddn Nugget when we go to Vegas at least once a year. We have always loved the Golden Nugget and have never had a problem up until this stay. We booked 2 nights in the new Rush Tower at over $100/night. (at least $40 /night more than the regular rooms that we usually stay in). The room itself was nice and updated. We went to bed and slept through the night on a nice soft comfortable bed. About 6 A.M. the first morning we were awaken by a large THUD and the sound of water running, we could hear the shower in the next room as if it was running into our bed. We were kept up for about a half hour as the people in the next room took showers. We called down to the front desk and were spoken to by a RUDE female who really didnt want to be bothered by the issue. A short time later we were contacted by a women who said she was the hotel engineer and spoke to us about the issue, this after we had falled back alseep. The woman assured us that somebody would be up shortly to speak to us about the problem and try to see if they could get into the next room to check out the loud shower issue. We stayed in our room until after 10 A.M., and got no call back from the woman and nobody responded to our room. As we went downstairs to start our day we stopped at the front desk. We spoke to the male at the front desk about the issue. He told us that he would have somebody check into the issue and would let us know if there was anyting they could do, or if they could switch our room. After a short time out we stopped back by the front desk, the male was no longer there and nobody knew what we were talking about. Nobody ever advised us of a check up and no offer was ever made to switch our room after that. Again the next morning, same THUD and same water issue, again we were awake at 6 A.M.. Upon checking out the woman at the front desk asked us about our stay, we told her this entire story, her response was...."Oh I am sorry to hear that, do you want a copy of your bill". This was the WORST stay we have ever had in Las Vegas in over 15 years of going there. We are going to be contacting the Golden Nugget management about the issue to see if we can get a response from them. My advise to you, dont waste your money on the Rush Tower, we have never had an issue with the older rooms for almost half the price. We will probably go back to the Golden Nugget, just not the Rush Tower.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 8214 on December 17 & 18, 2010. I travel to Vegas several times a year and like to put in a couple days stay downtown when I can. I stayed in a regular room in the Rush Tower last time so I stayed in the Jr Corner Suite this time. I also had the VIP check-in which would have been of great help if I had arrived during a busy time. My flight was delayed so I arrived late (after 9PM) and there were no real lines to speak of. Check-in (and check-out two days later) was friendly and quick. I was in my room in just minutes. (see pictures) The room was of good size and quite comfortable with a sofa to sit and watch TV as well as a separate sitting area for reading or chatting. There were actually two flat panel televisions, one to be watched from the sofa and the other while you are in bed. Hey, it's a Jr Suite, why not two TVs in the same room? The internet connection ($12.99 extra) worked without problems but did seem to be a bit slower than what I'm used to, but most will not see a difference. Having stayed in the regular Rush Tower room on my last visit, I probably would opt for the regular room again since it was a large enough room for me. The only thing the room needed, but did not have, was a refrigerator. Suites usually have a wet bar or at least a fridge. This was my sole disappointment. If I wanted one badly enough, I could have had one sent up, but for such a short stay, it really was not worth the effort of the phone call, never mind the additional cost. The weather was bad during this trip with record breaking rain and flooding. It created a gloomy atmosphere which is rare in Las Vegas. Fatigue caused me to fall asleep once I was unpacked, so no dinner the first night. Breakfast in the Carson Street Cafe was fine. Food was very good and the service was terrific (my coffee cup was never empty). Also, had a Ruben for lunch at The Grille. It wasn't great, nor bad, just OK which is OK. The Grille is very informal and usually you would get something to go rather than eat it there. I stopped at the Chocolate Box and picked up mint chocolate drizzled caramel popcorn. OMG, it was great. Munched on this stuff over the next few days. Unfortunately, I was not very hungry later that night, so I skipped dinner. Last trip to the Golden Nugget, I eat at Red Sushi for dinner twice. It was terrific. There is also a Starbucks or two here. I do love the gingerbread latte they have at Christmas time. Bonus mood points for those! The cost of laundry here is a bit cheaper than the strip, so if you transfer to a hotel on the strip and you have laundry, save a couple of bucks and get it done here. The casino is as good as any on the strip and nicer (cleaner) than the ones here downtown. For blackjack, be careful of the 6:5 game. You will have no trouble finding the 3:2 tables, just check before playing. I found each dealer and pit boss friendly and engaging. This is important especially if you run into a bit of bad luck. The slots are the same as you would find everywhere else. The Fremont Street Experience is always a trip a night. Live bands, costumed characters, local artisans, and just a lot of excited people, not to mention the new "Zipline ride" above your head. It being December, I only went to the shark pool, or "the tank" as they call it to take pictures rather than to swim. Imagine going down a water slide that takes you through a huge tank filled with sharks! And you get to see it all as you go along. I heard this was one of the top 10 pools of note in the world because of this feature. I believe it. As usual, I had a great time at the Golden Nugget and am returning March 30 and 31. This time I will be in a Gold Club Room @ the facebook rate which includes the internet. I really have grown to love the GN and the Downtown area and try to build some time into each trip for them. If you stay here, you should have a great travel experience. Very Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nemoandchina
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I went to Vegas for my birthday weekend, and when we booked we wanted to get a nice place that was near everything, but in a cool area. The Golden Nugget was the right choice! Located on Fremont Street in the Pre-Strip heart of the City, its perfect. Freemont Street consists of several covered pedestrian area blocks, with a ceiling of lights. You step out of the Nugget Casino doors, and you are right in the mix...convenience stores, 5 other casinos, and a great variety of eateries, all with great prices you WILL NOT find on the Strip. The room we had at the hotel was great, with the only draw backs being a semi-noisy AC unit (but after roaming around all day, it didn't matter!), and the fact that there is no coffee makers in the rooms, but 2 starbucks on the first floor. We stayed on the 18th floor which is non-smoking, and you cannot hear the faintest noise from downtown. The room was cleaned very well all three days of our trip. The one thing to beware (other then all the gaming) is being waylaid by the hawkers of the GRANDVIEW RESORT. As you walk in any of the doors (except the main hotel entrance) what appears to be a friendly personal greeter infront of a consierge desk is a trap. If someone approaches you and says "Hi! Are you staying with us?" or "How would you like a few free gifts?", WALK AWAY. What they claim to be a no pressure 2 hours previewing a new resort is actually a 4 hour ordeal of high pressure time share salesmenship. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoking Rush Tower is a Breath of Fresh Air”
Reviews.Author: dfwtraveldoyenne
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times, but this was our first stay in the new Rush Tower. All hotel floors are non-smoking and that is such a relief from the smoky common rooms and casino. It would be even better if the lobby and casino areas adjacent to the Rush Tower were also non-smoking. Rooms are elegant and contemporary, bathrooms have soaking tub and 2 sinks.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Golden Nugget but avoid the Gold Tower Club rooms.”
Reviews.Author: joel90069
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget Jan 14- 17. Couldn't decide between the Gold Tower Club rooms and Rush Tower. Decided to go with the more expensive Club rooms because it included wifi and access to the spa. The room was a decent size, big plasma screen tv, comfy bed but there were also some major design flaws. First, the closet is in the bathroom. I was alone, so that wasn't a big deal but if I'd been traveling with someone else I'd have found it really inconvenient. Second the tub is enclosed and half sealed with glass. The half that opens, swings out. Because of where the water temperature gauge and spigot is placed you can't turn on or regulate the water temperature unless you're already in the tub. If you're a person with a disability or a senior these bathrooms are a law suit waiting to happen. How the hotel could've allowed the design is beyond me. No risk management folks? Third flaw are the window treatments. Despite what the picture shows on the website (roman shades) there are only poor fitted venetian blinds. This becomes a particular problem if you're in an east facing room. At 6:30 am, you're awake. This is Vegas. Who wants to wake up at 6:30??? I was put in room 1608 (east facing). When I was awoken the first morning I called the front desk. No one answered. After being on hold for 15 minutes I gave up and dialed an assistant manager. A woman answered and told me she could move me to 1614. I told her 1614 was just a few doors down and faced east also. She told me not to worry because there were drapes in that room. A guy came up with a new key card. Before packing I decided to check the new room. She was wrong, no drapes there either. Just blinds and plenty of light. I asked to be switched to a Rush Tower room. She claimed they were sold out (I later found out that was not true) Then they sent up a maintenance guy. He suggested I take the cushions from the sofa and stuff them in the window when I went to sleep at night. Huh? That's the solution? These people are in the hospitality business? I called back down to the assistant manager's number. Someone else answered this time. I explained all that happened. He was very nice, apologized and switched me to a room on the 17th floor facing a different direction. Having been out until 3 am, all of this was a little much on four hours of sleep. The third room wasn't perfect but at least darker then the first two. Stay away from rooms without drapes! Spa workout room was adequate but nothing fantastic. Wifi did not work well all weekend. The pool was nice, heated and since it was winter not at all crowded. Selection of restaurants was fine. Had dinner at Charthouse one night and really enjoyed it. Great service. My table was right next to their beautiful huge aquarium; very cool. If you don't want a big breakfast there's a Starbucks. I also ate at their coffee shop a couple of times (Cason Cafe?) and it was decent and fairly priced. Hotel service was hit and miss. Some were terrific and professional , others were poorly trained knuckle heads. Valet was easy and courteous. Staying downtown is fun. Everything is within an easy walk. Golden Nugget, even with it's flaws is by far the best in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: mvrgm1234
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Golden Nugget's "Rush" Tower (1 year old). The receptions was perfect. The staff were very ingaged and made us feel special. When arriving to the room, we found the room elegant yet cofortable and very clean. This is the first time in our many stays that we decided to stay downtown. I couldn't have been more happy with our choice. It's nice to walk out of the door to Freemont Street and have access to other casinos, vendors, impersonators and people you can talk too.... Give downtown a try on your next trip to Las Vegas! Stay at the Golden Nugget and you will have a great time! Oh ya, I almost forgot the pool! Amazing! You actually have a waterpark slide that takes you through a shark tank and splashes down into the pool! Awesome for adults and kids!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is lots of luxury for little $$$$$$!!! Best in Downtown Vegas by far!”
Reviews.Author: Sheepster25
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here at least twice with my hubby. We are always impressed by the modern, upscale, high-end hotel that sits in an older downtown Vegas. It really is compatiable to any hotel on the main strip.. but 1/4 of the price! The pool is by far my favorite aspect... there is a 'shark tank' with tons of tropical fish and sharks that sits right in the middle of the pool area.. and water slide that shoots right through the middle! The pool is a little smaller than many Vegas pools... but worth it because of the water slide and shark tank (if you are fish lovers like us!) I also love the water immersed sun chairs that keep you cool while you lie out in the hot Vegas sun. Food is GREAT.. comparible prices to other restaurants on the strip.. and gambling downtown of course is always more fun, local, and 'loose' than the strip hotels. "You must have a car if you stay here'.... so you can get to visit strip and get out of downtown. Parking is free though! Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower was great!”
Reviews.Author: rhyenblues
Reviews.Content: Booked a room over a busy convention weekend for the Gold Tower at the Golden Nugget. Upon check in there were no more double rooms available with non-smoking. The agent moved us to the new Rush Tower. I actually prefer staying in the Rush Tower because they have their own valet and entrance separate from the busy Casino Center entrance. We had a high floor nice room overlooking Fremont. The Rush tower rooms are very nice and spacious. Beds are very comfy, big bathroom, private toilet and a HUGE bathtub. Toiletries were nice. Only minor complaint is they need more power outlets that are accessible in the room. They have one in the desk but it can be a pain if your plug has a large end. It is the only hotel I will stay in on Fremont Street. If you are looking for cheap rooms stay at the Carson Tower in the Golden Nugget, then the Gold Tower (there are some nicer VIP rooms here, the standards are good but bathrooms are small), and finally the Rush Tower.

Reviews.Title: “INteresting Stay....”
Reviews.Author: LukeMB
Reviews.Content: we were interested in staying at the Golden nugget since first coming to old town. when finally booked we were pretty excited, the hotel lobby was small but nice and clean. i actually liked the fact that i did not have to walk a half a mile to get to the room. we book a room near two other couples we were traveling with. the staff was accommodating , not overly nice, but very respectful. we made our way to the Carson tower, entered our room and it smelled terrible. it smelt like someone had broken a bottle of perfume. extremely strong smell. not wanting to complain or be moved to different floors from our friends we figured we would "air the room out". step one:open window. fail. the window would only open approx 2", so we turned on the A/C and the bathroom fan, and figured it would be better after dinner.well we came back at it wasn't, so we broke down and called the front desk. very helpful staff had someone up in 15 min and moved us three rooms down the hall. everything was fine until the next morning at 0500 when i got in the shower. i had the pleasure of being covered in rust brown water. it was so thick with rust water it clogged the shower head, so we called the front desk again. this time the gentleman at the front desk said they had a water problem and were trying to fix it. i should have gotten a letter under my door explaining this.
