I explained to him that there was no letter and this is the second room issue we have had. he kinda chuckled and said " well i guess it is luck of the draw". so i asked to speak with a manager. explained to him that i have traveled a fair amount and have never had to change rooms. let alone twice in two days. then to be told " luck of the draw" ...i was not happy. he repeatedly apologized and said he would move us to a suite. i was thinking he meant their parlor suites, but after the bell hop told us to go up stairs and he would meet us at the bedroom door to drop off our luggage i knew something was up. in the end i was very happy with the stay,and the suits are great. if we ever do a group travel thing again we will check out a suite. it was great to meet in, have a drink or two, then go out. we ended up staying at the pool mostly. they had a hot tub that was out doors and very relaxing next to a fire pit. we were allowed to bring our own drinks as long as they were not in a glass container. even though we brought an entire box of beer down the staff was great. a employee came up and asked us if the case of beer was almost empty, and we said no. he proceeded to explain that the hotel doesn't mind of guests bring a "couple" of drinks to the pool area but they don't like excessive amounts, so if the box was "almost empty" he could just walk away. so we told him yes it was almost empty (even though you can see it was more than half full) and they left us alone. until we ran out. but have no fear: there was a bar no more than 50 feet way. i hope this review helps. the hotel isn't the swankiest in Vegas but loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shellybelly22
Reviews.Content: Lovely bright check in area,staff very helpful and friendly. Got complimentary tickets to see the Gordie Brown Show, which was very good as he is a great singer in his own right (he does a lot of impersonations) Room was lovely,very clean and furniture and drapes very chique. Maid came every day to change sheets and towels.Fantastic view as we were in the Carson tower on floor 20. Last time we were in Vegas we stayed on the strip at the Luxor. I preferred the Golden Nugget though as it was a more friendly hotel and the shark tank was amazing. If you play the tables and slots all your drinks are free as you get a "gaming card" which you insert into all the slots and at the end of the week it gives you comps based on how much you spent on the machines or at the tables,so we didnt pay for any food we had charged to our room either.The Freemont experience is also not to be missed and the Nugget is right in the heart of it.All in all a marvellous hotel in a marvellous place, what more can I say but I think every one should do Vegas at least once in their life!!

Reviews.Title: “Hit almost every nail on the head... almost”
Reviews.Author: fzeciri
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas quite late because we couldn't fly out of Kansas City until the afternoon. So by the time we got our car and found the hotel it was probably close to 1am. We had booked a room in the Rush Towers, a Jr. corner suite. Pulled up to the valet and was greeted by some courteous guys. Got in the hotel, looked at the desk of the Rush Towers and it instructed us to the main desk... so we had to grunt all our luggage across the hotel floor. Once we got there, there were an easy 15 people ahead of us, and 2 people working the desk. We waited in line for half an hour, not so much because of bad employees but idiot customers that hadn't booked in advance or were whining about something else. We got to our room and were more than please. Very spacious, two flat screen televisions, couch, huge bathroom for a hotel. The view... meh. There was a lot of imagination to be pleased with the view, but who cares. The gambling in the hotel casino was much better than the other places we had visited. It was a bit smokey but... it's a casino. We ate at the Grotto, Carson Street Cafe, and the Buffet. The Grotto had amazing authentic Italian Cuisine, brilliant desserts, and an awesome staff. Absolutely no complaints all three times we ate there. Carson Street Cafe gave out massive portions, had very reasonable prices, and was really the type of food we were looking for after three days in Vegas. We eventually got tired of the glitzy dining, and just wanted a down to earth meal, the Cafe definitely hit the spot. Only complaint I would have is the wait was a little bit long, but beings I grew up in the Restaurant Industry I can understand that sometimes it takes a while to make a good meal. The Buffet... ehh.. it had a lot to be desired. It was quite costly, had a lot of food but nothing that really meshed. Seemed like whatever they had sitting around went out on the pans. We went there once... that was too many times. I love the location of the hotel, it's away from all the hustle and bustle, and perfect if you have a rental car. The only complaint I would have is that the pool was freezing. Not only that but because of the wind the pool was only open 2 days out of the entire week we were there. Fair enough - you can't control the weather. However, the upper deck pool that was meant for adults only, was also closed even when the weather was fine. Why? Because there weren't enough patrons entering to keep it open. I didn't realize you needed a lot of patrons to keep a pool open that already has the chlorine and water in it anyway. Overall, I loved it. I just hope next time the pool is open. Oh - the shark tank is pretty neat too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Time”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGB2010
Reviews.Content: Initially apprehensive about staying here based on a previous visit several years ago. The hotel was dated and very old fashioned for my taste. Anyway, friend preferred to stay in Downtown area so I gave it a shot. Glad I did! The rooms were outstanding, the front desk personnel extremely helpful and friendly. Our stay was over the Thanksgiving weekend and we had a blast. I would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A golden hotel, couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Victoria711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for two weeks back in May, and found the whole experience to be extremely good. Firstly, we arrived quite late, about 9pm, and there was not a queue for check-in as some people had mentioned on here. The staff there were polite and courteous, and everything was done swiftly. We were given a room on the 18th floor of the Carson Tower, and pointed in the direction of the lifts. There were six lifts serving the upper floors of the tower, so you never had to wait long to get one. The lift was quick, and we soon found ourselves at our room. My first surprise on opening the door was the size of the room; it was huge compared to plenty of five star hotels I have stayed. It didn’t have air conditioning, but each room has a cooling setting on the heater under the window, and believe me, it blew the iciest air ever and was a welcome relief from the heat. Plus, I usually have trouble working the air con systems so this was a welcome change. The room also had a large built-in wardrobe and a large chest of drawers (about 6 spacious drawers) upon which the huge widescreen tv was sat. This was a bonus as, having travelled from the UK, we had a LOT of clothes to store for our stay. The bathroom was spacious and the shower, no matter which time of the day or night you used it, was hot and powerful. The hotel itself was pleasant and I always felt safe no matter what time I was walking around. There is a pleasant shop by the lifts at the Carson Tower which sells sandwiches, newspapers, etc. and also a Starbucks next to that. Perfect to take back to your room for an afternoon of lounging before heading out at night! During my stay, I used a few of the hotels eateries with mixed opinions. The Carson Street Cafe really wasn't great at all, and I found the service a little disappointing. The breakfast buffet upstairs (off the casino floor) was a great find, but could get expensive as it was $10 each every morning. In the end, we used to end up in Binions across the street as they did a lighter breakfast so you could just pay for what you had. I'm not a "pile the plate high" girl! The Italian restaurant, Grotto, inside the Golden Nugget is amazing. I had a lovely salad there, and the ambience was great - good prices too. I never used the pool whilst I was there, sadly. The first few days when the weather was good enough to use the pool, we went sightseeing. After that, the weather went a bit crazy. It did look amazing though, and the shark tank is awesome! So, on to the location. At the start of the week, we took the Ace Gold Bus to the strip from outside the hotel. This was SO convenient, so don't be put off this hotel just because it's not on the strip. That is a good thing, the strip can get a little bit too crazy. The bus takes about half an hour to get to the strip, but you forget time as you go past all the hotels (Stratosphere, Sahara, Hilton - the hotels between Fremont and the strip) and you even end up hopping off to see them! Later in the week, they moved the bus stop to the next road down. I don't know why they did this, but there was someone on hand to direct you to the new stop (which was like 100m away - pointless!). I found Fremont Street to be EXTREMELY safe and fun. I often walked back up at 4am in the morning and there were always plenty of security guards outside the casinos, and I never saw any trouble. I will definitely be staying at the Golden Nugget the next time I return to Las Vegas. Staying on the strip may seem like a good idea, but other than the hotels/casinos, there isn't a great deal to see or do there and it can get hectic. The Golden Nugget is situated in the "real Vegas" area of Fremont Street where you are close to the Premium Outlet shopping area (worth a visit for some great designer bargains), on Fremont Street which is full of great bars and eateries and where you can still reach the strip easily...if you don't get fed up of seeing it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good value,”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellin48
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed here and it is still a great hotel, beds are fantastic which is great after partying all day and night. Different to the strip but downtown Vegas is great value for money and the Nugget is a fab hotel

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: lindaabc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget one night after Christmas. We stayed in the Rush tower. It was a lovely, quiet room. Everything looked brand new. They had nice soaps and lotions and shampoos and such. The towels were white and fluffy and there were plenty of them. The bed linens were nice, too. The mattress was very comfortable. There was even an extra pillow in the closet. I always appreciate that. We enjoyed the casino, too. It had lots of fun games. We ate a Vic and Anthony's. The food was delicious. The music was too loud, but I think we were under a speaker. It was a pleasant hotel, and we look forward to going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hip room, awesome shark pool, excellent bargain”
Reviews.Author: Cali4niaWanderlust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Golden Nugget three times now. This time we had a suite in the tower and the rooms are relatively new, so you get a top class room with a chic, modern style for a very cheap price because it is located in downtown Old Vegas. Our room was really cool, with modern, hip, chocolate brown furniture and a great pair of wooden sliding doors that separated the bathroom from the living areas. There was a big jacuzzi tub which we loved and a separate room for the toilet. It is really a cool, hip room. The pool is always great although it can be crowded. I didn't bother with the shark slide this time as it seemed like a long wait. The Chinese restaurant in the hotel changed ownership since our last visit and I don't think it is as good as the previous one. Also, Starbucks in the hotel won't take your gift card. The gaming in the hotel is okay, but you can always walk down Fremont or drive to another casino in Vegas for that. The advantage of this hotel is then great room for the affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed but too smokey”
Reviews.Author: palapagirlontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget Dec.28 for 3 nights....we were aware of the smoke but hard to get away from it. We had requested 2 smoke free rooms but did not get the first night so we did not sleep much - they changed us the next morning and we slept well - it was quiet. Restaurants were great and Gord Brown.was great entertainment. Next time we would stay on the strip. Staff were all very nice with the exception of one young man at the front reception but we did mention it to staff in the hopes they would pass that on. He stood out because he was not friendly or helpful and everyone else was - so that is a good thing. Unfortunately they closed the road to the canyon so we had to turn around - big disappointment but that is life. We enjoyed the O show and the shopping and touring of hotels. Plan to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place great price”
Reviews.Author: stephen46mo
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel , downtowns best,can get some really great deals here under $50 a lot. the in room coffee cost $ though. but pretty good place for real

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a messy let down”
Reviews.Author: cottydoo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the nuggs four times and had a great stay before this last visit. I booked a web winter special for the rush tower at $75 wich is a great price for these lovely rooms. upon check-in I was told I did not have a reservation, I told the lady there must be a mistake I booked online Sunday and the website went to the completion page. she asked me if I had checked with my bank to see if a charge went through? I said why would I do that, I always book online and don't have any problems. so she said she would call upstairs. She got a code from whoever was on the phone upstairs and Walah, there I was in the computer billing info address and all. so she said it never went through I will put it through for you now. Ok great ... my wife had been waiting in the car now for 20 minutes she was already pissed off and tired when I left her there I'm just happy this is done. She hands me my keys and the receipt and I notice she booked me for a different room... the crappy tower for $50 when I had reserved the rush tower for $75 (I've stayed in the older tower, worth every penny to upgrade BTW if you can). So I tell her my reservation was for the rush tower remember? Oh, yahhh. Well you can call reservations and see if they can change it for you... ok so now I'm pissed its been like 20 mins and I'm back where I started. No I'm not calling anyone that's your job I just want the room I booked online for the price I booked it for, and I want to talk to a manager please. Ok I will call upstairs for the reservations department again to change it, and call for a manager. As she's calling I pull up the page on their website where I booked the room. They talk on the phone and she hangs up and says all set its $80 sign here... I double check their website for the current special rate its still the same that I booked it for $75 I show her on my phone . So again she picks up the phone to call upstairs and says ya hi, he says its $75 not $80 ..ok I will tell him. No reservations says its $80..I'm thinking lady I just showed you the live price for tonight on your own website and your going to argue with me over $5 but I hold it in even though at this point I'm boiling. Ok I will just wait for the manager, she had called for him like 10 minutes ago. So without her asking I say I'll get out of the way so you can help other customers, and I move to the left.10 minutes go by as she checks in two people, still no manager so she calls me over and asks "do you just want the room for $75"... you've got to be kidding me.. "of course I do, all i have wanted since I walked in here was the room I reserved for the peice I reserved it for." " ok well the manager isn't here yet so he must be on the phone or busy so I will adjust it and have him approve it later." She hands me the new receipt, as I'm signing Im thinking about where I'm going to gamble and drop the $200-400 I usually throw away in Vegas. After this I didn't want these guys getting another cent from me. So no joke as I hand her the receipt about a hour after walking up to the front desk the manager Julio walks up, " I here you have someone for me"he says to her. I explain what happened he was polite says sorry and smiles I force one out back at him to be polite even though I'm still fuming, "would have been a lot easier if your reservation went through huh", " if only" I say.he looks at the computer and says "well sorry again, let me give you a late check out at 3 instead of 1"..."awesome, thanks"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: nursepolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carson Tower for 4 nights. We had requested a nonsmoking, king room but had to take a smoking room for the first night. The smell was horrible. The staff was very accomodating, sending keys to a nonsmoking room the next morning. The sales people located at the elevators and Fremont Street entrance were very annoying. The same salesperson would approach us each time we passed by, sometimes within 5 minutes. Really? Can they not recognize people who just rejected them? The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The heater/air conditioner in the room was very old and extremely noisy making it hard to sleep. The breakfast buffet was good and we received comp coupons for free meals. We rented a car from the on-site Budget Rent a Car kiosk and were given a Mustang convertible for the same price as the subcompact we reserved. My husband was overjoyed. We have stayed on the strip, just off the strip and at other resorts. The Golden Nugget was a nice change. Everything was within walking distance and the other guests were very kind and polite. The Fremont Street experience with the zip line was great fun. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value downtown for everything the Nugget offers”
Reviews.Author: iowanweber
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years Eve on Freemont and had a blast. The GN was the least expensive "big" hotel/casino we found on any one of the hotel websites. Stayed there in the past, will stay there in the future

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - A Class Act”
Reviews.Author: 2onvacaton
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and we are never disappointed. The rooms are lovely, comfortable, quiet and clean with excellent room rates. To be able to slide in the tunnel thru the shark tank is way cool. The restaurants are all great -the new CHART HOUSE is outstanding. We both had the macadamia nut Mahi and it was melt in your mouth delish. Some folks shy away from Fremont Street but we believe they are missing out on a lot of reality... like real people, real food, real drinks and real FUN.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly room”
Reviews.Author: nellsonic
Reviews.Content: I love the ambiance of the Golden Nugget casino and have always wanted to stay in the hotel. When I checked in I was told that since I was using a debit card they would put a $300 hold that might take a week or two to release if I wanted any services. Internet was going to be $13/day(!) and I needed that, but was able to get it by logging in directly to the service from my room. TV included only the most basic of channels. No Comedy Central, Cartoon Networks, etc. Just local and the cheapest cable channels like TBS. If I were to go back, which I probably won't, I would splurge for a higher grade room. I stayed in the Carson Tower. Nice view, but the carpet was the ugliest shade of gold ever. Total contrast to the classy look of the casino. Other than the carpet the room itself was ok. No frig, but a big flatscreen tv. Very comfortable bed. Fairly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - filthy bathrobe”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget the weekend before Christmas. We've stayed here a few times before and really like this hotel - nice restaurants and casino, lovely rooms with comfortable beds and a great location for people who like downtown. I had an experience this stay however that disturbed and disgusted me. After showering, I put on one of the robes provided by the hotel and proceeded to begin doing my hair and putting on my make up. At one point I looked down and noticed that there were large splotches of make up on the robe. I didn't recall spilling any, so I took a closer look and realized it was a very dark foundation color and not my make up at all. I was disgusted to realize I was wearing someone else's filthy clothing and called the front desk and asked to speak with a manager. The response of the man I spoke with was, essentially, sorry, we'll send you a clean robe. I told him I didn't think that was an appropriate response to the hotel's serious lapse in cleanliness, and he offered to send up a security officer to take a report. The security officer was very professional and showed concern for the situation. He also pointed out to me a large stain on the back of the bathrobe. He told me the hotel would make it right with me, but I told him I didn't want anything - just for the hotel to make sure this didn't happen again. While I am in no way a clean freak, the thought of wearing a stranger's dirty clothes (and possibly even sleeping on their dirty sheets) bothered me greatly. And the manager's weak reaction bothered me more. All I expected was a serious expression of contriteness, and I did not receive that. Would I stay at this hotel again, probably, but I would confirm the cleanliness of everything in the room before using it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; great bed!”
Reviews.Author: GingelaOK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls' weekend and didn't know what to expect. The room in the Carson Tower was so nice and the beds were amazing! I've never slept so well in a hotel bed before. The Grotto was delicious and the craps lessons were a ton of fun. We did get to sit out a little around the pool area, which was beautiful. Wish it had been warm enough to do the shark tank chute. Looked like fun!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget ??????”
Reviews.Author: Kyrcho
Reviews.Content: Service is good but I can't believe that in 21st century there are still hotels without coffee maker and a refridgerator. The AC unit was the latest piece of technology from the 1950's and there is no way for you to go to sleep if this thing is on. Well..... The food in the buffet was not that bad

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Smittyh2ojunkie
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Golden Nugget from the 4-7 of December. Stayed in the Carson Tower, got a non-smoking room but only had 2 double beds(not Queens) available no Kings were available when we checked in at 7:00 P.M. Rooms were your average hotel room layout, had a nice sized flat screen TV and the room was clean, beds even though small were very comfortable. The housekeeping staff was always prompt with the room cleaning and supplied everything we needed during our stay. Everyone we encountered was very friendly. The Hotel itself was very nice, check in went smoothly and didn't have to wait more than 5-10 minutes but it was a little confusing on where to check in. The Carson tower registration area was closed so had to walk over to the gold tower check in desk, in the mddle by the entrance to the pool. Although we did not use the pool (weather was only in the low 60's during the daytime) the pool is heated and there were a few people enjoying the water. What a nice addition to this property. The pool area of the hotel is great with the shark tank, water slide, hot tub area. The Adult area was not in use as it being low season but in warmer months it would be a great place to hang. The casino itself is a little bit of a walk from the Carson Tower, but a pleasant one and we expect to do a lot of walking when we visit Vegas. Loved the downtown experience on Freemont. We were there during the NFR so a lot of action on Freemont in the evening with the 2 stages they had set up for entertainment, the zip line overhead and the Canopy that lit up with videos and music all added to the experience. Took the bus to the strip one day and just walked along on the strip stopping it at a few of the smaller casinos. Lots of people walking around the area. Overall, our experience at the Nugget was a great one and we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget scores a 90 out of 100...”
Reviews.Author: DesertCowboy60750
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget Casino Hotel in downtown Las Vegas is beautiful and layed out well. The rooms were great, the service was great and the entertainment was fantastic. We went to two concerts and the venue is excellent. The downside? The buffet is a C- at best.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, stay at the Rush Tower!”
Reviews.Author: NCGirlLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rush Tower three nights in November. The Golden Nugget is more beautiful and accomodating than we could have imagined. The rooms in the Rush Tower are EXACTLY how they are presented on the GN's website. They are full of dark brown wood and tile and natural colors and it makes for a very cozy, relaxing room. We had three rooms booked and the front desk attendant was kind enough to search out rooms on the same floor, even two next door to each other so we could arrange daily activities conveniently. Speaking of convenient, the hotel is so convenient to everything. If you stay in Vegas much you will notice sometimes you walk more than anything, from the car to the hotel, from the hotel to the casino, from the casino to the road, etc. Everything at the GN is RIGHT THERE. The lobby of the Rush Tower is steps from the parking deck. You are steps from the casino floor, which is right next to Fremont St. Parking is ample, even on a busy night. You might have to park at the top of the deck, but there are two elevators available. Parking is also complimentary for guests, as it should be. The only restaurant in the hotel we checked out was the Buffet, which was delicious. It didn't seem like the "typical" buffet. It had choices like caprese salad, which I've never seen on a buffet! We enjoyed it, and the price was super cheap. We even had decent luck on the machines! The men really enjoyed the poker room, which has a cheap buy-in and they played all day and met some really nice people. Fremont Street is really an experience, which I guess is how they came up with the Fremont St. Experience name. There are so many interesting people and events that go on out there. We even rode the zip line, which was awesome. I really prefer Fremont St to the Strip. To each his own, I suppose! Also, the pool area is GORGEOUS. It was waaaay too cold for us to enjoy it, but it is very nice to look at. All in all, I would DEFINITELY stay here again. The hotel is beautiful and everything inside makes it so worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: CarlosFR
Reviews.Content: I usually stay on the strip in Vegas but tried the Golden Nugget downtown on Fremont since friends decided to stay there. Got a good deal on air + hotel package from Newark through Continental over the Halloween weekend. If you stay downtown then it seems like the Golden Nugget is the place to stay. Not as fancy as the on-strip casino/hotels, but rooms were large, comfortable & well-kept. Good casino staff, at least a the tables, and it seems like everyone playing was a long-time regular on 1st name basis with the pit-bosses & table crews! Restaurants OK but not as great as places on the strip. Best part was the pool & slide through the shark tank, fun for adults as well as the kids! Overall, pleasantly surprised with the Golden Nugget on Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel room was awsome”
Reviews.Author: Jdonna62
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband are from Newfoundland, Canada. When we would tell staff at outlet stores or restuarants they had no idea where Newfoundland was. We were very surprised that these people didn't know where we were located in Canada but oh well that's the US for ya! The Golden Nugget was great but it was pretty far from the strip so we spent alot of time on the busses. We loved the Fremond Experience if you go to Vegas you must go to Fremont which is downtown Vegas. You should try and buy your show tickets in the hotels where they are playing it is a little cheaper. Be aware of being approached by alot of people offering gifts for a low price and a couple of hours of your time. The catch is it is about selling you Time Shares around the world basically. We thought it was a great pitch but they didn't give us time to talk it over before we made such a big decision. You either took it that day or the offer was off the table so that kind of pissed us off. The price was actually really good but we weren't prepared for such a big purchase. We did get free money to spend in some of the casinos and a free show so it wasn't all to bad. I would also recommend that you take a coach bus to the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam. It takes up a whole day but it was worth every minute and we got our tickets much cheaper buy asking the people who work on the ticket desk in our hotel. We were going to go by helicopter but decided against it as you wouldn't get to see as much and it is much more expensive but to each their own. If you are not smokers then you will be in for a shock because they smoke everywhere, in the hotels, the casinos etc.....My eyes watered the whole time we were there but I had my eye drops and cream so I still had a blast. The Golden Nugget will give you a coupon book if you ask for one. There are coupons in it for Buy one get one free breakfast buffets which was great it only cost $10.80 for the two of us and it was awsome. I tipped some of the cleaners because they did a great job cleaning our room. One more thing it is very expensive to call long distance through the hotel, you are better off using a cell phone or call collect. I can't wait to go back there is so much more we wanted to do but we were also exhausted from all the walking from morning until night. Shopping and seeing shows and just site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is a MUST”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSherri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Rush Tower to check in to our Delux room. We were advised that the hotel was at full capacity. They asked if it would be ok if they upgrade us to a suite at no charge, duh, no brainer !!! We were given a Parlor Suite in the new Rush Tower. This room was great, 2 full bathrooms, living room w a 52 in LCD, dining room, a conversation pit and a separate bedroom with a 42 in LCD and a HUGE gorgeous bath. If you are going to the Golden Nugget request the Rush Tower, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here but gamble elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: azkind
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights stay. We only played the evening we arrived. It didn't take us long to figure out the machines were not paying. If you sit and play $300 in a quarter slot machine it would be nice to be served a complimentary beverage. Everyone we spoke to was having the same luck. Fortunately, we found games that paid out at several other locations withing a short walking distance right there on Fremont St.

Reviews.Title: “I had low expectations - How wrong was I?”
Reviews.Author: roblynes
Reviews.Content: We changed our plans halfway through our trip this year and needed a cheap hotel stay, we didnt fancy trying to book anything on the strip, and having never tried downtown hotels, thought we'd give it a go. Booked a single nights stay in the Rush tower room, WOW what can i say? truly a lovely room, one of the best night's sleep i have ever had, the room was a great size, and had all the expected facilities, a great 42 inch TV, plenty of channels to watch, reasonably priced internet connection, and most of the all the room was spectacularly clean. The furnishings in the room were all of a really high standard, and very comfortable. Location was great, close to the freemont street experience, but not so close you could hear everything going on. We actually had booked to stay 4 nights in a suite at Ti (see previous review), but cancelled 2 of the nights and rebooked back into Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star resort at very low price”
Reviews.Author: goldengreeke
Reviews.Content: House keeping staff is the best weI have ever experienced in 40 years of travel. Every day our room was as spotless as the first day we checked in. Check in and checkout was a breeze. Most comfortable beds we have ever slept on .Never a wait for the elevators, six in our tower. From now on my wife and I have decided that we always book here instead of the strip on all our next visits. The best deal in Vegas IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyMacomb_Il
Reviews.Content: Despite the reviews, I stayed and have no regrets. Great hotel and location if you wish to be downtown. The rooms were fantastic. Stayed in Carson Tower, and though it is a long walk to the elevator, then the room, this is typical in a Vegas hotel. The view out window wasn't the best, but I was barely in the room and loved the location and easy access in and out to the other casinos and entertainment. I had no trouble with check in, checkout or anythign else and best of all won some money. It was too cold for me to swim but it was a nice area. Hard to know if there is enough seating as there were not many people out there.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Visit - Stay Here and Play/Eat Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Leaving_LostWages
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the GN this year. This time we stayed in the Carson Tower. Last time I was in a Club room in the Gold Tower. The Carson Tower is farther away from the casino and Freemont St., but in my opinion the rooms are just as nice as those in the Gold Tower, and the decor is much brighter than that found in the Club rooms. My advice: save yourself some money and book in the Carson Tower if you can handle the extra 5-10 minute walk to get to the casino. I used VIP check-in this time as well. I was checked in and in my room within 10 minutes of arriving. It costs extra, but is a huge time saver. VIP check-in can be purchased with ANY room reservation. Depending on the room specials when you book, you may also get a coupon book as well. The specials in the coupon book (free drinks, food discounts, and match play) will more than equal what you pay extra for VIP check-in. My advice: VIP check-in is a MUST. The pool area looked nice, but it was a bit cold so i didn't use it. There is also a hot tub and fire pit nearby if you want to relax. There are BJ tables and a bar nearby as well. My advice: check it out and enjoy the sharks. I didn't go to the GN buffet this time, as I wasn't overly impressed with it (for lunch and dinner) during my last visits. My advice: go to Main Street Station instead. They have a good brunch buffet on the weekends (you can get a 2-for-1 coupon if you sign up for their players club) and the decor is much nicer than the GN's. I visited the Carson Street Cafe again (for breakfast), and while the food is OK, the service is consistently sloooooow, even when it's not that crowded. My advice: avoid if you can help it. This time I did splurge and ate at Vic & Anthony's steakhouse. I had a Landry's Select Club $25 credit to use, so that influenced my choice to eat here. The decor was very dark, and they played relaxing jazz music during dinner. The restuarant was quiet at first, but then got progressively louder as it filled. Supposedly there is a dress code, but I observed people dining in jeans and shorts, so that detracted from the overall experience. The food was pricey but excellent, and the service attentive but not overbearing. The jumbo shrimp cocktail was a bit disappointing, but my 12 oz. filet mignon was cooked to perfection, and the sides were huge and tasty. My advice: splurge if you have it, and avoid the shrimp cocktail. Finally, we get to the casino itself. The slots and VP are pretty much the same as can be found in other casinos, but the table limits here are the highest downtown, even during the non-busy times. The staff overall are excellent, and if you want to spend $10 and up per hand/throw, this is a good place to be. The big advantage of being downtown is that there are other casinos a short walk away that offer more games and have cheaper limits. My advice: play here if you are a high roller and/or like a nice atmosphere, and seek out other places if you are not and/or don't care too much about the ambiance. I've now stayed downtown twice, and I like it a lot more than staying on the strip. Lots of casinos, good food/drink specials and entertainment, and all in a fairly compact area known as The Freemont Street experience. My final advice: the GN is the nicest place downtown to stay. Stay here if you can get a good room rate, but for better quality and value for your money, play and eat elsewhere. Although a bit off the beaten path (but not too far), I highly recommend Main Street Station for the latter.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable standby in Vegas-paying for a chaise at the pool is outrageous”
Reviews.Author: irelandmm
Reviews.Content: Situated in the old Las Vegas makes for expensive taxi rides or interminable bus rides. However, it is easier to get around than the enormous hotels on the strips. traveling with someone for whom walking distances is a problem this was a good choice. The check in was fast but we got in early on Thurs. there were long lines later on . We could not get a room in the Rush tower unfortunately but the Carson tower was lovely. Though we were on the 22nd floor we never had to wait long for the elevator. the room was very nice. We had dinner at the Chart House -a chain but the food was excellent . Our waiter was a hoot ,marvelous, the manager came around several times to check on things never intrusive very pleasant. There is an enormous fish tank which made dinner very entertaining. My only complaint is having to pay for a chaise at the pool. I really resent that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, comfy, clean, fun, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: CourTree1
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a better hotel, especially for the price. The beds were very comfortable, bathrooms large, rooms large. Many onsite choices for eating. Beautiful pool with waterslide and shark tank. Very close to all the Fremont street attractions. A little far from the main strip, but i'm sure there was a shuttle somewhere that I just didnt bother to look for. The only advice I have is that if you care about the view from your room, request it and pay for the more expensive room. I chose the cheapest room and had a so so view of a few casinos and a roof, but I didnt go to Vegas to look out my hotel window.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Goosenick
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Las Vegas I am often torn between the ultra luxury "strip" hotels and those with a more personal touch. Well, that conflict has been resolved. The re-vitalized Golden Nugget is excellent! Yes, it is in "Old Vegas", but I consider that a plus. There is free entertainment on Freemont Street, a number of other casinos within a few feet of the doors, and the excitement of the "Freemont Street Experience". The hotel itself is smaller and more intimate than the Las Vegas Boulevard monsters. The staff are friendly and helpful. The property has been completely rennovated and upgraded in ways that satisfy your Las Vegas dreams. Our room was simply excellent . . . well appointed, clean and extremely comfortable. If you want quality over flash, The Golden Nugget is the place for you. EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown splendor”
Reviews.Author: onlyonmaui
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a nice hotel, stay here. The service is great, the decor is lovely and the smoke level is less than the other hotels. The clothing store on the lobby level is the best! I found some wonderful buys for designer items I would have paid twice as much for elsewhere. Very enjoyable, relaxed atmosphere at the Golden Nugget with good room rates. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “they'll take you for every penny they can get”
Reviews.Author: bcknblck73
Reviews.Content: we recently returned from an 8 day stay at the golden nugget in las vegas..we were very disappointed in everything from the service to the facility. they have the highest resort fees in las vegas $100 per day of your stay which they secure on your credit card when you check in they will refund that to you within 10 to 21 days after you check out if they decide you did not damage anything in your room. we can prepaid and our travel agent assured us they would not charge us this fee because we had all incedentals turned off andthat was the policy between the two companies. they insisted on running our debit card at check in (which is standard for most hotels even if you pay cash). we insisted that they girl who checked us in sign off that there would be no resort fee charged and she agreed. Before we even got to our room they had secured $800 on our card. We had to insist on see a manager and all she could do is wait till morning and call our bank to release the funds. It took they 2 days to do so. which put a dent in our grand vegas plans. After all was said and done they offed to refund 2 nights of our stay(which we still have not received).when we checked out and told they how disatified we were they offered nothing. the clerk who checked us out ask if there was anything they could do to make us feel better we said we would like a free shuttle to the airport, the clerk replied the he couldnt do that. We paid for vip check in that was a joke a complete waste of $30 all they give you is a line jumper pass which not one of there restaurants honored.they sent us to the end of the line any way. all in all they charge for ever thing even bringing your bags to your room and we paid extra for vip service! They are nothing more than a giant hotel machine and all they care about is filling there rooms. no srevice you cant even reach someone at the front desk i waited on hold for 45 minutes to ask a question and still no one answered. we will never stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Golden Surprise”
Reviews.Author: retiredgrandma
Reviews.Content: On an 8000 mile drive across country, we wanted to spend a few nights in a hotel (we were camping) and thought that Las Vegas would be fun with th e casinos, etc. We were towing a small camper so we looked for hotels that could accomodate us. The Golden Nugget fit the bill allowing us to park on their garage roof. Our roof had been recently redecorated and was beautiful, spacious and clean. The food at the buffet was wonderful, and we enjoyed being in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “A few inconveniences but overall ok”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget 11/4-11/7/10 in Carson Towers. We reserved a king room. Upon arrival we were told that reservations for a particular room are on a first come first serve basis. I said then what is the point of having a reservation in the first place. I was not pleased. They told us that they would move us to a king room in the morning. We were also told that we could leave our packed luggage in the room and the bellman would move it for us. All we had to do in the morning was come to the business center for new room keys. This was not true. We had to move the luggage ourself. I do not mind moving my own luggage however I was not happy that they were not truthful with me. My opinion is that if you are going to promise something then keep your word. The room was spacious but poorly lit. There is a makeup mirror outside of the bathroom. The shower had good pressure and there was plenty of hot water. There is a hairdryer but it is in the closet. I had to look around for it. There isn't a coffee pot in the room but you can get one by calling the front desk. The bed was comfortable. Housekeeping did a nice job. Shampoo, conditioner and lotion were stocked daily. The pool and shark tank are a must do. They have a very nice pool area. There are blackjack dealers poolside. There are plenty of chairs and towels. It was still warm enough to swim while we were there. Overall the Golden Nugget is a good place to say. You can't beat the location. If the hotel would have had my king room available at check-in I probably would not have anything bad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget, more bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: golfnugget
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Golden Nugget. It was our first time in Vegas and we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The downtown atmosphere was so much fun and the hotel had a lot of great features. We stayed in the Carson tower, which although being the older tower had renovated rooms that were very spacious and did not dissapoint for the little amount of time that we were in the room. The swimming pool with a shark tank in the middle was a great place to relax and take a break from the gambling. Since we are not hard core gamblers, the lower limits at the downtown hotels made it possible for us to gamble and not feel like we were going to have to mortgage the house to cover any losses. Most of the time you can find $5 blackjack tables (during the evening limits seemed to all go up to $10, but still less than the $25 minimums at most of the strip hotels). The nugget also offers affordable poker tournaments every few hours with $65 buy ins, which were a great way to play some poker and enjoy a few drinks. The food was great tasting and reasonably priced at the hotel. We had meals at the Grotto (Italian), Red (Japanese-Sushi) and the Carson Street Cafe. I would reccomend eating at any of these restaurants. For breakfast we strolled down Fremont street and there were a number of options for those looking to cut the cost of the trip down a little by avoiding paying for 3 gourmet meals a day (Krispy Kreme, Starbucks, McDonalds). One thing we weren't sure about was whether we were limiting our Vegas experience by staying downtown, rather than on the strip, however the strip/downtown express bus made it possible to get to and from the strip in 15mins or less and a 24 hr pass was only $7 per person. We spent a full day and evening wondering the strip and took in a show at the Venetian, but in the end, we decided that downtown was a little more our taste as the strip was a much more expensive playland (We spent more on one meal on the strip than all of the meals combined that we ate over 4 days at the Nugget). The Fremont experience was also a lot better than I was expecting based on some comments that I had read on here. We thought it was a fun experience, wondering along the street, drink in hand and taking in the free concerts offered every night. The only complaint I had about the Fremont street experience was the last night we were there, they had a Mexican band playing, which seemed odd as 90% of the clientele of the downtown hotels is caucasian and don't speak Mexican. Even given this we managed to have a good time by wondering through some shops and taking in the other sites while that concert was ongoing. The afforementioned bus pass was also handy at getting us to the Outlet shopping mall which was another relaxing break we took during our trip. The shopping was approximately a 5 min bus ride from the Golden Nugget. Overall, we had a great experience at the Golden Nugget and will return again at some point.

Reviews.Title: “great Stay”
Reviews.Author: craiger702
Reviews.Content: My 3rd trip to Las Vegas since April. Once again the staff, accommadations and food were fantastic. I can not say enough about this property. I do not know why so many people have issues. Everything I read centers around check in and check out. I have spoken with many people and they realize there is an issue a certain times and are really trying to come up with a solution. I can not believe that waiting for 20-30 minutes really can ruin a persons vacation. I was there from Thursday night 11/4 to sunday morning 11/7. I waited 15 minutes at VIP check in. If it was 30 minutes than so be it. I said it in one of my previous reviews. You are on vacation or away for an event or business. RELAX and enjoy yourself. A very simple rule I like. "In life there is always somebody worse off than you" Have your house burn down or get washed away in a flood or think about the people whos young kids have died or been kidnapped. Now think about the 30 minutes and how selfish that really is. The staff at the GN is as good as I have ever seen in any hotel. If you have an attitude you will eventually get one in return. "Treat people the way you want to be treated". I know many people have stayed in the Carson tower, which is the oldest of the three and they expect their room to be a suite. You get what you pay for AND the value at this property is the best in VEGAS. We ate at the cafe and Vic and Anthony's all meals were better than expected. Pool service for the first week in November was great (Thanks Lindsay). I can only assume that people who bash this hotel just have nothing better to do than complain. This is a great hotel. For the gamblers only "Use a casino host" If you gamble even a moderate amount you should use a host. Ask what they can do for you. Do not ask for more than you are entitled and if they say no don't get upset just move on. I have been in this hotel 3 times and not yet met one employee that was anything but professional and friendly. With the amount of drunk and unruly people they deal with they should be given medals for how they conduct themselves. Enjoy this place it is a great hotel. PERIOD. If you trash it is probably because you wanted something for nothing and didn't get your way. No place is perfect 100% of the time but the GN is darn close. Thank you all at the Nugget (From Connecticut)

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful place”
Reviews.Author: dhaney4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 6 nights and never had a problem. All employees where extremly helpful and curtuious. The only draw back is the location, some distance from the strip but it is right on Freemont St where the light show is

Reviews.Title: “All the glitter you could want”
Reviews.Author: lamington_jones
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Vegas, first in the USA, so we were very excited, and the Golden Nugget was exactly what we wanted. The location is perfect - step outside and you're face to boot with a giant neon cowgirl or something. The room was a bit dated, I guess, 80s style, but it was clean, comfortable and spacious. All the public areas of the hotel were swarming with people at all times, but I guess that added to the excitement for us. We had fun gambling in the surrounding casinos and we walked to the nearby outlet centre for some fantastic clothes shopping. We spent the second half of our Vegas week on the Strip, but definitely recommend doing downtown 'glitter gulch' at the Nugget as well.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget...Still gold”
Reviews.Author: lilsorrel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always stay one night of our five night trip to Vegas at the Golden Nugget. As always we were very pleased.When we arrived at around 5pm my Carson Tower room which I booked for $39 was sold out. So they gave me a free upgrade to a Gold Club room. Talk about comfort. From the ipod dock, to the loungers ,and the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in this was definately the best freebie I've ever received in Vegas. As a matter of fact when we travel to Vegas next summer we may splurge and book one nite in the Gold Club room On Friday afternoon we rented loungers at the upper pool. While it was nice to be away form kids which are prevalent at the lower pool, this Infinity pool is small. With temps in the 100's it seemed everyone was in the pool, and it was quite tight. Also, there is only one toilet in each bathroom so lines were common. Next year we will probably save the money to rent the loungers and stay at the lower pool. Overall, we still love the Golden Nugget and Freemont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown fun!”
Reviews.Author: Btbryant
Reviews.Content: Staying downtown is always a lot of fun. I would recommend the nugget for good gambling fun. The rooms and service were fair for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hold on to your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: PropertyPartner
Reviews.Content: We were in the new Rush Tower. The room was large and well appointed. The colors were dark brown and the lighting was just a little too dim for reading (three-way lamps had one-way bulbs) and it was a challenge to find the switch for the bath, located well inside the dark brown room. The bath, however, was very large with double vessel sinks, a soaking tub and rain shower. The bed was very comfortable and there was lounge seating to watch the large flat screen TV. Given all this it seemed strange that there were only two 8 oz. glasses in the entire room. Everything else that you would need for a comfortable stay was available FOR A PRICE. It would have cost us $16 to print our boarding passes at the business center, if it had been open. Of course, unlike Motel 6, they charge for in room internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Suite!”
Reviews.Author: scooterchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed Halloween night at the Golden Nugget - never been to freemont st. - what a blast - especially on Halloween night! The Spa Suite we stayed in was recently renovated and it was spectacular! The flool to ceiling windows looked over the pool and out to the mountains in the distance. The living room couches were fabulous as was the entire first floor - the loft bedroom up the spiral staircase was nice and comfortable - the upstairs bath had a spa tub overlooking the living room and second story wall of windows, two sinks, a HUGE steam shower, vanity and a powder room as well... the only big downside was the room totally smelled of SMOKE - it was "non-smoking" room but in that hotel, you could not get away from the underlying smell - the PJ's that we spent the evening in our room came home with the faint smell of smoke - other than that - great time, great room and worth the extra money - but not sure we would go back for any longer than one night as the smoke would really get to us!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ReservoirDog
Reviews.Content: Overall good experience. I have stayed at better hotels, BUT who goes to Las Vegas to stay in the hotel? i love the location (downtown Las Vegas)...with access to Freemont Street. Price was O.K., service was O.K....nothing exceptional, nothing below expectations. Mattress was a little soft to my liking...if you gamble and you like to drink, a nice place to get comps. Only complaint, CHECK IN WAS REALLY, REALLY LONG! 40+ minutes. Really nice restaurants in the hotel. Decent nightlife spot (Golddiggers) AND nice pool area. Only a few minutes away from the strip...do not take a cab, use the public transportation "the deuce" for easy and safe access to the "Strip" aka Las Vegas Blvd You must pay for internet service and local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful and very well appointed.”
Reviews.Author: Country53
Reviews.Content: My sister stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights in October 2010 for a conference and I met her for 3 nights.We were very pleased with the hotel, the rooms, the casino and the restaurants. We ate at the cafe which was a bargain. The buffet was very good for breakfast and the Italian restaurant was excellent. Service was excellent as well. The Chart restaurant was a bit expensive. Only 2 negatives, coffee was $10 in the room for 4 packets (one cup) and a charge of $5 to connect to internet to issue boarding passes. Still, the hotel was great and I would recommend it. Just wish it was on the strip..

Reviews.Title: “Best deal downtown”
Reviews.Author: turbo609
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about the Golden Nugget. The best value in Vegas, if you enjoy downtown. Have stayed there many times and have always found them helpful and more than worth the money!!! solid 4 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Late review Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: webfeetmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at the Golden Nugget Sept 15th to Sept 21st and we all thought the hotel and casino was a great place to stay. We stayed in the Carson Tower which is not the newest one however, our rooms were clean and spacious and our beds were very comfortable. The casino has been updated and is kept very clean for the large crowds that were in and out it was the busiest casino on Fremont Street. The weather was extremely warm and we did use the pool it was very crowed but we found chairs and there was room in the water. People seemed to have fun going on the water slide that goes through the shark tank. There are some very nice restaurants and lounges through out the hotel and casino. We gambled and ate some of the hotel and casinos on Fremont Street and the Golden Nugget was by far the best and we did use the valet parking which was really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “"GOLDEN NUGGET, NEW TOWER, AWFUL"”
Reviews.Author: bobi1229
Reviews.Content: GOLDEN NUGGET-DOWNTOWN LAS VEGAS Many people (20-30) were standing in line to check-in along w/myself, late at night, and there was only one (1) person at the desk checking us in. After we began to joke & complain to each other while we stood in line, another staff person, a male came out to the desk to help us check in. He stated to me, "I will up-grade you, no extra charge"; I thanked him but just wanted to get to my room, check the room out for cleanliness, drop my luggage & "Go play" w/my sister who lives in Vegas. The room was a large beautiful suite in the new tower, "Oh lucky me". Slept well the first day; but for the next two-three (2-3) nights, I was kept awake till 4 AM because the suite was right above a night club inside the Golden Nugget. I did not want to re-pack, & take time away from having fun w/my sister, so I did not complain then; after returning home, Hawaii, I wrote to both the hotel & the corporate offices, about the very loud & awful music, banging away into the night. I have not heard back from any person connected to the GOLDEN NUGGET. I paid my bill in full, gambled in the hotel, & paid for my drinks & food at the various, expensive, ($10 martinis), bars & eateries. Its true, you get what you pay for; I will stay at the Bellagio as I always do; no hope downtown at having fun, sleeping well to refresh for more fun. GOLDEN NUGGET sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience staying at the Golden Nugget!!”
Reviews.Author: 57119Judy
Reviews.Content: We checked in our room which was in Rush Towers, but nothing to rave about. First the TV would not work or play movies. So we called and several times and they finally sent a tech. up and he said to recommend another room which we did, so we went to the second room and no TV or playing movies. So we spend the next morning waiting for them to find us another room and as usual no movies, we gave up. Stayed 2 nights but stayed in 3 different rooms. and on our bill was charged three. the guys at the front desk were so rude. We finally demanded to the manager and he did knock off $60.00 of our bill.---------------Never again to stay at the Golden Nugget

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, noisy room.”
Reviews.Author: hppy2bme
Reviews.Content: We chose the Nugget because it was promoted as a host hotel for the PBR event. We arrived at 11PM to find our room not ready. We were told that we had to wait at least 30 minutes for our room. We were not offered the choice to leave our bags and had to stand in the lobby and wait. The next morning we asked about a shuttle to the PBR events and were told that there was no transportation provided by the hotel. The room although on the 18th floor faced the Fremont experience and we could hear the very loud music from the street until it shut down at 2am. We're not sure if the bed had bed bugs or if we were allergic to the detergent the hotel uses, but we both started itching as soon as we laid down. We did ask to have the sheets changed during our stay but still had the same issue, so we're thinking bed bugs. The hotel comped us one nights room, but of course the cheapest night and then messed up and credited and charged the wrong credit card. All in all from start to finish a very negative experience. We would never consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: richpill
Reviews.Content: The Golden nugget was a nice a hotel. The actual room was nothing special though. It is the run of the mill room. It has its own safe. There is no real view from the room though. There was no refrigerator. You also have to pay for internet access. If you are staying at the hotel it is free self parking. The room itself was a nice size although the bathroom is small. The cleaning room comes in very early. One day we were in our room by 12 and we had to call to get the room cleaned. And one day we left around 8 for breakfast and when we came back in an hour the room had been clean. I do not know if you would count that as a good thing or not but for us it was not especially in Vegas where you are out at least to 1am. The casino part was one of the nicer ones in downtown Vegas. The pool was nice, it has shark tank where a slide goes through. It was ok. It also has an arcade for smaller children but I never actually went inside. They also have a club called Gold Diggers but we did not enter it either.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Waste of Money.”
Reviews.Author: fotografiik
Reviews.Content: I've been to Fremont Street multiple times and have stayed in a handful of the hotels along the street and this was by far the worst experience I've ever had in a hotel. When we first arrived, they let us check in before the room had been cleaned which led to an hour long stretch of encounters with the overly intrusive cleaning staff (who let themselves in and don't wait for you to answer the door). Directly after the room was finished being cleaned and right after I had gotten out of the shower, the power to the entire hotel went out for a few hours. Since this was the day before my brothers wedding (which was held at the Golden Nugget), most of the wedding guests couldn't check into the hotel after their planes had arrived so had to get ready for the rehearsal dinner at the airport and restaurant. The next few days were filled with rude staff at the front desk, restaurants, and pool and ended with the hotel refusing to comp. anything for any one of the wedding guests for the extensive power outage. I left the hotel with my credit card being charged prematurely when I had explained to the man at the front desk that my room and another room would be put on the same credit card when my father arrived to check in. This then led to me having to wait 5 days for the money to be placed back into my account with the hotel refusing to pay any over-drafting fees they caused. This was the absolute biggest waste of money on a hotel I've ever experienced in my life. Do yourself a favor and spend your time and money elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “It's not the Nugget of yester-year, but trying to hang...”
Reviews.Author: BryanBoerne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I very much enjoy Downtown over the Strip, and we have been 'regulars' at the Nugget over the years. However, it's been about four years since our last visit. We stayed in the Carson Tower, where we have always stayed, and it appears this section of the hotel has been allowed to age in lieu of the newer Rush Tower section, which is now the 'upscale' portion. Also, an unsual turn from the days of old...the breakfast buffet was very dissappointing, rude/slow wait staff and bland food. This buffet used to be one of the highlights of our day. The swimming pool is phenomenal. It's worth a trip through the hotel simply to see it. With all that said, we will return to the Golden Nugget based on it's location downtown and overall decent value. However, we might price the Rush Tower to experience what we were once accustomed to.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: SmirkingPixie
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas so weren't really sure what to expect. Contrary to other reviews, the check in was relatively painless and we had a room in the Carson Tower. The room was huge but the bathroom was tiny - seems odd when there is so much floor footage. Our floor was non-smoking but of course stank of smoke - luckily our room was at the very far end of the corridor so the smell faded by the time we reached our door. The main issue was that BA lost our luggage so we were in constant touch with the Front Desk and the Lost/Found dept to try and get it resolved. Typical attitude was speaking to somebody face to face at Reception, being encouraged that they would help us if we rang down with reference numbers, only to be told 5 mins later when we rang from upstairs that the relevant person had left for the day. All in all, they say all the right things but that's where the customer service stops. Why is this? Having said that, I liked being Downtown, enjoyed the quirkiness of the area and Fremont Street and would probably prefer it to the Strip (tho I know it's not everybodys cup of tea). Lots of outside/street acts, including Kevin James, the magician from America's Got Talent - he was great! One of our cases eventually turned up but was in the Business Centre for about 24 hours before we were actually told ....... But I would recommend the hotel as a base as long as you don't expect too much. We didn't eat in the hotel at all - it all looked a bit sad from what we could see and of course is pretty expensive. And why limit yourself to the hotel when there's so many other places to eat in Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay..”
Reviews.Author: EternalFyre83
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas for my birthday and we stayed at the Golden Nugget for the week. The room was big and very clean, with a nice view of the strip. The hotel itself was located in downtown Las Vegas, so if you're wanting to get away from the craziness of the strip, you can still Casino hop and check different sights downtown. The strip was a direct bus ride from the hotel which was very convenient. The GN has a number of on-site restaurants, we didn't try all of them, but the ones we've eaten at..including using room service one night..wasn't bad at all. Spent some time at the pool, it was clean and got busy during the day but had no problem finding a lounge chair..one of the hotel's attractions is the pool water slide... I didn't use much of the other hotel services, aside from the Casino, so not much to say in that regard but I had no issues with this hotel and overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: MBethel
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms for a great price. The rooms have been renovated recently and are a great value. This was our third trip in the past two years, and I have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for an event”
Reviews.Author: stabard
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Nugget for the Ad Softball World Series. We stayed in the Rush Tower where the room was large and comfortable. I am a light sleeper and the room on the 19th floor was very quiet, just what was needed after a long day on the softball fields. The pool area was a little on the small side and the hot tub was very crowded ( full of softballers) The area the hotel is located is a little out of the way for Vegas. If you do not have a car it can get expensive using cabs to and from the strip. However if you do have a car the parking is free for hotel guests. If i was going to Vegas on vacation I would not use this hotel as it is too far from the srip.However for the softball series at Big League Dreams it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoser_ehh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Treasure Island before going here. I wish we had stayed here the whole time! The only thing we didn't like about The Nugget was the location and they charge 12.00 for WIFI - who charges for WIFI these days!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN..........”
Reviews.Author: copper999
Reviews.Content: Okay, we arrived at the Golden Nugget on Mon., Oct 19 - 22nd...........On Wed., we had plumbing problems, Sink was backing up, the tub didn't drain probably, on Thursday, we spoke to a housekeeping attendant and she used our phone to call the front desk......two hours later, no one showed up, at this time we had "black" sewage half way up our sink and some in the bathtub, my husband had to use a plastic bag to drain the sink.......so we called again and were told that someone would be up in five minutes, not..no one showed up..more than 5 hours of our time, our paid time waiting for someone who never showed up...at the end of the night, my husband called the front desk, and they said someone would be calling us.........never happened. We enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas, other than for the "hotel's concern" of our problem, which they obviously didn't care.....such wonderful reviews of this hotel, I beg to differ. Our travel agent referred us to this hotel, will be hearing from us.........horrible service...next time would stay at a "better" hotel within Freemont St., Someone should contact "management" and improve on their client services..oh by the way internet service in your room was $13,00 per day, right, you can go down to Freemont St., for nothing and get your internet.........Room 2075..British Columbia

Reviews.Title: “stunning!”
Reviews.Author: bethney80
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I have lived in Las Vegas for years. My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas the night of my 30th birthday. I booked one of their Jr. corner suites. The room was very large and with modern decor. There was a living area and a sleeping area. I was pretty surprised that there was no mini fridge or microwave, but that was hardly worth mentioning. The bathroom was stunning....tho the "large soaking tub" isn't very big. It won't fit 2 adults unless you are both tiny. The bed was, without a doubt, the most comfy bed I have ever slept in. Even better than my bed at home. They have big fluffy pillows and big fluffy towels. The Golden Nugget is usually the most expensive hotel downtown....but it was gorgeous. Also, the front desk staff were very nice and efficient. And if you are a terribly light sleeper like me, no worries. Ask for an upper floor. I slept like a baby. Enjoy! (also, parking is free is you are a hotel guest)

Reviews.Title: “Aggravation”
Reviews.Author: eslienau
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are spotless clean, that is an expectation. Checking in to a 30 minute wait at the check-in wing clear on the other side of the hotel (the only one open) was an omen of the beginning of 3 days of testing our patience. Confirmed for a king with my wife celebrating an anniversary, we received a room with 2 doubles. We were told to check the next day only between 12 and 4 for availability of a king. (Nice way to break up a day!) Finally got the king but every walk to the elevator was met with by a salesperson hawking "free show tickets" in the hope of securing a deposit for a trip to Vegas at a later date. After the third elevator trip it gets really old and a little abusive. Parking validation had to be done every time we took the car which was another walk to the cafe cashier for a stamp. The next day was met with a 6 or seven hour power failure (didn't hang around to clock that one) The following day, the parking garage was closed on our return for some unknown reason-had to park down the block on the street until that evening. A minimum $10 charge just to go to the pool area was petty as well. Friday night when crowds showed up, the parking garage filled to capacity probably due to the 60 or so parking spots roped off closed for no apparent reason. We had some medication that required refrigeration but a trip to the floor ice machine yield no ice on 2 different floors All in all while the staff was courteous, and well meaning, this trip was just plain agravation.

Reviews.Title: “Not such a great say this time....”
Reviews.Author: BACJS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rush Tower when it opened last November, and the service and standards were very high. This time, our bathroom was not very clean; I advised staff of this when we checked in (orthodontic elastic on bathroom floor etc) the elastic was still on the floor on Friday; we checked in on Monday. The H2O pool that is part of the Rush tower now charges $50.00 to sit by it during the week and much more on weekends.....the food in the buffet was okay in the morning, however; get there early if you want it to be hot.....I am unsure if we will stay here again. Having said that the beds are very comfortable in the tower and it is non-smoking...

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Cities”
Reviews.Author: rnbnut
Reviews.Content: Let's get this straight, boys and girls, there are two Vegases: "Downtown" (Fremont Street), and "The Strip". The Strip has the newer mega-hotels, and is where you probably want to stay if you're limited to one trip to Vegas. Fremont Street is either a $30 cab ride or a 1-2 hr. (esp. at night) bus ride away, each way. Fremont Street is more 'old-style' Vegas, much more user-friendly, you could walk the whole length in about 15 minutes, but you'd be missing all the fun. Fremont Street is made for strolling, watching the street artists, the street musicians, dancing to the free live music, and so much more. This is where you'll find the Golden Nugget. Our stay at the Golden Nugget rivaled any of our many stays on The Strip. We stayed in the Carson Tower, had a nice, basic hotel room for a very reasonable price. Wish there was a coffee maker and refrigerator, but for some reason these amenities are rather rare in Las Vegas. Nice, clean, basic, hotel room, with a wonderfully comfortable king bed. The one thing that sets the Golden Nugget above other hotels is the pool. Or rather, pools. First of all, all rooms come equipped with bathrobes. Very cool, if you pack light, as we do. Change into your swimwear in your room, walk on down to the pools. The main pool is big, with a lot of deck space for more than enough chaise lounges, and assorted other seating arrangements. Two very special features make this pool unique. First, it's built around a shark tank. Secondly, it's got a water slide! VERY fun! It's only three stories tall, but it runs pretty fast, twists and turns, and ends with an acrylic tube shooting you through the shark tank. Free. Take a ride, towel off at the bottom, enjoy a cocktail, another ride may seem like a good idea. Our only problem was the hot tub. A large, very inviting hot tub right off the main pool. While we were there, we counted 11 children at one point using the hot tub as a kiddie pool. Splashing, running, frollicking, diving(!?). There is an adults only pool on the 3rd floor, but they charge $20 for a chaise lounge chair, and it was totally dead when we checked it out. Good thing or bad thing, your call. Oh, by the way, yes, it'll cost you $13/day for wifi. Really.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, shame about the service which kinda ruined the whole stay :-(”
Reviews.Author: kirsty389
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vegas with a friend as part of a road trip and having spent ages trying to decide on a Vegas hotel we opted for the Golden Nugget which wasn't particularly cheap and is not on the strip but it looked really nice and we thought that it might be better not to be in thick of things all of the time. We arrived in LV mid-late afternoon on Saturday and drove round and round looking for the hotel car park. In the end we had to resort to parking in a public car park and then finding the hotel on foot to find out how to get to the parking. There are two options for parking – valet or self park. If you can, go for the valet parking. We went self park and ended up nearly parking at the very top of the car park because it was pretty full and most of the lower spaces were reserved for the valet parking but even if you do end up at the top there are lifts so it’s not too bad. When we checked in there was a bit of a wait (about 20 minutes) and the receptionist was quite helpful. The room was lovely - huge bed which was super comfy, massive TV, very very impressive bathroom with his n hers sinks and a lovely deep tub and air con. On the downside - there's no tea/coffee making facilities and they put bottles of water in your room which you can buy for $7! We were advised not to drink the water from the tap (when you smell it you'll understand why!) so ended up buying water but not at $7 a bottle! There’s a 24 hour Walgreens just a short walk from the front of the hotel on the corner which is the best place for supplies and the odd cheaper souvenir. On the first night we were tired so decided to eat at one of the restaurants in the casino, the Grotto. Don’t bother – very expensive and very very poor service. We were ignored for about 10 minutes when we arrived and eventually found ourselves a table in the bar area. We then waited a further 30 minutes for a menu but weren’t offered any drinks so, not really knowing the etiquette, we went to the bar and bought 2 Buds for $9.75! The guy behind the bar was extremely rude and said we should wait for our server but did serve us. Eventually our server appeared and we ordered, waited another 30 minutes, got our food and then needed another drink but no server anywhere so we went back to the bar and again the bar tender was extremely rude again. In fairness it was a Saturday night, they were busy and the servers were stretched but it took us about 2 hours to have a quick meal which was very expensive and we were mostly ignored expect for the bar tender to be rude to! Another downer is that there is no free internet access – if you want wifi it’s something like $12.99 per day. As two travellers both trying to keep in touch with family and friends we both have android phones and decided that it was worth paying the money. When we went to check out we were told that there was $90 to pay for internet access (we were there for 4 nights)! We were then advised that the daily charge is PER DEVICE and that it was outlined in their terms and conditions but we weren’t quite sure where! I argued with the receptionist who agreed to waive the additional fees incurred so only charged us for 1 device for 4 days but very grudgingly. If you decide to do a trip to the Grand Canyon my advice is do it, it’s fab but don’t pay hotel prices. The hotel quoted us $183 for a days coach trip – we paid $70 for the same tour! There’s a guy called Bruce Z-Man (Zesserman) who you’ll find outside 4 Queens Casino in Fremont Street. He’s a street vendor and we were really nervous about him to start with but he has all the necessary permits and he’s very helpful. He saved us loads of money and it was relatively hassle free.
