To get to the strip you can buy a bus ticket for $2 which lets you ride the buses for 24 hours, there’s a stop very close to the hotel but make sure you have the right change with you. All in all, if I ever go back to Vegas I would rather pay more and stay somewhere on the strip. The attitude of the staff and the prices at the Golden Nugget put us off plus it takes quite a while to get from Fremont Street to the strip where everything happens. If you do stay on the strip though do visit the Fremont Street Experience it’s definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, see u in 2011”
Reviews.Author: Wrestler214
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the host hotel for the 2010 police Softball World Series, we stayed for 3 days and 4 nights. We had a great time at the Nugget the room was very clean and well taken care of. We ate at the Red Sushi, Chart House, Grotto, the Grille; all wre excellent. The 2011 police softball World Series is scheduled for the same time frame and same host hotel, count us in for another three day four night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby87
Reviews.Content: Every year I come to vegas I always stay at the Golden Nugget. we always com in march to see th NASCAR Races. The golden nugget has the best service. There wasen't no long lineups for check in got there at about 9pm since our flight arrived late. We got the room we booked 2 queen beds. It is in a great location I love walking around freemont street. you can take the deuce up to the strip its only $3.00 a day. The food at the golden nugget is wonderful a little pricey but the food is amazing. would also reccommend the Paradise buffet located in the freemont hotel just across the street thats amazing to. The pool there is great its open till 9pm so you still have time after a long day of shopping and the hot tub is great to thats open till 2amThe have great food by the pool. the have waitress walking around so you don't have to get up and go to the bar but be carefull the drinks are very expensive $3.00 for a diet coke All in all the golden nugget is amazing and can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buffy045
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Golden Nugget on Freemont Street. We chose the new Rush Tower and were very impressed with one exception. Valets were quick and helpful, front desk check-in was friendly and efficient, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The only criticism we had was the bathtub/shower. The tub height including the track for the shower door was 22 to 23 inches high and if you had the least bit of a mobility issue with knees or hips (or are short), it was very hard to get in and out. A grab bar would be much appreciated. The double sinks are a nice touch too. The comode is in a seperate "closet" with a door and light but no exhaust fan. Because of the bathtub issue, the next time we visit we'll request the North Tower (now known as the Gold Tower). We had better luck gambling in casino than previous visits so that was a plus. Overall a great hotel and the price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: wader
Reviews.Content: ....wouldnt stay here again. We have stayed at several different hotels in our trips to Vegas and thought we would give the nugget a try. First the good....we stayed at the rush tower and the room was very nice. Nicely appointed and was first class. The other nice thing is downtown has more of a feeling Vegas had when we first visited 20 years ago...a little more low key, things were priced a little cheaper, and finding a $5 black jack table was easy. On the downside....the location didnt work at all for us. We like to go have a nice meal and watch a show on the strip at night. The cab ride was $20-$25 after tip each way....we were expecting of course to pay for cabs, but didnt realize it would be that much. Luckily we were with another couple, so it wasnt so bad, but if we had to pay an added $50 for the night out, it would be better for us at least...to stay somewhere on the strip. The other thing was the pool. We really enjoy lounging by the pool during the day, but the pool was VERY small....yes the shark tank was cool, but after one day the novelty wears off. The pool was basically big enough to get wet and thats it. So if you are wanting or expecting a big pool like say the Mirage....you wont find it here. Also the way the pool chairs are situated there are basically two areas to lounge by the pool, one area gets the sun in the morning, and the other area gets the sun in the afternoon. But with limited seating, its hard to get both, so you have to take your pick....you cant pick up and move for the afternoon sun, cause there wont be any chairs left....so that was a bit disappointing not to be able just to plunk down for the whole day and enjoy the sun, but instead have to try to play musical chairs to find sun. So in the end mixed reviews....

Reviews.Title: “We ate at the lunch buffet and got...”
Reviews.Author: hammyaz
Reviews.Content: We ate at the lunch buffet and got violently ill later that day. The food was not worth the money. I'm off buffets for good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KRRanch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early Oct 2010. Liked everything about the rooms. Used room service once and enjoyed that as well. We stayed in the Rush Tower. Rooms were recently renovated and although dark wood used throughout - we thought it was very elegant looking. It was a very comfortable k/s bed. The casino area is one of the brighter and cleaner of all the downtown hotels. The pool area was fantastic to lay on the couches for a few hours under the warm sun!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Jamey71
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Vegas for our anniversary and decided to try staying down town. I picked the Golden Nugget because it was listed as a four star hotel and had some good reviews. When we checked in they wished up happy anniversary and then told us that they were out of rooms with king size beds and we would have to have a room with two twin beds. I asked them if they were seriously telling me that I would not be sleeping in the same bed with my wife on our anniversary and their reply was "if you check the fine print you have to take what we have available", no apology, not anything. They did say that we could check back each morning until a different room became available. On top of that the room was outdated and the pillows, towels and such were the same quality that you would get at Holiday Inn 20 years ago. Terrible. They also had what appeared to be homeless drunks wandering there casino and lobby. I would not have felt comfortable letting my downstairs by herself at night. The aquarium and pool look terrific in their pictures but even that is a let down when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lhsgrad2000
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the new part of this hotel. The rooms were very modern and the beds were very comfortable. It was a great experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “21st Anniversary was the best”
Reviews.Author: msfjshep
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hoel that I have stayed in in a long time and my husband and I travel often. The bed was VERY comfortable and the hotel ammedities were excellent. The entire time that we awere there we didnt have to leave the hotel except to sight see. The hotel had theire own enities that were very beautiful. The waterfall swinning area was a beautiful sight and the fact that you are able to slide down the middle was fun as well. The hotel was right on the strip which gave us access to all the fun and entertaiment that we needed. Everyone there were extremly nice and there was even a valet service for hotel customers. Consierur service was were offered to us at no addtional cost. I definatly will be visiting Las Vegas again and will be staying at Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Nephew married in Vegas-family of 38-5 stayed at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mooseonaloose
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget had an oldtime, back in the day, charm that we loved. Very clean, very quite (but we slept little), beds were suberb and comfortable. Proximity to excitement on Fremont Street a blast. We did go to the strip and walked for miles, blah. The strip is SUPER spendy too-for food and what not-if you like that. Paid $14.00 for a cup of coffee at Vdarra!! Ouch!! $3.00 at Golden Nugget:) We all loved the Golden Nugget and in fact, all our family staying on the strip ended up coming over to game, eat and hang at the Golden Nugget. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Ruthy8
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my handicapped Mother and this hotel made it a pleasant trip. Everything was donr to make our stay easy. I want to praise the Valet staff they were extra attentive I rented a car and the always were helpful with transporting Mom and directions and advice, The staff at the buffet were super to us! The room was nice and easy axcessible only complaint was not a handicap toilet in the handicap room, Great job folks will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: moodywife
Reviews.Content: I have never wanted to stay on the "old strip" (Fremont Street) as I had found most hotels to be older and the beds extremely uncomfortable. We always stayed on the "new strip" (Las Vegas Boulevard) even though it was more expensive. NOT ANYMORE. We stayed at the new Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street. It was fantastic. We had a corner Junior suite one night and a regular room the rest of our stay. Both were absolutely beautiful. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying her on our future trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: furias3
Reviews.Content: Stayed downtown for the first time and and selected the Rush Tower at the Nugget after reading the reviews, simply put it was fantastic. One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in while in Vegas. These rooms are very nicely done with fantastic beds and huge bathrooms. Definitely worth having a seperate checkin/lobby than the rest of the hotel as we always saw long lines there but we checked in an out in less than 10 min. It was great being able to walk down to Fremont Street and the staff was very friendly. Will stay here again next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: PRS23
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times in the past. This time however we paid for an upgrade to their new tower, Rush, and it was awesome. Very spacious, modern, and closer to the casino and Fremont Street action.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: jlrjgr
Reviews.Content: Wasn't real sure about the Gold Nugget being as it was an older hotel and off the strip. From the moment we walked in we were impressed. The staff was wonderful the rooms clean with plenty room to streatch out and the view out our window was beautiful. My only real complaint was no coffee pot in the rooms. A funny thing every morning I would make our bed only to come back later to find it re-made. the last day there I was in a hurry so left without making it knowing the maids would do it only to get back around 9:30 that night to find it unmade. We laughed about it but still wonder what happened. For sure if ever in the future we go back I would stay there. For the price it is well worth it. For those wanting to go to the strip the shuttle bus runs about every 20 mins and you can catch it right outside the door of Gold Nugget. Wish I had pictures to attach at this time. Sometimes seeing is believing

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: strandedspirits
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I honeymooned in Las Vegas. We spent 2 nights at the Monte Carlo which we loved, and then the next 2 nights at the Golden Nugget. It was a nice mix of the strip and the downtown area. The Golden Nugget was a lot of fun and the hotel met and exceeded all my expectations. The pool at the Nugget is spectacular, I based my hotel selections for our honeymoon on the hotel pools. I figured the new husband would be in Casino and I would be relaxing by the pool. We plan on going back to Vegas and staying at the Golden Nugget again, It was just so much fun being on Freemont St, and we found it to be more reasonable in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: parrothead37
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night in Vegas-spent 3 nights at the GN and 2 night at Gamblin Bill's on the Strip (see seperate review). This was our 9th trip to Vegas but our 1st time staying downtown and we LOVED IT! The first time I went to vegas it was 1996 and I was 24- the MGM had just opened and they were building NYNY! Vegas has changed so much since then-some of it good (better hotels, better shows and better night clubs) but, some of it bad (insanely crowed, over developed-it takes FOREVER to get from one hotel to an another and the days of $4.99 buffets and amazing service/comps for the average person are OVER!). Overall downtown is more of what Vegas used to be only better! The GN was beautiful! We stayed in the Rush Tower and it was amazing! We could easily compare it to our room at Mandalay Bay for sure! Spent a day at the adult only pool and felt it was totally worth it. Saw Gordie Brown and we laughed till we cried.! If you have ever stayed in a good hotel on the strip you know breakfast in the 24 hour cafe is $50.00 for 2, drinks by the pool $15.00 each, adult only pool $40.00 per person, show tickets even in the worst seats are $60.00-you can basically half those prices at the Golden Nugget! Service was very friendly across the board. We also spent a lot of time gambling at Binions across the street and found their dealers very friendly as well with better cocktail service. Ate dinner at Vic and Anothony's-very enjoyable and Firefly which was also great. We had such a great time -we may be completly "over" the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Rocked!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie221
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We just got back from Vegas yesterday. We stayed at the nugget from 10/6 - 10/9.. Stayed in the rush tower on the 8th floor. Beds were awesome. Shower was amazing. Like others have said be careful when stepping into the tub can be slippery. Check in was easy. We arrived about 11:00 and were able to check in early. Took maybe 10 minutes at the most. I am not sure if the Nugget reads these or not, but I would like to thank them and there wonderful staff for a great stay. Some of the dealers that were especailly great to us were Kevin, Lee, Kimmie, John, and Peter. Pit boss Brian was great. Always had a smile on his face. Stay here if you would like to be away from the strip. Grotto Italian is amazing... We always stay here and look forward to coming back real soon. Thanks again to everyone at the Nuggett who made this a great trip and let us bring home some money. We will be bacl real soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Not treated as well as we would have thought.”
Reviews.Author: msj57
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget in Las Vegas has been our hotel of choice for years; the new mangagement has made some nice improvements to the hotel, especially the pool area. On our recent stay in July 0f 2010, the first night I woke up with bug bites on my ankles; we found a store and bought medicine to stop the itching. Did not think too much about it until my ankles had some swelling and began to wonder what on earth had bitten me. Two nights before we were to check out we were getting ready to go to bed and my husband saw a bug crawling on the floor and was able to get in a a plastic baggie. We went online and found that there were several hotels in Vegas, some being very expensive, that had a problem with bedbugs. We found pictures online of bed bugs and felt that the bug that we had found was a bed bug and was what had bitten me. We were up most of the night checking facts online and the next morning my husband called the front desk and asked if they were having trouble with bedbugs and was told "not in the room that we were staying" which told us that they had or have had problems. He told them that we felt that I had been bitten by a bed bug and they sent up a couple of gentlemen that looked at my ankles and the bug in the bag and they both said they thought it was a bed bug. They took pictures of my ankles that showed the bites and swelling and did ask if I wanted to see a Medic. They changed us to another room, which was an upgrade, however, by the time all this was finished, the day had been wasted. The next day we had a late afternoon flght home and I went to the front desk and asked if we could keep our room until 3 PM; the bell person checked with the manager and came back and told me we could not stay until 3 but 1 PM would be ok. This really upset me, as we had wasted a lot of our vacation finding a place to buy medicine, staying up most of a night because we had found a bed bug, answering questions, pictures being made,reports filled out and being moved to a different room. I voiced my anger and told the bell person that they had bed bugs and had ruined part of our vacation and that I could not believe that we could not keep the room until 3. He went back to the manager and came back and asked me if 2 PM would be OK and I was so tired of the whole business that I told him OK and thanked him for his help. I feel that the new management of the Golden Nugget does not care a lot about their customers; I would have thought that they might have offered at least a meal on the house, but they did not want to even give us a few hours extra. Let me add that we called to make our reservations twice and was quoted very high rates, different each of the two calls. We found that we got a better deal by going through our airline, however after I had booked all of the trip, I called and checked and the rates given me were much lower than the other calls and this did not please my husband or me. I might add that we have been a member of the Private Arrangement program since it was started by Steve Wynn and had always felt our rates were fair. I have concluded that the new managment is only interested in the almighty dollar; I guess someone has to pay for all the remodeling. I have read that there is a bed bug problem in many states and I can see where Las Vegas is a prime target, however, if I am a victim, I would like to feel that management is sorry and would like to make it up to me or any other customer. We are an older couple and like to stay downtown as the casinos are close and not so much walking and we have always been treated well by the Golden Nugget and have enjoyed our Private Arrangement program for years. I don't care how much you put into fixing up your property; you should remember customer satisfaction and service should be at the top of the list. We have always loved our trips to Vegas and the Golden Nugget, however, perhaps we need to find a hotel that still puts the customer first.

Reviews.Title: “High Cholrine/Bad Management”
Reviews.Author: bartonj
Reviews.Content: High Chlorine in hot tub changed the color of my husband's bathing suit and fried my hair. We were in there for less than 5 minutes. The answer we got from the hotel was that his bathing suit was made for lakes and rivers AND that somebody's lotion must have accelerated the chlorine levels. ABSOLUTE NONSENSE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The pool manager was supposed to call me back to apologize, but never did. Very, very poor service for a very severe problem.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget, 'downtown Vegas'”
Reviews.Author: Ketteringjimmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 6 nights mid September. I pre-upgraded our rooms to the Rush Tower. Fantastic Hotel......, nothing much to criticise, if I'm really picky the reception carpet was stained, but everything else was excellent. The reception desk staff were always very polite and helpful, we booked a cabanana at the superb 'shark tank' pool to be at the exclusive 'Hideaway pool', at $175 it wasn't cheap but it was definitely worth it for a special day by the pool. The casino was just like every other casino, we actually left the tables a few dollars up, the Rush Lounge is a nice touch =excellent live entertainment and the cocktails were a reasonable price $10 - $15 and you could taste the alcohol. Food - Carson St., was okay but nothing special, the buffett was great for breakfast with Juice, Coffee, Water, and too much food all for $9.95 each (had a voucher as well for a freebie so 2 for $9.95). Wouldn't bother with the Lunch Buffet. The Italian restaurant was good and reasonable price. The piece de resistance was Vic & Anthonys, absolutely fabulous - but not cheap. We had the porterhouse - twice. Freemont Street is amazing, full of real people out for a good time, good natured, good humoured with street entertainment and a lightshow you have to see to believe. Not once did we feel un-easy. Catch the deuce bus from the stop on Freemont St/Las Vagas Blvd, prepay at the m/c by the stop and its a 'not so quick' 1.5miles to the OTT strip. Nice for a visit but I'm so glad we stayed downtown - away from the madness and all the show/trip/sex sellers. Loved the hotel, loved the location (a bit kiss me quick but with style), couldn't fault the room, the staff, the facilities or the price. An A1 choice. TOP TIP - Apply for a Landrys Select Club members card. $25 cost but, gets you an upgrade and the $25 is added to the card for you to spend in the restaurants, AND you get points added. We spent the $25 and added another $25 with our spending which was taken off our food bill. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is the shining star downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JohnConnors111
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget is definitely a must-stay hotel if you visit Vegas. It has character and a true face that says Vegas. We stayed here for our marriage and loved every minute of it. Hotel was top-notch and everything was better than we expected. The pool is probably better than most others in Vegas merely for the fact that it has a slide that cuts through a shark tank. Top that! Slots were pretty loose as well. Freemont Street Experience is right out the front door and there is a bar on the 2nd floor with great views of Freemont Street and the lighted experience. Forget the strip. Go to the Golden Nugget where the real Vegas lies.

Reviews.Title: “BEST POOL!! Hotel Renovations made everything New again”
Reviews.Author: LazyBones810
Reviews.Content: I visited here in prior years and was not impressed, and it seemed crammed inside. In 2009-2010, significant improvements were made, and the hotel seems bigger and better. The POOL is the Best I have ever been in. You can spend big money, or go on a budget, they still treat you RIGHT at this place. Great Location, everything in walking distance, you will not need a car for Las Vegas when staying at this hotel conveniently located right on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - but not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: DrMarc034
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush tower for 3 nights and were very impressed with the value. I thought charging for WIFI was a bit much ($13 a day) but apart from that, I dont have many complaints. It isnt exactly central (about 30 mins from the strip by bus), but the area is a lot cheaper to eat and drink than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Birthdays EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfRacine
Reviews.Content: The previous year 2009 I stopped by the Nugget as I always did on a Las Vegas trip and to my surprise it was under construction. For many years I have always said to who ever I was with "one of these days I am going to stay here". Well, this year I decided to go to Las Vegas alone for my Birthday, and it was one of the best vacations - no, it was the best Las Vegas trip I ever had. The Golden Nugget 's addition and renovations were fantastic. Everthing was clean, felt new and was beautiful. The rooms were renovated in a very tasteful motif, the pool and surrounding shark tank, slide and other amenities were unbelieable. Food, service and shows were great!! I will not stay on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for children and adults to enjoy.”
Reviews.Author: chocokiss50
Reviews.Content: The Rush tower Junior corner suite is great for a family of four. Big room with two tvs and beautiful furnishing. The shark tank pool is fun for adults and children to swim or relax in. The line for the slide tube isn't long when the pool opens but can take anywhere from 30-50 minutes during peak times. Neat experience you have to try at least once. Children and adults can go through the tube. The back of the tank is shaded on very hot days. Buffets are excellent and moderately priced. Wonderful hotel we would definitely return to on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, perfect for the value!”
Reviews.Author: ladyr1
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the older part of LAs Vegas and the Golden Nugget is a perfect hotel in this area, located in the center of old Vegas - only a few steps to the attractions. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Nice pool area and bars are surrounded and of course a Casino inside.Good service and helpful stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Real Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: CWBush83
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I, her parents, and two family friends went to Vegas for her 25th birthday last year and stayed at the Golden Nugget as part of a deal that included our flights. As we spent a great deal of our time out on Fremont Street experiencing the Vegas Night Life - I can't really comment on the Golden Nugget beyond its basic amenities. First of all, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. You're not in the lap of luxury, but you certainly feel like you're living it up in Vegas. You need to navigate some labyrinthine halls to get there, but it's worth the trip. The breakfast buffet is good and has a nice variety of food, and there's plenty of gambling to be done if that's your thing. We weren't really there for the gambling. The pool is one of the best I've had the pleasure of visiting. Whether you're lounging around on deck chairs, swimming lazily in its lagoon circuit, or riding through the shark tank on the water slide - you're going to love time spent by the pool. My one complaint about the Nugget would be its night club. Half of the drinks on the menu weren't available and those that were were grossly overpriced for a place not on the Strip. We definitely preferred to do our drinking elsewhere. Also, the gym access was ridiculously high in cost. All in all it was a fun experience and it's nice and close to the rest of Fremont Street - but I'd only recommend it for accommodation. There's better (and cheaper) food and drink to be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A real Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: jeff19701
Reviews.Content: For the older part of town and older casino we were very surprised at how nice the room was! Actually the whole complex was very nice! Very happy with the room! Also booked a room and show package and saw the Blue Man Group for what I thought was a very good value. Funny show and very strange! The breakfast buffet we thought was excellent! Even served smoke salmon! Not huge, but a very nice pool, if you can get away from the smokers! Plenty of entertainment right out on the street day and night! Buy a $7, 24 hour bus pass and take the Gold line up and down the entire strip. The buses are clean and modern! Much cheaper than a taxi and they seem to come about every 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HappyVagabond2458
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nuggett was a great value at $40 per night - updated room & very nicely appointed also a very nice pool area. Unfortunately, althought we had a non-smoking room, the elevators, hallways, common areas etc. were very smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jmonwood
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Golden Nugget and can't say enough about how great our experience was. I was travelling with another female friend and we both felt totally comfortable and safe in and near the hotel. The public areas were lovely and our room was beautiful, well maintained, and the beds were fantastic. The extra vanity just outside our bathroom was a great feature when we both were doing our hair or makeup--great time saver! Anything we asked about or for was completed immediately and I never met an employee who wasn't pleasant. The food in the Carson Street Cafe and the breakfast buffet were excellent (we had the breakfast buffet 3 times and the made to order omelets were a highlight!). Even our experience with the valet parking was prompt and pleasant. We both have stayed in several different Las Vegas properties over the years and said we would choose to stay here again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great but...”
Reviews.Author: jpabon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget several times everything was great only a few minor things that were not so great. First it took us 30 minutes to check in to the Carson Tower they had 3 people handling check out and 1 person only handling checking in. Never was offered coupons to use there when asked about them they said they didn't have any. Then went to buy show tickets on the night before we were leaving and they were handing out the coupons to those that were checking in. Went to use the computers that they have to print out boarding passes paid $5.00 for 5 minutes would only let me print 1 pass, added another $5.00 still wouldn't let me computer shut downed and when it came up told me that I was out of time. Put another $5.00 and still could not print the boarding pass. Had to print the boarding passes at the airport. Other than that it was a great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: MT_SnoMo
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas a couple of times and really enjoy the downtown area and casinos compared to the strip. This is the nicest hotel downtown and for the money is a great value. the pool is very crowded so we went elsewhere to swim, but we were pleased with the rooms and the bars/restaurants in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Best stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: alsaidla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget Sep 28-Oct 1 and I have not one complaint. Stayed in Rush Tower. Check-in was very quick and easy. Our room was on the 20th floor and was beautiful. The bed was extremely comfortable, the dual sinks and the rainshower head were awesome. Large Flat screen and free in-room safe, even had bathrobes. I must say the food was average, but that was expected. The wait staff was extremely friendly and quick. But I have to say that the pool was the most amazing part. We stayed one day at the adult pool on the third story of the pool area. Extremely quiet and definitely the place to go if you want sun all day. The next two days were spent at the other pool, which is alot bigger than it looks and it was just as nice. The waterslide was great fun too. My only advice is to get there early and claim a chair. Beach towels are provided at no fee. However, you will not be able to gain entrance to the pool area without showing your room key. Would stay here again over any place on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Love it! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: huakai808
Reviews.Content: I have always stayed at the Fremont across the street but opted to stay here because of the newly renovated pool with the shark tank. I love it! The cafe that is opened 24 hours is a great place to sit and eat in the middle of the night. The casino is always clean looking and very open but still has a homely feel. We love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: travelnmoma
Reviews.Content: Can't comment much about the gambling. Didn't do that much here, but the hotel was fabulous! We used our Landry's card to get VIP check in and an upgrade to a Rush tower room. VIP check in was great -fast, friendly, helpful -plus snacks and drinks! The pool was wonderful, too. No problems getting chairs -however we prefer to be in the shade and we get up early. I wouldn't say it was crowded though. However, we were there Sun-Thurs. We ate the buffet a couple of times. Nothing fantastic, but we had a two for one coupon, so I felt like we definitely got our money's worth. We ate at Red Sushi with our $25 credit on our Landry's card, and it was delicious. We also had some Happy Hour drinks and pizzas at Grotto's. I had a few peach bellinis ($3 each) and we split an herbed chicken pizza with goat cheese and caramelized onions -YUM! It was only $7, too ! (during happy hour) The slide at the pool is CRAZY fast. If you want to see the sharks, etc. as you go through the tube, you have to sit up and kind of stick your arms or legs out to the side to slow down. You DO NOT have to pay for chairs by the main pool. You can rent cabanas and chairs by the adults only pool. You can go to the adults only pool without reserving a chair after 5PM. That pool and the hot tub stay open until 2AM. I will definitely come back to the Golden Nugget. My only complaint is no free wi-fi and even if you pay for the wi-fi, you can only use it in your room. I would have liked to surf the web poolside, but it wasn't possible. :(

Reviews.Title: “This is the most beautiful hotel and the staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ginny68
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a military reunion and were booked at a hotel chosen by the reunion committee; it was awful!! We went down the street to the Golden Nugget, got a room there and checked out of the other hotel. It was like going to heaven. Our room at the Golden Nugget was so beautiful and spotless. The casino was great; we spent alot of time playing the machines. I only wish I had got a players card since I will stay there next time. (we usually stay on the strip when we are out there just for fun}

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveVegas007
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for my husband's birthday and we usually say on the Strip, but decided to try "Old Vegas" for a change. Great decision. The check-in process was efficient and pleasant. Here's a tip, for a few dollars more, opt for the VIP check-in. Saves time, and you get to enjoy complimentary juice, water, M&M's and peanuts. Received an upgrade to the Rush Tower. WOW. Fantastic room wih a spectacular view of the Strip and mountains. Housekeeping was amazing. Bathroom in the Rush Tower is big enough to hold a party! Seriously, my husband and I had lots of room. Love the sleek, 21st-century snks, lush robes and plasma TV. What, no HBO?? The pool is a must visit! There's nothing like swimming with the sharks. The slide was so much fun and the lounges were clean and plentiful. Further, the private adult pool is simply wonderful. Slots were a bit stingy, but we had better luck at the roulette tables. Drinks kept coming, good cocktail waitresses for wine and beer, but the martinis (at the bars while playing video poker) were VERY weak. C'mon guys, I would've spent more! Loved the Fremont street experience, mind-blowing nightly shows on the world's larget TV (and I'm picky, am used to Disney fireworks and Epcot Sound and Light show).

Reviews.Title: “worth the money, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: marky1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN for a week and loved it. We got checked in very easy after a long flight and our room was really nice and very clean. We had worried about lack of sleep because the hotel is right on fremont street but it was very quiet so no probs there. The shark tank in the pool is good fun and there was plenty of sun loungers available for everyone to relax as well. The waitresses in the casino area seemed to serve only the people playing for the big money so we didnt get much service at the slots. The hotel is perfectly situated on fremont street and the light show each evening is excellent. There are plenty of other restaurants and casinos nearby and a bus stop stops every 15 mins to take you to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for downtown”
Reviews.Author: mmbrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Carson Tower room. Very large, but only thing that stood out was the bed. Extremely comfortable. My room was right by an elevator but everything was nice and quiet. The pool area is neat. Nothing like a fish tank with sharks right in the middle of the pool. Slide is a nice touch but we waited 15-20 minutes each time. Also, if you want a chair at the pool get there earlier (we did-all chairs gone by 10:30am). This is the same at all hotels so no big deal. Honestly, while nothing was spectacular, everything was really nice. It was my first stay downtown (other 9 trips to Vegas were on strip) and I'm not sure I'd stay downtown again, but if I did there is no doubt I would stay at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Rocked!”
Reviews.Author: kimmiejean22479
Reviews.Content: Never having stayed down on Fremont Street, I wasn't sure what to expect. This hotel/casino blew me away. From the front desk service, to the bell desk, to the valet service, holy cow this place was amazing. Also, the Red Sushi Restaurant had some of the best sushi I had ever tasted! The Golden Nugget is conveniently located across from Binion's, the 4 Queens, and the Fremont. And we really got a great taste of the Fremont Street Experience. Who needs the strip when you have your own little world of laid back entertainment, gambling, and hotels?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: KimmyCustard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights after a trip down the west coast. We had visited the hotel before as part of the Fremont Experience and liked it, much more laid back and the slots are looser! The rooms (we had a double in the Gold Tower) were great, they have been recently refurbished and the GN has done well. For $30 a night more you can stay in the new Rush Tower but this was more than adequate for us. The room itself is large with a table and 2 chairs for dining, a work table and a dressing table with mirror and hairdryer. The only downside was the bathroom was very small but who's measuring? All very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The pool is just great, with a slide that goes straight through the shark tank in the middle! Def try this whilst there. Loads of towels but does get busier in the afternoon when the sun comes overhead. Would stay here again and recommend it for the 'old' stay in Vegas as opposed to the sparkly Strip area.

Reviews.Title: “Room was robbed ... no one in management cared”
Reviews.Author: Traveler092010
Reviews.Content: We ran to the pool for a quick swim before checking out and left our wallets and phones in our room. While gone everything was stolen directly from our room. Yes, it was a mistake to not lock them up, but after we were robbed, it took over an hour before security came to our room, by which time we had cancelled all cards. Without cash, cards, or ID we had no way to get to the airport and management was of little help. They gave us some cab money, but then tried to push us on our way. No one from management came to speak with us despite us asking again and again. The last straw? We were asked: how are you going to pay for the remaining balance on the room? Since all our credit cards were now cancelled, and our cash gone, I handed back our cab fare! Luckily, the front desk clerk took pity on us, and did not take our fare, but made it a point to let us know that management insists on charging the card anyway. We were so disappointed because up to that point everything had been great!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is Golden!”
Reviews.Author: ChgotoCancun
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Golden Nugget on Sunday, September 19 for a three night stay. The place was packed! We went over to the check in at the Rush Tower and they took care of us even though we booked the cheapest room via Priceline negotiations for $32 a night. All my researching led to $49 a night for that time period so I am happy with the $32. I’m sure we were to get the Carson Tower. However, they didn’t have any kings left, so they said they would upgrade us to the Gold Tower for $10 more. I wasn’t happy that they charged $10 for a king bed, but we said okay. It was difficult to get to the gold tower elevators for some reason, but eventually we got use to it and found them right away. The room was very nice. It was bright and large enough. The King bed was very comfortable with a double sheet surrounding a blanket and then a down duvet at the foot of the bed. There was recessed lighting above the bed in case you wanted to read. The flat screen was fairly large and offered many channels. The curtains were thick and closed nicely so the room was totally dark when closed (the doorframe to the hallway let in a tiny bit of light however). The carpeting was clean and no distinct smell of any sort. There were two comfortable leather chairs and a table. A dressing table with a lighted magnifying mirror, a desk and a large enough bathroom (that might need to be remodeled sometime in the near future). Everything was very clean. The reason I am giving the Golden Nugget 4 stars instead of 5 stars because even though the room is very nice, it doesn’t have basic amenities like a mini fridge, microwave or coffee pot. The hotel was super crowded when we arrived at 8PM on Sunday. The hallways were warm and humid as well as the casino. It was very hot outside that day and maybe because of the crowds it couldn’t get cool. We walked outside to the beautiful pool area where the sharks swim (is that tank big enough for sooo many sharks and fish?). Many guests were relaxing on the lounge chairs enjoying the fire pits (even though it was still warm out). Very nice gathering spot. Downtown was hopping!! So many people and singers and bands playing. It was incredible. It was like one giant party. I thought to myself that downtown Vegas sure wasn’t hurting, not any longer. We walked to the El Cortez, that one block getting to the El Cortez was a little sketchy, but obviously fine. We had a couple of poorly made drinks and played some video blackjack and left. Then, we walked to the Golden Gate, that place was shaking with so much going on. Dancers on top the outside bar with blaring music. Dancers in the casino, fairly crowded. We sat down at the bar and they never even tended to us. So we left there. The next night (Monday), downtown was still crowded, but not as bad as Sunday. It was still fun to be amongst all those people. We walked about a mile to the Gold Silver Pawn Shop which host a reality show on the History Channel. It was great to see all the main characters. They were getting ready to film when we were there. I guess we could have stayed but we had other plans. Tuesday, we went to the pool (had to show our room key) and got a couple of loungers in the shade (plenty of shade earlier in the morning). By the early afternoon, we had tons of sun and the other sunny side (morning) now had the shade. It was fairly crowded by the pool, but not overly so. Still loungers left and lots of room to swim or float in the pool. They said that the pool is heated, though I was a little chilled going into the pool, but quickly got use to is (I am always cold though). I read here on TripAdvisor that the pool area charges you for a lounger or chair. NOT TRUE! They are free. The adult only pool upstairs charges. We walked up there, but it was too windy to be enjoyable, so we never even considered paying money to be there. The shark tank is truly incredible! I will post some pictures. The pictures just don’t do it justice. Very clean, what a sight to be seen! The pool was very, very clean. I read one reviewer said that the pool was nasty. Not at all. I also read that there were kids all over, splashing and screaming. Not when we were there. We went down the waterslide and it is fast! I thought I would make a delicate entrance into the pool from the slide, but not so! I went PLOP! Must be my age! Oh well, so I tried again and PLOP! Okay, maybe next time… The pool during the day and in the evening is probably the nicest pool area I have ever been at. One negative: the lounge chairs are too close together. We got two end loungers, so we move fairly far from our neighbors, so no big deal. No line to get into the pool either. We got there around 10:30 (I think the pool opens up at 10AM). Reviewers wrote that you had to start lining up to get a lounger, not true when we were there. We sat in the hot tub (very clean) for a little while and we were the only two in there. Maybe because it was Las Vegas in September! We saw that people were in it at night. If we weren’t exhausted by the time we got to our hotel at night, we might have taken advantage of that. Maybe next time. We never ate there. So I can’t comment on the food. We never gambled there (though the casino never seemed too smoky and the atmosphere was classy and comfortable , so I can’t comment on that either. We never even drank there. We just slept there and was gone for the rest of the day (except for that one amazing day at the pool). I would recommend this place in a heartbeat, especially for what we paid. This hotel should NOT be compared to the expensive hotels on the strip as some reviewers do. Those hotels charge two, three sometimes four times what we paid. I feel we got our money’s worth and that’s what I am basing this review on. Really nice hotel for the money. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome VIP Stay”
Reviews.Author: mandlintx
Reviews.Content: My husband is enamored with Freemont street - me, yeah, not so much! So when he insisted on our recent trip that we stay on Freemont street, my consolation was booking a nice room. We arrived on Friday night - there were about 40 people in line to check in - no worries, I had booked a VIP room in the gold tower ($159/night) which meant we could check in at the VIP lounge - no waiting! We proceeded to our room which was AWESOME - I particularly LOVED the play on materials in the bathroom; wallpaper that looked like brick and tile that looked like metal and wood. My husband's favorite - the TV behind the mirror in the bathroom of course! VIP access included coffee, papers and apples in the morning (by the elevator), and mixed nuts, M&M's and dried fruit in the evenings (same place); it also included access to the VIP lounge (just a room really) that was stocked with water, juice and snacks and available until late at night - FOR FREE as well!! Two more freebies that came with the VIP room - free internet and free bottled water each day. I believe the freebies MORE than equaled the difference I paid for the room. The pool area was awesome (just get there by about 930 am to get a chair), and the valet was super speedy. My one complaint - the breakfast buffet - $9.99 during the week; turns into a "brunch" on the weekend and costs $19 per person - the food was mediocre at best. Go next door to the Fitz for a cheaper and better breakfast buffet!!

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay if you like downtown”
Reviews.Author: BCLVfan
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights at the Nugget for my best friend's birthday after getting an awesome deal for $49 a night. The hotel is beautiful and classy, and the pool is amazing. We had a regular Carson Tower room which was very nice. My only complaint about the rooms are that the walls are thin because we kept getting woken up by some loud partiers next door. The location is great to check out Fremont Street and downtown attractions. I'd tell anyone staying downtown to stay here, but after 2 nights downtown I have to confess I'm more of a strip person and find downtown a little depressing. Plus, the upscale bar scene here and elsewhere was pretty dead on a Tuesday as opposed to how it is hopping every night on the strip. If you go downtown though, this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our trip”
Reviews.Author: mrsjackson09
Reviews.Content: We haven't gotten there yet but I just wanted to say that I called the Nugget to ask about room upgrades to 2 different suites and the woman VERY patiently explained the pros and cons of the room options regardless of price. I ended up sticking with the Rush Tower King and I am looking forward to my stay even more now! Now, THAT is what I call customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the new Rush Tower. Noon check in was a bit slow, but friendly. The free valet parking was a bonus. We requested rooms opposite the Fremont Street Experience side of the hotel and we did not hear any noise from the show during the evening. The hotel and downtown area were much quieter and less hectic than the strip properties. The basic Rush Tower room was very nice with comfortable beds and seating areas, but I think having a few brighter lights would be helpful. The bathroom was also a bit dim, but the shower and tub were good. A coffeemaker and small fridge would be added bonuses in the future. We chose to stay at Residence Inn on our return trip due to the need for a fridge after two weeks of being on the road. Pool area was fairly crowded and the pool had a very strong cholorine smell. We were concerned about the seemingly small space the sharks were enclosed in at the Shark Tank. We ate breakfast in the Cafe and the service was VERRRY slow with just average food. Chart House for dinner was exceptional. And Chart House bartender was friendly and the wine selection was good. We would be happy to stay in the Golden Nugget again during a less extensive vacation.

Reviews.Title: “RUSH TOWER SUITES are MODERN LUXURY PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: KP_vs_theworld
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Golden Nugget's Rush Tower, it is a new section to the old historic nugget. The rooms are brand new and very upscale. The VIP experiencing was as expected and the services was exceptional. Highly Recommend staying here, I usually stay on the strip at the Wynn or Bellagio, but this is my new favorite. Plus, I dig the history of Downtown Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed mid week. We were on a route 66...”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: Stayed mid week. We were on a route 66 trip and wanted to stay in "old" part of town to get nostalgia flowing. Mi week rates are dirt cheap. $30 for reg room. We upgraded to 2 br suite for $100 more and was well worth it. Great beds, slept like a rock. The pool there is great. Dj, blackjack tables, poolside!!! Bar and a waterside. Ooh yeah. And a shark tank in the middle that the water slide goes through!!!!! Great place. Forget the strip and go "old Vegas". We even got free drinks in the casino while at the $5 roulette wheel. Try that at the balagio!!! No way. And free parking!!! Will stay again!! So easy to walk around freemont street and much harder to get around strip. Give it a shot. We were surprised how cool it was.

Reviews.Title: “More rooms, more guests, less personal space”
Reviews.Author: luckyokguy
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the GN. The new Rush Tower has opened and I can't find a decent chair by the pool anymore unless I pay $20 for a chair at the "retreat". Probably worth it, but not a bit of shade, and once you rent a chair it stays where it is. We had a great rate in the South Tower. The rooms are holding up well, though the in-room carpet gets more and more worn. Public areas look great. Love the buffet for breakfast/lunch. Try and score a coupon book at check in. Be really nice to the guest service rep checking you in(there may be a wait, don't be grumpy with them, they are there to help). One problem with icky old food in the pocket of a robe. My grossed out call to the desk resulted in a new rope delivered in less than 5 mins. I was told that they dry clean the robes so I guess i'd rather they use soap and water. Downtown is great. Did better gambling at the Fremont across the street. Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay downtown.”
Reviews.Author: HolaMimi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush Tower and it was beautiful! By far this is the best place to stay downtown. Great restaurants, bars, and AWESOME pool area! I prefer staying on the strip (seems like downtown is an older crowd with more families), but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The "BEST" downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: bjprrp67
Reviews.Content: Very clean room and bath, good bed, and quiet for sleeping. Staff from check in to bell very very nice and helpful. We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraq_35
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying DT Vegas. We really liked the Golden Nugget. We stayed in a Jr. Suite. Room was big & clean. We checked in without any issues. The room needs a fridge, coffee maker and more plugins!! We also reserved a cabana at the hideout on Sat. and it was wonderful. We really liked the size of the Golden Nugget. We never felt lost as you can in some of the strip hotels. We would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club Rooms at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Maximagxe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights beginning September 12, 2010 in a Gold Club Room. The upgrade is well worth it. The TV in the bathroom is incorporated into the full length vanity mirror which I did not discover until the next morning. The remote in the bathroom says "electric mirror" on it but it is a tv remote. Encountered no problems at the pool in securing lounge chairs. I also would recommend gambling across the street at Binions and checking out the cowgirl blackjack dealers in the afternoon. Overall I highly recommend the Golden Nugget

Reviews.Title: “Our stay&wedding at golden nugget with family and friends was fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: Sonyacm
Reviews.Content: We had booked the golden nugget for our friends & family to stay for 6 days, as we held our wedding there, the rooms were great and the staff and security was excellent ! The spa gave myself and my sister and mother wonderful massages and we had our hair done by a very professional staff ! the steam room help take the stress off of us. I was so pleased with everything ! The hotel is so close to everything , and plenty to do for 6 days , the pool was great, we couldnt have ask for anything more than what we received at Golden Nugget !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fairytale2004
Reviews.Content: Just got home from vegas yesterday, stayed at the golden nugget, it was an amazing experience. Staff helpful and friendly, hotel very clean and well maintained. only 5-10mins from the strip by bus route called deuce 7 dollars for 24hr pass. please take some comfy shoes as the strip very long to walk. grand canyon beautiful, day to hollywood worth every penny approx 200dollers. take money off coupons when given on the strip can get dollars of shows, food and leisure activities. Men will get harrased by ticket touts selling girls. Just walk away. In my oppinion they are the only thing that spoil Vegas they approach you even if your with your partner and men are approched no matter what age.They are scum in my oppinion. But dont let that put you off having a fab time. do the fermont experience its free an a must. will go again and stay at the golden nugget. (perfect). very warm 96-98 everyday. Very Cheap to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lamp5
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was my choice for our Las Vegas vacation. Other people going with said they didn't really care because you aren't in the room that much. Well, true, but in reality, i still want a decent place to lay my head at night and take a shower! Golden Nugget definetely met those expectations! Everyone in our group was highly impressed with the hotel, the rooms were all very clean, spacious and comfortable. The hotel itself is the nicest hotel downtown and there is no doubt in my mind that I would stay there again! The price was very competitive with others like the Four Queens, Fitzgeralds, but I am so glad we picked this one! The pool was amazing - and don't forget to check out the Roof Top - the bar with swimming pool upstairs from the Shark Tank pool. Very fun! The Cafe - the restaruant in the lobby was awesome - affordable prices and really really great food! don't waste your time walking to the buffet's outside the hotel - the Buffet in Golden Nugget was by far the best one. Tip: Use the coupon books if you can get one. Don't buy the beers in the gift shop - go out side to the little gift shops/souvenier shops. Beers are just $1.50 each - its amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: OSUcrapsplayer
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a two night stay on September 10. Used the Landry card to access a VIP check in although the regular line was not long. Only hitch was that the machine imprinting the keys was down temporarily and that meant we had to check the luggage with the valet desk and come back a little later to get the key. No problem since we planned to sign up for a players card and look over the new areas of the hotel as we had not been there in about a year. We received our keys and gave the desk clerk our luggage check and went to the room. The luggage arrived at the same time. Very impressive service! The room was great. Very comfortable and spacious with a great bed. Only con was the tub and shower were one unit, and the tub is quite deep, making it a little tricky to get out without slipping. Elderly guests may find it a definite problem. Service at the GN is remarkable. Cocktail waitresses were prompt and we were comped premium liquors while gambling. Room service arrived as promised (about 20 minutes in mid afternoon) and was very good, and still hot! We had an excellent meal at the Grotto. The only complaint I had was that the computer could not give me the credit I had coming on the Landry card. Computer issues seemed to be a bit of a theme, but did not really impact our stay very much. We enjoy gaming downtown and the GN is clearly the class of the area. We had decent luck and would highly recommend both the casino and hotel. Our only experience is with the Rush Tower, but that was on par with Caesars, where we stayed for the balance of our trip. Overall I would recommend this resort, especially for those who enjoy the close proximity of the other properties downtown.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the nugget!”
Reviews.Author: kl_mpls33
Reviews.Content: I love the Golden Nugget. Have stayed there several times and keep going back. Very nice rooms, lovely pool, great restaurants, GREAT spa/gym. My only complaint is the loud music at the pool (why does it have to be so loud?) but i can easily put up with it because everything else is great. I love being downtown too, vs. the strip. More laid back, more real. oh, and my husband loves the casino there (i stay at the pool ;)

Reviews.Title: “Neat change of pace from the strip”
Reviews.Author: andy987654321
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, I would highly recommend it/ stay again. Got in on a Thursday morning at 8, check in line wasn't terrible, and they were able to give us an early check in at no charge. The pool is neat, but seating can be a bit hard to find, and there always seemed to be a lot of kids splashing around. You do have the option of paying $10 for a seat at the hideout ( a 16 and older pool), to get away from kids. The water slide was pretty fun as well, even if you can't see anything when you go through the aquarium. They had a lot of restaurants in the casino, which was convenient. Ate at grotto for lunch and dinner, but would definitely recommend the dinner menu because of the increased options, prices were about $20 a plate. Had the lunch and dinner buffet, at 12 and 20 dollars respectively. The dinner buffet didn't have that much extra compared to the lunch, but was still a pretty good deal. Skip the Carson street buffet though, it was like a village inn, but more expensive and with worse food. Gold diggers night club was fun, it was only a $5 dollar cover, as compared to $40 at most other places. Drinks were a bit expensive, but what can you expect at a club. Guest services were incredibly nice and helpful, we were the most needy guests on this trip than on any other, but they just smiled and helped with our problems. The freemont street experience is right outside the door, and it was nice staying downtown for a change, there were a lot less people and it was a much more laid back vibe. The surrounding casinos had cheap table game too, which was nice, but the golden nugget rarely had a table under $10. If you wanted to go to the strip, the bus stops were right outside the hotel, but I would recommend the 3 day pass. It is about a 45 minute bus ride, and you can't bring drinks on. Now for the negatives. The front desk is understaffed. It did take a long time to get help from guest services, and if you called down to the front desk you were always put on hold, with the option of leaving a message. Although the atmosphere of Golden Nugget was really cool and felt like old time Vegas, it is basically a very nice 4 star island in a sea of old people and run down buildings that compose the other casinos downtown. Consequently we spent most of out time in the the Golden Nugget, or on the Strip. there were not many restaurants outside the hotel worth going to, unless you wanted to cure a hangover on the cheap. It did seem like the hotel liked to charge for extras, i.e. internet, fitness center, late checkout and extra guests, but what hotel doesn't. Overall though, we thought the Golden Nugget was a great place, especially at the rate we got. As a quick side note, we got a standard room in the Carson tower, the beds were doubles instead of queens, and seemed a bit small, but otherwise it was pretty similar to staying at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but they'll Nickle & Dime you at every corner”
Reviews.Author: RodeoRacer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a new Rush tower room, beautiful, stylish, roomy. The Golden Nugget is by far the cleanest ( least amount of cigarette stink ) property in the Fremont St./Downtown area. HOWEVER, they'll try to charge you for all sorts of little things. For instance, if you want to sit on a chaise lounge chair next to the "Hide Away" pool they state that there will be a $20 fee. On our last night in Vegas we stayed out very late, going to bed after 4am. Before going to sleep, we called the front desk and asked for a late check-out. We were told in no uncertain terms that if we checked out even 1 minute after 11am there would be a $35 charge... NO EXCEPTIONS ! Incidentally, no automated check-out through the TV / Computer is available either. We confirmed this policy with the front desk the next morning (at 10:45 am) and they said it was true... 11am check-out time, NO EXCEPTIONS to the $35 fee. They tried to tell us that this was standard throughout Las Vegas (making us roar with laughter), but as long as we have been going to Las Vegas (about 5x per year for the past 8 years), we have NEVER encountered late check-out fees at any other property.

Reviews.Title: “never again the rush tower”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes095
Reviews.Content: when we got to the rush towers we where told no up grades and we belong to the landrys club and we where suprised at our bill from eatting at one of there places our bill was doubled billed, and it took a manger to get that straighten out and the manger gave us a cupon book to use the front desk was all very young and needs to relearn what customer sevrice is. housekeeping was on top of there game. where did all the kids come from? School has started? and all the under age drinking gong around the pool?? we will not be back, we have had enough of vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best of downtown, bar none.”
Reviews.Author: jasonc0604
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Vegas and second staying downtown at the Golden Nugget. The first trip a buddy of mine and I went for a week and stayed in the North Tower, this time being with my then girlfriend (now wife) we chose to stay in the new Rush Tower and absolutely loved it! For the price, you can't find anything as nice as the Rush Tower anywhere. We ate dinner at both Vic and Anthony's (where I proposed to my wife) and at Grotto and the service and food exceeded my expectations. Unfortunately it was too cold to swim otherwise we would have taken advantage of the best pool downtown and one of the best in all of Vegas. If you don't mind renting a car or hoping a bus or cab to and from the strip the Golden Nugget is the absolute best bang for your buck. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good qualities with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: handtoGod
Reviews.Content: First trip to Las Vegas for me and my son. We both wanted to stay in the Fremont district, which we love and prefer over the Strip. We both thought the Strip was a great place to visit but liked the feel of Fremont. As for the Nugget, it's a nice place and we would stay again. A couple of drawbacks: 1) we had to pay for the VIP in order to get a room with two double beds; 2) the beds and pillows were horrible, neither of us had a good nights sleep while there; 3) the VIP was supposed to allow us to forego the lines, which was true during check in but when we actually were waiting in a line, which was on our last day while waiting for the breakfast buffet, we didn't think about it until we were at the beginning of the line. When I brought it up to the cashier she asked to see my VIP line pass, which we had not received during check-in so that added "perk" was a wash. Speaking of the buffet, we waited in line for about 30-40 minutes and by the time we got to the front of the line they had switched to lunch; breakfast is served until 10:30 which seems a bit early to cut it off considering how late people stay up in Vegas. The food wasn't exceptional and of course we were disappointed because we wanted breakfast. The maddening part was we could see numerous empty tables just waiting to be bussed with no one in sight to clean them up. If they had enough help to bus the tables the line would have moved a lot faster. Bottom line for us--we won't be eating at the buffet again. Another problem I had at the Nugget-in all the time I spent at the machines not once was I approached by a cocktail server. The Fitz, Excalibur, Paris and Caesar's were extremely quick when it came to offering drinks-but the Nugget scores a 0 in this respect. In this day and age I find it ridiculous that they charge for Internet connections and a fridge in the room. The Nugget seems to nickel and dime you to death, but I guess that's the trade off for lower priced rooms.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: trailboss71
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to get married .We stayed at the nugget.The hotel was so much more than we expected.The place is beautiful.The casino was clean and friendly the staff went out of their way for us.We have no complaints.Freemont Street was a blast an the strip is only 15 minutes away with a bus pass (only 7 bucks)We liked it so much we are going back next year

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Byfaith
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush tower and there were a lot of design flaws. The biggest one was that the colors are so dark when you walk in you cant even find the light switches. It took ten minutes just to turn on the light. Since Vegas cant have coffee makers in any rooms any more, because of a law suit, you would think they would serve it free in the lobby. None was found. My husband gambles and I like to relax all day by the pool so I was looking forward to going to the pool the very first day. I picked this hotel just because of the pool. I got to the pool around 11am and there were no available seats anywhere and even to just sit next to the pool and put your feet in was next to impossible. That put me in a very bad mood from jump street. So I went to an employee that works in the gift shop by the pool and asked her what time they opened the pool. She told me that the doors open at 7 am but the pool wont open until 10 am. She also told me that if there is a chair with just a towel and no personal belongings that I can sit there but if there are belongings there I cant touch the chair. So my number one priority was to make sure I was there the next day as soon as the doors open. Next morning got up bright and early excited about going to the pool. Was the first in line and got the exact seat that I wanted. After sitting there about an hour I remembered that I forgot my iphone in the room and decided to go and get it. I told the security guard that I was going up to my room to get my phone and said I would be right back. He then pointed at a sign in front of him and with a loud voice proceeded to tell me that chairs can not be reserved or saved. I tried to say something and he interrupted me and spoke even louder like he wanted everyone to hear. In a polite soft voice I told him that I was not there to argue with him but was told by another employee that if I had my stuff on the chair that they could not touch it and asked if that were true. Before he could even finish saying yes I was out the door on the way to get my phone. The next morning I was up and at em early again but this time there was someone in front of me that got the seat I was in the day before saved 6 more seats in that row and then the round day bed next to her on the other side, and no she didn't tell me that she lives in Vegas and decided to come early and save seats for her family and that they were bringing their children. She wasn't staying at the hotel and she was on the phone for the next hour calling up her family telling them how to get there and how she was saving a bunch of seats for them. Now I flew in from across the country just to stay at this hotel to go to the pool and spent over $1200.00 and this chick hasn't spent a dime and just got prime seats for the day at the best pool in downtown Vegas. Now I cant blame her because if she is doing it you know there are others doing it too and that is one of the reasons i probably couldn't get a seat the first day I was there. Its called very bad management. Needless to say she sat in front of me smoking the entire time so that day was not a great one for me. Guess Ill go back to the Flamingo next year where there is plenty of seating and they dont let every tom dick and harry off the street into their pool. Another thing they have a night club but if you are staying at the hotel they still charge you to get in.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved The Nugget!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoJoAlbertaBeach
Reviews.Content: What a great 1st experience in Las Vegas. We went for a 30th B-day weekend and it was a blast. We stayed in the Carson Tower and it was really good. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I liked the vanity outside the bathroom to get ready. Lots of closet space and our small safe was handy. The shark tank (with waterslide) was pretty cool. The service at the main restaurant is very good. We had 8 in our party and the food and drinks came fast and everyone enjoyed their meals.We went to the Grotto for happy hour and a large pizza and 2 beer came to $10.00. The prices are quite reasonable, you just have to look around. Freemont Street is so much fun! This year was summer of the 70's and the music pumping was awesome. We visited the main strip twice which was alot of fun but we felt like The Nugget was home sweet home. You could just feel some of the history in Old Vegas, We can't imagine staying anywhere else but downtown. We will definitly stay at The Golden Nugget again!!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Len0559
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend after fourth of July. Our rooms were clean and comfortable and very roomy. The bathroom was on the smaller side but they have a vanity in the room so that gave us more space to spread out and get ready. The pool is great. Their location is not a problem for us as we tend to rely on a designated driver when ever we are out anyways so getting downtown was fine. Very nice hotel and everything was very clean. Looking forward to another quick getaway soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and relaxation/Love the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Speaker1
Reviews.Content: I just returned this morning after spending several days at Nugget. Once again they came through for me big time. I let them know that I was coming for rest and relaxation upfront. There did arrange for me to have wine, grapes and cheese in my room upon arrival. The servise the full time that I was there was excellent. That goes for check in/check out, to the cleaning staff. I was able to relax by the pool for some relaxation in the mornings without being disturbed. The beds were so comfortable that I spent one day mostly in my room. The Nugget offers some in room dining that I would suggest to any couple visiting them also. Their sweetheart breakfast is something that my boyfrined and I previously took advantage of. They roll a table into your room and you have a full breakfast. The Nugget stands out because of the attention they pay to details. Many people think that Las Vegas is the last place to go for rest and relaxation, but the Nugget made that possible for me. The Nugget actually makes you feel like a guest, rather than somone who just paid them to stay there. This is my favorite hotel in Vegas. I've stayed here several times andI' ll be back again. Denise W./Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “golden nugget rush tower nicest rooms in downtown,pool is spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dgiese
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the new rush tower which opened in november 2009 these rooms are some of the nicest rooms i have ever stayed in if you want to stay downtown with the luxury of a high end strip hotel than the golden nugget rush tower is it . and at only 69 dollars a night we felt it was a bagain, the pool is amazing with a water slide that goes thru a tank filled with sharks and other fish ,but dont worry they are well fed,by the time the water slide is opened. the hotel staff are fabulous not once did we come across any staff that were not helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “VIP PACKAGE RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: nishendu
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in room 1720. Room smelled moldy initially but the smell went away when air-conditioning was turned up. Real trouble started when my wife tried to get into shower.had no water. We called management and they offered us a free breakfast. They are basically unresponsive. Some one is working on it for a while. We arrived late and the "VIP" check in was closed. I had specifically told the staff when I made the booking that I will be coming late. They did not tell me that I would have to wait for fourty minutes to check in in a line. What ever you do, do not buy the VIP package.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay downtown!”
Reviews.Author: readytograbasuitcase
Reviews.Content: After checking out of the Golden Nugget Laughlin a day early, we decided to try their sister hotel in Vegas. Based on another review here, we decided to upgrade to the Rush Tower. Because it was a Saturday, the upgrade fee was $30. Not bad, as the total was $100 for the night. We also decided to upgrade to VIP for another $40, because on such short notice, we could be guaranteed the room, and have free access to Golddigger's, their nightclub. VIP check-in was so easy! I would go VIP again in a hearbeat! The VIP staff was so nice. The room was amazing! Bed was so comfortable, bathroom was huge, and plenty of space in the room as well. The pool was really fun to look at, especially the shark tank. We did not go in though, because there were really high winds that day from the nearby monsoon. Chair cushions were flying everywhere, and so were towels! When you see bungee cords holding down towels and cushions, it's not a day to go to the pool. Mind you that it was not the hotel's fault at all, of course. We ate at the Chart House for dinner, walked around Fremont Street, and hit Goldigger's after that. All in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The nugget is elegant and classy at a...”
Reviews.Author: bdg5556
Reviews.Content: The nugget is elegant and classy at a reasonable price. The location is the best in town. The strip is an easy quick trip via the Deuce for shows and dining but nothing beats a night strolling Freemont Street

Reviews.Title: “New addition in very noisy”
Reviews.Author: PsyProf
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Expedia and thought I was booking a nice room. The room I was assigned was in a horrible location with a view of another building out of the window. I paid for an upgade (at an expensive price) to stay in the new hotel addition they had recently completed. Our room faced the downtown area where they have incredibly noisy concerts going on every night until midnight. The noise from these multiple bands literally shook the glass in the windows of our room. If you don't mind very loud rock music penetrating your room until midnight every night then this is the place for you. As for me, this will be my last stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the hotels on the strip!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CatherineGurski
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would recommend the Golden Nugget to anyone staying in Las Vegas!! We stayed in one of the newer Rush Tower Jr. suites and it was absolutely amazing. The room was beautiful and big!! The pool totally awesome, like swimming with the sharks!! The Hideout was very nice and renting the daybed for the day was a very good idea, very relaxing and comfortable. All of the staff were very friendly and willing to help. If you do stay here, be sure to eat at Vic and Anthony's!!!! It was out of this world!!!! Our waiter Dennis was amazing!!! He knew just what to suggest to make our meal memorable. He was very polite and knowledgeable!!! The prices were good for the quality you got in both the food and the hotel!!!! It is nicer than most of the strip hotels without the price tag or crowd!! Def. recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great but expensive”
Reviews.Author: dawnharris
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the carson tower. the rooms was great and one of the best beds we have slept in. the hotel was spotless everywhere but the swimming pool was problematic. because of the shark tank the pool size was quite small for the size of the hotel. there were loads of people in a small area and so the water did become cloudy after a short while. the sunbeds were very close together and it was difficult to find empty ones. the drinks and food was very expensive. it was $8 for a vodka and coke and $9.99 for most basic meals; fruit plate, pancakes and omelettes. the buffet was better priced but food was only ok but plenty of choice. this is definately the best choice for freemont street and you do get great value for money. we didnt try the casino or show so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - good price”
Reviews.Author: Acmeflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had never stayed in the downtown area and wanted that experience. It is the largest hotel in the fremont area. I was surprised at how large it was. We stayed in the Carson tower. The room was nice, clean, comfy.
