If there was a complaint, it was that the pool, which has a large fish/shark tank in the middle was too small, too crowded and way too noisy. We had stayed on the strip at Bally's and eventhough there were kids around, the pool being larger allowed for those of us without kids to still enjoy ourselves. At the Golden Nugget pool, the kids need to learn pool etiquette. They were jumping/diving into the pool, splashing in my face and I did not find this fun. I felt like a sardine with all the loungers squeezed right next to each other. It was difficult to get a lounge chair unless you got there early. Now I want you to know that I am a mother of 5 and not opposed to children but I think the lower price hotel attracts more famiies on a budget and I should keep this in mind when next I book a trip to Vegas. That being said, there is a pool called the "hideaway" on the top level that is for age 16 and above. We could not get into there because it was all booked up. I would have checked this out but felt that charging for the chairs and minimum price on drinks was also a consideration. So all in all, the Golden Nugget is a fine hotel. Just keep in mind that the pool is small, not like the huge hotels on the strip with multiple pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: copella4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget in August. We checked out of the Flamingo early Friday morning and arrived at the Golden Nugget around 8AM. There was one person in line in front of us at the Rush Tower check in. The clerk was super friendly. The people in our room had already checked out, but the room hadn't been cleaned yet. The clerk basically checked us in, gave us our coupon book, and had the bell man hold our luggage for us. We just had to come back around 10:00AM and see if our room was ready and get our keys. When we returned just a few minutes after 10:00AM, our room was ready. We were on the 17th floor with a strip view. The room was absolutely gorgeous! Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. This was probably the first hotel I've ever stayed at where the sheets didn't come untucked when I pulled the covers down. Our room was cleaned promptly every day. The maid was perhaps a little too efficient. They give a large bar of upgraded soap and two smaller bars at the sink. The maid threw the soaps away every day. That large soap would probably last two weeks at home, so I just put them in my suitcase and only opened the little bars, so we wouldn't waste so much. My only complaint about the room would be the height of the tub. The first time I got in, I banged my foot. It's a deep tub. I could see an older person having a hard time using the tub/shower. The breakfast buffet was excellent, but the lunch buffet lacked variety, although everything was of a good quality and tasty. The table dealers were a mixed bag. A lot of them were very quiet. Once I started having the dealer play along with my hands, it woke them up fast. They were otherwise polite, just not as much fun as those who joke around and talk more. Once they were woken with tokens, they were more lively. My only real issue was that my husband was approached two mornings in a row inside our hotel lobby by prostitutes. All in all, an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Week... Really NIIICE”
Reviews.Author: travelingshoes_99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nuggett last week for my birthday. It was definitely nicer than I expected it to be for the price. The hotel was beautiful. I didn't stay in the rush tower but I took a stroll to that part of the building and was impressed. Maybe the next time I'll stay in the rush tower. I recommend this hotel. The Freemont Street Experience was GREAT! Very entertaining. If we didn't want to go far we didn't have to. Reading about how close it was to the Freemont, I was afraid it would be noisy and unsafe, but there was plenty of security there and I wouldn't even have known that there were hundreds of people with three different concerts going on at once from my room on the 15th floor :) It was just great. I stayed at the Bellagio one night and although the Bellagio is the great Bellagio hotel, I didn't miss being there when I came back to the Golden Nugget. If I had a complaint.. or a gripe it would be the bath clothes and towels. Out of the three towels and bath cloths there were typically 1 out of 3 of them that didn't have spots on them. The towels were a badge/cream color and apparently they are unable to be cleaned in BLEACH. We had to call housekeeping twice to bring us more towels/bath cloths because the ones we had were not spotless. BUT the problem was solved, we got more. Nothing more to complain about. EVERYTHING else was superb!!! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Bill31308
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night at the Golden Nugget while traveling on vacation. The room was clean. Very nice place. The shark pool is neat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Rush Tower and pay $20 for a pool chair at the Hideout Pool”
Reviews.Author: habsace
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Golden Nugget. This was our first time staying down on Freemont Street. I'm still undecided whether I would stay downtown again, but if I did, then I would most definitely stay at the Golden Nugget. Based on other Trip Advisor reviews, we decided to upgrade to the Rush Tower and we are so glad we did. The rooms are new and beautiful. The decor is very retro. The rooms are spacious and quiet (I would recommend a room facing away from Freemont Street as you can hear the free concerts below at night (we were on the 21st floor and could hear the music below much to our surprise). The rates are very reasonable Sunday thru Thursday. My biggest complaint was having to pay for extras such as Wifi ($12.99 for 24 hours) and having no choice, but to have to pay for a pool chair at the secluded pool (Hide Out) because the main pool is so over crowded. The cost is $20 and secures your chair from 10 to 5. You are given a wrist band so you can come and go as you please. Although the main pool is spectacular with the shark tank and water slide, I would highly recommend paying the $20 .The Hide Out pool is for guests over 16. While staying at the hotel, take in the Gordie Brown show. Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “We cried when we left”
Reviews.Author: ursula1968
Reviews.Content: From about two hours after check-in, I was saying to my little ones, "Remind me to review this hotel somewhere." I'm not an online reviewer at all, but we just got home from a four day vacation to Las Vegas for the first time, and I had to post this. The Golden Nugget was beautiful, classy, bizarre, lively, intimate, fun, comfortable, exciting. I have not slept so well in ten years as I did the three nights we were there. Lovely rooms (older, Carson Tower), great AC, beautiful view of the mountains, awesome shower that made us comatose at the end of the night, wonderful service (Every single staff member smiled and said "Good morning" or "Good evening.") One reviewer mentioned that, although the rooms have multiplied, the pool is the same, and yes, it's a bit cramped but you feel like you are at a family party with lots of nice, happy people. It's wonderful for couples, families, older people--anyone. There is an army of staff who are constantly cleaning everything from the slot machines to the pool area. I don't know how to gamble but I put about ten bucks in the slot machines over the stay and won a bit over forty just for fun. The Mai Tais at the pool are the finest I have ever had--no mix at all, just the real, potent deal. We rented a car at the in-house Budget counter and went to attractions at about ten hotels over two days (all the hotels have FREE valet parking for everyone, an insane concept for a Chicagoan who can't park anywhere without mortgaging the house). This is the one thing about the Golden Nugget: it's about a twenty-thirty dollar cab ride from the Strip hotels, depending on where you are going, so definitely rent a car for about eighty bucks a day, which also allowed us to ride out into the desert at bit and go back and forth twice a day to the Strip. We also had several meals at Carson Street Cafe--great breakfast--and had dinner at Lilly's, an Asian place with Chinese, Japanese and Thai cuisine, also very good. Fremont Street, day or night, is a must-see slice of Americana, and it was wonderful to be able to walk outside the door and say goodnight to old Las Vegas in its current incarnation of rowdiness (Fremont Street Experience) . . . and then head right inside for a safe, secure, totally quiet night, without any noise at all. We visited so many hotels on the Strip during our stay, and though we loved them all (especially Bellagio, Luxor, Caesars) I don't think we'd ever stay anywhere but the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as long as you get a great deal...”
Reviews.Author: Caliguy227
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends who absolutely wanted to try this place. I was intrigued and was hoping to get one of the new Rush Tower rooms, as some friends had stayed there before and loved it. Unfortunately, by the time we booked, they were sold out and we settled for the older rooms in the Carson Tower. They weren't bad - about 3 stars I'd say. Not too fancy, not too cheap. The bathrooms were small, though. Also, lighting is poor - the room could have used more lamps or lights. The one floor lamp we did have had a busted bulb. We called 10 minutes after checking in, and two days later they still hadn't fixed it. We were disappointed in the lack of service, considering we were used to the Wynn's AWESOME service. Whatever - we were a bunch of guys on a bachelor party trip. Another annoyance - there was no "do not disturb" sign - and no one could find us one. So each day, bright and early, there was a knock on the door from housekeeping. I am never mad at people for doing their job - but really? 9am? In Vegas? The ladies were polite, but the door knocking was annoying. Overall, okay experience, decent rooms. Just make sure you get a good price. It's about a $30 cab ride to the strip. The Downtown night life is not great - fewer clubs and a lot of the eateries close down at 11pm - which we thought was weird. The summer time Fremont Street experience is pretty cool, though. Oh, and the pool is pretty cool, too.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, great, super value”
Reviews.Author: nannyca
Reviews.Content: the only negative was the chairs in the room were very soiled. pool was really nice

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade to Rush tower with Landry's card”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: We purchased an Air and 4 night stay at the Golden Nugget package from Delta Airlines. The entire package was less expensive than what purchasing the flights alone would have cost. Upon check in, we presented our Landry’s card and received a free upgrade to the new Rush tower. Room was spacious and clean. The A/C unit was so quiet you could not tell when it was running. The only thing you would hear is the thermostat click. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. My wife got up a few times in the night to use the restroom and I did not even realize it. As stated in another review, shower pressure was not the greatest, but still adequate. The tub and shower area was large enough that a 2nd shower head on the other end of the tub would have been nice when we were both in there. Over the past couple years, we have stayed at three different strip hotels and now three different downtown hotels. This was our nicest room of them all.

Reviews.Title: “The Nug is THE place to stay on Fremont!”
Reviews.Author: NordicBlue
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Gold Tower at the Golden Nugget, and was extremely satisfied. The cost couldn't be beat, and the room's comfort and accommodations were all that you could ask for. The rooms have pillowtop mattresses, plasma screen TV, good working AC, and was clean when I arrived. The only thing I could have wanted to be better would have been more water pressure in the shower. The pool is not as large as the Strip resorts, but they had nice daybeds to lay on, a waterfall at one end of the pool, and even a water slide tube that goes through their famous shark tank! This was my first time staying downtown. Fremont Street is a fun experience. Live music, the nightly LED ceiling light show, and cheap food and drink all around. While down there, I attended the show at the LA Comedy Club at the 4 Queens Hotel and Casino. Laughed my a** off!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great service - extremely surprised”
Reviews.Author: craigslist1952
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond our expectations. It was extremely clean. Our room was very decent. When in Vegas, you usually don't want to spend a lot of time in your room anyway. The beds were very comfortable, the pillows were even fluffy and comfortable. The showers were amazing - the water pressure was like a blast ! We paid $39 per night and were completely satisfied. We've paid double that and got 1/2 as much. This was well worth the money. My only complaint would be that it is a little off the beaten path from where most of the action in Las Vegas is. However, being close to Fremont St. Experience kind of makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Low-roller gets the high-roller treatment”
Reviews.Author: creekj
Reviews.Content: Now I have to start by saying I'm sure my view of this experience is biased based upon the perks we received. Perks: Free upgrade through Landry's Select Membership to a Rush Tower Junior Suite, even though I booked through a 3rd party. $40 bill at Red Sushi comped for paltry play by a super generous casino hostess (I'm sorry to say I can't recall her name at the moment. To bad this could have been her opportunity to become Internet famous). Reviewer: Early 30's married couple no kids. Travel to Vegas about every 90 days. Interests are...wait for it...gambling (never would have guessed, huh?), food and lounging near the pool. Location: The Golden Nugget is ideally situated right in the middle of the Fremont Street experience. Every Fremont Street location is only a 5-15 min walk, if you have no difficulties walking. Check-in: Landry's membership gave us the option to use VIP-check in, but embarrassingly enough we had no idea where it was located. So we used the regular check-in and waited in line for about 6 mins. If your looking for VIP it's located next to the Rush Towers, keep the pool area to your left, follow it around to the slots and take a left. Elevators: Lightning fast, longest wait 30 sec. Room: 10202 Rush Tower Junior Suite. We've been steadily working our way up the hotel food chain. We have yet to stay at the Wynn, Palazzo or Bellagio, so if your used to these places then the junior suite will be comfortable, it just won't be "Wow, this is niiiiiice!" Foyer leads to a closet on your left, restroom straight ahead (double sink and deep tub with shower), and a separate make-up area with mirror to the right. Opens up into a lounge area, sitting area, and king bed. Two 42-inch flat screens. Furniture was very comfortable, views of other hotels (pretty sad), and shower water pressure was strong. Free in room safe. See attached pictures. Very pleased with house keeping and quality of room. Minor complaint: the pillows did not offer enough support IMHO. they folded like a lawn chair under the weight of my head. I think it was because they were down pillows. Pool: We opted to pay $40 ($20 a piece) for two chaise lounges at the Hide-Out pool located on the 3rd floor. Worth every penny. I'm not against kids, but kids can be kids, and downstairs was a zoo. The Hide-Out was very relaxing, quite and a fun group of adult couples. Jeff, the bartender, was spot-on and personable. The only negative: The only areas out of the sun were the cabanas ($250 a day, 6 people, but one can fit 16). But depending on the time of day, several day beds had shade from the buildings. Casino: Daytime you can find $5 tables, but the min moves to $10 at night. There is usually a $5 three card poker and a Super 21 blackjack at the back pit near the rear entrance by the WOF slot machines at night. Friendly dealers and pit bosses. Drink service was prompt. Kettle one vodka offered, sorry no goose. Slots: Golden Nugget has a reputation (deserved or not) as a tighter casino. Can't say that I noticed one way or the other. WOF seemed to be on par at max bet with other casinos, except the Cortez. I don't know if we were lucky, or what, but the Cortez was spitting money out of their WOF machines 3 days in a row. Casino host/hostess: They're great as far as I'm concerned since they comped my Red Sushi bill on a $200 loss. Restaurants: Vic and Anthony's is the best steak house downtown. If you disagree...you are wrong ;-P. Flawless service and an affordable $46 prix fixe menu (salad, 8 0z prime filet, side and dessert). 2.5 lb lobster is not meant for one person. You have been warned. Grotto: Excellent thin crust pizza and delicious pastas. Friendly wait staff, can be hit or miss with service depending on who you get. Buffet: Best quality downtown, but nothing that knocks your socks-off. The champagne served with the champagne brunch was pleasantly delicious and endless. Deadly combination. Bottom line: Golden Nugget is the class of downtown and I'm happy to say that the service exceeded my expectations. It easily has the best pool, restaurants and rooms downtown. Side note: It takes about 15-20 min to take an ACE bus from downtown to the Fashion-show Mall (across from the Wynn). The 108 bus will take you to the airport, but it takes 40 min.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Googlebears26
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas and stayed at the Golden Nugget for one night. We stayed in the Rush Tower and loved the room and the renovations of the hotel from the last year or so. Had drinks and food at The Hideout pool area and enjoyed ourselves greatly. At night we ate some sushi at Red Sushi and it was very enjoyable. All in all great stay'cation' and I recommend paying the extra money to stay in the Rush Tower. Not that much more for great value and definitely the best hotel on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Solo? You might not be worth their business!”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: For the first time I thought about trying the GN. I usually stay on the strip, so they had a good rate and I decided to book one night there and check it out, due to good reviews online. Parking lot was full, so I valet my car. Well the cheap rate matched the profesionalism at check in. After a 5 hour flight I was checking in around 11pm. I was supposed to have a king size, deluxe tower, non smoking room. Well first thing I was told is they were fully booked, so I would not get deluxe tower (whatever that meant, that was fine!) I would not get king size but two doubles, fine! I would get a smoking room and they had no idea if it smelled or not. In her attemp to convince me to get the room, she said "it's only you" I think she meant it as no family etc...but with the bait and switch already... it sounded to me like "you are not that worth it". Clerk said "it's impossible for me what each room smells like". So her carelessness incited my carelessness and decided to cancel my reservation. At this point it was midnite and I was not able to book for that date online. (Lucky me Hilton Team always helps me out! They allowed me to check in right then!) I have to say upon leaving there was a long line to check in around midnite, so hopefully those had a better experience. Good thing is valet made it comp, I am glad guys at valet know they are a cust service/experience business. Save your money and your experience while on vacation and AVOID the GNugget, don't fall for bait and switch. If they advertise so and so, and you book so and so, get them to deliver so and so. Pictures look good, but for me it's only a "what might have been". I hope supervisors change their tactics or deliver better training on their staff. My evaluation is only a reflection of what I did experience, since I never got further, and I did not want to get any further after such start.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't care for the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: skterrill
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget just didn't work for me. The pool area seemed a little seedy and our hotel room (a standard room in the older part of the hotel) was quite depressing. I didn't like downtown, in general. The reason we chose the Nugget was because our son loves sharks and we'd read about the Nugget's amazing pool (a waterslide runs through a shark tank). The water slide was fun for our son but the pool area just wasn't very clean or bright or spacious. I will say the people working at the hotel were all very helpful and friendly. I'm normally not a complainer. I don't think I've ever posted a negative review on tripadvisor. If you like 4* hotels on the strip you probably won't like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only complaint is the housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: gottagetoutofhereBc
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay within the last year. Only complaint is the housekeeping, The rooms are not completely cleaned but still pretty good. That's my only complaint and its actually not that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't return again”
Reviews.Author: Mesquitetraveler10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Golden Nugget numerous times over the last 8 or nine years and always found it satisfactory until now. We took advantage of the "Summer10" promo offering a room upgrade from the Carson Tower to the Gold Tower for $20 more a night. This also included a GN fun book. We checked-in at 1:00 in the afternoon, but had to wait till three to get the key because the room hadn't been cleaned yet. We picked up the room key at 3:00...went up to this "upgraded room" and quickly discovered this "upgraded" room was right next to the elevator shaft with the noisy icemaker right outside the door. The view from the window was the wall of one of the adjoining towers. We stayed in the room for only 5 minutes or so and decided it was totally unacceptable. Back to the desk we went and voiced our concern to some rude young woman behind the counter. She quickly informed us that they had no more smoking rooms. We told her to put us in the Carson tower and let us keep this fun book. She said "we didn't pay" for the fun book, but that it had been given to us...telling us the fun book didn't come with the Summer10 promotion. We got our room in the Carson tower. Day 2. We returned to our room at 1:00 in the afternoon to rest for a while before going out again. Housekeeping hadn't made up the room yet so we put the do not disturb sign on the door. They finally showed up at 1:30 or so...our room didn't get cleaned that day. Was glad to check out the next day.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalapamela
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new Rush Tower is very modern with leather couch and feather pillows. The bathroom is lovely with interesting double sinks. The new lobby is tasteful with beautiful blown glass throughout the wing. We found $10 Pai Gow, $10 Blackjack, $10 Craps and during the daytime it was down to $5 per hand. The new Sex in the City slot machines were a lot of fun and they have a new computer generated $3 blackjack and $3 3 card Poker set of seats of 6. This was really fun, too! Of course we love the downtown light show and the free entertainment. The Fitzgerald has a MacDonald's which is perfect for a quarter pounder at Midnight, just a short walk from the Nugget. We ate in the Buffet which was okay, not great, for lunch. The pool area is really terrific, but you have to save a lounge chair early. There were a lot of kids swimming and scooting down the water slide next to the shark tanks. The upper balcony is designated adults only, which we liked. We love the downtown light show and free entertainment. We love to just stroll around to the various Hotels within easy walking distance, but we did spend the majority of the time at the Nugget. We love the Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Great Vegas getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Scooter1970
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us (two couples) stayed at the Golden Nugget from August 2nd to 8th, 2010. Check-in was fairly quick and courteous (we arrived on a Monday around 2:30pm. Our rooms were King/Non-Smoking Rooms in the Carson Tower. The rooms themselves were nice and clean and fairly decent in size. My wife really enjoyed the make-up table and mirror just outside of the bathroom and I was happy to see that there was a safe in the room (small, located in the closet if you're looking for it, and was large enough for wallets/passports/jewellery but wouldn't fit a laptop or anything of decent size). The cleaning staff did a great job keeping the room clean during our stay too. The hotel itself is quite large and the Carson tower is situated right at the back. The elevator tower for it is close to a small store with beverages and hotel souveniers, and nearby a Starbucks coffee outlet (very busy in the mornings!). The pool is also nearby with the world famous Shark Tank. The pool itself opens at 10am for swimming, but you have to go earlier (8-9am) if you want a chair... great place to catch some sun. We even managed to catch filming of a few scenes of CSI Vegas in the pool area while we were there (I think the episode will be called "Pool Shark" and it's supposed to air September 30th). The Casino floor is fairly large considering it is a downtown Casino. Lots of table games too (my friend seemed to enjoy the poker room on a daily basis too). As for restaurants, we only tried the one near the pool (can't remember the name of it at the moment), but it was good and the prices were affordable. I had heard ahead of time that the buffet and some of the other restaurants were pricey, so we didn't even bother going into them. There's a ton of affordable places on and around Fremont to try out. The location of the hotel is fairly cental on Fremont Street, so it's close to everything there. While we didn't have too much interaction with staff, they did seem courteous when approached. The hotel was also close to a bus stop which our wives took to the north outlet mall (they found out later it would have just been a short & fairly cheap cap ride away - which they took to get back to the hotel with the stuff they had bought). It's aslo only couple blocks walk to catch the ACE Goldline or Deuce to head down to the strip (we found the Goldline great as it has less stops than the Deuce). The Golden Nugget (and Fremont Street for that matter) is also a short cab ride away to Cashman Field, home of the Las Vegas 51's Triple A farm team for the Blue Jays... very affordable tickets for a great night out. All in all, this was our first time staying at the Golden Nugget (first time on Fremont too) and we preferred it to our stays on the Strip (have stayed at Bally's and New York New York before). The Golden Nugget is the nicest of the hotels downtown, it's less crowded on Fremont and you spend less time going from casino to casino than you would on the Strip. If you've stayed on the Strip and are wondering about Fremont Street and the Golden Nugget, do youself a favour and try it out - you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure Downtown”
Reviews.Author: lalapamela
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new tower at the Golden Nugget and had so much fun. The Hotel is lovely and clean and the Rush Tower is very modern. The lobby has fantastic blown glass lighting. We wandered through the Hotel and into the Street Life every evening for the free Light Show. Also, there was free entertainment . . . great bands playing in the evening. AND there's nothing like a McDonald's Quarter Pounder at 12:00 p.m. in the Fitzgerald just down the street. It takes 5 minutes to walk there from the Nugget. We like the easy walking from Casino to Casino from our home base of the Nugget. The Pool is really great, but there were lots and lots of children aroound during our visit. You have to get to the pool very early to get a chair at all. Everyone is using the water slide witht he sharks swimming nearby in their tanks. It's too hot in the afternoon to sunbathe in the summer. There is an adult level in the pool area where it is serene. We loved the gambling in this Casino. We were able to find $10 Pai Gow, $10 Craps, $10 Blackjack and during the daytime the prices were even less. They have a good selection of slot machines, including the new "Sex in the City" machine, which is really fun!. Also, a brand new computer-type game with 21 and 3 card poker at $3 a hand with Avatars who were the "dealers". We had a lot of fun and would recommend the whole downtown Las Vegas experience, rather than staying on the Strip. We have stayed at the New York Hotel, the Mandalay Bay Hotel too, but we like the GoldenNugget the best.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Old Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jtram98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget in May 2010 for my 40th birthday. This was our second time here, the first being Oct 2008. This is the only hotel that we would stay at in old Vegas - it just seems to be a lot nicer and is close to a 4-5 star hotel. We stayed in the Carson Tower which as pretty basic rooms - nice but nothing really extravagant. There is an awesome pool with a shark tank. You can also play Black Jack by the pool as well which beats the casino floor when you get tired of the cigarette smoke. The casino itself is pretty good, it has that old Vegas feel to it - lots of dark wood. The only thing is that its a bit of a walk to the elevators. We had dinner at Vic and Anthony's steak house - a bit pricey but the steaks were quite good. We also had dinner in the noodle bar one night and it was good and reasonably priced. We will definitely stay here again when we com back to old Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the quieter but lively part of town.”
Reviews.Author: wayneghall
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and 15 year old son. The hotel is one of the oldest in Las Vegas and in places is starting to show its age, but not so that it would affect a stay there. The room was a two bed double, but the beds were on the small side, however the room was clean and tidy. The staff were all friendly and helpful, apart from one girl on the ticket office desk, who appeared disinterested in finding us a show. There are number of resturants with "world flavours" alongside a buffet and a cafe, the restaurants are often busy, so booking required, the buffet moves quickly, and the cafe is good for breakfast as well as afternoon snack. The pool area is great, if a little crowded, try to get a chair on one of the upper levels, where it is lesss busy. There is a private area that you have to pay to get into with its own pool, but this tends to be full of 20-something trendy types posing! The main pool circles a shark/fish tank, it is cleaned from the inside most days by three divers (one on guard!) this is very interesting to watch as the sharks approach. I did feel that the tank was on the small side though and began to feel sorry for the sharks. there is a flume that runs through the tank, great for the kids. All hotels have there own casino and this is no exception, with one of the largest in that area, however, it is also one of the smokiest. Outside of the hotel is the Fremont Street Experience, this has a carnival atmosphere and consists of permormance artists, shops, stalls and live bands on two stages. All covered by a giant LED TV roof. We actually prefered this to the busier and brasher strip. Close by there is a Tickets4Tonight stall that sells reduced price show, tour and meal tickets, we got some good savings there, but you do need to be there before 10am to ensure the more popular are not sold out for that evening To get to the strip requires a bus journey ($15 tickets for five days) that can take anywhere between 15 minutes in the morning and 50 minutes late at night back. So if you plan to spend most of the time on the strip, that may be something to bear in mind, but we liked being away from it for a respite.

Reviews.Title: “Alot to pay for just a bed”
Reviews.Author: phildiann
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the New Rush Tower, this was our fith trip to vegas, from the first time we went 12 years ago my wife has always wanted to stay at the Nugget so this time we were there for our wedding aniversary so to make it special i thought i would treat her to the Nugget, Big mistake it was more expensive than other casinos we have stayed in the room was very nice the bed was comfey thats it ,there was no fridge, no coffee maker,and they had the nerve to leave two bottles of water on the side for us at $4 each (the same bottle in a shop down the street was $1.49) at previouse stays we have had fridges, and coffee machines and free water but not at the nugget . The excuse was we dont charge a resort fee. RUBBISH.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool & clean spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: crileyteach
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay there because of their amazing pool, with a shark tank in the middle of the pool! It was all we had hoped for. Rooms were clean large enough for 3 adults to share, beds comfy, & of course the down town location that we so much prefer to the strip! Food is really good as well. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “beware of bedframes in rush tower.....”
Reviews.Author: KSMACICEK
Reviews.Content: the hotel and rooms are beautiful in the rush tower, but beware of the bed frames...the frames extend beyond the bed and my daughter in law and two grandaughters as well as myself knocked into the frames several times..needless to say we all recieved bruises...they need to redesign the beds...other than that the stay was fine..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, poor location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug2265
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The quality of the furnishings were top notch. Probably the most comfortable bed I have slept in with high quality clean sheets. If you want a nice hotel and do not care about the location, the Golden Nugget is great. If this were on the strip it would cost double. The location is not so great. Las Vegas is VERY crowded at the moment. It took 20+ minutes to get to the strip on several occassions. Downtown Vegas is not the best, the Freemont experience is good for about 10 minutes. There is no shopping in that area and there are several seedy people hanging out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sabdan31
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget/Rush Tower staff are just not helpful or positive. The rooms were ok, the housekeepers were very nice. But the staff at the front desks were absolutely indifferent to whether anyone enjoyed their experience or not. They moved slow, even when there was a long line, they talked amongst themeslves about personal stuff, and ignored the guests as though they weren't even there. It was creepy. There is no concierge, food is very expensive, no coffee pots in your room, $13 per day for internet, there is no one to anwer the front desk phones if you have a question, and if you want to make a restaurant reservation in the hotel, you leave a voice mail! The bigger places on the strip are worth the difference in price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: erin00
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget - not situated at the strip - offer great value for the money. We stayed in Februar at the hotel which seem to be not the main season for Las Vegas. However we got a gread price for a very comfortable, spacious room. The service is perfect and a lot of restaurants in the hotel as well as in walking distance around the hotel the venue. Parking prices are acceptable. You should have a car to get to the strip and the center of Las Vegas. Great price value!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: butcherboy55
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a standard rush tower room. payed the extra twenty dollars a night for this. the room was nice, but had a pecular smell to it. even in the hallways. it is true that they try to nickle and dime you. everything seems to be an extra charge. we also paid an extra 28.00 dollars for vip checkin because we read so many horror stories about the long lines. iam glad we did that, the lines looked very long and with vip you also get a pass to the fro nt of the line at restaurants. what a laugh that was. we stood seperate in a spot at the carson st. cafe supposed to be for vips and were completely ignored by the staff. csi las vegas was shooting at the gold nugget while we were there, that was pretty exciting. basically everyone was pretty nice, a mention to susan who works in the business office. she was wonderful, helping us use the internet for return flight home. that was greatly appreciated. the new section really is lovely and yes it seems to be a lot more crowded then past visits and many people and children at the pool. we did not gamble much at the nugget, way to tight, went to the other casinos down town and won many times.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised with Rush Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: Loveroffun
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I am not into downtown Las Vegas but stayed here because it was my husband's turn to pick the hotel. I would much rather stay on the strip at a more luxury hotel so I was definitely expecting the worst BUT I was proven wrong. We arrived at the Golden Nugget about 8-hours before the stated check-in time and were able to check in early with no problem at all. When we got to the room I was shocked - it was really nice! We stayed in the new non-smoking Rush Tower and I couldn't have been happier. The room was large and clean, the bed and pillows were SO comfortable and the bathroom was huge. The room was decorated nicely and had a big flat screen TV. The only thing that was missing was a small refrigerator but besides that I was very happy with the room and our stay at the Golden Nugget. I would definitely recommend the Rush Tower!

Reviews.Title: “First Time I was Disappointed Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: ABronxTale
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Golden Nugget many time in the past. I would consider it the best hotel in Downtown Vegas. But on my last stay I had problems that bothered me. This was the first time that I was going to need a late check in. I was told by the reservation staff that I could pay a $25.00 fee for a VIP upgrade and be guaranteed a no smoking room with a King sized bed. Otherwise it would be the roll of the dice for whatever was available. (They were hosting a large convention that week end) I paid the $25.00 fee since I wouldn't be checking in until after midnight and wanted to make sure that I had a No Smoking room with a King sized bed. Upon checking in I was told that there were no King beds available. I informed the check in person that I paid for a VIP package which guaranteed me a no smoking room with a King sized bed. She apologized and refunded me my $25.00. When I went up to my room I had to wait in the hallway while my room was being made. I couldn't understand how I had to wait in the hallway at 1:30 AM waiting for a room to be made when I told the Golden Nugget that I was checking in after midnight. When I called the front desk to ask why the room wasn't made the person at the desk apologized and told me that the hotel comped me on the V IP fee. I told him that I wasn't comped, I was refunded for a service I didn't get. So please don't act as if you comped me. Giving me a meal for free would have been a comp. The pool is featured on the travel channel. It has a shark tank and a water slide that goes through it. If you don't get there early to hold a lounger you are out of luck. There aren't enought loungers because the pool area is very small. Then on top of that CSI Vegas was filming there and the pool was closed for hours on two seperate days to accomodate the filming. The room ( I stayed in the Carson Tower) is very rudimentary. It has no refridgerator or coffee maker. I had to go back to the old ice in the trash can to keep my drinks cold. The rooms are a nice size and the beds are comfortable. In this day and age I find the lack of a coffee maker and refridgerator strange. Gambling- The Casino has a very good assortment of gaming tables and slot machines. I found the staff at the tables not to be the friendliest people. Even when tipped after a win they barely aknowledge you. I gambled at the other downtown hotels and the staff was much more pleasant. Overall I've been coming to the Golden Nugget for over 10 years. I enjoyed it much better under the old management. I'll probably stay here again because it is the nicest hotel downtown and I enjoy this area over the strip. BUT, I will be looking at the other hotels to see what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: split44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from late Sunday night until Friday evening. Our plane was late, so we didn't arrive until 1 am. We had a late return flight as well and asked for a late check out w/o any problem. 5 pm checkout and they held our luggage until our shuttle picked us up. 1st day we spent at the adult pool on the 3rd level. Rented a daybed and had a great time. Met several other people to chat with while drinking and relaxing in the infinity edge pool up there. The other days we went to the pool, we just went to the "shark tank" pool. Very nice to have the fish to look at. We would usually get to the pool deck by 9am to get the lounge chair we wanted and just have our coffee, read the paper, etc. Pool always opened on time at 10 am. Pool servers were attentive and always took care of us. Decent mix of families, couples, groups of friends at the pool. We ate at Red Sushi and the Grotto while at GN. Great sushi and awesome service at Red. Sat in the lounge area of the Grotto both times we went. Great Happy Hour specials during the week on food and drink until 6pm. Also ate at other places on Freemont Street. Firefly was 2 minutes away. Great tapas menu (service, execution, atmosphere were all great...actually went here twice we liked it so much). Had some beers and a late-late night snack at 777 Brewery. Nice menu and reasonably priced. Also stopped at Mickey Finz for a quick lunch and was pleased with that as well. Tried out all the casinos on Freemont and did like them. We hit the Strip on 2 occasions by just using the GoldLine bus. $3 gets you there in about 20 minutes. The Deuce was always PACKED and stopped at every hotel making it real slow...avoided that. GoldLine stops a lot less at the main spots that you can quickly walk to whatever other places you'd want to go regardless of the time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Vegas”
Reviews.Author: familyofsix094
Reviews.Content: The Spa Tower was decent but you really get what pay for. This is a decent hotel at a cheap price. Non smoking room a must! Best hotel in downtown Las Vegas. The service is very good and Red Sushi is a great spot

Reviews.Title: “Some housekeeping issues...but otherwise a great value”
Reviews.Author: midnitebreeze
Reviews.Content: This was my third and my hubby's second trip to Vegas. The other trip we took (together) was for a wedding, so we didn't get to see as much as we would have liked. He had never been downtown, so I thought it would be fun to book a two part trip..3 nights downtown and 2 on the strip. It's pretty well known that the Nugget is the nicest hotel downtown...so when I saw they had a summer special for $39 midweek rooms, it was a no-brainer. We arrived by shuttle from the airport on a Sunday night We had to schlep our luggage around a bit before we found the check in desk (better signage would be a bonus here), but after reading about some of the long waits, we were pleasantly surprised to find a very short line. We stayed in a standard room in the older Carson tower. For the money, we were quite satisfied. It was nothing special or over the top, but plenty comfortable...about what you'd expect to find at your average Hilton. I was pleasantly surprised to find they provided robes, and the bed was very comfy. We were on the 12th floor, kind of in a corner with a partial view of the Fitzgerald. The Carson tower is the one furthest back from Freemont Street, which suited us just fine as it was nice and quiet. It is also the closest tower to the swimming pool, which is nice if you prefer not to have to walk through a casino in your swimsuit! The GN pool is unique in that is surrounds a large tank with sharks and other fish. There is a (free) waterslide that goes right through the shark tank, which is pretty cool! The pool area was a little smaller than I expected, but definitely worth checking out. They close the actual pool at night, but you can still grab a lounge chair and look at the sharks after dark when they have the tank lit up. As with many Vegas hotels, there was no coffee maker in the room (we brought our own), but there is a Starbucks very close to the Carson Tower elevators, which would be appreciated for folks who want to grab a quick cup of Joe to bring back up to the room. Other than a quick dinner at the coffee shop the night we arrived, we really didn't eat at the GN, though I've heard Vic and Anthony's steakhouse is excellent, and something we're putting on our list for next time. Though V and A's is one of several higher end places to eat, there are MANY cheap places to eat downtown. Since the casinos are in such close proximity to each other, it's very easy to get around and try different places. Tip: for some good downtown two-for-one dining coupons, go to vegasexperience.com and use the password REALVEGAS. Many of these coupons are only good for first time player's club signees, but if you're new to downtown, these could save you a few bucks! The GN casino is very nice (you definitely notice the difference between it and some of the other downtown properties) and we had fair luck. Didn't win anything huge, but were able to play a long time off a minimal amount of money (we mostly do penny slots). The only downside to our experience at the GN was a few housekeeping issues. After our room was cleaned the first day, they forgot to leave us clean towles. No biggie...we called the front desk and they delivered us two days' worth. The next day, however, we didn't get any houskeeping service at all! I suppose we could have called to complain, but we didn't bother. Again, not a HUGE deal (at least we had another days' worth of clean towels), but for a 4-star hotel, this is kind of a big oversight. Overall, though, we found the GN to be a great deal for the money we paid. I doubt we'd stay anywhere else in downtown Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer joy”
Reviews.Author: tetsie41
Reviews.Content: Total thumbs up to the Golden Nugget ...stayed there years ago before the remodel and it was nice..now its awesome..the shark pool and even the cheapest Carson rooms were beautiful..I am hoping someday to beable to stay in one of the spa rooms...i recommend the 4 star Golden Nugget to everyone who goes to Vegas..not stuffy and snooty like staying in the fancy places on the strip but just as nice...Downtown is much more relaxed and easy to access casinos..and if you gamble and drink..also cheaper and better odds!!

Reviews.Title: “The Pool was the highlight”
Reviews.Author: SchulzeM
Reviews.Content: The Fremont area of Las Vegas is a great place to stay and the Golden Nugget is clearly the best of the downtown places to stay. The rooms are adequate, the hotel is nice, but it's the pool that makes it all worth it. The waterslide through the shark tank was one of the highlights of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “RUSH TOWER GOLD SUITES - TOO NOISY”
Reviews.Author: tvlbug714
Reviews.Content: After having one of the worst hotel experiences ever, I decided to give the Nugget another shot. We booked the Rush Tower Gold suites, paying for the upgrade to a larger room. The room and renovations were fantastic and desperately needed, but the NOISE was unbearable. We had an 8th floor corner room, one window facing the Fremont Experience and the other above the pool. A constant boom-boom at the Fremont window until 11:30pm and very loud voices every night until 1:45am from the poolside window. I could hear laughter through my pillow. Then at 6am starts the neighboring shower noises...ugh..I had no sleep for 3 days. This tower was designed the same as Thehotel at Mandalay. The noise travels up the glass enabling conversations to be heard several floors up. If you don't sleep until 2am anyway, then this is the place for you. I know it's Vegas, but I have already "been there done that" when I was in my 20s. Also, Internet was 13.00/day. Overall, I would stay here again should my accommodations require a downtown location, otherwise I will be at the Vdara.

Reviews.Title: “OMG what a pit!”
Reviews.Author: Atomicpunk22
Reviews.Content: OK, this was up in the top worst hotel experiences EVER. My brother and I were traveling back from Grand Canyon (North Rim) where we were going on two days of no sleep, and just needed our two bed non-smoking room so we could crash for the night before heading home the following morning. Reservations were made months in advance, with a triple-check that we'd need a late check-in time. When we drove up to the hotel, it wasn't at all clear where to park. We pulled up to the valet area, who told us to drive around the the tower to the parking structure behind. When we pulled up to the garage, the fully tattoo'd attendant said we couldn't park in the garage until we had a room key. We had to park in the dirt parking lot down the street. We walked back to the Carson Tower check desk, and it was closed - signs said that we had to check-in at the Golden Tower desk. We worked our way through the smokey casino (I think there was a gang banger convention going on or something), and eventually found the Golden Tower check-in desk. The host banged away on the keyboard for several minutes before excusing herself to the back for another 10+ minutes. When she emerged, she advised that they no longer had any non-smoking two bed bedrooms. She could give us a non-smoking King with a roll-away Queen in the Golden Tower. Fine - we're exhausted. We get our key and head back to the car so we can move it to the parking garage. Tattoo man let's us in, and we find probably the last slot in the entire structure. We carry our luggage back to the Golden Tower and find our room (3rd Floor). We go in, and SURPRISE - someone is already in this room! Nice - we got a key that opens someone elses room - WOW, I really feel safe in this place now. OK, lug everything back down and hit the Golden Nugget front desk again - the angry host from earlier is now gone, so we get to deal with someone else who begins to argue with us why we want a freakin' refund, and we're moving on to a more reputable establishment. Took 30 minutes to process the refund. Ended up going to the Hilton Garden Inn in Henderson, and go the perfect hotel experience we deserved (and it was cheaper). I would NEVER EVER EVER stay in this hotel - and I would recommend anyone considering it to think twice. There's no way the positive reviews on this site are real - this hotel isn't professional enough to pull off that kind of good service.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower, best of Fremont Street and world class pool.”
Reviews.Author: chachachio
Reviews.Content: This was about my tenth trip to Vegas and I had always stayed on the strip, except for one other time when I stayed downtown at the Four Queens. The only reason for my staying downtown this trip was so I could be closer to a couple of social functions happening around Fremont Street. Liking the best I can afford, I booked the Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget. Rush Tower is the Nugget's newest addition and rivals the four star hotels on the Vegas strip. Coming from the airport, if you want to save on cab fare take the shuttle for $9. You will surely be last to arrive at the GN as it is the last stop. By cab, ask your driver to take Dean Martin to Industrial, Industrial to Wyoming St., Wyoming to Main and on to the Golden Nugget.. This route will save you three to four dollars. On with the review! Stepping throught the doors was impressive enough with the reservation desk being backed up to a huge aquarium with the Chart House bar sandwhiched between the desk and the tank. There were ten parties in front of me waiting for room keys since there was a power failure or some such thing. New keys were in the process of being made. Twenty minutes later, I was finished with the check-in process and on my way to room 21225 on the 21st floor. The room was spacious with a large seperate bathroom and water closet. There are two sinks and a back lit mirror, magnification make-up mirror and plenty of fresh white bath linens. The room was very clean. The window faced south where distant views of the Stratosphere and the strip, beyond could be seen. Looking below, I could see the drive up entrance to the Rush Tower and to the left the pool area. Since there were sufficient bath linens for five days, I opted to hang the "do not disturb" sign on the door knob. The flat screen TV was on a large wall unit with up lights on top. The closet was spacious with enough hangers for one person. The safe is in the wall unit, tucked behind one of the doors. Decor is in brown and orange tones, not my favorite color scheme but comtemporary and restful. A large brown sofa and tables filled the area between the bed and window. Be sure not to pick up the water bottles which are on the tray or you will be charged $4. I had to ask that the price be removed from my bill. Staff at Rush Tower is very friendly and helpful. My room keys stopped working and security had to come up to fix the situation. That and the long checkin were the only inconveniences. If swimming is important to you, the GN is the place to be. Their pool is on of the top ten in the world with its aquarium filled with shark and other large fish. It is quite beautiful after sundown with the accent lights all around. The restuarants are very good, the Chart House and Grotto, especially, are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: SuperTeacher2
Reviews.Content: After seeing the Golden Nugget's swimming pool highlighted on the Travel Channel, I decided that my 3 teen boys and I would stay a few nights at the Golden Nugget during our upcoming Vegas vacation. I must say that the only thing I regret about our stay there is that I only booked us for 2 nights! Our room was a jr. corner suite in the rush tower and it was absolutely wonderful. I was initially a bit hesitant to book the rush tower suite since they are only available with 1 king sized bed and there were 4 of us that would be sleeping in the room. However, the booking agent informed me that the jr. corner suites include a sectional type sofa that comfortably fits 2 people. And she was right! The only complaints that I heard from my boys during our entire stay at the Golden Nugget was that the line to get on the water slide was extremely long and the pool itself was really crowded. In fact, even though the pool opens at 10:00, people start lining up about 9:30 in order to snag a lounge chair. Despite those 2 minor things, our stay at the Golden Nugget was awesome! It'[s located right in the middle of Fremont Street, the staff is happy and helpful, the rooms are super clean, and there's a wide variety of places to shop and eat right inside the hotel. I will absolutely be returning to the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel to stay at with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: GNISAL
Reviews.Content: As per a recommendation from a friend, and the feedback from Tripadvisor, I decided to make my reservation through Expedia which was an easy process. Shortly after I decided to call them to make some special request on the room since I had my parents with me, and I was advised to pay an additional $ 25.00 for the VIP service, which I did, and that was the best thing I did because upon getting to the hotel, proceeded to the VIP lounge and was treated like a VIP by the staff there. The room that I was given was immaculately clean and it looked new despite the fact that it was in the old building. I was very impressed since I am a Hotel General Manager as well. Service was perfect. The only thing that puzzled me were the charges in the restaurant which put a hold on a larger amount from the receipt that I got cause apparently they put a 20% on top of what you pay for ( if paid in credit card ) which is normal in Las Vegas, but to sum it all up, this hotel made my vacation with my parents a truly wonderful, pleasant and comfortable one, and I will definitely come back to the hotel again, and would highly recommend them. GREAT WORK GUYS, THE STAFF AND THE HOTEL WAS AWESOME.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jmiranda
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice time at the Golden Nugget....Check in went fast, tried to upgrade to the Rush Tower but all sold out!!! But our room in the gold tower was really nice and very clean, and the beds were really comfortable!!! We bought chase lounges in the private pool for $20.00 a chair and that was so nice!! The regular pool was so packed!!! As for gambling I lost!! Loved Fremont street....during the day it is nice and cool and at night it lots of fun!!! My only complaint is that is so hot out in Vegas I just don't know how anybody could live there!!! It's like your sitting on the freakin sun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Round 2”
Reviews.Author: craiger702
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GN back in April for my first trip to LV and was very impressed. There were things I didn't do that I really should have. This time I went with some of the criticisms I have read in the back of my mind to see if they were really true. #1 and the biggest complaint I see on this site regarding this hotel is the check in process. I spoke with a hotel member and she said they know there is an issue and they are really trying hard to get that fixed. She did say it is an ongoing issue but they are really working on it. The one that really blew my mind was that somebody said the tub in the showers were very slippery and to be careful. Last trip I had no problem with the tub. This time I found that to be true. They do provide bath mats and you should use them. The only other problem with the shower/tub is it can be a very big step for an older person or someone with any leg or knee problems. The last thing I looked for that somebody complained about was that the food in the carson street cafe was not 4 star. For most people reading this I would hope that nobody other than the person who wrote that would guess that a cafe should have 4 star food and service. I ate there twice and the first time I was greeted promptly and the food was above average for what I expected. I especially liked the red onion soup (their version of French Onion) Very hot and well seasoned. The second time there I waited about 5 minutes after being sat before anyone coming to wait on me. I was there for soup and salad for an afternoon snack. A little dissapointing with the service but not terrible. The food was above average. As far as check in I can not comment because I am usually checked in when I arrive by my host. As in my previous review "IFYOU GAMBLE A DECENT AMOUNT (Not Huge). GET A PLAYERS CARD AND ASK TO MEET A CASINO HOST" This will be one of the best moves you will ever make. Now for this trips reviews. Check in very early or very late to avoid the lines. I will say this again and again and again. There is not ONE person in that building that is anything but extreemly helpful and curteous. They have the best staff in town or on the strip. I had a pit supervisor that remebered me by name without my players card and went out of his way to talk to me for a few minutes. The pool: One word packed.. Get over it Do what everybody else does and be a winner at the pool. Go down around 8:30 or 9:00 and bring or get a couple of towels and t shirts and stake you claim to your lounge chairs early. You can put your stuff there and feel pretty safe about it. That is why I say T shirts( crappy ones in case somebody does move them). Went to the pool 4 times for no more than 1 hour max. For me that was pleanty of time. Buffet: Good value for lunch at $11. Wasn't as pleased with weekend brunch for $19. Had dinner in April and thought is was a good deal for the $19.00. Did not try the Grotto that is on the agenda for next trip. I had great luck on the slots $1 primarily. Black jack was a killer this time. After my budget was up for the 5 days, I had an extra $18.00 in slot money back. So I took it and played .25 cent poker and 6 spins in hit a royal flush 1 hour before I had to leave so although I lost overall I finished on a $1000 hit. Best dinner in a long time: Vic and Anthonys. Can be pricy for some but this is all of 4 stars and then some. Biggest problem is portion size on their sides and salads. Buy a you own entree and split a side or two. If you go figure 100 PP for 2 drinks with salad, entree and side plus tip. WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY SPENT. John was my waiter and Edward his assistant. Never missed a beat. I left at 10 PM sunday night for a red eye back to the east coast. I got to the airport only to NOT find my month old blackberry. I made several calls to the receptionist at the rush tower ( who went beyond to help me find my phone. TO no avail. Called the casino host office and Virginia tried to find it. No luck when I arrived home I emailed my host and she said it was found and VIP serviecs had it they are sending to me. If that isn't customer service nothing is I will say this again as in my last review. Treat people the way you want to be treated. You are on vacation in a great city enjoy it and don't stress over small little things. Every time somebody ask how I am I say great. I get the same answer "really why?" My answer is because I got up today, I am healthy and I have a healthy family. There is so much bad in the world shed some positive energy. When you are on vacation have fun some people never have the opportunity that you do. Try living in a box or a shelter. Think about that next time you have to wait a few minutes for a meal or a table or a room. Have fun and enjoy your life it's the only one you have. Golden Nugget you have the greatest people working for you and they are one of your greatest assets. Keep up the great work. Thank you Jessica. Maria, and Virginia. You are what Customer service is all about. If there is someone in houskeeping I should know about please let me know CC

Reviews.Title: “As size and glitz goes up...courtesy and service goes down...”
Reviews.Author: ALANSC7
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the only "strip type" hotel downtown. It is large, classy, and upscale with a pool that is world ranked. We have stayed at the Nugget many times and expected our usual easy check in. We had made our reservation 2 months in advance but at our check-in (10:30 am) they were evidently overbooked. We had a very charming but incredibly new or incompetent desk clerk. As I watched the minutes tick away she continued to type and sigh. She finally called a supervisor over who typed and grunted. I pleasantly asked if anything was wrong and they smiled back a lot. The short version is that after a 20 minute wait watching them type they didn't have the room we reserved and put us in the "south" tower which is the oldest and an overland hike from the casino. I objected and asked if we might get any comps or considerations since we didn't want to stay in the south tower. What we were offered was the south tower standard price! They said we were saving money from our original reservation and I explained that we were saving money because we had booked a more expensive room! At this point it was about 40 minutes of debating at the counter and they succeeded in winning the smile down. The vapidly grinning clerk offered to call in the manager but I had to concede they'd won and just took our luggage and schlepped the miles to our room. When we finally got to our room our message light was blinking and I hurried to check it in the event that this was only a bad joke. However, it was an irritating message telling us how much they loved having us and wouldn't we just love to book a show! The Golden Nugget is getting a little too crowded now that they have added their fourth tower for a total of 2300 rooms! That being said, it's still a very cool place with a great casino. For the younger crowd they have a good variety of theme restaurants, bars, and a night club. For our over 50 crowd they have a good buffet and a lot of penny slots! At peak times it can be a little hard to navigate as the crowds can get pretty dense. It's location on Fremont Street is convenient to all of the other casinos and that's what I love about downtown. If your luck's run cold at one table or machine, another casino is but a few steps away. We spent two nights at the Golden Nugget and then I moved across the street to the Fremont Hotel & Casino while my wife flew back home. (Her Vegas Fun tolerance is a little lower than mine!)

Reviews.Title: “We will be checking in again for sure”
Reviews.Author: MissJasmine
Reviews.Content: Review, The Golden Nugget, Las Vegas. Excellent Spa Suite Stay. Date of Stay: 20th June for 3 nights. Having stayed on the strip many times, we decided on this occasion for a change,we would try down town. After studying many reviews on Trip Advisor, we chose the Golden Nugget and decided that we would go for a Spa Suite. What I would say at this stage is, if you can afford one, then go for it, they really are worth the extra. Check in was via their small VIP room which is situated just off reception. We arrived around 3pm and our suite was ready. The suite is set over 2 levels and has a winding staircase to the bedroom area. There is a huge whirlpool tub and a steam room/shower as well as a toilet upstairs and another downstairs. There are plenty of pictures of these suites available so I won’t waffle on too long about it other than to say, they did have a BOSE radio in the suite which was great. For one of our days, we rented a cabanna at the Hideout pool for $175 for the day, this was well worth the money. My husband played some poker and won a little and we played a little on the slots and ended up willing about $400 on the Star Trek machine. We ate all our breakfasts in the buffet, which was excellent and one of our dinners. We also ate at the Italian restaurant, we asked for a nice quiet romantic table and I think they thought it was our anniversary as we had a free desert to share and as we left we were wished happy anniversary, which was nice even though it wasn’t our anniversary. Freemont street was fantastic, we went out each evening and enjoyed the light show and the cheap bars and cheap shopping, Mikkie Finns at the end of the street is a great bar serving nice food and beer. Overall, we really enjoyed The Golden Nugget, the staff were friendly and helpful and the slots were nice and loose and of course our suite was fantastic. When we go back to Las Vegas, we will be checking into the Golden Nugget for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly recommend the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: caringkate03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights and loved it. We spent one night over at the Bellagio and would chose the Golden Nugget over the Bellagio. We upgraded to the new Rush Tower and it was beautiful. The rooms were so pretty and spacious. The bathroom was huge. We were in Vegas celebrating my husband's birthday and it was perfect. I ordered a cake ahead of time and they had it ready right when we checked in. Everything was clean. Room service food was fabulous- portions were huge and not overpriced. Poker room was nice. Machines weren't loose but you don't go expecting to win- although that would be nice. All staff members were great. We did not do the shark tank as it was always busy. We were okay with that though. This is where we will stay again when we go back to Vegas. Very highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget stay”
Reviews.Author: ShedneyS
Reviews.Content: magnificent pool with tank of fish and sharks...hotel rooms are very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Best pool, great location on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: kelesp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our 3rd nigt of a 3 night stay. The oter 2 nights were at teh Paris and the Golden Nugget was a step up in many ways. The pool is the very best. The room was clean and even though it is in the older part, still very nice. The A/C had a hard time competing with the 110+temps, but it did stay cool enough. THe buffet isn't as goo as I remember frmo years ago, but it was suitable - tehre was nothing to complain about with the food and their buffet is far less expensive than those on the strip. Fremont Street is amazing and the Golden Nugget is in the niddle of it all. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on Fremont Street”
Reviews.Author: herebedragons
Reviews.Content: We had a Gold Club Luxury Room which was excellent. The hotel has been refurbished not so long ago so everything is in good condition. Particularly liked the flat screen tv set into the bathroom mirror! We looked right over the Fremont Experience which was quite noisy. On the other hand, it was great to be able to walk out of the hotel and be right there to see it! Had a room service meal the first evening which arrived quickly, everything hot and beautifully presented, good glass of house cabernet. Water slide through the shark tank is great fun but usually going too fast to see the sharks! Good pool area with shade. Although we didn't suffer, noticed horrendous queues at check-in a few times in passing.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, could be worse”
Reviews.Author: blkjck5697
Reviews.Content: There were many things that I enjoyed about staying here. When in Las Vegas, I prefer now to stay downtown, as I don't like the long walks between different places on the Strip. Of the places I have stayed at downtown, one has closed (Lady Luck), one was a dump the time I stayed there (Four Queens), and now the Nugget. The good: We were assigned a room in the Carson Tower. The room we had was well equipped, clean, and the beds comfortable. The valet parking service was very convenient (and free), especially when the temperature is over 100. The casino workers were relatively friendly, and the casino itself has a very classic look. This is a major step up from what Binion's has turned itself into (with the trashy looking blackjack dealers), or the low class casinos like the Las Vegas Club or Golden Gate. A friend who was traveling with us stayed in his own room, and was upgraded to the Rush Tower when he checked in on Sunday thanks to his Landry Select Club Membership. That was a gorgeous suite. The downsides: I myself got the Landry membership, but don't think I got upgraded. While that may have been due to the fact that we didn't check in until just before midnight on a Saturday, either no upgrades were available for a two bed suite, or the hotel clerk didn't know what to do with the Landry Club. After a long day of travel, we just checked in. Not that there was anything wrong with the room we received, but just thought they would have done better for us. Foodwise, we were disappointed with the choices we made there. We tried the lunch buffet, and I've had better. Very limited selection and not the greatest of food. Our Landry Club membership required a payment of $25, but that is refunded to you when you eat at a Landry restaurant. I also got $25 added to the card because of my birthday, so we went to eat at Red Sushi in the hotel. Even though the card's website listed Red Sushi as a participant, they wouldn't honour our card because Red Sushi was not one of the restaurants on the back of our card. They said we should have went to Grotto or Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse. For the room rate we got, $40/night from Sunday to Wednesday, great deal. Otherwise, I will go offsite to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointing!!”
Reviews.Author: feranelli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nugget for 6 days and found the service adequate, but nothing special. The restaurants were pricey, the rooms nice and clean and cool, the pool overcrowded. You could never get a chair at the pool unless you were there the minute it opened. We booked a Cabana on the 3rd level for the whole day - 10am - 2am., upon arriving at 11:00am and staying about 25 minutes we were informed that the pool was closing for a private function and all the Cabanas were booked so we would have to leave. We immediately canceled our Cabana and requested a full refund. This was very poor repesentation on their part, failing to give any notice. There was also a charge for the internet. You would thnink that a 5 star hotel could provide free internet!! The housekeeping staff were freindly, but the security at the pool left alot to be desired with a grumpy attitude and poor people skills, I would reccommend a different line of work maybe. We will not be staying at the GN again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JoTav21
Reviews.Content: We always stay here because It's more like the Vegas we knew and love. I don't like the strip anymore. This hotel is beautiful, clean, & friendly. You can walk from A to B without being worn out. Lots of fun and free entertainment on Fremont Street. The pool is wonderful and the rates are great. I wouldn't want to stay on the strip if the rooms were free, I have been going to Vegas for many many years and sometimes twice a year. I liked the way it used to be and I like to play with tokens. I am from the old school but it used to be a lot more fun.

Reviews.Title: “This place is appalling, I will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: butterscotchhair
Reviews.Content: I don't expect much from a Las Vegas hotel on Fremont Street, just a clean room and the basics but Golden Nugget was just awful on this last stay. We have stayed there years ago (before the huge remodel) and back then we enjoyed it but this place has forgotten all of the ideals that make people return to Las Vegas. For starters, for 2 of the 3 nights we stayed there, there was no parking available in the ramp for us. I have never in my life heard of a hotel that denied it's guests use of the parking garage! They put us in a remote lot 2 blocks away which was a huge inconvenience. If you going to increase the size of your hotel by adding several hundred rooms here is a tip- Add more parking!!! In addition to that, upon our arrival the registration desk for our tower was closed so we had to drag all of our luggage from the remote parking lot- to the other registration desk which had a wait time of about 30 minutes only to drag it all the way back to the tower we knew we were staying in. Those were the big inconveniences but we had several more complaints.They wanted $2 per cup for the low-quality coffee self-service in the rooms. How about a decent brand name if you want people to pay for coffee in their rooms? I won't even begin to get into how they apparently offer the same size small uniform to the girls working at the pool regardless of their size- the poor girls- give them a size that fits! The elevators were terribly slow and sounded like they were about to break down at any moment. Golden Nugget should have kept the tacky old decor since the remodel apparently sucked all of the quality service out of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget. We were pleased with the rooms, especially considering that this is an older hotel. You wouldn't know it from the rooms, and we stayed in the older tower (the other one has been relatively newly renovated). The Golden Nugget is not on the strip, but on Fremont Street. It was cool to see the Fremont Street Experience. We just drove to the strip, because you can park for free at most of the casinos/hotels along the strip. One of the main reasons we stayed here was because of the shark tank in the pool. According to several online sources, it is one of the top 10 hotel pools in the world. We thought the shark tank was pretty awesome. There are several varieties of sharks in the tank, and the waterslide that goes right through the middle of the tank. Would definitely recommend if you have kids or if you just like sea life like us. We didn't come to gamble, but to see the sights, and we thought this was a good value for the price, a pretty good location in relation to everything (if you have a car), and a neat unique experience at the pool. One of the negatives was the incredibly long line to check in and check out. It took at least 45 minutes each time. It would have been nice to have free wi-fi too...we went down the street to Krispy Kreme to use their free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: alley22
Reviews.Content: We received a very generous free upgrade, so I cannot review a 'regular' room. I can report that the staff was uniformly friendly and professional, and that the hotel facilities are well-maintained. Public areas were notably clean. One-of-a-kind pool is a great attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Beat for Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: GABoy63
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how nice the rooms are here given the age of the resort. Our room had an excellent decor, the king bed was superbly comfortable, nice heavy wooden furniture, a flat screen television, double bathroom sinks, very cold A/C, and nice soft colorful carpeting. The slots here, like most of the other downtown casinos, are more lucrative. The staff was always well at tentative. The buffet was the best I've had in Vegas. All hotel guests receive a coupon book. The book contains several specials including 2 for 1 buffets, free well drinks, free slot plays, and many discounts. Valet parking is free for quests also, however, there is a garage located just across the street. Quest park here free also.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Rush Tower July 3rd-8th”
Reviews.Author: airman1937
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Golden Nugget. Last year we stayed in a Gold Club room. This year we stayed in the new Rush Tower. We arrived Saturday at 2 o'clock to an empty check in counter and were warmly greeted and helped by JP. The check in area and elevators are off the beaten path so it was always less crowed and a quiet area. We stayed in room 8220 looking out over the parking deck and the far off strip. It was not a great view but staying downtown we understood there are not a lot of great views although last year we overlooked the pool which was nice.. The room was very similar to the the Gold Club room in color, decorations and furniture but with a much larger bathroom with a separate water closest. We did miss a TV in there the Gold Club bathroom had a tv in the mirror and very cool. The reports of the slippery bathtub are very true but there was a rubber mat that I suggest everyone use. We did that the second day and there after so really not a problem. The only issue for us that was mentioned in other post to was the lack of electrical outlets near the bed if anyone else has a CPAP machine.
