I had to pull out the night stand and unplug the clock no big deal since we really didn't use the clock or the built in Ipod player but an extra outlet or adapter would have been nice. I know we could have called and possibly got an extension cord or something. The room overall was comfortable, very clean and as quiet as any hotel room can be except for the occasional slam of a door or loud people talking as they walked down the hall past our room. Maid service was preformed efficiently everyday with plenty of towels and toiletries. Golden Nuggets staff was always pleasant, very helpful and they would stop and talk a minute with you. Casino has a good vibe with very good cocktail service. We play video poker and the selection was not great but 21 and craps tables were great fun. Did not eat at any of the on site restaurants this year but heard good things from other folks. Pool is great but yes crowded with kids so we skipped this year no big deal for us. The one thing we noticed at most casinos was the kids this year hanging out, Serveral youngsters were helping their father play video pokier in the Golden Nugget Casino, what a shame and where was security. Overall our second visit was a very pleasant experience again. In the future if we stay downtown we would definitely chose the Golden Nugget but probably stay in the Gold Club room and pass on the Rush Tower unless the prices were crazy between the too..

Reviews.Title: “Las Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: onered66
Reviews.Content: Decent property with good service and selection in dining. Stay away during the summer months if you dont have children, I thought I had got on the wrong plane and ended up in Disneyland, what do people do with their kids in Vegas, teach them how to gamble? The pool was PACKED with families with kids, never went near it. The Rush tower is very nice with contemporary decor. The Steakhouse was good but doesnt warrant a #2 rating for Vegas, Ive had better steaks elsewhere, the Sea Bass was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The good, Bad and Whoa...........”
Reviews.Author: bakodon
Reviews.Content: The good, bad and whoa........................ We stayed at the Las Vegas Golden Nugget with family (including two teenagers) over the long 4th of July weekend. Overall I can only muster three stars. Hotel- five stars, very clean and great staff. Room was better than expected. Very nice and all they promised. VIP, Valet Parking, etc all very nice and attuned to your needs. Casino was very nice. Excellent staff. The negative. The hotel entertained a very large party Friday night and closed the pool for the afternoon and evening with no notice! The noise was too load and too long The pool has turned into a party pool for the young. We met our grandchildren and expected to stay in by the pool all day Saturday. HaHaHa - absolutely no room and very rambunctious young crowd doing a lot of drinking. This continued through Sunday and Monday. The adult pool was “sold out” all the time we were there. Management could have cared less. Food - TWO STARS. GN needs to wake up and smell the coffee real soon. Ate at the buffet and wow. They moved it upstairs and the food is medicare at best. Looks like the Landry Family is using real restaurant control to run the buffet and other restaurants. Selection was half what it was downstairs. So called Prime Rib was a dried out old piece of beef, tough and no flavor. Food was warm, not hot for both dinner and breakfast. The same for the Carson Street Café. Cut the menu in half and took away all the good stuff to foods for the masses. No more bowl of wanton, no more shrimp-crab Louie, etc. And the staff could care less if you have a VIP line pass or not and the service is not on par with the Carson Street Café I remember. Long waits between seating, ordering and getting your food. And they were not busy. Go figure. We also dined at Vic and Anthony’s A little high for what you get but the food and service was great. Would I return? Probably not. Other hotels have the same deals with better amenities, especially the pools and better dining experiences. (MGM, Mandalay Bay, and others).

Reviews.Title: “Seen Better Days”
Reviews.Author: Rebus9
Reviews.Content: There are three or four different towers. We stayed in the Gold Tower, which I would guess was built in the 60s. Whenever it was, it's seen better days. Several annoying things beside the decor, lighting, etc. of the room were bad. For example: they put kind sized pillows into standard pillow cases; the toilet is way over-pressurized and makes a loud noise, had to call for towel replacement even though they said they change it twice a day, etc. Also, you have to decide whether you want to be downturn near the old Vegas or on the Strip were the newer places are. There are some wonderful places there, there's a glut in the city of rooms, and while I didn't compare prices, I imagine you can get a much better place on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again...A fantastic Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: tonyw1uk
Reviews.Content: Second time here in 8 months from Birmingham UK. Brilliant value, great hotel, sevice 1st class, pool fabulous. We enjoyed being on Freemont Street away from the madness of the strip which is only a 20 min Duece ride away. This hotel is the best value around and is recommended for couples especially. The buffet is great and the pool is a very nice place to relax....if you get there early enough to bag a lounger...before 10 am is ok. We will return in a few months and definately go back to the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: sweetdi60
Reviews.Content: my better half took me to Las Vegas for my birthday. we stayed at the Golden Nugget and it was a great experience. everything was perfect, from check in to check out. impeccable service and the restaurants were fabulous. only one thing wasnt perfect and that was the buffet, we went on a sunday and for two people it was $43.00 and the food looked like it was standing out a long time. all in all the Golden Nugget was great.

Reviews.Title: “Dont ever stay here, unless you enjoy the garbage treatment!”
Reviews.Author: Pima_Travels
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to book the Golden nugget because of their incredible pool. Very bad idea, the pool is beautiful assuming you get a a chair and a space to lounge in the pool. It's so small you cant even swim 2 feet without bumping into someone. The wait for the slide was killer. They should really consider putting in a canopy instead of letting their guests sizzle in the 100 degree heat, while waiting to ride a 30 second slide. Check in was terrible they wanted to put us in a smoking room having paid the full hotel rate. That was insane. I had to fight with the front desk for 20 minutes finally they magically had something available. This is a very nice hotel, unfortunately the customer service deserves and "F".

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Experience!”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNoel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rush Tower and it was a very nice room. Check-in was quick and the staff was very nice. The pool was awesome! The kids really enjoyed the shark tank and the slide. It was really packed, so it was hard to move around sometimes, and of course it seemed like everyone was drinking and smoking (but this is Vegas!) You can step right out of the hotel and enjoy the Fremont Street, which was fun! We had a great stay and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The clear choice for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: No trip to Vegas is complete without a visit downtown to the Fremont Street Experience. We've stayed at a few hotels down there before and this time finally ended up at the Nugget. The room was well appointed, renovated and stylish. The bathroom was modern with a tub and again worked well. LCD TV and decent quality clock radio completes the package. We stayed in the Carson St Tower and the lifts were quick with minimal waits. I would recommend this hotel to others. However I do have to agree with a previous reviewer on 2 points. 1) Check In. There was only 3 people in front of us and 4 staff doing check in and it still took 30mins, maybe they have slow or not so user friendly system. 2) The pool hours were odd, given it was summer, maybe they could open earlier to better spread the crowd. Still, both of these are not show stoppers, but minor issues made up for by the hotel and room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jen_white_21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap ($60) and the rooms were super clean and beds were VERY comfortable!!! Check in process was very long got there about 3:30pm and we waited in line for well over an hour. Besides check-in thats the only bad thing I can say. Fremont St. was right outside the door. Hotel service was better than the other hotels on the strip. Pool area is alittle small but loved it!! Overall we loved this hotel and the location was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Remodel!”
Reviews.Author: blmunn
Reviews.Content: Went to GN for my husbands 60th birthday - 8 of us- we had a great experience. Our rooms in the gold tower were very large, He and I had the VIP floor for 99.00 includes entrance to gym and spa, nice as well. The pool was crowded with lots of families, but you could rent cabana's up above to get away from mainstream if you want, also another pool area you can pay a fee for. Shark tank is pretty amazing. Great fun walking along fremont street with all the activity...so for a group it was better than the strip. See Gordie Brown while you are there...a super great show REALLY and reasonable price, we laughed our butts off. The group went to the Las Vegas Speedway and drove exotic cars- exoticracing.com a great experience, my husband is still smiling from driving the ferrari!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget!!!”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN for 3 nights (6/25-6/28) and absolutely enjoyed our stay. This is my third time staying here and it gets better each time. We’ve been to Vegas at least a dozen times so now when we go our focus is more on the gambling and shopping, than seeing the strip. So we choose to stay downtown because 1) the slots are looser, 2) the table game minimums are lower and 3) it’s easy to casino hop since you don’t have to walk for miles. The Golden Nugget is the nicest of all the downtown hotels. We stayed in the Carson tower, which is the oldest of the towers, but our room was clean, spacious, and nicely updated. We stayed in room #1276, a corner room very close to the elevators. It had a king-size bed, a small table with 2 chairs, a make-up desk with lighted mirror, and a big lcd tv. I wish the room had a coffee-maker and refrigerator, but thank goodness there is a starbucks at the bottom of the Carson tower so we’d stop by every morning to start our day. The shark pool is gorgeous (and crowded) but sadly we did not find time to stop by. Check-in and check-out was quick. We checked-in around 6pm on Friday night and there were about 6 people in line. Suprisingly, it only took about 20 minutes. For check-out, we tried using the express checkout on the tv but it wasn’t working. I called the front desk and explained that the express checkout wasn’t working and she checked me out over the phone. The GN casino had a great vibe and the now that the rush tower construction is finished, the casino floor is lot a bigger. I really enjoyed playing their Wizard of Oz and Monopoly penny machines. We also spent a lot of time at the Fremont where I won a few small hits on slots and one good hit on Keno. That’s what we love about staying downtown is that if you’re not feeling lucky at one casino, you can always walk to the next one. Overall, we had a great stay at the GN and it will be our first choice from now on. If you’re looking for the ultimate in luxury, than this is not the hotel for you…you should stay at the wynn, bellagio, or Venetian. If you’re looking for a great value at a reasonable price and still get nicely appointed rooms and amenities, than the Golden Nugget is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the complainers - This place is terrific !”
Reviews.Author: Trekkie_Nerd
Reviews.Content: Book it through the hotels' own web site to guarantee the reservation, not third party travel sites. We stayed for $39 (Mon.-Thu nights) with a 22nd floor room in the Carson Tower. It's quieter than the rooms right on Fremont Street. Pay a one-time $25 for VIP check-in (no buffet waiting is one perk). Carson Tower rooms have everything you need, except a coffee maker (like that REALLY matters?). Why spend hundreds at some over-rated Strip location? The Tank is the hotels' social hub (free for hotel guests). You must try the water slide right THROUGH the shark tank (in a clear tube). It was a great place for fresh air, refreshing swimming, and comfy beach chairs. The sports book was small, but nice. I even won some money on some World Cup soccer bets (slots quickly bore me). Being right beside Fremont street is amazing (free nightly shows, the 12 million light video shows on the dome and rock concerts are awesome. Basic shopping needs are all on Fremont or within a block (not as far to walk unlike the Strip). If the Strip beckons, buy a $7 (24-hour unlimited usage) pass for the Deuce bus. Way cheaper than a cab. The hotel internet isn't free, but the Krispy Kreme on Fremont has it. The fitness centre costs $20, so we used it just one day (in the morning for cardio and after dinner for strength training) and great saunas. The wet sauna is bliss. You can always go to the Tank pool for free swimming. We've stayed at the Nugget before and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Week of Golden Nugget HELL”
Reviews.Author: Cygnus_10
Reviews.Content: We got there with plenty of time for lunch and shower before meetings started. Five, That's 5 people at check in behind counter. 3 people in line to check in. We waited over an hour in line at check in. No lunch, no shower and were late for meeting. I paid up front for internet all 4 days. Only got 1 day and had to fight with them every day over it, after waiting in short lines that take all day. Pool closes so early never was able to use it. Had to call to get bed changed and towels everyday. I'll leave it at that. Golden Nugget is the hotel from HELL!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from our girls weekend in...”
Reviews.Author: tblair09
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our girls weekend in Vegas and loved our accomodations at the Golden Nugget Rush Tower. Older on the outside but gorgeous on the inside and amazing rooms. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the bathrooms have a zen like quality. The only downside to the room was there are NO blowdryers and NO refrigerators unless needed for medicinal reasons. Other than, highly recommend it. Great dining, great pool, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “GN is a true gold”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers55129
Reviews.Content: My son and I go to Las Vegas every year. Typically we stay on the strip, the rates at the Golden Nugget were very competitive and the reviews were all fantastic. Our trip was so great, I wanted to share how pleased we were with our stay. I'm torn between how much detail to share - as other reviewers give a minute by minute account of their vacation. So I'll just say this - the GN represents an older time in Vegas - great service and value. Value doesn't mean cheap - I've stayed on the strip and and have paid more for the room and food - I'm referring to true value. It appears the staff at the Golden Nugget are the only ones that realize we have choices as Vegas visitors and at every turn my expectations were exceeded. The food was great (coffee shop, Chart House, Vic and Anthony's). The room was fine - basic Gold Tower room - but it was newly furnished. We wanted to make it to the pool, but didn't. It's as nice as you'll find in Vegas. A final point - I rent a car in LV because cab fare adds up quickly if you casino hop (Hard Rock to Rio to Mandalay Bay etc). However, we did not use our car for one solid day of our short trip because downtown and the Golden Nugget met all of our needs - extraordinarily so. This includes the nightlife. By the way, as low stakes but persistent gamblers, the table minimums downtown are lower than on the strip. The GN will raise their minimums to $10 in the evenings - but lower them again after the peak periods. If you want try your luck at different casinos, they are just a short walk away. On the strip, it can be a mile walk from one front door to the next closest casino. Stay downtown and stay at the GN.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to an Old Friend”
Reviews.Author: MUTiger1997
Reviews.Content: As a 'Private Arrangements' member I used to stay at the GN a lot. For whatever reason I had gotten out of that habit, so it had been quite a few years since my last visit. With the opening of the Rush Tower, this seemed to be a good time for a return a visit. I checked in very quickly on the Monday evening I arrived. I was assigned a room on the 15th floor of the Rush Tower. The room was great! Nice size, flat screen tv, dvd player, a clock radio you didn't need a degree in engineering to set, comfortable bed, and large bathroom area. My only complaint would be that in facing Fremont St, it was very noisy each night until past midnight. I got up early each day to go golfing so a quieter room would have been of great benefit. I'd love to stay in the Rush Tower again, but only if I could get a room on the other side of the hall. I tried the buffet one night and would have to say I was underwhelmed. For a property this size I was expecting a much better selectin. The food available was ok, but given how great everything else was at the GN, the buffet was a disappointment. I also ate at the Carson St. Cafe and had a very good breakfast. Returning to the GN was a good decision. It was nice to be reminded how much I liked the property, as well as the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Carson Tower Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: spokanetraveller
Reviews.Content: With all the hype about the Rush Tower, I was hesitant to book a room in the older part of the hotel. I have been in old worn out rooms before. But we were not planning to spend too much time in the room so booked the lowest priced room. Far from being worn out, the room was in excellent condition. It was large, had a big screen TV (the content was regular cable TV not HD), and and was immaculately maintained. In Europe, this would be a $300 per night room. Parking was complementary for guests (had to show a parking permit when leaving the lot). The nice thing about this location is that low priced meals are available nearby in the California and Main Street Station. The best gambling odds around are available in the downtown casinos. There are a number of panhandlers wandering around if you beyond the end of Freemont Street, but there are enough people around that you don't feel unsafe. There aren't high priced boutiques like in City Center/Aria, but who needs them. This is an excellent value and an awesome room. The buffet is reasonably priced on weekdays. On weekends, go to the Carson Street Cafe in the casino, Main St. Station or the California.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a fantastic place if they'd address some issues”
Reviews.Author: delily
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about this hotel and would probably not stay there again. My friends and I stayed in Carson Tower which are the older rooms but they were, nevertheless, very nice--pretty, clean and updated. The beds were extremely comfortable and I usually hate hotel beds. Our only complaint about the room is that there was no coffee pot and it's inconvenient to have to get dressed and go downstairs to buy coffee from Starbucks. The rest of the hotel is beautiful. We had one meal in the cafe that was good, reasonably priced and with good service. The staff that I dealt with were pleasant and helpful. The hotel is downtown, not on the strip, but it was easy enough to take the bus to the strip and having the bus ticket also allowed us to hop on and off the bus to visit the various strip hotels which are much farther apart than you might expect. All in all, if we were coming to the Golden Nugget only to play penny, nickel and quarter slot machines, this is probably a great place to stay since the strip hotels seem to have few of these machines. The problems we encountered however, outweighed the positives. We had done our research prior to our trip. Several hotels would have met our needs. But we chose the Golden Nugget because of the pool. The shark tank in the center was beautiful. We also liked that there was an adults-only pool. And we were intrigued by the water slide. None of us "old folks" had ever been on a water slide before and we'd decided that we were all going to go down it at least once. The day we arrived we were very tired and decided to hit the pool and hot tub to relax before dinner. Unlike other hotels we saw, The Golden Nugget has no sign at the door saying that you need a room key to swim. No one ever asked us for a room key during our entire trip although I was later told by an employee that someone is supposed to ask for it. When we arrived at the pool that first evening it was crowded with kids and we wondered if local families used it since no one was checking. We decided to bypass the crowd and we went upstairs to the adults-only pool which is small and shallow but very nice. Two days later when we came back from a day of sightseeing, we were anxious to visit the pool. Unfortunately, someone, probably one of the small children, had had "an accident" in the main pool and they'd had to shut it down for cleaning. It wasn't scheduled to reopen until the next day. Again we went to the small adults-only pool, however, we found kids splashing around there! About the time we were getting ready to get out and complain to a manager, the bartender came over and told the kids to leave. Their mother started arguing with him and said someone downstairs had given them permission to swim there. The bartender was polite but still insisted they leave. We were very appreciative. Unfortunately, there is no hot tub in the adults-only area. The hot tub is on the first level and open to everyone. On our first night there, we got in but almost immediately found that it wasn't a pleasant experience because there were so many kids jumping around playing games and even trying to swim in it. A sign says that kids need to be with an adult but they weren't. The sign also says it's recommended that kids stay in for 10 minutes only, due to health concerns I suppose, but these kids were there for the long haul. We never did visit the hot tub after the first night because every time we looked, no matter how late at night, kids were in it playing games and even tossing beach balls around. I expect a hot tub to be relaxing place to soak. At the Golden Nugget I found no opportunity to do that in 5 days. We never tried out the water slide either because the constant line of pushing and shoving children was more than we wanted to deal with. We never swam in the main pool with the shark tank. I understand why the Golden Nugget wants to make itself appealing to families. But I felt that this hotel catered to families with children at my expense. My friends and I were on an adult vacation. But we found little space the entire week to just relax with a drink in the water. If the Golden Nugget wants to be a family hotel that's fine, but they shouldn't be advertising themselves as a "romantic getaway." Any newlywed couple would have been as disappointed as we were. We were particularly annoyed since there really is an easy solution to the problem if the management cared to address it. All the hotel would have to do is establish "adult hours" after 8 p.m. when the main pool closes anyway. We found it strange that the pool would close at 8 p.m. and disappointing, since we like to come back after a show for a midnight swim and it would have been nice to do so around the beautiful shark tank. Since the kids already can't swim after 8, why not just make all of the pool area adults-only from 8 until 2? That, at least, would give adults a chance to enjoy the hot tub which is now filled with kids all day and especially after 8:00 when the pool closes.

Reviews.Title: “Begining a little bumpy at the Rush tower but improved.”
Reviews.Author: barbiep1199
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 2:30 pm and the check in was a little slow. Only one person on the desk but after a 15 minute wait they added another person. If you are using a debit card to check in they hold $100.00 per night on your card. Was not told this at the desk and did not find out until we withdrew some money later that night. Went to the front desk and complained and they took the hold off. I have stayed in many hotels in casinos and out and never had a hold this large on any card. After that it got a lot better. The room was very nice and comfortable. Down comforter and pillows, big screen TV. The bathroom was nice and the shower pressure good. Maid service was good and the staff very friendly. The pool area was small and very crowded. Packed in like sardines. Went one day. First time we stayed on Fremont Street and we enjoyed it even though some of the casino were seedy. The Golden Gate was very dumpy but it was a good time and we were lucky in there. It was not a 2 mile walk between casinos like on the strip. We went to the strip one day and we did not miss that walking. It took 20 minutes to get from the Belaggio to the new Aria due to construction and a mall. Would recommend the Golden Nugget Rush Tower and woud stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Sucked!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdgirl2319
Reviews.Content: This weekend I went to stay at the Golden Nugget and went by the reviews, thinking it was something worthwhile. First of all it was far from the strip. We get there and are directed to the wrong area to get to our room, the hotel empolyees are not familiar with how to get to the appropriate room. We get to the room and there is smoke smell all over the room, we were wondering why we did not get a non smoking room, after the front ,check- in-lady, confirmed that we arranged for non-smoking room. We call the front desk and they apologized for sending us to the smoking area. Then they send a gentleman whom helped take our stuff two floors up and the room was so far from the elevator, seemed like we were never going to get there. We call and speak to the hotel manager and he hooked it up with free buffett tickets, which we picked up the last day of our stay. The check out lady was so rude when we explained our situation with the buffet tickets, the lady at the front desk was so rude, trying to talk over me when I was trying to explain to her our situation. When she finally spoke to somebody her attitude was somewhat different. So we get to the buffet, but the food was not that great, it was very dry and was only able to eat one plate of food. oh it gets better..... We go to the pool to chill out and gamble, the security asks us for our hotel key but we left it in the room because we had checked out, Besides we were just going to gamble which did not require a hotel key to get in the pool area. So my friend leaves to get money out of the ATM machine so we wait at one of the poolside chairs. As I'm laying down, waiting for my friend to arrive the security guard makes a scene in front of everyone and tells us we have to leave and escorts us out, treating us like we committed some kind of crime, even the dealers at the tables made commets to the security guard. It was unbelieveable, the treatment that we got, I have never been so humiliated in my life. I called to put in a complaint the following day and still have not heard back from them. UNBELIEVABLE EXPERIENCE!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best I have stayed at in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gr8roper
Reviews.Content: I got to the Rush Tower early since my flight came in early. I got there at 12 noon and had reserved a junior suite and it was not ready yet. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. This gave me time to sit at the fish tank and have a cocktail which I really enjoyed. The staff at the front desk let me know immediately when my room was ready. I was really impressed with the junior suite. This will be the only place I will stay in Vegas from now on and I have stayed at other hotels in Vegas before.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Place to Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: carlsbadca
Reviews.Content: We stayed downtown for the first time at the Golden Nugget and thoroughly enjoyed it. It's NOT The Strip - and that's the point. It's not fancy, but it's good. We stayed in the older room tower simply because we got a great price, although I've heard raves about the new Rush Tower. We ate at the Italian restaurant, Vic & Anthony's steak, and the coffee shop and everything was good. The Chart House bar is awesome. All staff we encountered were terrific. The pool is fun! with the shark tank in the center of the circular pool, and the slide through the shark tank. Private adult cabanas and a private adult pool are available for additional cost, of course. The casino was fine. This is not Paris Hilton's Las Vegas, but it's good. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is the best deal in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bignastysr
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is on Fremont Street i.e. “The old strip.” The Old Strip is not as crowded or expensive as The Strip but is still Las Vegas. If you are looking for the super glitz and glamour you should stay on the strip. If you like smaller crowds and real people try Fremont Street. The Old Strip tends to clear out around 1:00 during the week. The New Strip is about a $20.00 cab ride away from the Golden Nugget. I stayed at the Golden Nugget twice in May. Both times we stayed in the cheaper Carson Tower, which is about a three minute walk away from Fremont Street but close to the pool and Carson Street Café. The Golden Nugget casino floor is about a two minute walk from the Carson tower. The hotel check-in lines were way to long both times. I stranded in line about 25 minutes before check-in both times. Other than that I had a great time. The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable. The pool is cool for kids and there is also a separate adults only pool. I will continue to stay at the Golden Nugget on future Las Vegas trips.

Reviews.Title: “Little oasis away from the buzz of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia103
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. We booked with the Golden Nuggest without knowing much about the location. However, we were very happy that we were staying at the Golden Nuggest. It allowed us to have a combination of crazy strip and more relaxed downtown. Downtown has a lot to offer... fairmont experience, shopping, live concerts at local bars and overall cheaper prices on food, drinks and little items you may want to take home. It is also very close to the Premium outlets with all the brand names. We had 3 shows booked on the strip and took taxis over (about $25 each way), we also took one day to explore the strip by foot and used the express bus. Otherwise we chilled at the golden nugget, had great meals at their steak house, and took free gambling lessons. From the shows, we saw Zumanity and it was awesome. There is plenty of nudity and it was very entertaining. We slept through O but we booked it on our first night so I think we were tired. At the end of the day, my advice is to know what you want. If you are going to PARTY HARD, go to the strip. New York New York would be a great place to stay for you. But if you want slightly more relaxed atmosphere or a hotel that doesn't feel like a busy train station, Golden Nugget is great. This way you can have the best of both worlds. If you are looking for a pure romance, Venetian would offer plenty of it. One thing is for sure, Las Vegas is the best place to spend money, just make sure you know what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy, Crappy, Crappy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina8D
Reviews.Content: I have never been one to feel strongly enough about a business, whether good or bad, to write a review. However, after this weekend, I must... I must because I feel deceived and I'm angry. After extensive research and reading so many reviews, I decided to book the Golden Nuggets Hotel for a girls' weekend - it boasted as a 4-star hotel with great amenities, a shark tank pool, and awesome reviews by users. It ranked within the top 15% of hotels in all of Las Vegas according to trip advisor (higher than that of MGM, TI, etc. on the strip). I thought I had a pretty safe bet; what could possibly go wrong??? Let me tell you what went wrong... (1) THE ROOM: - The room was small and had the smell of "old" because everything was old - from the carpet, linens, towels, to the furniture. - The beds were much smaller than other 4-star hotels - thank goodness we are not curvy bodacious babes! - Our sink clogged up - we called maintenance and no one came... - There was a flat screen TV, but the remote didn't work half the time - don't even bother calling maintenance cuz they'll come up and step all over your stuff. - The knob below the shower faucet fell off. - No refrigerator - The lighting was very dim... maybe all the electricity were used to light the outside of the hotel. - Lastly, our room was about a mile away from the elevator. - Overall: This aint nothing more than a 2-star room. (2) THE SERVICE: The front desk and parking attendants were very nice. Everybody else sucked!!! They all wanted their turn to snap at us. The lady guarding the pool was especially rude and mean. Maintenance never came up to fix our broken sink; they did come up one time to fix a broken remote, and she was grumpy and stepped all over our stuff. (3) THE POOL AND RESTAURANT: The pool had a shark tank and slide... it was just ok nice. Great hang out for families with little kids - not so much for adults unless you want to get splashed all the time by the little rugrats - not their fault, i'd do the same if i was 9 years old :) I ordered chicken dumpling soup from the hotel cafe, I got canned chicken... food quality would be something you get in a cafeteria or denny's... how is this 4-star??? So that's my experience at the Golden Nugget - VERY VERY SUPER DISAPPOINTED!!! It's not even comprable to the 4-star on the strip. Let's make it clear, this may be the best hotel in Fremont, but that doesn't say much at all - waaaaay below vegas standards. That begs the question: why all the rave reviews???

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: woodallmia
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not on the strip we really enjoy staying here. The first time my husband and I stayed here ( in Januray) we really liked it. Both pools were warm enough to swim in January. The Happy Hour at the bar has some great pizza too. The staff was great. We took our son in April here and it was great. A bit crowded but we still enjoyed the pool etc. The room are clean. Room service was slacking as we had to call them during our entire stay to clean our room. I would recommend this hotel for adults and families as well.

Reviews.Title: “probably won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: vanna01
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Golden Nugget because of the reviews I read on this web site. However, the room was not clean, the pool was crowded and COLD! If this is your first time to Vegas I would recommend you stay on the strip, that is what you came to see anyway. We had to take a bus to the strip and it took us over two hours to get back to our hotel. The beds were comfortable, that's a plus, the bathroom sink would not drain. We asked for a roll away and they did deliver it pretty quick, cost 20.00 a night. I probably would not go back to the Golden Nugget, but then I probably won't go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloAmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget recently for 2 nights as the start of an extended west coast vacation. I had stayed there once previously, but it had been 7 yrs ago, so I thought I'd stay there again, as it was nice from what I remembered. The rate was also very good. We (there was two of us) arrived before check in time, and were able to get into our room in the Carson Tower. He offered us an upgrade to the new Rush Tower for only a total of $60 more, which we would have gladly taken, but they didn't have any rooms with two beds available, which we required. Next stay! The Carson Tower was fine for us, and we had no major complaints. The room was fine, clean, good size. It had two comfortable beds, a sitting area, a separate table with makeup mirror outside the bathroom. The only problem we had, was at first the internet wouldn't work, both wired and wireless. I tried repeatedly and kept getting an error message that my name didn't match the hotel record's for that room. It took 3 calls to the desk before it was resolved, 1st call noone answered, 2nd call a message was left and they didn't call back, 3rd call they responded and said they'd send a guy up. They did, and oddly, when I tried it when he came up, it worked, and was fine from then on. I don't know if they fixed something at the desk or what. I can't comment on the restaurants, as we didn't eat at any of them, besides the Starbucks, of which they have two in the hotel. I ate at The Buffet and the Carson Street Cafe though 7 yrs ago, and both were good then, but I can't comment on how they are now. We ate at the Main Street Station buffet after all the good reviews I read about it on here, and it didn't disappoint. Lunch was a good price, with great variety and it was all good quality. I'll definitely visit again on my next trip! We also ate at the Cafe Binion, inside Binion's, basic menu with good prices, and was also a good meal. We didn't use the pools, but passed by The Tank, the pool with the fish and the sharks with the waterslide that goes right through the tank going to and from the elevator every time. It looked nice, the chair/chaise lounge rental prices are $10/$20, which I imagine go quickly on summer days. The business center at the hotel is 3 computers by the Carson Tower elevators, there's a fee for their use, and also to print out boarding passes. The hotels nearby all had a similar setup. The timeshare sellers tried to stop us right when we were headed to the elevator right after we checked in, as we had to walk by their desk to get to our tower's elevators. They are also by the doors on Fremont Street, as others have mentioned. We got stopped 4 times the whole trip, 3 at the Golden Nugget and once at Planet Hollywood. The one time the woman at the door made a beeline for me right on to Fremont Street when she saw me coming inside. I guess I met her target group. We didn't have a car, so to get to the Strip, we took the ART bus from Fremont Street, the stop was across from the El Cortez. The stop where we got dropped off was right across from the GN's main entrance, so that worked out well. We took the ART to the Bellagio, and got it back from Paris. You can also get the Deuce bus at the same stop on Fremont Street, and it makes more stops, some the same as the ART. The ART was fine, except it can get very crowded, and is slow. Overall, it was a good stay, and I'll probably stay there again eventually, though my next trip, I'll probably go back to one of the Strip hotels. Downtown is old Las Vegas though, which should be experienced, as should the Fremont Street Experience, especially if you've never seen it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Job, Golden Nugget!!”
Reviews.Author: bj2699
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Golden Nugget, and it was FABULOUS! Our 5-night stay was in a newly renovated room, which was beautiful, with the most comfortable King Sized bed and a Huge Flat panel TV (Room 1577). It was a corner room, and very quiet. We enjoyed the pool daily, and were always able to get deck chairs. The shark tank was a great addition to the pool area, and the slide was really worth the 3-story climb! My husband and I were both very lucky on the extremely entertaining video slots, especially Star Trek, Sex and the City, and The Wizard of Oz machines, located near the pool entrance. Table games, not so much, but they were still fun. The poolside Black Jack was a nice added bonus, and the dealers were all beautiful or handsome, and all charming. The pit boss at the pool was loud and crass, however he didn't ruin our good time. We didn't eat at any of the Golden Nugget restaurants, however did order room service and it was prompt and tasted delicious. I am looking forward to our next visit to Las Vegas, and would definitely stay here again. Downtown Las Vegas has so much to offer that you really don't need to leave to go to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget & Fremont Street - What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: crmoores m
Reviews.Content: We arrived May 21 for a 4-night stay at the Golden Nugget and check-in was very smooth and quick. Both the valet and hotel staff are exceptionally efficient and the service is top-notch. Rush Tower room is just as described on the site. The bathroom is very nice and roomy with the dual sink vanity, large shower, and separate toilet room. The studio is roomy and nicely decorated with the LCD TV and extremely comfy bed and pillows – best ever for us. Our view from room 20122 was of the strip and the mountains, very nice. The Golden Nugget casino is very nice, we also enjoyed seeing Binion’s, 4 Queens, and Fitzgerald’s, but we enjoyed returning to the Golden Nugget. I think all of these casinos are probably favorites to different people. Pool – The pool is much smaller than we expected, and that’s because of the shape and the tank in the center. It’s pretty at night with the lighting but we didn’t spend as much time in the pool as we had wanted to. The seating area with the “sofa beds” and tables were very comfortable however. Sun is in and out due to the 3 towers surrounding the pool. The upper pools are less busy of course because of the charge. Fremont Street Experience – The light show is amazing, especially when the real show starts. But my favorite sight was the neon lights on all of the casinos. Vegas Vic and all of the other lights and images – this is the Las Vegas we were looking for! And the vendors aren't hawking you as you walk the street - very comfortable and clean. Dining - Vic’s & Anthony’s steakhouse at the GN – I enjoyed the best steak I’ve had in years. This strip steak was exquisite! The au gratin potatoes are to die for as well. My wife tried the king crab pasta dish and was not excited about it and probably wished she had ordered the filet. But she enjoyed the king crab that was already deshelled. Grotto Italian restaurant at the GN – My wife loved the rigitoni & meatball dish, and I enjoyed the pizza. The food is excellent at this restaurant. Golden Gate Casino shrimp bar & deli – Just down the street from the GN, the “Best Tail in Town” is a must. Very good shrimp cocktail for the price ($1.99 & $2.99), and the French dip sandwich is good too. The deli is a fun place to people watch. Shows – We missed the RatPack at the Plaza, unfortunately. We were counting on the Frank & Barbara show at the Riviera but they were out of town, it turned out. We did see Gordie Brown and were a little disappointed, but there were some good moments. We really enjoyed Terry Fator and the Blue Man Group, these are excellent shows. Terry Fator has to be the best performer in Vegas at the moment. One last note on the level of service here – A Golden Nugget hotel guest tossed an ashtray from their Gold Tower room and smashed our rental car rear window – nice. We were picking it up to go to Planet Hollywood for lunch when the valet and security staff informed us of the recent damage (I used the valet option because it is so much easier and costs only a few dollars - I would definitely recommend going that way after this experience). The rental company needed the car returned before they would release a replacement, and that meant they would need to have the car towed to their airport location. They advised we should follow the tow truck and pick up the replacement. Right… The lead valet, Barry, talked to the rental company and the tow company for us to ensure everything was being taken care of. He went the extra step and found that the tow was 2 hours away and said the hotel limo was at our disposal for the remainder of the day and night if we needed it. That was a great gesture on their part, and we decided to stay at the GN until the car was picked up and then take the limo to the airport. Barry and the security officer then followed up with a very generous lunch voucher for our troubles - that was the first time I had ever ordered filet and a shrimp cocktail for lunch! So we want to acknowledge the level of service this staff went to in assuring our satisfaction. We’ve experienced many 4 – 5 star hotels and resorts and the service at the GN is excellent. Needless to say we will be staying here when we visit Vegas again. The Golden Nugget is a very comfortable hotel and the service is consistently exceptional. Reports we've read here of sections of Fremont Street being "seedy" or unsafe are unfounded - Fremont Street is very comfortable and clean and we really enjoyed this part of our visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Lewisj03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GoldenNugget in Vegas for over a week. It was very clean, had comfortable bed, good food, beautiful heated pool, and great location in the the downtown area of Vegas. Walk out the door to Fremont Street and experience the Fremont Fun. Covered street helps with the heat in the summer if you are outside. Only one negative--It cost $20. a day to use the workout room. Internet is $12. a day.I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars for $29!”
Reviews.Author: fillmap
Reviews.Content: While not on The Strip it is on Fremont Street and bargain priced for very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Squix
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in the "old town" of Las Vegas at Fremont Street, not at the strip. So you need to take the bus or the cab if you want to go to the strip. Unfortunately at night you don't have a schedule for the busstops, so maybe you have to wait long time. At the Fremont Street itself you don't find so many young people like at the strip. The casinos are smaller, the walking ways shorter. You can like it or not... but you really need to see this part of Vegas, too! At the hotel there is a nice pool with a waterslide through an aquarium with sharks and other big fishes, but you can not see it on the slide, because it is very quick. If you don't like so much action you can chill at one of the sun decks or at the jaccuzi. The staff at the reception are very frindly, so we got a very nice room at one of the higher levels with strip view. Nice room, no long ways to walk. So if you go to Vegas and don't want to have action all day long or you don't like the hype of the stip, you should go to Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “4th Visit to the Nugget-RUSH Tower is now our new favourite!”
Reviews.Author: har8cin5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget the end of April for 2 nights. This was our fourth stay in 5 years and we have never been disappointed. This was our first time staying at the new RUSH Tower and we highly recommend it. The entrance is stunning and we felt seperated from the more crowded casino part, which we liked. The rooms were so cozy and well appointed that it was truly hard to leave them. The ebony wood colours and the leather couch were nice touches that you don't see anywhere else in standard rooms. The bathroom...well that was large enough to be a bedroom. There were french doors that opend up to a spaciously appointed bathroom. Top of the line Gilchrist and Soames tolietries. We paid $69.00 each night and had two rooms (travelled with my parents-their first time in Vegas) for these brand new rooms. This included the Golden Nugget coupon book that had 2-1 breakfast and lunch buffet coupons that we used and 2 free drinks. How can you go wrong to have a breakfast buffet for $10.80 for the two of you and you are not hungry until dinner? Then there was a happy hour special at Grotto (wood oven pizzas) and we had $5.00 pizzas and $3.00 belinni's or wine from 2-6pm. Truly an economical yet beautiful time at the Golden Nugget. Hats off to the pool area once again. My mom was able to relax in comfort by the pool and yet stay out of the direct sun on one of their spacious couches with awnings. We were able to enjoy sliding down the shark tank never tire of that) and sit in the sun. Great spot for a relaxing few days when you want to get away from it all! Thanks Golden Nugget..we will be back for a fifth time someday!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice change from the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: riz513ca
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I was thinking "What did I get us into?" as we rode through the streets dotted with bail bondsmen. Once we finally made it to the hotel, I was cautiously optimistic. We booked into the Rush Tower. Our only complaint at this point was the lack of front desk staff. This seemed to be an ongoing problem as we regularly passed by the check in during our 5 night stay. Other than that, we have virtually no other complaints. The Rush Tower rooms were very nicely appointed, clean, comfortable, quiet, modern and roomy. They even provided little extras such as a DVD player and alarm clock with an ipod dock. I did notice the lack of a bar fridge tho. Although I'm not a big mini bar drinker, the fridge would have been handy for juice and other items. The hotel itself had a completely different feel than the Strip. It actually seemed cozier and more welcoming. Not quite as pretentious as some of the other hotels. We've stayed at the Mandalay Bay, the MGM, and the Monte Carlo on some previous visits and enjoyed the Nugget just as much. The pool at the Nugget has recently undergone some significant renos to the tune of $20,000,000 I'm told. It was quite nice but perhaps a little small in regard to seating area but we still were able to find places to sun ourselves. Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse in the Nugget was another stop of ours. Definitely a great meal. We left completely satisfied after about a 2 hr dining experience. Fantastic food and worth the visit! We also checked out the Italian bistro just opposite the pool. Excellent service and also great food! Try the pizza with chicken! The Cafe was also quite good and offered a good selection of food for a decent price. You can walk out of the Nugget onto Freemont Street. Also a cool experience. A number of places to grab slushy drinks and cheap food. We found a couple of nice pubs down at the far end and enjoyed some good food and cold drinks. If you want to do some shopping, the new outlet stores are a short cab ride away. $12 or so. Excellent selections and plenty of options. If you want to make it over to the Fashion Show Mall, cab ride there and also to the Strip is about $20-25. One other thing...we had originally only planned to stay at the Nugget for 3 nights and then move to another hotel for a change. We decided to stay a couple extra nights at the Nugget. I called down to extend. No muss no fuss. When we checked out though, as is my usual custom, I simply do the quick check out and didn't check my bill. They had quoted me a different price on the phone for the two nights than what they charged. My bill was significantly more than I expected. 3 weeks later, I called the Nugget, advised them of the price I was quoted and what I was charged. Within a day, they had refunded the difference to my card. Thank you to Rosa in accounting :) We enjoyed our stay and found the rooms to be an excellent value. The different feel from the Strip was a nice change. We would definitely recommend the Golden Nugget, Rush Tower to any who want a cozier environment, a bit smaller scale of hotel and a change from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jclark1421
Reviews.Content: Every five years, my husband and I return to Las Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. We have stayed at the Golden Nugget previously, but this time it was the best! We stayed in the recently opened Rush Tower and loved it. The hotel has added this amazing swimming pool with a center aquarium - there is a water slide running through the aquarium that if you have your eyes open, you may even see sharks! We ate at the Chart House restaurant and had the best food we've eaten in Vegas. We still went to the strip every day; with bus passes it is the best "deal" in town. Downtown is less stress and more user friendly than the strip, yet it is still Vegas! We even hit the hotel dance bar, Gold Diggers, and danced the night away!

Reviews.Title: “Not much Rush at the Tower”
Reviews.Author: johnash
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Golden Nugget and this time got a room in the new Rush Tower. We'd pre-booked a twin-bed room with "view of the Strip" and, as I'd also requested VIP Check-in, I was told by the reservations staff that the room was pre-assigned. Arrived at the new hotel entry for the Rush Tower. Valet staff and bell boys helpful as ever but VIP check-in was closed. Indeed we never saw it open. Not much point providing it, really. Also, quite often we noticed the standard Rush Tower check-in was close at quieter times. In both cases this means a haul round to the main check-in area which is all a bit of a pain after a long journey. Not the friendliest of welcomes in the main VIP check-in, compared to previous occasions and, when we got to the room, it was not south-facing (closest you get to a Strip view from here). So all the way back to "VIP" check-in when I was advised that all the twin rooms are on that side. So how come I was told I'd been "pre-allocated" a twin room with a "Strip view". I never found out the answer to that but was given a King bed room with a South facing view. Room was great and you can glimpse bits of the Strip but still a better view than we would have had. (Though not important to some, we do like a bit of a view). After that bit of hassle we really enjoyed the stay and standards at the Nugget remain high. The new rooms and furnishings, especially the bathroom area, were very nice indeed. No coffee machine, of course (we bring a travel kettle) there is a safe in the room, FS TV, and expensive Wifi access. Have given a lower rating for service due to the reservation and check-in problems and the attitude of the check-in staff. All other staff were most helpful and friendly. It did seem very quiet in the Rush Tower area though (bar, check-in and gaming). But the Valet car return was always pretty speedy. Another oddity for a new facility was the waiting area for the Valet consisted of a couple of benches perched on a curb. Odd they had not thought about a proper waiting area when they planned this project. Also, we are not sure we would pay the extra for a Rush Tower room next time, nice as they are. We will always go and have late Steak n' Eggs in the Carson Street Cafe, long may it reign as our favourite place to eat at the Nugget. Despite the few whinges, we''ll be back! The smart place, the only place, to stay Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “a different experience”
Reviews.Author: jef-ind
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Golden Nugget with our three children after a week-long vacation in Utah before flying home from Las Vegas. I booked it largely due to the description of the pool, which I thought our kids would love. On the positive side, the pool was GREAT, our room in the Rush Tower was spacious, new, and extremely clean and well appointed. There were a number of food options both in the hotel and nearby. The nearby free parking was great. On the negative side, the service was a bit slow. There was only one person working the check in counter the whole evening and the lines were at times quite long. It took us about 2 hours to get a crib brought to our room. There was also quite a bit of noise coming from a concert on Fremont Street, but this stopped by 11.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower - wow”
Reviews.Author: CaptAdventure
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a whim for our last night in Vegas after reading a review of the new Rush Tower in The Week magazine. We were amazed. It was by far the nicest place we stayed after travelling all over UT and NV for two weeks. The bathroom was luxurious, with ever amenity thoughtfully chosen, and an impeccably clean, very fancy shower and bathroom. Our room was upgraded complimentary to a corner suite, and while the view was nothing to speak of, the room was all we needed to see to give the Rush Tower an A+. We also enjoyed free valet parking (standard with a booking at the Rush Tower). Self parking is also available. We had a perfectly enjoyable dinner at the Grotto restaurant and while we unfortunately missed being able to go down the shark aquarium water slide (we finished dinner too late) - we had fun watching others do it from the view from our table. The big shock was that this room was less than half the price of our Bellagio room, where we stayed for the rest of our time in Vegas, and was much, much nicer. Granted, Fremont Street is still not the Strip - far from it - but had I known better we might have enjoyed this incredible room and cabbed to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ac135
Reviews.Content: I paid extra for VIP treatment and got nothing for it. The room was clean and nice, but nothing to write home about. The service was just ok. The pool was nice, and the spa was nice, too. Vic & Anthony's was great. What really got me was that wireless cost $10+ daily (didn't get it), and I had to go somewhere to pay to print boarding passes. It would have cost them nwext to nothing to print them for us, and their failure to do so lost me forever.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay HERE again!”
Reviews.Author: JJ67Albuquerque
Reviews.Content: We had never previously stayed in downtown Las Vegas so since we were booking last minute (and prices were $$$) we decided to stay downtown at the Golden Nugget. After driving for 8 hours (and arriving at 1:00am) we walked into the hotel only to find the check in process very confusing. The hotel has two different towers and two different check in areas. We waiting in (what we realized was the wrong one according to the posted signs) for about 15 minutes and then thought we were at the wrong registration, so we left our spot in line and walked to the other registration desk where it said "Carson tower." Guess what? It was closed so we had to walk back with all of our luggage and start our wait over. 15-20 minutes later we were greeted and advised that the hotel did not have anymore non-smoking rooms... ARE YOU KIDDING??? What kind of hotel expects a tenant to stay in a smoking room when they don't smoke?? Especially after the guest RESERVED a non-smoking room?? Our front-desk person told us she would get the manager and asked us to step aside. Approximately 10 minutes later the manager comes out and advises us that when we reserved a non-smoking room it was actually only a request; they do not guarantee non-smoking rooms... FUNNY, I have never had this happen at any other hotel... EVER! After about 10 minutes of back and forth amazingly enough a non-smoking room became available. We got to our room about 2:00am and lights out! The accomodations were 3.5 star, comfortable with higher-end toiletries. The next day while at the pool we found out that (even though we gave our credit card to the front desk) the front desk didn't register it... so back to the waiting game... this went smoothly, but only after a 20 minute wait in line. While in line I observed a manager having a verbal confrontation with a guest... I am not sure what the complaint was, but the guest was threatening legal action and the manager didn't seem to be responding appropriately or maturely! The manager on duty this day looked like a 25 year old kid! After the manager finished with that guest he was being awaited on by another unhappy guest... This seemed to be some sort of room problem and the guest was not happy about a reservation he made (and had evidence of) and the hotel didn't have that room available... the guest ended up leaving (I guess to stay at another hotel.) I did not witness nor did I have one positive interaction with any hotel employee the entire time I was there. One morning while at the hotel cafe, while delivering my (wrong order) food, the waitress told me that "I didn't tell her that" in regards to how I ordered my eggs... Seriousely, be more tactful... say "I must have missed you saying that" or something of that nature... Do these people not work in customer service??? OH, one more discusting thing... Upon arriving at our room at 2:00am the first night I went to the rest room and found that our sink hadn't been cleaned. This wouldn't have been so gross if it wasn't for the fact that it had tobacco chew juice all over it!! In terms of the hotel, except for this, it was nicely cleaned and everything worked in proper order. In terms of customer service -- NO WAY would I EVER consider staying at the Golden Nugget again! Oh, and the valet and self-parking closed completely... even to hotel guests! Where the heck are paying guests supposed to park their car??

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Downtown”
Reviews.Author: JimLovesToTravel
Reviews.Content: First location- If you haven't tried downtown Las Vegas because it doesn't seem like it would be as fun as the strip, think again. I've stayed at pretty much every luxury hotel on the strip, and downtown Las Vegas offers a welcome change to the giant casino resorts, with the Nugget being the "best in class" downtown and worth a look. The Nugget is in the center of the downtown casino district on a pedestrian only street with all the casinos and souvenir stores in the area just outside your door. This central location provides a variety that should certainly be experienced. The Hotel - The Golden Nugget is comparable with many of the smaller 4 star resorts on the strip (think Paris or Bally’s, nicer than the Monte Carlo, not comparable to the mega resorts like MGM, Caesars or Mandalay Bay). The rooms are smaller than what you'd find on the strip (we stayed in the updated Gold Tower), but they are well laid out with quality materials (comfy beds with high-count linens, large plasma TVs). The bathrooms are small for Vegas (like standard hotel bathrooms...one sink, toilet, tub). The new pool at the Nugget is an incredible complex...the best of any hotel of its size in the city. It was packed in late May and they need to upgrade their music at the pool level, but it's a beautiful, clean, fresh complex with tons to look at. We suffered one poor experience that I feel compelled to share. The ice machine on our floor had seemingly not been serviced/cleaned in some time, as we noticed slime in our ice bucket after the ice had melted (wish we saw it before). We both suffered from bouts of "stomach discomfort" earlier that day (after consuming the bad ice), and can't help connecting the two. When I brought the ice bucket down to the front desk late that night to complain, the clerk simply stated that he would call maintenance to have the machine repaired; the manager was not called and nothing else was said. Definitely not up to 4 star standards from that experience, but it was the exception for our stay and not the rule. Without this event, I would have scored our stay 4 stars, but it did happen and it put a damper on an otherwise great stay. So the net is that we loved the downtown experience. The location of the Nugget ; the freedom to roam without the long walk between casinos was very convenient, and there was a feeling that the staff everywhere downtown was just a little bit friendlier. If the Nugget would spend a little more effort on their service level, I would have recommended it unequivocally.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: SmallTuna
Reviews.Content: The good: Comfortable and spaceous rooms. Nice pool area, good buffet. Good valet service. Good location downtown, only a few minutes drive for the strip, where most of the parking is free. The bad: Long queue for check-in (took nearly 30 min) and seemed somewhat disorganised. The room was never cleaned even though we stayed for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: peanuts77Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the new rush tower which was gorgeous, we booked a corner suite. It was lovely but had no bath tub which was disappointing, make sure to ask for one if you are booking a corner suite because I think some of them come with a bath. Also another thing that niggled me was that the sinks have no plugs! I thought it was a bit odd, you waste tons of water washing. Apart from that it was great and nice to stay off the strip. The pool is class too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SAJIH
Reviews.Content: Has great amitnities, simming pool was a unique model. Breakfast buffet was awesome. Only drawback is that it is away from the strip but doesn't matter much if you rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBusinessDad
Reviews.Content: Renovations are great. Staff was great. Nice amenities and the beds were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “By far the class of Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last night of our trip at the Nugget moving from three nights on the Strip at the Monte Carlo. I had often gambled at the Nugget but had never stayed at the hotel. With a fantastic promotion, I took advantage of staying here instead of lesser expensive properties downtown as is my norm. Our checkin process was fairly smooth at 11 am, a room with double beds in the Carson tower was available so we spent maybe 15 minutes at the desk before entering our room. The room was attractive and very comfortable and though the bathroom was a bit small it was adequate for our needs. The decor was a bit dated but more reflective of an older Vegas feel than disregard. It was neat, clean and very functional. Actually, I enjoyed our room at the Nugget more than our room at the Monte Carlo. The only restaurant we patronized on-site was the buffet for brunch. It was unappetizing but acceptable with a 2 for 1 coupon at $11. The Cafe was well-attended and we probably should have eaten there for a quick bite. The casino is my favorite downtown. The gaming selections are the best downtown, the seats are very comfortable and the atmosphere more upscale despite constant walk-ins from Fremont St. The cocktail service on the floor continues to be the best downtown if not in Vegas. The drink quality is consistently good and the cocktail waitresses friendly, efficient and attractive. The property in general is equal to or even superior to many on the Strip. The ammenities are good and coincide to the price paid for a room. The sports book is well-appointed, comfortable, and intimate. To me, it is a bit small to stay for too long. The multi-tiered pool area is compact yet very nice with a nice choice of loungers and a European option. The massive saltwater aquarium and waterfalls at the pool's center are very unique and attractive features even featuring a waterslide through the shark-infested aquarium. It was a fun place to spend a few sunny hours with good drink service but its smallish size was impacted by the number of children in the area - some unattended - that negatively impacted the experience. This was a major annoyance. Since the Fremont St area is fairly compact, it is very easy and fun to access the other hotel/casinos/restaurants in an evening as well as the light and sound show under the canopy. It is due to this ready access that the Golden Nugget stands out decisively as the premier property downtown and an excellent alternative to the LV Strip for those seeking less hype and expense with a comfortable, "old Vegas" vibe. The Nugget is certainly the class of several viable alternatives downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: artemiss1977
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding night at the Rush tower here. Got a free upgrade from a a jr suite to a Parlor suite and we were quite impressed. The pool looked fabulous, and we loved the HUGE saltwater reef aquarium behind the front desk. I had a great time at the blackjack tables, and even won a little. The location was great to hang out and party on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Fun Time at Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: MNpalmtree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget May 7-11 for a long weekend. First time we stayed downtown and really liked it overall! Line at check in desk was minimal. (Saw it was longer later on though.) We got a room on the 16th floor in the Carson Tower (south tower), non smoking which is what we requested in advance. Room was quite nice; clean, spacious, marble counter in bathroom, flat panel TV. The bathroom even had a regular rug with plastic backing, which is a lot nicer to have than the towel-type bathrugs. No view to speak of out our window, but you could see the LV Hilton if you craned your neck a bit. I was not there for the view anyway. Bed was comfortable as well. I thought the room was quite nice. The rooms at GN are far nicer than comparably priced rooms I've had on the strip. It was quiet too. People say it is a long walk to the Carson Tower rooms but I think it is far less walking than you'd do at any strip hotel. We had no issues with housekeeping. They came a bit later on Sunday as I'm sure lots of people checked out but they showed up eventually. There are timeshare people near the elevators, just keep walking.... We ate at the Carson Street Cafe late at night on our first night for breakfast. Service was great and food was also quite good. Also ate at the Chart House on our last evening. Walked in without a reservation and got right in on a Monday night. We had a nice table right by the fish tank. It was a lot of fun to watch the fish during our dinner. I had the scallops with risotto and DH has the scrimp scampi. Both were excellent and service was perfect. Played a bit in the casino, mostly slots and did not have great luck. Drink service was pretty good though. Had better luck on slots at other Fremont street casinos. The pool was VERY crowded on Saturday, a little less so on Sunday. Tried to reserve chairs for Sunday at the new Hideout pool but it closed due to high winds. Too bad they did not tell us earlier so we could've grabbed pool chairs. People play the pool chair game and leave towels on chairs and return 2+ hours later. Wish they could put a stop to that. Water slide is very cool though! Also visited lots of other casinos and restaurants DT. One nice thing aobut Fremont street is that you can easily walk from one casino to the next much more quickly than you can on the strip. Makes it easier to eat and gamble at other places. Anotehr nice thing is that DT does not have the porn slappers and timeshare sharks on the streets. Fremont is quite clean and very safe! We found we spent a lot less on food and beverage than if we stay on the strip since things are a lot cheaper DT. I really enjoyed my stay at the GN and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right speed.”
Reviews.Author: Funnfamily
Reviews.Content: People told me again and again that when staff are nice in Vegas it's because "they have o be". Well I don't care what the reason, when you need something (which is all time when you travel), you want to get the help that you need. In four days, we had not one reason to complain! I usually have something I could bring up- like having a concern dismissed or funky tasting eggs, but my stay here gets a gold star. Ok twist my arm- there was a motocross race in town so there was a lot of woooooo! And dude what's UP! And I felt like a lone flower in a sea or scolly-fonted black tees and plaid shorts, but whatever, they were having fun. Ok and I've had a better ceasar salad, but I was sitting by the pool, drinking a darn good bloody Mary and watching the sharks swim by. So really, can I complain? My room was so cute! The decor was funky, but I can appreciate Vegas better than the average person. It was clean, bedbug free (very important!) and spacious. I had fun sitting at the vanity and preparing to go to a wedding. My hubby was very worried about being stuffed into a depressing room, but that did not happen. It helped that he made friends with a bird that would come to the window and share his starbux muffin every morning. The pool had no available chairs by the time we got there , but we rolled in pretty late, but as I said before, we enjoyed ourselves there. Breakfast in the cafe was good- give me my own caraffe of coffee in the morning and you've got me in your palm. Give me people watching too.........well. I didn't gamble here because I had a super cheapo gambling plan for the El Cortez but that's another review. When I hit the strip or any other casino I was always glad to return to the "crown jewel" of downtown. Thanks for an excellent time!

Reviews.Title: “terrible place”
Reviews.Author: rpet
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before. I am not that fussy and most places for me are acceptable. The Golden Nugget was simply terrible. We arrived at 2 a.m. and had to wait in line for 30 minutes. No non smoking rooms were available so we had to wait another half hour. We were than sent to a smoking room that had a very offensive odor . The whole floor and room were stained and VERY tired. We went back to the front desk and were sent to another room that was NOT a 4 star. the front dsek clerk said this is a real problem, too many smoking rooms and can't accommadate non smokers. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN VEGAS!!! BAR NONE!!!”
Reviews.Author: LWhite56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Las Vegas to see Garth Brooks and it happened to be Sprint Cup NASCAR weekend also. The best rates we could find online were at a "lower end" yet very famous strip hotel. From the time we arrived we were NOT happy with our accomidations. We did NOT get all we were promised on the phone, from 1600 miles away. They were unfriendly, dirty and not at all helpful with problems. We had called the Golden Nugget, but due to the NASCAR weekend, they were all booked up. On Monday after the race was over, we called The NUGGET, and they "bent over backwards" for us, and gave us a beautiful room, starting that morning, let us check in immediately, knowing we had to be out of our hotel, and the whole time we were there the staff, from check-in to housekeeping, treated us like "hi roller royalty" which we are a long way from. The entire hotel complex is glamourous, friendly, and the pool is awesome, the casino is clean and modern and our whole trip (starting that Monday) was a very pleasant experience. We get several emails a week from Hotel/Casino complexes, with very reasonable rates, but I erase them as sonn as I get them as, when we go back to Las Vegas, and we do, at least two times a year, we will not stay ANYWHERE else but THE GOLDEN NUGGET, ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget...I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: FollowMyGPS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget in April for 3 nights. I have never stayed Downtown before but I am familiar with the area. Booked a 2 room suite for $135 a night. Arrived mid-afternoon. Since I had booked a suite it entitled me to VIP checkin. Very quick and I was in my room within minutes. Room was very large and clean and had 2 full bathrooms, one with a jacuzzi tub. Excellent, well appointed sitting room and a very nice wetbar with Marble countertops, fridge and sink. Bedroom was large with an excellent king size bed. Two 42" LCD TV's, one in each room and a coffee maker in the room! Unheard of at most places on the strip. View was not good but it did not detract from my stay. I chose a smoking suite and apparently they only have one suite that is smoking. Pluses are many, including the staff. The only minus was the buffet. Found it expensive for dinner and slow service. Valet parking was excellent, never waited more than 4-5 minutes for my vehicle. There is a Starbucks right in the hotel which was great. The hotel is clean and kept in good repair. The people are a little more mellow and the pace is just easier than the noise and confusion of the strip. The downtown part of Vegas, outside the Fremont Street canopy, can be sketchy. As long as you remain under the Fremont Street canopy, it is probably safer than the strip. There are security and police everywhere and there are none of the annoying "card flickers" or panhandlers to be seen. With "buck a beer" Heineken and all kinds of incentives, it is definitely more affordable than the strip. Every night they have free street perfomances, (musicians, dancers, etc.) and I found them to be quite entertaining. I like the fact that you can walk from your room to multiple other casinos with 2 minutes. Downtown is not as fancy as the strip and is the "old Vegas", but the payouts are definitely better. If you have never been to Las Vegas before, then stay on the strip, you will want to see the sights. If you have been to Vegas multiple times but have never stayed downtown, and are getting a little tired of the whole "Strip experience", then give the Golden Nugget a try and make sure you book a suite. It is definitely worth the extra money and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel Downtown.....”
Reviews.Author: travelweliketoo
Reviews.Content: We usually stay on the strip, but decided to try downtown this trip. We were pleasantly surprised to view accomodations online when a friend suggested the Golden Nugget. They boast being the nicest hotel downtown and they are right! We stayed in the new Rush Tower and the room was 4 star. Granite countertops in bathrooms and cool bowls for sinks and everything extremely clean. The bed was one of the comfiest we have ever slept on too. I found myself sitting on the sectional for the first time in 4 days and it was comfy as well. They have valet parking, but self parking is free and is adjacent to private entrance for the Rush Tower. Registration is quick and easy as well and is located at private entrance. New pool with cool slide is pretty impressive and there are plenty of lounge chairs. We never tried the buffet, but ate at the Asian, Italian and Seafood restaurants which were all good and fairly reasonable. We did not eat breakfast here....buffet was overpriced for the amount we wanted to eat in the mornings....walked over to Binions to their grill for breakfast......McDonalds down the street a few times too.......Fremont is right outside the door and is alot of fun. Some junky stores for souveniers, but a few neat kiosks for higher quality gifts too. We really enjoyed our stay here. Only improvement would be, and I don't know if it is possible for the management to fix, but staff everywhere except for the maids seem to be out of touch and not willing to go the extra mile or even greet you with a smile....Is it that they will never see you again or are people just not as friendly in other states outside of our homestate of Texas??
