We will return to downtown and will return to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “After stopping on the strip, was a nice surpise”
Reviews.Author: plod1127
Reviews.Content: After stopping at a couple of the hotels on the strip we decided to visit downtown for the Glitter Gultch experience and stop at the Golden Nugget for 2 nights. We were presently surprised, as we were expected to be downgrading on the hotel quality. On booking in we were offered an upgrade to a Rush Tower room and were glad we took it. The Rush tower has a seperate lobby area - much quieter, different decor with a more exclusive feel. The room was beautiful and the largest/nicest we stopped in during our vacation. Seperate shower cubicle, his and hers sinks, large tv screen and a good sized sitting area. I also preferred the casino to many of the others. Although big it was the easiest to navigate around and didn't feel like it was designed to keep you in (with the exception of the female casino dealers wearing little outfits and showing lots of cleavage!). We also had one of the best meals there during our stay in Vegas. Vic & Anthony's steakhouse was fabulous and where I had one of the best steaks in my life. It is expensive but is reputed as one of the finest steakhouses in all of Vegas. The exits on the Freemont side lead directly onto the street where the lightshow can be watched. Our only grumble was the pool area - it's just not big enough for the size of the hotel. Beds were limited and due to the enclosure of the hotel's towers people were moving beds throught the day to avoid the shifting shade. The pool is designed for dipping rather than swimming and is usually full of people stood in it watching the sharks/fish in the tank located in the centre of the pool, oblivious to others having to swim around them. There is a seperate pool on a higher level called the Hideout, but was tiny and always full. I would recommend this hotel highly if you are stopping downtown. We loved it and will definately stop there again if we return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: snoopy-on-trinity
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the older towe, Carson, and it was faultless. The 'flowery?' theme in the room is beautiful and very new. I guess it's just a matter of taste!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place with bad players.”
Reviews.Author: jayxx2
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Golden Nugget after spending days here finding a nice hotel to try. Stayed 5 days at the Gold Tower - the room was excellent, no problems to speak of - if there is one extra that I would have enjoyed it would have been an in-room fridge but I never did get around to seeing if one could be rented or not or if another Gold Tower room was around with one in it. No matter, the room was always done up quickly, the safe, beds, linens were a.ok. The bathroom is a biiit small for 2 people - no problem at all for 1 person. I used the In-room WebTV (9.99 for 24 hours of internet) and had no problem using it once I changed the batteries out of the wireless keyboard, they had clearly died. I enjoyed the hotel very much, aside from the large numbers of smokers which are unfortunately everywhere in vegas. The poolside was very nice and although there was one occassion where drunk, loud americans managed to puke all over their cabanna, they were taken out quickly and the cleanup was rapid. Restaurants were very nice with no trouble to speak of. The buffet was always clean and updated (although I learned slightly smaller than other places close-by). In terms of the casino there: I can't say i was lucky at anything although the baccarat was good to me. The players at the blackjack tables are some of the worst I have ever seen in my life - no idea of basic strategy what-so-ever and I found that they often abused the dealers for no actual reason. My pity goes to the staff who have to deal with such horrid people. all said and done I give it a thumbs up, being right on freemont street and being easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again, but with an upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: claired13
Reviews.Content: We got a package deal online, and the room worked out to be about $80 per night for both of us. We had a room in the oldest tower (Carson Tower) and the rooms had dated decor and linens (flower mania--reminded me of a grandma's room), BUT the beds were SO COMFY. Lovely, pillow-top mattress. We had a room with two queens and it was big enough for the two of us. A nice perk (that we hardly used) was the huge, flat-screen TV in the room. Also, I want to note that we took the Gold bus to the strip multiple times. It only costs $3 per person to get to the Strip on this bus. This Gold bus is the EXPRESS bus, stops right across the street from one of the Golden Nugget's exits (on the Freemont Street side), and takes you to the heart of the strip in just 20 or 30 minutes (getting to the strip takes maybe 15 minutes, but getting the Bellagio can be another 15 minutes longer due to the horrific traffic). Buses run VERY frequently, day and night. The longest we waited was just 20 minutes and that was in the middle of the night. So, take the GOLD Bus to get from the Golden Nugget to the Strip on the cheap! Buses were clean, safe, spacious, CHEAP, and FAST (especially compared to the slower public buses that stop every two minutes and take at least four times as long). The Golden Nugget staff told us about the Gold Bus and I will forever be in debt to the lovely man who told us about this. The pool is awesome. SHARK SLIDE!! We ate at the buffet for breakfast. It was a weekend so more expensive (champagne brunch), but whatevs. It was fine. The only thing that I really dis-liked is that we happened to be seated near the escalator and there were people in the hallway right outside the restaurant chain smoking (no barrier between the hallway and the restaurant). I find cigarette smoke totally un-appetizing so didn't really eat very much.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JasonWW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget from May 1st - May 4th in the Rush Tower. The room was great. It had a king sized pillow top bed, feather pillows, leather L-shaped couch, plasma TV, and a good view. The view we had was of the pool, Stratosphere, Rio, Trump, and the mountains. I have stayed on the strip 2 times before staying downtown and I really enjoyed my downtown LV stay. Previously I stayed at Monte Carlo in 2004 and Treasure Island in 2006. I would stay at the Golden Nugget again. The pictures on their website accurately depict the new Rush Tower. We also ate at Vic and Anthony's in the Golden Nugget and it was just about the best steak I have eaten. I had the bone in ribeye and it was cooked to perfection and was like butter melting in my mouth. My wife had the 6oz filet and she really enjoyed it too.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendes1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in a club room. We had priority check in and use of the VIP lounge. There was a huge line to check in at the normal desks so it was great to get checked in straight away at the VIP desk. Our room was on the 16th floor which you needed a key card to access. Our room was amazing. It was nice and large with a big bathroom, a huge tv and a sofa. The view from the window wasnt great but then we didnt spend that much time in the room looking out of the window. There was free coffee in the morning delivered to the floor and also in the afternoon jely beans, M&M's and assorted nuts. There were also free bottles of water. The price of the club room also included a newspaper and internet access. The club room was only a little bit more money but with the extra bits you got it was well worth it. The hotel itself was great. The staff were all really friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean and good fun. The swimming pool was great with the shark tank to swim around. We also never had any problem finding a lounger. We ate in the Chart House restaurant which was amazing. The scallops were to die for. All in all we had a great time at this hotel and managed to look all around Fremont street end. I would absolutely stay here again it truly exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nuggets cares if you are happy with your stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Hinrich_12
Reviews.Content: Big tvs. Comfortable beds. Awesome pool. Amazing value. The check-in line was a little crowded but not too bad. The first room I went into had a pair of wet pajama pants in it and smelled a lit funny so I called the front desk. They sent someone up with 2 minutes. They switched my room and gave me a strip view. There was construction going on on that side but that was no fault of the hotel. I accidentally left 2 pairs of designer sunglasses in the room and thought they would be lost forever but to my surprise they were waiting for me at the lost and found. I think the staff here really wants you to be happy and come back. It was refreshing compared to some of the other Vegas hotels I've stayed in. RIVIERA is the worst!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: lucky243
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Vegas for years and once we discovered how much fun it is on Fremont we decided to stay at the Nugget. We have been 3 times in the last 18 months and it just keeps getting better. The upgrades are beautiful, especially the new Rush Tower and the Chart House. Though the best part is the staff. You must go visit Jose and Richard at the Grotto Bar and Maggie in the Chart House they are exceptional and a lot of fun to talk with. We love the Golden Nugget and would recommend it to anyone. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: kendrac21
Reviews.Content: Last min. trip to Vegas and it just happened to be the night of the big boxing fight at the MGM Grand. Everything is sold out and/or outrageously priced. The Golden Nugget was a good deal versus $500 to stay on the strip. The hotel was pretty quit. The Fremont experience closed early at 12pm so after that, there isn't a lot to do. The streets were empty like a ghost town, no local bars open either. The taxi ride to the strip was about $25, kinda pricey since your not going very far. However, nice pool, friendly staff, and clean rooms. Good for families and people not looking to party. Pros: inexpensive, quiet, nice pool, easy parking Cons: far from the strip, no nightlife

Reviews.Title: “New Rush Tower is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RobinInAMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rush Tower, and did the extra upgrade for an extra $30 per night. Our room was SO nice! The bed was super comfy, the bathroom was super cool and modern, flat screen TV, alarm clock plays my iPod, DVD player. The blackout curtains really work too. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Peri
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget for my birthday and I must say I was quite surprised. They did have a long wait at the check in but noticed that they were training 3 people that day. I did have an issue with my reservation but they took care of it right away. We got the corner suite in the rush tower and it was 3 times the size of any hotel room we have stayed at. The pool was fantastic and very clean and fun. Mix of children and adults. If I was to stay downtown this would be the only place I would stay hands down. I like to stay at different places so I go between the strip and downtown. This is now the only place downtown for me.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: PickE_1
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for one night on the way back from California and wanted an inexpensive room but had heard horrible stories about cheap rooms on the strip. I talked my husband into booking a room at the Nugget. He had never seen the Fremont Experience and the rooms were inexpensive. We got a $100 room and it was HUGE! It was nicer and cheaper than any room I had stayed in on the strip. There were 2 large flat screen TVs, a sitting room and a huge bathroom with his and her sinks. The room was very clean and the housekeeping checked on us when we checked in. There were dental kits, slippers and robes. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I did not want to get up. There was one thing I did not like and that was that check in and the casino were smoky but once we stepped off the elevator I could not smell it. Our room smelled great. We had the breakfast buffet and it was good too. My 5 year old thought the pool was fun as well. I only gave it a 3 on location as we had a child and felt that there was more for her to participate in on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay & Incredible Value at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: royaltara8
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas to celebrate a birthday, and we we were amazed at how nice the hotel is. We stayed in the Carson Tower for the bargain rate of $39 per night! Recent renovations have created clean, comfortable & quiet rooms. Beds were new and very comfortable. We even found comfy robes in the closet for use during our stay. The pool area is beautiful with several lounging areas and an outdoor aquarium that sits in the center of pool. Watch the sealife while you swim! Don't miss the indoor floor to ceiling aquarium as well. We loved being downtown on Fremont Street. Classic Vegas! Lots of fun casinos within immediate walking distance and a street party atmosphere every night. The new ACE Gold Line bus runs from Fremont Street to the Strip app. every 15 minutes, but we found we loved being downtown and didn't miss being on the Strip at all. All in all, a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - almost...”
Reviews.Author: chamberlain62
Reviews.Content: Everything went very well almost the whole way through the vacation. We went to celebrate my wife's birthday, and we were promptly upgraded ($20.00 trick). The only negative I had was the maid service. After the first room cleaning, I thought that the change I had left on the desk was a little light. The second day, I left change out again - but counted it. Two quarters missing - exactly two quarters, fifty cents! The next day I left (counted) change out again, and there was $1.30 gone! If I had not counted it myself - several times - I would never believe that anyone would jeapordize their job for a few bucks in change. Management really didn't seem to care. Saved me money in the long run, 'cause I sure didn't leave my usual tip for the maids at the end of my stay! The way I see it, if management thinks that spare change from customers is a perk for the maids, I sure don't want to stay there! Next time - Main Street Station!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding bargain”
Reviews.Author: cincymoe
Reviews.Content: I was stunned to find out how comfortable, spacious and quiet our room was for the price. We stayed in the Cason Tower for only $39 a night (week day rate). It was extremely clean, the bed was surprisingly comfortable and the room had adequate amenities, including two fresh, white robes and a safe for our valuables. There isn’t a coffee maker or a refrigerator so you’re on your own for storing cold drinks and morning coffee but there’s an ABC mini mart next to the casino…by the way, the perfect place to buy a bottle of wine for your room. When you just want coffee and donuts in the morning, Binion’s, across the street has a Dunkin’ Donuts inside the casino and Krispy Kreme is the next block down. Speaking of which, if you’re looking for an excellent breakfast, try the Golden Gate at the end of the block. The vintage coffee shop atmosphere is charming and the food is excellent - freshly squeezed OJ and the bakery goods are made daily. For a budget conscious happy hour, you can find $1 frozen drinks (only available during the day) at The Las Vegas Club across the street and $2 shrimp cups at the Golden Gate (the best for the price). But I digress – back to the hotel. We only had one dinner meal at the Golden Nugget and the experience was over the top. The Grotto offers an Italian fare that’s hard to beat. Our food was absolutely delicious and the service was attentive, timely and very friendly. If you just want a snack and a cocktail, go to The Grotto bar (it overlooks the pool) and try their Margarita pizza made fresh to order – it’s so tasty we ordered a second one! Sit at Denise’s table when you’re there, she’s a hoot. Shopping is minimal and like most hotel boutiques, a little pricey. Quite by accident, I found a small boutique tucked around the corner from the check in desk in the Rush Tower. I walked away with a couple of very stylish and affordable fashion souvenirs; a tee emblazoned with the words Las Vegas in gold and silver sparkles for $20 and a light weight, hooded and zippered jacket, embroidered in silver with the Golden Nugget logo, for $40. With the recent room renovations, great service, excellent food, outstanding price and relaxed location, I would highly recommend staying at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mrjiggyfly
Reviews.Content: I am a Vegas local and decided to treat myself to a two night staycation at the new Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas. The tower has its own valet area and its own front desk. Check-in was quick. I was in my room within 10 minutes of leaving my car at the valet. The room was very classy. It had a nice couch which made it easy to have a couple of friends hang out for a while. The king size bed was extremely comfortable and the tv was very nice. Unfortunately, it didn't get the Versus network which was crushing to me as a big hockey fan. Oh well, no hotel is perfect. The bathroom is big and very nice also. I would agree with those who suggested bath mats for the shower as it was a bit slippery. The Golden Nugget also recently opened a second pool area (in addition to the phenomenal Shark Tank pool) for adults called the Hideout. It's beautiful. They do charge during the day to get in there. I paid $20 for a chaise lounge chair and I thought it was worth it. Fortunately, I went on a Sunday which I heard was far less crowded than Saturday. The Hideout is free after 5pm and is open til 2am I believe. It's a great place for evening cocktails. World class! The Italian restaurant in the hotel, Grotto, is very good in my opinion. I have eaten there several times and always liked it. I prefer downtown Vegas to the strip because you can walk to several casino in just a few minutes. The strip if far more grandiose and it takes a long walk to move from one hotel to the next. The gambling is also cheaper downtown than on the strip (though the Golden Nugget is more expensive than the other downtown casinos). The staff was very friendly across the board during my stay. The addition of the Rush Tower and the Hideout makes a great hotel even better.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: whalerfan
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed downtown but decided to when I attended NAB this year. I booked through Expedia for $39 a night and got a room in the Carson tower. I found the hotel and casino to be very clean. The room was very clean, the staff courteous and the pool outstanding. I would recommend this hotel and casino to anyone who is looking for something a little different than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in the Carson (South) Tower...”
Reviews.Author: macmaroon
Reviews.Content: My seventy-six year old mother and I stayed at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas, Nevada for four nights starting on Sunday, August 9th, 2009. We booked a Carson (South) Tower room and when making our reservations online, we requested a room on the top floor, away from the elevator and the noise from the Fremont Street Experience, and we received a room on a high floor at the end of the hall overlooking Casino Center Boulevard. There were eight elevators in the Carson (South) Tower, and we never had to wait long, no matter if we were on the main floor or coming from our room. The walk to the casino was quite far for a downtown hotel, so if you are elderly or have trouble with mobility, try and request a room in the Gold (North) Tower. As you walk from the Carson (South) Tower to the casino, you pass a Starbucks, the gift shop, a restaurant, the swimming pool, and the front desk. The large room included two queen-sized beds, each with three pillows on them, a clock radio, two comfy chairs beside a round table, one regular chair next to the make-up table, a large HD television with about 20+ channels and a remote, and an iron/ironing board in the closet area, along with an extra pillow. We also found the doors slammed quite loudly, so we tried to close them as quietly as possible during our early morning gambling excursions. The medium-sized bathroom included three sets of towels, bottles of shampoo, conditioner and lotion, as well as a bar of soap. There was a very nice handle in the shower, that my mother was able to use to get in and out of with ease. The parking garage is across from the hotel on First Street and was almost always full. If you are staying at the Golden Nugget, you will be issued a parking permit which you will show, along with your parking ticket, to exit. The casino is very large and crowded, with not much space to move around in. Despite staying four nights, my mother and I gambled elsewhere during our stay, as past visits to the Golden Nugget's casino resulted in empty pockets.... The hotel is located in the Fremont Street Experience area, within walking distance of quite a few casinos. At night there is a light show, which is very entertaining. After taxes, the average rate per night for our room in the Carson (South) Tower came to $54.39 U.S. Funds. Overall, we were very comfortable in the room as it was very clean, and for the price, how could you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: vtpiper
Reviews.Content: My initial reservation with the Golden Nugget was for three days, on a special advertised on Travelzoo.com. I booked online with no problems. My husband and I fly standby, and it looked more likely that we would get out to Vegas if we left a couple days earlier, so I called the hotel reservation line - again, no problems, added two nights for a reasonable cost. Flew in late and arrived at the hotel - the check in desk was hard to find, and when found for our tower (there are four), it was closed. We then had to walk halfway across the hotel and through the crowded casino with our bags to the nearest tower's desk. We use a debit card for travel, rather than a credit card, and upon checking in, had a nice man who neglected to tell us that they would be placing a hold on our card - $100 for every night booked IN ADDITION to the reservation's total balance. He also neglected to give us the "$250 in savings!" coupon book that was supposed to be part of the Travelzoo promotion. The next day was rainy, so we didn't stray far from the hotel and didn't know our checking account had been completely tied up with this pre-authorization charge until we went to the buffet for dinner and couldn't charge $30 because our card was declined. Upon checking our account, we found out that there was only $27 left in it after this Pre-Authorization. Went to the front desk to complain, and was brushed off by a woman who said "we'll call your bank in the morning" without taking our bank's phone number. Needless to say, they didn't call, and we went down to the desk again and FINALLY got a person who cared, took all our information, informed us that the hotel's policy with debit cards is to do a hard charge for the whole owed amount and just turn off incedentals. Fine. So he brings this info back to the cashiers who have to release the charges - it took ALL DAY for them to release the charge, when they told us it would be a couple hours. We had no money to eat!! When we called the hotel, the cashier said, "oh, I just haven't gotten around to it yet." WE WOULD LIKE TO EAT! The rest of the stay was fairly uneventful, and housekeeping was generally good until our last day when housekeeping just threw our toiletries onto the counter, gave us just two towels and didn't look like they changed the sheets. Plus was the bed was pretty comfortable (we stayed in Carson tower, the oldest). Very few amenities. Spa ridiculously expensive for a downtown hotel. Also, the website makes it sound like wired internet was free but you had to pay for WiFi - this is not the case, you have to pay for both. Luckily the Krispy Kreme down the street had free wifi. Location - not much to see or do in Downtown (Old) Las Vegas. Fremont Street Experience was nice, but that's it. We spent most of our time on the Strip - at Treasure Island no less. I think we'll stay there next time. Liked best - bed and the really cool pool Liked least - everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Woops..Watch that slippery shower!”
Reviews.Author: pintogal
Reviews.Content: April 16 - 21st, checked into the Rush Tower 19220. Staff at the door very friendly, Ryan behind the desk who checked us in was distracted and appeared irratated at our questions. Up to our room with a beautiful view of the mountains. Quiet room, comfy bed, had to ask for building maintenance to come up and get us access to the plug in for hubby's CPAP machine. No prob, very friendly fella. I could pass on the buffet, there are better buffets in walking distance. Lily's Asian restaurant was wonderful, service was hands down amazing. Watch that shower! I'm 5'6" tall, and felt like I was climbing up into the shower. Then once the water was on, it's slippery. No bath mats available. One other couple in our group staying in 19218 commented the next morning how slippery it was, and she bruised her leg getting in. And wouldn't you know it, on my last day there I slipped in the shower ..smacked my head and too home some big bruises. Discussed this with hotel staff that morning, hopefully they will place bath mats in the bathroom for folks to decide if they want to use or not. Sorry for my would not recommend rating, but until they fix the bathroom situation, I feel it is very unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Golgen Nugget + Rush Tower = Winning Combination”
Reviews.Author: lesson4u63
Reviews.Content: 4/16/10-4/22/10 I arrived at the Golden Nugget Rush Tower valet at 1:30pm and recieved a warm greeting by the staff.My bags were taken in by the bell captain who met me up at my room 20220.The check in was very fast as well. My first two nights were in the new tower standard king.The room was spotless clean and quiet also.I never heard a peep for the week i stayed in the Rush Tower.Sunday night i moved to the Jr Suite room 20227 for the remainder of my trip and let me tell you this room is fantastic! The bathroom has a large tiled rainfall shower, 2 separate sinks/vanities, and closed off commode. There is a table with 4 chairs, sectional leather sofa, and large flat screen in a sitting area. King sized bed, dresser and another large flat screen tv.I will say this-they MUST fix the pitch in the bathtub/shower because someone is going to lose thier footing or slip and fall and hurt themselves.That was my only knock on the room. I went to all of the restaurants in the Golden Nugget and had the room service.Every meal was wonderful. The only other knock-and it was a big one was my 5:15am wakeup call never came and i nearly missed my flight. Overall a great trip and vacation and i,m looking very foward to staying at The Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “Not so fond of Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: TexasNan
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas at least twice a year and always stay at the Nugget. In the past we have stayed in the now Gold Tower and Carson Tower. Both are very good. We decided to try the Rush Tower this go round and was very disappointed in the comfort and convenience of the room. We had a King room and I would not call it 'user friendly'. It is very nice, luxurious and quiet. However, if you need electrical outlets you're in bad shape. There was one by the window and one in the bathroom. My husband has sleep apnea and has to use a C Pap machine at night. No plug-ins near the bed. The one plug in the bathroom is used to plug in the lighted make-up mirror so if you need to charge a cell phone, use a hair dryer or curling iron you have to unplug the light. Also the bathroom has inadequate lighting and it is difficult to see to apply make-up. The mirror is very high making it impossible to sit while putting on make-up or doing your hair. The bathtub/shower combination was very deep and you had to step way up over into it and out of it. The sides were so high that short or elderly individuals will find it very difficult to get in and out of. Now to the bed. The mattress was very thick but not comfortable. It sloped on the edges and at the head, making you feel like you had to sleep in the middle of the bed to keep from rolling off. The pillows were very plump looking but when you laid on them they went flat. They were down pillows. We asked to have them replaced with regular pillows and got very small ones that were a fiber fill that went as flat as the down pillows. We used the pillows from the couch(even though they were as hard as rocks) just so we could get our head up enough to keep from sliding into the headboard. We will continue to stay at the Nugget but will definitely not stay in the Rush Tower again. We are always perfectly comfortable and have all our needs met in the Carson Tower. Convenience to Fremont Street, parking and other casinos is great from the Rush Tower but that is the only thing I can recommend about it.

Reviews.Title: “The Best on Fremont”
Reviews.Author: ChefSteve43
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying in Fremont district. Our room in the carson tower was awesome. Better room that New York/New York, right down to the bath robes. Sparkling clean, and very quiet. The Hotel itself is something to see, you wont find anything else like it on Fremont. If we return to stay on Fremont, it will be here again. One note though, as with all the hotels throughout Vegas, stop at Walgreens and get a $9.99 coffee maker, as none of the hotels have them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!!”
Reviews.Author: MrKilowatt
Reviews.Content: A little late writing this review, but better late than never. We stayed at the Nugget for two nights after spending three nights on the strip at the Luxor. I have to say, that I think 3 and 2 nights are the perfect way to enjoy Vegas. We checked into the Nugget around two in the afternoon. The line was fairly long, it took about 45 minutes to get checked in. We were with another couple and asked to have rooms close to each other. The check in lady was very nice and got us rooms right acroos the hall from each other. The rooms were nice, clean, and just ordinary, but that is fine with us. The casino is big, and has everything most strip casinos have. The pool is awesome, with the shark tank and black jack on the pool deck. We had no problems at the Nugget and will defenitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower - WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: czechchick1976
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our trip for the Carson tower, but decided when we got there to opt for an upgrade to the new Rush tower. Carson is nice, but it is such a LONG walk to get to it from the casino. Am I ever glad we did. Definitely worth some extra money. It was absolutely gorgeous and very modern. Beautiful bathroom with extra large tub and rain shower head. Robes and slippers to use. Comfortable bed. HD flat screen tv w/ DVD player. Sectional sofa. Great view of the north end of the strip. Not to mention the location inside the resort is perfect (just right near the pool). Also, the check in area of the rush tower was so beautiful with the lighting and giant aquarium. We couldnt be more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: craiger702
Reviews.Content: I arrived Saturday night at 10:00PM from the airport. That was the only travel mistake I made. I took a taxi from the airport. Way too expensive. For the price I could have hired a town car. Next time either a limo or just take the shuttle. Checked in to the Rush tower and this weekend was packed so they upgraded me to the Gold Club room in the Gold tower. Reception was quick and Door man and receptionist were both great people. I had given my bag to Bill at the door. After realizing I would not be in the rush tower I told him what room I would be in and he said he would take care of it for me. I took 10 minutes and introduced myself to my new casino host. This is my first gambling trip to LV and it wont be my last. After she gave me an overview of the property I went upstairs to my floor and waiting for me was the Bellman (Ricardo) with my bag. I was very impressed the way I was treated having never been to LV. I am a AC and Connecticut casino player. You don't get treated like this in the east unless you are a diamond player. I like the fact that the dealers are on a first name basis. I felt like I was the king of the GN all three days I was there. I don't know why people complain about service. Not one person I came in contact with was anything but nice and very respectful and FUN to be around. One major difference between LV and AC is the alcohol. If you want to get trashed and throw away your money go for it. In AC they stop serving at 1 or 2 depending on the day of the week. I spent time downtown and on the strip. I didn't care for the smaller places downtown. The strip is what it is. Glitz and Glamour. It has it's place I walked the strip on Monday for 1 hour. Having people shove stuff at me as I walk all day is not my Idea of fun. My friend stayed at Harrahs in one of their Deluxe rooms. I went there and the room was 1/2 the size of mine. He and his girlfriend asked to meet my host and now they will be GN guests moving forward. The pool at the GN is fantastic. Next trip I will spend more time there. I like the fact that they have 2 separate areas for adults and families. Pool area fills up quickly. If I could give one tip that I noticed. whenever you go to a casino, If you play slots or table games, GET a players card and be rated. They do give out comps, Food, beverage, and rooms. It goes up from there for the serious players. I do not understand why people don't want to be rated. If you are going to give them your time and play at their casino why not take advantage of what they have to offer in return. I have been in the Mirage as well as Ballys and Caesars about 10 years ago in a more family vacation and limited gambling. The Golden Nugget in my opinion is the best. I only ate at the buffet one night and my friends and I ate at the buffet at Harrahs the other day. I liked them both. For the money the nuggets was a little better. Harrahs and their group offers the all day $30.00 deal which for some might really work out well. Next time I am at the GN I will definitly eat at the Grotto and Vic and Anthonys. They both looked great. My final piece of advice and you should think about this in all aspects of life, Treat people the way you want to be treated. Sometimes thing don't go as planned. If you are nice to a receptionist that doesn't have a room being nicer about it as opposed to getting upset with probably net you better results in the long run. If you are going to stay and play at a casino property. Ask for a casino host. They can usually help you. You dont need to be betting $100 per hand at a table game but at $25 or so you will be surprised at what you can get. If you remember nothing else from this review. 2 things, no matter how bad your life is somebody else is always worse off than you. Don't let little stuff bother you because somebody elses house burnt down or drifted away in a flood. You are partying or on Vacation in a great city. Enjoy yourself and have fun. I would like to thank the Golden Nugget for Three GREAT days in Vegas. You are truly a GREAT place with GREAT people. Keep it up I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “loved the golden nuggett”
Reviews.Author: DianeMn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early April. I have been to Vegas many times, and this is my second time staying downtown, and at the Nuggett. Room prices were fantastic. I booked air/hotel/car through my local travel agent (TravelSource in Minnesota). Valet parking.. which was nice. Easy quick check in, let us check in hours early. Rooms are beautiful and spacious. We were in the tower.. 2 double beds but very comfy. Large beautiful bathroom. Over all we really loved staying at this hotel. We didn't eat at any restaurants at the Golden Nugget so can't comment on them. Pool area is great (been there before), although it was too cool during our trip this time. We did eat at some good restaurants worth mentioning. Had breakfast at th California Hotel and Casino ( a few blocks off Freemont). Their buffett is excellent, and only $5.99- best breakfast buffet I have ever had in Vegas. It is small.. but the quality is excellent (all beverages included in that price). Ate dinner at the micro-brewery at the Four Queens, their pizza and beer are great. We traveled with our 13 year old and it was o.k. for him to eat up there. We went to the deli at the Golden Gate, and they would not allow children in their deli. However, went to the Freemont Casino for shrimp cocktails and they did allow him in their deli area. Also ate at the Main Street Station- few blocks off of Freemont. This is a huge sports bar/micro brewery. Very good food and inexpensive. Across from the Nugget at the Four Queens they have a "half -price/discount" booth for Vegas shows which is very convenient. Since we had our son with, we opted for a family show and went to the Mac King Comedy/Magic show at Harrah's. Tickets were only $18 discounted (3p.m .show). Very good show for the money, we all enjoyed. Overall.. Golden Nuggett and downtown are great places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, crappy service”
Reviews.Author: xyyzSF
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Gold Tower -- the rooms were very nice, with upscale touches. Pool, slide and shark tank were great. Downtown is not the best location, but OK. Service, as stated in many of the reviews, is really crappy -- the staff is snooty or indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters...”
Reviews.Author: d16rr702
Reviews.Content: Love the spa suites, very cool multi-level affair, perfectly appointed. One complaint, only a handful of old analog local channels on a beautiful 65" Come on, where's the HD !?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Gobucks79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days and enjoyed the entire facility. We were on the 15th floor, quiet, comfortable room with a safe and bathrobes. The staff were polite, helpful with directions/ideas. We wanted to stay off The Strip and enjoyed the atmosphere of Fremont Street. The pools were very nice-clean with plenty of towels. The only negative was about a 30-45 minute wait to check-in, but every day they were quite busy. Breakfast buffet was excellent. We had a car so didn't eat a lot of meals there. A short drive to the Hoover Dam and did a little hiking too.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lucylu_67
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room a month in advance. But it seems when we arrived they didn't have a room reserved. Said we would have to spend the first night in a smoking room and then move to one we reserved the next morning. No Way!! We refused and asked to see the manger. After all we paid extra for the room in the casino tower that we reserved. The manager gave us an "upgrade". Placed us in the mini-suite on the 16th floor where you have to use a computer card to enter the floor from the elevator. Well, the room turned out to be the room near the stairwell which is the smallest room on the floor. There was only two areas in the room.......... the sleeping/slash setting area with big screen TV and the bathroom. Granted the bathroom had a slate lined shower with slate flooring and a large mirror with a flat screen TV inset over the vanity with a wash basin bowl-type sink. But that was it!! We were insulted. There was one one straight back desk chair. Nothing else to sit on except the bed. We had to call down to ask for a second chair to be brought up so we would have somewhere for both of us to sit. We won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T USE THE PHONE”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a British Airways package for nine nights. Its more like an airport terminal than a hotel with people continually coming and going and taking ages to check in and out. There is nothing wrong with this hotel and equally there is nothing that would make me want to return. Everything was average. Would thoroughly recommend Pink Jeep tours (I did five of them), all of which were excellent and well worth the money. The Golden Nugget gives the impression of being totally mercenary and not worth the money. When I was due to fly back to the UK the flight was cancelled because of the Icelandic Volcano. I rang British Airways who fixed me up with another flight and another hotel as the Nugget was fully booked.(free of charge) the call took 53minutes which according to the AT&T website should have cost $79. The Golden Nugget charged me $222 which just about sums them up

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club VIP Rooms are Sharp - Literally”
Reviews.Author: Leaving_LostWages
Reviews.Content: Just completed a brief 3-night stay at the Golden Nugget. My review follows. We stayed in a Gold Club VIP room on the 17th floor in the Gold Tower. Check-in and check-out were super fast using the VIP lounge. No wait at all. A coupon book was given to us which included some great deals and freebies for the bars, buffets, restaurants, and other services. VIP rooms also come with buffet and coffee shop line passes - which we never had to use, and free access to the Spa and Internet. VIP rooms required key access in the elevator to reach the VIP floors. Elevators were fast during our stay. The room was clean and spacious, but very dark due to the color scheme, wood accents and furnishings. The king-size bed was comfortable, and the cleaning staff was timely and diligent. The room was quiet, since it faced the Rush Tower and mountain views (i.e., faced away from Fremont Street.) I recommend that you request the same if you're a light sleeper and/or retire early. The room, however, also had some considerable drawbacks. There was a lack of usable drawer space, and the closet was actually located in the bathroom, which we found to be highly inconvenient. The doors for the closet were the self-closing type, which was also a nuisance. The corners of the bed frame were sharp, and I actually cut my leg when I bumped into one. The bathroom fixtures were also of industrial design, with sharp edges and square corners on the faucets. The biggest problem in the bathroom though was the height of the step required to get in to and out of the bathtub and shower, and the shower head itself: it was a rainfall design, and had very low water pressure. Also, the TV that was in the mirror did not work, but that was not a big deal to us. Given the above, I'm not sure the amenities provided for a VIP room and the room itself is actually worth the price. We will definitely come back to the Nugget, but next time may try either a Rush Tower or standard room instead. Either way, we will definitely purchase VIP service, as that is a big time saver. As for the casino, the layout was somewhat confusing at first but easily learned by walking around and/or using the property map provided at check-in. The staff was very friendly. Waitress service was generally pretty quick. All of the standard games are here, along with the standard table limits for a downtown casino (depending on the time of day and number of gamblers). I saw a small keno lounge and a decent-sized sports book. There are a vast number of different types of slot and multi-game video poker machines available in the casino as well. There were a number of bars, all offering excellent drink selections (beer and well drinks) and video poker at the bar. Service at the bars we sat at was quick and friendly. We did not stop at any of the trendy bars or night spots on the property, so no comment on those. We ate at 3 of the restaurants: the Buffet, the Carson Street Cafe, and Lillies Asian Cuisine. Breakfast at the Buffet was good, cheap (with a 2 for 1 coupon) with varied selections. There were also 2 omelet stations as well. We had a comped dinner there as well, and overall it was good, again with a wide selection of offerings. We had a late-night meal and breakfast at the Carson Street Café, and both times the food and service was excellent, with decent prices for the meals. Finally, we had dinner at Lillies one evening, and although the restaurant was somewhat price, the menu and food was outstanding. We did not make use of the Spa, or the pool. The pool itself seemed interesting – with a Shark tank in the middle of it – but it also seemed a bit small. On the day I was intending on using the pool, a convention at the hotel had the entire area reserved for an event. I feel the VIP staff should have let us know this at check in to that we could have planned accordingly. If you are going to stay at the Nugget, or any other Las Vegas hotel for that matter that may host a convention, you may want to check first at http://www.pcap.com/lvconv.htm so you are aware of a potential competition for the hotel’s resources. All in all our stay was very pleasant and except for some minor annoyances, we will come back to the Nugget to stay and gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the price - Do your Homework!”
Reviews.Author: SantaDog
Reviews.Content: We came back to the Nugget as the price is great and we like the Fremont Street Experience as opposed to the Strip where it is just to chaotic for us. We experienced a line last year for check in and this year paid the $25 to get VIP check in which was awesome then we also go a card to jump the lines at every restaurant except Vic & Anthony's. We stayed in the Gold Tower as opposed to the Carson Tower last year. Rooms a bit nicer and more centrally located. We asked to be near an elevator and they were happy to take care of us. The Fremont Street Casino's are a lot "looser" and more fun to be at and the drink people come around every 5 minutes instead of every 2 hours on the strip and you can also play $3 or $5 Blackjack. The Fremont Street Experience Light Show is a lot of fun so take a camera or video camera. The new pool on the 3rd floor is nice as its adults only but it tends to get a bit windy up there. Restaurants - Red Sushi was great, Grotto was good for Italian, and Vic & Anthony's steaks are out of this world. IWe also checked out the new restaurant in the Rush Tower - can't think of the name, but seafood was good and appetizers were yummy. . Check out via the TV was easy and got my folio by e mail, no lines this way. Had a massage too and both my wife and I were pampered and were relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Golden Nugget was most enjoyable and the service was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Darlene77
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff from check-in to departure made every effort to ensure our stay was enjoyable. The rooms were tastefully decorated, with granite, and modern carpet and all the coordinates and bedding and linens of any 5 star major hotel. Our sleep was luxurious,and the hotel still had the character of old Las Vegas and that is what we love and remember. The rooms were spotless, and the maid service were polite and courteous. Valet service at the Hotel is second to none, and these guys "run". I would most definitely recommend The Golden Nugget for anybody who still has a heart for the good old days.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again”
Reviews.Author: melodysfs
Reviews.Content: It took 45 minutes to check in for a room that I had booked and paid for online. It took another 20 minutes to check out of the hotel. Didn't get any sleep because of noise all night. Walls are very thin and people were yelling in the halls throughout the night. I will never stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay so much, we extended it”
Reviews.Author: MissBugg
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Vegas, what you miss out on in terms of not being downtown is more than made up for by the great rooms. This feels like I imagined a Vegas hotel to be. It was quite plush with bathrobes in the rooms. The rooms themselves were great, really clean and comfortable. We enjoyed our time around the pool too. If I came back to Vegas, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Nuggie”
Reviews.Author: xzelda
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas. VERY nice rooms at inexpensive prices! Fremont Street was entertaining. Wonderful Sushi, Pool was amazing and all for 69.00 per night. Allready planning to return. Why stay on the strip if your looking for rest and relaxiation. It is worth a trip and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Same Story - Great Pool and Rooms Purely Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4Work
Reviews.Content: Pool was great, needs more seating but it is a smaller space so can't really do much about that. Rooms were great! Gold Tower is the way to go. The service was just terrible. 25 minutes to get a drink at the pool from a waitress. There was a time this weekend at The Hideout where there wasn't even a waitress there and the one bartender that was working was an idiot. Didn't get much better inside, no cocktail waitresses in sight and the bartender at one of bars where I was playing video poker tried to charge me for my beer (these have always been free if you were playing). When we go back in October, we will not be staying here again. It seems that the Golden Nugget has forgotten how to serve their customers, instead all they wanted to do was complain about how the economy was hurting tourism in Vegas (you would think that they would have tried better to impress the people that actually did stay there). All in all, great pool and rooms - but for sure gamble anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't dismiss staying downtown..this hotel is better than a lot on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: missie22
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas over 10 times, we always stay on the Strip and only ever visit downtown...but after my last trip I thought that the Golden Nugget looked like a really nice place so this time we stayed ! Some of downtown can be a bit run down in comparison to the Strip - but it is reflected in the prices, but the Golden Nugget is definately an exception. We stayed in the new Rush Tower and the room was just fantastic. Massive bathroom with twin sinks, a rain shower and a tub. A huge bed, massive flat screen TV, DVD player, Ipod dock and the usual mini bar etc, plus a corner sofa lounge space - and all really modern. I would say the room quality is on a par with Caesars and other Strip hotels ! The casino has a really nice atmosphere too and is really well kept...the pool area looked fantastic - it was a bit cold to try it out, but we had a look around and although looks a little crowded with the beds close together, the pool and the slide that goes through the big fish tank was great. We had a great meal in Vic and Anthony's steakhouse and it was the most amazing steak ever...done in butter and just melt in the mouth !! We also used the Spa, and although it doesn't have the modern feel of some of the ultra spas on the strip - it was really nice and the treatments were fantastic. We would defintately stay here again, my advice if you want to get the best of Vegas and are staying for four days or more would be to do a couple of nights downtown at the Golden Nugget and enjoy all that downtown has to offer and then move and stay a couple of nights on the strip - that way you get the best of both worlds. It's what we did this time and it was the best trip of the ten ever....plus we got married !

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, the best downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamsouz
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights with wife here, airport shuttle bus drops you off on 1st street back entrance . very far away from check in counter especially with all your luggage, long check in line, not much of a greet at the desk , Not a Warm welcome, did not receive any coupon book once received room key it was another hike back to the elevators of the carson tower, constant being stopped at Desk opposite Starbucks coffee trying to get you to sign up for The Grandview timeshare tour, after a while it gets annoying.great location for Downtown. i stayed in better hotels and stayed in worse, no place is 100% perfect. If i go again I would stay here or stay at the Strip. no other place Downtown either

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New Pool & Tower; Blah: Everything Else!”
Reviews.Author: Etak214
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Las Vegas & and my stay at the Golden Nugget. Firstly, the hotel is not located near "The Strip." Yes, its reasonable but when you want to travel to LAS VEGAS- this is not where you want to stay. It is located on Fremont Street; Downtown Las Vegas. There is about ten other hotels near this one but other than that- its desolate & not very safe alone. It is located relatively close to the outlets (whihc we walked to one day). The hotel itself just built a brand new tower & pool to go with it. THIS MAKES THE HOTEL! The new tower has gorgeous rooms & has an awesome adult only pool called The Hideout. The larger "family" pool is located just below it on the ground floor of the hotel and is just as nice but the chairs are very close together and one side gets the sun in the morning & the other side in the afternoon. The Hideout pool is phenomenal; quiet; waitress service with reasonable drinks and adults only. =) (Hint: Get chairs as far left as you can when you walk in- those have the sun the longest on that deck.) We ate at the Carson St Cafe & Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. Vic & Anthony's was to die for; I had filet mignon that melted in my mouth. The hotel staff were fairly courteous and helpful- didn't have one complaint about them. My parents enjoy spending time downtown & get comped for almost everything. If you get comped- go for it. If you want to experience Las Vegas- book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: FunFilledTravel
Reviews.Content: I always worry checking into Fremont Strip Hotels... This time I was taken back from the moment Valet opened my door!!! Entered with a grand entrance with a giant fish tank in front of me... the entire place has been renovated and done VERY tastefully... obviously we walked to every hotel, and Golden Nugget was THE BEST!!! Upon Check in, no line... very courteous Host, and gave us a room with a strip view!! Walking through the casino to the elevators was nice... looking at how great this place was in every direction!! Went to the room, was very impressed with the room!! Only downfall was the window a/c, but it was surprisingly quiet, and kept the room a very comfortable temp vs. turning on and off, on and off... . Restroom was beautiful too... just wish there was more water pressure... but not so bad that I was bothered by it. Went down to the Casino walked through the pool area WOW!!! Laid on one of the lounge BEDS, and a waitress came RIGHT UP!! Gave her a nice tip to start it off right, and she came around every 15-20 mins like clock work. The pool area they have is very resort like... nothing you would expect on Fremont Street. Walking the strip was fun and exciting... then it came time to eat... went back to the golden nugget where we had Teppanyaki!! Oh the cook was amazing!! Did a great show, and cooked the food to PERFECTION!! You MUST eat here... even if staying somewhere else!! All in all!! BEST HOTEL ON FREMONT STREET!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice pool shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: mooreuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, has recently been refurbished by the look of things, and the rooms in the carson tower were pleasant. We found the staff, particularly at reception, to be unhelpful and bordering on rude when we checked in or asked questions. We found that most of the ground floor has a strong smell of stale cigarette smoke which obviously comes from the casino floor. Our room in the carson tower was a bit noisy, with the sound of deliveries occasionally waking us. We also were woken at 4am as room service incorrectly tried to deliver breakfast to us. European travellers beware: breakfast is not included. There's plenty of choice if you want to eat in, we tried the cafe, the buffet and the Italian restaurant. We found the food in the cafe somewhat bland and of a poor quality, and experienced rude waiting staff. The Asian and the Italian restaurants were good and offered reasonable value. The breakfast buffet was acceptable, but beware, it gets very busy after 9am. We enjoyed the swimming pool, in our view the hotel's best feature. Be warned if you plan to enjoy the sun get to the pool early to make sure you get a lounger. All in all, it felt like they were trying to charge us for every extra, for example, there is no free wifi, it costs 12.99 usd or the gym 20 usd.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: poohbearlives
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel- got upgraded to 2 suites on check-in, from "cheap" rooms, at no extra cost! Gold Tower suites, spacious, comfy beds. Small but awesome pool (get out there early to get loungers- lots of people holding spots for later by putting shoes etc. on them, very rude) with aquarium in the middle, very cool. Chart House dinner was great, Red Sushi was good, Carson Cafe good and super-friendly staff at all restaurants. Cocktail service in casino was excellent, slots paid enuf to keep me busy for 3 days without breaking the bank. Easy video check-out in room, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: PDXBUFF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Rush Tower during the first week of March for four nights and five days. The check in process went smoothly and we settled into our room which was on the 15th floor. The Rush Tower is non smoking which is nice. The room was of decent size with all the amenities including a 42 inch flat screen tv. The hotel has numerous restaurants and bars and the casino is huge. There is a swimming pool with plenty of lounge chairs plus a large hot tub and seating area with a fire pit. The pool also has a water slide and an adjoining shark tank with real sharks and other fish. This was my first stay in downtown Vegas and I found the Fremont Street scene to be quite an experience. I enjoyed our stay in this hotel and the service was excellent, the room was quiet and I will gladly go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Our 'gamble' was a 'win' at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: MStangle
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, we decided to take a ‘gamble’ and try staying downtown instead of The Strip during this trip to Las Vegas. The week-day rate for a room in Golden Nugget’s new Rush Tower was very reasonable and the pictures (on their web site) of the accommodations looked inviting. Upon checking in, we were not disappointed and in fact were truly impressed with the entire stay. The Rush Tower has it’s own check-in desk, which we didn’t know, so we stood in a short line at the main check-in desk, while the other desk would have probably checked us in immediately. (Be sure to park or ask the taxi driver to drop you off at the Carson Street entrance if you’re staying in the Rush Tower) Besides a friendly valet and quick service, the front desk for the Rush Tower has the gorgeous 75,000 gallon tropical aquarium from the Chart House as their backdrop. There is no traipsing through the casino to get to the elevator to take you up to your room, it’s just around the corner. Our room was incredibly clean, comfortable and well appointed with plenty of amenities. The décor was elegant, with rich woods, a flat screen TV, iPod docking station, leather sofas and handsome lighting. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The double-sink bathrooms were huge -- plenty of vanity space -- and a Raintree shower head that was wonderful. Everything was fresh and new -- ideally it’s a ‘look’ they can maintain. We have only stayed this one time in the Rush Tower, so these are the only accommodations I can (highly) recommend. The room was outstanding, and at a great value. The renovated pool - now called ‘The Tank’ is a highlight of the property. In fact, it was recently listed by Budget Travel as “One of the World’s Coolest Hotel Pools”. In the center of the pool is a 3-story shark tank (all kinds of tropical fish!), a 3-story water slide and colorful private cabanas (on the second floor). There are wonderful lounge chairs, tanning beds and on the third floor there’s a quieter pool with a bar (for adults). On the ground floor you can enjoy a drink from the H20 bar, sit in the huge Jacuzzi, or relax next to the handsome fire pit. (Plenty of lounge chairs and sun beds here, too!) There are also several Black Jack tables poolside. When we were there, the tables had a $5 minimum. The location definitely reminds you of where you are…in the old part of ‘downtown’…not on The Strip. This can be a pro or a con, depending on what you desire from your visit. This does not have the glitz and glamour of The Strip and it can get a bit seedy, the further you get from The Golden Nugget. That being said, there is security is everywhere. CASINOS: There are many hotels with minimum $5 (or less!) Black Jack tables -- even at night, with non-stop (complimentary) cocktail service. (this was during the week, so I can’t vouch for the table minimum on the week-ends or during peak season) Although the Golden Nugget looks totally renovated, some of the other casinos are pretty shabby. RESTAURANTS: There are plenty of choices of restaurants. The two we chose were inside the Golden Nugget -- Vic & Anthony’s and The Grotto (Italian) -- and both were very good. Besides those two, there’s also the Chart House, Lillie’s Asian Cuisine (with Teppanyaki tables), a classic Vegas buffet, Red Sushi, Carson Street Café and a 24/7 “Grille”. There are several wonderful restaurants nearby that have carried a great reputation for years. (Hugo’s Cellar, being one!) ENTERTAINMENT: There are a few places where you can catch a show. Gordie Brown is one (at The Nugget)…and he has been recognized as Entertainer of the Year. The Rat Pack show at The Plaza Hotel gets great reviews and is just a block or two away. And speaking of being “a block or two away”…that’s a definite ‘pro’ of staying downtown. Rather than taking you ten minutes just to reach the front door of the hotel/casino where you’re staying, in ten minutes you can be two casinos away! Another source of evening entertainment is the Fremont Street Experience -- high tech wonderment at its best. It’s free entertainment overhead (fantastic light show to music), for length of about 5 football fields, and it’s free!) If all of this bores you, you can take a cab ride or catch The Deuce (cheap, double-decker bus) to The Strip for more options on how to spend your money! In summary of our ‘gamble’ to stay in downtown Vegas, we came out a ‘winner’ in every regard and would return again to the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, smoke-free”
Reviews.Author: janeauten
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas, inlcuding MGM Grand, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, etc., but have never had a better experience than in the Golden Nugget, Carson Tower. The room was amazingly spacious, meticulously clean, beautiful. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. We were on the 18th floor and although there was briefly noise from the concert & light show below, it didn't bother us. This is the first casino I have stayed in that I didn't have to walk across the smoke-filled casino to get to the elevators to our room. I was grateful not to have to walk that gauntlet.

Reviews.Title: “don't bother to stay there”
Reviews.Author: screamdream
Reviews.Content: First, we did not feel welcome, maybe because we're canadians? The shuttle from the airport drops you of one end nowhere near the registration area and no one to welcome or guide you, so we had to figure it ourselves, the registry attendant was no very welcoming attitude, lame, yet we felt brushed off, then she point it out to just turn left straight down where we'd have the elevators, but way beyond then just around the corner. Finnaly made it up, the entry door cards only worked when they wanted to work, somtime first try, sometime3 or 4 times whenever. We could of bet on this alone, maybe it was part of the show. No, do not disturb signs so next morning knock knock on our door to do the room, one day we arrived at 3pm and the room wasn't even done yet. Everything has a price for usage, not even free internet, pricy, shame on a city where technology is developped. Food at certain restaurants was ok some pricy, some not so pricy, some beyond reason, Location was fair but far from the other entertaiment centers. need to buy 3 day pass to ride the deuce (all access) gets pretty crowed mid way up the strip. We won't be back in vegas, but if we did, we'd get up at circus circus or around that area mid way, hoping they welcome you better.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean rooms in Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: gogirlWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Golden Nugget in the new Rush Tower. However, if you don't stay up very late, you won't sleep if you're in a room facing Fremont Street. The loud music goes on forever. They were so kind to change us to a room on the other side of the hotel, and we slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower East End Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: Kansas38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try downtown, traveling with friends who prefer downtown to the strip because of their gambling preferences. We originally booked a $99/night junior corner suite in the new Rush Tower. I prefer a separate tub from the shower, so we opted to upgrade to the East End Jr. Suite. This reservation is not available on their website or through an agent. You have to call direct to the GN for the upgrade because there are so few available. We paid an additional $50/night for the upgrade. It was SO worth it! We were in room 9215 and stayed 03/28 thru 03/30. Front desk at the Rush Tower presented a line and 1 attendant. The Chart House aquarium was in the backdrop, so at least you had something pleasant and relaxing to calm the frustration. The young man helping us was very pleasant. We arrived around 8AM and had our luggage held until we could check in. Because we had a suite, we were allowed to return to the VIP check-in. We returned around noon and our room was ready. VIP attendant was not friendly at all. I think she thought SHE was the VIP. It could've just been a very stressful day for her, working her shift on her feet in those heels and skin tight dress. A girl can only take so much for the sake of appearance. She was very pretty, so we'll stick with the good. Would've been great had she not opened her mouth to speak. Our suite was incredibly clean and amenities that satisfied our preferences. East End suites are 150sqft larger than the Jr. Corner Suites, overlooking the pool area. The bathroom has a huge walk in closet, large tiled rainfall shower, extra large soaking tub (easily fits 2), 2 separate sinks/vanities, and closed off commode. There is a table with 4 chairs, sectional leather sofa, and large flat screen in a sitting area. King sized bed, dresser and another large flat screen to watch while in bed. Our bed was very comfy. Turn down service was provided. Housekeeping did a fabulous job and was tipped accordingly. We invited our friends up to our room for some down time and we purchased a movie. The sofa sectional seating was very comfortable for 4. The pics on the GN website are exactly what you will get. It is still fresh and new and hopefully they will work diligently to maintain that. I would return to this suite downtown at GN in a heartbeat, probably before booking again at THEhotel, but the locations are apples to oranges. Downtown is old school, Rat Pack, Vintage Vegas, designed for hard core gamers, but not so much the experience of high end shopping and shows that we do enjoy - but that all being just a $25 cab ride away. Also, far fewer kids downtown than at strip resorts. It is a bit seedy once you step out of the Nugget onto Fremont Street, but I never felt unsafe. Lots of neon and old retired signage from what the strip was eons ago which is pretty cool, old Vegas charm. Security is everywhere and there are stages at either end of the Fremont Experience with continuous performances. I noticed maintenance workers cleaning along Fremont and I have to say, it was quite clean and unlittered, well maintained. The strip is actually far dirtier I believe. It's really nice to walk under the Fremont canopy from resort to resort with doors open to the street, always a place awaiting me on a $3-$5 minimum blackjack table with non-stop cocktail service. Good times and great fun. We did visit Wynn while there for an intimate night with Garth Brooks. What a performance, catering to only 1500 ticket holders. Stories of his childhood and songs/artists that influenced him along the way. Felt like I was sitting on his living room sofa, listening to him reminisce and belt out tunes from Bob Seger to Elton John to George Straitt, and many of his own. It was 2 1/2 hours of Garth, all accoustic, probably a once in a lifetime opportunity. When we picked up our tickets in a meeting room at Wynn, we were offered complimentary beverages and we were given complimentary passes to the buffet at Wynn with VIP seating - BONUS! It was a good night. A downtown dining experience this trip worth talking about; Hugo's Cellar - THE BEST dining experience we've had in Vegas, and we've had many. It's a total escape, very quiet, very romantic, superb service, and a great overall experience. We had so much fun gambling downtown, mostly amongst 40+ age range of people who would sit at the tables for hours together. Servers were very attentive and working hard for their tips. I don't think 20 minutes passed between server visits to the tables. They were very pleasant and they spoke proper English which I appreciate, as did the majority of dealers. A nice change for the better, comparted to the strip. Altogether a far superior gaming experience, compared to that of the strip. Hubby took 3rd in a poker tournament at GN and walked away smiling. Another good night! Golden Nugget Rush Tower is the only way to do Downtown Vegas and it is a far greater value than the same class/star rating resorts on the strip. Highly recommend! Oh yeah, one last thing worth putting out there - GN buffet makes Steve Wynn's momma's award winning recipe of bread pudding, worth the buffet price for that alone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Not a 4 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KonaMona2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget this past weekend hoping to have a fun, relaxing weekend. THE GOOD: The pool shark aquarium and the Chart House wall aquarium were interesting. I also liked our spacious room and the bath products stocked in our bathroom. THE BAD: Front Desk is poorly managed. We were welcomed by a 45 minute check-in line Friday afternoon. I observed the same l-o-n-g front desk lines on Saturday and Sunday as well. Why is such a long wait necessary when you have reservations? We stayed in the new Rush Tower where all rooms are supposed to be non-smoking. Maybe the rooms are non-smoking, but the hallway leading to our room was poorly ventilated and smoky. The toilet in our room greeted us by threatening to overflow on first flush. All tower rooms are also supposed to have 42” plasma screen televisions. Our room had an old square tube type T.V. We stayed on the 9th floor and had window view of an opposing tower wall. Our room lacked a mini-bar or refrigerator. I asked around, evidently none of the rooms in the Tower have mini-bars or refrigerators. DO NOT stay at this hotel unless you like lots of loud music being blared 24/7. Music blares perpetually in the casino’s, restaurants, hallways, elevators and at the pools. I went outside by the pools to sit in the sun, read and relax. Impossible. I couldn’t even hear myself think, no less read because there was no escaping the blasting music. After I gave up trying to read, I tried to strike up a conversation with the person sitting in the chase lounge next to mine. Neither of us could hear what the other was saying because the music was so loud. The only place in the entire hotel I could find quiet was in my room. If you like to lay in the sun, this is not a good hotel to do it. The main pool is surrounded by tall towers. This means that if you find a sunny spot, it wont’ be sunny long. As the sun moves, the buildings cast long shadows. The small Hideout Pool has the ubiquitous blaring music , but is better sunning pool. Regarding the hotel’s Sunday Champagne Brunch, one word: AVOIDABLE! The food was not freshly prepared. Salads were soggy. The shrimp cocktail looked and tasted like it had just been thawed from a 100 year freeze. Entrees were either greasy, fatty and under cooked or way over cooked. The prime rib was so raw that many people complained and brought their meat back to be cooked properly. The bacon was burnt. The only fresh fruit served at the entire buffet was whole apples in a bowl and cantaloupe. I skipped the dessert table entirely because everything else was so bad. Finally, the casino: Big, noisy, smoky, & crowded. I guess this is to be expected in many Las Vegas hotel casinos. The machines are tight. You will be a loser if you play slots here. No one I talked with had any luck with the slots. Redeeming gambling chips, slot receipts and Keno tickets is not convenient because the Golden Nugget keeps their casino cashiers discretely tucked away. My friends and family members walked to the Four Queens and had way better luck in their casino.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget needs to do more to live up to its self appointed high standards.”
Reviews.Author: Betsey71
Reviews.Content: The wait for check in took FOREVER! They had one clerk on a Sunday morning. The hallways and rooms are dark. We ended up checking out early because my kids did not like the room atmosphere. With the exception of the pool, which is awesome, there is nothing much for children to do and the TV channels even reflect this (no Nickelodeon/Disney, etc). The casual dining options for families with small children are not great. There is still a lot of riff raff downtown on Freemont Street which does not feel safe with kids at night.

Reviews.Title: “Getting married and vacationing at the Golden Nugget Hotel - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ZippyDavis
Reviews.Content: This review is for anyone considering getting married/staying at the Golden Nugget Hotel in Las Vegas. I apologize for the long length of the review but I know I would have really appreciated having this sort of review before we booked our 6 day wedding\vacation at the Golden Nugget. We were married there in mid Feb 2010. All in all, we are happy with our decision to marry and vacation at the Golden Nugget. I will give a detailed review of my entire experience below, ranking everything on a 1 thru 10 score, but just to sum it up – our overall experience was positive. I would rank it an 8.5 out of 10. My individual ratings of each item are: Reservations –rated a 10, check-in – 6, wedding – 10, room – 10, gambling – 4, salon – 10, hotel staff – 10. First, we looked at many hotels and chapels in Las Vegas but decided on the Golden Nugget because it was so close to the license bureau, it was reasonably priced, we wanted something that was nice and not cheesy for the ceremony, we wanted a place that would likely be around for a while so we could revisit on anniversaries, and we’d heard the gambling odds were a little better downtown. Reservations: We made room reservations via the internet (room and air was booked as a package deal.). We used promo code which was to include several hotel perks such as a coupon book. We were booked for 5 nights into a standard king room in the new rush tower. A few days before we were to leave for Vegas, I called the hotel’s 1800 number because I realized I needed a fridge in the room to store some medication. They said no problem. Before hanging up they offered me a VIP package for $28. They said this included VIP check-in, no waiting in line at any of the hotel’s restaurants, a guarantee of a king size bed in our room, and some other perks. We took this offer, and they charged my credit card. See more about the VIP offer below. We had no problems with the reservation process so I give it a 10. Check-in: Once at the hotel, they did not have us listed for the VIP check in, but went ahead and let us check in anyway at the VIP check-in desk. I had to ask for the coupon book (it was not offered) which was supposed to be included in our promo. I also had to ask for the “go to the front of the line” card which allowed us to skip the line at the hotel’s restaurants – again, it was not offered – I had to ask for it. I asked how much it would cost to upgrade our room and was told that since we were in the rush tower, we were already upgraded (a standard king room in the rush tower was considered an upgrade over the regular Golden Nugget rooms). Since we'd paid an extra $28 for an easy check-in, I was a little disappointed that they didn’t have our information ready and that they didn’t offer us the perks that were supposed to be included in our package – I had to ask for them. But even so, we were checked-in within 15 minutes or so and on our way to the room. I rated the check-in a 6 because there was just a lot of room for improvement. Room: Our standard king room in the rush tower was absolutely gorgeous. It was just perfect with a sofa/couch and flat screen TV. It was a large room, extremely clean and very modern – I can’t say enough about how pleased we were with it. In fact, after seeing our room I was glad they had not encouraged me to upgrade during check in. The fridge was not in the room when we got there but just a quick phone call to the front desk remedied that. I rate the room at a 10. I just don’t see how it could have been any better. VIP – this turned out to be a little bargain. There were lines at just about all of the hotel’s restaurants and we were able to walk past everyone waiting to be seated and go to the head of the line. It seemed rude the first couple of times that we did it, but it turned out to be such a time savor that we both agreed it was worth the money and we’d purchase it again next time. Gambling – The casino wasn’t too smokey or full of bad smells the way some casinos are. We’d heard that the gambling odds at this hotel are excellent. I’d beg to differ. It took us less than an hour to lose our entire daily gambling budget on the slots in the hotel’s casino that first day. We thought it was just an off day but the same thing happened again the next day and the next. However, they did have my favorite slot machine: the “sex and the city” slot machine. It is just a bunch of fun and I was able to play for a long while on it before it too, ate my money.
