We continued gambling at the Golden Nugget throughout our 6 day stay at the hotel but never got ahead or even close to breaking even on any given day. And just walking through the casino, we noticed that we never heard anyone yelling out excitedly they way you normally hear people that are winning on slots. There were plenty of loud people at the table games, but we weren’t playing table games for the most part. So even though we lost a bunch, I still give the gambling at this casino a 4 out of 10 because we had a so much fun gambling there and the air smelled a bit cleaner than at some of the other downtown casinos. Salon - Two days before the wedding I went to the hotel salon to have a spray-on tan. It was reasonably priced and turned out beautiful. They recommended doing the tan a couple of days before the wedding so that there will be time to fix any spots that need touching up before the wedding. The salon also did my hair and make-up on my wedding day. I have long hair – to the middle of my back. The salon used a curling iron to make long ringlet curls in the back (which took over an hour) and then a swept up-do look for the front. My makeup looked natural and beautiful. The total price for the tan, hair and make up was somewhere around $160 - $200 (depending on how much you tip) and totally worth it. They made me feel and look like a pampered princess, so I give the salon a 10 out of 10 rating. It just couldn’t have been nicer or better. Wedding – We were able to walk to the marriage license bureau from the hotel. We went around 10:30 am and we were in and out within 30 minutes. We took our wedding clothes to the front desk to be pressed the day before our wedding. They delivered our pressed clothes to our room that night which was nice. Silke (the hotel’s wedding coordinator) did a wonderful job. We purchased the $299 wedding package from the hotel. On the day of our wedding, Silke, along with the minister and the photographer were on time, ready and waiting for me to arrive at the chapel. The minister was lovely and very professional. He’d obviously done thousands of wedding ceremonies. The chapel was a medium sized room and was decorated tastefully. It really was perfect for any sort of small wedding. The ceremony lasted around 20 minutes and was perfect. Although 6 or 8 photos came with our package, the photographer took almost a hundred. We ended up buying all the photographs he took. He took photos before the ceremony, during and after and also took multiple photos of the entire family. It really documented our special day wonderfully. I give the hotel’s wedding experience a 10 out of 10. Again, I don’t see how it could have been any better. Note – the minister has to turn in paperwork to the county clerk documenting your wedding before you are allowed to order your final marriage certificate. I think he has up to 10 days to do this. On the 9th day after we returned home, our documentation still wasn’t there. I called and left a message for the minister and within hours the documentation showed up. I’m guessing he probably waits until he has several to drop off to avoid multiple trips to the county clerk’s office – which makes sense. At the wedding, you might want to just ask him when to expect your paperwork to be filed so you have an idea of when to expect it. Reception – We only had 5 family members with us for the wedding. We had reservations at “The Grotto” restaurant (inside the Golden Nugget) for lunch after the wedding. The Grotto allowed our guests to drop off our wedding gifts there before the wedding so they didn’t have to carry them around the hotel. Once we were seated for lunch, the Grotto brought out a beautiful rolling table that contained our wedding cake and all of the wedding gifts. We ordered a wedding cake from the hotel bakery (white cake with buttercream frosting). It was a two tiered cake ($100) and we ordered a cake topper for it ($30). The cake was gorgeously decorated – it looked like something from a magazine. It was just so incredibly pretty. However, the butter cream icing tasted a lot like Crisco with a tiny bit of sweetener and the cake itself was extremely dry and tasted like maybe it had been frozen at some point. Although, it should be noted that this might have been sort of our fault since the hotel offered us the option of having a fruit filling (between the cake’s layers) but we opted for just icing. The fruit filling might have made the cake a bit less dry. But as far as how the cake looked – it was absolutely beautiful and well worth the $100 price. Again, all in all we really enjoyed our stay and wedding at the Golden Nugget. and would definately recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Charlie-Lucy
Reviews.Content: We have only stayed on the strip before so we definitely thought we were "rolling the dice" by staying downtown. What a great decision, the Golden Nugget was a fabulous spot and Fremont St. was a blast. We stayed in a Suite in the new Rush Tower and the room was outstanding. Only thing missing was a coffee maker. If you go make sure you go see "Drop Dead Ted", the bartender at the Charthouse Bar. He won't steer you wrong when you are looking for someplace to eat. Ask him about Casa D'Amore.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: Pntlvr
Reviews.Content: I pulled up to Valet and there he was, DREW! always so happy, friendly and smiling! He remembered me from last July! At check-in, the gal was very pleasant and professional and helpful too! I never slept better in the 3 days I was there because their beds are the best! (and I want one!) The G.N. is centrally located within walking distance to other properties. Step out one door, and you can walk the Fremont Street Experience. I highly recommend this place to other travelers, and will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Suite in New Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: JJBZ3
Reviews.Content: The new Rush Tower has a separate entrance from the Golden Nugget Casino. Checked in and the elevators are right next to the desk. Didn't have to walk through the casino to get to the rooms. Big Plus! The suite was nice and roomy with a pleasant decor. My 17" laptop fit in the in-room safe! Finally a hotel that got it right!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Downtown”
Reviews.Author: goingblonde
Reviews.Content: This is by far the nicest hotel downtown. We had a special rate and took advantage. The pool shark tank is a must see, and the rooms are very nice-the only thing that is a big negative for me is no coffee maker in the room. yes they have a Starbucks downstairs and they have room service but i like my coffeee before i get dressed to go out of the room, and i actually think Starbucks is well over priced.As is room service. Most of the cocktail waitresses are very nice and come around often--one that was in the Keno room was pretty rude -her name was Dianne.She really must have been having a bad day :( I would stay again with a good rate but not pay the regular rates only because we go about 3 times a year and i am fine to stay somewhere that is not nearly as nice as long as it is clean and i feel safe. First time visitors to downton shoukl stay if they can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 21st Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: EatatRalphs
Reviews.Content: On 3/10 My father and I checked into this hotel to celebrate my 21st birthday... Upon arriving we were informed that the room type we had reserved had been oversold and no rooms were available... The front desk agent then gave us the option of having either one of the new Rush tower rooms or a 1 bedroom suite since it was my birthday. We took the suite and wow it couldnt have been nicer for 60 bucks a night! I worked for the Ritz Carlton company and nw wor for another luxury hotel chain and wow! Trust me these rooms rival those of Ritz and other 5 diamond hotels... I will be going back this weekend to check out the new Rush Tower! Cant Wait... and do yourself a favor and stay at the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Jonnyfootballhero
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the new Rush Tower. The rooms are modern, spacious and have all amenities you would expect like very comfortable (!!!) beds, big screen TV with DVD-Player, two phones, shower with tub, seperate toilet etc. There is no fridge in the room, so have to cool your drinks with ice cubes. The service is kinda lame. We waited about 20 min for check in and about 45 min before our luggage was brought to our room, check-out was very impersonal. The pool with the shark tank and waterslide are great fun! We tried the all-you-can-eat buffet for dinner. It costs about 20 bucks and is worth the money if you eat three courses. Be aware that the hotel is located in Downtown and you have to walk about 20 min to reach the north end of the Strip. So, if you are looking for a "Las Vegas-Style" hotel in Downtown and expect not too much service The Golden Nugget is a good and value for money place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: mtmary29
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget for a business conference and I came away very impressed. The service was great, my king sized room was quite large, and the ambiance of the place wasn't as tacky as I thought it was going to be. Despite the cold weather and the distance from the strip I would say the golden nugget was a great location for an event.

Reviews.Title: “What keeps bringing us back!”
Reviews.Author: MikenMind
Reviews.Content: We love Vegas but we especially love the Golden Nugget! This was not our first time staying here, and we were quickly reminded why we love to come back! We feel we get MORE than what we are paying for from the GN. The GN, along with all the other hotels on Fremont are still quite large but not NEARLY as large as the hotels on the Strip. So navigating around the hotel is pretty easy, you don't have to walk far to get to food, a bathroom, or your room elevator. Then there is Fremont. Small YET large & ALWAYS a party! We love the small town feel that comes along. Not to mention drinks & food are MUCH cheaper down here. By staying at GN we are left with more money for other things such as gambling. Which we don't do much of, but sitting down at a slot on Fremont & taking the chances to win get you great timely drink service so even if you lose it was worth it! We checked out Gold Diggers which was a first for us. We like how big it was & made sure to get there early enough to get a table on the balcony overlooking Fremont & under the canopy. The drinksthere were about $8 which was more than we wanted to spend, but they were VERY strong! The music as great. Oh & they had heaters on the balcony to keep you warm from the chilly spring nights. This was also our first time seeing the new pool on the 3rd floor. AMAZING! We spent nearly every day here. Not only because our trip was blessed with nice weather but it was pretty cool! The infinity affect was nice, the bar was even better, and the beds were comfortable. Not that the beds below aren't, but it was also really cool that kids weren't allowed up there. They were also cool about drinking in the pool, which from our experience is not the case at most the strip pools. Another thing we love is having the option of fancy or fastfood dining SO close. We got the chance to enjoy the new Chart House in the Rush tower which was TO DIE FOR! We were seated right along the 70,000 gallong tank & recieved amazing service. The food, well lets just say we had to force ourselves not to go back EVERY NIGHT!!! It was spendy but still much cheaper than what you would pay for that experience on the strip. We also enjoyed the Grotto. Again, pretty darn good! Our room was decent along with our experience with the hotel staff. We learned that the higher floors in the Carson/South tower are updated. We unfortunately got stuck in a line during check in and then found out the type of room we requested was no longer available nor was an upgrade. They said we could try to switch the next day but when the next day came we weren't up to switching and we kind of enjoyed each having a bed to ourselves! We were extremely dissappointed to find out we couldn't even PAY for an extended stay & got a little fired up when we found a condom wrapper on the floor during our room sweep before check out---that was not ours! We were also irritated that there was no free wi-fi. It is 2010 people! Why not???? Besides all that though, we had an AMAZING trip & look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful suite, close to most and away from crowded strip”
Reviews.Author: cyndimoore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Spring Break with 13 and 17 yr old...had 2 bedroom suite--very reasonable and awesome rooms---loved Fremont Street...and the Italian rest here at hotel...kids loved the waterslide through the shark tunnel...and hot tub...would def. stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: sdahl
Reviews.Content: Our party had 3 rooms reserved, two of the rooms received early check in and the third one was not available until 5:30! The rush tower is impressive. The only thing missing from the room was a fridge. We were denied late check out in the morning, a little disappointing. Particularly to the couple who was unable to have their room until 5:30. Pool area was beautiful, chlorine very strong in the hot tub. Felt fairly safe downtown. Pay attention to advertised dinner specials, usually have time restriction like not available after 6:30. I wouldn't spend my whole time in this area, I prefer the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravelToMars
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights and would certainly recommend this place to others. However, the positive review is also influenced of the good rates we obtained (approx. 50 $/night; booked 4 months in advance). The hotel is situated in downtown Las Vegas, approx. 20 minutes busride (the Deuce, 3$ oneway) from the strip. The room we had was HUGE, clean and quiet. It was too chilly to use the pool when we were there, but it looked great, and the shark-tank is a nice touch. Also, as most Las Vegas hotels, parking was free. The only drawbacks were: no refrigerator in the room, a very small safe, and no free wi-fi. Internet access was 12.98 $/24 hrs. However, even with these drawbacks, I had a wonderful stay at the nugget, and find it a good value hotel to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Goldan Nugget a Wonderful old Vegas RESORT!!!”
Reviews.Author: canmannyc
Reviews.Content: just stayed at GN 03/06-03/10 great stay as usual!!! stayed in their new non-smoking Rush Tower anyone stating the rooms being smokey should stay Rush Tower dont be such a cheapskate pay a few $ more and get the non smoking environment you want also who brings their family to Vegas except for the Excaliber(kiddy land) LOL if you want a business hotel stay the Wynn or Trump Tower dont bad mouth a great hotel cause your not smart enough to check out the alternatives!!! also most people that complain about the front desk usually have other issues and because the front desk doesnt bend over backwards and kiss their u know what they are uncooperative or poor Ive stayed at the Golden Nugget for over 30 yrs and never had front desk issues If you want to stay at an excellent Vegas hotel stay GN leave the kids home and also u got business stay at the Trump dont blaime your problems on the GN

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Voluntarily Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: tgibbons14
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Golden Nugget for four days and I'm surprised by the number of positive reviews. I didn't find that much to like about it. Pros: - Clean - Nice pool area Cons: - Everything smells like smoke, including our non-smoking room. The entire first floor including the lobby and restaurants has a very strong smoke smell. - Small double beds - Poor value - you pay extra for Internet ($12.95/day/room/computer) and fitness center ($20/visit). "Business Center" is pay by the minute computers - $0.50/min and $1/b&w page printed. Restaurants are OK, but not a good value. - Front desk is almost always understaffed. Front desk staff was mostly unhelpful and sometimes rude. - Noisy heat/ac unit in room. Similar to what you would find in a cheap motor lodge. - Seedy/sketchy part of town - Gaining Internet access by charging it to the room required a call to the front desk each day, which meant a long wait on hold. After two days, just gave up and put it on a charge card. - System for charging items to room didn't work very well. Front desk asked if we wanted unlimited charging at check-in and we said yes. When we tried to use it, we were told our credit limit was exceeded. Checked with front desk and they told us we had to authorize more money, which we did. Tried to use it again...credit limit exceeded.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Downtown and GN”
Reviews.Author: chgoburbscougar
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites. Room was in Carson Tower. Very nice. Provided robes in room and was very comfortable. Nickelodean slots were great to me. Room service was good. Used the Spa and had a travelers special that was advertised in the room. Nice Spa and very nice staff. Going back in April.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel ruined by terrible front desk service and noise issues”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: We come to vegas all the time , we just stayed at the GN with my parents for 3 nites. A very nice place with two huge problems: 1. The front desks (there are two) are really understaffed. If you have to do anything at the front desk (we had to stand in line 5 times in 3 days) it's a 15-30 minute wait each time. 2. We stayed this time in the new Rush tower - great if you get a south facing room it will have a view down the strip, but there is only one handycap room on each floor and it faces north - with north facing rooms there are huge noise problems from large roof mounted ac units and the freemont street experience, and no view of anything - stay in the south tower (now called Carson Tower) , it's cheaper and no view or noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “4 months latter a different greeting at the check-in desk”
Reviews.Author: tahoetraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We tried the Golden Nugget for the first time in October on a road trip, and I was impressed from check-in to check-out. This time we were going to an awards trip for my husband's work and we added an extra day and decided to stay on Fremont St. for one night. I was very surprised at our greeting when checking in. As we waited our turn for a few minutes when the front desk "guy" looked up to check us in he said "credit card and ID please"! No hello, or welcome, or even smile, such a different greeting than in October where they made us feel so welcome. I was very surprised as they were not busy and this seemed inappropriate at best (downright rude actually). Well we checked in and the room was very nice in the new tower and everyone else was nice and accomodating. I did not write this review for a few weeks, as the experience did not alter the fun I had or "ruin" my trip. I do believe the room was not a clean as it could have been, but I realize you can go somewhere 5 times and have 5 different experiences. Next time I do believe I might say something to management as I believe the person at the front desk sets the impression of any hotel. I would stay here again my husband loves the pool and I love the casino. Starbucks downstairs is also nice in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel choice in "old" Las Vegas (Fremont Street downtown)”
Reviews.Author: efsch
Reviews.Content: I think the Golden Nugget is the best quality hotel in the old Las Vegas area(Fremont Street "downtown"). This area has good public bus connections with the airport (#108 or #109A departing from airport level zero, allow 1 hour each way, $2 each ride or buy an all day bus pass). The downtown area provides great nostalgia for old Las Vegas. The hotel fronts the Fremont Street Experience, a free hourly sound and light show every evening, with additional free live stage entertainment most nights. When I arrived, the hotel gave me a free upgrade from the older (and probably quieter) south Carson Tower to the newer north Rush Tower, even though I had never stayed here before and am a non-gambler. My Rush Tower room was very elegant and quite large (about 500 sq. ft. = 50 sq. m.). The room was decorated in medium to dark brown tones, with a large marble and tile bathroom, a king bed, and an attached sitting area with a large sectional sofa. At about the cost of a single buffet dinner on the Strip ($39), my room was a great bargain. In appreciation, I doubled my usual service tips to the various hotel staff. The staff were very friendly and efficient throughout the hotel. The breakfast buffet was a good value at $10, with good variety and nice presentation (but avoid the pastries, all of which were stale). I did not try any other meals in the hotel. The pool area is relatively small compared with the hotel size, but it is entertaining because of the shark tank and water slide in the center of the pool. I found only two drawbacks to staying at the GN. First, the public "Deuce" bus which shuttles passengers along the Strip runs well in the morning, but by afternoon is jammed, and by evening is worthless due to excess demand. Second, Rush Tower rooms facing north (Fremont Street) are somewhat noisy from about 8-10pm while live entertainment is going on -- a band played Johnny Cash tributes at about 150 decibels, and even the double glazed windows could not keep the noise (music) out. Still, I recommend the GN for anyone who wants to stay in old Las Vegas and does not have to shuttle to the Strip for shows or shopping (there is a good premium outlet mall only a mile from the GN anyway, on bus #108).

Reviews.Title: “Excellence Superior to all other places in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Banky3
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas every year for the last twenty years. The Golden Nugget is one of the oldest casinos in Vegas but they renovated into a modern facility with all your wishes at hand. From the heated pool to the restaurants (we ate at all of them) and the dance club - DJ was awesome, we had no reason to go anywhere else. The location is in old Vegas so you do not have to do a lot of walking to go to other casinos. They have a mall type of cover outside which you can go out without a coat if the weather is bad. They have entertainment at different locations throughout the mall and shopping. We found that old Vegas pays out more in all the areas of gambling and the shops were inexpensive. We will never stay anywhere but the Golden Nugget from now on (best value all around), we really hated to go back home it made us feel so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Stewillard
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is a great hotel. Rooms are better than many more expensive located on the strip, the casino is a comfortable scale and the food is excellent at all levels. The pool is unbeatable with a tropical resort atmosphere. Staff is professional and houskeeping is impeccable. Staying on Freemont St. offers lots of flexibility as other hotels/casinos are a short walk and there is great access to highways if you want to drive to Boulder City, Red Rocks or even the strip.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Sin City... Loved the Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seraphel
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, food was absolutely great, and the atmosphere was like nothing I'd ever experienced!! Fremont Street was amazing!! The location of the hotel was just far enough from the main strip that it had it's own feel and atmosphere but close enough that just 10 minutes drive could get us anywhere we wanted to be. I'd definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: BobbieA2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, friendly. Love it on Freemont Street

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: emmajh
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is friendly and comfortable with the most amazing pool area, everything you could need and at a reasonable price. I'd rather stay downtown where there is character and atmosphere, and here is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really good time downtown....”
Reviews.Author: Martini 425
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many, many, many times and have never stayed Downtown. As a matter of fact, my husband had never even been downtown before so this trip out we decided to stay one night downtown and the other two nights on the strip (THE Hotel, see other review). I believe it was about a 20$ cab ride from the aiport, but honestly I forget now. Check in folks were very nice and we stayed in a Gold Tower room, was about 60 bucks via their website. The hotel was alot nicer than I thought it would be actually. I had a minds eye view of the downtown hotels and don't know about the others, but GN was classy, clean and well appointed. The room was wonderful really. Super comfy bed, nice side bathroom, flat screen tv (never turned it on so can't comment). Better than many of the rooms at the mid level hotels we have stayed at on the strip. Certainly not as nice as Bellagio, MGM or Mandaly but I guess that goes without saying for most. Casino was great, checked out alot of them downtown but mostly played here. Others have said they were lean on the payoff but we did not experience that. Found an Invaders From Planet Moolah here and had a ton of fun for quite a long time on that quirky little machine! Spent a good bit of time at one of the sit up bars (can't remember which on) and fell upon a Video Poker machine that really, really liked us - hit 400$ bucks twice on it. Gambling gods were smiling on us here. Actually came back to that same one the next morning, however a very nice lady was perched on it. We waited.....and waited....and waited but she was not moving!! We were joking with her and she promised after her last deal she was on her way. Low and behold....her last spin she hit the jackpot. Rats for us but good for her. High fives all around. Food: Sorry, can't comment. Did not eat at the GN. Did have the buffet at the Paradise across the way and it was really very good and very reasonable. Would eat there again (breakfast). Pool: Too cold but looked very nice. On the small side in my opinion. Bet it is jammed in the summer time. Downtown Experience: Interesting. Lots of characters down there. Nothing to complain about on our end but I wouldn't roam around down there by myself. Street is a party to be sure. You can walk around with drink in hand so you know how that goes. I'd like to comment on the light show, but I'll be darned...we missed it!!! How might you ask? Well we roamed into Glitter Gultch (what the heck....why not....it's Vegas) and ended up hanging out there quite a while. While certainly not a high end club, service was good at least. Let's just say husband did not spend a whole lotta time staring at the various ladies, every one outta ten was at least average. Made it fun thought. I will say I woke up the next morning without my drivers license and new I left it there when I cashed out the card. Had to hang around till 11 the next morning to get back in (nice...on a Sunday morning....lurking around the club entrance waiting for them to open). Managers searched high and low and found it behind the bar. They went out of their way to find that sucker for me. Very much appreciated as I needed it to fly home! Yes, I would stay at the Golden Nugget again and would recommend it to others. Enjoy and have fune.

Reviews.Title: “New Rush Tower is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TNGal08
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times over the years and keep returning because the cost per night stay is always very reasonable for the room type and ammenities available. We have always been treated very well by all staff members we've encountered. I had booked a king room in the Carson Tower for 6 nights using my slot club card (which is what I typically do) but at check-in was given an upgrade to the new Rush Tower. WOW - the linens, bathrobes, flat screen TV, spa like bathroom, and leather seating area were far beyond my expectations! We LOVE the pool and spa and try to take advantage of them as often as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Another successful stay”
Reviews.Author: mymisfit
Reviews.Content: Once again my stay at the Golden Nugget was successful. I have stayed here many times and have yet to have a bad experence. Maybe I don't set overly high standards or something, but I always enjoy myself when I stay here. I was at the Golden Nugget from February 16 - 19, 2010 for work and stayed in the North or I guess it is called the Golden tower now. My room was very comfortable and the bed was to die for. I slept every nite as if I was at home in my own bed. We arrived at about 11:00 a.m and waited about 10 minutes to check in. Our room was ready, and we were on our way in no time. We had a room with a view of the pool area. The weather was in the high 60's low 70's and there were alot of people using the pool area. The family pool was heated to 83 and the adult pool is heated to 90. I didn't do great on the slots, but a friend of mine hit for $900.00, so I guess it is just the luck of the draw. Would I go back and stay here again, you better believe it. If it is the hussle and bussle you are looking for, then maybe downtown is not where you want to stay, but if you just want to be able to relax and have some fun then try the Nugget, I think you will find it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Yet”
Reviews.Author: Melissalynn19
Reviews.Content: I loved staying in downtown and the newly remodeled Golden Nugget was the perfect choice. I enjoyed being able to take the Deuce to the strip and play during the day but come back to Fremont Street at night and watch the amazing video shows overhead. Excellent food and rooms. I will likely stay here on my next trip to Vegas because out of the 4 places I've stayed, this is by far my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Exeeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: HNRVancouver
Reviews.Content: I'm a single traveller between 50 and 65 years of age who booked through Expedia and got a real deal on my flight and hotel from Feb. 17 to 24 at the GN. First time I've been a guest there. At around 9PM there wasn't much of a wait at the front desk and the 3 ladies working it were all very nice, efficient and one in particular very cooperative at accommodting my requests. Those being a high floor with a view of the strip and a king bed. I had to settle for two double beds which turned out to be OK because it was so clean and comfortable that I slept like a baby. The quality, size and cleanliness of the room was very good. The walk from the eleavator was exhausting but I lived through it. I'm talking about the good, old Carson (South) tower. The view of the back of the county jail (OJ stayed there) and the Strip were fun and OH! So Las Vegas. Seeing the tallest mountain of those surrounding the valley covered in snow after a night of rain in town from my 19th floor window was something I'll never forget. Mt. Charelston, I believe. Just beautiful. I only visited the buffet once for breakfast which was a real quality treat. Loved it! I never enclountered a grumpy staff member. Everybody was great to deal with. Think quality when you think Golden Nugget LV. You won't be disappointed unless you are prone to being disappointed. The shared shark tank by the pool should be seen by all visitors in the downtown area. Other worldly. I look forward to going back to the GN soon.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: ShiebaK
Reviews.Content: It was so nice an the staff went out of our way to make our stay wonderful, I truly enjoyed it. If we get a chance to return that is the only place we will stay!! Pefect Location!!

Reviews.Title: “Rave”
Reviews.Author: TamaraF
Reviews.Content: The service at the Golden Nugget was superior to other hotels that I have stayed at. And the room was clean and kept that way during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near the courthouse”
Reviews.Author: TD8
Reviews.Content: The upgraded suite on my first visit was awesome. The regular room I got on the last two visits was very average. I am 37 and was pretty much the youngest person in the hotel. I did find it very convenient to the courthouse - one block away - so good for my job.

Reviews.Title: “my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: sandbyrd
Reviews.Content: the hotel was alright but i did not know that it was pretty much cut off from the rest of the vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower: First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: RickNP
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the GN on a few occasions, and have always been satisfied with the experience. This week, with one night left before catching my flight home, I decided to try the new part of the property. It was very impressive. The leather furniture and 46 inch TV made for some easy relaxation, the bed and bedding were what one would hope to find in a 5 star resort, and the bathroom couldn't have been nicer. Some niceties include drapes that actually close tightly enough to block all outside light, ironing board with iron and and steamer, a lighted make-up mirror (I used it on low as a night light) , robes for guest use, and a leather bound ice bucket. The newness and careful upkeep of my room were everywhere evident. A big improvement to my one gripe about past GN stays is the elevator system. Fast and totally silent, I never waited more than 10 seconds for one to arrive on the 15th floor. With the addition of the Rush Tower, the Golden Nugget solidifies its position as the best Downtown Las Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: LadyJLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay on Fremont Street for Mardi Gras, since there was going to be lots of live music and we figured why risk driving home (we actually live here). I didn't expect much other than basic and clean from the hotel. Fremont Street is old Las Vegas, not the Strip. But the special deal - under $50 for the night incl. taxes - was too good to pass up. I was very pleasantly surprised. We stayed in the Carson Tower. It was very well appointed, with a nice view, totally quiet. Amenities included bathrobes and a full range of quality toiletries. It was actually possible to set the room temperature to maintain comfort - we like it towards cold at night and so many rooms don't maintain that. The hotel had a wide variety of restaurants and we enjoyed one for dinner and one for breakfast. We also enjoyed the live saxaphonist in the lounge later in the evening and probably would've enjoyed Gold Diggers, a lounge with a balcony overlooking the crowd below - we've been there before - but by then all I wanted to do was curl up on the very comfortable king-sized bed for the night. If I'd stayed another night, they'd've discounted my already-low rate! It was incredibly good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: MichaelL29
Reviews.Content: it is in the heart of freemont street it is quit a spacious room and a good price

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: SueM25
Reviews.Content: wasn't extravagant, but food was great. casino areas were always clean, rooms were sufficient. parking easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas At Christmas”
Reviews.Author: deejor
Reviews.Content: great location, great food, fun had by both of us, pretty much stayed downtown, but did go to the strip one day, felt like I was in another country with all the foreigners. we really enjoyed downtown

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality”
Reviews.Author: AmberNichelle
Reviews.Content: They have gold shampoo!!! And tvs in the bathroom! haha

Reviews.Title: “a family reunion, aunt's last dream”
Reviews.Author: sweetasshit
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel room. And when you check in, you are re directed to another block around the corner, if you are staying in the Carson tower. And the bartenders are the rudest people in the world. I heard many people complaining about this... but gave them another chance. And then went back to the Grotto Italian bar and restaurant and Michael was telling us that they are not in the business to make money on drinks, but on all of the idiots gamblimg away their money (like us). And later went out to the shark pool and got to witness another rude bartender, who called security. I saw a lot of arguments, but ultimately, the security from what I saw hit the guy in the face, first, without provocation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganGals
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to LV and stayed from Feb.7-Feb.12. We originally were prebooked at Fitzgerald Hotel, it was a disaster (see review under Fitz for more info). We moved over to the Golden Nugget our first night in LV. IT EXCEEDED OUR EXPECTATIONS! My mom (70 years old) and I were down there for my Bday. It was the best birthday ever and I owe alot of it to the GN Hotel. We stayed in the Carson Tower on the 20th floor. The room was immaculate, beautiful and unbelievably comfortable. They had plasma tvs, 2 bathrobes, spa products (from the hotel spa) in the bathroom,the beds were the most comfortable I have experienced (and I travel ALOT), they had duvets on them which were fabulous, first time I have ever seen that and the sheets must of had a 1000 thread count, very soft. We ordered room service our last night, it was pretty overwelming for they come in with a huge table with flowers on it and it was like being treated like royalty. They did not have coffee makers in the room, so we walked across the street to Walgreens (open 24 hours) and got a 4 cup maker for 10 bucks, IT WAS SO WORTH IT!!! I highly advise buying one, saves $$ vs buying starbucks daily. Walgreens have tons of stuff in that store, including coffee and cream and sugar,lol. The hotel and casino was breathtaking! The pool area is definately a site to see, guaranteed you will be in awe. We did not swim in it, but others were. There is handblown glass chandaleers and ornaments threwout the hotel, OMG, beautiful. ALL the staff were outstanding and always smiling. You have to try a truffel from the Chocolate Store, NUMMY! Worth it for $2.50 per piece,trust me. We only ate at the 24 hr restaurant, it was good prices and a plate full of food is enough for 2 people to share. The location on Freemont Street was right in the middle of the action, PERFECT location. It was our first time staying downtown and we will 100% be back and HIGHLY recommend the Golden Nugget :) And for the record the downtown-Freemont Street is VERY safe to walk on, anytime of day. Trust me, we were walking down it at 5am with our luggage tagging behind us without any hesitation. There were still lots of people around and also they were cleaning the street with high powered washers. It was immaculate when they finished. Be prepared though for tons of people, especially on the weekend. Definatley a site to see and a lifetime experience! It is like a carnival, mardi gras down there daily. And dont forget to book your room at the Golden Nugget....you wont be disappointed, guaranteed. Beats the strip 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Golden nugget las vegas N.V.”
Reviews.Author: LorraineJ4
Reviews.Content: The pool here is aswome!The staff was very nice.The rooms were clean and very pretty.The only thing was I smoke.and I would not stay in smoking again.The smoke in the halls was very thick come eveing time.Freemount st.is great fun for the whole family.very laied back feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place on the Fremont Strip - Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Keith R
Reviews.Content: Well I found a place to stay that I love in Vegas and it ain't one of the Big splashy hotels. At least this is where the boys and I will stay when we go. Comfortable, economic and still old school Vegas. the pool area is great! the Buffet is good and best of all is the cafe next to the sports book. Best breakfast Burritos I have ever had for $5. My wife wouldn't like it but for the boys it is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Rush Tower TOTALLY disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Garam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GN's new Rush Tower on 2-12 & 2-13-10. We paid approx $190 USD per night. Overall total disappointment. There was a 15 min wait at registration (4:45 pm, Fri eve.), not because of a long line (we were 2nd in line), but because there were only 2 clerks at the desk. I would guess some of the people in line behind us waited up to 30 minutes to check in. The lobby is new and attractive, but no place to sit down other than the gaming tables, which were usually empty due to the high minimum limits at those tables. The halls upstairs are dimly lit and unattractive. Our room was decorated in dark colors, which, I guess, was supposed to make it look rich and elegant, but because of poor lighting, it just came off as dark and depressing. No refrigerator. No coffee maker. We were on the 8th flr facing south, and there were arc lights to light up the side of the building that shined into our windows. No view to speak of. Upon check in, we found that our bed sheets had two large, nasty stains (I won't go into details) that NO maid could have missed, and one of our bath towels also was soiled. In other words, housekeeping had simply remade a used bed and refolded used towels. The bathrooms are small and ugly. The floor, and up the side of the tub, is cheap-looking fake-wood laminate.... same as just outside the elevators. The bathtub is a law suit waiting to happen..... There is no seperate shower, and the tub floor is very slippery when wet and soapy (the guest book advised that a bath mat could be provided FOR A FEE!), there are no grab bars in the shower whatsoever, and the artsy-fartsy steel faucet knob is cubical with sharp corners that would probably kill someone if they slipped and hit their head on it. The glass shower doors leak water onto the bathroom floor no matter how you try to close them. The restaurants in the new tower are attractive, but terribly overpriced. I ordered the sushi combo plate at their restaurant RED, and for over $30.00 got a bowl of miso soup and only 7 pieces of sushi nigiri and a california roll. Wait staff were generally not friendly. I joined trip advisor specifically to give this review, as there are no feed-back forms in the rooms, and because upon check out, the desk clerk didn't even bother to ask "HOW WAS YOUR STAY". I have stayed at the GN several times over the past 20 years and used to always enjoy my stays there. Unfortunately, it appears that the crown jewel of Freemont Street is turning into a sequined rat's behind.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Pjiano61
Reviews.Content: I was only there a short,couple days,but it was so exciting&colorful. Temperatures were in the 100's. Need to go back when it's cooler in the Fall/Winter Seasons. You need at least a week stay in order to take in most of the sights. There's so much to do.

Reviews.Title: “~ Great Hotel ~”
Reviews.Author: Soniya80
Reviews.Content: For my hubby's bday, I decided to take him to vegas. After searching for hotels , I found Golden Nugget to be a affordable, yet great hotel. We stayed at Golden Nugget from Feb 6th till Feb 10th, 2010. If you've been to Reno, you'll realize on fremont street, it's similar to that. Fremont street has its own casinos, bars, restaurants etc. Once we got off the airplane, we decided to catch a cab to the hotel. By the time we go there, it was close to $25 in fare. I did not realize that this hotel is far from the strip. The first night to go the strip and come back, we had paid $40 in cab + tip. The next day we decided to look for shuttles or even buses..and thank god we asked! Two blocks from the hotel, you'll find a bus stop....you have to purchase the ticket to get on the bus...which is $3.00 one way or $7.00 for the entire day / person. If you can't find this ticket booth, dont worry, just take exact change and use that inside the bus. THEY DO TAKE CASH!!! Which we didn't realize until the 3rd day. We had visited some great restaurants but they are pricey...as you know..Vegas is not cheap..Try Spago inside Ceasar's.. They even have a cheesecake factory inside there too..We also tried Table 10 inside Palazzo. Portions at Table 10 is bountiful and I must say.. they have the best bread I have ever eaten..soft and warm..yumm!! If you planning on shopping there is a cart inside ceasars called Everything for $10...but if you go upstairs in Treasure Island..you will see the same store but with more stuff..It's cheap and good. If you have a pricey taste...don't worry, there's plenty of shops on the strip also they just opened city center..has great shops and some are still in the process of opening. If you want to see shows, try Mystere in TI. Its fun and great for adults and kids. We got our tickets at $25 /person total of $50 with no tax. Usually its starting at $70. In Golden Nugget, their staff is promoting a new timeshare called "Grand View" and what they want you to do is go in to see the place for 2 hours, eat snacks and get your free gifts, We were given an option of watching Mystere by paying $50 (2) and free breakfast buffet at GN or get Cris Angel Mindfreak show by paying $20 (2) and get $25 free money to spend in GN. If you get Cris angel..you in a way make $5.00 out of this but we preferred Mystere. Hustle these ppl inside GN so they do give you other free things..like we got breakfast buffet and trust me , they need you to go check out this new place. BTW: I recommend taking the 1.00pm shuttle there so you can eat lunch at Grandview. They have deli sandwiches, juices, coffee, fruits and cookies. Free Lunch and plus you can ask them to drop you off on the strip once the session is over, so that way you can save your money on Bus fare. Overall Vegas was fun, Hotel was great and don't forget to check out their amazing pool with REAL SHARKS inside. Enjoy and hope this review helped !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lrotero
Reviews.Content: Expect the most and don't mind staying in Downtown, outside the strip. Golden Nugget is clean and brand new, with good staff and service. 10 minutes drive and you're in the strip. But you don`t need to go to the strip to play in a hot casino; Golden Nugget`s is a good one! Won`t mention the huge and fancy pool, perfect for kids and young teens. Recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: stillastud
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Vegas for 20+ years. Once or twice a year. I usually stay on the strip. (luxur/mgm/bellagio etc. ) Never stayed downtown before , I love it ! I loved taking a break and going outside. I was on Freemont st in 5 seconds and came right back in and gamble some more. Rooms were very nice and all restaurants were super except the cafe that has 24 hour dining. The Chart House and italian and Asian were all excellent. Oh and the pool was fun. Very nice layout and design of everything. Needless to say I will start staying at the Nugget from now on.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaVamp
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very clean, and beautiful, great casino, and great pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2goodtimes
Reviews.Content: It's a great casino over all my only two things were the buffet i didn't think it deserved a very good rating .And the table miniums during the day were higher than the other Casino's downtown.I would also like to see either Caribean poker or Texas holdem as a table Game being dealt.Other wise i would possibly give it a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “We loved The Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: LWC52
Reviews.Content: My hubby took me to LV for Mother's Day and we loved it! It is the nicest place to stay on Fremont Street and we very much enjoyed the services provided by the staff. The rooms were clean & spacious, the gambling was good and the meals at hotel restaurants were excellent. I also enjoyed a wonderful spa day, which I highly recommend. The buffet is good. The shark tank at the pool is interesting and we enjoyed watching the sharks swim around as we played blackjack at the poolside tables. Great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, proper Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: stafbulp
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and enjoyed the stay. I think this is one of the older Las Vegas casinos and it did not have a very modern feel to it. But as for amenities, I suppose it had all the essential Vegas stuff. It was a bit to cold for us to swim with the sharks, but the fish tank in the middle of the pool is a nice feature!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest old school casino off the strip”
Reviews.Author: NaptownTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest hotel downtown, but I would never stay there. My mom would enjoy it immensely. However, their pool is spectacular. A two story, curvy water slide that goes through a clear tube through a shark tank? Jumanji!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaL4
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel at a very affordable rate, right in the heart of old Las Vegas on Freemont street . Newly remodeled

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk – Unsafe and customer service stinks!”
Reviews.Author: brosygirl
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat customer and will NEVER stay at the Golden Nugget ever again! I travel to Las Vegas for work about three times a year. Every trip my coworkers and I stay at the Golden Nugget because it is a convent location to our office. In December of 2009 I stayed at the Golden Nugget for the week. While I was at the office, my room was broken into. The adjoining room door was kicked in; the door to my room was destroyed. My things were scattered all over the room and my luggage was stolen. I had about $1000 worth of items taken. The hotel management didn’t offer any type of apology, or reimbursement at all. I was moved to a new room because my safety was jeopardized, but for my entire week stay, I did not receive a single night room comp, not a meal comp, nothing – in fact, since my suitcase was stolen I had no way of getting my remaining things home. The bellman was kind enough to find me a small bag to put some of my things in, but I had to ship the rest of my things home on my own dollar. I was also charged for a $4 water from my room that I never consumed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: tashie123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located on Fremont Street, which has a great lights show anda activities at night. Didn't mind not being on the strip as there is a bus on Fremont street the you can take all the way to the strip for really cheap. The club there Gold Diggers, is a lot of fun, and I would definitely recommend it if you like to party. Also, you have to hit Tryst and Pure, they're amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Rush Tower: Unquestionably the best place to stay downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: trooks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget's new Rush Tower for three nights in early January and were very, very impressed! It is very nicely decorated, the staff was professional and friendly, and the rooms were great! * Price. We paid $69 a night (Tue-Thu) and felt it was a great bargain. * Check in. Was a breeze at 1:00 in the afternoon. During our stay we did not notice any long lines at the front counter, so staffing appeared sufficient. * Lobby. Very modern and clean, with a gigantic aquarium. Nicely done! * Room. Our 16th floor room had a good view of the northern part of the strip. It was nicely appointed with a very modern motif; lots of dark colors. An "L" shaped couch is set next to the window and is easily rotated to face outwards. The room featured; central air, a safe, large flat screen TV. Extra touches included; an alarm with IPOD docking capability, a DVD player, two robes and slippers. * Bathroom. Very clean and modern with a separate area for the commode. The dual sinks are nice, but I did not care for the bowl-type sinks because the plunger does not have an exterior control. The soaking tub was very roomy, but I'd prefer a shower curtain rather than the sliding glass doors because it would make it easier to get to the controls. The tub felt slick when showering, so we would up putting one of the towels in it. The bathroom is very dark at night - illuminated light switches would be a welcome addition. * Parking. We self parked, which is free and directly adjacent to the hotel - very convenient. * Phone Messages. We had several phone messages that actually turned out to be promotional messages from the hotel. We did not like this at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: rondreizer
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few time at the strip and decided to stay downtown for 2 nights. We booked the cheapest room at Golden Nugget and weren't disappointed. The Hotel has the best location downtown, the rooms are big and clean, internet was ok (14 dollars), nice restaurant. The safebox could be bigger, my laptop was to big, or the safe to small. It was a perfect stay, friendly staff and nice casino. The crowd is different downtown and there is less glamour. But the Golden Nugget is the place to stay, i had much more expensive hotels at the strip that where worse than this hotel. But over all, i prefer to stay at the center strip, though this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: alwayz_on_vacation
Reviews.Content: We stay at the golden nugget several times a year and finally had the chance to stay in the new Rush Tower. We loved it. The decor is modern and warm feeling. We enjoyed the very comfortable king size bed, huge bathtub, double sinks, flat screen tv and lounger. The new rush lobby is small, however, the fish tank and bar area are beautiful and check in and out were fast. The new pool is also very nice. Too cold for us to enjoy this trip but we will be back in a couple weeks. We love the golden nugget and downtown and would recommend any room, but especially those in the rush tower to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Taylorje1982
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel, especially seeing how much cheaper it is than 'new Vegas'; Located on Fremont Street, this is a Grand Hotel. It features intricate artisan work through out. There is a casino located on site, I actually had my best luck there! If you want to stay in 'new Vegas'.... go ahead, the rooms are nicer, but nothin' beats a true LasVegas Strip experence!

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas Charm”
Reviews.Author: CountdowntoTrip
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the old tower of the Nugget on Christmas Eve. The room was fun with original carpet and purposely outdated decor. We had a king sized bed and a flat screen TV, as well. We wanted to stay away from the strip and close to Fremont, so the Nugget was a perfect choice. The new tower is quite nice, and the Shark Tank is a unique addition. Unfortunately, Fremont was dead and we missed the last laser show (we didn't even know that was possible). We ended up playing the slots in the Nugget Casino. Although the Golden Nugget has changed along with the rest of Vegas, being in this area allowed me to imagine what Vegas might have been in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hiched
Reviews.Content: I have read several reviews and I have to say that I couldn't disagree more with any of the negative comments. Our experience was nothing short of perfection! We arrived on Jan. 28th around 11:15pm and the hotel staff were courteous and more than accommodating. Being the fact that it was New Years week and hotels were jammed to the rafters, the only room they could give us for our first night was the Spa Suite. Holy crap! This room goes for $800 a night any other time, but we got it at no extra charge and the timing couldn't have been better. I had a screaming migrane and just needed to relax and the spa suite was the answer to my prayers. This two bedroom, 3 bathroom and with TWO jaccuzzi tubs (2 person wide), along with a formal diningroom and livingroom, complete with 5 (count them, yes 5) LCD TV's, I was in HEAVEN. The next day, we had to move to a regular suite in the Carson Tower but again, they upgraded us to a newer room on a higher floor with a view of the strip....without us even asking for it. I cannot praise the staff at this hotel enough. They went out of their way to make us comfortable and welcome anytime we had questions. Regarding some of their quirky rules.....like, there are NO coffee makers in the rooms people!! When we asked if we could have one, they said it was a safety issue. Of course, to make it convenient for us, they did have a Starbucks (where coffee is $4 a cup) at the bottom of the elevators, so it wasn't too far to go; just cut short our gambling funds for a cup of coffee every morning (lol). We have been to Vegas several times, but this was the first time we've ever stayed at the Nugget. The location is fantastic to the Premier Outlet shopping mall....just a quick 20 minute walk and you've got the best shopping in town and the sales were unbelievable!! Fremont Street is something to experience....I loved all the lights on the corner where all 4 hotels come together. The H2o bar in the pool area is neat. Although we never swam in the pool beside the sharktank, we did use the hot tub which was fantastic. Drinks are expensive but food and beverages are quite high in general, so make sure you budget yourself accordingly. A couple can eat 3 meals a day for around 100 bucks. Gone are the days of the 2.95 buffets....but at least the hotels gives you a booklet which has two for one breakfast, lunches and other discounts for food and entertainment. Still, we weren't quite prepared for the cost of food and drinks. The buffet food was a typical buffet....not very hot, but quite tasty and lots of variety. Anyone who complains about the buffet is too picky - get over it and eat elsewhere if you don't like it. We found a fabulous restaurant on Fremont Street called Hennessey's. It's an Irish Pub that has fantastic Pepper Chicken. You can get discount meal vouchers at "Tickets for Today" stands which is just outside the 4 Queens Hotel. You can eat a Sirloin Steak for 8.50 with the coupon. Drinks were yummy too. If you're gambling, the drinks in the Nugget are fantastic - not watered down. I particularly liked the margaritas and beer. The only drawback to staying at the Nugget is that it is not very safe to walk outside of the Fremont Street hub at night. Druggies and other activities occur on a regular basis and you're best to take the bus to the strip if you want to do some walking at night. We would definitely return and stay at the Golden Nugget and are already planning a trip for Spring 2010.

Reviews.Title: “A solid GOLD star for the Nugget!!”
Reviews.Author: Austinmike28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget the day after the BCS Championship game (friday Jan 9, 2010) on our way back home to Texas. It was the first time I've stayed in a downtown hotel casino, and I must say this place rocks!!! It's got the class of the strip at way better prices. We had a room in (I think) an older tower away from Freemont street, and our view was to the north and the mountains. It was VERY spacious and clean. There was a sitting area, a place that a lady could sit and do makeup, a nice HUGE flat screen TV, robes in the closet, very updated bathroom, and two comfy queen beds. I didn't spend much time in the room, but it was very nice and the price was great. The Nugget really feels like a strip hotel/casino, but you don't have to walk forever and a day to get to A..your room, B...the casino, C....the pool, D....other casinos. The place was clean, shiny, and actually looked NEW to me. The dealers were very nice, cocktail service was fantastic, and the Japan resturant hibaci grill was GREAT. The only thing I would change about this place was the tempature in the hallway on our floor. For some reason every time we were in the hallway....going or coming from the room it was REALLY HOT..... I know it is winter, but it didn't need to feel like the surface of the sun. Other than that minor detail this place is fantastic, and I'll stay here again for sure. Another big plus about this place is that you are so close to the other casinos downtown. So if you want to gamble at a few different places it's very easy to do.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget has service issues”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn1844
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas a couple of times a year but almost always stay on the Strip. We decided to drive from Las Vegas to the Rose Bowl for the BCS National Championship and changed hotels to the Golden Nugget downtown when we came back at 1am. We were tired and there was a huge line to check in at 1am in the morning on a Thurs night/Fri morning! It took over 40 minutes. If they'd had 2 more people at the front desk they would have made enough on one round of blackjack to cover their salaries many times over from the people waiting! Our room smelled just awful and it was in the "new" tower. Rooms are double beds not queens. Our sheets had holes in them; there was a huge tear in one of the towels, and the icemaker in the hall didn't work.The room smell was the worst part to me along with the long wait to check in. I will say they have a spectacular pool though and the sports book personnel were nice .

Reviews.Title: “The creepy staff may not give you what you what paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller6947
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget gets one star for the duplicity of their staff. I paid for a Gold Tower Deluxe room - which by the way is very nice - but here is what happened. Something seemed fishy about the attendant's manner at check in - what she was saying about availability didn't match her body language and the way she was looking at her screen. She told me I was lucky to get the last room available. I went up to find that I was assigned a crummy end room on the 5th floor. Behind one wall was a humming ice maker, behind the other paper thin wall were neighbors having loud sex, and on the third side was a fake walled-up window!!. The dingy lighting and dated decor completed the mood of this seedy room. I went back down and told them I didn't want it. The second attendant made a call, mumbled a few things into the phone, and sent me back up to a much nicer room on the 17th floor. It turned out that the second room was the Gold Tower room that I paid for. The first room was two levels or more lower in quality than what I paid for. They pretended to be doing me a favor by giving me the second room when it was actually the type of room I paid for. The Gold tower was very nice - I liked the TV miror and Bose sound in the bathroom. However the attitude of the staff has a larger effect on my overall experience. I'd rather stay in a dumpy hotel with very nice staff (well not really, but you get the idea ) I just didn't like that I had to complain to get the level of room that I paid for. SHAME ON YOU GOLDEN NUGGET!

Reviews.Title: “Slow to Start but Full House in the end”
Reviews.Author: Calmity72
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the beginning of the New Year season and the place was packed. After a lot of confusion and a two hour wait to check in we were told that our room wasnt ready and that we should go to the restaurant and they would pick up the bill. The 100 or so people before us either relocated or sent to the restaurant so we were expecting this. However, for us this was unacceptable as we had been travelling for a long time and just wanted to sleep so insisted that we see a Manager and amazingly a room became available and we were offered some compensation for our two hour wait to check in! The room was above average quality and we would have been happy to stay there for our full four nights. However with 10 mins of being in the room we flushed the toilet and it over-spilled onto the floor - so within 10 mins we had the lid of the toilet off trying to stop the flow and were calling maintenance. As you can imagine we went straight back down and complained ...... We delat with the same Manager, Julio, who after a little arm twisting, promised us an upgrade the next day as he had nothing available that night. The next day we moved to a suite in the Rush Tower which was truely amazing. We spent the next three nights in luxury and the rest of our stay was very pleasant with staff as friendly as can be in a hotel this scale. We had a meal in the Itailan restaurant one night and surprisingly it was lovely - not being gamblers we has a small flutter on the slot machines and walked away $50 up so all in all a pleasant stay overall. This was our first time in Vegas and downtown is quite far from the Strip but parking is free and cheap at the Nugget. Vallet parking staff are good and offer insightful help for a small $2 tip. Trip would have been perfect had we had started in the rush room. Trip would have been good if we had started and finished well in the standard room. The Manager used his discretion to turn a bad situation into a good situation. Vegas wouldnt be my destination of choice but if I went back i would happily stay at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay and loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaygee
Reviews.Content: We arrived at GN on 24th December for 7 nights, and we had a room in the new Rush Tower. We arrived late, and that meant that check-in as really easy. There was one party in front of us, and they had been dropped off at the GNRT by a taxi, when really they were checking into the South Tower. The receptionist still checked then in and directed them over to the other building. We noticed over the next few days that this seemed to be the latest trick of the cabbies to drop people off that the Rush Tower - so this meant longer lines to check in at busy times of the day. So we got to our room, we were 12th floor, and had a view overlooking Fremont Street. The rooms are lovely in the Rush Tower. The entranceway is a good size with a table and a really handy little dish to put your coins and keys in. The bathroom was off the entrance way and had lovely sliding doors that opened the bathroom right up. There is a separate toilet in the bathroom, which is great (don't really want to see my DH sitting on the loo!) There is plenty of seating in the room with the corner sofa, a great place to sit and watch the street below. the room came with DVD player, 42" Flat screen TV, data ports, safe, and loads of storage space, and a lovely large wardrobe, with plenty of hangers! Now there was one downside to the room, and this was the bed, not the mattress, but the bed frame - it sticks out beyond the mattress and both me and my hubby bashed our legs against it a couple of times and had the bruises to prove it! But once we were accustomed to steering clear of the frame we were OK! We had great times in the casino, DH was extremely lucky and won every night, his best win was $4K on Let It Ride. The pit boss (Frank) was excellent, and really made us feel welcome every time we sat at the table. I wasn't so lucky in the GN casino, but there are so many casinos around about that there was never a problem going somewhere else! We ate at Vic and Anthony's restaurant on Christmas Day night, and the meal was wonderful. It was the best steak that I have ever had, seasoned and cooked to perfection. Excellent! We also had a couple of breakfasts at the Carson Street Cafe and the service was wonderful. It seems that the staff is a little older at the hotel and I always feel that they give a much better service.... Overall I would highly recommend the Golden Nugget - our last stay there was 8 years ago, and there is no way that we will wait that long to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, far from good part of town”
Reviews.Author: dkaplan435
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the court house.. lots of bail bonds and DUI lawyers. Internet is not free. They charge $ 5 to print your boarding pass! You are better off staying at a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Vegas, Baby!”
Reviews.Author: Pflipper73
Reviews.Content: If you want a good hotel value, the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas is where you want to stay. Lots of renovations and a new shark/fish tank and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget I don't know what to say accept....”
Reviews.Author: Kerryokequeen
Reviews.Content: snooze! My hubby and I stayed Dec 27th -Dec 30th in the gold tower room 206, you really must see the view from our window! SPECTACULAR The bathroom was tiny & dark, the robes were a nice touch, the room smelt musty and the carpet had not been cleaned very well as we saw remenats from the former guest. the wait to check-in was about 25 mins (seemed unusal with only 3 guest in front of us) the casino was like a maze, the pool and shark tank was cool, the slots were very tight no luck at all there, but I did land four of a kind queens playing Pai gow ($$$) the room service was pricey but because there were no coffee makers in the room ONE pot of coffee from roomservice was $15.00 not including tip! I didn't dislike fremont street but I think I'll continue to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here several times, will not stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: ohana22
Reviews.Content: I sent an email to the reservations manager twice in regards to some concerns I had on our last stay, never received a response on both occasions. Not a nice way to treat a guest that stays at least 4 times a year. I will not gamble or stay at this establishment again, will not refer any of my friends to stay here either. Not very good customer service to a loyal customer. It saddens me since I have always liked the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new rooms, great value!”
Reviews.Author: theFinn
Reviews.Content: We hit Vegas for the second time in 2009 to the New Years party on Fremont Street. After looking at the other hotels downtown we decided to pick what we felt was the nicest one and spent a little extra to stay in the new Rush Tower. It was an excellent choice. For the same price as staying in a lower end property on the strip (i.e.: Circus Circus, Excalibur, IP) we got a VERY nice room at a very nice hotel. The Rush Tower rooms still have their 'new room smell' and the whole tower feels like it just had a the plastic taken off. The decore is all muted browns and powerful reds. The room had a comfortable (if a tab bit harder then I like) bed, a sitting area with a nice sized leather couch and ottoman and a very nice 42 inch flatscreen HDTV (along with about 10 full HD channels). The bathroom is large with a double vanity and a separate toilet area that you can close the door on and relieve yourself in peace. The property itself is very nice. The casino is large and filled with all the latest games. The table limits are higher then most of the other strip properties ($10 minimums are as low as I saw them go) and they have plenty of eye-candy dealers (along with non-eye-candy dealers if that's your thing). We ate at the Buffet, Carson Cafe, and the little Asian restaurant beside the Carson Cafe. In addition we order room service once, but that's just food from the Cafe. All the meals were good. The buffet is small by Vegas standards but the food was very good and fresh and the staff was attentive and friendly. The Carson Cafe is large and open 24 hours a day (reduced menu during late night) and the staff there was also attentive and friendly. The Asian resturant was the highlight of the dining at the Nugget. Their food is excellent and priced very reasonably. Overall all the staff we encountered were friendly and gave good service with a smile. The front-desk staff got us checked in quickly and gave us a nice coupon book. The Rush Tower valets were fast and friendly, even when the lot was full except for guests all they asked was 'are you staying with us sir?' and took me at my word when I said 'yes' , I was never hassled to provide proof. Our room was cleaned early every day (each day we were out by 10am and normally back to a fully cleaned room at noon or 1pm). Charging things to our room was a breeze even when I forgot my room charge card they were very understanding. While we didn't spend any time in the pool it looks AWESOME with the big shark tank and the water slide. In the summer months I bet this pool area could really rock your socks off. Checkout took exactly 8 seconds using the express checkout on the TV. The location downtown is great if you want to stay downtown. You have access right on to Fremont St. right out the hotel doors. If you stay here and want to get to the Strip often (as we did) you have to have a rental car, it's the best blend of ease and affordability for transportation when you're staying downtown. That said, if you just want to drink and gamble and eat Fremont St. is perfect for that and everything is in walking distance. Overall I have no real complaints about the Golden Nugget, it was as close to perfect as a hotel can come. The only marks off I give are for location (real far from the action on the Strip) and a couple points off for service in the casino as drink service at the machines was rather slow (at the tables it was great). A couple of things to note specific to the Rush Tower Rooms: 1) The closet has door handles but they don't turn. When you try and turn them it feels just like a locked door. All you need to do is give them a firm pull and the closet pops open to reveal your robes and slippers + ironing board etc. I felt rather dumb when I figured that out after being in the room for an hour wondering where I was gonna hang my suit, save yourself some embarrassment ;) 2) When you're having a shower, due to the way the 'rainfall' style shower head works the bottom of the bathtub can get quite slippery. If you have stability issues (disabled, older, etc) you'll want to watch out for that or you could take a very nasty fall in there.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal and cool location”
Reviews.Author: Esfy
Reviews.Content: I was a first time Vegas traveller and was meeting family to stay on the Strip for several days. Wanting to see old downtown Vegas so I got there a day early and did a lot of research as to which of the hotels to stay in for that one day/night. I chose the Golden Nugget and didn't regret it. Wanted to be near enough to the Fremont St experience but not right on top of it since I'm a light sleeper. I got a room on the 14th floor in one of the towers at the southern end of their large property for sixty-something dollars, was allowed to check in at 11 AM and found the room to be clean and the staff to be helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that the room was a tiny bit dark in the daytime due to the drape / window configuration. But turning on the lights solved that problem and I didn't spend much time in my room. Also the room next to me had some sort of argument going on late at night (audible through the locked doors in the shared wall. But the argument quieted down before I had to call the front desk. Downtown is pretty different from the Strip. It's definitely older, and as others have mentioned, the emphasis is more on gambling and less on glitz and fancy stores and all that. I would have stayed down there even without the Fremont Street Experience happening, I love old buildings and pedestrian-friendly streets. Unlike on the strip, it's easy to walk around and check out the sites. The old hotel signs at night are pretty amazing; Binions, the Plazas, the California, the Golden State. If you're into vintage stuff, you must at least visit downtown at night. But unfortunately most of the action is limited to the immediate area around the Fremont St Experience. It gets seedy as you go east on Fremont even though there are some cool looking old bars. The minimum bets seem to be lower on Fremont St than most places on the Strip as well and people are friendlier too. All in all, I recommend the Golden Nugget and downtown in general.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Rush Tower”
Reviews.Author: bleujazz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the rush tower room 16207 and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. We checked in on Christmas day at about 4pm.Check-in was super fast and the staff was very polite. We stayed in a jr. suite. The room was super clean, actually the whole hotel was super clean. Loved the size of the room, the bed and the restroom was beautiful. Also loved the slippers and robe that are provided. The only inconvenience was the shower knob, you had to be pretty strong to turn it off and on. They do have high speed internet but it's $13 a day, not a problem for me but I know some don't like having to pay. I had used the free in room safe, but for the life of me I couldn't remember what code I typed in, we stopped at the front desk our last night there before going back to our room to have them open it and the front desk sent security right up to get it open. Loved the Buffet and the grotto. We had a really nice server at the buffet that waited on us both times we visited, but i can't remember her name. Our server at the grotto was also very polite and efficient. We checked out on the 29th and it only took about 10 minutes. My husband highly recommend this hotel, I know we'll stay there again next time we visit vegas.

Reviews.Title: “New Rush Tower First Class!”
Reviews.Author: lonestar65
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Year's weekend. Other than a slow-checkin process (only 2 staff on duty), the rest of the stay went well. The room was very well designed and appointed. All of the staff we encountered were friendly. Although we didn't use it , the pool was one of the coolest I've ever seen and heated all year round. Fremont Street is a blast with lots of activities and cool light show at night. The Buffet has great food but a little more expensive than other downtown buffets.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve 2009-10 at the GN”
Reviews.Author: vegasbride08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GN during New Year's and again it was a wonderful experience. Wouldn't stay anywhere but the GN anymore. We had a old room in the Carson Tower and had thought about possibly upgrading to the new Rush Tower but decided to save our money (who's really in the rooms that much anyways). Even for an older room it was clean, well maintained, no complaints. Service was great! The only negative thing I can say about GN hotel aside is the Buffet. Go across the street to Fremont and go try to Paradise buffet for only 6.99 for breakfast or Main Street Station for their $6-$7 dollar buffet. The hotel gave us free wrist bands for NYE Fremont party which was awesome! Loved fremont street for out new years celebration!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: loulou1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the new Rush Tower for 3 days at the beginning of December. The room was fantastic !! I am not sure why a few people are complaining, it's a hotel room not your permanent residence. Everything was to our liking....everything !! I am just confused by peoples reviews saying things were bad. Well when you sign up to get a brand new room thats what it's going to smell like... brand new !!! We stayed just a few weeks after it opened and it smelled great. I love that it's a non smoking tower. You can tell the difference BIG TIME !! This is the only hotel we will be staying at in Vegas.
