Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: blackalls
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded at the golden nugget & found this room about the best accomodation while touring the u.s for 5 weeks....this room was luxury class compared to some dumps we stayed at...the light experience was excellent at night....the only thing we could complain of was when the lifts were working it was pretty noisey at night, also fremont street is quite a distance from the strip....however my husband & i like walking, so that is what we did, because all the buses are usually packed....have stayed in casinos on the strip, but in future we would always pick fremont street ....p.s if you are going to the airport take the airport $3.50 for 2 compared to $40 for taxi

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks For The Rusch”
Reviews.Author: dewhit6959
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in one of the new Rusch Tower standard rooms on November 22, 2009. Our Las vegas trip was for five nights this holiday and we had enjoyed a day spent at the Golden Nugget on an earlier trip and decided to try one of their new rooms in the new tower. The valet parking is a nightmare at the new entrance since many of the locals were using the valet parking and guests were stuck out in the front entrance road. I have never seen so many local people with so many young children and babies in tow all over the hotel common area's and Fremont Street. We finally were checked in thru VIP services and a room was finally determined after several lenghty phone conversations and walkie talkie's. Our room was a king bed standard and was completely brand new. The smells were a bit overpowering and it was clear the finish had been made "under the gun" so to speak. The bed was not level, the light switches on the wood entertainment center were hard to find and the bathroom is not to our liking at all. The tub is a fiberglass insertable and has an unusually high step over, Someone is going to be seriously injured in the future. The shower/tub doors are very flimsy , very thin glass and not commercial grade. Very Cheap. The bathroom doors are twin shop doors. To close, you must pull both the doors together on overhead tracks. Not very private and not easily or quickly done. The room is very dark with browns and tans and in my opinion will show wear and tear quite quickly. The colors are very dark and very masculine, but not inviting for a sitting. The large corner leather (?) sectional is good for placing suitcases on, but not much for a relaxing sit and the three head lighting fixture immediately provokes sixty/seventy images and will be broken quickly . The television remote was overly complicated for getting just a news broadcast or weather channel , but the ipod alarm was a nice feature bolted to the nightstand. There was NO security for the elevators and no room key was required to access. I expressed my concern to a front desk agent who replied that several guests had voiced concerns. The walls were thin and other guests could be heard in the hallway who ever was coming and going thru the fire exit doors at the end of the hallway. The casino was extremely crowded as was Fremont street. The casino had a lot of persons , but not many gamers as the boss in our section was preparing to close several tables after dropping the minimum minutes earlier. Our boss was a former real estate agent who bemoaned the state of real estate in Las Vegas as was our dealer, a young Phillipino man who stated he had made a lot of money as a loan originator, but was now shutling his BMW between relatives homes to stay ahead of the repo man. I can't say I felt sorry for him. The crowds on Fremont street were depressing for us on this trip and we decided to cut our stay short and move on. we felt like we were in a maze trying to get around the Nugget this trip and felt like we were in a bus terminal. Still a nice place, just not that friendly feeling this trip and the Rusch towers are over priced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: unhappyTacoma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the new Rush Tower. The room was outstanding, and nicely appointed. There were obviously construction issues due to the excessive noise very early on my second morning of a 3 night stay. Throughout the Hotel there was a complete lack of service. I ate at both the Carson cafe as well as the Grotto. Both locations I recieved the worst service that I have ever had. I have tried since my stay to have the Hotel contact me to no avail. E-mail as well as letters have gone unanswered. I would like to know that my business matters , but it obviously doesn't. The Golden Nugget has been the only place that I have stayed for years...NEVER AGAIN!! Lousy service and a non caring staff made it clear to me that my business will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean room on Freemont for $59”
Reviews.Author: MKUltra3340
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night while en route to a friend's place in Arizona. I wasn't enthusiastic about being in Vegas. It's so tacky and seeing those pathetic, chain-smoking zombies glued to slot machiness depresses me. However, it was for only one night. The Valet, Jesse wasn't friendly or welcoming. Although we were the only car there when we pulled up, he was in a hurry to get rid of us and seemed very irritated that we wanted to self park. Bad first impression. Once inside, the gentleman who checked us in was extremely fast and seemed genuinely friendly. He was quick to offer a suggestion for dinner without having to be asked. I regret that I didn't make a note of his name. I stayed on a Monday, and the room was $59. It was elegently decorated in a modern fashion, immaculately clean, with clean, comfortable chairs, large flat pannel TV and a nice view. It's been three weeks since my stay, and I forgot which of the towers I stayed in- I think it was called the Carson Tower. I mention this because the hallway carpets were clean and nice and the hotel was extremely quiet (I am a very light sleeper, so I appreciated that)... although, it was a Monday, so maybe that was why. I did not use room service, nor did I use the pool, but it looked very clean and appealling. My only complaints are Jesse, the unfriendly valet, and that the wireless was very expensive-- I'm surprised by that because free wireless to me, is something I expect. It was even free at Super 8! My other complaint isn't specific to the Golden Nugget, but it is appalling to me that smoking is allowed inside the buildings. I assume it's to keep the slobs parked in fornt of the machines uninterrupted, but it is an affort to have to walk through and smell the stench. I would never return to Las Vegas, but I would happy recommend The Golden Nugget to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Yenism
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas and after doing a lot of research I was glad that i made the right choice to stay in downtown at the Golden Nugget. Obviously the whole Strip hotel vs Downtown is purely subjective... but there was no doubt that we loved the charm of old vegas and as first time travellers to sin city on a budget, Golden nugget ticks 90% the boxes. It is Luxurious and great value for money and is definitely the best hotel to stay if you were to stay downtown. I booked this surprise trip for my boyfriends 30th and after visiting casinos on the strip we much much preferred to go to the casinos downtown. Sure its probably not 'as 'glamourous' but it has charm and we like the old skool feel, plus we can hop from one casino to another in a matter of minutes, whilst with the hotel/casinos on the strip you would need to trek a bit to get from one to another. All in all our experience has been great, everyone that worked in the hotel was very pleasant, plus because we were newbies to casino games so we got lessons that are available through out the day, and they are really helpful. The dealers were also very friendly and were a joy to have a banter to. I would say though out of all the places to gamble, this might not be the cheapest, but its still alot cheaper than the strip and is also just as nice. The buffet was good value, especially when you stay with them, they give you booklet of vouchers... plus i would highly recommend the pizzas at the grotto. We had them on one very late evening and they were superb...Seriously you might wonder how good can a pizza can be, well this one is one of the nest i've tasted and the base was cooked to perfection. We hade a friendly check in lady and we managed to get a free up grade to the gold tower rooms, our room did have a slight strange sewage smell. Which other people has also mentioned previously. But i think its either there pipes or water system once we put the cooler on you cant really smell it. the smell didn't really put us off plus it could of been a bit warmer, but i guess it wasnt to bad for December and we still managed to have a nice swim at the H20 pool, though it was a real shame we couldn't go in the shark pool...

Reviews.Title: “good night's stay”
Reviews.Author: kaytchinha
Reviews.Content: I agree with the general assessment of the GN which is that it is clean, good value, a bit friendlier and homier than the casinos on the strip, and is less overwhelming than strip hotels via its downtown location. I found all of these things to be true. I stayed in a Gold Tower VIP room, which cost about $80 before tax. These rooms have a few more touches and include a free pass to the spa, among some other perks. The room was well-appointed with couch, desk, armchair, nice standing lamps, flatscreen TV, and comfy bed. The decor was a bit dark for my preferences-- very masculine, very grandpa's office. But I guess that goes along with the whole old-time rat pack theme of the hotel, so I didn't mind. The window is small because it is an old building. All in all it seemed like a good room to have vintage cocktails in with some friends before an old-time night downtown. I was by myself though, and immersed in a writing project, so I ended up leaving the GN the next day to go to a bigger, lighter room with a bigger desk at Caesars. But for the vast majority of people who are NOT in Vegas to spend a lot of time writing, I think the GN is a great choice. One final note: I definitely recommend the spa at the GN for the tub, sauna, and steam room. The steam was great and hot tub was big, hot, and uncrowded. I did not think as much of my body treatments-- they were ok but very expensive and not competitive in skill to "real" spas.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas charm, good value, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: smalltowngalReno
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas many times but this is the first time I have stayed at the Golden Nugget. My family and I were looking for an inexpensive hotel because we preferred to spend our money on some nice meals and good shows. The hotel was very busy and we had to wait quite a while to check in, we inquired about a room upgrade but were told the hotel was completely sold out. Our adjoining rooms were ready (the only bonus) but I do not recommend the South Tower rooms. They are very old, dark and small but we all enjoyed the old Vegas charm of this hotel and Fremont Street and it didn't take us long to get to our shows on the strip. The gaming was good and we enjoyed the casino. We dined at the buffet and the coffee shop, both were very mediocre and one morning our breakfast showed up stone cold. The waitress was not very helpful and simply avoided our table after we brought it to her attention. On the way out of the restaurant two of the employees were having a rather loud disagreement right in the middle of the restaurant (very unprofessional). Room service and valet service were both very fast and courteous so no complaints there. I was amazed when I saw they are still charging for internet access at this hotel and to top it off, it was quite slow. We saw Terry Fator at the Mirage and Rob Thomas at the Palms, both excellent shows. Dinner at Japanois in the Mirage and Nine at the Palms were expensive, but delicious! I would stay at the Golden Nugget again, but not without confirmed reservations in one of the larger, newer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AprilMayJuneSeattle
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we asked for a quiet room and were given a room between the elevators and the ice machine. The window looked out onto a wall. There was not enough lighting in the room to read. We asked for a room change and were told that they would call us back, but no call was received.

Reviews.Title: “If you are not wanting to be on the strip - this is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: markandjeremy
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, with a bit of history in downtown. Room was large and comfortable, even though there was three of us staying together. The casino did not do many low stake card games and was frequented by more serious gambling aficionados. Great for one night but the strip hotels are better for most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “overall it was a good visit”
Reviews.Author: texascandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 night at the Nugget while in town for the NFR. We had stayed there once about 10 years ago and thought we would try it again. We stayed in the Gold Tower and overall it was a good visit. The staff were all pleasant and friendly, the shark tank/pool area was interesting (we didn't try the pool-the weather was too cold for us), and the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a little small, but nothing we couldn't deal with. We ate at the Buffet for breakfast and dinner and thought it was decent. Not as fancy or elaborate as some others, but good. We loved the small bar area behind the Rush Tower check in with the huge salt water tank behind the bar. Good happy hour specials-the ahi tuna nachos were especially good. We also ate at the Italian restaraunt on site, The Grotto, and were very pleased. Had a good thin crust wood fired pizza one night, and a very good pasta dish the other. The self parking garage is free-it would be nice if they had a walkway connecting it to the hotel. My only real complaint is that they do charge $13 for 24 hours of internet. With free wifi everywhere these days, that seems pretty cheapo of them! I like downtown better than the strip-it is smaller and easier to get places. Seems like the strip is always packed and it is so big, it isn't easy to visit other places. We did have a car, so that helped, too.

Reviews.Title: “I had no idea there was a hotel of this caliber in downtown Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: lsgoodwin
Reviews.Content: After my nightmarish evening at the Plaza Hotel and Casino (see my review of that fleabag!) I checked into the Golden Nugget, and couldn't have been more happy. For about $15 more a night, the difference was staggering! First, the casino, lobby and elevators have been beautifully restored, and are clean and fresh smelling. The check-in staff was not overtly friendly, but still very polite and respectful. The offer of bellboy service was made, but in the age of rolling luggage, who needs that! I wasn't expecting much from my Gold Tower room, but was delighted to see how spacious and luxurious it was! Amazingly comfortable bed, nice furniture, giant flat-panel television, mini-safe for valuables, etc. The entry area was marbled, with the balance of the room carpeted. Everything was immaculately clean, and the room was fresh smelling but not laden with cleaning chemicals or disinfectant. The bathroom was smallish (hey, this is a very old building) but again, it was beautifully restored...marble tile, elegant sink/counter, shower with curved curtain rod and great water pressure, etc. The commode seemed to be rocket powered! WiFi internet access was a bit pricey at $12.95 a day, but it worked well and was very speedy. Now none of this was a fluke, as each of my three friends had rooms that were virtually identical. If I had to say anything negative about the room, it would be that sound isolation is not terribly good. It's not that I could hear people through the walls, but sounds in the hallway (doors slamming, people walking, etc.) definitely seemed quite loud. Again, this probably just goes with the territory in an older building. No big deal. That evening my friends and I took a quick dip in the pool, and had fun swimming up within inches of the giant fish and sharks in the central aquarium. It was fascinating to be so close to these beautiful animals. Afterwards we soaked in the jacuzzi for an hour or so, to unwind before going out to dinner. The pool staff was attentive and helpful...lots of clean, high quality towels were provided, and the wait staff was quick to bring drinks around. We spent a fair amount of time in two Nugget bars, I wish I could remember the name of them. The first has a large balcony that hangs out over Fremont Street, and it's a great spot to do a little "people watching." The second is a circular arrangement with the bar in the middle, and it had the most amazing band playing there. Just four piece (guitar, keyboardist/vocalist, drums, bass) but they sounded huge, their level of musicianship was tremendous and the singer really knew how to work a crowd. Honestly, I had no idea that downtown Vegas had a hotel of this caliber! When traveling for work, I usually stay at the Bellagio. Now the Nugget is no Bellagio, but you know what...it's really not too far behind! Anyhow, I definitely recommend this hotel to anybody who wishes to enjoy the "old school" Fremont Street scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice hotel in downtown vegas”
Reviews.Author: NZfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Downtown vegas is much more relaxing than the strip and the golden nugget good place to stay. Free parking round the back in building, which is a short walk across to the hotel. Room fairly standard, but comfortable. Swimming pool was highlight, going through shark tank down clear slide. Like most vegas pools bit much chlorine in the pool, but still fun. McDonalds down the street has 99cent pancakes and buffet across the road at the freemont is good value. Most people you talk to like the golden nugget. We didn't gamble there, but enjoyed our one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: catfish55
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I had a great time at the Golden Nugget. The casino crew is outstanding for friendliness and professionalism. When my key didn't work to open our room, security was quick to respond and allow me access to the room. If there was one drawback, it would be with the marriage the Golden Nugget has with RCI time share vacations. We didn't appreciate being targets for their "sign up for a presentation" every time we passed by their booth on the way to our room. Being familiar with RCI time share vacation rentals, we knkow they are not what they seem and do not follow through with their promises. Other than that, we will go back to the Golden Nugget in the future and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and play and get PAID!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjarami1
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Golden Nugget 11/18/09 - 11/21/2009. When we arrived we mistakenly went to the check-out line instead of the check-in line. The staff did not turn us away and immediately checked us in. I asked if I could have an upgrade and he complied without hesitation. We still were in the Carson (South) Tower, but had a refurbished room. The room had a flat screen tv, a view of the Stratosphere, and was immaculently clean...not a single bit of dust. Food: We ordered room service our first evening. The friendly staff had our food and all the fixings to our door in less than 15 minutes, now that's service!!! The Texas sized fries are the absolute best. We also ate at the Buffet which was superb! When you check-in you will receive a coupon book that has a buy one get one free buffet, good Mon-Fri. I highly suggest going to the Buffet. Casino: Our first night I won a little over $800, but played in back the days after. Don't go to Vegas thinking you're going to hit the big one; go to have FUN!!! I also visitied Binions, Mermaids, and Freemont Hotel & Casino. They had nothing on the Golden Nugget. Would I go back??? Absolutely! The review prior to this one stated the bellman do not offer their services and that you have to ask for service. I did not experience this at all. If you want to get away from glamour of the strip and just want to have some downtown fun, Golden Nugget outshines all of the other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in GN, Rush Tower & Downtown”
Reviews.Author: onlytravelsouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the new Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget. This was our 1st stay downtown and had booked 2 nights but made plans to leave and stay somewhere else after only having been there a couple hours. The casino area reeks badly of heavy smoke, the machines and tables are practically on top of each other. The new area was not very big - there were no craps tables in the new area (the game we play). The new restaurant looked very plain - didn't eat there. We did eat at the Grotto which was excellent. The Rush Tower lobby smelled like smoke since it was connected to the old GN. I thought the rooms seemed small and dark - I felt like I was in a Hyatt Place. The mattress seemed too soft. The a/c was loud though I thought everything was supposed to be new. The shower was nice. The towels shed all over us (perhaps they had not yet been washed before). The hallways were dark and lightened by red lights - bringing to mind the Amsterdam Red Light District. We were not impressed with the pool area - small with chairs on top of each other and the sun blocked out by the tall surrounding buildings. The $250 worth of coupons seemed like a bust also. The buffet coupons are only good during the week; drink coupons are for $2 draft beer which just about most of the Fremont Street bars served as their regular price. We did not find the front deak or the dealers to be nice or friendly. The whole atmosphere seemed sleazier to me. There wasn't any security by the elevators checking for room keys and seemed like the pool area was also open to the general public as no one was checking for room keys.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget great spot for first time downtown”
Reviews.Author: LuvLVEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget recently Nov 19-22. All staff I approached were friendly and polite. Checkin was not busy at all on Thursday morning. New clerks were being trained but the process was quick and painless. I was given an newly renovated king room on the 16th (non-smoking) floor. What a nice surprise being able to go up to our room at 11 a.m.! The ice machine didn't work on our floor but you just go up or down one floor to get ice. Why sweat the small stuff - you are on vacation! The elevators were always fast. I am a slot player and hubby plays blackjack. Neither one of us had a problem getting a drink when our glass was empty. We had a lunch and breakfast in the Carson St Cafe. Meals were adequate (nothing special) service was friendly. First night we had dinner at Vic & Anthonys. A meal to remember. Lance took good care of us. We started with lobster bisque laced with cognac (yum) followed by salmon stuffed with crab and gouda for me and a 16 oz prime rib steak for hubby. Yes, he finished it but neither of us had room for dessert. We took in the Gordie Brown show in the Gordie Brown showroom - a very nice venue. Bought the 2nd cheapest seats and had a very good view. No one sat in front of me so I had a great view and I'm a shorty. Laughed my head off but he covered so much material that I had to buy the DVD. I would say the show is relevant to ages 40+ (some 20 year olds might not know who Wayne Newton, Tom Jones or Sammy Davis Jr. are. A nice plus was all the eye candy. That weekend there was the Firefighter Combat Challenge going on outside on Fremont St and the Fitness America Weekend in the Nugget. Oh my. Firefighters and body builders - OH MY. Women as well. Hubby and I had to take turns keeping each other from running into things. But some of those discount spray tans were ghastly shades of orange - eek. Checkout was done fast and painless through the tv. The smoke was a bit bothersome in the casino but I didn't notice it at all in the other areas and I'm from Alberta which has banned smoking in ALL public places. I would definitely stay at the Nugget again. The room was clean and the water hot. New plasma tv worked fine for my episodes of Survivor and CSI. Everything is close on Fremont St and the atmosphere a bit friendlier than on the Strip. One lady in the Fitzgerald casino asked me if I minded if she smoked before she lit up her cigarette 3 slot machines down from me. I about fell off my stool. Very considerate of her.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToShopToo
Reviews.Content: The staff throughout the casino and hotel were the rudest I have ever encountered. The front desk staff was snooty rude even though we were staying in the top suite. The bellmen didn't ask me for help with my luggage even though there is no ramp and you have to cross a series of stairs to get to a level where there is an elevator. I walked right past them with my luggage and they didn't offer a hand, but when I reentered the area to tell my husband something they interrrupted our conversation telling me something unrelated to what I was trying to tell my husband. I told them if they wanted to help me they could have helped me with my luggage a minute ago. They replied "well you didn't ask"......"whatever", I guess you have to ask the employees at Golden Nugget to do their job?? The buffet was subpar to those in Vegas. Our waitress also tried overhearing my husband and I conversation and tried joining in on our conversation when it was of none of their concern. To me that is rude and inappropriate. It was hard to find a waitress on the casino floor and after playing there I was always dehydrated to the point my mouth was bone dry. I approached a man in a suit on the floor and explained to him that I could not find a waitress he didn't offer much help so I went to the bar and had to pay $4 for a water. The slots were tight and some I would not get one credit back. I made my rounds to the casinos and found the Fremont Casino (kiddy corner to the Golden Nugget) to be one of the best paying casinos and there was always a waitress coming around for drinks. I didn't give Golden Nugget another penny after that. The room was average clean and had only minimal accomodations compared to other hotels. The hallway door was about 2 inches shorter than the floor so all hallway noise would be directed into our room. I also had to call housekeeping as they forgot to give us towels, refill water bottles in fridge etc. This was also the first hotel I had ever stayed in where they charged $5 for 15 minutes of interent service on a public pc in a hallway. My husband used the spa while there for a massage. It was overpriced and they tacked on a 20% tip automatically. The next day I checked out Bellagio spa and they don't tack on a tip and it was a lot nicer and classier than Golden Nugget. There was also no vending machines for hotel guests everyone had to use the gift shop were pop was $3 a bottle. It seems like they could be a little more considerate of their guests, but I guess their goal at the Golden Nugget is to hire the cheapest workers who are rude and won't do their job unless they are asked to and rip off their customers. Golden Nugget however was one of the more updated/modern casinos on Fremont even though the entire place including hallways on a nonsmoking floor were filled with a smell of stale smoke. This was the first time I had stayed on Fremont and I don't think I will stay downtown again. I will never step foot in the Golden Nugget ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Gold!”
Reviews.Author: GillianW1
Reviews.Content: Fab shark pool,if a little scary at first! Nice inside and outside of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Fireguy169
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget from the Sunday 15th-Thursday 19th November. Great stay!! Very clean hotel! Although I was with a group, I decided to get my own room at the fantastic rate of 49$ (Golden Nugget website rate) for the comfort and benefit of not sharing a bathroom. It was well worth it!! Got a huge room with a super comfy king size bed! Bathroom was incredibly clean and nice. Amazing pool with shark tank/aquarium!! Beautiful hot tub and lounge area too. they were doing some swimsuit model photoshoots there which also made for some nice scenery. Bring sunglasses. Fremont Street is right outside, and was a fantastic experience. Lots of live entertainment and things to see. Casino very nice, staff very helpful and friendly. Parking garage is very close and easy to get in and out of. Rental cars available right at the Carson Tower. Got a great deal on a car for the day from Betty! There are restauraunts in the Hotel, but for a deal, go into the casino and up the escalator or elevator for the buffet restauraunt. I had a big breakfast early every weekday morning for 9.99$ and if you time it right can get a lunch in for nearly the same price before 3:30pm. Very classy dining area! I ate at other buffets in the neighborhood, which were nowhere near as nice. Book an airport shuttle for 9$ 24hrs in advance, otherwise the cab ride is kind of steep. 28$ and its really not that far. You can find accomodations for less on the Strip, but after going there and walking the strip after dark, the Nugget and Freemont St felt much more safer. We did spend our first night at the Luxor, which has a beautiful atmosphere, but our room was horrible. You will not be dissapointed with the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, even in Carson or South Tower which is farthest from Casino”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Booked with package by Travelociy and paid $85 per night with tax (for a Saturday night). Check-in was easy. The Carson or South Tower rooms are least expensive and the walk from the street is a little long (through the casino, past the Tank pool, up the elevator), but the room was nice and very large. Easy check-in (not a long line). Was also very clean. Only negatives - small amount of mildew around caulking in shower, the toiletries provided (shampoo, conditioner, lotion) had been used by others, and the bathroom fan was noisy. It was so nice to be downtown within walking distance of many casinos and be provided with robes in closet and a closet safe. Was a little cool for the pool, but many were still there. The tube slide through the shark tank looked great and I liked the blackjack tables outside by the pool. Cots were crammed closely together. Didn't try the restaurants - but we had a great breakfast at the Golden Gate's coffeee room (not in the back), and of course shrimp cocktails in the back of the Golden Gate (now $1.99 rather than $0.99).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kmm808
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in almost every hotel in Downtown except this one. They had a 1/2 price deal so we decided to try it. The front desk was very friendly and we had arrived early so they took our luggage to hold and asked us to check back in a few hours. We arrived back at the hotel about 3 hours before check in time and they said that our room was ready. We also got a great coupon book through hotels.com, (I think you can get it with signing up with the Player's club). The room was large enough for the 2 of us and VERY clean! Large flat screen tv, beautiful view of the mountains. The timeshare people at the bottom of the elevators asked us everyday if we wanted some comps. we just said no, they didn't pressure us like some places on the Strip. We ate at Carson's Cafe which was average priced. I wouldn't recommend it, I ordered a medium rare steak for $11.99 and it was bleeding. The rest of the food was cold. My husband had the prime rib special for $8.99 and it was just OK. The shark tank is a great attraction. They have a really nice pool too and a pool bar that is open until 2 am and has poker and blackjack tables next to the pool. All the other Fremont Street Casinos were very empty, Golden Nugget was packed! If you walk outside the door, you are in the middle of the action on Fremont Street. The location was excellent, and we only paid $49 per night! At 1 am, people were polishing everything, even at the Starbucks (they have 2 of them in the hotel) they moved everything out and cleaned the entire Starbucks each night! The casino didn't pay out, so we didn't play there much. Pays out way better on the Strip. the buffet prices are really good if you have the 2/1 coupon it came out to $5.50 each for my husband and I. The best part about the Golden Nugget was the Gordie Brown Show. This guy is going to be really big one day. He's an incredible impressionist and had everyone in tears with his comedy. He headlines at the Golden Nugget and we had 2/1 tickets so the best seats only cost $69 for both of us! It didn't matter if you got the $29.95 seats or the $69.95 seats, it's a small 600 seat theatre so every seat is great. You have to see this show! I will definitely stay at the Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mnjjjmom
Reviews.Content: great bed, comfortable room..all of the employees were very polite and attentive..excellent value for the money..being downtown is a totally different experience than being on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: realtor99
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed one night there. Their website offers $10 room upgrade, but when checking in, was told there were no rooms to upgrade too, but then they did find one, but would not honor the website offer of a $10 upgrade, instead charged us another $40 for the upgrade. The girl at the check in desk was kind of a smart mouth. Although the room was nice, the bathroom is really small. Too bad for the check in girl, they will not get my business again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Ebes64
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas and stayed at the Golden Nugget. All I can say is this is by far the best hotel I have stayed at for the price in Las Vegas. The rooms are great as is the service and location. They have the best lunch buffet at only $10.99, with excellent food. The local casinos such as the Fremont have $3 black jack tables and the beverage servers bring beers frequently. Downtown is the only place to stay in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawgirl28
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice - I'd compare it to a Hilton. I stayed in the North Tower. Bathroom was small but nice. Everything was clean and I felt safe in the hotel as a solo female traveler (although off Tremont St, I definitely would not feel safe wondering around downtown). I had a great rate ($65/night) and for a 2-night business trip, it was fine. Hotel restaurants were fine - I did not try room service. Internet access was pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LuisS1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, and the pool is super, the Buffet is ok the best is breckfast and lunch, diner is no that good, the room are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: Freddie29
Reviews.Content: Our mixed family group (4 rooms) from CA and NY had a great time at the Golden Nugget. We had 2 economy rooms (spacious/nice bathroom/older decor) and 2 gold club rooms (modern, vessel sinks, TV in bathroom mirror, VIP check in with no lines, unlimited bottles of water and snacks, fresh coffee and newspapers in the morning plus a coupon booklet). Very comfy king bed with feather pillows and duvets. We didn't win but others in the group couldn't lose at slots or black jack...so was a good trip casino wise. (Try the Elvis slots!) Great location with easy access to the Fremont St. activities and casinos. Great for young (lots of free entertainment) and older (close to other casinos, easier walks than on the strip). The Grotto restaurant was divine! Out of 6 of us, not one complaint and lots of compliments! Cannot say the same about the Cafe, would not eat there again..only 3 out of 8 enjoyed their meals (and they ate sandwiches.) Actually tried the breakfast buffet which was Ok especially with a 2 for 1 coupon. Easy free valet (call down ahead and the car will be waiting for you.) Cool pool with slide through shark tank!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellin48
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel where we hosted our 20th wedding anniversary party by renewing our vows. Our party co-ordinator Jim Kinsella organised the whole event via email correspondence and it was perfection. Every detail was attended to, the hillarious "Elvis" service, food, bar, decorations, D.J. were fantastic. The wedding we always wanted plus Vegas was just fab. We would have no hesitation in recommending Jim to anyone considering this sort of event.

Reviews.Title: “Really feels like vegas”
Reviews.Author: wendywuredhill
Reviews.Content: Good old fashioned hotel with a really nice feel. Great to walk onto Fremont street . Great pool set up and a real sun trap from early morning. I would use this hotel again on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: belkauctions
Reviews.Content: Much better to stay Downtown than on the Strip. Walk right out of the hotel onto Freemont Street for the party! The beer and food is cheaper and so are the rates. The table limits are much better! the only problem is the very annoying people who stand at the elevaors and harrass the guests as they get off of and onto the elevator...they are trying to sell something and they work for the hotel. We avoided them like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay on Freemont Street!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsaxon9454
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I'd done the Freemont Street Experience...it was pretty cool! The rumors are true, slots do seem to be looser in Old Town. We did well! The service was better and more attentive in the big casinos and we loved the canopy over Freemont Street. The hotel had recently been remodeled and was very clean and quiet. The room was pretty basic, but all you really need is a bed and a bathroom when you are in Vegas anyway. I think for the money it was pretty great. And it's not huge, so you don't have to walk 400 miles every time you leave your room! In Vegas that's a perk. The food was "okay". We ate at the diner and never went to one of their fancy restaurants...I'm sure the steakhouse would have been pretty great. If you want to go to the strip you can buy a ticket on The Deuce (double decker bus) and ride up to the strip. It takes awhile to get there, but the price is right ($7 for unlimited rides for 24 hours). I'd recommend Golden Nugget to the traveler on a budget. Even one who isn't. The less you spend on accommodations the more you have to spend on shows!

Reviews.Title: “so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: floralbrigades
Reviews.Content: i had a lovely stay here, the bed was giant and comfortable, the staff were nice (the people at the front desk seemed to be a bit tired and over it by the time i checked in, but i would be too at 10pm!) my room was huge! i felt like i could run laps! the bathroom was nice. and i was excited to be able to smoke indoors again! and you step out the front door and you're on fremont street! this was handy because i was mostly in town to take photos, but it was a bit annoying how far i was from all the other casinos, but i guess this is my fault for not checking the map properly. in the morning i nursed my hangover with eggs florentine in bed, and they were the best poached eggs i had on my entire trip of the U.S!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: dragonrn67
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one day, because we had to check out of MGM on the strip at 11am, and our flight left at 11pm, and needed a place to put our bags, rest, and see a bit more. We hadn't gone to Old Vegas yet, so decided to go on our last day. Old Vegas is not for me, we saw the Freemont Experience, a light show that was fun, but I expected more after hearing about it. Unexpected downside: when we returned to our room, we were LOCKED OUT! Because we had locked the door from the inside before we left, apparently when the guest opens the door to leave, it does not default open, and thusly the door locks. Two different security people had to come up, and the supervisor stated "this happens all the time." The hotel had a LOVELY front desk person, she is from Nashville, can't remember her name. We ate at the Italian place there, NOT good service, waitress FULL of excuses, I sat with an empty beverage for most of my meal as she rushed by me saying "I'm getting that beer!" Overall the hotel is nice, but kind of cheesy. The pool has a cool shark tank, but the actual swimming area is very small, and chairs are on top of each other. The price Expedia gave me was only $66.00 for the night, so although we were only there for the day, they let us check in early at 12pm, and we enjoyed a solid 9 hours there. I wouldn't go back, but its more because I did not like the vibe of old Vegas (die hard gamblers, polyester contingency, lots of homeless, beggers, very little to do....).

Reviews.Title: “my first bad vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: AhhCraps
Reviews.Content: My first bad experience in Vegas and this happened at the Golden Nugget this past weekend. Check in on Friday, and was given a suite in the Spa Tower. Beautiful 2 story room. Thumbs up. Put bag in room and went out to gamble. Got back to room early Saturday morning around 3:30 am. Slept and up around 11:30am and downstairs in the casino by around noon. Although I have a beautiful room, I'm the type that stays out all day and just use the room to sleep. Once again gambled till around 3:30 am early Sunday. Go to the room, put the key in, but the key did not worked. Damn. Thinking that the key got de-magnetized, so trek downstairs to the front desk to try and get a new key. At the front desk, they could not find me as registered guest!!!! So I showed them the "guest card" showing the dates of my arrival and checkout which was supposed to be Monday. After checking somemore, the front desk robot told me that they checked me out on Saturday just after I have gotten up and left the room!!!! I ask why, of course the front desk robot could not answer me. Then I ask what happened to my stuff that I left in the room. After numerous phone calls, I was told that the cleaning staff removed my toiletry bag and kept it in housekeeping somewhere. However, my bag that was in the closet with a couple of t-short on hangers were nowhere to be found. Remember, this is around 4:00 in the morning. I'm tired. My cloths stinks and you don't want to be near my feet. So I asked the front desk robot if it is golden nugget's policy to check people out of their room before they are suppose to!!! Of course no answer was given. Granted, the front desk robot offered me another room, but given their treatment so far, I declined. I could get a room anywhere on the strip. By this time, someone from housekeeping arrived with a blue plastic bag with my toiletry bag inside, but my other bag with clothing and everything else is nowhere to be found. Seeing that there were no answers to be gotten from the front desk robot and I really did not want to wake up the host that make the reservation for me, I just gave them my cell number and ask to them call me when they found my bag. So I left with my toiletry bag and went to another casino on the strip. Expecting a call early in the morning when someone with some sort of authority that could sort out the situtation but it was not to be. No one called. So, I had to drag myself back downtown as I have some valuable items in the bag that I left in the room. Eventhough I showered, I had to put my old clothing back on. So I still stink. I went to the host office told the host on duty my story and after more phone calls, I was told that someone else with a name that was close to mine asked to check out on Saturday and they make the mistake and check me out instead. Right!!!!!!! With my stuff still the room!!!! At this point, I really didn't care for their explanation, I just wanted my bag. After a few calls, I was told my bag was at Lost and Found and the host sort of hinted for me to go there to get my bag. Yeah right!!!! How many strikes is this? Seeing the expression on my face, he quickly call someone to bring it down. After retriving my bag, I check the bag and thank God everything was there. They actually did folded my t-shirts bery nicely before putting back in the bag. Thumbs up. Thumbs down for making me come back down to get it. So I left with my bag. Today, Monday, I have left a message with the host that make my reservation to call me but alas no call yet. Maybe tomorrow (they are very busy you know ...) or the day after or probably never. Well, golden nugget will never see 1 gambling dollar from me again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelku
Reviews.Content: The remodeled rooms in the South Tower were beautiful and comfortable. We had thought to maybe use the pool but it is like center stage at a singles club, surrounded by glass and full of young people, so not the sanctuary we oldies were hoping for. All staff were very polite and helpful. Food was good. The highlight of the buffet was a wonderful server who sang happy birthday to someone at a neighboring table. By popular demand she sang another song after. The woman needs to be on stage she is so incredibly talented! We did tend to avoid the restaurant across from the pool after one meal there with an over zealous server who was a little too interactive with the guests. (constantly commenting, talking us out of ordering certain items, etc). Even he was very nice though.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sylvano7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in september, had prebooked with netflights for only £105, but it was only a basic room in the south tower, wished we had paid for an upgraid to the north tower which I understand are much better rooms, there was no coffee maker or fridge. We only ate in carsons cafe which was very nice. Loved being down town, such a great atmosphere, went to the strip one night but was so glad to get back to fremont. The hotels pool area is fantastic with the shark tank, what an experience swimming with the sharks. It was lovely going to all the other casinos knowing your bed is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “I love downtown Vegas and the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: slickllh
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Vegas. I've stayed at the Aladdin (now PH), the Palazzo, and the Monte Carlo. I've visited downtown before, but never stayed there. This time, I thought I'd give it a try. I'm very glad that we did. We arrived on a Thursday night, around 11pm. Check in was a little slow, but thorough. We were given a booklet of Golden Nugget coupons as well. We used about three of them during our two night stay. Our room on the 14th floor was nicely appointed, two beds & non-smoking - just as I asked for. Everything was very clean. I wished that our room had a mini-fridge and coffee maker, but we were ok without it. The complimentary toiletries were good sized and nice. After getting settled in, we went down to the Grille for a bite. We used a $2 off per person coupon. The food was really good, and it came out fast, considering it was after midnight. The pool area was great, if but a little small - really liked the shark tank. The only real downside was that there wasn't a whole lot of sun reaching the space. It more than likely has a lot to do with the time of year (the sun doesn't get as high- we had similar problems finding chairs in the sun at the Venetian later in the week), but you have to scope it out early if you want to get a spot in the sun. We ate at the Buffet for breakfast (used a two-for-one coupon and got breakfast for $10 for both of us!) and it was pretty tasty. I recommend going earlier than 10am if you want all of the breakfast selections... at around 10:15 they started switching over to lunch. All in all, I would definitely return to the Golden Nugget. It's a good value and a fun, laid back atmosphere. I'm hoping to give the spa a try during my next stay. *I also signed up for their 24 Karat Club (a must if you like Vegas and getting offered room specials!)

Reviews.Title: “Wow !!!! is all I need to say !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boogieshoes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on the strip many times ,thought we would try downtown for a change. We were so impressed by the friendly staff ( everyone from the front desk to the bartenders and waiters ,bellmen,etc) All were professional and helpful .Went to Vic's ,sat at the bar and had the BEST martini ,oysters and crab cakes !!!!!!! The bartender was fabulous ! Trust me I'm very well traveled and quite particular ...... The hotel room was spotless,quiet and comfortable .The pool was fun and relaxing. Ever played blackjack in your bathing suit ? Needless to say we will be returning in the spring and will never stay on the strip again !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Teenagers Review of The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: sdeeken
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget Hotel was one of my favorite parts of Vegas. One of the most popular aspects of this hotel is the casino located on the bottom floor, although I was unable to take part in the gambling due to my age, the sight of all the machines and black jack tables was overwhelming. At the core of the hotel, the swimming pool was one of my favorite places. The slide running through the shark tank was awesome and thrilling, and definitely attracted a lot of people, not only children. The actual hotel rooms were very cozy and welcoming. The Golden Nugget Hotel offers tons of opportunities for teens including the swimming pool, and all sorts of shops, including souvenir shops. For teens, Fremont Street offers all sorts of stores, restaurants and the famous light shows. My experience at The Golden Nugget was great, and I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Wee_Teamies
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent hotel. It has everything you need... from dining & gambling to relaxing & partying! Rooms are gorgeous and we stayed in a standard room! Only downside regarding hotel is no free wifi anywhere in hotel - internet access in each room is charged daily and it's $12.99! Hotel is based in downtown area - this area is much better for gambling compared to the new strip as it's much cheaper! However, this is also the only con regarding the hotel - to get to the main strip you can board the Duece bus...but let me warn you it takes upwards of an hour to travel the short distance between both strips, especially in the evernings and the bus is always overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: SmartNorth
Reviews.Content: We (my partner and two friends) booked 2 rooms in the South Tower in May this year and really looked forward to our stay. When we arrived we where pleasantly surprised. The refurbishment was finished in the North and South tower, only some light work on the new tower, so no noise and dust or nothing. So that was a good start as we expected the refurbishment still to be under way. But it only got better. Once at the desk we asked casually about a free upgrade. The receptionist said he would ask the manager and when he came back he said we would be eligible for a free upgrade. So we ended up in the Spa tower in a two bed roomed suite which was the most beautiful thing we have ever seen. One living room in the middle tastefully decorated with top quality French furniture, 40" flat screen TV, entertainment system, bose speakers etc. Curtains closed by just pressing a button next to your bed.Then there is one bedroom on either site with the same decor. Another 40" flat screen and bose radio-cd player. The bathrooms where fantastic. 2 bathrooms in the suite. Double sized spa bath and huge steam shower. And another TV, but bit smaller. The whole suite was absolutely spotless. Not a mark anywhere and not a speck of dust. We where of course over the moon with this free upgrade. The rest of the hotel was great too. The food on the buffet was great so was the meal in the grotto. All very reasonable priced. And then of course there is the pool, what a fantastic place to just sit there and watch the sharks and fish and have a nice drink with friends. The staff went out of there way to help us with any questions we had. We will definitely stay at this hotel again, not just because we had an upgrade. We looked in some other rooms too and they where very good as well. Although our room was right above the Fremont experience, you could hardly hear anything, it was lovely and quiet. And when you have enough of Fremont street, the strip is only a short drive away. Will def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Never the Strip again, always Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Munichmaedchen
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Golden Nugget and the friendliness of the staff was the first impression I got when we arrived. When we told them that we would get married the next day, they were so helpful drawing a map of where to find the license office and where to find the deuce bus stop and the little white wedding chapel and where the limo would pick us up. I loved the room, everything clean and we got an extra nice one in the higher floors with nice view. The restaurants were all great and the buffet was our favorite. We simply have no complaints and will come back next year for our wedding anniversary. We had the time of our life in and outside the gorgeous pool area. I will never stay at the strip again - it is nice to stroll downtown Fremont Street with a 99 cent margarita in the hand listening to live music and watching the laser show without cars driving left and right from you like on teh strip. LOVE downtown. We even met Chumlee and the folks from the TV show Pawn Stars and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very nice for money”
Reviews.Author: MARSPEC
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget was very nice for very little money. Grotto restaurant in lobby is excellent. Rooms are elegant, hotel seems clean and up to date. Love the shark tank, wish we had time to enjoy the pool. Fremont street experience is a plus. Do take note walking from here to or from the strip at night is really not a reasonable option in this rough neighboorhood. Renting a car is fine to get back and forth, and really not any more than a few cab fares. I have heard the bus is ok to get to and from the strip to, though I have not tried it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sgaucho
Reviews.Content: We live in europe and honestly even a 3 star hotel in europe provide better services than the Golden Nugget. What else can you say about a hotel that wants to charge you 5$ for an EXTENSION CABLE!!!!!!!??????? We arrive at the dinner buffet at 2130 and 3 ladies sitting in the reception desk rudely inform us that the restaurant closes at 2200 and that we need to hurry. Infact, my wife, the ever polite lady greeted the recepcionist only to be ignored totally! The only thing that we really liked about this hotel was the SPA amenities which are really cool although the showers in the SPA dont permit you to have a cold shower! The Gold room was basic with no tub or minibar.. For 109 $ per night, you can find a better deal at the Bellagio or the Venetian..

Reviews.Title: “great nw updates”
Reviews.Author: Mochidog
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before, but the new updates are really great, especially the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “"Extreme Pools" Travel Channel”
Reviews.Author: Swim4speed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget in September. I stayed on Friday and Saturday nights for about $59 per night. The price for hotels (like Treasure Island, MGM, New York New York, etc) on the strip were going for around $150-200 per night. Anyways, I read about the pool at the Golden Nugget and decided to give it a try. The hotel seemed to be completely renovated. The wait at the check-in desk was about 25 minutes. The room was completely renovated and better than I would have expected at any hotel in the old downtown. The room was probably as good as the standard rooms in Treasure Island, MGM, and New York New York (The last times I stayed at TI or MGM were about 3-5 years ago). The bed, air conditioning, TV, and bathroom were all fine. The Golden Nugget swimming pool was awesome! It was featured on the Travel Channel show, “Extreme Pools” around the world! The aquarium was right in the middle of the pool and was filled with about 6 sharks and a bunch of different kinds fish. It was really cool being able to watch sharks swim right by my face! Within a couple of inches! The slide was pretty cool too! It twists and turns a few times before you shoot through the middle of the shark tank/aquarium! I had to ride it a few times. The pool was not crowded when I went. The Golden Nugget buffet was very good for the price. It was only $21 and they had pretty much everything. It was not as big as the Wynn or Bellagio buffets, but it is much less expensive. I had crab, fish, chicken, turkey, Chinese food, Indian food, pizza, desserts, and much more. If you want to stay downtown, then I recommend the Golden Nugget. If you want to hang out on the strip, then you might want to stay…on the strip. The drive to the strip is only about 10 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in downtown Las vegas”
Reviews.Author: CaroleCindy
Reviews.Content: We were entirely pleased with our experience. The room, pool, and dining areas were top notch. The nightly light and sound show outside the hotel was spectacular, including the live entertainment. The only drawback was the distance fromn the strip and expense of taxi to get to and from other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel....Must enjoy the Fish Tank Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: CharmTravel
Reviews.Content: Terrific service, fast check in. Wonderful pool area with Shark tank and super slide through the middle of the fish tank! Fascinating watching the fish swim right next to you!Construction outside the South Tower causes noise and traffic congestion. New tower being built! Inside the hotel the reconstruction on the floors is done with little disturbance to the guests. Top notch hotel for the price. You could never have the amenities the Golden Nugget provides at the price you pay on the Strip! Enjoy all of the amenities Freemont Street offers while staying at this hotel...covered 5 block area, good paying slots, overhead light show. Easy area to walk and experience evening concerts, many other casinos in a short walking distance, good, inexpensive souvenier shops.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cre8tv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Nugget three times now, and it is the only place we stay. The location is great, and the hotel itself is so pretty and the rates are always good. We had my 50th birthday while we were in LV this past time, and ordered a birthday cake from the hotel. The cake as so cute (made to order), delicious as well, and the price couldn't be beat. If you're a ":downtown" kind of person, the Nugget is very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay, very clean and a very new feeling.”
Reviews.Author: djsautobody
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest and classiest hotel in the downtown area. Very friendly staff and crew. Our hostess, Nicole was very thorough and concerned that all of our needs and wishes were addressed. I wouls suggest requesting a room in the north tower if you want to be close to Freem,ont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mommyme26
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed downtown before, but...We would stay at the Golden Nugget again! My daughter saw the Shark Pool on the Travel Channel and asked if we could go and check it out. I called and was shocked at how inexpensive the rate are. We booked two nights and got a $25 room credit to spend in the hotel. The room was huge and nicely decorated. Bathrooms, are big and clean. DH loved the big screen tv. The pool is nothing short of amazing! My kids loved it, but truth be told DH and I did too! The only thing that I did not like was the dinner buffet. Over priced and not very good. We did order drinks and snacks from the bar around the pool, and we found it to be a good vaule and very good. Service all over the hotel was great! Can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Management Attitude To Compalints - "That's The way It Is - Deal With It!"”
Reviews.Author: Scouse-Express
Reviews.Content: As a Tour Bus Driver, I've had the misfortune to stay here twice, within the last month. The rooms are okay, but only two out of the four elevators serving floors between 2-9 were working, in the South Tower, leading to long lines and frustrated guests. As for my experience, I needed to load 42 suitcases in the morning prior to depature and a 300 mile drive to LAX Airport. Unfortunately, the area outside the Hotel on S 1st Street is a construction zone, very dusty when dry and muddy when wet. There is a fully paved area just up the street. However, I was not permitted to park here whilst loading luggage, which led to my shoes being covered in mud, along with the bottom of my trousers. When I complained to the Doorman, he replied......"That's the way it is - deal with it" and when my Tour Manager complained to the "Duty Manager" she got the exact same response. It seems as though this attitude runs rife through the Company. 20oz Pop is $2.50, bag of potato chips is $1.50. Breakfast consisting of Hasbrowns, eggs, sausage and coffee is $17 + gratuity. You get the picture!

Reviews.Title: “great time but 48 hrs is more than enough!!”
Reviews.Author: bls517678
Reviews.Content: downtown is not the strip and both have the good and bad points....if downtown is your choice then the GN is the place to be...great food...great time...good play...pool was what i thought it would be...you can see all of fremont street and more in 4 hrs...we stayed 48 hrs...more than enough time...i'm probably just getting to be a nasty old man but can't vegas survive without the "families with rug rats running around" being part of the landscape..?..there's enough theme parks to choke a horse for the little darlings...why vegas.....?...we chose the gold club room because of the offers but saw no advantage...when we got there the line was long and no vip checkin as promised(later we found out go to the vip lounge)...would have been nice to know...the room wouldn't cool down below 68...tv reception was fair...and no security...anyone could have gotten on the elevator and gone right up to our floor with us...you have to walk thur the lobby to get to the pool...got old being pestered by the time share people...oh well....all and all i'd reccomend the GN but don't waste your money on the supposedly high end rooms...P.S.pay the money to take the taxi from the airport...you'll be on the shuttles for over an hr because downtown is the last stop...after 12 hrs of airports/flytime...those 60 mins seemed like 6 days and gave me a attitude right from the start....2 days at downtown then 3 days on the strip...great combination.....

Reviews.Title: “Typical Las Vegas Hotel --- Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: BLUEWONDER1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of the tour. We were given standard room on the South Tower -- as you will expect massive hotel with 2 towers North & South. As we were a tour group we only given the South Tower room because non-refurbished room and far from all the restaurants in the hotel except Starbuck Coffee on the ground floor of ST but only open 06:00 - 22:00 --- at NT Starbuck open 24 hours. Room was ok --- small, dirty, very dated and no duvet only very thin blanket , an air-condition was very noisy and filthy --- bathroom very small and not so clean. We didn't see refurbished room at NT maybe it is much better but if you decide to stay here make sure you book at North Tower. Location is good if you prefer to stay near Fremont Street but if you like more Vegas feel better to stay by the strips. Restaurants in the hotel we tried The Buffet for breakfast and dinner very disappointing because of the quality of food --- the cost of buffet sound value for money but we have to say very very poor quality and we have to mention Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse in the hotel is absolutely perfect food, service, ambiance try this one you won't be disappoint --- you must book in advance for this restaurant as they are always busy. For our own opinion hotel is far too big for pleasure holiday guest -- swimming pool always very crowded can't relax at all ---- smoking was a problem for us some guests smoke inside the lobby the smell is far too much for us. Overall average stay but we won't come back to Las Vegas it is not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Love that pool slide!”
Reviews.Author: Josie87120
Reviews.Content: The GN was absolutely the best downtown casino hotel I've stayed at! The staff I came across were friendly and helpful from the gal at Starbucks to Andrew the waiter in the Carson St Cafe. My daughter and I were in the South Tower and the room was great! She liked the dressing table with the lighted mirror. Gordy Brown was hilarious! The time share folks were there; however, all I had to do was smile and say "not interested" and that's all it took. I loved the pool slide - I went down it 2X and I'll be 65 y.o. next month. GN is not responsible if folks bring their kids; and I'm also an avid cruiser and facts are there are parents who are very careless with their children. That's the case all over. I will definitely return to the GN real soon.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed. We will never stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Teri45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible. What happened to the fun Vegas? There are so many kids running rampid you can not have any fun. They are in the casino & of course parents drop their kids off at the pool while they gamble. I pulled a two year old out of the water because her mother was too busy drunking & talking to watch her. TIP: DON"T TAKE KIDS TO SIN CITY! Us grown ups go there for a reason, to have fun not to be bothered by kids. That is what Disney Land is for. You will never get a drink, you will never see any staff member smile & you will never win any money. You are harrased everytime you come off of the elevator or come in the front door to buy a time share. What a joke. If you want to win & get good service & drinks go to any other hotel on Fremont. I needed some food heated up from one of their restaurants & they refused to stick it in the microwave for me. Very small bed in south tower.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A SINGLE DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: luvlasvegasOhio
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and Fremont Street from the moment we walked onto it. The hotel staff was nothing but polite and helpful. Our room was an older one (South Tower) but was very clean and maintained. We had one small problem. The bathroom sink didn't drain the first time we used it, but my husband called the front desk and by the time we came back later in the afternoon it was fixed and we didn't have another problem with it. We felt we did get our money's worth. Will no doubt be staying with the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Still very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Tom43302
Reviews.Content: The G.N. iscertainly the class of the downtown hotels. Always feel comfortable at the Nugget and they seem to take care of their costomers. The cafe still has tasty meals and the rooms are very nice. I will stay here every time we stay downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best choice downtown.”
Reviews.Author: NOLAthenDCnow
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed there for three nights for a bachelor party in Vegas and had a good time. Pros: Large, clean, and recently renovated rooms. (Make sure you get one of the renovated ones. They charged $10 extra and it was worth it.) Everyone on staff we talked to was very nice. Great water slide at the pool. We were a group of 30s-early 40s adults and loved the water slide and shark tank. The pool isn't very large but had just enough room for the number of people there. It is hot in Vegas so the fact that the hotel shades the pool much of the day was fine. Cons: Downtown is a dump. We're not really gamblers and that part of town is mostly just depressing. Sure you can find $2 shots and margaritas at the hotels there. But I can also find cheap alcohol at home. If you want to head to the strip for a show or a decent restaurant the cab fare is about $25 each way. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. But I probably won't stay there next time I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: a9_Traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in Fremont street but Fremont street experience is a little bit exaggerated.Besides the giant screen they have on Fremont street and below average band playing music at night , there are nothing else to see. The H2O tank inside hotel is pretty nice but its always full of people and kids.I should have stayed at the Strip. Disappointed with the way the hotel is managed. I booked a king-size bed room for 3 nights. I called and confirmed couple hours before arriving but when arrived I was told king size bed room are all taken (what the point of reservation AND confirm anyway) so we have to take a double queen bed room. I was promised a king-size bed room tomorrow was given priority card (whatever it is) and was told to come back between 12 and 4pm tomorrow. I came back at 1: 00 next day and after waiting in long line, i was told the room is not ready and was told came back later.I came back later that night but was told they dont have any king room (again!) , my spouse was so mad and we almost checked out. So we ended up sleeping in double queen size bed room again.We finally got our king size bed next day but it was also the last night. We will not go back to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget was very impressive”
Reviews.Author: cyclonefamily
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of staying downtown Las Vegas and this was my first stay at the Golden Nugget. The hotel and casino were very clean and staff was very nice! Grotto's restaurant was fabulous.....highly recommend the pizzas! Pool was awesome as well but go a bit early to grab a good chair. Dealers were very nice and helpful at the tables. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Vegas -- excellent value for money and fab pool!”
Reviews.Author: Style_Buff
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying I've stayed at the Bellagio and the Palazzo (both of which had gorgeous rooms) and I was very hesitant to stay here. But I decided to take a risk and I'm glad I did. We stayed on the 22nd floor of the South Tower in a room supposedly remodeled in 2009 and we paid $49 for the first night (a Thursday) and $159 for the second night (Friday). The Good: Excellent value for money, esp. at the $49 rate. If both nights were $159, I would not have stayed here because I got the same rate at Bellagio but I wanted to save some bucks and spend it on a great dinner out. The room was large and clean but the furniture looked dated and a little scuffed. The bathroom is tiny and the door opens inward which makes it even more crowded. The sink is ridiculously small. However, it's serviceable. All amenities provided, flat screen TV, blow dryer, lotion, shampoo, iron and board, etc. and replenished each day. I was surprised to see robes hanging in our closet. That is a luxury hotel amenity and to find it in a $49 room is pretty amazing. The pool is fantastic! If you have kids, I can't think of a better way to have them spend the day than under the waterfalls and hurtling down the water slide that cuts through the shark tank. Yes, there are live sharks swimming in the shark tank and you can gaze at them while they peer at you through the glass. You can do the water slide and lie out on the lounges to your heart's content and never have to spend a dime unless you want to buy beer and food, which is always a good idea. The weekday crowd seems to be working-class families, the weekend crowd seems to trend younger with lots of L.A. and O.C. visitors. The steakhouse at the hotel is pretty good and I have reviewed it separately on yelp.com. Lots of slot machines (which I don't use) and gaming tables of all kinds. I played texas hold-em at the lowest limit table ($2/$4) and the dealers were helpful and friendly and most of the players were nice. The Bad: Most of the staff don't look particularly happy and aren't particularly pleasant. We did end up getting upgraded to the 22nd floor at check-in and a waiver of the $12.99/24hr. internet fee the next day but it was not easy to do. And none of the workers seem to smile much. Maybe they don't get paid well and that's why the hotel is good value for money? Hmmm. Not very convenient to the Strip so if you don't have a car, you'll have to take the City Bus or taxis if you want to get up where all the action is. We had no trouble driving and we also enjoyed exploring Fremont Street. If you're on a budget, things seem to be a little less expensive at that end of town anyway. Side Notes: You have to prance through the hotel lobby in your robe to get to the pool. I guess you have to do this most places but it felt strange. Lots of shiny gold and mirrors all around. No doubt this was high style back in the day but if you're looking for uber-chic Zen decor, this place isn't it. The casino in particular seems very poorly lit, and I'm not sure why. In sum, put on some vintage clothes and vintage attitude, let go of your expectations, and kick back for good times. And don't forget to swim with the sharks!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Freemont Street, not sure about the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: dragonfry
Reviews.Content: First stay in old Vegas, loved entire Freemont St. Exp., don’t think we’ll ever stay on the Strip again! Planning a group trip in Feb., not so sure about returning to Golden Nugget. Hotel’s not very accommodating to its guests. Expedia Itinerary stated “1 Deluxe King Room, South Tower.” No king room available upon arrival, put in a double, told we could move to king the next day, had to check between 2-3 to see if room was ready, asked if any compensation for inconvenience, told “No”, booked through online travel, only run-of-house room guaranteed. Why give the choice at time of booking? They held luggage the last day, South Tower desk closes at 3 p.m., choices were take to North Tower yourself or wait 10-15 min. for them to get it when you are ready to leave. They should automatically move it to the North Tower! Very disappointed at lack of security at elevators to rooms. There is none! Knock at door at 1 a.m., female visitor looking for some “Fun”. Have to show room key to get to the pool area but not to guest rooms, makes no sense! Spoke with hotel management/security, told security’s available 24/7, should have called. Lucky it wasn’t someone overpowering, could have burst into room, wouldn’t have had time to get to the phone. What if we were followed? Lame answer! Pool great idea. Crowded and 90% shaded at all times. Seems they were more concerned about the building Cabanas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: cslater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights during the "Summer of '69" festival. Check in line was long, but was expected on Labor Day weekend. Did not get into room until 5pm due to our carpet being cleaned. No problem, we ate lunch and hung out at the pool. Our room was clean and well decorated, but carpet still damp. Slight smell of smoke, even though it was a non-smoking room. Upon returning late that evening, we found out why the carpet was "cleaned". The air conditioning unit was leaking water and carpet was wet from the unit to the bed. Went to front desk early the next morning and they were more than happy to move us to another King room, 19th non-smoking floor. Much better. The pool was fantastic. Water slide, 2 waterfalls, shark tank, black-jack tables, and pool side bar with food (sandwiches, appetizers, etc.) This was also a nice place to end your evening with a cold beverage and good company. Staff was always friendly, rooms were cleaned early each day, and by far this is the cleanest hotel and casino on Fremont Street. Plan to stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget was Terrific”
Reviews.Author: travelingraysgirl1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was fantastic. We thouroghly enjoyed the shark tank pool. The rooms are clean and quite nice. We had a good view of the strip. The casino itself was never too smokey and all areas of the hotel were so well kept and very clean. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. We will be staying at the Golden Nugget in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, first time staying in Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: rd35nm
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and a great location for the Freemont Street experience. We only had one issue, they were replacing carpet and woke us up @ 8am sharp with the noise. It would have been nice to know this in advance, staff was apologetic and they comped our dinner from the night before to make up for the 8am wake up call.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: PokerFaceNJ
Reviews.Content: It's been over 5 years since I stayed downtown at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas and I certainly missed the experience. My wife and I decided to spend two evenings on the strip (Flamingo) and two evenings at the GN. We both agreed that the GN was a much better time. Valet and check in moved very quickly. The room, even in the South Tower, was very nice and spacious. I know some complain about the walk, but it just did not bother us. Seemed we had an even longer walk in the Flamingo. The casino floor and restaurants are great and you can't beat the location on Freemont Street which was such a blast on the weekend. The highlight for us was the pool area. We spend both of our afternoons there and really enjoyed ourselves. The shark tank is simply amazing and we found ourselves gazing into it for quite some time. Very much a party atmosphere on the weekend with alcohol everywhere and many people drinking in the pool itself. Unsure if the best place for kids on the weekend because of that. Sunday there was much more quiet with many kids splashing around. My only complaints (and really not a huge deal) was the elevators. They appeared to take some time to get to the main floor and for some reason kept playing the same video clip over and over again when you got on (Gordie Brown singing Ice Ice Baby)...after drinking that was the last tune I wanted to hear. But overall a great time and a good idea for a alternative to the expensive strip resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay”
Reviews.Author: stattori
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Nuggett (after 3 at the Flamingo). This is the first time I have stayed Downtown. Have to say I was pleased with both the hotel and Fremont Street.
