The hotel itself is well run, clean and with good amenities. We stayed in the South Tower (ie. the non-refurbed rooms) and the rooms were still good. Didn't see any of the poor carpets or furnishings that others had seen. Nice flat screen TV, comfy beds (if a little soft) and robes provided. The pool area is lovely, though is indeed a little cramped. It opens at 8, but the pools are only staffed by 10. We tried both the Italian and steak restaurants. Both were good value. While Fremont Street is no Strip, it's a fun place for a couple of nights and doesn't have the extreme walks associated with the bigger hotels. The hotels surrounding the Nuggett are fairly cheap and cheerful, but the gambling is fair (plenty of $5 tables). I wouldn't choose to wander off the covered area of Fremont Street, which does look rather down at heel, but there is really little need for you to do so. Would definitely recommend if you are a repeat visitor, who has seen most of the Strip sights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.......”
Reviews.Author: escrowgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN 8/28-8/31. We booked the hotel with my husband's air miles through his business card as the other hotels offered were on the strip and we had stayed at each of them. That said, I still did my research. Check-in was quick. We arrived around 3 or so and it took maybe 10 minutes, if that. We ended up in the South Tower, Room 2296. Nice big king bed, large flat screen, plenty of lamps for lighting. This was good as we did not have much of a view - but I don't spend much time staring out the window. The bathroom was nice sized - I certainly didn't have any trouble turning on the water, showerhead, etc. standing outside the tub, nor did I have to lay down to rinse my hair - the shower head had great pressure. The tub did drain rather slowly, however. Housekeeping was quite efficient. One phone call and pillows arrived not ten minutes later. They did the rooms twice a day - 8am and 3pm. If you didn't want to be bothered, you just put your privacy sign out. I am guessing that some of the other posters who thought the south tower was such a long walk have never stayed anywhere like Caesers, MGM or some of the other strip hotels. From the south tower elevators it was straight down the hall to the pool, a right then a left and a little more walking and there was the casino. Very convenient. Never did hear any street noise from our room - never even heard our neighbors or people in the hall. The pool area was great. For an FYI for those that are interested, if you are looking directly at the shark tank, the sun hits on the left side of the pool first in the am, then moves across to the right mid-day, and then back to the left late afternoon. Plenty of lounge chairs (with great pads) and seating areas with couches - chairs were plentiful until around 10am or so and then they got sparse. The are also two levels with cabanas above the pools and any chairs that are not in front of cabanas are open to all. Pool opens officially at 10am but you can get in around 830-900am and get a chair; just no towels or swimming until 10. Food was good - the Grotto has wonderful pizza. Cocktail waitressess are all over and you never really had a wait for a cocktail. I played craps and had a great time - even if I am a wussy bettor! Starts at a $5 minimum and at 8 or so goes to $10 but if you have been playing at the lower minimum you can stay at it. Only thing I was a little annoyed at was charging to my room - no problem several times and then at the gift shop all of the sudden they wanted my id! Suppossedly this is policy but then it should be enforced all across the hotel and they should tell you at check-in. Minor inconvenience but annoying. P.S. Thoes "people" outside the south elevators that want to give you "gifts"? They are time share hawkers - imho way more annoying than porn slappers!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jwin7831
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in the south tower. Room was quite a ways from casino---a hassle every time you wanted to go to your room. The room itself was adequate and fairly roomy. Nice and clean, but to rate a 4 star I think you should have updated carpet and a nice duvet---not an old bedspread that is very scary. I checked across the street for a room at 4 queens which was older, but not that much different for a huge price difference ($49 vs $22). Staying at Xmas time at the new Rush tower of nugget. Hope it is a lot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club rooms not worth the money, pool area is way too crowded.”
Reviews.Author: foldemjoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there five nights, just got home two days ago. The Gold Club rooms are not worth the money. Small, dark, even the bedside lamps not good for reading. They have a cover over the air conditioner, like a small coffe table type of thing, with louvers for the air to pass thru. Had to remove it each day so the room would get cooler. Soon as we pulled it out I could feel the cool air flowing throughout the room. The bathtub/shower combo sucks. You have to get in tub then turn everything on. The rain shower head was a pain, my wife had to turn on tub faucet then lie down in order to rinse her hair out, rain head would take forever. At least three of the five mornings we were awakened by emergency vehicles sirens from the streets below, and we were on the 17th floor, room 1710. The swimming pool is way too crowded with no room to spread out. Surrounding properties have gone way downhill last five or so years. I will not be staying downtown again, used to enoy staying there. I want to mention to everyone that they should boycott the 6 to 5 blackjack games. Most of the Vegas properties have made the game unplayable, used to never see 8 deck shoes there, no doubling down after split pairs on single deck. Terrible blackjack games. If enough people stop playing these highly unfavorable bj games they will revert back to the old rules. The South Point has double deck, 3 to 2 on bj, dbl after splits, $5 minimum. Look around and find the better games, don't let the casinos get away with changing the rules so they can take your money faster. Hope this review helps, plz e-mail if u have any questions regarding your Vegas trip. I visit there 3 to 4 times yearly, play poker, Blackjack, some slots (only when bored, lol).

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay if in Downtown/Strip”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: If you must stay in Downtown, book the North tower even at the extra added cost. Very LARGE flat screen TV and large room. Very comfy bed. Stayed in the South tower last year, and had to change rooms twice due to a leaking ceiling and floor. UGH. Had it not been for our stay in the North tower, I don't think I would have ever gone back. The Italian restaurant here is W-O-N-D-E-R-F-U-L. Pasta was home made and food was very close to what we had in Italy. We only chose this place because we were too lazy to drive into town. What a surprise this was! Good location next to the Premium Outlet mall.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget best value in downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SurfCityBeach
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the best value for your money in downtown Las Vegas because you get a 4 star hotel with a reasonable price. We stayed their for a seminar. They offer a VIP check-in for an additional $20. It is well worth it because you do not have to wait in long check in or check out lines. You just go to the VIP room around the corner from the check in desk. They have some cheese, fruit, crackers, and bags of nuts offered while checking in and out. The rooms are nice. They have a great pool with jaquzzi's, a water slide and a large shark tank with sharks and fish swimming in the middle of the pool. They have many choices of restaurants, a good nite club with a balcony over looking the downtown walkway and have two Starbuck's inside. If you are on a budget walk over to the Plaza hotel where they have Mc Donald's, Subway, and a reasonably priced buffet. A great buffet with lots of variety and good food, desserts, and drinks included is around the corner at the Main Street station casino. The price is resonable for what all you get. If you want to save on a beer or two walk over to the ABC market towards the Plaza casino. At the Gold Spike they have shrimp cocktails for $1.99 or if get a players card there then the shrimp cock tails are 99 cents. I did not eat at the Golden Nugget buffet so I can not comment on it. It was a great stay. I would recommend the Golden Nugget to my friends if they are going to stay downtown. It's especially good if you don't have a car because of it's location and if you want to go to the strip you can take a bus for $3 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: stijnec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, as hotels on the Strip are quite expensive on Saturday nights, and found a good deal through Hotwire for only $84 ex tax. Checkin line looked long, but it only took us 10 minutes to check in. Room was of good size, with a nice flatscreen. Pool is great, but very busy, and there is not much shadow, We ate in one of the many hotel restaurants and food and service was fine. Enjoyed the fremont street experience, which is litterally just outside the hotel. Would come back, but not for more than one night, as there is not much to do in the direct vicinity, and I prefer being on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandhotelpro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable. The pool is fantastic, my kids loved the shark tank. We stayed in the south tower and the room was pretty standard. We found a shower cap wrapped over the smoke detector in the room. The previous occupant probably did not want to get busted for smoking in a non-smoking room. There was a slight odor of smoke, but you expect that in Vegas and we didn't complain about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Spa Tower Suite Stay”
Reviews.Author: blossom
Reviews.Content: After seeing video of this suite on Expedia, I have always really wanted to stay here. The look of it just evoked fun old Vegas cheesy luxury to me! And our suite ended up looking exactly like the video, very nice. The spa tower suite is about 1200 sq feet, has two story windows, with views either overlooking the pool or Fremont Street. The room feels even more spacious because of the huge windows and two open floors. All the drapes work electronically, very cool. There's also a large bar area with a coffee maker and an empty fridge, a nice perk in Vegas. The upstairs bathroom is huge and has a steam shower and big, very comfortable whirlpool bath, a separate w/c with toilet and bidet, a vanity area, a tv over the sinks. There are even mirrors over the king bed, which I tried very hard to avoid looking up at ! The room is very clean and well maintained; my only small quibble with the room is that there is an industrial type of brown carpet that covers the stairs and entire upstairs, including bathroom. Sorta detracts from the overall luxury feel the room's going for, but that's minor. Check in is in the Vip area, a nice touch; I found the desk clerk a bit cold, though polite. Would I stay in this room again? Probably, I do enjoy the strip more, but the GN is a good hotel, and the spa tower room is great for a special occasion if you find it for under $300 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas many times, typically staying on the strip. A few things have gotten old about it - the litter, the crowds at night, and the bad gaming odds at strip casinos. We spent a night of our last trip at the Golden Nugget to give downtown a try. This time we spent all three nights (Fri-Sun) there. After this trip, we're sold on downtown. We had a south tower room, which was spotless, had a 42 inch flat-screen TV and a very comfortable king mattress. The hotel was full according to the desk clerk, but the soundproofing between rooms seemed very good. While we saw our neighbors in the hallway, we never heard them. Yes, the bathrooms are small by strip standards, but there is a make-up desk and mirror just outside the bathroom. The shower head was excellent (one of those "rain" types) and the towels plush. We didn't try the restaurants, but had the lunch buffet one day and breakfast buffet another. No buffet is gourmet, but the food selections and quality were more than adequate and the buffet dining room is pleasant. The pool is a big attraction, but is too small and crowded for actual swimming (it's best for just taking a dip and looking into the aquarium). We didn't have much difficulty finding a couple of lounge chairs. It only took a couple of minutes of "cruising" to find someone who was leaving. They chaises are close together, but very comfortable. Much of the area is shaded at times by the buildings, but to us that's a plus since it's still plenty hot and prevents sunburn. Every staff member we encountered in our stay was pleasant and helpful. We did pay the extra $20 for VIP check-in, which I think was worth it since it was a busy weekend and we wanted to be assured of getting the room type we requested and not having a long wait in line. We checked in about 10:00 Friday morning, and the two woman at the VIP desk gave us a room immediately without our having to ask if that was possible so early. When we checked out Monday there was a line at the main area, but we got helped immediately in the VIP room. I'd do it in the future if coming on a weekend. If anyone at the Golden Nugget reads these reviews, I do have one question - what are you going to do about the pool area when your new building opens? It may be genuinely overcrowded at that point. A plug for downtown in general - we were amazed by the almost total lack of trash compared to the strip. Even off of Fremont street in the neighboring blocks to the north, it was clear that street cleaning is a high priority. Also, there are none of those obnoxious people passing out the girly cards that are everywhere on the strip. Must be something different about city vs. Clark County (where the strip is) rules. Also, the entertainment downtown was outstanding. Major props to the downtown association or whoever it is that puts on the events. The Woodstock Tribute Weekend bands were all excellent. I think some might be better than the original bands they covered ("Jimi Hendrix", "Janis Joplin", and "Joe Cocker" were fantastic). The crowds were ample and the mood very festive. I was also surprised and pleased with demographic of the downtown crowd. I expected old and downbeat, but actually it was pretty much the same mix as the strip. Very few visible "bums" either. Throw in that the gaming odds are much better in most downtown hotels, food deals are still plentiful, and it's easy to walk around with the shade and width of Fremont Street. We thought we'd spend at least part of our visit going up to the strip, but we ended up only leaving downtown once. We're no longer into the nightclub scene, but I'd say that is one area where the strip holds a real edge. We'll look first to downtown and the Golden Nugget for our future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely thrilled with this hotel and all of its services”
Reviews.Author: sven25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Golden Nugget. We were so happy with this hotel. Last time we were in Vegas we stayed at the Rio, which I love, but wanted to save a bit of money and decided to stay downtown. The G.N. is the nicest hotel in the downtown area. The pool was beautiful!! Except that the sun goes behind the hotel from noonish to 2ish. Which is a long time when you are trying to get a tan!! I loved the restaurants....especially the Grotto. Very nice and a great change from the diner type dinners. I wasn't that thrilled with the buffet at the G.N. but it was relatively cheap and the food was good. Just not a lot of variety. Our room was very nice. We were in the south tower but managed to get on of the updated rooms with the new bedding and flat screen t.v. I totally recommend this hotel if you are looking for R&R during the day and great nightlife in the evening hours!

Reviews.Title: “Its exactly what you want in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MikeUSA99
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here with friends in April. They offer really good cheap rooms knowing that once they have you onsite they will make the profit on gambling. So you can expect good quality clean rooms. The only problem is that you are downtown and it takes ages to get to the New Vegas Strip because the traffic gets sso bad, but thats not really this hotels fault.. Also the swimming pool is great!

Reviews.Title: “Went for the pool, enjoyed the food, Poker room and slots (as well as the pool!)”
Reviews.Author: cooper1
Reviews.Content: We decided since we wanted to go to Las Vegas when it was incredibly hot (July), we would base our trip around Pools. Golden Nugget is a hotel that we have always wanted to stay at, so we were happy to check it out! We arrived and got checked in (there was a fairly regular stream of people coming in to check in) about 20 people in front of us. Check in was quick, and our wonderful check in agent upgraded us without us asking! We got a very nice room (not sure if they are all like this room, but it had a lot of space, king bed, robes, a couple chairs and writing table.) She offered us a room overlooking the pool which I would have loved to take, but it only had double beds in it and DH is too tall, needs either a queen or king! We overlooked the canopy (we weren't really there for the view though) DH played poker and said the GN room was one of his faves. I found a WOO slot and kept myself occupied for a couple hours :) We found a resteraunt that overlooked the pool (I cannot remember the name of it) but we split a pizza that was really great. We went out to the pool once it cooled down. There were many lounges available all over the place, they have really done a great job of ensuring they have provided as many as they can. They have round bed loungers, regular loungers and couches under a roof cover as well. You can also go to the second floor and sit on the loungers as long as they are not in the private cabanas. I did not check to see if there were loungers on the third floor. We did however stand in a LONG lineup to get on the slide. We did the slide once, it went SO quickly, that we decided not to stand in line again for it as fun and unique as it was. We spent most of our time in the pool under the covered side staring at the sharks, using our underwater camera to get some great video and pics. I will eventually post them. There is a bar as well as a hot tub around the pool, we came out later on at night to check the pool area out after dark and were surprised to see so many people out there, in the hot tub and having drinks at the bar out there. I will absolutely stay downtown again at the Golden Nugget. We really liked the room as well as the vibe of the casino. Service all around was nice and seemed genuine, right down to the doorman. When we woke up on check out day, there was a note slipped under the door offering us an extra nights stay for $40 the next night. If we didn't have a room rented at the Monte Carlo, we would have absolutely taken them up on their offer!

Reviews.Title: “tank with sharks... awesome!”
Reviews.Author: allertstar
Reviews.Content: I've been in Las Vegas so many occasions and every time is a different experience. This one of course caught my attention because of the great renovation the Golden Nugget had recently. Even though The Golden Nugget was built in 1946, the hotel provides the best customer service and the pool with a huge tank with sharks is a priceless attraction. We arrived very early in the morning thinking that they might not have our room ready but Carmen at the front desk was absolutely phenomenal letting us to check in super early. We liked the room but we wanted to have a room with a pool view. We moved rooms later on. the room had a nice view of the pool, at night, the lights make this a magical illusion. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Buffet in the hotel is absolutely the best so far I ever tried in Vegas. Employees are very attentive and polite, every time we were passing by the corridors or the elevators they stopped their chores to smile and ask if everything was ok. The music that was playing at the pool invited to stay longer and the drinks that are prepared there are really tasty. The Golden Nugget is a truly golden treasure, definitely I'll recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: herctech
Reviews.Content: I liked the size of our room in the south tower (nice and big). Beds are extremely comfortable. Great T.V. set in the room, not like the old box style most hotels still have. Only a couple downsides I found.. The pool was very busy and probably a bit small for the number of guests that stay at the hotel. We found it very hard to get a pool chair in the mid afternoon, in short too many people not enough pool. I was also a little turned off by the young children eating plates of nachos while in the hot tub, pretty gross seeing bits of food falling into the water (clearly no parents in sight). I would recommend to the older childless traveler to visit Vegas outside of the summer holiday period.

Reviews.Title: “So Super!!!”
Reviews.Author: kim11065
Reviews.Content: Before I left i read alot of bad review and was scared to death when i got there!!! Everyone was beyond wrong!! The hotel was very nice I had a room in the so called horrible south tower my room was large ang very clean. We had such a great time downtown the streets where clean and all casinos nice. We took pack duece to the down right dreadful strip there was construction everywhere and the streets were covered in those porn cards!!! After we saw some drunk girls getting arrested at 2pm we got right back downtown!! GIve old vegas a chance I loved it

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: flowers0529
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas and my first stay at the Golden Nugget hotel. It was the best hotel experience! The rooms were nice and clean. The staff were friendly and courteous, and there was never a dull moment in the hotel. The pool was fantastic, and clean also... the kids loved it. They also loved the Freemont Street experience. Always something fun happening with a nice family atmosphere around. I will definitely recommend the Golden Nugget to anyone who asks and I will be returning in the future! Keep up the good work Golden Nugget!!! : )

Reviews.Title: “Great room, beautiful hotel, perfect location, cruddy pool”
Reviews.Author: LennyLovesSpaghetti
Reviews.Content: I loved the Golden Nugget. The hotel was beautiful and had the feel of one of the Italian hotels on the strip. Everything was freshly done and clean. The rooms were beautiful and reminded me of the Venetian, which was surprising considering the Golden Nugget's prices were about a quarter of the Venetian's. The casino was nice, had nightly live entertainment and a nice selection of restaurants. The real plus of this hotel is its location. If you've never stayed on Fremont Street before, take a few nights and stay there. We split our trip between there and the strip and thoroughly enjoyed Fremont Street's tacky glory. There are two small, hideous casinos nearby that give you free Mardi Gras beads every time you walk in and bring you so many free drinks you won't be able to walk when you leave. Plus they have 99 cent twinkies! The only thing I didn't like about the Golden Nugget was the pool. Most of it is taken up by a giant fish tank and the tank casts a shadow over a majority of the remaining space. The water is cold. The chairs are nice if you can find one. There were a lot of crazy drunks galavanting around, which was partly annoying, partly hilarious. Plus, people take a magazine, towel or anything they can find out at like 7 a.m. to mark their chairs for the day and don't come back to use them until 2 which is really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: #1Barb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Golden Nugget several times and it was my parents 50th Wedding Anniversary and they wanted to stay there so I booked a package and off we went. From the time we walked into the Golden nugget we were treated terribly..from the front desk, to the person holding our luggage until our rooms were ready. We were suppose to have North tower we got south tower which are a disappointed over the north tower rooms. My parents had no blow dryer, it had been ripped off the wall and during our 5 day stay they did not get another one. I talked to the manager and he apologized but that was it! I will never, ever stay there again. it doesn't take to much to please me but rude associates at the hotel I have no tolerance for and it was an embarrsement since this was a celebration for my parents. Too many places to stay Golden Nugget..the Queen's rooms are nicer then your south tower and the people are so much more friendly, food is better and service out shines you by 100%. Shame on Golden Nugget for treating their guest this way and not attempting to make it better.

Reviews.Title: “second stay in a month!”
Reviews.Author: wordub
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights Jul 27~Jul30. This was my second stay here at the GN in 4 weeks. Once again the staff and general vibe of the guests was very upbeat. The Fremont Street Experience was as always cool. the pool scene was very busy. I have to say that my vacation part II was just as great as the one in June. I plan on returning in the next 2 months! The price is right and the locatiion is a little more mature.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mollymak
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 4 nights On booking this hotel I didn't realise it was downdown on Freemont street> But the location was fantastic a real Gem of a place . After a pleasant flight with BMI & delta Airlines we arrived to find we had been upgraded to a suite. ( only for the night )well what can I say it was like something from the the 20's it was pure bliss 2 floors of art deco furniture & decor a Lcd in the bathroom with a whirl pool bath a sauna in the shower room a dressing area mirrors on the ceiling electronic curtains for the huge windows . my hubby & I where in heaven. But did'nt we have a bump back to earth the next 3 nights in a standard room but you only need that to sllep and get showered. We loved the hotel the casino area was spot on real good staff in all areas of the hotel we loved it . We are planning another trip to Vegas & are considering staying there again. It is a excellent hotel would definetly stay againx

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCBX1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay in Las Vegas on August 1, 2009. We selected the Gold Nugget because it was away from the strip and appeared to cater to an older crowd We were not disappointed, Our room was very nice for our needs. We had a king bed in a room in the south tower. It was quiet when we returned to it each evening (no loud noises from other rooms, no rowdiness in the hallways). We also checked in during the week (on Wednesday), so there were no lines and no big crowds. The process was very smooth. We decided to elope to Vegas and the Golden Nugget was in close proximity to the marriage license bureau and to the chapel we selected. We also wanted to experience a abit of the old Vegas. We did venture to the strip one day and went into sveral of the hotels and casinos but were glad to return to the Golden Nugget. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet the most. We also dined at Vic & Anthony's for our wedding dinner (they staff was great, ask for Annette, she was a top notch server). If we return to Vegas on our 1st anniversary this is where we will stay. Just beware of the slghtly annoying timeshare people who are positioned by the elevators. Just say not interested politely and keep moving. I have run into them in Florida and Mexico and I just keep moving then they don't bother to approach me anymore! Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again, in the middle of all the action.”
Reviews.Author: thetiernans
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Nugget - with a friend for four nights in July. Tired of long walks and high prices on strip so stayed on Freemont St. Large clean room but didn't spend much time there!. Pool area is excellent - poolside bar, great attentive waitresses and five pool side Black Jack tables with beautiful dealers and five dollar minimum. Spent hours there! At night all other casinos are close by. Many options for cheap beer , Black Jack, poker and entertainment. Had a great dinner buffet at the Nugget and several late night snacks at the 24hr. Cafe. Good food and cheap. Also try the buffet at the Freemont and dinner in Magnolias at Four Queens, a must stop for a good sit-down meal. G.N. is the best spot in downtown and will stay again. Only downs were terrible water pressure in shower and those annoying timeshare people. Head to Downtown where the regular folks hang out with bargains all over.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Marines98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Las Vegas several times but always stayed on the strip. We wanted try something new so we decided to stay at the Nugget. We both loved the place! It was much, much nicer than expected and could easily fit in on the strip. Our room was extremely clean and newly furnished. The hotel pool with aquarium was very unique and a great place to relax. The Night Club played great music and all the people were friendly. I cannot say enough good things about the Golden Nugget. If you are a Vegas fanatic and are looking for something different from the strip, I highly recommend staying downtown at the Golden Nugget. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: Travel Lady2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 25-26 July 2009. The room was very, very nice. Check in was supposed to be at 2:00 p.m. but we arrived at 11:30 a.m. and we checked in with no problem. We only ate one meal at the GN. We had lunch there when we arrived. We ate in the Carson Cafe. I had a grilled chicken sandwich. It was pretty good. The chicken breast was huge. My husband had a cheese omelet and he was not overly impressed. I loved the pool! My only complaint is if you want a chaise lounge, GET THERE EARLY!!!! The first day I got there at 1:30--they were all taken. The second day I got there at 11:00--they were all taken. The second day they found glass in the pool, so they closed the pool at 1:00 and it didn't reopen till the next morning. It would happen on the hottest, most humid day! But I got two hours of swimming in. I'm from Nebraska and bars and restaurants are all non-smoking so the smoke really bothered me. But I know they'll never ban smoking in Vegas. The Fremont Experience is a must-see! When I saw it lit up at night it was just SO VEGAS!! All in all, an amazing experience. Willl return to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapsandSox
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget provided a terrific vacation hotel for my wife and me, but there were a few drawbacks: the A/C in the room was marginal, the room had some minor maintenance problems when we arrived, and the pool area is not open long enough during the day (10 am to 8 pm). Despite the drawbacks, the Golden Nugget had far more positives attributes. Those included: extremely comfortable bed, surprisingly quiet rooms, fantastic location, best race and sportsbook downtown, excellent staff, very cool pool area, great restaurants. Overall, if you want to stay downtown in Las Vegas (and I think if you are a real gambler, you should), the Golden Nugget is the best place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed with the Golden Nugget Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: KIP1958
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was underwhelmed with my stay at the Golden Nugget in downtown Las Vegas. I had booked a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room. It took 15-20 minutes to get that changed. Then the room I was moved to was what I believe to be the one they save for emergencies. The light over the tub didn't work, the a/c was awful, and the door didn't close tightly unless you slammed it. We had the a/c set on 60 trying to cool off the room and it never got below 78 or 80 in there. It was miserable. And having to slam the door to get it to close was just ridiculous. The room was clean, but nothing to write home about. We had just stayed at Bally's for 2 nights and the room there was nicer, bigger, AND cheaper. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I will play at the casino but I probably won't stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a queen in their room”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed downtown, having always stayed on the strip in the past, but this time, for the great rate of $52 a night plus some free extras, we decided to go for it. What a great hotel! I was so impressed by it! The hotel is very well maintained and elegant. There is a fabulous swimming pool with a water slide that you can see through and watch as people come down. The swimming pool has waterfalls you can drench youself with. The room was large and very posh. Ornate curtains hang at the window and over the bed. I felt like I was in a room fit for a queen. In addition to the splendid accommodations, we were right on Freemont Street where at night they had a 60's street party. Lights and music everywhere, and we all joined together under the canopy and enjoyed the ambiance. Have a great time and go to the Golden Nugget! I'm a frequent Vegas visitor, and I know I'd stay at the Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice...real gamblers should ALWAYS stay Downtown, not the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: First off, if your primary reason for coming to Vegas is to gamble, it's foolish to stay anywhere BUT Downtown in the Fremont Street area. I want to be absolutely clear to anyone who is trying to decided between the Strip and Downtown. The big boys on the Strip have decided to fight the recession by gouging you at the tables. All of the hotel/casinos I visited that are part of Harrahs, and all of the the ones owned by MGM/Mirage DON'T OFFER REAL BLACKJACK AT A REAL PRICE! Take note of that. ALL of the blackjack tables on the Strip that I visited now only pay 6:5 on a blackjack hand, as opposed to the REAL blackjack, which SHOULD pay 3:2. This raises the house advantage pretty substantially. I'm hoping you won't be like the rest of the dopes at these casinos throwing their money away obliviously, thinking they're playing blackjack: they ain't. 'Nuff said! Now, as for the Golden Nugget...this was my first time staying there, having snagged a deal months beforehand on Continental Vacations. We usually stay next door at Four Queens. Usually the Four Queens is cheaper, but not this time. The Golden Nugget has a reputation of being the "Wynn" of Downtown. (The Nugget was Wynn's first casino.) The hotel was nice, but not really much nicer than the Four Queens. And it's much bigger, and the layout and distance from different areas will require your walking shoes. The room was old, but clean and well-kept. The televisions in the South Tower, where we stayed, were older; not really acceptable at this level. The beds were comfortable and the room was fairly large. Oddly, there is no mini-fridge, and housekeeping never gave us shower floor towels. The room, though, was quiet, service was good, and the A/C (so vitally important in this sauna of a climate) worked well. I am an avid runner, and wanted to use the workout facilities. The spa/workout room was nice, but it will cost you a "nominal" $20 to use them...per day. I hate that. Very cool pool area, with a circular pool and water slide that surrounds (and the slide goes through) a shark-infested aquarium. The bottom line is that the Golden Nugget is nice, but I personally wouldn't pay more for it if the Four Queens was cheaper, as it usually is. That said, Golden Nugget should please most people.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected - The secret it out!”
Reviews.Author: Californiation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget for a week, we loved it. The reviews looked great but the rating was not a 5, we wonder why not after staying there. Last year we stayed in Vegas in Henderson and scoped out the strip but never had time to get to the Fremont area. The strip is great, don't get me wrong...if you love to walk and walk and walk...to much busy-ness there, it's ok for an evening outing or two. BUT Fremont and especially the Golden Nugget were by far one of the nicest places we have stayed this past year. We spent apprx 60 nights a year in various hotel rooms and travelled cross-country this year and can't wait to go back next year, to the Golden Nugget for sure. The staff are awesome, extremely helpful and recall conversations that we had over the week. The desk clerk Laura was wonderful, she was extremely attentive and helpful. The housekeeping staff were also helpful and remembered our names whenever we strolled down the hall. Please don't forget to tip housekeeping, they work hard, we recommend $5 min per night. The bar-keep was also great, they remembered us each night we were there. If you want hussle-bussle and those extremely large hotels where we are sure "no one will remember your name" then go to the Strip...otherwise, head to a beautiful landmark, the Golden Nugget where "everyone will remember your name!" Cheers! P.S. They renovated the hotel and are in the midst of adding another tower, the rooms are absolutely beautifu/luxurious. Trust us, the pictures on their web-site don't do them justice, they are even nicer in person! BOOK IT NOW, stop looking!

Reviews.Title: “A fun place to stay in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Summerstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cheapest rooms available and they were actually very nice. (Be aware there is a $20pp charge for more than 2 people in a room.) Pool area is really fun but closes too early. 8pm. Enjoyed the fish, but felt kind of sorry for them...seems like the tank is too small. Appreciated the fact there were several lifeguards around the pool helping to keep an eye on my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget – A pleasant surprise for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: We reserved rooms at the Golden Nugget to start our western family vacation, and were pleasantly surprised and very pleased with our stay. Our rooms were in the south tower, and were the lowest cost room type available when we booked. They were recently renovated, in very good condition, and included flat-panel LCD TV, an air conditioner that left our room well cooled on one of this summer’s hottest days, a low table at the entry with a make-up mirror, and two very comfortable beds. For business travelers, there is no desk or other adequate workspace, but there is cabled and wireless HSIA available at $12.99 per day. Owing to its status as an older hotel, the guest room bathrooms are well-appointed, but small. While the room rate was shown as $50 per night, when we called to make reservations, it quickly escalated to more than $75 once we told the reservationist that our seven year old child would be with us – and – we elected to pay an extra $20 charge in order to be able to skip long check-in and check-out lines and work through the VIP lounge instead. But, given the length of lines we saw when we arrived, it was $20 well spent. Food and beverage was good, too. The Casino Café served standard fare (steaks, burgers, sandwiches, pasta) and service was prompt. We didn’t try the other restaurants, but they were very busy and seemed fine. The treat for our family was the pool area and water slide/tube through the shark tank. The kids loved it, and made a dozen trips through the tube during our afternoon there. There is no cost for doing the shark tube slide, and even on a busy day, the maximum wait was about 10 minutes. The pool area itself is very small – grab a chair early if you plan to use it that day. The H2O bar area is nice, but not over the top. Another treat at the Golden Nugget is the pool-side Blackjack tables. For evening entertainment, the Fremont Experience outside the hotels in that section of downtown Las Vegas is cheesy but entertaining. Parking was free for hotel guests in a deck behind the rear of the hotel. Overall, we’d recommend this hotel as a lower-cost alternative for a pleasure stay in Las Vegas, and we commend the Golden Nugget for all they’re doing to keep the hotel fresh and the downtown casino environment alive.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: glendalegal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from several days in Vegas with the teens. Stayed one night at the Golden Nugget in the South tower to get a feel for downtown before moving to the Mandalay Bay. Check in was a breeze and in retrospect we should have been much more appreciative of not having to wait for elevators. (We had to wait in line for elevators at the Mandalay Bay!) Our adjoining rooms faced the parking garage, but who cares? The room was clean and comfortable and we got a good night's rest. We paid $52 per night (made the reservations the night before) and we got a coupon book that we used for half price breakfast and lunch buffets. The evening Fremont Experience was right outside our Casino door so we spent an hour or two there in the evening. The kids got to the pool at 10 AM when it opened and enjoyed the slide and sharks until check out time. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “MAY stay again”
Reviews.Author: gypsy413
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Nugget. First time 5 or 6 years ago was perfect in every way (except for the tight slots, which are even tighter now but hubby did fairly well on the blackjack tables). We've stayed at the Mirage as well as MGM. Arrived Sunday evening July 12 about 6 and faced a long line for check-in. Soon as we got to the desk we were told we should have gone to VIP check-in. DUH! I had forgotten that fact. We got 2 parlor suites, one for us, smoking, one for our couple friend, non-smoking. We were in the north tower, 2nd floor, friends on 6th floor. We had only a view of the concrete walls between buildings and rows of compressors. First negative was the smell. We've stayed in a lot of smoking rooms but none stunk as bad as this one. I brought my own expensive air freshener which didn't help at all. They should provide some type of decent ventilation. The bathroom fans did absolutely nothing when showering. Pictures online showed a bright cheery room, slightly feminine in decor but both of ours were done in very contemporary, dark tans and browns with minimal lighting and even with curtains opened, it felt like a cave. We had a non-working refrigerator which had 4 warm bottles of water. Maintenance came and inspected it and said they'd try to find a replacement. 10 min. later a tiny little elderly man who couldn't speak English showed up with a luggage rack carrying a really beat up replacement that was half the size of the one in the room. No way could he have lifted it, much less the broken one. We sent him away and soon another maintenance guy shows up and tries to work on it. He gave up after sparks shot out from the bottom and hit his boots! Next day 2 more guys show up with a working replacement. Another complaint was we killed 3 roaches in our room. Not a good sign. The small whirlpool tub had several long dark hairs in it and was so stained I couldn't tell if it was clean or not so only used the shower. I did go down to the VIP lounge to complain and she did offer to move us, but we declined as we were all settled in. She gave me a coupon book for our troubles. Oh boy! $5 discount off $65 Gordie Brown tickets, a free drink with purchase at several clubs and a couple of free desserts with purchase. As another reviewer mentioned, Gordie Brown was ok, but not worth the money. We did have 2 full bathrooms which was nice. Shampoo, conditioner, bar soap and body lotion was provided, no shower gel. We received 4 small bottles of water (complimentary) but they never supplied more. 2 large bottles of Figi water if you wanted to pay $4 each. The bed was very comfortable and was turned down our first nite but we put out the privacy tags after that since the rooms had already been cleaned each day and I'm never comfortable with people in our rooms when we are not there. The dinner buffet was mediocre. There were no cooked vegetable other than mashed potatoes and salads. No green beans, peas, corn, carrots, etc. I asked one of the servers and he said "I'll go down to the warehouse and see what I can find". Of course, I already had my plate fixed. I went back to check about 10 minutes later and they had about a 3 serving platter with completely undercooked fresh green beans, red bell peppers and hard as a rock carrots. I guess since they were comped, we couldn't complain too much. My husband and our friends had breakfast (I slept in) at the buffet and said it was excellent. The first morning, we orderd room service and my Eggs Benedict were superb. We never ventured into the pool area although we had intended to. It was just too incredibly crowded with young children everywhere. If you do stay downtown (or just go there from the strip) be sure and catch Carl "The Safe Sax" Ferris. He is so great to watch. We've bought 2 of his CD's and they don't disappoint. He plays most nights and takes tips as well as selling his signed CD's. I would still recommend the Nugget hoping others would have the great experience we had the first time. But when making my reservations for our next stay, I will be very specific as to what I expect and will demand another room if it's anything like this last one. I suggest insisting on seeing the room before committing to accepting it. Oh, one other thing: Don't discount the slots at the airport. Our flight was delayed over 2 hours and my husband decided to try the one we'd seen a guy hit big on when we were there last year (stayed at MGM Grand). He ended up hitting a $600 jackpot (put $100 in) after 2 spins and 4 spins later, hit $2700. This was on a dollar machine. The gal that paid him said that was the best paying machine they had. Made the expense of the trip a little easier to swallow!! I would definitely take advantage of their online specials. We got the Parlor suites for $149.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: melcj90
Reviews.Content: We stay for 6 nights. It's was our first stay downtown, Golden Nugget does have nice location. The downtown atmosphere was great, free music, cheap eats, walgreens and mcdonalds short walking distance. But the hotel has needs some improvement in terms of service. 1. We stay at the South Tower. I know this is the cheapest rooms at the GN, but they could start to renovate the rooms. Ugly curtains, no flat screen TVS, (couldn't connect my iphone to watch movies, i guess they wanted me to pay for movies!), sheets were "Days Inn" types. 2. The maid service. Some times they clean the rooms at 9am, some days at late at 4pm. They was no way to tell when they were going to come. They should have a sign like the cruise ships that says "Please clean the room". I left the room early mornings i so they could clean it, come back late afternoons to take a nap, they didn't clean it. And they didn't clean it that day. Also they didn't pick up room service trays right away, some were left in hallway for days. 3. Customer Service. I ran into some problems with the safe, security came to fix it. They seem to have attitude problem, and accuse me of breaking it. They fixed it, but they could have bigger safes (yes ive been to other hotels that have bigger safes) Also, I requested a restaurant chair to help me with my disability, but they gave me a hard time. I just wanted a extra chair! 4. Food was expensive, so we ate at other downtown hotels. 5. Swimming pool was okay, but very crowded. With the new tower being build, it 's even gonna be more crowded. Also they didn't check hotel keys, so I guess anyone could use it. 6. Casino was okay, but at times it too smoke smell ...better ventilation is needed. Overall I would consider to stay downtown again but not at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Alexanc
Reviews.Content: We were a little leary about staying somewhere for $39.00 a night. I wanted to see the room first but were assured by valet that we wouldn't be disappointed. I am so glad we stayed. After seeing our room in the North Tower we ran right back downstairs to book 2 more nights and got the third night free! Bed is super comfy! Room service was prompt (food was not so good). Housekeeping is the best! Smelled so clean and fresh every evening when we got back. The pool is fun and crowded. At night pool area turns into a cocktail lounge with really good music and coctail servers. This is our new place to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool, great value, but.......”
Reviews.Author: socal805
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Nugget with wife and two kids. Pros: Awesome pool for kids (shark feeding is at 12:30pm every other day), clean, and affordable (we paid $36/nt), two Starbucks in hotel, waitress service at pool was good Cons: Taxi to strip is expensive-- $22 one-way. No kids menus at any of the hotel restaurants and food at hotel was over priced-- food was good but not great. Access to the gym is $20/day. Breakfast buffet ends at 10:30am sharp. Suggestions: Request a room away from the hotel's expansion project or else you will here construction vehicles honking and backing-up early in the morning. Overall nice hotel and would stay there again and would recommend for families. Weekdays are a lot less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Gold at the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: DTUWilliams
Reviews.Content: My spouse and another couple all travelled together to Vegas. It was our first time, there 5th. We had originally booked another hotel earlier, but booked our flights at a later date, which gave us an unanticipated extra night in Vegas. The extra night landed us at the Golden Nugget. We were pleased with everything the minute we stepped into the Nugget. It was very nicely decorated, it was bustling with people, we had a quick and easy check in, plenty of restaurants, casino close by and our rooms were great. The rooms were nice and spacious, clean, well decorated and charming. We also had no troubles parking our rental car. We spent a 1/2 day by the pool. It was darn hot, but we managed to stay cool on the 2nd level under the shade of the palm trees. We also took frequent dips in the pool to cool off. Also it was a must to view the shark/fish tank from in the pool and of course take a fast slide through the tank into the pool. Although the line up for the waterslide looked intimadating it moved quickly. When relaxing on the lounge chair there was a drink service available which we partook in and found the drinks to be reasonably priced considering other places we had been (of course they don't beat the $1 Margherita's on the Strip!) After the pool, my husband and I ate at the Grotto on site. We had a fantastic meal and great service. Our friends ate earlier at the Buffet and said there was lots of variety and they ate well. This casino and the Fremont St area seemed to be our last lucky day for gambling. We had not fared well on the Strip, but Fremont proved for us to be our jackpot (we are by all means not big gamblers, and winning $25 is huge to us!!). Great area to stay in at night witht he entertainment, casino's and old style Vegas Neon lights. We highly recommend staying at the Golden Nugget if Vegas is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Spa Suites are worth the splurge!”
Reviews.Author: ilovemycows
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is our favorite Las Vegas hotel & casino. We have stayed in every room type available there. The Spa Suites are worth the splurge!! They are also a great value compared to the upscale suites on the strip. We booked our Spa Suite for $239 per night through an email promotion. The suite is about 1500 sq ft. It has 1 1/2 baths, floor to ceiling glass windows, bar with refrigerator & ice maker, 3 flat screen TVs, jetted jacuzzi tub, separate steam shower, bidet & a convenient exterior door in the bedroom chamber upstairs. The casino was our friend during our stay. I like the dealers at the Nugget because they are very personable. The whole atmosphere at the Nugget is what I like the best. It is classy yet laid back & fun. Also...the hot rock massage at the GN Spa is fabulous. And, the rib-eye steak at Vic & Anthony's at the GN is fabulous too. The Gordie Brown show is ok...not the best. I encourage you to sign up for the email promotions if you are interested in staying in a suite at the GN. You can probably get a better deal through a air/hotel package for a standard room.....but the best deals on the Spa Suites & the Parlor Suites are through the email promotions.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: calidreamin09
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded me and my families expectations! Beautiful room, bathroom, restaurants and pool! The parking was detached from the hotel which made it a little inconvenient, but not bad. We especially loved the pool. It was gorgeous! The best we've seen. I only wish that the pool was opened to all until 10:00pm. The pool area was so crowded and didn't really have chairs available until 6:30pm - 7:00pm and it closed at 8:00pm. We had so much fun anyway! Also, the hotel is connected to the Fremont Experience street that was the happening "strip" of the downtown area which made it very convenient to shop and hotel hop to gamble or eat. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A classic gem that still needs polishing”
Reviews.Author: LV_Syl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a staycation, so we checked into the Golden Nugget for one night. The hotel itself is lovely, and the staff is courteous and efficient. However, there were some issues. My complaints are as follows: 1. Hookers in the casino. If they're obvious to me, they should be obvious to security. They shouldn't be allowed to work the casino floor in so blatant a manner. 2. They need to invest in new mattresses. I felt like I was having a Princess and the Pea experience. The mattress in our room was entirely too soft. Not everyone likes to sink all the way to the floor when they lie down. 3. Make sure all rooms have a Do Not Disturb sign. We didn't have one in ours, but I didn't think it was necessary. That is, until housekeeping barged in at 8:30 a.m. and woke us up. Ouch. Good thing we were able to check out and drive the three miles to our own house to sleep in comfort. Other than that, the Golden Nugget is a nice location for tourists. Just don't expect to be getting caviar on a bologna budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: jallen5493
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I had a great time with friends and this is a spectacular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvtogo8718
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Golden Nugget around 3pm and there was no wait at check in. We asked for a free upgrade and the clerk did try to find one but most of the rooms were sold out due to a Blackjack Tournement that weekend. We had a South Tower room on the 19 floor which had a pretty view and a very comfortable King Bed. The bathroom was nice and the shower had very good water pressure. The time share people near the elevators did try to stop on on several occasions but just tell them you are not interested and they will stop. (you will also get these people at the entrance to the casino on Fremont St as well) Overall the the Golden Nugget was a very nice hotel, we did get the coupon booklet but most coupons are only good Mon-Fri, and of course we stayed on the weekend. We did eat at the Carson St Cafe which was okay. We ate at The Grille on late nights but the people there did not have much personality at all. Casino was fun, but the slots were very tight. I enjoyed playing the blackjack tables there and the dealers were always great. As far as the Fremont St area, the place has a lot of sketchy characters in the area and a lot of people giving you "free" comps (beware of them it is a timeshare). Lightshow was pretty neat as well. I would probably stay on the strip next time, not because of Golden Nugget because it was fabulous there, but the Fremont St area did not impress me much.

Reviews.Title: “Tried it once, but will not go back again”
Reviews.Author: RosaElliott
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas numerous times and usually travel there twice a year, always stay at Main Street Station (see my review) stayed at the GN for 3 nites and then over to the MSS for 4. The price of the room was $49.00 a night plus tax, received a coupon booklet, only used the ones for the buffet. The drink coupons were kind of a joke, as all they gave you was a sampler glass of certain types of beer, and a small mixed drink ( you could not taste any alcohol) the bartender was not very nice. The buffet was good and a value at 2 for 1. Like others have said the pool area is very crowded and it is extremely hard to get a chair. There were a lot of families. You had to a walk a far way to get to the elevator for the south tower and yes those annoying time share people were there bugging everyone, just keep walking! If you walk far away from your spouse they will not bother you. We ended up getting a handicapped washroom (the sink was very small and there was no counter space at all to place anything) there was no fridge in the room and the TV did not always work as there were no signals for the channels. The GN is pretty crowded and it seemed like there was a more younger crowd who like to party ( the MSS is more quiet with a different clinental) the slots were tight, could not even win $5.00 (different story at the MSS, the CAL and Binions) drink service was far and few inbetween, not like Binions (with excellent, super friendly waitresses) and MSS or the CAL. In any event, the GN was clean and the room was pretty nice, but not all that big but for $49.00 a night, who can complain. I just will not stay again, it just was not for me. Any way, that's my 2 cents worth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, annoying stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ajay0876
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Golden Nugget through Orbitz several months before our trip to Vegas. They were running a special which included somewhat discounted pricing on rooms and included a special bonus booklet including gambling vouchers, meal discounts, free meals etc. Many other hotels were offering great pricing on rooms, but didn't have any special bonuses, so we chose the Nugget. Well, once we arrived and self-parked we were accosted by a desk full of used car salesman types trying to sell us discounted tickets to shows. We told them that we just drove all day and want to just check in. They still tried to sell us tickets and finally we had to be very firm in order to get directions to the check in desk. When we arrived at check in the line was ridiculously long. When I got to the desk the clerk was rude and bossy. I tried to give him my printed confirmation from Orbitz and he said he didn't need to see it in a very brash way. Then what a surprise, we get our keys in a little folder and there is nothing in there except our keys. No booklet w/ specials or vouchers. So we have to go back down from our South Tower room, which required us to walk past the desk of show ticket sales people again - just don't make eye contact with them. When I talked to a different gentleman at check in he said that they had "run out" of the special booklets and all her could offer us was 2 free passes to the buffet and 2 free passes to the spa/sauna. What a ripoff!! The booklet we were supposed to get included over $100 of vouchers and coupons and we get two passes for a $15 buffet (which was not very good at all btw) and passes for the sauna. If I wanted a sauna I could walk outside where it was 112 degrees! I couldn't even use the "spa" passes for any spa services such as massages or manicure/pedicures because it doesn't include that. I asked if we could exchange the spa passes for something else that we would actually use and was told no. I was fuming. We even talked to the host about this and had no success at all. He did nothing for us. They would have been wise to give people gambling vouchers so that we would at least stay in their casino to gamble. We did have fun in the casino, although if you purchase drinks at the bar it was extremely expensive - stick w/ the waitresses. Our room was beautiful, very large and immaculately clean, the bed was so comfortable. Nice bathroom, nice towels. I called housekeeping to come and change our sheets and it was taken care of right away. For some reason the TV got very few channels and the hotel services station would not work, neither would the movie channels. The only downside of our room was that being located in the South Tower meant that everytime we went to and from our room we had to walk by the desk of ticket sales-people. And EVERY time they tried to sell us tickets. It was really annoying!!!! The location was convenient and within walking distance to lots of places on Fremont St. The dinner buffet pretty much stunk. The food was the same quality that I would expect at an Old Country Buffet - Yuck! However, the breakfast buffet was wonderful!!! Everything I had for breakfast was delicious and there were so many choices. The day we were checking out there was a special offer slipped under our door - if we wanted to stay an extra day we could have the room for a discount. I called the front desk and they said we could have the room for $34. If we had gotten our incentives booklet we would have stayed for sure. But without that they're just trying to get more of our money so we opted not to stay the additional night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It But... Pool Is VERY Busy”
Reviews.Author: Spuddysmom3
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one night stay at the Golden Nugget on June 26th and really enjoyed the pool but it is a very busy place and chairs were hard to come by, I noticed alot of chairs that were being "held" with towels on them, I think after awhile if no one is using them then the towels should be removed so they could be used but thats just my opinion...We also enjoyed the different slots in the casino, never won anything BIG but had lots of fun. I would definately stay again if the price was right..

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SadiesPal
Reviews.Content: This is the third time at the Nugget in my last three trips to Las Vegas. I was a little concerned when I booked the room because the only rooms available were the ones in the older part of the hotel and I had never stayed there before. I was pleasantly surprised as the room was not cramped and was very clean and well kept. Three nights stay with no additional charge for parking was around $70 per night. I was in town to play in the poker tournament that the Golden Nugget was sponsoring during my stay. The tournaments were very well run and organized and gave the players good value for the entry fee. With some of the poker room employees running the tournaments the organization of the poker room itself suffered a bit, but still a good experience. I only play poker in Vegas, so I have no opinion on the slots, machines or table games. The Noodle House wasn't great. The service was very good but the food was average. Carson Street Station has an awesome breakfast menu and very good service. Excellent little grill by the Sports Book for burgers and sandwiches. Didn't have time to eat and Vic and Anthony's this trip which I regret. I usually don't enjoy sitting by the pool but after the sun went down the pool was an enjoyable place to relax and have a drink. Check-in and check-out went quickly and overall the staff was very helpful. If you haven't stayed here, give it a shot. Before trying the Golden Nugget about 2.5 years ago, I stayed at Caesar's, Mandalay Bay, the Mirage, Venetian and the Flamingo. I haven't regretted making the change to the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget but...”
Reviews.Author: wheresdaapplebzdaddy
Reviews.Content: We love being downtown and have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times and have always been impressed with it (even before the shark tank pool). I really don't know how to say this without sounding crass but if you enjoy adult time and peace and quiet around the pool you won't find it anymore at the Nugget (at least during the summer break season). The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are a value, and being downtown is a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mrsstyle
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11:00pm and the staff was very helpful. We had two children with us, one 6month old and one child that was 4 years old.The front desk manger immediately upgraded us to a room with a better view and one that was in a quiet area. The overall day to day staff was great. They tried to help in any way possible.It was great to be downtown and not have to walk far for entertainment. Fremont street had bands on every corner. In prevous trips,We have stayed on the strip but I am now going back downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lastguyontheright
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried when I booked a package at the Golden Nugget instead one of our usual strip choices (NYNY, Luxor), but overall I enjoyed this experience more. Stayed on the 8th floor, south tower and although I was a little disappointed that we didn't get a renovated room, I couldn't complain. We had a view of the mountains, towels and toiletries were replaced every day and the bed was soft and comfy. The service was excellent - we even got our room at 9 a.m. on a Saturday check-in! - and everyone was friendly and courteous. The pool area is a little cramped, but awesome with warm water, tube slide, shark tank and BJ tables that weren't overly crowded. We even decided to see Gordie Brown and weren't disappointed - he was hilarious!! This is definitely the place to be downtown and I think the Golden Nugget may end up being our home away from home when in Vegas. My lone complaint: The air fresheners in the A/C unit are way too strong ... my wife had an allergic reaction. Request to have them removed on the first day and it won't be a problem. Seriously, it was so strong we could hardly breathe and the cleaning lady said a lot of people are complaining about them.

Reviews.Title: “Wnted to stay Longer!!”
Reviews.Author: banglesTaz
Reviews.Content: We both loved the Golden nugget - even though it is situated at Fremont St. not the strip it was fantastic and the night life and casinos at fremont street are great. The hotel room was spacious - nice big plasma TV. Very easy to get the deuse bus only walk one block to go to strip. Loved the pool and the H2O bar - it was spacious enough. The buffet - we loved that and you get coupons when you check in so you can eat very cheap. Only one complaint - no fridge in room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kerriannt
Reviews.Content: What an experience. We stayed in a spa suite, it really was unbelievable, better than the other top rooms we have stayed in at other hotels. I was a little worried at first, not being in the center of everything, but I really enjoy this location better. The room has floor to ceiling windows on both floors of the suite, a large whirlpool bath and a steam shower. I think we had 4 tvs and 2 or 3 bathrooms (we paid 275 a night). The best part was the customer service. Cally, the pool manager is so nice, and I really recommend renting one of their cabanas for 175.00, it is well worth it, very private and it is really hooked up w/a tv, fresh fruit, water, and personal waitress. (make sure to reserve ahead, they were sold out when we stayed, but I had made a reservation in advance) The waterslide is awesome and so is the aquarium. Everyone there was super friendly. We also got massages at the spa, we both agreed they were excellent. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice .....”
Reviews.Author: WOODNHEAD
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the golden nugget. The people were good, the pool was great. But get to the pool early, it fills up fast. Fremont street is really cool at night. Check out Ellis Island just off the strip, fun place.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Carolina_Traveler_7
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in a South Tower room at the beginning of our trip and one night in a North Tower room at the end (our prime destinations were Brice and Zion National Parks). The North Tower Rooms are somewhat more expensive and considered "premium". All the basics were fine with both rooms. They were clean, quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. Parking is in a deck across a small side street and is free, as long as you hang on to a little parking slip they will give you on check in. One thing that surprised us was how far "The Strip" is from downtown. All the cross roads are under construction, nobody pays any attention when driving, "strip" parking is crazy, and side streets get sleazy looking really fast. You would need to plan on 45 minutes to an hour to get to MGM, for instance, to go to a show. So it's best to come to this city with a lot of patience. The difference between north and south tower: a few more toiletries, closer to the casino (but farther away from the parking deck), a somewhat better view, bigger tv (but not a lot of channels), larger room. Again, both rooms were fine overall...it depends on your priorities.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and downtown location”
Reviews.Author: PNKS
Reviews.Content: Room on 22nd floor with nice view of the pool. Some construction going on but it did not bother us any. Room had been updated and was nice and clean. Bed was comfortable. Small bathroom. Fun pool area. In the miggle of downtown excitement. Arrived late and was checked in quickly.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Room Not Worth Money”
Reviews.Author: pegdaveTexas
Reviews.Content: I booked a VIP Gold Club Room for the extra amenities like going to the head of the line in the buffet, and the VIP Lounge. I also booked it because in the virtual tour of the room, there was both a recliner and a large sofa to relax on. When we got to the hotel, the service was great, and the public rooms were beautiful. When we got to the room however, that was a different story. Our room was in corner in a stairwell area. It was laid out differently than the picture. The walls were very dark brown, not deep tan as the pictures seemed to indicate. This made the room also like being in a cave. Since there were no curtains over the window, there was a lot of music coming from the street as well as a great deal of bright light. Also, the one feature I wanted the most was missing. There were no upholstered chair or couch. Just a wood desk chair and a end of bed bench. No sign of either sofa or recliner. We basically got half a room. The bathroom was so trendy as to be almost unfunctional. It took me 5 minutes to figure out how to turn on the water using the ultra modern style faucet, and another 5 minutes to figure out how to turn on the shower. The glass in front of the shower made it very hard on turn on and adjust the shower. Once the shower was on, it was the rain type showerhead and I could never get a forceful spray that I prefer. On the other hand, the TV in the mirror was cool. In the morning we were awaked before 6 am by construction noise from somewhere outside. If there had been curtains on the window, it might have muffled the noise. The buffet was okay, it was food and a large variety but nothing great. The coffee was weak. The casino was laid out in such a way that if you wanted to walk around, you couldn't. There was enough room between slot machines facing each other, but the main walk areas through the casino was so tight as to be unsafe when crowded - elbow to elbow people. The line to get the 24 karat club card was so long we never got ours. The morning we checked out we used the VIP lounge such to have a quiet place to read the newpaper and drink coffee since our room had no chairs. It was beautiful and comfortable, but a group of people came in after us and starting talking, so it wasn't quiet. We asked the ladies at the desk to assist us in a couple of things, but they could not accomodate us. When we checked out, we did talk to the manager about the lack of chairs in our room, and he did knock $50 off the room rate. Overall, the extra cost of the VIP room was not worth it, the few extra amenities we got such as free bottled water, and a few snacks did not make up for the lack of chairs, the noise, the bright lights and lack of quiet space. Our room was $169 before the $50 deduction, but even at $119, that is more than double the cost of a standard room. At least in a standard room there may have been a chair. If I had to do Las Vegas again, I would have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure Hidden in Plain View in Downtown Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: supershe
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about how well the Golden Nugget took care of our group. We had a gathering of Trip Advisor people from all over here for a week, more or less, at the end of May, and first part of June. We had several planned activities, and everyone at the Golden Nugget bent over backwards to accommodate us. I give them the highest recommendation for anything like this that you or your company might have planned. You will not be disappointed. Little things, like a gathering by the Pool for a Night-time surprise birthday party... They provided the cake for us at a third of what a local bakery would do, and they served the cake and provided plates, napkins, forks, etc. The cake was gorgeous, with glazed fruits on it. Really pretty. Other group gatherings were attended to with attention to every detail. The rooms are very nice... large, with flat panel TV's, safes in the closet, and the air conditioning works very well. The bed has a very comfortable pillowtop mattress, and my room was clean and well kept. I will also say that the outside noise doesn't even seem to penetrate here. Elevators are fast, too. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants except the breakfast buffet, and it was fine. They had an excellent omelet station. And the pool itself is awesome, with a nice sized hot tub, and the Shark Tank with slide through the center is beautiful, and definitely a one of a kind! Loved the H20 bar out there also! Hope this helps. I enjoyed my three day stay here... it is undoubtedly the nicest hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: slotalot
Reviews.Content: This review / tips is more geared to people on a budget. We were going to be bowling at the cashman center. We bought a roundtrip bus trip on the bell trans for $15.00 from the airport. No issues there. Had to be picked up at 3:30 a. m. return trip. He was early. Relief. Arrived at the Golden nugget and checked in without incidence. No waiting at 6:00 P.M. We had the 21st floor, South Tower. You have a choice of 8 elevators. No waiting . Our room was very clean. The closet had a blow dryer, security safe, ironing board, approx 20 hangers, 2 bathrobes. The bathroom was small but still clean. It has a bathtub w/good water pressure. One sink on a large granite countertop. The basic room included the 5 drawer dresser, table 2 chairs, night stand w/alarm clock and vanity. We had a 47" flat screen tv. The internet adapter was on the table for $12.50. Not quite sure on the price but close. The beds were quite comfortable and soft. I really dread the hard beds. Never heard any neighbors and the curtains when closed made the room pitch dark. I really enjoyed looking at the pool. This is seen on the 1st floor. What a cool feature. Only one night was it extremely crowded. Sometimes they had only about 20 people in it. Closes at 8:00p.m. Buffet on the 2nd floor. I give it about an 8. We ate breakfast here. We had a woman who did the slow shuffle as our waitress(MS Wiggins). I enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the Fremont so much better. The egg guy at the fremont was terrific. He was on it. I did not enjoy the Fremont for dinner. Ate at the Carson Street cafe for supper. Good place to eat. Service was great. Manager walked around and asked us if we had good service. I would definitely stay here again. The fitzgeralds still has the old slot machines. In fact some of there machines would not take the new $5.00 bill. Alot of them still return the coins instead of the tickets. The fitz has gone down hill since i stayed there 3 years ago. Smoky smell is bad. I really hate that as i see the potential of this hotel. I used to love that hotel They have a Mcdonalds there. Ask for Senior citizens drink/coffee. Cheaper. Never did find Burger King even though it shows ads on it. The Plaza has a Mcdonalds and a Subway in it. They do not offer the senior discount For bowlers: Binions has a shuttle bus that takes you to the Cashman Center at no charge except tip. Its in the back of Binions. The taxi cost $6.50 from fremont street to Cashman. Walking distance is about 20 minutes from Main street. Parking at the Cashman was $3.00. Transportation: Fremont has a free Charter bus that takes you to Sam's Town. From there you take another free bus ride to the strip(Harrah's & Riviera). Last run back is approx 10:45 p.m. This is how we got around. My husband's brother took the Deuce from Stewart street (downtown) to the strip. Information is on the RTC website. I believe it was $7.50 one way. Also the Cat (local bus) information in on the RTC. I believe that approx $1.50. I called them to find out what bus route to take to the strip. I ended up going out on the fremont bus. website. We ate at the Margaritaville on the strip. We ate a volcano. Large mound of chips/chili & cheese. This could eat 4. We bought one for two. Way to much. This was great. I am glad we stayed at the Golden Nugget. It is so much closer to the bowling center. If the price is right again i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget, LasVegas...What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyb61
Reviews.Content: We arrived on May 1, 2009 to stay for 5 days while my husband bowled in the USBC tournament. Service was exceptional from start to finish. The guys at the front door of the hotel were friendly & courteous. Check-in was a piece of cake with very knowledgeable and friendly staff. My husband shipped his bowling balls ahead of us for ease of travel and asked the staff to locate the package. Within 5 minutes of us arriving in our room, the box was delivered to us. The room was just as their website described. We had a king-sized bed and a very large, comfortable room. My only complaint (which is certainly not the hotels fault) was that we stayed on a smoking floor (hubby is a smoker).
