Room had a desk, a table with 2 chairs, dresser with a large flat screen TV on top, dressing table with makeup mirror, large closet with a safe, iron, ironing board, hairdryer and extra pillows. And the best of all...2 absolutely, fabulous bathrobes! We had dinner at the buffet that evening and breakfast there everyday after that. The weekend brunch was just fabulous with your choice of champagne or mimosa's and lots of great choices with everything you could imagine for brunch! Saturday was my day at the spa, while hubby went to play in the casino. I just started working out with a trainer and was sore from being out of shape, so I decided to go for the "sports massage" and facial. I was pampered from the start and the staff was great. I was brought into the spa and shown everything there (which includes the salon, fitness area, hot tub, sauna & dry heat rooms). I was given a pair of sandals and brought to the changing/waiting room. I was given a locker which had a robe to change into and where I could keep my clothes while I was at the spa. The waiting area was comfortable with lounge/chaise chairs and cold refreshments & snacks. I changed and was immediately called in for my massage. The massage was great and lasted for 50 minutes...not so much relaxing as it was healing my sore muscles. I was then brought back to the waiting area to wait to be called in for my facial. It was a 30 minute facial which everyone should experience! Throughout my massage & facial, both staff members were constantly asking if I was comfortable and enjoying my spa experience. Once my facial was done, I decided to go into the hot tub. I enjoyed that to the point where I became wrinkled! Once I was ready to leave, the shower area was complete with everything one could possibly need...shampoo, conditioner, razors, washcloths, towels, etc. The makeup area was complete with combs, hairdryers, deodorant, body lotions, etc. The experience was wonderful, relaxing and something I would certainly recommend to anyone! Later that afternoon, the day continued with a BIG win on the Kentucky Derby which was shown on 4 big screens in the Grand Ballroom. Sunday was bowling day in the afternoon, so most of the morning was spent on the casino floor (which was fun & profitable!) Monday morning (VERY early...6am) was bowling day #2, so we were back at the hotel by 10 am. I wanted to spend some time by the pool while hubby went to play in a poker tournament (which he won!!!) The pool was just AMAZING! Waitstaff was very courteous and busy! Towels were supplied poolside and frozen strawberry margaritas were great. The shark tank was just the coolest thing I have ever seen. To be able to take a dip in the pool and swim up to the fish and sharks was just amazing. Very relaxing lounge chairs in the shallow part of the pool were refreshing too. Wished I had worked in a trip down the slide, but was enjoying myself too much relaxing in a lounge chair. 4 blackjack tables poolside were very good to hubby as well. Casino was very comfortable, clean and well laid out. Service was exceptional; rates very reasonable. Will DEFINATELY stay again next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with pleasant & courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Shrimpman
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews on Tripadvisor regarding this hotel and viewed hotels own website plus others, so expected this hotel to be a decent one. We were not disappointed in the slightest on fact our expectations were exceeded. We arrived late (midnight) and we had a very quick and easy check in. Our room was a King Deluxe in the South Tower. Room was big and was identical to the photos on the website. Room was lovely and clean as too was the bathroom. Only thing lacking in the bathroom was a mini showergel, but this is really being picky as we had everything else and more besides. Bath was low with easy access and hand rail. The cleaners came to tidy our room and make the bed daily, they changed the sheets every other day, and they did a fantastic job. The food at the hotel, buffet and Carson Street Cafe is excellent. We only ate at those places did not try other places. In fact we had a buffet breakfast most days and found that we filled up on it so much so that we really didnt feel the need to eat anything else for the rest of the day, we would have an evening snack of sandwich or similar and we would be fine. The South Tower alone had 16 elevators, 8 for the even floors and 8 for the odd floors. There were elevators and moving stairways upto the buffet restaurant and Showroom. The casino floor was all on groundfloor level as was the Tank, other restaurants etc. The casino was nice and airy, not too much smoke and did not smell as some other casinos did. The staff at the hotel did everything they could to assist us, even the bell hops, one of which booked and arranged a trip for us to hoover dam at short notice. The Deuce bus stop to the strip is just a couple of blocks away, and we used this service everyday. Costs $3 for one way trip $7 dollars for all day or $15 dollars for 3 days. The 3 day pass proved really good value. Journey sometimes was quick but other times could be lengthy but we felt this just depended on time of day and driver. However most nights we would return from visitng the sights on the strip to the hotel and Fremont Street as the party atmosphere there was great fun and more enjoyable than the strip. When you look at the Hotels website and wonder if it really does look like the photos or have they "glossed" it up a bit - they havent, the hotel really does look like that and is a fantastic place to stay. It can get busy at the weekend however this adds to the party atmosphere. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CookieladyNh
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about staying at this hotel. It got a 4 diamond review from AAA. We were disappointed from the time we checked in . We travel frequently and have always trusted AAA reviews. We were supposed to have adjoining rooms, instead they were across the hall. That was fine. We had my elderly mother in law with us and there was no handicap access for her. At least we were not informed of any. We went to breakfast at 10. It was scheduled until 10:30. We were told after paying that they had stopped cooking breakfast!! Our shampoo supplied was used! This is not 4 star. I could continue, but I am limited in space.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: TripTipsfromTX
Reviews.Content: Had never been downtown so we decided to give it a try this time. Opted for the VIP check-in but wasn't worth it as there were no lines at regular check-in. Receptionist there was professional but somewhat standoffish. We told her we'd never been downtown before and were there for our anniversary (21) and were really looking forward to our stay. She managed to thank us for coming downtown but that was about it. Room was okay - stayed in the South Tower. Requested smoking as I was assured the ventilation was very good. Well it's not so if you don't have to smoke in your room, choose non-smoking. All in all room was clean but the dust ruffle on the bed was grossly stained. Had a few maintenance issues with the shower but someone responded within fifteen minutes of calling and quickly took care of things. Got a little loud in the hallway when the Beverly Hillbillys arrived on our last full day there. Buffet is excellent choice for breakfast. Lots of food including meats, eggs, bagels, pastries, fruit cereal, etc. The bourbon sauce is a must try (we poured it over the bread pudding - yum!!). Lunch buffet is not nearly as good and the only saving grace was that they still had the omelet station going and of course that lovely bourbon sauce... Location is good. It is very convenient to access different casinos with little walking. We walked down to Main Street Station a few times and highly recommend the Microbrewery there. Pool is cool. Was never really packed but those lounge chairs are on top of each other. There are a few 'pit' areas with sofas and tables and they looked really comfy. Valet service was outstanding. Received wonderful directions from the guy behind the desk. Fast, courteous service. I'm not really sure I agree with the 4-star rating but would be willing to try it again (non-smoking please), especially at the rates we got.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: cazcazcaz
Reviews.Content: We usually stay swanky on the strip in Vegas. A big gang of us went down this year and decided to stay at the Nugget. I was a little skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised! The location on the Fremont Strip is fantastic. The check-in was smooth, and the staff was extremely courteous. Even the ladies vacuuming the hall made a point to say "hi, have a great stay" every time I passed them. I stayed in the South Tower, and the room was pretty basic. I pulled back the sheets to check for bedbugs (I'm supremely paranoid, yes!) and the mattress etc was super clean and in tip top shape! The bathtub could have used a re-caulking (old and dark, ew) and a good hit of draino, but those were my only complaints. Who stays long in their room, anyway? The beds were ridiculously comfortable. Some of our friends stayed in a suite in the North Tower, and it was more impressive. We spent a lot of time at the pool, and had a fantastic time. A great mix of young partiers (no one was pretentious), couples, and families with kids. The food at the restaurants was excellent! We ate twice at the Italian restaurant (Grotto?) it was that good. All in all, a great stay, and I would definitely stay there again. Oh, watch out for the staff at the desk near the North Tower who offer you a "free gift." It's an invitation to a timeshare presentation. No thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Will return next year, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JefeArdrossanAB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 days at the Nugget. I paid a bit more and rented the gold VIP room on the 17th floor, nice to treat yourself sometimes. The check in was fast and smooth as well as the luggage was there waiting for us. The room was incredible and comfortable, all the comforts. Water and free snacks as well as coffee and a paper by the elevators, nice. Room was so clean and all the staff were very nice. We ate only once for breakfast at the buffet so cant comment on the food to much. We ate out most of the time as we rented a car, real nice to have and look around. Red Rock canyon was nice as well as a trip to the Hoover Dam was interesting. Driving was a snap with the GPS and the convertable was fun but got hot in the pm. Went to Chris Angle belive, Zumanity, and Gordie Brown at the nugget. All the shows were good and Gordie Brown was real good. Im a gambler unlike my wife, and found all the dealers very nice and was served drinks. Slots are tight! My trip at the nugget from the vallet parking to the pool and staff was fantastic and will return back to Freemont Street next year. I found it more personal, and half the price as the strip where I have stayed before. Stay here and you will not be dissapointed and dont hesitate to rent a car for the days. We still did the cab thing at night as we enjoy to have a few drinks at night. Thanks to the Nugget for making my trip that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Swiming with the sharks”
Reviews.Author: stoutbrewer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to join up with families coming to Vegas on vacation. We hadn't been to the Downtown area in a few years and weren't sure what to expect. Walking in and around the Gold Nugget reminded me of Treasure Island on the new Strip. From the time we drove up to the entrance to the time we drove away we enjoyed our stay. The staff was always friendly and helpful. Our son totally loved the pool with its waterfalls and slide tube, which goes through a large tank with sharks. At night, walking out the front of the hotel and onto the Fremont Street Experience to see the night show was grand.

Reviews.Title: “What a suprise”
Reviews.Author: CWS55
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Golden Nugget to meet relatives from out of town. Now I am a strip guy who usually stays at The Mandalay Bay or similar. But this is where the gang was staying so I agreed to give it a try. Great place. Large comfy rooms. Great valet and baggage service. Excellent food in the resturants. This was a fun place. Being downtwon is a little funky but the casino was large, clean and relatively free of smoke compared to the other places nearby. The pool is fabulous with a large shark tank with a slide tube that goes right through the middle. Fun. I would go again anytime. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The only minus was a $15 charge per day for wifi. But then that is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is the best place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Hockey77352
Reviews.Content: I went there with my wife, and what a wonderful time we had there. Not only is it in the best location in Vegas (Fremont Street), but the casino is one of the best that I have ever been to. Not to mention the best burgers in Vegas right across the road at Binion's. If you like great hotels and a great street party, Stay at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in the entire city.”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this one is in my top three, easily. It's not on the strip, nor close to the strip, but downtown, which has it's own charms. This is by far the best hotel downtown. The pool is the best one in town. Yes, THE BEST ONE. It doesn't cover acres with beautiful landscaping like the strip pools, but it has a 3-story waterslide that goes through a shark tank, which you can also swim right next to the tank. It's also heated year round, unlike a lot of the strip pools, so this place becomes an even better deal in the winter. The club has a great balcony that overlooks downtown. Check this place out. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a salon suite during CES each of the last three years. What an incredible room. It can be pretty pricey most times, but I guess because of the bad econemy I was able to get it at a very decent price this past January. Beautiful decked out two story suites, the first night you'll want to just hang out in your room and feel like a high roller. The room I stayed in this time was amazing! With a rich chocolate tone to the entire room, brown leather sofas, brass rails on the staircase, a full bath upstairs, and a half bath in the downstairs, with a full wet bar and frig. The location is great to me as well, your on freemont, but only a $15 cab ride to almost anywhere on the strip. The regular rooms are decent as well, a friend was staying in one of the regular rooms while she was out there and wasn't to bad either and was much much cheaper. I believe she was paying $85 for weekend rate during convention time, not bad at all. MY two story suite was on the lowest day $199 and most expensive day was $249, but not a bad price for someplace actually nicer than my real home, lol. I highly recommend to this hotel, one of the gems of Las Vegas. Also if you stay at the Nugget you gotta check out the Grotto, great italian food. Also nugget has one of the best pools in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: BusyBee5
Reviews.Content: We visited Vegas April 29 - May 2 2009 and stayed at the Golden Nugget because of all the favourable Tripadvisor advice. Have to say that we were not disappointed in any way. We were in the South Tower on the 18th floor. Room was huge and clean. Bathroom also big and clean. Room gave us a partial view of Freemont Street without any noise. Had to ring the front desk at 4:30 am one morning because keyboard to use the tv internet was not working. Someone was at our door within 5 minutes with a new keyboard. Employees were friendly and the in house Buffet was excellent - ate there for breakfast and no need for any other meals all day! Coupon book fed us at a 2 for 1 rate ($10)and that was an added bonus! Pool area is busy and the Tank is really neat. You have to go down at least once! Smoke factor walking through casino was a little bit annoying, but it's that way everywhere. Weekly rate was cheap for a 4 star ($60) but watch out for weekends, they triple! It was really great to go out to a show on the strip at night and come back to Freemont street where it's all happening without all the walking you have to do on the strip to go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bazandbabs24
Reviews.Content: Had some reservations about staying in Downtown Vegas but was very surprised at how good the rooms were. Very well done out (obviously had a re-fit fairly recently). The casino and pool area were very well presented. Rooms were a good size and had all amenities included (including free use of the safe). Huge flat screen TV in the room with good range of channels. Very nice bathroom with good quality shampoos, etc. Check-in was a little slow but otherwise a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Experience Downtown”
Reviews.Author: FanofFlorida
Reviews.Content: Freemont Street used to be only a sideshow on my previous trips to Sin City, yet during my recent stay at the Golden Nugget, it became my primary destination. Staying away from the newer hotels and attractions was a ‘hard sell’ but my husband convinced me to give it a try. The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino surprised me with comfort and luxury I had doubted existed downtown. VIP check-in was fast and convenient. Our 17th floor Gold Club Level room was beautiful, furnished with modern details and a very comfortable bed, offered robes and slippers, plenty of storage and complimentary coffee, snacks and water. The view of the pool was inviting yet the automatic window shade tightly shut out the morning sun. My husband was tickled by the television set into the mirror of the bathroom as well as the huge flatscreen in the bedroom. They even provided a collection of music CD’s and free wireless internet service. Dining options were good, yet varied in quality. At Vic and Anthonys, we shared the most amazing Australian Lobster tail and a 24 ounce bone-in ribeye, cooked to perfection. I was a bit distracted by the noise level, expecting a more romantic steak house environment. We were delighted with the quiet atmosphere, service and options at Lillie’s Noodle House- try the Sea Bass! Carson Street Café was convenient and offered a good variety all hours. I would not recommend Grotto, unless you are satisfied with Olive Garden quality dining. The buffet was a huge disappointment, as it is recommended by many guides as a local favorite. The food choice was minimal and unappetizing. The pool at this hotel was great. Not only for the fantastic aquarium situated in the middle of the swimming area, but the shaded H20 bar area provided an excellent space for extended relaxation. We spent quite a bit of time lounging on a huge papasan, gazing up at the palm trees and listening to great music. Celebrating our 11th anniversary, we felt comfortable with the many other couples the resort seems to attract. Unlike the distance required to travel on the main strip to see ‘nearby’ attractions, the Freemont Street Experience is right outside the door of the Golden Nugget. It was a great party! We enjoyed the advantage of watching the action from the balcony of Golddiggers, a second story nightclub in the casino. The hotel is under construction, building a 4th tower on the West side. Aside from the view of the progress from the pool area, I did not notice any evidence of their work. I look forward to seeing the finished building. I definitely plan to stay at this hotel in the near future! Who would have thought downtown Las Vegas would offer such a comfortable and beautiful experience?

Reviews.Title: “best 4 star anywhere”
Reviews.Author: larrylBrampton
Reviews.Content: If location is your only concern then you have nothing to worry about. Ride the Deuce for $7 dollars a day . Do not rent a vehicle to save money. Insurance rates are ridiculously high. Costs more than the car rental. The rooms at the Nugget are very nice and roomy. The pool is exceptional and a great place to spend afternoons. Recommend spending at least part of your holiday on Fremont at this hotel. View the laser light show in front since the music is a big part of the show and is best there.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay. The best downtown”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis101
Reviews.Content: Clean, relaxing, great food, pool, rooms and lounges worth the extra dollars. Great fun

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Vegas-Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pokerdealerdan1964
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our awesome stay from the Golden Nugget Las Vegas! So here is my review, hope you find this useful! We booked our package through Allegiant Air, flying out of Eugene, Oregon, three nights, and a round trip shuttle to and from the airport. All that for $600 total. This was definatly the way to go, and here is why...Allegiant Air is a cheap no frills airline, its been the third time i've flown to Vegas with them and its been great everytime. The airline was ontime leaving out of Eugene and we actually landed about 10 minutes early so that is always great when you are excited! So the bad thing about flying into Vegas right now is they only have One Tram working. So there is a long wait to get to baggage claim. This will be ongoing for sometime. Just a warning so be ready for this, also, keep that in mind when you return, give yourself plenty of time to get through security and back on the One Tram thats working. The round trip shuttle option offered through Allegiant was a great deal, saved a few bucks, it was $28 round trip. It only took minutes after we got our bags to be on the way to the hotel so that was pretty awesome I thought. If you outright get a shuttle it can be $14 per person each way, and a cab from the airport to Golden Nugget yikes! We did the regular check in the Golden Nugget, took only minutes and the room we reserved online was ready for us so no need to pay the extra $20 for VIP. So here's the great deal for a prepaid trip to Golden Nugget, they do not need your credit card or debit card for incidentals! Otherwise they hold $100 per night, so that was another good deal! We stayed in the South Tower, 10th floor room 10109 and had a view of the Stratoshper Tower. So all the complaints about the walk from your room to the casino floor, don't worry about it, its not bad at all! I've stayed on the strip, now that's a long walk! They do have those pesky Tahiti Villiage people along the way to the elevators, so just don't make eye contact, keep walking and you'll be ok! Actually its not that bad at all. So the food was great there, we ate at Lillies Noodle house, two of us came to $60 and the food was great! Ate at Carson Cafe for breakfast, great again. Ate at the buffet for breakfast, not the best but only $10 each so what do you want for only ten bucks?? The thing i liked about the buffet was the veiw of the pool! So the staff was excellent, everyone was very friendly! I can't wait to stay here again, i receomend this hotel to anyone wanting a great Vegas experiance. How can you beat it? Catch the Duece to the Strip, its only $3 one way or $7 for an all day pass. We caught a cab from Excallaber to Freemont and it was $25 so cabs are pricey!! Just be warned. Oh, about the room, i didn't think there was a safe in the rooms because it's not listed on thier web sight, but there is one in the closet. Also blow dryer, bathrobes, iron, ironing board, extra pillow, nice!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Fremont”
Reviews.Author: shastaball
Reviews.Content: I generally upgrade to better suites whenever I stay anywhere, but the North tower was booked. The room in the south tower was clean, good sized and adequate. Two things that could be better are the drain in the bathtub was semi clogged, so when I took a shower there was always an inch or 2 of water in the tub. This shows lack of attention to detail on the cleaning crew - they should see this when they clean. Also, the rooms are very dark - floor to ceiling windows would help immensely. Since I spent very little time in the room, it was a non-issue. The one very nice thing is the rooms seem to be well insulated. The hotel was extremely booked, yet once I got in my room I couldn't tell anyone else was in the hotel. This is a plus anywhere. The pool is nice, but extremely crowded. It is nice that there is always a part of the pool in the shade and part in the sun, so if you just want to lay outside and read/lounge, but not in the blistering sun, you can do so. The location can't be beat. Walk outside and you're right on Fremont and things are always happening. It's a short walk to the next casino, etc. On the strip you wear yourself out just walking from your room to the front og your casino :-).

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget is Golden!”
Reviews.Author: siejen
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I second stay at the Nugget,and was not dissapointed. We were upgraded to a suite for the 6 days we were there and it was great.All the staff from the girls at the VIP check in to the servers in the casino were friendly and attentive to our needs.The room service was above par,we party till early am(5-6)and dont get up till noon and our room was always made up with fresh towels. I have always liked staying downtown just for this reason,it seems they try a little harder to make your stay more enjoyable than they do up on the Strip. We have stayed at a number of differant hotels on the strip,and once youve walked till your feet almost fall off and seen everything(although I dont think you could ever see EVERYTHING)its time to stay somewhere you can ea t well,drink well,and get down to the reason most of us come to Vegas for...Gambling! We used to stay at another hotel on Freemont but found that it was deteriating rapidly and wasn't the same fun place anymore,so we booked at the Nugget,best place to stay in Vegas! There is always a party on Freemont! We both enjoy the atmosphere downtown.it might not be for everyone but those in the know,know that your odds are better here than the swankier places on the strip,granted there isn't the oppulance here that you would experience on the strip either. The Grotto=great food,Vic and Anthony's=even greater food!,the buffet...well it serves its purpose for breakfast. Its very convieniant to have a car rental company on site,no probs grabbin a set of wheels for the day. We are going back in a couple months for a wedding up on the strip and we are still gonna stay at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “downtown rocks”
Reviews.Author: tour_junky
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the golden nugget i downtown lasv vegas i was blown away with the care and attention all staff memebers gave us during our stay downtown is party central

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Super Cool Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: Our second and third day in Vegas was spent at the Golden Nugget Casino & Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas right on "The Fremont Streetm Experience". The guy that booked our rooms guaranteed that we would love the newly renovated pool area. We got the room for really cheap rates ($25 on weekdays). We checked in pretty late, and by that time the shark pool was converted to a bar-- really cool. The rooms were ok. But the next day we made sure we were up early to just lounge by the pool. The tank of sharks were a nice touch, kinda makes me want to stay here again, in spite of the distance from the Strip. Cons: Inconvenient Parking. Downtown (ie off-strip) Pros: Reasonable Prices. Awesome Brand new shark pool.

Reviews.Title: “A MEMORABLE STRESSFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: MOJO329
Reviews.Content: Our family is a returning guest to the Golden Nugget hotel. We decided to return to the hotel because of its location in downtown Las Vegas and the amenities that are offered by the hotel. We stayed in the south tower in a non smoking room with 2 queen beds. The room was clean and comfortable throughout. Our family especially enjoyed the pool area and swimming with the sharks. Another feature that we enjoyed, were the hours that were offered by the hotel and that hotel security is present in the pool area. It could be annoying at times, when the Tahiti time share resort personnel were continually present when going to your hotel room or entering the hotel/casino entrances. However, our stay was not a total relaxing and enjoyable time as it was abruptly changed on the morning of our second day stay when we discovered that our vehicle was vandalized in the hotel's self parking garage. Security was somewhat helpful in that they took a report and photos of the incident. We were somewhat fortunate that our vehicle was not entered and that it wasn't stolen. It apparently was a random act of vandalism - no reason as to why we were the lucky ones as there was absolutely nothing of value in the vehicle for the criminals to take. While it is true we park our vehicles at our own risk and that the hotel is not responsible for any acts of vandalism or theft, it would have been appreciated if the staff of the Golden Nugget could have showed more compassion and concern to their valued guests. At the present time, we don't know if we could recommend this hotel to relatives, friends or strangers.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: mssocaljj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because that is where my Aunt & Uncle were staying to watch the basketball tournament. I did not expect to enjoy it that much. Its more of an older crowd but the hotel is nice, the pool is amazing and its right by Fremont St.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: jayhere5192
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel several times...best hotel downtown. Cannot beat the poker room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay- great location”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler98
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Las Vegas and our first stay Downtown. We have previosly stayed at the Flamingo and Treasure Island. We were satisfied with both, but not overly impressed with what you get for their prices. We chose the Golden Nugget because of their reputation for being the nicest hotel Downtown. From what we saw of the other casinos, Golden Nugget is BY FAR the nicest and the classiest. We played at the other casinos, but I couldnt get my husband to eat anywhere else but the Golden Nugget. We chose a deluxe room in the North tower because of the upgrade features. The flat screen TV was very large and the bed was great. The sheets were very comfortable and the pillows and comforter were super soft. We LOVED the room. It was better than the standard room at the Flamingo and on par with the remodeled rooms at Treasure Island. The common areas are beautiful and the pool was nice. The only complaint about the pool area is the number of available chairs. We were there during a HOT spell, and before the pool even opened, most of the lounge chairs were taken. This is concerning considering we saw a sign in the construction area saying there were 500 more rooms being built. Hopefully they expand the pool area too. As for the construction, we only heard noise one morning and it was barely noticable. Since the construction area overlooks the pool, we did see more than one construction worker staring down at the pool area, presumably checking out the bikinis by the pool. The casino and restaurants were very nice and had a very classy feel. I dont think the slots were as loose as the other hotels downtown and the table limits are higher. I realized quickly that since the new building needed to be funded , the slots would probably be tighter . Most of my gambling dollars went across the way to Binions and their $2 roulette. As for location, Downtown is the way to go. We love the Fremont Street experience light show, the entertainment and the action at night. The clientele is a little rough at times, but it is on some parts of the strip too. One good thing, no annoying people flicking their nudey girl cards at you. You can walk easily to multiple different hotels that have good gambling . We have found that the strip casinos take your money FAST. Downtown you can play longer and have a lot more fun. Overall, we had a great time. We will never stay or gamble on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay on the strip again”
Reviews.Author: JANEY039
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Las Vegas and my husband and I decided to stay downtown this time. We went with 2 other couples and had a great time. Loved EVERYTHING about this trip. The location is great. We had a room in the South Tower and the walk wasn't that bad to the casinos as described in some other reviews. The room was clean and updated. The pool was the best!! Went down the waterslide quite a bit. We didn't come all this way not to do swim with the sharks. Spent alot of time on Freemont Street and the experience was awesome. There is a Walgreens just a couple of block away if you forgot something. One night we decided to go the the "strip" and got bombarded with people trying to give you info on strip joints. We much enjoyed the downtown experience more. Already talking about doing this again in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nisey
Reviews.Content: Had a blast. This hotel is located in old Las Vegas! So much fun. The Freemont St. experience is worth the stay alone. So many things to do in this area and much cleaner then the "strip". Live bands, casinos, shopping and the cheapest places to eat. The hotel was awsome. Beautifil large rooms. The pool has a giant shark tank in the middle with a waterslide that goes right through the middle. So much fun. Was there for 5 nights. Not enough time to do it all. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Last visit was awesome, this visit was average”
Reviews.Author: Vikingslovebacon
Reviews.Content: Last year we visited in the Nugget for the first time and were very impressed with their rooms and service. In our recent visit, we were very disappointed to find things were not quite the same. Although our room was clean, two of the lamps did not work, the alarm clock's power went on and off and overall the room was dated. When we arrived the toilet was running, which continued on and off during our stay. The Nugget definitely beats the dumpy casinos (Plaza, Riveria, Circus Circus), but I don't think it's above average. On the plus side they do have a very nice pool, which is a great place to catch some sun and relax. We love staying downtown were you can gamble, eat and drink very cheap, but next time we visit we might try another hotel. Avoid playing the Nugget's slots though on both of our visits they were extremely tight! They have some crabby blackjack dealers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my Stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Golden Nugget from Sunday to Wednesday. We really liked this hotel. All the employees we encountered were friendly and professional. There was always something going on around the hotel, whether it was vacuuming, cleaning windows, or replacing plants in the pool area. It was nice to see how much they work at keeping the place looking nice. We had a room on the Eighth floor in the South Tower. The view wasn't much to speak of, but I don't stay Downtown for the view. The beds were very comfortable and soft. The bathroom was very nice. The room was a decent size, too. The only downside was that housekeeping could have been a bit more thorough in their cleaning. I would definitely stay here again and was disappointed that I never had a chance to hang out at the Tank (pool area).

Reviews.Title: “First time a great experience”
Reviews.Author: celeste_1960
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas, we decided to stay downtown because of what we heard from friends and reviews. We stayed April 3-7 in the south tower on the 22nd floor with a view of the mountains it was great the room was clean and tidy with a flat screen TV, king bed, non-smoking (couldn't smell any smoke at all). After two nights in this wonderful room there was a message on the phone to call the front desk, they up graded us to a parlor suite for the next two nights at no charge we were shocked!!!! we didn't win any money but sure had the time of our lives. The staff was friendly had no problems what so ever. We will be back to the GN again

Reviews.Title: “Great place at the right price”
Reviews.Author: JPostal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the GN with some friends at the end of March. Check in was great at the lady at the front desk was very nice. The coupon book they gave us was full of useful coupons that saved us a lot of money during our stay. There were no line-ups when we checked in at around 1pm, but later on in the day I noticed that the line had got pretty big. As requested we got two non-smoking rooms with king size beds...both rooms were on the 18th floor of the South Tower and were big and clean, but nothing too fancy. We are not into gambling so we picked this hotel mainly for the pool. We were very happy with the pool area other than it can get pretty crowded and hard to get loungers (and we were there mid-week). The hot tub is open until 2am and is a very nice place to relax at the end of the day. We did not spend too much time on Fremont street at night but if I go back to Vegas I would hang out on Fremont a bit more. We went to the main strip a couple of times and in my opinion Fremont street had a way better vibe, and everything is close together. *Tip* If you have a car and you want to visit the strip you can valet park your vehicle at the Bellagio for free (tips are expected). Other hotels might do this too, but the Bellagio is kind of in the heart of the strip and is a great place to start exploring. If I ever go back to Vegas I would stay at the Golden Nugget again, but maybe not on a weekend...I think it might get pretty busy. In my opinion it is the best value on Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lizziesmom1
Reviews.Content: We've stayed on the Strip many times - but this was our first time downtown. The Nugget was excellent. We had a beautiful room and it was super clean. The staff was so nice and considerate. The slots paid off way better than we've recently experienced on the Strip. The one and only negative was the pool area. The pool was beautiful but we couldn't get a lounge. They were all full. We loved the atmosphere in the area. We'll do this again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want to gamble and have fun”
Reviews.Author: ganta07
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas many times and this was my first time to stay downtown. The Golden Nugget is just as nice as most hotels on the strip and table limits in downtown ar much more reasonable than the strip. The buffet is okay. I would recommend the buffet at the Freemont. The Carson Cafe had good food in the Nugget. The rooms were clean and nice, staff was friendly. We checked out to go home and we were almost out of town when my wife realized she left her billfold in the room in the safe. We called the Nugget and they had the billfold (intact) waiting for us y the time we got back to the hotel. The only downside was our room was pretty far from the elevators. I will stay here again on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: redpepper74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Golden Nugget at the end of a week long trip. We started out at the Trump, then drove into Utah to visit some of thier beautiful National Parks, and then drove back to Vegas the night before our flight out. We decided to stay downtown for something different. We got a good rate through Orbitz for the Golden Nugget. We had a little difficulty with parking-- valet was full and the parking garage was hard to find. Check in was easy, and the service people very friendly. Our room was nice, clean, and had comfortable beds, but nothing outrageously special. However, we had a great dinner at the steakhouse, and really enjoyed Fremont Street. The real winner at the Golden Nugget is Fremont Street--- the atmosphere is so much fun, like a big street party! There were 2 bands that night, and tons of people dancing, drinking and having a great time. The strip is great, but Fremont Street is the real party! My husband and I decided next time we visit Vegas we will split our stay half on the strip and half downtown -- downtown is a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: akh2oguy
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas that I stayed downtown off of the strip. I will definitely go back. How often have you called the desk to check out and have the operator ask how your day is going? The facility was great, the room was great and clean, and the staff bent over backwards to accomodate me. The strip is a $20 cab fare away but why would you stay on the strip when you can stay at the Golden Nugget for $49.00/night. I was impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Downtown Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: Jiddodon
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews of the Golden Nugget before we picked this hotel and I must say the reviews were not really fair. The room( in the South Tower) was very nice and the walk from the lobby really wasn't that far. The value book they give out saved us quite a bit of money back. The one big negative about the Nugget is the 6 to 5 pay out on blackjack. You can go across the street and get 3 to 2 on all blackjack games. I did no gambling at the Nugget but our stay there was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Not worth it having to buy all services A La Carte”
Reviews.Author: adb25
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, colors outdated but no big deal. The hotel sent an email confirmation stating that the room we would get would be based on first come, first serve. Knowing that we wanted a King bed, smoking room, I called the reservation 800 number. To secure this exact room we had to pay an extra $22.20. We were driving and not going to get to Vegas and find out we had a double bed and it was non-smoking. So we paid the extra. When we arrived, we parked in the self park and went to check in. We had to carry all of our things from the parking garage, down 5 stories, through the hotel, up 20 stories and down about 1500 ft to our hotel room without a cart. No carts anywhere, unless you wanted to pay a bell-hop to take your items for you. We get into the room and find out that it is $12.99 per day PER laptop to use the internet. Do they not get enough of our money in the Casino? Come ON! Will not stay there again. Having to pay extra for everything, you may as well pay for a room on the Strip. Other than that, the hotel is still under construction, not too much noise. There is a terrible odor in the elevator area of the South Tower. It was there for our whole 2 day stay. They do however have a decent casino and play rather great music. The Buffet for lunch was ok. Glad it was only 10 bucks. Not bad, but not the best I've had either. One thing to note, the South Tower Elevators are only accessible by walking past the desk with the sales people who are trying to get you into Golden Nugget's timeshares. Expect to get asked each and every time you go to and from your elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Spot”
Reviews.Author: tatiana1
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted my daughter's wedding and most of the wedding party and guests stayed at the Golden Nugget, site of the wedding and reception. Silke Hunt was our contact for the ceremony and reception and did a great job. We managed to bring 70 guests, about 25 from Scotland, many from the Shetland Islands, to Las Vegas and even had Elvis Presley himself perform at the reception. All of that was great! Now on the to rooms. I booked the parlor suite which was the best idea of all. Not only did I host my daughter and her four bridesmaids on the day of the wedding for hair and makeup sessions from a local woman found on the internet, I had a cocktail party for the families to meet, and found my room to be the site of several impromptu gatherings. The parlor suite features a separate bedroom and bathroom connected to a large living room area with a couch, two large chairs, a table and four chairs, a television, another full bathroom, a bar, sink, and refrigerator. The price was great too, it wound up being around $500 for that room for four nights. Also enjoyed the Fremont Experience right outside the front doors of the casino, Golddiggers nightclub, and other downtown casinos which we walked to. Highly recommended, will return to the Golden Nuggel.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: johnn
Reviews.Content: stayed here over 3/12-15 with a few buddies for the golf weekend, low expectations since first time staying downtown - wow, much better than expected. rooms were big enough (south tower), and pool was one of best in area with slide and "dive bar" real convenient, best thing about place though is its spot on corner in "new and improved" downtown, everything from the low roller tables to good eating within walking distance - not like on strip where everything is miles apart. this place is clean and well kept, and service oriented, everyone i asked anything of was very helpful, will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible incident”
Reviews.Author: unhappybrideLakePark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget as we had in the past and have had a good time. We came to Las Vegas to get married on Valentine's Day. We checked in on Thursday night, Feb. 12, 2009. When we checked in we checked to see if they would up grade our room since we were getting married, no not at this hotel. Our friends had gotten married earlier in Las Vegas and they were up graded to a suite, but this was not the case at the Golden Nugget. Friday morning we were gone from our room for 2 hours to walk down to get our marriage license. In the 2 hours that we were gone they had cleaned our room and stole the jewlrey that I was going to wear to my wedding on Saturday. I called security immediately and they came up to our room and I completed a form, and that was it. They did no investigation, and now it is a month later and no report and no phone calls, no apology. NOTHING Apparently the Golden Nugget allows the cleaning staff to come into your rooms and steal from the guests while they are out of the room. We will never stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, buffet, and value!!!”
Reviews.Author: WarEagle2K6
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget's location right on the Fremont Street Experience was perfect. We checked in, walked up to a bar in the casino to get 2 free drinks (from coupon book they gave us at check-in), and right out into Fremont Street. The room was very nice, comfortable bed with great pillows. The next morning we enjoyed an awesome buffet, using the "Buy 1, Get 1 Free" buffet coupon from the aforementioned coupon book! We accidentally timed it perfectly by getting in right as breakfast was ending and lunch starting, so we paid the cheaper breakfast price and got to eat breakfast and lunch food. We didn't use the pool, but the slide through the shark tank looked amazing. We will definitely stay at the Golden Nugget next time we go to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KimpossibleOmaha
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 day trip to Vegas to celebrate a friend's birthday. We stayed at the Golden Nugget in the South Tower. Rooms were nice, not fancy, but somewhat updated and clean. The distance to the South Tower was minimal - the casino isn't that big. The staff was friendly, dealers very helpful and nice. We spend a lot of time at the pool, which is nicely heated. Unfortunately, they are doing construction and the hot tub is totally torn up. In addition, lots of noise! We like the downtown area, but the cab fares did add up on our trips to the strip. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will never stay anywhere else but the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: OhioLovesVegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget From Feburary 22nd to the 26th. Second time staying here and cannot see any reason to change.We had a North Tower room near the elevator.Very quiet and close access to elevators.Fantastic room and service Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kelligirl4
Reviews.Content: WE came here with two other couples. We had rooms all near eachother and partied pretty hard. :o) Check in was perfect, with the most nicest of young man, I wish I could remember his name.....The rooms are roomy and well appointed. The pool and slide are all fun. We especially liked the MALE sharks!!! (you will know what I am talking about, when you see them) Downtown Vegas is a hoppin' place.......We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Golden Nugget!!”
Reviews.Author: calnmextc
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Golden Nugget and we had a blast. We were able to get a great deal on a spa suite. We were not given one of the new, updated rooms, but the room was very clean and very nice. Housekeeping is great! We ate at Vic and Anthony's one night and would highly recommend it. Great service and great food! We were not able to get to the pool this time as it was pretty windy and a bit chilly. On a previous visit in May, we rented a cabana at the pool and it was very relaxing. The service is wonderful. There were only two negative aspects to our trip. The slots are very tight. We did not see anyone winning other than one person win 2,000 on a penny machine. We like to play 3 card poker. Most of the dealers and floor supervisors were very nice and alot of fun. However, the later evening shift on a Tuesday was an exception. The dealer asked the floor supervisor to pick up our 24 Karat cards (3 times) so that we could get credit for our bets. The supervisor completely ignored the dealer and us. If Jesse is there when you sit down to play, don't bother. Over all we will definitley stay again. We really enjoy downtown.

Reviews.Title: “stayed may times and loved it”
Reviews.Author: Fremmings
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Nugget for years. We find it very pretty, clean and the staff are nice. They treat us like royalty and are not. The free soda is hard to come by but with the economy i suppose you have to cut somewhere to keep the prices low. Our rooms are always nice. We love it there

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely hotel. Fantastic stay but exceptionally rude staff let it down”
Reviews.Author: kathrynWirral
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week as part of a 6 month round the world trip and the accomodation is of the highest standard. We could not complain about any aspect of the Golden Nugget except that the reception staff are simply rude and it lets the hotel down terribly as the staff in all the other areas are generally o.k. apart from pool attendants and security guards but you don't expect the reception staff to be so abrupt! Downtown Vegas is very different from The Strip but I definitely think you get quality in the Golden Nugget that could not be compared in a hotel on The Strip at a very reasonable price. The pool area is lovely however does become very crowded so you have to be quick to nab your sunlounger! The restaurants in the hotel are o.k. not spectacular and not that cheap but there are so many places to eat along the Freemont Street experience you don't need to rely on what's on offer in the GN. The rooms are very big and really nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: akingers
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a little nervous about staying downtown. I wasn't familiar with staying downtown. We loved the Golden Nugget! The room was extremely clean which is a must for my stayovers. The room was very nicely decorated and it was a standard room. It looked newly updated. There were fresh robes awaiting us and we got the best sleep in the extremely comfortable king sized bed. They also offered many coupons including a buy one get one buffet coupon. Both of us were stuffed on ten dollars. All Vegas travelers must experience downtown especially if yoyu like that "Old Vegas" feel. I will stay there again. The pool is also amazing with a huge aquarium containing sharks and a clear tunnel slide that runs through the aquarium. I will recommend the Golden Nugget to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “20th Floor South Tower”
Reviews.Author: Blasien
Reviews.Content: Great room with several extras, quite comfortable and pleasant, modern and clean. Housekeeping and desk staff pleasant and helpful. Casino is nicest downtown, buffet was a bit disappointing (Main St. Station is still best buffet and best value). The GN is nice balance of a classy hotel that doesn’t get too snooty or stuffy (that used to be their problem – seemed to have fixed that). Definitely would return on a special offer which often appear.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JJJC_Family
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget, while an older hotel, is reasonably well-maintained. We had stayed once before and were pleased. We stayed three nights for $59 per night and found the value excellent. The room was quite large, which we liked. It had a refresh recently, including a decent size LCD TV. The staff was very friendly and efficient. We were amazed at how fast a maintenance man swapped out the innards of the heating unit. From phone call to completion of the fix, it took less than five minutes - an all-time record. The only negative is being away from the strip, to which we had to drive each time. While not onerous, next time, we will probably stay on the strip so that we can just walk back to the hotel after walking around at night. Although, I would not be surprised if we visit the Nugget again, because it is such an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy being verbally abused while handing them money head for the GN casino!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with extended family from all over the west and a group of friends from home made our yearly trip to the GN Feb. 13-17. I have never been so disappointed - the service/atmosphere has changed tremendously for the worse. We (the entire group) had seven rooms in the North Tower on different levels. Two rooms in the South Tower as they were "sold out" in the North. It was Valentine's holiday so my husband decided to surprise me with a Club Room. It was a beautiful room with tasteful appointments - cd player complete with Frank Sinatra cds, large plasma/hd tv, clock with iPod station, free bottled Figi water,etc. However, coffee promised near elevator? It was there one morning during our stay. The "food/snacks" consisted of m&m's, granola, chocolate covered rasins and a bowl of apples. It was there one day but all of it was gone by 11am over the weekend and not refilled all day. I had an apple on the day we checked in and found a bottle of water. The goodies were in bowls with spoons but I saw ppl dip there hands in for a handful. eww! The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows! Bathroom was nice with tv built into the mirror. Bath robes and slippers provided. Our maid was wonderful and our room was cleaned to perfection every day. Do NOT expect "express room service" as it took an hour and a half to get mediocre food at room service rates. You can hear everything (and I mean EVERYTHING) in the room next to you. We were on the 17th floor. WiFi did not work for our stay. Pretty pointless to book a room on this level unless you really stay in the room the entire stay. View was of the mountains in background. Nothing special. Here's the ugly... Casino - As stated, we were on a yearly trip always staying at GN with family and friends. We were there in August for our anniversary and labor day with a wonderful stay too. So we are really wondering.. WHAT HAPPENED???? At the end of this trip three of us had been verbally accosted - I was called a [-] by a pit supervisor in front of everyone remaining at the table! 3 card poker with some great ppl from MN and others. I had previously heard some mumblings about us "midwesterners" but let it go. Instead of simply stating "Hi folks, It's late and I will be closing this table down in 10 minutes" we kind of chuckled as the pit boss walked by and quietly upped the minimum from 5 per hand, to 10, to 25 without a word. We had been playing for a couple of hours at wayyy more than the minimum, having fun with the dealer (who was very nice btw) and tipping as well. Perfectly understandable that they would close down a table if it were empty but it was not. When the "pit supervisor" upped it to 25 (remember 3 card is 3 bets!) I had money on the table and was finishing a hand while others looked on. This guy arrogantly called the bet off as I "was not playing the minimum bet". Huh? You just turned it in the middle of a hand!? I was not happy at all but when I went to walk away.. he called me that in front of everyone in the casino and loud enough to hear. When I turned and said "what did you just call me?" He had the audacity to repeat it. Even the kind ppl who had been sitting next to me were in awe. I really don't know who this guy thought he was but wow..there was absolutely no reason for it. We could not believe that in a casino hotel of this "caliber" had no GM on duty. This guy just grinned and asked "what are YOU going to do about it?" No manager was on duty or at least no one wanted to deal with me -I was crying at that point. Go figure. This is not our first trip ..take a look at my profile - not pretentious or a snob of any kind. I simply like kind ppl, comfortable surroundings and beleive that you should take care of your "guests". You simply expect someone in upper management to contact you about such an issue even the next morning. They were probably all off playing on a holiday weekend - this is Wednesday evening and we have heard nothing. I must say one lady who was also a pit super from that evening sent to pacify me..so "generously" took off a whopping 35.00 charge from our bill on our final day. The head of security at least called back but told us to write to the GM. Wow. (and he/she can't take care of this because???) On another evening - late on our last night our friends wanted to gamble before bed so they were at the crap table where one guy was referred to as an "[-] in front of everyone. I was on my way to my room when our friends called me over. The dealers will mock you behind your back so watch out - this guy had played for days on several trips to this casino, tips well and is one of the nicest guys you will meet. Also, know that the F word flies freely so consider yourself warned if you are sensitive to this kind of language. I hope if you decide to gamble here you understand these guys can rip you off and call you every name in the book and WILL get away with it. I don't know what is going on with this place but for these reasons we will head to another casino on our next trip. Since I don't want to just list the bad - we had fun despite the situations (they are NOT going to get away with wrecking our trip) here are some good points- We did meet many nice guests and I really enjoyed playing craps with the couple next to me who had the most amazing roll I have ever seen. Congrats again dear - you deserved it! During warm months the pool is amazing. There were many ppl IN the heated pool but it was too cold to lay out near it or that is where I would have stayed after the casino assault. The bar near the pool serves amazing bloody marys. :) Rent a cabana -so nice. The RED restaraunt for sushi is wonderful and the wine bar is quite nice for socializing. Carson Cafe had great food and drinks for reasonable resort prices. Next time to Vegas we will try Four Queens - we spent much of the next day there gambling and found the dealers and bartenders (while playing Video Poker) to be the best! I love staying downtown as it is fun to be able to visit many casinos in one area DH is returning with friends next week but is NOT returning to GN. It's a shame that such a beautiful hotel has such ugly staff and needs so much improvement before we will ever return. One more note..we have also stayed at NY/NY, Bellagio and Binions before the GN and if you check our trips it is a VERY rare occasion when I have something negative to say. This took the cake.

Reviews.Title: “First Experience Downtown, Loved The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Rocketman35
Reviews.Content: Feb. 5 - Feb.7, 2009 Check in was a breeze, we were a little early and our room wasnt hardly ready yet but they held our bags for us, gave us a coupon book and told us come back in an hour. We walked around the casino, checked out the pool & sharktank area and then back to the front desk, they handed us our room keys and we were off. The room was great, we had a North Tower room, everything was perfect as if we were the first to stay in this room. The Golden Nugget is right in the middle of the Fremont St. Experience, so the location was perfect as we planed on walking to see everything in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VPKingQueen
Reviews.Content: Went on trip with husband and friend of husband's. Our friend did not specify North Tower, and got it. We did specify North Tower, but got South Tower. We checked in at the exact same time, and still the Front Desk insisted that's all that had. Okay... For being GN, the room was below average (remember, it's South Tower). Bathroom had one sink, TV was not even a flat screen. Even the 4Q has flat screen TVs in their rooms! I'm sure our friend's room was nicer. It must have been... Slots were tight, but did have luck at video poker. Moved on quickly after a win. Atmosphere was fun - it was football playoffs. Overall, nicest hotel DT, but if you can get upgrades at neighboring hotels, the rooms are probably close to the same for less $, possibly nicer. Comps at GN have really gone down by comparison to other DT casinos. Best advice: Follow the offers.

Reviews.Title: “We got this one right”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandPam
Reviews.Content: Having been to LV before but not been to Freemont we wanted 2 nights there to soak up the atmoshere, Good decision, its a great expereince - for 2 nights. Super ambiance on traffic ffree Freemont Street especially at the weekends. 5 blocks of overhead digital video and a terrific sound system Booked direct with the hotel for Jan 16/18 and got a Gold Club room at a decent price which included priority check in - so check in no problem. Good room, quality furnished but nothing really spectacular. Pool area is spacious but overlooked by so many hotel blocks that the sunshine is limited. You can slide down a tube within the shark tank but its hard to see anything on your way down and the sharks are nonplussed. Carson Street cafe is great for quality food and reasonable value. The buffet at 4 queens is excellent, as is the dinner at the Freemont So... yes 2 nights on freemont street is great. Then back to tthe strip

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tripper36
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Gold Club Room during the NFL Conference Championship game weekend. Room was great, staff friendly, food was very good as usual. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Still Shining!!! Great for The Money”
Reviews.Author: TopazDreams
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a $69 per night room which had been newly remodeled. Huge room and lovely furnishings. Comfy bed and lovely bathroom. A feeling of old Hollywood meets Vegas is here..Classic. The service was excellent from the bellmen to check in, to maid service to the awesome room service attendant I had. Breakfast at the "Nugget" is still very reasonably priced - something hard to find in vegas. They do add that typical room service charge onto the tab, but even with that, a full breakfast of eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee only cost me around $15-20. Excellent bfast! Room had thick, plush carpeting and bedding - nice shampoos and toiletries in bathroom replaced daily by maids. Great view from room. Outside of hotel is gorgeous at night! Inside is lovely as well. Downsides: This hotel is NOT on the Vegas strip - no where near it! If you want to see anything on the strip, you will need to rent a car or have lots of cash stashed for taxi fare back and forth to the strip. Lucky for me, I had a local friend who was driving me around wherever I wanted to go. Cabs are not cheap here and they wiill try to find the scenic route whenever possible.. The spa at the hotel was extremely overpriced and not at all enjoyable. I paid $$$ to have a manicure/pedicure and the woman slaughtered my poor feet. She took too much skin off my feet and I had a hard time walking for almost a week after she got done with me. So not only is it overpriced, they don't know what they are doing in there. Also, for what you pay, they didn't even have the decent pedicure chairs with attached foot bath...My feet were soaking in a bucket!! Do NOT pay the big bucks for a pedicure here. The slots here seemed quite tight. I saw no one winning anything. I did see quite a number of unsavory looking characters lurking around (only in the casino part downstairs) and felt there should have been better security there. Mediocre: All the food eaten at all the restaurants at the hotel - with the exception of the room service bfasts - of course! :-) Overall: Very much worth the money, would stay here again and do what i did last time - stay here for the nice room, but go elsewhere for better gambling and to avoid the unsavory looking characters in the Nugget's casino.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club Room”
Reviews.Author: satx
Reviews.Content: Background - married couple in their mid to late 50's and retired. We booked our airfare and hotel on a New Years Eve Special and got 50% off both airfare (Southwest Airlines) and our hotel room for 3 nights here at Golden Nugget. Because the fares were so reasonable we opted for a Gold Club Room (Concierge Class). We arrived at the hotel about 2:30pm and went to VIP check in and it took approximately 5 minutes (in the meantime my husband got himself a juice and a bag of pretzels to tide him over until dinner - this is included with the cost of a suite or Gold Club Room). Our room was on the 16th floor near the elevators (as requested at reservation time). I was surprised at the size of the room (large) but I also noticed that our room did not have the L shaped leather sofa and instead included a leather lounger along with a fabric recliner. I would like to add that even if the room had the L shaped sofa it would have still been considered large. The mattress was nice albeit on the firm side, bedding was nice. The room is very dark and it's necessary to have the blind open. Our room faced the Freemont Experience and the Nevada Mountains. The bathroom has a nice amount of counter space but otherwise it's dysfunctional in design. The flat screen tv was okay but the speakers are inadequate for a room this size without turning up the speakers to an unreasonable level (due to neighbors on either side). Included with this room is wifi, coffee in the mornings, bottled water in the afternoons and evenings, along with snacks. I agree with previous reviews concerning the fact that the snacks (choc covered raisins, jelly bellys, peanut m&ms, and trailmix) are open to hands that could have been anywhere (yuck). What we didn't like at all is housekeeping, it's poor at best. We were out of our room before 7:30am each morning and it was after 2pm most days before the room was ready for us again - not satisfactory at all. The air conditioning units are old and are noisy but we are people that like ambient sounds while we sleep anyway. We were able to hear the Freemont Experience from our room and it was somewhat annoying and then on our second morning we heard saws of some kind beginning around 6am - it was background noise but annoying nonetheless. We ate at Carson Street Cafe (good but not what it was even 2 years ago), The Grille (inside the casino area and a very good value with excellent food), and The Grotto (Italian - good). We also ate away from the Golden Nugget. We love the accessibility of downtown (moving from casino to casino without major walking) and we have always felt the Golden Nugget gave us a good experience for the monies spent.

Reviews.Title: “Is complimentary coffee not the minimal standard these days?!:)”
Reviews.Author: blue_hyacinths
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at GN for New Year's Eve. I appreciated the quick and early check in. I arrived and received the room around noon, even though the usual check in time is 3pm. During my stay the service was great from security, to receptionist, room service, and housekeeping etc. The room was very clean, with comfortable pillow top king bed, dark curtains, tv, large nice bathroom, with spa robes, hair dryer, toiletries, iron and ironing board, safe. The heated pool with water slide and fishtank is a nice feature. Still, I cannot give a better rating than average/neutral. For $100 dolars average rate/night I do expect decent treatment, decent conditions as listed above, and more!!! There isnt a coffee maker in the room, excuse me!? Subjective I know, but it's just terrible to not enjoy a slow start with a cup of coffee in bed! The choices are: to pay about 5.50 (small pot of coffee) + 5 (operation fee to all room service orders) + tax + gratuity = which comes to about what? 15 bucks coffee? or to face the world with your morning face, take the elevator to the starbucks "conveniently located" :D right outside the elevators, and get back in bed? Ridiculous! On the down side also, the rooms have outdated looking ac units, settings not very clear, difficult to adjust the room temperature in the winter; first night I woke up frozen, second night was okay but the unit started to make a loud noise that woke me up so I stopped it, third night just folded the blankets in two - that was a good nite, fourth night forgot the heater on -that never stopped and I ended up sick because of the overdry and heated air. Those with allergies/sinuses problems Beware! I ate once at the cafe-(dont remember the name Carson?), food was good. Room service was also good - the prices too - 6 dollars a mimosa:) The pastries at starbucks in the hotel were very fresh and delicious, especially the fruit tart, also cheesecake and danishes. I liked the New Years atmosphere on Fremont outside the hotel. I cannot comment on any other features of the hotel, as I only used it to sleep/rest, then went out sightseeing strip, hoover dam, etc. It's 8.50 + tips the shuttle to and from the airport, which I find convenient. It's about 5 dollars the bus to the strip from what I heard but havent used it. It' s 23 dollars the taxi from the strip -(Luxor area)back to the hotel. Note that it's almost impossible to find a taxi on a holiday night like New Year's Eve, we waited over 15 minutes for one -out of many passing by -to stop and then they ask "how much are u willing to pay!?" It's up to anyone's negociations skills and no less than double:) In conclusion, I would stay at GN again, but I will bring with me a coffee maker and a humidifier..of course, after I check out its competion on the strip first:)

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyingred
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights at the GN coinciding with CES. The hotel is expensively finished (marble floors in the public areas) and the room was pleasant and comfortable. Parking in the adjacent garage was free to residents and there were always free spaces. Because I was here on a working trip, I was getting to breakfast before seven. The staff was inflexible, not seating us in an empty cafe until additional servers started at 7 am. On several occasions service was very slow in the cafe. My room was nicely appointed and in good order. All the plumbing worked as expected and the supply of toiletries was good. The Starbucks on the south side opens at 5 am and the one in the casino is open 24/7, but that doesn't make up for the absence of a coffee maker in the room. The other downside was that guests tended to smoke around the lobby area and in the lifts, but that's a Vegas problem rather than specific to the GN.

Reviews.Title: “Rent a Car!”
Reviews.Author: JamesInBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently returned from the 2009 CES show (her company was presenting). The first night we stayed at Harrahs, which was more updated/modern hotel. And of course it's right in the middle of the action. The Golden Nugget was not updated, but I didn't mind--it had that old swanky charm to it. And it's in Downtown, I think not at all in walking distance. The Golden Nugget's main area's were updated and fancy enough, I loved the idea of the pool and the shark tank with the fish and sharks swimming by. You can see it from the lobby. Their buffet was closed, so we used the two-for-one coupon given at checkin for a main entree instead at the cafe. It was ok, just not as good a deal had it been the buffet. We're from Boston, and in my reading on Vegas nobody mentioned that there is PLENTY of FREE parking. Seriously. At least when we went. Every hotel has a self-park lot, which we were plenty happy with--let alone the valet service which we didn't even try. Some people complained about the Strip being a "parking lot", but we didn't find it that bad at all (again, Boston). The reason I mention this is that the Golden Nugget is a long 3+ mi to the top of the Strip, which itself is 4 miles long. I wholeheartedly recommend getting a car to explore Vegas: save your energy for walking inside the huge resorts, rather than between them. The resorts themselves are so full of detail, you can easily get mentally and physically tuckered out. Perhaps at most you can do two a day (if looking at the architecture/sites is your thing). We had no problem getting from the middle of the Strip to Downtown where the Golden Nugget is by car. We had to return the car early, so a taxi from MGM Grand to GN was $25. Rent the car. We stayed here because at the time it had the lowest rate for the supposedly higher quality (hotwire "4 star" for $75 a night, during CES). I disagree with the stars (lower). But obviously if you can get a cheap room on the strip, do it. Otherwise, stay downtown if it's cheaper and rent a car, it's really not a problem at all, I found the size of Vegas to actually be more car friendly than walk friendly.

Reviews.Title: “GN still the best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: twototravel
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nites at the Nugget to bring in the new year. We have been staying at the Nugget at least once a year for the past 7 years and we are always pleased with our stay. We had one experience on the strip and much prefer the downtown area for our "home" base. We always rent a car; this is very reasonable in Vegas. This trip we rented a car from Advantage for 8 days for a total of $117. We make 4 to 5 trips to different casinos on the strip and enjoy some of the restaurants in the area (love Peppermill and Rosemarys). This trip we were in an upgraded South Tower Room (preferred since this area is close to the Self Parking garage) which featured flat screen TV, new art work on the walls, new mattress, new shower head and heating/air conditioning unit. As usual everything was clean. Our only three disappointment were (1) the lacking of any bath mats or small rugs for the bathroom tub area (twice I asked one of the cleaning ladies and both times was told "don't have any"), (2) sheets that don't stay tucked in...every morning the bed was a mess and we aren't "toss and tuner" sleepers, and (3) the towels - they need to be replaced! They are rough and some smelled sour - yuck. We do very little gambling at the Nugget since the other downtown hotels have looser slots and $3/5 blackjack which my husband plays. On January first the buffet was closed for renovations (no one could tell me for how long) AND Lillie's was also closed (tho no explanation was noted and again no one could tell me why). We will keep returning to the Nugget because it is such a great value and we are very comfortable there.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never be scared of the South Tower again”
Reviews.Author: claud_hopper
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal at Hotwire that only had a South Tower option. I've never stayed in the South Tower only the North Tower. I was pleasantly surprised. Everyone always says the walk from the South Tower to the casino is so far but it's not. What else am I doing but sitting and gambling, so what's a few minutes of walking. The room is basic and not huge but it's clean and the bed is comfortable... what more could I ask for for around $50/night. The best part of my stay was what I like to call "spa day" My wonderful husband offered to treat me to a massage so I booked myself the "pamper package" which includes a 50 minute massage along with a mani/pedi. And you can use the spa facilities. So first I worked out in the gym then I took a dip in the hot tub. Then I got an amazing massage followed by a really great mani/pedi... Well worth the $199 for everything. They also throw in fruit, juices, water, trail mix to snack on... just so relaxing and wonderful. My only complaint with the hotel is that they wanted to charge me a "half day rate" of $25 just to check out at 1pm instead of noon... That's ridiculous. The hotel lost out because instead of having our breakfast there we checked out went someplace else. It wasn't the $25 so much as the nickel and diming... I mean I already lost almost $1k in gambling so why should I have to pay them $25 for an extra hour in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TXVegaslover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Golden Nugget. This was our 4th visit to the Nugget so we've witnessed the evolution of this property since it was purchased by Landry's. The improvements include a nicer, more comfortable casino with generally good drink service. The pool is awesome and the atmosphere in the common areas is much classier. However, service has suffered since the Nugget was owned by MGM. I remember during our 1st stay we were treated like royalty by everyone from the front desk clerks to the parking garage attendants. Our room was perfectly maintained by the housekeeping staff. The service has lost that personal touch. No one was rude - just not as friendly as in the past. We stayed in the south tower at an average rate of $54.00 a night. Don't get me wrong - for that price the room was good. It was just lacking a couple of simple things that could easily make it high class again. For instance, one night we had no wash cloths. Some of the towels were frayed around the edges. The sheets were too small for the bed to remain tucked in and the carpet in the halls was stained and worn. On the plus side, the beds have been upgraded to pillow top mattresses. The room had a flat screen TV with an impressive selection of channels for a casino hotel. The room was quiet although we did have a hard time regulating the temperature.
