It was cold outside but we still had to run the AC to be comfortable. The fan motor was pretty noisy and should probably be replaced. The next visit we'll probably upgrade to a North Tower room if it's not too much more expensive. We ate at the buffet on Christmas Day. It was nothing impressive - especially for $20.00 a person. The buffet at Main Street Station is much better and costs less. We also had breakfast at Carson Street Cafe and were pleased with the quality and the price. All in all, we had a good trip. The weather was unusually cold. Next time we'll visit in the summer so we can enjoy the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Truely an welcomed experience”
Reviews.Author: SoonerNDN
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the 'Queen' of downtown. The accomodations were excellent. Of course she's older but well maintained. The 3rd tower construction was not intrusive to the stay. It's been awhile since I've been to Vegas and done the strip thing. The strip is grand of course but downtown is far the best for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite property in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: CasinoResortLover
Reviews.Content: I’m a Las Vegas local but I love to stay at hotels here in town when I see a good deal or have a birthday/anniversary. From the first time I visited the Golden Nugget I fell in love-the pool is amazing, the property maintains a touch of “old” but mostly new and updated, and a great location (I love Fremont). The property in my book gets an 11 out of 10 – the rooms are really nice at affordable rates (please tell me where you can find a 4 diamond resort in this country for $59 a night other then Las Vegas!?!), the amenities are amazing, and the Food & Beverage outlets are impressive (although I would expect so much with the hotel now being run by a Food & Beverage company). On this specific trip I stayed 2 nights for my birthday to pretty much drink at the pool during the day and relax in a nice comfy bed. We ate at the buffet for breakfast (2 for 1-$10) for a great breakfast buffet; we had room service-decent, and ate dinner one night at Grotto (very good we had a FEAST for $100 including a few drinks). My only complaint with the property was some of the customer service I received. I presently work for a strip property in customer service and have reasonable expectations (I understand things that might upset your typical guests and I try not to ask for too much BUT at the same time it takes an extra step to WOW me). The front desk clerk at check in wasn’t friendly and seemed to be just “doing his job” as we say – he didn’t explain anything to me I had to ask questions to get anything out of him. I had issues with the authorization on my card (they over authorized on incidentals) and when I called the front desk to ask why, I stated the clerk who checked me in told me it would only be $100 a night and I’m being hit $130 a night – they replied “the system sometimes does that”. I was using a debit that a family member had pre-paid for my trip for me as a gift with the exact amount for room & tax + $100 incidentals on it. An authorization on a debit card is as good as a cash withdrawal in most circumstances – and asked the hotel manager that if my account over withdrew due to this lack of information given to me were they going to cover my over withdrawal fees passed on to my family member-they said no and were very rude about the situation. I clearly signed off on $100 incidentals a night on my registration card, so if I wanted to take legal action I could. Luckily no over withdrawal fees were passed and all was fine & dandy with me-but it was the manner both front desk reps and managers handled the situation that left a sour taste in my mouth. On a positive note every dealer, server, and food & beverage representative was great – I would highly suggest a retraining of the front desk staff on 4 Diamond Standards. The incident with the front desk will not keep me away from the G-Nug, I love it way too much, but some less understanding guests may not return if they were to encounter a similar incident.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryCR
Reviews.Content: 've been staying in the Golden Nugget for 30 years, however for this visit, I found out that they can put you in a double room even if your reservation is for a king AND that there is no valet parking OR self parking! It is all full. I am miserable here. Price is no object. Please tell me the best place to stay! I have to get out of here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Lapp0025
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we just loved it. The Nugget is located on Fremont Street in downtown and has the perfect location. If your with a party that doesn't want to do miles and miles of walking this is the spot to be. Walk right outside the hotel and you can walk 10 steps to another casino! Plus, Fremont street is their backyard which has light shows and all kinds of activites and crazy stunts going on 24/7! Plus it's all free! We didn't win any money at the Nugget, but I can understand that with the great renovation they just did--they need the money! But it's great! Go there and see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: iluvpizza
Reviews.Content: I went by myself to recover from a surgery. Truth be told, I don't gamble in casinos. I stayed in the South Tower, on the 22nd Floor - the top floor. I paid $20 extra for VIP check-in/check-out. You go into a special lounge to check in/out, and avoid the unwashed (just kidding). Also, you are more likely to get the room that you request. It is worth it to me. The rooms on the 22nd floor are all recently remodeled, and virtually identical to the rooms in the more expensive North Tower. So if you stay at the Nugget, try to get on the 22nd Floor. My room was fine. I think I paid $60.00 per night, and stayed about 10 days/nights. I was happy with my stay, and plan to return. Their buffet is out of this world - delicious! I hear it is rated one of the top in Vegas. I only have one criticism. The 22nd Floor is supposed to be a non-smoking floor. They will fine you for smoking in the room. This is great, but what about fining people for smoking in the common areas of the floor too?? While I was there, these jerk partiers couldn't smoke in their rooms, so they go out into the hall to do it, and some of the smoke comes in my room. But I can understand how something like that would be pretty hard to control. Anyhoo, I recommend the Golden Nugget !

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Downtown”
Reviews.Author: QueenV44
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vegas many times, The Golden Nugget was absolutely amazing!!! Our new fav., service was great, food was great! Check in was to the point I did however did get upgraded due to my b-day, to the newly remodeled South Tower room on the 17th floor which included an pillow top king sized bed-slept oh so great!, flat screen tv...the bed was to die for, and complimentary robes!!!! The room was very clean, bathroom even more clean.:) Very easy to get to room, time share respected wishes not to be bothered, and remembered faces. VIC AND ANTHONYS was to die for...GREAT steak, friendly service, GREAT wine lists and a little tip portions are large enough for two. Room service is reasonable, prompt, and very good-I think it comes from the Carson St. Cafe which is also very good; and with the coupon book you can save 2 dollars an person to eat there. My husband and I looked at other casinos downtown and by far The G.N. is the best choice!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not to mention the night life is also great the Gold Diggers Club within the casino offers an great night life experience, with NO cover charge and a great view of the Fremont experience. Taxi is an preferred choice to traveling to the strip the ranging from 20-to30 dollars. Or you can save money by traveling on the Deuce"the bus"for about 5 dollars on an all day pass be advised, a lot more rough people. All in all the G.N. is an great choice-less crowds, less hassle and everything in extreme close range!!!!!!!!!!!!:)

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: cushie57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the North Tower of the Golden Nugget. The king sized mattress was the Most comfortable I've ever slept on, the down bedding heavenly...The flat screen tv was surprisingly huge, was a great room! Our son was getting married so we had booked him a suite; it wasn't ready so GN upgraded them to a fabulous two-story spa suite, complete with spiral staircase, marble, full bar, beday (which our cowboy friends got a kick out of!) We've stayed at the Grand in Steamboat and many other fine hotels but have never seen anything like this suite.. The casino was full of friendly dealers, we think way more friendly than those on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: arwrtawel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the beds comfy, the bathrooms were also good. We had 2 rooms, one a disabilty room. The check in time was just ok after a long journey. The room was dissapointing in as much as you could not make yourself a hot drink in the morning. Sure there was a Starbucks, but not everyone wants to get dressed to make a drink and not everyone drinks coffee! Disability access is via the valets area, but I beleive this is being worked on for inclusion in the new entrance. We were on the 16th and 18th floor, my parents had some building noise as the hotel is being increased in size. The valets were excellent I have to say, very happy to help with directions and parking was free. Incidently, parking is free for all main hotels on the strip, you just need to tip the valet guys/girls a great help if you have someone with you who has physical/mobility issues. The rooms were relatively free from other patrons noise and no smoke came into the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Strip type hotel in the heart of glitter gulch”
Reviews.Author: DavidB67
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in early, to the day we caught the shuttle to the airport, everything here was topnotch, and miles above the other downtown joints. The pool was particularly great due to the fact that you could get hot sun, shade, or a third diffused reflected sun from the north tower which was juuuust right. they have tons of beach chairs, blackjack and a three story waterslide that glides you through the massive central shark tank. Also where the private cabanas are on the terrace you can find some adult only sunning complete with waitress service. Incidentally, they sell aluminum bottled beer for 5.75 a crack, so depending on your budget, you may want to pick up a four-pack at Walgreens for 9 bucks and smuggle it in.... like I did. You have to show your room key to get in, so no unwashed masses here. Lots of pre-flight fully dressed sleepers though, and the odd obnoxious smoker. The casino is huge and rambling with odd lounges here and there, two Starbucks, and a very good coffeshop bistro neer the pool entrance. The buffet was crazy busy lined up always, so we took in Fitz's cheap mello buffet. You can always find a 2 deck blackjack table with 5 minimums, slot machines as far as the eye can see. Room in the north tower was average sized, flat screen plasma tv, marble bath with decent pressure. Beds were comfy; ironing board, safe and robes in the closet. No crazy drunks in the halls, the place was polite and pleasant all around. We left for the strip one evening.... Chaos!! Downtown has all you need within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: happynftworth
Reviews.Content: My family and I and a few close friends just got back from Vegas over the Thanksgiving holiday. I am happy and pleased to say that my family and I were thrilled that we chose the Golden Nugget. Everything was just perfect from the time we arrived on Thursday, to the time we left on Monday. We absolutely have no complaints. We stayed in the North Tower and the rooms were nice. My friends who accompanied us chose to stay at the Venetian. Of course our room wasn't as luxurious, but guess where they kept wanting to go.... our hotel/downtown. While the strip is nice, downtown is sooo much more relaxed and not so stuffy. We ended up downtown every night until 3 in the morning. All the dealers we played with at the Nugget were very friendly. I learned to play blackjack this time and all the dealers were more than willing to help me learn and advise me how to play my hand. We did eat at the buffet one afternoon for lunch. As you check in, they give you a book of coupons that are valid at the hotel. One of the coupons is a buy one get one free buffet. The food wasn't bad. We both ate for 11.00 so I can't expect 5 star food. I will recommend the buffet at Rio. It has a wide variety of food. And the quality is good, however it is 25.00 a person. As everyone mentions, the pool area at the hotel is very nice. The pool is heated so there are a few people who swim during the day. They have a few blackjack tables out at the pool, so we hung out there one night. It was really nice because you could hear the sound of the water, they had heat lamps to keep you warm and you got to breathe a little fresh air. All in all, we enjoyed the Golden Nugget. This was our 3rd visit to Vegas and have always stayed on the strip. I can say from now on, we will definitely be staying at the Golden Nugget. Its a nice hotel for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: redwham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our wedding anniversary, 16th Nov 2008, had a great time, both thought the hotel was excellent, we stayed in the nth tower as we had previously read reviews that stated it was a long walk via the casino from the sth tower.The room was big and have paid much more in England for smaller. When we got their was very surprised that this wasn't the long walk we were expecting. As we booked direct with the hotel, would recommend that you register online with them, as nearer the time of going, they offered a better deal which they honoured. Must say though they did say that we would get a voucher book worth xxxx$, we did get this but the vouchers for the hotel buffet was only valid for week days (we were their over the weekend). We went for breakfast at Main st stn, which was better value for money. But the hotel itself, found no fault, clean, rooms cleaned daily. Overall had a great time, although very tiring.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Downtown Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr1108
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe how wonderful this hotel was. And the value for our money! The Golden Nugget is and always has been the class of downtown. Considering the other properties you have to choose from it's a no brainer. Staff friendly, our room was spotless, the pool is amazing. We witnessed a guest checking in next to us giving the front desk clerk a hard time because his room preference was not available. What a jerk! Every hotel we've ever stayed in we know that your preferences are just that, not a guarnatee. The clerk was polite and professional even though the guest was not. He must have just lost some money in the casino and decided to use some displaced agression. Grow up dude!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Golden”
Reviews.Author: erdocdrummer
Reviews.Content: I booked a special "VIP" room at the Golden Nugget expecting something exceptional as this hotel is rated 4 stars. I was disappointed from the moment we got there. I stood in a long check-in line with only two staff members working behind the desk. After a long wait I discovered that I could have used their special VIP check-in area. They did not make this clear when I made my reservation. Access to our floor required that our key be put into a slot in the elevator. This made us feel special but the room did not live up to expectations. It was dark and had only one small window. The bathroom was small and the door opened so that it blocked the shower. The decor was above average for a hotel and the room had a big screen TV and a special bed which was very comfortable. For the extra price you got free bottled water, apples, and 4 bowls of candy in the hall by the elevators. We also got to use the spa for free which would otherwise have cost 20 dollars a day. The Golden Nugget is by far the nicest hotel downtown, but it does not come close to the nicer strip hotels many of which are also rated 4 stars. If you want to stay downtown, I would definitely recommend the Golden Nugget over any of the other hotels, but don't expect 4 star service or accomidations. I am not sure the VIP rooms are worth the extra price. The pool is not nearly as nice as it looks on the web site. It is relatively small and did not get much sun because it is surrounded on all sides by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Strip chaos, nice for most, not for kids.”
Reviews.Author: zoomer-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with our family (2 ad, 2 kids under 11) and were impressed with the Vegas style features we saw. The Shark Pool was our main reason to stay there as we figured that there is nothing like this anywhere in the world! we were proven right with this choice as the Pool was excellent and the waterslide goes through the shark pool - what an experience. The usual gaming traps are at the hotel but the entertainment within the Fremont Experience at night is something else - really awesome. The location of the hotel is great for people who don't want to be near the strip. The prices are reasonable and the service is the usual high standard expected in Vegas. Drink prices are reasonable and the gaming floors have the standard variety. The Starbucks on the ground level proved useful after a big night out and the parking is exceptional in the building next door. Although not really for kids, they enjoyed it. What really sucked though (and this is all over Vegas) is the smoking - everywhere! Not a healthy environment for anyone really. No opinion on the food as we always went elsewhere. Pros Location Shark Pool Price on the Friday / Sat night Cons Smoking

Reviews.Title: “Nugget is Nice...”
Reviews.Author: aliciact
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that this was my first time in Vegas, so I have nothing to compare the experience to. My employer paid for my flight and one night at the Golden Nugget as an incentive for winning a sales campaign. There were about 30 of us total that met there from around the West Coast. We arrived around 11:30 am and the check in line wasn’t too horribly long. However, when I finally arrived at the front desk, there appeared to be no reservation for my coworker and I. The Golden Nugget staff could not find my name or my coworker’s anywhere in the reservation database. I wasn’t too thrilled about this, as my employer said they had taken care of everything. Fortunately, there were extra rooms in the hotel, but we did have to charge it to our personal credit card until our district manager arrived later that day to work things out with the hotel. (I also noted that there was another couple next to us that was having difficulty checking in. They had a confirmation number, but apparently they weren’t in the system either. Hhhmm….) That aside, the Golden Nugget was quite nice. We were in the North Tower rooms. They were somewhat luxurious, but not spectacular. The view was of the parking lot. Oh well. My company did rent a Spa Suite to hold our awards ceremony. The Spa suite was amazing! It was two stories, had a great view, bar area, and just had a luxurious feel. I’m not sure how much they paid for that one. : ) The casino was quite nice and the dealers were pretty friendly. They talked and joked around with us, which was fun. One of them even remembered me when I came back later, even though I wasn’t a high roller or winner. The only place we ate there was the Carson Street Café. I wasn’t that impressed with the food, but they had $3 mimosas! The pool was absolutely amazing!!! I wanted to spend time there, but my coworkers wanted to see the Strip, and I didn’t want to hang out by myself, so the Strip it was! It became kind of expensive to take a taxi back and forth though. While, the Golden Nugget was nice, it doesn’t quite compare to the larger hotels like Caesar’s Palace, Bellagio, Treasure Island, etc. We walked through a few of them just to see what it was like, and I was quite impressed. If I return to Vegas (which I am still not sure that I will because I’m not a big gambler), I might consider a hotel on the Strip. I don’t know what the price difference is between the larger hotels and the Golden Nugget, but it might be worth it to be more centralized. Overall I enjoyed my stay. If you’re looking for something in the downtown Fremont area, then I would definitely recommend the Golden Nugget. But if you like the Strip, then I would say, stay on the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: The room we got was definitely not four stars. We saw pictures of some of their upgraded suites and they looked like they were 5 star quality. Our room looked very old but clean. It was also a large room. We stayed in the south tower and I think their lower quality rooms are on this side. The hotel has an awesome pool and that by itself would be an attraction. You can swim next to a tank with sharks. The hotel has a very good location right in the middle of the Fremont Street area. I would come back here if I was staying on Fremont street otherwise I would prefer one of the 4 or 5 star properties on the strip over the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “A Golden Stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Bnude
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to GN this year. We took the parents for their 40th wedding anniversary and we couldn't be happier with how things turned out. Upon arrival (10:00 am) we were greeted at the door by the bell persons. Figuring that we would have to wait for our rooms, we checked our luggage and proceeded to the check-in desk. What a delight to find that 1 of our rooms was ready to go. Our bags were taken to our room and within 15 minutes, we were out having fun. On the second day of our stay, the parents had some plumbing problems with their room. They were immediately upgraded to a suite and all their bags were moved for them. Great job GN! There was a problem with a room safe. One call to maintenance, and within 5 minutes, the problem was fixed. Our rooms were clean and bright. We were in the North tower, so we were only a short distance from the casino floor. With each of the minor things that happened, the GN staff responded with speed and congeniality. From the desk staff, to the casino host, the dealers in the casino to the bellpersons. Everyone we met was polite and went out of their way to help us. We ate at all of the restaurants at the GN. Each one was unique, and all were excellent! Comps were good. Final bill for our 3 night stay: $63.00 These were the tips from the meals we ate. Good job Golden Nugget. We will be back in April 2009!!!

Reviews.Title: “the only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: worshiguchi
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Nugget for 17 years (yes, I confess, we may have a gambling problem) and have watched it transform itself through several iterations. It was always a bargain, large rooms, clean, quiet, and good service. It has become a first class hotel, south tower rooms are always a steal, as low as 49 dollars in the winter. Although they do involve a walk to the casino proper and running the time share gauntlet (never make eye contact, never acknowledge their greeting, keep moving there is a Starbucks on the other side of the property), and check in can be a 30 minute wait (always send someone in your party to check and see if they south tower desk is open). The Gold Rooms expedite check in, the walk to the casino, and save you the time share panhandlers. Downtown is not for everyone, but this is the place to stay if you are staying downtown. Between Benions and the Nugget's poker rooms you will always find a game, Mama Cita's has great Mexican/Cuban (down by the El Cortez, never make the trek after sundown), and it is a bit lower key (but not too low, this is vegas).

Reviews.Title: “Super Spooky Halloween Experience (and not in a good way)”
Reviews.Author: sarathena
Reviews.Content: You know, I should expect issues any time I book and prepay through Expedia. I always have trouble in one way or another, and my recent visit to the Golden Nugget was no exception. I had planned the trip as a romantic getaway for my husband and myself, and requested a king bed in the newly-renovated North Tower. When we checked in (a process that took a long time, but it takes a long time everywhere in Las Vegas, honestly), we were told, of course, that we were in a room with two double beds. Not exactly the weekend I had imagined, as I'm not a Puritan. When I asked about a king bed, I was told that not a single king room was available in the entire hotel. I silently stared at the clerk for a while, and eventually she caved and "consulted a manager" who "found" a king room in the North Tower. Our room was a) behind the elevators, b) next to the ice machine, and c) directly across from the housekeeping phone. So it was quite possibly the worst room in the entire hotel, if not Las Vegas, which is what I get for being tough and demanding my way. Also, our view? A dirty wall. But we commenced with the power drinking, and eventually I forgot about how much the room location annoyed me. They do have awesome club sandwiches and divine breakfasts, so recovering the next day was rather nice in our noisy cave. Net net, it's expensive-ish for what you get, Fremont is nothing compared to the Strip (even on Halloween), and king beds are apparently as rare as big wins on their slot machines.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget Rocks”
Reviews.Author: westozman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GN end of Sept and had a great time. Check in was quick and the girl that checked us in was very helpful and polite. We got a room in the south tower on 11th floor and found it to be very well appointed and clean and tidy. As to the people on this forum wanting flat screen TVs, I say, Hello, your in Vegas, who stays in their rooms and watches TV!!!!!!. The pool was great and we ate most of our meals at the buffet which we thought was outstanding value and the service there was sensational. We had no problems with noise from the constuction site across the road or within the hotel itself. Overall we would def stay at the GN again. The Fremont street area is good. Although catching the duece bus up to the strip can become a bit frustrating ,I think we would put up with that and trade off the lower prices and nicer area of fremont street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garyorient
Reviews.Content: The rates on this hotel were excellent, and in truth you can't knock it. Room spacious, lifts quick, staff friendly and efficient, tables pretty good, slots varied with plenty of low cost machines. Buffet - I've had better but perfectly acceptable Time share people - Obtrusive and a pain in the butt. Apparently they rent space at the hotel, but they do the hotel a complete diservice and are that much of a pain that I would think carefully about re-booking. One small warning. To get to central strip is $20 each way in a taxi. There is a bus that runs theoretically to te Strip from Downtown. Do not waste your time with it. Cheap it may well be, but we joined a queue waiting that was already 15 minutes old, and after a further 20 minutes the bus had still not arrived. Added to that, the journey time, and for my part I would rather spend the money than waste the time. As ever I loved my stay in Vegas. Really enjoyed the Nugget and would definately recommend the hotel, subject to the criteria above.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: Lissete
Reviews.Content: This was our first downtown stay/visit. we arrived at the hotel at around 6PM. Check-in was quick but very impersonal. The girl checking us in barely looked at us and did not give clear directions to our room. Check-out on the TV was not working so I called to see if we could check out by phoneso we would not have to trek to the lobby then back to the parking garage. The guy that checked us out was friendly, upbeat and very helpful. A stark contrast to our check-in experience. The hotel itself was very clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and the room was nicely appointed. Our room was a non-smoking room but the bedspread had a huge cigarrette burn hole on it. I understand that this is a casino hotel and the vast majority of folks smoke. BUT, we had to wait several times for different elevators because people were smoking in there. If not common courtesy, at least observe some fire safety. Our room was in the South Tower and the most annoying part of our stay was the timeshare people every single time we would get off the elevator. We ate at the buffet once for breakfast and it was quite good with a nice variety of options.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget was ok”
Reviews.Author: tatterdema
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Golden Nugget. While I have to agree with most of the reviews, as far as it being the nicest hotel downtown, I really dont think I would stay there again. I was with my elderly mother (in a wheelchair) and we stayed in the South tower. Check in took about 25 minutes at 3pm, and I asked specifically to be as close to the elevator as possible. On their online reservation form, there is also a place to put this request. While I know it was only a request, I was completely surprised to be almost as far away from the elevators as possible. We got off the elevator, went down a long hall, turned a corner, went down another long hall, and were at the end. I would have returned and asked for another room, but did not want to waste an hour trudging back down, waiting in line, etc. Other than that, every thing was fresh, clean and well maintained. The pool is a really nice amenity, although it does not get much sun during the day. I think next time I will pay less, and stay at one of the other hotels downtown, where the walk to the room does not take 20 minutes, even if they are not quite as up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SharonKai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the South Wing of the Golden Nugget for 5 nights in September, 2008. Our room was very nice and very clean with beautiful, large, soft towels. The view wasn't great - the carpark where we parked our car!! We opted for the VIP Check-in ($US22) which ensured us of a non-smoking room and our choice of bed. We rang from Barstow in the morning to find out what time check-in was and they told us they were already checking people in - not the usual 2 or 3pm like most other hotels. We were glad that we'd done this as when we arrived check in was very busy. We just went to the VIP Check-in and did so straight away. The elevators were great - one for the ground floor to the 9th floor, and the other for 10th floor up. The If you stay in the South Wing it is a little bit away from check-in BUT very close to the free parking lot, which we found very convenient as we used our car every day. Being in Freemont Street it is great at night when you can see the action outside. The pool was wonderful, especially seeing all the fish, including sharks in the tank. If you are going to park your car in the free park it is located on the corner of Eat 1st Street & East Bridger Street. We never had a problem finding a park there. Breakfast is not included but there are plenty of eateries in and around the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Smittie76
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Nugget for 4 nights and loved every minute of it! The Tank pool/spa was excellent - really cool being able to swim so close to the fish/shark tank! We ate at Carson Street Cafe and The Grotto (Italian) - both very good. Also would recommend Golddiggers Club - really enjoyed it and the views over Fremont Street brilliant - especially when the light show is on! We stayed on The Strip after the nugget for further 10 nights - probably not enough to do in downtown alone for a long trip but if looking for cheaper accommodation then this would be a perfect stay with easy access to The Strip via the Deuce bus (regular service to and from - various stops all the way along) for $2 one way or $5 all day. Rooms clean and comfortable and a good size. Friendly staff. Perfect stay! Stewart & Catherine, Scotland UK

Reviews.Title: “Best in Fremont and what a pool?!!”
Reviews.Author: Vickyjo
Reviews.Content: If like me you love the Freemont area but still want a top notch hotel then the Nugget is for you. I like Freemont for the fact that it feels so safe in comparison to the strip. It also has the Bay city diner - yummy!!! The pool at the nugget is amazing, the shark tank is fab and it feels wonderful to lay there in the middle of all the hustle and bustle and just chill. There was some construction but it didn’t affect me, the music by the pool drowned any noise out. The rooms are nice, clean, up to date, fancy I guess, comparable to the strip hotels. It's location for Freemont is great but it's not the strip so bear that in mind. It's much more expensive than most downtown hotels but is the best. The only thing is the prices in Vegas vary so madly that you may find a top strip hotel on a deal for the same place as the nugget if something is on in Freemont and then I’d be tempted away to the Paris or similar. The gambling I found is slightly more expensive in the Nugget than the surrounding hotels. Main street station is great though and just a few minutes away. The biggest problem was check-in and out, huge qs and I left a pair of earrings on the bathroom shelf. I realised 1/2hr after we vacated the room and we were told that the room had been rented already and they weren’t found?!? My own stupid fault I guess. All in all I’d go back in a second if I wanted to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Courtney, courtney, courtney....”
Reviews.Author: tdawg200122
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Nugget was great. Visited with my wife, and another couple. The rooms were fine, the service and check in went smoothly. The Sharktank (pool) was outstanding. We rented a cabana for the day, at a very reasonable price. The cabana comes with a flat screen tv, refrigerator, complimentary fruit plate and bottled water, couch, indoor chairs, deck chairs, etc...One thing that wasnt listed with the amenities of the cabana was our waitress, Courtney. Oh...My...God....might be the single most attractive woman in the history of the waitstaff industry. When she came around the corner the first time, just myself and my wife were there. I immediately became a drooling caveman with ADD. When she left, my wife looked at me and said, "its okay", thereby verifying Courtneys hottness. When our friends got there, it became even worse. You could hear the brakes screeching on any conversation we might have had going on when she came by asking if we needed anything. Plus, she was a great server. Overall, fantastical week at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: absolutely_his
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great week (10/9-10/16), despite a few days of unusually cold weather, at the Golden Nugget. We loved eveything about this hotel. Check-in around 5PM took about 10 minutes. We stayed in the south tower and didn't mind the longer walk to the casino. We had a standard room with a king bed as we had requested. The room was nice and clean and larger then most hotel rooms we have been in. We didn't have much of a view but hadn't requested a view. We didn't heard any noise of any kind. If people were in the room next to us we didn't know it. That was great because I'm a very light sleeper. We ate at the Grotto Bar several times instead of inside the restuarant. Their food is wonderful and the same goes for the service. We also ate at the buffet, which was good but for Sat. & Sun Brunch we did eat at the Fremont Hotel Champagne Buffet because they had crab claws, salmon & shrimp. We loved the hotel being right on Fremont Street and enjoyed downtown so much. We have stayed on the strip in the past and will never stay there again. We'll take the deuce like we did this time for 1 day but that's it. The Golden Nugget is the best and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great ,no problems here”
Reviews.Author: orioles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the nugget Oct 12 -17 in the south tower. I heard no noise what so ever, no check in lines. and no pushy timeshare hawkers. A little credit card glitch, but no big deal. Will stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Construction noise!!”
Reviews.Author: hidingbehindmyalias
Reviews.Content: I really like the Nugget and I have stayed there numerous times, but they are building a new tower and not only is there construction noise but I was awoken at 4:40 am by an airhorn that went off EVERY TEN MINUTES nonstop for hours. Forget sleeping. I was in the South tower facing the construction - great view of the crane, if you're into that. I'll go back when the construction is over. By the way, many of the strip hotels also overlook construction due to the many large projects under way - notably the City Center project - so beware of construction noise if you are a sensitive sleeper (I am not).

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: Kaycj
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about what I would find in the Golden Nugget's older, less expensive south tower. I made my reservations by phone, and the salesman was really pushing the newer, more expensive north tower rooms, extolling the virtues of pillow-top beds, flat-screen TVs and in-room safes. I decided to go with the south tower anyway, and... maybe I just lucked out, or maybe it's important to ask for a room on the upper floors (we were on the 18th floor). But my budget room boasted a pillow-top bed, a flat-screen TV and an in-room safe(!) Anyone out there who, like me, might be hesitant about choosing an "old" room shouldn't be. It was very nice -- large, nicely decorated, with several pieces of furniture, a table, chairs and a nice, clean bathroom with plush towels and even two robes in the closet. Sure, the carpet is a little worn, but it didn't bother me. My only complaint -- and it may sound strange -- the bed pillows were horrendous. I can't believe such a high-class establishment would put such uncomfortable pillows in their rooms. One night, I simply could not sleep because of the pillows -- they're small with bunched up, lumpy foam. To the hotel's credit, though, the front desk had a replacement pillow delivered to me in the middle of the night, and it was fine and my sleep was fine after that. One final note: this was the first time I stayed at a downtown hotel. I found that I missed staying on the strip, and believe it may be worth the extra dollars to do so, especially if you've never been to Vegas or have limited time there. But the Golden Nugget is a great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget Really Isn't Golden”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl0
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed with this hotel. All the staff (Lilly's Noodle Bar aside) are breath-takingly rude and incredibly unhelpful. The pool is fine if you don't mind virtually sitting on strangers laps (the sun-loungers touch). Also overall I would say - don't stay downtown if you don't mind either a $30 taxi ride or an hour's bus ride to get to Vegas proper.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget not so golden rooms”
Reviews.Author: hdrelxn
Reviews.Content: Went to Golden Nugget for Las Vegas Bike Week 2008. Arrived and room looked very nice. Till the evening I killed the cock roach and his partner exscaped under the door to the adjacent room. Reported issue to Manager on duty Jerry and he asked if I charged anything to the room but we were paying cash and not charging. He said the exterminating crew was there and he would have room sprayed. Never heard anything more about issue. Then we noticed the mold in the shower. And the final event was the person attempting to enter our room. Hotel person shows up and knocks on door and discovers that they gave the person the wrong room number. When we checked out we asked for some sort of comp for these issues. Manager on duty ignored my wife and said that Jerry would look into it. Bike Fest was interesting but I would consider other hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “very long check in lines”
Reviews.Author: egsandclsareme
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Golden Nugget was not good. When I arrived, there was a very long line to check in. I stood in line for over an hour. During my three day stay, there was always a long line. It was tiresome after a long flight. The clerk did not apologize for the inconvenience. I will probably stay elsewhere next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Belle16
Reviews.Content: I had the cheapest room and it was wonderful. Everything about the room was the quality of a much higher priced room anywhere in the world. Loved it!!!!!! As a woman traveling alone I was made to feel safe and comfortable in every way. The buffet was very good with high quality foods and plenty of healthy choices. The prices were good, too. I would have liked to be able to use the gym for no extra cost but the hotel is just not laid out that was. The whole hotel is elegant and the new pool with an aquarium in the center was just the best. I could swim along with the sharks and other fish in the hot sun. I like the Downtown, Freemont, part of town as it is easier to get around and even easier to get to the bus to the strip. The journeys on the bus does take time but that is just because there are so many people. I would choose this hotel again any time. It was really gret. I travel a lot and am fussy.

Reviews.Title: “gold brick”
Reviews.Author: ziggystar
Reviews.Content: booked on strength of other trip advisor reviews and desire to be off strip for a few days with children. great hotel, located right in middle of freemont experience. Rooms large with comfortable beds and good bathrooms , quiet in morning and easy to sleep in. good reasonable priced restaurants. Not a huge hotel but still large however easy enough to get around with children to restaurants pools etc. Pool is superb. Slide and fish tank a real feature. kids loved it. bar by pool is good. gaming tables around pool if you are so inclined. check out simple and quick as was check in, friendly staff. drinks if not gambling pricier than rest of freemont area but you tend to wander anyway. All in allwell worth the reasonable price and children friendly

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: julesingeorgia
Reviews.Content: We received an excellent offer from the Golden Nuggett via email and decided to cut our stay at the Las Vegas Hilton short and stay 2 nights at the Golden Nugget. It was nice to stay in the downtown area for a short time but I was not impressed with the hotel that much. The front desk check-in clerk was bordering on rude. Also never did get my club card as the line was rediculously long all times of day. We ate at the buffet twice and I would say the food was fare but very affordable. We also had bad luck at the slots but that was pretty much the case everywhere this trip. We paid to have an upgraded room in the North Tower. The room was nice enough but still felt dated. The road construction woke us promptly at 6a every morning, THAT was a nightmare in itself. Wish I would have known about the construction and either got another room or not stayed there at all. I felt like my upgrade was a downgrade! The pool is excellent! Loved the aquarium in the pool, very cool. The pool deck is too small though for the amount of people there so the chairs are placed smacked up against each other. I did not feel comfortable laying that close to a stranger really. Drinks at the pool bar were very good. I guess this would still be the place you want to stay downtown as the other hotels do not look all that nice. I think next time I will stay at my Las Vegas Hilton and take a taxi down to the Nugget like we have always done in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: heisman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at the Golden Nugget and it was superb, as usual. We had stayed there in February and in July of this year also and would stay nowhere else but the Nugget for this trip. This is my first review for this wonderful hotel, but it will not be my last visit as we will return. It has never taken us more than 15 minutes to check in and we have always been granted our request of high floor, no smoking, king bed. On our July visit, we found the television replacement to the huge flat screened version. We were there with relatives who also stayed at GN and as first time downtowners, they were impressed as well. Except for one visit where we stayed in the suite in the North Tower, we have been in the South Tower and it is not a long walk to anywhere. A second Starbucks is outside the banks of elevators as well as a computer area to print out boarding passes for $5. Rooms are clean and spacious and bed is comfy. Another replacement since the summer is the shampoo, conditioner, hand lotion in that it is half the size of the former containers. Lotion is a handy "to go" size, but the conditioner was not enough for one person. However, housekeeping obliged with the request of another conditioner. The vanity and makeup mirror just outside the bathroom is convenient so I can dry and curl my hair while husband is showering. Pool area is great with the shark tank and is relaxing in the evening as well. Not a huge pool area, but there are sunny and shady areas as well as areas you can met as a group. Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Glitches”
Reviews.Author: elharo
Reviews.Content: 30 minutes to check in. The pool was completely closed on Sunday. Buffet service cashiers had trouble understanding English. Shower was broken, and when the maintenance man came to fix it he tracked mud all over the shower so I still didn't want to use it. The room door was warped and extremely hard to open and close. The TV was large, but didn't have HBO. Spammers in the lobby kept trying to sell you time shares. Otherwise, it was a decent hotel. No one of these things would put me off the hotel, but taken together they add up and I can't imagine staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: MicheleMartuscelli68
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget, Las Vegas, NV was ok but not great. Arrived: September 21, 2008 Reviewed by: Michele, Pennsylvania The pool was nice, the tank in the pool was awesome, small pool but ok. Our room was nice, very large, but wasn't very luxurious like the site had led us to believe. We stayed in the south tower, might be better to stay in the north tower. They boasted about the international beer bar, that was a joke, it was just a plain old bar near the casino exit, there was really nothing special about it. There is no place in there to just get a burger and a beer if you want. They have a suchi bar that was always empty and a noodle house that was also very vacant. Vic & Anthony's steak house, way over priced. Next time we go will will stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Monkeybrains11
Reviews.Content: Please do not go to this hotel! This was my trip to Las Vegas, so I was very excited to be there and see the city. I started worrying about the hotel when I stood in line to check in, and had to wait (and wait) because two groups of desk personnel were standing around talking, ignoring the people in line. I had asked for a room with a king bed, and was given a room with two doubles. When I asked if I could get the requested room, I was told no. Just that! "No." I asked if it was possible to check for the next night. "I guess you can." was the response. It went downhill from there. My room was dirty, and the staff ran from indifferent to rude. They all seemed to have an attitude that they were at a 3rd rate hotel and didn't need to make any effort because no one really cared about the service or the guests. One positive - the nice doormen and bellhops - they were great!

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Road__Less__Travld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad, but not very good. Very poor value for the money and sort of running down. The staff, with on one exception, were horrible. The person helping me on check in was great, but it went down hill fast from there. I would avoid the hotel based on three reasons: Poor air quality - the place is very smokey and the air is stale Location is sub optimal - expensive to get to the intresting parts of town and the location is by the justice center, so by definition a high crime area Value - not great value for the money - vey pricey for what you get - in particular the retaurants in the hotel seemed expensive given what they provided. I just did not find the place "fun" or "relaxing" and could not stand the smoke. This is an older building and lacks modern air purificaton systems. I do not think the new addition/construction will make a great difference. It may help with the air quality, but that is about it. The location remains away from it all. The staff seems to generally not be interested in helping or seeing guests happy. It really shows. By the end of my stay, I was ready for a vacation - which seems sort f wrong!

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sassysally8
Reviews.Content: HaveJust come home from another fantastic trip to Vegas. staying at the Golden Nugget was again Fab. Staff very very helpful and pleasant, rooms great overall service superb. For vegas virgins or regulars alike Downtown Vegas is a must. The Freemont experience out shines the Strip.... Greatest tour was a trip to the neon museum aka the boneyard,, its a must do tour, book in advance for this best $15 ever spent, if your planning a trip to vegas soon, make this a must do on your list, i think an actually museum is planned for next year, which will be cool but seeing this in its raw state is a must, for all you csi fans this is a must, see season 4 episode 22. I would also check out Bills Casino on the strip the Karoke with the $1 beers is a must and after 5 can guarantee you will be singing, I did, it was an abba classic, dancing queen (I blame the super mamma mia i saw the night before at mandalay bay).. Cant wait to book up again!! VEGAS ROCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of American trip”
Reviews.Author: ValenciaScarlett
Reviews.Content: When we arrived,there was a huge, 25 minute queue at reception.We later saw that there was always a long queue at any time of day or night which was a bit of a pain if you just wanted e.g. some local info. The reception staff were not forthcoming with any advice or help when we asked them. The room we had was clean and quiet but the bed was uncomfortable. The hotel was also uncomfortably cold in all the common areas e.g restaurants,corridors as the air conditioning was on full blast. Luckily we had an air conditioning unit in our room which we were able to programme ourselves. The area where the hotel is located is grim and ugly. There's no ( advisable) way to get to the central strip ( where all the more glamorous hotels + fun is) unless you get a taxi for the 10 mile ride. The taxi cost us 25 dollars each way. The less advisable way is to catch a local bus from the nearby bus station. We tried to do this but failed to do so as we were given such poor info from the receptionist who just wanted us to catch a taxi! The bus station environment was pretty dodgy looking too. If you're going to Las Vegas to gamble and nothing else then this hotel is probably OK as it has a casino. If you want to get a bit more out of your trip and want to be somewhere more central then think again. In retrospect, we'd happily have paid more and stayed elsewhere e.g. on the central strip and we'd have saved money on taxis!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shasadee
Reviews.Content: Arrived at noon on Saturday the 13th...room was not ready but only because we waited for a smoking king room. Staff was pleasant and helpful - check in line was very quick! Room was ready as promised at 3. The room itself was very nice - no obvious defects - and a wonderful view of the mountains. Big (32 inch? ) flat screen tv was a nice feature. Maid service was hit or miss. One day it was miss - no facecloths - another day fantastic - room spotless and extra towels - left. Staff at the pool, in the casino and in the buffet and Grotto were knowledgeable ,friendly and generally helpful. This was our second trip to the Nugget and probably won't be our last!

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: txSatx
Reviews.Content: San Antonio,texas,I bought my husband Mitch for his birthday a trip to vegas ,we stayed at the golden nugget hotel,great hotel,nice room good service,did not won any money ,but we had fun..I called the hotel direct for reservations they gave me a good deal buy 2 nights geht 1 free..thanks golden nugget hotel,we be back... Rose from san antonio

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, ordinary people”
Reviews.Author: DavidBelgium
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for +/- 60$/night and bought myself an upgrade to a one bedroom suite for 100$/night extra when checking in. For that reasonable price I got a huge suite; very large living room, bedroom, two bathrooms (one with shower & tv, and one with whirlpool). The suite was spotless clean and had a nice view, no noise. That was the good part. Now about Fremont Street; I don't understand what people like about it beside the light show in the evening. There is not one nice shop, simply not one. Only a few ordinary souvenir shops and a few casino's, that's it. If you spend half an hour in Fremont Street than you've seen it. In the hotel and in Fremont street you have to see the crowd. I've never seen so many ordinary people together in one place, the crowd in the hotels on the strip is very different. Sorry I have to say this but most of the guests in the Golden Nugget are rather low class. I sometimes felt uncomfortable. You can certainly leave your best clothes at home. Beware the distance to the strip, a taxi ride will cost you 25$ one way with tip. When checking out early in the morning computers were down, they couldn't even tell me the amount of my bill. They said they would send the bill by post, still haven't got it. Sure I got a great room for a great price, no doubt about that, but if I had known about the very low class crowd and the location, I would have stayed on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Tipsymazuk
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Las Vegas having stayed on the Strip previously (The Bellagio and Excalibur). We were not disappointed with our stay at The Golden Nugget and enjoyed Fremont Street tremendously. We were booked in for 11 nights. Check-in was quick and easy and I requested a room with a good view and had the choice of downtown or the mountains. I opted for the latter. We were located in the South Tower, which is very close to the pool area, Carson Street Café and one of the 2 Starbucks operating within the hotel. The room was extremely spacious and very clean. It comprised of two double beds, a bedside table between the beds with a lamp, telephone and digital clock. There was a large chest of drawers with ample room for clothes, on which sat a huge plasma screen television. In addition was a good sized round table, two comfortable chairs and a very large wardrobe with an abundance of coat hangers, one iron, ironing board, hairdryer, two dressing gowns and a safe. The window does open and there is an air-conditioning unit underneath the window frame, which was quite effective in the intense heat we experienced. Also within the room was a vanity unit with two good mirrors and an ice bucket (there is a free ice machine further up the corridor). The bathroom was a good size with a large vanity unit, bath and shower. An abundance of clean towels were provided each day and we were never without the free toiletries as these were replenished each day. The Golden Nugget is a beautiful hotel, extremely clean and comfortable with a good atmosphere. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and eager to help. The beds were as comfortable as those we have at home and housekeeping was without fault. It was such a pleasure returning to our clean and tidy room each day. The breakfast buffet was extremely good value with a huge selection each morning, all freshly prepared and quite delicious. We also ate the Champagne Brunch at the weekend and again the food was fresh and delicious with a wide selection to choose from and the champagne was flowing freely with our glasses topped up regularly. We ate several times at Carson Street Café and we were constantly impressed at the excellent quality of the food and the very reasonable prices. Again, it was a very relaxed atmosphere and the staff were efficient and friendly. We enjoyed several mornings at the Shark Tank and Pool on very comfortable sun loungers. The pool area is very attractive and again extremely clean. It is an amazing experience to swim alongside the sharks and other fishes in the tank. There are two bars, which serve drinks and food (although a little expensive) and a good mix of music plays all day, to suit all tastes. It did become a little crowded over the weekend and the sun loungers are quite close together. However the terraced area was quiet. The pool also has a hot bath, which can hold up to 50 people. In this area are comfortable seats and day beds. There are also several Cabanas for hire. The slots were kind to us at The Golden Nugget. On joining the Players’ Club you are given $10 free play. I proceeded to win $70, which was rather nice as it didn’t cost me a penny to bet! My husband and I could not fault The Golden Nugget and if we were to return to Las Vegas we would not hesitate to stay here again. Downtown is a different holiday to that of the Strip. There is a party atmosphere each evening with live bands and street entertainment. During the day it is very relaxed and you do not get tired walking to the casinos as they are next door to one another. Also, the price difference is very noticeable with Fremont Street being far cheaper and better value than the Strip. Definitely 10 out of 10 for The Golden Nugget and Fremont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: shayna3579
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. We have alway stayed on the strip and thought it would be fun to stay downtown. The hotel is alot smaller than I would have thought, but very easy to get around. I loved the pool........small but a great place to relax. You have to get there early or you will have a hard time getting a chair. The breakfast buffet was not bad but the dinner one was the worst. We only ate there once for dinner, go to Main Street it is less money and much better. Own room was in the north tower and very quiet. The room was small but the bed was great. The bathroom was the smallest I have seen something close to the bathrooms on cruise ships. Having said all of this I would go back. The staff was great and we really had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: julj1
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. The room was fine other than the ever present stale smoke smell in the "non smoking room"... nothing fancy but the bed was comfortable, which is important. the pool is fun, but surely not the hippest in vegas. in retrospect i should have splurged the extra cash to stay closer to the strip...a cab ride to the strip costs about $20-25.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: mellokitty
Reviews.Content: Check in took well over an hour. Obviously several flights had come in around the same time. They had to have known we all were coming. The other guests I spoke with had come in on time, as had we, so it was no airline snafu that had caused this sudden crowd. So why weren't they staffed for it? I don't know. The room was fine. Not great, and not spotless either. I will say I did enjoy having the vanity and lighted magnifying makeup mirror. I did not enjoy being ignored at the entrance to the poker room. I am a nicely dressed normal looking 43 year old woman. Three separate times I was ignored. The pool was nice. I would not recommend "The Buffet." Their lack of imagination in naming the place is a clue to the lackluster effort in the quality of food and beverage. I had some of the worst service of my life at "The Grotto." I'm a long time hospitality manager so I will spare you my litany of things they did wrong so as not to sound crazy. Suffice it to say that as our "Fancy Dinner Night" it really sucked. The food was strictly ok. Go to Mamacita's down the street for really good food And Service. I won't complain too much about the 24 hour construction outside our room. After all it is Vegas and I don't expect quiet. I mention it for those who knowing about it, would choose to stay on the other side of the street. Which is where I will be... at Binion's.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Good Time, BUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTopdog
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving, I called to check on the room that we had booked on line and to see if I could get a room guarantee. Please be aware that the "Standard Room" that most people book is located in the South Tower. The problem is that the South Tower is nearly 100 yards away and and the rooms have not been upgraded. To get a room guarantee in the North Tower (Standard Room) is considered an upgrade and costs an additional $36 per night. If you don't ask, they won't volunteer to tell you. Also, I would recommend that you pay the additional $20 fee for VIP check in to avoid the long lines, particularly for early check-in. We found the staff very friendly and accomodating throughout our stay. A word of caution if you're checking out in the wee hours of the morning - Getting a copy of our folio (bill) prior to checking out was impossible because the computers were shut down. We were told that they would have to send it to us either by fax or in the mail. Well, it's been a week now and we still don't have it resolved. Charges have appeared on both my wife's and my credit cards and no one can explain why or give us the actual charges. I would highly recommend the buffet for breakfast or lunch and we found the shark tank and the Freemont Street experience to be awesome. We booked round trip transportation to and from the airport with Gray Line Airport Shuttle. Be sure and call 24 hours in advance to make your reservation for pick up from the hotel. Call them again if the driver is not there on time. We came close to missing our flight because the bus picked us up over an hour late. P.S. Avoid the offers for "free stuff" at the hotel in exchange for a few hours of your time. The 2-3 hour time share presentation turned out to be 41/2 hours of high pressure gimmicking by some of the best in the business.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: crowndking
Reviews.Content: We arrived late too the Golden Nugget (2am) We also took a cab (big mistake) take a shuttle if you are staying at the Golden nugget it was a $40 trip if you have to take a cab tell them to take the Swenson exit and the strip its cheaper. Check in takes about 2 minutes and you are to your room with in 3 minutes, but that was at 2am so it was quiet and easy! The room was clean, maid service always did a great job and the temp in the room was cool(nice to get out of the heat of August) we had an alright view we could see the corner of Fremont street and some construction, we never heard any noise from the construction so no complaints there Don't think about getting room service unless you are ready to spend a few bucks! you are better off eating at the great buffet for $9.99 per person (for breakfast) plus you get a few 2-4-1 coupons when you book through certain places we went through NWA lunch is $10.99 and dinner is $17.99 all prices very much worth it. The staff was great, We stayed for 9 nights, so many of the staff remembered us and greeted us as we went through the hall ways, the dealers were very friendly and willing to help and teach you how to play games and they also made a point of remembering you and you're name as well! The pool was fantastic and clean and so was the cabana which you can rent for $175 a day, very cheap, many other places charge $500 a day! Fremont St is amazing so much to do and see and lots of security so you don't have much to worry about no matter what time you are out there, the Golden nugget is definitely one of the best hotels and casinos on Fremont ST so if you are staying there Golden nugget is the place to be! the best way to get to the strip or lets say you want to go to MGM from GN hop onto a bus to Sahara hotel and casinos and then get onto the mono rail and cruise that to the end with in 10 minutes or you could stay on the bus but that can take a very long time all day pass for the bus is $5 and a all day pass for the monorail is $12 very much worth it when you can travel from downtown to the strip in no time and see it all with in a decent time frame! The Golden nugget is a hotel that when we go back we will be staying there again. My Wife and I looked at all the other hotels and casinos and we were so pleased with our choice at the GN, it was fantastic! The only complaint we had was the people trying to sell time shares from the Grand View hotel they were all over downtown and the strip, just tell them no thanks and keep walking, they will leave you alone after you ignore them! the best bet if someone is offering you free stuff and their name badge does not say Golden nugget ignore them because its not truly free! Golden nugget is a Golden hotel! 10's all around!

Reviews.Title: “golden nugget is golden”
Reviews.Author: SouthernOhioNaillady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Golden Nugget and felt compelled to write. Had always stayed on the strip and wanted to try something different. Couldn't have been more surprised and pleased. Stayed in the South Tower cheap room and was a little nervous because of the low price ($59. summer deal). The room was beautiful and the distance between the room and casino and pool was no problem at all. (If you've ever stayed at Bally's and tried to get to the pool you can relate! ) The restaurants were great. Won a little in the casino and access to other casinos was so easy. In fact, for the first time in Vegas we did not get burned out (literally and figuratively) since everything was an easy walk and the Fremont overhead screen also kept the area shaded. Access to the strip was easy and cheap using the Duece (public bus), however we ended up only going there once for a show at the Mirage. The staff was friendly and eager to please. The clientelle was a comfortable mix of Americans. Europians and others, young and elderly, no seedy types. Also, it was a nice change with no flesh peddlers handing you papers constantly. Unfortunately, you still have to put up with pushy salespeople but at least they're only selling condos. Really wish they would get rid of these obnoxious people, but I can walk fast and talk fast ("No!") when I have to. Would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience as always at Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: luckyokguy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. We go about once a year. This was the first time we stayed in the North Tower. My sister was right, it is so much closer to everything. It never seemed like a far walk from the South tower, but it is. The North is also remodeled with luxury bedding and very large flat screen TV. Don't expect a coffee pot in the room and internet is $12.99 a day. If you don't mind a 2 block walk(from North tower), just take your laptop down to the Main Street Station and access wonderful free wireless internet there. It is in the players club area and is not a problem to use. The food is great at the buffet, ask for a coupon book when you check in(depends on your rate) and you will find 2 for 1 coupons. We had a small problem with getting them to change the sheets. They only do it every 2 days(water shortage ya know), which is fine but after the third night they still hadn't changed them, so on day 4 I asked that they come up and change them. They did, but much to my surprise at midnight when I got into the bed I found my toes on the matress cover because they had shorted the bottom sheet by about 2 feet. I called, they said someone would be right up, 30 minutes later, nothing had happened so I had to get dressed and go down to the desk. I was told they were on their way, I nicely asked for some compensation for the trouble and was given a $46 food & bev comp for Carson Street rest. I still think the day maid did it on purpose, but the great front office MOD made it right. Fantastic pool, new club Gold Diggers overlooking Femont Street. It's great to stay downtown. Just hop on the double decker bus (The Duce) to go to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Las Vegas Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: i_m_good
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget because of a great package price I got from the airline. I had been a little hesitant to stay on Fremont St, as it's an older area. But as soon as I checked in I was very pleased. The rooms were very nice and clean and the pool is beautiful. We ended up upgrading to a suite for the last 2 nights, and it was definately worth it. The bed is amazing, and a beautiful marble bathroom with a jetted tub. And for anyone having any doubts about staying on Fremont, IT'S GREAT!!! There is always action right outside the hotel, and the Fremont st experience (light show) is great. And with everything in close walking distance it's super convenient. And getting up to the strip is easy, there is a bus (the deuce) that runs up to the strip all day. I recommended the Golden Nugget to a couple of friends, now they won't stay anywhere else! Bottom line, the hotel is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: chino53
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LV at 630 pm on a flight in from Detroit. Caught the CAT bus # 108 from Mccarran Airport. It was easy to catch, a short walk from the terminal, the fare is $2.00 or you can buy a 24 hour all bus pass for $5.00. The #108 takes you directly downtown and bypasses the strip. The absolutely best place to stay downtown is the Golden Nugget which has just been redone and is absolutely beautiful. Stay in the North tower it is worth the extra dollars not to have to walk and it has all been remodeled. The rooms are large with 50" plasma TVs and beds that have feather mattresses and pillows and comforters. Ask for a room at the end of the hall if you want quiet. I stayed at the Paris Hotel and these rooms are nicer than the room I had at the Paris. The pool is circular and it has a large clear cylinder 360 view shark tank in the middle of the pool that you can swim up to. It is quite large and has a large assortment of sharks and fish. Be sure and catch the free blackjack and craps lessons @ 10 am in the casino. I paid $150 for 2 nights that included a 25$ food credit. We ate at the Grotto an Italian restaurant but It was overpriced and the food was not as fantastic as the price would lead you to believe, - avoid it. Our best budget stratagy was to eat at the McDonalds accross the street in Fitzgerald's casino and in thier Coffee shop up stairs which is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is true class!”
Reviews.Author: kpdzineChicago_Il
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I have stayed here and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas. The suites are great and the service is top notch. I loved the pool and did pretty good at the casino. A true gem in Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: redhat52
Reviews.Content: First time staying Downtown Vegas, wished we had done it before. The Golden Nugget hotel was everything and more! The pool area alone was worth it, the shark tank and slide are even more fun for "grown ups" lol The food at the buffett and the Carson St cafe was great. We were here to unwind and enjoy and everyone at the hotel was helpful and nice. We will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Contiuous Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: KenG3659
Reviews.Content: Return guests are given first class treatment. Limo pick up at the airport and comps.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wgwg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Golden Nugget five times and never had a bad experience. This time I stayed in the North Tower. My room was one of the best I have ever stayed in Vegas. The room has a 48 inch plasma TV and a bed that felt like a cloud. The staff here cannot do enough for you. The pool is incredible, you have to see it to believe it. There is construction going on, but other than parking issues it does not effect you. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: kegsy_baby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. First time in Vegas. This hotel is great! It's a lot cheaper than staying on the Strip, and in my opinion, the area where it is (Fremont St/Downtown) is far better. It is so much cheaper and smaller (much easier to get around) than the Strip. its the original Las vegas! If you want to go down to the Strip, just take the bus (The Deuce) for a couple of $. The hotel is smaller than its Strip counterparts but it really is lovely. The pool is unbelievable - a huge shark aquarium, water slide, water falls, hot tub! There are lots of good places to eat - a cafe which serves breakfast, lunch, snacks and dinner; the buffet is fantastic; and italian. There are 2 starbucks on site. Nightclub and a bar also. Our room: we asked for a smoking room but learned our lesson. After coming from smoking-unfriendly New york we assumed Las vegas would be the same....WRONG! you can smoke indoors in Las Vegas. Our room stank of stale smoke and all our clothes (even in the wardrobe and suitcases) smelled bad. We thought it would get better (there is only A/C so no actual ventilation) but it didn't. We should have asked to change room but we didn't. Oh well, we will know for next time!!! Staff are very friendly and approachable. Casino is good too, but we didn't do much gambling; far better to watch someone else put $5000 on red at the roulette ;) all in all, great hotel for the money, very luxurious. P.S We seen our friends room at the MGM Signature - Penthouse suite which was amazing but it was their honeymoon $$$$$! they said that they actually preferred our hotel amenities and location. Plus they arrived to be told they had to pay an extra $15 a night for "service charge" for use of the pool!! They weren't happy bunnies!!

Reviews.Title: “Nugget is the Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: longhorn1989
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Golden Nugget was above average. The bellhops were not too pushy and the desk clerks were friendly. The wait to register was about 10 minutes on a 08/12/08, Tuesday 4:00pm check in. We were staying at the South Tower which was located on the opposite side of the casino, but you got to view the shark tank pool through the a.c. lobby as you walked to your elevators. The negative was the time share people just outside the elevator hallway hawking you with "Hi, are staying here for a couple of days ..... blah,blah,blah ..... " as we just walked by and ignored them. The rooms were very nice and clean. They had a vanity top inside the restroom and just outside the bathroom was another vanity top for the ladies to get ready, while the restroom was being occupied. The beds were very comfortable and we requested feather pillows to be sent up to the room. The rooms come with a free to use digital safe, which came in handy. The a.c. was the under the window type which was no distraction to us. Overall, we were satisfied with the rooms and felt they were larger than your standard room, because of the vanity area. These South Tower rooms are nice and no upgrade is needed to be comfortable. The valet pick up was busy and slow, so we opted to use the self parking garage, which was actually very close to the South Tower. This made going to your room very easy and fast as opposed to using the valet and having to wisk your way through the casino, past the Shark Tank Pool and then the restaurant row, then your elevators. Use the self parking if time and distance is of the essence. The breakfast buffet was great and cheap at only 9.95 per person and it included an omelet station, salmon, fruit, salad, dessert, and free drinks. The line was brisk and we even got to use the buy one get one free coupon that we picked up at the front desk upon arrival .... must be staying at least three nights according to our travel package. The 24 hour diner was also included on the buy one get one free coupon and the oriental salad was big and good along with the world famous bread pudding that Steve Wynn's mother recipe.... also free with coupon. The blackjack tables are tricky in that some pay the 6-5 odds on blackjack as oppossed to the standard 3-2 payoff. You have to ask for the 3-2 tables to ensure you are not getting ripped off or read the sign for the 6-5 warning. The tables were mostly $10 min. bets and shoe dealt were available along with single deck. The best blackjack tables I found were the Las Vegas Club and The Cortez which both had double deck, $5 min. bet dealt out of the shoe and open faced. You have a better advantage this way in tracking cards patterns. In my experience, The 4 Queens offers the best comps for your play as far as time played equates a free meal at their Magnolias Cafe. The best prime rib special was the the Main Street sports grill/ brewery for $7.95 with the best tender prime rib, vegtable, and potato. It was better than Magnolia's $7.95 prime rib. Overall we felt safe and well taken care of at our downtown stay at the Golden Nugget and will be back soon. I hope this helps some of you make your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Updated hotel at a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: reformedgoodgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Golden Nugget. The hotel has been renovated since my first stay and it is a vast improvement. The rooms are spacious, the bedding was first-rate, the amenities were high quality. My room had a king-size bed, a big, flat-screen television, a desk with free wireless internet, and a comfortable armchair. There are restaurants, bars, a live theatre, and, of course, a casino, in the hotel. The hotel is on Fremont Street and within easy walking distance of several other hotels, casinos, shops, restaurants, and the Clark County government offices. I got an unbelievably great rate of $59 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Entire Stay!”
Reviews.Author: but4goi
Reviews.Content: First time on Fremont Street, what a FUN time! Great atmosphere inside and out. Hotel was nice and clean with a really cool shark tank in the pool (aka The Tank).
