Suggest that you take a small coffee pot, filters and coffee with you if you are a caffine freak as the rooms do not have one. Also nice to have a cooler (ice is free!) and buy bottled water or drinks at the ABC store next door to the hotel for your room. The buffet at the hotel is very good; ask for buy one get one free coupons at the check-in desk. Also, if you need transportation to see the strip area, there is a shuttle called the Deuce that costs $5 for any 24 hour period. There are tons of free things to see on the strip (but wouldn't want to stay there) in the MGM, New York New York, and other places. Just ask at the front desk. Free drinks at all the hotels if you play at any slot machine. Golden Nugget offers the best free drink selections around. Make sure you get your 24K card at the Nugget, it's free and offers perks. You won't be disappointed! Priceline offers great rates!

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel in Vegas-- who knew!”
Reviews.Author: CLA0406
Reviews.Content: The rate is amazing-- $59 a night during the week-- only around $100 for the weekend. The rooms are huge and the pool is BY FAR the best in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Commish33
Reviews.Content: Had another good time at the Nugget frorm 7-22-25-08...check in was quick and the girl, Cindy, took the time to get us the floor and type of room we wanted....it was not a hurry up thing with her. The hotel had plenty of vistors and it was easy to get around. the Pool was the best...plenty of site seeing there. Morning buffet was excellent...even though we got there late still had breakfest food out past 10:30 am. so we had a little breafeast and lunch....only bad part of the visit...the maid service was not up to the 4 diamond standard...forget wash clothes all three days we were there and soap on other days...and I mentioned to a supervisor the problem...it seems one lady just doesn't bring enough of them when she starts in the morning....but for the price...location...and easy in and out parking...the Nugget is great....will be back next Summer using Private Arrangements....

Reviews.Title: “Gold in downtown/freemont area”
Reviews.Author: pharmdeity
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, Saturday, for a great price through Priceline. Check in was quick and painless with helpful staff. Very nice throughout the hotel/casino although not as elegant as 5 star facilities on the strip. Room was clean and quiet. I only ate at the 24 hour restaurant, can't remember the name. Excellent service at 1am along with very good food and portions. The waiter even added pancakes with my meal which wasn't on the menu. Poker room is a little cramped but very friendly staff and management. It was so busy that one of the managers had to serve as a dealer. I was very impressed with their commitment to their patrons. This facility is so much nicer than any of the others in or around downtown that there is really no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Still A Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cisko213
Reviews.Content: Hotel still reaked of smoke. Decided on Golden Nugget because heard such great stories about it and how they spent 100 million to remodel it. Well I can't see where the money went. The pool is the best thing the hotel has and it's more or less just a shark tank. Room layout was horrible. Still just a downtown hotel no better than Vegas club or 4 queens.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Rodan45
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Golden Nugget and this time we stayed for 13 nights. Everyone treated us great, didn't run into even one rude person. We had a room on 14th floor in the North Tower. Our view overlooked the pool & could see the mountains. They are building a new tower behind the pool but the construction noise didn't bother us at all, the only thing we ever heard was the crane blow it's whistle when it was moving something. The room was big & the king size bed was so comfortable. Everything was clean & spotless, the maid service was great, everyday they had our room cleaned & new towels etc before noon. The slots were pretty tight at the Nugget, really did most of our gambling at other casinos, but on the day we checked out my wife hit a 5 times slot for 550.00 which was a great way to say see you next year Golden Nugget lol. We also had NO problems being downtown, we never got bothered by anyone & felt very safe. We walked fremont st at all hours of the night & it's very safe. We will be back next year without a doubt, 2 stays at the Nugget & neither time did we ever have a problem so they will get our business every year until they do something that really gets me upset lol. Oh one more thing, we checked in around 2:45pm and it only took 5 minutes max and we were all checked in & ready to have some fun, and check out was even faster ;) One last thing, if you book your stay through a travel agent & request North tower be prepared to pay additonal 25.00 a night at check in because we were told that when travel agents book your stay it's always at south tower price. That caught me off guard & kind of got me upset but my wife calmed me down so i would stop swearing at the lady at the front desk heh

Reviews.Title: “First trip DT- gret experience”
Reviews.Author: orangectyny
Reviews.Content: This was a solo trip for me, my 3rd trip in 18 months and my first DT. I had decided on the Nugget before even looking at other hotels based on reviews here. I was overly impressed with the staff from the Valet, bellhops, front desk. My room was ready and it was above expectations. It was a South Tower room on the 19th floor. I ate the the Carson St Cafe, and felt the meal was priced accordingly and was a good value. Had room service twice- both times it was hot and delivered quickly. I had registerd through Private Arrangements and I know when I return in December I will be staying once again at the GN. I loved the proximity to Fremont Street and being able to pop in and out of all the other casinos. I did not win at the Nugget's casino but this was not a winning trip at all. Only bad service was at the Rush bar- very busy night and only 1 bartender on. Our group moved over to the Dive bar- which was quieter and we were able to enjoy ourselves. The Tank was awesome- and the staff there handled an emergency evacuation very professionally. All and all an excellant 6 night stay

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Babygirl1982
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my boyfriend's first time we went to vegas, and loved it. We stayed at the golden nugget. People were really friendly. And the following year we booked a trip to vegas again and we stayed at the monte carlo I wasnt to inpressed. So this is our third time going now and we were looking at the pictures and airfare and of course we were drawn by the pool that the golden nugget has. So now we cant wait til we go in september of 08

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: barbtender13
Reviews.Content: Loved the Nugget. Its the best in downtown las vegas. Its hot in july but their pool is the place to be. THE TANK has a shark tank in the middle of the pool. Great place for relaxing in the water. Rooms are very nice the restaurants are very good and service is excellent. We will stay there next year

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the remodel”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I planned a Vegas weekend and reserved and paid for two nights at the Mirage. After we booked that trip, he got a deal from the Golden Nugget for 3 free nights, 2 free meals and $250 to gamble with in the casino. So he decided to go ahead and take them up on our offer and book the rooms for the same weekend we were at the Mirage. The plan was to go directly to the GN, check out the room and facilities, grab a bite to eat and let him blow through that free $$. After that we'd head back to the Mirage (I'll write a review for that as well.) I'm kind of a "new Vegas" girl...I was not too excited head over to the old strip...but decided it wouldn't kill me. So we went. I have to say I was impressed with the new Golden Nugget. The last time I was there was YEARS ago and I didn't even want to walk in! Now it's all very modern and clean with marble everywhere. Certainly an improvement! Our room was on the 9th floor and overlooked the pool. I was so surprised at the non-tacky, fresh rooms with crisp linens and super comfortable beds! The room had been completely redone with new carpet, marble, wallpaper and obviously bedding. The room was a nice size, but the bath was small - only one person at a time in there! There was a desk, internet accessability, etc - but one thing to note, no fridge/mini bar. They were also very accomodating in the buffet restautant. I wasn't feeling well and didn't want to go to the buffet - but asked my boyfriend if he could bring me back some toast and cottage cheese. They never allow you to take food from the buffet - but they were kind enough to transfer the buffet credit to the cafe where he was able to get me my requested lunch. I thought that was a really nice touch. Again, we didn't actually stay over night there...but I did take a nap and all together I think we were there 5 hours. I wouldn't hesitate to go back or recommend this hotel to others...though I have to admit, I'll probably be sticking to the hotels/casino's on the new strip.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: ilovemycats
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights and 8 days at the Golden Nugget. This was our first time staying down on Fremont St. We figured that since we always end up playing downtown, we might as well stay there this time. We used VIP check in and our room was ready for us when we arrived at 11:00 am. They provided a refrigerator that I had asked for when we made the reservations. We stayed in the South Tower on the 12th floor. The room was large and the bed comfortable. The carpet has seen better days, but the room was clean and it was re-cleaned well each day. The pool was lovely and it was quite an experience swimming so close to the sharks. The chairs are close together and the pool gets crowded, so we always went early in the day. The only meal we ate at the GN was at Lillie's Noodle House since we had a $25 meal comp. My soup and sushi were very good and my husband enjoyed his crab rangoon and shrimp dish. We did not play at the GN. There Blackjack is not very good compared to the other games close by. El Cortez has some of the best low limit BJ to be found and we spent most of our time there. We also played at the California and the Golden Gate - very loose slots! We made our reservations through the GN websit in advance and they went down twice. Both times I called and they gave me the cheaper rate without any problem. All in all it was a comfortable stay without any issues. My only complaint was that they would not let us know if we could have a late check out in advance; they said they only do that the morning of check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasisgreat
Reviews.Content: For the best rates, I continually checked every possible website for months! The hotel website was actually the best each/every time. I even canceled and rebooked with the hotel when their prices declined. After seeing negative reviews on tripadvisor, I was hesitant about our trip. Our group stayed in the south tower in 3 rooms in the 17th nonsmoking floor; plush sheets, pillows, towels, showers, sinks and mattresses were beyond perfect. Carpeting and AC was wonderful. Housekeeping was great. The buffet was fabulous. Customer service was very pleasant including the parking valet (which we used each night including Saturday), check-in, doormen, casino workers. This is definitely a four-star hotel. The pool is a nice size with much seating; the fish tank and slide are fun and interesting. We found 2 for 1 coupons for Downtown and much of Vegas in a book americancasinoguide.com and there is also a coupon page Downtown in the center of the street at the O2 booth-ask and you shall get. We never paid full price for any meal or drink while there! Our favorite place to eat was at the back of the Golden Gate (huge shrimp cocktail 99 cents with player's card) and Bay City Diner next door (huge fresh breakfast). Coupon is in the American Casino guide above. Enjoy your vacation! We sure did. 8-)

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: waimeaswan
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my room and even that is just ok. The non smoking rooms still smell of smoke. I changed my room, now my room doesn't smell but the sheets do. Carpet is very old. The pool, is not as grand as shown in the pictures. It is actually rather small. Other then seeing the freemont street evening activities it really doesn't have much going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mistaz1123
Reviews.Content: I was only at the Golden Nugget for 1 night while waiting to join others the following day at anonther hotel in Las Vegas. I arrived at the hotel at 10pm and was greeted quite cheerfully by the front desk staff. I was told there was good news and bad news, I had booked a smoking room and there weren't any available, but the good news was they had upgraded me to a 1 bedroom suite in the North Tower. I was pleasantly surprised and delighted at my good fortune at the start of my trip. the 1 bedroom suite is BEAUTIFUL!! After getting up to my room, changing, I set out to investigate what else the hotel had to offer. The shark tank in the middle of the pool was pretty impressive (and the water slide is great fun for kids of all ages), the hotel itself is very well taken care of and it shows. I decided to dine at Red Sushi located a few steps from the casino floor, and as a sushi lover I have to say the food was impeccable and the service excelllant, I felt like a queen. I checked out the nightclub Gold Diggers that was fun for dancing and people watching from the balcony that overlooks Freidmont Street. The casino is spacious but not enormous which was fine with me. I had breakfast at the buffet the next morning, the omelette station was very good as was their overall selections. My waiter, even though it was a buffet, was very attentive. I was sorry to checkout later that day, but I will definately return to The Golden Nugget , it's wonderful staff, and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel In The Crown”
Reviews.Author: Shazar
Reviews.Content: Just back from another excellent stay at the Golden Nugget. This is the 3rd time we have stayed there and you will not get better value anywhere in Vegas, the US or Europe. We have travelled far and wide and no where is as good as the Golden Nugget. We were last there in October last year and it has improved even since then. The new Gold Diggers club and bar over looking Fremont Street are great. The staff in the hotel as so helpful and Gabriel at the pool even remembered us from our last visit. Impressive customer recognition or what! We paid around £700 for a 2 week stay, which is less than half the cost of a reasonable strip hotel. BTW the pool is amazing! The poker scene there is amazing too - we met Daniel Negranu, Phil Ivey and others playing poker in the Golden Nugget - totally awesome. The atmosphere in the Golden Nugget is always electric and the entertainment on Fremont Street is great everynight. The convenience of being able to cross the street in a comfort to another casino without the red hot sun beating down or the heat hitting you in the face is great. The choice of restaurants on in the Nugget and on Fremont Street is amazing. If the buffet is busy we recommend Jillians at the East Fremont end of the street for a great steak and cold beer. You can get a game of pool or do some bowling there too, if you want a break from the slots etc. I cannot recommend this hotel more highly - just go there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: iluvvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget for 5 nights over the July 4th holiday weekend. Arrived around 11:45pm and waited 15 minutes to check in. Only one person was helping ‘regular’ guests check-in, while another 2 people helped the VIP guest line. Got to the front and was told they had no king n/s rooms left. She kept looking, and magically found a king n/s room in the South tower. Fine with us, that’s what we paid for and we didn't want to pay $50 extra for the North tower rooms. Headed off to the room, 4th floor facing away from the construction, and walked in to a room that was completely under construction. Mattress was leaning against the wall, headboard was leaning up against the bathroom, drawers were pulled out of the nightstand, etc. Ugghhh, how frustrating at midnight!! Went back to the front desk and explained to the same girl the room fiasco and she was very apologetic. She upgraded us to a North tower Gold Club room for our entire stay! Our gold club room was on the 12th floor, mixed in with the regular North tower rooms. We were not on the VIP floors. The room was awesome...a comfy bed with fresh linens and lots of pillows, a modern bathroom with a tv in the mirror, a corner seating area and a 42" flat panel TV. The a/c worked perfectly and kept our room nice and cool. Also, our room was about 3 doors from the elevator so it was a very short walk. Ate at the breakfast buffet using a coupon from the booklet at check-in. Very good breakfast and $11 for two of us. I thought it was a great value. Also ate at the cafe for lunch. Salads were huge and very good. Had lunch at The Grotto and enjoyed our meal. They were not busy at all for lunch and the service was excellent! Used both the valet and self-park garage. Valet filled up on the weekend and even hotel guests had to self-park on Saturday night. Asked for a parking voucher at check-in so all we had to do was show that card to get free parking. Overall we were very happy with GN, our room, the staff, the restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Lacrosse-66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. The front desk were not very helpful checking in, sending us to the wrong room twice. We asked for a non-smoking room and ended up on the 12th floor. The hallway was one big smoke ball. Not great. The air conditioner didn't work and they had to bring in a new motor for it. If you stay in this hotel, spend the extra bit of dollars and stay in the North Tower!! By the way , we asked for a free food voucher or something for the hassle and we got nothing. That didn't seem like it should have been a big deal to us, if they wanted to keep their customers happy. Some people seem to get buy one get one free coupons and others didn't for gold diggers. The drinks were 8.25 a drink!!. The strip gives you more value coupons, that is for sure. We didn't even get a free deck of cards... The pool is pretty good, but not as big as it probably should be. The slide is good but you are going so fast you don't even notice you are going through the shark tank. Food is very expensive, we never found a meal under 23 dollars for us two. We thought downtown would be cheaper then that. We actually enjoyed the other casino's like the Plaza and Binions more then the Nugget to gamble in. You could always get your own table. The Nugget is trying to compete with the hotels on the strip and it's not working. They would be better off to just be the nicest hotel downtown.. Overall we did enjoy the Downtown better then the strip, but not sure if we would stay at the Nugget again or try another hotel down there..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Paul5795
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Vegas for seven days over the July 4 holiday. We had been to Vegas before, but always on the Strip, never downtown. So we decided to stay downtown for the first four nights of our stay. After some research, I determined that the Golden Nugget was the only four star hotel downtown. Armed with that info, I was able to get a great price for a holiday weekend -- only $75 a night - on Priceline. We got a room in the (older) South Tower, and based on some other reviews I had read I wasn't sure what to expect, in terms of whether the rooms might be run down or noisy because of ongoing construction near the tower. The room, however, on the 6th floor, was very nice. It was quite large, with only minor wear, and very quiet (even on July 2, when there was construction going on). The pool was nice, but crowded. The breakfast buffet was fantastic -- for only $9.99 we had all sorts of great food, a waffle and omelet station, and unlimited coffee and juice, all in a brand new, renovated restaurant. The prime rib at Tony Roma's across the street from the Nugget was also a good deal. I am a card player. The Nugget poker room was very nice. For blackjack, however, I walked to the casinos at Four Queens and to Fitzgeralds, which were very close to the Nugget, to find the five dollar tables with more favorable rules (e.g., permitting surrender). The Nugget only had ten dollar blackjack tables. One night we went to "Defending the Caveman," a one act play running at the Nugget. This play has been around for awhile, and both my wife and I had seen it before, but it is a fantastic play and very well done at the Nugget. You can get discount tickets to this show, and many others, as well as restaurant discounts, at a "tix4tonight" booth in the Four Queens Casino right next door to the Nugget. Check in and out at the Nugget were very easy, unlike our experience at the Luxor on the strip. But that is another review. Tip: Car rentals are CHEAP in Vegas, and I recommend that you consider that if you want to get around a bit. We got a full size car throught Hotwire for $17 a day. All the casinos have ample free parking (no surprise, eh?) so its easy to access them all by car travel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely surprised by the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: stkn1
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of the Golden Nugget only after I booked a room for my two almost-grown children and myself in the south tower. The reviews I had read regarding the more affordable south tower of the Golden Nugget were not good. I was pleasantly surprised, however, when we opened the door to our room. The room was beautifully appointed and clean. The beds were so comfortable I couldn't believe it. I've never stayed in a hotel where the beds were so nice. The pillows can be exchanged for feather pillows at no additional charge, but we didn't feel the need to do that because they were comfortable, too. The bathroom was nice and the dressing table outside of the bathroom was a luxury since I had my teenage daughter with me. The pool is beautiful, but a little small. It also closes around 8pm nightly, which we thought was way too early. Customer service in the hotel is quite good. One word of caution: The food at the hotel buffet is not good, it tastes like you are eating a bad frozen dinner. However, there is a restaurant in the hotel, Carson Street Cafe, that I recommend. They are open 24 hours, serve breakfast around the clock, the food is delicious and the servings are huge. Oh, yeah, the prices are reasonable, too. The fitness room and spa areas are gorgeous, top-of-the-line facilities, but they charge you an extra $20 per day to use them. Bottom line: The Golden Nugget is great, but I didn't like the pool hours, the buffet food or the extra spa charges. Additionally, they charged me an extra $20 per day to add my 18 year old son to our stay even though he was the second adult.(my daughter is still considered a child.)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Bell Desk!”
Reviews.Author: SummerVaca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to Las Vegas with our two children for the fourth of July weekend, and were suprised to find out when we got checked in, that the pool was CLOSED- because of a private party. IN THE DEAD OF SUMMER?? The next day we wanted to get some ideas on what we should do for the 4th; after all, the kids wanted to see fireworks. We called the operator, who told us the fireworks will be set off all over the strip- WRONG. Then we called the front desk who informed us that they had no idea where the fireworks will be, and transfered me to the bell desk. The young girl that i spoke with was VERY informed on when and where fireworks will be at- a breath of fresh air! Later on we wanted to find a good mexican restaurant in the area- and once again the bell desk was there to the rescue. This hotel seems to rely greatly on the knowledge of the Bell- Desk, as did we. We called down repeatedly for advice, and was never steered wrong. Overall- i don't know what our vacation would have been like if the helpful individuals at the bell desk werent there for us.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget-Best of a Sad Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: red8sox
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and this time I decided to stay downtown, hoping to experience something different from the strip. Downtown is fun for about a night, but it really is a rough, somewhat sad place to spend more than a day or two. I stayed four nights at the Golden Nugget, and it definitely is the nicest hotel in the area, but the problem is that the area is full of degenerate drunks, homeless people and other various vagrants. The pool is way, way to small for all the people trying to get in. I saw hundreds of people trying to find chairs while I was there. People would stand and wait for others to leave, and it created a tense feeling for everyone. I also found the tiny downtown casinos to be far too crowded and much smokier than the strip casinos. I think the very low ceilings has a lot to do with this. Comps are also nearly non-existent at the Golden Nugget, surprising for this type of an establishment. I guess the biggest difference is that people staying downtown seem to be much more hard-core drinkers and gamblers and the strip is more about having better food, nicer rooms, bigger pools, etc. I just found the downtown area to be a place that brought some of the bad things about Vegas more to light, things that the strip is better able to hide. I would not stay downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “improved a lot”
Reviews.Author: dolphinboy1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the nugget for a few days down town before hitting the strip. we didnt have the best last time so we thought we would try again. it was much better, the check in was good and the room was clean and comfortable (north tower). the only downside was the attitude of the casino host. we wanted to play large and would have liked comps, but she wasnt having any, so we took our gaming to another casino. the other downside is the pool, im not exagerating when i say it nice and all that with the sharks ect, but come the middle of the day you are right on top of the person next to you. there is just no room. all the sunloungers are crammed together. so be warned, you wanna go by the pool? be early and be prepared to be squashed. otherwise a great stay. and ideal for down town.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jwinn
Reviews.Content: First off, we booked this through Priceline and got an amazing deal. It is the only four star hotel downtown, so when you are bidding you know which one your bidding on when you narrow done the criteria. The hotel isn't one of the luxurious ones on the strip but it is deffinetly the nicest downtown and nicer then most in Vegas. Nice casino, great pool, great rooms. It is a few steps from Bennions, The Four Queens, and Harrahs, all downtown. We rented a car; most hotels offer free parking and the Nugget allows guest to park for free. I would recommend the Golden Nugget to family and friends. Also, if you like the Beatles, and who doesn't, you have to see LOVE...it will change your life.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: hollymist
Reviews.Content: Hotel right next to the Fremont St Experience, it is however off the strip and a bit close to some seedy joints. The hotel itself of high spec as was the room, furnished to a high standard and comfort. There was a problem with the plumbing - the bath filled up when showering and there was some back flow problems with the toilet. Staff not particularly helpful and kept waiting an age to check in. No free wi-fi like everything else in Vegas your expected to pay a premium!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: CrazyinCA
Reviews.Content: The best thing the Golden Nugget has going for them is the Valet parking crew. These guys were awsome. They hustled like no other. Always asked if we needed directions, had the air running and they were so polite and full of personality. The bartenders should take a lesson from them. Bartenders at the casino bars were stingy on the drinks. One guy even said only one drink per person for free. I had never heard of that before. Agree with others about South tower. A little dingy and the time share peeps do drive you craaaazy. We found the maid service to be much better than other reviewers. Biggest gripe was the pool area. Very crowded and I believe that if they truly checked pool keys the crowds would have diminished. Seems like any one who wanted to could get access to the pool during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Focus on the little guy”
Reviews.Author: joeca2dal
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in I inquired about the bonus package that I thought would be given to everyone that checked into the hotel, I was told only people who booked with selected online travel sites were elegible. Other things that were bothersome was having to pay for local calls and also paying to use the computer for travel arrangements. The Golden Nugget is a very clean and fancy hotel, but they don't seem to cater to the person who wants to gamble a couple of hundred bucks. I don't believe I would stay there on my next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine at the Nuggett”
Reviews.Author: polks71
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Golden Nugget was pretty much what we were looking for. It was not perfect but it nice. When we arrived the check in was prompt and the front desk staff were very friendly. Our room was nicely decorated and clean. The bed was probably the best bed we have slept on in a hotel. The pillows were terrible though, but we requested feather pillows and they were promptly brought up which made a huge difference. The air conditioner was loud, not insanely loud, but loud enough. I found that if I pushed two chairs up against it the rattling stopped. There were a couple of other quirks but they did not distract from the niceness of the room. The rest of the hotel is nicely kept up and seems maintained pretty well. The restaurants were all very good. We only ate at the buffet for breakfast but it was good. The cafe was a good lunch maybe a bit pricey. The Grotto was a great place for an evening meal. The desserts were great and the service excellent. The staff that we encountered all seemed friendly and helpful. The housekeeping did a good job keeping our room clean. I will say that I like staying off the strip. When we were on the strip during the evening/night the atmosphere turned into too much of a party atmosphere for our tastes. When we got back to the Golden Nugget there was plenty going on but we did not have the "club" atmosphere. The hotel does show it's age in some ways but you can tell that they are working to improve the place and keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “a+++ stay at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: daisy91
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas 7 times and The Golden Nugget is one of the hotels that is at the top of my list. We really enjoyed the shark swimming pool. The rooms were very large and nice. Make sure you stay in the north tower if you book there because it is easy access to the lobby and casino. I dont know if i would stay on fremont st. for a long period of time however because the transportaion to the strip via bus is very slow and taxi cab could get expensive. I would recommend staying a few nights on Fremont st and a few nights on the strip that is what we did and it worked out well. Also just to warn everyone dont be in a hurry to check in at the Nugget because they are very very slow checking you in. I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “not what she used to be”
Reviews.Author: shot2pieces
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget june 25, 26 and 27. We have been staying at this property at least once a year for the last 10 years. i usually book us in the south tower because it is cheaper and very close to the parking garage. The good was that the pool is a very nice pool though way too crowded. Tons of kids [sorry i liked the older kidless Vegas] . The rooms are always nice and clean. I know this sounds nitpicky but they used to have the best bath towels, large and very high quality and now the have regular hotel quality towels. Not a big deal but you pay a little more to stay here and the little perks are nice. Also we went to the breakfast buffett and since they moved it upstairs it has lost its appeal. Too crowded and very limited choices. I do NOT reccommend it. Go to Main Street Station for a much better breakfast buffet. I am sure we will stay here again though as some of the other properties are not as nice and clean and do not have the big rooms the Nuggett offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Blinkybill11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently and thought it was one of the best hotels on our holiday. The rooms were large and very comfortable, the reception staff extremely helpful and the pool was sensational (especially the water slide going through the shark tank). The only thing to be wary of is building works going on next door. I believe they are building a third tower but the noise goes all night. We complained, and were given ear plugs the first night and moved to another quieter room the second night. Despite the noise, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jglaw
Reviews.Content: beware, this hotel is not on 'the strip", but in what is called 'historic downtown', there is a bus connection to the strip, (30 minutes on average, with many stops) HINT if you take a cab: ask for a direct ride, else you will be taken up the highway and pay the double), the hotel is good, we booked a deluxe room in the north tower, but first had an 'unlucky' corner room without view, after complaining we were immediately relocated to a very spacious and nicely decorated room, the hotel has a friendly less nervous atmosphere compared to the powerhouses on the strip, with several good restaurants on site, and a rather small and crowded pool,

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Brought our family to the Nugget for a four-day getaway in May. We had two upgraded rooms and one of the spa suites. It may seem like a lot to pay for a hotel room, but check out the deal you can get on these suites - I'm pretty sure they are half the price of the suites at the Venetian and other hotels on the Strip. And what a room it is! A duplex with a second floor that has a huge master bedroom and a "bathroom" that is larger than most NYC apartments. There are floor to second ceiling windows as the bedroom opens out onto the first floor where you'll find a full-size living room, dining room, and wet bar. We found it was a great place to have a few drinks (just hit a liquor store on your way in from the airport) and practice our poker game before hitting the tables. That is not to say the other rooms weren't also excellent - oversized and recently renovated - just a little dark. Obviously you'll spend most of your time gambling, but that is the great thing about downtown - get bored at the Nugget and you can stroll outside to hit Binions, the Four Queens, or some of the ahem, let's say less glamorous establishments without traveling 15 minutes between casinos like you do on the Strip. That's not to say you shouldn't venture out there are well, either for the spectacles or the food (can't say enough good things about Bouchon at the Venetian - checkout the raw bar or steak frites and revel in Mr. Keller's creations while you're friends sweat it out on the wait lists at Per Se and French Laundry). The buffet at the Nugget wasn't worth it, either for breakfast or dinner, but the coffee shop and noodle restaurant are always good bets. And of course there is the renovated pool complete with shark tank. It may be a little over the top, but it is sooooo much fun. We went down the slide which passes through the tank five times in a row, squealing with delight each time as the sharks and schools of fish passed overhead. Skip the bar drinks out there - way over-priced, unless you're playing at one of the three pool-side card tables. One more suggestion that has nothing to do with the Nugget: visit to the Neon Sign Museum or "bone yard." Volunteers will take you on a one hour tour of the old neon signs of Las Vegas taken down to make room for the new, giving you a healthy dose of history along the way. Makes for a great photo opp and you'll appreciate the restored signs the musuem has installed on Freemont Street even more. Win big and wear sunscreen!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel30
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas on Saturday the 21st of June. We stayed at the Golden Nugget for two nights then transferred to Harrah's on the strip for three nights. It was our first time staying on Fremont St and we loved it. The room was actually bigger and nicer than Harrah's. The breakfast buffet for $9.99 was excellent and we loved the pool and had no trouble at all finding chairs to sit in even in the water. My daughter and son-in-law enjoyed the slide thru the shark tank. There were even $5 blackjack tables at the pool area. Would definitely stay there again. only thing we didn't like was my daughter got a smoking room when they had requested non-smoking and they couldn't change it...Great hotel and casino....

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at The Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganKitty
Reviews.Content: We ( family members ranging from 19 to 78) spent 5 nights in the South Tower part of the Golden Nugget. The ONLY reason I didn't mark excellent for our stay at this elegant hotel is because I wasn't very impressed with the beds. Rather lumpy and I swear even with my pillows I felt like my head was lower than the rest of my body. It's the first time I didn't sleep well my entire stay at a hotel and I've stayed in a lot!! However that negative aside, wow what a place; what a location!! The Tank or what some call the Shark Pool was awesome. The lounge chairs were the most comfortable I've ever sat in at any pool. I had heard some complain that you're "sardined" in at the pool side but I didn't think it was that bad at all. NOTE: If you want to stay out of the sun, I recommend the chairs closest to the hotel windows to the right of the entrance. The pool itself is salt water and quite refreshing in the hot summer sun. Deep enough to swim in which I like. The slide is fun if you want to climb the 3 stories to get to it. I did it once. The music ranges from mostly 80's to current. Great sound system. The drink service is pretty good or you can walk over to the Dive Bar and order. The bathroom at the pool and in the casino were very clean and impressive.The pool is right there next to everything too, so it was very easy to keep track of your party if some were gambling, or in their room or at the pool. Our meeting place became the Pool. Also, they were very strict about checking your room key so not anyone can go into the pool area during the day. Another plus about the pool, was the whole sitting area is open until 1a.m. so parts of our family would just hang out down there and visit in the warm summer breezes, have a few drinks and watch the sharks. Now for the hotel location: Having stayed several times on the Strip, we all are now sold on the downtown atmosphere. There's so much less walking involved going from casino to casino and to restaurants and little souvenir shops. The Goldent Nugget is literally in the middle of all the nightly action. The Fremont experience just rocks!! There's something for everyone, all ages! The service at the Golden Nugget was exceptional. The doormen were great; the gentleman at Check-In was friendly, as was the lady at Check-Out. Our housekeeper was a lot of fun. We visited with her every day and tipped her well. She did a nice job. Oddly enough, as much as I loved the Golden Nugget, I did very little gambling there; I thought the slots rather tight. I did like the fact that the BJ tables at the Pool were only $5. So that was fun, especially in the evening. We also didn't do much dining there. My mom and I ate breakfast once at The Carson Street Cafe. A little pricey for breakfast and not as good as the $4.95 breakfast next door at 4 Queens. My sister and brother and spouses ate at Lillie's Noodle House and were not impressed with the amount of food they got for their $$$. My sons, however, ate several times at the buffet at lunchtime and were quite satisfied with their meal. We stayed on the 21st floor and even with my 78 year old mother, the walk from our rooms, to the elevator, to the casino was not at all bad. I'm sure we walked at least that far when we on the Strip. Our view was the mountains facing west which was breathtaking. The rooms we all had and hallway were always very quiet. Air conditioning worked well as did the TV, though many of us spent very little time watching! Well, hopefully, I've covered everything! Thumbs up all the way for the Golden Nugget and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “ambulance/security”
Reviews.Author: jgieske347
Reviews.Content: my husband fell ill and had to go by ambulance, security made it easy, considering we were sofar from home..also when it was time to come back to the hotel, they even came back and got us! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: armyfamily98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally stay on Fremont Street. We have stayed at the Golden Nugget in the past as well as Fitzgeralds. We were celebrating his re-enlistment in the Army and decided to stay on night on the strip (THEhotel at Mandalay) and the rest of our trip at the VIP Gold Club rooms at the Golden Nugget. I am going to review THEhotel and also Main Street Station in reviews under their headings but they were great. The Golden Nugget, on the other hand, was terrible. I was so upset and let down! The "upgraded" rooms are already showing wear - there was a big spot on our coffee table and scratches everywhere. Front desk was so-so. They put us in a tiny corner room at first and I called and had us switched to what was pictured on the website. There wasn't any sort of an apology or anything. They give you water one night and then the rest you have to fight with everyone else for bottled water that is left out by the elevators (which I don't understand because if someone new was checking in each day, paying our same rate, they would get a new big bottle of water)and food left out and the bowls are open so who knows what kind of germs are there. Housekeeping was so-so. The buffet is WAY overpriced (eat at Main Street for a great buffet or in the Fremont for better deals). What bothered us the most was the terrible service. Random waitresses with attitude (one woman had asked for a lime in her coke and the server walked by, dropped it off sans the lime and the server said "yeah yeah, no lime I will catch it next time" and walked off before the woman even had a chance to speak! Javier at the bar was the saving grace for this place. And the COMPS! Good golly they were terrible! We played less then $300 at Mandalay and walked out several hundred ahead (loved playing there and at the Luxor), we were treated like we really mattered and earned 2 free meals. We spent 3 times that at the Nugget, the Casino Host was rude and we didn't even earn enough points to START the comps!!!!!! Nothing was paying either, not even enough to pass the time. The pool is in the middle of the hotel and so it sucks the wind in. The chair situation is insane with no sort of rhyme or reason. The Spa was alright but showing signs of age and not clean enough for my taste with a rude staff. All in all we will only stay down on the Strip or if we are being budget friendly, we will stay at the Main Street Station on Fremont Street. The Golden Nugget is WAY to big for it's britches and just not even near what it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Was plenty fine”
Reviews.Author: MNJoy
Reviews.Content: Just realized I didn't post a review for this last spring, so will just recount my couple of memories from looking at others' reviews. Stayed with a group of friends for our annual April Vegas trip. Had one of the third-floor South Tower rooms directly next to the huge air conditioners, which I actually liked for the constant white noise but would be lousy for anyone wanting a view. The room was just fine and the walk to the south tower elevators was very short compared to any hotel on the strip. I've never been approached by a time share peddler at a hotel in Vegas (here's the tip if you like to be polite - make eye contact and smile while you're still too far away to be approached, then deliberately look away while you pass them). However, the part of our group which visits Vegas several times each year managed to get upgraded to the VIP rooms for a small charge. Their rooms/views/amenities were great, and there was certainly a difference in the way we were treated by staff for the rest of the stay. The cabana was worth the price to have dedicated space at the pool, along with some shade, a television, a fridge, and attentive servers. Would certainly stay at the Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “A May vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lynnatron
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas many times. We were married there and stayed at the Golden Nugget. This year we decided to go with another couple. Disappointed at the hotel, the front desk was rude to us. On the day we were checking out, I was going to call for a late check-out. The front desk said earlier when we had arrived that it would be no problem. Well, it was, I called that morning and they were booked. We had a late flight so, we really wanted the late check-out, lack of communication and respect on the hotels part. The pool was awesome, we enjoyed that. The weather was great in May.

Reviews.Title: “Viva The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Ennisgirl1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas several times as we have family living there. This trip came as a last minute decision - booked 10 days before we travelled. We decided to stay downtown this year as our relatives live closer to this end and driving in to meet us would be easier for them and there would be no traffic like on the strip. We can't say enough about this hotel. The room was very big with a huge bed. The bathroom was lovely with a separate vanity area. The hotel has every service you could ever need and staff are so eager to help. The pool with the shark tank running through it is so cool. It was lovely so sit by the pool with a drink on a comfy sofa and relax. Restaurants are top quality with excellent service. I truly can't recommend this hotel enough. I don't think I'll ever stay on the strip again - excpet my 10th wedding anniversary where we have a suite booked at the Venetian. One nice incident - the day we checked out we packed out gear and went out for breakfast. We had a lot of change in our pockets that we were sick of hauling around so we left it in the ashtray for the housekeeping ladies. There was probably €30-€40. When went and had a sumptuous breakfast (airline food being all we'd get for the rest of the day) and came back to get our bags and leave. On entering the room we found it spotless as usual and the bags were neatly left against the wall for us. I went around to check we hadn't forgotten anything and that's when I saw it. The housekeeping ladies had written us a thank you note for the change we left them. This was a first for me - when we have stayed on the strip before we were robbed blind. Cosmetics, shoes & items of clothing were taken at various times, now I'm getting a thank you note. This is one of those things that restores your faith in humanity. We will definately be staying here again and would recommend you all give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler123
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was much more than expected. For the price I didn't expect much. The rooms were clean and updated. The staff was pleasant. Self parking was close and easy. The Tank was wonderful. We were always able to find a lounge chair. We did stay midweek. The only problem for us was the restrictions on the water slide. 48" height requirement. Children cannot go down on a parent's lap and life jackets cannot be worn. They were strict about this. Room key is required to enter the pool. Will definently stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Love Downtown”
Reviews.Author: DisneyBaby2006
Reviews.Content: I own at the Grandview in Las Vegas, and while staying there for my week, I opted to leave a day early to enjoy Fremont for the night. It was so nice to have a room upstairs and all of this entertainement so close. I truly enjoy Fremont more than the strip, had already done all my shopping and sightseeing, and this night was just for checking out the slots and enjoying the Fremont experience. Check in was OK, my clerk was not very cordial, but the lady next to him (checking in my aunt and uncle) was awesome, so I chalk it up to one unfriendly person). After checking in, I immediately went to enjoy the pool, while my family looked around. It was great, would have been better with some girlfriends with me (I was travelling with family, all older than me), but I decided to just go enjoy anyway. So I grabbed a magazine, a margarita (the pool bar was very generous with the tequila) and settled in for a couple of hours of sun. Later on, we went to Main Street for a very good buffet, and then enjoyed the lights on Fremont. After all were in bed, I stayed up until 3, playing the slots and people watching. I felt very safe wandering Fremont, even on my own....more so than I ever would have on the strip. Our room (south tower) was very nicely appointed, clean, and with great toiletries. My only regret was catching my plane home in the morning. When I return to Las Vegas to use my time share, I will definitely talke a night to stay downtown. And only at the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, even comes with brass donkeys!”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas on business fairly often. The Nugget is in a fun, vibrant, younger, and somewhat more "locals" area than the famed Strip. There is a lot of cool nighttime streetlife going on here, and other interesting hotels, restaurants, and bars/clubs surround it. You can watch street performers and musicians, video projections, and more out on the sidewalk at any time of night. The Nugget is finely furnished and lavishly decorated, very clean, with a nice staff. We once were put into a huge room with an insanely high ceiling and a pair of life-size-esque brass donkeys standing guard on either side of the in-room fireplace. It is the kind of place with golden silk tassels on the thick tapestried drapes and throw pillows. Makes you feel like a high roller for a few nights even if you're not. it also displays the world's largest natural gold nugget, its claim to fame. We have had a great experience every time we've stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facility”
Reviews.Author: daniherr
Reviews.Content: Clean, secure, well kept hotel & casino! Rooms are quiet and comfortable Friendly, helpful staff. Great location for observing the Fremont street experience! Fast check in & check out. Plenty of free parking for guests. Pool is awesome! Found hotel coupons useful! Negatives:No coffee in room,many timeshare sales people at entrances. Great value and had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: barbaradixon
Reviews.Content: We loved the Golden Nugget last year, so decided to another 5 day trip to Vegas. Price can't be beat, and we love being downtown. We've stayed in South Tower both times, the rooms are cheaper. The Nugget is perfect. It's very clean, rooms are spacious and well appointed, staff is helpful, pool area is great, breakfast buffet is really good. In other words, nothing is lacking. My personal taste is light, tropical and minimal. But this is Vegas, land of excess, so the room decor is red and gold, lots of prints, etc. Nope, not my taste, but everything is clean and in perfect condition. I read a complaint about the bathroom. NO WAY. It's all marble and ceramic, lots of big fluffy towels, lots of soap and shampoo, even body lotion. Shower has great water pressure. Can't imagine anyone complaining. Only complaint about the pool is that about 9 a.m. everyone throws towels and books on the chairs, then when people actually go to the pool around noon nothing is available. I wish the pool staff could somehow stop this practice. Downtown is our preferred place, but it dosn't have the glitz and glitter of the strip, so if you decide to stay downtown, remember it's quite simple.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: FTAListCom
Reviews.Content: We booked our Golden Nugget stay as part of a whirlwind tour of some of Las Vegas's best pools. The GN has The Tank, a pool that surrounds an aquarium filled with large fish and sharks. Only a thin, clear barrier sits between you in the water and the shark swimming at you. The Tank also includes a water slide of moderate length and only a couple of twists, but its highlight is a clear section that runs through the center of the shark aquarium. There are some decent waterfalls, and a section of the pool is permanently shaded by the second and third levels of the pool complex. We got a great price for our mid-week visit. The south tower room is a bit of a walk, but it was certainly no further away from the action than some of the strip megaresorts. The room was large enough and clean enough, except for a bit of mold in the shower. The TV showed only a dozen or so channels. Comparing the pool to the others in our tour, the drinks and amenities were nicely priced, and a slide of any kind is great for the kids. Going face-to-face with toothy sharks was a unique thrill. But after that's all said, the pool is a little small. My sunburned back was grateful for the shade, though. Valet parking is friendly and convenient for check-in, and self-parking puts you near the south tower elevators. The second-floor buffet had the best bread pudding we've eaten in a while (the bourbon sauce was what made it special), but the buffet seemed a bit pricy for the relatively ordinary selections at dinner. Of course, the best part of the GN is that it's downtown. In a short walk, you can pass competing (read: inexpensive) souvenir/sundry sellers, hop between casinos, and watch the Fremont Street Experience at night. We also went bowling at Jillians at Neonopolis. To sum it up, the GN showed us a good time at a reasonable price. For slightly upscale service, it's one of the best values in town.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed in our room!”
Reviews.Author: jbarshaw
Reviews.Content: We were 6 women on a girls weekend and we were robbed in our room. The management lied to us, refused to compensate us in any way and asked us if we had left our door open! They did an investigation only after we wrote several letters to the owners which showed that the only people in our room besides us were the maids and they closed the investigation! They say they satisfied their legal requirements, but we have never even received an apology! The 4 diamond status is a JOKE.

Reviews.Title: “Mom loves Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: scnursecat
Reviews.Content: My mom wanted to go to Vegas for Mother's day. While we were planning our trip, I received a letter from the Golden Nugget. My boyfriend and I stayed there in Feb. and for the most part had a good experience. I was informed that I had earned comps for two nights, so I booked a extra night. I'm really glad we decided to stay at Golden Nugget. My mom had a blast. The staff was super friendly. I've seen a lot of people complain about downtown but for us ,it worked out well. We spent the better part of the day on the strip and came back at night to see the lightshow and listen to the live entertainment. The bus stop was just two blocks away, and we had fun just riding and seeing the sights on our way to the strip. I would stay at Golden Nugget again on my next trip to Vegas, even without the comp.

Reviews.Title: “What I expected”
Reviews.Author: lvfan26
Reviews.Content: This hotel for being in Downtown Las Vegas is pretty decent. easy to get in and out of. The Bathrooms need major help they are in need of redecorating it's pathetic when I got in the shower I was scared I was going to slip the bottom of the tub curves in and the shower head is in need of Lime away it is crusted with limescale!! but other then that the carpet looks nice and basically new the beds were a bit firm bit seemed new I just thought the decorum was tacky flowers and flannel like print don't quite match great view of the Binion Tower where we could see the time and what the weather was like and you could see the Fremont Experiance (that is a whole other story)

Reviews.Title: “Best Rooms Downtown”
Reviews.Author: GrayWolf5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the North Tower - only problem was at check-in - they wanted to put us in a room directly behind the elevators 15th floor - which we didn't want - 3 hours later we received a room on the 5th floor. Didn't hear any noise from the constuction as we were on the side away from that. Rooms have been updated - have 42" lcd tv's. If you don't want the bed turndown service I suggest you leave the do not disturb sign on your door at night. The Golden Nugget has the best rooms downtown for sure - its our #1 choice but only if the price is right. We enjoy downtown more than the strip - once you have seen the strip - its all the same inside - they just want your $$$. Downtown is a easy walk between casinos and lots happening on Fremont Street at night. Oh and your money goes farther downtown. The North Tower rooms are better than the South Tower for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDowntown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget in May for 1 week. First time staying downtown. The hotel room where great, in the south tower, but very long distance from main hotel and casino. The pool area is poor and wouldn't stay there again. Very small area and chairs too close to each other. We arrived by limo at the main door, and found it difficuilt for old people to get our luggage in that door with No ramp. The meals we ate there at the buffet and resturants where OK and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Best Value!”
Reviews.Author: mynikko
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget Hotel locates in downtown Las Vegas and is one of the older hotels compared to the ones on the Strip, but I think the management did a good job trying to reform Golden Nugget. If you walk around and see through the other hotels on Fremont Experience, you will notice that Golden Nugget is by far the best quality hotel in downtown area. I have stayed in Bellagio and TI, and I would choose Golden Nugget over those two hotels given the price difference. In Bellagio and TI, I felt neglected but in Golden Nugget, the staff is extremely friendly that makes you feel at home. The staff even apologized to me when I lost US$40. The facilities and room are newly renovated and clean. The swimming pool is nice with a fun water slide through a giant fish tank. The coupon book for the guests is by far the best value I have seen: Lunch buffet for US$12 for two people (US$6 dollar each!!), Free US$10 slot play, Free US$10 poker play (with US$50 buy-in). Even the shops in the lobby will not rip you off. I compared the prices and gladly found that they only charge about 50 cents more than Walgreens. Yes, downtown is a bit far from the Strip, but double decked bus (the deuces) runs 24 hours a day for $5. I would not pay extra US$100 just for the location; in fact, I get better services here in Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kersieboom
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel has the most amazing buffet, the food was great and definitely worth spending on average $10.99, go at lunch time you get the most value for money. Our room didn’t have the greatest views, but was always clean and comfortable. We had a few issues with broken things and our plumbing. With both the bath and the sink plug holes we had problems with stuff coming up out of them, and in one case it was … well we’re not entirely sure what it was but it was green and disgusting, definitely not something you want to see when you are brushing your teeth! But we called maintenance and they came out almost immediately and we didn’t have any more problems with them after that. The general ambience and quality of our stay far outweighed any problems we encountered, and I would definitely stay there again. The pool and spa were beautiful, but more for adults than children (although there is a shark tank and slide by the pool to keep kids happy). The hotel is located on Fremont Street, and it is a very upbeat area to stay, and you benefit from the cheaper prices by not being on the strip. It is only a $20 cab trip down to the strip, so you don’t feel too far away from everything. True Story.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: TheLouTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget 5/11 thru 5/14 and really enjoyed it. We upgraded to the North Tower penthouse and were really happy. When you do that, they comp you passes to "The Spa" which normally cost $20 just to enter! The buffet food was delicious and Vic and Anthony's was 5 star. The pool/hot tub/shark tank/slide/poolside bar was very nice, but get there early to get a seat. Slots really paid (try Powerball) The only downside was the construction of the third tower behind the pool. Construction is 24/7 and VERY LOUD overnight. I can still here the "beeep, beeeep, beeeeep" from the bulldozers backing up! In general, the hotel/casino staff was friendly and helpful. They must have gotten wind that they were getting poor reviews. Make sure you get to the Premiere Outlet Mall - we cleaned up over there at "Wal-mart" prices!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but not on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cmd123
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to LV, and we met our son and daughter in law there. They always stay at the Golden Nugget, and so we stayed there as well. We understand that the hotel has been recently renovated, and we thought our room was terrific. It was large, very well appointed and very quiet. The hotel has put in a water slide that goes through a shark tank, which is a great fav with the kids. They give you a coupon book that contains buy-one-get-one-free coupons for the breakfast buffet and one of the other restaurants, as well as other discounts. It's important to note that the GN is not on the strip, but on Freemont Street in the old section. To get to the strip, you have to either take a bus (cheap but it takes forever), or a taxi. The taxi rides averaged about $20 for the 4 of us, each way. However, we only paid $186 for 2 nights at the GN. Rates at the strip hotels are far higher, and we figured we could take a lot of taxis for what we saved. Our son also likes the fact that the minimums at the tables in the Freemont Street area are much lower than those at the strip casinos. All in all, we thought this was a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at nugget”
Reviews.Author: bigfatposterman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at the nugget in early may. we arrived early 10am and got our room right away. the room was not bad, older and not redone but perfectly clean and fine for the few hours you spend in your room. We ate mostly on the strip but did eat at the grotto one night. the grotto was great and i would recommend it. the service was excellent and desert was best part of menu. The pool scene at the nugget is good as well, similar to many of the strip hotels given the bar and gambling at poolside. swimming up to the aquariam is fun and there are a ton of fish and sharks to see. the bar and hot tub are open till 2am which is nice because you can have a drink before going out for the night.. the only problem is it is hard to find a seat at the pool since people come early and place towels on the chairs and seem to never return.... the gaming floor is the nicest of the downtown casinos but obviously older than the strip hotels. never a problem to find an available table though. no problems with any staff. food is cheaper downtown so it is easy to eat something quick and cheap during the day. i would stay at the nugget again., just wish they had some transportation service dropping you at the strip but oh well.....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Construction!”
Reviews.Author: jaszica
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is a wonderful hotel. Once the construction is completed, I would highly recommend it. Right now - be warned. The construction started at 2am and we were awoken repeatedly by drilling and the sound of trucks reversing. It was worse when they had workers hammering on the outside of our window (working on the plastering and pannels) at 6:50am. If you do go, ensure you get a room far from the construction. There were many people asking to switch rooms as we checked out. Thankfully, we only stayed one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: chocopenguin
Reviews.Content: Went here for christmas/ birthday celebration last year...the hotel was more than i expected to be...i got to stay in the older tower, but my room was super excellent....except the view of other hotels' rooftop. But other than that, it was awesome. Clean room, nice bathroom, super comfortable bed, and the coolest of all....bathrobes!! I felt like Ric flair for the entire weekend I was there. Woo! Definitely recommend this property to anyone who's looking for the best in downtown Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Shame about the Construction”
Reviews.Author: scubastarlet
Reviews.Content: Loved the Golden Nugget, great hotel for my first stay in Vegas, as it may not be on the strip, but the bus is so cheap it doesn't matter! Standard room, you get what you pay for, it was clean and nice. The pool is small but pretty cool as the aquarium is in the middle of it and the waterslide goes right through it! However we did have a few problems, checking in and out and speaking to the concierge involves queuing quite a bit. The maid (hopefully accidentally - ie when changing the bed sheets) stole my friend's t-shirt that she was sleeping in and she really had to fight to get anyone to apologise or offer a replacement! AND THE MOST IMPORTANT THING - THERE ARE NO CONSTRUCTION LAWS IN VEGAS - THEY ARE ALLOWED TO BUILD 24 HOURS A DAY and sadly we were right next to the construction site. Drilling started at 5am and never stopped. There were nights were it was just impossible to get to sleep. So ask for a room near the top where apparently it's quieter as we were on a lower floor, or check to see if they've finished building next door. Also don't listen to the concierge about trips to the Grand Canyon, we found much much cheaper better ones over the internet (actually using Tripadvisor and Google).

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a cruise ship on land!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTraveldog
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to LV and I was told that it was a lot like a cruise ship on land. BIG difference! The casino and shows were fun, but the staff could care less about you or your needs. Don't ask for an extra towel at the pool or you will get a resounding "No" without explanation. Don't sit at the casino bar without gambling or the bar staff will ignore you. There were a few friendly staff members, particularly the housekeeping folks. It was very obvious that those who were friendly and welcoming, were so simply because they were nice people and NOT because they were trained or encouraged to make the customers feel like guests. I will be going back to LV for next years conference, but I will stay on the strip and see if the nicer hotels are more accomodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Club rooms are the way to go”
Reviews.Author: sauceontheside
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a gold club room and it was really, really nice. It includes access to the gym and wireless. We love it downtown. You don't have to deal with the long walks, wind, sun, traffic lights. It is one huge party just steps away from your room. We love the Golden Nugget and always stay there when downtown. Two things I didn't like about the room: No central air but a noisy air conditioner that ran 24/7 and bathtub design is a little difficult to get in and out of even for the most agile person. I feel sorry for the maids having to climb in and out of there to clean it. The maid service was excellent, but there were room service trays constantly in the hallway that seemed it took hours and hours to get picked up. We went to the gym daily but didn't go to the pool much. We found a great liittle Hawaiian style restaurant in the skywalk corridor between Main Street Station -- great architecutre and a must see that used to be a train station -- and the California. It's called Aloha Specialty Restaurant and it is cheap and good! If you like rice bowls and soups, then this is the place. I had kalua pig with cabbage, rice and macaroni salad for like eight bucks and it was delicious. We discovered it late but would have eaten there daily. Also, there is a place on Briger Street called Luca's that I heard is excellent but only open breakfast, lunch as they cater to the downtown workers. Back to the Golden Nugget. It's always going to be our favorite and I know there's some construction issues but we didn't have any of those. I think you want to avoid the south tower and parts of the north tower. Gold club rooms are in the North Tower, so choose your room carefully if staying there. I think the one side of the gold club rooms have some construction issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: Texlogic
Reviews.Content: Overall the Golden Nugget gives you a great value for your dollar. It is an older Vegas hotel that gives you very large rooms at a good price. They have renovated the North Tower rooms (which are more expensive), along with the shark tank and swimming pool area. Some of the rooms have a great view of the mountains or the Las Vegas strip, but not all. There is some construction that is going on around the hotel 24 hours a day, which caused a problem for my friends in other rooms, but my room was quiet. The hotel is located in the old downtown area which is away from the craziness of the strip. It is still, however, a very busy place with slot machines and an in-house casino. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The service was very good and friendly. The only real problem that I encountered is that they seem to have a problem with the hotel room door keys. Both my travel partners and I had problems with our keys not working. I would definitely recommend the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: fonda2008
Reviews.Content: Loved the golden nugget!!! plenty to do and see in the hotel and seemed to be the best of the hotels in the downtown/freemont street area of Vegas. Pool area was very good but hard to get a sun lounger on a very hot day!!! Casino itself was very nice with plenty of choice for gambling!!! Rooms in the hotel were nice, very clean with some good views. Only bad points about the hotel were the internet and phone charges, internet in the room on the telly was absolutly terrible and had to be paid for!! Othere bad thing tis the distance from the strip, the only real way down and back was by taxi and this will cost you 20 dollars a go, the only other thing is drink and food are cheaper dwntown were the golden nugget is located

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Downtown Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DHuggins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our stay at this Hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent and when I realised it was not on the strip I was a little apprehensive to say the least. But i needn't have worried.... This hotel is a gem! We stayed for a week from April 10th to 17th and when we arrived at 2pm we were served straight away at the check-in desk, and were in our room within 5 minutes. Our room was on the 19th floor of the south tower and it was very nice and clean (see pics). We didn't hear any construction noise. The room had a big bed with plenty of blankets (not that you need them!), a colour TV with a few basic channels, Internet connection ($12.99 for 24 hours) and a very nice bathroom with shower, hairdryer and marble floors. There was also an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe. In the hotel there are a couple of decent restaurants, The Grotto was our favourite with it's reasonably priced Italian food. There are also two Starbucks. The only problem we encountered was the Time Share People who linger outside the elevators just waiting to catch your eye and hound you. My advice is to either ignore them and walk as fast as you can, or pretend you don't speak English (I knew my GCSE German would come in handy one day!). My husband and I hired a car for the week so we were never too far from the fun and games on the strip. But even if you don't do that, Downtown Las Vegas is still a fab way to spend a few days in this fantastic city, and we will definitely stay here again! P.S, if you want a FANTASTIC cooked breakfast, go across into Binions Coffee Shop. Their Big Breakfast is de-lish and really cheap too. xxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experiance”
Reviews.Author: Comanderkody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget 5/4 - 5/7. My only compliant is that we did not get the room we wanted because Continental Airlines screwed up the flights and we arrived 7 hours late. (Avoid Continental's Newark hub at all costs.) The GN called the next day to move us to the room we requested but we were only there two more nights and wanted to avoid the hassel. Everything else about the hotel was wonderful. The whole place was very clean. The service was excellent. The pool was very nice with the 'tank' and waterslide. The pool area is small with lots of shade but if you were only there a few hours each day it was not a problem. We stayed in a basic room in the south tower and it was more than adequate. Plenty of space with a nice bathroom. The south tower is farthest from the casino and main exit so anyone who has trouble getting around should request north tower. There were people selling timeshares next to the south tower elevators that were not as big a nuisance as others have made it out to be. The only restaurant we ate at was the breakfast buffet and it was pretty good. I normally don't like buffets so I would not be a very good critic. The Fremont street experience was a nice touch. The light show was fun and the entertainment was very good. We mostly gambled at night anyway so we caught most of it moving between casino's. All in all Fremont street was very clean and safe with lots of security. We took the 'duece' bus back and forth to the strip. It was cheap, pretty convenient and took about 45 minutes. We walked to the terminal to catch the bus, instead of the end of Fremont street, and were one of the first people on so we could get the upper deck, front seat. You get a great view so it makes the ride more enjoyable. All in all the hotel was very nice, downtown was a good place to gamble with plenty of cheap tables, and we saw all the strip we wanted to. Love the Nugget and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “May 2008 weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Gold Club Room May 3 - 5. We did VIP check-in to the Gold Club rooms and there was no line. The VIP attendants were very nice. Elevators are 30 feet down the hallway from the lobby and only steps away from the casino – really a nice change from the huge strip properties. Gold Club Rooms are brand new and were $240/$220 per night on Sat/Sun. These rooms are beautiful and the hallway was quiet. Warning - my opinion of the room has a lot of “buts”. We loved the look of the room – dark brown with a leather couch, chair and ottoman, mood lighting (kinda dark), nice bed with upgraded linens, Ipod docking station, plasma TV, DVD player, safe, etc. We thought the bed was really comfortable (on the firm side) but the five pillows were unbelievable soft and I had to use three just to get any neck support (they looked brand new but compressed flat with any pressure). There were lots of decorative pillows on the bed and one weird fake fur “roll”. Ewww. That one was thrown onto the couch where it stayed the rest of the time. The AC in the room worked great but was loud (older beneath the window unit). The bathroom was gorgeous but was not planned well. I understand they only had so much space to work with since the hotel is old. The closet is behind the bathroom door and has two double doors, so the three doors competed for space – you had to choose which you wanted open since all three was not an option. The bathrobes were a nice touch and the in-mirror TV was great, although you really had to stand to see the screen due to the glare. The ceramic sinks sit on top of the marble vanity and have cool faucets. There are shelves underneath and towels were plentiful and somewhat plush. There is a lighted makeup mirror along with a chair and knee space. The toilet is not in a separate area and is less than eight inches from the bathtub – kinda awkward. The tub was a disappointment, although it looked really cool. It was an enclosed tub with a door that looks like it should slide open but doesn’t – it swings open and gets in the way in the already narrow bathroom. You have to step into the deep tub and it is awkward and seems a little dangerous – plus you have to get into the tub to turn on the water unless you have very long arms.. The bottom of the tub was rough and not pleasant for a bath. The rainshower fixture was nice but you couldn’t turn it on and get out of the way, so be prepared to get wet immediately. The toiletries were very nice G & S products. We didn’t have enough time to take advantage of most of the room amenities (DVD player, spa access, etc) but the bottled water and morning coffee in the elevator lobby was nice. They also have snacks (M & Ms, nuts, raisinettes and fruit) but it was self serve and did not have any napkins or plates, so you know people were putting their hands into the bowls, so we passed on those. For some reason, the construction crew worked all night on Sunday night (and loudly, with even a concrete hammer) – very annoying but we thankfully had some earplugs in our bags. Surely they get lots of complaints about that but I’m not sure what could be done, other than providing ear plugs, ambient noise machines or window seals.
