Some advance warning would have been nice since it caught us by surprise. We liked the vibe in the Nugget casino and they had $5 tables open during the day. We did 95% of our gambling there for the weekend. Some dealers were great and others didn’t seem happy at all. That was the recurring theme here. You would see one in perhaps four employees that seemed happy, the rest were either blah or even kinda rude. Maybe they are experiencing cutbacks (we didn’t ask) The pit CWs were great but the slots CWs were few and far between. We went for very casual food this time. Grotto was not packed at 8pm on a Saturday night yet the service wasn’t good at all and everyone seemed in a bad mood. The food was extremely good, though – if the atmosphere would have been better, this would have been a great meal and decently priced ($70). The Carson Street Café had good, dependable food (we had breakfast on Sunday and salads the next day). Prices are OK and they have an extensive selection but again, the wait staff just didn’t seem to be into it. The view of the pool from one section was really nice and we never had a wait. Fremont Street wasn’t crowded at all, even on Saturday night. We saw two light shows (the Queen tribute was great) and watched two bands and one saxophonist. Nice vibe early on, but drunks prevailed the later it got. The pool area at the Nugget was gorgeous. The new waterfall/slide/shark tank is brilliant. I wish it had more room since the place was packed both days. Maybe the new portion of the hotel will provide more sunbathing room – the chairs took up all the space and every one of them were full. There is a new portion of the casino in a hallway leading to where the new wing will be connected – and a sushi restaurant called Red is right in front of the doors. We played the Golden Monkey machines here both days (won the $25 progressive, but at $1.25 a pull, we put it all back in) but never saw the sushi place open. Checkout was at noon on Sunday and the VIP pointed us to the host’s office before we settled up. They comped the Saturday night room and the Carson Street Café ticket for us and offered a lunch comp, but we were already full from breakfast. It wasn't our most fun trip but we did enjoy ourselves. We wouldn't hesitate to return to the Nugget, but I'm not sure the Gold Club rooms are worth the extra $$ unless you can guarantee a comp.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: marie4899
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last year. It was our first trip to Las Vegas. We werent sure what to expect........... Turned out to be a great vacation and cheap too! We loved the pool with the shark tank. I went to the pool everyday and enjoyed cocktails and sun bathed.The water slide was also fun, with no wait time! Fremont street is a big party every night right outside the hotel. You can get inexpensive drinks right on the street . There is a free concert almost every night even week days. The bands are good to. Cheap gifts there also, you will pay at least double the price for everything on the strip. And there is no reason to, plenty of entertainment on Freemont street. We went to the strip and couldnt wait to get back to our hotel. Two drinks on the strip was 20 ndollars, on Freemont street maybe 5! Go have fun and stay at The Golden Nugget, you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel, but beware the construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_LA
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I planned a quick Vegas trip since tickets to Jersey Boys fell into our lap. When we saw the ‘buy 2 nights, get another night for free’ promotion we stretched our fun dollar and stayed downtown for a longer stay There is definitely cheaper rooms around, but the Golden Nugget is a great place and the rooms are the same as most strip hotels. With the cheaper food, gambling and entertainment downtown, we could afford to stay more nights there than on the strip. Our room troubles started with a clogged drain in the shower/tub. After one night in the south tower (farthest from the casino) we were transferred to the tower that faced west on the 14th floor. Not too close, but in sight of the hotel expansion. We forgot that everything in Vegas is 24/7, including construction. All night pile drivers and very heavy machinery kept us up. After complaining, were were moved us back to the south tower facing north and were comped the night. I talked with other guests that also couldn’t believe the racket went on at all hours. So, if you stay here, be sure you are not facing west or in the original tower facing south. That is unless you are the true Vegas lizard who doesn’t plan on sleeping in his room (wink, wink, nudge, nudge). Our room package included two for one coupon for the buffet, coffee shop and show “Defending the caveman”. We tried then all and they were very good. The show is a one person show, so no sinking of the Titanic or ex-circus performers in various stages of undress, sorry. The breakfast buffet is a cut above the usual warming trays and made to order omelets and the café is one of my favorites. All the waitress staff were very pleasent. Jersey Boys at the Palattazo is a must see. Additionally, if you love good Thai food, check out the Lotus of Siam on Sahara Blvd. Skip their lunch buffet and order off the menu for some of the best Thai you'll ever have. The updated downtown light show is good. The street entertainment is fine. The pool at the Nugget is very fun with the slide, shark observation area and blackjack tables.

Reviews.Title: “beware construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Masterbrew
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in downtown Vegas again after a great stay last year. However since then they have started construction work on a third tower block and many rooms in both the North and South towers are badly affected by the noise. I spent one sleepless night and then tipped the check-in staff 20$ to be moved to a strip view away from it all. I dont think these rooms are offered to anyone as a matter of coursed so I'd recommend asking for one on arrival - and the 20$ tip seems to work.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel for Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenniyoder
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST hotel to stay at, if choosing the downtown area (and even if not!) It has been fully renovated, it's right in the middle of everything downtown, great places to eat and room service, rooms are clean and they have a great pool area. The Shark tank and waterslide are a must! This hotel is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Rickard
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were staying at the GN between 19-25 April. We liked the hotel very much and loved the space that the room had. The room was very clean and the carpet was without stains as it can be sometimes at other more expensive hotels. We were at the 5th floor with a view over a parking garage. The staff at the hotel is very polite and service minded. The pool is so nice and the aquarium at the center is cool with the sharks. If we come back to Vegas we will probably not stay here, not because we don’t like it just because we thought MGM grand feels fresher. (MGM has better air at the casino) One thing that bothered us a lot was the time share sales guys at the hotel who try to book people up for a visit at their new resort… My advice to you is that it’s not worth the 3 hours it takes to get mangled by the salespersons over there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Catherinehy
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I got a great deal from vegas.com and decided to get away for 4 days at the golden nugget. We actually didn't expect the " oh so new and renovated" hotels like the ones on the strip. Still, there was something about GN that we liked. The front desk was pleasent and efficient, the room was average but housekeeping did the best job possible, the pool area was relaxing and the shark tank was definitely a plus. Being in the middle of the fremont experience was convenient. For someone who have stayed on the strip, i think that downtown has that little flair in which the stirp doesn't have. The coupon book saved us a bunch of money at the buffet. Everyone was nice and friendly. Overall, we had a great time staying at the GN and would stay there again. Warning: DO NO GET SUCKERED INTO GOING ON A TOUR FOR TIMESHARES. yes, it will save you money and there are incentives, but 3 hours of constant hustleling was not worth it for us. you decide for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLL79
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas/ California for a week and stayed here our first 2 nights! Service and Accomoadations were fantastic!!! The staff went out of their way to assist you in any way possible! Although it is not right on the strip there is tons to see and do within the hotel itself. The pool is beautiful and heated (which was rare to find). I am not one to lay by the pool for a day, but the atmosphere and friendliness of the staff made this easy to do. Kids would love this spot and it is set up so that parents could eaily lay back and be able to keep an eye on the kids. Through the attached casino are doors to Fremont Street. The light show is actaully something to see. The lights on the strip did nothing for me but Fremont St. Experience is actaully a very unqiue experience. The location is convenient if you plan to travel around as the Freeway is only 5 minutes from the hotel and traffic was never an issue...you were in and out with out a hitch. At the end of our trip we dediced to return to the Gloden Nugget becasue we were so thrilled by our first experience and once again our expectations were surpasssed. Both times we checked in we received a free upgrade to a suite. On this occasion we were given a great deal on late checkout becasue we didn't have to catch our flight until late...no questions, all we had to do was let them know our departure time. The food and drinks were excellent. Casino cocktail waitresses around frequently. No wait at the restuarants/ buffet. Just a fabulous stay! Hope yours is as great.

Reviews.Title: “Construction woke us up at night”
Reviews.Author: kkelley725
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and we loved the shark pool. Rooms were clean with all the amenities with the exception of a coffee maker. We were awakened in the middle of the night to major construction going on outside of of our south tower room. I'm talking cranes and other heavy equipment. Apparantly they are building another tower. During the day all is quiet but they work all night. This was surprising since it was only about 75/80 degrees tops in Vegas during the day. I was surprised that we were not notified of this at check in. We loved the Freemont experience; lots of interesting people and a great band who impersonated "Queen". Will stay again, but only once construction is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: aprilk30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget April 7-11th. We were pleasantly surprised at how large this hotel is. It has 4-5 restaurants, and a Starbucks. At check in, you get a very valuable coupon book, for buy one get one free drinks, buffets, etc. This saved us a good bit of money. We first had a Deluxe Room in the South Tower, that was very beautifully decorated, although the view wasn't very good. We ended up hating Vegas (not the Golden Nugget) and decided to spend more time at the hotel, so we upgraded to a Gold Star room in the North Tower for $50 more per night. This gave us VIP passes at the buffet line, which can get pretty long, so that was great. It also gives you free access to the spa, which was INCREDIBLE. To get to your Gold Star room, in the elevator you have to put in your room key. So the people that are staying in those rooms are VIP and in the hallways there are fresh fruits, bottled water, coffee, nuts, candy, etc. That was really nice. The Gold Star hotel room was incredible! The decor was amazing, there was a leather sectional, and upgraded mattress and linens. There was a large plasma TV, but the hotel doesn't have them hooked up in HD, so the picture wasn't impressive. The bathroom was beautiful, tile and granite. There was a TV in the mirror, which was neat. Separate vanities, and upgraded lotions, shampoo, razors, etc. The pool area was really nice, lots of chairs, couches, and beds outside. The pool was too chilly for me, but my husband got in and really enjoyed the shark tank and waterfall. The jacuzzi is really big, and there are beds around it, too. That was my favorite part. We only ate at the buffet, as the other restaurants in the hotel are pricey. I liked it, and my husband absolutely LOVED the food. As far as the casino, it was nice as far as casinos go. They all seemed the same to me. The cocktail waitresses, though are pretty slow. We found ourselves out of drinks constantly. Not enough waitresses for how big the casino is. The Golden Nugget is in downtown Vegas, not on the strip. I like downtown, Fremont Experience, etc. The most economical way to get to the strip is to take the Deuce city bus. This was cheap, but took forever. And there are some pretty weird characters that ride that bus. I wouldn't take it at night. Overall, we hated Vegas. Way too crowded, and absolutely ridiculously expensive. We were planning on renting a car and driving to Hoover Dam, but the traffic and roads in that city are horrible. So we decided not to. Even the Mcdonalds and Subway restaurants are twice as expensive as normal. We did not anticipate how much everything costs! But, the Golden Nugget is a very nice hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: terryd724
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after doing some research on line. Most reviews said it was remodeled and gorgeous and I wanted to try somewhere different to stay. I found a decent price online and booked it. The hotel is gorgeous; staff is very friendly, check in was very fast. Beautiful pool side lounge area with huge shark tanks that take your breath away. Rooms are very large and very nice, very quiet. Housekeeping does an excellent job. All in all, I was very pleased with whole Golden Nugget stay. The only negative is it was far from where I needed to be every day but that was my fault. There is two Starbucks right in the hotel so that is always a plus for me. I would highly recommend this hotel for it's classiness and beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: dasher2
Reviews.Content: The property and rooms are clean and comfortable. Swimming Pool was fantastic. Their Bread Pudding at the Buffet was to die for...and they share the recipe with you. We were able to get in our room right away...even though our flight arrived before noon. Good downtown location....Freemont Street....needed refridgerator for husbands insulin and this was provided complimentary for medication. Courteous employees.

Reviews.Title: “Security appears to be lacking!”
Reviews.Author: azsbuffy
Reviews.Content: Security is lacking at this hotel. Last night my husband had his pocket picked on the elevator while security was absent at the booth located at the elevators to the hotel rooms. While the rooms are okay, and the staff at the hotel appears to be very friendly, I would certainly say that security appears to be a bit lacking. I have stayed at many hotels on the strip, and some a good bit less desirable looking than the Golden Nugget, I have never been at a hotel that does not provide evening security at the elevators to the rooms. When I called the front desk and spoke to an assistant manager I was informed that they do provide 24 hour security; however, they do not always have security at the booth located at the elevators where patrons have to show their keys to access the hotel rooms. Generally we travel as a family, and I would caution anyone who feels security to be an issue to them to contact the management at this hotel first to make sure that the proper level of security is provided!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I expected”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Girl17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget to celebrate my wedding anniversary. A lot of people warned me that the Nugget was not a nice hotel nor in a “nice part of Vegas”. They said it brought in a strange cliental. (that was not true). I enjoyed the Freemont Experience and would recommend everyone to see it at night (if you are not staying there.) Check in time was SLOW, took almost an hour. I had requested a Handicapped Accessible Room and was disappointed in the Bathroom. I had to call and request a shower chair (was suppose to be in the room when I got there). The shower head was mounted, so it was not very convenient to shower/rinse off (had to use the ice bucket) for anyone with disabilities. Room was clean (and hey all I did there was sleep and shower). Décor is outdated (but again, who cares). Casino was very Smokey (poor ventilation). The Spa was overpriced and the staff was snobby. Did not feel like I got my monies worth. Pool area was nice (the day I laid out was chilly, first “cold front” in ten years I was told). Watching the sharks was cool. Restaurant was just ok (meal was not worth the price), the buffet however was wonderful! Caught bus to go to the stripe. If you don’t mind being “away” from the “real” action I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Petite Suite sucks bad”
Reviews.Author: ScottinParkCity
Reviews.Content: So we booked the Petite Suite for Sun and Mon night. We had to check in at 10 AM and it was great they had a room ready and we had an easy no wait check in at the VIP Lounge. We got to the room and while the room was nice. The Furniture was old and out of date. Like Motel 6. The TVs in our suite were tube TV's with old grubby remotes. We did notice the other non suite rooms had nice new flat screens. The bathroom was a joke. yuk!!!! grime dripping from the shower doors. stains and what looked like dried blood on the floor. Toilet paper was hanging from the guest before us. Wet and stained towels. The bottled water for $4 were cracked open and half drank. I would recommend to stay in the lower price room as they looked real nice. Our suite sucked. The room service people did not come replace towels or clean up as they had said they would. The hotel was great just read the other reviews. MID ($5) limit video poker machines were on lock down. Not even a pair of Js or better after 300 in? Poker room was great. I might come back if I'm on a budget. Did win a hi hand jackpot in the poker room so I will play there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great comps”
Reviews.Author: barbark2003
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before a few times. My brother, sister and I took my 80 year old mother to Las Vegas via Route 66 and decided that the Golden Nugget would be our destination from Indianapolis. I called about 2 months prior and the reservation clerk told me our rooms would be fully comped by the casino. We arrived on the 1st of April and waited about 10 min for check-in. Once we got to the rooms, we were very pleased to find out we had adjoining rooms. The pillow top beds had down comforters and the TV was a nice 50 inch flat screen. Bathrooms were marble with tub/shower and waterfall shower heads. We stayed 3 nights here, gambled moderately and before we checked out, went to the casino host to see if meals would be comped. They were! We only had to pay for incidentals (internet for 1 night, 1 bottle of water & phone calls if any). My advice to gamblers, charge all meals to your room, before checking out, talk to the casino host and see if any can be comped as they usually will comp most or all of your meals. Also go to the Players club to see if you have any cash available based on your play. Very nice hotel, will stay here on all future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time but not impressed with the service”
Reviews.Author: bbcakes25
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself just returned from a 3 night stay (4/3-4/6) at the Nugget. It was my husbands 30th Birthday present so I sprung and booked a Gold Club room, I have stayed at the Nugget many times in the past with my family so I was excited to be staying there for the first time after renovations. **Warning this could get lengthy but I wanted to give a detailed review of the Gold Club room. VIP Check In: We arrived at 4:15 ( more than an hour after check in) we were matter of factly told our room wasn't ready and were told to check our bags at the bell desk and come back in an hour. The girl said this like it was routine and going to be no big deal for us, she didn't even offer for us to stay in the VIP lounge and enjoy the free appetizers and the drinks (I didn't see them or I would have had some) Basically VIP check in was a joke, the regular check in line had 4 people standing in it and I am sure they were all in their room way before me and my husband were. We walked around for an hour, came back and were given our keys, I asked for a coupon book , after all I paid upwards of $600 for the room I thought I would get one but she told me the coupon book didn't come with that room (I could have booked a North tower room for half of what I paid and recieved a coupon book). Gold Club Room: The room is very nice, it is dark but there is a electric shade for the window to let in plenty of light, the room does look exactly like the pictures online. However there are many things that bothered us about the room. Bathroom: shower is a deep tub with a rain shower head, the entire shower is enclosed , while taking a shower there is no ventilation and your shower quickly turns into a sauna, fixture is difficult to turn off without shower dripping all day. With the shower being enclosed you cannot sit and have a nice bath and watch the tv in the mirror. The closet is behind the bathroom door and is VERY inconvienient, there are 2 doors that are pretty heavy and they do not stay open, to get your luggage into the bathroom and into the closet is a real trick. Robes are nice idea but not soft at all and the slippers are cheap disposable ones, never used them but did see some women with their robes at the pool. Room and amenities: Beds are very nice, pillow top with 4 down pillows and 4 down comforters. Clock radio in room with IPOD docking station was nice, TV is huge but it is high def and the hotel only has cable, makes for a huge tv with a fuzzy picture. There is a DVD player in the room and I believe there was supposed to be some DVD's however there were only a few Sinatra CD's. Complementary Fiji water was nice however it was never replenished. There is NO turn down service what so ever, never saw any maids at night going into the rooms. There really should be a refrigerator in a renovated room like this,my husband used the 2nd sink in the bathroom as a cooler by running back and forth to the ice machine , I wish they would have done away with the recliner and added a wet bar with microwave and fridge. Our room was not made up on our 3rd day, we left the room at 10am and saw that the maid was next door to our room, we came back at 2pm and our room was how we left it, we saw a maid on the floor and asked her about it,she said to call housekeeping because she was working on the rooms for new guests. We called housekeeping a few times before getting an answer, we were told they would be there within 15 minutes, instead of showering and getting ready for our last night like we had planned we went downstairs and came back 2 hours later and our room was still not made up, I then made the bed myself. Coffee, newspapers, water and snacks (M&M, raisinettes, trail mix, nuts) by the elevator were the best amenity that came with the room. Pool: Very nice, we layed out 1 afternoon. Water was too cold for me but many others were in, my husband enjoyed the waterslide but you go too fast to see any sharks while on the slide. Lots of cocktail waitresses walking around, strawberry daquiri was very good with fresh berries but hardly had any alcohol. The only other problem I saw was the sun only shines on half of the chairs at a time, we got there at 10:30 and by 1 the sun was going behind the south tower and people were trying to find new seats in the sun. Other VIP amenities: Buffet Line pass, we went to the breakfast buffet Friday morning, there was no line so we didn't get to use our line pass, when we came out after eating the VIP line was actually longer than the regular line. Never used any other passes. Dining: Only ate at the buffet for breakfast which was pretty good . Other than that I must say that the Grotto has some highly suggestive artwork on their walls, I am not a prude but I find it tacky to have artwork like that at a restaurant where kids may be at. I am talking melons and martini's with olives placed in particular places, interesting to say the least. We did visit Gold Diggers while waiting for our room it was not busy at all in early afternoon, it was nice to go up there to sit and people watch over Freemont Street. I do highly suggest going to Main Street Station (walk down to the Plaza turn right, if you don't like the area ,walk through the Las Vegas and California Club and walk across their bridge) I have always loved their buffet and we just discovered their 777 Brewery $5 for their award winning beer sampler (5 different beers) and the pizza and garlic fries were very good. Deuce Bus: walked to the main station (walk down the street between Freemont and Horseshoe) The main station was very "sketchy" but once we found the double decker Deuce at the far end of the station we got on right away with no wait, fare is $5 for 24 hour pass or $2 for one way(beats a $20 taxi ride!). It did take 1 1/2 hours to get to New York New York but we wanted to be able to drink and it was a good way to not deal with the traffic and see all of the strip. The passengers on the bus were mostly tourists, a lot better crowd than the city bus, and you can get to the airport and outlet centers also. Other tips: Check out Changs Hong Kong Cuisine for excellent Dim Sum (on Decatur off the strip) I already want to go back! Go to Hooters Hotel (across from MGM) for a Nipper Juice at their poolside bar, this is a rum drink with tropical juices, very strong, you only need one and it puts you out of commission for awhile! To sum it up we did enjoy ourselves very much, but the price we paid did not coincide with the service we got. Although the room is beautiful I would have had just as much fun if I was in one of their regular rooms. Out of the amenities they list for the Gold Club we only really enjoyed the snacks the others were deemed useless for us especially the not so VIP check in. So, go to the Nugget but get a regular room with a coupon book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, bad location”
Reviews.Author: beachtimeDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: The Nugget is a great hotel too bad it's downtown. 1. Check in was great, very quick. 2. Gambling was good for all in our party. 3. Pool area was awesome. (heated pool) 4. Rooms were nice and clean. 5. House keeping very good. 6. Restaurants are goood. 7. Gold Diggers night club good. (great scenery) 8. Overall a great hotel, to bad it's not on the Strip. 9. Older crowd at the Nugget. 10. Great service through out hotel. The bad - It's downtown. Freemont street is a dump. If you want old run down casinos and gross food go outside the Nugget. Yes the light show above is cool but thats it. We did go down to the strip and it is much nicer, cleaner and not as dumpy. Drinks are not cheap anywhere in Vegas nor is the food. Had a great time and probably won't stay at the Nugget just because it's downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bad stay due to Housekeeping walkout”
Reviews.Author: mary_228
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived tired after a late flight on Easter Sunday to find a long line at check-in due to rooms not being available due to a housekeeping walkout earlier that day. We were "lucky" to get put on a waiting list for a room (others were sent to Binion's, which is apparently nowhere near as nice) and offered a free meal in the cafe. The food and service was good, but we are not used to eating in the middle of the night. On top of that, the waiter told us the hotel would not give him a gratuity for these comped meals. He was very sympathetic toward the front desk staff, who he said had to clean the rooms for us. There were plenty of cleaning people working in the hotel lobby, but apparently union rules prohibit them being diverted to do housekeeping chores. We finally got a city view room in the south tower at 4am. This hotel is very clean and beautifully decorated. The pool area is sunny and has a heated pool with a waterslide through a giant shark tank which my children enjoyed. Food at the buffet was good, although bussing service was very poor. A lot of the staff at this hotel was sympathetic toward the housekeepers' action and conveyed a sense of dissatisfaction with management. We stayed three nights and on yet another day, no housekeeping services were provided. I was only able to get clean towels by taking them off a cart in the hallway. We received a free night and breakfast at the buffet, but the experience really put a damper on our stay. This hotel is in downtown Las Vegas, which is far from the fun of the strip. We had a rental car and drove to the strip each day and parked at the various hotels there. This was a bit of a hassle and it helped to know the backways (courtesy of The Unoffical Guide to Las Vegas) to avoid the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jhoonosorio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the UH vs. UNLV game september 2007. It was fantastic. it is by far my favorite place to stay in vegas. the hotel is very nice and I prefer the downtown to the strip. The rooms are spacious and very "untacky". The casino is fantastic, you can't go wrong with 5-10 dollar craps tables. the restaurants there are pretty good as well. I really enjoyed eating at the Grotto and the buffet is fantastic. The crowning jewel of this place though is their pool. Also, being Kamaaina and the location downtown it's very nice to be able to stay in such a nice hotel, but still be in walking distance from the California (you know, when we're craving local kine grindz). all in all, for me, the best place to stay in Vegas and I strongly recommend it to any folks from hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: HoustonJers
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone down hill and seems to be going further down hill. When the Golden Nugget was owned by Steve Wynn, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. We loved the downtown atmosphere and we loved staying at what felt like a 5 diamond hotel. We have been going there for years at least twice a year. It was a tradition my parents had started and when I got married my husband loved the Golden Nugget and Las Vegas as much as I did so we contintued to stay there. When MGM bought Mirage hotels we went back and found that not much had changed. The customer service was still the best downtown, the building was still beautiful and we were happy to see the same employees each time we went. Then when the two young guys Tim and Tom bought the Golden Nugget we still went back. Things changed a little, they wanted to bring back old vegas but at the same tried to cater to young people. We loved watching what they were trying to do and loved knowing the employees were still there and the service was still great. Even though we could get good or sometimes better room rates on the strip we liked the Golden Nugget atmosphere and employees. We even loved the food. Carson Street Cafe had menu items we craved when we weren't there. Some employees we had grown to know over the years. We didn't sign up for the marketing campaigns but still got great deals and we didn't even mind spending more at the Golden Nugget than we would have spent other places. Since Landry's has bought the Golden Nugget it has only gone down hill. Yes they have done some remodeling and it looks nicer. But looks are not everything. The employees don't care anymore. There are very few employees left. You don't see employees cleaning everything little corner and door anymore and you wait forever, for slot and cocktail service. We don't even bother with the restaurants anymore. The Carson Street menu no longer has the items we loved. The Buffet is okay but not worth the price, Grotto and Vic & Anthony's are the kind of places we eat at when we are home, not what we want on vacation. But we do love some of the restaurants at the other downtown hotels. The morale of the employees has gone down due to what the employees call masssive layoffs. Now you can see that there are not many employees left who care. The service is mediocre. Landry's is a restaurant company but they have the type of restaurants that are mediocre food for high prices. We eat at Landry's restaurants in our home town, they are not that great but they are okay. In Las Vegas we like to have great food at low prices. We stayed there last week 3/26 to 3/30, morale was even lower than before. We heard employees talking about more lay offs. They talked about a lady who had worked there for 23 years and was laid off, then they said there were more who had worked there just as long and were laid off. It sounds like Landry's doesn't want experienced Hotel and Casino employees. They must want part time college kids like the ones who work in the their restaurants every where else. It was sad to hear them talk about people we had been counting on serving us that past 15 years we had gone to the Golden Nugget. I am writing this from the Airport. It is my fairwell to the Golden Nugget. I miss the old days of great service, great food and wonderful happy employees. We will go to the strip next time. Probably to Wynn, where we know we can expect employees who are treated well and appreciated, so they will treat us well and like we are appreciated. Farewell Golden Nugget your glory days are over.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town "Golden Nugget" Downtown is back and better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoMamaFox
Reviews.Content: Haven't been to Vegas since '89. My husband and I were very pleased with the Golden Nugget. It was very clean and the staff was actually interested in the guests. Very helpful and good service in all areas. The pool was something to behold. Hollywood style with fish.The buffet (which we don't usually even try) was quite a deal (2 for 1) and good to boot. Very easy to get downtown on the duece bus. $5.00 for 24 hours.. Very nice and filled with us tourists. We even saw Elvis on the duece on his way home from work. What a great story to tell the grandchildren and all of our friends who will listen! Don't miss Defending the Caveman and Rich Little at the Nugget. We will be back. Plus we even came home with $$$$$$$$$$$$$!!! P.S. Did you know there is a Golden Nugget in the Hotel. Can you find It????

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: cbfosterdog
Reviews.Content: Not the Golden Nugget I remember! They did an incredible job updating it...and the outdoor aquarium was so impressive. I wished it had been warmer so that I could have enjoyed the pool/aquarium area more. The casino was okay..kind of quaint but the machines paid out pretty well. The food was very good in all the restaurants as well, but moreso at the upstairs buffet. The rooms (there was a group of us) were all very nice, we felt like we were on the strip and not downtown. I really reccommend staying here if the strip is not a necessity...because it has everything including free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but smoky”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in March 2008 at the Golden Nugget. We were given a deluxe room in the north tower. The room was pretty large, had a desk, two chairs, small coffee table, a bar, large closet and a king bed. The bathroom in the rooms are tiny, but nicely appointed in marble. The sheets on our bed were particularly nice and were very high quality and soft. The room had wireless and wired Internet. The room was very clean and we had no problems with it. My only comment is that during the night, some of the smoke from the Casino wafts up into the rooms and when I woke up around 4 am or so, the room was very smoky. Other than that, no complaints. The hotel has a very nice pool that has been recently renovated. It was very busy when we were there. Overall, the Golden Nugget is easily the best hotel downtown. Give it a try as an alternative to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Went for a few days”
Reviews.Author: rjm83usmc
Reviews.Content: We went to the Golden Nugget for a few days for a work related function. At first we thought we would be disappointed that we were not on the strip, but overall we weren't all that disappointed. It is certainly the most up to date hotel in downtown Las Vegas. Here are a few of my observations from staying there. Rooms- The North Tower is the rennovated tower. Book a room in this tower, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were fresh daily. The 42" Plasma was nice. The bathroom was a bit small. The carpets were very dirty and to be sure we sprayed lysol on everything we could. The A/C was noisy and seemed a bit old. The rooms in the south tower might have a view, but they are old and in desperate need of rennovations. Food- The Cafe was nice, service was fast during non-rush times, however they get bogged down during the meal-time rush. The steakhouse was spectacular, we sat with a large group and the staff seemed coordinated and took care of everyone seemlessly. The Grotto was the same thing...great food, decent prices, and the staff worked hard to take care of everyone which they did. We ordered room service quite a few times as well and it got to our room fast and fresh. The only complaint would be that they have two set times a day that they pick up the carts from your hallway and it might jam up with carts. The buffet was not worth the money. I left there disappointed as did others from the conversations I had. Bars were nice, drinks were stiff and the staff was friendly. Gambling- Didn't do much of it there, however compared to a few of the older casinos on the strip, the nugget topped them all by keeping the areas clean and things smelled clean as well. Freemont St- The overhead show seems out of date but drew a crowd regardless. The problem with Freemont is the moment you wander off the street you get the uneasy feeling as if you might get mugged at any time. It's old Vegas. Pool- The pool was packed every day and was kept in great shape all time time. The shark tank is small but worth a look! Overall- The Nugget was better than expected, the staff did their best to take care everything and they delivered where-ever possible. The timeshare people were not aggressive like those on the strip and were kind enough to give directions without a salespitch. The Nugget definately brings a breath of fresh air to an old downtown, hopefully the other hotel's there will take a que from the nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikecDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting. Could not ask for a better facility for the meeting. The rooms were great, nicer than the Mandalay Bay or the Monte Carlo. Great people from check in to check out. Food was great too, very good sushi bar. Had a room in the north tower on the sixth floor overlooking the pool. End room, very quiet great location. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price...”
Reviews.Author: icedg
Reviews.Content: Went on a Sunday through Monday. Fantastic price. Rooms were much better than expected compared to other downtown locations. I would definately consider this if you are willing to stay downtown away from the strip. We would definately go back. One nice thing was that we were able to check in @ 11:30 that day..

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping ripped me off and the hotel did not make it right”
Reviews.Author: JillMissouri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights, we chose the Golden Nugget because we had heard that the older part of Vegas was where the fun is at. We were bored downtown, and had to go to the strip to have fun. To make matters worse, I accidently left my earrings in the room after check out and they never turned up in lost and found. I just think it is crummy of the hotel not to make their staff responsible for taking their guests' belongings!! I was told that they are not responsible for guest losing their things, I explained to them that I did not lose anything, I forgot them in my room and the only explanation was that housekeeping kept them when they cleaned my room. I do not understand why hotels do not hold their staff responsible when something is taken from your room! I will never stay at the Golden Nugget again and I will tell all of my friends and co-workers not to stay there. Very dissapointed in the buffet too. Very few food items were worth eating, nothing was considered delicious. We also had a very rude dealer and the table manager treated us like we were dirt because we had some comp chips. Not a friendly hotel or casino!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChrisZegers
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here in February 2008 I arrived after midnight and all the standard rooms were occupied already, so because I had my reservation and they had to put me somewhere they were kind enough to let me sleep in the Presidential Suite the first night. That was really very nice, as you can see on the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveTA
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas has the most fabulous hotels I have ever seen! My husband and I traveled there for a one week honeymoon in July 07. On the weekdays we stayed on the new strip but they raise their prices super high on the weekends so we booked the Nugget for a Friday and Saturday night. It was just what I imagined a hotel casino to be like! The casino, pool, sharks & buffet were wonderful. The lobby was quite elegant and the staff were very professional. This is a full service hotel which means they have complimentary valet and a bellmen brings your bags up to your room (they're very adamant about doing it); I didn't really care too much for this benefit, I'd prefer to park my own car and wheel my own bags to my room and not have to wait 30 minutes for them to arrive AND save myself the 5 dollar tip of course! The room was very nice, certainly not what you get at the Venetian or anything like that, it was somewhat dated but very nice, clean, roomy and comfortable. The hotel isn't too big so it's not a 20 minute voyage to get to your room like some of the other places. Another thing I would like to mention is that there seemed to be a lot of kids at this hotel, particularly at the pool area, it wasn't a problem for me but I know some people aren't down with that or whatever! I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Service and Friendliness Stinks”
Reviews.Author: Shabe13
Reviews.Content: Before ranting about the poorness of the staff in general, the maids and dealers were very nice, and the restaurant staff and massage therapists, very nice to good. That's where it ends. I booked this thru Orbitz--was suppose to get $30 food tickets and other comps-didn't--what is worse, was lied to not once, but twice by the front desk people , who are the rudest and non caring people I ever met, making New Yorkers look like Saints (and I'm from NY). While at the pool, and at the Casino, I had to wait forever for a drink--I even had to leave the table once and Stop Gambling (the whole concept, I thought) to get my own drink. When attempting to work out a situation, I got no help of any sort from the staff. Although I have no complaints against the rooms, the front desk staff and the cocktail waitresses leave a lot to be desired at best. I doubt I'll ever stay here again because of such a lousy treatment from their personnel. My name is Shaber, and that's my story!

Reviews.Title: “very busy”
Reviews.Author: gordon24fan
Reviews.Content: we stayed here monday - thursday and thought we would come the week after the race. boy were we wrong. it was so busy you couldnt get on a table the cocktails were hard to get and the slots were not paying out anything (went to 4 queens and won 1195 on wheel of fortune game). The hotel on the other hand was ok the room was nice size and clean but the bath drain was slow but called maintenance and they came and fixed it no problem. i would stay here again but would try it when its a little slower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Nug”
Reviews.Author: kquistct
Reviews.Content: We just loved the Nugget. I booked directly though the hotel and got the best rate available. 54.00 dollars a night! The room was large and clean. The bedding wasn't the best, but certainly do-able for a 4 day stay. The pool was fabulous! The water slide was a blast and fun for all ages. The atmosphere poolside was like being on a cruise. Great music to listen to, a poolside bar, and lots of friendly people. Right outside the Nugget is the Fremont Street Experience and it's just that... an experience! Great people watching. Everything you might of forgotten at home can be purchased at the ABC store next to the Nugget. Liquor, beer, wine and water were staples for us. Across the street was Binions. They have a great restaurant downstairs that serves everything 24 hours a day. It's nothing fancy, but good food at an affordable price. If you're really hungry, get the BBB (served from 11PM to 7 AM) 2 eggs, 2 sausage patties, 2 strips of bacon, hash browns and 2 pancakes or toast... $3.99! We went for the prime rib dinner one night and at $8.99 you can't beat it. Getting around Vegas is easy with the Duece bus pass. $5.00 let's you ride all day. It can take some time because traffic in Vegas is a nightmare but it's better than a cab or walking. We rented a car for the day. Buget rental is right at the Nugget. We got a mustang convertible and took a 15 mile drive out to Red Rocks Canyon. Absolutely beautiful and a great way to spend an afternoon away from the crowds and the slot machines. I'm telling all my friends to stay at the Nugget. For the price it's the best value in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bshfdan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for three nights and the place was very took. Took advantage of the VIP check-in and didn't wait at all. There were about 20 people in line at the regular check-in. The pool was nice, good poolside waitress service and very tasty margaritas, The room was big, clean, comfortable bed, bathrobes in the closet. The only problem I had was trying to get a coupon book. They wouldn't give me one but couldn't tell me why. This is by far the best downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget: Great VIP Check-in”
Reviews.Author: tessmerl
Reviews.Content: The VIP Check-in for the Golden Nugget, is the absolute best. Yes, there is a charge for it. But when you have children, you want to check-in fast. When there are long waiting lines, the children get so anxious to go swim with the sharks. I have found that paying the extra charge for the VIP Check-in is the way to go. Go to the website to find the number and call. (Use AAA or AARP discounts too.) -Travelor with kids from SD-

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: saleswoman
Reviews.Content: We have stayed on the strip at the MGM, Aladdin, New York, Luxor, Excalibur, Flamingo and in our opinion the Golden Nugget beats them all. The rooms are comfortible and very tastefully decorated - love the lighted makeup mirror. Only thing this room is missing is a coffee machine. Will definately recommend to friends and family. Carson Cafe - great selection, pool was beautiful, but the slots were pretty tight on this trip. My new favorite place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, bad comps, below average staff”
Reviews.Author: jetma
Reviews.Content: As far as the rooms go, you really can't get better in the Fremont Street area. Top notch all the way. We had a two bedroom suite in the North Tower. Beautiful space, very comfortable beds, shower pressure wonderful, etc. However, the ice machine is literally right outside the door, and that was somewhat annoying. The staff was cordial at best and down right rude at the worst. Almost all seem to be doing you a favor instead of their job. The one exception was the staff at the cafe restaurant. They were always pleasant. The housekeeping staff forgot to clean the living room area of our suite one day and managed to take a tv remote another day, but otherwise I guess they were sufficient. The water and coffee that was supposed to be in our room daily was missing one day and the turndown and chocolate service was only given to us once. No one bothered to collect our breakfast request that was hung on our door the first evening, so we called in to room service for the rest of the time. Comps and cocktails are lousy at the Nugget and Full Pay video poker is no where to be found. Go to the Main Street Station bar for full pay and awesome comped cocktails. El Cortez also has full pay and attentive waitresses, but be safe and only venture there in the daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and inexpensive in Downtown LV”
Reviews.Author: hvtrust
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent one night in Vegas and chose to stay in Downtown Las Vegas for a change. Since we were only traveling through Vegas and needed to stay one night, we didn't want to pay big Vegas prices. We were pleasantly surprised with the Golden Nugget. It seemed like it had been updated a bit. The lighting fixtures were interesting and the casino was well lit. The check-in staff, valet, and bellhops were very friendly. I was impressed with the variety of dining and bars. There were 2 Starbucks in the casino too! My mom does not care for sushi, but I ate at Red Sushi (restaurant in casino). I ordered two rolls of sushi and the bill was $20. In addition, we visited one of the bars got 2 glasses of wine for $20. The service and food was very good. The casino smelled of light smoke from cigarettes, but it was not overbearing. I really enjoyed the Tank. It's a huge aquarium built into the pool area. While I didn't relax poolside, it looked like I could have had an enjoyable afternoon there. We stayed in the South Tower and the room was nice, clean, and quiet but the beds were uncomfortable. Also, the TV in our room was not working...it automatically turned on at 5:30am and began beeping and would not turn off until I unplugged it (and it wasn't the alarm). If you need internet access, it is $11.99 per 24 hours. The great parts about staying at the Golden Nugget were 1) it was close to the freeway, 2) not a lot of traffic like the strip, and 3) Fremont Street. The vendors, light show, and entertainers were fun to watch on Fremont Street, but it was very touristy. If you have a car or take a taxi, you can definitely get to the main strip easily and do Vegas big, while saving some money on a hotel. This is a great place to stay to save money on hotel and if want to experience Vegas low key.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Great Las Vegas Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CeCeVacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loves Las Vegas and this hotel added to our love for Vegas. This hotel was amazing. It is a true Vegas Style hotel. The room was large, clean and up to date. The shark (aquarium) tank by the poolside was a sight to see. We would love to spend another week at this hotel. The price was right, however it is not on the strip, yet in the heart of Old Las Vegas. If you don't mind taking a 10-12 minute bus ride on the Duce, or taxi ride to the strip. The food was a little pricey at the hotel, there was a limited selection, yet several eatery's along the old Vegas strip under the Light show. The staff at the hotel were pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “overall good accommodations”
Reviews.Author: susiefranca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget for 5 nights in Feb./08. Overall experience is average to above average. Rooms are very clean and spacious. We stayed on 11th floor in South Tower. Room was nice, bed comfortable but our view was not so good. From the window we saw the roof of a building and a parking garage across the street. The pool seemed nice but it was'nt warm enough to try it. No luck at slots. We also did not see anyone win big. On the last night that we were there they did not make our beds. We went back to our room around 2:00 am to sleep and our beds were the same as we had left them in the morning. I don't know what happened there. I called front desk to tell them, in a polite way. I did not complain. I was told they would see what happened. Never got back to me. Also when we were checking out, they were charging me for an extra night. Everything had already been prepaid through Expedia. I had to wait 10 minutes until clerk spoke to manager. She came back & said it was their error. Wasn't very apologetic. Overall hotel is very clean. Rooms are nice. If you have any problems walking, as my husband does, I would not recommend South Tower. It is too far to walk from your room to Lobby & Casino. All in all, I would recommed hotel. Buffet is excellent. We had to pay $2.50 for a small bottle of water at bar on our way back to our room. In my opinion, water should be free. We had just stopped gambling and were going to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at GN!”
Reviews.Author: HBRoBo
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Golden Nugget from 2/9-2/11 and enjoyed our time there. We found clean rooms and the staff to be friendly enough. The kids were excited about the pool but it was too cold to swim. We plan on staying there again later in the year to try out the slide through the shark tank. We ate at the buffet once and the food quality was excellent. It was fresh and had a great selection. They had wonderful desserts and ice cream too! The wait staff was attentive and friendly. I won some money on the quarter and dollar slots and am looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room for very good price”
Reviews.Author: TravelRaven
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations for an older hotel in old town Las Vegas, but I was very happily surprised and I will definitely stay here again. The room was very large and much nicer than an average room in a Holiday Inn or similar. The bed was comfortable, the room and bathroom were very clean, and it was QUIET! something that can be hard to come by in Vegas. The food choices in the hotel are above average - we really liked the Grotto and the buffet had good fresh food. Service at the desks was efficient and friendly. Even on a very busy weekend the hotel didn't feel overrun with people - I liked that a lot. The hotel is convenient to everything by taxi and you can see all the interesting things in old town by walking.

Reviews.Title: “No big deal”
Reviews.Author: Bigbeef56
Reviews.Content: I guess I should have learned from my last trip to Vegas about a year ago. This town has changed a lot. Vegas is now run by corporate bean counters that I think do not know how to have fun.The Nugget was OK at best. We finally arrived at about 4am after a 13 hour Southwest airline fiasco (different review on another site soon) and were starving. Went to the Nugget's 24 hr restaurant, Carson Street Cafe and was told they only had a very limited menu tonight for some unknown reason. So I got a hot roast beef sandwich. Oh well, we were starved. For $12 I got a couple little slices of beef on a pile of bread swimming in gravy. No "graveyard" specials at this hotel. At check in we watched the couple in front of us get a coupon book but we were told "Not with the package YOU bought" Ok? we were too tired to argue. It was a Southwest Airlines Vacation package and that will never happen again. Asked a bartender one morning as I was playing slots just in front of the bar for a bottled water so I could take some meds and was told "You have to play $10 dollars in the machines at the bar for me to give you a bottle of anything. Or it's $2.50. Or I can just give you a glass of tap water". Oh my what generosity!WHAT ARE THEY DOING TO MY VEGAS?? The room was Ok. The service was Ok. The pool looks pretty cool with the shark tank and slide. Too cold to swim. The slots were very tight . The hotel staff seemed to try their best but the place didn't seem to have any excitement or electricity in the air. I doubt if we stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved the Golden Nugget!!!”
Reviews.Author: kbales2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at GN Feb. 14th to the 17th. We booked a Gold Club Room directly through the hotel website about two months prior. In early January, I checked the website and the rates had gone down. We called the hotel and they gave us the lower rate with no hassle. We arrived at the hotel around 9AM and went to the VIP lounge to check in. They advised a room would not be ready until later. We left our luggage with the bell desk and went to play slots for a while. Around noon, we went back to the VIP lounge and asked if a room was available yet. The clerk said the one we had reserved was not clean yet, but there was another GC room that was ready and she would put us in that one. We were assigned room 1619. As previous reviews have stated, the rooms seem very dark. However, after I turned on all the lights, it was fine. The room was nicely decorated with a large 42" plasma tv mounted on the wall, a couch, a reclining chair and a large dresser/vanity/entertainment center. All of this is pictured on the GN website. The bathroom has two sinks, a vanity area with chair, and a rainshower showerhead/tub combo. The shower/tub is standard-sized and not a jacuzzi bath. There is also a closet located not-so-conveniently behind the bathroom door. There are bathrobes, slippers, extra pillows, iron, ironing board, and blow dryer in the large closet. There is also a TV in the bathroom mirror. Our room overlooked the pool area and the side of the Plaza. We could also see the mountains in the background. There was not any hallway noise and only occasional noise from the pool area during the day. There are several other little "perks" to the room which may or may not be important to you: - IPOD alarm clock - pay per view movies - video checkout - dvd/cd player - a few cds and magazines in room - large safe - lots of toiletries in the bathroom - internet available on the TV for a fee - free internet access for your laptop - free bottled water in room - free bottled water/coffee/snacks by elevators - turn down service w/mints on pillow Also with the GC rooms, you get a VIP pass which allows you free access to the spa and a line pass for the buffet and cafe. If I had to find something wrong, it would just be little things. One is that the window shade does not completely darken the room. In fact, it lets quite a bit of light through. Another would be the TV reception. For a plasma TV, it was very fuzzy, like something was interfering with the signal. However, these were very minor issues for us, so overall we were very happy with this room. One thing I would caution people on the GC rooms: they are regular-sized rooms, not suites. It is simply a regular hotel room that has upgraded amenities. We also ate at the Grotto, Vic & Anthony's, Carson Street Cafe, the buffet and the grille. All were good. We gambled quite a bit and found the dealers to be friendly and a good variety of slots. I also had some treatments at the spa. The people there were very friendly and the spa's locker rooms were full of amenities. We would go casino-hopping down Fremont Street, but were always happy to come back home to the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Not the same”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget at least 7 times prior to this past week's stay. While the hotel is still very nice in the public areas and very clean, it is lacking the "friendly customer feeling" it once had. We checked in and the receptionist at the desk was very nice but would only upgrade our room if we paid $100 extra a night. So we decided to just stay in the North Tower. The girl told us to come back in about 1/2 hour for the keys as she called housekeeping and asked them to clean our room. We went back in a little over an hour and got a different girl who checked and said the room wouldn't be ready for another 1 1/2 hours. Plus she must have been having a bad day because she never looked even looked at us! Even when addressing us. She looked down .The rooms are getting worn. The rug in the hallway is worn. Our room was very dimly lit. Even with every light on in the room it was still dark. The maid did an excellent job in providing us with what we needed and doing the basic cleaning. However, when I pulled out the books from under the nightstand, the dust was so thick, I started coughing. The TV area was not ever dusted either. AC was very loud. The pool area is beautiful but they took away so much room with the addition that the lounge chairs are right on top of each other. And the sun hardly hits the area. Hope they plan on expanding this area. One last note...we didn't see a one person hit anything big on the slots. It really drained your money. I think the casino should at least give you a few winners. Must have used all the money on remodeling. We decided we wouldn't stay at the Nugget again until they change it somewhat. We'll pay the extra and stay on a nice place on the strip. A tip to everyone: If you book your room online or call them directly, keep cheking back on their website because as the time gets closer, and they don't fill the rooms up , they drop their rates. BUT they don't give you the lower rate unless you call them and ask for the lower rate that is on their website!! I had to call them back 8 times!! But the rates for 3 nights went down a total of $150!

Reviews.Title: “Upset with management and security”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel04
Reviews.Content: We had some of our jewelry missing from our room. The manager would not speak with us and were told that it was a security issue. When asked what thier internal investigation found,no information was available. After we returned home I phoned once more only to hear, sorry for your loss. I guess once our stay was over there was no need for explanations they already had our money.

Reviews.Title: “Employees are extraordinarily pushy”
Reviews.Author: Jeema
Reviews.Content: The employees at Golden Nugget are possibly the most pushy ones I have encountered in Vegas. They stand just outside the elevators and intercept their 'guests' (i say that term loosely as their 'guests' are apparently walking dollar signs to them) not with gentle 'hello and can I help make your stay more enjoyable' but by shouting you down from behind on your way to breakfast to solicit you with crap offers. I think the woman sensed my displeasure when I turned around because she said 'smile baby, you're in Vegas!' at which point I flashed her a quick patronizing fake smile and went back to the angry scowl. :) Next time I'm in Vegas I think I'll just stay at Embassy Suites or Travelodge on the strip...

Reviews.Title: “Love it - Classic and Clean”
Reviews.Author: seance
Reviews.Content: After a horrible stay at the Sahara, we moved to the Golden Nugget. Clean and classy! No complaints, the staff was excellent, the hotel restaurants were good and we felt CLEAN and SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget: Does anybody work here??”
Reviews.Author: TXSheri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget every year, and love the hotel, the casino is nice (but crowded) and we mostly love the location. Our last visit this month was somewhat disappointing, however. Once you've checked in, you are on your own! Do not expect to see hotel employees again, unless you run into the maids. Check-in was abrupt and not overly friendly. But, if you've just arrived in Vegas, you are excited to get going and overlook the chilly reception. Once up in our room (South Tower) we realized that we did not receive our coupon book. So down the elevator hubby goes, in search of a few bucks off our fun. He returned emptyhanded, explaining that we did not get a book because "e "did not book the 'right' package". Huh? OK, fine, keep your freakin book you cheapskates. We will eat, gamble and spend our money elsewhere! Easy enough to do on Freemont street. The best casino is at the El Cortez anyway. We spent all our gambling money there. The day we departed we had questions about transportation to the airport, but nobody in the lobby to help us. When you NEED something, employees mysteriously disappear at the Golden Nugget. They have your credit card number, and from that point on, customer service is OVER! On the plus side of things, the rooms are large, clean and nice. The buffet is nice, but too expensive. Plenty of cheaper meals elsewhere on Freemont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodations in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PaulNori
Reviews.Content: I booked this for $73 a night on Priceline. What a deal. The room I had was nice and large. You'd think your staying on the strip. I usually stay at Main Street Station because they have a special Hawaii package....but what a nice change and treat to stay at Golden Nugget. If you are planning to stay downtown, you can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In Downtown(Old Town) Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Gone~Walkabout~Man
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Golden Nugget off and on since the late 1970's. I have seen all the "For the better" renovations thru the years. The swimming pool area has always been great, but it is even more so now. The rooms are large and modern and comfortable. I always enjoy my stays at the Golden Nugget, I'm a repeat customer, that should tell you something. I live in northern Arizona, so, I come to L.V. often. I've stayed from the southern strip to downtown, and the Golden Nugget is one of my favorites. I rate the G.N. between a 3 & 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's at the GN”
Reviews.Author: tswctf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN for three nights over the New Year's holiday. We expected it to be packed, and it was, just like the rest of the city. Positives: The property itself is great and the upgrades they've done are all nice. We had a North Tower room (the Gold Club rooms were all reserved) and it was nice--no complaints. The decor looked a bit like my grandma would have liked (very floral and lots of gold), but it was in no way old looking or shabby. Another couple in our party said their bed was awful, so maybe they have not finished replacing all of the mattresses. Apparently, some rooms are better than others. The casino was great, pool and shark tank was fabulous although it was a bit too cold to enjoy. The restaurants were all good--we especially liked the new sushi bar, which was very fresh and just as good if not better than much pricier places in town. The spa and the boutique are also first class. The Negatives: The staff, although we did not encounter anyone that was outright rude, was extremely overwhelmed, misinformed, and generally not very much help. New Year's Eve in Vegas is busy every year, so it's not like they didn't know it was coming. We arrived early so we weren't surprised or upset when our room wasn't ready, but what was upsetting was all the misinformation and wasting of our time. The first desk clerk told us she would put a rush on our room and it would be ready in 30 minutes and to go to another window (which did not exist). The second clerk told us it would be another hour. After that hour plus some had passed, the third clerk told us that it still wasn't ready and that housekeeping was behind, but that she would put a rush on it because there wasn't a rush noted previously--apparently a lie by the first two clerks. After that and a couple more hours, we called the front desk from one of the house phones in the casino. The clerk on the phone literally told me to hold while he checked (he took my name) and then never got back on the line! I called again (this is the fifth clerk mind you) and they said our room was finally ready. We got no compensation or upgrades for this inconvenience as all the better rooms were booked. That's to be expected I suppose, I just wish they would have told us we had to wait four hours so that we could have gone to do something else rather than waiting around for our room. After this major frustration was over, however, our trip got much better. Also, I agree with other reviewers that, although the property is nice, it's more fun and a younger crowd on the strip. The GN is a better value though if you want a nice hotel and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huskerfan128
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 3 day trip to Las Vegas where I had chosen to stay downtown and at the Golden Nugget because of alot of positive reviews I have read on Trip Advisor Upon arrival at 8 am to the hotel we found the hotel very clean and decorated very upscale. We were very impressed by the greetings we received coming into the hotel by many employees. We went to ask to see if we could check in...No Problems they said. Very nice since we had had a long morning flying from a eastern time zone. We were able to freshen up and relax before going down to the casino. The room was very lovely we had a King room with updated furniture. It was very clean and we had a view facing east torwards downtown and the mountains. We were on the 11th floor of the South Tower. Very quiet side of the building not facing the Fremont Street Experience. The hallways were very clean and very modern. As some reviewers have said the timeshare people can be a pain at the entrance to the elevator area of the south tower. But I found a nice way to avoid them. Every time I went past the desk area I pretended to be on the cell phone...It worked great. Although most of the time they were not really pushy with us. Awesome Pool area and Shark tank is really cool. It was cooler outside, so we could not use the pool. I was impressed with the set up of the casino. It is the nicest Casino in the downtown area hands down...I was not impressed with some of the rules of their blackjack. You cannot double down after splits and you can only split Aces once. Kind of takes away some player advantage from you. I did not do very well on any gaming action at GN but sometimes the gambling gods are not with you no matter what. One tip for visitors. A great place to go eat is the Golden Gate Hotel just up the street. Inside is Bay City Diner, they had great meals and lots of food for inexpensive prices. They are world famous for the 99 cent shrimp cocktail and it was great. Also they have a Prime Rib special for 6.99 and it was pretty good. We had a great trip and we will surely stay at the Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool”
Reviews.Author: mellimelst00
Reviews.Content: OMG Never left the pool. What an experience. Beautiful engineering. I felt like a big kid with the water slide!! Was knocking kids outta the way to get to the top first. Had a blast. Rooms were nice. Dinner buffet was fantastic. Have stayed at the Mirage and would choose the Nuggett hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget-a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: SMLJ
Reviews.Content: We go on a girls only-trip each year. We chose Las Vegas this past summer and one of the girls booked the Golden Nugget. I hadn't been in the Fremont Street area at all in at least 20 years and mistakenly thought the hotel would be run-down and not very comfortable. What a surprise - it was truly beautiful, had been completely refurbished, and the room was very roomy and comfortable enough for 4 ladies. We asked for a mini-frig and extra pillows - no problem. Beds were comfortable with nice bedding. Great pool, with water lounge chairs, and a huge fabulous shark aquarium in the middle of the pool, and a cool water slide that goes thru the aquarium-great fun.. It was very nice, with plenty of dining choices. Reasonable prices, and with city buses nearby to the strip and malls. I'd definitely return to this 'touch of class" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the remodeled Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: craig54
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Golden Nugget 3 days , from Jan 4th thruj Jan 7th. We reserved 2 ajoining rooms both with 2 queen beds. We paid 119.00 a night each for the entire weekend, which i though was a good deal. First thing you should know is the new remodel is OUTSTANDING!!. we stayed in the south tower and the rooms were elegant and very quiet. i cant say enough about the employees, every person we met was very professional and polite., and cared about their guests. We tried most of the eating options there and the Grotto and the Sunday Buffet were very very good. Me and my son played craps for 2 days and the staff at our table was helpful and very professional,two of them have worked there over 9 years. To sum up this is a quiet hotel with elegant rooms , great food , great staff . This is a place you go back to every year !

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean rooms; nice pool; secure for downtown location! Starbuck's on site!”
Reviews.Author: PleaseTakeMe2
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotels.com for three nights at the Nugget. We were a bit skeptical at first due to some of the reviews and a few of the photos. We decided to go ahead and take a chance on the room when we got a $69/nt rate and the 3rd night free. The hotel does not provide a free shuttle from the airport, but you can reserve a ride through several shuttle services for about $14 each passenger one-way. We got a great weekend rate on a rental car, so we did not have to take a shuttle. We expected to get the worse room available due to arriving at the hotel just after midnight; but to our surprise, our king non-smoking South Tower deluxe room was clean, roomy, and rather modern. The bath was marble and very clean. While the rooms have been recently renovated, the tv sets were not updated. No plasmas here----and very few viewing channels. Nobody goes to Vegas to watch tv, but it would have been nice to have more than 10 channels (4 of which were hotel only channels) to choose from when having a little down time in the room. Another downside to the Golden Nugget is the towels. They are a dark beige color, which cause them to appear dingy/dirty. The hotel has excellent water pressure and very hot water. So be careful when you flush and when you shower. We enjoyed the shark tank and the on-site Starbuck's. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, so I cannot comment on those. The gaming was okay. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful---I used the business center to fax & the employee was very courteous. Avoid those pesky time-share people in the lobby of the South Tower near Starbuck's----you'll waste a lot of your vacation if you get sucked into listening to their script. Parking is free---parking deck across the street from the hotel---show room key for easy in/out access. Steps away from the Freemont Experience. Check out was quick---South Tower has it's own front desk, but it closes around 5 pm. Overall, a very good stay. We prefer to stay on the southern end of the strip, but we would definitely stay downtown at the Nugget again if we can get a promotional rate for a free night or some other incentive.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: sublime1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the Saturday before New Year's because the rate was right at $80 a night. The first non-smoking room I was given smelled really bad. I tried to air it out by propping the door open & turning on a tiny bathroom fan. After twenty minutes it wasn't any better. So I went back to the front desk & told them I needed a different room. The second one didn't smell but the electronic key didn't work in the lock. Went back down to the lobby & they sent up a maintenance man to let me into my room. Had to go stand in line at the front desk again to get my key refreshed. Turned on the T.V. once I got in the room but it was so blurry my eyes started to hurt. This is 2008 after all...low definition television will be obsolete in one year & this hotel is hopelessly disorganized. I've never seen a tube this bad in any hotel. ESPN flashed some graphics on the screen but they were illegible. But I don't go to Vega$ to watch television...so I headed into the casino but the smoke was so thick I could barely breathe. Air filtratation systems are totally inferior at this place. Thought about going to the dinner buffet, but at $24 plus tax/tip seemed like one more money grab. The Gold Nugget offers no discount coupons for the guests. I love old downtown Vegas & wanted to like this historic hotel. People I talked to in the elevator agreed that this place sure isn't what it used to be. What a shame that management refuses to reinvest their strong casino edge back into the property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: sailordude_sd
Reviews.Content: Had a good time at the Golden Nugget. It was only on night my wife and I wanted to stay downtown for a night to check it out. The room was clean and nicely appointed. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants. Check in was quick and so was check out. For the price $79 on a friday I thought it was great. The hotel has that great Old Vegas feel and elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: CJ611
Reviews.Content: This is long but well worth the read! The Golden Nugget is the place to stay when staying down town. This was my second trip to Vegas and I really enjoyed staying off of the strip. It is pricey though to take a cab from downtown to the strip BUT you can get a ticket for the bus for $5 and it is good for 24 hours. The bus ride can be long when they are busy but it is a way to save some cash for gambling or shows. The Golden Nugget staff were all very friendly. They gave us a room with a great veiw of the strip, which is beautiful at night. They beds were pretty comfortable and the rooms were spacious. We used the room service a bunch and the food is excellent with great service. I was spoiled by their service! The pool was very relaxing and enjoyable too. There is a lot of chairs to sit in but the good ones go fast! The hot tub is very large but still can get crowded and it is right by the bar!! There was great service out by the pool as well. There are cabanas on the second and third floor in the pool area to rent and also a topless sun bathing area that is private. The water slide is very neat and something you must do. It goes right through the shark tank and is super fast. The kids will enjoy it as well as any adults. We didnt swim too much while there because it was cool outside but we did sit out by the pool and enjoyed watching the sharks swim and drinking some cocktails. EXCELLENT way to relax! The best food inside the Golden Nugget is at Vic and Anthony's steak house. It is pricey but oh so good. You have to treat yourself there atleast once. Everyone talks about the long walk from the South Tower, it really isnt that bad. In Vegas you are going to do alot of walking anyways. Now, to gamble...we did not have any luck downtown at all. So, save your money down there and go check out the show in the Golden Nugget Hotel...Defending the Caveman. Excellent and funny, but not really for kids. We had a great time staying there and will always stay there when wanting to stay off of the strip. Very impressive!
