Reviews.Title: “A Classy Hotel-Casino Downtown”
Reviews.Author: djangobibby
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best kept hotel in the downtown area, very comfortable and not terribly smokey in the casino, which was good. Nice little sportsbook area. We found the food to be a bit pricey here for what was served and ate well at much more reasonable prices in nearby hotels, esp. Main St. Station, Fitzgerald's and California. Staff were polite and helpful and we felt safe staying here. Room was well appointed. The beautiful courtyard pool and shark tank is something to behold --- a very nice area just to relax in, even if it is too cold for swimming as it was when we visited at Xmas. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Las Vegas who is looking to stay Downtown and who wants their stay to be a bit on the posh side. Classy with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great time @ the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Get0ffdanutzz
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas around 5 times, but the 5 times prior to this trip I went with a bunch on friends and Once with the wife. I've always stayed in "New Vegas" and I wanted to experiance Downtown. I had business in SoCal so I decided to go to vegas for a 3 day weekend, all by lonesome. I booked a room at the Golden Nugget because I wanted to stay at a "nice" hotel because I've heard horror stories about places like The Plaza Etc. I arrived early, Check In was quick at easy, I went to my room and noticed that my view was of a brick wall, I immediately went downstairs and told them I was not paying for a view of a brick wall, although rude the front desk clerk, gave me a room that faces the pool but I had to wait 3 hours before I could check in. No problem im in vegas. The casino was beautiful and so was the pool. I've stayed at the Wynn, Ceasars, MGM, Mirage and the Palms, so I didnt know what to expect at the Nugget, but honestly I was pleased by the pool which had a shark tank and a water slide that went right through the shark tank. Nice view. I stayed th weekend and had no problem getting chair or bed by the pool, yes I said bed, they have these bed looking things where u can relax right by the pool very nice. I finally got into the room. it was a deluxe room, you can tell that the Nugget was aged but they did a good job with quality sheets and etc. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in vegas though, but I was by myself so no problem. The Casino was nice as well. Although when I went to play I would walk across the street and go to Fitz where they have $1 tables. Also, I wanted to play Bingo for some odd reason and the Plaza had a nice Bingo hall. I always have luck in Bingo for some reason, I one 3 Grand this trip. Overall, the nugget was awesome, it was lacking a Night Club though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: jellybeanalberta
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I went on a bus tour from Edmonton to LAS Vegas and stayed at the Golden Nugget for 10 Days. This was our first trip to Vegas and I was very impressed with The Golden Nugget as from the time we entered the hotel until we left 10 days later everything was so wonderful.Everyone greeted us wonderfully and were very polite and always showed us where to go. The rooms were awesome and very clean and the service was great. We really enjoyed our stay and will defenitly go back again and stay there.Hats off to the Golden Nugget, Keep up the great work,Carol and Ed from Edmonton Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the GN several times and have always found the hotel to be clean..the staff friendly..and the casino not too crowded. The rooms have been remodeled and are comfortable and spacious. The buffet has many selections and the price is right. The dining experience at Vic and Anthony's is wonderful..the steaks are excellently prepared and it is definately a high end steak house. The Golden Nugget may not have the glamour of a hotel on the Strip but it has a certain charm and is less crowded. After all, the Strip is only a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: nfossaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Golden Nugget. As soon as we walked into the lobby I knew we were in for a good experience. The place was decorated for Christmas and it was beautiful. We were checked in promptly, given a beautiful room which was spotless. The employees we met in the course of the day were always polite and courteous. We have found if you smile and say thank you, you will have a great experience anywhere. Common courtesy goes a long way to getting what you want. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the nugget!”
Reviews.Author: Morrison84
Reviews.Content: First timers to vegas for the hatton/mayweather fight, me and my girlfriend are from the uk. After a looooong flight connecting at calgary we arrived at the nugget around 11pm on a wednesday, after reading other reviews I was expecting a line for check in however there was no one there. We were checked in in minutes, they advised us they didnt have any non smoking kings so would it be ok for us to have a double for the first night and then swap the next day, this was no problem for us. The next day they phoned our room to advise us that the king room was now available, so we went to the front desk and swapped rooms, while at the front desk I asked the helpful lady were the nearest duece stops were, she advised me to get on at the terminal but it was probably not best to stay on to the terminal at night as it was a little quiet down there after dark so she advised us to get off at the bottom of fremont. we sometimes got the duece back from the strip on a night and it was all quite safe to ride it to fremont street. When we went to our new room, the air con wasnt working correctly, it was only blowing out warm air, we rang the front desk and they sent somebody up to sort it, we werent there when they repaired it but it was blowing cold air when we came back. We stayed in the south tower and as other people have said it is quite a walk from the casino/front desk, but it didnt really bother us except when my girlfriend wore heels! Although the nugget is located downtown, we were still visiting the strip everyday, it very easy to jump on the duece at the terminal (to get there take a left out of the lobby and its 2 blocks down) there is always a deuce in bays on the far side, getting on at the terminal is better than getting on at the bottom of freemont as normally there is a line of people getting on there, if you get on at terminal you can just jump straight on a duece. It will take around 40 mins to get the to the top of the strip, but its quite enjoyable and there are a few characters who ride the duece. Our first ever duece ride was hilariuos, the driver was singing down the mic and cracking jokes all the way to the top of the strip!, something you dont get on public transport in the UK!!! and for $5 24 hr pass its well worth the ride. We had no problems at all while staying at the nugget, the room was huge for our standards, the only thing that bothered me was that the bath was really small and low, but this might just be an american thing, however it didnt bother me really. We only ate in the nugget twice, at the carson street cafe, quite tasty and fast service, no complaints here either very friendly place to stay, and would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting to stay downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place To Stay Despite Other Peoples Bad Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Bruster777
Reviews.Content: I have always said that a person writes a review and it is biased by whether they have won or lost money in Vegas. Having said that I will admit that we didn't, by any means, come home rich. My wife and I stayed at the Nugget for 5 nights and 6 days. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. We were impressed by the room, the King sized bed, and all the ammenities available. The only problem we had was trying to flush the toilet. In the interest of conserving water in Las Vegas, the toilets are the water conserving type. We had to push the handle 2 or 3 times to flush it properly. Really no problem..... I think some people expect to come to Vegas and be waited on hand and foot, and not be expected to put any effort into providing for themselves. The GN is an O.K. place to gamble. My wife hit a nice jackpot on a penny machine. The casino floor could use a filter change in the ventilation system. The smell of smoke lingers from the night before. While we were in vegas we checked out most of the downtown casinos, and always came back to the GN and felt like we were home. It was a pleasant surprise to meet, shake hands with, and take a picture of Willie Nelson in the lobby of the GN during the week. We plan to make another return trip next year and plan to stay at the GN without a doubt and hands down. We enjoyed the small town atmosphere of the Freemont Street Experience. If you go to Las Vegas YOU HAVE TO CHECK OUT THE LIGHT SHOW !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “NEW Gold Club Rooms - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jenn123444
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the new Gold Club rooms at the Golden Nugget this weekend and below is my review. I read in TA a few times where folks were looking for a review of this newly introduced room. VIP check-in does come with this room. Bypass the standard check in lines and go into the VIP room for a speedy check in. The Gold Club rooms are located in the North Tower so from the VIP room, head left towards the elevators. The Gold Club rooms are on floors 16 & 17. The top floor 18 is for the apartments (2000 sq feet) and the executive suites. Our room was 1616. View / Noise level The room view was okay. You could see the beginning of the Fremont Street Experience and the tops of some parking garages. Nothing special. The noise level at night was fairly loud for being that high up. I was a bit surprised. Bring earplugs – that solved the problem for us. You could hear the Fremont Experience (light show), the bands playing on Fremont Street, the cars/fire trucks/ambulances from the street below and could always hears lots of folks yelling. What you could not hear, was any ‘inside’ noises (meaning folks in neighboring rooms). Bathroom Excellent – Top Notch. Tile, clean new fixtures, very modern. Robes and slippers provided. Iron and board provided. Bathtub was very nice but I had expected it to be bigger (wider) and to be jetted. It was a deep soaking bathtub. Very nice, just not what I had in mine for such a nice room. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, bath sponge, lotion and bar soap all provided. Room itself Magnificent !! King bed with clean, white, crisp bedding and down comforter. High end. Lots of pillows. Large sectional sofa in the corner, plus an extra chair. LCD flat screen TV and combo DVD/CD player. Plenty of lighting. One thing I don’t think they advertised well was that you have FREE internet access in these rooms. We had wanted to do our airline check in early that afternoon but they were charging $10 pp downstairs at the machines so we decided later to use the internet through our room and picked the rate of $5.99 for two hours. When we checked out, we found out it was free internet (when we asked why the charge wasn’t on our bill). Had we known this we would have checked in hours before and gotten better seats. Nightly bed turn down service was provided. Hall way Take advantage of the free coffee and bottled water by the elevators. The water bottles in your room at $4 each, but the ones in the hallway are free. Just get them early because by mid-afternoon they are all gone. General Didn’t check out the spa at all. Used the VIP line pass at the buffet and Carson Café several times. This saved us tons of time waiting in line as we were eating at the same time as everyone else on a busy weekend. All in all, the room and service we received exceeded our expectations. The ‘virtual tour’ pictures on the hotels web site were 100% accurate as to how the room looked.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed service experience”
Reviews.Author: michal_chour
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and clean. Amentinites are good but you don't find slippers. Despite 3 reminders from me, movies on demand not fixes for 2 days. Plug addaptors not available and staff not able to offer effective assistance - first, I was sent to shop to get it - in vicinity of the hotel. It was raining and the hotel staff didn't offer umbrela - don't have any.... Secondly, the shop did't sell the adaptors so I returned to the hotel to get "assistance again". This time I was helped by lady called Trishia in business center - she was great! However, the adaptor became really expensive after I was sent to another shop which sold it. The fare 26 USD. Overall, service is terrible for somebody, who expects first class service. Staff are not very pleasant in general except of Trishia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaDi
Reviews.Content: The new pool area was fantastic and the staff was fabulous. The last time in Las Vegas we stayed on the Strip. I must say the stay at the Nugget in Old Las Vegas was much more fun to me!

Reviews.Title: “stayed over thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: jbm50
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget twice a year for 25 years and have seen many changes through the years. This trip was made as a package deal from US Airways for a better price than doing it separate as I usually do. Most of the time it's cheaper to do airfare separate and the room reservation using my slot card membership for a better deal. This is the second time in all those years that they couldn't put us in the north tower. While the south tower is nice it is true the walk is far from the casino. That in itself is not bad except if you have back problems as I have which seemed like torture each night just going to our room. I would like to put out a big THANK-YOU to maintenance man Wes for coming to our room to fix our broken down air conditioner at I think was 1 or 2 in the morning. The fan did not turn on at all so he actually took the whole unit out and replaced it all in a matter of minutes. This may seem odd to have air on this time of year but to all women out there having hot flashes you will understand this! Our package deal came with a coupon book with 2 for 1 coupons at the buffet which we used for breakfast. I really liked the selections and quality of food. Of course we overate but it was walked of each night on our trek to our room! As for the changes in the last year or two....the pool area is something to see although the chairs were to close together. They have moved my favorite machines around so that took some getting used to. The service in the Carson Street Cafe seemed to improve from previous stays. We will continue to stay here in years to come as we like the hotel and the ability to just walk outside the door to the next casino for a change of pace instead of the mile hike to each casino on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Treated very well”
Reviews.Author: glrsandldy
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel as I wanted two rooms, close together but no connecting. When I arrived they could not accommodate my request for two king rooms close together. I explained that I was traveling with two seniors and not being close would be a hardship. I even offered to take one of the rooms with two queen beds if they could get us closer. To my surprised the clerk u[graded us two a two bedroom suite in the spa tower. The room was fabulous. Very large and well decorated. I only wish we had been staying longer than one night so we could have enjoyed it more! The only negative thing I can say about the hotel is that they don't have any parking for check in. You either have to pay for the valet parking or go to the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all happy”
Reviews.Author: j2bm
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for 9 rooms originally (ended up cancelling 3) for a Thanksgiving family reunion. I called the GN directly, they assured me that we would have all the rooms on the same floor & would pre-assign them if I paid the extra for VIP check-in. When we arrrived, we went to the VIP check-in at the end of the regular check-in counter....nobody thought to send us to the VIP lounge, which I doubt would've helped anyhow....we were there for almost 3 HOURS trying to check in! No place for any of the 18 of us to sit, (ages from 8 mos to 69 yrs) ...the girl kept leaving for 30 minutes at a time, not telling us where she went! I thought maybe we were invisable! FINALLY, she started handing out our keys when I realized that we were all on different floors & 2 of us would have to change rooms on Thanksgiving day! I reserved 2 suites, those we could'nt keep! I reserved these rooms nearly 2 months prior. I was so fed up that I put all the keys down & said," I am going to go smoke a cigarette, fix this!". When I returned, the manager had taken over & tried to 'sugar coat' the situation, saying that they never pre-assign rooms & they can't guarantee anything! What a fiasco! We ended up on 2 different floors, & anly 1 room had to move, from a 2 bedroom suite to a regular room with 2 double beds! Ha! I am a smoker & the smoking rooms are nauseating! More than anything, The attitude of the staff made me feel like they just didn't care, they wouldn't look me in the eye, apologise or offer any kind of compensation for the inconvenience that THEY caused. I am not a complainer, I roll with the flow, and indeed, own a hotel myself! The rooms were beautiful, the beds & bedding were wonderful, cleanliness was okay (hair in tubs, kinda dirty, didn't smell like they used cleansers, drapes were not fresh smelling, kids feet turned black from carpet). Not unusual, but, for the price, not a great value. The Thanksgiving dinner was fine. Gambling is gambling! Nothing cheap in Vegas....no expectations there! I will not stay there again, & the rest of the party feels the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Vegas Fremont”
Reviews.Author: sandyohio
Reviews.Content: When visitng Vegas we decided to spend our last night on Fremont Street. That is the old town Vegas. If you have never been there don't miss it. You have to go at night to get the full affect. It is a little seedier than the strip but better value and easier to get around. We chose to stay at The Golden Nugget because they just did a huge remodel. The rooms we above our expectations. Large and roomy with extra space and make up table. It came with bathrobes and a digital safe.The bed was great and the room was quiet. We slept well.The restaurants were wellrun and the food was good at a good price. The service very friendly. They have this new pool that goes through a shark aquarium. Really fun! Not great for sunbathing this time of year because of the suns location to the buildings. There were complaints that you couldn't charge your drinks to the room by some guest that were by us at the pool. This wasn't a problem for us. We hit better on the slots in Fremont and it was friendly and fun. I am glad that we stayed there the last night because I was getting tired of all the extravagance of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TheNWTammy
Reviews.Content: We had a great package that included hotel and air. What we thought was a great value turned into hell. First they lost our reservation. When they 'found' it, we went up to our room and it wasn't clean. Plus the bed felt like there was a spring poking up right in my back. We asked for a different room only to get woken up at 6 AM sharp by the construction going on outside our window. The food wasn't that great either. The pool area was the best part. We had a ways to go to get to the strip but we didn't get to see all we wanted to. There wasn't enough time. We will come back to Las Vegas but we won't stay here ever again. The worst thing is when we would go to the front desk to complain, the clerk would give us a smile and a sickenly, sugary "I'm so sorry for your inconvenience" and you could tell none of them cared if we were inconvenienced or not. When we explained that we booked through Expedia, they just smiled again and said that they weren't a part of Expedia so they couldn't guarantee a promise made by Expedia. Expedia reps beg to differ on that subject. But that's another story. I just know I will never stay here again and even if you are on a budget, it's not worth it to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “5 adults at Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Needsumnow
Reviews.Content: VIP check-in - We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights in early November. We opted for the VIP check-in. When we arrived, there was one desk clerk and one customer. We sat down to the cheese cubes and bottled water. Within 5 minutes, the desk clerk was ready to assist the next client (me). A couple had walked in and were standing at the counter but deferred to me by moving (slightly) out of my way so I could check in (I think the man was mad that I had "cut" in line - he didn't seem to understand that VIP means not having to stand in line). After our very quick check-in, we left and there were 5 people waiting to check in. The clerk was unsure who was next. They should have a sign-in book at the entrance so everyone can sign in then relax. The Tank - The pool area is gorgeous and we spent much more time than expected just watching the tank sharks. The chairs are very close together (similar to a cruise ship) but were never crowded. I was surprised that the area is open to everyone - not limited to resort guests. The water is heated but the water was quite cold in the late afternoon. I did get into the hot tub for short while but with so much foam (foam=chemicals trying to kill body oils), I stayed only a short while. Except in the morning, the music level is so loud, you have to shout to hold a conversation. Grab a towel when entering. The chairs/couches are comfortable but you'll want to put a layer of protection between you and some of the stains. Room - The rooms were nice and spacious, no complaints there. Staff - Except for one slightly snippy bartender at Rush Lounge, all the staff we came into contact with were very nice and helpful. I even approached a craps table and was made to feel welcome though I am clearly a rookie. Slots-I enjoyed my corner where there are four Star Wars slot machines complete with sound effects. It paid enough so I could continue playing for a long time. Smoke - You can't escape the cigarette smoke in Las Vegas unless you're in your car. It is everywhere! Self Parking - It seems like you're driving to the desert but you're actually very close to your room. Overall, I was very pleased with our stay and hope to visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: a12barblues
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget , Nov 14-16th , we travel to Vegas 2-3 times a year as it is only a 4 hour drive. Normaly we stay at our timeshare but we used all our points Superbowl weekend . We havent stayed downtown in well over 10 years but usually spend at least 1 day per trip gambling there. Received offer for $59 per night plus coupon book , so after reading some reviews and input from friends that recently stayed there we took a shot at it. We were very pleased with our stay , room was large and clean , asked for a corner room on a higher floor and were set up in the South Tower 17th floor. Had view of Freemont Street and mountains beyond. Check in at 1pm took about 10 minutes. used valet parking . The walk from the South Tower was no big deal . Coupon book has (2) 2 for 1 buffets, free drinks , $10 match play and some other stuff. Dealers for the most part were friendly , craps tables $5-$10 minimum , BJ $10. and according to my wife slots were very tight. Pool is very cool with shark tank in the center with pleanty of seats at 3 different levels along with an adults only section. We felt very safe under the canopy , but it gets alittle scketchy outside that area at night. 2 Starbucks in casino but you'll pay about a dollar extra for everthingl. There is a "normal" Starbucks about 4 blocks away by the courthouse , it was good to get out of the smoking casino anyway. The Nugget is the classiest of the downtown casinos and falls somewhere between the strip casinos . But is you want some bang for your buck and don't need to see and be seen it's a pretty cool place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but wish it was on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ccs3rd
Reviews.Content: Since we never made it downtown on our last visit to Vegas my husband and I decided to give the Nugget\downtown a go this time round. Everything about the Nugget itself is wonderful; the staff was nice (especially the gang in the poker room), the hotel was beautiful, the pool was fun and the restaurants were delicious. Unfortunately we did miss the buzz of the strip, so we will still probably opt to stay there next time. That being said though, this hotel has it all, so if you’ve been there and seen it all and are just looking for a nice relaxing stay in a well-appointed hotel then the Nugget is a fabulous choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the old Strip”
Reviews.Author: travelwhenwecan777
Reviews.Content: This trip started out in an awful way with a 10 hour flight delay out of Green Bay. So instead of checking in around 2pm on Sunday, we checked in at 2 am on Monday. Being that it was 2 am we were expecting a short wait to check in once we got to the Nugget. Sadly, we waited nearly 45 minutes in a rather short line only to find out that the only room they had available was a smoking room. We are not smokers, and the thought of getting our much needed rest in a smoke filled room nauseated us a bit. I had recently been to the Nugget's website and noted that there were newly remodelled Gold Club rooms that they offered and asked if there was a possibility of being upgraded to one of these rooms, just for the night, and then we could relocate later in the day to the standard room we had booked. The staff agreed to this upgrade and we were informed that we could switch rooms after we have slept, etc. The Gold Club room exceeded our expectations. It was spacious, with a living room, bar area, two bathrooms and a sitting area in the bedroom as well. Plasma TV's everywhere and modern furnishings made us feel immediately better after such a long, drawn out day. The bed was so comfortable and we slept very well. Upon waking, we decided that we would rather stay in the Gold Club room for the remainder of our stay and inquired to the front desk on what the additional charge would be to stay in our current room. We were informed that it would be about $100 extra per night, an amount that we could live with and gladly agreed to charge it to our room. We ordered some room service breakfast and settled down to chill for the next few hours. Right as we finished eating, the front desk called saying that we would need to leave our room due to "unforseen mechanical issues" with our room and that the Nugget would gladly buy us lunch while we waited for a new room to come available. We had not even showered yet after our dreadful first day and were not in any condition to leave our room. I told the front desk this and asked what they could do for us instead. We were told that they could upgrade us again to a Spa Suite at the current price that we were paying for a Gold Club room. I had seen these rooms on their website as well and was satisfied with that solution. A bellman was to our door in 30 minutes, ready to move us to our new suite. I looked online and the Spa Suites go for about $400 a night and at the rate of $150 that we were paying... I felt this was a pretty good deal. The Spa Suite was a bit dated but very spacious. The floor to ceiling windows were great! The ceiling height made the suite feel huge! Almost too much for only 2 people! The bedroom suite part had a great 2 person steam shower, vanity, seperate toilet area and a jacuzzi tub. The lower level had a bar area, dining area, living room section with tv and stereo setup and another bathroom. Our view was pretty nice, over looking the pool. The jacuzzi tub over looking the city at night was very relaxing. The bed was also very comfortable. All in all, the Golden Nugget took care of us after an initially rough start. I don't know if I would pay to stay in a Spa Suite again, although I will most definitely stay in the Gold Club rooms next time we choose to stay on the old Strip. For the money, they were very, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wadewynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN from a thursday night to sunday afternoon. The rooms were clean and we stayed in the south tower. The money they spent on the place can been seen at the pool with the slide and shark tank. We ate the breakfast buffet on fri for 10 bucks and it goes up to 17.99 on sat and sunday (champaine). We also ate at the site down cafe a few times and was pleased with the food. Price was about 10 per head. Sports book is a little small but the overall amount of people at the GN and downtown is lower than the strip. We took the "bus" which is called the Duece and it is 5 bucks for 24 hrs. Watch out for prime times on the bus since it will take sometimes up to 45 minutes to get to your destination depending on where it is on the strip. The downtown experience is different and the nugget is by far the best hotel down there. In would recommend it for the price and stay there again. The pool,slide, and tables outside by the pool are the best things about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe hotel for children!!! Do not stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: sprts4lfe16
Reviews.Content: I was here over Labor Day weekend and was riding their new water slide and my head was smashed into the top of the slide!! The Golden Nugget did nothing to help me and won't help pay for my medical bills, that THEIR FAULTY WATER SLIDE CAUSED!!! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel on Fremont-but really missed the hub-bub of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Tlaquay
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the line for the checkin was long, however an employee allowed us to use the Southern Tower lobby for checkin. Once there we inquired about upgrades and boy did it pay off. We were rewarded to an extra $50 a night for a suite in the North tower. The room was wonderful and the bed was FANTASTIC. I highly reccomend Room #834 in the North Tower. *Large Bedroom with King size pillow top bed *Large Sitting area with Dining table *2 marble bathrooms, 1 boasts a jacuzzi tub and the other boasts a stand up shower. Also there is a private vanity area in the bedroom * Room also includes wet bar with sink, coffee pot, and mini fridge. *2 televisions, 2 phone lines, and 2 Bose stereos The location of the hotel was prime for the Fremont experience, Binions, Fitzgeralds and 4 Queens. The average cab ride to the Strip is going to set you back about 20 to 25 per ride. Just FYI. If you have a problem with this then catch the bus for $5 per day or just bypass Fremont and stay on the Strip. The hotel itself was well kept from what we saw and the slots paid out or least ours did. We won over $1000 on nickel and pennie slots. The Grotto restaurant has fabulous Italian and Vic & Anthonys Steakhouse was wonderful. We had the 8oz Filet and split a 20oz lobster tail. YUMMY! We are very happy we picked this hotel, but will most likely stay on the Strip next time, since sightseeing and restaurants are more our thing than gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Has improved but could do better.”
Reviews.Author: coysh
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has improved a lot since the last time I stayed especially the food outlets there is a very good Chinese’s restaurant, steak house and Italian restaurant. Plus the Buffet for breakfast is a real bargain. The shark tank is interesting but the pool area is a bit small and crowded. One thing spoiled our stay and that was upon check in (at this time of day there where no queues) we arrived at about 9.00 PM on a Monday evening and they only had smoking rooms left. Even though you have paid for a room it is take it or leave it. They offered to deodorise the room but it does not mask the smell of smoke and it smelt like an ashtray. It must say something to hotels if the only rooms they have left are smoking rooms that is nobody wants to sleep in a rotten smoke stained ashtray of a room if I smoked I would not want to sleep in it so it is no wonder it is all that is left. They compounded this by not offer any refund or compensation it was a case of we are sorry but that is all we have until the next day. The next day we changed to a different room in the South Tower. This was on a non smoking floor and was a lot quieter and much better than the noisy North Tower. Most hotels let you reserve non smoking rooms why can the GN not do this? In my view save your self some money as there is no difference between the 2 towers apart from a 40 Meter walk to the lobby and where I come from that is not “a long hike". The rooms were nearly identical in size and fittings the levels of cleanness was OK but could have been better there was dust under the beds in both rooms. Apart from this complaint the GN is the best hotel located Down Town. I have stayed on the strip and I like both locations for different reasons it has improved it does offer good value for money but it is lacking in levels of service and could still do better. If you want a quality stay there are better hotels on the strip but you will have to pay more and you will miss out on what makes down town an interesting place to stay. I guess if you want to avoid an ashtray of a room get there early.

Reviews.Title: “the gamble paid off”
Reviews.Author: meatslinger
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this and other web sites were so polarized I really couldn't decide whether I should stay at the GN, although I wanted to absorb the downton LV culture on a brief visit. Being Vegas, I took the gamble and it really paid off. We arrived around 4:00 on a Wednesday and there was absolutely no wait at the regular check-in counter where we were processed in about 2 minutes. Our double room on the 4th floor of the south tower was enormous, with a sparkling clean bathroom and firm but comfortable beds. We didn't have much of a view but probably could have asked for a higher floor. Being on the lower floor, though, we never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator. Not bad for $69 a night. If you really want a view of the surroundings, you'll need to get a room on at least the 10th floor. The hotel is quite large, thus I would suggest that those who will be gambling a lot pay the extra money and get a room in the north tower which is much closer to the hotel casino and other venues on Freemont St. Those, however, who prefer access to the self-service garage, shark-infested pool, and a slightly more isolated experience can do better in the less expensive south tower. The pool was kind of neat but the water just a bit too cold for swimming or taking a slide through the fish tank. Towels are available poolside. We had a good dining experience in the Asian restaurant in the south tower lobby area. For breakfast, save a couple of bucks and try the Freemont Casino Paradise Buffet across the street. All in all, an excellent experience, and the only good gamble I made in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: tryanythingonce
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Spa Suite for just one night in transit thru Vegas to Denver and was so glad we did. We booked a spa suite as we wanted to experience the true, Vegas experience and boy did the Golden Nugget deliver! Check in was brilliant - in the VIP lounge, with a glass of champagne and some cheese. No queue - this felt very exclusive. The room was really, truly brilliant and undersold on the hotel website. We had a steam room in the bathroom and a two person hot tub - after a 10 hour flight from London, this was SO welcome! The sitting area was beautiful - great wet bar area, lovely comfy sofas, downstairs guest toilet and the best bathrobes. Upstairs the bedroom area was lovely with a very very good bed (better than at the Bellagio!!) and Bose wave hi-fi. We ate in the Asian restaurant, which was really excellent. The pool area is just great - the slide goes straight through the shark pool, and the staff were so accommodating. Freemont Street is a must see - at night. In the day, it is a bit tacky and a long way from the strip, but I would be very happy spending a few days at the Golden Nugget without leaving the hotel except to view the Freemont Street show. Overall? This hotel is underrated - and just for a treat - book a spa suite - you will not regret it! (They are all optional smoking rooms tho so if you hate smoke, it may not be for you). Thanks to all at the GN fcor giving us an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had fun at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mothra102
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget a couple of times before and always enjoyed our stay. Since the remodel the hotel looks even better. The reason we stay at the Golden Nugget is how small the hotel is compared to those on the strip. In 5 mins you can leave your room and be in the casino, restaurant, or pool. The casino is small enough that we had no problem located our fellow travelers. The new pool area is sensational. The chairs around the pool are too close together, but comfortable. The new restaurants are great and offer good food. The old coffee shop is still there and still has good food, but service is extremely slow so bring a newspaper or book to read. The rooms don't appear to be upgraded as they still had that musty smell. Even though we were in non-smoking rooms we could still smell the smoke from the floor above. We love the Fremont Experience, but there isn't much else to do in the downtown area. This area needs some serious revamping. Although we love the Golden Nugget will probably stay on the strip next time to be closer to all the entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!!”
Reviews.Author: Boog48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget 10-26/29th 2007 and we had a wonderful wonderful time. Anthony & Vic's steakhouse really made our diing experiance a perfect birthday memory. Lillie's Noodle House had great food. Check in and Check out was fast and easy. The Italian restaurant has the best pizza ever. The rooms were clean and so was the hotel. VERY VERY nice place. Will be there again soon. We have stayed at the MGM before and did not like it at all. The Nugget was so much fun and the Freemont Experiance was a 3 day party.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: uk_she
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we've stayed in downtown Vegas and in my opinion in beats the hotels on the strip hands down. The refurbished Golden Nugget is undoubtedly the best hotel downtown and it could hold its own against some of the fancier strip hotels. It leaves places like Circus circus and Excalibur in the shade. I don't have one single complaint about this hotel. We were in a South Tower Deluxe room which was not outrageously priced at all. The pool complex was fabulous. The staff were helpful and attentive. The onsite food was great. The whole place was very clean. All this and the fabulous atmosphere and choice that Fremont Street has to offer right on your doorstep. My top tip is to walk down block or so to catch the Deuce which is the strip bus. They come every 7 mins and you can get a $5 24hr ticket so you can jump on and off all day. Sit upstairs for the best view. Also for cheap eats go to the Paradise Buffet at the Fremont Casino. Even my fussy eater husband loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Coder
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to Vegas after 22 years curious to see exactly how it had changed so after seeing hotels on the strip were $150+ we decided to stay downtown and found the Nugget had rooms for $89/night so we booked 4 nights. The Golden Nugget was a really nice place to stay and the staff was extremely helpful with all our needs especially the valet parking. The room was clean and the bed was more than comfortable. This establishment is right on the Fremont Street Experience where the famous light show is every night. We stayed in the north tower and really did not hear any noise from the streets at night. It was also easy to access the Vegas strip from here as we stayed off Vegas Blvd and took several side streets which made things easier as well. One of this things that has changed about Vegas in the ways to get around as there are now several monorail systems and above ground walkways - very impressive. There are just a few things about the Golden Nugget that I noticed - There's no in room coffee probably because they want you to go to their Starbucks (there are two in this hotel) and no little refrigerator or microwave which are common in hotels these days - again probably because they want you to use their giftshops and eateries but don't get me wrong, they are great dining places. I also understand that it is about making money. What we did was brought a cooler and just kept it filled with ice the whole time. The GN is a fine hotel and we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: StevoLakeTahoe
Reviews.Content: Well I waited to long to book a room for Interbike 2007, so I missed out on the good rates at the big places near the strip. I didn't want to pay $200+ for one night when all I needed was a quiet smoke free place to sleep.I have had very bad experiences in Vegas at "cheap" hotels, so I was very skeptical. When I checked Hotels.com it was the third choice on the list. I read a few reviews and just about everyone said it was smoke free and decent place to stay. I ended up booking directly with them to save a few dollars. If you are looking for glitz and glam this is not the place. If you are looking for an inexpensive clean smoke free place this is it. The staff was also friendly and understanding when I checked in late and was very tired and grumpy. About the room: I chose the North Tower because it was newer and the entire tower was built as a smoke free environment. There was a $10 price difference between the two towers. I stayed on the 9th floor facing north towards Fremont Street. The room was definitely larger than expected. The decor was modern enough and the colors were neutral. Cleanliness was excellent throughout the room. The bathroom was modern but the ventilation fan didn't move much air and the shower was dimly light.. Other than that it was great room. The linens were new and clean and the bed wasn't too mushy. I will definitely stay there again. I even figured out a way to navigate down to the strip by using South Main and Industrial Road to avoid the heinous traffic on the strip and on I15. I will try and add photos at a later date.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: KayD
Reviews.Content: We had book our 4 night stay directly with the hotel but when we arrived at 9pm after 16 hours travelling there was no room ready for us. We were told to come back in 45 minutes when one would be clean. When we finally got a room it was a twin not a king which we had booked and we were told basically it was hard luck and you get whatever is available. We promptly decided to check out the next day, which we did and went to the Paris. We did however get charged on our credit card after we had left for 3 further nights without authorisation. We were refunded in the end after making 2 long distance calls back to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget, The Best Place To Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: hal52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget September 2nd till 13th, had a great stay and would definitely recommend it, we are booking soon to go back next year. Our room was in the South Tower the walk from the Casino was not a problem, the room it self was very nice and clean, room service did a good job every day. We loved the pool and spent many a relaxing time there. It was our Fourth visit to Las Vegas and this time we felt we were able to take it easy and relax, not needing to rush around every day, to try and see everything. The staff were all very polite and helpful, the Rush Bar was superb, Frankie Moreno and his band playing there are not to be missed. Noticed this visit there are less Vagrants wandering Downtown, may be just a coincidence but the Shark Tank in the Nugget has some very well fed Sharks (Allegedly).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay at the golden nugget”
Reviews.Author: MouseEssex
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a brilliant 8 day stay, and can honestly say that our total experience was perfect. Our first visit to LV was last year, when we stayed at the Bellagio, but dispite this comparison we were VERY pleased with the GN. The hotel, starting from the Lobby was impressive, expecially for the amazing price. The pool was very good, and was being constantly tidied by staff. We ate a substantial breakfast each day at the Carson St. Cafe, the wait staff and food were very good, and could not be faulted. We were very pleased with our South Tower room, yes, the bathroom was smaller than previously experienced and did not have a seperate shower, but still bigger than our bathroom at home. We always tip daily for housekeeping (reap the rewards of your tip whilst you are still there!) and we were always fully stocked with toileteries, towels etc. Fremont Street is great, so much to see and you feel totally secure. Suffient security staff on bikes to feel safe, but without making you nervous. Deuce bus service was a real find and really makes a difference, and would suggest that you only use the trolley for the ride from the Stratosphere to the Premium Outlets at $2.50 each. We also enjoyed an outstanding meal at Hugo's Cellar (as found on TA), we pushed the boat out with the upmarket "surf and turf" and were not disappointed by anything. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHobo
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was the right choice for my most recent trip to Vegas. It's the only really nice place to stay in downtown, which is the place to go if you're looking for a different Vegas experience, with cheap gambling, plenty to see and do, and a very interesting mix of people. We had a good experience here from the beginning. Easy and quick check-in, comfortable rooms, and really nice hotel facilities. The casino is quite nice, and has relatively low-limit tables, which I enjoy. The pool area is the highlight of the resort, with the cool shark tank and water slide. And the $5 blackjack tables by the pool provided a nice atmosphere for some gambling as well. We ate at the cafe, which was better than most, but didn't try any of their other restaurants. The rooms are pretty standard, nicer than others downtown, but not as fancy as some others I've stayed in on the strip (Venetian, Paris, etc). But the price was right ($130/nt. or so on the weekend), and it provided a great base for a fun and relaxing Vegas trip. You get the Vegas feel without the pretentiousness of the Strip. If you've stayed on the strip and want a nice alternative for your next trip, I'd definitely recommend the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: GreenTrout
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for out 25th anniversary. We checked in on a Wednesday at 4pm without having to wait. Only problem was that we could not get into the room until after 7pm because it "wasn't ready". I found this to be really unacceptable for a weekday standard room. This kind of ruined dinner plans since we could not change into nice clothes for the restaurant. However, there are lots of good casual places to eat elsewhere in the downtown area. Otherwise, the room was about what I expected. The beds were hard so be prepared for that. Furnishings were a little worn. The pool area is very nice but could be larger. The chairs are packed together pretty tightly. The water slide is fun-even for a 50 year old. We stayed at the South tower and the short walk is no problem. Be prepared to ignore the timeshare salespeople. Here's a tip-don't walk together with your spouse and they won't bother you. Staff and casino personnel were friendly and we really had no problems other than not getting into our room on time. This was my second time at the GN.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget works for us”
Reviews.Author: charnascarchar
Reviews.Content: We arrived Oct 3rd - 8th for a reception in our room and our wedding. Our choice for a room was the spa suite. It was everything that you read about here in the reports. What a suite to entertain about 30 of our friends. VIP check in it was very easy and any questions that I had was answered or I directed to who I needed to talk to. The lines were very long for any of our friends that did not do VIP. On Friday evening we hosted a reception for everyone attending our wedding. I called room service on Thursday and had everything arranged to be sent up to the room Friday afternoon. One note, if you go out the entrance by the sports book and go left there is a liquor store on the left. This will save you lots if you want to drink in your room. Glasses, mixers, etc. arrived early Friday afternoon and ice was brought up to us right before the party. We all left the reception and went downstairs to Vic and Anthony's for dinner. I had taken place cards for everyone attending to Kelly the day before for the table. Everything was as I wanted it and my every wish was meet with no questions all evening. The lobster bisque is to die for. The maid service was hit and miss with some toiletries being replaced on some days and not on others. You do have a coffee pot in the room but this was not cleaned on certain days. We throughly enjoyed the Grotto Bar and the restaurant. We did not go into the restaurant but we did order late night meals from the bar area and took them back to our room. The food was great. We liked Vic and Anthony's so much that a group of us went back on Sunday evening and ate there again. We had breakfast one morning at Carson Street Cafe and the food was excellent there also. We ate one evening at Lillies Noodle House and it was just mediocre. Anyone wanting to get married, the courthouse is within walking distance of the Nugget. Our limo's were arranged through the hotel to go to the chapel and arrived on time. The only glitch was in checking out. The room rate that was quoted to us was not what we were charged. Always bring along your original paperwork. I went upstairs and got the original paperwork and our bill was adjusted to reflect that. All in all, we feel like this is the place to be if you want to be relaxed and have some fun. By the way, we won enough money at the Nugget to pay for our trip. We are already planning an anniversary at the Nugget next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBry
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at the Nugget for 5 nights and were very pleased. Our trip got off to a bit of a suspect start when we were assigned a smoking room after we had asked for a non-smoking room. We got up to the room and it was very small and our view was of a concrete wall about 1ft. from our window. We could not even see the sun. We went the front desk the next morning and they were very helpful and switched us to a much nicer room w/ a nice view of the Nevada mountains. Everything from that point was nice. The beds were very comfy and the place is kept very clean. The Valet parking service is a nice touch and the pool are was awesome. The Shark Tank is very cool and the hot tub area and Dive Bar is nice also. The only negatime about the pool area was that the pool closed at 6PM. That is way too early to close any pool down, much less a pool in vegas that is as cool as the Tank. The Casino is very classy and the New Sports Book area is very nice. The dealers were nice and the restaraunts were solid also. Fremont Street is a very cool place to stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: rrdub
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights and had a pretty good experience. Reserved a south tower room online and when we got there they upgraded us to north tower. only problem was the room was right next to the elevator and very noisy- not just the elevator and people but one morning there was jackhammer construction going on starting at 7 am-all morning! so much for sleeping in on vacation. Also we had no view of anything, I mean NO view.... there was a concrete wall about a foot outside our window. the room was huge, clean (except for stains on carpet) and the bed was comfy. definately the nicest place downtown but its still downtown and the odds are more like the strip properties.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service from Check In to Check Out.”
Reviews.Author: heavyweight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 4 nights and will never stay anywhere else in Las Vegas. Check in was effortless, the room was large, clean and the buffet outstanding. The A/C unit was not cooling properly and maintenance replaced it in less than 20 minutes from the time we placed the service call. Visible Security personnel who actually checked our room keys before allowing access to the elevators, drinks supplied without asking while playing at the tables and slots, and very friendly dealers made for an outstanding experience. The Tank is a great experience and one of the few pool areas that actually have enough chairs and lounges to accommodate their guests. We will return at the first opportunity. Thanks to the management for maintaining a little bit of old Vegas with modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A blast from the past”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for a long weekend last month, and decided to try something different than the strip - not that there's anything wrong with that. There have been several reviews about this hotel here, and most of them are right. I was transferring from another hotel in town, so I checked in at what I thought was an odd time, so there wouldn't be much of a line - wrong! The lobby is too small, so it makes the line seem even worse, but pay the extra for VIP check in - I'm glad I did. We stuck with the standard south tower, and it was fine. Yes, it was a walk, but not the end of the world. The room was in generally good shape, but older. Some renovations had been made, some could still stand to be done. Weather stripping around the window was loose and the wind whistled on the 19th floor. The A/C was a window unit - you don't see those in newer rooms. The furniture was in good shape, but it was older, dark gray-green faux bamboo trimmed. The TV wasn't very large, and the cable seemed to reset every day, requiring a call to the front desk to get it reset. The pool was beautiful, sharks were an interesting touch. Apparently $70 million of the $100 million that Landry's has spent was on the pool. I have never seen so many chaise lounges squeezed into such a tight space, though. I can't imagine what it's like in the summer! The restaurants are hit or miss. The Landry's branded restaurants are excellent, while the legacy GN restaurants are mediocre at best. The Grotto was as good as the original in Houston, and Vic and Anthony's might have been better. The only problem there was that they let people into the restaurant in shorts - they need to enforce a dress code. The casino turned out to be one of my favorites. Reasonably priced tables for a hotel casino ($5 BJ) and the best music of any casino I've been in - a lot of classic rock from 70s and early 80s. Only drawbacks are sparse waitresses and only one restroom location in the middle. Downtown is not the strip, and it's not quite the same experience. Once you're off Freemont Street, downtown is not a place you really want to be. On Freemont Street, the GN is by far the nicest hotel there, and the only 4 star hotel. Plus, it's pretty easy to get to the strip if you really need a fix. This was an interesting change, and a hotel I would consider again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Public Areas”
Reviews.Author: sarge74
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day visit to the GN casino and found it a very beautiful building at least in the public areas. The check in went quickly, helped that it was at 12:45AM. We were on the 20th floor, 20111. The room was as we remembered it from prior visits, large,clean, and with a good view of the Strip. However there were some minor problems which really don't belong in a 4 star hotel. The shower worked fine but the drain didn't work properly. I really didn't mind taking a shower standing in water up to my ankels, and the visable rust arounmd the shower drain and the door hinges really didn't bother me either. The shampo and lotion was never replaced after being used and one day neither were the towels.We didn't spend a lot of time in the room so our television not working properly really didn't bother us much either. The picture would be fine then go to fuzzy with lines and even change channels occasionally by itself. On the evening of the second day it didn't get a picture. On the morning of the third day I complained about the tv to the front desk who said they would send someone up to look at it and we didn't have to stay in the room. On our arrival back in the room the evening of the third day the tv's position had been changed so someone at least did look at it, It worked better but thew picture was still not good. Other than than the minor problems in the room the wife and I were very impressed by the public areas, The new pool which rates in the top 6 in Vegas was very impressive especially with the Shark tank in the middle of it. The buffet was reasonably priced the the food was good. Lastly the slot machines payouts wern't very good to us, so enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suites: worth the splurge”
Reviews.Author: 4meandhim
Reviews.Content: Oct 1-5 stay in a spa suite (1br @ 1800 sq ft) was very nice. Suite and property in excellent condition, VERY clean, and well maintained. Check in/out: VIP check-in included with suites, but worth $15 for regular rms (no lines!!!). I agree with other reviewers: BELL STAFF do NOT offer assistance. I guess they don't depend on gratuities! At 6am check out, only bell staff available at desk. Was the ONLY guest at the desk, but had to wait for the 4 bellmen to notice me. Thank goodness they weren't my FIRST interaction upon check in. Service: The service provided by all others (VIP desk, housekeeping, maint., valet, rm svc, casino staff) was timely and attentive. With the exception of the bell staff, they are happy to be at work, and very happy that YOU are there. The bell staff needs work. Suite: 2-story suite was very clean and nice. If you stay Monday-Thursday, for the same price as regular room on the strip, please treat yourself to this guilty pleasure. You'll find marble, great crown and picture mouldings, and gold & brass fittings EVERYWHERE. If you want vintage Las Vegas glam, get a spa suite. The suite is 1800 sq. ft. of over-the-top tacky-liscious fun! Specs: 1 1/2 baths, spa tub overlooking living rm (look at the skyline while lounging in the spa!!), huge steam shower, dressing area, and fainting couch in bed chamber. Most importantly, there is a coffee maker (not found in regular rooms) and the spa tower has a private elevator right at the casino entrance. (ref: other reviewers about north and south tower rms) Food: Room service presentation was better than expected and restaurants ok, nothing spectacular. Buffet not worth the wait or the money. GO to the Paradise Buffet across the street....very good (don't be discouraged by long line...it moves rapidly). Gaming: I enjoyed the smaller casino. If you like the large sprawling complex, this might not be for you. The GN's gaming floor is very well lit and plush for a small place. Slots were loosest at the GN... I lost and won back money EVERY day. Parking: USE THE FREE VALET PARKING. To avoid waiting, call from your rm when you want to get your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Reenwad
Reviews.Content: Read and heard about all the renovations the Nugget has done and all I can say is WOW! Great job! We arrived on September 19th. We reserved a two bedroom suite, since there were six of us sharing the room, we thought that would work great. When we arrived, the check-in line was quite long, but since we reserved a two bedroom suite, we got to use the VIP check-in service. (A private little room off to the side)Checking in was no problem at all, except our room wasn't ready, (we arrived about 1:00 pm) but it only took them about an hour. Our room, #827, is basically three rooms made into one big one in the north tower. (The difference between the north and south tower is walking distance! The elevators were very convenient for the north tower, the south tower was quite a hike to get to.) Our room had three entrances! A door to the left was the master bedroom, the door in the middle was the living area, and the door to the right was the second bedroom. Each bedroom had a full bathroom, and there was another in the living area, which made three full bathrooms. It was beautiful. The beds were the most comfortable I have EVER slept on. The living area was quite large. It had a full size couch & table, dining area, wet bar, and of course at television. See the photos! Bell desk had our luggage up within minutes of calling! We dined mostly at the Carson Street Cafe. Food was good there and had quite a selection. From breakfast, to sandwiches, to steak dinners, there was ample to choose from. We did have the breakfast buffet one morning, which was pretty darn good for buffet food. I don't like to eat at buffets all that much, but everything seems quite fresh and hot! Breakfast was $10 - great deal! The Grotto was our favorite stop for food. They had the best thin crust pizzas there! Drinks were a strong there, much stronger than the freebies on the floor. And not to ridiculously priced - $15.00 + tip for a Captain & Diet and a Pina Colada. Room service we used only for coffee in the morning - $15.00 for the pot plus tip. I'm glad only three of us drank coffee!!! The pool is amazing! It has the "shark tank" in the middle, and the pool goes around it. There are also other fish in the tank, maybe food for the sharks??? They have a slide that goes right through the shark tank - and it's clear so people can watch you and you can see the sharks as you fly by. There was seven cabanas on the upper level that you could reserve. I think the price was $150 for the day, and you had to be out by 9:00 pm. They had a fridge, television, safe and comfy couches! We got cabana #4, which was right next to the "adult sunbathing section". Hot tubs stayed open til 2:00 am too! The casino was plenty big with lots of tables to play cards. Not alot of waitresses going around offering drinks, but when you found one and treated her well, she would remember you! Slots were pretty tight, but we all had fun gambling here! Valet guys were awesome! Quick and efficient. The day we we're leaving our guy actually took the time to write down the directions to the car rental place for us so we wouldn't get lost! Great service, great people and great rooms - that sums it all up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Fremont Location & Pool, guestrooms lacking”
Reviews.Author: CGTravels
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget boasts ann excellent Fremont Street location and the public areas are nice, especially the fish tank water slide pool area. Lillie's Noodlehouse has great Wonton Soup and the Carson Street Cafe has the best Banana Cream Pie ever... we're talking my favorite dessert to date and I have sampled a few. However, the guestrooms, like many Vegas hotels, are poor in quality. The bedding is less than desirable and the room smells strongly of cleaning supplies. Check-in lines are attrocious!!! Be prepared to pay for any extras: internet, use of fitness, etc. However, parking is free, but that's most places in Vegas. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Doglady17
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and decided to try the Golden Nugget as a change from the strip while in town for four days visiting our new grandson. We were very pleasantly surprised. The check in line was long but moved quite quickly. The hotel itself can hold its own with most on the strip and definitely better than some. When we walked in our room we both said WOW. It was lovely and big. The bathroom wasn't huge but definitely adequate. I work at a resort so I'm picky and notice everything and this room was spotless. The towels were fluffy and they even supplied robes. These are items I'd expect in a much more expensive hotel. Everyone we met except our waiter the final morning was extremely nice and helpful. Didn't use the pool but it is great. Loved watching the fish. Ate at The Grotto one night and the food was wonderful. It's entirely open so it's noisy or it would have been more enjoyable. Bike Fest was going on our weekend so there was also lots of noise going on all night long with Harleys coming and going. Any other time I'm sure it wouldn't have been a problem. I didn't really like the downtown area itself but the Golden Nugget has no complaints from me. Well, maybe one, I didn't win!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimbo410
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in 1946 and they have kept it in excellent condition. Beautiful chandlers. Kinda reminded us of a cruise ship. The pool is one of a kind. The pool is not large in size, it circles the tank. The tank is awesome! Beautiful at night. There pool is open til 9PM. Two waterfalls for a nice head massage. The lounge chair area is not large but there is a lot of movement so you may have to wait it out for a lounge chair. Way too many towels to make it look like it is occupied, a lot of guest just get up and leave the towels. They should be more strick on the distribution of the towels and this would not happen. But what a cool pool, you will never get this close to a shark, when they swim by the glass you can see all their teeth. The water slide is two flights of stairs up, but what a blast. You must do this at least once while you are there. We had breakfast every morning in Carson Street Cafe in the hotel; they are open 24 hours a day. Food was good, breakfast special starts out at $7.95. Pot of coffee $2.50 with a cafe left on the table. We also had dinner at their buffet upstairs. We do not usually do buffets, but theirs was awesome. They had Food stations labled with different foods. Salad, soup, Seafood (peel and eat shrimp deveined), sushi, fried shrimp, shrimp gumbo, Oriental stir fry, egg rolls, carved beef, turkey, ribs, Italian dishes, fresh made pizza and a dessert area. Much much more, but that is all I can remember at the moment. $17.99 including your beverage. The portions placed out were small but replenished often so it does not get old and dried out, very fresh. Grilling meat as you watched. They also have mixed, and specialty drinks at a considerable reduced price. If you go make plans to eat there at least one night. It was excellent. All the food was very yummy. Dessert were excellent, cakes like you would see in a bakery, carrot cake was excellent, cookies, sugar free deserts, hand scooped ice creams and sorbet. Big Bang for your buck. Grotto, Italian resturant, we had pizza there thin crust chicken which was very good. Two starbucks coffee shops available. One with an outdoor cafe on Fremont Street. The are doing some renovations, so no need for an alarm clock or wake up call, the worker show up daily for work. Their work area does not interfere with your stay. Well we just flew in, when I get some photos off my camera hopefully I can post to this and if I think of anything else, I will add it. One of the best in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Baskgrl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget before, but this time the experience was not as pleasant as in the past. The check-in time took forever, even though there were only 3 of us in line and three people at the counter - we got in line at 8pm and finally checked in at 8:30. The room (south tower) was fine except for the bathroom. The tiles were dirty and the water would back up in the tub when taking a shower. We like the downtown location but will find a different place to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lady Luck's alive and well at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: ADeputy4U
Reviews.Content: About a month before our trip, I had received an invitation from the Golden Nugget to stay with them Sunday through Thursday at a $69 per night rate (standard king room) and also receive a complementary coupon book good for services at the hotel worth over $250 dollars. The rate of stay for Friday and Saturday in the standard king room was $189 per night. When I called to make reservations, I learned I had earned four complementary nights at the hotel using my Preferred Arrangements (PA) Card. (If you don’t have a card, call the hotel and ask to become a member. It’s free of charge). I also learned, by staying on the nights I booked, I would earn double PA points (you earn 25 points during a normal stay Sunday thru Thursday and 20 points for Friday and Saturday). This meant, we could pay for the first two nights at 50 points a night and comp the last night, and not loose any points already earned. Good stuff huh! I also want to tell you I researched the latest information on the hotel via Trip Advisor and learned of a VIP program where you could pay $15 dollars through VIP services and use them for check-in and out, eat light snacks during your stay (cheese and cracker plates in the lounge while open) and arrange any type of concierge issues you might have, like booking shows on the strip or Limos. I called and paid for the service prior to our trip. More on the VIP service in a moment. My wife and left out of San Jose, Ca on an afternoon Southwest Airlines flight and arrived in Las Vegas on time. We took the free shuttle bus to the new rental car center and picked up our compact car at Advantage for $13 a day. Once the car was loaded, we were off to the Golden Nugget. We arrived at the hotel around 4:15 pm, and I noticed the line for check-in was extremely long. An easy 20 minute wait. Here’s where the $15 dollars for the VIP services comes in handy. Just off the check-in area is where the VIP lounge is located. We opened the door and were greeted by a young lady behind the counter who asked for our last name (oh, I forgot to mention there was no one waiting to check-in inside the VIP lounge). Once she had the name, we were checked-in and handed our room keys and our coupon book. We were given a room in the South Tower. The South Tower is located away from the Casino floor, heading towards the pool and Carson Street Café. I’ve seen a few post on here about the “long walk” and how horrible the distance is from everything. I didn’t see it that way. Yeah, it’s not right next to the Casino and the restaurants, but you’re only in the room to sleep, right. Our room was 1499, located at the far end of the tower. The room’s are older, but never the less, clean and quite. We put our things away and made our way back down to the Casino level to explore the hotel (I had not been to the GN since 2005). We went outside to the pool area and I can’t express to you how nice the pool area is now. The Shark Tank and water slide that goes through the middle of it. There were Cabana’s, air mattresses, a Hugh Jacuzzi and even an 18 and over, European Tanning Area. That’s right, a nude tanning area (located on the 3rd floor, south end). The rest of the hotel looked fantastic too. The new owners have done a great job with their renovations. We had dinner at Grotto’s, known best for its Outstanding Pizza, WHICH THEY ARE by the way. The wife had Lasagna and I had a pasta dish that was out of sight. After dinner, we did some gambling. The tables were $5 dollars a play on Wednesday night and went to $10 on Thursday through Friday nights. The casino’s across the street from GN stayed at $5 dollars a hand during our entire stay. The Fremont Street experience was good, but the thing that really impressed us was the Spray Painters who did paintings using nothing but their talents and spray paint. They are incredible. Make sure you take the time to watch one of these guys do their work. On Thursday, we decided to grab a Cabaña for the day. They have a total of seven. Four are located on the 3rd floor and three on the 2nd. There’s a private bathroom located on the 2nd floor, and the entrance to the water slide is on the 3rd floor. The Cabana’s are $150 dollars Monday through Thursday and $200 dollars Friday through Sunday. Included with each Cabana is a 42 inch, flat screen HD TV, a refrigerator, a safe, two wicker chairs and sofa and four lounge chairs outside. You also get your own drink hostess and concierge. The service was great and I had a great day just relaxing and being pampered all day. Well worth the money. On our last night at the hotel, my wife and I had dinner at Vic & Anthony’s Steak House, located inside the GN. The food was FANTASTIC! I highly recommend dinner there and make sure you make reservations. The only other place we dined at within the hotel was the Carson Street Café. The food was okay, nothing great to report. Take a look at the photo’s I posted and if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask me. I enjoy reporting and taking in depth photos on places I visit, because I hate going in blind to anywhere I plan to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Standout Downtown”
Reviews.Author: pirate859
Reviews.Content: No problems or queues at check in, offered our choice of King or twin Queens room. Lobby and public rooms were all attractively decorated and sparkling (as one would expect in a property that has just completed a major refurbishment). Our room, King on the tenth floor in the south tower, was spacious, comfortable and very clean. Sound insulation was very good, despite being the nearest room to the elevators we were never disturbed by noise. Bed was on the firm side, but I had two great nights sleep so can’t be that bad. Bathroom was a little small by Vegas standards, i.e. normal size for the rest of the U.S. and perfectly adequate. It was spotlessly clean. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Valet parking worked well, we rang down when we wanted our car and it was always waiting for us when we came out of the door. We didn’t eat in the restaurants, but had breakfast in the buffet each morning which was good, and a steal at the price. We have visited Las Vegas several times, but never stayed downtown. We checked out the better hotels around Freemont St during our stay and would rate the Golden Nugget an automatic choice if staying downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon57
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was amazing. I booked it mainly because of the location ( Fremont St.) but also because of the pool. They have a large pool that surrounds a 200,000 gallon aquarium filled with fish and sharks. When you are swimming it feels like you are swimming right with them. There is also a 3 story water slide that goes thru the center of the aquarium. It was amazing! The room was beautiful as well. Very clean and roomy. The only small problem we had was when we checked out. We left at 5 am and I went down to the desk to see if I could get a luggage cart. They said that only the bellmen are allowed to use those and they don't come on til 6 am so we had to carry all of our luggage back down by hand. We were on a road trip and had quite a bit so it took us 2 trips each. We did use the valet parking and I would recommend that as the service is free, you just have to tip. You know your vehicle is safe and it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: KatfromLQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end August. We booked a room in the south tower at the summer rate but if we waited for 45 mins we could upgrade to a north tower room. We waited for 1 1/2 hours and the room was small, dark and faced a wall. We complained to the front desk and the manager put us in a suite and gave us a $ 50.00 credit for dining. After this shaky start everything else went smoothly. All the staff were friendly and the room and hotel itself very clean. We did look at rooms in the south tower and they seemed brighter and newer and it was not much of a walk to the casino. We rented a cabana and spent one day at the pool and had such a great time. The pool manager was very helpful. Even though it was over 100 degrees outside the pool was cool and refreshing. The shark tank was really cool and we had fun on the water slide. I thought the food was very good at both the buffet and cafe. I liked downtown because there were a lot of choices within walking distance and it seemed very relaxed. We will be back next summer with the kids and Grandma!

Reviews.Title: “Great Party Pool”
Reviews.Author: safred-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for the UW UNLV game and had a great time. The pool was the perfect place to meet other Badger fans and celebrate after the win. We even watched the Packers win the next day on the T.V. in the pool bar! The slide is fast and fun and the couches are so comfortable that they're hard to leave. The only complaint we had is that we requested a non-smoking room but none were availabe upon our arrival They did move us the next day but some kind of added perks would have been nice for our trouble. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and the Nugget is the gem of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “off the strip, but do not let it off your radar”
Reviews.Author: terryjgardner
Reviews.Content: A fascinating hotel, good place to stay off the strip. Do not be put off by bad reviews, everyone will have a bad experience in a hotel if that person is a frequent traveler. That is simple probability. On to the GN: a nice hotel, interesting decor, less flashy and opulent than hotels on the strip. I have stayed many times at the GN and would go back again. It is not the Bellagio or the Luxor, but not too bad either when the strip does not appeal. Breakfast buffet is inconsistent. Sometimes good, other times .... not so good. I always find the golden pianist a bit creepy, like something from a Doctor Who episode.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights at the Golden Nugget in April 2007 and really enjoyed my stay. I've always stayed on the strip and made day trips downtown but decided to give the Nugget a chance for a brief solo trip. Stayed in the South Tower. Not sure why people complain about the distance. Wasn't that far and certainly not any further than the walks in many Strip resorts. Also, didn't have any trouble with the timshare folks although they were positioned right by the elevators. room was nice - comfortable bed, clean, nice size, functional bathroom. Had an issue with the remote and housekeeping was up in minutes to replace. Only room issue I had was the drains in the sink.
