Anytime I used the sink, I noticed a sour, unpleasant smell from the drain. Not overpowering or uncomfortable but noticeable. Check in was a breeze on a Friday afternoon and check-out through the tv worked fine. Dive Bar was nice, with great bartender (from Wisconsin I think). Also enjoyed the coffee shop for good, quick eats and the bar off the casino was fun and met some nice people. Didn't do much gambling at GN, spent most of my time at the tables at 4 Queens and Fitzgerald's. Overall, a very nice experience and would definitely consider GN for a future off-Strip stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'll rate the Nugget a B+”
Reviews.Author: MrVegas
Reviews.Content: The social areas have recently been refurbished, and they are very nice. All the restaurants, the casino, the lobby are fabulous, new, and very clean. I stayed for several days in a standard north tower room which was good, yet will need redecorating soon as it's beginning to appear worn. This is an older hotel, so the bathroom is small by "major resort" standards. I stayed my last three nights in a Spa Suite, which is magnificent. These have recently been redecorated and the two story suites are perfect. I've stayed in a spa suite four times, and while this one had a pool view, some have poor views. I had two cabanas rented for Saturday. I was phoned in the room on Friday and was told they "overbooked" the cabanas, and I could only have one. They told me they would credit my room $100 for my trouble, but I learned on check out, they only gave me $50. I need to "bird dog" them for the other $50 I guess. I only ate at Lillie’s Noodle House, The Carson Street Cafe (twice), and the buffet (lunch and breakfast). Lillie’s was very good, while Carson and the buffet where good, but not great. I play blackjack, and I found the dealers to be friendly. I don't ask them to deal me winners, but I sure hope they root for me and smile a lot. These dealers were good in that regard. I ordered room service and the presentation was great, including a cart with tablecloth and flower. The food was slightly cold, and it took 65 minutes for delivery. FYI, they add a $5 room service charge, and this is not part of the tip. With tip, my $12 meal became $24. Some don't like downtown, but I love it. Walking to the other casinos is easy and fun. While the other places aren't fancy, they aren't dumps, as some believe. After spending a week at the Golden Nugget, I give the place a B+.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for 30th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We were given a complimentary upgrade to a mini-suite in the main building. We took the elevator by the VIP lounge which was right by the casino, and the room was close to the elevator so very convenient. The room had a table and 2 chairs by the window, armoir that held the TV, large bed, 2 nightstands, and there was a dressing area (with sink and make-up mirror) adjacent to the bathroom. The bed was the most comfortable we've ever slept on and think the pillows were new, and the sheets were very soft. The Hotel Manager also sent a fruit basket to our room to recognize our anniversary which I thought was very considerate. The pool has been renovated and was very busy during our stay, but we didn't have time to use it although it looked inviting. My husband enjoyed the table games and was given 2 buffet meals, so we had supper one night and enjoyed the selection and the waiter was attentive to our needs. I also called the spa and made an appointment for a haircut, and I will go back again since I loved the cut. We will definately stay at the Golden Nugget again, because we were treated good there and enjoyed the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star hotel with a 1 star service level”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Brigitte
Reviews.Content: We stayed a first time at Luxor hotel and enjoyed the strip, then visited Bryce, Monument Valley, Grand Canyon, and choosen to move to fremont area. Golden Nugget seemed a good choice according to Trip Advisor advices. Excepted most of clerk we met were under expected level for this hotel. Car valet was RUDE. We were literally ejected from our car ; no matter we were tired after 5 hours driving and no other car after us. Swimming pool bar guy was also RUDE, giving us back money like to dogs. We don't really expected red carpet, but this lack of basic courtesy is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Down Town HOtel”
Reviews.Author: DICKGAINE
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget Hotel many times over the last 10 years, and it gets better each year. Its easy to visit the surrounding hotels (Binions, Four Queens, etc) . the food in the area is great, and not expensive. when we want to be pampered we go to the Top Of The World for a really great dining experience I would not hesitate to suggest The Golden Nugget to anyone. Richard and Carol Gaine Watchung, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Still the BEST place downtown by far!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGuy805818
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of negative reviews I have to disagree with all of them. First off the rooms were spotless and very nice. You do need to keep your air conditioner running 24 hours even when you not in the room. The bathrooms were very clean didnt see any mold like others talked about. Rooms were also quiet. Mattresses are a bit on the firm side, The Hotels general areas were spotless, at night there always a army of people cleaning. The best part of the Gold nugget is the swimming pool, its absolutely amazing! There is a shark tank smack in the middle of the pool, with a 3 story water slide with a clear tube u slide in that runs right through the middle of the tank! The bar by the pool has great drinks and you can have food brought to you. The Jacuzzi is very large and the lay out is designed to give you privacy or socialise. The if you have been to the strip and never stayed downtown you must stay at Freemont Street. Its a world apart from the crazy mega casions. So much is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: glynnism2002
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Golden Nugget on and off for several years. The hotel remains the best in downtown Vegas. It is very clean and classy. It has been bought by Landry's Restaurants over the last few years and there have been some changes, some good some bad. The good: a beautiful new pool with a shark tank and a water slide, a new bar (Rush) with live entertainment away from gambling and a new theater. The bad: Front desk staff are very rude and the lines are long. The North Tower is no longer saved for player card players, and it now is more expensive than the South Tower. They have also raised the required amount of points needed for a casino rate from 500 a day to 1000 a day, which makes it a little hard to get a good deal unless your are gambling away your lifes savings...that said, the rooms are very nice and clean, and the beds are very comfortable. Room service is exceptional and fairly quick. On the casino floor there are several bars, one of which is the internation beer bar, the bartenders at this bar are friendly professional and attentive, the dealers at the tables are for the most part also friendly and make losing your money a pleasure! I recommend staying at the Golden Nugget, but be patient at the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: bellykay357
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Golden Nugget. We had never stayed downtown before so we were quite excited about our downtown experience. Got to the hotel around 5pm on a Tues. and checkin was very speedy. Had 4 staff doing non-VIP checkin. Once we got to our room (South Tower) we found that the air conditioner wasn't working. Husband called desk and within 5 mins 2 maintenance men were at the door pulling a new unit behind them. In another 5 mins they had removed old AC and installed new unit and were out the door. Nice, cool room the rest of our stay. The room was quite lovely and the tub was a good soaking tub at the end of a long day. Being midweek the pool area was not too crowded. We moved to different chairs a few times so we could stay in shaded areas. The lounge chairs and additional couches, chairs, and "beds" were also very nice. My husband played some table games here and did well. Wait staff was very quick and friendly. We will definately stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - Not a 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: Hess-9
Reviews.Content: Stood in line for over an hour to check in. Our room in the south tower was old, dingy and smelled bad. The room was hot and the toilet did not flush well. I requested a room change and was told that they were "sold out" by a manager who was not concerned about customer satisfaction. The buffet was expensive, mediocre and smelled of cigarette smoke from the casino. The restaurant served better food, but the service was terrible. Overall, the staff suffers from extreme apathy - with the exception of the sales staff selling time shares - they chased after us every time we came off the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Agree w/ rude customer service!”
Reviews.Author: drox
Reviews.Content: Hi, We also just returned from a 4-night stay at the Golden Nugget (8/13-17, 2007). We requested a N/S King and upon checking with lines being 30 minutes long I could understand that the hotel was full so we did not get that type of room. So we said, "no problem, just get us a quiet room." We got 9th floor in the Tower directly under an air handling unit. The whole room vibrated and was noisy! I called down 2x and finally got a human. They gave us a key to a N/S King however this time 18 floors above more air handling units... didn't they say they had no N/S Kings available???? We gave up and just slept 4 nights with the TV on all night to drown out the noise. It has been 15 years since we have been to Vegas and the Golden Nugget is NOT the elegant reserved establishment it had once been. We were bascially treated like cattle and because we booked as a complete air/hotel/car package we felt like we were considered scummy second-hand lowlifes at the Golden Nugget. I had packed 3 evening outfits and my husband had suits along and we did not bother to get dressed for the evening. The hospitality staff (restaurants, housekeeping, and valet service) were all polite and accomodating however the Front Desk should be ashamed and sent directly to be taught manners and customer services skills. We stayed there to relax at the new pool. This was definitely my mistake! It smelled like chlorine so strongly that I was afraid for my skin to even get my tootsies wet. The pool area is nothing more than being on a cruise ship for its' size and the lounge chairs are tightly lined up that made personal space uncomfortable. Basically, we got what we paid for. It was no deal because the Golden Nugget just has made a new class of service... SCC! Second Class Clients!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - But REALLY slow check-in and out”
Reviews.Author: 50SomethingTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week in June for the second time. We plan to stay again in September. The hotel is lovely. The rooms are great (comfy beds) and the pool is exceptional. The only complaint we had on both visits was the long wait to check in and to check out. The first time we stayed we arrived at 4:00 p.m. and had almost an hour wait. In June we arrived at 12:00 a.m. (midnight) and still had a long wait - over 35 minutes. Hopefully the wait will not be as long on our visit in September. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 25th Wedding Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: kgoins82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget Aug. 5th-10th for 25th wedding anniversary. Booked a Spa Tower Suite in the North tower with VIP check in. I will try to hit all the highlights and be brief: Check in: a breeze with VIP service. You can pay an additional $15 for this service for room other than suites and it is well worth the money. We arrived about 4:30 p.m. Sunday and lines were long but there were more than 2 people at the front desk. Walked straight to VIP lounge and was checked in in less than 5 minutes. Left luggage to be delivered later. Got to room and called bellman for luggage. Was delivered within 10 minutes! Wow! Room: WOW! WOW! WOW! 1,500+ sq. ft. of sheer bliss!! 2-story, with tons of lighted mirrors that give an even larger perception of the room. Marble and granite everywhere. Jacuzzi tub upstairs with a view of the strip from the ceiling to floor windows. Spiral staircase leading to the most amazing master bedroom/bathroom I have ever seen. The shower could easily fit a dozen adults--not that I would recommend that! but it is that big and includes a steamer. Automatic drapes and lights that can be controlled from either upstairs or downstairs. Coffee maker, fridge, hairdryer, iron/board, wet bar, ice maker, stemware, tons of towels. Bed was huge and comfy with tons of pillows. Entry door on lower and upper level. Lower level goes to foyer and upper level goes directly to bedroom. The room lacked nothing. Private elevator for Suite Tower guests only. Only has 5 suites per floor. We thought the elevator was just for us because we never had to wait nor did we ever run into anyone else. Suite key must be inserted to use elevator which is located right off the casino floor. Pool: "The Tank" with a 3-story waterslide thru the aqarium was awsome. Lounge chairs are close together but there was plenty of room to move around. Never totally full. Pool water cool and refreshing in the hot sun. Closes at 9p.m. Beautifully lit at night. Restaurants: Tried the Carson Street Cafe twice for lunch. Service was quick and friendly. Food was good and price was reasonable. Very casual atmosphere. Less than $20 for 2 adults. Had dinner at the Grotto. Again, service was quick and very friendly. Food was amazing! You must try the cheesecake!! Less than $60 for 2 adults. Attempted the buffet but line was too long so went to Carson Street Cafe again and got right in. Casino: We're not table players, only slots and certainly not high limit. Won some, lost some but Golden Nugget has best casino on Freemont. Layout is good and drink service is also good. Casino hosts readily available when needed and very friendly. Location: Freemont Street!! Forget what you have read...downtown is not dirty or filled with homeless or winos. Yes, we saw a few homeless people after dark but you can see that anywhere. Free concerts, acrobatics, artists, musicians, etc. After dark, the street comes alive but there is still plenty of room to move around. We are smokers so I pay attention to certain things and not once could I find a cigarette butt on the ground! The entire street was very clean--and had a safe/secure feeling. Transportation to and from strip: use the Duece - terminal within easy walking distance from hotel and ride all day for $5. We walked to the terminal and had no problem getting a seat but bus does fill up quickly. I would not want to wait in the hot sun on the strip to ride it back. We rode from terminal to the Wynn then walked our way up the strip for the rest of the day at a leisurely pace. Returned to the Sahara from Bally's via monorail. Cost was $9 for 2 adults. Then took cab from Sahara to Freemont. Cost was $8. You can get a 24-hour monorail pass for a few dollars more but we didn't need it. When you get off at the Sahara, be sure to try Peco's Mexican Bar and Grill. Best mexican food we've had. Cost was less than $20 for 2 adults with a couple of drinks! Overall stay was sheer perfection. We will be back and we will always go back to the Nugget! The strip is nice to visit for a day of sightseeing, but if you really want to relax and not walk miles and miles, the Golden Nugget is the place. Overall, the Golden Nugget has scored BIG with the renovations and is by far the best resort on Freemont.

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: docbrinker
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel, my hotel room was entered and cash stolen. I took this up with the security but they were unable "to prove" any liability on their part. STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Stay at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: kimmer727
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed downtown before while visiting Vegas, so decided to try out the Golden Nugget. I must say - I enjoyed being downtown, everything is so close. We had a room in the new North Tower, which was nice. It was an average room, nothing fancy. Looked alittle worn to me for being new. But the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We LOVED the new pool at the Nugget with the Shark Tank. It was great and we spent every morning there - get there early if you want a chair. The pool officially opens at 9:00 a.m., but they let you in early if you have your room key. The Golden Nugget buffet was the best downtown. We tried several others for breakfast and lunch, and none of them compaired to the Nugget's quality of food. It was good. And I'm really not a "buffet" person. Took a cab to the strip a couple times - usually around $15-$18 depending where you get dropped off. Didn't win a thing in the casino - at the Nugget or anywhere else downtown or on the strip. Never have I been so unlucky in Vegas, but that's the chance you take - I'll certainly go back! I would recommend the Nugget if you are staying downtown, it was the nicest of all the casino's on Freemont Street.

Reviews.Title: “Our first-time stay at the Golden Nugget was a Winner !”
Reviews.Author: JenJo-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the G.N. on August 5 & 6 and had a great time. The room looked just like the photos posted on the website, always very nice and clean. Never had any problems. Smooth check-in at the South Tower desk. We had reserved a pool cabana for Monday and it was great! Would definitely reserve one again. (we had cabana #5) Enjoyed in-and-out pool cabana privileges all day (meaning you can leave and go to lunch and then come back and forth all day). Unfortunately, they had to close the whole pool in the late afternoon because someone got sick in the pool. It was shut down until the next day, leaving only the hot tub area open. We were disappointed and my husband went to talk to the manager at the Ticket Office where we had reserved the cabana and and explained our disappointment and they refunded the full cost of the cabana. That was more than we were expecting and we were very impressed and pleased. Had lunch at the buffet and for the cost, it was good. A nice variety of foods and very good service from our waitress. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, crap service”
Reviews.Author: CraigDownUnder
Reviews.Content: We turned up late in the evening and, despite having a pre-paid room, they walked us to Binion's, which is a run-down dump across the road. While I can understand overselling a hotel when guests with standard bookings haven't turned up, I think it's despicable that a hotel can sell a room that has already been paid for. When we checked in the next day, the queue was huge. When we tried to phone the front desk from our room several times during our stay, we either gave up after being on hold for 15 mins or left a message, in which case they never called back. When we checked out, the queue was again huge. In short, their customer service totally sucked. On the plus side, the hotel itself is great. Everything was clean, our room was spacious and decent. The pool is lovely; the spa pool is large and surrounded by seats and comfy outdoor beds; the water slide is fun; the sharks are a great addition. It's in a nice central position downtown and really easy to get to by catching the 108 or 109 bus from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: wrensnestred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nugget for 4 nights in early July and we were very happy. Rooms were really good with everything that you would want, except coffee maker. We have stayed in Vegas many times before but always on the Strip, so we thought we would give downtown a try, it is very different and in our opinion a more enjoyable place to stay, IF, you have visited Vegas before. We would not reccommend for anyone to stay downtown on their 1st visit to Vegas as it is a long trek, either by bus,car or taxi to the strip, but when you have done the Strip downtown makes a welcome change and we would say that this hotel is one of the best. Pool is great, slots and tables OK. We did not try the buffet but all the other eateries were good, but we would recommend visiting Main Street Station both for the food, micro brewery and even consider staying there if the price is right. Many great value places to eat, drink and gamble. We will certainly stop downtown on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Crimewave at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: rrod785
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Golden Nugget for over twenty years. It was such a magnificent place to stay. However during my recent stay, my hotel room was broken into resulting in the theft of numerous valuable items. Another guest had her room broken into the same night as I did. The Golden Nugget General Manager spoke to me on the phone and referred me to the risk management department. She did not offer to reimburse me for my loss, or comp me for my room. She didn't even offer me a cup of coffee or a glass of water. This is no longer the jewel of Downtown. They are lacking in security. The famous buffet has been gutted from what is was as well as the Carson Cafe. What a tragedy. I can't believe it. I am extremely disappointed. BEWARE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Sparkalot5
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Golden Nugget August 2nd – 6th, 2007. We had an excellent experience in the hotel from check-in to check-out. Check-in was a breeze with no waiting and we arrived on a Thursday evening around 6pm. The staff was always very courteous and helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and has an upscale feel. The rooms were very nice and well appointed. Although we never swam or sat in the lounge chairs at the pool, it is very beautiful. The Rush lounge and entertainment were great. The casino and staff there were fabulous as well, and the slot machines paid very well! May I recommend the $5 Wheel of Fortune machines.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: truefarmgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Nugget for our honeymoon. The rooms were nice and clean and the pool area was geniusly engineered. Just the right amount of breeze and sunlight at all times! Soundtracks playing were wonderful, also. The problems we ran into were: Our king size room wasn't available when we got there so the first night of our honeymoon was spent in a room with 2 full size beds. The other problem was our wireless internet was not working. Any trips or calls to the front desk were futile- the ladies working the desk couldn't tell us the problem/fix it. Also, there was at least an hour's wait in line to get to the desk. We had dinner at Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse- I highly reccommend it. Wonderful service and fare. The Starbucks in the lobby was convenient, also. Beautiful carpets/decor in the casino area. I would go back, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of work!”
Reviews.Author: astege
Reviews.Content: What a terrible stay! I don't see how this hotel receives a 4 star rating. From the moment we walked in our room, we knew we were in trouble. We stayed in the south tower and our room (#1769) had a horrible smell. Our daughter became sick on the way there, so we were desperate to get into a room. Otherwise, we would have asked for a different room immediately. There was black mold growing in the shower, the toilet took a good 20 seconds to flush, the shower did not drain well so we were standing in dirty water, and even though our room was seperated by a hallway from the elevator, we could still hear the elevator all night long. The pool was small and the water was not clear. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Experience”
Reviews.Author: Yelm100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Vegas and since the wedding chapel was downtown, decided to stay at the Golden Nugget. I'll never go back to staying on the Strip! Downtown is lively and walkable and tons of fun. At any rate, we got one of the Spa Suites, which are some of the most expensive rooms in the hotel. Our room was stunning and immaculate. A small foyer, half bath, basic kitchen (bar, glassware, mini fridge, counter), dining table, couches and chair all made up the first floor. Floor to ceiling windows with wall switch control curtains are gorgeous, but with an ugly view of the Fremont Experience street covering (it's a hollow half-cylinder running the length of the street), the windows were just okay. The upstairs, (this suite is NOT recommended for disabled people!) accessed from a winding staircase, contained the master bedroom, a WC (toilet and bidet), steam shower, vanity, another vanity with 2 sinks and a flat screen tv, and a humongous jacuzzi tub. The tub looks through glass windows down into the lower level. What I liked best about the Golden Nugget was the fact that my wedding dress' zipper broke when I took it out of the carrier, and had to rush down to the Bell Desk the MORNING of my wedding and ask them to get it repaired. No problem! After my hair appointment, I came back to the room and my dress was laid out on the bed and perfectly repaired! What awesome service! Oh, and the Shark Bar on the patio is way cool too, and drinks are, for Las Vegas, decently priced.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Vegas - Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Sunraindancer
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the best place to stay downtown. It is clean and quiet. It has been upgraded. The rates are better than at the strip hotels. We do wish they had more clerks at the check-in, even the VIP's had to wait in line for 30 minutes or so. We enjoyed the location. The buffets are the best and are reasonably priced. They are all you can eat and much lower priced than on the strip. We had a rent car and did not even need to use it. We rode the double-decker, airconditioned bus. It costs $5. for a 24 hour pass. The bus goes from downtown to every hotel on the strip. We enjoyed the pool area and the shark tank if fun to see. The downtown light show on Freemont Street every hour after dark is a great experience. The last night we were there we ate at Vic & Anthony's Restaurant in the hotel. The ribeye steak and the spinich salad were better than any steak restaurant in Houston except for Vic& Anthony's in Houston. You will need to make reservations for the restaurant. We will go back and stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill, poor service, too bad!”
Reviews.Author: Yodelai
Reviews.Content: My stay began on a Friday, one of if not THE busiest day to arrive in Vegas, and was to continue until Monday. I have stayed at the Golden Nugget two other times, mid-week mind you, and was impressed, unfortunately, this time was different. Check in is at 3pm, but my flight came in earlier at 12:30pm, so I wanted to try anyway. When I arrived at the front desk, wow, the line was horrendous. There were only 2 clerks checking in and the wait took about 30 minutes. Luckily, I was able to check into my room right away. The next day, I had come back to my room after turn down service, only to find out that no additional toilet paper nor soap was given. I called the front desk and they did send housekeeping up to the room. I did take one day to relax in the pool. You have to get there early, by 10am and grab a chair before they are gone. The slide is great, if the line is short, or having a short spurt. It is noisy and crowded, but with a Peach Belini drink and a lounge chair, you can forget the rest. It is worth it for a cool dip in the desert sweltering heat. So far, not too bad, but the stay turned for the worst. If you are lucky enough to receive a Golden Nugget Coupon Book, do so, but if you make your reservation through the hotel directly, not using Orbitz or some other third party, you most likely will not be given this coupon book. In the book, there are free admissions and discounts for their breakfast/lunch buffet and other goodies, as well as upgrades on your next stay. Instead, I was only offered a $25 room credit, great I thought, enough for 2 people for breakfast. I was told it can be used anywhere in the hotel, except for gambling. My last day, I decided to use the credit for the breakfast buffet, ok food, liked the eggs benedict the best, especially if it is for free! To my surprise, this offer was more headache than it was worth. I was looking to have my last couple of hours in Vegas to be relaxing, but instead I had almost misssed my flight. The room credit had to be used in it's entirety (the whole $25) or else you could not use the Express Check Out from your room. I bought a couple of tiny items from their gift shop and even paid a couple dollars out of my own pocket to be sure I used the whole $25. Needless to say, their lack of communication skills forced me to wait in the Check Out line at the front desk, another nightmare even on a Monday, and then wait another 30 minutes until a manager could help sort the problem. My frustrations had reached their limit, I just wanted to leave to catch my flight by this time. The manager blamed ME for not understanding the rules and did NOT appologize nor seem to be bothered by my bad experience. In the end, I did make it to my flight on time, barely, but will not stay at the Golden Nugget again. Very poor customer service in situations when you need it the most. They have gone downhill already. Beware of room credits and try to book through other web sites to receive the Coupon Book, no confusions there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - but expected more....”
Reviews.Author: robpValparaiso
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at GN for a suprise birthday party for a wonderful lady. We usually stay at Flamingo (location, location, location) and always get great comps. Five nights/six days (basic north tower) of constant gaming, food, and drink...average bets just under $50 for MANY HOURS x MANY DAYS= free room no food ($400), drinks ($200 pool), etc. Even after losing a considerable amount of money and "asking for an appeal" from the rewards agent...no food. I expected to pay for the drinks...not the food. UGH! Harrah's has always treated me well, I tried to move anyway, now I'm going back to Flamingo. Reasonable room and food comps has earned Flamingo my business (and potentially thousands) . Rooms were OK. Pool was beautiful while small and crowded. Freemont Street - OK -once. Front desk - short staffed. Housekeeping - good. Comps - poor. Bar - hope you like "well drinks" 'cause top shelf is extra (not even the basic top shelf). We travel to Vegas 3-5 times a year...I guess that we are "Strip People" afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are not enough for us to go back!”
Reviews.Author: amyclark
Reviews.Content: I've been at the 'old' Golden Nugget before they 'renovated'. Be prepared for a 30 - 45 wait to check in. Not once did I see the line go down. Popular hotel, but when you have 75 people in line, you need more than 3 front desk clerks. We checked in on Thursday about 8am... and every time we walked by, it was PACKED! My parents came in on Friday, and waited over an hour in line! So be prepared to wait!!!! Rooms are in major need of repairs. Our toilet leaked, sink stopped up, and bath-tub stopped up. our sink was fixed, but nothing else. So we had to keep towels on the floor the entire time we were there, so not to have soaked feet from toilet water.. The A/C did not cool - but were told it was because Vegas is HOT. No coffee makers in room, guess this is due to a Starbucks that was put into the hotel. Buffett was not like it used to be!!! Not a big selection and bad food. Defending the Caveman show was AWESOME!!!! Free $10 slot play gave me over $50 - so that was AWESOME! Their rates are comparable to the BIG strip hotels where you get better amenities, etc...

Reviews.Title: “not worthy of its star status”
Reviews.Author: dawnybrads
Reviews.Content: hotel in excellent position on fremont street staff helpful lobby area lovely on arrival we had 2 rooms booked the staff then tried to insist all 4 adults shared one room even though wee had pre paid for 2 the rooms are clean, tidy but nothing special and on getting in bed found to our horror we were over the main air conditioning uit for the whole hotel NOISY NOISY NOISY !!! then 4 am the dustbin wagon comes to pick up the rubbish NISY NOISY NOISY if you are staying here ask for afront or side room dont get one at the back of the hotel you will never sleep

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and poo to others”
Reviews.Author: iapiggy
Reviews.Content: i booked our trip way back in oct of 2006 at $69 per night for 5 nights between jul 15-20. when we arrived at the hotel sun jul 15 at 3pm there was a line at north tower front desk. in a few mins we were asked to follow a person to south tower front desk where we waited less than 10 mins for check-in. we were given a room at noth tower king smoking (our request). the room was very nice , the air was on the bed was recently replaced and we didnt expect any less. the house keepers take care of the room every day and we left a small tip every day for them. we played table games and slots and were comped every day for breakfast by asking. to those in the past who have complained about the room, the house keepers, the front desk poo to you. dont be so critical of everything cause its las vegas and anywhere will have its problems. if you want a nice way to see the strip walk up too fremont and las vegas blvd get on the deuce for $5 all day and just ride and see the strip in comfort. By the way the upper deck restarant at the vegas club is now closed for good . thats too bad.we took the public bus from the airport downtown for $1.25 each (108 paradise) it took about 45 mins and dropped us off at bridger and 4th 1 block behind the hotel and it runs every 20 mins during the day from the airport. only use it if u arrive between 10am and 6pm though.as u can see we have nothing but good things to say and we do the same next time.

Reviews.Title: “customer service awful”
Reviews.Author: longhorngrrrl
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about staying at Golden Nugget. The check in was awful. The line was long and we had to wait because there was only 2 people working. We just wanted to take a shower and relax. When we finally made it to the front and mentioned it to the front desk, we were told she would have someone call us. We never received a call from anyone. The rooms and the pool were nice. But the customer service was awful. I don't know if I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: mikethern
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for 35 minutes to check in because they only had 2 clerks. Shower drain was clogged. The next time I stay downtown, I will choose the Plaza or Vegas Club again because their rooms are dirt cheap, and basic but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: cpbino
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day trip to Las Vegas and a great stay at the Golden Nugget. I have stayed at several hotels in Las Vegas but always return to downtown and the Golden Nugget. This time I splurged and stayed in the Spa Tower in a great, two-story suite. This had to be one of the finest rooms I have ever been in. The only thing I could compare the room to was the view as seen through the huge windows. The casino was great, though packed, and the food was everything you would expect. Even the Ruben I got at the grill in the casino was exceptional. Landry's is doing an outstanding job of creating a hotel experience to compete against the giants on the strip. We took a couple of side trips to the strip hotels to see a show, shop and gamble but found the size a bit too much and were happy to return to the confines of the Golden Nugget each time. Those huge hotels are nice to look at but downtown is much more relaxing. The "Tank" (pool) is really something now that it is finished and everyone seemed to enjoy it. As far too many kids as some reviews noted, I saw just as many on the strip and they did not seem as well behaved as those I encountered at the Nugget. There is still construction going on as they expand the hotel/casino but we were not disturbed or inconvenienced by it. On check in the line was very long but they seemed to get everyone checked in as quickly as possible and had addequate staff. I will stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous brand new pool, wonderful hotel, lots of penny and nickle slots”
Reviews.Author: PortiaWestlake
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget's new pool opened about a month ago. It has a very, very long and high tube through which folks can jump in and sort of 'luge' down into the pool. The twists and turns the tube takes you on make you go really fast and then you end up in the beautiful pool. The pool features a separate and enclosed aquarium within the pool in which there are lots of big sharks with huge teeth. The tube travels through the shark aquarium. It is a rush. When standing in the pool you can get right up against the aquarium glass separating it from the pool and observe sharks about 2-4" from your face--seeing their dozens of huge teeth. Two waterfalls flow into the pool and it's very, very beautiful. It is absolutely a blast to fly down that tube and I'm 59 and I loved it. Rooms are extremely clean and the hotel, in general, is terrific. The nighlty 11pm light show outside the hotel is unbelievably innovative and entertaining. Golden Nugget's south tower rooms don't have coffee pots or hair dryers in the room--the only negative about the place. Drinks at the bar (if you gamble at the dollar or quarter video machines) are completelly free of charge. Drinks are free, as well, on the gaming floor. Staff is super friendly and professional. This place is extremely special, especially with this fabulous new pool. Food at all the restaurants in the hotel are wonderful. The buffet is very, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: bavone22
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Golden Nugget and we had a great time. The staff was extremely friendly. The only problem we had is that we had to leave our bags with the concierge because our flight got in early. When we went to have our bags sent up to our room, they told us that we had to come down and pick them up! I couldn't believe what I was hearing. Every hotel I have ever stayed at ALWAYS brought our bags to our room. Other than that, the price, at only $50 per night because it was a week night, was the best deal I have ever got. I almost feel like we were ripping them off! The pool was incredable! They actually had a fish tank right in the center of the pool. The staff at the bar were friendly. The dealers at the tables as well as the pit bosses were awesome and more than willing to teach us how to play even though the table was completly full. The beds were a little hard and kind of unconfortable but they did bring us extra pillows and towels. There was also a safe in the room which was convienient. Unfortunatly, we didnt win enough to actually use it, but it was nice to even have one. The location was great. It is right on Fremont St. I would also like to add that there were alot of bums on the street BUT none of them ever bothered us or asked for anything. Anyone from Chicago knows about the bums roaming around the city that constantly beg, but these guys just mind their own business. We even danced with a couple of them and ended up giving them bottles of water because it was 110 degrees during our stay and we felt bad. I have stayed at many hotels on the stip including the Luxor, the Sahara, and the Statosphere and the Golden Nugget was definitly the best by far.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget put me out of my room”
Reviews.Author: kbeeker
Reviews.Content: I was invited to your recent Blackjack tournament. The tournament itself was very enjoyable. I did have what I consider a major issue with the hotel. I checked into the hotel on 12 July and had a reservation until 17 July. One night I came back to my room (room 1617 North Tower) and my key would not work. I called to the front desk and was told that I had checked out of the hotel. I had not checked of the hotel and asked why they had checked me out. The front desk manager did not know why , but after checking, advised the cleaning staff not seeing any luggage in my room thought I had checked out. I had a backpack on this trip and it was with me. This is why there was no luggage in my room. After about an hour the front desk manager gave me another room, which I thought was also in the North Tower. It turned out to be in the South Tower. I really did not want to stay in the South Tower and I was tired of fighting with it, so I returned to the front desk and checked out of your hotel and went to Paris. Upon checkout I asked for a receipt where there were charges on the bill that were to be comped off the bill. They were not and I was told that I would have to take it up with the 24 Karat Club. At this point I was not in the mood to deal with this issue, so I left the hotel. I did ask for the managers name and was told it was Martha Sanchez. The next morning I called and spoke with her Admin Assistant, who took the information and advised that she would have her call me back. She never did call back. The next day I came back into the hotel and advised the 24 Karat Club supervisor on duty that charged had not been comped off. She looked into her system and said that notes had been placed in the record to comp off the charges and that the front desk should have been able to see the note. She then took me to the front desk and had the charges taken off. At this point I had still not received a call from Martha Sanchez. When I was at the airport yesterday, leaving Las Vegas, I tried to one more time to call Martha Sanchez and she was in. She told me that the hotel has guest check out without telling the front desk and that it was assumed I had left even though my reservation was through the 17th. She made me feel like the whole thing was my fault and that was just the way the hotel is run. In all my travels I have never been checked out of my hotel room while I was still there. I expected a lot more from the Director of Hotel Operations. I had the feeling that because I was comped the room and not a paying customer or a high roller, that I was not worth taking the time on. Although I did have great services from most all aspects of the hotel/casino, this one instance and the way it was handled left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Nugget”
Reviews.Author: gcs0220
Reviews.Content: We drove to Las Vegas from Edmonton, Canada. When we arrived in the mid-afternoon, we checked into the Golden Nugget. It was Sunday and the weekend guests were all leaving and the tour busses would not arrive until the next day, so we got a room with two queen beds for $69. Service at the hotel was excellent. The front desk was always busy, but you wait in line and they are friendly and helpful when it is your turn. We had a problem with the AC in our room and the unit was swapped out in less than half an hour, so we chalked that up to an example of this hotel keeping their customers happy. Our room was very clean and the furnishings were in very good repair. I had no trouble sleeping on the beds. The pool and water slide are very nice. The area is clean. Outside the door of the Nugget is a covered street that provides light shows every night. There was also a live band playing and lots of gift shops (I purchased a CSI T-Shirt for $2.99!). Food is cheep in this area of town. We blew the budget and ordered 14oz prime rib and steak w/lobster dinners for $11 each. I almost needed a cart to wheel my bloated body out of the restaurant. ... Oh, and there seemed to be some gambling going on as well. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is ok...”
Reviews.Author: sara1700
Reviews.Content: First off, we booked our trip through Vegas.com. It was very cheap ($64/nt), easy, and we got to check in on Saturday. I think that if you book through their website-they don't allow check-ins on that day. There was a line when we arrived at about 3, but it wasn't terrible. We waited about 20 mins. We did end up having to wait another hour for our room to be cleaned, but we filled that time easily. The rooms are huge and clean. The only problem I saw was that there was black mold growing on the grout of the shower. I don't have mold in my own shower at home, and don't expect to have it in a hotel room. This I think was probably due to a cheap tiling job-where they didn't seal the grout like they should have. Our maid was great and did excellent cleaning our room. Another negative thing was the people selling timeshare in the lobby and as you enter the hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights and trust me, after the first or second you want to tell them to kiss it. I thought this was bad that the hotel allowed them to hound their guests. At least make them set up outside. Very un-classy of the Nugget. We ate the buffet once at breakfast and it wasn't very good. Not a lot of variety. VERY VERY greasy. I paid $9 and ended up with toast (which I actually had to wait for) and cereal. Not my idea of great. There are better options for breakfast in the other hotels. The pool is very nice, however I myself am a designer and I saw several problems. First was the mold on the bathroom floors (another cheap tile laying issue.) Second of all, the pool is very small for the amount of people that are there. Every chair was nearly taken-every day. The chairs are also 4" apart-at the most. So if you use the armrest you are holding hands with ur neighbor. They also have large mattresses out there. This is not really a concern to me, because I wouldn't use them anyway. But the designer should be smacked on the hand. It was a waste of $$ for the nugget as the pool area is not even 6 months old and shows significant wear-especially on those dirty matresses. Other than those few small things...that really you can live with, the Nugget isn't bad. It is by far the nicest hotel downtown. If you can get it cheap it is worth it....but I would definetly not pay over $100 ever to stay there. I would prefer the Strip for that price in a second. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: rodanzz
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Golden Nugget for our honeymoon July 8th through July 13th. It was our first visit to Vegas and read many good things & bad about GN but we decided to stay downtown instead of the over priced strip hotels. The GN was a GREAT experience, we checked in sunday afternoon at 3:00pm and the wait was only maybe 15 minutes max. We stayed in the North tower and the room was big, clean & the bed was VERY comfortable. Our room was cleaned daily by 10:00am-10:30am & I must say not one time did we ever have to ask for anything from the cleaners. Every employee we came across treated us VERY friendly and were always glad to answer any question we had. The shark tank was so awesome & there are PLENTY of lounge chairs to sit back & enjoy the pool area. The casino was a great time & the slot machines were paying pretty good for me & the wife :-)..Fremont experience was really a good time, don't let the fact it's downtown bother you, my wife & I thought it was safe,clean and NOT run down as some reviews have said. We don't understand all the bad reviews on tripadvisor about the GN, maybe some folks expect way too much. We had the greatest time of our lives & will with out a doubt be going back to Vegas & stay at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Inexpensive, and FUN!”
Reviews.Author: chickytava
Reviews.Content: I don't know why so many people are complaining about the Golden Nugget. I went with 6 friends, and we all thought it was great. They set us up in two adjoining rooms that were tastefully decorated, quiet, comfortable, and very clean. We spent most of our time at the hotel pool and gambling along Fremont Street. The pool (which features a $3m renovated shark tank and GREAT water slide!!!) was lovely. The poolside drinks were delicious... I recommend the pina colada especially... and the lounge chairs were very comfy. You can also rent nice-looking private cabanas if you want. The pool & shark tank, which you can swim right up to when you're in the water, are by far the best part of the Golden Nugget. I must admit that I did not dine at the Golden Nugget except for getting a sandwich and coffee from the Starbuck's downstairs, however some of my friends said the breakfast at the restaurant wasn't so tasty. As far as gambling, they offer lessons every morning at 10am, and I learned how to play craps there from several very patient and experienced dealers. My friends and I were served numerous free drinks from the cocktail waitresses, who were always ready to freshen our beverages. Furthermore, if you want to see the "real" Vegas, you can easily walk up the street to the Beauty Bar or the Griffin in the evening for a drink. There aren't many other nightlife options downtown, but the Deuce bus provides shuttle service to the strip, and a taxi ride is only about $20 (cheap when shared with friends). The bottom-line is this... if you are on a budget, and your expectations are not exceedingly high, the Golden Nugget is just want you want. It's clean, comfortable, inexpensive, and is by FAR the best hotel downtown (I checked out several others, and they were rancid with cigarette stench and full of worn-out-looking old people who appeared to be having very sad thoughts). The Golden Nugget, on the other hand, was like a breath of fresh air on Fremont Street... smelled nice, upper-middle-class clientele, and definitely a notch up in quality. If you want an awe-inspiring experience, go to the Strip. But if you want to save some money and aren't extremely high maintenance, the Golden Nugget is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: osujenny
Reviews.Content: Hello all....Let me start off by saying I love Vegas! I take a trip out there at least once a year and have stayed both on the strip and downtown. My girlfriend and I decided to take a trip and stay at the Nugget. I wanted to stay downtown (you downtown fans know why) and she wanted a nice pool...so we were left w/ one choice...the nugget! The rooms were nice, but come on, who stays in the room?!!? The cocktails at the Grotto were wonderful...the bartenders at every bar/lounge were outstanding, friendly and attentive. That was probably a good thing, because everything else was a bust... Checking in is torture. Luckily my girlfriend and I were smart enough to grab a beer before heading in line for our 1 hour wait. I am not even joking. It was ridiculous. The table minimums are too high, the staff did not seem to have an answer to any question, and DO NOT try to get a meal at Carson Street Cafe late night.. we waited over an hour for our food...and there were about 3 other tables in the place. The pool area is nice, but too small and crowded. The table games outside are a rip off too. I'm going back to Vegas in a couple of weeks and will thankfully be staying at my favorite place, Main Street Station...although I will probably stop in the Nugget for a martini...I won't be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: qbert81a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2007 for 3 days and couldn't wait to leave. Arriving at around midnight during a weekday, we had to wait 1 hour to check-in behind a slew of people. With 1 of the counters open it was miserable when you've been traveling for hours only to have to stand and wait. The situation didn't improve on checkout either as everyone and their brother was trying to checkout at the same time and the line was well over 120 people deep with only 2 counters open! The check-in/checkout process at this hotel is the worst I've experienced in my 7 or 8 trips to Vegas over the past 4 years. Once checked in, we made our way up to our room. My fiancee at the time is a bit of a princess and is very picky about accommodations and the only way I was able to talk her into staying at the Nugget was that I told her it had been recently remodeled and that I thought it wouldn't smell like an old hotel/casino and on top of that we were in town for only a few days for a sporting event so the price was right. From the moment we walked in the door, I was eating my words.... The Nugget had been remodeled, but then redecorated in the same 1970's style decor as it probably was before. There was no way to tell that there had ever been any upgrades! The extremely long haul to our room let us take a look at all the old style furnishings that made me feel like I was watching re-runs of old TV shows. The place smelled and looked extremely dated (pretty much what we thought of the entire downtown Las Vegas scene to be perfectly honest). Our room had an A/C unit that would work part of the time and then just blow out lukewarm air, the bed was comfortable but the decor was severely dated. Our dining experiences were subpar both within the Nugget and anywhere in downtown LV. The cafe within the Nugget had some of the worst food I've ever tasted and was so greasy it was disgusting. The places to eat in downtown were slim to none. Very disappointing. The gaming at the older casinos was also very surprising. The dealers at the Nugget, Four Queens and Binions were all terribly rude and caused us to pick up our chips, cash in and leave after 5 games. I was shocked by how they had barely any dealers that appeared to speak english and how absolutely rude they were. I even let the pit boss at the Four Queens know that we tried 3 different dealers and were treated poorly by all 3. He seemed like he couldn't give a heck so we just bailed. I mean everyone has to experience old downtown Las Vegas at least once I suppose, I really wish we had not. It was dated, smelled and I found very little entertainment value here. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to stay on the strip where there are things to do, the accommodations are clean and you are within walking distance to anything you could need. To give a few words of positivity on the whole experience at the Nuggest....The valet parking attendants were extremely polite and timely and you are only a few blocks from the outlet mall which has a lot of cool stores.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: azazaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN July 6-8 and had a wonderful trip. This was our second stay at this hotel this year and will definitely be back. The North Tower rooms are more convenient than the South Tower rooms which is what we stayed in. The standard rooms are clean and very comfortable with pillowtop mattresses and everything you need. No coffee...but no hotel in Las Vegas has in-room coffee makers. We ate at the Grotto twice which I would highly recommend. The lasagna was the best I've ever had and the deserts were even better. We had a horrible meal at the Carson Street Cafe on our first night. That place is great for breakfast and hamburgers but don't try anything else. Wish they had $5 craps tables like the rest of the downtown area but the limits seemed to stay at $10 except when we left on Sunday and then the limits came down. Go across the street to Four Queens for lower limit table games. The staff was great, got a late checkout at no add'l. charge and overall this is a great downtown hotel. Others have commented on the pool area - very nice! No complaints so we'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: brunelle4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I split up our stay in Las Vegas. We stayed at The Golden Nugget July 1-3, then the Monte Carlo July 3-6. We have been visiting Las Vegas for the past 4 years and wnated to experience staying on Freemont St....and it was well worth it!!!! Fisrt of the deal we got was fantastic, 2 nights for $69 a night. (ask for coupons, they won't just give them to you) The room was very nice, and clean. The best part of the Golden Nugget was the pool...absolutely AMAZING!!!! The have lounge chairs, couches, even queen size beds to loung in! and a hot tub with a 52 person capacity. The pool has s shark tank right in the middle, you can swim right up to it, and watch about 10 sharks and other sealife swim right by you (for a realistic experience get a pair of goggles, go underwater, and watch the sharks...very cool). A waterslide also goes right through the center of the shark tank, which was alot of fun ( I did it about 8 times, and hardly a line to wait in). The other great thing about the pool was that it is open until 9pm, most pools in vegas close like at 6 or 7pm. The pool is also absolutely beautiful lit up at night, and can view the sharks very well. The Buffet has also recently changed, it used to be just off the casino floor, now take the escalator upstairs, and there is the brand new buffet, which is bigger, and better. Food was geat. We got there for the sunday brunch, and 15 minutes later was the change over for the seafood dinner, so we stayed and ate seafood for the brunch price...it was great!!!! I Highly reccommed the Golden Nugget to anyone. It was great being away from the strip for a change, and not having to do all that walking. Everything is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service!”
Reviews.Author: Raygood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a travesty. The physical property is first rate, the best clearly of the downtown hotels. However, it is easy to take out a check book and build facilities; it is another to manage a property and this is where the current group of owners (it tends to change every other year at the Golden Nugget) completely fails. The current group of incompetents need to go back to the food service business where they made the money to purchase the hotel. Check-in is a nightmare, although they will save you a lot of money since you are never going to make it to the gaming tables/slots, since all your free time will be standing in lines. Two people to serve you at check-in even at the busiest of times. Computers are updated in the morning so don't expect to be able to check-out. They will "mail your statement" which they have not. Call for service, etc., go unanswered. They clearly spent their budget of updating the hotel and none on people, training, customer service, etc. The only hope is the current owners lose enough money and someone who knows how to run a major hotel/casino purchases it.

Reviews.Title: “WOKEN UP BY JACKHAMMERS!!!”
Reviews.Author: trippingla
Reviews.Content: Thought I was in the middle of a construction zone first thing in the morning. Couldn't believe they would "upgrade" us to the north tower, right underneath a floor undergoing massive renovations! Front desk service people were unprofessional and unapologetic. After I wrote several emails to customer service after returning from Vegas, I received absolutely no response, not even a stock 'thank you for your email." We would never ever stay in this hotel again. Positively the worst hotel experience we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget is Golden!”
Reviews.Author: preraph
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The Las Vegas strip is hollow and has no soul. Every hotel looks and sounds the same. The Golden Nugget is a piece of history updated. Also, the value for money is phenomenal. I thought everything about this hotel was great. And, the fact that is is smaller and gets a lot of natural light is a big plus for me. The area around the Nugget is downtown. But Fremont Street is kept so clean you could eat off the ground there. Came back at 2AM on July 4th to discover a crew scrubbing the Experience area. Be sure to visit all the old neon signs from Vegas' heyday down the side streets. The Shark tank is very cool. I also loved that there are TWO Starbuck's inside the hotel. One is open 24/7! The Spa is gorgeous and the staff is kind and friendly. There was a line when I checked in but at most hotels on the strip you will encounter that as well. FYI, if you need to go down to the Strip you can catch the Deuce Bus just a block down from the Nugget off Fremont. Runs 24/7 and costs just 5 bucks for hop on, hop off. The only down side was some of the people who felt the need to bring their own coolers and drinks to the pool. Tacky!!!! All in all, great time!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelwithpete
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying in the "old" Vegas district, but this hotel was great and we could not beat the price! Service was wonderful, room was clean, and even pretty fancy. The front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite, which had a wet bar (but BYOB) and was very spacious. I have stayed at the Bellagio and would say this hotel was a fantastic alternative for a smaller budget (more money to spend shopping!). The valet parking was complimentary and since we rented a car for other travel, we could access the main events on the Strip without any hassle. One word of advice... spring for the $16 VIP check-in package!!! The check-in line at 3 p.m. was outrageous. I waited probably a half hour in line. If I had done the VIP check-in, my room request would have been guaranteed (i.e., nonsmoking, king bed--but not that it was a problem since they kindly bumped us to a suite), but also I would have been able to avoid the crazy line.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - Golden Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marlinfisher
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas 6 times now and this was the first time we stayed downtown. We stayed over the 4th of July week. Didn't mind the cab/bus issue to get to shows on the Strip in exchange for a slower pace and a deal of the century for what would be a 200-250/night hotel if it was on the Strip. Cab was about 20-22 dollars but one aspiring NASCAR driver got us from Bellagio to the Nugget for 17 dollars total. The Deuce is cool, clean and easy to use. I highly recommend it if you want to save 50 bucks or so in round trip cab fare. As for the hotel, excellent stay from check in to check out. Our room was as nice as our room at Caesar's, the food at the Buffet and Carson St. was great, the pool was amazing, and I'd say the staff was the best I've ever dealt with (I've stayed everwhere from Bellagio to Stardust). Each and every staff member was nice, kind and courteous. The valets were genuinely thankful when I tipped them for cab service -- as opposed to other places like Wynn and Venetian where it's "expected," and if not received, the cab door's slammed harder. The Nugget's casino is laid out wonderfully, easy to navigate, and the dealers are all friendly. Drinks were aplenty too. Wait staff at Carson St. seemed like family and delivered 1st rate service. The French Toast (at 4:00 AM) was as good as I've had anywhere too. The pool simply speaks for itself. Incredible. I witnessed a number of people who weren't staying at the Nugget visit the pool area and say they were staying there next time just because of how cool the pool looks. I agree that none of the other downtown hotels can even come CLOSE to the Nugget, and if I stayed downtown again, I'd only stay there. That being said though, the Nugget seems to be setting itself apart from the rest of the area and could easily compete with the likes of a Paris, NYNY and blows away a Luxor type Strip hotel. Great, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not for average trevelers”
Reviews.Author: johndunn11
Reviews.Content: If you are an average traveler this hotel is not for you. Maybe the high rollers get treated with respect but we sure did not. I was put on hold 3 times when calling about an air conditioning breakdown and left on hold until I could take no more. Went to front desk where we were told to wait until fixed. No alternate room to wait in. Pool is their only attraction and is far too small to enjoy. All this at a time when the hotel was not crowded .

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Manager name Claudia poor service bad accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gyv
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice except for the people working for them they have no problem ignoring you when there is a problem. We arrive late so the VIP was close we got a room that had to be close because the parking lot was on the 3 floor south tower you can see and they can see you. The key to my in-laws door did not work. We had to go back called security to open the room, then go down to get new keys we had requested rooms close to each other the next day we went to the VIP and they move us to the 8th floor. Which was ok until the AC at my in-laws rooms collapsed and they were put out of their room. It was hot and uncomfortable so they went to our room to see what we can do. We called the front desk they put you in hold forever. Then they ignore you hoping you go away. Our room was ok until we wanted to take a shower and it was not working .so here we go again trying to get service. I decided to go down I went to talk to a manager name Claudia. After 45 minutes waiting for her, she advice me that the problem was being fix and the only thing that could be done was to change rooms again, but they did not have any available I felt frustrated and angry. I just walk away there is no point they are not there to care for the needs of average travelers they are there to take the money and forget you. The service is AUFUL I will truly not recommend it. There are other hotel down town like the main street stations its wonderful I recommend it. Well after our ordeal we left the hotel to the Tuscany suites and it was like paradise good service and the accommodations were superb. We have travel to many parts of the world and to Vegas several times we wanted to try a hotel downtown it is not worth the hazels, and the pool which they spend so much money is crowded. Good luck in finding any thing to sit. If you order the special which is 5 beers in a bucket of ice they have to give them to you open by the time you are ready to drink the next they are flat and not cold because you can not put them on ice. Good luck if you dare to try this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: abqman
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here end of may for 3 nights. Overall It was a fun trip. The pool slide is def. worth checking out. On some nights they have a pool side party which was alot of fun. They had drawings for a cruise to mexico I think. The same name was drawn on 3 seperate times, unfortunatly they did not give out the prize that night as she wasnt there during the drawings. ... We are younger mid 20's so we would have preferred to stay on the strip, but they had such a good deal that we couldnt pass it up. Would recommend this place though it was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: marcene
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget many times before and this time was the WORST! They spent $30 million on the pool, but cannot spend any money to hire more than 2 check-in clerks to work during a busy time! We arrived at 1:30 am Sunday which according to the airline attendant is a KNOWN busy time for flights coming in. But at the hotel there were only 2 clerks working! Huge line. There was room for more to work plus a whole other check-in area but it was closed! Then, surpirse....rooms were not ready. Yes, at 1:30 AM. Very strange that it was ready an hour later because housekeeping is not even there! Others had to wait for a room also. This hotel is run like a Super 8. I expected better from them. They knew we were coming, why no room ready? Then, they offered us $30 ea. food credit, but the CATCH was we had to eat it all THEN at 2 AM! No thanks. Who wants to eat a $30 meal at 2 am before bed??? We convinced the clerk to let us have our food credit on account. He promised to put a note in the computer. Of course, this was NOT done and we had to WAIT again at the front desk to argue this later in the week. Only resolved because I asked to speak to the mgr. who I never got to see anyway (because I'm only the customer I guess). We bought the expensive internet service (which should be free) only to have it not work when we really needed it because they closed the account service after 1 day. Again, WAIT in line to set it up again. Each time you need the front desk, expect a huge 1/2 hr min. wait. The pool is nice & unique but I found the ladies bathroom with a plugged up toilet, filthy floor, etc. Again, not enough staff hired to maintain it. There were 3 gaming tables poolside with chairs sticking out in the aisleway. Poor engineering for $30 M. Also the buffet had the same problem. There were 10 tables with the chairs sticking out in the walkway! I had to skoot in each time someone walked by! Didn't they hire an architect? There are tables that overlook the pool, but you only get to sit at one if you ask. We ate there 4 times and sat in the aisleway each time! When returing to get our bags at 4 pm Thurs, there was a very huge line to check in, and again tiny staff of 4! Are there no people to employ in that town? No extra money to hire after $30M blown on the pool. Why have customers stand in line for 30+ minutes when they could be gambling in your casino? Wish I had a picture to post of the huge, snaked-line of miserable people waiting to check in.

Reviews.Title: “over before it started”
Reviews.Author: kingsberry
Reviews.Content: I have never been to downtown Las Vegas before, usually stay on the Strip. Decided to try the Golden Nugget for one night on our way back home from a long road trip, mostly because of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and their website looked promising. Downtown LV is down at the heels and depressing. Despite efforts to spiff it up, it is a far cry from the Las Vegas Strip. The Golden Nugget appears to be the jewel in that dreary crown. The common areas and casino look nice, and we enjoyed lunch at the Carlton Cafe. However, the pool area at the GN is disappointing, teeny and jam-packed. Sharing a pool with such a throng must be unsanitary, personally I wouldn't put even a toe in that water. Although I realize that GN doesn't have the real estate that the Strip hotels have, the pool area is in no way sufficient for a hotel with nearly two thousand rooms! We never made it to the room. After waiting in the check-in line for 45 minutes, we were no closer to the desk with its many windows showing closed signs. Mind you, this was not even a holiday or a weekend. Exhausted and frustrated, we called the reservation number and asked if we might please cancel our reservation and not be charged for the night. The agent on the phone was very accommodating, and agreed to credit back the room rate to my card. Although we had driven for the previous ten hours, we got back in the car and drove four more hours home rather than wasting one more minute of our precious time in that unreasonable line. Obviously there is a serious problem with check-in at the Golden Nugget that they are not addressing. They should wake up and realize that people standing in line aren't out in the casino giving up their money! They should hire some more agents or at the very least be offering complimentary cocktails for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jackie-London
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night weekend stay at the Nuggett. This is a great hotel and definately the best downtown hotel by a long way. Rooms are nicely furnished and spacious. The pool area is fabulous with the shark tank and waterslide going through. Only negative is the loungers are extremely close together, but then they need to be to accomodate everyone. We eat at the Carson Cafe and also the Buffett and both were great. We have stayed here 5 times now and have always been very impressed. The prices have definately gone up but then they have spent a fortune on the hotel so I guess that is expected. I would definately recommend this hotel if you are planning to stay downtown

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Crashpro
Reviews.Content: June 12-16, 2007. We wanted to check in on June 9th, but we were told that the Golden Nugget does not allow Saturday arrivals, so we checked into The Fremont for the first few days. We wish we'd stayed there, but we wanted to try GN's pool. Check in was crowded at 5:00pm and we waited about 20 minutes or so. Not too bad. We asked a bellman (one of four standing around discussing their weekend) to help with our 9 bags and he directed us to the bell counter. Another bellman kindly offered to help us since the first one blew us off. Not a good start. The rooms were large, clean, and the bath was large enough for one person, but you didn’t have to leave for the other person to get past you and into the shower. We went to the ticket counter at 8:30am Wednesday to book a pool side cabana for Thursday. We had heard of the demand for these things and wanted to be the first in line. The counter was supposed to open at 9:00am, but at 9:15am, there still was no agent to help us. Someone from registration finally found someone for us. It was money well spent. Cabana #2 is very nice and is most in demand from what the staff told us. Drink service was frequent and friendly. We’d do it again. We had a few issues that required the attention of the front desk, but were never able to get them on the phone. The recorded messages that told us how important our call was to them were apparently a lie. We never got a return call. On the way to our room the first day, we saw a discarded napkin and a fast food taco joint sauce packet in the hall on the floor. They were both still there when we left, 5 days later. The public areas were spotless. The only staff that were friendly were at the pool, and the wonderful ladies that clean the rooms. We went to the registration desk and asked for a late checkout on Saturday as our flight didn’t depart until 6:00pm. We were told that we could have the room until 1:00pm. I asked that if no one could check in on this day, why did we have to be out so early. The agent helping us asked why no one could check in. We told her that it was Saturday. She asked what the day of the week had to do with it. A man chimed in from about 10 feet away and told her that it was a standing policy of the Golden Nugget that Saturday check ins are not allowed. I asked him, then why we had to be out at 1:00pm if no one was going to be checking into our room. He actually turned his back on us and walked away. When we directed out gaze towards the agent that had been helping us, she turned to have a casual conversation with the agent next to her as though we had disappeared. When we spoke louder to get her attention, she spoke louder to her friend. She might as well have stood there with her ears covered, stomping her feet, and doing the “La la la” thing. She never addressed us again. We just stood there in disbelief. We were VERY disappointed with the service there, and will not return. The service just does live up to what we experienced there 5 years ago. We will however, gladly return to downtown, but stay at another hotel. The pool is awesome, but the lousy staff at the hotel makes it not worth it. We did not try any restaurants there. We ate mostly at Magnolia's at the Four Queens. It's virtually impossible to have bad food or bad service there. They are a tremendous group of people.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is a Golden Experience”
Reviews.Author: cjennt
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive to book this hotel in the downtown area of Las Vegas, due to the negative comments about the surrounding area of the hotel. First of all, I want to say that the hotel is roughly three miles from the hustle and bustle of the Strip where I usually stay. I had never been to Fremont Street before, where this hotel is located and after reading the not so favorable reviews about it, I went in prepared for something horrible. Well, I am now proud to say that I was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED that Fremont Street was NOT the dump that I thought I would see. There was not ONE SINGLE piece of refuse or trash on the ground, the ground is immaculate, nor did I see one homeless person or any sleeze hanging about outside. The parking situation here is kind of dicey, as the self-parking is somewhat of a schlepp to the hotel lobby entrance which is on Fremont Street. If you don't want to deal with carrying heavy luggage for two blocks, I would say go for the tip based valet which takes you right to the hotel lobby door. The rooms at the hotel were gorgeous, very tastefully decorated, even though we were in the South Tower. Many have said that the North Tower rooms are much nicer, but we saw both and the only difference is the price. Our room was the deluxe one which is 364 sq. feet, very spacious and the marble bathroom was absolutely immaculate. We were very happy with the front desk staff as well, we thought they were very professional and kind. We did wait in the check-in line about ten minutes, but it moved fast and we got into our room pretty quickly after that. I want to say again, that the surrounding area of the hotel was not at all filthy or run down. Granted, it is not the Strip, but then again you aren't paying Strip prices at this four-star hotel. I feel that the hotel is an excellent value if you want to escape the crowds on the Strip. By the way, the Strip is FAR DIRTIER in terms of trash in the streets and overrun with tourists/locals, etc. than Fremont which we found to be very quiet. I am a very discrimminating traveler and have stayed at the world's four and five star hotels and I can say unequivocally that the GN was a fabulous experience, one I would most definitely repeat in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: rmori
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas. Stayed at the Golden Nugget in the old part of Vegas for the first time. We've been to Vegas and stayed on the Strip many times so we thought we'd try the Fremont Experience for a change. The Golden Nugget was really nice. Great service, clean, tastefully decorated, nice newly renovated pool with the shark tank; no complaints about the hotel itself. The only thing was, it is so far away from everything! We thought there would be more to do in Fremont but it's really run down and kind of depressing; good for a one night visit, perhaps, but to be down there for three nights and four days was too much. We ended up taking cabs to the (new) Strip and at $25 one way, it ended up being expensive. It was also about a $25-30 cab ride from the airport (each way). I would say check out the Fremont Experience for one night maybe, but stay in the new part; there's just so much more to see and so much more excitement, which is why you go to Vegas in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Downtown Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lightning21
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and fairly nice. The downtown location is convenient for those who like to wander about to other clubs.
