They have a swimming pool with a large adjacent fish tank and a water slide that goes through the fish tank. This pool is a center of activity for the hotel. Three gaming tables and a bar are poolside. The hotel’s Italian restaurant, steakhouse, and coffee shop all serve decent meals. The hotel does charge $11.95/day for internet access which seems a bit of a rip off, considering many roadside motels provide this free to their guests. The show Strictly Ballroom was enjoyable. The lounge "Rush" has some overpriced, but decent, specialty drinks and occasional fun live entertainment. The casino has a decent poker room. The other table games like blackjack are a little better than average for what is offered today in Las Vegas, given the long decline in the table games (during which the house has increased its advantage primarily through adverse changes to the rules). The staff at the hotel was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “If you are spending time on the Strip, stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ath17
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget was a fine hotel. We had no problems with the hotel itself. And the room rates were simply unbeatable. If you are going to Vegas to gamble, relax by the pool and hit the buffet, it is great. You should not go to Golden Nugget if you are planning on spending most of your time on the Strip. Although downtown is only a few miles from the Strip, transportation back and forth is awful. The Deuce bus runs down to the Strip every few minutes, and only costs $5 for an all day ticket, but it is painfully slow (due to traffic on the Strip, interminable traffic lights, and lengthy boarding and unboarding of passengers). It is a good 30-40 minute ride to mid-Strip. A quick trip back to the hotel to wash up and change for the evening is not really an option. So if you are in to the "traditional" Vegas experience (which doesn't include Star Trek, Madame Tussauds, or the Blue Man Group), Golden Nugget is a good hotel. Otherwise, shop around for a deal near the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “very unfriendly hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: uniquegirl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the golden nugget for 4 nights in june. i had made reservations a month earlier, and they included a nice price for the 4 nights and coupons, show tickets, and meal voucher. when we went to check in, a very snotty recepionist tried to over-charge us, and not give us the other things we were promised,so we had to talk to a vip to get everything straightened out, embarrasing, and we were never apologised to. the room was great, the food was great and the new pool is very nice, but the only staff at the golden nugget that were ever friendly, or courteous were the maids that cleaned our rooms. golden nugget is a really nice place, but showing hospitality toward their guests is something they need to work on!

Reviews.Title: “Proper Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grant_George
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Nugget didn't start off too well because of a power failure and a problem with our room but once these issues were resolved we had a great stay. Our room was more than big enough although the beds were only standard doubles so not the full american luxury experience. The hotel is an authentic part of the real Las Vegas not one of the show hotels like on the strip. The casino is massive and they run classes in most of the table games if you know nothing about gambling. The swimming pool is amazing with a shark tank in the middle which has a water slide running through it! Have dinner at Vic & Anthonys steakhouse if you fancy a big splurge, the steak is amazing and the service is second to none. Plus, the Fremont Street Experience if right on your doorstep and that beats any of the stuff on the strip in my book!

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem”
Reviews.Author: joemel
Reviews.Content: This could be the best #38 trip advisor rated hotel ever. The room was very clean and the hotel was great. I got a great massage one day and the pool is a great place to spend the day. The new Buffet is not as lavish as others but the quality of the food is much better than those huge buffets. I have been going to Vegas every year for the last 13 years and have stayed in most of the strip hotels, this was a great bargain of a hotel and would not even think about staying anywhere else when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Ate well @ Nugget”
Reviews.Author: madison666
Reviews.Content: Background: I Have only stayed at the Las Vegas Hilton about 6 consecutive years in the 90s for meetings, so I do not have ability to compare to other LV hotels. Enjoyed: Grotto restaruant food (especially salads and pizza) and service (James), shark tank, pool slide, Cafe food and service, VIP check-in (avoided an extremely long SLOW line), quiet rooms, breakfast room service (however avoid lox and bagels). Disliked or neutral: very SMALL bathroom which was NOT clean especially floor and had mediocre shower, did not see any difference in south or north rooms that we visited/stayed in, beds either not high quality or too old, no coffeepot (brought our own small pot) or refer (consider cooler). We used the bus to go to shopping/strip. Very fast on a Thursday, extremely SLOW on a Sunday so we returned via taxi.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: LCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay downtown on our last trip to Las Vegas since we usually stay on the strip. Service was superb and although the rooms were a little outdated they were very clean. I was surprised at the lower noise levels in the casino than most others in Vegas. As far as the dining goes they had the best food that we have had in Vegas. Go figure! A lower rated downtown hotel and casino with better food then the more expensive places on the strip. Now I am not comparing this to food at the Bellagio or Wynn but it out did any of the food that we have had at Mandalay Bay, Bally's, Paris, Mirage and Treasure Island. If we stayed downtown again, we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is a wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: 02212012aj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Golden Nugget Hotel in Las Vegas, and boy, did I have a GREAT time or what? Everything was super clean - from the rooms, to the public restrooms, to the gaming tables and slot machines. I loved the atmosphere! I have not been to Vegas in a long long time, especially not to the downtown area which never sounded appealing to me. I took this trip with Good Times Travel, based in Fountain Valley, so everything was arranged by them. I personally would never have made an effort to book downtown, leave alone the Golden Nugget. All I can say is that I love this hotel, swimming pool, shark tank, gym, spa, and the fact that I saw every age group represented. What a happy place. I will definitely be back !!! and look forward to seeing the "ceiling" show at night (projcected onto the ceiling of the roof over the pedestrians-only street). The music and graphics were awesome. Never knew about that little surprise! Marci Wiesen

Reviews.Title: “A great Vegas value!”
Reviews.Author: kmike566
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget April 26-30 and I was happy with the trip overall but a bit disappointed. This is the 3rd time that I stayed at the Nugget and the first since it was bought by Landry's and renovated. The new gaming floor and pool is very nice, everything I hoped it would be. Also the sportsbook is now modern and confortable even though still WAY too small. The same can be said for the new poker room. It is modern and I love the daily hold'em tournaments but there are only 10 tables and they are so close together that you are pressed up against the table your sitting at. I have read several reviews about the service and I had always been extremely happy with the staff at the Nugget until this last trip. I don't know if I just had bad luck but if so, then so did the other members of my party. Everything from a blackjack dealer personally insulting me while dealing to a waiter refusing to find my server who was AWOL because she said that wasn't her job. To be fair there was some of the usual great service I expect from the Nugget but on the whole I was very unhappy with the service. I would still recommend this hotel for anybody who loves old Vegas, gambling, or staying downtown. When it comes to hotels in Vegas, the Nugget is easily the best one not on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasDee1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN in Las Vegas May 27 - June 1, 2007. It was a terrible experience. I have stayed at this hotel for years and have always found it to be a great place to stay, but this visit was not the case. Evidently they are now going for quantity and not quality. With their new pool and arcade for kids they evidently want a different clientel. Kids running in the halls, couldn't find a place to sit at the pool and when did get in the pool it was not relaxing as in the past because of all the kids. Also for the first time have trouble taking a nap in the afternoon because people in room above were running and stomping. Call the front desk but it did not help. On the thrid day no one even answered at the front desk. Phone rang for seven minutes before it finally cut my call. If you are looking for a restful place my advice is not to go to the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget rocks!”
Reviews.Author: dthopson
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying in the "downtown" area. The Golden Nugget was THE PLACE to stay. It is very clean, the food (minus the pizza) is excellent, and besides that the price was right. The Carson Street Cafe was excellent. The staff went out of their way to make sure everything was just right We stayed 5 nights in the farthest room from the elevator in the South Tower - which is really not that bad of a walk at all. I would much rather be with the "small" crowd at the Fremont Street experience than the 'large" crowd on the strip. Yes, we did go to the Strip each day, took the Deuce ($5/pp for 24 hours). I would definitely consider staying again at the Nugget. I believe that some of the negative comments on this site, are just from negative people. It has an an excellent pool - the shark tank is awesome. It is extremely crowded and I really don't like the fact the people insist on bringing their children to a place where they absolutely should not be. The Golden Nugget scores a 10 in our book!!!!!!! .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sburnell51863
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a Saturday morning and were able to check into our room around 12:00 PM...which was a welcomed reward since check-in is ususally around 3:00 PM. The rooms were beautiful, and the Casino, pool and restaurants were great as well. The surrounding neighborhood was not the best, but then I didn't come to Las Vegas for the hotel surrouding neighborhood...I felt safe while I was there. I will stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Above average - clean, but the area around the hotel is a pit”
Reviews.Author: Brucinator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at he Golden Nugget since I was taking her to see Celine Dion, and we were not willing to pay 200 - 400 dollars for a strip hotel. The room was clean and the staff generally courteous and friendly. The main gripe was the restaurant - the food was so-so, and service was some of the poorest I have ever seen. My main gripe is that the area around the hotel is kind of run-down. The Fremont experience is interesting, to be sure - but the kinds of people in it seemed to be more of out-of-control party types than folks who just want to have a good time without being completely blot-o. Also some of the folks were just plain weird - I may of had an attempt to have my pocket picked - I am not sure, but when I get bumped into by some dude carrying a jacket when it's 90 some odd degrees outside, I get a little concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: shopaholictraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here the beginning of May. We were supposed to be in the South tower, ( I think this was where the online special priced rooms are located) but when we checked in, they did not have a room with 1 king sized bed available in that tower, so they put us in a room with 2 queen sized beds in the north tower saying that we could change after the first night. We did not change when we heard that the North tower was nicer than the South tower. The room was comfortable though the A/C unit was a bit loud. The room was nicely furnished and clean. Yes the pool was incredible. The shark tank was fun to just sit and watch. I enjoyed the atmosphere and we spent an late evening sitting on the lounge chairs, talking, drinking, watching the tank with friends. Once you get to look around Fremont Street, you'll realize that the Golden Nugget is probably the nicest hotel downtown. I am really surprised that some people find the walk from the parking structure to the hotel or between the two towers, far to walk. This hotel, compared to many on the Strip, is the easiest on the feet. So if you want to stay downtown, I do recommend the Golden Nugget. We checked-in around 9:30pm and had no wait. I did notice around 11am to 4pm, there was always a line to wait.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MarshBird
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Victoria Day long weekend (Canadian). Stayed in South Tower which was close to the self parking. Right outside hotel is the Fremont Street experience, and close to all the good dining/buffet deals not to be found on the strip. Also very close to the Premium Outlet Mall. About 10-15 minutes' drive to mid Strip. Room: Spacious and clean. They weren't able to meet our request for a King Bed, so ended up with 2 doubles, oh well. Quiet, bed was comfortable, and that's what's important. Internet is available for surcharge, quite high, so didn't bother. based on decor and amenities, I wouldn't rate this hotel as 4-stars. 3.5 maybe. Otherwise there would be quite a few 5-star hotels around. Dining: Didn't try, other than the Starbucks. Somewhat pricey compared to what's around (California hotel 2 blocks away had champaign brunch for $10 and prime rib dinner for $6.99). Overall, it's a very good deal and a good alternative to staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again, 3 rooms 7 people! Ages 37-76”
Reviews.Author: lisaanddenny
Reviews.Content: Just returned this evening, spent 6 nights @ the Golden Nugget. The only real negative is no coffee pot or refridgerator in the rooms but that is obvious, they want you to buy Starbucks in the Lobby and eat at the restaurants in house! Makes sense if you own the restaurant but no one gets $4.00 for a cup of coffee, or $2.95 for a glass of soda, GET THE COUPON BOOK AT THE DESK, THEY ARENT REAL EASY TO HAND THEM TO YOU BUT THERE ARE A LOT OF GOOD DEALS INSIDE....use the coupon for the lunch/breakfast buffet, actually quite good, you get two per book! no coupons on weekends thoguht.....use them, especially buy one get one free breakfas/lunch!! Casino~ nice, father played in the poker tournaments ALL week, he liked it. The hotel itself was very professional and clean, our rooms, South Tower, 1181. 1195 and 1190 were very nice, they kept us close by one another. I brought my own coffee pot, worked out great for all of us, saved us $4.00 PER COFFEE IN STARBUCKS. The Carson Street Cafe is nice but expensive, along with the Noodles restaurant. We rented a minivan, we always will, and I don't mind driving, everything was pretty close by vehicle. There is a super Walmart approx 15 min from this hotel, we bought all of our wine/beer and breakfast foods (donuts, pop tarts, snacks) here! If you like Sushi, you MUST go to Makino, its on Decataur Street, off the strip, off of Flamingo Road, its FABULOUS, look it up on the net! We at there twice, you MUST LOVE SUSHI THOUGH! You literally walk out onto Freemont Street, I found the area safe, I don't go walking at night off small streets, Freemont is safe, you see the same nutcakes you do up by the Bellagio, trust me! The Valet Service was professional and wonderful, these boys work hard and your car is waiting once you call down to Valet, would never self park in Vegas, never! I used Valet at every hotel, it was WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The rooms were very clean, air Conditioner was good! Some say the rooms are not "updated", all 3 of our rooms were very nicely decorated and up to date! I would return, although I do like to try different places, the Shark tank pool is GORGEOUS. Definately give it a try, and hopefully you have a vehicle, the strip is not that far away, email me with questions!

Reviews.Title: “Fool's gold”
Reviews.Author: onejumpjohnny
Reviews.Content: Against my better judgement (and my wife's bitter disagreement!) I decided to experience Fremont Street . Getting into the Nugget is a feat unto itself! After three or four trips circumnavigating the corner, we opted for the park and hike. Out of three entrances (unmanned!) only the "main" entrance (the one we didn't find!) was staffed. Unsympathetic to our plea for valet service (of course it was very difficult to understand with my gasping....) we were again directed through the rat's maze of elevators and after two missed opportunities, finally made it down cardiac alley to our $200 room. The massive gold nugget on display is cool. That's all that's cool about downtown. Fremont St. is a novel approach to losing money/entertainment. The service was horrible, staffing was uncaring and unprofessional, parking is inconvenient, neighborhood is used up, but overall the room was comfortable and quiet. Lines were long to check-in, check-out, and dine-in. It's apparently a challenge to manage and move paying customers here. The Strip is the new Las Vegas, stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a four star.....”
Reviews.Author: wojo1989
Reviews.Content: This is rated as a four star.....It is more like a 2 1/2 star. The casino area is nice and the pool is great, but the rooms are in need of help. You could feel the springs in the bed, there was not very much water pressure in the shower, the towels were pretty old & ratty. The room had not been cleaned very well. There was a beer cap on the table next to the bed & there was no soap or shampoo in the bathroom. I would only recommend this hotel if you get a good deal of no more than $60.00 per night or if you are expecting a 2 1/2 star hotel, not a four star. Date of stay: May 18-20, 2007.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the second time. I got a good rate. They have improved the pool area and buffet since I was there last year. However, this is not a great hotel for a business traveler. Everything costs extra. High speed internet $11. Printing of anything including your air boarding pass was $1 per page. The TV has few channels. The buffet was good and I enjoyed the new shark tank by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: jlinderts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget last weekend, and had a great time there. The pool area was great with the shark tank to swim around & the water slide was a lot of fun! Lots of room to lay in the sun & good drinks. Only bad part about the Golden Nugget was the check-in. We waited in line for an hour. Everytime we walked past check-in the lines were super long. Usually only 1 or 2 people working at the counter. They need to really improve on that. Otherwise highly recommend the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Just spent Sunday night, May 13th, at The Golden Nugget. Arrived about 1pm Sunday and the line for checking in was HUGE. People in line were complaining that the line wasn't moving. Soon after I got in line an employee came and took half the line to another desk to check us in. All in all about 1/2 hour was spent in line. Our room was very nice, clean, large. The bathroom could use some updating but it was clean and functional and that's all that is really important. The pool is very cool and especially nice after the sun goes down - they even have poolside blackjack tables which are great in the evening. The casino is pretty big but the ceilings are a bit low which seems to hold the smoke. Ate at the Carson Street Cafe twice - the Montecristo sandwich was terriffic. Easy access to Fremont Street which is a nice break from mile walks through other hotels to get anywhere. Overall I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GN- Still Golden!!”
Reviews.Author: COtravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights (May 6-8). We made our reservations through the Private Arrangements desk, and also added on the $15 VIP check-in which was well worth the money! We were able to bypass a rather large line in the lobby upon arrival, and were quickly checked into our rooms within minutes. Another perk of the VIP check-in is that you are guaranteed the room type you request. I reserved a non-smoking King on a high floor, and was given a non-smoking king on the top floor of the South Tower. My traveling companion requested a King smoking floor near the elevator, and she received a room that was directly off of the elevator! The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, and I only had a minor issue with a TV problem that was fixed promptly when I reported it to the front desk. They have free in room-safes for guest use. The air conditioning worked really well. The bathrooms were clean and light. The shower appeared to have a new Kohler showerhead and it had great water pressure! We ate at the Buffet for breakfast, and at Carson Street Cafe. Both were great food, and good service. The new pool looks great, and always had quite a few people enjoying it. You can go check out the shark/fish tank at night when things are quiet, and have a drink poolside. Valet is extremely easy to use, and we had great service. We've stayed here before, and we'll definitely be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was good”
Reviews.Author: clrhonda
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and was very impressed with the hotel itself. I thought that the restuarants were very expensive and really not worth the money charged. I did not like that they did not have in room coffee. In the future I will choose a hotel that does. I feel that orginally my reservation was booked incorrectly so watch when you call direct. The people that also traveled and met me there was booked wrong. I had called before arriving and changed the dates but the other party did not. They were charged double for the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: bridaldiane
Reviews.Content: Staying a the Golden Nugget was a new experience for us. We have never stayed downtown before. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. The rooms are very nice except for the water pressure in the bathroom. Are only problem was with the valet service. Having arrived on April 10th late in the night, after picking up a rental car at the airport we drove directly to the Nugget and used the valet for the car we checked in.. The next morning we had to be at the Venetian for a all day meeting. we also stayed and ate dinner and gambeled there. Returning to the Golden Nugget at around 9:30 that night. When we drove up and presented our keys to the valet he called over the supervisor who informed us we where given the wrong car that morning and that we needed to talk to security. To make a long story short we did not make the error with the car but where made to feel as though we had and spent a great deal on time filling out paper work. A word of warning even though the car you pick up at valet is the same color as the car you rented be sure its your car the whole ordeal was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: ann44Florida
Reviews.Content: decided to go back to vegas in the middle of april and wanted to stay downtown. decided that the golden nugget was where i wanted to stay. had read about their renovations especially their new pool area. was very happy with how pleasant the staff were to us. the room was very nice, we were in the south tower. also went with V.I.P. check in so there was no wait at all. housekeeping could have cleaned a little better and delivered the right amount of towels and other things but not too bad. ate at vic and anthonys, very very good steaks, everything ala carte but well worth the price. great service there. also carson street cafe for breakfast was very good and the italian rest. was good for lunch. the pool area was especially nice to hang out by, the shark tank was entertaining to watch around the pool. the casino was lively, they say the slots are tight because of the renovations but i didn't find that to be true. enjoyed being able to get down to the casino quickly instead of the big hotels, almost like a maze to get to their casinos. the down town area is much less crowded than the strip, more relaxing. a short cab ride from the nugget to the stratosphere was only about $7.00 and then you can head on up the strip by bus, monorail or cab. i would stay at the golden nugget again but the only downside is no coffee makers in the room. this is true of alot of the hotels, i brought a small coffee maker. if you've never stayed downtown do it once and stay at the nugget, the other hotels downtown are no where near as nice.

Reviews.Title: “New Pool is Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: kar344
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Golden Nugget. Rates were good; all services, including check-in and check-out, were fast and courteous; the entire property is very clean and well-kept; all eight elevators were fast; our room was fairly large and very clean. I didn't care for the brand of toiletries provided in the bathroom, but maybe that's just me. The pool is wonderful: the clear waterslide goes right through the middle of the huge cylindrical shark tank. (Of course, you''re sliding so fast that you don't enjoy the sharks from that angle.) The steps to the waterslide were better than any others I have seen. Instead of open-back, slippery stairs, these are solid concrete, and they feel very secure. To fully appreciate the shark tank, one must swim up to the cylinder and get face-to-face with the sharks. From that vantage point, the third of the tank which is below the pool surface is visible. The pool isn't very deep at any location, maybe 6 feet, which is nice. There are plenty of comfortable lounges around the pool, and chairs and couches and tables, too. Just don't forget your sunscreen. A guy I met said he paid $26 for one tube at the little pool store because he forgot his. Of course, Las Vegas hotels, including the GN, don't have in-room coffeepots. That wouldn't be so bad, except if you're in the South Tower as we were, you'd better be in good physical shape to walk all the way down to Starbucks and back. I will never stay in the South Tower again; it's way too far to walk. I have two complaints with the bathroom: the sink and the tub. They are placed so high that we could barely reach the sink, and I was afraid that my mother would fall getting out of the tub. (We are 5'2" and 5'4" and have never encountered this before.) All linens were excellent quality. The Carson Street Cafe has very good food, and so does the breakfast buffet on the second floor. Be sure to look at your coupon book, because there are coupons for those restaurants. Although the buffet says that breakfast ends at 10:30, they replace the food gradually, so you can still get breakfast items at 10:30. The bus stop is two blocks away, and the bus takes a little over an hour to get all the way down the Strip. There are a Walgreen's and an ABC Store nearby in case you forget anything. We had better luck gambling at the Four Queens. Golden Nugget's location is great because you only have to leave the neighborhood if you want to. With Fremont Street right outside and everything you need there, you can avoid the hustle of the Strip unless you want to see something on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth About The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: rb888
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and clean it had the vibe of a big hotel on the strip compared to the dumps surrounding the nugget I would say its the best hotel downtown, The casino was just about the right size and it was nice they keep the riff raff out, The problem is I didnt feel like a guest at a hotel I felt like a sheep being bled for every dime, every thing cost's internet, the workout room isnt even included it was $20.00 to use it they said I could use it all day, who works out all day Its not enough that you chose this hotel and hand your money over at the casino they want to flip you upside down and shake you incase there is any change left in your pocket, another problem I had was the fact that they had no coffee pots in the rooms, A clear idea to have you get up and get out of the room and into the casino and spend your money, who do they have in mind there certianly not their so called guest, and okay its not the end of the world you have to go down to get coffee but so does everybody else, there were 32 people in line with me to get a coffee it took forever I felt that this was rude, the other thing was both mornings our phone rang at 6:00 am just one ring, I started to wonder if the hotel did that just to wake us up and get us spending, so this was the way I felt at this hotel I was suprised they let me in the pool without paying. If none of theese things bother you the hotel is nice the rooms were nice the casino was nice the game wheel of fortune the game I traveled all that way to play are restricted to only pay out small amounts so even when you've paid and finally won a spin they dont even allow you a fair chance at winning, this makes me sick, mabey thats just the way vegas is but I have stayed at hotels like treasure island and felt very much like a hotel guest and not a money rape victim. the bottom line: This isnt a hotel with a casino in it, its a casino with a hotel in it. and there is a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Pool is the Bomb”
Reviews.Author: hostetterj
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon in Vegas!! No I didn't get married there. My fiance and I had booked rooms at the Palms for our honeymoon but we had family and friends staying at the Golden Nugget. We helped our friends and family check in and upon seeing the pool, we decided that we only needed to stay one night at the Palms and the rest of the honeymoon at the Nugget. The Palms pool was only open from 10am to 5pm the Golden Nugget pool was open from 10am to 10pm. The slide at the pool was awesome. Here are tips for going slower if you want to try to check out the sharks on your way down. Sit up just enough but don't hit your head that will slow your descent. Overall I can't say enough about the pool at the Golden Nugget. It was the highlight of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at it's Best”
Reviews.Author: Sadrobin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget from Apr 9-12, and I absolutely loved it. Unlike others I did not have a problem with check in, the guy that checked us in was not as helpful as I wanted him to be but we were only around him for 5 min. Our rooms were in the South tower, and they are huge for the price. I was surprised by how clean the rooms were, they did not have that muggy, stuffiness feel or smell. We had a great view of Fremont St. and the mountains. I thought the lights from Fremont St. would bother us but they did not, the curtains were very heavy and shielded the light. My aunt ordered room service and she absolutely loved it, my friend and I ate in the 24 hour cafe and the food and service were great. The buffet in the morning was awesome too. I fell in love with the tank, it was just beautiful the water and the slide and the sharks and the fish, I felt like a kid again. They have plenty of seating including beds around the pools and jaccuzi. I enjoyed not being on the strip because I could be away from all the action and relax, I did hate the bus ride to the strip, it took like an hour and a half to get to the strip. Fremont St. provided ample entertainment for me. The Golden Nugget did have an older crowd and some children but that didn't bother me. All in all I loved my stay at the Golden Nugget and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Lawman61
Reviews.Content: After 30 previous visits to Las Vegas I was not able to get a room on the strip for anything under $300 as something huge was happening. So I thought of the Golden Nugget and was able to secure a rate at half the strip casinos rate. I had read a number of reviews from here; some great, some bad, and most just average, so I was not really sure what I was to expect. As far I was concerned the Golden Nugget is not a Strip facility, but comes out on top in old Las Vegas. The rooms were very clean, large and in great repair, house keeping was excellent and every request was met with no disappointments. The only thing I did not like was the $12 a day internet fee, that since I was there on business was forced to utilize. I just see this as a huge cash grab. The casino is smaller than the bigger places, but how big do you really need it. The casino hostess and bar tenders keep the drinks coming if your gambling, better than the large casinos. So if you like old Las Vegas or just want to try something different from the big strip casinos, this is really a great place to be. I will definitely be returning to the Golden Nugget in the furture.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: alias2_u
Reviews.Content: We were only to stay here for one night as we were on a short trip which we split between the strip & downtown. I had been in the Golden Nugget in the past and in their pool area so I thought it was a good choice. CHECK IN We were booked for a standard room in the South Tower. When we got there to check in, they were full so the desk clerk tells me they have upgraded us to a Parlor Suite in the North Tower at no additional charge. Hey I was thrilled! The line was pretty long to check in and I did notice that their front lobby stayed pretty busy with check ins. ROOM The room was on the 14th floor and was really nice. It had a king bed that was so comfy I wanted to bring it home. There was another room with a bar/kitchen area along with a living room & dining table. There were 2 bathrooms, one with a jacuzzi jet tub and the other with a steamer shower. This was a lovely treat. The room was very clean, with everything you could think of needing in it. Absolutely wonderful. POOL The pool area is nice. The shark tank is fabulous and is much better when viewed from in the pool than from the side. It goes down deeper and them sharks swim right up to you. The slide is quite fun, goes pretty fast but by the time you get to the clear portion going through the tank you can't see much. But still fun. The pool gets pretty crowded. Lots of people just sunning, more than in the pool, but the weather was a bit mild so that might be why. In the morning the left side of the pool near the bar gets full fast as it is sunny & the right side is in the shade for awhile. The jacuzzi was nice - it said it had a 52 person capacity, but I couldn't quite envision that! It was really hot though. All in all I would stay there again. I wasn't expecting the suite, but was glad I got it. I would be happy in a regular room as well as I felt the Golden Nugget was very clean and fun. It is definetly not for those who are looking for relaxing privacy though. It gets crowded there and of course being downtown is much different than the strip, but I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The base for our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: djo5555
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6.30 on a Friday evening expecting to queue having read previous reviews on this site! We waited about 10 mins and there were 3 people in front. We found the staff courtious and made the check in a reasonable experience. We had been deposited at the south tower entrance by the limo, and it was a bit of a hike to find the main desk with our luggage in tow! We then had to lug it back again as our room was on the third floor in you've gussed it the south tower. Nobody offered to help with the luggage although we did not request anybody to do so. The room was clean, and ready for us. Irrespective of what time we left the room, we always returned to find the bed made and bathroom cleaned. The shower was wicked, if somewhat complicated to work! I have to agree with previous reviews regarding the towels. Plenty of them but they could do with a bit of fabric conditioner as they were stiff and clearly a bit old. My only other comment regarding the room was the aircon. It was a little chilly one night and we wanted a bit of heat. We had to endure a quite revolting burning skin smell as the heating function had clearly not been used for some time. As the windows do not open more than 1 inch, this was rather unpleasent. If you are reading this Mr Nugget, I suggest running the heating once a month to avoid guests having to endure this experence. 1 final pain was the Nugget car park across the road. Nothing worse than a noisy motor bike rider parking on the top floor and deciding to leave the car park at 4.30 in the morning. I shared his exit from every floor, and his obviouse relief when he finally got to the bottom and roared away!! The hotel public area's were spotless. Staff were always out in the late evenings polishing the mirrors and brass, and one night we saw a guy on his hands and knees scrubbing one of the carpets. Very impressed! We are not gamblers so I can make no comment regarding that facility. It was however a very interesting place to stand and watch others playing with their banks money! I do have 2 gripes. They both revolve around eating! The Carson Cafe staff were not the friendliest, and there was a considerable amount of waiting for food. The quality was not special either. I had southern fried chicken one evening that was so over cooked I could not eat it. The chips were not any better! My new wife tells me however that the pancakes were great. My other gripe was the Buffet. It shuts at 10, and we arrived at 10 to. There were 2 staff at the desk and a waitress at the entrance. We made a move towards the waitress and one of the staff at the desk stopped her conversation and said "You have to pay here first" It was not the content that annoyed me but the way she said it. There were no signs to say "wait here to be served" and , at the end of the day I was a customer! We turnrd on our heals and left her to her conversation. Clearly an overtired employee, or a fed up one. The nice part was the pool area, which was fully open, and had nice fluffy towels!! This area will be a hit! One point for Mr Nugget however. It is nice when you are on holiday to spend an evening outside in the fresh air with a nice drink and good company. I was therefore suprised that we got booted out at 2am because the bar was closing. The Nugget does not match the hotels on the strip. However, we were very glad that we chose the Nugget and would certainly revisit if ever we could afford another trip to renew our vows. Dream on!! As for Vegas as a holiday, A week is long enough! A lot of walking in spite of the fantastic DEAUCE buses. We have been home 3 weeks now, and I have had plenty of time to think about the stay. If anybody from the UK is reading this and thinking of going, dont hesitate to contact me for further tips and opinions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Redfrick
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay on fremont street at the Golden Nugget and it was a great experience. Checking in and out was great, staff was very freindly, the breakfest buffet had lots selection and the quality of the food was great. The room was very large and very clean. The pool and hot tub area was very neat (shark aquarium) I would recommend the hotel for anyone and especially for people who are looking for the real vegas experience. I've stayed on the strip previously and I have found fremont to be more exciting and more what I imagined Vegas to be. All of the casios on fremont are right on off of the sidewalk and there are no 15 minute walks just to get to a casio. Also the fremont experience (viva vision) is very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Pool”
Reviews.Author: LeighW
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Golden Nugget, April 13 - 16th, 2007. We have stayed there twice before and have loved the hotel in the past, so I was looking forward to seeing the new pool and the changes they have made. We were not disappointed. The pool, in my opinion is the best in Vegas at this time. The water slide through the shark tank was a blast. My husband and I both went down it and had a great time. Nice, comfy lounge chairs and patio furniture all around the pool and loved the lawn beds in the water. Great way to keep cool and watch the shark tank. The rooms are always nice and the beds comfortable. Housekeeping is very good, with a supervisor coming by to check the rooms after they have been cleaned, I saw this myself. We ate in the Carson Street Cafe and it was very good and reasonably priced. And the Grotto bar was fun with very friendly waite staff. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel and they have just made it even better with the new pool and new lounges and restaurant. We will stay there again no doubt about it. We were comped very well and my hubby did good on the dollar flaming 7 machines. If someone writes a bad review about this place, they better pay the extra and go stay at the Bellagio or Wynn. We have stayed at several strip hotels in the past and the Golden Nugget is by far our favorite. If you stay there and want a really good prime rib dinner that is inexpensive go to the California Hotel Casino in the Market Street cafe. It is only $6.99 and it is fabulous and you even get dessert with it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel, Not crazy about location”
Reviews.Author: marshefen
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas and it was a last minute trip. I really liked the hotel, but it is really far from the old strip. Fremont is nice though and the light show at night is cool. The bus is only $5 for a 24 hour period and we pretty much stayed on the strip and in the other hotels most of the day. I did get to meet two celebrities (comedian Mike Epps and Woody Harrelson, who was shooting a movie in the convention center) in this hotel, so I was happy overall. I would recommend this hotel if you want to get away from all the crowds, but not if it's your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Large And Busy”
Reviews.Author: fourstar
Reviews.Content: A large busy hotel not for people who want peace and quiet. The room we had was a good size 2 large beds and a good sized bathroom. The strip is about 5 miles away and will cost about 17 to 20 $. Several restaurants on site giving quite a selection of good food. The self service breakfast has a large choice,and as much as you like to eat,the service very fast. Can't say the same for the front desk,long queues just after we checked in. One problem we had it was the motor Grand Prix weekend and the hoel was isolated by the track and barriers,the only in was over a temporary bridge. Taxis and buses had no access, would have been a problem if you were carrying heavy luggage. Did'nt use the pool,but it looked quite amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mark2211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The rooms are big, clean and quite luxurious (even for Vagas standards). Whilst not being on the strip, the location is great as it is right by the light show. Casino was a bit tight when we were there, but what could I expect? I would certainly recommend this hotel to people traveling to Vagas who do not want to be directly on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel,terrible slots.”
Reviews.Author: lafjhns
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the g/n from 4-1 to 4-3 and the hotel was nice and clean,the buffet was really good,it had turkey,ham,salads,pastas and a good variety of deserts,the deserts are behind the counter so it is better because no one handles them other than the server,the rooms were clean and cozy with good strong showers,the drainage was a little slow but thats a minor issue,the pool is nice,a little too small but nice with a aquarium in the middle with sharks separated by thick glass and a water slide that goes through the shark tank,overall the hotel is nice,now here are the cons,the check in was 45 minutes and the slots were extremely horrible i played at least $300 in slots and did not win a red cent,i did not see anyone win anything,however i will stay there again,i just won't play their slots again and i'll wear comfortable shoes to stand in a 30-45 minute line.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas newbie review”
Reviews.Author: Babs80
Reviews.Content: My husband was sent to a conference on our 10th wedding anniversary. So I decided to tag along. I am glad we chose the GN. I loved the location. I'm glad our room was not on the Freemont Experience side of the hotel. Our room on the 18th floor of the south tower was surprisingly quiet. We were never bothered by any noise. I had not expected this-especially during Spring Break. The pool was great. It does get a lot of shade though. Kept having to move to stay in the sun. The room was clean and spacious. We did find a bucket of vomit outside a neighbors door one morning. It was not removed until late morning. The Spa was the only dissapointment. The ad said to come early to be pampered. Tap water in a plastic cup with lemon was their idea of "beverages and fresh fruit". I was given a floor show-when a male guest was escorted through the spa in a spa robe that was too small for him-and he inadvertently flashed me. Their robes were horrible. The pedicure I had was not worth the nearly $75 fee. I would book a stay at the GN again-but would avoid the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Just Keeps Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: AJSoma
Reviews.Content: We have been coming several times a year for 6 or 7 years now and it just keeps getting better. The entire property is always spotless. The new shark tank and pool are out of this world. The food is outstanding in all of the restaurants. The people are friendly and accommodating. If you pick you spots, the room prices are so low that I'm, sure most Motel 6 Inns charge more.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: karenew
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the previous poster's comments about don't stay here if this is your first Vegas trip. We had been to Vegas before (got married there almost 5 years ago) and have primarily stayed on the strip. We wanted to go somewhere new, neither of us had ever been to Freemont area. Unfortunately the pool area was closed for most of the time that we were there due to high winds. Golden Nugget has some of the best food I have EVER had. Be sure to try Grotto (Italian restaurant).. their dish of homemade fettucini with gargonzola sauce over tortellini topped with bosch pear is awesome! The desert of Italian wedding cake is TO DIE FOR! Noodle Thai- try the Mongolian beef. YUM! Yes, Golden Nugget is the primary attraction for geriatrics, but it is trying.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change of pace from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kilgorie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 3rd trip to Vegas. This was the first time I stayed off the Strip. I was a bit hesitant at first because I had heard stories about Fremont being past it's prime and in a run down area. Needless to say I was pleasantly surprised by both the Golden Nugget and Fremont St. We were on the 19th floor in the South tower. The room was big and clean with a nice view of the Plaza hotel and the mountains off in the distance. The hotel was buzzing with people all week. The big reason is that iit is the official hotel of the Vegas Grand Prix. The hotel was busy all week. We ate at The Buffet which was pretty good. The food wasn't great but there was lots of it. It wasn't the best buffet I had ever been to but it wasn't the worst either. We also had dinner on our last night at Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse. It was very pricey but the food and service were both very good. Dinner for 5 came to $350. The best part of the hotel has to be the new pool called the Tank. It's hard to describe but the whole layout includes a waterfall, cabanas overlooking the pool area, a waterslide that goes right through a shark tank, poolside blackjack tables and a bar. This was the place to be seen at The Nugget. I would definitely come back to the Nugget. It was clean, fun and close to several other casinos on Fremont ( on the Strip you will never be able to say that you can run across the road to 3 other casinos in less than 5 minutes.)

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sktchgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget from Mar. 31-Apr 3. I was very skeptical of the hotel after reading the reviews, but it turned out to be one of the most beautiful and relaxing hotels I've ever stayed in. My boyfriend and I booked a package through Priceline. We had no difficulty registering late at night (arrived at 11pm) and there was no line. We asked the gentleman at the front desk for a room with a good view. He said they were fully booked but we could return in the morning to switch. Walking to our room late on a Saturday, noticed it was quiet and very secure. The next morning a nice bell hop switched our room to the TOP floor and with an incredible view of the strip. The new pool is gorgeous and the shark tank in the center is exquisite. There was always a deck chair to relax in. The casino is great too and it is where I had the best luck during my entire stay! Overall, I just loved the hotel, the location, and the employees. We were treated extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “We were forced to give the Golden Nugget a try”
Reviews.Author: juststartedtraveling
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas often (at least twice a year) and usually stay on The Strip (T.I.). This weekend, however, even the low-end hotels on The Strip (Sahara, Circus Circus, Tropicana) were going for around $140 a night. So for starters, no, don't stay at the Sahara or Circus Circus. They're scary, plain and simple. The Tropicana at least has a good location. But I digress...We booked a room directly through the hotel using the Spring Lucky '07 promotion posted on their website: $99 a night and a coupon book. Always book directly through the hotel, as most of them will meet any travel website's price and you don't run the risk of Orbitz "forgetting" to pass your reservation along. (Yes, this happened to me when I booked a room for a production crew in Buenos Aires). Just so you know, you can't use most of the coupons in your book during the weekend. We drove up to the Golden Nugget around 5:30 PM on a very busy Friday. The valet was full to visitors and only taking hotel guests. After reading reviews here, I expected to stand in the check-in line for at least an hour. We waited for about 15 minutes at most. Although the promotional rate was for a room in the south tower, the young lady at the front desk was nice enough to upgrade us to a north tower room (albeit a smoking one) at no additional cost, simply by asking. FYI: you're supposed to tip front desk staff $10-$25 for upgrading you. The room smelled bad, yes. But we bought some incense at a liquor store on Fremont Street and it made a huge difference. North tower is definitely better than south tower. The room was tidy but not super clean. We moved one of the chairs in the room and found an old bobby pin on the carpet. No big deal. The bathroom was small but seemed clean. The Golden Nugget seems not to have adopted the "green" towel policy: a towel on the floor will be replaced, etc, etc. We put towels on the counter and on the towel rack and they were still replaced. Towels are fluffy, by the way. Location: The Golden Nugget seems to be the place to be in downtown. It is definitely the nicest hotel and casino there. Hip casino with music playing all day and all night, AWESOME pool, etc, etc. The spa was just ok. The Buffet was good. All in all, the Golden Nugget is not as geriatric as you would imagine. They are making a huge effort to attract the young crowd. Getting to and from the Strip: we took a cab from the GN to Caesars and paid around $20. We hopped on The Deuce for the trip back and paid $2 each. The Deuce dropped us off on the other end of the Freemont Experience (near Neonopolis). Bottom line: Don't stay here if you plan on barhopping/clubhopping. Don't stay here if you're looking for "glamorous" Vegas. Don't stay here if this is your first time visiting Vegas. Don't stay here if this will be your only time visiting Vegas. Stay here if you can't afford anything on The Strip. But then if you can't afford anything else on The Strip and don't care too much for quality, check out Casino Royale, which can also be kind of scary but has an EXCELLENT location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: thelosttexan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four-night stay at the Golden Nugget and couldn't be more pleased! Our room was on the 11th floor in the South tower and while the decor was slightly dated, it was very clean and BIG! We've had suites in other places that weren't as large as the room we got at the GN. The newly-remodeled pool was awesome. We really enjoyed the tank with the sharks and fish, and the water slide was great, too (as was the poolside bar and blackjack)! This was the first time we've not stayed on or near the strip, but our experience Downtown will bring us back there again. Unlike folks on the Strip, the staff at the GN seemed to understand that they work in a service industry, and treated us as if we were valued guests. It's nice to be treated like you are truly appreciated, and not just cattle. They went above and beyond every time we needed anything. Freemont was fun and there was plenty to do and see there -- and we felt as safe or safer than we normally do on the Strip. The only drawback might be being away from the strip, but we had a car, so we didn't have any troubles. For us, the lower room price and the excellent service was a fair trade for not being on the Strip. We didn't try the buffet, but ate several times at the Carson Street Cafe and it was above average for a hotel diner (although we got one so-so waitress one morning) and ate appetizers one evening at Lillie's Noodle House and it was really good, too. There's no doubt that the next time we're looking to get away to Vegas, we'll check on rooms at the Golden Nugget first before considering any other place!

Reviews.Title: “Dire - bumped !!!”
Reviews.Author: chimbo
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from an 8 day trip to Nevada & Arizona, with our last night due to be downtown at the GN, after spending 3 nights at the TI at the beginning of the trip. We arrived at the hotel at 4pm, where the receptionist checked our details, and then told me the manager wanted to see us. He said that due to a problem at the hotel - which he would not specify, we had to be moved over the road to The 4 Queens. Despite repeatidly asking him if they had doubled booked, or if they had problems with the room, he would not told why, only that we would not be compensated, but there was no additional cost to us. We particularly selected the Golden Nugget for our last night in the US, and were dismayed with their take it or leave it attitude. We suspect that as we got a cheap deal through another website (especially after now learning that Orbitz operate the hotel !?), that we were bumped for a customer paying a higher price. Whilst we waited for the manager, we also noted that no one else was rejected, and thus it appeared we had been specially selected. Quite frankly the room at The 4 Queens was poor, being noisy with a filthy bathroom, and this being our last night spolit our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: asch74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a four star hotel which I find very hard to believe. The best thing about this is the pool with shark tank which you can't spend anytime at because it's always so full. A year and a half ago we stayed at the Mirage and got our whole trip comp'd. We spent more gambling our first night at the Nugget than we did our whole trip at the Mirage and we barely made 1/3 of our 1500 point total needed to even begin to get comps. By the second day of our stay my card quit working period. The first day of our stay our room key quit working so I had to go get new keys made and then find my husband out on Fremont Street to give him his keys at 1:00 in the morning. Our non-smoking room smelled of smoke and sewer. The maids didn't show up until 2:30 p.m. Our drains in the shower and the sink wouldn't drain and nobody at the front desk would answer the phone. We had to stand in line for 15 minutes to get the manager to hear our complaint on the third day of our stay. She took $24 of our room and said the drainage would be fixed. It wasn't - so when I complained upon checkout the gal said she couldn't do anything, didn't offer to get the manager and thanked me for my feedback. My mom got a whole night comp'd for the bed bug bites she received. The bartenders don't recognize you unless you are showing cleavage. The food is mediocre. The staff is not well trained. The valet has it together but that's about all. Spend your money elsewhere and don't let a AAA four diamond rating fool you. This hotel shouldn't have one.

Reviews.Title: “Suite-less in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Stevenjsofiesue
Reviews.Content: Our stay was March 10-13. 2007. We had called four months in advance to assure that we would have a 2 room suite. There were four of us celebrating our 50th birthdays...! the 2 room suite was booked...though it was the Nascar weekend, we ended up paying higher than normal rates...that was fine...the room was booked ...SO WE THOUGHT! Upon arrival at the hotel, we were told that there was NOT a suite booked in our name! The desk clerk in the VIP Check In called the Manager on duty(Ekatrina..not real sure of the spelling, she seemed to speak w/ a French accent) came to the VIP room and began to work with us on finding a room. We asked, how can this happen? We booked back in Dec.! She said the computer did not take and hold the reservation!! How true that is, is anyones guess...but, she found 2 adjouning rooms in the South Tower, credited our pre payment of the first night, gave each of us a VIP LINE PASS that we could use throughout the hotel to "jump" ahead in any lines and paid for our evening dinner night! All in all, we were very pleased how she handled the missing suite! Though the rooms we now had were not as elegant as a suite might have been, they were clean, large and nicely decorated for 69.00 a night. (and that first night was FREE!) The one problem we had was the never ending pounding of the techno disco beat that engulfed the pool area. We aren't prudes by any means, but hey, mix after mix, HOUR AFTER HOUR, the same constant boom boom boom ..never a change. ..from 10am open to close! We had mentioned it to the lifguard and a few other employees..they agreed...too much of the same. After 2 entire days of this incessive pounding...the next day we were pleased to be greeted by a variety of music...everyone around the pool was commenting on how nice the music was compared to the last couple of days. Overall the pool was great and the slide was alot of fun. Other than the check in w/ no suite....I would definately stay here again. The Manager that evening did what managers in her position are supposed to do, make sure the hotel accomidates the patron!! A job well done!! Kudos to the Golden Nugget! Steve,Kim,Barb & Laura

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Econruth
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 16-18, 2007 for a conference. Check in was quick at 8pm (no line), friendly young man at the desk. Nice room in South Tower on 12th floor, smoking. I had a very quiet room as it was on a wing that didn't overlook Fremont Street - 12106. Others staying in 12th floor did have the noise problem. Make sure you are not overlooking Fremont. King room was very large, great water pressure for the 12th floor. Clean, and maid service was efficient and thorough. Carpet a little worn, but otherwise room in good condition. Iron and hairdryer were in room, didn't have to call down to have them delivered up as in some other hotels. South Tower good choice for conferences and convention center attendees. Also, baggage check is at the South Tower Bell/Business Center. North tower is closer to the casino, South Tower a bit of a walk to casino but not as bad as say the MGM to get from one place to the other. Thought restaurants were expensive when compared to rest of Fremont Street hotels, but it IS a classier joint. There is a place called the GRILL in the casino (by the sports book) where you can get takeout food (sandwiches, salads, fresh fruit, soft pretzels) to bring up to your room instead of room service. Service was quick and friendly. I had a really good tuna salad on croissant and a soft pretzel with cheese dip. Got lost numerous times but every hotel employee I asked for directions was friendly and knew what they were talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl702
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. The pool just finished being renovated and it is awesome! The pool is built around the Shark/Reef Aquarium. The is also a slide that goes through the aquarium which is really fun and cool. There is even a area to take a tan while lounging on beds in the water! This is a really cool Pool - one of the nicest in Vegas so far. The atmosphere is very relaxing with a retro feel. There are beds and sitting areas all over the pool as well as lounge beds. The music is well picked... 80's type and you can even gamble out by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “GN still the only place to stay dowtown, but beware.....”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at GN 3/5 to 3/8, just before NASCAR race wknd. PREPAID my reservation through NWA.com (4) months in advance. Reserved North Tower King Non-smoke. SPECIAL THANK YOU to other travelers who advised to get VIP checkin for extra $15.00. We arrived very late and were told by desk that the hotel had been overbooked. If we hadn't purchased VIP checkin, we would not have gotten a room, even with prepaid reservation. North Tower room was not as nice as the ones we have stayed in at the South Tower. Bathroom was very small. North Tower very easy to get to and all rooms are close to the elevator. Drink service was slow at the slots. Service was very good everywhere in GN. Friendly. We ate at Buffet one time, it was good for the price. Again service was good. New pool area and shark tank are magnificent!! Even if you choose not to stay at the GN, it's worth the walk to see the new pool. Timeshare attackers at the entrance to GN from Fremont Street were intolerable. They get you in or out. Very annoying and we were uncomfortable being rude to them. All in all a great trip and we will stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: tmthompsonsc
Reviews.Content: I depend on Trip Advisor a lot and this was my first trip to Vegas, saw that it was generally rated higher than most hotels on the strip with the exception of the high dollar places like Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn, etc. Now I am not a routine traveler to Vegas and the gambling routine so I cannot comment on all of this stuff like Comp's, keeping tab's etc; so I can only comment on the accomodations and I rate them as typical of any high end chain such as Marriott etc. Rooms adequately furnished and large, I was in North Tower. I rate as above also on the value, since price I got was much cheaper than most at the Strip, there was a NASCAR event in town. My only real complaint was that they wanted to charge $20/day to use the exercise facility. Can you believe that!! Needless to say, I passed. If you have never been to downtown Vegas, let me say that it is not a place for an evening, or afternoon walk for that matter, very seedy and unsafe feel. Again hotel is fine, just it's surroundings are not where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: firefighterinsac
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends stayed at the GN from 3/4 to 3/6. 99% of my experience here was positive. The upgrades to the hotel are very nice. The rooms have all been redone. The bathrooms are a little small but very sufficient for a few days. The beds are a little hard but I think most hotel beds are this way. We stayed in the South tower on the 18th floor. This is not a long walk. Maybe 2 minutes from the elevators to the casino area. The pool area was just beautiful. Alot of people sun tanning and swimming. They even have gambling by the pool. The shark tank was very nice with the water slide running through it. We ate at the buffet for breakfast which was good food. It is standard breakfast fare. Use the 2 for 1 coupon you get at checkin. The only problem is that it took 15 minutes for the waiter to come and take our drink order. The 24 hour cafe was also very good food. We did not really gamble at the GN but I did notice that it took awhile to get drinks. The check in line only took about 20 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. You can get a 24 hour bus pass for the deuce bus and take it down to the strip. The bus runs 24 hours a day. It will take atleast an hour from freemont area to the strip. I think the negative reviews are from people who have very high expectations or are used to a 5 star hotel. I will stay here again. I will also ad that I was not bothered 1 time by the timeshare people.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Change”
Reviews.Author: ForneyNan
Reviews.Content: You can't imagine our dismay when we discovered the Nugget we've always enjoyed so much to be a different place. They're remodeling and that's okay, but the whole casino floor has been changed. The rooms have not been upgraded, that wouldn't bother me, but we were used to getting comps for all meals. That has all changed, the employees seem very unhappy with the new management and don't mind saying so. We heard a lot of complaints. One of the waitstaff made a statement that made a lot of sense. "People don't come here just to look at whales and visit restaurants. This is Vegas. Hope management will consider this. It may be our last trip to this legend downtown after almost 30 years.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, but moving back to strip next time”
Reviews.Author: BacktotheStrip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Nugget 3/2-3/5. We have stayed there several times but I don't think we'll be back. We booked a suite through the Nugget's "Private Arrangments" club and checked in at the VIP lounge with no problems. Our suite on the 4th floor in the north tower was roomy and clean. There were two bathrooms, one with a jacuizzi tub and one with a shower. The water pressure in the shower was terrible and the plumbing rattled pretty loudly when you used the hot watter, so that was disappointing. The bed was comfortable but we couldn't get the room quite cool enough and had to rotate between using the comforter and kicking it off. We got coffee at Starbucks every morning and ordered room service one night, both were pretty good. We didn't try any of the other restaurants at the Nugget. Tony Roma's at Binions was fair. My wife found that she had much better luck playing slots on the strip (Caesars, Ballys, O'Shea's, etc.) than she did at the Nugget or the other downtown casinos. That could be simply her luck, so I would read too much into that. Although we played on the strip during the day, we played primarily at the Nugget at night. I spent three nights playing blackjack and pai gow until the wee hours of the morning but I don't think that they did a good job rating my play. When I checked with the rewards desk the morning of checkout, they said that they only track slot play and that I needed to check with a casino host to see if my table play qualified for any room discount. When I finally did run down a host, they said I didn't meet their requirment for a room discount. . . . Whatever, I can only tell you that I gambled for several hours three nights straight and was down over $2k when done. No big deal losing, that's not their fault but I would have expected some comp on the room. I think when I moved between tables they did not keep up with me. Is that my responsibility? In contrast, the limited amount of time we played at Caesars we were given $100 in comps which we used to eat a nice dinner at the Flamingo Japanese Steakhouse. All in all I cannot say that the Nugget was "bad". I did encounter a few rude staff members, but there were many more that were pleasant. The dealers I encountered were friendly and knowledgable. This being said, I simply think that we'll be happier going back to the strip, probably Caesars again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations, terrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Brwnsugababy2
Reviews.Content: My accomodations were booked for a conference I was attending, and I had a suite in the North Tower. I was quite skeptical about staying at a hotel in the downtown area, due to the fact that I have never stayed anywhere other than the "strip". But the accomodations were lovely. I was very comfortable and quite surprised when I arrived at the overhaul that this hotel had. The lobby was beautifully decorated but they lacked staff at the front registration . Lines were abnormally long and they seemed to stand there for a long time to wait to be checked in. The suite I had was beautifully decorated, whirlpool tub, seperate shower, BOSE stereos in both the bedroom and living room, and kitchenette. The bed was so comfortable. I had questions about their gaming, because I kept hearing that you could win at the Golden Nugget! NOT!!! I didn't hear a soul screaming if they won, so my group went over to Fitzgeralds to gamble in our free time. We definatley hit there. The banquet staff was quite pushy and very fast talking. I can't say that my company will book another conference there again, but I will say that I will stay there again, but go gamble somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convienent for disabled guests.”
Reviews.Author: Daisysmama
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother-in-law and I made the trip to Vegas to celebrate my husbands aunt & uncle's 50th wedding anniversary. Check in was slow, due to an understaffed front desk, but that was the only hiccup during our trip. We stayed on the 9th floor, North tower and had a nice view of the moutains. The buffet was very good and a value at $9.00 for lunch. The coffee shop was great and we also enjoyed the Noodle House. My husband's uncle is ill and in a wheel chair most of the time and he was very well taken care of by all the staff including the black jack dealers. The shark tank and pool are great. The casino is very smoky, but if you go to the area past the sports bar it is much much better. We were there with a group of 40 people and there really were no complaints. We have stayed @ Mandalay Bay & Bellagio...both of these hotels were better, but you get what you pay for. For the price, Golden Nugget was just fine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been worse”
Reviews.Author: wrecknball
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Nugget several times in the past 10 years. I know what to expect, so I did not have high expectations. The property is the nicest downtown, and this is where our group wished to stay. I've experienced the nightmare that is check in at the Nugget before, so I opted to pay the extra $15 (per room) for VIP check in for all 4 of our rooms. It bugs me that I had to do it, but it was SO WORTH IT. We checked in at 3PM on Friday, and the line at registration was long. Using the VIP check in, we checked in three of our rooms, got a couple of bottled waters and were on our way to our rooms in a matter of minutes. We stayed in the South Tower. Some complain about the South Tower, but I prefer the easy access to the self park. Rooms are relatively spacious. They're not strip quality, but they're satisfactory. Had no problems with noise, water pressure etc. At check in we requested rooms as high up as possible facing west. We were on the 18th and 21st floors. We did not have any issues with the timeshare folks. They were still doing work on the pool, so intermittently the shark tank was covered. Even when the weather is warm, I wonder how much sunlight the pool area will get because of the surrounding towers. The Golden Nugget is notorious for being tight on slots. Several members of our group reported this to still be the case. I play table games, but DO NOT play at the Nugget any longer as their table staff have apparently never had instruction on customer service and their game rules are some of the worst downtown. Golden Nugget dealers are among the surliest, bored, and unnattentive in Las Vegas. I played a great deal at the various other casinos downtown. My action and my tips were appreciated at the other casinos, even though I'm a mid range player. Since my expectations weren't high, I wasn't disappointed. Frankly, you're paying extra for some brass and marble, and that's about it. If you're going to stay downtown, you'll get better value for your money and better customer service at some of the low end properties, or spend the extra $25/night and stay on the strip or one of the nicer outlying casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget has gone McNugget”
Reviews.Author: Delaw
Reviews.Content: Alas, the Gold is off the Nugget - it's more like a McNugget now - 'cept not as good. Have stayed at the Nugget - off and on - for over 20 years. Have always found it a good & comfortable value (particularly after Wynn's ownership) for its downtown location. It has recently changed hands (Landry's/Fertitta) and much has been touted about its renovation under the new owners. We were there this past weekend (2/23-2/27/07). We booked a room in the North Tower (more expensive than South Tower). We were unable to get a King Room as we had reserved except on a very low floor. We opted for an available double on an upper floor. We had a faulty showerhead, sewer gas coming up out of the sink drain (permeated the entire room if drain left open), and an a/c/fan unit that didn't draw in outside air with the Fan Only (weather was cool and we just wanted some outside air) and made such a racket with the A/C that it was unuseable. As a result, the room was stuffy and uncomfortable throughout the night. The Hotel no longer triple sheets its beds and a very nasty looking dingy white blanket was on the bed. Upon my request, Housekeeping did oblige and triple sheeted for our stay but I had to specifically ask about this. We had no glasses for the bathroom - again, had to ask. A tray of partially eaten nachos sat in the hallway across from our room from Saturday night through Tuesday morning. For this we paid nearly $200 night. The rest of the so called renovations are not terrific enough to draw me back: The spa hot tub in the renovated spa had a grey/brown film that had deposited itself on the tiles - disgusting! Amenities in the spa were barebone, e.g., no brushes or combs. The Hotel pool area - which used to be pleasant in the winter to use - was only partially open and the pool itself was drained with workmen drilling and plastering. Incredibly, the in-hotel TV channel showed the pool fully open - there were even pictures of people sunning and swimming! (?) Same with the billboard and magazine ads about the hotel currently in circulation. So much for truth in advertising. My husband tried the buffet (now located on second floor) and said the quality of the food was average at best and the layout confusing and congested. From what I could see, the main renovation has been a reshuffling of floor space in the casino to accomodate more slot machines which are placed in a congested, maze-like configuration. The Nugget staff and fellow gamblers still are friendly (with the exception of the front desk personnel) but we left grumpy and feeling like we had been nickel & dimed to death - you are even charged - rather heftily - for printing out your airline boarding slip at the Hotel's on-line center! While we will probably continue to visit downtown vintage Vegas in the future, we will stay at a hotel on The Strip. Landry's/Fertitta ownership of the Nugget has removed any value it might have had in the past. Unless you are ok with a budget motel type of experience and don't mind paying $200 per night for a $39.99 room, avoid the Nugget - money is better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: CMB26
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very disappointing. The rooms were decent in size, but the quality wasn't great. There was very little water pressure and little ventilation in the rooms and the same goes for the casino. I am a smoker and found the casino to be overly smoky. Bring lots of money for the slots because you'll be waiting for your drink for ages. We were there for our wedding and decided to upgrade to a suite for our special occasion, but couldn't do so because we only had a Visa debit/credit card and not an actual "credit card." Apparently money isn't money anymore. The staff wasn't helpful at all. The only time anyone was nice was when they were coaxing people to attend the time share deal. Yes, the new Shark Tank/Pool is nearly done and will be nice, but that's the only thing nice about the Nugget. Well, the restaurants were above average and we were pleased with the food, but the hotel itself is way below. And unless you pay more for a room in the North Tower which is closer to the casino itself and the rooms are basically the same, you'll have to walk clear across the property to get to the rooms in the South Tower. We chose this place because the reviews were good, but apparently they weren't from recent experiences. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be exclusive but fails”
Reviews.Author: dremind1
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 days at the this hotel 2/25/07-2/28/07. We had wanted to stay downtown in the best hotel there. We were quite dissappointed. When we arrived we had to wait in line over 45 minutes for check in. They are very short staffed in most areas. Our room was in the South Tower which is not near anything and since I walk with a cane I had a very hard time walking that far. It is right across the street from the parking garage but the street was closed off and we had to walk a block to get to the garage. Valet was very slow but they did have our car ready when we checked out. The bed linens and towels are very poor quality and the shower barely worked. The towels were very rough and scratchy and the bed linens were very old .We ate at the buffet twice and did not find it up to the standards we expect in Las Vegas. Also had the buffets at the Orleans and Red Rock Spa and Casino and both were much higher in quality. Also Sam's Town breakfast buffet was far superior.
