The hotel is beautiful with lots of brass and marble everywhere. In the casino there is a wide variety of slots and video poker as well as table games and it is laid out well. They definitely need more staff for the front desk and better quality linens. If you decide to stay here, pay more and get the North Tower which opens out to the Fremont Street Experience and is adjacent to all the casinos downtown. We would not stay here again and do not recomment the south Tower for anyone over 50.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rager999
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay but the service was terrible, especially at the eateries. The service personnel were just plain rude. Other than that the rooms were real nice and clean, excellent gambling facilities. Just staying downtown was nice.

Reviews.Title: “I Like the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mjet
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Golden Nugget (happily) many times over the past 10 or 12 years, but had not been there since the major facelift. Knowing I was going (Feb. 22-25) I read a lot of the reviews here. That said, I was very impressed by the facelift. The whole look is upscale, without the auditorium feel of some of the Strip casinos. Stayed on the 17th floor of the South Tower - the walk is NOT bad, and the time-share people did not bother me even once. Checked in about 5:30pm on Thursday, only about 5 minute wait. Actually shared a room with my brothers and we got a "rollaway bed". I don't think we had even been in the room 15 minutes when it was brought up. Very quiet in our hall. Shower did not drain well, but we called the front desk and someone arrived about 30-40 minutes later to fix it. Buffet breakfast good - wish they served it on Saturday morning too instead of "brunch". Only employee complaint I had would be the guy manning the snack bar - not very friendly. Did not get to try any of the new restaurants - maybe next time. All in all, a very pleasant stay. If I have a complaint, it is that the rates are getting too high, but somehow I don't think that is going to be changing anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: marilyns
Reviews.Content: We traveled to llas vegas for a convention the third week in February. We booke two rooms and a direct flight with a travel agent. We arrived at 8:30 PM and only one of the rooms was ready. We said ok, requested and received coupon books, went to grab a bite to eat, and visited the casino. When we returned we were assured that the second room was reay. We went up for the night and discovered that there were someone else's belongings in the second room. A call to security, housekeeping, and a plumber! After the intrusion and a long wait, we were compensated by removing $50.00 from the bill. The "checked out" traveler returned to "his" room at 3:30 AM and attempted to enter. Another call was made to security. So much for sleeping the first night! On the last night of our stay were were told that we had not booked for four nights in room # 2, (the doomed room!) and that they had no other rooms. Once again, we were at the front desk, arguingand wasting vacation time. After a long time of arguing, a manager finally appeared. She was pleasant but acknowledged no error on the Nugget's part. We mentioned the many negative reviews that we had read in the Trip Advisor and informed her of our trepidation on staying there. She sent housekeeping to the room and offered us another room if we preferred. I had pretty much had it with the doomed room and we took her up on the offer. We were put up in a beautiful one bedroom suite in the north tower. There was a living room, dining area, two bathrooms and two king size beds! Even better, te problems and switching resulted in a 'comped room! The casino was ok, not much of a pay out and very few servers. The restauraunt Vic and Anthonys was excellent. A pricey steakhouse, elegant in appearance but worth every penny, yummy food! We also had breakfast at the buffet, another 'comp and a few sandwich times tthe Carson Street Cafe, another hit. There is noticeably less smoking in Las Vegas and it was a good convention. When we return in April however, we will return to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel isbad.....and I mean bad in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: JoLouisiana
Reviews.Content: The recent reviews are pretty much dead-on accurate about this hotel. The rooms are fairly nice, but the service is absolutely lacking, and most of the staff was not very friendly. We had a 45 minute wait upon checking in although the hotel was not filled to capacity. Rooms were available when we arrived in Vegas at 8 a.m., but we had to wait until 12 to check in to the hotel. I don't understand that reasoning at all, considering once they allowed check-in, the staff seemed overwhelmed. The restaurants are pretty good, as is the buffet. Be prepared to get hassled by the Timeshare desk everytime you pass by. If you're staying in the far tower, that will be at least daily! Also, if you stay in the far tower, be prepared for a pretty long walk to your room. Finally, a word of advice. Bring a credit card, and not just your debit or check card. For some reason, many of the services at hotel aren't available (including suite upgrades) unless you have an actual credit card. I don't carry a credit card, so could not upgrade to a suite, or access any of the premium movies available in the room. I think it's a very unfair practice, but that is their rule, and they claim it's unbending. Overall, I would recommend other hotels to my friends and family. There are many more comparable hotels in Vegas with just the same amenities, but with far better service, and nicer staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Golden era long gone”
Reviews.Author: Lay9
Reviews.Content: I can add only a few more remarks to the previous reviews., which are, mainly, unfortunately negative. We were not informed that the pool was closed although it had been open, we understand, the previous week because of some special event. I should of heard alarm bells ring when they did not reply to an earlier email I sent before arriving., which was just a general enquiry and no real reason to avoid. The show, although the singers were good and the dancers did their best , was not up to a standard which reflected the price of the tickets, or the show in the UK. Slots were tight and the staff were a mixed bag, some letting the others down.,especially when a smile and just acknowledging you are there., costs nothing!..Maybe the owners....should take a look at this site and try to rectify., as the staff selling timeshare, were causing arguments among couples because of the pressure tactics used, just to top off your stay at the golden nugget! A positive remark is that the rooms were good, although towels had seen better days. Cracks are showing., lets hope the Golden Nugget take note before a gully appears and they fall down it!

Reviews.Title: “Good N Bad in Everything”
Reviews.Author: trinkets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget, Las Vegas from Feb 22-26th. First off, we did not wait in the long line that many complained about, you can purchase a VIP check in for $15 prior to arriving and you are then (and only then) guaranteed a king bed, non smoking room. Our plane was extremely late and the VIP girl stayed and waited until we all arrived as she had known about the plane delays. I would say the whole process took about 10 minutes. The walk from the South Tower to the casino, not bad, I can see if maybe someone had some type of walking disability, but pretty much for us Vegas is a walking trip, so we were not bothered by this. We ate at only two places at the hotel, the Grill and the Cafe, both, we were treated very well by the staff and the food was good. The room is what seemed to disappoint me the most, we had a beautiful view of the lights, on the 20th floor, but for spending all this money on remodeling, I just didn't see it in our room. The wallpaper in the bathroom was all peeling off, the tub all scratched up, the TV case looked like something purchased out of a resale shop. The bed was the worst I have ever slept in, very hard, no covers to speak of, and 3 small pillows. But on the bright side, you dont really spend much time in the room. The time share people didn't bother us, yes, they asked us if we wanted to get free stuff, but when do you ever get "free" stuff?? so we knew right away they were time sellers and weren't interested, when you told them politely your not interested you were greeted with "have a great day", no pressure. It was a beautiful day on Saturday so we went to see the very talked about Shark tank and it was closed (covered by a huge cloth) due to construction around the tank being done. However, we did get a peek before we left and it was really cool. I can imagine in the summer months having a drink, laying on those very padded comfy chairs, it would be great. We did take a cab to the strip for $14- $16 each way, I love the strip but my husband and I were excited to get back to the slower pace, more quiet Freemont Street in the evening. I would say overall our experience of the Golden Nugget was good. I would recommend it to our friends. The price is right and the hotel is really beautiful, you just have to overlook the room issues. One more thing, we did find that the slots were much better on Freemont vs. the Strip, you just seemed to make you money last longer, which in Vegas, is a good thing. Have Fun....

Reviews.Title: “Be careful...”
Reviews.Author: chachakaboom
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the staff at the Nugget and will never stay there again. The rooms are fairly nice (Holiday Inn quality) and they have recently done some tasteful renovations, including an all-new, beautiful pool/aquarium. However, the staff and service at the hotel are well below average and completely ruined the stay for me. We had some problems with our room and were treated very rudely by the front desk, even though they were the ones who had made the mistake. Our last day in the room, I accidentally left some diamond earrings in the room (which I'll admit was *completely* idiotic on my part) and the earrings mysteriously disappeared. I searched all of my belongings and they were nowhere to be found and I know I took them off in the room. I contacted security and filed a report and was astounded by the rude and apathetic response I was given. If you do choose to stay at the Nugget, please be smarter than I was and diligently lock up anything of value in the safes that are provided in the room. I realize this is probably common sense, but after a few fun days in Vegas it is amazing how your "common sense" can fail you. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Annoying Timeshare People, Long Walk”
Reviews.Author: quietandloudatonce
Reviews.Content: Glad (or not so glad!) to see others still in 2007 are complaining of the horribly annoying Timeshare salespeople posted by the South Tower elevators! These people are annoying, lying, barracudas. I complained to the Golden Nugged about them after our stay, and obviously it did no good because they must still be there! We made a point to walk around some slot machines and towards the checkin desk and back around to the elevators just to avoid them. Now for the loooooooooong walk. Seems everyone gets to stay in the South Tower, huh? Well, anticipate a long walk to the casino. Then theres the Buffet. It's terrific, but don't even think you're gonna get anything to eat in there after about 10:30 pm. THIS IS VEGAS, PEOPLE!!!!!!! We're hungry and eating at all hours of the night!! Keep the Buffet open longer! In any case, this was our first and last time to stay downtown. It's nice and all, the rooms are terrific, and I found the staff nice. But seeing the lit up street that lights up overhead(whatever it's called) just once is plenty, You spend the rest of the time taking cabs back to the strip for some real entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice; everything else annoying”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaGirl98
Reviews.Content: Neither my husband nor I had never stayed downtown before, so we decided to try it since we had a car and could drive to the Hilton, where we were exhibiting at a trade show. I had heard that downtown was being gentrified and was getting nicer, but this isn't really true. It's definitely seedy, and there isn't anything to do like there is on the Strip (except the light show at Fremont Street). As far as the hotel itself goes, it doesn't compare to some of the fancier ones on the Strip, but then again it's under $100 a night during the week, so you can't expect it to be the same. Our room was nice enough; I can't really complain. They are still doing major construction on the street just outside the front entrance, but luckily our room faced away from there so we didn't hear anything. Service was poor. There was a line at checkin, and although it wasn't very long, there weren't enough people working the desk so it took half an hour to check in. I think that is way too long considering there weren't that many people ahead of me. We had to retrieve our luggage from the storage room (too complicated to explain why we didn't have it with us), and the bellmen seemed to have disappeared. Employees kept coming in and out of that room, and although they saw people waiting there to get their bags, nobody so much as glanced at us or said it would be just a moment. I actually had to open the door, stick my head in the room and ask when someone would be out to take care of us. Then there was the time-share desk! I'm sure all the hotels have them, and now that I know how it works, I will ignore them in the future. What they do is ask everyone who walks by if they want cheap tickets to a show. I didn't remember having been asked this in the past, so maybe it's a new thing, or maybe my memory is going bad, but in any case I thought this was a bona fide offer so of course we went over to listen to them. This woman goes on and on about the shows she could get us into for $10. When we looked interested and started discussing dates, she then says that we have to go look at their timeshare property in order to get the tickets! And she didn't even use the word "timeshare" but we knew that's what it was. It's just so slimy not to tell people this right away, and if the hotels think that they are helping themselves by doing this, they are wrong. It does not make good business practice to piss off your guests. We didn't have time to go look at it and even if we had time we wouldn't have been interested. The whole thing was just plain annoying. We didn't eat at the restaurant, and the Starbucks concession in the lobby was charging double what a regular Starbucks charges. I know this is standard practice throughout Vegas, but it's still ridiculous. We found a Starbucks two blocks away from the hotel, so we went there instead. The Nugget is probably the nicest hotel downtown; the other ones I peeked into didn't look too good. But I wouldn't stay downtown again; the Strip is much more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mickeyAvon
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Nugget for years. This past experience will probably change that. Our reservations were "lost" supposedly by a third party we were not even aware of. We got rooms but only after a very unhelpful staff agreed to let us stay after presenting credit cards and being told we would have to pay for the rooms again. It was all straightened out by our travel agent within 24 hours with never an apology by the hotel. Much construction going on which made using the Parking garage downright dangerous. They could take lessons in customer service from any of the hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rude people at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Jamie221
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden nugget on February 8 - February 11 2007. The hotel itself was nice, casino, and the pool. We didn't care for the service that we received. The hotel staff was very rude and had no sense of humor. The beds were rock hard. The cocktail waitresses were very rude and slow. We went to the strip and were treated very well. Sat down at a slot machine and a cocktail waitress was there right away. This is the first time that I have been to Vegas, I will not stay at the Nugget again. I will pay more money to stay on the strip somewhere where you will be treated like a human being.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Sweetest Suite”
Reviews.Author: MileHighGirl
Reviews.Content: Four adults and one toddler stayed in a two bedroom suite on the 10th floor from Janaury 12 to 16, 2007. The suite was nice but nothing spectacular. I expected more. I have no idea if this suite had been renovated or not but it didn't look like it to me. FIrst, the shower door in the bathroom by the wet bar stuck most of the time from the outside and my mom got stuck in it once. Second, there's no light over the dining table so it was useless after it got dark. Third, the water pressure was very low and it took extra time to rinse. Fourth, the complimentary body wash, shampoo and conditioner was poor quality. Fifth, housekeeping doesn't do a very good job of cleaning under things. While searching for my son's toy I ran my hand under one of the side tables in the living room and found sticky fruit. Sixth, even though we were in a suite, we never had turn down service or chocolates on the pillow. And seventh, the renovated buffet is nothing to brag about. It's small with a very limited selection. Oh, one other thing...eighth...the suite we had on 10 was right next to the elevator and ice machine and a room for staff only. Staff members were in and out of that room at all hours of the day and the door would bang closed. Not very considerate of guests. I realize I've said some pretty negative things about the Golden Nugget. However, I like the property and it's where we usually stay when we go to Vegas. This was our first trip with our son (15 months) and we got the suite so my mom and sister could come with us to help with babysitting. The things we like most about the Golden Nugget are: the beds are amazingly comfortable with big fluffy sheets. The location is ideal if you don't want to stay at an overpriced strip location. The staff is mostly friendly and so helpful. The restaurants are good. Room service is fast and efficient. And it's easy to park in the garage. The suite itself was OK. The thing I liked best was it had three bathrooms and three different doors to enter from the outside. That was great when our son was sleeping. The Nugget also provided a crib at no extra cost and that was nice. I do have to add that a suite of that level should have a microwave and not just a fridge and coffee pot. There were also phones in the bathrooms. That's a neat feature if you need it. :-) And there's a TV in the bathroom by the wet bar. We'll definitely stay at the Golden Nugget again but we won't spend as much as we did for a suite when there were so many things that could have been better. It's a nice suite but when you're paying several hundred a night, you want a light above the dining table and no sticky fruit on the floor. :-) And we won't eat at the buffet again. We saw the pool. It was closed because of the cold weather. It looks really nice and we hope to visit sometime in the summer and try the new water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mespos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 4 nights in January. What a lovely surprise upon entering our room to see turn down service with "Golden Nugget" wrapped chocolates on the pillow! Renovations at the Golden Nugget are complete - from what we can see. The pool (although closed for swimming in the winter) has been renovated to include a huge aquarium shark tank featuring a waterslide that goes through the tank before ending. Also a huge hot tub outside the pool bar with heat lamps which is opened all year. Pool also features pretty waterfalls. The new buffet, now located on the 2nd floor up the escalator was very good; especially enjoyed breakfast and the Saturday brunch. No question best buffet in the downtown area! Didn't need a car rental for staying "downtown" as everything is within walking distance. Fun to see the "Freemont St. Experience" which plays every evening on the hour. Our room at the Golden Nugget was nicely appointed with wood cornices over the bed and windows and the bed was comfortable. We would definitely stay there again! Only negative was upon arrival at 8 PM they said they didn't have any rooms with the King bed/non smoking we had requested. Rather than accepting what they said, we "nicely but firmly" said that would be unacceptable and asked them to check again. Within a few minutes they seemed to locate a "king non smoking" room for us! It's my opinion that when they are booked "full" they may try and "bump" people out of their room request depending on what rate you're paying. (the lower the room rate the higher the risk of you not getting the type of room requested.) So I would try to avoid arriving late if you don't want this to happen. I will mention however that our friends were offered a suite because they had nothing else to give them (they had arrived at 9 PM) so you never know; you could be upgraded! Other than that, we found the staff to be very nice and helpful. Tip: do ask for the "Golden Values Coupon book" upon arrival. There are several buffet coupons in there along with free cocktails at Claude's bar, etc. although not sure if they are routinely given out or not as it could be only for customers receiving special mail offers as we had.

Reviews.Title: “A major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bogiesdad
Reviews.Content: To begin with we paid extra to upgrade to the North tower. The room was next to Fremont Street and the Fremont experience. When we asked for a different room upon check in we were told that was all they had available even though we checked in in the afteroon having paid extra for the VIP lounge. Somewhat noisy even with the windows closed. Worst was the bed. The springs in the mattress came through and my wife had to sleep on top of a pillow in order not to feel the springs. Management not real gracious about the matter. We arrived on Sunday and the dinner brunch was a special seafood brunch for $19.95 per person. Years ago the dinner brunches were wonderful so we went. Like eating at a cafeteria. Very mediocre. Rather waste my money at fast food. At least you know what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “stay Downtown and drive”
Reviews.Author: nblmom411
Reviews.Content: 1/14/07 to 1/19/07 Our stay was very good. Hotel staff helpful and friendly ,very clean rooms .Rented car [park free] and did vegas OUR way .Would stay again $89Sun $59the rest of stay

Reviews.Title: “The best of downtown, no contest!”
Reviews.Author: sprintf32768
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Checked in on a Friday afternoon. I paid the extra $15 for VIP check-in and lounge access, and I'd say it's worth about $15 --- especially if you plan to check in during a busy time! The regular check-in lines were getting a bit long by about three, so I was glad to have the VIP check-in. Although the VIP check-in gives you unlimited access to the VIP lounge, this is of limited value. There's a comfortable seating area, but no cocktail service and very limited/inconsistent refreshment selection. Do it for the quick check-in, and the professional, careful service. This was my first stay at the GN -- normally we stay someplace very low-budget downtown. It was worth it. We chose to pay slightly more to stay in the North Tower, which in my opinion is totally worth it. It must be $10 more, but the elevators come *right* down next to the gift shop, *right* next to the casino. I was so glad to be so close to the action, and then, so close to the room when the action was over! Oh, and I am obliged to mention that the elevator service was extremely efficient. The room itself was on the 15th floor, looking out toward the plaza. I'd say this room is as nice as the Mirage, but the last time I stayed at the Mirage was in 2000 (I think they've remodeled since then). But the executive summary is that it's fine, a nice room. You've got an iron, everything's clean, the tub drained well, there's a nice table, you've got thirty TV channels, pay-per-view movies. There's one of those light-up mirrors that ladies use to do their make-up. It's nicer than a Doubletree. By downtown standards, this is extraordinary. When is the last time a tub drained properly at Binion's? By strip standards, the GN is probably just average, but for downtown it's crazy-excellent. So, great stay, hope to stay there again the next time I stay downtown. If you've seen my reviews of other hotels, you know I do not hesitate to quibble and gripe about things, but the GN was great. What you've heard is true, this is truly the class of downtown Vegas, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel if you want it a bit quieter”
Reviews.Author: EJRM
Reviews.Content: If you like Vegas, but perhaps you would like it a bit slower....... then I would strongly recommend the Nugget. Its clean, large rooms offer respite from the hustle of the strip. Must also recommend the Carson Street Cafe. On first glance it looks like any other joint in Vegas, but don't be fooled. My wife & I sampled many items from the menu in our ten days there & failed to find anything that wasn't great value & beautifully cooked. Landrys have clearly worked hard on the food here & we found it to be great. One final thing, my wife wasn't well one night, needing an ambulance. The hotel staff could not have done more even arranging a car to collect us from the hopsital * checking on us regularly afterwards to see if there was anything we needed. They really went the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to the GN”
Reviews.Author: boaterkathy
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Golden Nugget. It is a great classy feeling hotel, and we really enjoyed our stay. We got what we thought was a very reasonably priced deal for 5 nights. Our room was on the 22nd floor, and we had a nice view of the mountains. The buffets there were the best of the 6 that we ate during our trip. The new pool area had just opened, and it is really neat with the shark tank. We were in the South Tower and walked right by the pool every day which we enjoyed. Some people comment that they think the walk is too far from the South Tower to the Front of the hotel, but it didn't bother us. It really isn't very far. We did most of our gambling in the other Fremont Street casinos, but did a little at the GN. Always thought I HAD to be on the Strip, but now I think I actually like Downtown better for the close proximity of the casinos, plus this was the best we had ever done gambling. Fremont Street is fun, and the atmosphere reminds us a little of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mb56
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget in Vegas and was not disappointed. Took advantage of the $15 VIP check-in and this really speeded up check-in and check-out, as well as assuring us the type rooms I wanted. . The staff here was always accomodating, friendly, and courteous. Stayed here about 2 years ago and love the remodeling they have done. Just wish the pool was open....the shark tank is really something!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was good but terrible dealing with the staff members to fix billing error”
Reviews.Author: hskaoscreen
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of their special rates and booked two rooms, one for our parents and one for us, but paid both with our credit card. We have stayed at the hotel numerous times in the past and had always been satisfied. The stay at this time was not any different. The accommodation for the price was excellent. We spent 2 nights at the hotel and checked out on 12/29/06 and drove to San Francisco where our parents lived. When we received the American Express bill, however, we found out that we were charged 2 extra nights on one of the rooms (as a separate charge, and of course much much higher rate). We called the hotel immediately to correct the situation. We were advised to call back during the business hours, M-F, and speak to someone at the Accounts Receivable. We came back home early on Friday to call them, during the day, and spoke with someone at the Accounts Receivable. She briefly transfered me to the Front Desk to see if they could see what is going on. The person at the front desk (we found out later that the person was a manager) told me that according to their note, the cleaning crew found some luggage in the room and notified the front desk on 12/29, and the frond desk assumed that we decided to go back to the room (after checking out completely??), thus charged our card using their year end rate without confirming with us at all. He rudely transfered us back to the Accounts Receivable. The Accounts Receivable rep at this time was very nice and promised to get back to me by Tuesday after doing the needed research. On the following Wednesday, since we did not receive any call back, we called her back. At this time, she was no longer nice. She said that she did not have any authority to post any credit, hence she will have to transfer the issue to the Front Desk Manager (after wasting several days). She abruptly told us if we don't like it, we could call the credit card company and dispute the charge. She transfered the call to another Front Desk Manager. This manager was not friendly at all (based on her tone of voice). She said since she did not have any evidence that shows that we really did not occupy the room for the two nights, she could not give us the credit right away. She needs to speak with the first manager who spoke with us. That will take few days, she said. At this point, we are waiting for this unfriendly front desk manager to get back to us. We have traveled a lot and have had to face few hotel related problems, but they were always very friendly and helpful and never took this long. This time, Golden Nugget is treating us like we are trying to cheat them. They are giving us run-arounds and dragging their feet in giving the credit back for the error they created; they are charging us for the days we spent in San Francisco. We have never experienced this kind of treatment, especially from so called hotel managers. We will not go back even for any great deals and we hope anyone reading this will not either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: redshoetraveler
Reviews.Content: We had heard great things about the Golden Nugget & this was our first stay there. It was nice to stay off the strip...less crowded & less expensive. The valet and bellhop were very nice & friendly. When we got inside, though, we had to wait in a very long line to check in...it was soon after check-in time and we had to wait in line for about 20-25 minutes! We had a South Tower room with 2 double beds. It was a large room with nice furnishings even though they seemed a little dated. The beds were a little hard, though. While we were there, we had two meals at The Buffet: the seafood dinner and breakfast. They were both very good. We've eaten at several buffets in Vegas & this is favorite yet! There was a decent selection, but not as large as some, but the food was better quality than many of the buffets that cost much more. The seafood dinner was $20 & the breakfast was $10. Overall, we liked the Golden Nugget. However, I think we'd try to book a different room next time and check in a little later.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpdzine
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay and had a great time. The staff was incredible and the room was clean and tasteful. The remodeling they have done is beautiful, the casino, lounges and pool looks great. They know how to treat their guests well and I will stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “What Was That Smell?”
Reviews.Author: traveldudey
Reviews.Content: Rooms was pretty bad. I would compare it to a run down Holiday Inn (South Tower). Strange smell coming from the bathrom. Never figured out what it was. The service was OK - very attentive staff. But this doesn't make up for the lousy room. Stay on the strip, and take a day (or night) trip downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful hotel in downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through a third party website - the kind that doesn't reveal the hotel's name until after you have paid for it. We were both excited to find out we booked the Golden Nugget for a total of $62 on a Thursday night because we had heard great things about this hotel and they are definitely all true. The hotel's interior was nicely decorated and clean. The pool was gorgeous with a shark tank in the middle and even a waterslide that went through the shark tank (too bad it was the middle of winter and the pool was closed.) The hotel room was very nice - no tacky hotel room decor - and it was clean and quiet. There was even security by the elevators that lead up to the rooms checking for room keys. There was jackhammering that we heard from 11pm - 12:15am, which we thought were odd hours for construction to be taking place but we just turned on the room fan on low heat to drown out the noise. Overall we had a very pleasant and enjoyable stay at the Golden Nugget and would love to stay there again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it!”
Reviews.Author: LoveVegas2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both loved our stay at the Golden Nugget. We were there celebrating my husbands 40th birthday and we had such a wonderful time. The rooms were very nice and clean. The staff was so helpful and professional. The shark tank in the middle of the swimming pool was cool. It was way too chilly to swim, but we enjoyed spending time just seeing the sharks. What a neat added touch. Very cool! This was our 1st time in Vegas, but we have already decided that the Golden Nugget is where we will stay the next time we are in Vegas. Oh one more thing the food was awesome and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: mots
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. The check-in process was quick. The food at the grotto was great. Our room, in the south tower, was very clean and comfortable. We felt very safe on Fremont Street and the public transportation was very efficient..

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: msj57
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Golden Nugget two or three times a year for longer than I can remember. It just keeps getting better and better and we would not stay anywhere else. Fremont Street is so much fun, especially at night and we always have felt safe downtown. We have stayed on the Strip and found it to be too much walking from casino to casino; we stay at the Nugget and drive to the Strip and take in any casino that we want to see. We make a point of trying to visit at least one new casino each trip, however, we go home at night to the Nugget. The Buffet at the Nugget is great and we often eat at the restaurant that is open 24 hours. The Nugget is very clean and the staff have always been very courteous and helpful. You can casino hop without walking for blocks as they are all close together. We highly recommend the Golden Nugget and it is our favorite hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitzright2001
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Nugget twice (most recently April 2006)and love this hotel. The Freemont Street experience is great. You can walk around Freemont Street and you are under cover so if its raining you wont get wet because of the massive roof. There are a ton of shops, bars and little casinos all around Freemont Street. Freemont Street is very much worth seeing and experiencing. The hotel is very nice, clean and very pretty. The rooms are large and they are very clean. We rented a car and there is free parking if you stay at the Nugget. We drove up and down the strip and you will have no problems finding a place to park and walk around the strip. The buffet was wonderful, there was a ton of choices for every meal and everything was wonderful. They also have a non-smoking area in the buffet. As with every place in Vegas you can eat any time of the day or night, we ordered room service and that meal was just as good as the buffet. The prices for meals are very affordable at the Nugget more so than on the strip. I would have no problem reccomending this hotel to anyone. We are planning another trip to Las Vegas and will definitly stay at the Nugget for a third time. I hope this review helps anyone planning a trip to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem. It's nice!”
Reviews.Author: bestfoot13
Reviews.Content: I've seen some bad reviews for the Nugget, but I don't understand. I love the Freemont area--it's where the locals go to take out of towners. It's fun and not too high falutin' (sic). The hotel itself was very comfortable, not overly large like the strip hotels, the price reasonable. The pool was opened while I was there. I didn't get to swim or lounge, but it was impressive, sharks and all. The room was nice. No problems with service. The construction was there, but it was everywhere in town. You should see the Stratosphere. Oh my God it was awful. At the Nugget, it was easily manuveured around. If you must be in a place where the slot machines ca-ching constantly, pick the Nugget. It's smaller and you can get past it in a hurry. The Freemont area is fabulous. Teaming with people on Friday nights. Great for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “The other hotels downtown must be bad”
Reviews.Author: Rawham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 2 nights (11& 12 Dec) following 5 nights on the strip (Flamingo) as I wanted to experience staying downtown as well. First impressions were not too good. A massive line for checking in - I understand that there are going to be lines as there are a lot of people to check in and out every day however it does annoy me when the hotel don't seem to be doing anything to address the situation. Just 2 counters checking people in whilst empty counters were to the side of them! That said the person we saw when we did get to the front of the line was quick, friendly and helpful. I had a room in South Tower - it's a bit of a trek. The room was nice, spacious and clean. The bath looked very small but as I only shower that didn't bother me. The new pool area looked stunning even though it was December and they were still finishing it. I can imagine it being great in the summer. There wasn't the 'buzz' I was expecting to find downtown but that's not necessarily the fault of the Golden Nugget (and after all I was there in midweek December!). Although the Nugget was good I fear for the other hotels downtown in that it is held as such a shining beacon up to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammer All Night Long”
Reviews.Author: sgandara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the recently renovated Golden Nugget Hotel from Dec 17-20, 2006. The first night a city road crew started jackhammering right outside our hotel window at 9:45p.m. - the crew continued jackhammering continously until 4:45a.m. the next day. When we complained to the hotel staff, they said that they were sorry that we had gotten NO sleep at all, but that there really was nothing they could do. Eventually they agreed to move us to another room, but we were not compensated for the "jackhammer" night. Now having said that, the hotel itself is certainly the most upscale downtown. The rooms were huge, and the breakfast buffet was excellent. We also saw Simply Ballroom, and while it was enjoyable - don't go unless you get half price tickets (you can get half price coupons on-line for a number of Las Vegas shows).

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I thought”
Reviews.Author: MrE_Dog
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights starting on the 12/14. It was nice to walk from casino to casino with only a couple minutes in between. When you are on the strip, it takes 15 mintues or more to get from one casino to another since they are far apart. The hotel is right on Fremont Street and it is brightly lit all night long. This added a sense of safety walking back to our room 4 in the morning. The room was so so in the South Tower. The bathroom was too small for two to use. The room had two full beds and NOT queens like the other hotels we've been two. The TV reception wasn't great. Our non-smoking room smelled like a smoking room but it went away but maybe we just got use to the stench. I was hoping for an inexpensive Sunday buffet brunch but it was $16 per person. I expected a better deal for dowtown. Maybe their new buffet commanded more but I don't know since we turned back. It's less on off days. The poker room was great. they had more players there than at Binion's across the way. they also have poker jackpots while Binion's did not. They checked our keys at the elevators ALL THE TIME which is good. The staff didn't seem that friendly at the check in counter. Parking was not that great since there are no bridges to enter the casino. The elevator takes forever to wait for and then you exit street level to enter the hotel. You also have to cross the street with your baggage. The outlet is a short drive from downtown and it beats shopping on the strip. The price was right at $60 a night. I thought going to downtown Vegas would be bad but it wasn't so.

Reviews.Title: “A love hate relationship”
Reviews.Author: thegospelofstpaul
Reviews.Content: Far beyond the glitter of a lovely lobby -lie serious problems.On written request for a king bed-this was not available to me on arrival.To further aggravate the matter-the registration at the South Tower lobby was closed ,and remained so during my entire 3 night stay.The North tower a huge walk away was the new place to register the South Tower guests.This was located in and around the casino,and became an expensive location.Much as I enjoy gambling,the return (and I have gambled at many casinos in Las Vegas and many other places) was the worst that I have ever experienced.This coupled with the worst comps of any casino that I have played in -there or anywhere.I normally stay free in Vegas,but this time I wanted to stay downtown instead of the strip.More research would have served me far better.No,I shall regretfully not return there!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget Used to Be Better”
Reviews.Author: robm103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Nugget many times before, but this past visit was very disappointing. We weren't bothered by the construction, but what had always impressed us in the past about The Golden Nugget was the above and beyond customer service. This trip, that wasn't seen anywhere. At previous visits, we always checked in near the South Tower, but this was closed down during this trip. We waited much longer to check in at the main lobby and then had to hike back to the South Tower. Also, security is much more lax now at the hotel. I always felt safe during previous visits when there were hotel personnel at the elevator bays checking room keys. That was nowhere to be seen during this trip either. The one thing that made the Nugget stand out for us previously was the impeccable customer service, and it was always better than most of the hotels on the Strip. Since the new management took over, this customer service has fallen to the side and that's truly sad. Tim and Tom had a wonderful vision for the hotel and I'm saddened that Landry's has taken that vision and decided to "Strip" it up.

Reviews.Title: “Best Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vicsite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget for five nights over the Thanksgiving weekend, and we really enjoyed our stay. It was our first trip to Vegas, and we didn't want to stay on the Strip. After walking around the first night, we realized we made the right choice. Sure, valet parking may be full but the free self-parking is right across the street, and they always made sure the guests had spots on busy nights. The casino is a managable size and they offer $10 in slot play if you join their players club. The new pool area looks amazing, but it was too cold when we were there (and there wasn't any water in the pool yet). The breakfast buffet was a great value, and we also had dinner at the Grotto restaurant, which was very nice. Overall, the staff was professional and friendly, although housekeeping did miss our room one day. We stayed up on the 21st floor of the south tower, which was all non-smoking (to give our lungs a break).

Reviews.Title: “Keep your valuables out of the room....”
Reviews.Author: jthutmd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days and had my luggage rifled by someone (the maids) and my cell phone charger stolen. Luckily I had my checkbook and cell phone with me that day. DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING OF VALUE IN THE ROOM ! When I told the manager, he made the excuse that cell phones and chargers are left in the rooms all the time by mistake and forgotten. He didnt volunteer to pay for it or call the police. Room was ok. Pool is terrible and smells when it is crowded. Walk is long to Freemont St. from the room. Terrible buffet.. Go somewhere else on Freemont to eat. Let me recommend the .99 cent shrimp cocktails...get several. They are worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way!”
Reviews.Author: meyerinc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget this past weekend and absolutely loved it! We were in the North Tower. We had paid for a standard room, and the front desk gave us an unasked-for upgrade to a mini suite. The room was beautiful! The staff was friendly. There were two men manning the elevators, each with a smile and a hello. We ate dinner at the Grotto and really loved the food. This was a first-class experience from start to finish. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: gringo123
Reviews.Content: Still some construction, but not very bothersome to me. Impressive lobby and facilities. Rooms quite large and clean. Shark tank is quite an attraction for young and old alike...same applies to Fremont Street Experience. Several very nice restaurants as well as a grill and Starbucks. Never far away from a bar or cocktail attendant. also, the Carson Street is a 24 hour restaurant good for any meal of the day at reasonable prices. For me, the location is great in that you can walk to numerous restaurants, casinos and gift shops in a matter of minutes (safely).

Reviews.Title: “Decent Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: at8126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget for 2 nights, Nov 12 & 13th 2006. You can tell that the hotel is older, but it is nicely maintained and clean. The pool was not open yet, but looked like it would be at any time (just in time for winter!) The pool had a very nice aquarium with fish and sharks and the slide goes right through it. We only heard construction noise one time, and it was only in the lobby. Our South Tower room was nice and quiet. We had no complaint about the room other than it smelled slightly of smoke despite being on a non-smoking floor. The fremont street experience is right out the door of the hotel, and it was moderately entertaining; and we really enjoyed gambling at the casinos in the area. They seemed much more profitable than the strip casinos. My biggest regret about staying at the Golden Nugget was that we didn't rent a car. The taxi from the airport cost $30, plus $20 each way to/from the strip. Overall, it was a nice place and I would recommend it for people looking to save a little money by not staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sweeegh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in my life. Being a business traveler takes me to many cities, but when I vacation, I prefer to go to Las Vegas. When I have, I have stayed at most of the hotels there, but over the years none have matched the Golden Nugget in service and style. It seems to improve every time I visit. My latest stay was in November of 2006. I must admit, I read many reviews here, and was somewhat worried that since the Landrys group took over operations, that things may have changed for the worse; however, I can happily report that nothing could be further from the truth!. My room in the South Tower was large, quiet and immaculate!. The renovations they have done have certainly raised the bar for hotels at this, or almost any price!. The rooms in the North Tower are a little more pricey, but even nicer, as in the past I have stayed in them as well. Yes, the towels are a little scratchy, but they are functional, and you get plenty of them. Plenty of closet space, an in-room safe, auxiliary vanity mirror in the bathroom, and a nice large TV I can watch from my King Sized bed, just add to the comforts you get at such a value. I almost didnt want to leave my room! The buffet is now located on the second floor, and includes such wonderful items as crab legs, a tex-mex bar, italian bar, and some of the most succulent Prime Rib you will find anywhere. Vic and Anthony's now lives where the California Pizza kitchen used to be, and presents itself as a steakhouse which I can attest to as world class. Even the famous coffee shop has the highest quality food you will find anywhere on the strip, or downtown, for that matter. Even room service is top flight, and operates around the clock; I highly recommend the French Onion soup. They have a new lounge, called "Rush", and it is a nice, quiet alternative to the crowd and slot machine noise you will hear so much of in this town. Its a nice place to unwind. But best of all, and what makes this establishment a four diamond hotel, is the service. You will not find a more responsive, courteous, and helpful staff anywhere. They are all as nice as they can be, and you will not find an attitude anywhere in this house. I implore you; do NOT listen to the negative reviews about this grand lady of a hotel; I am convinced they are placed by people who cannot be made happy. Period. The Golden Nugget is the jewel of downtown, and I would put it up against any hotel in the world, for style, and overall value. Have fun at the Nugget, and don't forget to visit the "Hand of Faith"; the world's largest gold nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Let's be honest.”
Reviews.Author: bugeater_NU
Reviews.Content: Lets be honest this hotel is old and dowtown. If you are used to and loved staying at TheHOTEL at mandalay bay, or the venetian you might be dissapointed. Personally I love staying at the nugget. The rooms are nice, the bathrooms are a little small though, the hotel is clean, and the gambling is pretty good as well. The south tower is a bit of a walk but if you ask for a room that looks down on Freemont street you can watch the show from your room. (backwards) The food at LIlly's upstairs is excellent and the fun pass they give you at check in gives you buy one get one free. The ability of walking to numerous other casinos is the true attraction here. Next door is the four queens and I love the bar there( it is open to freemont experiance.) Binions is across the street, as well as all of the old school casinos left around. Check in was a little slow check out is super fast as you can do it from your room. The Bell boys were great, and the staff at the nugget was helpfull. One thing that I dont like but you see it in most places are the people trying to sell you a time share, buy giving you tickets or a cruise or whatever. there seem to be a lot of them here. If you want to hit the strip you can catch a $11.00 cab ride. Overall I liked it and at the prices you can get(air and hotel) it is by far and away one of the best deals in vegas. A lot for a liitle $ thats not even mentioning the new pool that is being worked on right now. when done it should be great. It features a slide through a shark tank! Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Underachieving But Sufficient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philoviation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 19-23. The construction was not finished. We booked on Priceline and apparently got a Priceline room, in the distant South Tower with no view but a death-ray sun coming in the window in the morning. Parking is free. The staff was generally friendly. We rented a car and had no problem with the hotel's distance from the Strip, but it would be an issue if we were without transportation. It's located on Fremont Street, which is worth some strolling. There are also some fun low-limit games along Fremont although those casinos are a little warn, and sometimes downright ragged. The Nugget and some other casinos don't have low-limit games without imposing unacceptable rule changes, such as 6-5 blackjack payout. (If you have a car, you may want to see the new Red Rock Casino, about 20 minutes away ... it has low-limit games with good rules and is new, pretty and friendly.) The Fremont Street light show is mildly entertaining, but don't go out of your way just for that. The room was of good size and it was quiet. There was a safe and an iron and an extra luggage stand, which is always welcome. There was no coffee service (perhaps because of the Starbucks downstairs, and a second on the way). The Starbucks was a bit pricey, had a line and the coffee wasn't very good ... too weak one time, with a lot of grounds in the bottom a second. However, there's a McDonald's nearby in a Fremont Street casino, and no line. The shower water pressure was poor ... never more than a heavy dribble at various times of the mornings. Towels were cheap synthetic that were scratchy. The climate control was an air conditioner under the window, like a highway motel. The high-speed internet service cost $11.99 per day ... I can't imagine why they don't catch up with the Travel Lodges and Holiday Inn Expresses of the world with free internet, but then there's a saying: What money you bring to Vegas, stays in Vegas. Check-in was easy, although the clerk didn't want to take my credit card for incidentals, the first time that's happened. I assumed I'd just pay on checkout. But ... when I tried to make a local call, the phone wouldn't work until I gave them a credit card downstairs! Local calls were $1 for 30 minutes, sufficient for checking email. The television service was out for one night. There's a large, two-station ticket office downstairs, but it's only for tickets in the Golden Nugget. We didn't use the concierge. The cafe service was good, and food often came right out, because it apparently had been prepared en masse long before. Also, someone was checking for hotel keys at the elevator of our tower. I don't know if they were screening for hookers, thieves or people sneaking coffee pots into their rooms. If you can get a room at the Nugget for a really good price, it would be worth it. There were no horrors here, but it's not a hotel that is going to win your heart or impress you with considerate little details. You'll be tolerating a lot of niggly things as noted here, things that could be fixed which is why I refer to them as underachievers.

Reviews.Title: “Construction & Promotions”
Reviews.Author: parpat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six days, construction all over the place.. though we never heard any noise (were were on the top floor though.. the new swiming pool will have a slide that goes through a giant aquarium .. still not done.. South tower is wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyy away from the casino and all other areas .. Automated phone calls announcing new openings and show starts were very annoying ..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place. Bad location”
Reviews.Author: Manchester4000054
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this site and so it was with some trepidation that I went to this hotel. I was glad that they were proved wrong. Dispite the building work that it still going on, a number of months longer than expected, the hotel and its staff were excellant. There was no queue for check-in, and they gave me the room I wanted. The rooms were clean, and were above my expectation for a downtown hotel. The staff were polite and attentive to any requests. In all a nice hotel experience. My only problem was with the location. Although Fremont Street was excellant and you can walk between the casinos, to get to the Strip involved either an hour long trip on The Deuce (Bus), or a an expensive taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: Cheales
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a five day trip to Las Vegas and stayed at the Golden Palace. Having read most of your reports we took special attention to most things, it took exactly 10 minutes for us to register and get our room, which was exactly what we had requested. Admitedly my friend only went to the cafe in the Nugget once as the service was very poor but there are so many other great places to eat at very reasonable prices. We also found that we could walk around anytime of the day or night without feeling insecure. We loved the Freemont location the events put on in the evening> I don't thing I would stay on the strip again we went up one day and the people and traffic were unreal. Also there are a number of hotels that we checked out for future reference, but again would stay at the Nugget anytime.

Reviews.Title: “'Golden'!”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the downtown end of LV, nice hotel but getting sum refurb work done at the moment, staff very nice and friendly. Despite saying you can onyl check-in after 3pm checked in at 1 with no problems. Very large room. Pool was shut.

Reviews.Title: “"Golden" All The Way”
Reviews.Author: jbruce6149
Reviews.Content: We stay specifically at the Golden Nugget every year that we go specifically for the top of the line service that we get... The accomodiations are superb and the staff goes out of their way time and time again... This year(2006), they are doing alot of consturction in the pool area so not being able to swim was a bit of a downfall especially in September when the temp. did reach nearly 100 degrees... But we will be excited to see what the final project will look like when we are there next year... This hotel by far is worth every dollar spent and I assure you that you will not be dis-appointed...

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Fremont District!”
Reviews.Author: Jesbal
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal and fun location to stay at in "Old Las Vegas". We were upgaded to a nicer room after having to wait an extra 5 mintues. Room was comfortable, clean, and spacious. Can't wait till the new pool is complete! It looks great. Very cool that this hotel is part of Fremont Street area! We had a blast playing and walking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “long way from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: elkthumper42
Reviews.Content: Was greatly dissapointed in customer service from the time we checked in till the time we left. Rooms were not bad- had a party of 6 and were suppose to have adjoining rooms and that didnt happen. We all didnt even get the same floor- family had sent a wedding basket that never arrived from room service and it took two hours to track that down. Gave us a non smoking room but said we could smoke in there and that they would send up ash trays and in the 3 day stay they never arrived. Breakfast buffet for 12.00 bucks a person was terrible, food was cold and the selection was dissapointing not to mention almost needing a hammer to eat the waffles. The hotel is under construction and the vibratory compactor used in packing the dirt for the pool was great to wake up to at 6 am when we were out all night so i would recomend a floor alot higher than the third floor so you can get some sleep from a long night out. The hotel is nice but definately could use some front desk keepers with a little better attitude and reliability. As for a four star hotel i was unhappy but like i said the rooms were nice and the location aint half bad- If you plan on staying there expect to take care of yourself with you own service and bring ear muffs-

Reviews.Title: “under construction”
Reviews.Author: 3cardpokerwinner
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 nights at The Golden Nugget in Las Vegas. We have stayed there many times & always with wonderful results...this time was different. Every part of The Golden Nugget is under construction, 24/7. Parts of the casino are blocked off at different times, Restrooms & escalators are closed at various times. Constant noise & dust going on with the construction. Our window on the 3rd floor was directly above a dumpster which was being utilized all night long. It sounded like explosions. I realize The Nugget cannot close while these renovations are being done, but the guests should receive some kind of consessions, or be told ahead of time what to expect!There is no longer security at the elevators checking room keys. There was even a homeless gentleman begging for money inside the casino. You will be approached EVERY time you enter the casino or your elevator from people t rying to con you into free gifts, shows or time shares. The lines at the cashier window were generally very long due to only 1 or 2 cashiers being on duty most of the time. It seems the entire staff has been cut in half. I will give The Golden Nugget another chance because all of our other expierences were so positive, but I would'nt stay there again until the construction is complete! Our favorite restaurant, Stefano's, is no longer there & has been replaced with Vic & Anthony's, which we did not try. The second floor is now the buffet, which was very good. The pool is going to be fabulous when completed, but it looks like that will be quite some time...NOT October like it says on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gallegoschris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a family wedding. Since we usually stay on the Strip, we were looking forward to a new experience staying downtown. Check-in was fast and easy, and we were very pleased with our room. Very clean, big, comfortable bed and the bathroom was just fine. But then in Vegas we do not stay in the room very much. We had a vacation package that included a $40.00 hotel credit and we saved it for the Sunday brunch that was very nice. We found many good dining options on Fremont St. Good $5.00 breakfast buffett at the California and also a good breakfast restaurant upstairs at the Vegas Club. The ongoing construction noise did not bother us, and it looks like the new pool area will be lovely when it is finished. I did use the Spa for a few hours one afternoon. I was not informed at the desk when I paid that the jacuzzi was under construction and not available. I was diaspointed with many aspects of the spa. I should have taken a little tour before paying $20 to use it. It is very small, and only 2 lounge chairs to put your feet up for ladies to use. They were stingy with bottled water ( if you wanted one, you needed to pad out to one of the desks and ask for one and they were also warm) and the juice was just out there on the table warm with no ice to put in a glass for it. I very much enjoyed the sauna and the steam room, but outside these two rooms was one hook in which to hang your bathrobe. So the 7 ladies using these facilities had to pile as many robes as we could on the one available hook and the rest used the floor. There was the bare minimun of amenites for skin and hair care at the vanities. I cannot imagine the facility on a busier day......there would be no place to sit. If we stay at the Nugget again, I would not use the spa. Did not gamble much there, as other casinos had much more fun atmospheres. Parking was very convienent as the garage was right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TimPithers
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable experience at the Golden Nugget during our 4 night stay in September. Check-in was very efficient and friendly after a very long day of travelling from England. There were several minor problems with our room but having spoken to personnel on the reception desk we were swiftly moved to another on the same corridor. The room was extremely comfortable and large and was fine as a base as you're not likely to spend that much time in your hotel room in Vegas! The location is great for the Fremont St experience as it's right outside. We had no car, but getting onto the strip was pretty straightforward as the Deuce double decker bus leaves downtown regularly and stops all along the strip. It's quite slow, however! The ongoing renovation and refurbishment at the Golden Nuggett didn't bother us at all and I'm sure it'll look fantastic when completed. The price we paid was amazing value for money - check the hotel website for offers.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: SimmoUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days at the Golden Nugget as a "Vegas Virgin". The hotel looked very nice, was very clean and the room was very spacious, compared to European standards anyway. Shower and bath provided but the shower was crap. The walls were very thin so I had to endure a couple coupling on a couple of occasions! Had to queue for breakfast and due to renovations, there is only one other coffee alternative (Starbucks) with 10-15 minute queues each morning. The staff were very friendly and the hotel clean. Next time I would stay on the Strip as it's where I spent all my time as it turned out and a can costs $15 or so each way. The Fremont St. Laser Show is right outseide and is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: trivster
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience, we booked our 3 night stay here around 6 months ago but on arrival were told there were no non-smoking rooms available. The room stank so bad that we kept waking up in the night wheezing and with headaches, even a smoker would have felt ill here. Management still insisted on not being able to do anything about it, but to their credit they were very helpful but no substance. We checked out immediately the next morning and went to stay at the Stratosphere who had plenty of no smoking rooms available. The Golden Nuggett attracts the over 50 trailer-park crowd and after a while of trying to get past chronic geriatrics who clog up the aisles, it gets very depressing. Fremont street is best forgotten, it's a load of lights, porn and homeless people. Stay down the corporate end of the Strip, leave the north end for the old farts.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: I stay in vegas 20 times a year. Usually on the strip. I was aprehensive, but this was VERY nice and it was cool to stay on Freemeont for a couple days. They are remodeling the lobby, the new pool and restarants will be really cool when its all done. Interesting history--- was owned by the same group as mirage, so when they last remodeled they remodeled the same as the Mirage, so the rooms are the same. The new owners seem to be maintaining it as well. Very plush and very nice....

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the cheaper price.”
Reviews.Author: Rach84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went there the week of August 17-23. We were a bit disappointed we weren't told back in February that the construction would be going on, but the people at the front desk at check-in were nice about it. They technically couldn't do anything since we booked through expedia, but she was very nice and gave us a free coupon book. The view from the rooms is very pretty. We had a view of the west and all the mountains, very pretty. The room was pretty clean and big for the price, which was nice. I wasn't particularly happy with the maid service though--we ran out of shampoo and were not given another bottle, and 3 nights she forgot to give us a new bath mat. Also, there was an unusual stench in the bathroom that wouldn't go away anytime we were there. I read an earlier review saying the same, so it must not be just me. They charge you $1 a minute to use the computer, which I believe should be complimentary to the guests. But if you're lucky and receive the coupon book, you get 10 free minutes. If you plan on using internet there, bring your laptop and use it in your room. It's $12 a day, but a much better deal than the $1 a minute. It's a good downtown location, but too far from the strip to walk there. We booked this thinking we could walk to the strip, being it was only a couple miles away. We were obviously wrong! Walking 2 miles to the strip sounds easier than done, being that it's very hot and being outside for a long time can really drain you. If you're looking to stay downtown, I really recommend renting a car. We took the Deuce one day, which was pure hell. The other days we had our car, which was much better. Rent a car if you can, much more freedom and less time consuming getting around. You'll be approached by people looking to sell you timeshares and such, almost everytime you walk through the hotel. Avoid them by nicely telling them "I live here" and they will keep their distance. The hotel is a much older crowd; you hardly see kids around it. My boyfriend and I are in our early and mid 20s, but we like nice, quiet places that don't have such a party scene with a younger crowd. So in that aspect, we really liked it since it wasn't ever loud. It is ok if you have kids, but I just don't think this hotel is very kid friendly. Especially since there isn't any pool. It's a nice hotel, but I don't think we'll be staying here again, being that it's too far from everywhere we wanted to go to on the Strip and off the Strip. But if you're looking to get a good deal and don't mind being a distance away from the strip, go for it. Oh yeah, be sure to check out the manican at the piano near the lobby--he looks real! Atleast I thought he was :-)~

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: stn61
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week's holiday in Las Vegas. It was our first visit to LV, so we had nothing to compare with in terms of the standards of hotels generally. However despite on going renovation and improvement work we have nothing but positive things to say about the GN. The room was a really good size, very clean; it had a big, comfortable bed, a good sized bath and a very powerful shower. We were in the South Tower which meant a little bit of walk when we wanted to go anywhere else in the hotel, but the peace and quiet and quality of the rooms more than compensated for this. Check in was fine - we arrived around 1600hrs and there were no queues. I think we were quite lucky though as on other days/times when walking past registration we noticed it was quite busy. But there always seemed to be lots of check in staff on duty. We used the fast check out facility through the TV so didn't have to contend with queues either at the end of our stay. We visited the breakfast buffet most mornings - and only on the last morning of our stay were we put off by the queues. And we found it to be very good value - lots of variety, good service for $8.99. We were on foot so getting to the strip was a bit of a concern. However the local bus service - the Duece - was good, frequent and cheap - $5 for a one day pass to take you up and down the strip. And the nearest stop is just a short walk from the hotel - one block further on from the end of Fremont Experience, on Las Vegas Blvd. It was our 30th wedding anniversary during our stay, so we decided to celebrate by going to the Top of the World restaurant at the Stratosphere. A high quality revolving restaurant over 100 floors up with incredible views over LV, it was a tremendous experience. The food and service was first class. Despite the fact that the GN is located Downtown and therefore a little way away from the major attractions, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. It doesn't have the wow factor of the likes of the Luxor, Belagio, Venitian but what it does provide is a really good standard of accommodation and service for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Golden Nugget for 2 nights, September 3rd to the 5th. We received the summer special $59 per night with a $40 food and beverage credit with our reservation. I have nothing bad to say about the GN but I was disappointed due to I was expecting something spectacular. I believe the GN caters to a certain customer and I don't think that we were it. I was a victim of false advertisement due to my reservation stated that I would receive a room with 2 Queen beds and I received a room with 2 doulbe beds. It was not the most comfortable situation. The buffet was just average and the cafe specials were expensive. There was a sign stating that men could not wear sleeveless shirts in the restaurants. I thought that was odd due to the temperatures were soaring in the 100's. I feel that sleeveless shirts can still be stylish due to as much money as the higher end clothing designers sell them for. Check in was long due to it being a holiday weekend, they only had a few employees working the front desk Sunday evening. There were several people complaining loudly but nothing was done. For the most part the staff were very friendly, especially the sprorts book gal. I believe the pool area will be beautiful when all the construction is done. The GN is a great location downtown but I don't believe i will be patronizing the GN in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the over 40 crowd”
Reviews.Author: ariesfire
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. The room was large and comfortable. It was a very long walk to get to the room. The buffet was discontinued when we were there. I don't know if that was a permanent or temper thing. The cliental was much older. We are in our late 20's and early 30's and the bulk of the guests were 40 and up. We had a hard time finding the parking area. The valet was fast for pickup. Slots were beyond tight and the table limits were high compared to other DT hotels and lower level strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: vegascrazy96761
Reviews.Content: My husband and just returned from a 5 night stay. Our room was very nice clean and quiet. Maid service was excellent. We never did eat there so I can not comment on that. Even though it is being renovated the casino was clean spacious and did not notice much of the construction. Check in was fast and we checked in early. Checked out on the tv and made it to the airport with plenty of time to spare. When we go back this winter we will stay there again. We really enjoy downtown compared to the strip, it is not as crowded and you dont have to walk forever to get from place to place. Had dinner at Limericks at Fitzgeralds it was awesome. Great food nice steak house but also casual and a wonderful waitstaff.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: floridatravel06
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel because the price was right, our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the food was tasty. You can't compare it to some of the hotels on the strip, but it's the nicest place in downtown Vegas. They do a good job keeping the place clean and shiny. There is lots of construction going on right now and the pool facilities aren't available. The hotel gave us a 40 dollar dining and bev. credit that we used to cover two of our b-fasts- gratuity not included. We had to wait in a 20 minute line to get through the buffet even when we arrived there at 8:30am, but that's typical for Vegas buffets. The food was decent, and I really like the cheese blintzes. We really liked the room. The pillows and bed were just right and the soaps in the bathroom were nice. The shampoo and conditioner weren't so good though. I would recommend this place to anybody who wants to stay downtown. We rented a car because downtown hotels aren't within walking distance from downtown. Parking at this hotel is free for guests- they have a garage and you use your room key for parking validation.

Reviews.Title: “1 Night at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Kenderson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GN for 1 night on 8/5. Arrived at 1:30AM to find they had no more non-smoking rooms with a king size bed. I then requested a room that was away from the construction that was going on just outside the hotel and was giving a room in the South Tower on the 4th floor. The walk from the elevator to the room was long and it seemed like we were walking through a maze. The room was large, spacious, and clean. Beds were comfortable, pillows soft. Washroom was small, but clean and suited our needs just fine. There was nothing to do in the hotel itself other than to eat, sleep, and gamble. We arrived late at night, so when we went out to walk Fremont, it was very quiet. The other downtown casinos weren't very busy either. Hopefully the next time we stay here, the construction will be complete and there will be more to do at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: almadelpueblo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived early at the Golden Nugget, about 10:00 A. M. We were able to check-in at that time in spite of the 3:00 P. M. check-in time. It took about 8 minutes. Check -out took about 20 minutes. The staff was friendly and very helpful. No waiting at all. We booked a non-smoking room at the South Tower. The room was clean and spacious and my wife loved it. The walk to the room was long but we did not mind because of the nice accomodations. Our room had a nice view of the mountains and the Stratosphere tower. At night, the view of the strip lights was breathtaking. We chose the Golden Nugget because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. We will definitely be back and highly recommend it. One thing I did not like was the smoke/smell which seemed to go nowhere, especially in the casino. We ate breakfast twice at the Carson Street Cafe to use up the $40 food and drink credit. Smoking passersby made the non-smoking section of the cafe smell like the smoking section. Otherwise, it was a most enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Lady is starting to show her age a bit.”
Reviews.Author: ricoba
Reviews.Content: Have spent many happy times at the GN over the years. She is a great property and in a great location, since we really enjoy downtown Vegas & Fremont Street. But having said that, was a bit aware this past stay, that the Golden Lady of Downtown is starting to show a bit of wear & tear....afterall she is celebrating her 60th birthday! We reserved directly through a casino host & got great service etc as always. The room in the North Tower was clean, but it's time for some updating. The carpet, chairs, bath fixtures etc are all starting to show their age. I wouldn't let all this stop me from visiting again, in fact we may go next week again. But be aware that the rooms are not as fresh, fancy & new as some of the brand new properties up on the Strip. We are happy with the GN, always get good service and good value, but hopefully the new owners will spend time updating the rooms, just like they are updating the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel-casino we have stayed at in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Trevor101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Golden Nugget for 3 nights recently during a holiday in the United States. The cost was $69 a night plus taxes. We booked with the hotel direct, via their website.
