The Golden Nugget Laughlin is a casino. It is elegant and stylish, decorated with chandeliers and mirrors. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. We stayed in the South Tower. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with a huge king-sized bed and a view of the mountains. We were very impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: dietcoke85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for four days, but we had a chance to add another day to it and we've always wanted to stay downtown. Lower gambling limits and ease from getting to casino to casino were our main reasons. I booked the Golden Nugget online for $49.99 + tax. My husband, who has heard horror stories about downtown being dumpy, couldn't believe we were staying in a room for $55. Well one look after you walked thru the doors knew we weren't in a dump at all. The only problem at the moment, was due to construction, we had to walk aways from parking to check in. Our room was a king size room with the most comfortable bed, beautiful marble bathroom, and outside vanity area. Their pool is still under contruction, but I was there to see downtown, have cheap eats, and gamble. We are definately planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - A Grand Lady”
Reviews.Author: cheribob
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is a Grand Lady. This beautiful hotel is located downtown away from the Strip. However, don't let that scare you away. It is a beautiful hotel with beautiful rooms. (SO said the rooms were comparable to what he had at Treasure Island). The rooms were extremely clean, large and beautiful. The hotel staff were outstanding. From Valerie and Kristopher at the front desk to the housekeeping and restaurant staff (especially our waitress, Diane and the cashier, Shirley) everyone was so cheerful and helpful and truly made us feel that they were glad we were there. There were no problems with the Orbitz reservations. We got exactly what we booked (non-smoking, King). Valerie, at the front desk was so helpful, informative & kind. We did not feel like second class citizens because we booked on-line. Valerie even arranged for us to have a room just down the hall from our friends. Valerie also gave us a coupon book for hotel amenities and explained about the $40 credit that came with the room. We used that for breakfast on Saturday & Sunday. Our rooms were in the North Tower but facing away from the construction. (The pool is STILL under construction.)So there was no problem with construction noise. The bathroom was a tad small (not enough room for two people). There was a full length mirror on the closet doors. There was also a safe, blow dryer, iron & board in the closet. Just outside the bathroom was a vanity with a lighted magnifying mirror. There was also a wardrobe containing a TV w/ 4 drawers below. Plus a table & a couple of chairs. The AC worked just fine all weekend. There was a line at check -in. I think we waited about 10 minutes. There were 6 people working the front desk during the 3 pm check-in times both Saturday & Sunday. I thought it was a long line until I was at the Bellagio on Sunday afternoon. The entire Bellagio lobby was jam packed with people trying to check out. People were just walking into one another like bumper cars! It was a mad house. When we returned to the Golden Nugget I turned to my SO & said, 'Ah! Peace & quiet!" There was a manned parking garage directly behind the Golden Nugget. All we had to do was show our room key and we parked for free. I love the Golden Nugget and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown splendor”
Reviews.Author: joet1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night at the GN in mid July before moving to Bally's for two nights. My only regret is that I didn't stay at the Nugget for my entire stay. I have no idea if this is a 3, 4 or 5 star hotel, but I can tell you that the rooms are at least as good as The Mirage's. The pool wasn't open when I was there, but it didn't matter. The room was immaculate, the service was friendly, the A/C was so good I got a call from a meat packing plant that wanted to hang sides of beef in the room, AND it was as quiet as a mouse in the room. My view wasn't any good, but it's downtown so what are you going to see anyway? The only complaint I have is that the room had an odd odor when we first got there. Like someone had just dropped a huge duece. It faded pretty quick though. If you're staying downtown you won't go wrong with the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: selamatjalan
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about the Nugget as many of our American friends had raised an eyebrow when we said that we were spending a couple of nights Down Town. But we were pleasantly surprised. Although the decor was of a more classical style it was pleasing and was certainly NOT tired looking. We stayed at the Nugget in June 2006. Downtown Vegas is very different - it has not got the rich and glamourous people, the trendy expensive restaurants, the digital adverts and the shops that there is on the main strip, but because of that the hotels are much cheaper over here and the limits at the tables are lower. We did wander into some of the other hotels in the area and I would say that if you did decide to stay downtown, make the Nugget your choice. It is welcoming.,comfortable and is undergoing some major refurbishments for a new aquarium restaurant. It also had a nice looking steak restaurant (but we opted for Tony Roma instead !!) .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mekl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GN for 3 nights (7/8 - 7/10). We booked the 'Summer Surprise Special' promotion which included great room rates, a $40 meal credit, and coupon book for various things (like 2 free cocktail coupons at any hotel bar which we used on the way up to the room and a $10 match play which we used at the roulette table and won!). Upon check-in, we were upgraded to the North Tower which is very convenient to the front of the hotel entrance, check-in, valet. The South Tower is a bit of a walk, but not very far at all. This was our 3rd stay at the GN and we stayed in the South Tower on our 1st visit in March 2005 and our 2nd visit in November 2005. Our room in the North Tower overlooked the pool construction. The 1st night was peaceful. On our 2nd night, we heard construction noise, equipment, etc. most of the night. The next morning we asked to move to the other side of the North Tower and were given a new room with absolutely no problem. We are Private Arrangement members. This is the GN 'Frequent Stay' program where you earn points for your stays and then redeem them for future stays or take dollars off your bill upon check out. The pool area is under construction and we were advised of this when we made the reservation. There is an architect's model in the lobby of what the pool area will look like when finished. It looks like it will be great! Hopefully, GN will do some marketing offering good future room rates to those who stayed in July and August when the pool was under construction. There is also various, minor other construction projects going on inside, but we only saw it late, late at night / very early in the morning--never disruptive in the busier casino hours. We ate once at Carson Street Cafe inside GN for a quick dinner. We both had hot sandwiches. The food and service was great. We also ate once at the Buffet for breakfast on the morning we left and it too was fine for food and service. Bar service was great. These meals and one trip to the bar were basically free because of the $40 food credit that was part of the Summer Special ($40 credit was linked to room, so you had to charge the restaurants/bars to your room in order to properly receive the food credit). We used the business center once. The hours are a bit limited (9A- 3P). We were there around 2:45, checked our flights and printed a couple of pages. The employee was ready to leave and she told us she was shutting everything down. She wasn't horrible, just not as great as all the other employees we encountered. The guy at check-in reviewed the package we booked (how the coupons worked and how the food credit worked). The lady at check-out went over our bill completely and our Private Arrangement account. Housekeeping made up our room everyday. The valets are some of the hardest working guys. They were great. We called down several time and asked them to bring our car from the garage at a specific time and it was ready every time. Best tip money ever spent. I am not sure why people staying at the GN use the self-parking garage?!?! I cannot say enough good things about the Golden Nugget. While in Vegas this time we went to Lake Mead one day and did the cruise around the lake and hoped to rent a PWC but thunderstorms prevented that. We ate lunch one day at Commander's Palace ($18.80 Martini Lunch - Excellent!!). We rent a car every time - cheap and convenient. We prefer to stay downtown. We visit the strip, but do most gambling downtown. About us: We are 38 and 46, married, travel a good amount each year for business and pleasure, we work in the travel industry and outside sales. Please email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “still a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Nugget several times over the years, and it remains a dependable 'nice' option DownTown. The Nugget is currently undergoing renovations - including new restaurants and a brand new pool area - which means not all services are currently available. There is no pool at this time! It looks like they are several months behind schedule, so if a pool is a must, stay somewhere else. The Sports Book is also majorly shrunk down right now - hopefully it will reexpand after the renovation. The rooms are still very nice, and the bathrooms are the nicest downtown. The bathroom fan and the AC unit both seemed a little underpowered, leaving the room a little muggy after 4 people had showered. These rooms are a cut above standard Strip fare (Trop, Flamingo, Harrah's, Strat). The Nugget no longer compares with the top places in town - Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian, etc., - but it is far more affordable. The gambling is more Strip-like than downtown-like - meaning many $10 minimum tables and very few $5. There is a lot more high roller/black action here than anywhere else downtown. The drink service is pretty good. The atmosphere is nice but not over the top like the big Strippies. Parking is fairly easy, and free for hotel guests - nothing like that super-long walk from a mega-parking structure on the Strip. Service was a little disappointing on this trip - the front desk was great, but the chambermaid ignored our requests (both written and verbal) for an extra towel even while happily taking several bucks left out as tip! But the rooms were always clean and made up, so no major problems. The food is top 1 or 2 downtown, which means it is better than the average Strip place. Their buffet is fairly good and a real bargain. They have an outstanding little cafe that I always eat breakfast at, and the food is so reasonable and tasty! The lines are not too bad, but be prepared to wait at prime time. All in all, I still plan to stay here again next trip. Downtown is a better bet for good deals, and is more walkable than the Strip. If you haven't tried the Nugget before, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay and Price”
Reviews.Author: Richardsontraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Golden Nugget in early June. Great prices but remember no pool yet, under construction. Room was very neat and clean. Be sure to check out via TV, lobby is a mad house if you are trying to check out on Sunday around noon. Parking garage is closer to South Tower than valet. Save you plastic key card to get out of parking garage free when you check out of hotel. Buffet was good not the best, but OK. Coffee cart in the south tower lobby in the morning is also very good. Only one problem, our room did not get cleaned one day. They said our "Do Not Disturb" sign was up, which was not true after 10:30 AM. Anyway, they came and cleaned the room around 7 PM that night after I called front desk to complain. Not releated to hotel, but on Fremont street, don't fall for the $1 margarita signs at every cheap casino. That is a ploy to get you to come in. After you come in they tell you they are out of the $1 size cups and then they offer you a $13 or $16 size to buy. To me it is false advertising when they still have the neon lights flashing in front of the business. Rio Buffet is the best, look for coupons in the local rags. You get to cut in the buffet line and use the registers used for hotel guests because the line use automatic machines that do not accept the coupons. We found out after waiting for almost 40 minutes, what a waste.

Reviews.Title: “changed rooms on check in - appalled!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were returnees to nugget for 3 nites 6/26-29. Upon checkin we decided to switch towers from south to north. Well I was appalled at the rate hike of $25.00 extra per nite for tower change. We were returnees after all and the hotel was not that booked!!!! We were on 11th floor and little did I know about construction below that started at 3 AM daily. Also whats with those room air conditioners - can't they upgrade for comfort - the noise drove me nuts, you can hardly do anything with controls - its mostly on or off. Carson Cafe could re-do their menu's also - I found $22.00 for 2 breakfasts (without tip) a little costly. Guests rave about the buffet but I only found that it was quantity not quality, reminds me of a typical family restaurant in the midwest. I enjoyed the Noodle house most. This was an expensive trip for us with flight, etc from Milwaukee, I don't think we received much for the dollar and it will be a long time before I visit Nugget, it's back to the strip for accomodations and the like!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tanalexs
Reviews.Content: Travel dates: June 26 - June 29. Purpose: Visit after 5 years to see what has changed. Picked the Golden Nugget because of some of the positive reviews, and wanted to see what was there. It was a BUDGET trip to explore changes, so the $40 food credit was great. (Does not apply to gratuity.) Arrived late Monday night, check-in (North tower location only. South tower was closed.) was fast, though counter did not ask smoking preference. I was assigned a room in the South tower. Room was good size, and comfortable. The walk was long, but it is a great way to work off the food. Construction was located on the west side of the North Tower. Throughout my stay, I did not hear any construction noises. (Not quite sure whether pool will be opened by end of summer based on what I saw!) Overall, the place looked nice and classy. No one tried to sell me anything. Staff encountered were all pleasant. Restaurants: Only visited the lunch buffet and the Carson Street cafe. Food was good, but not spectacular. Service was a little slow during late night/early morning in the cafe. Bread pudding is a must try in the buffet. Travel: If you plan to use the Deuce (double decker bus) to travel to the strip area, be aware that the published schedules were not followed well at all. It would be fine except the temperature was in the 110s during the days. Bring liquids with you. Cool bus though, and you can see a lot from the upper deck. Entertainment: Found a same day half price ticket booth (service fee applies.) at the 4 Queens one block east. Good variety of shows. Location opens about 11 a.m., and will display the available discounted shows. Decided on the Beatles tribute at the Aladdin, and the Elvis tribuite at the Fitzgerald. Both were excellent, though the Fitz had a more personal environment. Fremont experience was okay. Street entertainment was actually very good with both the Sax (near the middle of the Fremont expereince), and the piano (West end). Strip: Things have changed. The mega hotels were really spectacular, but every place seemed extremely commercial. You cannot walk anywhere without feeling someone pressuring you to buy something. Things have also goten expensive. There are also many desolate areas when you travel between the Downtown and the Strip. Extremes in contrast. FREE internet (?): Hotel charges about $12 oer day. Walk two blocks east to the Krispy Kreme donut at the Fitzgerald, buy a donut, and surf for free. Donut quality is great, but coffee is subpar unfortunately. If you cannot link or connect to the internet, have the counter reset the router. It is a 11 mbps DLink router, and it is a little subpar performance- and reliability-wise. Not many know about it however (No one else was using while I was there.) so Happy Surfing! (If you are looking for free internet connections, visit [--]) Airport: Allow extra time on your return. My flight left late evening, and the lines were long. Suggestion: Visit hotel web site to discover status of construction and openings/closings before trip to avoid any unnecessary stress. Hope you have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Report Las Vegas 7-4 to 7-7”
Reviews.Author: sfergy
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of posts here before planning my trip to Las Vegas and they were very helpful so I wanted to give a little back. This was my first trip to Las Vegas in about 10 years so I didn't really know what it was like now. The "Freemont Experience" and the Nugget I booked a room at the Golden Nugger because of reviews on this site and the price ( I'm kind of a value conscience consumer ). It looked like a good value but I never visited downtown and was apprehensive about staying there. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. I was prepared for the atmosphere by reading the posts here so I was not really surprised by the kind of age of the places down there. I never felt unsafe at any time and really enjoyed the gambling and atmoshere at the Nugget, Fremont and 4 Queens. The "Fremont Experiences" is more than just watching the light show , which I admit was kind of disappointing. The Nugget was a great place to stay in my opinion. Since I had a rental car, transportation was not a problem but I can see it could be without one. I had room 1876 which was an East facing room in the South Tower. The only negative was the AC was loud ( which I shut off at night ) and there was some road noise from cabs which seem to queue up on the street below at night.The buffet was OK but not great. The room came with a $40 meal credit so I ate Breakfast and one Dinner there. I think the buffet at the TI and Bellagio were much better but also much more expensive. For the money, it was a good deal. All in all, I would have no problem returning to the Nugget for my next stay. BTW, don't worry about the contruction. I never would have known it was going on if they didn't have the portholes to see the progress. Gambling I really only play blackjack so I can't comment on the other games. I enjoyed playing at the 4 queens as all tables are 3-2 with $5 - $25 dollar and some single deck tables. Freemont was good too, I played there several times. The Nugget though was mostly 6-5 and usually had higher limit games $10 and up. It was hard to find a $10 table on the stip and never saw a 3-2 game ( didn't look real hard though , not saying they are not there just hard to find ). I have a hard time sitting down to play blackjack at the Bellagio with $25 minimum multdeck shoe and 6-5 payoff when I know I could go the 4 Queens and do a lot better. That's just me though. The Strip Wow. Lots of walking but some really nice places. Visited TI, Venetian, Bellagio, Wynn and was really impressed. It's something I think you really have to see but, it's very crowded and expensive. It's kind of like the saying, "It's a nice place to visit, but I'm glad I don't live there." Shows I really didn't come to Vegas looking for the shows but I was again pleasantly surprised. I saw Mystere and Blue Man Group and was blown away. They are not cheap ($60 - $150 ) but they were great particularly the Blue man group. There are several outlets called Tix4Tonight around town, one at the 4 Queens downtown that sell show tickets at very good prices. The selection may not always be there but you should be able to find something. Overall Lots of walking especially on the Strip, not so much downtown. Good Buffets. Downtown's got good gambling and values. Strips got good sightseeing and crowds for those that like that sort of thing. Nugget is a good value. See some shows! I have to go back more often. 10 years is too long. Hope some of this has been helpful and have fun on your next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozteddy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Golden Nugget was great. We did know that the pool was under reconstruction as were parts of the hotel but it did not mar the experience at all. The rooms and every part of the casino that we saw were clean and well maintained. Check in and valet parking was a breeze and staff very friendly. We checked in here after returning from the Grand Canyon following a few days staying on the strip in Vegas and the peace and quite was a welcome relief from the frantic (and grubby) constant hustle on the strip. If you can afford to stay at an upscale hotel on the strip go for it, but if you are after good, reasonable priced accomodation for a family, I don't think you could beat the Golden Nugget. I stayed here on my first trip to Vegas in 1983 and loved it then too.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, brother and 2 girlfriends friends stayed at the Golden Nugget (June 19 -23) after spending a week in Hawaii and we were very pleased with the accommodation, hotel staff, casino floor staff and staff at the buffett......you made us all feel welcomed and the Golden Nugget was our home for the 5 days we were there....and let me tell you we were a long way from home - Perth Australia. The Golden Nugget was spacious and comfortable and our rooms were clean, comfortable and we had adjoining room which made it easy to all get together and talk over our adventureous days. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast's and the staff were polite and friendly and our biggest enjoy was sitting on the machines, having a small win and being offered drink at the same time. We explored Fremont Street, even got ourselves an airbrushed tattoo. We explored downtown along the strip and we were all taken in by the size of the casino's, the fact they were all different and the different theme's that each one gave. Who could ever say the Vegas was boring. We found the heat to be extremely overwhelming we were getting days from 107-115 and man that was hot. We were upset that the Golden Nugget was under construction with the swimming pool and new surrounds, but I am sure they will be well and truly finished upon our next return, and yes Golden Nugget we will return. Again thank you to all staff at Golden Nugget for our warm welcome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Joint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas four times and The Golden Nugget is my favorite. I liked the fact that it was not on the strip, and yet the strip was very close when we wanted to go. The Golden Nugget's locale was relaxing, and, believe it or not, quiet. Yet action was so close. I really enjoyed Freemont Street and all it had to offer. I liked the history behind The Golden Nugget and Freemont Street. The light show was very good, the street performers were very good, shopping was good, food on Freemont Street was good and the food in The Golden Nugget was excellent. The in-house performer was very good, although they change shows from time to time and Gordie Brown may not be there now. Room was excellent, very clean and price could not be beat. Get the hotel & air package from The Golden Nugget web site and it's all done for you. Check out the old neon lights, including Glitter Gulch. This was the old Vegas. Vegas of history. Highly reccommend The Golden Nugget. James Old Fields, WV

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nuggett is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our tour group of 50 people stayed at the Golden Nuggett for 3 nights and 4 days. EVERYTHING was wonderful. The location, the rooms, the people, the casino, the buffet, check-in and check-out were all outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going that way and looking for a beautiful experience during their stay. Please remember that WE as customers must do our part as well - Expect to be patient, we're not the only custuomers they have. Be kind & friendly, we're not the only ones who have had a rough day. Prepare to forgive, everyone is human and make mistakes or misunderstand. In my experience, ALL of the employees at the Golden Nuggett were very professional and efficient. I did not have any problems but I saw other people in the check out line who did and I watched the staff try to work with them and most of them were able to get what they needed in a timely and friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our flight out was 3 hours late, so we didn't arrive at the Golden Nugget until 11:30 p.m., and expected to have terrible rooms. We were told that all they had left were smoking rooms, and with a group of 8 people, thought that might be a problem. We were pleasantly surprised. One couple did switch rooms, but it was only because they wanted a better view (they were on 2nd floor). Our room was on the 16th floor in the North tower, with a decent view of the Plaza, although there was construction of the new pool going on below. We never had a problem with noise from other rooms, the hallway, or the construction. Our room was huge! The bed was comfortable, and we were happy to find an extra pillow in the closet, along with an ironing board, iron, blow dryer, and safe. The carpet, upholstery, and bedding were all in good shape, and despite the fact that it was a smoking room, did not smell of smoke, so we opted to stay put. It would have been nice if the room also had a refrigerator and/or coffee maker, but for what we paid, we couldn't possibly complain! There was a Starbucks in the Casino, so we were set. Everyone we encountered: from the front desk personnel, to the shop clerks, the housekeepers, the casino attendants, to the waitresses in the restaurants - everyone was very friendly and helpful, and seemed eager to please. Special thanks to Betty in the Carson Street Cafe - that woman knows customer service! We never had to ask for anything, she was always one step ahead of us. If you go there, get the hot turkey sandwich, it's fabulous! And ask for Betty! The casino and hotel were very clean, and we were impressed with the attention to detail. Despite the construction going on, (which we barely noticed), everything just gleamed. We had rented 2 vehicles (and got a free upgrade at Thrifty to an SUV because we got there so late, and they only had 1 full-size vehicle left!), and it was easy to park the vehicles, drive to the strip, etc. Parking was free for hotel guests, and pretty convenient. We felt very safe downtown, and didn't worry about the vehicles the whole time we were there. We were all very happy with our decision to stay at the Golden Nugget, and will definitely be back! On a sidenote, if you get the chance, go to Lake Mead and the Hoover Dam! We rented a boat at marina in Hemenway Harbor for 2 hours, and had the best time. The water is crystal clear, and the view is magnificent. We went home with some great pictures. That was probably the high point of our trip! Lake Mead is only a quick 30 minutes from Las Vegas, and definitely worth the drive.

Reviews.Title: “Was a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since we like Fremont St. so much we decided we would stay down there this time. We decided to stay at the Nugget since its the nicest hotel downtown. Well, nobody bothered to tell us the pool was under construction. We definately would have chosen another hotel since the temperature didn't go below 105 degrees. Also, the hot tub in the spa was broken.... and it had been for 3 months. The airconditioner in our room also didn't work properly the last two nights there. When I complained about these things the lady at the desk simply said "sorry". Now we payed DOUBLE what we would have payed at any other casino downtown I think they could have done better than sorry. I will say the room was nice and the buffet was very good but considering the other incidents I will have to think long and hard before I stay at the Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “1st trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1st time to Las Vegas...Golden Nugget was great...check in was easy as well as check out....rooms were clean and larger than expected...buffet was great....easy to get to strip....I recommended Golden Nugget to all my friends...casino was as good as anyone on strip....first time gambler.... everyone was very helpful did not mind answering questions...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: mr_maui
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget June 9-10,2006 and totally enjoyed the hotel. At check in, Mr. Ahmoo, ( hope the spelling is right ), a manager, and Karen in the VIP area were the greatest. Check in and out was smooth as silk. Had a line at the main lobby, but was taken care of in a prompt manner. The room was clean and nice, and maid service was top notch. Needed some extras, and room service and cleaning service was prompt and very polite. Totally enjoyed our stay there. Much better service and atmosphere here than on the strip. Will try to book our next trip to Vegas at this hotel. Thanks to the Staff.

Reviews.Title: “We love Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday. I read a lot reviews from this website and decide to stay at three different hotels with a budget of $70 per night (before tax) since we don't want to break the bank. We stayed at Best Western Inn, Orleans and Golden Nugget. This is easy to give the winner. The hotel room in Golden Nugget is aboulutely beautiful and spacious. The king bed is very comfortable with right firmness and softness. We also like their lunch buffet ($7.95, 10:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.). They keep lots of breakfast items and they also have all kinds of salad, various hams, smoked salmon, lots of entree selections, and abolutely wonderful dessert. Our room is at the South Tower and there are lots of construction going on around the South Tower (they are building new underwater restaurant and new theater). So when we go to bed, we can hear the construction noise even after 1 a.m. Our room is on the 17th floor, so it didn't bother us too much. But I still want to warn you if you are sensitive to noise, you want to tell the front desk about the noise concern. Ask them to put your room away from the construction side of building. Oh, the pool is also under construction, so if you must splash into cool water after a hot day, you may want to choose other hotels. I book the room directly on the Golden Nugget website and with their special promotion rate, we get great rate (average $65 a day) with $40 food credit. We love Golden Nugget and the Fremont experience at night. We rent a car so we don't care if we are a little away from the Strip. For sure, next time when we go to Las Vegas, we will stay at Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management Skills- Thanks a lot, Eric”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience... We arrived at the Nugget to find HUGE check-in lines. There were 2 women working at the desk for a line of 50+ customers. After waiting an hour in line, our journey began... Prior to leaving for our trip, we were browsing on Goldennugget and Vegas and found a special promotion that advertises a food and beverage credit for $40.00 when you book a two night stay. There were restrictions on the dates, which we had clearly booked in. The front desk would not honor the $40.00 credit, so we checked in and requested a manager, who was on lunch, so we waited for another hour. We called the manager after an hour wait and she told us there is nothing she could do and she had better things to deal with, then promptly hung up on my mother. I tried calling and the same manager told to come back down and wait in line and she would maybe take a look at the pages I had printed off the internet of the $40.00 meal and beverage credit. I told her that I was on vacation and I didnt feel like waiting in line, so I wanted someone to come up and look at the printed offers. At that point I was threatened with security. The manager told me that they were on their way up to get me. Promptly, I marched to the front desk to talk to Eric, another manager who proceeded to tell me that we had purchased the wrong package. Eric belittled us and told us he had better things to do. After all of this, when going back up to the room, we noticed thousands of dishes sitting outside with bird feces all over the place. After seeing this, I vowed never to eat anything from the Nugget. See the photos below.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: brandy407
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget from April 2nd - 8th. I booked my reservation in early January at a rate of $79.00 per night. I have been to Vegas many times since 1985 but never stayed in the downtown area. I wasn't sure what to expect. But basically, I didn't miss the strip action at all. I really like staying downtown due to the close proximity of the casinos, the entertainment, shops, etc. I had a king room in the South Tower. The Room was impeccably clean. That is a plus in my book because I am a neat freak. The bathroom was a nice size and very clean. I asked for a refrigerator and they bought one up in 20 minutes at no charge. We ate at the cafe most days and the food was great and the service was fast. There was some construction going on but you wouldn't know it. They camaflouged the construction noise and debris really well. The parking is really convenient if you are staying in the South Tower. It is free as long as you are a guest. The slot machines were kinda tight there so I frequent the other casinos like Fitzgeralds, Binions and some others and I really like playing there. These casinos had all the latest slots. The dealers at the Nugget were friendly and were willing to help me learn the games. The only cons at the Nugget was the front desk staff in the South Tower and the main tower were not very friendly. I had to get their attention and they weren't that busy. They seemed bothered when I asked a question or needed assistance. With the exception of the bad attitudes of the front desk staff, I would definitely go back again if I can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “One week @ the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: larryjohn
Reviews.Content: hello, my wife and i just spent a week at the nugget and everything was fine as usual. we've been there before and at numerous strip hotels but like the fact you can casino hop without walking miles. we we're aware that the pool was closed/gone for remodeling so when i checked in i did the "poor pitiful me" routine with a smile and the desk clerk gave us two free friday nite dinner buffets and a coupon book with more discounts and two-for-one offers and free drinks etc. all the staff we encountered we're pleasant and the place is clean and quiet. can't wait to go back once the make over is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, relaxing and really fun”
Reviews.Author: Fashionbuyer
Reviews.Content: Quick check in Super staff! Clean and very nice rooms Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Thing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you like the Golden Nugget depends on what you are looking for. Personally, I loved it but I happen to like hotels with character and vintage grandeur. The hotel is full of gold and glass, but from another era. Our room was very large and clean, on a high floor with a view of the mountains. The furniture is retro but authentic. The Friday night seafood buffet had unlimited fresh oysters. The casino is pretty low-key and there’s a Starbucks with an outdoor café. I liked the Golden Nugget all the more after visiting some of the overwhelmingly glitzy mega hotels on the strip. The Downtown area still has some of the old Las Vegas hotels like the Golden Gate and the Main Street Station with fabulous antique fixtures worth a visit in themselves. Interestingly, the hotel seemed to appeal to a lot of New Yorkers. Whatever the “real” Las Vegas is today depends on your taste, but the Golden Nugget will appeal to those who want something between Hunter Thompson and Walt Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KJUW
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an upscale hotel in Vegas without having to pay over $100, the Golden Nugget is a great option. By far the nicest hotel in Downtown, its interior looks like many of the nicer hotels on the Strip. The rooms are good sized and clean. We had no trouble with outside noise, either from the street below or the rooms next door. Parking is free with your stay, although you'll need to show your room key to get out. Its about a 10-15 minute drive to the strip, about 20 from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: ClaireR
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other hotels downtown I do feel that the Golden Nugget is probably the best there is. We got a lovely room with a roll away at no extra charge for the duration of our stay. The hotel is undergoing major renovations but to be honest we found no evidence of this apart from the occassional sign advising that certain areas were closed and when they were expected to re-open. The bedroom was nicely decorated and had plenty of space to acommodate 2 doubles and a roll away, plus 3 girls and their suitcases without feeling cramped! My only complaint was the noise of the a/c, like other hotels downtown , for some reason is incredibley loud but after a while you become obvlious to it. We were staying in the North Tower but didn't find it was a long walk to Fremont St as I kow some people have mentioned. All the staff we cam across we very friendly and helpful. We had dinner in the buffet restaurant that evening and while it was very cheap the food was indicative of this. Breakfas the next morning at the Carson St Cafe was much better, although the comparison with a European sidewalk restaurant was a little far feached. Overall we had a positive stay and would more than likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to try the Downtown on our recent trip to Las Vegas and after reading all the reviews decided on the Golden Nugget. I still can't belive that we had such a nice room for about $60. The hotel was very clean, and our room on the 21st floor faced south so we had a nice view of the Strip and Mountains. Staying downtown was fun, and since we rented a car going to the strip was no problem. All of the hotels have free valet parking so for the price of a tip it's really convenient. We knew about the construction ahead of time and to be honest it really wasn't that much of a problem other than we had no access to a pool. When we booked we were told that we could use the pool at Binions but when we arrived we were told that that arrangement didn't work out. We sounded a liitle disapointed so they gave us some coupons for some free meals. The only other complaint we had was with the hours of the Gym. They don't open until 10 AM and then close right at 6 PM. Generally most people would rather work out in the morning before they get on with their day, so trying to schedule in a work out is a bit tricky. When I spoke to a manager about this they apologized and offered us a free dinner, which made us feel a little better and speaks to their desire to try to keep customers happy. Overall we enjoyed our stay and feel for the price it is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - best downtown.”
Reviews.Author: samuraiwriter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GN for my 30th b-day, we were not disappointed. Great room ( suite ) with steam shower and additional whirlpool bath. Very clean and spacious. Room service was excellent and quite affordable by LV standards. If you want to stay downtown stay here. No other hotel compares. I've stayed everywhere downtown :) and now it's ony the Golden Nugget. By the way spend the money and eat at Vic and Anthony's Steakhouse... best meal ever... wine was superb. Our sommellier (sp?) Shelby was extremely good as was our waitress Laura.

Reviews.Title: “a great change from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: carolynkernow
Reviews.Content: We like some other reviewers stayed downtown for a change and were very pleased with the Golden Nuggett. it is a classy hotel with everything spotless and the room delightful. We were on the 21st floor and had great views of the mountains. The room is very well equipped and the furnishings are lovely I immediatly felt comfortable in this room. The Hotel is at present updating its pool area, this is well screened from the public areas and we were never aware of any noise - there are porthole windows to look through so you can see how it is progressing. The breakfast buffet is the best value we have ever encountered in Vegas and of very high quality with friendly staff. We liked staying downtown the strip is so crowded now with people and traffic this made a refreshing change, we stayed 3 nights on a driving tour and had free car parking and found plenty to do everynight. The casino is no too large here and it is easy to find your way around which is not the case in the larger Casinos. The other restaurants in the Golden Nuggett are varied and good value as well and we had good service in all of them. We like it here and will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gr8drmrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was small and noisey. You could hear the traffic outside and the window air conditioner barely worked to keep the heat out and it was so noisey my husband could not sleep. We asked if all rooms are provided with this type of air conditioning and was told yes. The rooms are so far away from where you drop off your car it was like a hike to get to the elevators. The hotel down on Fremont that serves the 99 cent shrimp cocktails, please beware, my husband got so sick from that cocktail, he got food poisoning. Also when we got our car they had damaged our front headlight and they only agreed to pay for half of the cost to replace it. I would never ever stay here again. If you want to visit Fremont which is awesome, take a taxi, drive, do anything but don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget not so Golden”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were unhappy with our recent stay at the Golden Nugget. My husband and I have visited Las Vegas several times and stayed on the Strip. We thought we would give downtown a try this time around. We arrived at the Nugget on a Monday to VERY long check-in lines - not enough personnel. We were given a room in the South Tower, which was nice but the construction noises and street traffic woke us up between 5 a.m. and 6 a.m. every morning. We came with 9 other family members and during our five-day stay no one won money at the Nugget. It was also impossible to get a complimentary cocktail. We gambled at Binions, Fitzgerald's and 4 Queens with much better outcomes. Of course you come to Vegas to lose your money, but it's nice to win every now and then so you can pour the money back into a slot machine! I was very disappointed with the Spa and Fitness facility at the Nugget, which was advertised as being complete, but was not and I was still charged to use it. Essentially, I had to pay each day just to use a treadmill. When I asked the manager, Eric, at the end of my stay if the hotel could eliminate the fitness fees from our bill - I was rudely turned down. When I complained to him that the hotel offered no pool, whirlpool, steam room, sauna, shower, etc. and had no agreement with any other downtown hotel for guest use of their pools, he appeared not to care. His comment was, "You signed for the room charge, therefore you pay!" Except for one lovely waitress in the hotel restaurant, this manager's surly attitude was reflected by most of the employees of the hotel. We enjoyed downtown. The Strip was very crowded. It is unfortunate that the Golden Nugget did not live up to its reputation. I don't know whether this is due to the change in ownership, but hopefully the problems will be ironed out.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget Is Golden”
Reviews.Author: RichardHudson
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Golden Nugget in mid May. This was our second stay, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is a quality operation for the most part. Our room in the South Tower was large, nicely appointed, and quiet. Most staff members were friendly and professional. Friends who live in Las Vegas tell us they drive downtown to eat at the coffee shop in the Nugget, and we found it to be excellent. Try the special French Toast made from Hawaiian sweet bread and covered with strawberries and banannas. Only complaint was a young lady at the front desk. When we checked in, she gave us a message to call the airline about a missing bag. After getting to the room and discovering I could not make outgoing calls, I phoned the front desk and learned that they don't turn on the phone unless you register a credit card. (We had booked a pre-paid package deal.) Obviously, we should have been told this when we registered. Also, her directions to the South Tower were "just turn left and take the elevator." Accurate directions would have been, "turn left at the top of the steps, go about 100 yards, turn right, go about 100 feet, turn left, go about 200 feet, turn left into the elevator lobby." She was confusing every guest she registered.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: I was on business in LV and stayed at this downton hotel. The lobby and casino are solid 4.5 star quality and the room and bathroom were both spacious and comfortable. There are plenty of dining choices. Everyone at the front desk was nice and my room was ready at noon. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. If I was in LV for fun I would stay on the strip though. I didn't care for the adjacent "Fremont Street Experience" which is in need of serious modernization and downtown LV is just horrible. Up the street there is a Walgreens and a semi-abandoned mall. Other than that, you're out of luck for shopping and dining choices. But for a business traveler, the Nugget was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent five days in Las Vegas, but before we ever booked our trip we went on a search for the hotel that we wanted to stay at. MGM, Mirage, Paris, New York, New York were a few that we looked at and considered, then we came upon Golden Nugget. We looked the hotel sites over, not one but many about this hotel, and read all of the reviews and decided this was the place that we wanted to stay during our visit. I must say, we were not dissappointed. The hotel is full of beauty and charm, and the staff was friendly and if you had any questions or needed anything they were right there to help get answers or to help in any way that they could. Our room was very nice, clean and room service there was excellent. There location of the hotel is wonderful. We went up to the strip and visited the other hotel during our visit, and we both decided that we were quiet happy with the hotel that we had chosen. And folks for the price you can't beat it. We booked our flight and our Grand Canyon tour through Golden Nugget also. I must say that last year we went to Niagra Falls in Canada and spent four days there and spent almost three hundrend dollars a night for the room that we stayed in and I have to be honest the room we had at the Golden Nugget was just as nice, and the service was far better than that hotel even thought about being. There is no doubt that we would recommend this hotel, and when we are ready to return to Las Vegas, this will be the hotel that we stay at again. So if you are looking for a nice hotel, with lots of charm and good friendly people to assist you then Golden Nugget is the place that you will want to stay. Another bonus it is right off of Fremont and you can see the light show each an every night a must see if you are in Las Vegas. All in all we cannot say enough good things about this hotel very much worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Different from past stays-not terrible, but different!”
Reviews.Author: michmi
Reviews.Content: I have always loved staying at the Nugget when I go to Vegas and have stayed there multiple times. This time, with the Landry's purchase, I noticed a definite difference in the amount of staff visible and I also had issues I had never run into before at this property. Construction-We stayed in the North Tower, but the construction really wasn't disturbing us except at 6:30 AM when the equipment started up. It's construction, it is what it is. Staff-No doorman on our arrival at 6:00 PM. The usual daytime doorman was there at the south entrance on other days, but apparently this is the only door staff they have kept on. He is a gem-always knows what's going on, who needs to go where, etc. If they take him away, I will really be disappointed. Anyway, on arrival, we were told there were no double bed smoking rooms in either tower, only 1 king smoking or double beds/no smoking. When I stated that wasn't acceptable, the desk person magically came up with a double bed smoking room in the North Tower and wanted to charge us an extra $25.00 a night for it. I said no, this charge was taken off and we got that room for the price we originally paid. Housekeeping--on past visits, the housekeeping staff was very generous with matches, shampoo, soap, etc. This is a small thing, but I noticed that every day we got exactly 2 books of matches and nothing else. I don't dine at the Nugget since there are many other reasonable places to go with better food, so I don't have much to say about it. They are hiding the construction well, so I really wouldn't say that the hotel or the casino are torn up. The pool was closed for construction, but I expected that so I wasn't disappointed. I am in the process of planning another trip to Vegas later in the year and I think that until the new tower is open, I'm going to stay away from the Nugget....it wasn't a horrible visit, but it was different than my previous stays, which were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Previous favorite, now may not return...”
Reviews.Author: sbowen0823
Reviews.Content: I have only stayed at the Nugget once before, and my mom has stayed every year for the past 5 years or so. I have to say, I was very unimpressed this stay with the staff. My husband and I, and another couple (all in our mid 20's) arrived on May 7. We will probablly not return, as my mom, who is a perferred member, may not return as well. Front Desk - To being with, the South Tower Registration desk was closed, so we had to wait in line about 30 minutes to check in at the main registration desk.The staff at the front desk was friendly - however, after asking for rooms on the same floor, but NOT next door to each other...we recieved rooms next door to each other. Spa Staff -Upon getting to our rooms the guys headed out to gamble and the two girls inquired about getting a pedicure at the spa. Being a Sunday late afternoon we didnt think they would be too busy. After calling 2 times in a row, and sitting on hold for about 10 minutes each time, without anyone answering, I called the operator for assistance. She rang the spa on the same number and on a different number but could not get anyone to answer either. She told us to go up to the Spa and that we should be ok to get an appointment being that we were hotel guest and would be a priority. Once we arrived at the Spa, the girl was on the phone and had us stand waiting for another 5-10 minutes. Once she finally got of the phone, she took another call and after a few minutes put her PERSONAL call on hold....and THEN addressed us. We asked if there were any appointments or openings for walk-ins availble for pedicures and she gave us a sharp and rude no. I asked "even for hotel guest?" and again got the same rude no and went back to the phone call. At this we turned to leave. Housekeeping - Once back at the room, we orded 4 drinks through room service and these arrived fine. However - the tray that they arrived on was still in the hallway 2 days later when we checked out. Along with my empty glasses on the table, which also sat there for two days. Housekeeping came and made the bed, but that was about it. We had to ask for more toilet paper the next day as well, again, after housekeeping came. They did not replace the soap or shampoo and conditioner either. Luckily, the last hotel that we stayed in DID and I took the remainder with me, so we used that the last night. Probablly will not stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “This gem has really lost its luster!”
Reviews.Author: california_vagabond
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I've stayed at the Golden Nugget about five times. When it was being managed by Tim and Tom, it was a fantastically hip place with lovely rooms. Now that it has been bought by Landry's almost everything has changed. The rooms are shabbier, the pool has been torn out (a new one is under construction), the spa is half-closed, the restaurants are now part of the Landry's chain and instead of promoting their poker room, they've turned back to slot-machine tournies. Also, the sizzling lounge music is gone! Meanwhile, prices have gone up and the staff are downright surly. What a shame!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: jenny5000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget from April 30th-May4th and thoroughly enjoyed it for the great price of $69.00 per night. I did notice that the casino was smokier than the strip hotels, but it is an older hotel and from reading other reviews we were prepared for it. We did rent a car, which was very convenient as all of the hotels on the strip have free valet or self-parking in their garages. We still did walk a lot as we would just park at one hotels and walk to all of the others. We also drove down to Hoover Dam and took the tour which was interesting and only a 1/2 hour to 45 mins away from Vegas. As far as food, we at the Carson Street Cafe at the hotel once and it was ok. My husband asked for his steak cooked medium and it came back rare. We sent it back and it came back well-done. The server told us that they don't know what medium is and you'll either get it rare or well-done...maybe eating at 1:00 in the morning had something to do with it? I think that his ribeye steak, eggs, hashbrowns and toast was only $7.99--a special from 12-5am. We also had the lunch buffet which was $7.99 as well and had good food for the price. They even left some breakfast foods out for those of us who slept in and missed breakfast. We did go to Bellagio for the lunch buffet and it was PHENOMINAL, of course it was a lot more expensive ($19.99pp, I think) but it was worth every penny. If you stay at GN, don't forget to check out the downtown area. We didn't notice all of the shops and restaurants until the morning that we were leaving as I went to go search for another casino to check out. The laser light show is connected to the hotel, but unfortunately we didn't get a chance to see it. On a last note, if you plan to see the free Pirate's Show at Treasure Island, make sure that it is not windy. If the wind is over 15mph they cancel it. Overall, great trip and we would definately would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Class of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First visit to Las Vegas and the Golden Nugget is the place to stay if downtown. Preferred Fremont to strip but if you want opulence, the strip is the place to be if you can put up with the loud-mouthed drunks roaming the streets and I'm talking about the tourists, not the locals. Room at Nugget was very spacious and the staff was courteous. Check in does take a while but that's the only complaint. Pool undergoing renovation which apparently was sorely needed. Four Queens is right next door and best place if you play blackjack on a budget. Always $5 tables available. Hourly light show ("Fremont Street Experience") wasn't all that great but that's not why we went. Will stay there again on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: good hotel just dont make any international calls or you will run up a huge bill in SECONDS also the laundry service was a rip off. not a bad location, if you dont want to go to the main strip often because you will have to pay alot in taxis. other then that everything was cool.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget is classy but not snobby”
Reviews.Author: BrotherSmith
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget Las Vegas Summary: The Golden Nugget is the best hotel-casino (of five) that we have stayed at in Las Vegas. It is classy but not snobby. When and why we stayed: We stayed at Golden Nugget for 3 nights in April 2006, during a holiday in the United States. Cost: $69 a night plus taxes. We booked with the hotel direct, via their website. The Room: We stayed in Room 1584 in the South Tower. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, with a huge king-sized bed and a view of the mountains. We were very impressed with the service. One evening our toilet started overflowing. I called room service – within minutes a plumber and an army of housekeepers appeared to fix the fault and clean up. The Hotel: The Golden Nugget Laughlin is a casino. It is elegant and stylish, decorated with chandeliers and mirrors. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. We ate in two of the hotel’s restaurants: twice at the Carson Street Café, which serves well-cooked and reasonably priced (by UK standards) food. The service could have been better. We ate breakfast at The Buffet. It may not be fancy like Bellagio’s or Wynn’s, but is cosy, cheap ($6.99 for breakfast), with typical buffet breakfast fare to fill empty stomachs. Don’t miss the buffet’s speciality bread and butter pudding – creamy and delicious – cooked to Steve Wynn’s (a previous owner) Mum’s own recipe. The service is attentive and friendly. There is also an open 24-hours Starbucks – its patio makes a great place to chill out, take a caffeine-fix, and watch the amazing Fremont Street Experience light show. The casino set the prices – they are noticeably higher than in Starbucks elsewhere. The 24 Karat (slot) club was offering a $10 free play offer for new members, so we joined, despite our British scepticism that if something is too good to be true then it probably is. We were wrong - this was a genuine offer. The 24 Karat club gave same-day cash back and we played (and lost) enough during our 3 days stay to be comped two buffet breakfasts. Location: On Fremont Street, in Downtown (old) Las Vegas. I think Downtown Vegas is vastly under-rated. Along with gambling, it offers history, entertainment, shopping and excellent restaurants. For somewhere special - eat at the Center Stage in the Plaza – reasonably-priced gourmet food and service in a romantic setting with spectacular views of Downtown’s neon and the Fremont Street Experience. A pianist playing standards serenades you. The strip is a short drive or bus ride away. The city: Las Vegas is the greatest city on earth. Feel free to E-mail me if you require further information.

Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: theroys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget April 18 to 24. Very enjoyable. This was our 4th stay at The Nugget, and our first since it was purchased by The Landry Group. I had read some reviews that sounded like the service was not what it used to be, but maybe that was just during the changeover, because we found the service to be top notch, even better than before. Very friendly staff, from valet, front desk, cashiers and maid service. Room was spotlessly clean with lots of shampoo, conditioner and lotions. Casino paid better than any other place we played downtown. Enjoyed a comped supper at the new steakhouse "Vic & Anthony's" and had a fantastic steak and lobster dinner, with great service. We will definetly be back to the Nugget on our next trip to Vegas. The only downside was the ongoing construction on the pool, but it looks like it is going to be a really nice addition and we were not bothered by noise.

Reviews.Title: “Still Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: fregow
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at the Golden Nugget (GN). Overall, it was another good experience. Check-in lines were long but moved pretty fast. South entrance check-in was closed during our entire 4 day stay. Not a big deal. Our room in the South tower was great and the house keeping service was perfect! We had a burned out light in our room that was replaced promptly. We requested a King/non-smoking and got it, as usual. One peeve was the lack of security next to the elevators leading up to our room. The GN casino has a nice feel to it but has always been "smokier" than almost every other casino. I don't know why this is but it sucks! And I never win at the GN. No problem, though. Binion's is 25 feet away! The Carson Street Cafe is not bad but is a bit expensive. The staff at the CSC is very friendly and fast. Construction was going on but was a non-issue. I just hope the great rates that the GN is famous for don't go away after the renovations are complete. Overall, another good experience at the GN and we'll go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The Nuggett is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided that after spedning some time on the strip that we would like to 'live' Downtown for a few days before we went home. That was a great decision. The Golden Nuggett is an amazing hotel. Not too big so you have a mile walk to your room and back. Not long queues for the elevators. The Breakfast buffett was wonderful and at $6.99 a bargan. The guy doing the poker lessons was great and very patient at showing us all how to play texas holdem. The rooms were big and clean, with great decor. Everyone in the hotel was helpful and courteous. When we left our bags were collected from our room and delivered straight into a taxi 2 hours later for our trip to the airport. This really was an amazing experience and to anyone that has not ventured 'downtown' you really do need to do it. The Nuggett is being refurbished at the moment, but apart from some, very prettily dercorated screens, which had 'we apologise for our dust' on them you would not have known. Well done the Nuggett, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not dissappointed, what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kelikesh
Reviews.Content: After visiting TripAdvisor for weeks to learn what other people had experienced, I decided to stay downtown at the Golden Nugget. I thoroughly enjoyed the stay 4/2-4/5. The lines were about 10-15 min. for check in, and I did have to go back later to the desk to pick up my coupon book, which they do not give out if you do not ask for them. ASK FOR IT!! It will save you money on food! We ate well at the GN, and with the coupons we were able to get 2 for 1 buffets for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Our first task after checking in, was to deposit our belongings into the room. We'd ask for help, but the bellman said he had 15 other guests ahead of us, so we hauled our stuff up to the room ourselves. Yes, we got put in the south tower, last room on the floor... but it was very quiet! Maid service was great.. make sure you leave a tip! Room was exactly what I expected it to be. Nice, clean, no complaints! We wanted to head out for the casino to check out the action. We're not big gamblers, but had a budget for each day, and was chomping at the bit to use it. First headed off to sign up for the 24 Karat Club, and get our playing cards. Did that at other casinos downtown, because I knew we wouldn't gamble just at the Golden Nugget. Played a few slots, headed off to Fitzgeralds, where I had already signed up online for their players card. Nice... took only a few minutes, and off to hit the slots. Remarkably, we played quite a bit (as entertainment, mind you, knowing we would eventually lose)but still have fun in the mean time. Stayed 'up' for the first 2 days, gambling on our winnings. The only games we played at Golden Nugget were penny machines, where we could play for hours and not lose over 40.00. The buffet at the GN was pretty decent. I liked the variety, and never walked away hungry. We managed to eat only two meals a day, and saved a bundle on our food budget. Unfortunately, we didn't get to try other places out, but we were very satisfied with the buffet there. We did try out the Carson St. Cafe one night, and the portions are big, very satisfying. Service is okay. Drink service is good when playing slots. Make sure you tip... they remember you and your drink! : ) For all you Video Poker Players out there, Golden Nugget has mostly 8/5, so I didn't play them, but there sure were alot of other players on them! I went down to Fitzgeralds to play there, and eventually into 4 Queens, where I won $400.00 on slots very easily! We ended up going to Laughlin, NV and the Grand Canyon in-between our stay at Golden Nugget, but had to return to Vegas to fly back home. While waiting for our flight to leave later that day, we went back downtown for about 5 hours, and hit the same spots to see what our luck would be. The 4 Queens was kind to me again with a 272.00 payout on slots, but I quickly burned that away at Golden Nugget. All in all, our stay there was great. Yes, the walk from the south tower is long... but we needed it from all the food we ate at the buffet! I would not hesitate to go there again... but maybe not gamble there! : )

Reviews.Title: “Think twice.”
Reviews.Author: DTro
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Sun evening and had a quite a long wait at check in. I got an upgrade for an extra $20. Probably wasted money. The room was nice, overlooked the mountains, but straight down was the pool construction. With that came a LOUD jackhammer every morning at 8:00 am. If you are a light sleeper, forget about it. Don't make the mistake I did and stay up til 4 or 5. 4 hours of sleep all week catches up with you. The GN didn't seem to care and they were well aware of it. I played a lot of poker in the poker room, and had a blast. I played a few table games and hit a nice "let it ride" hand with over $1000 winnings. You would've thought I robbed the joint. The floor came over, all grumpy to verify the hand, and gave me a few "I think you're cheating" looks. Jeez, lighten up. I loved downtown and the room was very nice, but I always thought the intent was to keep me at your place, and if it wasn't for the poker room, I would've played elsewhere the whole time, as my wife did. Now that I think about it the poker room was also lacking. No bad beat jackpot, high hand jackpot, or even rated play or comps. I hit two straight flushes and couldn't even get a hat out of them. One other thing...whoever designed "The Deuce" should be fired. Are you kidding me? Can people not walk more than a couple of blocks? It took almost two hours from downtown to the Excalibur. Talk about brutal. I'll be downtown again for sure, just not sure I'll be staying at the GN.

Reviews.Title: “Young staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: moonkwean
Reviews.Content: First time staying downtown. Was with my 80 year old mother in wheelchair and she had a blast. Once she was got over the unfamilarity of things she felt very comfortable. Every complaint brought to the attention of the staff was dealt with quickly. We changed rooms ( usual thing smoking in a non-smoking room, use of wheelchair ( bell captain have 3 for use no charge), and the bellperson even called down to Primm mall to see if wheelchair was available. Look forward to pool opening. Thanks. Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Stay away (at least until the construction is finished)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is the first time I stayed downtown. I understand that the experience is a bit different from the strip. The GN is nicely decorated and our room was clean. We requested an upgrade at check in and received it; however, the conditions were terrible! Our room looked directly to the Plaza Hotel with an awesome view of the mountains in the background. Unfortunately, the view was hindered by the construction going on directly below. Construction started at 8:00 am every morning, but not your usual construction. Heavy machines making pulsating jackhammer-ish sounds constantly for hours on end; therefore, sleeping in was not an option. Every night/morning I dreamed that the housekeeper was knocking on the door, but then I awoke to the construction sounds. I can only compare this sound to the "Chinese water torture"- constant and slowly drove me crazy. I expected more from this hotel-more gaming machines, more room and more clean air. I think because the hotel is under construction that the actual gaming facility was reconfigured and "schrunched." I thought there would be more modern slot machines, but only a handful were to be found. The casino contained more older three reel machines than I have ever seen at another casino. Rarely were people playing those machines. The air quality in the casino would be an issue for non smokers (as I am). I am concerned that the GN casino's ventilation system is not up to par. There was a constant haze of smoke hovering around the casino, especially in the evening. The smoke just lingered in the room. My eyes often teared up and watered, I would often sneeze and cough while in the casino; however, if I went to a nearby casino (Fremont, Binions or Fritzgerald's), I did not have this problem. Once again, it may be because of construction. The hotel did not have a pool or spa/salon open during construction, which was a bit of a disappointment. I thought that maybe the hotel would offer guests the option of accessing another hotel's pool/poolside, but they did not. I spent more time at neighboring casinos and won a small amount. I lost at the GN. I had fun at the GN's Let it Ride table, though (my husband had success at the poker room, too). I got bored with the limited slot machines at GN. Overall, the hotel is quite nice and reasonably priced. The hotel's food was fine, but nothing spectacular. The buffet line is usually long and food choice is limited. I loved the cheese blinzes at the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, want to go again!”
Reviews.Author: kittee
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas, this is the first time I have stayed downtown and I enjoyed the Golden Nugget as an economical change of pace. Can't beat the location and value. Didn't gamble there but was great home base in the center of Fremont St. Experience. Check-in took a little long but was acceptable, lines were actually short compared to what we saw at other times while we were there. Only ate at Lillie's Noodle House (at the GN) and it was exceptional. Elevators were very fast and rooms were clean. My only complaint was that the first 2 days the sheets on our King bed were too small and wouldn't stay tucked in. Can't wait to go back and see their new pool and other improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mrs_V
Reviews.Content: As usual, we had a great stay at the Golden Nugget. We're looking forward to returning once the pool area and spa are completed. They are also adding another tower and a nightclub over Fremont Street...we can't wait to see those! Check-in went okay; we checked in quite late on a Sat evening. We requested king rooms in the North tower, but were given double rooms in the South tower. However, Sunday aftn we were able to move to our requested rooms for the duration of our stay. It did seem that throughout our stay the registration area was filled with people pretty much the entire day every day. Perhaps they need more people on staff here. This hotel is VERY CLEAN throughout, and the decor is very elegant. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are dimly lit though and could use a bit more lighting. The cleaning staff did an excellent job in our room, even though our daily tips were not over the top. The TV in our North tower room only received a handful of channels, but it wasn't a big deal as our TV viewing was very limited. (Who watches much TV in Vegas?!) We ate at THE buffet a few times and thoroughly enjoyed each meal. It is a consistent, high-quality buffet, and the atmosphere is very nice and comfortable. The wait in line is a bit long at times, but it is worth it. The construction is hardly noticeable, and unless you have been here before (which we have) you may not realize how much they are doing. I agree with other reviewers that the mannequin playing the piano in the area just off registration is kind of creepy and should be removed. We did not redeem our comps because we know they are not too generous. We figure we are best to let them accumulate. We're not really big gamblers, so we don't expect much anyway. We did find a couple slot machines that were fairly "friendly", so we were at least able to keep playing without losing all of our money right away. No big wins though. :( The anticipated changes to this hotel are very exciting, and we look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: KrAshton
Reviews.Content: Hubby & I stayed at the Nugget 3/30 & 3/31. We arrived around 5pm and got checked in right away. The shuttle dropped us off at the south doors. There was no visible bell service and we had to shlep our luggage and ourselves to the north desk, only to be sent back to the south tower to our room. Mentioned it was our anniversary and the front desk clerk assured us an upgrade. Made it up to our room only to discovery two small full-sized beds. Called the front desk and they sent a bellman to help us move down the hall to a king bed (no visible upgrade, BTW). Still can't understand why there were none available at check-in, maybe you need to be a high roller. The room was very nice, w/ a slight view. We were on a no smoking floor but our room still reeked, fortunately I anticipated this and brought along a room freshener. Avoid the Carsen Cafe at all cost. We had a wait both times we ate there. A long line w/ a half full restaurant and I'm being generous to say the food is average, at best. If you've ever been to the caribbean, it was like the entire staff was on Jamaican time. It was quite surprising to us, normally they WANT you in and out so you can keep gambling. The staff, front desk, store, casino and even the cafe, were all vey friendly. Overall, the hotel is nice and will be even nicer once the remodling is complete. The location was cool. We made it out to see the Freemont Experience on Friday night, but there was technical difficulties so no show. We'd might look in to staying there again. Downtown is very different than the strip, I couldn't say one was better than the other, just different.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Clean”
Reviews.Author: 4kellys
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas and stayed in the Golden Nugget (downtown) March 25 through March 30. The only complaint we had is that we had requested a king room, and when we checked in we were given a two double-beds room. The very next day, however, we were moved to a king room. A bellman moved all our luggage for us. Our room was in the north tower--a much better location than the south tower. The hotel itself, as well as the rooms, was very clean, and the decor was beautiful. There was some construction going on, but it was not distracting at all. They have walls up around the areas that are being worked on, and had I not known that there was construction, I would not have even noticed. This was our first time at the Golden Nugget, and we will most likely stay there again when we return to Vegas. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time @ the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed July 05 and are going back May/June 06. The staff weren't the greatest, but for the price, location, HIGHLY recommended buffet, and very clean room this place was fantastic. I have stayed in far better 4 star hotels, however this is so much better than I expected. I read a few reviews from this site and some opinions weren't in favor of the nugget but it impressed us so much that we're staying there on the second leg of our trip. We're staying @ the Excalibur for the first, so look for my review of that one ;o). Check out my pictures from our fist trip. It was very clean and spacious. The pool area was awesome too! The BEST buffet in Vegas is by far @ the Nugget. Every place in Vegas is a great place to stay if it doesn't have children there. This is not a town for kids, but if you do have them I suggest Circus Circus, it's very fun and obnoxious there, kids love it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my first visit to Las Vegas on Monday, March 13-18. I went with two friends for a vacation. We are all in our mid twenties and have been doing a lot of research to find good deals on places to stay, eat, and play in Las Vegas. Although many people have recommended for us to stay on the strip, we liked the low minimums and cheap eats that the downtown had to offer. We did rent a car and visited the strip everyday. We decided to stay at the nicest hotel downtown...the Golden Nugget. I read some great reviews and poor ones as well, but we tried our luck at this hotel. I found a great deal on Priceline for $60 a night ($17 a day for a full-size rental car with unlimited milage as well!). The check in lines were all bunched together and it seemed unorganized. After checking in, we had to call back down to get another room because our non-smoking room was stinking of smoke. Finally, we settled in to our room. It was very average. The beds were small and nothing like the 2 queen beds that were promised. I expected more from a 4 star hotel. We also made a reservation with the front desk (as recommended at check in) to get the airport shuttle so we could pick up our rental car the next day. The shuttle never came (we waited 45 minutes). After asking the front desk about it, they said there was nothing they could do because it's a separate company. Why offer a service then? I could have just called myself and made a reservation. The pool and fitness center was being renovated so we couldn't use either of them. After asking about an alternative location to work out in, they said they couldn't do anything for us. Overall, I felt that the Golden Nugget didn't offer very much and didn't try to accomodate us.
