The casino dealers were not very nice either which was surprising for the many donations we made to the casino! I was even charged 40 cents for a cup of water at the Starbucks inside! I didn't like the lay out of the casino either. I can't put my finger on it, but my friends and I thought it was very odd. We're use to going to the Tropicana in Atlantic City, NJ (which is only a 3 star hotel) and the Tropicana blew them out of the water with amenities and services. The only thing I did enjoy was their $5.99 breakfast buffet which offered many healthy choices and was very good. We enjoyed the downtown scene and liked that we could walk to a variety of casinos within 5 minutes. The minimums were very low ($1 at some tables) and we had fun trying out the different drinks. Mermaids sell frozen drinks for a dollar, but they sell out of cups quickly (before 6pm) so try to get them early. The Four Queens sell a 52 ounce football for $6 which made us all feel better about our losses. The 99 cent shrimp cocktail at the Golden Gate was surprisingly good was one of our favorite night time spots. On the next visit to Las Vegas, I will definitly stay at a strip casino. They are beautiful. There is free valet parking at every strip casino and each one we parked out was quick and polite. The strip casinos don't seem as smokey and there are more to see and do. The Golden Nugget did not impress me at all and I probably will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Downtown - But not the Strip Experience”
Reviews.Author: JQuatt21
Reviews.Content: I had just recently stayed 5 days and 4 nights at the Golden Nuggett in downtown Las Vegas. The purpose of this trip was to attend a training conference for my business. This was my first real trip to Las Vegas (my first strip was when I was a child) and did not know what to expect. Here is what I think about the Golden Nuggett. Rooms: For Value, The Golden Nuggett is the best in downtown Las Vegas. If you dont want to spend $200 and above for a room like you will at some strip Casino's but stay in a nice hotel; the Golden Nuggett is the place for you. The room was clean and had everything like soap, shampoo, lotion etc. It also had an ironing board, iron, safe, high speed internet access ($12 a day)and in house movies. The room also had a safe so if you wanted to place some of your valuables in the safe, you could. The room in which I stayed in was a standard King Room. The bed and pillows were nice and comfortable. ( I was in the South Tower - 22nd top floor) There are no balconies at the Golden Nuggett and I did not have much of a view. (View of one of the Plaza Hotel Towers and the parking garage below) The room did not smell and was extremely quiet which was nice when I wanted to sleep. Casino: The Casino at the Golden Nuggett is small but the cleanest and classiest of all the Downtown Casino's. You can tell a difference when you enter any other casino downtown and you enter the Golden Nuggett Casino. It is probably the busiest downtown but the tighest with slot payouts. If you want loose slot payouts, try Fitzgeralds down Freemont Street. They have many 5 dollar tables during the week but once thursday came along, $10 minimums were the norm. Try any other Casino's downtown for constant $5 dollar and less hands. They have a small high limit area that was usually empty along with a small high limit slot area. If you are a true high limit player, this is not the casino for you in the fact that they have few high limit machines to choose from. If you are a nickle and penny player, I did not see many nickle machines and not one penny machine. Mostly .25 cent and dollar and up machines. Try Fiztgeralds, 4 queens, binions, or golden gate for smaller machines. Finally, their slot club "the 24 karat club" currently at this time gives you when u sign up $10 in free slot play. You then accumulate points towards merchandise and other comps so they say. I played mostly at the Golden Nugget and played max credits on .25 and $1.00 machines all week at hours at a time. In 5 days, I earned about 650 points which I though was good. I asked and was told that I needed 1500 points for a meal comp and $15 slot play. Also, if you dont play over $25 a hand on the tables, you dont get rated. (it states it on the back of the card) The slot club is not worth it unless you visit yearly. Food: Most of the restaraunts are closed at this time due to renovations. There are three open at this time which are "Carsons Street Cafe, The Buffett, and Vic and Anthony's." Carsons Street cafe has a little of everything and allows you to play Keno while you dine. Its a relaxed atmosphere with decent service. prices are ok and the restaraunt is open 24 hours. The Buffett has decent food. It is prob the best buffet on the strip by quality of food, atmosphere, and service. It is the most expensive buffet (14 dollars for dinner and about 8 for breakfast) but food quality is the best. Vic and Anthony's is the Golden Nuggett's version of a fancy strip type restaraunt. I did not get a chance to eat there but people say the food is pretty good but there is better value on the strip and better views on the strip. Finally, there is a small snack bar and starbucks located by the front entrance to freemont street. Service: The one thing about the Golden Nuggett that stands out is the service. Everyone from the bellman who picked up my luggage to the front desk, operators, and bar tenders; everyone was excellent. Even one morning, I called for a wakeup call and woke up ahead of schedule. i had forgotten to call and cancel. I then hear a p.a. announcement for me on the loud speaker. I call the operator and she just wanted to track me down to make sure I was ok because they didnt get a hold of me. I though that was excellent. I had no trouble checking in during the day and when I went to check out, they allowed me to use the VIP checkout because the front desk was extremely busy. (start of NCAA Tournament - Everyone was checking in) I thought that was excellent. Getting to/from McCarran & The Strip: If you take a cab from McCarran Int'l Airport, plan on paying about 25 to 30 bucks with tip to get to the Nuggett. It dosent matter if they take the highway or the side streets, its all the same money. If you can afford it, its the fastest way. If you want, you can take a shuttle service that you can book online from an indepent company. If you want to go to the Strip, you will pay a hefty amount each way. Its about 20 buck each way from the Golden Nuggett to The Venetian for an example. If you want to save some money and have the time to spend, you can take the Bus which is called the "Duce". For 5 bucks, you can buy a 24 hour pass which you can ride as much as you want for 24 hours. You can pickup the bus at the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Freemont. The Bus makes many stops and takes about 1/2 hour to get from the Nuggett to the Stardust for an example. Meeting Rooms: The Convention Center and Meeting Rooms were very cozy and can accomodate many different types of groups. Our group had about 212 people and it was perfect. Nice place for small meetings and groups. The pool, spa, and fitness center were all closed at the time. All in all, if you are looking for the Vegas that everyone knows, the Nuggett is not the place! This place saw an older crowd and dont recommend it for younger people. It is better in the fact that the table limits are cheaper and room prices are cheaper but if you are looking for the strip experience every minute of the day, dont stay downtown. Downtown is cool to visit but not to stay 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “It was charming!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had never been downtown so we thought we would stay at what we were told was the **** Hotel & Casino on Fremont. We were right and very pleasantly surprised. Downtown is definitely an older crowd tho, and in no way compares to the strip, but if you like a laid back, no clubs, no screaming young people feel, then The Nugget is the place to be and so is downtown. Their buffet has good food and is reasonably priced and their room prices we found to be very affordable on average about $69.00 a night for a nice room with a king size bed. The staff was very friendly and even though there is construction going on, everything is very clean and there is no noise that we noticed. The parking for the hotel is free and accross the street and we had a great time. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Changes are coming”
Reviews.Author: QueryK
Reviews.Content: Our visit was very good, but staying at the Nugget this weekend was a bit like saying goodbye to an old friend. Although the changes are just beginning, I think the Landry Corporation is going in the wrong direction. The first problem we encountered was that both Lillie Langtree’s and Stefano’s have been closed, yet last week both were still listed on the Nugget’s web-site. That leaves only Vic and Anthony’s as a dinner house choice. While I’m sure that Vic and Anthony’s is a great restaurant, their menu is a little pricey for Downtown, similar to those of Morton’s Steakhouse. There were 9 people in our party and we all noticed that it appears there have been some cuts in staffing. There was no security at the South Tower elevators after 10 PM and considering the neighborhood, that was surprising. The staffing problem was also evident at the Carson Street Café on Saturday morning. There was a long line for seating which extended down the corridor, yet when we were seated at least one-third of the tables were empty. We asked why and were told that were no servers for those stations. It was also next to impossible to find a cocktail waitress in the Casino all three nights we were there. I talked to some employees that I have known through staying at the Nugget four or five times a year, and the plans for the Nugget are surprising for a downtown hotel. They are adding some Designer Boutique stores, an large aquarium with a seafood restaurant, and a grotto type swimming pool with a waterfall. I’m sure the hotel will be lovely when all the renovations are complete, and I am equally sure that the cost of the renovations will be reflected in the prices. I do hope the Landry Corporation understands that no amount of renovation will attract the people who prefer the strip to a downtown hotel, no matter how elegant. I also hope they understand that the Nugget has always had a core of loyal customers who can be driven away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: putergeek
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the GN and absolutely loved it. The room was very big (South Tower) and very clean. I keep reading about the construction and wanted to comment on it. Yes, there are some areas that are under construction but it's nothing that bad! From some of the reviews I read, some people make it sound like there is saw dust and nails all over, but in reality, it's not bad at all. You see a few roped off sections or a big wall blocking off a small area, but that's it. I heard no noise in my room and didn't hear much noise at all downstairs. I think the wallks block noise and dust. The one thing that is closed is the pool, but it's to open pretty soon. If you were going to stay at the GN to swim, that's the only reason I'd tell you to go to another hotel. Other than that, the place was great. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Here's a few tips:”
Reviews.Author: glb310
Reviews.Content: My stay was Friday, 2/24 through Sunday, 2/26. The GN is under construction but with the exception of a few signs displayed here and there you would never know as I expected to see scaffolding, plastic drop cloths and ladders everywhere. The upgrades/repairs were performed quickly and almost invisibly. Here’s some tips if you are budget-minded or on a schedule: Check-in was quick but use the “fast” check-out The South tower is cheaper and the rooms were better than expected. Insist on a non-smoking room and use the allergy excuse if you need to. The GN casino is less “smoky” than their neighbors. The buffet is okay but walk two blocks down to Main Street Station and you will get a much better deal for the same price The spa is closed but they do offer in-room massages They have a Starbucks. Perfect location to view the “Freemont Experience” which occurs every hour The slot that paid off for me was the one against the wall that has the spin option on top and I don’t mean the Wheel of Fortune Save the $40 taxi ride to/from the airport and take the public bus named “The Deuce.” Take a cab from the airport to Mandalay Bay ($10.50 w/o tip) and then the Deuce ($2.00 one-way w/o tip) to the Golden Nugget). Reverse the trip back to the airport. I discovered the Deuce by accident and it is a great way to get up and down Las Vegas Boulevard. The double-decker buses are new, clean, efficient and monitored by closed-circuit TV. The Monorail is great during heavy traffic periods but does not go downtown and it costs $5.00 every time you get on or off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: darmf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 5 nights Feb 14th to the 18th in the South Tower on 21st floor overlooking the strip. Lovely large room with two queen beds. The food in the cafe was not worth the wait in line, the buffet was better. Our only complaint was the smoke in the casino was so strong we could only stay for a couple of hours before we couldn't stand it any longer. All the casinos were smokey except for the newer ones at Bellagio, Paris, Venetian, Wynn, and Mandalay Bay, so it is possible to have ventilation to remove excess smoke and I hope this is planned for at the Golden Nugget. Did not see anyone win big at the slots. The slots at the Golden Gate seemed to be paying the most frequently, and the diner at Golden Gate was great. The only big winners we saw were playing poker.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget - YUCK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh my. Our Stay at the Golden Nugget was terrible. The reservation agents were cold, stone faced individuals who obviously needed to reconsider their chosen vocation. The room was gross, the air smelled like it has been uncirculated in years and we were in a "non-smoking" room at that. It was SO noisy, sounded like we were in the middle of a boiler room. We will Never stay down-town again. Those of you who have written great reviews of the Golden Nugget obviously have never stayed in a real 4 or 5 star hotel. I can only compare the GN to an upgrade from a doublewide trailer...

Reviews.Title: “golden nugget was nice”
Reviews.Author: dianenjnj
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to las vegas. we stayed at the golden nugget and paid $139/night. we stayed from fri. feb 17 through monday, feb 20, which was the President's Day Weekend. we checked in at around 4:00pm and were assigned room 520 in the north tower (the north tower considered a good location). i had called previous to our visit to request a room that was in a convenient location since my husband has arthritis and i had my doubts that we would be assigned a north tower room when i was told they could not assign a room but would note it in our file but they did. north tower is more convenient to casino and fremont street, but due to construction, south tower is more convenient to the temporary hotel entrance/taxi stand and cafe. the room had two queen beds and was small. view over the parking garage. asked for king bed smoking, got 2 queen non smoking. the bathroom was very small, but overall the room was clean although the second day (we left a $4.00 tip for the maid day 1 and 2) the maid didn't bother to wash out two glasses and left them half filled with soda. so third day no tip. my biggest complaint was that the room was very, very stuffy, even after turning the airconditioning on high. also, i agree with the person who said the room smelled, yes indeed it did, so much so that i awoke in the middle of the night choking on that awful "perfumy" smell which i think was pumped in through the ventilation system. plumbing/hot water/water pressure was fair. the drainage on tub/shower was slow, but toilet flush was good. sink water when turned on leaked on the counter. the food at the hotel cafe was good and the service was good. we found that you had to be in the cafe before 8:00am if you wanted breakfast without waiting on line to get in. for lunch we waited on line for about 30 or so minutes on sunday at noon for a smoking table for 2, however non smokers didn't have to wait more than 5 to 10 minutes. bar service was good, drinks moderately priced and slot machines tight. overall, i'd rate the gn good/fair. however, we would return and i think that in the future when refurbishing is complete it will be a great place to stay and look forward to booking in august/september when most of the work is scheduled to be complete.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what the fuss is all about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the GN Feb 9 - 12. We have been reading the reviews from this site since we booked back in September. We read a few good ones, but most people didn't have a high opinion of the GN. We got a great deal and pleasantly surprised when we got there. Yes, there was construction going on around the building and a little on the inside of the building, but nothing that put us out. We stayed in the south tower where there wasn't a view but we didn't go to Vegas to stay in our hotel room and look out the window. It was clean, comfortable, and a very nice stay all around. There were no lines checking in and the express checkout is so easy. The employees at the GN were all very nice and helpful. We had no problems with the noise, the supposed long walk to the casino, or anything else with the hotel. We would definitely stay there again if we were to stay downtown. It is by far the most classy hotel in the Fremont area. Besides the GN, however, I would recommend taking a helicopter ride over the strip at sunset, very smooth. I would also recommend any men out there who plan on proposing to their girlfriends, to take them on the gondolas at the Venetian. The gondolier just happened to be from the Chicagoland area where I grew up. Then he mysteriously developed an Italian accent and began to sang. After passing under the bridge of love, my boyfriend proposed. It was the most romantic proposal that could ever be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: GK95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget over Valentine's Day. Booked 3 nights on the Golden Nugget website and received a great value - buy 2 nights at $65 and get the 3rd night free, a $20 coupon to any Landry's restaurant in the country, and a coupon book with 1/2 price coupons to the buffet and free drink coupons. The staff was very nice and always cleaning the property. The check in at night was too long -they need more staff. And I too think that they should have advised guests on their website that they are doing construction (a lot of it). But all in all it was a great experience. I am fussy about my hotel rooms and was delighted to see that these were very, very clean. We stayed in the South tower, which is a bit of a ways from the casino, but it is right across from the parking garage, which was nice. We have stayed on the Strip in the past at a major hotel and felt that the Golden Nugget was much better and the staff friendlier. We knew going into it that there were no 5 star restaurants and fantastic shows in the Downtown area and that was okay with us (although the Golden Nugget seems to be getting better shows lately). Downtown is really coming back into its own and we will stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most hotels in downtown, but needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: Blueglass74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under construction and they should put that on their website. There is not a spa or a pool at this time. The rooms are average size and clean. The mattresses have those old fashion springs in them and they squeak! I laughed when I sat on the bed for the first time. The casino is smaller than the large hotels on The Strip which I liked. I thought that staff was friendly and I liked how there were vending machines on each floor. The cost for the tables were reasonable during the day. At night they went up to $25.00. I think that is a bit high for this hotel considering it is in downtown and not on The Strip. We ended up gambling at other locations down the street which only had $5.00 black jack tables. The biggest problem about staying down town is trying to find a good place to eat. There is a couple of restaurants at the Golden Nugget but outside of the hotel there is not much to eat. We managed to find a McDonalds after walking around and also a Tony Romas. If you want to just gamble and not do to much else, than I recommend staying here. If you want to see a lot and be entertained, I recommend "The Strip" area. Downtown is about $20.00 -$30.00 from The Strip by Taxi. Also, check out some hotel called The California in this area. Tons of people from Hawaii stay there. I didn't know about it, but maybe it is nicer than The Golden Nugget. If you do stay at The Golden Nugget, make sure you see the largest found "Golden Nugget" which is on display near the spa tower. My prediction: I think Freemont & The Golden Nugget will be better in a few years. I am sure Landry's, who recently purchased this hotel, will buy up properties around this area and clean it up. I bet they will add their chain restaurants and Ferris wheel and all that stuff. I do hope that when and if they take over Freemont that they keep some of the local casinos and beef jerky stores rent prices reasonable. I have a feeling that they plan on changing this entire area!! But for now, it is ok and old… :(

Reviews.Title: “No Longer 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Golden Nuggett off and on since 1994 and have always considered it to be the crown jewel of downtown Vegas. No longer is that the case. I took advantage of a recent promotion for Private Arrangement members and stayed from 2/6/06-2/9/06 because I wanted to see how the new owners (Landry's Restaurants) were handling things. When I arrived, there was considerable construction/renovation taking place. They never mentioned that when I made the reservation or is it mentioned on their website. The front entrance is closed and you are directed to the valet area. The pool and spa are closed. It looks like the pool won't be ready until at least late spring. The lobby area is being revamped and they have put in a mannequin of an African American playing a piano off to one side. The piano plays continuous electronic music. I don't know what they were thinking of when they did that. When you walk from the South Tower to the casino area, construction is going on pretty much 24/7. Everything is being changed to a brown motif including the carpeting. The rooms haven't changed yet. When I requested a late check out, I was denied. They have already installed their signature steakhouse, Vic & Anthony's. I didn't eat there but the menu and prices are no different than a Ruth Chris' steakhouse. All in all, I would rate this 3 stars for now until all the construction is finished. I would give them at least 6 months before I go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Landry's Losing Loyalty”
Reviews.Author: JLO
Reviews.Content: We have been regulars at the Nugget for many years, juggling our vacation dates to be sure we could get a room, sending friends to the Nugget and shunning offers from strip hotels. Our decade long loyalty has been severely tested by the new owners of this property. While we compliment the company for making renovations and improvements, there was no notice to guests at the time of reservation that this would be going on. The pool is closed and the spa is closed. We would not have come to Las Vegas had we known this, and when we complained, the offer of compensation was $20 off our room rate. So silly - considering our room was comped anyway. A real insult. Management was firm and unyielding. Without the spa and pool, the Golden Nugget is just an expensive downtown hotel room. If we just wanted a room, Binion's has them for $39. We were sadly disappointed at the poor planning (taking reservations without telling the potential guest that amenities were out of order) and even more troubled by the "Joe's Crab Shack" mentality toward resolving the issue. We will give the Nugget another chance - ONE more chance. Landry's has yet to learn the fragility and importance of loyalty when it comes to Vegas regulars. We sure hope they do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great service!”
Reviews.Author: loveairplanes
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Las Vegas and our first stay downtown. We found the rooms very clean, quiet, with excellent service. We have stayed at other hotels on the strip and the rooms are not as clean, quiet or decorated as nice as the Golden Nugget. I'm not sure why another person in their review is complaining about food stuck on the counter in their room. Did they call housekeeping and mention the problem? I'm sure if they did, it would of not been overlooked and taken care of right away. That is just the way the Golden Nugget operates, service, service, service. The only 4 star hotel for 29 years running. If you have never been to Las Vegas before or are under the age of 35, you are probably better off staying on the Las Vegas Strip. Downtown is quieter and more for the 35 + crowd. Downtown hotels offer buffets for $5.00 - $6.00 cheaper than their strip counterparts. The Golden Nugget, Freemont Hotel and Mainstreet Station hotel offered cheaply priced buffets and we found them to be very tasty. Binions offers a $4.99 12oz steak special in their downstairs restaurant which was also very good. Shopping is very convenient and direct via the city transit bus (3 blocks from the hotel) Approximately 10 minutes away is the Premium Outlet mall and Meadows Mall. The Galleria at Sunset mall is a a little further away, but a quick 20 minute direct bus ride down the freeway (no stops inbetween) We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, because they aim to please you with their service.

Reviews.Title: “Did we stay at the same hotel???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The computers were down the entire time I was there. They did not have my correct reservation and had "lost" the reservations of my colleagues. Further, the fitness facilities are closed for the foreseeable future. Definitely won't return.

Reviews.Title: “The class act of Downtown Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to the Nugget in the last 10 years and it never fails to live up to its reputation. Great rooms, nice casino (that succeeds in not being cheesey like others in the area), friendly employees, parking right across the street in covered garage (free) and usually very good rates - even great rates using Priceline (Bid 4**** hotels downtown as the Nugget is the only one ) I paid about $60 a night. I realize downtown isn't for everyone but it still have the flavor of old Vegas - sure I loved staying at the Venetian but I paid 3x the price.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget stay was terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget on Jan. 10, 11, 12, 2006. The winter deal online was a great value - buy 2 nights, get 1 free. I have been to Las Vegas 3 times before and never stayed downtown. From now on, I'll probably stay at the Golden Nugget because I love it downtown. The hotel was beautiful and always full of action. The rooms were very nice- I only wished they had a coffeemaker in the room. The bathroom was a little small, but that's really a minor thing in my opinion. The employees were friendly to us - no complaints there. In previous reviews I read about the time-share solicitors hassling people...we saw them around and they approached us twice but were not persistant when we said "no thanks". The buffet was very good, but there was always a line to get in. The slots were good to us at the Golden Nugget and everywhere else downtown. It was nice to be able to visit so many other casinos within an easy walking distance. We never felt "in danger" at all. The Four Queens was the best freebies when you sign up for their players club. We entered slot tournaments and had a blast. My companion played Texas hold em at the GN and came out ahead. Even though we didn't win any big jackpots, we won enough to keep playing and had a grand time. The Fremont Street experience was a must see also. I highly recommend the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Restored Glory!”
Reviews.Author: RDCollins
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in early January 2006 while on business nearby. My client had recommended it and frankly I was skeptical -- I'm more of a Bellagio kind of guy. However, I was surprised at how nice the hotel was. It's undergoing a nearly finished renovation and it simply sparkles! It has sort of a 50s chic thing going -- elaborate, glittery, over-the-top. The public areas are clean and polished and very appealing -- if you like the older style. For the price, The Golden Nugget is hard to beat! My room was in the south tower, which is a distance from the casino and restaurants. Not a big deal, but it could be a bother if you have problems getting around or make frequent trips to your room. The décor was nicely done with new paint, wallpaper, carpet, and furnishings. I had a problem with the TV when I arrived, but that was promptly repaired. The only negative regarding the room was the old-fashioned air conditioner/heater, one of those units mounted inside the room under the window -- it was loud, so I had to sleep with it turned off. But the room was otherwise quiet and the bed comfortable. Nice bathroom, too. Good high-speed Internet access, but at a price of $12 per day. But like most Vegas restaurants, no coffee in the room -- that sucks! Also, the hotel is a long way from the Strip, so if your going to Vegas to see the Bellagio, the Wynn, and all the other truly wonderful places on the Strip, you probably won't be happy here. But if you're coming to gamble, to relax, and to see a bit of OLD Vegas, this place is great! A couple of observations: Compared to the high-end hotels on the Strip, this place is Sun City. I estimate that the average age of the patrons during my stay was over 70 years old. That makes it easy to get in the restaurants -- most oldsters seem to prefer the buffet or the inexpensive coffee shop or one of the cheaper eateries in the nearby hotels. But the odd thing, at least to me, was how busy the casino was -- much more action than in the Strip hotels where I usual stay. The first night I ate in the new streak restaurant, Vic & Anthony's, which had been open only 2 weeks. I travel all over the U.S. on business and pleasure, and I don't deny myself nice meals in good restaurants. I thought this place was incredible! It's one of the most sensuous eateries I've seen in a long, long time. Dark, moody, great art deco surroundings, excellent service, great food, but expensive even by L.A. standards. The second night I ate at the Italian place in the hotel, Stefano's, supposedly named for Steve Wynn, the big-deal Vegas hotel developer who owns or once owned the Golden Nugget. Just OK. Décor was like something out of Disneyland -- a silly, over-the-top version of Italy. Waiters were not Italian and were dressed in cartoonist Italian waiter costumes -- but at least they didn't sing (they are supposed to be singing waiters, per the advertisements for the place). Didn't work for me. I ordered the osso buco, which believe it or not was so tough I sent it back. It was also only luke warm. The replacement was only slightly better. It came on a bed of what was supposed to be risotto Milanese, but it was cooked to the point that the rice was just mush, and it tasted predominately like the sauce in which the meat was cooked. Dessert was tiramisu, which was good but too sweet and not very Italian. So, skip this place. If you want good Italian food, drive to Henderson and go to Gaetano's.

Reviews.Title: “The New Golden Nugget (Almost)”
Reviews.Author: capitol5555_8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the GN various times for over 20 years. New ownership and the hotel is undergoing major renovations. We had problems with our check-in, even though we are members of "Private Arrangements". We booked a rate of $59 per nite, stay 3 nites, 4th nite is free. However, at check-in, our room was not available, this was at midnight! I slipped the reservations clerk a $20 bill, amazingly he found us a room, in the North Tower. The bad side is that he tried to charge us $111 per nite for a room! I gave him my confirmation number, he dissappeared from the counter and returned to tell me the asst. manager approved our rate of $59, even though I had a confirmation number thru Private Arrangements. As usual, took over an hour to get our luggage at the airport. Used Dollar rent a car, good deal, great/polite service. Always use Dollar, free upgrades if you are a member of the Fastlane club. We finally made it to our room, which was nice, a little worn out, but a small, small bathroom with a lousy shower head. The cable TV did not work, a technician came to our room the next day a fixed the tv. We received a fun book which included money saving coupons for services and such at the GN, which included 2 free tickets to the Gordie Brown show. He is an impressionist/vocalist. His show is pretty good, but the show room is small. The food is still great at the GN, and the other services were excellent, however I overheard 2 employees saying that the Hotel will not pay good money to hire good employees. The casino was busy, not many cocktail waitresses. Luck was not good at the tables or the slots. Nice thing about staying downtown, is that you are very close to other casinos, of which I had better luck. We visited the strip one day, and what a traffic mess! Tons of families dressed like slobs trudging thru the hotels and casinos. Visited Wynn's new venture, nice, like the Bellagio, buy very very expensive. Self parking is very convenient. We visited the high end shops, no price tags on the merchandise! Guess the clerks guess what you can afford to pay for their goods. We will never stay on the strip due to the crowds and traffic. Took a side trip to Red Rock Canyon, a must see, go west on Charlestson Ave. towards Summerlin. There is a new mega hotel, casino, spa under construction in Summerlin off of Charleston. Red Rock Hotel and Casino. Brought to you by the Palace group. Amazing place from the hwy. Will open in Spring of '06. We will probably stay there for our next visit. check out their website. I will eventually return to the GN, but it is not the same place when Steve Wynn owned it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cm5400
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Golden Nugget in August, 2005. Rooms were spacious, and very clean. Only problem that I had with housekeeping. They tried to clean the room at 8:30 in the morning. I came back it 6 pm to find the room unmade. I went down to the front desk and they said that they would send someone right up. I also asked them to change the time housekeeping cleaned the room to the afternoon. I never had a problem after the first incident. I also at at Lilly Langtrees ( a chinese restaurant,) Zax, and the Buffet which were all delicious. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Package deal at the Golden Nugget was a joke!”
Reviews.Author: highlandsally
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a total of 5 nights in Las Vegas and 6 nights touring Arizona. The last two nights of our vacation were spent at the Golden Nugget. We booked our rooms through Expedia.ca as we are Canadian's "Eh!" When we booked through Expedia site we were told online that the price for our two night stay included 2 complimentary tickets (a $110.00 value) to the Gordie Brown show for two guests per room at the Golden Nugget as well as $10.00 in free slot play, one person, per stay and one Golden Values certificate book per room. When we checked in on wed. Dec. 28th, 05 - here is what we were told. "Sorry, tickets have been sold out since last monday!" When we asked if there was any compensation for this, here was the answer. "If you were staying over on friday with us, maybe we could do something!!!!????" <---Right, we are leaving to return to Canada on our already arranged flight! Note: we had called on the sunday prior while we were in Phoenix and asked about the tickets and were told that vouchers would be waiting for us, and all we had to do was turn them in for our seats.We were very disappointed to say the least. We did not receive the $10.00 in free slot play. We were told that you have to join the Nugget Club first and earn 1500 points first before you are rewarded.The coupon book was based on "4 people sharing" eg: $10.00 off breakfast in the book = $2.50 off each person in a party of 4 spending more than $10.00 each. There was a 2 for 1 @ the buffet. We went to the G.N.dinner buffet @ $12.99 per person and both of us ate for $12.99 plus tip. The buffet was average and had a good variety of choice. We each made ourselves a great salad plate and enjoyed the roasted turkey breast on the side. Just that would have cost us $12-$15.00 ea. had we gone to a regular restaurant for a chicken ceasar salad. We knew Vegas was expensive for eating and so we just watched for specials. Best one was at JJ's in Paris Hotel. Turkey wrap with soup and a cup of coffee was $6.50. Buy an extra cup of coffee and split the "large" bowl of soup and the wrap and you have lunch for two. ("Please don't spread this around as the good deal might disappear!") Back to the G.N. We arrived at our room on the 14th. floor and it was everything we had expected from reading other "Trip Advisor Reviews." It had a king size bed, (good mattress), was very clean, nicely decorated, very nice bathroom, bedroom was large compared to our stay the previous week at "New York New York Hotel" on the Manhatten Nights special! (read my comments on that please!) Day 2, we left the room around noon to go shopping and arrived back at 6 pm. to find the room not made up. I called housekeeping and explained. They said, someone would be right up. I asked if they could do it between 8 and 11 pm. as we would be out at a show. They said, "No problem!" We returned at 1 am. to find the room not made up. "Another call to housekeeping!" "They said, within the hour they would be up." Great at this hour of the night! I then asked them to just bring dry towels and I re-made the bed myself. It was a bit disappointing. We are well travelled, and I realize that this happens once in awhile but certainly didn't expect it at the Golden Nugget on a "slow day." They are not living up to the advertising special that they promote both through Expedia or their own web site. "Beware or disappointed!" We would still consider staying there again as it offer's value room for the Canadian Dollar! Sincerely, Highlandsally!

Reviews.Title: “This really IS the best Downtown Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Naupaka
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few hotels downtown, and was fine with them all. However, now that I have stayed at the Golden Nugget, maybe I cannot turn back! This was a bright, clean, classy hotel with topnotch, prompt, courteous service in every department (and I do mean every department--I think I dealt with every single one). The casino is also bright and clean, and when you walk into other downtown casinos after the Golden Nugget it's hard to take. I know it's a 4 star hotel, but I was still surprised at how huge the room was. Since I am an active shopper, there was more than enough room for me to spread out with my shopping bags. I would definitely stay here again if I could get a good room rate/package.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Best Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much from the Nugget due to the $49 rate I paid a few weeks ago. I was surprised that it is a really nice hotel. Certainly the best hotel downtown Vegas. There are areas under construction (like the lobby) and some long lines at check-in and check-out but those are the only complaints. The rooms were very nice with comfortable beds and quite large. Bathrooms were clean. The room service was excellent. I would stay here again but the biggest downside is most of the action is on the strip which is a long bus ride or a $15 cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Gramm
Reviews.Content: For our fifth trip to Vegas my wife and I stayed two nights at the Golden Nugget this month. We highly recommend this fun filled facility. Stayed in the North Tower which is great when going to the casino or to Fremont St. We enjoyed the buffet. We have stayed at hotels on the strip but will make the Golden Nugget our resort for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fine Stay at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Juju11
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Golden Nugget in several years. We typically stay on the strip these days but, the Nugget had a great Saturday rate ($79) so we opted to begin our trip there. We were not disappointed. Check-in was fast and friendly. They actually asked us if we preferred a high floor, etc. We were also able to get a funbook from the front desk even though we were not there on a promo offer. Our south tower room was spotless and the decor had been updated since our last stay. The parking garage is not connected to the building and is quite a bit closer to the south tower, so I definitely recommend requesting that tower if you plan to carry luggage or access your car frequently. Either way, the lot is not far from the entrance to the casino. We did not do much gaming here but we did eat the Sunday brunch buffet. It was very good and included a pretty wide variety of selections including smoked salmon and trout, sushi, prime rib and roasted turkey, and some killer bread pudding. I recommend the Nugget to anyone looking for high quality accommodations downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Golden nugget good enough...”
Reviews.Author: cdelga03
Reviews.Content: Went for business/pleasure to Las Vegas with my boyfriend and waited to the last minute to make reservations (not my idea). Anyway based on the reviews I thought the Golden Nugget was the best for what was left to pick from. Honestly it was very nice. The rate was one of the lowest for the quality when we went to make the reservations. The rooms was very clean and spacious. The water pressure was great (as this tends to be an issue in most las vegas hotels). Our only complaint was that the cable kept coming and going because (I think) the wires in the back of the TV were lose or torn. The other issue is that it is NOT on the strip. It is on a section called Fremonte Street which is on the most northern end of the strip. There is a city bus that will take you up and down the strip for $5 a day. Its well worth it. The only problem is that it stops soooooo much, it will take you an hour to get to the south end of the strip on that bus. Taxi? Well the taxi cost $30 from the air port, so you can imagine how that can add up if you take a taxi when going down to the strip. I think a good option would be mandelay bay because it is very close to the air port and is on the strip. All the hotels are beautiful, venetian and cesaers being the nicest (not that I would pay it). Treasure Island was a surprisingly nice hotel, though the pictures dont show it. There is lots to see in las vegas but you need money. Shows are about $100 per person for the nosebleeds, but there is a lot to do. Obviously gambling is huge so dont fall for the trap! OOOOOOOO and its very dry there. In three days my skin was dry as hell and itchy. Take lotion!!! So I hope I have helped. Let me know if you want more info.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gjrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget from December 1-4, 2005. For my first trip to Vegas it was a lot of fun. The Golden Nugget was an awesome hotel downtown. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the decor was beautiful, the casino was nice, food was good. I went to the spa a morning and the workout area was nice, but noticed people had to wait for machines as there are not a lot of them so go early, but the locker room area was very clean and the workers very helpful. There was entertainment outside our hotel at night which was fun but the show on top of the tunnel(lights and music) was the same every night. Although the machines ate my money(didn't win any money) if I was gonna stay downtown in Vegas again I would definately stay at the Nugget but I think next time I would like to stay on the strip. The door people were very helpful getting a cab when we ventured out but the fare was expensive depending on where you were going. If you are going for the PBR Rodeo which was in town at the time, lots of cowboys stayed at the Nugget and they did have a room with big screens to watch the rodeo live. I would definately recommend this hotel if you want to stay off the strip in a very nice downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: njkate1
Reviews.Content: From November 12th through the 19th we again had the pleasure of staying at the Golden Nugget! I have stayed at other hotels in Las Vegas but you get a great hotel room at the GN at a great nightly rate, not like some on the Strip (what you pay per night for a room on the Strip, you can just about stay at the GN for a week). Now, that the Landrys have taken over the GN, it is a good idea to sign up for the '24 Karat Card' as they do send some great offers. I had received one of their offers, and I took advantage of it so most of the days were for $49.00 each night. From check in through checking out, the staff consistently gave excellant service. I appreciate the security at the elevators but it is best to have your room key readily available for them to see. We only had one disappointing experience while at the Nugget (about 2 AM), apparently one evening each month they totally shut down the Carson Cafe for steam cleaning (usually open 24 hours), so then we went to the snack bar only to find out that they to were closed for their monthly cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Golden Nugget Nov. 28 for three night getaway. It was a two night get the third free offer. We found the room to be clean, spacious and smoke-free. Overall the staff was very helpful. I had a massage by Lesslie in the spa the first day I was there and it was incredible. I also had a manicure the same day. The second day I had a facial as did my mother. We used the locker and gym facilities, which we were charged $15. each in addition. I had a bit of a problem with that add on charge after spending over $200 for facials. Compaired to the strip hotels the spa charges were less expensive. I think my beef is, when I made my reservations the locker and gym facilities were included with all Spa treatments. Now the web site and hand out material only include the gym/locker facilites with a massage appointment. I hear the spa area will be under renovation shortly so that may be the reason for price increases. The downtown location was fine for us. It's an older crowd and lower key atmosphere. The second day we took the bus to the strip and payed a couple bucks. It took maybe an hour but you can always get off and jump on the monorail if your in a hurry. We took a cap home that evening after the show but we took the monorail to the very end and grabbed a cap to the Nugget. The cap ended up costing $9 total, not bad. If downtown is fine for you, I'd recommend the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Grand Dame of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that if you wish to spend all your time on the Strip, then Downtown Hotels aren't for you. Do your homework and don't complain. The Golden Nugget is still impressive. It has dated a little, but displays the typical early "Steve Wynn decor" similar to that of the Mirage & TI. Value for money is excellent copmpared to the Strip hotels, and rooms are generously sized with well-appointed (although slightly cramped) bathrooms. I stayed on the 18th floor for 3 nights, and had wonderful wide views incorporating Red Rock Valley and the mountains in the distance to the Plaza Hotel across the street. The beds are comfortable, the water pressure is excellent, the shampoo, conditioner, soaps and lotions excellent quality, and best of all - you can't hear your neighbours! The casino, like most of the downtown places has low ceilings which adds to the very smoky environment, but there is a level of elegance here missing from most of its competitors. The buffet is surprisingly good (although probably not as good as Main Street Station), and the Carson Street Cafe offers a wide selection of fare as a cheap alternative to the buffet, all set in an airy open atmosphere. This was my second stay at the Nugget, and I would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Overrated! Misleading!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all....its miles away from the strip! The only economic way of getting tothe strip is taking the DEUCE--which stops at every half block and takes at least an hour (even when the strip is only two miles away!). You can take a cab but thats gonna cost you $20 bucks a trip. My advice....save the cash and spend it on a NICER hotel on the strip! Golden Nugget misleads you by calling their standard rooms deluxe rooms! Shady and false! the hotel is overrated, old, and perfect for grandpa/grandma people!! Very disapointing!

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget a Strip Sandwich Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Alazzo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful Veterans Day three-night weekend stay at the Golden Nugget. We made it a Strip sandwich a less expensive way to spend a weekend in Vegas. This was our first time at the GN and they exceeded my expectations the GN was first class all the way. Corrie our bellman asked if we were just arriving in Vegas and when we told him we had spent our first few nights on the strip he told us that they were going to spoil us and he was right. The overall look of this older hotel was impressive. Our noon check in with Val was flawless just a short wait in line, bags were delivered to our oversized nicely decorated king non-smoking spotless deluxe 15th floor room in minutes. The bathroom was beautiful, nice amenities, plush towels and a large lighted make up mirror in the sitting area outside the bath. The lobby and halls were well kept and the friendly maids did a great job keeping everything clean. The Café serves reasonably priced meals and the line moves fast due to a friendly well-trained staff. You can give them your name and they will call you in turn if you do not want to stand in the line. We ate there three times for breakfast and once for lunch for under $20.00 and the food was very good. We loved Fremont Street, no one clicks cards at you every few yards and the Veterans Day events were outstanding. Walking is limited and the more relaxed low-key fun atmosphere was a nice break from the strip. We met our friends from California there for the weekend and they had a room with a beautiful view looking right up the strip. Dinner at Lillie Lang try’s was enjoyed by all the food was very good and the service was excellent, our waiter suggested that we add two house rice dishes to our order when we received the bill at $7.00 each I'd avoid this when we go back. The casino was great, full of people having a good time. The free show in the lounge had people clapping and dancing. I took advantage of the free 10:30am Pai Gow Poker lesson from Dave and had a ball playing the game. When we took the cab from the Strip my wife noticed the Vegas Premium Outlet Mall off of 15 and it was one of the first places we went on Friday afternoon. It would be a five-dollar cab ride but our friends drove so we went over. The girls had a ball shopping but four hours of this was enough for me. Overall Fremont Street was great fun the Golden Nugget is a super hotel at a reasonable price and we plan to return on our next trip to Vegas for another Strip sandwich. Try it you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Dragon
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Vegas we stayed one night in the Golden Nugget and had a wonderful time. The Nugget is a almost-Strip quality hotel in the middle of downtown. The hotel was clean, attractive, right on Fremont Street, and - best of all - $59 a night! First, the room. The room is an average hotel room, but nice, spacious, and clean. The bed is average - too firm for our tastes, but might not be a problem for most people. The cleanliness was the most important thing. The room looked and smelled clean. Our room was in the South Tower which is more of a walk from the casino, but really not that far to be a big deal. Valet parking (in the mode of Strip hotels) is free. It was also quick and easy. (Tip: The entrance to the valet is on Casino Center Drive.) We didn't eat in the Nugget so can't comment on the restaurants. However, we've heard from many that the buffet is second only to Main Street Station downtown. Then there is the casino - fantastic! Wonderful, friendly dealers. Clean air (especially compared to other downtown casinos which were downright hazy). And a fun fun crowd. Also lots and lots of low limit tables. We had a great time gambling at the Nugget. We were up on our play here and the environment was a major factor. The one downside was signing up for the slot club card. There were two people working the desk and the line moved very slowly. Signing up in advance made no difference as apparently they couldn't find our info in the computer. This was the only negative of our stay. Downtown is something definitely to be experienced. It is tacky and gaudy and just plain FUN. It's Vegas the way Vegas used to be. The Nugget is a great way to experience it. Also - cheap deals are just about always available here. Try downtown for at least part of your next Vegas trip and definitely stay at the Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time we have stayed downtown and we stayed at the Golden Nugget, Nov. 14th-17th. This hotel/casino could easily be on the strip but PLEASE stay downtown! we really like the atmosphere on Fremont St. The hotel is very clean, the food is very good and the service is great. it is like they can't do enough for you. the casino does get crowded at night but what does that tell you. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone wanting to stay downtown! Looking forward to our next trip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeamSudbury
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, my husband and I just got back from a four night stay at the Golden Nugget. From the time we arrived there until the time we left we absolutely loved every single minute in Vegas! Checkin at the hotel took about 5 minutes and we received the room we originally requesed with a king bed/non-smoking. The room was exceptionally clean and large! The colors were nice and rich and the bathroom was done in all brown and creams colors with lots of marble. I am very finicky about hotel rooms and this was gorgeous (and the rates were cheap). We never heard any noise from the hallway or neighbors. That was nice because we often slept late into the morning after being up very late. The main restaurant serves great food - did not have a chance to check out the buffet though. A great buffet downtown is the Main Street Station - excellent food and very nice staff. Best breakfast is downstairs at Binnions across the street. See Steve Connelly (the Elvis impersonator) at Fitzgeralds. He is amazing and totally looks, acts and sings like Elvis. Also another good show (if you like the "old" Las Vegas) is The Rat Pack Tribute at the Greek Isles Hotel just off the strip by the Stardust. We love that era of music and we were so happy we went. They let you take still pictures of the whole show so I was able to take some great shots. When booking make sure you book a VIP booth - well worth the extra money. Tip the guy seating you and ask for a booth. Downtown Vegas is amazing! The atmosphere with the light show, outdoor bands and freemont street was the best time I have had in a long time. The strip is beautiful too but not as intimate the Old Vegas downtown. The slots are looser downtown too. Check out all the hotels on the strip - the are really breathtaking and each one has a theme. There is always something different happening at each one. Caesar's Palace has the forum shops which are a must if you are a shopper. Just gorgeous! The Bellagio and Treasure Island have their outdoor shows so try to catch those - incredible! Paris Paris has the most beautiful casino I've ever seen. The new Wynn Hotel is a 2 billion dollar project and owned by Steve Wynn. You must take a walk through this place -your jaw will drop! Lots of beautiful people with lots of money! The best place for supper with a view is the Voodoo lounge. The food is great and this place has one of the most spectacular views at night! A must see. I could go on an on but I just have to say the Golden Nugget is the best hotel downtown and you can't beat the service and the rates. We will more than likely stay downtown again the next time in Vegas. Viva Las Vegas Baby!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Golden Nugget while visiting and enjoyed a delicious breakfast. The service was excellent, all the coffee you want and great food. You wouldn't realize until you walk through the doors what a beautiful place it really is. Too bad it is downtown though. I thought it was as nice inside as a lot of the casinos on the strip. Do not think twice about dining here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Golden Nugget.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Golden Nugget on November 4th and 5th. It was our first trip to Las Vegas and we spent the first two days downtown and the remaining four days on the strip. We arrived at the GN at noon on Friday and we were able to get into our room right away. Our standard room was very clean and comfortable. The bathtub / shower was spotless, but it rapidly started filling up with water during my first shower. It didn't look like it was draining at all, but was empty when I returned five minutes later. It really wasn't that big of a deal and it was the only negative thing that we can say about our stay. The casino was well lit and just plain gorgeous. The employees that we encountered were extremely courteous and made us feel like we were special. We would consider staying here again if we return to Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several negative reviews, prior to our very recent trip to Vegas, we were hesitant to stay at the Golden Nugget in Vegas but our arrangements had already been set and paid (11/6 thru 11/9th). This was our first experience off strip. Once inside the casino, we were pleased to see how clean it was and our room was very neat, tidy and comfortable. Because we spent most of our time sightseeing, we only ate breakfasts in the casino, but even at that, the food was yummy. The hotel/casino staff were wonderful and very helpful. Therefore, we have only positive comments to share, and have already been promoting The Golden Nugget to friends and family since our return trip home yesterday.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best time My wife and I have had in a long time. The people in the hotel all of them were just great.We played blackjack a lot and had a great time lots of comps. We will be back I love down town the best. Just can't say much more on how great the staff was.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the 4 star rating!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress the fact that everything portrayed on line is exactly as it was! I am a very picky individual and when I stay in a hotel I expect the very best. The rooms were just as pictured on the golden nugget website. We were in the south tower and the rooms were very clean and stylish. Others have complained about the walk from the south tower to the casino and obviously they have never stayed anywhere where there IS actually a walk. The distance was NOT bad at all. The timeshare people were not as pushy as others have said. We stayed for four nights/5 days and were approached a total of four times and once we told them we were not interested they laid off. I would highly recommend the Golden Nugget for anyone over the age of 30 as it is geared toward the mid age group such as myself (35). Being on Fremont was great-lots to see and do other than gamble. I will definitely stay there again on our next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice good value”
Reviews.Author: tireman
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and in good repair, quiet, good location, very friendly staff, very helpful. Good food, good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Was a Class Act”
Reviews.Author: Smilesfortravel
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Las Vegas and I can't wait to go back. We stayed at the Golden Nugget and it was outstanding. The room was beautiful, the staff went out of their way for us at each request. We played in the casino and the dealers at the BlackJack table were great. I met two very rude staff at the roulette tables who had no patience for a novice... but I didn't let that get me down. Outside the Casino Door is the Fremont Street plaza over which is this large (a few blocks) screen and they run mini shows, race cars, fighter jets, etc... It's an experience, hence the Fremont Street expericence. The resturants at the Nugget were great. We ate at the Carson Street Cafe, the Oriental Resturant and the Buffet. I enjoyed them all. Pricing was right.. for two of us it was never more than $30. We had massages in the spa and they were great! I had Ron do mine and kudos to him. It was a great experience. I highly recommend the GN for your next visit to Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & location”
Reviews.Author: singr38
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really great, everything clean, the Irish dancing show was passable. We were on a package deal with air & car. It is really important to have a L.V. City map while driving.The streets have changed over the years. PLan your return route to the Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Oldie”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In september we took a trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at a hotel on the upper strip for a few days afterwards we moved to the downtown strip and stayed at the Golden Nugget. I can't find anything negative to say about this hotel. Our room was beautiful exactly like the pictures on the website. This hotel casino is clean upbeat friendly helpful staff the food is good the casino is fun my husband had a great time playing blackjack! What else can I say except that this is definately a beautiful Golden Oldie!We would love to go back to the Golden Nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Our 5day/4night getaway to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, I, and another couple were looking for a "value" trip to Vegas and found a great deal on the internet. A little over $400 got us round trip from Iowa and four nights stay at the Golden Nugget down town. While we had always stayed previously on the strip, we opted to give the down town area a try. Our accomodations were terrific! The GN was very clean and sparkled from floor to ceiling. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our room was made up promptly and thouroughly each day. We slept very well in the comfortable beds and enjoyed peace and quiet from the outside hall or adjacent rooms. We ate once in the Carson Street Cafe...very good and reasonable. We played Texas hold-em in the poker room, rolled the "bones" and played Three-card poker as well as the slots. NO COMPLAINTS! The "Freemont experiece" as it's called was O.K. A little to much hype for me. A large canopy covers the street and shows a sensual ad or music video in the evenings (O.K for kids). The street is cleaned each evening and is kept immaculate. Two blocks walking distance takes you to where you can catch the #302 bus to the strip. Take the #302 if you'd like to get out to your location sooner (4-5 stops only), take the #301 if you'd like to signal the driver when you'd like to get off. $2 each one way trip (need exact change). If your looking for: very nice, smaller, lower min. stakes tables, bar/casino hopping capabilities and great value, look into the Golden N. GOOD LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: nan307
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget from Thursday, September 29th till Monday, October 3rd. Check-in was fast and our rooms were ready when we arrived (approximately 12pm). We stayed in the South Tower which was very disappointing. Our room stunk, smelled like the sewer gas. When the bell hop arrived with our luggage, I mentioned something to him and he said that he would send someone up. The maid arrived shortly after and sprayed the air conditioning vents and the carpet and other areas. We could open our window a little bit (about 12 inches) and we kept the window open the remainder of the time. The lighting in the bathroom was horrible. Thank goodness they had a vanity with a light up mirror. Without that mirror, don't know how I would have applied makeup. Our room safe only worked the first night. We kept getting error codes on the safe. Security came up and reset the code and it worked for a couple of hours. When we went to get money out of the safe, we got the error code again. We ended up using the hotel safe which was very inconvenient. If anyone is going to this hotel, request the North Tower as the South Tower rooms are a very long walk! We played video poker at the bar a couple of times and everytime we ordered a drink, we still were charged, even though we were playing the machines! Gambling is much better across the street at Binion's. Now for the good points..... Ate a late night breakfast the first night we were there at the Carson Street Cafe. Very good food and very good waitress staff. Room Service was excellent. Hubby and I ordered two cheeseburgers and stated that we really needed them delivered within thirty minutes as we were renewing our wedding vows that day and the limo would be there within an hour to pick us up. Room Service had the food up to our room within fifteen minutes which really impressed us! The burgers were very good too! Room Service also delivered us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries as a gift from a friend from back home and they made the arrangement beautiful! On Sunday we all wanted to watch the Eagles Game and were seated at the bar at the Nugget. We asked the bartender if the game was going to be on that television. He checked the station and couldn't get it in. Maintenance arrived and tried to fix the problem. After a few minutes, the Maintenance Man told us to follow him and he would show us where we could watch the game. He took us to a little restaurant in the Hotel, I think it is called Zax. We had the whole place to ourselves to watch the game on a huge screen television. The waitress was excellent and very attentive. What a way to watch the game! We also were only approached by Timeshare people one time and I just stated No when they started talking. It was great being on Freemont Street and just having to step right outside to see the light show and listen to the bands. Security for going up in the elevators was very good. Had to show our room key each time we passed Security. Bell Hops were very attentive and fast! Would we stay at the Golden Nugget again? I don't think so. I think our next visit we will check out the Palms. Previous trips we have stayed at the Aladdin and the Flamingo. So far, the Aladdin has been my favorite. Hope this trip report helps.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 4 star hotel in downtown vegas. definitely the best hotel down in that area. Service was friendly, professional and always very helpful. housekeeping left extra towels and toiletries at our request. Valets were courteous and prompt, as was the bellhop and frontdesk staff. check in/checkout was a breeze. Drink service at bars and casino and by the pool was prompt and friendly as well. The buffet was not very large but service was good and the food quality was better than average. the coupon booklet gives you 2for1 (3) coupons. ask for the booklet at checkin if they do not give it to u. Rooms were average, bathroom a little small for my taste. you have your standard bed, tv, 2 stuffed chairs and a small table. One thing we appreciated in the room was on the table they had an extension cord and outlet so you wouldnt have to hunt for an outlet anywhere. Toiletries are decent quality and beds were firm and comfortable. It was very clean. Water pressure in the bathroom was excellent, but the drain got a bit backed up. great view on 16th floor, non-smoking floor. south tower is nice, i heard north tower is newer so u may want to request that. a far walk from room to casino/buffet/pool but that's to be expected in a hotel this size. i never felt crowded or rushed. Pool is a decent size, biggest downtown. Never crowded, great drink service, cabanas available, there are cozy couches out by the pool too. there's a nice sized jacuzzi and towel service out there as well. be sure to register for the golden nugget slot card. you get $10 free matchplay for slot or table game use. very handy!! All in all i enjoyed my stay at the golden nugget. I would stay there again. I got the room for $49/nite through priceline. You cant beat that with a bat.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MikeG6000
Reviews.Content: I met my girl friend at the GN in late July. We have stayed there before and knew what to expect. What has always impressed us are the valleys. Parking is fast and efficient. They literally run. It would be a good summer or part time job for a college athlete who wanted to stay fit. It took a while to get checked in, but not ridiculously long. Every body was friendly. The room was large and clean. We did get bugged by the time-share people, which I didn’t like, but we all have to make a living and it does provide jobs. I really don’t enjoy the slots but I love to play Black Jack and my girl friend plays Roulette. The last time I was there I wished I had took advantage of there Texas Holdem training. I believe they have classes for most of the games; therefore, I took advantage of it this time. The instruction taught the basics. Including tipping procedures. lol I played in a game right afterwards with the other students and two or three others waiting for a table and again that evening. Since then I have a new favorite game. Since we have five casinos which offer Texas Holdem games within 15 minutes of where I live in Oklahoma I have been able to practice quite a bit. Can’t wait to go back and give the GN tables another go. The discount tickets they give really set off the Down Town experience. The rooms are reasonable, the food is well priced and the gaming is great.

Reviews.Title: “Can they deep six the time share shills?”
Reviews.Author: Lulutoo
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Nugget several times a year- and always seem to get clean, comfortable rooms, pleasant desk clerks and reasonably ok buffet food. But for the last several stays, the time share "shills" they are allowing to overtake the hotel have become out of control. They used to just pounce on you on your way to the south tower elevators- now they stalk you as you are going out the door onto Fremont Street- and then again as you come in- they literally try to corral you like cattle- it is disgusting1 A few months ago , the Nugget was full and we stayed at the Plaza. It was older, shabbier, but there was not a time share pest in the area- so we are really tempted to change hotels. It is so out of keeping that an alleged " four star" hotel could subject their guests to this inside the hotel!! It is to the point where you dred having to walk through the lobby. I complained at check out and the clerk sighed and said they hear complaints all the time, but"there is nothing we can do." I understand the hotel has recently been sold to the Landry's restaurant chain, soo I'm hoping they will get rid of this vermin! We have experienced this in front of Harrah's and the Four Queens as well, but perhaps would expect it in the less highly rated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place!”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleReunion
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas. We are not gamblers, we were there for a wedding. Super people watching. The Freemont Street Experience defies description. Starbucks in the lobby was a huge bonus. Got lost a few times trying to find our room. The rooms were great. Spacious and well equipped. Can't wait to go back and explore! Massages to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Call it Golden Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for my first non-business related event. Got a rate of $140/night for the weekend and found the rate to be the best among the hotels. What stunk... The Golden Nugget is a salute to downtown's finest - 20 years ago. Wynn left it to die. The service was slow, from check-in to check-out. The bell desk was unhelpful in even giving directions. The dry cleaning service they offered was described as a "rip off" by the woman at the front desk - who wasn't far off when we decided to get a suit dry cleaned and it was returned without pants. After two calls to housekeeping, we arrived to our room with no cleaning service later that evening. The snack bar in the casino gave me a bad ache for the next day or so. The sun doesn't cast a shadow on the pool area until 10:30-11am due to the building height. The people who stay here are not "hip" which is fine. But some visitors (mostly groups) made us wonder what decade they lived in/died in. What was good.... The self-park was across the street. The bathrooms were nice. The bed was ok. The mountain view described in our room was potentially noticeable early in the morning. The ac worked. There were ice machines. People seemed to line up for the buffet. Fremont street experience is right outside if you want to get loaded with Kentucky's and Ireland's finest outcasts. No one stole from my room, although no one cleaned my room to steal anything anyway. Perhaps it was my expectations, or all the reviewers who came before me - that ruined my idea of the GN. Let's be truthful. GN is ok. But to give it a 4 or higher for hotel is blasphemy.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Travelforfun06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget from 9/19-9/21. We were very much looking forward to our visit. We had gone in October of last year and as a result received complimentary rooms. We stayed in room 1525 located in the north tower. We had a view of a brick wall (literally). Okay, well the view isn't that important. The following is the list of issues: pistachio shells littered one side of the bed, lipstick smeared on the vanity, nail clippings scattered on the floor of the vanity and the bathroom had hair on the floor and in the tub. I called the front desk and spoke to "Anita". She never offered me an apology. She simply told me she would notify housekeeping. That night nobody came by and/or called us. The following day someone had finally vacummed the pistachio shells; however, everything else remained the same. The following day the hair in the bathroom had finally been cleaned. Perhaps, when you go the vanity will be cleaned and the nail clippings removed. We cut our trip short and will never go back ---complete filth---

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: matthijst
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huge, the pool is small. The breakfast buffet is great! Located next to the Fremont Street Experience, which is fun. Only downside is that it's far from the strip, but we wanted to catch some of that old, classic Vegas vibe and this is THE place....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and eight friends stayed at the Golden Nugget September 8 -12, 2005. The hotel staff, valets, doormen, waiters, waitresses, and dealers are friendly and helpful. The room (South Tower, 20th floor - the walk is not that bad) was clean and quiet. The bathroom is a bit small but servicable. The look of the room is somewhat dated as is the rest of the hotel, at least in comparison to the newer hotels on the strip. The casino is a bit small by strip standards. The buffet was cheap but unappetizing (the floor manager on Thursday night could not understand that we had used a two for one coupon and did not owe him for another person - we paid the extra charge to make him go away). The food in the cafe was quite good. They could use more restrooms on the main floor (there was only one in the casino that serves the entire main floor, at least that I found). The crowd skews older than on the strip, probably an average age of 45 to 50. The muzak in the casino caters to this age group. Be ready for Carly Simon and the Bee Gees. The other hotels and casinos on Freemont strip are pretty much dumps, though the people watching is great. The great equalizer was the price, about $250 for four days including a Friday and Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: cubsd
Reviews.Content: I used to enjoy the high level of service at the Golden Nugget, and the low table limits at downtown Las Vegas casinos. Unfortunately, both of those are over. I complained at check-in and check out, and then came home to send this letter to the Golden Nugget. START OF LETTER I have been a patron of your hotel/casino for over ten years. I used to enjoy gambling in your casino, eating at Zax, Stefano’s, and The Buffet. However, following my recent stay with you July 17th – July 20th, I doubt that will continue. I called casino marketing two months prior to make reservations for a non-smoking, king room in the north tower. I inquired if there was any tournament taking place at that time and was told “no”. I stressed that I wanted to be in the north tower, and I was told that the request would be made. When I arrived on the 17th, I was told that there was nothing in the north tower. I explained my disappointment, because I did not wish to hike from the south tower to the casino. The desk clerk explained that it was because of the poker tournament that was on-going. I told her that I would reluctantly accept a non-smoking king room in the south tower. After hiking to my room, I discovered that she had put me a room with two doubles.
