I called the front desk, because I did not want to hike back to the front desk for nothing. After explaining the problem, I was transferred to casino marketing. I then had to explain again to a casino host, who said she would call me back. When she did call back, she stated she had been told by the front desk that they had no non-smoking king bed room available. I told her that was unacceptable and that the front desk had said they did have a king room in the south tower, they had just put me in the wrong room. The host then told me that she thought that she shouldn’t be involved anymore, and gave me the direct extension of the front desk manager. I later found out that you have many “front desk managers”. This call took place July 17th at around 5:00pm. I called the front desk manager and began to again explain the problem, when she impatiently cut me off, and began to lecture me on “room requests”. I told her that I understood she may not have a room in the north tower like I reserved two months ago, but that doesn’t excuse being lied to over the phone about the poker tournament, put in a room without the correct bed type, and being given the run-around. She sarcastically told me I had not been given the run-around, as this was the first time she had spoken to me. I informed her that if she had let me tell her what had previously happened, she would know what was going on. She told me to go back to the front desk, and they would put me in a king room that I had previously been told didn’t exist. The entire time, she addressed me in a hateful, disrespectful tone. After waiting in line again at the front desk, I asked the same desk clerk why she had put me in a doubles room, when all we had discussed was a non-smoking king. She said “That’s what you asked for” and then smirked. After arriving in my room, #22124, I realized why she had smirked; she had put me in the farthest room from the front as possible. The room stank of carpet cleaning, and the TV had horrible reception. In addition, the guest services on the TV did not work. Because of my previous experience, I did not call to complain, because I was tired of being jerked around, and treated with disrespect. Later during the stay, I realized that the internet did not work either, and despite calls to maintenance, and three different men working in the room, internet service was never provided. Because of this, my partner had to make three phone calls from the room, which Golden Nugget was only too happy to charge $45.00. Because of what had happened, I did not gamble much at your casino, and instead cashed out my points. It is sad for me to see a place that used to offer high customer service fall so far. I do expect a reply to this letter, and an explanation as to why I should continue to stay at the Golden Nugget, when there are so many other places to stay, eat, and gamble. END OF LETTER The day I sent this letter, I received a form letter from the Golden Nugget that said they were sorry I didn't enjoy my stay, but didn't address any of my concerns. It was a complete blow-off. I never received an actual response to my letter. Goodbye downtown Vegas! Your table limits are no longer low, and the only decent place to stay is no longer decent. AAA four diamonds? I think not. It's the strip for me, where there are plenty of places that don't lie to me and treat me rudely.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay at the Golden Nugget. There was some slight confusion because we booked a King bed room and were given a 2 double bed room. We didn't find this out until we got to our room and after calling the front desk they offered to move us. While my fiance went to get the new room key, anouther group of guests tried to get into my room because the front desk screwed up and made it available before we left. That was really the only snag we encountered though. The rooms are on the small side and are nothing more than average. This is by far the best place to stay downtown though. Much more strip-like than any of the other downtown places. The Fremont Street Experience is right outside the hotel and is great to watch. As far as downtown goes though, I was not impressed. The strip is much better. Even though downtown isn't that great, you really can't beat the rates at the Nugget on the weekend. As long as you have a rental car or a cab to the Strip you are set.

Reviews.Title: “Non smokers beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel about 8:30pm and was told there were only smoking rooms available, even though the room was booked as non smoking several months earlier. Had no choice but to accept the smoking room. The desk clerk did offer to have the room "deodorized" (cover up any odors with perfume) but the staff clearly didn't care at all about only having smoking rooms available at a pretty early check in time by Las Vegas standards. The room did smell quite smoky, and there was also a used bandage near the bathtub, and the hotel guide binder was on the floor behind a table with most of the pages strewn about. There was also a blue chalk line on the carpet near the window for some reason. Cleaned the room, then opened the window and left the room for a few hours in hopes it would air out by then. My friend called the hotel about midnight pretending to inquire about booking a room for the night and asked if there were any non smoking rooms available. They were told that all that were left were suites. Of course, I have been upgraded to a suite at no charge in the past at strip hotels, but apparently this is not done at the Golden Nugget. Their website does state, "We will note your preferences for room type and/or location, however due to arrival and departure patterns, we are unable to guarantee any room requests." so this may be why the staff is not concerned at all about room requests not being available. I had a second reservation for the following two nights, was able to change it to a single night, and was allowed to switch to a non smoking room for the next night. This room was better maintained with no major issues. There were still some positives about the hotel: -On a night when the parking structure was quite full, there was security limiting parking at the time to hotel guests only so all guests would have a place to park. -We noticed a large spill in the hallway near the elevator on our floor. When returing to our room, two security guards were walking the halls and one was calling housekeeping to clean the spill. In short, this is still a decent hotel with a nice casino and atmosphere, and is still a good choice if you want to stay in the downtown area if good rates are available. However it seems like some of the rooms may be showing their age and sometimes are not cleaned completely. So if you are a non smoker, keep your fingers crossed that a clean non smoking room is available and try to check in as early in the afternoon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jodie1906
Reviews.Content: We spent the last evening of our vacation to the Las Vegas/Grand Canyon area downtown at the Golden Nugget. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was well taken care of, clean rooms and adequate sized. The food was much more reasonable than on the Strip and the Fremont Street Experience outside the hotel was enjoyable. It seems to be a little bit of an older crowd than on the Strip, but there were certainly many ages - seniors, families, singles etc. downtown. My only complaint is that the casino area which like many hotels, you need to walk through regularly to get to and from rooms was smokier than the hotel we stayed at on the Strip. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dense smoke in casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Golden Nugget hotel. Although it was off season, and there were not that many people in the casino, we were overwhelmed with the thick densely-filled casino as we walked in. We tried to gamble, but it was not successful . Both my husband and I could not stay long, as it overwhelmed us. It would be a nice jesture if the casino would accomodate the non-smokers, as we were not the only couple feeling the affects, with both burning nose and nostrils. A separate room would be the correct-thing-to-do for the non-smoking guests. It's a shame, as the Golden Nugget got every-other-thing right as far as abiance, decorating, and a good quality staff and management. If this major problem were corrected, then the Golden Nugget hotel would have-it-all! One last thing.. by the South Tower there is a Time-Share-desk. We were approached by them, as we had just come in from a red-eye flight. Thery were extremely aggressive, and cheapened the hotel. Other hotels who handle time-shares handle it differently. They place in the welcome-package information about the time shares, and the guests choose thmselves whether or not to attend the time-share presentation, and whether they want to receive all the gifts offered...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our Las Vegas trip.... I am in the travel industry and i am ashamed to admit it but this was our first trip to Vegas. We were hesitant to go to Vegas because we thought vegas was cheesy and we are not big gamblers but now we know better..... We had a great time, when we arrived we rented a car and drove ourselves to the Golden nugget on Fremont St. What a good choice, we got in very late and the desk staff were so nice and welcoming. We were upgraded to a suite and sent off to our room. It was faboulous, large and very clean. The next morning we went to the 6.99 breakfast buffet and we were so suprised with the quantity and quality of the food. I highly recommend you make a trip to the Nugget just for the breakfast, it's worth the trip from the strip. I wanted to stay at more than 1 hotel in Vegas so we eventually moved on. After staying at the MGM we decided that although the main strip is much more entertaining, the fremont street area hotels try harder to please you and are all about old fashioned good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms but don't eat there!”
Reviews.Author: SYV
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night weekend stay to celebrate our anniversary with friends. We had requested a room with a strip view and the first person at the front desk put us on the 11th floor which had a view of the garage. When I called down to the front desk, they offered to move us to another room. The second room was on the 19th floor, and you need to be on the 18th floor at least to get a decent view of the lights at night, which were very pretty. The room itself was large and nice, clean, with a smallish bathroom. One thing that was great was that I never heard a sound from another guest the entire time! Maybe it was the corner location (19125), far from the elevator, but worth it in a good night's sleep. Overall, we were very happy with our room. We ended up gambling at the casino several times, and the staff there was fine. Some dealers were very friendly and some were just blah, but none were rude. It is smokey, but several of the casinos we went into were, too. I used the salon to get a haircut and was pleased. Now for the bad. The first two mornings, the line at the restaurant was long so we just decided to go to the Starbucks in the hotel and eat a big lunch. Starbucks is very popular but the line moved fast and we enjoyed our coffee and pastry. The second morning, same thing, long line to get in for breakfast, so we got our coffee at Starbucks and went down the street to get Krispy Kreme doughnuts. Third morning, we had a late flight so we decided to just wait to eat a nice breakfast and were looking forward to it. We both ordered eggs, hash browns, bacon. I ordered my eggs scrambled and when we got our order I took one bite and they tasted terrible! My husbands eggs were OK but both of our hash browns were unedible. When I called the waitress over and told her I could not eat my eggs, she asked me if I wanted "country scrambled" eggs instead. What's the difference from what I ordered, I asked. "Well, they are real eggs, and these you got are powdered!". I could not believe that a restaurant of this supposed quality would consider using powdered eggs, and she acted like she heard this complaint every day. I can't say we will never stay here again, but any hotel that can't provide a decent breakfast for $25 gets downgraded by me. It's not like it was included free in our room rate of $139; no one expects those breakfasts to be much. And, if you are staying downtown, there's not much choice elsewhere to eat breakfast. The Golden Nugget is elegant and definately the only place to stay downtown, but next time we will probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but kinda far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: hotel is nice, but it is very far from the main strip. taxi can cost more than $30 per trip depends on the traffic. bus is cheaper, but it taks at least 40 min to get there. next time, i would definitely stay on the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Guest Service and attitude attitude attitude”
Reviews.Author: fun_robbie
Reviews.Content: I've been in hotel management for 13 years at a VERY touristy hotel in Charlestons, SC. I KNOW what guest service means and how to have returning guests. I will NEVER stay at the Golden Nugget ever again. We booked a king room through Expedia package deal. We got a room with two very small double beds. Then, one day "before" we were to check out...our keys would no longer work. When we went to the desk we went straight up to the counter. We were told to get in line. Mind you a VERY LONG check in line. I said no. I was not waiting in that long line for a key to a room that I had been staying in for 2 days already and am now locked out of. They got the Manager. She acted as though I was inconveniencing her. SORRY..."I'VE BEEN LOCKED OUT OF MY ROOM". We also mentioned not getting our king room. She said it's just a request....well, we paid more money for the king...so I say WE SHOULD GET WHAT WE PAID FOR. I explained, that I too manage a hotel and that her answer was unacceptable. To which she informed me that they do things differently in Nevada. I guess!!! In Charleston, SC we actually CARE ABOUT OUR GUESTS and their requests. The casino was okay. The food okay. The service AWEFUL. For the Vegas experience....I do not recommend the Golden Nugget. This was our 3rd trip to Vegas in 1 1/2 years and there are WAY too many places to stay where you actually feel human and not just another dollar in their pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best choice in downtown”
Reviews.Author: smartgirl247
Reviews.Content: Nice big and clean rooms, very friendly front staff. Self parking far away in a separate building. Long lines at the buffett and also other eateries (midweek). It was my first time downtown, not too bad but I prefer the STRIP.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: herd4sheep
Reviews.Content: While in Las Vegas we stayed 3 nights at the Golden Nugget in downtown, LV. The rooms were four star. They were clean with the blankets actually enveloped in two sheets. What we noticed most was the friendliness of the staff. While there we dined at Lilly's...try the "war won-ton soup" -- outstanding! We would stay here again no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the time we left four days latter we felt we were in the old Vegas. A beautiful lobby, clean, well appointed rooms, friendly staff, a very helpful bell captain, excellent meals in both the restaurant and buffett, great entertainment in the lounge were all toped off by Freemount St. We will be back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Jersey, 25 miles from Atlantic City
Reviews.Title: “The jewel of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As A travel agent from New Jersey, I have taken groups to Las Vegas twice a year for the last 10 years. From The Las Vegas Hilton to Mandalin Bay and downtown to the Nugget. My groups all loved the Nugget. The location first and then the fine restaurants and very above service. I enjoy this hotel so much that every September I take from 35 to 50 guest to this very same hotel every year as of the last 5 years. My clients in our September vacations to Vegas ALL want the n Nugget. The rewards for the casion players is tops. I have been to Vegas about 45 times since 1985 and have stayed at many hotels. I have never enjoyed the service that they offer. Of course if you stay in the South tower it is a bit of a walk from the desk to the casino. Steve Wynn was the main reason I first tried the Nugget and even as it changed hands three times since, we still love the Hotel and casino. The casino might be a bit tight but so are most in Vegas. The truth told they care for thier guest and welcome your return. In fact 8 of my September Clients stay free over the Thanksgiving week for a total of ten days FREE. Yes they pay nothing for RFB. room, food and beverage. We love the pool, the restaurants and the rooms are very clean and above average. We go again this September 10 to the 15 with 32 guest total. Joseph A De Pompa Travel4u.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget not the Mother Lode”
Reviews.Author: MrHospitality
Reviews.Content: The bad: 1. Front-desk service at check-in was atrocious. Couldn't find my already-charged reservation. Then they assigned me to a room in the netherlands (might as well have been as far away from the elevator as the actual Netherlands!) 2. Food mediocre at best. Not awful. Just mediocre. 3. I'm middle-aged but staying at the Nugget made me feel ancient. Staff is old, old, old. Other patrons are in or are approaching their golden years (ergo, the "Golden" Nugget?). "What happens in Vegas may very well stay in Vegas due to death on account of old age!" 4. Public spaces, including the casino, aren't adequately air-conditioned. (Perhaps a concession to the aged clientele?) 5. No excitement. Morgue atmosphere. 6. No help from staff on advice on restaurants, etc. That basic input is for high-rollers only apparently. The good: Thinking.....must be something good....well, the room was clean. That's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the GN for 5 days and had a Wonderful time! EVERYTHING was IMMACULATE. Amazing to see a Casino kept so clean. We really loved the Carson St. cafe. Just about anything you could want to eat and at very reasonable prices. The Fremont St. experience was pretty neat. We went in and out of all the Casino's and we each won a small jackpot at one casino on the "street". Friendly, courteous, helpful staff. It's only $20 for a cab to the strip- furthermost point. We found we enjoyed the GN second only to the Bellagio (another immaculate casino). Hardly any children or "young" adults except on Fri/Sat night. We do love children, but not in a Casino. Definitely an adult atmosphere. We'll be going back, I'm certain!

Reviews.Title: “Anyone need a Room?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are headed back to the GN this week. We were last there in 3/05. There is absolutely nothing we don't love about the Nugget! The spa is great! We played Texas Holdem last time for most of our stay and the dealers were great! Don't forget to take a trip to the 4Q for dinner at Hugo's Cellar! The best dinner! We have a room booked at the IP on the strip by my husband's company for business this time. We chose to fork out our own $$ and stay at the GN. Anyone need a room at the IP? Yours for the taking LOL

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCJC10
Reviews.Content: Just visited Las Vegas the latter part of June. This was my first time flying. It was wonderful. We stayed at the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. The hotel is beautiful. We had a deluxe room, but deluxe means standard (a little disappointed). The design of the room was really nice and cozy though. You see people constantly wiping/dusting and maintaining the cleaniness of the hotel. Another added feature for security, which I thought was good, each time you go to your room, there's someone at each corridor checking for your room key. So not just anybody can roam the floors. At night on Fremont Street there is a light show every 15 minutes after it gets dark that's pretty neat. We also had a rental car, which was good because we learned the city pretty quickly and drove up on the strip frequently. There is so much to see. You can get to see shows for free, dinners, casino cash, trips, you name it, by attending timeshare presentations. If you've never been to one, let me warn you, these people are pushy for sales and can get on your nerves. If you have some time to spend it can worth it for the free stuff. I give my trip to Vegas adventure five stars and can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Golden Nugget! Lovely room...clean and comfy! Great slots...wonderful buffet. Fremont light show is amazing....3 shows a nite! Near a bus station for easy access to the strip! Take the express, because the standard run is VERY slow! (Many stops)

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: suzi27mcd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights (Jun 24 - 27). Great location for Fremont experience and the ability to walk only a few paces to visit other casinos. Rooms very clean, although smoking room was very smokey. Buffet breakfast excellent and good value. Nice relaxed atmosphere. Perfect to adjust to the time difference and recover from the journey before hitting the strip. Pool very cold first thing in the morning as it takes a while for the sun to hit it. Nice pool area though. No complaints at all about this hotel, although we preferred the strip location (stayed at Aladdin for the remiander fo our trip) as there was much more happening on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Shop Around Before you Stay at The GN”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four nights and three days at the GN. When we arrived after a long flight, we were bombarred by GN reps wanting to give us their promo package. Here's what they offerd. If you took their tour of there upcoming new Casino the Grandview in south Vegas, you would get 50.00 in Casino money or a three day trip to Florida or Las Vegas. My suggestion, DO NOT TAKE the promo. They will tell you at the desk that it will only take two fours. Not True!! My wife and I left at 10.30 a.m. and did not get back till 2:00 p.m. and that is after we told them that we were not interested in purchasing a time-share apartment. That's right folks, they try and sell you a time-share at the Grandview Hotel & Casino for as little as $8990 with a deposit of $890 and between 71.00 to 89.00 per month depending on our credit rating!! The $8990 is their cheapest package. Once you get to their site, you still have to go thru their who cycle of talks even if you are not interested. Of course, we did this just to get their promotion package which included a free 3 day trip to Florida or Vegas and free tickets to see Gordie Brown which was their nightly entertainment at that time. If you were to purchase the entertainment tickets it would cost you 99.00 for two.In my opinion, the show was not worth 99.00 nor worth free tickets. As far as food in concerned, you can eat just as good and cheaper outside of the GN. We ate, after a tip from one of the GN employees, at the Golden Gate Hotel and Casino at the Bay City Dinner. My wife had Prime Rib for 5.99 and I had pasta for 4.99 and it was great!! I found the GN casino not to be the highest payout casino as mentioned in one of the LV review magazines. I did poorly at GN and it was not until I played at the Golden Gate and Fitzgeralds did I hit my big wins. Finally, if you are planning to stay at the GN I suggest shopping around first. There are so many better deals elsewhere and even on the strip that beat what GN is offering. I feel that once south Vegas is up and running, GN will have a run for their money. One GN employee stated that it is not going to affect GN because they have 450,000 people coming to Vegas every day of the year. I beg to differ. By the way, it's not just the GN that is offer the time-share apartments, other casino are doing the same thing. So if you are planning on going to Las Vegas..Shop-Around before you stay at the Golden Nugget!! Good Luck and may the Chips fall in your lap!!

Reviews.Title: “At the Fremont Experience Rocked”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Golden Nugget in Downtown Vegas. Let’s just say the only thing memorable about this trip was the Fremont Experience. The lights, music, and atmosphere were awesome. Would have preferred choosing a different hotel especially since the Golden Nugget tends to cater towards the older crowd. Food was horrible (would not recommend the buffet). However, the room was clean and very nice. Not too many good places to shop within the hotel. The only good thing about the Golden Nugget was a decent room and of course the Fremont Experience. Would not recommend anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights in Vegas over the Fourth of July. Our stay at the Golden Nugget was EXCELLENT....we will definitely return. After reading several "not so good" reviews of the Nugget we were a little leary but all went so much better than we had hoped. Check in & out was very fast and the food at the snack bar is delicious as well as in the restaurant. Had a great day by the pool with great drink service. The bartenders were very nice and the housekeepers did an excellent job. We stayed in the South Tower and were very pleased with our rooms. I have heard a lot of people say the walk from the South Tower to the casino is too far....it's really not. I would highly recommend the Nugget to anyone. We have been to Vegas more than a dozen times and usually stay on the Strip but are very happy we chose to try the Nugget this time.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE TREATMENT AND FOOD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were abashed by the treatment that we recieved at the time we checked in. We asked for the Discount Booklet and were told that because we went through ORBITZ we were not entitled to it. My wife then asked why the other couple, her brother and his wife, got one and that they came the same way we did because she booked them as well as us at the same time. After a hurrah they gave us one rerluctantly. The food in the buffet is alright however the restraunt food is terrible. My wife and her mother both became ill and it ruined their day needless to say. My wife and I have never been treated this way at any other place that we have stayed at in Vegas before and we will never go back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Nugget Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Ladygriff
Reviews.Content: We booked the GN over the internet based on price, rating and reviews. This was our second trip to Las Vegas. The first time we stayed on the strip. This time we wanted to check out the "Freemont Experience" so we chose a hotel downtown. I must say, on the way to the hotel, the further away from the strip the bus travelled, the more uneasy we became, especially given some of eyesores along the way to the hotel. After checking in, checking out the common area and getting into our room on the fourteenth floor, it was clear we had nothing to worry about. We were thrilled with the room which was modern and beautifully furnished. The food was ok, service was excellent and the price was unbeatable. The light show each night outside the hotel doors was spectacular, like a party! Free shows on the 'community stages' and you could walk out of one casino and right into another. Our time away was every bit what a vacation should be. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat! The Golden Nugget rocks!

Reviews.Title: “GN best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas and got to tell you about the GN. Three girlfriends and I stayed there with adjoining rooms and what a great time we had. We especially noticed how quiet and soundproof the rooms were and how comfortable the beds were at the end of long day of exploring Vegas. We range in age from 61 to 81, so we have stayed a lot of places and travelled a great deal. We all agreed this was one of the best experiences we ever had. Everyone was friendly and could not have been more helpful. Any question was answered with a beautiful smile. The doorman told us the best deals on traveling around the city. We enjoyed the hot tub at the pool with drinks at our finger tips. We stayed 3 nights and was sorry to leave so soon. Our rooms were spotless.....housekeeping the very best!!! We ate at the buffet twice and both times the food was outstanding. We also enjoyed the 24 hour cafe....service just a tad slow, but worth the wait. Our annual trip to Vegas will again be at the Golden Nugget.....OUTSTANDING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pup4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nugget from 6/5-6/9. It was a great Hotel and the security was tight. Our room was very clean, nice drapes, linens, carpet, furniture, etc. was new and not outdated. The bathroom was small but had nice new fixtures, marble counter, clean shower with GREAT water pressure. There was large thick fluffy white towels, that were new not worn. They had a hair dryer, with lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. There soap was mint and smelled great and was non drying. Housekeeping was great cleaning our room early and we were very messy. It was my Husband, sister and myself in the room with all our stuff and we were tight. The closet was nice and large with enough hangers, They had a newer iron and board. There was a easy to use safe in the closet that was free. Cokes in the machine on the floor were 2.00 and snacks were 3.00. The view was OK. We had a view of the remote strip and some mountains. The hotel was basically very friendly, some Blackjack dealers were rude but no one was tipping and they do take alot of abuse from drunk people. The food wasn't very good in my opinion. Checkin was fast, there is a long walk from the casino if you are in the south tower. Will go back, A++++

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget- Nice”
Reviews.Author: fsoriano
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Nugget. First off, this was our first trip to Vegas and felt that we needed to pay our respects to Downtown Vegas. We arrived Thursday the 23rd about 7pm. Check in was super quick. Stayed in room 1599 in the South Tower. Room was good sized with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom was clean and average size. Tub drained slow so the showers had to be fast. Did not eat at the restaurants at the GN, Had dinner at the Magnolia in the 4 Queens on Thurs. night (Average). Lunch at Harrah's buffrt on Fri. (excellent), Sandwich at the Deli in NYNY (Average). Lunch at the Sahara buffet on Sat. (TERRIBLE) dinner at Aladdin Sat. night (above average) and Lunch at ESPNZone on Sun (Nice but little pricey). We watched the light show on Fremont fri. night (very good). Went to see Zumanity on Fri. night at NYNY (very good). Overall we spent most of our time at NYNY and the surrounding Casinos. Didn't expect to see as many families as we did on the strip. I think we will take the kids next time. Downtown was nice but think the strip will be our calling next time around. Thanks GN for a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare ....”
Reviews.Author: MOM52mom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel Sunday morningi,got in the valet line, popped the trunk, struggled to get our bags out, then were asked if we needed any help....we had done the hard part, so I thought, pulled our bags to the front door, struggled again to get the door open, because the two door men were talking about some guy that "STIFFED" them on a tip. front desk clerk was rude, two block walk to our elevator. get to the room, no A/C, called front desk, 20 min. later, called again, unpacked, called again. They told us to go about our business, and the A/C would be fixed but the time we got back, three hour later, it wasn't. Had to repack and move rooms. Paid $30.00 for the Sunday buffet, about 3 PM and was little to choice from and really bad. Next day my daughter and I went out walking, I waited down stairs while she took some things up to the room, she was tired of carrying. 30 min. later she limps back up with tears in her eyes. She had been knocked down by a group of young people that were a little drunk coming off the elevator. As she lay on the floor, three security people, 5 foot away, never lended a hand, but did seem to get a laugh out of it. My daughter had surgery on her knee a little over a year ago, and when she fell, it went our place. We spent the next four days, doing very little. I went and talked to the manager about all of this, she offered up a free breakfast for all of you trouble.... FREE.....I paid $1,100 fo this trip. My daughter had never been to Las Vegas before . What will she remember, Rude people, Bad food, and alot of pain. Thanks Golden Nugget for absolutly nothing. Morgan

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: trifique
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with our room and found this to be the nicest hotel (by far) in downtown. There is plenty of storage space, a makeup vanity with the best mirror I've ever used (I got lots of compliments on my makeup application). The bed was super comfy and we had a great view from the 22nd floor. The downtown area in general is more local and/or seasoned gamblers rather than tourists. Not the place if you love nightlife, perfect if you just want relaxation and luxury. The GN is not the greatest for gambling, but there are lots of casinos in the area with looser slots and lower table limits. And forget about getting the cocktail waitress to get your drinks to you. We ordered and waited and waited and finally decided to go gamble somewhere else. Not very good deals in the restaurant, average food. Try the $2.99 late night breakfasts at Las Vegas Club instead. We didn't use the pool, but it was always crowded. The staff was great, very helpful and friendly. We had a slight issue with the tub and maintenance responded in under 5 minutes! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Week Long Stay at the GN”
Reviews.Author: vegascrazycanuck
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I have just returned from a week long stay at the GN (June 5 to 12). We found certain elements excellent and others slightly below average. Making a reservation was a breeze. We booked directly with the GN back in March with a rate of $59 per night week day and $99 per weekend. A couple of weeks later they dropped the weekend price to $79 dollars on the internet. I called to see if we were able to get that price and they said there was not a problem. They didn't even blink an eye they just did it. For the entire week we only paid $513 USD including all taxes and fees. An excellent price for such a classy place. Check in was easy but we were there at 11:30pm. The atmosphere was elegant and the attention to detail was excellent, I was forever seeing someone buffing the brass or cleaning the glass on the doorways. It was hard to imagine that the hotel was over 50 years old. The rooms did not look their age. They were simple but very clean. We stayed on the 7th floor in room 7111. It was a bit of a trek from the casino but at that price who cares! We had a smoking two queen bedroom, but the room didn't smell smokey. (I'm a non smoker whereas my mother is). We also had a table and two comphy chairs and a vanity which was handly because the counter was really high in the bathroom so it made it difficult to put my contacts in. The bathroom was a little small but large enough to get things done. The maid service was EXCELLENT! The room was always very clean and done promptly. The first day we had a bit of trouble with the bath tub not draining well but it was because the drain was not fully open. Once we figured that out we never had another problem. Our flight out was not until 4:30pm so we called down to ask if we could check out later and they said it was not a problem and there was no fee involved. We ate in the 24 hour Cafe twice and we had the Champagne Brunch on Sunday before we left. The food in the cafe was okay (Canadian equivalent Pantry, ABC) and hot, but the pricing was exactly the same as back home. Example $9.95 for a sandwich and fries. The service was indifferent the first time we went and good the second. I was disapointed with the Buffet. The selection was great but the food was cold and the service terrible. The guy we had was always reaching across our food to grab our sugar packages that we used for our coffee. No excuse me or asking if we needed anything. He must have really hated to see used sugar packs on the table. It got to the point that we politely hinted to leave us alone. He also didn't pour our champange and orange juice properly either. I ended up making a mess when I tried to mix the two. We found the Cashiers snarky when we were cashing in our travellers cheques, but the doormen very friendly and helpful. Bar tenders were also friendly and the time share people didn't bother us. The pool area was very pretty but the pool hours were horrible. 9am to 7pm. Dawn down there was at 4am and after a night of gambling it would have been nice to go for a dip before we went for a nap. Security was hot and cold. Some were not paying attention and pretty much let anyone up the elevators and others were checking everyone's key card. We found the slots to be very tight (I put in a $20 into a wild cherry quarter machine and didn't even make a single quarter) and the table minimums way too rich for our blood. ($15 Black jack, $5 Roulette with $25 down inside and another $25 outside) A couple of pointers: 1) Ask for a room closer to the elevators if you have trouble walking because it's a long walk just to the elevator from the casino and another long trek to your room. 2) Tip your maid. It's amazing how quick they'll make up your room if you leave $1 per person for them. 3) Book directly online you'll get a better rate 4) Don't use the phone in the room for local calls it costs you a $1 each time. Find a payphone downstairs. Overall I will definately stay at the GN again but I will not eat or gamble there. There are much better places along Fremont to do that and they are only a couple of steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Downtown Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: vrite
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget really is the best place to stay downtown. Many things have been written about the GN but what impressed us the most was the tight security. Our room was in the South Tower and no one goes past the security gentlemen wthout showing their room key! We tried the North Tower last year and the best thing about the North Tower is the proximity to The Buffet, the casino and the valet parking. The nice thing about the South Tower is the proximity to the Self Parking garage and the 24-hour Carson Street Cafe! The Buffet at the GN is regular but they have the best matzo ball chicken soup/dish -- the best comfort food after a long day shopping, hotel hopping and seeing the sights. The GN bread pudding is also the best! Right outside is the Fremont Street Experience which was not "on" during our visit last week but every night we enjoyed different concerts/shows and it's a short walk to ABC Stores (for bottled water) and Krispy Kreme doughnuts (at Fitzgerald's). The GN is hands down the only hotel to stay in downtown and the only casino downtown where you can still breath comfortably without bringing home a cough and congestion for a souvenir.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobambro
Reviews.Content: used this site to decide where to spend a nite downtown before spending several days on the strip...figured the golden nugget deserved a try, and if we werent impressed, it was only for one nite anyway and we would have the aladdin to look foward to....for whatever reason (maybe because we were a harmless looking mid aged couple) we got upgraded to a suite, and could not be more thrilled....my wife and i could have lived there and been happy...marble and brass all over the large layout....26" tvs and a bose wave radio in both the living room (with marble wet bar) and the bed room....big jacuzzi tub in one bathroom and a hugh walk in shower in the second bathroom (which also had a small tv on the vanity)....the bed was by for the most comfortable hotel bed we've ever slept on...next visit to vegas we will probably stay at the golden nugget for the duration...plenty to do downtown and the slots seem far more generous than on the newer end of the strip....great stay, you cant go wrong here...

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Young (21-35 age group)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is BY FAR the nicest of the "downtown" hotel/casinos. Although, if you are in the 21-35 age group, I would not recommend staying there. The dealers seem pretty friendly. But wait in line for the TRUE older gamblers to leave their seats. The casinos around the Nugget offer lower limit tables and very friendly dealers. There seems to be a more laid back atmosphere downtown. Don't expect a great pool. It is more like a kiddie pool with a swarm of pool chairs. You have to wait in line in the morning to even get a chair. Not worth the wait. (We went to the Wynn. Amazing drinks, but kind of pricey at $12.) The buffet is okay. Nothing to write home about. I heard ZAX was great though. There is a STARBUCKS in the hotel. YAY! They have a small patio to watch the Freemont Light Show at night. That was fun. You can see pretty some funny people watching there. As far as night life.....the Nugget does not offer anything for the younger age group . It seems that the average age at the Nugget was 45. There is nothing about 40 somethings that I don't like. But when I go to Vegas, and I am drinking and laughing out loud with my girlfriends, I don't want any dirty looks for being too loud. We experienced that quite often. Come on! We're in Vegas...lighten up! We felt like we had to "behave" as if our parents were with us. (The Hard Rock welcomes fun!) The rooms are very clean and pretty nice. There is a vanity with mirrors galore and outlets for the ladies. The rooms are quite large and include a seating area. The Golden Nugget was an overall nice and "okay" hotel. It is definitely above average in the cleanliness and look area. But, it is average or below for it's nightlife, pool, and younger activites. Like I said before, if you are in the 21-35 age bracket...go to the Hard Rock, Palms, MGM, THE STRIP AREA! I'll go back to the Nugget when I'm ready for a quiet and relaxing Vegas vacation. As for now, I'll stick to the younger part of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for downtown”
Reviews.Author: marymcq
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago to be downtown...I don't know if it's only me but I get nostalgic for the "old" Vegas and love the older casinos downtown. The Golden Nugget was a great place to stay. It's kind of a pain to get to from the strip but once you know your way around it's easy. The hotel is a great deal for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lousy City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, though it is located in a less desirable part of town. Downtown is old and outdated. The only thing nice is the Golden Nugget. It truly was the only thing that saved our tip from being a total disaster. Las Vegas is absolutely DISGUSTING. America should be ashamed of it (yes I am an American). If you like prostitutes and do not object to litter and a LOT of tobacco smell then this is your place! You have the option of $$$$ shops like Armani, Chanel etc. or crap you expect at a dollar store - no in between. Shopping is great for those with endless amounts of money, and the pits for everyone else earning below say 1/4 million a year. The streets are LOADED with ILLEGAL aliens passing out hooker flyers like it was the "Extra, extra, read all about it" Kennedy assassination paper. It is a deeply disturbing place. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading so many great reviews on the Golden Nuggett , we were very suprised and disappointed with our stay. I do have to say, for the money, the rooms are fairly decent and clean and the hotel itself is nice but that's about the only good thing I can say about this hotel. The biggest frustration and disappointment for us was that the small pool area didn't open until 11:00 and only had about 40-50 lounge chairs for a hotel with almost 2000 rooms. If you're not standing in line when the pool opens (yes there's a line) you can forget about having a chair. My friend and I went down to the pool around 11:15 and there was only about 15 people around the pool but every single chair was "saved" with either a a towel or personal items laid on them. Several people were upset like ourselves and when we inquired with the pool supervisor, he said there was nothing he could do, we should have gotten in line before the pool opened! We waited for over an hour and still most chairs were not "physically" occupied... I realize that gambling is the main purpose to go to vegas but for many people lounging by the pool is way up there with trip importance. Our group gambled at the GN for 3 days and no one won or let alone saw anyone win on slots. We also played table games but were very turned off by the cranky dealers. Occassionally there was a great dealer but most everyone one we encountered seemed miserable. The food was very bland and below average for the price, except at Stefano's. Stefano's was excellent and one of the only bright spots during our stay. Settling our bill at check out took more than 45 minutes as we had to stand in line for almost a half hour. There were only 2 people at the desk with a very long line. You get what you pay for at this hotel, I do not see whatsoever how this could be even close to a four star hotel.. I've stayed at many other vegas hotels for the same price but with far better pool areas, better food and loser slots... We will never stay here again and did not enjoy our trip because of our frustrations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Bristolmember
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 4 nights in March 2004 and had a great time there. The staff were helpful and there are plenty of places to eat whilst there. The court yard restaurant offered an excellent variety of food at reasonable prices. The room service there was excellent and the breaskfast which we ordered one morning was of mammouth size proporations! Extremely hard for two skinny Brits to eat!! Golden Nugget is situated in downtown Vegas and is central to the Fremont Street Experience and is half an hour's bus drive away from the main strip. However the public bus service is not very reliable and when the buses do arrive they are often too full to get onto so I would recommend if you have the money to get taxis to and from the strip in peak hours. I would recommend that people visit the Red Rock Canyon which is a magnificent experience, that is only 30 minutes away! I would recommend the Showtime Tours in Neveda as a good sightseeing company which can to take you to Red Rock & other excursions on offer in the area. We were able to see Red Rock, Elvis -A- Rama and Ethel M Chocolate factory and Botancial Gardens for $49.99 which is a bargain. This was my second trip to Las Vegas- I last visited in 1990 and was a little disappointed by the way in which the main strip has changed. In my opinion it has become too commerical and has lost its original charm & appeal. I would recommend to anyone who is in search of the excitement and glamour of old time Vegas to stay in the Fremont Street/Downtown area. If you don't know what I mean just watch the current Snoop Dogg & Justin Timberlake video for 'SIGNS'

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Slothappy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget Apr. 24-29. Our flight was delayed so we were late checking in, we had booked a non smoking room. When we went to check in we were told only smoking rooms were available. We were not happy about that and told the clerk that there was no way we would be staying in a smoking room. We had stayed at the Golden Nugget in October of last year and had no problem with our room. After about 5 minutes the clerk said we would be upgraded to a suite for the first night and our regular room would be available the next day. Well we were very impressed with the service and the suite was unbelievable. We had to come down to earth the next day and take a regular room but our stay was great, the room was very clean and the Carson City Cafe was very nice, great food. We even won on the slots!! All in all would recommend this hotel, it is nice to be away from the strip and it doesn't take long to get there if you want. Freemont Experience was enjoyable. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyA50
Reviews.Content: Two months before our trip, I booked, confirmed and payed in advance for our room with a king bed. We were there to celebrate our 10th anniversary and I wanted everything to go smoothly, so I even called again to confirm. When we arrived on 4-24-05, we were told all that was left was a room with 2 double beds. I advised the desk clerk that I had confirmed a king bed. She snapped at me and told me there were no confimations for king beds, it was just a request and they wouldn't be able to honor that request. I asked for a coupon book, that was refused. The room was about the quality of a Super 8 motel, absolutely nothing special. We had a lovely view of the bus station and some cheap hotels. If you like to eat, stay somewhere other than downtown, unless you enjoy waiting in 2 hour lines for bland, nothing special food. Lines are long at expensive restaurants and the cheap buffets. While we were in Vegas, we happened upon The Orleans, a hotel/casino that we have decided we will stay at from now on. The Golden Nugget isn't worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: mimigirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Vegas and stayed at the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas. Check in was a breeze, the room on the 21st floor was very luxurious, marble countertops in bathroom was a plus, even the hallways were elegant. Even though we spent minimal time here, when we were here, it was definitely worth the time. Check out the lounge band, Stepenstonz, which plays Motown hits at 10 pm in the Lounge after the Races are over. Breakfast Buffet was good for price but did not think the lunch buffet was much of a selection. I personally did not like the Gordie Brown show, they show too much of his act on their channel in the room so everything I thought was funny, I had already seen for free. He needs to update that act. Overall, a great hotel to stay at and if you stay downtown, the best.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget..............a true treasure!”
Reviews.Author: galbjc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 day 4 night stay (April 14-18 2005) at the Golden Nugget. This was the 1st time we stayed downtown on the "old strip" and we enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was outstandingly modern, spacious, and everything we were looking for. We stayed in the south tower on the 17th floor room number 17106. The walk to the main casino was nothing really and we were approached by the timeshare sales people but paid no attention to them as we walked right by. The hotel is very decorative with all the polished brass and marble floors. Our check in was extremely fast and the counter person extremely professional! We did manage to eat breakfast and lunch on three different occasions at their buffet restaurant and the food was awesome. The spreads of many different foods were astounding and delicious, especially the sushi and seafood! The cost of the lunch buffet was a great deal at $8.00 per person! We also ate at the hotel cafeteria, Lilly Langtrys and had excellent fare there as well. We really enjoyed staying downtown and seeing the old strip along with the Freemont Street Experience light show..........this is truly a show not to be missed! The cost of food is much less on the old strip and we also enjoyed playing the old style slot machines which payback with coins instead of a printed ticket. For a small $5 daily fee, one can purchase an unlimited use bus pass for 24 hours on the city transit to take you between the old and new strip. I highly recomend staying downtown at the Golden Nugget as I know my wife and I will stay there the next time we visit Vegas. You will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints..At all!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas we stayed at the GN from 4/15-4/18 and it was perfect. We were in the South tower, the room was very clean and very comfy. The entire hotel was very nice and didnt quite look like it belonged downtown. The sales people bugging you by the elevator left us alone after we told them no the first time. There was only someone checking for room keys twice. Check in took us about an hour as they definitely take their time. The food at carson's wasnt the best but it did the job. I definately reccommend the GN if you are staying downtown. We actually enjoyed Freemont more than the strip. Slots were ok, better at the hole in the wall Mermaids on Freemont. Binions s----- as far as looks and the smell, but I won quite a bit of money on the quarter slots there. The loosest slots were on the strip at the Luxor, and we won the most ($500) at NY NY. Overall, Vegas is overrated. If we ever go back, we will stay at the GN again if we want to stay downtown. If not, the NY NY and we will never leave as everything is the same in all the hotels. Expensive drinks with rock gut liquor. it was so hard to find Bacardi Silver and Jack anywhere unless you bought the bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Much better in town for alot less!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: Our stay this trip involved 3 hotels of which GN was over a weekend (4/8-4/10). Rates seemed high at $187 per night for what we got. Check-in was slow and many agents just standing behind others not helping while open computers were available. Only 6 couples in line before us and took more than 30 minutes. Unnacceptable to me. The first room was North Tower floor 22-room 125. The longest walk from the elevator. Wear good shoes! The room had so much air spray in it my eyes watered. My sinuses filled up - it was awful. We asked for a change. At first they said, "No, open the window and turn on the air." We came back 3 hours later and it was just as bad. Finally, they agreed to move us. We stayed in the North tower and had floor 15-room 064. Small room, small bath and not worth the money in our opinion. See my review of Terrible's to compare. While I can easily say "no", the timeshare people were out of control. You cannot pass to the elevators without them jumping in front of you. Why would hotels do this? It was an invasion! Ate at Zax - was terrific. That was the good part of the GN. I rated this a 2 but would go 2 1/2. It was not horrible just that we are not picky people and felt the price for what we got and compared to what we get elsewhere in Vegas was not worth staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: mpowers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 2 nights at the Nugget (we spent our third night out at Green Valley Ranch in Henderson). We have never been to the Nugget, but really did enjoy our experience there - no real complaints. It is the nicest option downtown and the service was very good. We only had breakfast in the buffet in the mornings, so I really can't comment on the food overall. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable, never had any noise issues from other guests. The Freemont Street Experience was something fun to see, overall, we had no complaints and would return if we elected to stay downtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget... Making a comeback”
Reviews.Author: hacmco
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-night stay. I must say the hotel, which had gone down in service last year, is getting back to the levels of 2003... We visit LV 3-4 times a year and always spend at least a few nights here. As far as timeshare.... We are a couple and even though we were approached a couple of times, the sales staff took "NO" for an answer, so this was really not an issue. The rooms continue to be great and the service is getting much, much better. The casino and its staff are friendly. At the time we were planning this trip we thought twice about returning here. I'm glad we decided to come back! We will do it again.

Reviews.Title: “no problems to report,,everything was good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just in from a wonderful 6 nite stay,( I vist several times a year and always select The Nugget) checked in with minimal delay (North Tower), even tho there was a small line things were moving quickly, could not understand why the check in counter at the south tower was closed but it was not a big problem- have seen numerous reviews on The Nugget and most all state how annoying the time share gang is--My visit was uneventful in that regard, as a solo traveler it seems there focus in much more on the couples so perhaps that is why I was left alone for the most part (thank goodness), I was approached one time but simply kept walking, my advice to make this a non issue is as follows- if you come off the elevator (and the time share booth is right there) they seem to pounce on the traveler who is somewhat unsure of his surrondings, somewhat like a fishing expedition for the time share guys I guess, look straight ahead and keep waking with a purpose- I had a brief convesation with a bellman about this subject and he informed me that many guest complain about this so I would imagine the new owners would (should) in time make the time share guys disappear all together- probably have a lengthy contract but common sense would say that if everyone is uncomfortable with the time share guys in time they will go away--lets hope! now on to the visit--My room in the south tower was clean and the king size bed was comfortable the only drawbacks to the room were the air conditoner was rather loud when it was running and I could hear the various doors open and close as the other guests were coming and going, I will admit I'm a very light sleeper and this will probably not be a problem for the average visitor, now on to the best part of the stay--first The Spa,,in a word OUTSTANDING- this is THE BEST 15 dollars you will spend in Las Vegas, period, the facility is outstanding (lots of cardio equipment, a weight room and sauna, steam ,whirpool are all superb) also the staff is quite personable and on top of things--The Manager, Lance, is a pro's pro and you will be glad you stopped by, Room service was also very enjoyable, on both my calls I was told it would be thirty minutes , the food arrive prompty in 20 minutes both times and was awesome--prime rib the first nite and a high quality turkey club on the second call could not have been any tastier- again,,service was fast, friendly and personable. top notch all the way. as a frequent visitor to Las Vegas I highly recommend The Mighty Nugget, also there sports book is well staffed and they always seem to have the BEST Number, I do wish it was bit larger but hey, the winners pay off the same either way- do yourself a favor the next time you visit and select The Golden Nugget you will be glad you did, and I'll see you at The Cashiers Window.

Reviews.Title: “March Madness at the checkin”
Reviews.Author: PageantDirector
Reviews.Content: Check In: We arrived at the worst possible time. March Madness weekend. We waited 1/2 hour to check in. The concierge/or someone in a black coat was trying to manage check out traffic in the lines. He started moving people around, but we ended up waiting the longest, people from the back of the line were moved to open hotel staff, it was kind of annoying.. Room: Room was superb. We asked for Nonsmoking and that's what we got...very clean, gold design a nice touch. Casino: Very smoky..when are people going to give that nasty habit up. When I say smoky..I mean cigar smoking smoky... Fremont street.. Not a place for kids..I read up on Vegas and they suggested Fremont was kid friendly..its NOT..unless you want your kid seeing a 1/2 clothed lady advertising a strip joint on the street..in bright lights.. when I wasn't covering her face, my daughter did enjoy the beautiful light show at night..all free..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NewToChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Golden Nugget, loved every minute. The room was glamourous, the staff was friendly and helpful, the Gordy Brown Show was one of the best I've ever seen, the buffet was my favorite, and I ate at the Bellagio and Mandalay Bay buffets, also. I am not much of a gambler so do not have that to be negative about. Overall, GN is a great value, well worth the cost. We did take taxi's to get to other destinations which was kind of scary with crazy driving, so watch out, but that was nothing to do with the Golden Nugget.F

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, met expectations”
Reviews.Author: Girlfriendal
Reviews.Content: Of course I would have rather stayed in the Bellagio or the Venetian, but the Golden Nugget has the distinction of being the highest rated hotel for the best deal you're going to get in Vegas. Our room was quite large and quite adequate, clean and well kept by maid service. Nothing ornate or jaw dropping, but we got a really good deal on it. For a 4 star hotel you can often get a room for the cost of the average 2-3 star hotel in Vegas - and we got free show tickets and free food tickets along with the deal. No internet access available in room. I don't know when all of today's hotels are going to get on the ball and have WiFi available as a standard amenity. No minibar, I had hoped, but that's ok - they're always overpriced anyhow - just go to the Walmart and get a styrofoam cooler, some beverages, and some ice from the ice machine in the hotel - all set. The casino seemed much like they all do, no better or worse. The in-hotel food options were also comparable. One of the better buffets in Vegas, and low cost too. The parking across the street (it's also one of the few hotels in Vegas that have a pay lot - cept it's free for hotel guests when you present your room key) was a bit inconvenient, and the garage was often quite crowded, but when compared to the garages of some of the other hotels...even if they are attached to the hotel itself they are so far away from where your room actually ends up being, there isn't much difference. The golden Nugget is a bit less daunting in size - you don't need marathon training to get from one side of the hotel and back. Not on the strip but the Freemont Experience is right outside the hotel and it's pretty cool. All in all, for a Vegas hotel in comparison, better than a Tropicana, nothing like Bellagio, good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel In The Crown Of Downtown Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: discjoker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both mid twenties) traveled to Las Vegas for one week in early March. The first part of our stay we stayed at the Palms (see seperate review). The second part of our stay, we stayed at the Golden Nugget. We wanted to get a taste of downtown and have heard so many great things about The Nugget. We checked in at around 4pm and were assigned a room on the 17th floor of the south tower. Check-in was quick, friendly, and efficient. Our room was a "standard" deluxe non-smoking room. The room was well appointed, clean and comfortable. It was on-par with a better Hilton. The view was looking toward Main St and the Plaza Hotel. There were only two small annoyances with the room. First, the air conditioning unit was a little noisy. Second, the towels were a little rough. The casino seems oddly laid out and a little cramped. You will find all of your favorite table games and slots ranging from 1 cent all the way up to $500 a pull. Cocktail service seems quick and friendly. My wife and I like to play slots and video poker occasionally and it seemed like the slots were tighter than most places downtown. We had two meals at The Nugget. Our first morning there we had breakfast from The Buffet. The food was very good but the buffet area was small and the layout wasn't very efficient. Also, the line to get in to the place was quite long. The next morning we had room service which was fast, hot, tasty and pretty reasonable. One thing I really want to address are the timeshare sales people located throughout the resort. You have a few options with these people. Option number one is ignore them (very easy to do). Option number two is tell them you are leaving that day or early the next day if they ask how long you are there for (this will get them to leave you alone for the time being). And option number three, talk to them and listen to their sales pitch. They are just doing their job and really aren't that much of an annoyance. And finally, if you were a fan of The Casino telelvision show on Fox, you most likely will see people you recognize from the show. We spotted a couple of the people from the telelvision show working (one was a dealer, the other was a floor person). The Golden Nugget truly is the Gem Of Downtown. If you are looking for a true 4 star hotel, this is the only one downtown. It will definately be on my list of places to stay next time I am in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay in 3 years.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Third stay in 3 years.Services and accomadations were excellent as ever.Will not stay on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in the old part of town”
Reviews.Author: IdahoJoeJerome
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget is the nicest hotel and casino on Fremont Street, a popular area for the middle class and working class travelers. Fremont Street is a well-known area in Vegas that seems to attract truck drivers, laborers, rowdy party goers and hard drinkers. The hotel itself is a big step above the rest of the area and a nice refuge in a noisy, rough part of town. It's fun to stay there even if you are used to staying on the strip--just for the change if nothing else. Across the street in the basement of the Four Queens is one of the finest restaurants in all of Vegas, Hugo's Cellar. First rate all the way and a real novelty in this part of town. It was voted "Best Gourmet Restaurant" in Vegas for five years in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr37
Reviews.Content: We haven't been to the Golden Nugget in a while, but are visiting again very soon (and have stayed there several times in the past). I wanted to assure readers that we have visited Vegas several times and have found the Nugget to be the best hotel value in Vegas. We have always found the rooms, staff, and service to be top-notch. I have recommended several people to the Nugget and will continue to do so. It's our preferred hotel for Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget, Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Golden Nugget where we had paid for a 5 nite stay but were given only 4. We found that if you have a problem at this hotel, it is your problem. There is no way to complain about it. The people and managment of this hotel will do absolutely nothing. Then you also have to deal with the constant badgering of salespeople the hotel allows to operate inside. If your idea of a vacation is being hounded by salespeople that will say anything, this is the place. The biggest plus of not getting the 5 nights we paid for was that we didn't have to stay another nite. We were ready to leave after the first nite. Our advise is avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “From Golden Visions to Tarnished Reality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our accomodations, along with our airfare through Expedia. Our confirmation assured us a Deluxe, Smoking Room. Upon our arrival, at 2am, a Smoking Room was not available, so we were given a Non-Smoking Room in the North Tower. We were greeted at the elevator by a gentleman who welcomed us to the hotel and wished us luck in the casino as he pressed our floor and sent us to our deluxe room. The room was beautifully and tastefully decorated, the bathroom included a jacuzzi and separate dressing room with wall-to-wall mirrors. There was a bottle of water on the table and a letter from the management, welcoming us to the hotel, wishing us luck in the casino and offering high-speed internet service via our televisio. A keyboard was under the TV and the letter stated that a technician would have to enter our room to set it up. Since we knew that we were moving to another room, we decided we could wait 8 hours, until we were settled. We were assured that our smoking room would be available by 10am and that we should contact the front desk for the new room assignment. ...15hours 40minutes, 3 phone calls and several trips to the front desk later, we were informed that a Smoking Room was now available and that "we could move our bags to the South Tower." Upon arrival in the South Tower, we were certainly not greeted by anyone holding any elevators, we were however stopped and made to produce our room key before we could proceed...not once, not twice, but every trip for the entire week, whether it was 5 hours or 5 minutes since we had passed that point. We were also swarmed by a band of headhunters, hawking free shows and dinners if we would simply sacrafice an hour or two of our coveted vacation time to visit another resort so we could be harrassed further for not buying whatever they were selling...all this negative excitement within 5 feet of the elevator that led to our bedroom for the week, but not one person in this group ever offered to hold an elevator, much less push our floor...on the contrary, they inevitably caused us to miss the elevator and prolong the agony of their abuse even longer. If we showed the slightest displeasure at this belittling situation, the representatives of the Golden Nugget became defensive and gave us attitude that plainly stated, "So What...Who Needs You!" Our deluxe room in the South Tower left volumes to be desired. The decor was dated, at best, there was no jacuzzi and the drains was so slow that you had dirty bathwater above your ankles while you showered. There was no separate dressing room of course, but you could barely get into the closet due to a narrow, sliding door that invariably knocked you in the head with the ironing board each time you opened it and one lamp was in need of a bulb. There was no bottled water, no letter from the management, no letter about high speed internet service and no keyboard with the TV...upon tuning into the hotel menu on the TV, we were informed that those services were not available. We ordered room service and were informed that we were on a "Cash Only" basis as we did not have a credit card on file with the hotel...all previous transactions had been completed with my VISA. On our 4th evening, we returned to the Golden Nugget around Midnight, following a full day on the Strip, including a sumptuous gourmet dinner at the MGM, a couple of world-class shows at the Tropicana and Treasure Island, along with a satisfying winning streak in various casinosl. Excited to change our clothes and hit the Fremont Street Experience, we opened the door to our room to discover that it had not been touched by housekeeping...dirty, wet towels laid in the floor and added a musty, mildewy scent to our already less that aromatic room. We called and demanded that someone come up immediately to rectify the problem...a maid showed up in about 30 minutes, gave us fresh towels, took the dirty ones, emptied our trash all over the hallway and was on her way. On our final day in Las Vegas, our plane left at 10:50pm, we asked the Golden Nugget if we could possibly keep our room just until 5pm instead of the scheduled 1pm check-out, so that we had somewhere to keep our luggage and we could get a shower before having to get on a plane for 7 hours after gambling in their casino all day - - of course, that request was out of the question. We were so disappointed in our stay at the Golden Nugget...we chose that hotel because the name itself says "Las Vegas". Their advertising stood out from the rest with emphasis on the deluxe accomodations. We are nostalgic by nature and this experience took something from us that we will never be able to rekindle. We will return to Las Vegas, there's no other city like it, but we will never return to the Golden Nugget and will be forced to tell anyone who asks, exactly what kind of lasting impression was left by the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino. Flabbergasted in Florida

Reviews.Title: “Going to the chapel and we're........”
Reviews.Author: NurseNan13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights when we went to Las Vegas to get married. The Golden Nugget lived up to my expectations! The hotel is grand, the service was phenomenal (they were even able to get my wedding gown pressed for me), the Buffet could satisfy all tastes, and the casino was fun. On my wedding day, I had my hair done at the GN's salon/spa, staffed with very talented and experienced stylists. Being able to experience the Fremont Street experience was a bonus. The only thing I would do differently on my next visit to Las Vegas is take a cab to the hotel rather than the shuttle....I've ridden roller coasters that were less wild.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights and four days at the Golden Nugget. The rooms were very nice and the casino and hotel staff were polite and helpful. The buffet is great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone. Our stay was 2/26/05-3/1/05

Reviews.Title: “Can hold it's own against any hotel on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a the GN this past weekend - we had never stayed downtown before. I am a bit of a hotel snob and frankly, I was disgusted at the idea of staying downtown. While I agree that downtown Vegas is, well, yucky, let me tell you what the GN experience is like...You pull up to the valet (valet parking is free) and are offered immediate bellhop service. there is a doorman waiting for you at the entrance. Now you are looking at a lobby that is so elegant, with chandeliers, marble floors and counters, and huge floral arrangements. The front desk staff is accomodating and efficient. You step to the elevators and realize the reason the lobby is so classy is that the casino is nowhere to be seen - it is around the corner, out of sight and earshot. Nice. At the elevators, and ever-present attendant calls the elevator and pushes your floor button for you. At this point I can suggest requesting a room near the elevator, as the hallway offers you a very looong walk otherwise. Also, request a room in the South Tower - we were in the North Tower and the view was of the freeway - no good. The decor of the hallways leaves a little to be desired - it is two-toned beige on beige. You arrive at your room, which is really quite cute. Our king size bed had a headboard and drapes at the front. The carpet was clean, the walls were two-toned with crown molding. The closet was mirrored and contained a safe, iron and ironing board, and coat hangers that were not attached to the rod. There was a vanity with a nice stool to sit on, and a magnified makeup mirror. The heating and air worked wonderfully, and the tv worked fine as well. the bathroom left a little to be desired, as it was very small and the water pressure was low. There are no coffee machines in the room, but room service is available 24 hours and has a nice big menu. The room service charge is $4, and they are very fast (and delcicious). One negative is that the walls are thin - I could hear our upstairs neighbor as she came into her room in high heels across the floor and flushed her toilet. The draperies in the room were great -when I woke up in the moring I seriously thought it was about 4:00am...turned out it was 11:30am. Nice and dark! For food: There are 2 nice restaurants, one is Italian and one is Cantonese (called Lillie Langtrys), where we ate. This restaurant is simply breathtaking. It is classy and elegant but not stuffy. The service is amazing - very fast, friendly, helpful. The food is simply out of this world, and not terribly overpriced (slightly cheaper than Spago). We also ate at the 24 hour cafe, which had a small menu but the hamburger and sandwich we ordered were delicious. The cafe is very very adorable and the service, again, was spectacular. There is no food court, but there is a little deli and a Starbucks. The gift shop is open 24 hours which is great if you need aspirin, ciggerettes, cough drops, etc. There are a couple other stores to spend time in as well. We did not visit the pool area, but our room overlooked that area and it did look very nice. I can assume it was well heated because there were no less than 30 people out there on a day that was about 65 degrees. The casino was not up to our standards, as it was very crowded. We never even managed to get to a table. There was no problem with the slot machines though - there are plenty (from 5 cents through $5). For table play we walked to one of the other local casinos and had no problem finding a couple empty seats (although the surrounding casinos are not very pretty, but when you are in a mood for roulette or let it ride who cares). There are two poker rooms at the GN, with a great variety of games. Check-out time is noon which is great, but it was madhouse downstairs. If you are checking our on a Sunday, do yourself a favor and get up early. Go checkout and have the bellhop take your bags. He will have them held until you are ready to go home. I have stayed at Ceasars Palace, Aladdin, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, MGM, and Mandalay Bay. I can tell you that I would put GN up there with any of them. Give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of down town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget 2 times and both times the service was very goodand staff went out of there way to make us happy. When we go to Vegas again we will be staying at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty Nugget”
Reviews.Author: boomer93
