Reviews.Content: This was our first stay downtown, and you can't beat this hotel for the price. The rooms were nicely appointed. The staff was friendly. The casino had excellent drink service, and the machines were clean. We were offered free show tickets and it wasn't even part of our Expedia package. If the bathtub had been marble, I would have rated it excellent instead of above average. The only negatives were just minor things: 1. The lighting in the room was very dim. No wattage printed on the bulbs, but they couldn't have been more than 40 watts. 2. The business center is only open 7am-5pm Vegas time, which I couldn't understand in a business that caters to tourists from all over the world. Internet access was expensive too, at $1 per minute with a $5 minimum. 3. The people hawking timeshares for Grandview were annoying, but just say no and walkaway if you don't want to deal with them. 4. Cab ride to the airport was ~$28.00 each way, plus tip. A designated Nugget shuttle to the strip/airport would be a bonus. As far as staying downtown, it was nice to have several casinos close together, as opposed to a half mile hike to the entrance of each one. Some were nasty (Lady Luck-eeew, what a pit!), but as long as you keep your wits about you, you'll be fine. Saw many police officers on bikes, which was comforting. The bottom line is: If you're expecting the Bellagio, then quadruple the GN room rate and get a room at the Bellagio. But if you want a nice room in a safe location, then the Nugget is your best bet. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In February 2005 we stayed for the first time on Fremont Street at the Goden Nugget...and we loved it. The Nugget is lovely. All the staff was helpful and pleasant. The rooms are nicely furnished, very clean, firm beds, very pleasant. The casino was above average in return on your gambling dollars. The Carson Cafe was a wonderful place to dine. We really liked their breakfast fare. The Nugget has a show "Downtown Gordie Brown"...this is an excellent show, we would recommend it for a fun evening. The only negative was the towels of all things...they were very rough. they need to use more Downy. Make sure you ask for the Tower where the elevator goes directly to the casino (North Tower) otherwise the other Tower is a long walk. We would recommend the Nugget as a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; good service; bad location Feb 11, 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being my forth trip to Vegas, I thought I would try downtown. From all I've heard, the Nugget is the only real downtown hotel if you're high maintenance or demand good service. The GN delivered both. I stayed in the north tower. The rooms have recently been tastfully remodeled and are quite nice. Although the remodel was not thorough. The newer wallpaper covers obvious wall disrepair but it's not too bad. The rooms are furnished nicely as are the bathrooms. Water pressure is a little weak but still usable. The casino is decent, not too big and not too loud like some of the annoying casinos. It could use some newer gaming but it does the trick. I found everything in the hotel quite nice and clean. The food for room service, the restaurants, and the buffet was all excellent. No complaints and the service was quick and friendly. Now the downfall; Location. Fremont street is nice and they've done a great job redoing the street. Also wouldn't be surprised if the screen is extended to cover some new building that's going on. However, if you like the shows, restaurants, shopping, and sightseeing on the strip, you will be bored with downtown quite quickly. In a mere 3 days I spent several hundred in cabs. (I know, I should take the bus) If there is ever a monorail that runs to downtown, I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Nugget again. It really is a great place. If you want a slower pace, only want to gamble, and don't want to deal with moving hoards of people, then downtown at the Golden Nugget is the place to be. MshaneH

Reviews.Title: “Nugget still the jewel of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sunrisegsd
Reviews.Content: Visited Vegas for our fifth stay. Booked our favorite, Golden Nugget several months in advance. We were a little concerned that the new owners may not have been able to maintain the same high stadards or have the ability to keep a motivated, happy workforce. Happy to report that all appears well. The staff was as professional as ever and the place was spotless as always. This Hotel is class. Everything about the Nugget is first rate. I do have a complaint about not being able to book a Saturday arrival on the Golden Nugget web site. Had to use a booking service and pay extra. While I was checking in someone walked in off the street that had never stayed there and was quoted a room rate far below what I had paid. I was unable to negotiate a matching rate since I had already booked "with an outside agent". It is apparent that the Nugget is catering to High Rollers more and more. They do need to remember that us guppies are important too.

Reviews.Title: “Great to Be Downtown”
Reviews.Author: letsgonow
Reviews.Content: We four nights in February '05 and everything was just great? Rooms were in great shape and the hotel staff were helpful. Most of all we love the convience of being downtown. You can get off of the property and on your way in a matter of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Nugget”
Reviews.Author: lijedo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nugget in early January, as I usually stay there at least 5 times per year, however this may be the last time. They have always had water problems, both smell and taste. They even went as far as to completely turn off the water one night, but comped us TWO small bottles of water. Water problems still existed when I left three days later. SMELLS LIKE SEWAGE. The slot machines were filthy. I resorted to cleaning them myself if I wanted to play them. The food at the buffet was good, but as I was leaving with a half of a muffin wrapped up to take out, I was stopped by the staff and chided that I could not take any food out. VERY EMBARRASSING. They have a slot card that I have always used for them to track my play at the slots and the tables. When I tried to use the card at the tables, I was told that my play could not be tracked unless I was playing $25 per hand, although my play varies from $10 to $40 per hand. When I made my reservations, I was told my room would be comped. When I tried to do an express checkout on the in room TV, it was not working, so I left without knowing how much my bill was. When I got my credit card bill, they had charged me for the room. When I found this out, I emailed the GN about all of the problems, but still have not received a reply. I know that they have sold again and probably have a lot of unhappy employees, but do they want unhappy patrons also? We don't usually return--especially if the problems are not addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms - downtown not quite there though”
Reviews.Author: CanadianRambler
Reviews.Content: We decided to give downtown a try for part of this, our 3rd trip to Vegas. We'd seen the TV show, and the rates were reasonable ($65 a night Sunday/Monday) so we gave the Nugget a try. As it turned out, we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel other than the rooms and the casino (in other words, the perfect stay from a hotel-owners perspective), but what we were able to see we were pretty impressed with. Once you get off the main level and up to the rooms, the hotel approaches 5-star territory. Very tasteful decorating, new TVs with all the bells and whistles (almost - more below), and large marble bathrooms are all the equivalent or better than what we've stayed in on the Strip. The room was also the quietest we've stayed in in Vegas. What we saw of the rest of the hotel was OK, but certainly had none of the "wow" factor you might get on the Strip. That might be to be expected - all of Fremont street is probably not much longer than the roadway in front of the Mirage, so there's not a lot of room downtown for spectacle (the overhead thing is pretty cool though, speaking of spectacles). The Casino was unremarkable (and small by Strip standards) except for one thing - the fabulous leather chairs. Very easy to spend a lot of time on these things. The drink service was also a little on the slow side, but mentioning that to management rectified it in a hurry. A few complaints - first, when we checked out there was a $75 phone charge on our bill because somehow the phone didn't hang up after we had finished speaking to our airline. The hotel should have clued in beforehand that we didn't spend 500 straight minutes on the phone, but they did take care of it when we brought it to their attention. Second, how a couple of internet millionaires allow the TV internet service in their own hotel to be so bad is a little puzzling. Slow connections, poor interface and maddening wireless gizmos mean don't bother paying for this. Plus I thought their website was crappy, but see they have since updated it. Third, I agree with the other complaints regarding the shysters in the lobbies (and throughout the rest of Downtown I might add). Are the sales for whatever these jokers are selling (we never stopped) really worth annoying paying customers? Overall though, these annoyances were minor in the grand scheme. As for the "Freemont Street Experience" downtown, now that I've been downtown I'm not sure I'd stay down there again. We did have a lot of fun at some of the casinos (the Mermaid and Nugget in particular), and even walked away with some extra cash, but if you're into shows, restaurants, shopping and the other amenities of the Strip, Downtown is not quite there. While the Strip is only a short drive/cab ride (or soon to be Monorail ride, apparently), the scene here was much older (I'm talking senior's home older), and the fact is that you spend most of your time near where you are staying, otherwise, what's the point? I'd probably go back downtown for a night of gambling and hanging out, but to me, Vegas is the Strip. If I do go back however, I would definitely stay at the Nugget, and if you happen to be someone over 50 or so, I'd recommend it highly. I'm not saying that disrespectfully - I think if my 55 year-old parents go back I'll recommend the same to them, as the Strip can be quite gruelling due to all the walking and the crowds. Downtown is quieter, more "compressed", is quite a bit cheaper, and there's still quite a bit to do - if you get bored of it then take the cab to the Strip, but bring your walking shoes. One last thing, stay far, far away from the Tony Roma's "deals", such as the $9.95 steak and lobster they have advertised everywhere. The lobster is OK, but the size of your thumb, and the steak is the poorest excuse for a piece of meat I've seen. The buffet in the same hotel Tony Roma's is in though was excellent, and $6.95 at lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Expedia at the Golden Nuggett. Very clean, good service, ironing board and iron, in-room safe. The only negative comment is that being downtown between tall buildings, the noise level during the day was fairly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Was a gem for us.”
Reviews.Author: jtkauai
Reviews.Content: We received complementary upgrades to 2 large (1,000 sq ft) 1-bdr, 2-bath suites in main tower. Rooms were huge, immaculate, and one included both steamroom and jacuzzi tub. Bose stereos, 3 tv's each, bar/refrig. Room service was xlnt. Coffee shop is good for LV. In the past we've stayed in distant tower, which we didn't like as well. This was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Packages”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware of Golden Nugget packages. I paid more for my roon in order to see Gordie Brown. I thought I was getting a good deal. That is until I went to pick up my tickets for the Saturday show, only to find out it was a blackout night. I had called the hotel to find out about seating and was not told it was a blackout night. When I complained to the Assistant Hotel Manager, he said there was nothing he could do about it. He finally ended up giving us 2 tickets for the evening buffet. That turned out to be another tale of misery - worst buffet I have been to. This was my 2nd time to stay at the Golden Nugget and probably my last time. You can get as good a deal on hotels on the strip and that's where you will find me next time. I have also stayed at the Venetian and the MGM Grand for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Golden Nugget a number of times. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. Service, Food & Accomodations can't be beat. Can't wait to go back. Colleen & Walter Popovic

Reviews.Title: “"Excuse me, where are you folks from"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They get you walking into the casino, and walking to your elevator. They ask you where your from, and then try to get you to look at their timeshare information. That got old real quick. We stayed January 8th-January 10th, both my husbands and my first visit to Vegas. Stayed in downtown because of the price, I think next time, I'll pay a little more and stay on the Strip. The buffet was not good, there wasn't a selection, and of course the price was steep for what it was. The evening lazer light show right outside the hotel was neat to see. I heard the Golden Nugget's slots were tight, but we found them to be the best, in respect to the other nearby casino's, its also the nicest hotel in downtown, of what we saw. We took a taxi in for about $35 (including tip), thought it was high, considering how close the airport is, but since it was my first visit, I didn't know any better. Found out my instinct was right, when we took a taxi back to the airport for around $20. I would never rent a car though, the traffic on the Strip was nuts, parking expensive. We had dinner at Kokomo's at the Mirage, its not cheap, dinner for two cost $140, the salad was nothing special, but the dinner was great, but my husband and I were yelling at each other from across the table, since we couldn't hear each other with the waterfalls all around, so not intimate. As I'm sure all the other Vegas hotels are, I thought the Golden Nugget was a bit cheesy, the rooms were OK, an updated Ramada Inn, the view was of the parking lot, but the room was cheap, you get what you pay for. Check-in took a little bit, but we were there right at check-in-time. If you want to go sightseeing, stay at the Strip, for the money you pay in taxi fares (think there is a shuttle you can take, but never saw that) it evens out.

Reviews.Title: “wondeful stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it was a great place to stay, my sister and i stayed for 4 nites and had very guick check in and out time, the room was to far from the elavator but it was very nice and clean. the house keeping staff was very nice. it was a good walk to the casino but they had slot machines in the check in area not far from the rooms. the security there is fantastic. you couldnt go up to your room without showing a room key. i felt very safe there. and a couple of times when sitting by the doors to fremont street a couple of pan handlers came in and they were very descreetly asked to leave when they came and started talking to me. i am going back and i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor front desk performance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 1. Checking in took forever.We were third in line and it took 45 minutes to get to the clerk. We were not alone in this respect. People in front of us and behind us were getting angry. The clerk did not allow in-room movies on our card unless we got out of bed and gave her our credit card again. Even an O.K. over the phone was not acceptable. The same was true regarding charging meals to our room. We had to back to front desk and show them our credit card again. 2. When our in-room movies were finally approved, the TV set was faulty. The two repair men that came to fix it said that nothing could be done-the sets were old and should be replaced. They did get the set to work--for a time--by pounding on the side of the set with their fists! 3. The Fremont Street Experience. What a ripp-off! For $35 each we were allowed out of our hotel to join the other celebrants at New Years. Two years ago while staying at the hotel we joined in the celebrations on Fremont street quite freely!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Las Vegas and all the reviews pointed towards staying at the Nuggett. Everyone there was very friendly from the desk clerk to bellman and housekeepers. Everyone had smiles on there faces and ready to please. Room service 24 hours a day. Only draw back(if no car) is the taxi to the strip which got a little expensive . From $8- $ 20 a trip. Did take the bus a few days for $ 2.00 . My room were clean and tidy A little smaller that expected but very nice. and food was great. Most of all,hotel was not crowded and was able to get a lot of individual attention. A great retreat after spending time on the strip. A little smaller that expected but very nice. Great value for a 4 star hotel would definately go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “All the Class of a Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Travel Agent warned me but I did'nt listen. The accomodations are acceptable but the staff at the working level was uninterested and uncaring. I made the mistake of trying to cash some slot returns in at the "Cashiers counter" where six people were standing around with their thumbs up thier butts, I was nastily sent away to the Change counter next to it where there was one person and a long line. I then made the horrid mistake of inquiring at the buffet at 9:45 if I could still have dinner as the place said it closed at 10 PM. I was told by a lady with a pained expression that I could pay for it but they would take the food away at 10. There were others in line behind me who were in a state of disbelief, we all went down the street to eat and gamble. These are only two of several stories I can tell about the Golden Nuggets lack of interest in providing customers with a positive experience. And a word of caution, the folks in the main hall from the hotel to the casino who offer you free perks for staying there.... they are shills trying to trick you into visiting one of thier real estate developments. Just keep walking. The Nugget is a two star hotel with a one star staff.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Getting It Right”
Reviews.Author: SFEscape
Reviews.Content: Word of Warning.... 1. Pre-booked, prepaid non-smoking reservations don't guarantee you such a room. Check in early, reconfirm at least once. 2. There IS a non-smoking floor in the North Tower(4th Floor). North Tower is where you want to be for better rooms and location. 3. Seating at the Carson Street Cafe is convoluted, archaic process. The Buffet line the same. Despite the ad the waiter don't always sing at Stefanos. 4. Use your privacy hangtag on your door or get awaken daily at 8 am by housekeeping. 5. The TV Movies are overpriced and the in-room Internet barely works. 6. The hot babes you saw in the TV show the Casino are only to be found at the front desk. And a a strip club or bordello nearby. The GOOD Geordie Brown is an amazing performer. There arfe a few terrible seats so arrive early. The Lounge features good talent ZAX is a welcome refuge of poshness, fine eats and friendly service. All of the staff are friendly and welcoming. Their package deal is a bargain. Side Excursions $10.99 Steak and Lobster plus old fashiond breakfasts across Fremont St. at Binions in the historic downstair cofee shop. Great Microbrew at Main Street station(2 blocks away)and at Chicago Brewing Company in the Four Queens(next door). High-priced, Outstanding Quality Food at Hugos in the Four Queens. Classic Diner with character at the Golden Gate.

Reviews.Title: “GN is the place to go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel to say the least, for the money you absolutely can't go wrong here - just read up on what's around downtown prior to going to take full advantage of the Freemont St experience, especially gambling-wise. Check-in was fast. Not surprising since there is a very high staff - customer ratio at this hotel across the board. Smoking room in the older (south) tower didn't smell too bad at all says non-smoking wifey. Probably this is because they make a great effort to keep the entire room clean. Walking on the carpet over prolonged periods left your feet the same color as when you came out of the shower. Bathroom was nice and clean too. If you only drink imported beer and get stuck for a bottle opener in your room, the kleenex box cover works great, just make sure you use either end of the slot, not the middle - I bent the craps out of the middle of it at first, before becoming highly proficient at this endeavor. The buffet is great quality and resonably priced and they gave us 2 for 1 coupons upon checking in. Carson St Cafe is very good too for quality and price - after midnight you can get a 16 oz sirloin for 9 bucks! For gambling slots (or lower limits), go somewhere else - this place is known to be tight. Keep in mind downtown is not like the strip, there are lots of places to choose from within a minute walk in this regard. The casino is extremely well ventilated compared to others, not smokey. The sports and racing book here is very good, just make sure you ask for your drink tickets when you make your wager. They are security concious here - you have to show your room key every time you go upstairs. I know the person who left a review 2 prior to this one thought it was a pain, but I thought it was excellent. Kudos to GN for taking a direct approach to this vegas-wide problem. The safes in the rooms are a good idea too. My one complaint about the GN is the "free" gaming money or show tickets you are offered every time you leave your room, situated between the Lobby elevators and all civilization. Really, it gets irritating. It's just a sales pitch. Avoid it like the plague. Check out can be done (during prime time) lightning quick on the computer/TV in the room.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back”
Reviews.Author: referee
Reviews.Content: I was very sorry to read the review of the golden nugget from the trip advisor from columbia, I know what it feels like to have a bad experience in vegas. my wife and I have just returned from this same hotel and it was one of our best trips to the city. check-in was very cold fish with the girl behind the counter interested only in how good she looked, but besides her the rest of this establishment had a little bit of class in comparrison with most other hotels, reminded me of the old desert inn, with their niceness, we were very lucky with the deal we got, if you stayed two nights you got two free tickets to see G Browne who was brilliant and afterwards they had a jazz band playing in the ballroom, who were great and also free. by the way the cost per night was 49usd. Having travelled from Europe to your great country I think that this was great value

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I had hoped.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews about the Nugget and was eager to stay there. I booked airfare and hotel through Expedia and after having the airline lose my luggage, I went to the front desk of the Nugget to find that Expedia hadn't faxed our reservations. After a few minutes of hassle, I was given a room on the 17th floor of the South tower. It was fairly small but had a spectacular view. The bathroom in the room was WAY too small. You had to walk in and completely shut the door in order to use the toilet. I was expecting it to be a bit more luxurious and a little less ordinary. I found the slot machines in the casino to be incredibly tight and lost all my money right away. The staff was only so-so and no one was particularly friendly to us. The security at the elevators made us feel like criminals for trying to get to our room. It seemed that everything was a rip-off at the Nugget. We made local calls from the room and were charged $1.00 per call upon checking out. Apparantly just for the pleasure of using the telephone. I didn't even find the fitness center that other reviews mention, however, I definitely wouldn't have paid $15/day for it. But my biggest complaint are the Grandview Resort "People Snatchers" stationed right next to the elevators. My husband and I thought they were GN staff when they offered us "comps" but it turned out to be nothing more than a TimeShare presentation. We were promised $50/piece "gaming money" which conveniently turned into $25/piece when we finally got through the presentation (wasting precious hours of our short vacation). When we went to cash in this "gaming money" it turned out to not really be real money at all. We were given fake chips and told that we could only keep the winnings. The dealer at the BlackJack table acted as though he had never seen these chips before (remember this is a promotion in the Golden Nugget hotel!) and had a couple of private conversations with the pit boss about us. It was VERY rude and made us feel ridiculous. In the end, he neednt have bothered since we lost those chips just the same as the rest of our money in their casino. I will not stay at the Golden Nugget again. If I ever go to Vegas again at all, I'm staying on the strip. And, as they say in Vegas, better luck next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Las Vegas last week. We stayed at the Golden Nugget and thoroughly enjoyed our 5 nights. This is our second visit to the Nugget. The entire facility is simply gorgeous. Didn't have the best of views from our room, but the room itself was very well maintained and immaculately clean. Security is great. No one gets on the elevators without showing a room key. Parking is very convenient. Breakfast Buffet is wonderful and the Carson Street Cafe can't be beat! Would definitely stay at the G.N. again.

Reviews.Title: “upscale downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Nugget for 3 nights at $49/night (11/30-12/3/04) and thought the stay was excellent. I'd recommend the breakfast buffet, but not the dinner buffet. The health club is a very nice facility and well worth the $15 entry fee per day. Definately looks to be the most upscale of the downtown properties - and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the GN again. Took a $2 city bus ride to the Strip - bus leaves every 8 minutes or so, so don't feel stranded downtown if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nugget Newbie - Sept 2004”
Reviews.Author: cajundego
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Vegas before this trip & was there for only 2 night on the was to San Diego. We arrived at 1:30 AM and the staff was great. From the valet to the service for the complimentary roll-away bed. The room was nice size for even 6 of us! The security was better at the Nugget than other hotels. Security needed to see a room key to get to the elevators. The brunch buffet was yummy. Liked being off the strip. However, it was convienent to get to via bus. (all day pass was $5). Walked out the front door & we were a step away from the "Fremont Experience". Very clean. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Downdown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Golden Nugget for 4 nights in November. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and nice as was the hotel and casino. The whole appearance says a 4-star hotel. Stayed there 6 years ago and definitely liked staying downtown after having stayed on the Strip two previous visits. We were given free tickets to the Gordy Brown show at the Nugget and for those who don't know who he is I will say you shouldn't miss the show. He is a wonderful entertainer! Haven't laughed so much in years. Only one thing to complain about the hotel and complete experience - only two glasses in the room. A very picky, but very easy to remedy, complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Tim and Tom are great!”
Reviews.Author: toby04
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay at the GN after watching the reality program last year. Everything was great! We parked in garage right across street, check in on a Fri nite was a breeze. Our room was beautiful and clean. It was great walking right on to Fremont Street. The buffet was great, my husband loved sushi. We went to Zax for a drink and snack and saw the owners, Tim and Tom, they saw us (pointing and showing each other!) and came to our table and spoke to us for a few minutes. They comped our tab. They were so nice to a couple of "excited tourists". I only wish I had my camera! We stayed in the south tower and it was very easy to get to without going thru casino. The smoke everywhere was terrible. Was impressed with security, both of us had to show room key to get on elevator. Will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Had a goot time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the G.N. and had a very good time overall. The room was very clean and spacious. The Carson Street Cafe's food was good although some of the staff at the Cafe seemed disintrested at times. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Nugget was Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget from 07-11Nov04. It was the first time I'd stayed there and the first time I'd stayed downtown in Vegas. I was a little hesitant after reading TripAdvisor reviews saying that the hotel had gone downhill since its change in ownership, but I was very pleased. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble. There was obviously lots of maintenance ongoing. There are friendly security guards posted at the elevators. The valet parkers are great - my mother is handicapped and they gladly helped load her scooter and wheelchair into our rental car. The room was accessible. Only drawbacks were that the accessible room didn't have an in-room safe (but the boxes downstairs are free), and the smoke-free floors still felt smoky - not great if you have asthma. It was also handy being downtown. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,casino,food and service”
Reviews.Author: drJ1023
Reviews.Content: Just returned from vegas on the 7 th of nov. four day trip. I was struck immd.upon entering the hotel how clean and updated it was. The spa and attendants were great the casino was very nice, reasonable minimums and again modern and clean. The room was very clean and upscale. Room service was very prompt . Pool was nice, but no bathroom outside??? so what. Every employee in the hotel was friendly and helpfull. I have stayed at the strip several times, this was my first time at the G.N. and I plan to return. Take a cab to the strip for some night life and return to yur quiet room and hotel at the nuggett.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for newbie gamblers”
Reviews.Author: stolimom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas on the red eye yesterday. We were at the Golden Nugget Nov. 5-7. We bought a package deal through Travelocity costing $700 for direct round trip airfare (America West) and room for three nights for two adults. We had never stayed downtown before and didn't know what to expect. We arrived very late around 11:30 PM on Thursday night and rooms were only available in the South Tower. There were also no king size beds available. The room was very clean, comfortable and had an excellent view - also it was very quiet. The next day we asked if a king bed was available and they moved us to the top floor and we had a beautiful view of the mountains and the Stratosphere hotel. We feel that this was probably much better then the North Tower rooms. We enjoyed the gym although we were surprised to have to pay $15 each to use the facilities, but the equipment was very good and the area well maintained. The only annoying thing was that the swimming pool didn't have a bathroom so I had to traipse through the casino in my towel to get to the bathroom. Also, the casino was well ventilated, bright and the cocktail waitresses were plentiful. However, the tables were a bit pricy and we chose to gamble at the Four Queens, the Main Street Station, the Fremont, and Fitzgeralds. The wait for the bus to the Strip was 45 minutes, the bus was packed, there were many unbathed people on board and it took us nearly 45 minutes to reach the strip. I think it's worth the 12-15 bucks to take a taxi. Also, I do not think it is worth waiting an hour for the various all you can eat buffets in Vegas. We ate at the Nugget Buffet and the Stratosphere Buffet and our experiences at local restaurants were MUCH better. The food at the buffets is all fried and obviously had been cooked in the morning or even days earlier (desserts). The brewery restaurant at Main Street Station is excellent, the Carson City cafe in the Nugget has an excellent breakfast and lunch and we found a gem of a place downtown which I think is called Mamacitas. It's a cuban/mexican restaurant that is a haven for the locals that has an amazing variety of latino dishes for good prices. Only downside was the extremely dirty bathroom they have to share with the convenience store next door.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Anchor97
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget website advertised a Fall $49 rate that was not available Oct. 25-27th. Our rate was $67. The South Tower room is a very long walk to Fremont St. The bathroom is half the size of rooms we've had at Circus Circus. The handle on the shower was floppy and wouldn't stay at the warm level. There was no coffee pot. The king size bed didn't have fitted sheets, therefore, everything, blanket sheet, etc. was tucked under the mattress. When you pulled it out to get in bed, the covers and mattress pad were loose and wadded. The room itself was smaller than a CC room. The Buffet was small and crowded and didn't even have an ice cream machine. The food was very average. At the place to get show tickets, etc. we stood patiently in line to ask about Gordie Brown tickets and when we finally got our turn, she said she had someone on hold on the telephone and left us standing. The other person helping was on the phone the entire time we were waiting. Golden Nugget did not give their guests, one advantage that we were aware--getting a card no reward, standing in Buffet line or shows. We like the downtown Fremont area, but will consider staying someplace else next time. You can buy a bus pass for $5 that is good all day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the Gordy Brown show.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The attendants made sure we had plenty of towels or anything else we needed. I recommend it to anyone staying downtown on Freemont st. We loved the Downtown Gordy Brown show. Very very funny.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: SuemHolland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were at the Golden Nugget in March of 2004. We were also there exactly 20 years ago go the date. We loved it back in 1984 and wanted to go back to see if it has changed. It was absolutely beautiful. I love the fact that it is downtown and your so close to so many other places. The hotel was very much updated. The rooms were clean and had no problem with service. We made all our reservations for show tickets and a rental car right at the lobby desks. It was convenient. If anyone is interested in staying Downtown for the action, Golden Nugget is where you would want to stay. It was record breaking weather so the pool was a good place to relax between gambling. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JAMES O
Reviews.Content: In terms of value, we find the Golden Nugget always our first choice when in Vegas. We typically stay at this property about 12-15 nights a year and nearly always find everything just right. We prefer the "south tower" rooms to those closer to Fremont Street. There is always the possibility of some view of the strip and outer Las Vegas and the rooms seem newer and more quiet. It is a bit of a walk to the front door, but we enjoy and need the exercise. A regular visitor should be certain to join the Private Arrangements Club. The membership makes every 5th night free at the hotel. This establishment requires men to wear sleeved shirts in the restaurants, and it is pleasant not to have to eat next to a tank topped tourist at breakfast. Too bad even the high end places on the strip do not get this hint. The rooms are very nice and tastefully decorated. All have in-room safes, vanity mirrors and well equipped bathrooms. Rates during the week can get to $39 on occasion. $59 is more typical. If you are here to be in Las Vegas and not Disneyworld, then stay downtown and treat yourself to the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Spent a 3-day weekend with the guys at the Nugget and had a great time. Compares nicely with Monte Carlo, where I stayed with my wife a few months ago. Lots of places to gamble and drink, with a more "interesting" crowd than staying on the strip. Not a great pool area, but I didn't use it anyway. If you're just looking to do some gambling and have a good time, I would highly recomment the GN and the downtown area. If you're looking for a nice place with a nice pool to relax at, I would recommend the Monte Carlo. Both are inexpensive and good values if you shop around for rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget has very pleasant rooms. They're by no means extravagant, but certainly a good value for your dollar. I made my reservation about four weeks prior to my arrival date. I asked for a confirmation to be e-mailed to me. Several days had passed, and still no confirmation. I called a total of four times to the reservation department, before I finally recieved what I had asked for. I was told that it was their preference to e-mail it rather than snail mail it. Either way would have been fine with me, but for some reason it was not going to get done without frequent follow up calls from me. Check in was efficient, although Jennifer was quite cold and a bit curt during the process. Her co-worker, at the next station, was warm and inviting to guests as he checked them in. I wish I had waited for him. I have eaten at many buffets in Las Vegas. The Golden Nugget's breakfast buffet should definitely be passed up. The price is inviting, but in this instance, you would be geting what you pay for. No one beats Bellagio's buffets. We were at the Golden Nugget for two nights. Although we had a,"Privacy Please," sign on the outside knob, the housekeeper still banged on the door in the morning. We asked her to please return later. We would be leaving for the day in about twenty minutes. We got back late that night. The room had never been serviced. So there weren't even any clean towels available. We were too tired to step out again for them to tidy up. So if service or a good breakfast on property is not of concern to you, but a good value for your dollar for the room is, then the Golden Nugget is okay. I thought a hotel got four diamonds for it's features and service. In my opinion, they only deserve three.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: misswyatt
Reviews.Content: We visit LasVegas twice a year, and have always stayed on the Strip...usually at Caesar's Palace. We were able to get into our room before noon (early flight in), which was very nice & very clean, the pool was smaller than the strip hotels, but we enjoyed it...especially since a half mile walk was not required! We ate at the Buffet most of the time....not overly extravagant but very good and reasonably priced. Cafe restaurant pleasant with very nice wait staff. My husband said the Spa & fitness center was first rate with excellent service. We had a great time at night on Fremont St...you can get to so many places with ease. The parking garage is right across the street from check in desk at the South Tower. A good time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget (mostly)”
Reviews.Author: Ilikehomebest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Golden Nugget Sept. 13th through Sept. 15th, 2004, on a trip to Vegas for our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is super nice. Very elegant rooms with marble tile in the bathrooms, adult height stools and sinks, and a nice vanity with a lighted make-up mirror just outside the bathroom. Our room was very clean, and we really liked being downtown. This was our first trip to Las Vegas, and the downtown area was nicer than I thought it might be. Much easier getting around than on the strip. The only complaint I have is that when I booked this room through the internet, I requested a king, non smoking room. When we checked in all they had available was a double, smoking room. That was an uncomfortable night, and they did move us the next day to our requested room. It smelled so much better! Would have been a bad experience if we'd had to stay in the double, smoking room the whole time. Maybe, if you book directly through the hotel reservations system, you get what you ask for. The clerk said they were full that night and the room we requested wasn't available, but I bet it would have been, had we been V.I.P.s. This was a Monday night. All in all though, we had a good time. We were in the South Tower, and it is a bit of a walk to the casino, but no big deal unless you have trouble getting around. Ate breakfast at their restaurant twice and their buffet once, and both were excellent. We liked the Golden Nugget a lot, except for the first night when we didn't get the room we requested. If we were to go back, I'd check into this a little further.

Reviews.Title: “had a great stay at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 days at the Golden Nugget, from Aug. 30 th Sept. 3rd. We were in the south tower and had a lovely room. The girl that checked us in was so accomadating and very efficient and pleasant. I did have some luck on the machines and saw several people that did also. We definitely would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the golden nugget at least 7 times in the past 4 years. We were there in March 2004 and as usual we enjoyed our stay enough so that we came back August 29 thru Sept 3 2004. We found that the new owners have ruined the hotel for the average gambler. They are only interested in the high rollers. If you don't believe his simply watch their fox tv show The "Casino". The slot machines are the tightest in Las Vegas. The sevice is so so. The hotel is now the dirtiest we have ever seen it. Maintenance seems to have been sacrificed for the creation of more high stake gambling rooms. The carpets are dirty and showing wear. The owners do not know how to run a casino. Their expertise are dot comers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Nugget in August and wished I'd booked for a longer stay. We stayed in the South Tower on the ninth floor and the rooms were immaculate. It's a bit of a hike to the casino from the South Tower elevators, tho -- if you don't like that, you can stay in the North Tower -- but I had no problem, even with a handicap, because the GN rented me a scooter. I had a blast with that! Cost me $105 for the entire three days and was worth every cent. My friend and I were there to play craps and we stuck to the $5 minimum tables. (One reviewer said here that "most" of the tables had $10 minimums, but I saw only one $10 craps table, and I did look at all of them.) Ended up chatting with a lot of the employees -- they're like a family there, and many of them have been there for 10-20 years and more -- I met one worker in the buffet who has been there for 26 years. The employees love the Nugget -- it has a great benefits package, I was told -- and it shows in the way they treat the guests. And the multi-million-dollar renovation has turned the GN into a very beautiful, tasteful place to be. Good restaurants, too, catering to all tastes and all pocketbooks. You can't go wrong at the Nugget as far as I'm concerned, and I plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Charging their guests for use of the fitness center???!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of buddies this past August and it was my first trip to Las Vegas. The Golden Nugget had the best looking place downtown and their dining options were very good. However there were some items that irked me as a customer that was paying more for my room that any other place in downtown Vegas. If I pay more...I expect more. These items included: 1. they wouldn't let me use the fitness center unless I paid an extra $15 A DAY!!! 2. I was shocked to see that the pool area was primarely set-up for folks to suntan and the actual pool was small. 3. Lastly, the front desk staff were extremely slow on the handful of occasions that we interacted with them (check-in, check-out, ask questions, etc.). All in all...it was okay, but it seemed to me that the Golden Nugget was trying to pass itself off as the Downtown "Strip-Wanna-Be" Hotel. The place was surrounded by tons of low cost, friendly hotels/casinos that don't put on airs. The Golden Nugget would be better served if they adopted the same demeanor with it's staff and pricing...while maintaining its air of quality and being recognized as the nicest place in downtown Vegas. I"ll be back to downtown Vegas, but not at the Golden Nugget. I'll take my gambling dollars/hotel dollars to a place that is what it is, rather then a place that acts like it's located somewhere on the Strip, next to the MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was a beautiful place to stay. The rooms were excellent and the service great. Also enjoyed eating at Binion's Resturant. Very good. Would stay again at the Golden Nugget. The light show was breath taking as well as the show we saw at the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Good bye to a classic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must agree with the previous responder, the new owners of the Nugget are heading down-hill. From their tacky TV show to the lack of service. New ownership usually results in cut backs but the latest game of bait and switch is beyond comprehension. I was informed I could be comped for up to five nights but when I called to make reservations I was told they can't do that over the phone. For serious play I would suggest the Station Casinos -- travelers need to take a close look at the 'locals.' These Maloof wanna' be's are headed down the wrong path.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown vs the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In Vegas Aug.12 th > 17th. Decided to stay in various hotels after not having been here for 5 years. Golden Nugget was a really great surprise! Awesome rooms...very friendly and helpful staff and dealers who don't mind helping visitors who are not casino savy! Wonderful food deals abound and it sure is nice to be able to walk from venue to venue. Bonus...NO KIDS ( which is the object of my review) !! Loved it! Moved to Bally's 3 days later. Sterling Brunch is always the highlight of our trip. Rooms OK. Slots here looser than most...starting to see lotsa kids. As a matter of fact, there were two adults and 4 kids in the room next door! Monorail was neat and a fun way to move around. Cabbies complained about the monorail..complained about their wages...complained about the number of tourists (?) so we really liked the monorail! On our last day we chose the Mandalay Bay. HUGE MISTAKE. This is the Disney World of Las Vegas. Took over 1 hour to check in and there were screaming kids everywhere. Forget using the pool. Did not gamble here as a result of all the noise. Actually we ended up going to the Strip to gamble and eat only used the room to sleep. The bathroom was really nice, but that was about it. Too bad.....we had heard some nice things about this hotel. If you have kids..you would be happy here..but we do not think that Las Vegas is the place for kids so we hated seeing and hearing them here. Please give Vegas back to the adults...we would come back more often! Next time, maybe we'll stay downtown..it certainly was better than I remembered it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice casino/hotel in great part of the city (Downtown)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and beds. I like the whole casino/hotel with the games, restaurants and the overall feel of the place. There are a lot of big glass windows in the building so you can see the poolarea and into the great poker room. It is also very accessable with entrences on every corner. I think the location in Downtown is great. It's an amazing and fun place and since no Vegas visit is complete without going to Downtown; you might as well stay there. It's just a short cabride down to the strip and you won't make many trips back and forth anyway. I like Downtown and Golden nugget is probably the best place to stay when there.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Hook”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just left 8-20-04 stayed a week and love it very clean walk around the room bare foot and the bottom of my feet still clean, staff very nice and helpful this is were I will always come.only thing the towels are ruff, and need coffee pots.but I will still come back.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was excellent, just spent 4 days there. Check-in was fast and the room was clean and smoke-free. Had a south tower room and the walk is not far at all, some other reviews make it out to be a mile walk. All staff members I encountered were friendly and helpful. Food is excellent throughout the resort. The casino is on the small side but there are enough slots and gaming tables for everyone. In the last review posted the person complained that there were no 1 cent slots or low min tables, this is correct no penny slots because that a creates cheap and shady clintele. If you want penny slots walk your cheap ass to the four queens or plaza. There are lots of $5 tables at the nugget too. The ride to the strip is about 10-15 min dependent on traffic, but not to bad at all. No question the Nugget is the place to stay away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Do they really think this is a four star”
Reviews.Author: BernieD
Reviews.Content: After staying 5 nights at the Golden Nugget in August I am convinced of a few things , a nice hotel-yes, a clean hotel-yes, a staff that is friendly and helpful-absolutely. But it is definitely a hotel/casino with shortcomings, and I would not charactericize it as a four star resort. When checking in I requested the North Tower. I was told this was an upgrade, and it would cost $ 25.00 extra per night. It really is not a room upgrade but rather a location upgrade. The north tower is located next to the pool and casino, The pool hours are 9-7. They have the door locked and they do not open it until 9. The first 8 or 9 people will take the tables that have the umbrellas, and the remainder will grab the lounge chairs. If you are interested in getting an umbrella, get in line about 8:45. Over the 5 days observed very few children and very few young people at the pool. On my last day I went to the main desk and asked if I could download my boarding pass off the internet. I was told it would cost $ 5.00. I was surprised at the number of people who would not pay the fee. The casino is okay, at night most of the tables were $ 10.00. You will not find any 1 cent or 2 cent slots, but they do have nickle slots. There is no question they want this to be the upscale casino of downtown. I found the best slots at the Vegas Club and Main Street Station. I also met a number of people from the Nugget playing at these casinos. Overall if you are going downtown the Nugget is the nicest to stay at, but I found the buffet, slots, and happy hour at the Main Street Station better.

Reviews.Title: “The GN deserves 10 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from five days at without a doubt the best hotel casino in Vegas. The staff and I mean everyone employed at the GN treated me like I was the only person who mattered to them. I am not a whale or big shot but just a working guy who loves the Golden Nugget. Won some money on Keno, my favorite gaming venue. The food was great at The Buffet and Carson Street. Being from Philly I ordered the Philly Cheese steak from the room service menu and it tasted just like one from Pats Steaks in South Philly. Tim and Tom the new owners have a real Gem on their hands. Forget the strip and stay downtown at the Nugget and you will return again and again. I already have plans to be there this coming holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Frequent Vegas Visitors”
Reviews.Author: Papdadio
Reviews.Content: July 31, 2004 - The Golden Nugget is a great place to stay for the frequent visitor to Las Vegas. After 10 visits to Las Vegas my wife and I decided to take a break from the “Vegas Strip” scene and enjoy the downtown Vegas atmosphere. The Golden Nugget offered a wonderful location if you are interested in staying and playing downtown. The hotel accommodations are glitzy, marbled, and pure Vegas over-the-top (similar décor as the Mirage). There are no other downtown hotels that will offer you luxury for less than the Golden Nugget. I requested a free room upgrade to the North Tower upon advice from other travelers and I my request was accommodated. The North Tower is definitely a must in order to place you close to the primary casino/hotel action and amenities. In addition, the North Tower allows you immediate access to the main exits placing you on Freemont Street where you will find the rest of the downtown casinos and entertainment venues. The South Tower’s location places you out of the main casino/hotel traffic patterns and will require you to find your way to the main casino and other hotel venues. A summary of the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino follows: North Tower Room: Large and well appointed. The view is not spectacular but little time is usually spent in the room looking out the window. The South Tower rooms are reportedly smaller and their location takes you away from the main casino action. Hotel Room and Hotel Amenities: All of the usual amenities of a nicer hotel (e.g., toiletries, towels, plenty of hangers) though the maid service only left three towels a day (we prefer four or five) and there is no coffee maker in the room (Starbucks is just a short elevator ride down to the casino). Like most Vegas hotels you will not find HBO (or other premium channels) in your room thought the local television choices are adequate for the late night or early morning television viewing. The king size bed and pillows in the room were rather uncomfortable. I assume that the GN doesn’t want you spending too much time in bed, drinking coffee, and watching television when you could be losing money downstairs. As for the pool, spa, and gym I found each to be quite nice and since we left the children at home we were pleased to see that other couples did the same while lounging around the pool. Restaurants/Buffet/Dining in General: The GN buffet/cafe was fine but not noteworthy. For the better downtown buffets you will want to make your way over to Main Street Station buffet and to the Freemont Paradise buffet. For a great prime rib deal visit the Golden Gate’s restaurant ($5.49) or the Freemont’s Tony Roma’s ($7.50 – also Tony Roma’s offers a nice $10.50 late night steak and lobster deal). There are plenty of bargain food venues throughout the downtown area that are worth encountering (e.g., .99 cent shrimp cocktail, .99 cent beer and hotdog). If you are looking for a fine dining experience downtown Hugo’s Cellar in the Four Queens Casino is truly a spectacular dining experience. The access to the Golden Nugget’s Starbucks was quite nice and my wife and I enjoyed sitting outside on Freemont Street in the Starbucks outside dining/sipping area watching tourist, locals, and various street people wander by our roost. Hotel/Casino Staff and Services: The hotel staff was friendly though not remarkable. The casino staff was friendly in general. Casino Action and Entertainment: The Golden Nugget offers little for the bargain or small time gambler (short of .50 cent roulette with $2.00 minimum bets on the inside and outside lines and a few lower limit Hold ‘Em table buy-ins) with the majority of the blackjack and craps tables starting at $5.00 minimum bets. If you are looking for cheap gambling you will want to make your way over to the Freemont for the $2.00 blackjack table (though they usually only offer 1 table), Binion’s Horseshoe for $3.00 blackjack tables and plenty of lower limit buy-in tables for Hold ‘Em or wander down to the seedy El Cortez, California, and Lady Luck casinos for cheap tables; though I would recommend making the El Cortez and California walk only during the day. If you are a slot and machine player then dropping your coin in any of the machines is just as good as the next. There are plenty of free (or inexpensive) and generally kitschy Vegas lounge acts downtown (especially at Fitzgerald’s Casino). That said, the Golden Nugget definitely offers finer comedy/variety/singing entertainment options for persons not looking for Cirque and people painted in blue. Once again, the downtown is not a venue for the first time Vegas visitor or the visitor with children (though everyone should wander downtown at night to enjoy the “Old Vegas” feel and encounter the Freemont Street lightshow). The Vegas Strip is still the best location for first timers and families. That said, if you are looking for a change on your next Vegas vacation or wish to avoid tour groups and children the Golden Nugget Casino and Hotel in downtown Las Vegas is an ideal location for close proximity to casino action, Vegas atmosphere, and an overall fun and “old school” Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “I liked our 1st stay downtown on Fremont Street...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We normally stay on the Strip, at a Condo, the Hilton or Rio. It was nice to stay "downtown" at the Golden Nugget for a change. Everything is so much CLOSER. The room was fine, room service was great, the pool was acceptable (although it was kind of in the open...being right off the casino and hallway..and having to walk through the lobby to get to it). BUT it was comfortable, chairs, drinks, towels and not terribly crowded. We mostly laid by the pool, explored downtown and ate at several places downtown. I would stay downtown again, and I would stay at the Golden Nugget again.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget for one night in May 2004. We thought it was very good value with the rooms being a high standard of presentation. The all you can eat buffet was also to a high standard and we liked the pool. We didn't gamble much in the casino but the advantage of been in downtown is there are plenty of other casinos nearby. We would definatly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: mtkitchn
Reviews.Content: Although we go to Vegas several times a year, this is the first time we've stayed downtown and I decided on the Golden Nugget in part because of the great reviews. My husband is not a gambler...he likes to lay by the pool, but this pool is very small and right off the lobby which makes for a lack of privacy. It turned him off so much that he didn't go to the pool at all. I figured the slots would be looser than on the strip, but that wasn't true either. The room stunk of some sprayed in smell, but was nice enough...nothing great. The hotel boasts on its webpage of great views from every room, but we had a view of the parking lot that was very unimpressive. The cocktail waitresses were more attentive than on the strip, but that was the only plus I found. We saw the show, and it was barely worth the five dollars tax we paid on the free tickets. If you like downtown, this is probably the best place in the area, but as far as Vegas goes, you could do a lot better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good--not great”
Reviews.Author: japtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and I agree with some of the other reviews about the hotel being very clean. The biggest issue is location. Walk to all the downtown casinos but need to take bus or taxi to strip. The bus is cheap but takes time.. one night took 90 mins to get to strip. Taxi is much faster and costly.. costs ~$20 one way from hotel to strip. If your plans call for going to the strip this can get kinda pricey. The other item is the pool is nice but does not compare to pools on the strip. If a pool is a big thing, then think of staying else where. If just interested in downtown this is best hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “New Age Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just arrived at the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino and we were surprised by the following hotel events: (1) The Golden Nugget Hotel is actually a re-modeled brand new hotel-it is the best property downtown; (2) the room we stayed in can be rated a A plus room; (3) the dining experience was excellent with a rating of 9.5 including the buffet-the next best buffet was the Main Street Station; (4) the spa needs to be remodeled with a new design; (5) outstanding valet service; (6) highly motivated Union workers-that go the extra mile; (7) the Spirit of Dance is an excellent production with great value for money with colorful performances;(10) found the slots loose and fun! Table games could be lower!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 ngihts at the Nugget over Memorial Day weekend w/ three buddies from college...got a great rate ($57 plus tax) on Hotwire...the rooms are great, the bathrooms are shiny and swank, and even though its downtown and away from the strip you will save more $$ staying here and renting a car when you get to the airport. Buffett is pretty nice too and the comps are easy easy to get at the casino.......

Reviews.Title: “Love Downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nuggett June 22-26 2004. We stayed there in 2002 also. The room is good. No hot tub in the rooms but perfect for sleeping and just hanging out for a while!! Very clean! The staff are way beyond friendly!! The roulette dealers could be a little more friendly though! Binyon's has the best roulette dealers! Even when you're losing they keep ya laughing!! My husband and I have been going to Vegas for 9 years now and try to stay someplace different each year, however we "repeated" the Nuggett and are strongly considering going back again next year!! The whole downtown atmosphere is what Vegas is all about!

Reviews.Title: “I struck gold at the Golden Nugget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: AWESOME !!!!! Beautiful, clean room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location, right next to the Jumbotron. I really loved this hotel. We stayed there on June 10th and I will return to this hotel many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent June 1-4 at the Golden Nugget. It was the first time we had ever stayed downtown. Everything at the Nugget was fabulous and the price can't be beat. The rooms are large and beautiful. There is a dressing table outside the bath with a large lighted make-up mirror. The bathroom is all marble and granite. Everyone was so nice and friendly. Staying downtown was totally different than staying on the strip. If you're going to Vegas for fun and action, I'd recommend staying on the strip, especially if it is your first time to Vegas. But, if you want a relaxing, slower paced time then you definitely want to stay downtown and the Nugget it the best. Also, there are almost no kids. We saw maybe 5 total our whole trip. Last year we stayed on the strip and could never get even close to the pool for all the children.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at the Golden Nugget for 15 years every year! It is always great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Golden Nugget for 15 years - each year it is always wonderful. We have had one time where we received a smoking room and it was awful - my husband had open heart surgery the year before so I was not happy. That is the only complaint I have ever had with them. We have stayed at many other places with different groups and it is never as pleasant as the Golden Nuggett.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas. My sister and I stayed at the Golden Nugget. It was fabulous and half the price of the Strip Hotel (Westward Ho) that we stayed at last year. The Spirit of the Dance show at the Nugget was very nice. The light show on Fremont Street wasn't as good as last year, though.

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10 in the morning, was given a room immediately. No upgrades available due to busy holiday week plus a major convention in town. Room was very nice. Planned on staying just one night. Got busy gambling there and at the other downtown casinos. Did pretty good on winning some money. Ordered room service for a late dinner, was quick and good. Gambled early the next morning until check out time, which was also quick. This place is clean, employees had a very good attitude, including in the casino. Never had a problem getting drinks anywhere downtown, although some of the other casinos were run down appearing. I think 1 or 2 nights in this area would be enough for me, then move over to the strip for the remainder of our trip. We thought we would visit downtown again during our trip was had so much fun on the strip, never felt the need to return. Golden Nugget is by far the best hotel in the downtown area and I would not stay anywhere else there. This hotel has class.

Reviews.Title: “A dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this wonderful hotel and casino, May 16th-20th. From the beginning, we were treated like royalty. The room was immaculate. The service impecable. This will be our hotel and casino for the next vacation. By the way, the downtown area is really the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget is Golden!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It all started last week...we checked in at the Nuggert and our trip was off to a wiining start. The hospitailty that we were give from the time of check in to the time of departure was outstanding. On the second day, I had sent come clothes down for laundry service, and to my dismay, I had left $2500 in my husband's shorts. I quickly called the bell desk (which I might add..they are wonderful), and told them of the situation. They found the money and sent it to security for me to pick up. The sevice that we recieved was excellent. Now let's talk about the cocktailers. They do not seem to have a sense of urgency. I found that to bew the case everywhere I went, so I am not really complainng, but rather just pointing it out. I will be returning (in August to be exact). I had an awesome experience and would recommend to everyone to stay at the Nugget. By the way...the pool rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal downtown”
Reviews.Author: limones
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Golden Nugget was a nice change for me and my husband. We got a great deal, the rooms were very clean, service very friendly. We usually have stayed on the strip at some of the big name casinos, but I wouldn't hesitate to use the GN again.

Reviews.Title: “the best value for money in vegas”
Reviews.Author: dongodfrey
Reviews.Content: we came to vegas for the first time in 2001 to get married! we stayed at the nugget and overall it is the best hotel in vegas,we have returned several times since and stayed on the strip in four other hotels but the all have just one thing that the nugget does not have,first class service! on our second visit which was seven months after our first we unpacked our bags and headed straight to the casino floor,five minutes after sitting down at the slots the waitress came over and asked if we required drinks,nothing unusual about that you would think! but she remembered our order from seven months previous! now thats impressive, aubrey we will see you in july. many thanks to all at the nugget.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend the slot machines.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you like the slots, we recommend the Golden Nugget. We vist Las Vegas often and it is one of our favorite places to play. During every visit, one of us usually wins a jackpot at the Golden Nugget. I recommend the dollar and nickel machines. The casino is always busy, and its not unusual to have several people in a row waiting for cash payouts. The slot personel is friendly, and usually very prompt about handing out jackpots. Cocktail Waitresses come by frequently. It is fun to play in a busy casino, where many people are winning. There are 3 casinos we like downtown....Lady Luck, Four Queens, and Golden Nugget. Good Luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have beeen better!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We( 8 of us )stayed at the Golden Nugget in Feb and were very pleased with the Hotel and Casino and recommend it highly. We wouldn't hesitate to go back and probably will. The only draw back is it is a long way from the strip but we knew that when we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious rooms, great spa which is ideal after day walking along the strip. Great downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Priced, but Needs Some Work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went here with a group of girls and didn't realize the hotel was off the strip, which threw a huge kink in my trip. When we got to the hotel I was plesantly suprised at how nice the lobby was. Most of the staff was very friendly, especially the front desk. The room was large and comfortable, and kept very clean. The only problem I found was the pool opened at 11... not sure if this is standard, and the cocktail waitresses at the pool were painfully slow and rude. We asked the waitress if she could get us a cocktail (nicely, I've been in the business and know you get no where if you're snotty), she huffed that ours would be with us as soon as she gets the chance. When we finally did get our drink, our cocktail waitress huffed us to put down our flag on our lounge chair... sorry on vacation didn't have that on the top of my to do list. Then to grab a quick bite in the casino and the staff looked like they hadn't slept for about 4 weeks. They weren't able to get the order straight. I do recognize that they aren't la creme de la creme of Vegas staff, but it was annoying. All in all this hotel was a bargain for your money, keep in mind the hotel is a $20 at best cab ride from the strip, and there isn't a young crowd (which we were looking for), but all in all I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel and casino downtown!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel truly was a serendipity. We had never stayed downtown before and I was a little nervous, but my fears were assuaged upon check-in. We stayed here on our first and last night of our vacation and it was a great way to start and end our vacation! And as a bonus, on our last night, the manager upgraded us to a FABULOUS suite! Truly a wonderful hotel and casino!

Reviews.Title: “Senior Day in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GlassHalfEmpty
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, sun-thursday, the end of march. I had my own room- in Vegas with 7 guys for golf. The hotel is decent: clean rooms with nice bath/water pressure, nice cafe/restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Buffet is typical and unimpressive. The pool is very nice and I used it every day after golf. The worst part about this hotel is the downtown location, which offers really nothing of interest but the condition of the other hotels makes the Golden Nugget seem like the Taj Mahal. The price was right, 65$ a night, and I had good service throughout the 4 night stay. If you have a car, hit the strip for entertainment and things work okay. If you can accept the limitations of downtown, this is a nice place to stay. It helps if you are a little older- this place cators to the retirement age crowd, at least sun-thursday.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay at the strip”
Reviews.Author: Ldiakiw
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 days at the Nugget and after staying downtown, I would never stay on the strip again. From the service that you receive with the doormen that show you into the hotel, to the courteous staff, I can honestly say that this is the place to stay. All the services were absolutely incredible, and if you did not have any shows booked, the bell person was able to provide you with all the amenities. Don't have a golf round booked, just ask them to do it for you. All in all, I give this a very high '5' in all aspects. Thank you staff at the Nugget. And one more thing, go to the Carson Street Cafe and ask to be served by David, he will make your experience worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Fremont St. Experience Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: ejan
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, so our family could experience Fremont Street. The light show was very disappointing, but the gift shops and atmosphere on Fremont Street were nice. Neonopolis (the game room) down the street was also disappointing. Not much to do here for kids. I did really lousy playing slots at the Golden Nugget. (Much better on the Strip.) The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced. Even though we were only here one night, took a cab to the strip for something to do with the kids (ages 11 & 14). By the way, I got a huge 2 bedroom suite for $199. It was beautiful, but one of the (3 )toilets didn't flush, and the maintenance man couldn't fix it after 2 visits (although he thought he did)!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For the Price”
Reviews.Author: islandiver7
Reviews.Content: After reading many different reviews, in Jan/04 we booked a room at the Nugget from March 28 - April 3. Expected to have a pleasant stay, but were prepared to be disappointed! Got in shortly after noon on the 28th, check-in was quick and friendly (Cherie, I believe) with a room readily available, and as I am a light sleeper we were given a room on the top (22nd) floor in the South tower with a view to the south (Strip). While a bit of a hike from the elevator, the room was quite nice, clean, and exactly as expected. If you stepped back from the window so as not to see the municipal parking garage directly below, the view was quite spectacular, especially with the strip lit up at night. All of the staff were helpful and considerate, the pool was OK although I found the music somewhat overly loud (maybe I was too close to a speaker?), and Fremont Street was far less annoying than the crush of the strip with lines of guys hawking "escort service" handouts. Two minor complaints about the Nugget was the low water pressure (perhaps somewhat due to being on the top floor), and not having an in-room coffee maker - I guess they love selling the $6 pot of coffee from room service. This is easily resolved by going to the Walgreens by Neonopolis and buying a 5 cup coffee maker for $10 and a pound of coffee - you now have endless in-room coffee! Walgreens was also good for late night/early morning snacks, and don't forget a couple of coffee mugs for .99 each (or 2.99 for the same ones at the tourist shops). Returning for a moment to my being a light sleeper - no complaint here with the hotel as they did everything they could to accommodate me, but even 22 floors up there is no getting away from sirens all night and back-up & bus beepers all morning. There were a few occasions where all you could hear for 20-25 minutes were police/ambulance/fire sirens until there was a lull before the next set started! I have been to Las Vegas many, many times so was rather jaded to the sights & action, but it was the first time for my partner. If you love to shop, this is the place for you! Many more things that could be said about shows, activities, etc. but if anyone has any specific questions and concerns I could try to answer them by email. To wrap up the review of the Nugget, we did not do much gaming or dining there (it was more the base for our forays into the wild-erness) so cannot really comment on that, but we found the room, service, and establishment as a whole to be top-notch in respect to its age and location (heed the warnings about navigating around downtown after dark).

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here March 2004, did not know what to expect, bit dubious about it being downtime. How wrong could we be. Loved the feel of the place. room (south tower) was comfortable, clean, well decorated. smaller than the hotels on the strip (which was a bit futher than we thought), but made you feel you were in a hotel to stay, and not just a tourist haven to pass through, staff more than polite and very helpful. food was reasonable priced, fresh, and varied. overall would definitely go back and stay there. and in fact can hardly wait to return excellent 4 day break.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the spa!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Treated very well, excellent spa, wonderful buffet, Jackpots were numerous, dealers were quite friendly. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4-Star Golden Nugget definitely did not live up to the 4-Star rating. First, the check-in was a fiasco. It took more than an hour to check in due to missing room reservation for which I had booked, paid for, and had confirmation print out. Personnel including the Asst. Manager made it seem like that it was my problem that their computer did not show my reservation. They almost tried to authorize a charge on my credit card for rack rate for me to get a room that I already paid for. I was only able to get a room after letting them authorize for room charges if the reservation was not confirmed by check out the next day. Also the non-smoking room that I got was smoky.
