I would have expected that in a lesser hotel but not at Golden Nugget. So much for 4-Star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Golden Nugget last September and was not that impressed. After all the rave reviews and the 4 diamond rating, I was expecting a LOT more. Maybe it's just my style or taste, but I thought the lobby was hideosly tacky and the rooms were not much better. For the price, it's definitely a nice place to stay, especially downtown, but I don't think I'll try it again. The pool area was very nice but the slots were tight (for us anyway) and service was decent. I think if you're looking for the excitement of downtown, you will not be dissapointed with this hotel, however for my money, I'd rather stay mid-strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Downtown area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Golden Nuggett - a good hotel, excellent service but too far off the Strip. Downtown area quite seedy - light show very good but that's all. For the price we paid, for only a small amount more could have stayed on one of the hotels on the strip - but didn't realise that until we got there.

Reviews.Title: “definately worth visiting again.......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: arrived sunday feb 29, 2004 and loved it from the beginning.....this was our first time in vegas and we didn't know exactly what to expect in "downtown"..... as soon as we got to our room we tried using the safe and it did not work(apparentely you need to leave it open and it was closed for us) we called down and they came to open it up for us very quickly and then gave us a golden value book for our troubles(very good and useful)....out in the streets--DO NOT TRAVEL OUTSIDE FREMONT STREET AT NIGHT TO THE BUS STATION!!!!!!!we did it and we definately would not do that again......be prepared to spend lots of time and $$ in taxicabs...overall we loved our room , our view and all the employees --they were all very helpful, nice and considerate to our quesions and need..... i would definately recomment this hotel to anyone elso....also, even though we did not gamble very much their slot machines are a lot looser than any of the others down in the strip.......

Reviews.Title: “Grand!!”
Reviews.Author: shortcak321
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was our first time in Vegas. Our main reason for coming here was for the NASCAR race weekend over 3-6&7-04. We got to come a day early so we needed a different hotel to stay. I read the reviews on this website about the GN and decided to try it. I'm so glad we did. It was so clean. The rooms were first class and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,better experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a nice cozy hotel! Stayed there in July of 2003 and the location is great and the service people are great! We had a problem with our door being hard to open,so they sent a carpenter to fix it,his name was Rich, what a great guy! He not only fixed it fast but made us feel that The Nugget was THE hotel in Vegas,very professional and a proud Union man to boot! I could go on and on about this hotel and the staff,but take it from me,you'll love it

Reviews.Title: “the best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend, of 40 plus years, and I try to stay at the Nugget whenever we are in Las Vegas. The rooms are beautiful as is the Casino. The food at the buffet is wonderful (worlds best bread pudding)! For two older ladies it feels very safe, everything is with-in walking distance. We will be back there again in March and we are very excited .

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: beachcomber2005
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of the last great deals in Vegas! Growing up in CA, we consistently visit Vegas at least 4 times a year, so have stayed at most (if not all) of the major hotels at least once or twice. I can honestly say that for the price, the Golden Nugget is a top choice! Great unassuming service, large and clean rooms (luxurious), and a great location close to everything. Please note that they've recently switched management from MGM Mirage, and we haven't stayed there since, so not sure if there has been any change. All in all, this is one of my favorite places in Vegas, even when including all the "big name" resorts on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Golden Nugget quitea few times and my last time was on my own. I'm always scared to check into places by myself for the way people judge you. I do have a cleft pallet so I look and sound differently than most people but the moment I check in with the Golden Nugget they have never given me any problems and felt like I was most welcome. The dealers were very nice to me, the staff was very nice to me, and they would help me out with what ever I needed. I will be retuning in May but this time I have a one bedroom suite so this is a trip I will definetly be looking forward to. The casino is great, lose slots and great odds at the craps tables. I will not stay anywhere else in Las Vegas. I feel safe and secure and I'm very happy to be a part of that atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: Cali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the GN mid Jan, and we were pleasantly suprised. The room was large, had a nice vanity area, was very clean and decorated nicely, as expected. The service was fantastic. Everyone we spoke to really liked their job, and it showed in their service. We got a great rate via expedia for two nights, mid week. We have taken many trips to Vegas over the past 8 years, were married at TI, but we never stayed downtown. This trip we decided to split our time between the strip and downtown. I'm glad we did, and I can't wait to go back. The food at the Nugget was a big suprise. The Monte Cristo in the coffee shop was well worth the 20 minute wait for it to cook. the buffet was one of the best I had been to, great quiality, and not a huge food-court type of buffet (I don't care for the food-court style, seem to be all flash). We LOVED the cheap gaming downtown (we play the tables, not the slots), and we caught the show outside while sitting at Starbucks (couldn't resist...) Our stay of 2 nights was the right amount of time for us to spend downtown. I understand the hotel has new owners, I hope they can keep up the good service, the good quality food and the fun, fun gaming!

Reviews.Title: “You'll find GOLD at the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: LiberatedMindFL
Reviews.Content: The Golden Nugget was a fantastic option for us, in Las Vegas. I originally was looking at the Stratosphere, but quickly reconsidered. The Golden Nugget had very large standard rooms, in the South Tower. I would recommend renting a car, unless you plan on staying somewhere at the center of the Strip, and not venturing off much. All the casino hotels offer free self parking, because they want you to see their property & spend a little! Also, Las Veags has many natural wonders of interest, such as the Hoover Dam, Lake Mead, Red Rock Canyon, Valley of Fire - all within a close car drive (each is between 35 mins - 1 1/2 hrs each way). Experience Vegas, and also catch the Freemont St. Experience (every hour on the hour), while staying at the Golden Nugget! PS I was also very grateful to the security staff, who graciously found my rental car keys. They seemed to have fallen out of my pocket, when I was enjoying my time, in front of a slot machine. =)

Reviews.Title: “Golden Nugget Thumbs Down New Owners.”
Reviews.Author: alriht4u
Reviews.Content: Golden Nugget was a great place up to 2003 when two dot com founders bought the place. My wife and I like to stay there before heading to the strip for better rooms and more options. Sadly, the new management is comprised of numerous young 20-30 ish suits, who look at 50 plus year olds like old farts. This past September they had one elderly lady doing all the slot machine coin cashing in, and; they had her lifting heavy plastic bags full of dollar coins to refill the machine while younger, much more able kids looked on. I went to the management to get this 65 plus year old some help. The so called managers were less then 30, and; they could care less about the older ladies plight. For hours this older lady worked her fanny off while others sat idly by. The comps were no where near what they were even a year ago. Changes need to be made at this place, as many employees, who have worked there for many years are seeing valued customers leave. The bellhops and other permanent fixture type employeees at this casino/hotel all asked me to write to get the place back to what it was. It seems that the new owners have no interest in hands on management. The plan seems to be to kick out tyhe baby boomers with money for younsters their age. sadly, not all 30-35 year olds have the money that those 50 plus have. They need to review their market, make a sound administrative policy decision and plan. I hope they do. I will try the place one more time period.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Nugget!”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: I am not a senior. Actually, I am 24 and I loved the Golden Nugget! I was advised by many people, especially a group of 21-26 year olds that stayed at the Golden Nugget and told me it was a terrific hotel. The staff was friendly, the service was great and the rooms were super. It may not have the glitz and the grandure of the strip, but it costs 1/3 of the price for the same room types. With only a 5 minute drive from the strip, it was well worth the money. During my next visit to Vegas this year, I will stay at the Golden Nugget again!

Reviews.Title: “So-so...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last visit was Dec 2003. The hotel / casino as noted is downtown Vegas and the GN is the best hotel casino in that area. The buffet is expensive - the food is ok, but not great. Almost always a line to get in. This hotel needs more dining options. The pool area is small and quiet, but like most Vegas hotels, closes way too early ( 5pm ). While the walk to the south tower can be miserably long after a long day and evening, there are a few slots in the area, but NO drink service. I personally like the GN, but next visit may stay on the Strip for more entertainment and dining options.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I truly love the GN. The Wheel Of Fortune .25 against the wall are alot of fun! I played all night on 100.oo which is good for me. and the people playing the machines next to me were alot of fun too! (considering I'm over 35, but not much!) this place is 'a good time' for anyone that has class and knows how to have a good time! I got a little hyper,and I didn't feel out of place, but I think that moods can be contagious, which is great for casinos, (people having a great time!, and showing it!) We actually had 5 people that just met playing the 25 cent W.O.F. slots,,(against the wall) and if 1 would run out of coins, we would share! Talk about a great time! I go to Vegas to play the Slots, I know I won't come out ahead, but Just being there and talking to people, that's fun to me! When I was there in August '03, like the 29th etc. I met a gambling partner Tom K. and his Dad! We had a great time and he was great company when I was gambling, and my husband was taking a nap! We are heading back 12-29 and 30th and I'm sure I won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel downtown but some things get shaky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Nugget is the classiest hotel downtown by far. Motel DT hotels are 2 or 3 star while the Nuggest is 4. This equates to better rooms, towels, toiletries. You get normal towels that dont flake off in your hair and decent bath products. Marble bathroom and a decent bed. I found the check in to be fast but the staff are just rude. I mean they do not care and make it apparent that they despise looking at you. It wasnt just me, I talked to many guests that had the same experience. Vegas is like that in general. I wonder why they get jobs at a hotel if they can't be nice. From what I've read and experienced the rooms do vary at this hotel. For instance, upon checkin we were given a room with two double beds. Even though we reserved and asked for a King bed. The check-in girl said we had a king but no, it was two doubles. Did they think we'd just take it? AFter many phone calls we finally got the manager. IT took 20 minutes of politely demanding what we paid for. After being told they had no king rooms one magically turned up when things heated up with us ready to take our $ and leave. Why do hotels always play this game? It makes no sense to me. Las Vegas is the worst. You reserve a room type and you get the opposite everytime. Anyway the first room we got was different. When we got to the room with a king bed it seemed nicer. I guess different parts of the hotel have more recent upgrades. THe rooms are comparable to the Mirage rooms on the strip. Prices are no where near the Mirage though as downtown isnt like the strip at all. Downtown is definitely an older crowd. The fremont St experience sucks. It really is uneventful and the light display is certainly not dazzling but left me feeling they used very old technology as the images look like a commodore 64 created them. I like to take off gambling downtown as I feel its the place in Vegas where you stand a chance at winning. The strip slots are tight and the table rules to tight. Downtown has little dives everywhere that have to offer better odds to get you in the door. THis is good for gambling but its bad if you want to gamble and your lady wants to walk about. Downtown is full of undesirable characters and wander off Fremont you'll find yourself amongst a slum. If you are young and looking to hook up with other young people then hit the strip. I'm early 30's and I like to gamble. WHen I come to Vegas by myself I love downtown as I can wander casino to casino in mutes not hours like on the strip. ALso I can hit my favorsite little shops shops and eat for $4. When with the girlfreind theres much less to do since she doesnt like the dives so much. Men can eat of $20/day easy but put a woman into the mix and suddenly that doesnt even cover your juice tab. IN summary, if you are used to nice hotels and want to stay downtown then its the Nugget for you. Theres decent accomodations all around but mostly not places to take your girl too. Gambling at the nugget is the worst downtown. I gamble elsewhere. Also having that trouble at check in didnt make me feel obigated to give them any more $. Had they been nice they may have seen me play there awhile.

Reviews.Title: “GN-Is always the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just read a review of the Nugget that stated it was fine for people over 35 and that the hotel was well appointed for seniors. Since when is over 35 a senior? My husband and I both seniors (over 35) have stayed at the Nugget many times in the past 10 years. When I say many times, I mean at least 2 twice a year. We have stayed on the strip several times and also at Fitzgerlald's (YUK!) downtown. We love everything about the Nugget. The location, the service, the food, the spa and the rooms are second to none. I have never been disappointed in the hotel and in fact we are going again the first week of February.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful "nugget" it is!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends and I stayed at the Golden Nugget November 23rd through the 26th. On my previous trip to Las Vegas, I had stayed on the strip, where the slots are tight, the lines are long, and you are made to feel "not so special". When we arrived at the Nugget, we were most impressed with the cleaniness and beautiful decor. Our check in was speedy and we were treated with the utmost respect. What a treat it was when we opened the door to our room for the first time. The rooms are beautiful and comfy. Service was first rate at all times. The staff was always friendly, sincere, and eager to help at all times. The food was wonderful. Security for persons staying at the Nugget was also comforting, with an individual posted near the ground floor elevators to insure that no one "unauthorized" be allowed to "roam" where guests stay. We found an interesting array of ages there. From young to the elderly, it only made things more interesting. We also found that the slots aren't as "tight" as they are on the strip. My friend hit 1,000 on a dollar slot machine after only playing six tokens! My other friend as well as myself also had successes on the slots there. We had rented a car (which was great) which allowed us to snoop around Vegas a bit. We did spend a day on the strip, but, were all anxious to return downtown to the original, true Vegas, to do what we came to do........gamble! Thank you Golden Nugget for making our trip such an enjoyable one. I have nothing negative to say about their establishment, and can assured anyone comtemplating staying there, to "go ahead" and book that room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the nugget!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golden Nugget on our honeymoon in early september. After spending a week and a half at the Paris and the Luxor: the Golden Nugget was a bit of adisappointment. It is a very nice hotel in an otherwise unplesant neighborhood when compared to the glamour and excitement of "The Strip". The hotel has very well appointed rooms and service was excellent; but unfortunately, we believe that if you are under the age of 35, you may not feel as you "fit in" this particular establishment. The hotel itself is well appointed for seniors needs in that respect. We were compeled to change hotels shortly after our check-in, especiallyafter discovering our room had a view of a concete wall. Please do not take our comments as a negative review, it is just a matter of personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “The best downtown”
Reviews.Author: Enschede
Reviews.Content: It was the second time we where staying in the Golden Nugget. The first time was 1993. The hotel is still oke. Service oke. We didn't stand in line for incheck. The buffet is one of the finest in town.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the postive as well as the negative reviews of the Golden Nugget. I want to give my own. Throughout the years my husband and I have visited Las Vegas we have always stayed at the Golden Nugget. We have never experienced the problems I have read in previous reviews. We have made friends with a few of the bartenders there and they always remember our names. These guys include David, Robert, Kelly and Wally. Our cocktail waitress Frenchy is pretty cool too. Golden Nugget is probably the only hotel in downtown with cordial gentlemen opening the doors for you. The only negative thing I have to say is the walk to the South Tower. Its quite a ways but then the hotels on the strip are much farther. The food and entertainment in the lounge is good and sports book is even better. My husband loves it the most. We will always stay there.

Reviews.Title: “No running water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Changed Rooms Twice...no water.no cool air..Rude staff But did offer us a Suite...........

Reviews.Title: “downtown good for gambling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from staying at GN over a 3 day weekend. I had never stayed downtown before and wanted to give it a try. I will say the GN is by far the best hotel downtown. Check in was a breeze at about 4 p.m. No line. We stayed in the south tower. A bit to my surprise the rooms were not very big. The bathroom didn't have so much as a counter to put anything on. The toliet didn't work very well, had to hold the handle down. The shower was a joke. The shower head came up to my shoulders and i am average height. Never seen that before. The room was very quiet though, and the bed was good. For some reason they have very small pillows though. Odd. The rest of the hotel was great. Good sportsbook. Nice casino. It is smaller and laid out better than most of the strip hotels, easy to navigate. All the service we encountered was friendly and helpful. Good location downtown right in the middle of everything. Close to bus to the strip. 2$. Though the GN didn't have many 5$ tables or good slot machines, the rest of downtown is great for gambling. Good pay tables on the video poker and plenty of 2-5$ tables. Spent a lot of time gambling at the Four Queens. The Plaza has a good coupon book and is good for gambling also. Bottom line if you are on a budget downtown is much better. Just jump the bus and visit the strip. Not much else to do otherwise downtown, but i went this trip to gamble. I was looking forward to seeing the lights at the Fremont St exprience. I must say, to my surprise, i thought it was lame. I took one look up and said big deal and never payed attention to it again. Don't understand why people think this is so great. The time share people downtown are a little annoying, but no big deal. I would recommend staying downtown if you are on a budget and want to try something different. That said, the GN is the best place to stay. I will probably stay downtown again, since i don't like 10-15$ blackjack tables and low paying slots. There is a lot more to do and see on the strip however. In my opinion don't stay downtown for the Fremont St. experience, it isnt worth it. Any questions, feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Nugget - What a gem....”
Reviews.Author: leenie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Nugget & were very pleased. For a rate of $49 a night, we were a bit wary, but it was great. The rooms are very nice. I can't say enough about the staff. Everywhere we turned a door was being opened for us, or some friendly words spoken - something I don't always see at the pricey Strip hotels. We recently also stayed at the Lake Las Vegas Hyatt, paying over $200 a night, & not one time did anyone open the hotel doors for us. I highly recommend the Nugget, & it didn't bother me that it wasn't on the Strip.

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Nugget
HotelInfo.Address: 129 East Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV 89101
